description:
Tropisueno was a cool place we stopped into on a Monday evening for some drinks and snacks. One of my girlfriends recommended the restaurant to us for our first experience in San Francisco and I can definitely see why she did. The service was seriously outstanding, specifically mentioning on of the male bartenders who was ridiculously accommodating and warm to us, totally hooked us up at a table at their high top bar when the place was jamming and we likely would have had to wait an hour to get seated if he hadn't made room for us. With that being said, the seating at the high top bar was a little weird. It was maybe a four feet wide table and we were sitting directly across the table from strangers. It was as if we were at a community table with other people except that the community table was seriously small and intimate and there was no way you weren't part of the conversation the people next to you and across from you were having. I wouldn't choose to sit at this table near the bar if you want any sort of privacy. For us, it was okay because we were literally having one drink, some chips and salsa and heading out to the next place.

Quick qualm, literally no outlets in this place. Searched high and low and then high and low again for an outlet to plug my phone into and they did not have one anywhere. I asked the host station, fail. I asked the bar, fail. Nothing. That was a bummer as we were getting place to place in San Francisco with the help of Uber and our maps and without cell phones we were SOL so we had to go to another place to get our phones charged up. The place was hopping on a Monday night. It was downtown but set apart from the business of the road in a little square with other restaurants nearby, I really enjoyed the area. They had margaritas, tequilas, you know, what you'd expect at a Mexican restaurant. When we sat down at the high top table, there was left over salsa from the people before us in front of us and so for a while we weren't given a fresh bowl there was no way in heck I was dipping my chips into somebodies used salsa so eventually I grabbed the attention of someone and he replaced our salsas. They brought out three different kinds and they were so delicious! Some hot, some smoky but they were all really tasty and unlike any salsas I had had before. I got a vodka soda and it was strong as heck.

I'd definitely come back here another time but I'd try and sit at the regular bar or grab a table.
author: Samantha S.

description:
I was very disappointed with Tropisueno. This place was recommended to me by one of the locals an eh it was average. I came here on a Tuesday night and even then (surprisingly)it was quite busy. This place is known for their cocktails so definitely come here for that, their drink menu is quite large. They offer indoor, outdoor and bar seating at this restaurant. The staff was very friendly and the manager came to our table to check on us.

I ended up getting a shrimp dish. The ingredients sounded great on the menu however my meal was bland. The type of bland that makes you want to sprinkle a bit of salt on your food and I'm not a salt person. The waitress also didn't tell me my meal came with tortillas to wrap it all in but the manager came in after I was finished to tell me I didn't get them. Well bummer, I wonder if that would have made the dish a little different but still.. not impressed. My favorite part of the meal was the triple dip that was brought out and the guacamole. I think I ate more of that during my meal than my actual meal.

I'd be willing to give this place a second chance if ever came back this way but it certainly wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Maria U.

description:
Tropisueno has a really solid and quick lunch menu, but my most recent visit for dinner was a huge disappointment.  We were seated immediately upon arrival on a Sunday, and it was quite crowded.  When we were seated, we got the usual delicious chips and salsa that they provide complimentary.  

The food quality and preparation is where this experience derailed and led to this poor review.  Our table ordered 2 of the pollo asado.  We waited a while for the kitchen to cook our meal and when it finally came, we cut into our chicken eager to eat it, but found out it was raw on the inside.  We notified the server, who took it back to the kitchen.  Someone else came to our table to let us know the entire order was being re-fired (which generally means they are cooking an entirely new order for us).  However, a long wait again later, we received the same chickens that we sent back - they just put it back on the grill for longer.  We could tell they were the same because of the areas where we cut into it the first time.  As a result of this laziness and frugality shown by the restaurant, our meals were overcooked, burnt, and the chicken's natural moisture was obliterated during the recooking process.  When you cut into meat and recook it, it gets dry.  The meal was dry and had many charred/burnt areas on the outside.  Veggies and garnish on the dish were also not redone, as they got cold while they recooked the chicken.  There was also no discount offered or any other resolution offered.

TLDR - Expensive, overpriced food.  If they make a mistake (even if it's as bad as undercooking chicken, which can get you really sick), they will not do their best to fully correct the mistake.  They will take the cheapest option possible to finish your table's ticket and charge you for their mistake.  This is really disappointing because their lunch menu and burritos are actually pretty good, but I don't think I'll be back.
author: Tim L.

description:
Decently priced Mexican food close to the Westfield Mall? Taylor found Tropisueño on Yelp when we were looking for a place to eat before heading home. Thanks to the Yelp app, we were able to place ourselves on the waitlist. The Yelp app said there was a 25 minute wait but once I checked in with the hostess, it was more like 8 minutes. 

They are efficient here. Water, chips and salsa come out. The waitresses take your drink and food order and you don't wait long for your entrees to come. 

I ordered the pollo con mole poblano. The chicken was tender and flavorful. It still doesn't compare to the Ortega family's recipe but it was really good. Portion-wise, I felt like it was more than 1/3 of a chicken. It comes with beans, rice and two corn tortillas. Plenty of food. 

I definitely will add this restaurant to my list of places to consider if I'm hungry and by Yerba Buena Center.
author: Olivia C.

description:
I love their Happy Hour! The prices are good and so is the food!

My husband and I stopped by on a Monday night around 5 and luckily, we were able to find a couple of spots on their communal high top table. The place was hoppin' already by that time, so get there early if you want to get a seat. We ordered a couple glasses of their House Margarita, Guacamole, Flautas, and Nachos. Everything was great. Their chips are so nice and light. We must have gone through three baskets of chips! The salsas were very tasty too and they had some heat to them too. The Nachos which is only available during HH had a nice amount of meat and other toppings. Definitely a must order with your drink. I enjoyed the Flautas so much, we had to order another plate after we inhaled the first one.

We've also been here for dinner, but we almost froze eating outside in their patio the last time we were there on a Friday night. There was a 30 to 45 minute wait in their main dining room and as we couldn't wait that long to eat, we opted to sit outside. Unfortunately they don't have heaters outside. They do give you a blanket, but it wasn't enough to keep me warm. The moral of this story is to put your name on the waiting list via Yelp ahead of time, so you don't have to wait too long for a table inside. 

We will definitely be back! We always have a good experience here. Their chips are so addictive! :) Service is always good and it's close to shopping and Bart.
author: Hazel C.

description:
Came here for lunch with a couple coworkers while I was in town for work after we couldn't get in to Ippudo. 

They have a lot of outdoor seating and a nice patio. During lunch hours, you go order at the register, they give you a number, you seat yourself and then they bring your food to the table when it's ready. A bit like nando's approach. They brought us a basket of chips with our food and there was a salsa bar. 

I have to say I liked the idea of the salsa bar but it was in a small area where only one person could fit at once so a line quickly built up of folks waiting for salsa. 

I ordered a plate with a cheese enchilada and a barbacoa flauta. It had rice and beans on the side. Overall, the food was good. The rice had a bit too much cumin for my taste and was a bit dry. Black beans were fine but could've had more flavor. Overall, I felt like the food I got was fine but forgettable. 

The really stand out part of the meal was the chips and salsa actually. Prices were reasonable considering the environment and food itself. I'd probably go back again for a lunch.
author: Ashtar B.

description:
Deliciously chips.  Salsas on the weak side.  Caldo the pollo is overly spiced and not authentic tasting.  My stomach hurt for hours afterwards.  The lemonade is extremely lime heavy and they don't bother to tell you that you will be charged $3.50 for a refill.  
This is not an authentic Mexican restaurant and the seats are way too close together to be comfortable.  The couple next to us was on their first date and I felt bad for both of them because I could hear every word.  I could tell that both of them wanted to leave as soon as possible.
author: Monica G.

description:
WOW ! One of the best Mexican food places ever. Tried this place as our first meal in SF. Can't go wrong with this place. This place would make a good date spot too. 
The location is very central to everything happening and ambience, food options and outside seating area are all very good. 
Their chips, guacamole and salsas enhanced flavor of the food. We tried their watermelon and cucumber margaritas and a bunch of tacos and enchiladas. Everything was delicious and priced well for SF standard.
author: Sugandha M.

description: It's more of a 4 1/2 than a 4 star restaurant. Reason I'm saying 4 1/2 is my first visit was a 5 the second was a 4. Food was amazing and the atmosphere and ambiance is killer. Just the service wasn't as good the second time around. Now it was busy but I found myself having to ask for stuff from other staff members felt like my waitress forgot about us lol. But the food was good and I'll definitely go again this visit I tried the Huaraches "tres Cochinitas" super flavorful but not as good as the chicken plate.
author: Michael P.

description:
My friends and I stopped by for lunch on a Sunday. It wasn't super busy, so service was very fast. I was a underwhelmed with my food, but my friends were pretty happy. That being said, the price was pretty fair. 

How it works: you walk up to the counter and order; they give you an order ticket; you continue to the cashier to pay; and then you sit yourself down at a table. The food comes, and you enjoy :)

I got a simple quesadilla, and unfortunately it was a little bland (it seemed to lack cheddar / salt?). I also got their horchata. Tasted good, but a little watery. The (complimentary) chips were very good. My friends went for the tacos + tamale, so you might have better luck there.
author: Calvin C.

description:
I realized only today that there is chorizo in their chicken taco - pollo tinga after looking at their other menu.

The menu painted on their board does not suggest that there is chorizo in the chicken taco. The staff does not speak english very well to confirm this further.

Their menus are inconsistent and do no list the ingredients accurately. This is especially a problem for people with dietary restrictions.
author: Tejashree M.

description:
If you're looking for a delicious drink and bite, then this is your place. The ambience is awesome and the time we waited for 3 people (20-25 mins) was definitely worth it, especially since we could sit at the bar and order drinks while we waited for a table. The drinks that we got were pretty good and when the bartender forgot to put an ingredient in one of the drinks, he realized promptly (even when we didn't) and he made us a new one right away. The food was also really good and the menu is accommodating to vegans and vegetarians as well. 
Overall a really good experience!
author: Alisha D.

description:
TL;DR
- Tropisueno is like a more authentic Chipotle
- Their red salsa is fantastic and reminds me of what I used to get at Chevy's
- Quick service
- Excellent street tacos
- 2 clean, gender-neutral bathrooms

I was shopping at Westfield with a friend who suggested going to Tropisueno for lunch.  This place is happening on a Saturday afternoon, but you can still grab a table relatively easy.

The service is a little bit of Chipotle-meets-Chevy's.  You go to a counter and order the food and drinks you want.  You pay, you grab your salsa from the salsa bar, and find a table.  They come and bring you your food and endless chips.  You fill up with a happy belly.

That said, you might think Chipotle? Chevy's?  Meh, doesn't sound authentic.  Well, these have really great street tacos.  I got two carne asadas with the finely diced onions, cilantro, and corn tortillas with some black beans.  Delicious!

Five street tacos, endless chips and salsa, two Mexican sodas, beans, rice.  $37 pre-tax.

Oh and clean bathrooms?  Yasssssssss!
author: Michelle M.

description: Keep hearing about this place so finally checked it out. Came right around opening on a Wed, and had made reservations for 5:30 pm, but it wasn't that crowded. The chips and salsa were good as everyone says, but that is pretty much it. I ordered the enchilada and tamale combo plate. It was barely warm! Like it was all made beforehand, sitting out. The tamale had way too much masa in it and the enchilada was limp and kinda stale. Both flavors were eh. Not impressed.
author: Vivian D.

description:
Happy Hour FTW!!! During my Bloomies' retail days, this place was a staple, a freakn savior!!! After an 8hr shift of retail hell - a group of us would come here often and drown ourselves in endless margaritas and the whole delish happy hour menu which was legit and such a deal!! Regardless of the nostalgic memories, I came here recently again for HH with the beau and the food and drinks were still on point, happy to say!!

The place is large with indoor/outdoor seating, and a sweet intimate bar area. Super easy and convenient location....right snacked in downtown. Service is consistent, nice, and quick, reservations easily made online. Tip: Def. don't expect this place to be super authentic given location overall - not a hole in the wall, very much a full on restaurant, casual & modern.

A MUST ORDER - house margarita!! Super refreshing, light, tasty, and easy to knock back. Def. Will get stronger and stronger as you go ;)

Food talk -

(1) house chips & salsa - fresh hot super crispy chips, lightly salted and easy to eat. All 3 sauces had a very different taste, all good - but def. liked the green verde sauce the most!

(2) ceviche - super tangy and refreshing, I know it's a little too sour for others....but I actually prefer my ceviche tangy so it was all good for me.

(3) chicken taco - was tasty and juicy, not dry at all. Flavor was def. on the lighter side + add any of those colorful sauces AND boom. Flavahh.

(4) steak taco - this was AOK, a little more chewy than I'd prefer but still tasty. There were some fatty pieces that had good flavor, but most pieces were cooked very....well done. (Which is def. Not preferred for steak)

(5) fried fish taco - yes there is a lot of sauce and toppings all over, but still didn't take away from this perfectly puffed fried hunk a fish - bombbb!!!! Refreshing from the toppings and yet still hefty since fried sooo freakn beautifully rightttt **salivation in progress

(6) flautas - fried super crispy, then jam packed with salsa and a bunch of condiments. The chicken and flavor inside is light (which seems to be a thing with their chicken)...BUT again - add one of the House sauces = AOK and good for the price.

(7) cheese quesadilla - average and good for sharing, pretty standard and enjoyable...but def. not anything amazing.
author: Saleen L.

description: Loved loved loved!!! This place was delicious and had great service! We came in on a Friday evening so it was pretty busy but we still enjoyed our time. The service was on point for being so busy! The thing about ceviche is that it must have the perfect ration of lime, salt, and the rest of the special ingredients in order to be perfectly balanced and they hit it on the mark!! BOMB.com my amigos! I also got the carne asada tacos which was also on point!
author: Theresa G.

description:
I solely came during HH and I had a great experience. This isn't reflective off a proper sit down dinner as we seated ourselves in the designated HH areas to take advantage of their great specials. As many of y'all know it's easy to rack up a bill quickly on food in the Bay area.

If you're a fan of tequila and margaritas, then I mandate you to grab their signature house margarita. Not because it's on special for $7 although that should be a reason of it's own; however, because it's actually a really good margarita on the rocks. Fresh lime juice and all!

They brought chips and a trio dip for the table. And I was literally hogging the red salsa to where I had no shame and asked them to bring me a bowl of it solely. #noshame

For my "main dish" I went for their AL Pastor tacos and I really did enjoy them. They had some nice seasoning and held up.

Staff was very friendly and super accommodating. I can see why folks around the Financial District area are always crowding this restaurant.
author: Tomas R.

description:
We joined the waitlist through Yelp on our way to the restaurant and we were seated a few minutes after our arrival. I highly recommend making a reservation or joining the waitlist early because this is a popular spot. 

The menu features your typical Mexican food, except burritos, which I found a bit odd. The drink menu features multiple pages of different types of tequila. 

The restaurant has a lively atmosphere and seems like the hip place to be. There's also a bar you can hang out at if you aren't looking for a sit down meal.  

We ordered:
Guacamole: The guacamole appetizer is $9 and comes in a bowl with a diameter smaller than my finger. It was mediocre, at best. If we weren't obsessed with guacamole, we wouldn't have bought it. It is absolutely not worth $9.

Mojitos: They were good and nothing special.

White Sangria: This was served in a small glass on ice. It tasted more like a cocktail than wine. 

Chicken Tacos: This came with two tacos, rice, and beans. The tacos were good, but again, nothing spectacular.

Ensalada de la Casa: This house salad comes with lettuce, tomato, jicama, mango, and pepitas. Chicken and avocado was added at an extra cost ($2.50 for a half avocado). The salad is large and refreshing. The chicken was cooked perfectly. 

Veggie Enchiladas: The enchiladas are served with rice and beans. It is a large portion and good if you have an appetite.

Our food was served relatively fast, but the service was mediocre, like many things here.
author: Roxanne F.

description:
Good happy hour. We came here after a long day to grab some drinks and food. We were starving and the service was good. We ordered their margaritas to start and they were really refreshing. 

Ordered their nachos, fish tacos, flautas and guac. Everything was seasoned perfectly and had great taste. The bottomless chips and salsa was also a plus. The three salsas they provided were really good. My favorites were the orange and green sauce. 

Highly recommend this place for happy hour. Can't wait to come back and try their regular dinner service.
author: Carlos P.

description:
Booked a reservation for Oct 5 at 7:30pm (my bday). We arrived at 6:30 to see if we could get seated earlier -we were already hungry. We had to wait about 10 minutes. A lot of ppl and it was noisy. After we were seated for 2 Mins, our waitress brought us chips & salsa -FREE. I ordered the 3item combo for approx. $15 while my boyfriend  ordered 2 item for approx. $13 and a chicken plate that cost $21. Unfortunately  the chicken was kind of burnt, aside from that AND the Violeta or tropienso margarita (forgot which one I ordered) tasted bad. I was not even able to finish half of it . 
Overall, I'll come back soon.
author: Lulu L.

description:
Being located on Market street, i landup visiting this place frequently.
Wait time is usually ~15mins. But I usually landup reserving a table through yelp in advance and plan to reach there according to my position in queue.
They start off with complimentary chips and salsa. The chips are fresh and crispy and better than most other places I have had.
I always land-up ordering the mango margarita and request it spicy. 
For entrees the Chicken asadon and the shrimp special is what I go for usually.
author: Shraddha N.

description:
Great modern Mexican food! Tropisueño is a charming, lovely little restaurant by Yerba Buena gardens. I'd say the highlight here, at least for me, is the cocktail menu. Their cocktails are just what you want from a Mexican restaurant with their own little unique twist on each one. 

In terms of food, the chile con queso stood out for us. It's super gooey and cheesy--exactly what you want to fill up on before your dinner comes :p

But my boyfriend even loved the chile con queso, despite not liking cheese that much. So I'd say it's objectively pretty awesome.

I didn't try some of the more creative things on the menu, but the enchiladas I had were pretty good. I highly recommend the chicken tinga enchiladas, in particular.
author: Claire C.

description:
Tropisueño is a solid Mexican spot with a creative cocktail menu and exemplary service.

Began our experience here by getting our name on the waitlist prior to ever leaving the hotel (right through the Yelp app, yo!). So, by the time we walked down, our wait time was minimal. 

Once seated, we immediately ordered chips and guac. The guac was fresh and tasty. I also ordered a margarita. I don't remember the name of my margarita, but it was a standard lime margarita with the intriguing addition of St. Germain. The St. Germain gave it a lovely floral dimension. It was spot on perfect. 

For dinner, I ordered their chile relleno. It was tasty. I wasn't wowed, but it was definitely solid. 

The interior is casual but cute and the service was completely lovely.

Get to it!
author: Ophelia M.

description:
I absolutely love this place. They are located in a convenient location, and have really fast service. I've came here for dinner and during lunch - and two completely different experiences. 

~ Dinner: put your name down, typical wait to be seated and have a server wait on your table. Still incredible food and fast service.

~ Lunch: now lunch rush gets crazy throughout the week so plan ahead and perhaps even try to beat the rush if possible. From the hours of 11:45am - 1:30pm, the line wraps around outside. The good thing is that you order the food yourself up front, pay and pick a table to sit down - unless you're taking it to go.  It comes out pretty fast to your table. There's a salsa bar and water station. 

Convenient place to take your lunch during work days - which explains the intense line at lunch. 

Food itself is amazing every time. A little on the pricier end but worth it. Among the many things I've tried here that I recommend (Chiles Rellenos, Enchiladas, Margaritas), on my recent trip I ordered the shrimp  burrito with the avocado/cheese and ordered it wet.  It did come out to about $18 (including tip) but it was amazing and managed to save half of it for dinner!
author: Joscelynne R.

description:
A nice after work spot to grab a quick margarita w co-workers!

Ambiance:  Good
Service:  Good
Food:  Not sure- this review is for the margaritas .  "Thank you, I'll have another please".
Price:  standard for the area

Will be back for sure- looking forward to eating there one day.
author: Carmela D.

description:
Location location location - usually a good thing. Reason for 1 star was subpar Mexican food that is really just turns out to be a bad attempt at Tex Mex food. If this was in Texas or New Mexico, it would fail. If this was in LA, it would fail. Waste of calories. 

I was open minded, but after eating here, I'm shocked this has so many reviews and is a 4.

Carne Asada was chewy, corn tortilla has 0 flavor, black beans don't even come with cotija, they use chunks of pineapple in the al pastor instead of proper basting, wet burrito is literally plain salsa and not enchilada sauce, and they stuff lettuce in everything.

Hibiscus drink was unusually tart. Forgot to give us our order of guacamole. 

Salsa bar is in an awful location that forms a line in everyone's way.

Not sure why people stand in line for this.
author: Brian W.

description:
I am a huge fan of Tropisueno, I've been there for brunches and dinner. I love that during brunch they have the salsa bar set up so that you can get whatever salsa you want to try or put on your food. Tropisueno also provides free chips and salsa during dinner service which is amazing because growing up in Texas that is what I am used to, so it is extra nice. 

The margarita selections are solid and have different margaritas besides the standard but their top shelf margarita is fantastic. I do really enjoy the cucumber margarita that they make. The bartenders are very nice and even if the bar is crazy busy they will still be as attentive as they can be and try their best to practice 'first come, fist served'.

I've never really had a bad meal here, I enjoy the tacos and they have really good flautas, not as good as my mom's but a pretty good substitute. Also, they have really really tasty black beans. The carnita nachos are also one of my favorites. One of the bad things is that it can be really busy with tourists since it is right in Yerba Buena.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
food was much better back in 2015 when i used to visit Tropisueño quite often.
I ordered the same dishes but has been disappointed about the quality of food.
It's a shame as it was one of my fav for the atmosphere
Not going back
author: Sonia F.

description:
Oh man, I could eat these chips + 3 salsas for DAYS!!! AAAAH.

In all seriousness, we actually come here for the chips and salsas - these salsas are THE BOMB. I love the green salsa (avocado based), hubby loves the red salsa, and as we are usually full by the time the food actually comes out we have been just sharing one dish. My favorite dish here is the Tampisueno, which comes with an enchilada + skirt steak + rice and beans + tortillas, so this can totally be shared. 

They have a great happy hour and if we make it before they close the happy hour at 6PM we get their house margaritas which are STRONGER THAN YOU THINK do not be fooled!

Sometimes we opt to come at lunch because instead of having to ask for the salsas and chips, you can just grab it yourself at the chips and salsa bar!!! AMAZING and love how there are no judgements :D
author: Michele L.

description: I came here at a weird time of service, between brunch and dinner on a Sunday, at around 4:30pm. The menu is limited to nachos, tacos, flautas, and tostadas. Unfortunately I had a crazy toddler with me so I only had a few bites of nachos and tacos, and had to pack up the rest. What I did eat was just okay... not that flavorful. And of course it didn't get better after sitting in boxes for an hour on the way home. The best thing was probably the free chips and salsa.
author: Shannon L.

description: This review is for the happy hour menu only, which is the only menu available from 4-6pm. The fish taco was ok, but the batter was too thick. Complimentary chips with salsa and guacamole were a plus. Sangria was ok, but you could really taste the triple sec. The standout dish on the HH menu was the flautas with chicken tinga. It was the perfect amount of spice and the pickled cabbage really elevates the dish. I would come back over and over again for these flautas! The total bill for a beer, sangria, 4 tacos, and flautas was $34 and we were stuffed. Good value!
author: Christine S.

description: First of all, this place is adorable. The interior looks like a movie scene from Coco- the decorations, music and all the workers wore flower on their tied hair.  They also provide a huge selection of sauces, best I've seen. The food is on point as well!
author: Kaylee P.

description: I have had two great Mexican meals here. We started off with chips and three kinds of salsas -- classic roasted red tomato, creamy avocado tomatillo, and fiery orange habanero.  Our family ate a range of dishes including cheesy enchiladas, three kinds of pork, excellent Chile rellenos, and a side of fried plantains with a special Gary carmelized crust. A boisterous crowd, good service, reasonable prices.
author: Charles L.

description: Pretty popular Mexican spot near market street. They give out free chips and three types of salsas that are mildly spicy but so good! They have the thinner chips so it's super easy to down two bowls of them! We shared the guacamole, which was a super tiny portion and came in a small stone bowl. It was good but pretty expensive for the amount of guac. We also got the carnitas tostada that are a bit messy too eat but really good to start with. For main, we also shared the grilled steak with rice, beans and a cheese enchilada. It's definitely very flavorful though the meat was a little tough. The good thing though this was a huge sized portion and ended up being more than enough for the two of us.
author: Jen L.

description:
I have been to a lot of Mexican restaurants like El Torito, Pedro's Cantina, On The Border, Chevys, Cafe Coyote, Camacho's Cantina and exc... Finally on my day off from work which was last thursday... I have been always wanting to try this place and finally I had the time to go to Tropisueno for lunch!!! 

And this is what... I ate from the Tropisueno... I had myself a Super Burrito W/ Chips and also ordered myself A Paloma Cocktail Drink!!! Which was my very 1st time ever that... I drank a Paloma Cocktail Drink which tasted really good!!!

If your visiting from out of town or if your a local like me, and looking around for a good time at a Mexican restaurant to eat at... You should go to the Tropisueno Mexican Restaurant at the San Francisco Ca Downtown Area!!!  It's a good Mexican Restaurant to go to!!!
author: William B.

description: Love some good Mexican food. This place did not disappoint. Was excited to see plantains with crema and black beans on the menu. Ordered the fried rainbow trout fish.  Topped with a margartia. Five starts for me.
author: Rosemary C.

description: Always a good time.  Great vibes on the patio and solid margies.
author: Tony A.

description:
Back at my favorite SF Mexican food joint. We walked from AT&T Park for the tamales, guacamole, chips, enchiladas and tacos.   After that walk, we celebrated with homemade lemonade and a margarita!

Come early for lunch.
author: Camille H.

description:
Best enchilada I have so far. I got chicken and carne asada. The meat is very tender. And the tortilla is perfectly cooked and fresh. Ask for the complimentary chips and salsa! They have good servings of cocktails as well. 

The ambiance is great for dinner but always packed even on a weekday so I highly recommend to do a waitlist thru Yelp
author: Krista D.

description: Cute spot for happy hour if you are in the city downtown area! We came here after MOIC for a team offsite. They got a good happy hour menu which consists of margaritas and chips and guac. Ohh and the special they have is $3 or $4 tequila shots!!! We must have had at least 5 rounds or more with a side of apetizers. Our server was super friendly and attentative to us. I'm DEF a fan and will be back!!!! thank you for the great service and the good food!
author: Lisa S.

description:
The restaurant was very crowded and loud. The tables are too small. Service was just okay, taking a significantly long time to take our payment and process. I got the Tropisueno carne asada... they did not provide a steak knife, only a regular butter knife. It was incredibly difficult to cut because it was on the medium rare end and I nearly knocked my water glass off the tiny table twice just trying to cut through the meat. 

Both my food and my girlfriend's food were very tasty. They get three stars for quality of food. The tiny table made it difficult to do just about anything, including dipping your chips in salsa - constantly risking knocking over your drinks because there was no space for your elbows anywhere.

My girlfriend is from Michoacán... and the food, while tasty, did not strike her as authentically Mexican - more white-washed.

This is probably a cool place to come for lunch, but dinner was miserable. We couldn't talk with each other without yelling... the drunk girls at the table next to us (clearly Kardashian fans - they looked and acted as annoying as that family does) were way too loud and used the word "like" every nanosecond. Clearly, millennial brains are incapable of processing complex thoughts and sentences. We spent all night making fun of our table-neighbors.

I will not be returning. There are authentic Mexican taquerias in SF that have real Mexican food and authenticity. 

Busser staff was phenomenally helpful - much better than our waiter service. I think the bussers did far more to take care of us than the overworked server staff.
author: Scott B.

description:
Came here for Happy Hour, which ends at 6 I believe and is available only at the patio and the bar. Prices were reasonable at this time, I had a margarita at $7.00, a taco for $3.00 and a pair of these flat hard tacos; the name escapes me right now.

The food was delicious, I quite enjoyed the flat hard tacos, and the taco itself was decent. They also give you a good selection of chips and salsa to start off with, and all three salsas are quite spicy. The orange one has a more smokey flavor, the green one is a more typical blended cilantro taste, and the red one was surprisingly a bit spicy as well, having an almost habnero sweetness to it.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Stopped in for drinks with friends: A-OK.

On a Sunday afternoon after brunch, our group of five were looking to extend our day out in The City, but alas, most bars and watering holes were closed at this weird hour. Tropisueño to our rescue! And straight to the bar we went..

They have a pretty big selection of tequilas and mezcals. Nice. No pitchers of margaritas or sangria, however. Boo. Extensive bar menu, with a couple pages worth of specialty cocktails. Sweet! One order per person says the barkeep, "no double fisting" policy. Well, ok I guess. Our friend who saved us seats will just have to make his way back to order his drink, then. Not a deal breaker, but really? Anywho...

Drinks + chips, guac, and salsa + friends = hard to beat. Extend the good times at Tropisueño!
author: Roderick T.

description: Great happy hour, the deals here are great on their margaritas. The drinks here are kinda strong so be careful. They offer salsa and chips along with great bites on their happy hour menu. The salsa make this place taste great so don't forget to try the salsa try all of them.
author: Poonam M.

description:
My review is for the bar area solely. I ordered a drink there before dinner and kept my reciept. When I got my credit statement I noticed the man who helped me, gave himself a generous tip, which I did not authorize. I already spoke with my CC company and the manager, Jose, so they are both aware. He did offer his apologies and took care of the charge, which I appreciate because he just may not be aware of a staff members actions. 

This is just to let others know to make sure you check your credit card bills and tip if you happen to dine/drink at this establishment

Overall it made me upset and a little sad because I had heard such great things about this place.
author: Kris T.

description: Great happy hour deals, good cocktails. Great patio location, needed to kill 30 mins so stopped in for some grub! Speedy service and great quality
author: Jen L.

description:
This is legit Baja style Mexican food. IMHO. 

We came for happy hour and had the best waiter Arturo great margaritas and delicious food. 

We loved the three salsa platter with the habanero and green being our favorites. 

Flautas -- get them! 
Guacamole was delicious 
Carnitas street taco.mmmmm
author: Christine V.

description:
Love coming here around lunch time for their delicious burritos but was disappointed when I came in the evening and they weren't on the dinner menu :( 

My friend and I opted for the plate of tacos instead (comes with beans and rice and 2 tacos). I got the veggie option which comes with roasted veggies or potatoes. We also ordered the guac off the HH menu! We had barely made it in time for HH but the server was kind of enough to let us get 2 margs each AND the guac for the HH price!! So accommodating!
author: Alysia T.

description:
This is a gluten free review. Everything I ordered was gluten free. Chips are thin and crispy. Salted perfectly. The salsa trio tasted fresh. All had good flavors, but my favorite salsa is the orange one. Not sure what it's called but it's pretty spicy. Has a bit of a smoky flavor to it. I ordered three chicken tacos. Two were regular (Pollo Asado) and one chicken tinga. I liked the flavor of the Pollo asado tacos best. Will order those next time. The rice is fluffy and flavorful. 

Service is somewhat slow. Takes a while to get your chips and check. The food came pretty quick, even though they were busy.

All in all, I will be back on my next trip to SF.
author: Sean M.

description: After that I wrote a review on facebook only for the owner to insult my mother and refer to a cancer patient as an "old lady". When I gave feedback on the post the owner became defensive stating this was my perception of reality and attempted to justify calling her an "old lady". I offered to arrange a phone call between her and my mother to further provide feedback on her experience. The owner refused. As seen on the screenshots. Please help spread the word this is very unfornuate and wrong. Please reframe from eating her. This was very hurtful. A good owner/ manager should welcome feedback and not become so defensive and further insult a cancer patient.
author: Bianca I.

description: This place serves great food. We were told waiting time of 45 min and we got the table in 15 min. The patio area is really nice. The indoor seating is very noisy and the patio, on a cold breezy day is very airy so you got to pick. The service is very quick and our server was very nice and informative about all the dishes. She had a smile on her face throughout even though she was taking care of almost all the tables in the patio area. Their Deseret was really good.
author: Shruti M.

description:
Came here on a cold friday night. Indoor seating was a 45 min wait but outdoor seating was open to anyone, so we snagged an outdoor table. There were no heating lamps or anything so we were freezing. Our food got cold really fast as soon as it came out as well. 

We got complimentary chips and I really enjoyed those. They had three different salsas which i loved. I ordered the chile verde for dinner, and it was good, but not amazing. I think freezing and having the food get cold fast made the experience not as good as it could've been. 

I don't think I'll be back for dinner, but I'd love to come back for lunch sometime because I heard their burritos are really good, but they don't have them at dinner.
author: Alexis T.

description:
It's been 4 years since my last trip in San Francisco. So I wanted something really good for my first night. I couldn't decide where to go. So I searched for restaurants in San Francisco and sorted by reviews. Tropisueño is pretty high up there. 

There was a bit of confusion with me wanting to sit outside. New York City is in a heatwave right now so it feels nice to sit outside even if it's a bit chilly. 

Server was really nice. Even a bit flirtatious at times but I would much prefer that over someone cold. He recommended a few things but I opted for the pick 3 option. 

Now at some point they thought I had already ate so they didn't bring chips and salsa. He apologized for the mistake and brought it out right away. It was worth the wait. I could have filled up just on the chips and 3 salsa options. 

I ordered the chile con queso. I was pretty shocked when it came because it was a dish that looked like a small clump of cheese surrounded by verde sauce. Boy, was I wrong! This was probably one of the top dips I've had in my life. 100% order the chile con queso! 

As for the 3 options I had a barbacoa flauta, cheese tamale and barbacoa enchilada. The flauta and the tamale were fine but there was something I did not like about the enchilada. Almost tasted like what I imagine cardboard tastes like. I'm also very picky and not experienced with enchiladas much. So I'm letting that one slide. 

I happily ate my leftovers for lunch and it was just as good. 

5 stars!
author: Derry R.

description:
Loooooove Trop! Always a great option for Mexican food during lunch. This place is efficient and super fair in portions, pricing, and most of all, QUALITY! Their chips are fire, meats are fire, salsa bar is fire, and service is fuego!!  

I've gotten a majority of all their items on their menus and I'm never dissatisfied. Tacos, quesadilla, burrito, salad, mixed plates (tamales/enchiladas), everything! The quality of the meats are super juicy and tasty. 

Their salsa bar has so many good options it's hard to pick which 2 or 5 salsas you might want. Surprisingly it's pretty well maintained by the employees since it's so easy to get a salsa bar dirty. Their chips go really well w their salsas so don't skip out!

Their dinner hours do change the style of the restaurant which I think is super fun and cool for them to do. But just be aware of their dinner hours since some things won't be the same as their lunch. There is no salsa bar, no line (its seated/reservation style), and I think menu changes a bit too for dinner. But I know there's a happy hour too!

Overall, Trop is the place I recommend to people to go when they crave mexican food in the city!
author: Tiffany Z.

description: I don't come here because I love the burritos or Mexican food. I really just come for the group fun since my work team likes to do Tropisueno on Fridays. Fun vibes but mediocre food.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Oh hello, Happy Hour! 

Not sure what goes on at other times, but we arrived ten minutes before HH (4-6pm) and they were closing down what looked like their walk-up ordering counter. We were lucky enough to find five spots at the tall table near the bar for our crew. 

When you not only get free chips and salsa, but you get free chips and THREE salsas that don't stop flowing out of the kitchen, you are winning. 

I drank a few Tecates and got two carne asada tacos. Just a word of advice, don't go too HAM on the chips and salsa though they're very very very very good. We also got the ceviche for the table. Small size but still surprisingly worked well to share though I may come back and just order that!

The space is a wee crowded but if you and your friends have a secret sign language or enjoy the energy of a full Happy Hour, this is your spot. 

Thank you to the very attentive staff, and delicious trio of salsas!!
author: Morgan F.

description: No! How did this place get 4 stars. Jus ok, burnt rice, beans salty.  No flavor. Only redemption is the chips and guacamole.
author: R W.

description:
Love the snappy Yelp wait list and reservation process! Seriously makes me want to return simply out of the ease. Tropisueño is also located right in the heart of San Francisco, with many places within walking distance. 

The chips and three salsas are waiting for you on the table the second you arrive and the servers are quick. 

I got a hibiscus cocktail and two carnitas tacos. Everything I ate was yummy but a tad too spicy for me. I totally understand because this is Mexican food but just something I'm not as equipped for! The carnitas were delicious and came with rice and beans.
author: Niki K.

description: Solid place! Came here on a Thursday for some drinks and Food. My friend and I got a table inside. Service was fast. I got pastor tacos and some spicy tequila drink. The drink was SUPER spicy but I loved it so. Nice place to hang on a weekday.
author: Erin J.

description:
Great restaurant in San Francisco! 

On a recent trip to the city I went to this restaurant twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. The night that we went for dinner it was pretty busy but we were still sat right away. I didn't realize that they had vegan items marked on the menu but I was still easily able to order something for me. I ended up getting the two enchilada plate with grilled vegetables that is served with rice and beans, and no cheese. It was pretty simple and the enchiladas were nothing to rave about. However, their rice and beans as well as their chips and salsa are really delicious. The service was fast and it was a cool spot so overall it was a good experience. 

Our time there for lunch was even better. During lunchtime it operates like a completely different restaurant. When you walk in you get in a line to order your food. They have a different menu with burritos and plates, which I felt gave even better options than dinner. I ordered Chile Rojo which is a plate of tofu and potatoes, served with rice, beans, and tortillas. It was one of the best options I've had at a Mexican restaurant. It had a kick to it and had so much flavor. It ended up being a lot of food and I probably could have shared with someone else. Definitely try this restaurant if you're in the city, you won't regret it.
author: Emily N.

description:
3/5 for food.
5/5 for atmosphere and service.
So I'm going with 4/5.

Inside this place is gorgeous. It's great for so many occasions: intimate or romantic or just a birthday dinner or work outing. And the service matches the ambiance. It also helps that you can make reservations (we showed up 30 minutes early and got sat right away). The area itself has a lot going on as well. 

The food was average. Nothing to write home about and there's an incredible amount of competition in San Francisco that definitely are better than this place. The carne asada was overlooked and burnt and items that were listed as "spicy" weren't really spicy rather than just overly seasoned. 

The drinks are worth it though. Amazing margaritas and the house margarita comes with a rim of smoked salt and tahine, which I would put on everything if I could. 

Overall, this place is cute for a date night or happy hour and a great spot for drinks and ambiance, but if you're looking for food that will blow your mind, this place is nothing over the top.
author: Veronica B.

description:
TIME: Weekday Lunch

STAFF:  Don't let the velvet rope with people in line intimidate you! It goes by fast because he staff here are very efficient. They are very attentive and friendly.

ATMOSPHERE:  this place feels like an upscale taqueria with lovely decor all over.  The restaurant is large and plenty of seating.  Even though you order first then they bring you your food, don't worry, you'll find a spot to sit, even during the busy lunch hours.

ATE:

I've been here twice now and both times with one other to share everything with. Both times, we've ordered the same things.  Why not? It was so delicious! 

Upon ordering you get a bowl of fresh house made tortilla chips. I swear there is crack in there. Or just that it's thin, fresh, lightly salted and just all around perfect. There is a salsa bar full of all sorts of sauces for your chips or food! I was quite impressed!

HORCHATA - $3
Your standard horchata with ice! Delicious! No complaints here.

CHICKEN TORTILLA SOUP - $9.95
This hearty yet light in taste was very easy to eat. I recommend asking for a second bowl to share.  There plenty of tender chicken pieces, some carrots and potatoes, a bit of avocado and a side strips of tortilla chips to add to your liking!  Definitely something nice for a cold rainy weather!

SUPER (+$1.75) QUESADILLA (+$7.25)
Super just means they add a drizzle of sour cream and a scoop of guacamole. I honestly wish it were a huge loop of sour cream.  The meat I chose was Carne Asada and it was quite delicious. Everything about this was tasty.

You bet I will be coming back here even if it's just for the chips.  There's really no complaints here.
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
I am writing about the disgusting incident that occurred at this restaurant two weeks ago, where I took my mother-in-law, my husband's niece and friend who were visiting from Ireland. They had never tried Mexican food, so I wanted to impress them by taking them to my one and only favorite Mexican restaurant in the city. Well, WAS- no longer is anymore for the following reasons:

We ordered from their happy hour menu- a couple of beers and grilled chicken and steak tacos. Mind you, this is their FIRST (and mostly likely LAST) time eating Mexican food. When we all got our food, my mother-in-law began to gag and pulled a long black strand of hair out from her mouth after taking her first bite into her taco. Not only was that absolutely disgusting, but she could have choked on it! That was enough to put the rest of us off in complete and utter disgust and not eat the rest our tacos either. I alerted our server in which he called the manager over to approach our table. When he did, he had a very cold, insensitive and dismissive demeanor and only said that he'd take her taco off the bill. One (1) TACO. That's a joke! $3 mind you, and offered no apology or some sort of compensation for the rest of us not eating our food either. When the bill came, it was just that- $3 had been taken off and nothing more. PATHETIC!!! It is just petty, pathetic, cheap and dismissive all together! We wasted $40 on food we all did NOT even eat. The manager literally made the executive decision to deduct $3 off the bill for the most vile and unsanitary thing a restaurant could do. That's the most unprofessional/ amateur/dismissive thing a "manager" from a very popular SF restaurant could ever do. It was a nasty, long black strand of hair entangled in the meat, onions and lettuce inside the taco!!! To their careless and dismissive manager- could you imagine taking a bite out of that and gagging so much you want to throw up? WHY don't your cooks wear hairnets on their heads to prevent this from ever happening??? You should be on top of that! You need a thorough food safety and sanitation evaluation stat! 

I'm so embarrassed and livid with their reaction and lack of action to do something after learning the fact that one of their cooks' hair fell into our food. I used to (no longer will) eat and drink at Tropi Sueno a lot as I work right next door to it. I had been going for 6 years or more and always attended their Cinco De Mayo parties. I had recommended and taken hundreds of clients, and friends and family there too. I always spoke so highly of their great food, and even though their service was always terrible and rude, I still went for the food. Now, how could we ever go back after that disgusting hair incident?!

Their lack of professionalism and action to do the right thing is appalling. So, I have decided I will definitely NEVER EVER step foot in Tropisueno ever again! I work at a company that receives thousands of clients a year, so I will make sure to spread the word not to go and eat their hairy tacos either. :/
author: Bridie T.

description:
The place was super jam packed. Did not enjoy my good or the experience. Will I return most likely not. Usually people try this place only for the review. 

However I did like the fact that they have gender neutral restroom, that's a huge plus. Also the inside restaurant is low light so makes it a bit more romantic. However the bar was horrible the drinks were just bad.
author: Gus L.

description:
Chips: just like chili's...so fucking amazing
Salsa trio: traditional red : B- -
                  Green : ass sandwich 
                  Orange : spicy, so it's good
Atmosphere thus far: sitting next to a mix of 4 individuals. 3 from the military, so super fucking weird in normal social settings, and 1 was a girl, prolly worked at GameStop. Will update when we get our food. I got enchiladas and my b got some tacos I think. 

Update: Our server is named Sebastian. He possibly could have peeped my shit when I was writing this review so he may be kinda sucking up but...super dope cat, really knowledgeable, 100% he's not gonna spit in our food. Overall, the best guy!!

Update: enchiladas with chicken...actually really good. Also pretty hard to fuck up. Refried beans: 6.87 out of 10
Mexican rice, also almost impossible to fuck up. It's either  clunky and hard (the shitty kind) or good. This place was good. My b got some steak tacos or some dumb chick shit that girls always be getting trying to be all "authentic". Meat was 7/10. She dug that shit though, you know she prolly lying to my ass. Eat at your own discretion 

Update: the fucking nerds next to us saw that we were on yelp and proceeded to talk to us about it. Very annoying, since, ya know, they are weird as shit. 

Update: the people next to us did that bullshit where they  try and speak spanish to the waiter. They tried to wish my girl a happy bday. Not that sick. 

Worth it, Sebastian kept growing on me, good guy, man.
author: Karen P.

description: Get the pollo con mole. One of the best I've had. The margaritas were also very delicious. I'll definitely be back.
author: Abe K.

description: Excellent food, service and lovely, relaxing atmosphere. Gluten-free friendly!! Five star experience!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I popped into Tropisueño as I was walking past. It caught me with the outdoor seating surrounded by lovely live plants. It was crowded and a wait inside but the patio was about half empty. It was evening in San Francisco so it was a little chilly outside as it was early summer. 

Chips and salsas:  thin and crispy chips with 3 different salsas, all of which were equally good. I managed to eat most of all of the salsas. 

I wanted the shrimp ceviche but the "taste all 3 " option was only a little more so I got that. I'm so glad I did because of the 3, the shrimp ceviche was just meh. The salmon and the tilapia ceviches were amazing, though!

The staff was hustling. I recommend this spot especially if you want to sit outside.
author: Erica B.

description:
Tropisueño is such a cute tucked away eatery in the downtown area, located behind the Marriott hotel amongst a handful of other hip, upscale restaurants. 

We enjoyed the late hours of operation and convenience In location (close to many hotels). 

Great selection of dishes but they were not willing to accommodate my special request for a wet burrito, because there were no burritos on the menu. Customers do appreciate special orders if we know your kitchen had the ingredients and capability to deliver it. 

My recommendation is to order one of their entrees where you can pick two or three of their more popular items, accompanied with rice and beans.
author: Monique W.

description: The food here is really tasty considering it's another taqueria with happy hour in the FiDi...I wish there were more veg friendly entrees on the dinner menu that aren't nachos or enchiladas. Last night I had the nopales enchiladas and it was really good - sauce was Smokey and creamy. Oh the free chips and salsa is realllly good - crispy airy chips! They're also on No Wait so you can add your name to the list before you even get there!
author: Farrah N.

description:
We have been here twice now and both times were enjoyable experiences.  This place is located in the middle of a busy area and we happened to stubble upon it after seeing a movie.  It was pretty crowded but luckily we were able to find 2 open seats at the communal table in the bar so we got to skip the wait.  This worked out well and we were happy to have gotten pretty quick service.  The second time we came we were seated in the dining area and we were seated right away.  The service was a bit slow as we sat with our empty dinner plates in front of us for over 10 minutes before anyone came by but they seemed to be pretty busy.

Food:
Chips and salsa (comes with 3 different types all of which are tasty).  The bowl of chips is huge especially for just two people so after indulging a bit too much of the chips we decided to split our entrée. 

Los Favoritos pick 3 plate with a chicken taco, cheese enchilada, and chicken flauta.  Everything was pretty good, not the best I have ever had, but good enough.  

Taste of 3 ceviches (de camarones, de pescado, salmon crudo).  The portion was pretty small for $17.50 but that worked out well because we didn't eat it all.  The shrimp one was our favorite but the salmon tartare was not what we were expecting and I didn't think it worked well with the chips.  It would have been better in a poke bowl.

Camarones al Mojo de ajo was our favorite dish of both times we dined here. The butter and garlic sauce was delish and I would definitely get it again.  There were 6 decent sized shrimp in the order and it was only $12.

For dessert they only offer flan and tres leches, we went with the tres leches and it was delicious.  Super moist and topped with whipped cream and strawberries.  We devoured the whole thing even though we were stuffed from dinner.

All in all, if we are ever in the neighborhood we would go back to this restaurant and have the chips and salsa, the shrimp and the dessert.
author: Danielle B.

description: Tropisueno is easily the most average restaurant I've been to. While nothing is particularly bad, nothing stands out either. The plates are all variations on a theme of meat and salt. The margaritas are sugary. The service was there. I'm not necessarily upset at having gone here for dinner. I'm just not thrilled given the number of other food options in SF. In short, the restaurant does a great job of being an after work drinks and dinner spot for the downtown crowd.
author: Nick D.

description:
Walking up and down the Financial District, both exhausted from a long drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco, we needed food. Any food! From anywhere at this moment. We passed by Tropisueno a few times (I think it was because I wanted to try their Happy Hour Menu) but didn't stop in. As we gauge our attention to different establishments in the area we ended up going back around (for the upteenth time) to find a seat outside.

We sat ourselves and ordered two House Margaritas from their Happy Hour menu, one Fish Taco and two Steak Tacos. I think the highlight of the babes late lunch were  their Chips and Salsa. We had to get him another order. 

We didn't stay long because we had dinner plans with friends. I'd say our quick stop was enjoyable. The staff were very accommodating and very personable. As we were leaving, I needed to use the restroom but the line was long. I noticed an employee in front of me. When it was his turn, he told me I can cut in front of him. I felt bad because were all standing in line but he offered me his spot. Thank you sir for your kind gesture. 

Craving Mexican food...go here and check out their Happy Hour Menu.
author: Cici M.

description: Came for happy hour Wed at 5:30pm, waited about 10 min for a table on the patio. Delicious fresh ceviche. Guac above average but not life-changing. Margarita on the rocks with nice salt rim, tasty drink, slightly on the sweeter side. Chill
author: Neal K.

description:
Good margaritas. Happy hour is good. Got here at 5pm on a Saturday and it did filled up very fast.
Now as for the food not worth the wait. Cold dish and what I had was full of fat. Chile Verde was a dull.
author: Bombiz V.

description:
Have had this place bookmarked and with nearly four thousand reviews was eager to see what the hype was about.

Located on Yerba Buena Lane in between the Powell and Montgomery BART stop is Tropisueno. 

It is a lively festive atmosphere inside and just the overal decor of the place is impressive. The service is also very good.

You order at the front , take a numbered "flag" if you will to you seat and shortly thereafter your food is delivered. 

Was the food amazing? No, I don't think it was and there are several establishments in the city that offer better taco's and quesadillas/burritos.  The al pastor I had was not very good and the quesadilla was very average as well. 

However, the vibe is pretty cool so if you're entertaining guests I think this would be a fun spot to bring people.  The price is pretty good as well. So I think the vibe/price is what makes this place popular rather than the food being out of this world.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
This is definitely my favourite Mexican restaurant ever.
The chips are fresh, thin and crispy, a great selection of dipping salsas that are unbelievable (tomatillo salsa is the best!), the nachos with carnitas are the bomb and the chicken quesadilla is superb.
author: Maria R.

description:
I've been to Tropisueno a few times now and definitely like them for the burritos. As my esteemed colleague would say, "I'd kill for a burrito right now" and know that's over at Tropisueno. 

The line isn't too bad if you go before 12pm when the lunch hour crowd shows up. Usually if you show up outside of this time period you'll be waiting no more than a few minutes for your food. I had the carne asada burrito with sour cream and guacamole. This one is pretty good and on par with most taquerias. I can't finish the whole thing, it's way too much food. Remember they are in the financial district so the prices are a bit higher than a cash only restaurant in the mission. Otherwise there is pretty decent service here during lunch. There is no waiter to take your order during lunch. Only counter service which is fine since they can't keep up with the people coming in during the lunch hour rush. When it comes to the salsa station they have it all. Jalapenos, pico de gallo, chili verde, you name it they have it. Definitely get the really spicy one to go with your free chips if you dine in. Otherwise it's a few extra bucks to take chips to go with salsa.
author: Tim G.

description:
Happened to stop by Tropisueno on national margarita day, and it was packed!! 

However, Tropiseuno has a convenient service where you can put your name down and they'll text you when your table is ready. On this visit, the wait was 45 minutes, but my friends and I were willing to wait. I recommend checking out the Yerba Buena Gardens or even the target nearby.

Once we received the text that our table was ready we were quickly seated, and given time to look over the menu. Before we could even place our order our server brought over a bowl of tortilla chips and three dips (salsa, salsa verde, and a warm red sauce). All three were delicious, but I definitely leaned towards the salsa verde.

After placing our order we were surprised by how fast our food arrived. Today, I ordered the pick 2 combo with a carnitas taco, a pork tamales, and rice and beans. Everything was delicious and well seasoned (and not too salty)! The tamales were very moist and had a delicious corn flavor that paired well with the pork. While I wished there was a little more meat with the dish, overall I was satisfied with the order!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Came here for happy hour with my friend and had a fun time! We came at peak hours (6pm) so we waited in line for a bit even to sit at the bar.

The sangria wasn't anything special but the guac looked amazing. Overall a good place but definitely expect to wait or stand if you're coming at a peak hour.
author: Megan K.

description: Great Margaritas. Food was amazing and the atmosphere and ambiance striking. Deliciously chips. Can't go wrong with this place.
author: wj b.

description: We went there for happy hour on a Friday afternoon and it was pretty crowded.. The sangrias were delicious though and the service was pretty quick. They have a little outside area where you can take your drink to and just relax but I think they could put more chairs and tables outside as well so that no many people have to stand right in front of their entrance. Other than that, Tropisueno is definitely a place I'll go back to for Happy Hour :)
author: Daffny V.

description: Horrible experience!!! Wait time, staff,food. Nice place when you walk into it. Thinking food will be extremely delicious. For the wait time & amount of people coming into this restaurant. Not at all. Our waiter was not attentive at all. Food took forever. Steak Tampiquena burnt!! Small steak! Should not even call it tampiquena steak! Over priced on everything they have on their menu! Ceviche horrible! Nothing attractive from this restaurant! Service, Food, attention not the very best for San Francisco.
author: Morena M.

description:
Their sauce station is delicious, but it stops there. Their vegetarian meal options used to be great, but now the only veggies they stick in 'em are zucchini and then some more zucchini. 
I'd recommend coming here for just the appetizers and drinks.
author: Mansi D.

description: Was able to put our name on the wait list through Yelp, which was awesome. It kept us looped in on how many where ahead of us and even sent notification when the table was available. The meals looked delicious as they came out, but I came to realize looks aren't every. I had the empanadas(cheese and mushroom) and did not enjoy them as they lacked flavor. The plantains and black beans were flavorless as well. The server that took our order disappeared never to return. An item I ordered was never brought but I was changed for it( had to have it removed). The only thing that was decent was the chips and salsa.
author: Tracy H.

description: I've been to Tropisueno so many times and I love it. My favorite thing to get for dinner here is the Chile Verde. The portions are big and the pork is super tender. I also LOVE the salsas and queso they serve with the chips here. The queso has a kick to it, but amazing nonetheless. The lunches here are more casual and you order at the front counter instead of through a waiter. It gets very loud and dark inside though, so I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for a quieter spot.
author: Amanda F.

description: The place is great for happy hour, good drinks (slightly on the sweet side) and plenty of appy options. We had the house margarita, the la peña ( a strong spicy kick), the guac, fish tacos, chicken taco and a steak taco. The drinks are better than the food but for downtown, it's a great deal. They have some outdoor space when the sun is out. Our waiter was super nice, too. Very attentive on whether we wanted more drinks or chips. Not to be missed!
author: Alice W.

description: Great mexican. we really enjoyed the food and service especially the drinks.
author: Sarah J.

description: Really good burritos with a very reasonable price.  Great for lunch.  I had the shrimp burrito wet and it was fantastic.  Remember to get your salsa and silverware on the way to your table.
author: Dan W.

description:
I come here with everyone: coworkers, local friends, family, people visiting, everyone. This place has the best ambiance, lively and relaxed (which may seem like an oxymoron, but believe me its true). However, with any great business with great food comes some crowds, so be sure to make a reservation in advance if you don't like waiting.

With some of the best and most reasonably priced margaritas in FiDi, it's super easy to drop in here any time for a drink and some of their delicious chips and salsa. All their chips are made in house and their salsas are out-of-this-world good. Their orange spicy salsa gives me major cravings and my mouth starts watering even thinking about it. *cue my need for said salsa*

I've tried a variety of things on their menu, best of which are their chicken enchiladas (~$14) and their sopa di pollo ($14). Both are delicious and have the perfect blend of latin flavor. Pro-tip: order a side of the orange salsa to pour on top of the enchiladas (or really anything) for a delicious kick of taste.

Seriously though, this place is great. The food is great, the staff is great and you can make a reservation in advance right here on Yelp, which is GREAT. 100/10 recommend!!
author: Anna P.

description:
We're from Dallas, so before flying back home, we decided we wanted to get some food.  This place was located close to where we were, so we walked over there to try it out.  

Everyone at the front was very friendly.  There are a lot of menu items to choose from, and they all look pretty good.  I ordered a carne asada burrito.  We took our number and went to sit at the bar.  The bartender seemed like he wasn't happy on the day we were there.  We ordered margaritas from him, and they were pretty good.  

They have a great salsa bar there, and we were able to try out various salsas to go with our meal.  When I got my burrito, the first thing I noticed was how large it was.  Also, the tortilla was very soft and very fresh.  The burrito as a whole was tasty.

I definitely suggest coming here for a good burrito.  I'm not sure I'd recommend coming here just to drink, so I am glad we ended up getting food as well.
author: Kacey R.

description:
Ordered to go for lunch since we came in a large group. We arrived around 12:15, there was a pretty long line but it moved quickly. 

Here is how you order to go: when you are near the counter, someone behind the ingredient bar will say "I'm ready to take your order". You tell them what you want. They hand you a number and your order paper. You take the order paper to the cashier on the right. You pay and they give you the receipt. You wait for someone to bring you your food. It's pretty hectic but surprisingly fast. 

The actual food -- I ordered the Tropisueno torta. It was delicious and super filling. It does have a lot of meat, so be ready. I liked that there was no rice and few beans in this sandwich. Would definitely recommend! Also, it was packaged in foil and tossed in a paper bag which had a lot of chips at the bottom. Make sure also to go to the salsa bar - the green sauce is totally mild, though it is labelled as slightly spicy.
author: Alicia W.

description: Really good breakfast spot! Try it!
author: Blanca M.

description:
Cadillac Margs were okay..and served in a long glass instead of a typical Margarita glass..I'm just being picky.

I did enjoy all of their salsas, and the chips they provide are actually different than the chips you would get with ceviche.

I ordered their 2 plate menu which consisted of a flauta and a taco. Comes with beans and rice and the portion was pretty small, but good enough.

Bf ordered ceviche, and it was part of their seafood section..and it was the tiniest little portion.

The total..with 2 drinks and 2..I guess entrees? Came out to like $60. -_-
author: Ayumi S.

description: Location is perfect and the decoration inside is great. And I love that they allow to wait in line with Yelp.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Each year we have the dental convention at Moscone center and this is always a stop for lunch... yummmmmyyy food!!! The super tacos were amazing... had a fish taco and chicken not pictured.... the shredded chicken ones on flour tortillas were my favorite !!! And the salsa bar.... wow!!!

Just know you order your food first and then find a seat. It's usually pretty busy but most times we find a spot
author: Dee G.

description:
I came here to eat and drink on Cinco de Mayo and it was a blast. Their margaritas and mezcal/tequila shots were excellent. Perfectly made and fairly priced.

The carne asada tacos though were by far one of the best I've had. The salsa is excellent. Super yummy. Friendly bartenders and staff. Great atmosphere.

I will be back and was very impressed with the quality at Tropisueno.
author: Carlos H.

description:
I've been here a few times, I dig the margaritas but brings these prices down. 

Every restaurant on that strip must be expensive as hell to rent at because all of them have like a 25% higher price tag to the menu. 

The Mexican food there is completely on par with nearby restaurants that charge a third less, but if you want something Mission-quality and you are a soulless business man strolling on Market, go right ahead and enjoy this fine establishment, before you go back to trashing minorities. 

Lol, ok maybe that's a little harsh, but that's who I see there, no joke. 

"They need to go find a MexiCAN, because this bitch we got now is a mexiCANT." - group of customers talking about their waiter next to me.
author: John W.

description: I'm really glad I chose to try this place out for lunch. The food is tasty and full of flavor. Even though they got some of my order wrong, the food still hit the spot. I smashed the chicken taco with a huge dollop of guacamole and sour cream in the middle. Complimentary chips and salsa was a nice touch! The horchata had a bit too much cinnamon, but still delicious! The wait was kind of long, but that's to be expected on a Friday during lunch hour. I'll definitely give them another shot. Their food was good, man! Cinco de Mayo is right around the corner and this is the place to celebrate.
author: Liz B.

description:
Is Tropisueño my favorite burrito stop in SF? No, but it's a solid lunch stop that will fill you up and get you buzzed if you're living dangerously. 

During the day, Tropisueño features quick-service counter ordering with staples like burritos and tacos. You can take your items to go or grab a table. In the evening, they offer plated and seated service with more entrees and a slightly higher price point. If you happen to arrive at the end of lunch service like I did on my most recent trip, you may feel like you're losing your mind when you look back at the wall-sized menu as you approach the front of the line, for it will disappear. It turns out it rolls up and out of sight and that you aren't hallucinating. 

I've stuck with the pollo tinga burrito and have been happy each time. I usually take down about half and pop the rest in my bag for a late-night snack at the hotel. The chips are great and there are a variety of salsas. I once indulged in a lunchtime margarita with a group and was surprised to find it came in a pint glass. It was boozy enough that I couldn't finish and feel comfortable going back to the office. 

The Mission will probably continue to harbor the best burritos in SF, but if you want a quick, affordable lunch, Tropisueño is a good bet.
author: Stacey L.

description:
So much sound  inside the restaurant. everyone got acidity in my family .

It is archested food not authentic food I bet . 100% not good for famiy . people who wants to drink and talk as no one else to hear ,eat some un healthy food , this is the place.
author: Rajaram K.

description:
We arrived too early for dinner so came for happy hour. A great variety of food choices. The tacos are sooo flavorful. Guacamole was yummy but chips are kinda salty and greasy.  Ceviche had very small pieces and quality of fish and it was interesting it came with thicker chips. 

Ate outdoors on this warm evening in SF. Quite a bustling crowd.  Would return again to try other happy hour items and a meal.
author: Mitzi W.

description:
We tried this Mexican restaurant during the week while visiting SF. The food is very good, everything was fresh and full of flavors as we liked. Main courses are quite big and we were not able to finish everything so only consider appetizers if you know you are VERY hungry
Service is great and makes you feel welcome.

Reservation are absolutely mandatory but you can do it from Yelp directly
Only 3 stars because this place is extremely noisy which made it a lot less enjoyable
author: Leo P.

description:
I continuously find myself coming here!

I've been here for lunch and dinner. This latest time I came for dinner. They still have happy hours on the weekend and I had the quesadilla suiza and a margarita. The margaritas are delicious!

I enjoyed the quesadilla suiza--I got this with carnitas. The carnitas were cooked perfectly--very tender and well flavored.

You can sit outside and enjoy the breeze at Yerba Buena Lane. They offer great dinner dishes too. And I loveeee their chips and 3 salsas that they offer.
author: Natalie M.

description: Let's just say when in San Francisco my colleagues and I just kept eating here. The food is unbelievably delicious. The entire restaurant is full of people and every table is taken. Prices are great. Service is amazing. And it's a must be place for food.
author: Mane S.

description:
I went here a few months ago and I still can't stop thinking about it. The food is nice and clean (i.e. not too heavy or greasy. ). I loved the salsa and guacamole. I could have a meal on that alone. I also appreciated the fact that the portions weren't too big. and there cocktails are great! I had some drink that had honey in it.  It went down so smooth I felt that it would be a great thing to drink while sick. That is a good thing. They also have a drink with absinthe. Which may sound scary until you drink it. Then you realize that it is scary good.  

The only real reason that I am not giving this five stars is for its location. Unfortunately they are located in the small complex sits between Market and Mission. If my friend hadn't known that there was a restaurant that existed somewhere in the general vicinity I would have never gone. I guess for some people it is a good thing that it's tucked away like some sort of San Francisco secret..."to each his own" I guess. Over all this is an awesome place and I can't wait to return.
author: Mario V.

description:
First, we were blown away. As a group of 5 after 6pm on a Friday we were told it would be an hour wait, expectedly. Within 10 min they created a space for us outside and we were served in no time! 
Their chips are amazing!!! I'm not sure how they get them so thin and crispy, yet light! Their array of salsas are also interesting! 
Also, their house margs are great as well! The salt around the rim has an extra kick to it!
