They lose a star for their entrees. My carnitas tostadas were super fatty and my friend asked for her carne asada well done and it was crispy. The vegetarian of the group ordered three veggie tacos and almost licked his plate clean!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Exceptional...
 
Food is fresh and prepared nicely with a unique Mexican twist.. The ceviche is very nice..
author: Head Chef F.

description: Love the decor. Love the food. Always a good place to hang out. I usually get their tacos and burritos for lunch, which are very flavorful. The portions are perfect. The ingredients taste fresh and well cooked. You can get as much free chips as you want. Came here for happy hour once and the drinks were great! The happy hour dishes were still good amount of food. And the service is always friendly even when it gets crazy crowded. Highly recommended.
author: Iris H.

description:
My guess is that this has solid reviews based off tourist attendance. But you'll want to pass and head to Mission for your Mexican fix. Yes, yes, it's convenient, but keep walking. They advertise on yelp, that should have told me what I needed to know...

The food is very much your average fare. The flavor is adequate, portions pretty small (particularly the guacamole), the chips super greasy. At lunch it's effectively a high end chipotle, they prep the food in front of you after a long line. On top of it all, the prices are high given the extreme averageness of it all.
author: Toby F.

description: Great time and great service. They want you to have a good experience. Drinks were yummy and food was tasty. Was super close to my hotel and the waitlist was very convenient.
author: Alicia W.

description:
This is a step up from chipotle. The prices are reasonable and my burritos loaded were about $10 each. For SF that's a steal of a deal. They have neat to go 16 ounces between $16-18 but lean and tasty. The restaurant is clean. The house chips had a slightly sweet taste to them. They have 6 salsas and jalapeños to try. We came right at lunch time. They were hustling and in my mind doing a great job at cycling customers in and out. Smartly ran and executed. 
Definitely our new place when we visit SF and stay at the Marquis. Right outside the back doors. 
If we had one by our house in Phoenix. We would be there weekly.
author: Cory P.

description:
Their house margaritas are the best.
You can have an amazing Mexican dinner for a very good price.
They have vegetarian and gluten free options.
It is also easy to get vegan tacos and enchiladas as they custom the dishes based on your preference.
It's usually very crowded, so better reserve a table in advance.
author: Sevda G.

description:
Decor: fake but festive hacienda house
Service: fair to favourable 
Food: nah

Look. I left full. It was tasty. Here's the problem:

1. San Francisco hotel in the Money District recommend this spot as 'must hit'. Dassa nope with their prices being incongruent with what's on offer.

2. Ok. But what if they 're recommending this to wypipo and Others who have never been to a barrio spot or an amiga's kitchen table? Fair. However consider the next point;

3. I appreciate habaneros, jalapeños and their cousins. But some people can't handle scoville situations. Everything I was served -except the rice and the cold drink - required fortitude. Pepper should enhance, not overtake.

4. I requested easy on the ice for my drink, was presented with a glass of ice with liquid accompaniment. I politely asked for less ice and was pointedly served a half glass of liquid. 

I expect more quality at these prices. 

Postscript: the host was very nice.
author: Hadiza A.

description: Awesome wet burrito!  They also had a salsa bar with probably 10 or 15 different kinds of salsa for the chips they provide.  Every one I tried was great!
author: Sean S.

description: I guess this spot is popular. It was really busy on a Thursday after work. It's in a great location and the menu is good. It's not a place to pick burritos and tacos. It's a sit down restaurant with service. I got the 3 item for 14.95 with flauta, carne asada enchilada, and tamale. It was a good meal. Came with rice and beans(refried). I had 2 Jarritos with that(grapefruit and tamarind). Came here with Zane. Paid $26 with tax and tip. I would recommend this for people downtown after work. Really bustling atmosphere.
author: Denise C.

description:
This place has a very authentic ambience around it that hits you when you walk in. It was PACKED on a Saturday night when we came. I overheard some parties having to wait up to 1 hour and 45 minutes to get seated. However, the bf and I were able to get a table right away, as long as we committed to being out within an hour and a half, which was easy enough for us to do. 

The chips and salsa that they give you when you sit down are delicious. The tortilla chips are not greasy at all, which is a pet peeve of mine. They give you three different kinds of sauces. Tip - combine the medium and hot salsas - delish. 

I ordered a combo plate of one cheese tamale and one carnitas enchilada, with rice and beans on the side. Both were pretty good, but I especially liked the tamale. I also got a cadillac margarita to go with my meal, and while it was mainly filled with ice, it still packed a nice kick to it. 

The staff was very friendly and overall, we had a good time here.
author: Anita L.

description:
First things first. I'm Mexican.

Second, this place is a wannabe glorified Chevy's. Anyone that rates this place well, doesn't know what real Mexican food is. They've never had Mexican food in the Mission. They're not native Californians. That clear enough? I think so.

The green salsa made things edible. No, it wasn't any kind of creamy goodness you'd find in the Mission. You know what I'm talking about: tomatillo, cilantro, avocado goodness. All up in that thang. Nope. 

Don't go. My ancestors are turning in their graves at this one.

This Mission is filled with amazing taquerias, and that's where I should've gone: Farolito, El Toro. Nunca mas.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Yummy and reasonable.
And no junkies flinging shit and needles within smelling distance. 
This is a HUGE plus for those who are not familiar with San Francisco.
author: Ricardo O.

description:
I came here for lunch recently, and maybe I just didn't order something good, but with a pretty standard lunch menu I was pretty unimpressed.  I ordered 3 tacos and they were edible, but definitely nothing special.  My friend ordered nachos and she barely even touched her plate.  But my friend who got a burrito loved it.  The 3 stars go to the margaritas and the chips and salsas.  Whatever that orange smoky habanero salsa is?  Kudos.

But like I said, I have only been here for lunch.  Based off of all the great dinner reviews I may come back.
author: Cori A.

description: Amazing Chile relleno - it's as big as my head! They have a great menu selection and an awesome salsa bar. Great patio for outdoor eating in the sun and nice ambience inside. Love coming here for work lunches
author: Miranda M.

description:
Great vibe! Great service!  Came in for happy hour.  Enjoyed the chips and salsa,  the tacos were tasty, the flautas were good, the quesadilla was good too!  The drinks were great- margarita and sangria.

The guacamole was really good.
author: Mary M.

description: The location is nice and the idea of sitting in the cute patio is also nice. BUT and a big but, they only have two heating lamps and two blankets, which are not nearly enough to accommodate their customers adequately. My group and I were freezing and we couldn't enjoy our meal. The food is just okay, but pretty good for the price, especially if you go during happy hour. Mor sure I would go back until they figure out the patio situation.
author: Sandy G.

description:
This place is always busy - and now I know why... Very cool vibes - indoor and out - and service is fast and friendly!

When you arrive at the table, you get chips and 3 kinds of salsa. Yum! 

They have really really good guacamole! Combine it with their homemade tortilla chips, amazing. 

I normally get the veggie tacos (minus cheese and sour cream) and they are OK.. not worth raving about. The black bean puree and rice are good! For meat eaters, you have many more options - good options - friends I've gone with enjoy the food very much.
author: Jenna M.

description: This place is located right behind the Mariott hotel in a very large and spacious patio. The restaurant is on the smaller side but has an indoor seating area, outdoor seating area, and small bar area. This place can get super packed during evening hours and on the weekends, so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time to make sure you are seated quickly. We came on a Friday evening, with a party of 6 and were seated quickly. The service here was awesome and always quick. The food here was also really good as well as the drinks. The place does seem more upscale than most Mexican spots that you go to but overall it has a nice vibe. Overall a decent place to eat and I would definatly come back here again!
author: Anne R.

description:
We came in here during a rush time on a Monday at 2:30ish.  This place was packed. Entering the restaurant we were a bit confused on how to order but there was a sign that we missed that tells you clearly to order at the counter, pay at the register and to sit yourself. 

We got three different chicken tacos (regular chicken, fajita chicken and shredded chicken), shrimp taco, grilled veggies taco and a tofu taco with a side of chicken tortilla soup. That soup is humongous and had chunks of veggies like squash and zucchini and half of an avocado that I could tell were fresh. I don't like some veggies but I gobbled it all up.  My favorites were the regular chicken taco, the tofu taco and that hearty bowl of soup.

We sat ourselves at the bar to try some cocktails. Our bartender was Alejandro and he was amazing. He really made the entire experience epic. He is superbly knowledgeable on mixology.  I had the pepino which seemed to be a popular drink there. It was tarty and tasted like lime and cucumber: fresh. We also tried la murte which supposedly is a strong drink with absinthe with champagne finish. I loved it. Overall a great experience. 

I would definitely come again.
author: Sampa M.

description: I got the Tampiqueno - carne asada steak with rice, beans, guac, and an enchilada. My medium rare steak was sadly the worst part of the meal. It was extremely chewy making it way too tough to bite. It was also way too charred and tough to eat. I decided to just eat everything else besides the steak. In addition to that, we were seated outdoors and shivering like crazy. The restaurants next door had outdoor heating lamps but this one did not at all. I think that heating for outdoor seating is a requirement for a restaurant in such a cold city!
author: Michael L.

description:
5/5 This place is awesome. Came here for happy hour (hell yeaaahh) around 5 and was blown away by the menu for drinks and food! I didn't have to wait and there were still plenty of open tables inside and outside. There's a good number of options and the prices are so affordable. 

Happy hour 4-6pm mon-fri. Last call 5:45pm. $4 draft beer, and snacks around $4-$6. The fish taco was big for $4! Tried 2 other small plates which came w 2 pieces each. The servings portions are good! I love how there's complimentary chips and salsa!
author: Miranda L.

description:
I love this place. I've been here probably 4 times and am always extremely happy with the food and service. Amazing, delicious, authentic Mexican food, unlimited chips, and a Salsa bar. 
You order your food before sitting down. Truly a gem for SF in the area with Convenient location, outdoor and indoor seating.
Must visit. Thanks
author: Ellie S.

description: ugh... I did not realize this was a waitlist restaurant until I got there.... what a bummer! Regardless, we didn't wait that long until we were seated. One thing that really popped out at me was the chips and guac and it wasn't b/c I was starving and that was the first things served. I can not put my fingers on it but the chips were very thin and warm and crispy with the guac wow.  I got the carne asada and enchilada combo with refried beans and rice. it was great! I loved the way the steak was cooked, almost well done but still tender (I do not like under cooked meat). One thing I kinda wished was they add a little cheese on the beans that would have made it 100% for me.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Really like this place, and the price is great for the location. Difficult to find decent priced places in downtown SF. Staff was friendly and it was pretty easy to hear everyone, despite the restaurant being full.

Food as a whole was yummy. I got the 3 for 14.95 Combo and liked it. The flauta was yummy, I only wish the tamale had a little more meat inside. Wine was affordable too, would definitely come back again!
author: Erin H.

description:
Good decor for large parties, but a bit too noisy for intimate conversations.

I had the Enchiladas de Nopales (Vegetable Enchiladas) which the reviews here set high expectations and it did not disappoint.  My favorite thing is the cactus for the novelty factor.

Hubby had the Pescado Frito de Verscruz (Fried Rainbow Trout) which I am not into.  He said he liked it, but he think the free chips are the best part.

House Guacamole is too smooth and is easy to make tastier.

Platanos Fritos was not crispy for us.

Camarones al Mojo de ajo (Garlic Butter Shrimp) taste like farmed shrimp and would work better with more seasoning and caramelization.

For drinks, I had the Gloria (Partida blanco, lemon juice, Elderflower liquer shaken with egg whites) which was not sweet.  I prefer sweet cocktails with lots of flavor.

Overall, it is a decent place to hangout without spending a ton.
author: Lisa C.

description: Lunch was great! Walk in and start ordering your food behind the counter. Lunch time was a little hectic but it was tasty! I had the veggie quesadilla. I liked that you can select whatever you want for your salsa. I tried all of them. I wish they had the name tags for them.
author: Scott Matthew C.

description:
Tropisueño is a Mexican Taqueria for lunch which turns into a sit down restaurant for dinner service in the heart of downtown SF. The short review of this place would be that in my opinion Tropisueño is the only Mexican restaurant that is worth visiting in downtown or FiDi.

I've been here about a dozen times mostly for the lunch service. My advice is to come early like around 11:30 am as by 12 there is a line out of the door. 12:30 pm and you are better off getting something to-go as you will be end up standing and holding your plate for a seat to open up. The menu here is a little more than what you would expect in a Taqueria. It covers nachos, tacos, burritos, tostadas, tortas, enchiladas, tamale, quesadillas and plates with meat or combination of other items along with rice and beans. Ordering system for lunch is hybrid table service style, where you order at the counter, pay, get a token, find a table and have the food delivered to the table.

Over a period of time I've tried most of the items on the menu and have yet to come across something that I have not liked. All ingredients used are fresh and the meat is especially good. You have a wide range of options for the meat which includes carne asada, barbacoa, chorizo, chile verde, al pastor, pollo asado and pollo tinga among others. There is a salsa bar on the inside to the right that you can help yourself too.

My favorite is the wet burrito i.e. Burrito Mojado ($9.50) that can be topped with red or green sauce. Making any burrito a super ($1.75) would add sour cream and guacamole to the burrito, but I generally avoid that as it makes it very heavy for lunch.

Price wise Tropisueño is about 20% more expensive that other Taqueria's or quick serve Mexican restaurants in FiDi but the extra cost is totally worth it. When benchmarked against other Mexican restaurants Tropisueño stands head and shoulders above the rest, hence it gets a well-deserved 5 star rating.
author: Ahmad J.

description: Solid Margarita; A regular here at the HH. Cannot go wrong with the carnitas taco. Very very loud and will be hard to carry a conversation. Service is fast even at the most busy time.
author: Souris L.

description:
Came to SF for a business meeting and was told by the hotel I stayed at that this was the spot for happy hour and the best margarita in town.  I travel across the world for business......AS A FOOD CRITIC. This will be the first of many reviews I splash across social media, urging people to not spend their money at an establishment that promotes mediocre food, lack of ambiance but most importantly, a staff that is so rude....so stuck on themselves that you are made to feel uncomfortable while dining. 

My food was doused in a tomato puree tasting sauce that was weak in flavor and lacked any sort of authenticity or creativity. The portions were so small they made "small plates" look like an entree.

My assistant came to dinner with the group and was served a margarita without being asked for ID.....my assistant is 20. We, of course, had her order to see if they would card and they did not. We took 2 sips of the bland, lifeless, poor excuse for a margarita and then tried to flag our server down to send it back for an alternative beverage. 

The server advised us is in a snotty tone that since we took a few sips, they would not take the drink back for an alternative option. I asked to speak to a manage. A sloppy looking guy approached the table. He was visibly upset that we had taken him away from flirting with a pair of women at the table next to us......overhearing him say he would buy them a few rounds if they were interested in coming back to his house after they closed was the preface I had to my "guest experience" with this individual. 

Drunk, immature and sloven...this is the management representation of Tropisueno. Kudos to the owners for employing a pathetic excuse of a human being named Alex. At first I thought it was a joke, possibly a drunken guest pretending to be a manager. But alas, this is in fact, the General Manager. While I was explaining my frustrations of the poor service, horrendous food and beverages, all he as concerned about was making googly eyes and looking down my blouse. 

Since you are unable to rationalize with an irrational person, my party of 5 got up and left. Alex stumbled after us and tried to "salvage the guest experience" by offering to send us all new food and take care of the entire check. My guess is he was too intoxicated to remember this encounter but my staff and I were not. We were so appalled by the lack of professionalism that the poor food, beverages and service took a backseat to being sexually harassed at the table by an individual that gets paid to manage this establishment. This is lawyer worthy....

Good luck Tropisueno.....
author: Kris C.

description:
I am surprised yelp has 4 stars for this place.  The location is nice but that's about it.   We had high anticipation for a good Mexican place. It was not.   It was almost like a low end place at a nice location with low end service.  

Let's start with food.  We did get the free chips and 3 dips.  That was nice and therefore gives them two star vs one.   We then got 
- tilapia ceviche - was okay. Nothing special 
- beef cheeks tacos. - was just okay
- empanada - terrible dough 
- scallop appetizer - salty
- prawn with garlic - was good but also was a bit salty

Service was scattered.  When we asked what he recommended.  He recommended the whole menu. Not helpful.  When we ordered he kept looking around a bit distracted. 

When our ceviche came, he also tried to serve us the prawn ceviche. I said I didn't order it and he tried to convince me I did.  I told him I pointed to the two other dishes on the menu I wanted and it was not the prawn ceviche.   So he asked me which do I want him to remove?   I said the one I didn't ordered.  He was still stunned. 

Lastly we ordered a side of rice when our last two dishes came.   He said promptly that will be an extra charge.   We said yes.  I am not sure there is a restaurant out there who doesn't charge for side of rice.   It was just the way he said it that was so odd. 

We will NOT be back.
author: Lei H.

description:
Verty tasty and lively place. The music was flowing and the drinks were being poured.

The food was good and authentic...beware as the reftied beans have dried chillis in them - smoking hot. The best bet is the shrimp tacos...yummy!
author: S W.

description:
Had tickets to the Ice Cream Museaum this past weekend  we had a few hour to spare so we decided to try this place. I thought It was a sit down get a menu order type of restaurant but upon entering there is a wall to your right and the menu is there for you to browse before you order. Where you order the food is set up like buffet style. Then you take your ticket and pay they give you a marker so the waiter knows where to take the food.

My daughter and I ordered the chicken nachos and tacos, one each of barbacoa, carnitas, Chile verde and chorizo. They also have a salsa bar. The orange salsa is the spiciest and the red one is also good. 

Our food came and the nachos were pretty big enough for 4 people to share as an appetizer.
author: Johanna G.

description:
First stop after early check-in, get a some lunch! Cafeteria-style authentic Mexican was the ticket. Walk thru the queue and let the ladies know what you want to eat, move on down and pay, take a seat. The server brought us chips and salsa (free with meal purchase) and not long after that, our meals. I ordered two super tacos: chicken, black beans, crema, guac - YUM!
My guy had a couple enchiladas which he said were excellent. Great spot and I loved the energy in the place, alive with patrons eating and enjoying the experience.
author: Bryan M.

description:
This place has REALLY good burritos. You can't go wrong with any of the choices. The serving style is basically like chiptole. You tell the workers what you want and they write it down on a piece of paper and you can add/take out any items you don't want. They make the food in an open space like chiptole style. You pay, grab a number, and find any open table. Someone will swing by and bring a basket of delicious tortilla chips and you can get stop by the sauce bar to grab whatever salsa you want. It's unlimited! The worker will bring the food out to you once it's ready too.

I always come here during the lunchtime and there's always a long line. I recommend coming here around 11:30-12:00 if you are in a hurry. The burrito portion is HUGE vs. Chiptole. 

I also highly recommend their happy hour. House margarita is only $7 and they were STRONG! Totally worth the money. Again, they serve you unlimited tortilla chips with salsa so you don't really need to order any food from the happy menu if you are tight on budget ;)
author: Anny W.

description: I may be wrong but I recall them being sister restaurants with  El Gusano in Oakland. The decor has a nice rustic feel to it. The 3 sauces they serve were good. Food and drinks were good overall...only nit that the guac serving was very small.
author: Sunil R.

description: On a nice sunny Sunday in the city, you can never go wrong with some Mexican cuisine! Spoiled with the endless Mexican food in SD I was surprised by the savory flavors of the shrimp burrito. Overall a great joint if you want a quick bite. However, it would be nice to have more entertainment within the restaurant.
author: Aga G.

description:
We came to Tropisueno for a weekend lunch before catching a movie at AMC Metreon.  My wife used to work in SF and raved about this Mexican place, which is super-popular during lunch hour.  The food is definitely Muy Authentico, and definitely a step-up beyond Chevy's, Chipotle, Dos Coyotes, etc. Service was quick and friendly too.  After ordering and paying, a big bowl of nachos appeared at our table.

Since it was lunchtime, the restaurant is Taqueria style, so you order, pay, and wait for your food.  Plenty of places to sit inside and out, and the ambiance is festive and cool.  The food here is outstanding.  I got the 2-item combo with chicken mole enchiladas and pork tamales with black beans and rice.  I highly recommend adding mole ($2.25 surcharge) to everything, as it adds a nice sweet-spicy flavor that's unique and hard to replicate.  Supposedly real mole requires 20-30 ingredients and lots of effort to make!  Wife got the three tacos combo which was also good.  I tried a sampling of the meats (pollo asado, steak) and all were seasoned and moist.  The refried beans use lard(!) and was creamy and decadent.

I can see why lunch is popular here.  Food comes out fast, is reasonably priced, and taste-wise, muy buenos.  My rating: Cinco Estrellas!
author: Daniel C.

description: This was a nice restaurant that is a little hard to find if you are not familiar with the area.  It is located in an unmarked alley on the back side of the Marriott hotel, across from the Contemporary Jewish Museum (a big blue cube).  The name of the restaurant is not prominent, but a sign that identifies it as a Mexican restaurant is on the exterior.  The restaurant is a bit noisy on a Friday night.  We had the chicken mole and guacamole.  It was all very good.  The special margarita is also very good.  The service was very polite and efficient.  We will be back.
author: David G.

description: So good! Best chips ive ever had. Love the 3 choices of salsas too. Didn't have reservations and they said it would be a 30 min wait. We barely waited 15 min and were seated. The food was authentic and delicious
author: Brieann B.

description:
Finally I found a great Mexican restaurant with fancy atmosphere and great food in downtown San Francisco.
There are so many food and drinks options to choose in the menu, I really want to come back to try more!
The corn chips are home made and served with there different sauces from mild, medium spicy and very spicy.
We ordered taste of all three ceviche, tender braised beef tacos, chile verde soup, they all taste great. 
The cocktail with cucumber water also taste great.
The interior of the restaurant is Spanish style especially at the bar area which brings relaxed yet elegant atmosphere.
author: Irene X.

description: Delicious and authentic. Lunch is the way to go if the time sits you and the salsa bar is where it's at.
author: Samantha M.

description: We came here for lunch with my two boys before a visit to the Museum of Ice Cream. Great location and good for kids. Lunch is order at the counter and then take a number to your table. We had chicken quesadilla and cheese and bean burrito. My kids split the burrito. I should have said not to include salsa and lettuce. My quesadilla was okay, but the chicken did not seem the best quality. We would definitely mutely come here again with the kids, but probably not on our own.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: I love the vibe and energy of this place. Although it's not very big, it's really lively and upbeat. Their spicy mango margaritas are perfection. They also have this orange salsa which, if you can tolerate a good amount of spice, is just delicious and adds amazing flavor to any dish. I usually get the enchiladas and they are great, especially the shrimp verde. Not a big fan of the desserts, but we can skip it next time.
author: Vyoma K.

description:
Pretty cute, decent Mexican restaurant with a great selection! Went here for happy hour dinner before TedxSoMA (TedxTalk ;) and we decided to just drop by here randomly.

Happy Hour selection was bomb dot com. We opted to try the fresh guac, veggie quesadilla, fish and veggie tacos, margaritas, and complimentary chips and salsa.

Gotta say I loved the fish taco, it was very well-rounded and quantity aplenty. No anorexic fish at Tropisueno! The veggie quesadilla and guac was decent, but the chips and salsa was better IMO. 

Ambient is dim lighting with casual wear and average noise level. Definitely great for a date night or outing with friends! Service was left more to desired, particularly painfully slow service at 5PM... but the great food and drinks made up for it!
author: Donna T.

description:
I was staying in the hotel attached to this restaurant for work and came here for dinner one night with my coworkers. I was pleasantly surprised! The food was really good. The salsas they brought out at the beginning were so good and flavorful - my favorite was the orange habanero sauce. We ordered the platanos fritos and chile con queso for apps and they were sooooo good. The queso has a little dab of goat cheese in the middle that was a great combo with the typical queso cheese. 

For my meal, I got a chicken tinga flauta and barbacoa enchilada. Both were great. Their margs were a little too sweet for my taste, but the food was great and super convenient to where I was staying. Will def be back next time I'm in SF for work.
author: Morgan S.

description:
A great little place with a great atmosphere! My friends and I stumbled upon this place at noon on a Sunday, and it was definitely a catch. There was no wait at all and plenty of open tables. Would definitely come back! 

The food was reasonably priced for SF: $3.50 for a regular taco, $4.25 for "premium" tacos. I like the concept of ordering first and picking an open seat of choice. My tacos were DELICIOUS--especially the tortillas. However, my friends and I shared the guacamole ($6) and was underwhelmed. The portion was so small for $6 and it lacked flavor, which was the biggest miss for me. 

Overall, a great place to try if you're in the area!
author: Erika S.

description:
What a huge disappointment.  This is like a fancied-up Chipotle with slow and ineffective service. Actually that's a disservice to Chipotle to compare them to this place.  It's more like an ineffective Chevy's.  Yeah, that's more appropriate.

Basically you wait in line for 10-15 minutes and they take your order and then you take a number sign and wait another 10-15 minutes for the food to come to your table. And then the food is made incorrectly and the stuff that is made correctly still sucks and tastes like it could have made at a grocery store.  That mediocre.

Also, to add insult to injury, if you want a margarita, you have to wait in a different line at the bar and order there separately. And the drinks taste like they came out of a Slurpee machine.  Ok, that's a disservice to Slurpee machines. 

Really, just go to Chipotle and save a ton of money and time and get your margaritas from basically anywhere else.
author: Saminda W.

description:
I've loved Tropisueno for years, ever since moving back up to Northern California. The food is great and the drinks are fantastic. However, it was not until today that I felt the need to write a review. 

My husband and I decided to take a weekday to relive our pre-mortgage & pre-baby days in San Francisco. We ended up stopping by Tropisueno for some food & drinks. We sat at the bar and were lucky enough to be served by Jose. He was fantastic-- we talked about tequila and thoroughly enjoyed your time there. He made our afternoon enjoyable and we will be sure to visit again when we get a chance.

He is a fantastic employee and reminded us why we love the restaurant.
author: Jean B.

description:
Trop, aka...my happy place! I have been loving this place for close to 10 years now and it just keeps getting better and better. Here are a few reasons why you should love Tropisueño as much as I do: 

1. Delicious Mexican food! Fish or shrimp tacos are my favorites. They also make amazing, fresh salads. 
2. So fast/efficient service. Even when the line looks like Disneyland's Splash Mountain circa 1989 - you can still be back at your desk 45 minutes later. 
3. Drinks on drinks. The margaritas are the perfect combination of tart, sweet and salty. I recommend always having two - instant mood changer. But only if you're not going back to work - don't be that guy/girl!

Take a co-worker, friend, date - anyone you want to have a good time with. Just remember to keep your schedule light in the afternoon since a Mexican food lunch never equals a productive afternoon!
author: Alison C.

description: We came early hoping to beat the crowd. We didn't! 25 minute wait for 2 at 5:20. We squeezed in to the bar and it was amazing!  Great house margarita for $7 during happy hour. Bartender was super friendly and informative for how busy he was. SALBUETAS were OUT OF THIS WORLD good!! And like $6!! Awesome find!
author: A W.

description:
Chill mexican place in the financial district. Decent but large margeritas. 
I ordered a carne asada platter - came out a little bit rarer than medium rare, with beans, rice, guacamole, and an enchilada.

Best to get reservations because the wait can get pretty long. But, all in a all, a solid place to get a meal with friends. Not too expensive. Win Win.
author: Vicky L.

description: Not 5 stars because of their ordering system. They really should hire servers and make it a full dining experience. Waited in line for about 15 minutes, food was delivered to our bar table within 15 minutes, not complaining about the time, just don't care for that ordering process. However, the food and margaritas are superior! Enchiladas (chicken) were my favorite, and hubby loved his traditional tacos al pastor. The tamale could have used a bit more filling, but still had awesome authentic flavor. The refried beans, I loved but hubby didn't like that they were spicy.  They have a salsa bar that satisfies many different palates. Very very crowded and noisy. Definitely will be returning!
author: Michelle M.

description: What Mexican food restaurant doesn't offer quesadillas or burritos.... this place!  To make matters worse, they have the materials to make these simple items, but won't make them for you.... that's unfortunate.  Chips and salsa were average.  Food was ok, but very disappointed in the limited menu.  Service was not good considering anytime we had a question or needed anything, we had to flag our waitress down. Overall, I will not be coming back here or recommending this place to anyone.
author: Lucy C.

description:
This place is really really busy and I'm not sure why...

Stopped in around two with my wife for lunch. We weren't really sure why there was a huge line out the door but we figured we would give it a try. We waited about 15 minutes and then all of the sudden you're in front of a giant menu and a guy ready to take your order. It seems like they should put the menu outside so that you can ponder the dozens of options while you wait. 

My wife tried to order a combo plate with two different tacos but apparently they dint allow you to do that with fish tacos. So she ended up with two al a carte. I ordered a chili verde super burrito. When then got to the register and there was some confusion. Maybe the cashier was new but the process was pretty inefficient. 

We sat down and waited for our food and were quickly served a giant bowl of chips but no salsa....oh you get the salsa yourself, okay.  The chips weren't hot and fresh but they were thin and nicely crisped. The salsa varieties were all pretty good. 

Then the food came but no silverware or napkins....ok you get that yourself too. The Chile verde super burrito was pretty good but not excellent. The spice level was great but you didn't get those nice chunks of pork or the tang from tomatillos that you expect.  The fish tacos we're a little odd. They were too spiced for my wife so I tried it and the fish was really really over cooked. 

Best thing was the chips. 

$30 plus square asks for a tip which seems silly since there really was no service.
author: aaron l.

description: The Mexican food here is out of this world. Goat cheese in the queso?! So much yes. Excellent service. The food was out quickly. Great drink selection. ( Modelo Negra is perfect for this experience) the aesthetic is warm and comfortable, and is a bit more intimate that your average restaurant. The prices are affordable and they offer outdoor seating. This is a must if you love Mexican food as much as I do. They bring out complimentary salsa and chips so be aware of that before you order appetizers. LOVE IT
author: Elizabeth G.

description: This restaurant is a great lunch spot! My friend and I were able to get our food in a timely manner and enjoy the outside patio seating. The food was good and the salsa selection was on par. The burrito was delicious!
author: Tyler B.

description: The service was awful! We came in contact with 5or 6 employees and all of them but one was rude and not very helpful. When I ordered up front it's specifically said that they had a salad under the appetizers but when I ordered it the lady had no clue what I was talking about and then turned around to ask her friend and she didn't know either. I showed them that their menu said they had a salad on their appetizer menu and they still didn't understand what I was trying to say.  When we went to the bar the bartenders also were not very nice.  I went outside on the patio which was nice to eat and my phone had died and I was 2 hours away from home so I went back to the bar to see if they would mind charging my cell phone and they threw a little bit of a fit before putting it on the charger. I've just been in the restaurant business all of my life and don't understand why people work in the restaurant business if they don't love working with people! But I do have to say their tofu was the best rendition I have ever had! The chips and salsa were amazing but the guac is way overpriced! It was less than one cup and it was $6. The nachos were good and I would not order the ceviche again. But I would definitely return to this restaurant because of the food. The server that served us outside was very friendly and nice. We loved him so much we thought about coming back for happy hour the same day!
author: JEN M.

description: Vegetable soup was so salty, I couldn't eat it. Boyfriend has the seafood soup which was really fishy. The free chips and salsa were good.
author: Jo W.

description:
I thought this was a good Mexican place near the FiDi.

They had those really thin, warm, crispy tortilla chips that remind me of those from Chevy's. These kinds of chips are my personal favorite. The chips came with 3 different salsas. The red, the green, and a cheesy yellow one(?). The yellow one was on the spicier side, so didn't really enjoy it as much but the others were pretty good.

The drinks are also pretty strong, which is a good thing if you like them really strong. I don't, so I asked for just half of the alcohol is my margaritas. 

The house guac was good. The fish and shrimp ceviches were both flavored well. My tampiqueño (grilled steak entree) was basically raw when I got it. I had asked for medium-rare, but I was served raw steak with a sear on it. I immediately sent it back for it to be cooked some more.

The service was good, but the food came out a bit slow for my taste. It was ok because I was catching up with a coworker, but if I wasn't, I would have definitely noticed that food came out slower than it should have. 

Overall, I would definitely come back. It was good food for the price near the FiDi (which is super hard to find).
author: Carolyn Z.

description: Loved the chips and three different salsas that came before our meal.  Our traditional combination plates with enchiladas, tamales and flauta were just mediocre.  There are so many better Mexican food restaurants around, that it is unlikely I would return for the food.  The restaurant was very busy and lively, but a bit too noisy for me.  Location is very convenient to the Union Square, Metreon, Moscone Center area.
author: Wanda L.

description:
Hands down amazing happy hour deals!

The staff is so kind and sweet. Very clean and beautiful decor - only a little bit squished at the bar, but no harm done :)
author: Albia C.

description: I went to Topisueño on Friday a little before four and it was still a taqueria. I ordered and sat where I wanted.  The food was cheap and came out quick. I loved it.  There was so much flavor and everything was hot.  When it was 4pm and happy hour started the host began seating people. I was told I can stay where I was and gave a happy hour menu.  This was excellent service!  I was debating another margarita or not and since I was given a happy hour menu from the wonderful host with a great smile, I decided to stay and have more drinks and great food.  Then Jonathan came and greeted me, he is so pleasant and very welcoming.  I am not one for reviews but this place is great and a must go !  Enjoy.
author: Juanita H.

description:
Oh god the chips. So, so good. And so, so unlimited/free. They're so thin, crispy, and perfectly salted. They give you three different salsas that are also super good!

I've heard that they have good margaritas but I didn't get to try it this time. I got the camarones (shrimp) plate with rice and beans. I thought the shrimp sauce was way too salty, but otherwise good. Rice and beans were nothing special. My boyfriend got the carne asada plate and omg the steak was so tough. I was chewing and chewing and it just would not break down and I just ended up swallowing a huge chunk and it was painful :(

I would love to come back for unlimited chips and to get drunk on margaritas!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
A trip to San Francisco wouldn't be complete without a stop at Tropisueño for some awesome drinks whipped up by the best Bay Area bartender, Alejandro. We always have so much fun eating and drinking at the bar where we can chat it up with him. Great guy!
Speaking of great, I've never had a bad meal there!  Two things that I am obsessed with are the spicy vegetable soup and the pork chops.  I'm usually a steak guy but after experiencing the Tropisueño pork chops, I now have cravings for the other white meat. Amazing! And who gets excited for soup? Well, this guy does now!
Whether it's an icy cold cervaza, a mezcal margarita ( highly recommended) or a full on meal, stop in to and say hola to Alejandro and the gang at Tropisueño. It'll become your Bay Area tradition just like it has with us. Stay thirsty, my friends. Cheers!
author: Barry B.

description: 3.5/5. I was excited and quite hungry when I arrived at Tropisueno. Having booked the waitlist thru the Yelp app I walked right in at primetime and was seated immediately. My date and I were greeted with chips and salsa. The chips were nothing exceptional but the variety of three sauces was unique.  I particularly enjoyed the verde sauce.  The tomato sauce was ok and the orange sauce was not at all enjoyable.  The Margherita with jalapeno, rimmed with a spicy sweet salt was just the right amount of tequila.  I ordered the Pollo Asado with rice and pinto beans.  The chicken was quite dry and the flavor leaves something to be desired.  The pinto beans and rice were filling only.  There are also veggies included such as zucchini and they are alright too.  I had higher expectations for this place and I would say that this place only has average Mexican food, especially in such an area with so many options for excellent Mexican food.
author: Robert M.

description: This place is treat to go to.  The salsas are delicious and the margaritas are too! I love the quest dip here it's so fattening but delicious! You can hang out on the side and just indulge in a happy hour or you can do the full service meal in their dining area. Food is very well flavored and timely.  This place also gets packed quickly so make sure you make a reservation or be prepared to wait
author: Samantha S.

description: Tropisueño did not disappoint.  Hip little Mexican restaurant.  Everything that you would expect.  Great, attentive staff.  Authentic decor.  Mexican music.  Chips and three salsas were surprisingly good.  Good portions.  Tasty, flame broiled carne asade steak.  Can't go wrong.  Very busy.
author: Matt B.

description:
Ate dinner with a friend here Saturday night, sat outside as the place was busy.  Chips were thin and crispy, like I like it.  Salsas were good, the creamy & spicy orange one my fave, came warm.  The Huaraches were good, edges slightly crispy, other parts soft corny yumminess with various  meat on top.  

They missed the boat on service.  Everyone was quite nice, however, attentive they were not.  It took a while to get a menu, even longer for a napkin and silverware and they really only came by for the bare minimum.  The food came fairly quick.  It was cold, and I don't get cold often; which they should consider when serving people outside.  One really should not have to ask for a menu, or napkin.  They do have blankets outside, which I noticed later; as they did not inform us of them.  There are SOOOOOOO many places in S.F. for Mexican food, amaaaazing places, there really is no need to return.  There are even several other restaurants, which I will try, on that slightly upscale alley.  Their chips are pretty addictive.  Run by a table and grab a few.... and run away fast!  ;)    Nooooooo!!!!
author: Delicious B.

description: You have to get the queso - soooo good ! I actually just got a bunch of apps and the veg taco which was pretty good but nothing special. Empanadas were delicious and nicely paired with the sauce it came with. The plantains weren't that great but I don't love plantains to begin with. And the chips and salsa they give out in the beginning - the orange one was delicious. Pretty spicy food which I appreciated. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Priya B.

description:
Not a full-service restaurant at lunch. This is a cafeteria style, order at the counter and eat at a table. Drinks are paid for separately at the bar and the whole "restaurant" system was confusing and not expected. No one seemed helpful in our bout of confusion either. 

Guacamole app size was disappointing for the price. (Expensive $13) Margs were good. Strawberry margarita a little sweet, not too sour. Food was okay, rice and beans were just warm (personal preference - everything needed salt).

Don't forget to grab water, silverware,and utensils at the bar/salsa bar before sitting down!
author: Nicole P.

description:
We reached there are 4pm. They were still serving lunch items. I ordered ceviche ( too much lemon), fish burrito was the best,my husband ordered chicken tamales and he loved it. Overall the food was great. 

I loved their margarita. I wish they had less ice. I'll definitely recommend this place in city for Mexican food.
author: Ashi C.

description:
Came here based on high Yelp reviews on Saturday night. Waited about 30 minutes for 3 people. The service was great, our waiter was nice and tentative. We ordered Tostaditas de carnitas, tampiqueno, and pollo asado. The chicken that my friend got was really moist and tender, tostaditas tasted great no complaints on those. However, my Tampiqueno beef was so under seasoned and the enchilada beef was dry. The rice was alright nothing special. Overall, the meal was ok not super impressed with the food. Maybe I should have order other things on the menu instead. We got charged for a side of cheese that we never got so the manager took out the tostaditas on our check which was really nice of them.

Overall
Taste: 3/5
Service 5/5
Parking: 3/5 on the street but we uber there
Price: 4/5 typical dinner price
author: Thanasri T.

description:
Thaaaank you Tropisueno for having happy hour on the weekends as well! I wish more restaurants did that. Bar area doesn't have too much seating so we were forced to sit outside (on a windy day). For Mexican food though, this is a small price to pay...

My friend and I came on Sunday at 5 PM and we were debating between HH and regular entrees. However, based on the price, we picked HH so that we can share more dishes together.

Chips and three types of salsa as an appetizer and all three were mmm mmm delicious! Orange salsa has a kick to it so if you can't handle spiciness, definitely be cautious at first. We ordered the fish tacos, nachos, chicken quesadilla suiza, and flautas, ranked from best to least favorite. Pro tip: split the taco tortilla into two so that you can get two tacos instead (shout out to my friend that realized that after she took a bite.) Would definitely get the tacos and nachos again. There is nothing too special about the quesadilla (they all taste the same to me), and do yourself a favor and don't order the flauta. That was a waste of calories IMO.  I wouldn't say this is the best Mexican food I've had, but for the price I think it's definitely worth it.

Servers were all very nice and pretty attentive.

Great place for a group of friends! Didn't get to try the drinks..maybe next time. On that note.....until next time....! :)
author: Cathy C.

description:
One star is extremely generous for this place. This is the worst excuse for Mexican food I have seen in a while. 

The chips definitely came out of a bag from the grocery store and the guacamole most likely also came out of a large, plastic, buy-in-bulk bag. As far as menu items, here is my piece of advice - if anything comes with shredded lettuce and chopped tomatoes, it's not real Mexican. Even if you're looking for more Tex-Mex style food, this is not the place. 

Don't, just don't do it.
author: Alexandra U.

description:
The chips and three salsa options they provide are delicious! The chips and salsa at Mexican restaurants are irresistible to me, especially when the chips are fresh and delicious and the salsa is tasty. 

I personally ordered the camarones Tropisueño, and the shrimp and sauce was absolutely delicious. The dish was served with rice and beans, and the rice was also delicious. My husband ordered the vegetarian soup and carne asada and both were also very good. 

The other couple we came with also raced about their food choices. One got an enchilada late and the other got tacos. We had no complaints on food. 

Another highlight was the great service that was provided. Our waitress was with us every so often and was attentive to our needs.
author: Neda F.

description: A great option for people who are working in the downtown area and want to have Mexican cuisine. Slightly on the fancy side compared to other Mexican restaurants in Mission district. I really like their guacamole. It's fresh and tasty and served with chips. I also tried their super taco and fish taco. Both are recommendable.
author: Julia J.

description: A friend of mine recommended this place and they love it and the food was good but I am giving them two stars because of the service. On my way to walking there, I put in a yelp table reservations and got there 11 minutes later. They told us that because we did not get there fast enough, they gave our table away. Not a big deal. Mind you, this was 8 pm on a sunday. Then 2 minutes later, they had a table for us. When we sat down, the hostess asked us if we had a reservation and we said no, we were did a yelp waitlist, and as a result, we could only sit there for an hour and a half.  Wait what?! there were many empty tables around us. Thanks making us feel welcome. Then! We had to wait 20 minutes before we got to order, so that left us 1 hr and 10 minutes for them to make the food and for is to eat. We ordered guac and then 2 entrees. After 30 minutes, they brought us our entrees, but not he guac, and then took away our chips as well. It took another 15 minutes for us to someone's attention to get our guac and more chips. For a $100 meal, I was really annoyed by the service, from beginning to end. I would rather give my money to people who care about the customers and do not make them feel rushed to enjoy a night out with their friend.
author: Christine L.

description:
Tropisueno benefits from an unbeatable location right underneath the Marriott and next to the Contemporary Jewish Museum along a pedestrian corridor that links SoMa and the Financial District. As such, it's a popular choice, and a natural one for drinks and for groups. 

I've been here a couple of times and have found it to be a decent experience. If it's not too crowded, there's a variety of seats, whether at the bar, individual tables, or cozy booths. Prices are quite reasonable given its prime venue, and the fare is decent. You can choose from anything ranging from tacos, tamales, tostadas, and burritos for lunch to meatier full-sized entrees for dinner. Personally, I've found the tacos and flautas quite decent at lunch, while the huaraches "tres cochinitas" (tortilla "sandals" with several kinds of pork) were a satisfying choice for dinner.

Drinks are fairly reasonable; at happy hour you can get some good deals. Service is fairly OK. All in all, it's a decent "go-to" option in the immediate area if you want something hearty and you're with a group.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Love this place!

With great food, great margaritas, great staff, great environment, and great prices - what's not to love? 

I had the super quesadilla with steak and it was absolutely delicious. I was only able to finish about half, but reheated it in the toaster oven the next day and it still tasted great. 

Will be coming back often!
author: Zahra H.

description: I was there for a conference, and found this place through yelp of course. I beat the rush hour of lunch traffic, and placed my order and drink order at the bar and got my food at a decent time frame. I was thrown off by the walkup ordering, but now I wonder why more restaurants don't do this. It's easy, and you get just about the same service. The staff there was friendly, walking up to a table I had a party of 3 , and they saw me wondering around looking for a table, as soon as a table was free, they quickly wiped it clean and moved tables around in order to accommodate my friend in her electric chair. Definitely will go here again when I am out there.
author: Rita R.

description:
Came here on a Friday for dinner. It was busy as expected and were given a 1-1.5 hour wait for 3 people. Decided to go to a nearby bar and get some drinks while we waited. 20 mins later I got a text that our table was ready, right in the middle of our drinks. Luckily they held the table long enough for us to finish our drinks and get back. I appreciated that they let us sit down even though one person wasn't there. They said they needed the table in 1.5 hours.

 They have addicting chips and salsa! I probably ate most of one basket of chips by myself. The drinks were ok, I got the Violeta. My friends got the house margarita and told me mine was stronger.

I had the shrimp plate which came with rice, beans, and tortillas. The shrimp was well seasoned and garlic-y, not too salty. They give a lot of food here and the prices are very reasonable! I would definitely come back and try other stuff on the menu.

I'm taking off one star for the service. My friend came late and was taking a bit longer to finish his food. They kept trying to clear his plate as a hint for us to leave I think. I know they needed the table, but they could have been more straightforward and just let us know there were people waiting instead of being passive aggressive about it. Despite this, I'd come back here to eat again.
author: Denise H.

description: Was looking for a cute Mexican restaurant while I was traveling in San Fran and this place was perfect. So cute on the inside and outside. Their customer service was amazing by making sure everything was taken care of. I got the salad with mango and jicama and it was perfectly light and tasty! Great mezcal Margs Too!! I'll be coming back next time I'm in town!
author: Kylie D.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for dinner and there was not one plate i was not DROOLING over and SAVORING. 

Came here again for lunch with family, and even though it was still pretty good it wasn't anything near as good as dinner. Recomend this place either way! Total yum!
author: jessica a.

description:
Pros: We had a toddler in our party and the restaurant staff was very accommodating even as we waited for a few late people to show. Fresh chips and 3 variety of salsa was served quickly after seating. One page menu has a good variety of choices and portion size are pretty decent.

Cons: This place is so overhyped. Definitely make reservations on Yelp, it saves you so much time and it's so easy. Super dim lighting that strained my eyes looking at the menu. I got the carne asada plate and asked for medium but it came out brunt and really dry. 

Ordered: Tampiqueno ($18)

Would I recommend: My coworker RAVED about this place so maybe my expectations were set too high but I'm glad I checked this place off my list so I can say "been there, done that" and not return. Pretty subpar Mexican food in my books. FYI, pretty loud environment; unless your conversation is right next to you, you'll have to shout across the table.
author: Terry N.

description:
I would not recommend this place for "good" Mexican. The ceviche appetizer had no flavor. The fish tacos were not memorable no matter how much lemon or salsa I added. 
This is a fast food Mexican food place that seems to be a better place for drinks. 
I was also charged $14 for a chicken taco so check your receipt.
author: Lupe J.

description:
Came here for lunch with my family. Being indian vegetarian, Mexican is one cuisine which really suits our palette and taste buds

Tried a few Mexican places before and this was definitely one of the best places I have tried so far. A no frills quick ordering system, we placed an order for veggie quesadillas, veggie burritos and veggie tortas with a portion of guacamole and horchata for drinks

We started off with delicious warm corn chips which were extremely thin and crispy and definitely freshly done. The food was served very quickly and the server was extremely warm. The portions are huge and we actually struggled to finish the three dishes we ordered for three people. The salsa bar is quite extensive and delicious, topped up with radish, pickles, onions and chillies which just add amazingly to the flavour of the food. The food in itself was also delicious and all three dishes were very well made. The horchata has a very unique taste and was delicious

The place definitely goes on my recommendation list, with lovely seating (both indoor and outdoor), warm and quick service, amazing food, drinks and salsa bar, huge portions and very reasonable pricing
author: Abhishek C.

description: Good food great margarita's but service was just OK. I did 100% appreciate that they held our reservation even though we got lost and were about 30 mins late for our original reservation time. I will remember this place next time I'm looking for someplace good to eat out in SF.
author: Jessica J.

description:
I will have to come back here Gage and Jose are amazing bartenders customer service was great!!!
The salas were not like anything I've tried before and I was able to get some to go. Food was amazing had the Chile verde enchiladas sauce to die for!!!
author: brittany l.

description:
Solid Mexican food place. Not the best I've had but just nice and solid. 

I got the three combination plate and it was enough for my wife and I to share. The taco Al Pastor was good but not your normal At Pastor. I wouldn't get it again. 

The chicken flauta was tasty and I would definitely recommend that again. 

Also, they bring chips and there is salsa to each table for free.
author: Kevin F.

description: How much I've enjoyed my afternoon here! Great food and very comfortable atmosphere. Alejandro the bartender is very knowledgeable. All drinks are made with local ingredients. I had a fresh watermelon mojito and a mango one. They were both spicy in a really creative awesome way. Super nice tequila and great presentation. I definitely recommend this place for a nice Mexican meal with a bad ass drink menu!
author: Glorimar A.

description:
Came on a weeknight around 6:20 and had no trouble getting a table for 2, but a party of 3 would have been a 25 minute wait.

Service was great. Everyone was so friendly from the moment we got in the door to getting the check. They were really prompt about filling our water and the food came out quickly which was much appreciated as we were seeing a movie at the Metreon.

Ordered the chicken mole poblano and tres cochinitas. Both were delicious! Everything tasted so fresh and flavorful. Plus their chips are amazing and come with 3 different salsas. I love it when you have options!
author: Susan G.

description:
Went for happy hour. The margarita was excellent. It was sour, with the perfect amount of sweet and the spice mix on the rim added an awesome kick!

Also had a good fish taco and quesadilla on the HH menu. Not bad prices for dt San Francisco.

Also the free chips and salsa came with 3 kinds of salsa and all three were great!
author: Altair T.

description:
Wow. Great find. Went for happy hour. When we sat we got a little 3 sauce platter of cheese, guac, and salsa. The chips were light and crispy and incredibly unique from the stand chips other Mexican places have.

We got 3 or 4 different things from the happy hour menu and all were $7 or so.

The house margarittas...  so fresh and delicious... 

Great for the low cost and in middle of downtown!
author: Brian C.

description: This was our first time here, it's a popular place so I highly recommend that you make reservations! Clean, affordable, great service, awesome variety of food. Will definitely be back!
author: Mary L.

description: The food was very tasty and the selection of salsas was great however the prices are outrageous for a taqueria style restaurant. We got 2 tacos, a burrito, a small order of nachos and 2 drinks and the price was over $40. The burrito completely fell apart and the they forgot our order of nachos even after they double checked our receipt so we ended up getting them right when we were leaving so we only got to eat less than 1/3of the order.
author: Frankie J.

description:
Ever since seeing them featured on an old episode of Check Please Bay Area!, I'd been wanting to check out Tropisueno.  I always knew they were a popular spot, especially for the nearby lunch crowd, but I had never really looked into them before.  On the show, not only did it seem like they had a pretty fun vibe (margaritas!), but the food looked great as well!

Having been here for both lunch and dinner, I can say that the restaurant really does seem to have a lively vibe at all times of day (on weekends, at least).  During both trips, the restaurant was pretty full, but especially so for dinner, so reservations are definitely recommended.  It's not hard to understand why they're so popular though; beyond the vibe, Tropisueno's menu is unlike anything you'd find nearby...not to mention their burrito counter!

-- THREE ITEM COMBINATION PLATE with a Chicken Flauta, Chicken Tamale, and a Carnitas Taco...$14.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tropisue%C3%B1o-san-francisco-3?select=4jUg9aRTYid_gk4_c8lZEg)
I regret doubling up on chicken (that's rookie move, Mike!), but this was otherwise solid...and hefty!  The flauta was the best of the bunch (crispy, not super oily, and very flavorful), but the others were great as well.  The carnitas were well seasoned and the tamale was surprisingly moist.  What's more, love how their combo plate included avocados!

-- HUARACHES "TRES COCHINITAS" - Three Thick Tortilla "Sandals" with Three Kinds of Pork - Chile Verde, Carnitas, and Al Pastor with Pineapple...$14
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tropisue%C3%B1o-san-francisco-3?select=-ylxn2-TQDENmhAO7PMcLw)
While this dish was just as filling, I didn't find it nearly as satisfying.  The sandals started out great, but they got a little soggy and mealy by the end.  As for the three types of pork, the chile verde one was just okay, but I liked the carnitas - crisp and delicious.  Sadly though, while they're great individually, the pineapples and al pastor didn't mesh for me (really sweet).

Even though the food left me feeling a little conflicted, Tropisueno is a pretty good spot if you're looking for something different near this part of downtown/Union Square.  At the very least, it's a good value for the money (their free chips and salsa are awesome!).  Given the choice though, if I was in the area, I'd be more inclined to try something new and head to El Toreador for something similar to Tropisueno, but in a far more convenient location.

Except for their burritos - I'd be willing to come back to try that.  How could I possibly not?  #burritos4lyfe

THREE AND A HALF STARS rounded down.
author: Mike L.

description:
First time here and very bad customer service, so I don't want to go back. 
In my food, I found  a small piece of plastic. I complained about that, at first, our server tried making an excuse which is it is not plastic and it is part of beans(?), but I didn't get any beans. So after that, he took my food to show to the manager. We waited very long time to listen what it is. But, the manager didnt come to us. So we just left the restaurant. So bad. 

Plus, our server forgot our tortillas.
author: Hye L.

description: This place is my go to if I am craving a good meal.  All of the food is amazing and the salsa...I could literally drink the orange one.  It's super spicy and delicious.  I've been here for lunch and dinner and it never disappoints!
author: Beau H.

description: The 2 stars are not for the food it is for the service. The food itself is 5 stars, expensive for what it is but really good food. That's it.
author: Stacie J.

description: I really liked this place.  Nice friendly staff.... even though they were crowded and could have opted to be otherwise.   Cozy authentic decor.  Good Mexican food with just enough of a modern fresh snap to satisfy every bay area foody
author: Kathy K.

description: Food was good but took 45 min to come out. I ended up eating way too many chips as all the salsa were very tasty. Super big fan of the avocado salsa. Menu was slightly pricy but you should expect that in the financial district. The entrees taste very Americanized. This place is basically a more upscale Chipotle with less spicy salsa. The place also gets pretty busy so it can be hard to get waiters attention if you are out of water or chips.
author: Diane Z.

description:
Super cute taqueria around the corner from my hotel (Park Central)! 

On a Wednesday after 5PM, it was hoppin' and almost all the seats were taken 20 minutes after my arrival. This is an "order at the counter" setup for lunch but a sit down restaurant by night. 

I love that there were complimentary chips with a salsa trio - I ordered the house guac ($8) and it had an unexpected spicy kick that I didn't care for. For my entree, I did the choose 2 and got 2 pollo asado enchiladas, served with beans (choice of black or refried) and rice. This, plus the chips, was super filling and I couldn't finish my entree! Minus the guac addition, this was a steal of a meal - just under $15 for dinner in SF. Can't beat it, especially when on a work budget.

Docking it a star because tables are very close together and it is super noisy. I've noticed this trend with a lot of SF restaurants and as an out-of-towner, I'm not a big fan.
author: Katie U.

description:
I've always been a fan of Tropisueno so I'm pretty bummed about having to write this review, but I had the worst possible experience with a server in my life here. 

My boyfriend and I rushed to get here on a Saturday night around 9:45 pm before their 10:30 closing. We found two seats across from each other at the community table, uncomfortably squished between two parties. We had just ordered when I noticed two seats opened up at the end of the bar, so naturally, we opted to move for more space. I walked over to the bar and was confronted by the bartender who basically called me out for moving: "Is that table not good enough for you? Did those people do something to you?" He was loudly proclaiming that I had now screwed with their system and it's not going to be his fault when we don't get our food because our waitress won't know where we are. (We moved 5 feet from the community table and literally could see everyone orders being brought out from the kitchen). My boyfriend talked to our original waitress/server and let her know we were going to be sitting at the bar. Our new server/bartender (Alejandro) then went on to ask us if we had ever worked in a restaurant because we clearly don't understand how the system works and how we're jipping our original server of his tip. My boyfriend offered to close out and tip so it would just go to the original server but the Alejandro said he didn't want that and finally settled on transferring our bill over, muttering things to other staff as he did so. 

I was honestly so shocked and frustrated at how huge of an asshole he was being for absolutely no reason, I started to tear up. I then got even more mad at myself for tearing up over something so stupid, so of course that made me cry more. He finally then came over very apologetically and tried to give us free drinks (but I refused to drink it out of principle lol). At the end of the night, my boyfriend asked if the whole issue was about tip because we would have gladly tipped them both if the situation was handled properly. But wait for it, PLOT TWIST: WE STILL ENDED UP TIPPING BOTH OF THEM. We tipped the standard 15% or whatever to Alejandro and then gave the original server $20 in cash, because we're nice fucking people and didn't deserve the shitty service we received. 

TLDR: food is good, drinks are strong, alejandro is a dick
author: Estelle C.

description: We ordered potato tofu taco and seasonal vegetable enchiladas with a side of black beans and rice. The food was very good. Great flavors and the portions were adequate for us ( we are light eaters). The ambience is pretty and warm. They served tortilla chips with three yummy sauces as soon as we sat. The service was quick and the staff is good with recommendations if you can't make up your mind! They only had two desserts but the cake with strawberries was delicious, not too sweet and just right to finish off light! Would highly recommend trying this place. The only thing I missed was a bit of more chili spice in the food!
author: Premila M.

description: There were things I liked about this place and things I didn't.  I liked that it's a taqueria style during the day and more of a sit down at night.  I liked the feel of the restaurant including the ambience.  Unfortunately the food was just so so though and really left me unfulfilled.
author: Gena L.

description: Solid 4. I would go again, but there was nothing to rave about here. I like that it was less drama than your average spot in this town and the food was in line with the prices. That in an of itself in SF is a major plus.
author: NIck R.

description:
I had been eyeing Tropisueño for awhile because it sounded like a tropical Spanish paradise. The actual experience didn't match my far-fetched vision, but it was decent nonetheless. I was meeting up with a friend only for drinks. We sat at the bar, and the bartender was fantastic. He made everyone feel tended to, even though it was quite a busy evening. I had a margarita, and my friend had the complimentary chips and salsa. The margarita was alright. Not the best but still strong and tasty enough.

I would have ordered food if it weren't for my existing dinner reservations. I'd be open to coming back here again for food if someone suggests it but probably wouldn't go out of my way otherwise. Oh, I did walk out of Tropisueño forgetting my sunglasses, but the bartenders were super nice about it when I went back for them. I do appreciate this stellar customer service!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I've been to Tropisueno for dinner and for happy hour in the past. 

In terms of dinner, I would highly recommend making an online reservation because the place gets very crowded, very fast. Chips and salsa come out first and they are super addicting! All three salsas are flavorful and great as well. This can be dangerous because chips and salsa are free and keep getting refilled as you eat. I ordered the two item combo and got the enchiladas. Overall, the food was pretty good and the ambiance was nice. I'm really tempted to drop in during lunch to check out how that is as well. 

Happy Hour is pretty standard. You can sit at the bar, on a select few of the dining room tables, or outside. Chips and salsa are once again free and refillable! woohoo :D I had the house margarita which was pretty delicious and my friend had the gin and tonic which she enjoyed, but thought was quite strong. It's great to sit outside on a sunny day and chat!
author: Lakshmi M.

description: Came here twice on my recent month long trip to San Francisco. Nice place located near Market street and the convention center. Service was decent, happy hour was good , food overall was good. The one thing that stood out to me was the salsa trio .. yum . Maragaritas were also pretty good . Nothing exceptional but still a good place I would go to again.
author: Jacqueline G.

description:
Skip the guacamole.  Not that good and small portion especially given the price of $9. 

We did enjoy the rest of our meal which was enchiladas and tacos.  Black beans were delicious.  Chips super thin and crispy and yum.
author: R. G.

description:
I like the decor inside the restaurant, music, and fresh variety of salsas! The food is good and their margaritas are delicious :)

Is it authentic mexican food? It's not your hole-in-the-wall joint but it's still delicious, fresh, and has all the spice to make it nice.

The chips and salsas are some of my favorites in the city. 

There can be a wait so call ahead or be prepared to wait a few minutes. They have a small bar area with a community table and TV so it gets filled up very fast. 

The service here has always been fantastic.
author: Carina M.

description:
Good Mexican food, well yes, long lines during rush hours, well yes! Do not get me wrong, Tropisueño dishes out some tasty dishes, but I feel like the hype is not really what one would expect. I think I have gotten used to the fact that the North Bay slings out some pretty tasty Mexican food, so it is hard for me to really give a stellar review as so few really stand out from each other. Tropisueño as mentioned before does a wonderful job, but do not expect a mind blowing experience as many have put it. 

So onto to more of a positive note! Do not be intimidated by parking as there are garages nearby or if you are lucky, some street parking. Due to the close proximity to the Moscone Center and most of all downtown SF, expect ample parking around (On a good day!). Once you finally make it to the restaurant, you may encounter a long line, but fear not as it moves much quicker than you would expect. With the long line it gives you ample time to look over the semi lengthy menu. Once you order via the Chipotle style method, make your way to one of the many ample seats in the house and do not forget to order a delicious beverage from their wonderful bartenders (Margaritas on point!). My go to for the few times I have visited was the Tropisueño Torta, basically a vegetarian/vegan nightmare as it is loaded with all of their meat choices, but it is pretty darn good! Pricing will surprise you as well considering their downtown location, so do not expect to pay to much a premium price here, plus I hear their happy hour is one of the best in town (Cannot comment though). 

So overall, Tropisueño checks all the boxes you are looking for, but for me it does not stick out from various other Mexican food establishments sadly. A solid choice though if you are craving Mexican food in downtown SF.
author: Ryan A.

description: Loved this place, we had a great time. Very up scale, and the food was exquisite. The Yelp reservation system worked amazing, will be back for sure.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Great Mexican food in the heart of San Francisco. Very fun and upbeat vibe and a delicious meal for a good price in an otherwise very experience city. I was craving some great Mexican so this hit the spot for my group of friends and I. I can see why this is a very popular restaurant and it definitely is a tasty meal.
author: Tristan B.

description:
Awesome margarita happy hour from 4-7 pm! Small space to sit indoors and outdoors, so can definitely get a little too crowded, but the drinks are solid. There are also small snacks on happy hour as well, but we didn't try any. Come check It out when you get a chance!

Pros:
Price
Drinks
Location
Ambiance - low key, friendly, fun

Cons:
Crowded
Not much space at bar to get a drink
author: Vyshak C.

description: Excellent food it was fresh, serving yourself was a bit different but getting your food and sitting yourself after a long day of walking was appreciated!  Great food and vibes here!  Wish I found it sooner!
author: Mandy J.

description: I got the vegetarian variants of the tamale and enchiladas. The food was OK but nothing to be amazed or pleased with for the price. The tamale just felt like this rigid ball of cheese that didn't taste very good. I got the impression that the food was frozen, and just topped with some sauce and cheese upon order. The enchilada also felt very tasteless - no spices or flavorful sauces. Don't think I'll be going back.
author: Manthan S.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite places for happy hour in SF. I've been coming to Tropisueno for years, and each time it's been for happy hour. Tropisueno is nestled in the cute Yerba Buena Lane complex, right by bunch of restaurants and St. Patrick's Church, and is Bart-accessible (Powell Bart).  As for food, I can only speak (but fondly!) on behalf of happy hour.  Tropisueno's happy hour is between 4-6pm on Mondays through Fridays.  Happy hour is only in the bar area and outside.  Happy hour can get really packed too, as this place is frequented by those who work around the area.  

Some of my favorite happy hour menu items include the street tacos (chicken, beef), flautas, quesadilla suiza, and the ceviche. All great items, very tasty, and affordable (the cheap HH price point is definitely a welcomed rarity in the downtown area).  Fresh chips and salsa come with your meal too; you are given three types of salsa, which are all really delicious...my favorite being the orange sauce/salsa.  I'm always dipping my chips with this orange sauce and smothering my tacos with it too.  As for drinks?  Get the house margarita.  The house margarita is pretty strong, so two of them can get you pretty tipsy.  The good food, good prices, and good drinks definitely will make you pretty happy at happy hour!

Definitely will continue coming back here again and again.  I kind of wished happy hour ended later in the evening, but it is what it is.  I will just have to leave work earlier to make the happy hour!  Hasta luego!
author: Matthew L.

description: Very good Mexican.  We were here for lunch sitting outside on a beautiful end of October day.  We will be back in the evening with a more extensive menu with margarita's.  Also very gluten friendly.  I took away a star because we couldn't get a bowl of chips.  Everybody else got them and were told they were coming.  Never came.  Finally went in to get them
author: Diane V.
