description: My 2nd time here and will not come back any more. I had booked a table for 4 on yelp, but we were going to be 3 people in which one person arrive late but two of us came in time. The waiter looked at his screen for a few minutes to then say that we had to wait for the complete party before he could seat us. So we wait while there are plenty of tables available. I got a text message 15 mins past my reservation time saying my table was ready and so I went to the waiter again. He asks if our party was complete and I said no she will be here in a couple of minutes, in which he tells me our time for the table has expired and the reservation was gone. Will never come back here with this type of service.
author: Xi-Er D.

description: The Marriott staff was outside on a strike, their drumming was loud and, charitably described as, marching-like. Outside the noise was bombastic, but inside all was fantastic: Tropisueño opened for dinner at 5, the staff was friendly and the atmosphere alive. We were quickly served free chips with three types of sauce; all were fine, though the salsa was boss. The Chile Verde tasted quite great, and I ate and I ate until I worried about my weight. The dessert menu was sparse, flan matched the theme but, barely a dessert, a farce.
author: Mike A.

description: Delicious food and their house margaritas are good too. Nice ambiance and whenever there's a line you know it's worth the wait.
author: Regina G.

description:
Came here for tacos, and definitely worth the short wait.  You order first and then pick a seat.  It can get pretty crowded, but the food comes out fairly quick.  Chips and salsa served when you sit down, and there is a self serve water station.  The bar is located inside, and you can grab a drink after you place your food order.  The bar was slammed, so took a while to get a drink.  If you have two people, have someone stand in line for food and the other for drinks to save time!

Food: Got the street tacos (steak, shrimp, fish and chicken).  All were fabulous!
author: Michelle N.

description:
Had a wet carnitas burrito here place seemed to ran efficiently and the help was available..... 
I will be back and would recommend this place
author: Big A.

description: Love love love this place. Lunch is so good, the salsa bar will blow your mind. Arrive early before noon to get seating. You will not regret anything you order. Generous portions and fair prices for the location.
author: Tim O.

description:
Checked it out with my family. Happy hour menu is good. Food on the regular menu was not so good. The Caldo is more like a chipotle stew, the veggie posole isn't at all what we expected. The mole was too sweet. Just wasn't traditional and the taste was off. 

Chile relleño wasn't bad, the beans and rice were good and the burrito my son ordered was good. 

The service was lack luster especially from the host. Once we got to our table the waitress and runner were awesome and they made it better despite the initial bad impression and difference of taste/style.
author: Laura A.

description: They have the best happy hour in the city... if you can get a seat. Expect a longer wait for a full meal, but it's well worth it! Grab a margarita and some amazing guac or tacos and you'll want to come back again and again!
author: Dasher K.

description:
Review is for HAPPY HOUR ONLY.

Loved it! Prices were very good, tacos were delish! I highly recommend the fish tacos. The chips and 3 types of salsa were bomb as well. Food-wise nothing to complain about, however, the place is a little cramped so you're seated very close to others, and the service could be more attentive. Will def come back for the food!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
The shrimp is too sour for me, my friend ordered a chicken that is really good.

The server was kinda busy, not very responsive.
author: Rui X.

description:
This place is fantastic and the energy is one of the best in the City. The food is amazing and the servers are nice and friendly. Probably the only friendly people in SF. JK. I want to give a shout out to bartender, Wayne, Andrew and Jose. These guys keep the bar lively and friendly. 

Wayne kills you with brotherly love and invites you in and it feels like your in his home. The energy is nonstop and I try to get there for lunch and happy hour as often as possible. 

Stay positive guys and thanks for always keeping the energy high and alive. 

Jefferson
author: Jefferson J.

description:
Attentive service, craft margaritas, artisan salsa varities, and did I mention the Mole?

Make a reservation because people line up in droves for this exquisite Mexican cuisine.   

Go.


5stars!!!
author: Meagan M.

description:
For a mexican restaurant in a super touristy neighborhood, this place is decent.

The food quality is good and kind of flavorful but the portion sizes could be a bit more generous.

Drinks were ok. Free chips and sauces were good! 

Ambience is nice. It's quite busy and noisy during dinner time. 

I like how the place takes reservations but ask for a table in the quieter side of the restaurant if you'd like to have a good conversation.
author: Soundarya C.

description:
My three friends and I recently went to watch Aladdin at the Orpheum and Tropisueno came up as nearby restaurants although it was really like a good half mile away or more. When we arrived, it looked packed both inside and outside and we thought the wait would be a while, but surprisingly, we got our table in less than 5 minutes.

Water was brought out immediately, then we were asked for drinks, then we got chips. The chips were really yummy. Lightly salted, thin yet crispy, and didn't break our jaws. There are three different salsas to try. An orange saucy type, a green, and a red. All were good and all were mild to spicy.

My three friends each chose a type of enchilada then flautas, but i got the chicken soup which was SOOO amazing. It was hot, spicy, and full of deliciousness. Served with hella rice, avocado, etc. The soup had zucchini, mushrooms, ginormous chunks of chicken, tomatoes, onions and more. So flavorful. It warms my tummy just thinking about it.

Will be back to this place if im in the city again.
author: Rose C.

description: Ordered the vegetarian enchilada, the waiter even told me not to have refried beans if I am a vegetarian (since there's pork fat in them) and was brought a chicken enchilada. The waiters excuse was that he was 4 days in and clicked the wrong button.
author: Alys M.

description:
This is a great happy hour spot. Get there early because it gets very crowded, especially around the bar area. We had spicy margaritas and they were freshly made and delicious. The bartender, Wayne, makes sure that everybody is having a good time and he's damn good at it!

Get the tacos al pastor and the enchiladas and you'll be pleased.  Great escape from the tech crowd and I'll definitely be coming back here!
author: Daniel B.

description:
Oh Trop...how I adore you. It's  not just that this is the best Mexican food in SoMa, which generally lacks anything decent, it's just of the best in the city. I think what makes Trop so good and unique is that it combines the offerings of a simple taqueria during the day, and elevated Mexican food with a romantic, sultry setting at night and no matter what you choose the food is killer. 

So lunch time - it's busy, but they're like Henry Ford's Model A assembly line in there. I'm mainly a burrito or torta (mexican sandwich) guy here, and you can't go wrong with really any of the meats. The fish tacos here are solid, but they really excel with carnitas, carne asada, pollo asado, chili verde, etc. Tacos are good too, but I just love the burritos and tortas (the breaded pork one is so good). The agua fresca's and horchata is homemade and rotates every day and then after you grab your food hit the salsa bar. The lighter green tomatillo salsa and the bright orange ones are my favorite and have a solid kick.

For dinner, grab whatever floats your boat. I've only been 3-4 times over the years for dinner, but can't remember a bad meal. And on top of that, dinner is your time to go ham on their incredible margaritas. There's ample seating, lots of outdoor seating as well, and the restaurant stays pretty darn clean for how much traffic flies in and out every day. It's in the alley way across from the Metreon and in between St. Patrick's Church and the Marriott hotel. Do yourself a favor if you don't want to trek to the Mission and stop here for a damn good meal. Final shout out for an always polite and hustling staff.
author: Nate E.

description:
Tropisueno will always be one of my fav mexican spots!

I have been here for lunch, dinner, and happy hour and all have been wonderful experiences.

My favorite drink is the hibiscus flower juice (non alcoholic). 

Their guacamole is delicious and a must whenever i visit!

Tonight I went for happy hour. Note: happy hour ends at 6:30pm! I had the ceviche, carnitas street taco, and flautas. All of which were delicious! The ceviche portion was quite small, but I figured the portions would be smaller due to happy hour. The cheese quesadilla was a decent sized option if you were hungry. Or you can just order all of the hh menu if youre really hungry! :) 

I would recommend coming here any time of day. Good casual date night spot or for catching up with friends!

The only downside is that service is a bit slow, but this can easily be resolved with more servers! :)
author: Claire W.

description:
I've only been here for lunch a handful of times, but would definitely give this place a shot for dinner. If it's anywhere near as packed as it is at lunch though, that might be tough. The line here is usually 20 or so deep from noon-1 pm, stretching well out of the restaurant. If you're in a rush, this isn't a great choice; depending on what you order, it may take 10-15 minutes to come out, longer if you have an obscure to-go order. All the better if you can get here around 11:30 am. 

That said, the food is pretty solid, and the folks working here run a tight ship. They have a taco bar run by a bunch of ladies in the front, a full kitchen in the back, and a tequila bar that serves up house margaritas for those of us looking to take the edge off before noon. Order at the counter, grab your number, pay, then get the hell out of the way until someone finds you. 

The best item I've had so far is the Chicken & Vegetable Sopa (despite my weekday-hungover self expecting chicken sopes, it's still a great lunch). Tostadas are alright; not really a repeat order. The burritos look decent, but they are definitely churning out food en masse for the lunch crowd; don't expect anything too fancy. Salsa bar is where it's at as far as adding extra flavor and spice, and the Tapatio hot sauce packets are a must-have. 

One day when I'm in a lonely mood I'll come brave the throngs for dinner service. Until then, more sopa! Salud!
author: Laura B.

description:
Very good Mexican food, authentic flavors , simple ordering style and fast delivery. Prices are very affordable for SF Standards. 

Burrito, Tacos were done well. Margaritas are expensive .
author: Steve S.

description:
A Trip down Mexican delicacies!
 Tropisueno is a Taqueria by the day n a full service dinner restaurant by sundown. This fine dining eatery is nestled in downtown SF. 

Ambience for the evening is warm,typically colored for the region its representing with dim lighting thus giving the guests a perfect private time to enjoy their meal.

Since it is a very popular place the wait time can be pretty bothersome! To mention, the outdoor seating arrangement is 'first come' an open seating section. Indoor seating is decently spaced though for some the tables are yet pretty close to each other.

Service in the busy hours is rushed,a little improvement there can certainly help. Staff is friendly n well versed.

Pricey on the pocket for certain.

Food- 
Being vegetarians our choice of foods was satisfying though more varieties can help guests like myself walk in more.
They help in suggesting the best of options or alternatives to make your dining experience good.

Our order was for a "Chile Relleno". 
Mild poblano chile stuffed with cheese n herbs having a good fried outer crust. Accompanied by black beans n a few greens this dish was very flavorful n rich in texture.
I'm not into cheese but a few bits tasted good.

Second to the Relleno we also had 
"Enchiladas de Nopales"-
Grilled veggies, corn, cactus and chiles in a fresh corn cream sauce.
Accompanied with Mexican rice & a few veggies which had lost their shape n texture as the cream sauce got the better of them. Taste nonetheless was good.
To say ,this was one wholesome dish, seasoned to perfection having great flavors.

To quench our thirst we had the typical Jarrito, grapefruit flavored which was very refreshing. Tasted great alongside the food as well.

Chips & salsa- the scintillating flavors of the salsas (3 different flavors) and the fresh, crispy chips was overpowering! One cannot just stop munching on them..

Overall, a great dining experience. My B'day dinner date concluded in good company & great flavored food!
author: Preeti J.

description: I wanted to try this place because I've passed by it plenty of times and it seems to always be busy! Busy means people come for the delicious food right ? Well this place have basic tasting food. More like the typical Mexican fast food and not very authentic! If you're from San Francisco it doesn't compare to El Farolito or any Mexican restaurant in the mission! This place does have very cute decors (very festive). When you first walk in there's a big menu on the wall of everything they serve, you get in line to order and they bring the food to your table promptly after. The prices are reasonable but a little more than what a local taqueria would charge! Maybe because of the convenient location, in the heart of the city. My boyfriend ordered the chicken Fajita plate that looked better than it tasted! I ordered 3 tacos: Fish/Baja, Shrimp, and carne asada. I decided to make the carne asada taco "super" aka they add beans and guacamole for an extra dollar or two. My tacos were also alright, nothing special about them. Sadly I expected more. Maybe it's my fault for having such high expectations since it does have 4 stars on yelp and thousands of reviews raving about how delicious it is! I love Mexican food and for me, this place is not up to par! Service was good and friendly! Maybe I'll give it another try in the future!
author: Karmela A.

description:
Bad service. We were seated after waiting 45min and then it took another 20-25min for someone to turn up to take our order. After we inquired about a couple of items, we were told that he is too busy and can't explain the menu items (this was within 30sec of him turning up). When we asked for recommendations as we were new to both restaurant and cuisine, we were told everything is same, and he cannot recommend anything.
Billing also had an issue, though it was corrected after we pointed out. Definitely not going there again and won't recommend unless you eat Mexican everyday.
author: Shruti S.

description: I came here alone one evening because I was out of town for a business conference. The staff was amazing! Very attentive and kind to me. The food was DELICIOUS! I got the steak fajitas and it was more food I can handle, but I just keep eating it! I would 100% recommend coming here if you're in town!
author: Carly S.

description: The burrito was amazing, the environment, and the service. I recommend this place to everyone in the area! Great atmosphere overall
author: Mario A.

description:
UNLIMITED CHIPS AND SALSA. YES PLEASE. Honestly, I could just eat that all day. 

Food - Tacos are a must-try when visiting Tropisueno. I personally loved their al pastor because it comes packed with flavor and was served with pineapples. Perfect combo of sweet and savory, it's great. Their shrimp ceviche was a very taste side dish, but a little too sour for my taste. Would've been perfect if it had a little less lime in my opinion. 

Salsa Bar - so many good things to try! Pico de Gallo is great, their Tomatillo Green Salsa is also great! But what I was surprised with was their Orange Sauce, which I believe might've been habanero? Correct me if I'm wrong, but it sure did add a really great WA-POW to my tacos!

Drinks - Tequila, tequila, tequila my friend. Tequila and I have always had a love-hate relationship, but Tropisueno's drinks just makes me love it so much more. The Herredura Cocktail was strong, but on a long day, sometimes it's exactly what you need. I'd compare it to a mexican version of an old fashion. 

Recommendation - try and find a seat inside to avoid all the pigeons who are just waiting impatiently for the perfect opportunity to swoop over you for food and scraps.
author: Nancy L.

description: Yuck! Awful food. Slow service. Read good reviews so decided to try the happy hour it and I was so disappointed. Fish taco was bland and the nachos were greasy and tasted like leftovers. Not worth it at all. Wish I'd gone to one of the other places I read about.
author: Julie M.

description:
The chips are warm, fresh and come with three types of salsas. Get started with these and a some margaritas (they were pretty strong).

We ordered the old school enchiladas (a combination of Carne Asada, Pollo Asado & Carnitas). They were not one bit soggy and all tasted really good!

If you want Mexican food and you're re not willing to go to the mission, this place is a good option. Grab a table outdoors while the weather is good!
author: Nimeela D.

description:
My friend and I came in a bit late for our 8 pm resso one night. For a rainy, Sunday night, the place was pretty poppin'. It was probably for this same reason that the service was just so-so. We didn't get our waters until after a while, and we kept getting wrong dishes delivered to us.

To start, we ordered some house guacamole and the ceviche. We had the combo ceviche - shrimp, salmon, and tilapia. I liked that there was mango with the shrimp. It gave it a nice sweetness, but the shrimp itself was a bit tough. The salmon and tilapia were pretty good. Just be careful with the tilapia because there are serrano peppers in there and it can get really spicy.

For my main, I ordered the two item combo. You get to choose from tacos, enchiladas, tamales, or flautas, and it comes with a side of rice and beans. I went with the carne asada taco and the chicken flauta. It was just alright. The beef seemed a tad overcooked, and the flauta was smothered in some green sauce so I couldn't really taste what the chicken was like. Maybe these are not their specialties. 

Not sure if I would be back if I were to return to SF - only because the mains weren't that great and the service was kind of lacking. If you're just looking for drinks and apps, then Tropisueno might be a good option for you.
author: Mel T.

description:
Great happy hour spot! Snag a table outside if weather permits. Unlimited chips and salsa (3 different kinds), strong margaritas and great food specials. GET THEIR QUESO!

I came here with a large group of coworkers and the staff did a great job. They made sure we got our orders in before HH ended and kept coming back to refill our chips and water. This place is on my list of spots to hit up after work.
author: Helen C.

description: First timer lol i had the wet burrito with al pastor meat and sour cream. My burrito was good the sauce was yummy and luckily at the time we went we didn't have much of a wait. I'm not sure if I'd be back again but it wasn't bad. They have a self serve salsa area which had a yummy orange sauce that had a kick.
author: Mel G.

description:
I met up with a group of friends for happy hour here. It's nicely situated next to Yerba Buena gardens and Target, which I hung around while waiting for the rest of the party. We arrived at 5:30pm for happy hour, which is 4-6pm. The inside bar area was packed, so we opted for seating outside in the patio. It was a really windy and cold day, so that wasn't too much fun being outside. Nonetheless, we hoped some drinks would warm us up. I had the House Margarita ($7) and Modelo Especial ($4) for drinks. The margarita was served with lots of ice, so it was even colder drinking that on a cold evening. Since we were hopping over to another spot for food later, my friend and I decided to share an order of the Ceviche ($5). To say the least, this was a very disappointing dish for me as it was too acidic and very tiny to me. I ended up allowing my friend to finish the rest of the dish and would definitely never order that again.

On the other hand, the complimentary chips and salsa sold me. I absolutely loved their trio of hot sauce to pair with their chips. That was probably the best part of the meal, so maybe I'll come back to try their actual tacos next time despite them being quite pricey.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Loved the queso dip. That's all I got to say. Haha. Just kidding. Much more to say.

Food wise = good.
Service wise = good.
Environment = good
Clean = good.

But ambiance wise - tooooooo loud!!!! This is why I gave it 4 starts. Ceilings are lower and the tables are close together so that was a little uncomfortable.  Also, be ready to wait if you want to come here. It is a popular spot so the wait times are long, especially for dinner.

Overall, worth a try and I would go back, but I would just try to find times when they are less busy so I can enjoy my experience a bit more.
author: Okapi C.

description: Excellent margaritas and a lively atmosphere. I prefer to go in when it is less crowded but it's good for what you get in the neighborhood. People-watching outside is a hit or miss, lots of homeless people who may throw things at the glass you're staring out of..
author: Jerry M.

description:
Nice place to stop at if you want to catch up over drinks. Food, I cannot comment.

I'm notoriously a drinks person and often opt to skip the accompanying meal. So when my friend brought me here, I was a little worried. Tropisueño is definitely a restaurant. However, don't let that dissuade you as the drinks are definitely quality.

It's open seating inside at a communal table and bar, and open seating at the outside patio. We opted to sit ourselves outside. It took a little while for the waiter to come and give us menus, so beware that the outside area is not as fast service-wise (which makes sense, given it's outside).

While I say I'm a drinks first person, the salsa and chips were a nice addition. With three different types of salsa, there was a nice variety for your tastebuds. In particular, I liked the orange sauce, which was creamy and had a nice (habanero?) kick. We finished all of our chips and even got a refill, so there's definitely value gained here.

In terms of drinks, I got the Tropisueño margarita and a La Piña. The Tropisueño was a little disappointing to be honest-- I don't like sweet margaritas, but this one was almost too sour. It also tasted like it had Mezcal, which was weird as the menu claimed it was tequila. However, the redeeming drink was the La Piña, which had Mezcal but still tasted delicious.

Overall a good experience minus my first drink. Fair prices for the area. I don't think I can give it 5 stars because the drinks weren't stellar and I didn't try the food, but my experience here was such that I would definitely consider coming back.
author: Angela C.

description:
So so tacos... self serve format, order and then they give you a number and then they bring your order to your table.

Maybe I just don't appreciate tacos, but I find that the original tacos taste better on the menu rather than ordering any specialty tacos with fried fish etc. The speciality ones are just overloaded with toppings and condiments and makes it super hard to eat. 

Also the tacos were very soggy... not sure if it is anything special, will probably not come back. The presentation is awesome though, and you will be full.
author: Lesley Y.

description:
My friends came from out of town and were staying at the Marriott. I found and made reservations here through Yelp.

It was walking distance and delicious which was a plus. We ordered tacos, and and chips and dip. A good light dinner before going out at night.

I would come back again.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Ate here while staying next door at marriott.  If you book same day...just go to yelp and add your name to wait list.  Short wait on a sat night.   Fantastic service.    Highly recommend the cecchini trio and Chile verde.   Margaritas were just right.....not too sweet..not to alcoholy tasting.  
High recommendation and super reasonable price for downtown SF.
author: s s.

description: Besides the waiter being a little too pushy on the drinks this place was cute. Happy hour is only at the bar or outside though and drinks at the table are 11+$. Yikes! Dinner was tasty. I had the salmon. Will be back!
author: Kimberly J.

description:
Trop-is-slow-mo

Last time I am coming here. Just wanted a margarita, been standing here for 10 minutes.
author: Alfonso N.

description: Super convenient that we could get our name on the waitlist since Friday night is so busy for dinner in the city and it was right downstairs from our event at the Marriott Marquis. Overall the service was quick, attentive and the food was great!  We enjoyed the guacamole which was probably perfectly sized for two people. Also we had the queso and that was really good! So good we ate three bowls of housemade chips!  I had the carne asada and cheese enchilada and loved it. My colleagues had shrimp and chicken and also really enjoyed it. The rice was done well and not an afterthought. I didn't have a margarita because i had to drive a ways after but my colleagues who had the margaritas with agave said they were great!  Will definitely try again next time I'm in town.
author: Evelyn B.

description:
Chips and salsa were delicious! Loved the 3 different salsa options. This place was very lively on a Friday night. Happy hour on the patio and dinner inside. 

Entrees weren't very memorable but go here if you want a cool atmosphere. A little pricey.
author: Alex S.

description:
Loved this place!!!
Yelp helped me find this place .. Oh man!! What luck it was. The ambience is so cool and it gets better and better as the sun goes down. Ya baby, let the sun go down, cause that's when the tiny lanterns glow and the oil lamps on each table create a fun atmosphere. People are happy and loud and music, simply adds to the drama.

The food! Omg! Yes, let's talk about food.
The Guac was great, they served it like an ice cream scoop hehehe , it was tasty , so was the ceviche ..  for the chef please.
The fish tacos were filling and so was the flutas .. Margarita did have good achohol so yes good going. Best thing! All this was in happy hour menu so cheap too. 

I would recommend everything mentioned above and if you are a spice maniac like me and love eating  food, ask for habanero salsa with your chips. Yes yes, do it!! 

What a wonderful evening spent.
author: Ramyata M.

description: Came here for happy hour, it was perfect! Food is good and the margaritas awesome. Will definitely be coming back here!
author: Susana M.

description:
So many noms! Had a late dinner here on a Friday night. We were told the wait was 45 minutes but were lucky and snagged two seats at the community bar top in the bar area. The wait seemed closer to 20 minutes as we watched groups get seated but no biggie. They brought out the chips and salsa that wasn't your standard layout, it came with a trio that were all really good! Standard red, tomatillo and a take on salsa-queso, we enjoyed each one! I ordered the combination plate with a steak taco, chicken flauta and a beef enchilada, also came with rice and beans on the side. 

We sipped on our beers and enjoyed the fun, energetic atmosphere this place seemed to have. Our food came out in a good amount of time and we started to dig in. It was delicious! I enjoyed the fact that my steak taco was just meat and some onions, very traditional and straight to the point. I added some of the pickled cabbage on top ant it was perfection. The enchilada and flauta were also outstanding. Being from South Carolina it had been a while since we had great Latin food and this one hit the spot! The service was great and our waiter was efficient and attentive. 

One gripe, there are just two bathrooms to service the restaurant, so the line could get long at times.
author: Andrea R.

description: Great spot for families during lunch.  Gets pretty busy though and parking can be tricky if you are driving into the area.  I had a shrimp burrito and it was great.
author: Matt T.

description: What a great place. A hidden gem. Quick and friendly service. Food was authentic and delicious !! A must visit
author: Liz M.

description:
Tldr - when you in the need to just grub on a big Mexican feast sit your booty right here. Good but just like any other Mexican combo spot.

Pretty cool spot with a smart business plan. During the day they're a lunchy oriented place where you order up front and are given numbers to sit down with. During the evening they're a more sit down dinner place.

This place is good but nothing special to be honest. Like I'll definitely be back to grab an enchilada combo or some tamales but it won't be in a hurry. The entres are honest just Aite, quite flavorful and typical with a lot of food. It gave me flashbacks to the construction days where after a full day of work was great to just sit down and have a nice big old meal. BUT at the same time not really, it seemed like that type of food but more catered to tech employees. 

I am definitely adding a full star specifically for the salsa bar and chips. That salsa bar is as extensive as a lot of places in the mission and they are quite bomb.com. The orange and salsa Verde are the best I think. Also their chips come out thin and warm and are incredibly addicting.
author: Samraaj B.

description:
Great upscale Mexican food for a very reasonable price. The three salsas served with the chips are wonderful especially my favorite, salsa verde.
Would love to come back here another time on my next visit to town.
author: Ziad J.

description:
THE CHIPS. THE. CHIPS. 

I don't even like tortilla chips. But the chips here are warm and fresh and delicious beyond words.

Tropisueno is a go-to mexican restaurant when my friends and I are in the area (which we're not in often). Without a big group, it's easy to get seating at the communal table or bar. The food is delicious.
author: Nicole L.

description:
We went here for dinner on a Saturday night, and needless to say we had a 45 minute wait to be seated. It is a very nice little restaurant near Market that serves amazing Mexican food! 

We ordered the empanadas, plantain appetizers, both of which were good. They serve chips and 2 kinds of salsa on the house to all guests, the 3 kinds of salsa were just very good. It was fresh and had a very unique taste! 

We ordered chile rellenos stuffed with cheese and veggie enchiladas. Both the dishes were very well made and well presented. It was a nice evening that was made even better with the good food we got here!
author: Priyanka R.

description:
There is usually a wait for dinner, even if you come during the weekdays. Happy Hour is 4pm-6pm with a good size menu and fairly priced drinks and food. 

The complimentary chips and salsa are SO GOOD! The chips are homemade and they give you three different salsas to try, which are all excellent. Beware that the habanero orange salsa has a kick and the spice definitely creeps up on you. All the salsas have great flavor. 

My boyfriend ordered the three pork dish and I ordered the carne asada that came with a cheese enchilada, beans, rice, and guacamole. Everything was super tasty and flavorful and not overly salty. The guacamole is super good and I wish they gave us a bigger helping of it. The guac is not too creamy, has a nice kick to it and the perfect amount of acidity. 

The location is right near Powell street Bart so it's very convenient to get to via public transit.
author: Steph D.

description: The ambience of this restaurant is really nice - Really got those Mexican fiesta feels with the decor, the blankets, the women with flowers in their hair, the men with embroidered shirts, etc. I've been here for dinner a few times, and they gave me ALOT of food each time. I discovered their quesadillas during lunchtime, and they are DELICIOUS. They are so plump, cheesy, and delicious - ultimate comfort food and prequel to food coma. Their pico is really tasty, and everyone raves about their chips. The only thing is when I get quesadillas to go, the juices/liquids from the beans (I add black beans to my quesadillas) and the chicken end up making the tortilla soggy. Also they don't have corn.
author: Ke C.

description:
Yuuummmm. Got the shrimp burrito. DELISH.
Babe got a Carnitas Torta - Devoured.  
Plus - the decor is adorable, and service was super friendly.
author: Shannon S.

description: Absolutely love their ceviche, although it is a little pricey for the amount :/ but one of the best I've ever tasted. Was fresh & sweet & sour with all the right flavors! The pollo asado was also a good portion!
author: Vivian C.

description: If you get a seat at the right place of this restaurant there's a nice vibe. If you're near the window area or outside, things are a little dull. Margaritas are delicious, though food is pretty run of the mill.
author: Martha N.

description: It was early on a Sunday evening and the patio was completely empty so I was pretty disappointed I wasn't able to be seated outside; beyond that, the food and drinks were really great.  The mole was especially good and the Santo Margarita was unlike anything I've had before.  I look forward to going back and hopefully sitting outside or making it in time for happy hour.
author: Julia T.

description:
My wife insists this is better than Chevy's. It's been a long time since I've been in a Chevy's so maybe she's right?  Does it matter?
Anyway,  pretty basic stuff. Nothing offensive or inedible, so 3 stars, but really, not worth your time.
author: John G.

description:
I normally hate Mexican food in the Bay Area but this place was pretty good. Prices are also decent. I appreciate how quick and conveyor belt like Tropisueno is during lunch. 

I had a chicken quesadilla. Props for also having horchata. I'm always sad when Mexican places don't have it. Also yay for chips and salsa!
author: Shannon L.

description: Food was delicious! Ordered chicken enchiladas and they did not disappoint! Plenty of salsas to choose from while you munch on corn chips. Service was excellent!
author: Randy F.

description: This place is great to have a good lunch if you want alcohol you paid that separate at the bar at night you need to make reservation because it gets very busy, one time we had to wait more than one hour to get a table cause I had no reservation and I didn't know. The food is delicious for sure and it's very cozy place to enjoy lunch and dinner.
author: Karla M.

description:
Best chips and salsa ever!! I just couldn't stop eating them they were so good! 

We had a pretty large group for dinner and they did a good job at getting all our orders out at the same time and keeping up on the drink requests! 

Would definitely come back here, especially for the habanero salsa
author: Evita B.

description: Awesome restaurant! Great vibes, great food. Came to sf for the weekend and this was my favorite restaurant fot dinner. Had the tampiqueño- highly recommend!! But be sure to get it medium to medium rare (someone in our party got medium well and it was just chewy rubber for her). Cheese enchilada was meh. The salsas that the chips come with are delicious! Ask for extra. The waitlist feature on yelp is super convenient as well. We didn't have to wait at all once we got there for a group of 4 on a Friday night
author: Julia M.

description: Cute spot. I ordered the Salmon which was EXTREMELY underwhelming; it had no flavor what so ever. My server was very kind and allowed me to send the dish back and order the Shrimp Tropisueno, which was amazing! Overall, this spot was just OK for me. It may have been because I'm a pescatarian; my friends thoroughly enjoyed their chicken dishes. I'll return if and when I plan to eat meat.
author: Jessica J.

description:
What is going on here? Food is subpar Mexican at best. Canned beans. Bland over cooked vegetables, and dry torturous mass production tortillas. I came here to meet some friends and when I realized what a turd this place is I opted for nachos. I figured, "If I'm gonna eat garbage I might as well opt for the dish that most resembles a hot pile of garbage."

Well, I'm here to inform you that there are people on earth who can fuck up nachos. They put about a tablespoon of beans on a full plate of nachos. And maybe 2 tablespoons of cheese. Mind you I waited 30 minutes in a huge line for that pile of garbage. And then I had to sit in an overcrowded restaurant of questionable sanitation. 

If you go to restaurants for good food, then skip this place. But if you're looking to hang out in a crowd of yelpers who love bad food, this is the spot for you.
author: Zach A.

description: What a fantastic place to go.  The food is great, the service is great and the atmosphere is great.  It's not that often you find a trifecta, this this place has it all.  Wayne, Carlos and Sergio are the best bartending team I've seen in San Francisco, and I've seen a lot.  They just make your experience feel special, while charging you for every drink ; ) Food is served timely and always on point.  There are few places that you don't mind the wait, or the bill at the end of the night and this is one of those places, plus they have Alex, one of the best host in San Francisco.
author: David E.

description: The food here was very good and the staff was friendly.  However, the tables are so  close together inside that it was very uncomfortable and the tables are incredibly small if you sit at a two top.  The atmosphere was very very incredibly loud.  It was so loud in here that it was actually nice to get out.  Four margaritas, chili con queso, and guacamole and the bill was $73.00.
author: Victor D.

description: Amazing food! Slow polite service and very strong drinks!!! Food was awesome, great flavor, could have been a little warmer but still enjoyable. We were told that we could have our table for 1.5 hours but the service was very slow, would have loved to see how that would have turned out. Drinks were flavorful but get strong, couldn't finish my 2nd drink because of that. Tres Leche  enough said
author: Sophia J.

description: One of the best meals we've had in a while and certainly best Mexican food I've had in some time. I had the huarachis and my partner the carne asada. The refried beans the 3 types of salsa and the margaritas were highlights of our dining experience. Excellent service too!!
author: John H.

description:
I came here probably 5 times before I started Yelping and this was the first time coming back in a few years. They did not disappoint. I loved it here when I was in college and it is still as bomb as I remember. They make the atmosphere feel like you're in Mexico with the decorations, architecture, and the vibes. I remember very vividly of their delicious chips and salsa. It's complimentary and it's unlimited. It is the best chips and salsa I ever had. The chips were thin and very crispy with a light salt to taste. The salsas are always fresh and full of flavor! They give a habanero, verde, and rojo. Don't be afraid to ask for more. 
For dinner, I got the "3 sandals." They were bomb! They give you a chili verde, carne asada, and al pastor. Meats were so tender and flavorful! Honestly can not go wrong with anything on their menu. Food is so authentic! Service is super friendly! I love this place and I honestly recommended this place to all my friends that go to sf and ask me for food suggestions. Prices are not bad either, especially for a restaurant in sf. Go check this out!
author: Michael W.

description: Went here for happy hour and fish tacos were so good, margaritas were so good, we all had a great time! Get there early though because it fills up quick! Guacamole needed a little more flavor and the chips although delicious were useless (chips were so thin and light that they'd break whenever anyone in our group tried to scoop with them). If the chips don't change the guac should come with a bunch of little spoons or something. Overall, had a great experience, I will be back!
author: Lily R.

description: Love love love this place! We come after work and enjoy some margaritas and Mexican food. Great music and vibes inside, staff is efficient and friendly. The food is authentic and flavorful with options for vegetarians and vegans. I love this place and I recommend it!
author: Karlos G.

description:
Really enjoyed visiting Tropisueno at a recent business trip. The food was great but it was an interesting ordering process. I had the fajitas along with tequila / cucumber cocktail - everything was delicious.

There was not enough space to sit inside so we sat outside but it was a nice day (much nicer than it had been on the east coast). The chips and guac were also a good addition to our meal.
author: Teagan R.

description: Don't get the scallops dish. It was salty beyond salvation and I'm sure peaked my blood pressure from how I started to breathe. Also expensive for the serving size. Only certain tables get to order from the happy hour menu, so be sure to ask and not get scammed like we did.
author: Lucy T.

description: This place is great, located in the financial district, it also has great outside seating. You can put your name on the list, head over to the bar and have a great margarita. I had the tacos; pork, chicken and carnitas with beans and rice-so good!
author: Paul A.

description: This place is one of my favorite spots in the city. I found it on Yelp and have come here so many times with my colleagues. The lunch is a bit crazy but worth the wait. The orange salsa is a must try!
author: William M.

description:
TLDR - Traditional Mexican food, but "fancier" ambiance than your average SF hole-in-the-wall makes for a nicer (and more expensive) meal.

My friends and I dropped in for some light food before a weeknight movie. Easy to get a table around 6PM but it got busy real quick shortly afterwards. They have happy hour from 4-6PM Mon-Fri, but only at the bar and tables outside. We wanted to catch HH but there was no bar seating open and it was chilly outside, so we ended up getting a table inside and ordering from the normal menu.

Food was good, though nothing to really rave about. They served complimentary chips with 3 salsas, my favorite being the spicy orange habanero. I ordered the Tacos de Cachete, as did one of my friends, and tried my other friend's Sopa de Pollo. Everything's definitely on the pricier side given you can get equally, if not better, Mexican food at any of the countless hole-in-the-wall's in SF for less, but it's not pricey by SF standards in general.

* TACOS DE CACHETE ($9) - 4/5
[braised beef cheeks, taco truck style w/ onion, cilantro, salsa tomatillo & radish]
Very tender and flavorful!

* SOPA DE POLLO ($14) - 4/5
[rich chicken and vegetable soup, tomato, pico de gallo & spices]
Pretty large bowl of soup. Warm and filling - perfect for a chilly night out.

Very casual, cozy ambiance overall that reminded me of a lot of the Chevy's my family used to go to when I was a kid, where I'd get coloring papers and crayons while we waited for food. Tropisueno wouldn't be top of mind for me when it comes to Mexican food or eating out in general, but it's a good spot to grab a quick bite before a movie.
author: Jessie L.

description: We had chicken milanesa torta, ceviche, chile relleno, salad, and guacamole & chips. Fresh food, great flavor, done right. Not greasy, chips are thin, and everything tastes great! Outdoor seating is available to enjoy the fresh air and views.
author: Mucho Mas S.

description: Probably one of the worst restaurants experiences ever! It started off well getting seated outside in the patio area almost immediately. Then, my girlfriend and I noticed the waiter was taking orders from other parties who arrived after we did. Once our waitress finally made it to our table we had ordered margaritas and an appetizer. After 20 minutes we still had not received our margaritas and our waitress was nowhere to be found. Our appetizer arrived and still no drinks. I had to physically go to the bar and ask about my order. After getting our margaritas (which I do not recommend) the food came out approx a minute after. I had the Carne asada and enchilada plates. The rice and beans were bland as well as the carne asada. The only acceptable thing we got were the enchiladas, appetizer, and chips and salsa. It was a waste of money and time. On top of all that our waitress gave me attitude for getting our margaritas myself. Never again. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Would rather go to a Taco Truck to eat Mexican food.
author: Xavier J.

description:
They give free chips and 3 types of amazing salsa. This makes up for the long wait time, but my friend and I ordered margaritas. These margs were super watered-down, I mean it was 85% ice and the rest was margarita.

This was during happy hour and I would say if you want a margarita then tell them NO ICE lol. We ordered no more drinks after our first one. 

I thought their tacos were really good- fish and chicken.
author: Nishi S.

description:
I love Troposueno it's a frickin problem
and yeah i like their margs i got a frickin problem
cause I love Tropisueno it's a frickin problem...

(5/5) Enchiladas de Nopales - Grilled chicken or veggies, corn, cactus and chiles in a fresh corn cream sauce. For the "green enchilada" enthusiasts. This is no joke. 

(5/5) House marg - They even put sug on the rim if you specially request it. This, my friend, is as good as it gets.

(5/5) Free chips - The description says it all. Naize and salty.

The only reason for the four stars is the wait. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation or it can get ugly. Also, the bartender is the funniest person in the world. Thanks for always making me laugh and for making killer drinks!
author: Nicole W.

description:
Having seen it on "Bay Area check please" many many years ago, I finally made my way to Tropisueno. The place was buzzing with life and energy, and the interiors were warm and welcoming even though the tables did not have all that much room between them. (It wasn't claustrophobia inducing, though!)

The three salsas with the warm tortilla chips were delicious. I especially loved the bright red salsa which, I suspect, has puree of roasted red peppers in them.

I decided on the pescado veracruzana, and I'm glad I did. The fish was firm and well fried, with moist flakes of meat (can I call fish flesh "meat"?) falling off at the nudge of a fork. The sauce was delicious as so were the generous portion of Mexican rice, black beans (I think you have an option of beans), and the tarty pickled onions.

The Sangria was really good and I loved it!

The service was fast and efficient, and I would love to come back again.
author: Umesh T.

description:
Tropisueno is like 2 entirely different restaurants transforming everything between lunch & dinner.

During lunch, it is this crazy counter-ordering fast-casual restaurant. Stand in this long line out the door and order at the counter where you watch the workers build your burritos and plates right in front of your eyes. They hand you a number as you play musical chairs and try to snag the best possible table (or any available table) in the house.
If you want an alcoholic drink, you must purchase separately at the bar, where 1 bartender is trying to make multiple drinks at a time with a dozen people holding their credit cards out, trying to be the first one to grab his attention.
Menu is expansive with lots of vegetarian/vegan options. I had the veggie burrito here, which was big and very filling. I loved the open salsa bar, with plenty of hot sauces and toppings available.

Dinner transforms the restaurant into a nicer full-service style restaurant. They take reservations online only, which I recommend because walking in seems to have a wait all the time.
The menu is entirely different as well, which is much more meat-centric. It was actually hard to find fully vegan options, having to modify the few vegetarian options to make it work.
I had the vegetable enchiladas with rice and beans-No cheese, and with white beans. (Refried is NOT vegetarian-friendly). I thought it was really good and cleaned my whole plate! 

There's a great cocktail menu-comprising mostly of tequila-based drinks. They are strong and delicious, at least all the ones I've tried were.

Friendly service, convenient location, and good for groups. It's no wonder this place is always so crowded.
author: Lanie L.

description:
Located in downtown SF, across the street from Yerba Buena Gardens, you can find yourself in this fancy little Mexican restaurant. The ambiance is nice - dim lit restaurant (not great for pictures) and beautiful decor - almost feels like you're in a touristy part of Mexico! Except the food don't taste authentic. The price of the food is average (~$15 an entree) but I don't think it's worth it for the quality, maybe the ambiance and location. They do have generous portions though. 

There is outdoor seating as well as a bar. Their drinks are known to be strong and they have a good tequila selection (though I haven't ordered any yet..too old for shots now!). 

Now with my little intro over, lets get into the review, shall we?!
(Scroll down to star for BAD review part)

I've been here twice and I don't think I'm coming back again after my most recent visit. My first visit was nice, but it wasn't the place for a broke college student. I do remember ordering a cocktail and it was pretty darn strong. If your intentions are to get drunk, you've come to the right place. Just don't drink a drive! Muni, bart, and taxi's are nearby if needed. To get a taxi, maybe you should go to the Marriot next door, haha. I remember ordering the chile verde for my first visit. From what I remember, I didn't eat half the plate, but I do remember it being good.... but I didn't eat half of it cause I don't like beans lol. 

Most recent visit, I made sure not to order the same thing for my first visit (almost forgot I ordered it) because it sounded soo good .. but I remember not liking it that much, haha. I ordered the a 3 item combo from OLD SCHOOL FAVORITE PLATO'S ($14.95). Thought it was the best deal if you ain't made of money yet lol. (Slowly growing in my career...). You can choose tacos or enchiladas, tamales, and flautas. I ordered 3 al pastor tacos since tacos have become a new love in my life. Thought it was meh because of the tortilla and what seemed to be no sauce on my meat. Tasted pretty bland. I'll stick to my street tacos. I also ordered a Corona ($6) since the cocktails are like $10+. My total came out to be a little over $20 for 3 tacos and a corona. 

***Okay, now where did this all go wrong? 

This dinner was supposed to be my friends birthday dinner. She made reservations for 12 people and we were separated into 2 different tables nearby each other, but not next to each other. What are reservations really for, if you guys are not ready to seat a big group? I understand it's busy because it's the weekend and dinner time but still...

While waiting for our orders, a family next to us was finishing up. We noticed that the father had an issue with the bill and he stayed there for about another half hour, trying to figure it out. Turns out he was billed more than he should have. 
(Wait for it.. there's more)

Our orders came 2-3 at a time for our table at 6. Of course we didn't feel right to eat our dish while the others didn't have theirs yet, so by the time it did come, it got cold. Table manners! 

The other table (our friends) finished before us because they got seated first. When paying for the bill, each table put multiple credit cards (5-6?). We try our best to make it easy for servers by writing the last four digits of the card with the cost of the transaction. My friend watched the server swipe each one. Now here's where things get weird.. my friends credit card goes missing when the rest of the tables cards get returned!! How the heck did a credit card go MISSING while getting swiped?! My friend accuses the server of theft. After arguing for about 30 mins, they compensated their table with a round of tequila shots (probably some low quality kind). BUT HER CREDIT CARD IS STILL MISSING!! She was pretty pissed because she had to use it for Cancun in the next 3 days.. 

Now we have a new group sitting next to us. The server doesn't come to them for about 30 minutes (probably because of the whole missing credit card thing), so they get up and leave without making their order. They dodged a bullet. 

Now our bill comes. We are charged 2 extra dishes on our bill, so this confused the whole table when splitting the tab. We notified them. New receipt, we write the cost of each transaction with the last 4 digits of the cc in the back again. When the waiter came to pick it up, we verbally told him about the cost of each card on the back of the receipt. We get the bill back and we're all charged ~$41 evenly... We tell him of another mistake, and he refunds us and swipes our cc's again for the charge that was on the receipt for each card. This could've saved us 20 minutes. 

The birthday dinner was a disaster with the whole mis-charges and missing credit card. Don't think I'm coming back again, because our server was sketch AF with all these unnecessary additional charges (for us and other table). 

Oh, and if you would like to know, his name was Hugo according to my receipt. We were seated in the nice corner with curtain
author: Mandy G.

description:
Was treated to this place last night and gotta give props to the baby brother for making a reservation - especially on Black Friday in downtown!!! 

This place was literally jam packed. The bar... the outside area even though it was hella cold... but well worth it - I swear!

Our server was friendly - forgot his name but definitely a funny guy! He was able to accommodate all our requests as well as recommending my entree, which was amazing!

Their chips were crazy good... we kept eating it that we all opted to stop since we were all getting full! We shared their platanos fritos which was a good portion for 5 and you can't really mess up fried bananas :)

I opted to get their enchiladas de Nopales with chicken and I kid you not... you will not regret it! It's not spicy at all... and the first bite - it just honestly melted in my mouth! The corn sauce and the whole entire dish... perfection. I think I left just one bite and even then I was regretting not finishing it!

Overall - highly recommend checking this place out with recommendation and take it easy with the chips!
author: Cath M.

description: We went in for dinner. The chips are fresh and salsa is really good. The orange sauce is super spicy so be careful if you cannot handle spice.  The tacos were good with the rice. We also ordered the ceviche, which was really good and fresh. The only downside to the ceviche was that there wasn't enough (especially for the price that you're paying). Overall, good food and service.
author: Soua M.

description: Pretty decent Mexican food right behind the Marriott Marquis in SF. Chips and guac were good, margarita was standard, and the Huaraches "tres Cochinitas" were ok. Nothing outstanding, but just a solid place to grab Mexican food. Check them out to see for yourself!
author: Tom F.

description: Love the food here. Order at the counter and the food gets brought to your table. I love any place with a salsa bar and their options are very tasty, ranging from mild to spicy. Good Mexican food alternative to Mission taquerias.
author: Lillian B.

description: love there food but its not enjoyable when you tell them that you don't want things in the burrito but they still put it in  i could have had an allergic reaction if my reason i didn't want lettuce and salsa in my burrito  pay more attention to details get the order right!
author: Erin W.

description:
5 stars goes to the spicy orange sauce that I have been craving every day in the last couple months! Every person I have met recently knows what I would do if I could get my hands on that orange sauce recipe! House-made, creamy orange, and straight fire emoji, this sauce has earned a special spot in my heart. 

The orange sauce here has single-handedly increased my spice tolerance!  I used to never eat spicy food, but now as I find my palette changing, I am constantly badgering other members of my office to go with me!

What's more is that orange sauce would never go well with a sub-par chip. Here at Tropis, they know how to do chips (way better than Chipotle, too, if I might add), which is why this salsa / chip thing can't be healthy.  It probably isn't, but curbing myself from this goodness would be like separation from a loved one.

Food wise, I'd have to say I'm a big fan of tacos. However, I will say that Tropis food is pretty good, but it isn't the best Mexican food I've had. I usually get tacos or a quesadilla, but more recently, I have only bought to-go orders for the chips and dip.  The to-go orders come with a bag of chips, so make sure you get your sauces ready after you order!  I personally get 2 full containers of orange sauce, 1 mild tomato salsa, and the green sauce!  All of them are so great, but of course, orange is my favorite.

Ambiance-wise, this restaurant is nicely decorated and is a solid lunch place to catch-up with a friend or do HH with coworkers!  Location is very ideal, with it being just a few blocks from Bart.  Lunch is served as an order or go type-of-deal (with the option of eating in) and dinner is served like a restaurant.  I'm generally really impressed with this place, so please keep up the great work!

And, lastly, note to Tropis management: would you please package that orange sauce!?!? I will be your #1 fan. :)
author: Jana L.

description: Love this place such good food and love the ambiance.  My only qualm about it is that out tacos were utterly loaded with onions and when we asked for new tacos and that we would pay for different ones they really had some bad attitude! Too bad cause I really love this place especially on a warm SF night!
author: Jill K.

description: Stopped by for lunch; line moves quickly.  The chips were decent.  Salsa bar has a lot of variety.  Solo carne asada was super chewy and bland.  The el pastor has more pineapple than pork. The only reason that this place has this many reviews is due to location.  Food was subpar.
author: M Y.

description: Excellent food. It is as noisy as you would imagine at 6 pm for dinner, but that lent to the excitement. Enjoyed the service and the food.
author: J B.

description: Great food and ambience, especially at dinner time. Love their complimentary chips and salsa although you can't go wrong with anything here really.
author: Pushkar M.

description:
I'm a vegetarian so I ordered the enchiladas de nopales for dinner. The corn sauce on it was super good. However the vegetables were kind of just thrown in the tortillas so when I tried to eat it, the tortilla and vegetables would fall apart and not stay together, which isn't a huge deal but it would have otherwise been easier to eat. The corn sauce was the best part. The rest of the enchilada was fine. I got it with black beans, rice, and some cabbage, which were all fine. 

If you are vegetarian, be sure not to get refried beans because it has lard in it. A lot of the other vegetarian reviews here say people found meat in their food so I was anxious about that but everything turned out okay in my order. 

I should also share that I am from Southern California so I have higher and different standards for Mexican food than a lot of people do in the Bay Area. I would say my order was something different that I don't find everywhere, specifically referring to the corn crema.

In conclusion, corn sauce was great. I would recommend trying it at least once, and I would potentially go back for more. Keep in mind this has 2 dollar signs on Yelp so it is definitely on the pricier side. My enchiladas came out to about $15.50 with tax, and then I tipped on top of that.
author: Karishma M.

description: My go to Mexican spot. Everything is delish - portions are legit. Margaritas legiter - if that is even a word. Great place for a celebration of any kind.
author: Megan C.

description:
I'd come here alone for their chips and salsa. That REALLY won the show.

My sister and I came here with reservations. The ambiance is great for date night or a dinner with friends. Service is fast and attentive.

The main course was nothing special, as expected from a Mexican restaurant. I could not stop eating those chips and salsa though. The guac left me desiring more.
author: Ellen C.

description: Came here for happy hour with friends on a Friday and this place definitely gets packed! The HH specials are only available at the bar and outside, which is pretty limited seating. The specials last from 4-6 with some decent margaritas as well some beer and wine specials. Didn't indulge in the food, but people seemed to be loving it!
author: Chandani D.

description:
I thought that their lunch was amazing. We hadn't been back to this restaurant in over 3 years but good to know they've really managed to keep their quality and flavors fresh and consistent. 

We had their taco salad with the beef and their tofu, both of which were great. Their salsas are also quite amazing. I will definitely go back for dinner.
author: Rohan D.

description: Very authentic Jalisco style Mexican food. The mole was spot on and the mango margarita delicious. There is a pleasant outdoor seating option, but inside is nice. If you have hearing issues you might want to sit outside because it was loud as many busy restaurants are. Salsas and chips were fresh. So glad to have found this place while visiting San Francisco.
author: Jeannette B.

description: Great food, the greatest thing about this place: Super fresh chips. The service could have been better.
author: Wallis T.

description:
I had an enjoyable experience at this restaurant for dinner. There were pretty long lines around dinner time on Sunday, so it took us about 30 minutes to get a table for 2. Reserve in advance if you don't want to wait.

What I liked:
* Unlimited chips and salsa - the salsas were really good especially the green one (guacamole?) and the spicy orange one (habanero?).
* Ambiance of the restaurant (dimly lit, semi-fancy), good for a date
* Fair prices overall for a more upscale Mexican restaurant.

What I disliked:
* The main meals arrived pretty slowly (we managed to finish two servings of chips and salsa as a party of 2 before the mains arrived).

I ordered the 3 item combo and picked a combination of flauta, enchilada, and tamale and also comes with rice and beans. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to finish the main because I naively ate too much of the chips and salsa before the main arrived. The main was alright, but I've had better versions before at other restaurants.

Overall a 3.5/5.
author: Michael M.

description:
I came here for my 30th birthday celebration and never plan to return, ever. We put our name in at 6:10 and instantaneously received a text  confirming our spot in line. They said it would be a 45 minute wait. We went to Bluestem for a drink and came back after an hour after we still had not heard. When we arrived, the manager explained we were never put on the list and we should have responded to the text message and explained we were now bumped to the end of the wait list. We had to show him the text we received that stated it was just a confirmation that we indeed had a spot in line, no action needed. He was the manager, he should have known how it worked, right? We demanded that we be moved to the front of the line. He made us wait 3 more people down the list. Fine. We waited that long and we were hungry so we waited patiently. 

When we're finally seated we order some much needed margs. They come 45 minutes later (no exaggeration). We asked at least 5 times when they were coming and if we could possibly get comped the round since they were taking so long. The extremely unprofessional/inexperienced server acted like this had never happened before and said no we can't do that. He actually had the audacity to crack a joke to say "We'll take it off the bill, no just kidding." When they finally came, they tasted like pure margarita mix and very little tequila. 

Food comes out immediately after drinks and it was cold. I couldn't even eat it - it was that cold. I lost my appetite..

We explained to our server how unhappy we were with everything in general and all he did was comp us with the dum dum lolli pops they hand out with the check. First time I didn't give a tip. In my life. How could I? I definitely do not recommend this spot. It ruined our night.
author: Marie J.

description:
This is my second time coming here so why not finally make a review. Last time I met up with my girlfriends we came here for dinner, but this time I came here for both happy hour & dinner with one of my girl friend. I had different experiences here before than i did recently on sunday. the place itself is cute, noise wise it can get loud - i felt like i was yelling instead of talking, but i didn't mind it. the food is actually good for a more americanize mexican resto although i feel like they skimp on the meat. 

Past: We ate dinner on a friday 6-8pm i believe and it was a busy night, we get it. we didn't make a reservation because it was a last minute thing. we walked in and the front guy said the wait was between 45 to an hour if we were okay with that, which we were. he told us to come back in 20 minutes, we came back and we asked if there were tables ready and he ignored one of my friend so my other friend had to go talk to him. i get it, it's busy but you just ignored one of your customer that was in front of you as if you didn't see her. rude. anyways we got seated and both our waitresses were really nice, she even gave us our own pitcher of water. LOL so we wouldn't have to keep asking for water. 

Recently: We came here on a sunday 4-7pm, yeah they're also busy but less busy than before. we had a choice to eat outside so why not, it's a beautiful day out after a break from the rain. our waiter notified us that we can only order drinks & tapas. we were fine with it since we were going to order drinks anyways then dinner starts at 5pm? i ordered their red sangrai and my friend orders their house margarita. oh, they also serve you a bowl of fresh homemade chips and three different dips, which were delish! we also got guacamole & ceviche, yum! yeah, we for sure did not get full so we decided why not just have dinner since it's already 5pm! we asked for the menu and my friend ordered another margarita and our waiter was like "order from me, i'm one of the best" we looked at each other so confused when he walked away. LOL anyways for our dinner platter we ordered their 2 combo plate i got their al pastor enchilada & pork tamales w/ black bean, my friend got flautas & enchilada w/ extra rice. each plate on their combo comes with refried or black bean and rice! the only downside is that we didn't have napkins and when we got our food we didn't even have utensils to eat it with. we thought he probably thought the table already has all that stuff but nope. We had to flag him down and asked for utensils, oh after asking for it, he forgot when we asked him about utensils. UMMM, okay?

Anyways, customer service is good I understand this place get busy and may forget things but they're very attentive, i appreciate that. I'd recommend this place, but if you're coming for dinner after 5pm I suggest you reserving a table.
author: Deneb T.

description: I found this place on a business trip many years ago. Anytime in town I go. Best margaritas, food. During day they had ale carte setup. Gets busy but nice atmosphere in evening.
author: Jeff K.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night about 5pm. Inside was packed so we sat outside on the patio. It would be great if they had outdoor heaters, the nights in SF get a little chilly and it's not always preferable to eat with a jacket on. 

On to the food and drinks: ordered the margarita, it was pretty good, definitely average.  The guac was a smaller serving size than I anticipated and the flavor wasn't anything to write home about. It was your run of the mill avocado and chopped veggies. The quesadilla was good- it's pretty hard to mess up one of those. 

The restaurant itself was cute and staff was friendly but I wasn't completely sold on the food so I doubt I'll be back unless I was in the area craving Mexican food.
author: Angela C.

description:
I came here after a long day at a conference. I showed up at 5:30pm, just in time for happy hour. 

Happy Hour: 
Food.........
-Tacos (meat & fish) 
-ceviche 
-flautas
-nachos
-quesadilla

Drinks.......
-house margarita 
-el jimador shots
-sangria 
-well drinks 
-tecate beer 

I sat at the bar and the bartender gave me some chips and salsa. The salsa was delicious!!! To order,  I had the Sangria (more on the dry side and not so sweet)  and then a Paloma (lime and tequila). For food, I went with the ceviche on the happy hour menu (refreshing.. it was tostada chips with a small bowl of ceviche). This dish was small, but filling. 

The seating outside was packed and the community table was full, so I ended up just sitting at the bar.

Overall, good spot for drinks and to meet friends.
author: Carolina C.

description:
Unfortunately, what was my first visit, was not the best experience and, thus, was probably my last visit to Tropisueno. First off, I do have to say that the food was delicious. But as good as it was, the negative experience, in great part, due to the team of employees left us feeling like this would not be a great place to return. Plus, the food is a bit overpriced for the quality. I get it. It's San Francisco and overhead is very high for any retail business. But it's hard to justify paying over $20 for a Mexican food combination meal and then you still have to account for a tip on top of that.

When we entered the restaurant, the host asked, "How many in your party?" We replied "Four." He then said, literally, "We have a table and you can have it for 90 minutes. (As in we would have to leave the restaurant within 90 minutes after sitting at the table)." It didn't exactly make us feel welcome and almost decided to skip dining here. The only reason we stayed is that we were entertaining guests from out of town and the cuisine served here was the only thing within walking distance everyone could agree on.

Food was very good. But when we asked a staff member for another serving of tortilla chips, they never returned with them, so we had to ask another employee to retrieve chips for us. When the server presented the bill, I left a $100 dollar bill and asked for change (so that I could tip her cash). She returned about 20 seconds later and says, "You only left me $100 (because the total bill was close to $100 and she implied that I was leaving her a small tip). I explained to her once again, "I need change of a $100 bill so that I can tip you cash." She leaves again and brings back the change and then stands hovering over me while I'm trying to calculate the tip. This is incredibly awkward. Do you really want your server, literally, standing over your shoulder as you sit to calculate the tip and feel like they are examining you at the same time? I had to politely request, "Please give us a moment while I calculate this." She did give us some time, but it was very unsettling nonetheless. It was not a great finish to our dining experience.

So to recap, food was good, but overpriced. Staff was not terribly welcoming and made everyone at the table feel awkward. If the aforementioned shortcomings of the staff were improved upon, I might entertain returning. But I'm not expecting that to be rectified anytime soon.
author: Peter C.

description: Possibly the best meal I had in San Francisco! 10/10 for quality of food, speed of service, and price. I got 3 tostadas, one with chicken, one with carnitas, and one with beef. They were all amazing. The meat was juicy, the bottom part crispy, and the flavors of everything went really well together. I'll be dreaming about this place...
author: April H.

description:
The restaurant is pretty loud, but you can still hear one another. 
Their food was great! They also give you chips and salsa as appetizer for free. Their margaritas (watermelon) was also good!
author: Kate L.

description:
One star because of our very amicable server, who found us a place at the surprisingly packed restaurant, and treated us with kindness. As for the food, the run of the mill taqueria turns out better food than this joint. With all the talent in SF, I can't believe this restaurant can't even get the side rice right. Cold and gloppy. Ay, dios mio! I mean, not even subpar. If you can't get the rice right, get out of town. 
Their staff is mostly Latino, enough reason for me to want them to succeed, yet the chile verde, the tacos, all child's play really, were very tired tasting. What an embarrassment. I gave them a couple of tries and won't be returning.
author: Firat Y.

description: First time here with my boyfriend to celebrate our anniversary & food was AMAZING! The service was friendly & fast too. We had a reservation booked because we knew it's a busy Saturday night and we were served asap & seated inside. Overall, highly recommend & would definitely come back and take my parents here for lunch or dinner :)
author: Adrienne C.

description: Really good tacos, almost like Baja style!  Love the salsa bar and lively atmosphere. Will definitely be back. Lunch crowds are very large so be ready.
author: John C.

description: Loved this place when my wife and I visited earlier this year in June. We were very pleasantly surprised by the ambiance it brought, the flavor and presentation of the food. The decor inside the Restuarant added a great touch to our experience. Definitely recommend if in the area and will be back on the next trip to San Francisco
author: Ronak P.

description:
First time trying this place & decided to check it out after seeing the high Yelp reviews/ratings. Decor was a mix between classy but with a very casual ambiance. Since we went during a holiday weekend, there was about a 45-minute wait for a party of 3. One of my friends ordered the Pollo Asado which was super juicy/tender. My friend & I both ordered the Tampiqueno which was grilled beef carne asada with a beef barbacoa enchilada, & guac. Grilled beef was very juicy and flavorful. Not a fan of the enchilada since the beef inside was super dry. 
We also ordered an appetizer, the Tostaditas de Carnitas. Very flavorful but messy to eat since it each mini tostada was on a flat 'chip' and taking one bite into it would cause the whole thing to crumble. It was also difficult to split since there were only 2 "tostaditas." Would have been nice to know how many were noted on the menu. After receiving the bill, we noticed we were charged $3 for 2 side orders of cheese when we specifically asked to have the cheese on the Tampiqueno dishes on the side. We got charged despite not receiving said side cheese orders which was our main concern. Server decided to comp our appetizer (which was $9) for the inconvenience.
author: Angela P.

description:
Came here with the coworkers and I came out satisfied. The corn tortillas for the tacos were delicious! I ordered the carne asada and chorizzo tacos. They're about $2.75 each, which is typical for a restaurant taco price. 

My coworkers ordered burritos, and it looked really good too! I will definitely try their burritos next time. 

It does get crowded and packed, especially during lunch time. We came in a little before 12 (around 11:45ish) and we we were able to get seats.
author: Joyce W.

description:
Great lunch spot with super fresh and authentic options... 

Had the combo plate with a carne asada taco and chicken tamale... Beef was tender and nicely grilled, tamale was flavorful with a delicious tomato sauce... Also came with fresh warm chips and sides of rice and beans.  

Lost a star for not including any salsa in my to go order- the taco and tortilla chips were desperately missing it... Would definitely go back next time I'm in town
author: Tazeen L.

description: Went here with a bunch of friends.  It is a classic order then pay then sit.  The food was very nice.  Had a chicken burrito which was huge.  Had the chicken quisidia which was nice and had good flavor. This is a great place with a warm interior feel to it.
author: Amber L.

description: Probably the best Mexican food I've ever had. The tortilla chips and three salsas were fresh and tasty. My entree was half a juicy, baked chicken, with rice, beans, and vegetables. Nothing was dry. The margarita was ok, not very strong. But the food is scrumptious!!
author: Felicia C.

description:
Came here on a whim with the wife when we visited town for a day and SO glad we did. Per usual, went straight to the bar and ended up being served by Gage. Firstly, we were astounded by their menu. It's so rad to see a legit tequila and mezcal breakdown by region. We ordered a mezcal margarita and it was poured just like we would at home. That of course forced a second round, and third, and you get the picture. 

Gage's knowledge of spirits was clear and we really enjoyed the time spent chatting with him. While we don't live local, we've already planned to come back. Hopefully we'll be fortunate enough to show up when he's working again!
author: Matt F.

description:
Best!!!!! Chips and tri salsa, orange, green, and red. Fuullll of hella flavor. Great price. Sweet beautiful waitress Gabby. Totally hot and makes you feel right at home. Make you want to order a drink. So I tried the Traditional Margarita. First sip. Good. I'm waiting for it to kick in because I took a half sip and I can tell yeah Awesome.  Going to take my time and enjoy because I need this from my fu#^^##%ckin boss's boss is a serious D}%#}#ICK. 

Meal was the best mXican I've had except for the roach coach on Little Mexico. 

Otherwise, yeah. Best Best Best. 

High Lee recommendation ish Yo.
author: G S.

description:
Had a 530 reservation and they were able to eat us in early- by 5pm. Took about 30 minutes for us to order our drinks. Food came quick once ordered and was delicious. Sign said happy hour was 4-6, but once we got the bill and inquired why the drinks were full price- we were told it was only at the bar and outside seating. 
Should have clearer signage or verbally tell happy hour rules to customers. 

Overall drinks and food were good, thanks!
author: Hannah A.

description: I've always wanted to try Tropisueno, and I finally did. The chips are so fresh, the dipping sauce was delicious as well. My favorite is the orange one, which has a kick to it.
