My friends ordered the  and I ordered enchiladas de something with the white cream sauce. It was amazing and delicious. I will definately go back again to try another dish off the menu.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Great place for drinks and for some delicious food. I got the salmon tartar, which didn't look like much but was fantastic and delicious. It was a bit too loud for my taste. Bottomless chips and salsa is always a plus. Definitely recommend coming here for some good Mexican food if you're in the area!
author: Sam T.

description: I really really liked both the indoor and outdoor decor. Great energy, good vibe, fast service and really good food! I ordered a Chicken Cheese Quesadilla and it came in a very generous portion and was really delicious!
author: Rumaisa M.

description:
I was back here after 3 years (I have now moved back to SOCAL) and was so happy that this place is still the same. The service is still that involving TLC, and the taste and the food is still so flavorful and wholesome. 
We got the Margaritas; one of my friends wanted a salt rim, they were happy to oblige. Folks at our table ordered   Chile Verde, Chile Relleno and Mole Pablano, desserts included Flan. Everyone loved what they ordered. I would highly recommend this place for, great food and service! 
Gracias!
author: Ad B.

description:
I know SF doesn't have a ton of chains, ESP when compared to other towns. But some places just give off the vibe of a chain... these are vibes you only know when you actually live here.

Good news here is they have updated their outdoor seating. It used to be p.a.t.h.e.t.i.c. like sit in a wind tunnel and the chairs fly off from how strong the wind is- no joke. This really has happened many times.

The food is the same. It's pretty good, I really like the enchiladas and the spicy salsas. I also like ordering and paying right at the register bc it makes the dining process faster. 

Cons-
The workers here are always in a rush and never pleasant. The price isn't cheap either. The happy hour ends soo early. The margaritas are disgusting.
author: Mariam P.

description:
I love trying new Mexican places and after the great reviews I wanted to try this place. 
The positives: great free chips and choice of salsa, the fun atmosphere, convenient location
The okay: service was good at times, and then pretty bad at some parts. Food was mediocre to good. (Stay away from the fried rainbow trout, it tasted and smelled like rotten fish)
The bad: a table for 2 on Tuesday night at 8pm is going to be 45 minutes, not a broad menu selection to choose from. 

I would eat there again for the chips and salsa but I don't think I'll be recommending this place to anyone in the area.
author: Spencer R.

description: Just didnt like the style and seasoning  . Love Mexican food but not here. I seems to be ok but only if you and their chef  like the same taste. And it is not cheap!
author: Eff R.

description:
5 stars for the mole, 4/3.5 for everything else. Whatever you get, get the mole added on. 

Tasty Mexican food, always reliable. A little overpriced, but hey it's San Francisco and the rent is high.
author: Caro C.

description:
So this place is ALWAYS busy and I was actually hesitant to try it when a coworker suggested. For some reason I assumed it would just be bland and Americanized and was most likely popular for a happy hour....

Turns out, the happy hour is great and so is the food! The margaritas were amazing actually, house marg had the perfect amount of citrus and you could feel that tequila kick!

We were luckily able to walk right in and sit at a communal bar table, which worked out to our advantage as a huge line formed in the few minutes following our arrival. 

We shared some queso, which albeit Americanized, had some spice and was freaking great. I take back my negative feelings and need to learn that crowded places in San Francisco are probably crowded because they are good. 

I've heard the line for burritos at lunchtime is endless for takeout, so be warned! Best time to come would be if you dart out of work a little early and can claim a table for your friends! Definitely a perfect place to start your evening off on the right foot!
author: Molli W.

description: The seafood soup is delicious...Every bite had some piece of fish in it.  I get it every time we come to San Francisco. Busy place be ready for a wait.
author: Devon R.

description:
The restaurant is in a great part of the city and is off the main road to avoid all the hustle and bustle of passersby.  The interior seemed nice but we didn't want to wait that long and dined outside instead.  

They gave us tortilla chips that seemed freshly made with some nice sauces which were nice but the second batch near closing time were really hard and oily.  I had the chicken with mole poblano with nice mole sauce; it was good that it also included classic sides of rice and beans to round out the meal.  I also tried their hibiscus cocktail which I enjoyed as it seemed like a unique menu option.  I had really high expectations after seeing all the positive comments on Yelp but was a little disappointed as I found it a little overpriced
author: Jenny L.

description:
The group I was with was looking for a restaurant nearby for dinner. Since we were there for a conference, one that was just around the corner, this place was packed on a Tuesday. We arrived only to be told there was an hour wait so we put our name on the list. They have a text system that alerts you when your table is ready. Tip* You can book a table through Yelp!

I got a text saying my table was ready after only 20 min and when I arrived back, was told it was a mistake and that although it wasn't ready I would be next on the list. We had to wait another 30 min for a table. Only advice: Maybe work on this system so people don't get sent errors.

Finally when our table was ready our waitress told us "we ask that you finish your meal in 90 minutes so we can pass along the table to others." Weird ask, seeing as how they weren't great with time.

Anyway the food was good. I got the shrimp entree (forgot the name) and it was delicious. The margaritas were great as well.
author: Courtney D.

description: Really great ambience and decorations! I recommend making a reservation online through Yelp roughly when you think your party will be ready. I made a few reservations, came to the restaurant and our name was called, only to find out we couldn't be seated until the whole party was there. This is totally fair and makes sense for them because they are incredibly busy! It was fine though because they let us get drinks at the bar while we waited. There's a huge selection of tequilas and mezcal margaritas, but they also have a full bar so you can really order anything if you're not a fan of tequila. I ordered the chicken and veggie enchiladas. Overall, nothing to write home about, was decent and like your average enchilada. It was pretty filling though, so the portions were good. I'm docking points because I was honestly expecting better food given how great the reviews on yelp were, but the atmosphere and vibes were chiller- great for a group or double dates!
author: Vandan K.

description: Great bar service especially the bartender Wane he is pretty cool and makes the environment pretty cool to kick it at the bar area
author: Liz K.

description:
I've been here for lunches and dinners, and the food is always authentic, fresh, and super tasty. There are bottomless chips, and for dinner, 3 salsas to choose from! No matter whether you get an old-school plate, tacos, one of their specials, or burritos, you can't go wrong. Also, the choices for vegetarians are fantastic!

Walk-in line for lunch is long, so show up before 11:45am to avoid having a long wait. For dinner, definitely make reservations (can be done online) ahead of time.
author: Sweta A.

description: Great atmosphere, food is authentic Mexican, salsa selection is delicious, fast and friendly service, great drink menu
author: Alicia D.

description:
Our favourite restaurant in San Fran! 

My husband and I come back to the bay frequently as it's my home. We discovered this spot when we first started frequently coming back (every other month) we always stay for 2-3 days max and every day we come to Tropisueño lol it's that good. Lunch and dinner, two very different vibes. Lunch you line up, order your food and it's delivered to your seat. Have a drink at the bar while you wait for your food (you'll only be waiting 5 mins MAX) 
Get: the combination plates for best value for money , 1 item, 2 item or 3 item options 
Don't forget green enchilada sauce is hotter than the red! (Both are good)
My favourite dish is the SOLO CARNE (only meat) your choice of meat served with guacamole, rice and choice or beans. Super yum.

Service : 5/5 we always sit at the bar and all the bar staff are excellent
author: Riccia K.

description: We were in town on vacation and ended up eating here twice. The first time we sat inside good service and food was good. We ordered he tres carnitas and the enchilada nopales. Both very good. Second time we sat outside not as good of an experience it's like they sorta forget about you when your out there. Our chips and salsa was kinda just thrown in our direction. Food was good overall.
author: Melissa M.

description: The food here is amazing, very well curated menu that is more than most  generic Mexican restaurants! I had some margarita's and they were decent sized drinks with some delicious tropical flavors. Great date spot too! Very casual setting and gets pretty loud in the evenings.
author: Neha S.

description: Fun atmosphere though it was VERY LOUD. Difficult to hear what your friends are trying to say. Food was amazing though and i had a lot of fun :)
author: Yeonhwa S.

description: This place is pretty good. Service is fast and solid. I liked the salsa bar and unlimited chips. The chips are amazing and tastes really fresh. Busy but fast. Great restaurant. They certainly know their business.
author: Linh V.

description: Liked the yelp waitlist (if you come here you need to use it or you'll be stuck waiting), great food/drinks and good service. Highly recommended.
author: Wendell O.

description:
My now boyfriend and I had our first date here at Tropicsueño for dinner. We were sat at an intimate table lit with candles. The overall ambience of the restaurant was lively but still romantic. The warm lighting of the restaurant at night lends to the overall aesthetic.

We started with the complimentary trio of salsas. They were all so flavorful, but our favorite was the orange one by far. I love heat, and these salsas did not disappoint. We also ordered the guacamole as an appetizer. I'm very picky about guacamole being from Southern California where avocados literally just grow on trees, but this was delicious! 10/10. 

For drinks, we sampled two of the margaritas. Both were the best margaritas I've ever had, hands down. 

For entrees, we split the Callos a la Plancha, or seared scallops on a plantain-chorizo hash. These were phenomenal. The sweetness of the plantain mixed with the robust flavor of the chorizo was the perfect accompaniment to the seared scallops. We also ordered the Chicken with Mole Poblano. It was very good, but didn't compare to the scallops. 

Overall, the food was delicious, the drinks were strong, and the ambiance was on point. What more can you ask for when planning a romantic date?
author: Nicholle K.

description: Went to this restaurant for lunch on a Saturday. It was not too busy when we got there but had a line out the door as we were leaving. We were not extremely hungry but wanted a quick bite and a margarita. We ordered the ceviche, guacamole, and the violet margarita. The ceviche was good but a fairly small portion and needed more lime for my taste. The tostadas that were served with it were extremely hard. Guac was good and chips were light and crispy. Margarita was average, I wish it had more stand out flavors. The gentleman at the bar and servers were pleasant but the female cashier was rude. The prices were high for what we got. Cute atmosphere however.
author: Candace B.

description: Worth service I ever experienced. Manager, Alex for resolution offered us to look for another place. I will never recommend this place to anyone.
author: George C.

description:
Went here twice over the last week. It's a great spot for happy hour and drinks but not the best food in the city. Just not that tasty honestly.

Dinner
* Tacos (ok)
* Enchilada (ok)
author: Kristofer E.

description:
Taking into consideration its beautiful location, the quickness of service during lunch (it's not full-service during lunch, more pay and sit down), and the quality of the food, I would definitely give this place 4 stars.
I ordered the fish burrito with citrus slaw & guac. 
The burrito was huge! I made two meals out of it.
They come with complimentary delicious tortilla chips and a range of salsas (pico, mango salsa, tomatillo, etc.).
author: Ashley S.

description: The food was usually good sometime ago, not these days. Our group ordered some dishes including super tacos. On the menu, it includes guacamole and sour cream on the top of regular taco. I found there was no onions and cilantro at my super taco. When I asked some cilantro and onions at a cashier booth, the lady said there should be no onions and cilantro for super taco. They promised me to change their menu. Their chicken meat was sometimes over burnt and dry. Please make it consistent.
author: Josh K.

description: Food is good. Service is garbage. See host for a seat, no host. You want a napkin, get it yourself. You want silverware, get it yourself. Oh you need a high chair, you figure it out. The food isn't great but it's good. Yelp said it was kid friendly and I don't agree.
author: Andrea K.

description: Spicy mango drink reminded me of the mango pops you get at the flea market and food was everything you could ask for. In one word all I can say is "authentic"!
author: Akash K.

description:
Awesome, high-class Mexican restaurant and bar. The plating was beautiful, but most importantly the food was very authentic. We ordered tamales but what really impressed me were the chips and salsa. The chips are light and crispy and come with a set of three very colorful and distinctly flavored dipping sauces. It was almost too pretty to eat. Also, the happy hour selection is reasonably priced. We ordered margaritas for $7 each, and ended up ordering  a second and third round soon after that. 

Great food, best happy hour, lively ambiance. Planning on going back soon!
author: Arielle I.

description:
Great spot for Mexican food if you're looking for something different to try aside from taqueria staples such as tacos, burritos, and quesadillas (they do offer these options; after all they are a taqueria in the day!). They have a variety of combination plates that come with rice and beans, soups, empanadas, tortas, pollo asado, and enchiladas. They also have a good selection of margaritas (no pitchers available; waitress said they are working on that), beer, and wine.

I came here in a group of four and I happened to get there first. They don't seat parties until everyone is present. When everyone arrived we all got seated by the back end cozy corner of the restaurant which was perfect for us as we got to enjoy fun banter and talks. The restaurant itself though is pretty loud and small for the amount of people they try to fit inside and outside. I felt myself having to squeeze between tables to get through and move sideways. Interior of the restaurant is cute and decorated nicely! Only bathrooms available to customers are the two by the front

Some of us got the house margaritas and the Violeta margarita which I really liked. For an entree I got the combination plate with two items; chicken flauta and carne asada taco with beans  & rice. Other items my girlfriends got were the camarones tropisueno (shrimp) and scallops with chorizo. We all really liked their starter nachos that every table gets with the selection of three sauces! 

Turnover rate at the restaurant is high as it's popular among family, friends, and the post-work crowd. Eat and take your conversations elsewhere!
author: Kathleen S.

description: The service was absolutely wonderful. But I just didn't like the food and the michelada wasn't that good.
author: Carina R.

description: I love the interior of this restaurant. It is beautifully decorated. Though due to the location it can get uncomfortably busy at times.
author: T A.

description:
Good salsa, bad everything else. 
We sat at the table for an hour and still didn't get our food. We tried to flag down multiple waiters and no one tried to help them. 
We even had to flag down a waiter to order. 

The people at the table next to us arrived, ordered, ate, and left before we received our food.
author: Lynn M.

description: Fantastic food! My first bite was just the beans and rice and that was fantastic. I had the enchiladas and they were... Fantastic. Just very good food all around! Even the lemonade my wife got was awesome! Definitely worth a second trip!
author: Aaron P.

description:
We came here on a very busy saturday afternoon after visiting MOMA which is right around the block. Found this place through yelp trusting all the good reviews. 
Luckily we got sat right away even though the restaurant was fully packed. Once we sat down, we got served with free chips with three different types of salsa. The complementary chips were really good. We kept eating nonstop. 

I ordered their house margarita, the Mushroom empanadas as appetizer, the Tampiqueño and the chicken enchilada for dinner. 

Overall we had an amazing experience. Could have given a 5 stars if the service was better.
author: Chul L.

description: Visited this area fav yesterday after a fun time at Moscone West and the SF Car Show  2017.  I have eaten here at least four times and have enjoyed my meal.  My Husband and I both ordered a burritos-we were happy with our walk up order made to order dish.  He had a Negro Modello  and I a sangria-red.  He was very put off by the $18 lunchtime bar tab.  The dishes were tasty and a deal at $8 or so each.  Will visit again as it is located well to holiday union square shopping and a good deal with good eats.
author: Nancy M.

description: Very authentic Mexican food. My family all love it. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to my friends who want to try Mexican in town.
author: Laura J.

description:
!!!PLEASE READ!!!

Never thought I would write a bad review of this place. We've been coming here for 4 years. We talk up your restaurant to everyone that comes to visit us from out of town. 

Tonight has really showed how much has changed. I only recognized 1 server that hasn't left. I walked in (6:55pm)and asked for a table for 9... They told me that they can only do 8, but I explained that #9 was a 1year old kid. They laughed and said ok no problem. I was told it would be an hour to 1-1/2 hr wait. We were fine with that because we were having drinks at PRESS CLUB. After an hour we got a call that the table was ready. We got in and were taken to the back table that can only seat 6 adults comfortably.  When we said this wasn't going to work, the host said " I explained from the beginning this is all we have"... BULLSHIT, He never said that at all when I walked in the first time. We asked if we could sit outside since they had heaters and we were denied that as well because it was close... funny, they had 3 other parties outside. 3 members of our party we're ok with sitting at another table... The same host rudely declined by saying no and shurgging his shoulders at them.  He did say they can stay and wait another 30-40mins to eat. Really!?! 6 of us  eat now and the other 3 have to wait?!!!? We decided to go elsewhere and as I was leaving I watched the host throw his hands around telling a server he told us and gave  the " I don't care hands"... 

For 4 years this has been our go to place for friends that visit because the food is great. 

This one experience has changed that. 

There were 2 host... 1st guy was short and Latino. The 2nd guy was taller, dark skin (not sure of ethnicity) and very skinny. The 2nd guy is the asshole I'm talking about. 

A change needs to happen and it should start with him. 

This was on 3/31/2018 at 8pm
author: Daniel C.

description:
A trendy spot to grab dinner. I didn't even know this row of restaurants existed in downtown until recently. I was able to easily make a reservation online a few days in advance for a Friday night at 7 p.m. I definitely recommend making reservations. This place was super packed and there were also people waiting outside for tables.

Get the house margarita! It was the perfect drink to end my Friday night. 

I had the chile verde and it was pretty good. Nothing out of the ordinary though. Don't expect authentic Mexican food, it's definitely not that. The meat was tender and the sauce was flavorful. I just wish it had more of a kick to it. 

My mom had the Huaraches "tres Cochinitas" which includes three different kinds of pork, chile verde, carnitas, and al pastor with pineapple. I like the al pastor with the pineapple. The pineapple added a touch of sweetness to the meat. 

They also give you free chips and 3 kinds of salsa. One of them was really really spicy so I couldn't really eat that one, but the other 2 salsas were great!
author: Mai Y.

description:
Came here after an event to grab a couple of small bites to eat. Noticed they didn't have nachos on the menu and we kindly asked the waiter if they had nachos. He replied "only on the brunch menu". We followed up by asking if they could make nachos as an appetizer regardless (they obviously have the ingredients to do so), but was followed back with "no exceptions". Great way to set the stage for wonderful customer service. 

We ordered a couple of small plates to share and only received one 30 minutes later and a refill of chips 20 minutes later. We asked to get the check since we were tired of waiting and asked if we only get charged for the ONE item we received. The waiter said sure, as if the other orders weren't even entered into the system. 

This place has been great in the past, but the customer service is lacking (and not just based on this one experience). Not even a simple "how was your meal" or "anything else I can get you". Save your time waiting for a table and go to Taco Bell.
author: Jordan C.

description:
**Tropisue'nope'**
Fair enough the location, decor, the variety of tequilas and some of the dishes are good.
However, for what they charge, there are plenty of better options in the city. Try "Rosa Mexicana", for instance... pricey but sheer quality or "Fogo Di Chao" which is only a few blocks away, though not Mexican.
I enjoy some music and a lively atmosphere but this place is incredibly loud. It's busy but the service is far too slow and inefficient, in that, one has to keep calling and reminding the staff to bring things. If you don't order drinks, then service is almost non-existent and they don't seem to want you there as that's obviously where they make the dineros. The prices are steep considering the portions are pretty small. Took a dish to go and even then they forgot to pack the tortillas and, upon contacting them, I was told that they don't travel well. Well, it'd be nice to have at least been asked - the nerve.
Overall, good food but awful service!
author: Foofa B.

description: Came here with friends. This place has the best vibes for a Friday night out in town, to get drinks and good food with friends. I had a dish that combined chicken and rice. It was wonderful. I would definitely recommend this place. Also, has great waiters!
author: Joy A.

description: Amazing service! Amazing Prices! Food is really good. I am full Mexican and love their food's sazón! 10/10
author: Viridiana P.

description: Every time we come to SF we hit this place up! Not only is the food second to none the drinks are awesome as well thanks to the bartender G holding it down. G is always courteous and goes out of his way to make everyone's experience memorable. Thanks dude!
author: BJ M.

description: Absolutely delicious. Our waitress was very nice. Both of us got the enchiladas (the entree one, not the combo one) and it was very good. The chips/salsa/guacamole you get is also good. Very nice, inclusive place if you want to go for a delicious dinner!
author: Haley C.

description:
The food was okay. Meat was tender and a plate comes with some tortillas. Guacamole was a tiny little bit, and the portion is not that big. It was ok but was not worth the price.

Outdoor seating was nice.
author: Xuaner Z.

description:
First of I don't understand why this restaurant has good reviews. The food is mediocre at best. You can't mess up chips and salsa and that was about the only thing worth having. 

We got the restaurant with family from out of state and we were told they don't seat groups greater then 5. There were 10 of us, so in order to seat inside they would seat us separately OR we could sit outside. This is San Francisco and it was 46 degrees outside. Since they couldn't seat us inside we ended up sitting outside. The eye rolling began. 

So we sat down. Got chips and salsa, which were decent. NOW let the 45 minute wait for dinner to start. 

When our food arrived I was as impressed by the food as I was the service. The enchilada was hard, cold and dipped in canned sauce (I am Mexican and I know canned sauce when I taste it) the chicken soup looked like the crap my grandma feeds the pigs for lunch and nothing else was worth reviewing. It was all GROSS.
author: Angelica J.

description:
I like this Mexican Restaurant. Its a Taqueria style but a really nice one. Surprise for the location the prices are reasonable. 
I love the House chips and they offer a free bar with many options of salsas.
This place is busy but the line go fast. Nice customer service.
I like the burritos, tacos and anchiladas. Always I have a great time here.
author: Jesus R.

description: Great service, fantastic drinks! Loved the hibiscus martini I had. And the food was excellent!  A must go! Good outdoor space if the weather allows.
author: Emily W.

description:
What a darling spot for Mexican food, outdoor seating, bar and an open counter for salsa dips!

Their fresh chips are delightful with the salsa selections that you can pair it with. 

I took favor in their generous portion of Albondigas.  A homely soup wth plentiful chunks of meatballs in it.  Share it because there are other delectable entrees on the menu to choose from as well.

Chile Relleno was mightily feasible.  Tacos were of the norm.

Nice layout and spot here.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Best chips ever, unlimited. Crispy thin and love the salsa. Nice ambiance, service can be slow due to busy hours but still a good place to visit
author: Taryn M.

description: Mediocre to good.  Chips and salsas were very good.  Mezcal margarita was really nice, michelada was not.   Huaraches - the masa cakes and pork were really delicious but the black beans were a disappointment.  I would not wait in line for a chance to dine here but it was fine in a pinch.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
As a So Cal native, I'm very discriminating when it comes to Mexican food. That being said, this place has some GOOD stuff. Great selection of salsas, sauces, drinks, and food. 

This was the best veggie burrito I've ever had in my life. There's a lot of points of interest in the surrounding area as well... great location! Can't wait to go back on my next visit. I wish they had an Orange County location!
author: B D.

description:
My favorite place to have dinner. I love everything I've tried here and I've been here quite a few times. Traditional and flavorful, this place never disappoints. 
You know the main entree is gonna be good if the rice and beans are good. And yes they are both always amazing!
author: Christine T.

description:
O M G

This place is outstanding on every level. We were visiting from NYC and tried this place because the reviews were pretty good (and who can pass up Mexican food while in California?)

Overall, the Service was A++
Food quality, presentation, taste and portions were all very impressive. 
Amazing margaritas. 
Average prices; but not expensive unless you're slamming margaritas like my husband was. 
Very clean and well maintained with authentic, cozy decor. 

Our bartender was Wayne, from Ireland. Huge guy, you can't miss him. He was every ounce of awesome. So cool and friendly, kept everyones drinks, basket of chips and 3 types of (absolutely incredible) salsas, replenished at all times. Recommended dishes that were out of this world and cooked to perfection. 

We ended up talking to him and another couple all night. Even though the place was packed, he was on it and manned the bar like a pro. 

Great experience, fabulous dinner and company. Will definitely be back!
author: Elle F.

description:
First time going there, me and some buddies needed a spot close to the theater before seeing Star Wars and it was perfect!

The chips and salsa: 5
The beer was cold: 5
The shots were huge: 5
The 2 choice enchilada plate was tasty: 5
The prices were very reasonable: 5
Happy Hour is only served in the bar: Fail

But I'd still go back! Check it out
author: Kevin B.

description: Met up with my bestie woman for happy hour and it was a blast! A packed house, but was able to snag a seat at the community bar table. First, the complimentary chips and the delish trio of salsas. $7 for a monster plate of nachos. And the ceviche sampler (thank you, Ann S for the tip) made plenty a meal for the both of us. Service in the store was excellent!
author: David N.

description:
I recall when Tropisueno's doors opened in this windy lane. Initially, I dismissed it as another trendy upscale Mexican restaurant with upscale prices. Eventually I noticed that Tropisueno consistently draws a crowd. So I gave in to curiosity and ended up having dinner here. The ambience is surprisingly impressive. The venue is well-kept and very clean, yet somewhat rustic with some raw wood accents. There are also a few alcoved booths with curtains for a bit of privacy. It is a rather large space with an expansive bar and an exposed kitchen. It didn't feel spacious at the time, because it was a full house. They offer outdoor seating, but Yerba Buena Lane catches a lot of cross-wind, so I imagine those seats are only occupied on warm days. 

We were presented with menus and complimentary chips and salsas. The chips were served warm, not too oily, thin and crisp. They were accompanied with a trio of salsas, which included what I believe was a spicy chili salsa, salsa verde, and a habanero mayo-looking one. Surprisingly, the orange-colored habanero-mayo salsa was our favorite due to its creaminess. Usually, salsa verde is my favorite. There is also a salsa bar, but I completely overlooked it, because everything was juicy and flavorful.
We completely polished these off while waiting for our entrees. Entrees come with Mexican rice, tortillas, and beans. We chose black & refried beans.

$16 Pollo Asado - grilled chicken on bone, zucchini, mushrooms, squash, peppers:
The plate includes an entire chicken leg. A very thin crust formed on the outside, covering some very juicy thigh meat. It sat on top of the zucchini, squash, and peppers, which were delicious, but just a touch soggy. Even the black beans and rice were tasty filler items.

$17 Tampiqueno - Niman ranch beef, thin-cut grilled carne asada, w/ beef barbacoa enchilada, guacamole:
The carne asada was juicy and full of flavor from the meat juices and intense seasoning. It was topped with uncut grilled scallions. The enchilada was covered in tangy salsa and queso fresco. The Mexican rice and refried pinto beans were topped with a scoop of guacamole, and absorbed some of the beef juices as well. Everything was excellent. I just wish it had a little bit more guac.

Since dining here and enjoying the food, I feel enticed to possibly return for lunch or happy hour. The menu is a little different and prices are more affordable. For lunch, the restaurant operates as a taqueria-style cafeteria. Margaritas, ceviche, and tostadas for happy hour sounds pretty good, too.
author: Joy W.

description:
Excellent ambiance and terrific food. 
Had their 3 item combination of tamales, tacos and flautas with chicken, pork.  Excellent flavors and presentation. Liked it that they were generally on the drier side and not too soggy.
The mezcal margarita was very very good. Muy bueno!
author: K S.

description: Tight inside. The food was somewhat "upscale Mexican" most of it was very good. Service was really subpar. They also have outdoor seating. Good food if you don't mind bad service and to be rushed.
author: Piper W.

description:
HH here is so much fun.

Lol, we had a theme going:
-party of 3
-chips came with 3 kinds of salsa
-got the 3-item combo plate (2 enchiladas, 1 taco)
-got the 3 kinds of ceviche

The others said the margaritas tasted like water but mines was pretty strong and I definitely felt it after.
author: Linda W.

description: I came for my sister's birthday, and the food + drinks were absolutely delicious. There is quite a wait time, even for a Monday evening, but it's worth it. They even helped me orchestrate a surprise for the birthday girl! Highly recommend the margaritas and the shrimp dishes. Yum!!!!!
author: Devika P.

description:
This is probably the best Mexican restaurant in the Financial District. By day, it is a taqueria, by night, it is a restaurant. So that's why this is a clever concept. Workers from all over downtown SF, tourists, and local visitors eat here to get their fix of Mexican cuisine. At first, I glanced at their pink take-out menu what they had to offer. Then decided, this is a good place to start. Then saw 2 guys waiting, but read the sign. 1. Order whatever food you want to a server on the counter. 2. Order your drinks as you pay your order. 3. Seat for yourselves. Little, did  I Know there was a salsa bar in the dining area. And you can order cocktails, beers ahead of time while you order and pay for your food. The ordering is confusing at first, but their service is fast like less than 5 minutes or more depending on what food items you order. 
The food is simple Mexican food but very authentic and it is all homemade. The reason like their refried beans is cooked with lard. I recognized their chorizo has a lot of cumin but it is salty. It was delicious. I just had 1 carne asada street taco and 1 chorizo street taco served with cilantro, and onions. Both are $3 each. Then the server asked if you wanted chips. I just forgot where the salsas are. So I just ate Tapatio sauce with it. I am missing my salsa for my chips, and tacos. Then I ordered Hibiscus tea or what they call Jamaica agua fresca in Mexico. It was more on the sweet side. Next time, I will add some lime juice to neutralize the sweetness of the drink. This place gets warm, but the drink is great. The server suggested light ice in my agua fresca - yummy - great recommendation. Food for lunch is cheap like $3 to $17, just depends on what you order.
Whoever gave very low ratings, didn't know what the deal is here or what Mexican cuisine is all about. In my book, the food here is great, authentic and all homemade. Little did I know, the salsa bar is bonkers because they have a lot of choices to suit your spiciness, and added flavor profiles to savor your dish. At lunchtime, it is affordable, fast and really excellent. At night, it is more authentic, showstopper, game changer, and the quality are impeccable. Free tortilla chips are made to order but it was too salty, but they were thin. Yummy! Food is 5/5.
The ambience is great too, almost like a countryside home with some Mexican trinkets here and there. It has comfortable and welcoming vibe here. 5/5.
Service and attentiveness of all the staff especially to Manuel, the bartender are really great. That is what makes the place so memorable.
5/5.
Tropisueno is a great Mexican restaurant located at the bustling and busy streets of the Financial District and tucked within the neighboring museums in downtown SF. If you want quality Mexican food that is authentic, homemade  and all of the food items are made from scratch. All of the items are fairly priced - come here and get your fix of Mexican cuisine with a casual and welcoming vibe, high-quality food and customer service.
author: Jade M.

description: So my wife invited out to dinner to try this place for the first time a week ago , really enjoyed it mainly because our waitress Liz was totally awesome great example of customer service, she really made what would have been not so enjoyable experience OK. So let's get the not so enjoyable out of the way. Long story short (mainly cause i should have wrote this a week ago and could go into details more) Me and my wife's food came out semi hot in some places and just cold in others which let me know it was microwaved. My wife had opted not to have her food re-fired because she was taking it home.When we me mentioned our issue to Liz she was quick to  do her best to rectify the situation. OK food comes back out not only was it hot it was a totally new plate of food Cool !!!  Drinks were good, service was great (Good Job Liz!!) So for now 3 stars I'll come back it do a more thorough job (with pictures)  in a few weeks or so.
author: Demetrius J.

description: Really great spot for Mexican food. Love their orange colored salsa....feel like drinking it. Good service especially at the bar. Sometimes tough to find a seat but wort.mu a visit.
author: D H.

description:
Fun, lively atmosphere with cheap prices. I was expecting it to be a little upscale for lunch based on photos but it was very casual. You order at the front, pick your own table, and the servers will bring your food along with a bowl of warm chips to you. There's a large variety of salsas that you can serve yourself.

I got the super quesadilla with carne asada ($9). It was packed with delicious cheese and large enough serving size I could only eat half of it. It was amazing! My boyfriend got the super burrito with carnitas ($10). The meat was so savory and tasted great with chunks of pineapple.

Overall I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Linda X.

description: My wife likes this place!! So I like it too!! But I doooo come here for the salsa! The margaritas are a great too!
author: Dom P.

description: I've missed you Tropisueno! Use to be my after work HH spot with coworkers. Had a random stop by there felt like it always does warming, filling and a little typsy.
author: Denise L.

description: There's a sign outside of Tropisueño that says run don't walk tacos - I agree with this advice. It was great to find such a nice eatery near our hotel. We got take out so I can't speak to service except for the nice maître d'. The tamales and chicken tacos were great. Everything has a little spice to it which is a nice change from the milder east coast tacos we get back at home.
author: Arianna H.

description: The salsa bar makes it! Really great choices, and super authentic Mexican food. The chips are some of my favorite ever!
author: Seymour H.

description: Came here with my friend for lunch and you can order then pick your own seat. For dinner it's different you need to wait to be seated. We ordered chips and guacamole, fish tacos, and it was great! Enjoyed it all, wish I had tried a margarita there. Overall a good experience, chips were hot but pretty oily. For lunch you order and then bring the food to your table after giving you a number.
author: Amy Y.

description: Tropisueno! You Are the Centro Latin kitchen of San Francisco. I love you. Service Great. Food... Delish to the maxxx. Margies... Let's just say Ide get down on one right now of I could.
author: Madeline K.

description: Good food and swift service by a friendly staff. Music was a little loud but still worth the wait for a table seat. Happy we found location within walking distance of current hotel in downtown San Francisco. By far the best chips and salsa mixes had in a long time. If you're in the area and like authentic Mexican food, you need to stop and enjoy the experience.
author: James L.

description: Great food, amazing ambience.... just gave a 4 star because the service was not amazing, but I guess that's SFO! :)
author: Cony T.

description:
After hearing so many good things about this restaurant, I made a point of stopping here for lunch. What a disappointment. The food was okay, but the service is very unfriendly. 

Also, I wanted a margarita, but to order one would have required squeezing up to a crowded bar. So I skipped it.
author: Monnica L.

description: went here on a monday & it was pretty busy but it was SO worth it. sebastian was our waiter & he was wonderful!
author: Kala K.

description: Awesome mole!  Very flavorful, not too sweet and just right on spices.  Really hit the spot.  Generous portion of mole on thigh leg with rice and black beans. Cena de oso cocktail had jalapeño and a kick- went very well with the mole. Service was fast. Only complaint would be only 2 bathrooms for the whole restaurant (a wait to use the restrooms) and noise level was a little loud for conversations.  Fun place for girls night out.  Best to get reservations, which we did and were seated right away.
author: Judy H.

description: O.M.G. I'm so happy this place isn't in Arizona. It would steal all of my money. The steak taco was amazing, steak so tender and flavorful. The green salsa is absolutely delicious. Ok, I take it back, I'm not happy that this place isn't in Arizona.
author: jen f.

description: Extraordinary customer service! Scrumptious salsa with fresh warm chips, plenty of smiling faces and a gorgeous patio!!! What more can you ask of a southern style restaurant?! I recommend a top shelf margarita and the nopales enchiladas
author: Desiree B.

description: Came here for happy hour on a Friday afternoon and sat indoors in the dining area. Less than an hour later we were told that they would be setting up for dinner where we were seated ... ok, so we asked what that meant and we were told that we were to leave. Period. Not move, not relocate, leave. On top of that their chips were flavorless and their nachos were bland. Never and I mean NEVER coming back here.
author: Lauren C.

description: I use to love this place. But let me tell y'all my manager ordered the team food from here... I got a super burrito "EXTRA SOUR CREAM" when I tell you there was NO sour cream on my burrito. That sh*t was dry as fu*k! Tropisueno did us wrong! I'm pissed waste of lunch! look at this dang burrito! smh
author: Jeanee N.

description:
What an amazing place! I came across this business when I worked as an Insurance Broker. The business operates wonderfully and the setting is ideal! Yesterday, I had the pleasure of arriving during happy hour, I ordered a Fish Taco ($4.00), Taco de Carnitas (3.50) and two steak flautas (7.00). The fish taco was my favorite, it had a nice crunchy outside but soft inside with a wonderful cabbage slaw on top. 

You are served chips and salsa once you sit down! Their salsa's are to die for. 

Their cocktails are amazing as well, Margaritas are my go to!
author: Iliana S.

description: Great flavors for quick easy and inexpensive... very friendly  staff.. do not let  the long line trick  you..it moves  very fast...
author: Angela L.

description: Loud, Crowded and mediocre food. Guacamole is pre- made . Service was slow and could not accommodate alterations to menu.
author: Mary Ann S.

description:
Pros:
- Neat place in the heart of the Financial District. When you walk in the lighting and the background make you feel like you are in a cantina in a small Mexican town. 
- We made a reservation through Yelp but one of the members of my party were late. The restaurant graciously let us wait for 30 mins before we ordered. Very hospitable! 
- A fan of their chips -- very light, and salsa -- 3 different types with a variety of flavors to meet anyone's palette. 

Cons:
- Was disappointed by their entree selection. They had all the options that you would see at a Mexican restaurant but nothing particularly unique.
- Additionally Mexican cuisine is usually pretty Vegetarian friendly. Here they had only 2 vegetarian entrees. I ordered the veggie enchiladas, which was topped off by this sauce that had too much cilantro and garlic -- very overpowering.
author: Abhi M.

description:
Walking distance from the Marriott Marquis Hotel, this place is a gem!
I loved their flavorful salsa and flavors in their dishes.
author: Loni L.

description:
T . todos dias mzafzas
R . royale with queso
O . or "torta" en ingles
P . por mi vientreh
I . i need almuerzo
S . salsa y chips doe
U . u know i also got
E . edible fish burrito
Ñ . ñiños with attitude
O . oh i'll be back yeah
author: Dan B.

description: This review is for their Happy Hour. The margaritas are $7.00 each. It's a tall glass but all ice. We ordered the chicken tacos as well as vegetable tacos and both were ok. One star because the chips and salsa were fine. Seriously folks -- skip Tropisueño's HH.
author: Tina C.

description: Great ambience, and the food is some of the best Mexican I have ever had! Highly recommend making a reservation through yelp so beat the lines
author: Shantal D.

description:
Take out review.

Chili verde - 2/5
Plantains - 3/5
Flautas - 3/5
Chips - 5/5

Overall, Tropisueno chips are always "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: Tropisueno should really provide a larger table for a group of 3 or more.
author: Noni P.

description: Elena and I spent an afternoon in the San Francisco Museum Of Modern Art. We came out at four in the afternoon. We used an app to find restaurants.Nothing to our liking turned up. We decided to explore and found this venue quite by accident on foot. What a pleasant surprise. We arrived during happy hour. We had great Margaritas and food dishes with a final bill of $30.00 what a pleasant surprise. The restaurant is warm and friendly. The staff is attentive and courteous. It's always packed so a lot of people love it.
author: Jack W.

description:
I've come here 3 times and each time have had great food and loved the ambience. The servers are great, really friendly and fun to talk to and the food is always tasty. The only drawback I have with this restaurant is the cost- but I've come t expect it in SF. 

I would definitely come here for a more special occasion, not for a casual dinner out, but nonetheless I have only good memories from this restaurant!
author: Pooja K.

description: Food was very authentic and delicious!  Chips were the best I've ever had, so light! Queso was unique and a must!  Margarita's were perfect!  Service was average , definitely not as great as the food! Atmosphere was well done! Definitely make reservations or put your name on the list ahead - wait gets very long!
author: Nanette M.

description: First time ever in San Francisco and I went with my two friends, our last day there we wanted Mexican so looked for places around and found this place . The food was amzingggg! Soo good!! The only reason I put 4 stars instead of 5 is because the price was a little too high for what we got, $9 for ceviche appetizer and it's only a tiny little amount given. But besides that everything was great! The lady at the register with the lip ring was a little scary and rude but I understand maybe it was a long day
author: Vanessa G.

description:
My favorite Mexican in SF! The food, service and ambiance is 5 stars, but the main drawback of this place is that its soooo looud. Not the restaurants fault though! 
Usually have Tres Huaraches or Chile Verde, their mole is really good too. Margaritas are yummy and well made and the complimentary chips and salsa is perfection!
author: Jo L.

description: Amazing food and excellent service.  I love the fact that you can check in with yelp and get a table on a busy night with very little waiting on site.
author: Josh H.

description: The food is excellent! I recommend the flautas. The place has a good athmosphere. But the house margarita is not the best.
author: Laura N.

description:
Good ambiance and friendly stuff, pretty good margarita special. Me and my friend ordered queso dip to share, after waiting for about 10-15 mins server came over to notify that he queso is on the way and it's gonna be 2-3 more mins.

5 mins passed and server comes back letting us know that they actually ran out. Lol why lie though?

I ordered scallops and was brought shrimp instead, and of course by the time they made what I actually ordered (scallops) my friend was already done.

It was tasty I'm not gonna lie.
author: Jaroslav S.

description: Best Mexican food in the world! Amazing service and friendly atmosphere. Also orange spicy sauce is beyond this earth, definitely you need to try it
author: Austėja A.

description: Went for a late Thursday night dinner, around 8:30pm. Place was pretty busy, though they found us a table for 2. Service was sorta disappointing, I had the mole and it was just alright, a bit sweeter than any I'd had before. Took a long time with the bill which was sorta disappointing as my travel companion was exhausted and falling asleep at the table. Overall, passable food/experience, but you could do much better for the union square area
author: David G.

description: Love them cant wait to go. . im taking my daughter so we can enjoy the wonderful taste
author: Zorana Lovelyallday B.

description:
This place is seriously worth every penny everytime. 
The food is clean. 
The food is consisitant. 
The crowd is lovely especially on a weekday lunch date or a dark dinner night. 
The restaurant is kind of dark at night but I think it's perfect. 
Salsa bar is on point. Multiple items to choose from to top off those tacos. 
Plus full bar
author: Europe N.

description:
Good for groups, I've come a few times for lunch. The mexican is one of the best in the area, but the standout here are all the salsas!

Downside is how consistently crowded it gets weekdays during lunch. Plan on taking a long lunch if you come on a week day.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Grabbed a late lunch here on a Friday and walked away highly satisfied. This place is very neat, the staff is very kind, and the ambiance is very welcoming and warm. 

We ordered the chile rellenos, a fish burrito, and a table guacamole. I snacked on the guacamole while waiting for our food and it was delicious! It's a perfect balance of spice, refresh, texture, and love. The chips were a perfect level of salted (love me some salt) so I'd recommend you grab some of those if you're only there for happy hour. 

When our food came I was too full to eat my burrito BUT I think it is a HUGE PLUS that when I warmed it up two days later, it was amazing! The coleslaw, salsa, and fish were all to a level of perfection, even after marinating in my fridge. I was especially surprised that the coleslaw was so good warm (it's hard to just re-warm parts of a burrito so I did the whole thing)

PROS: food, staff, ambiance, outdoor seating
CONS: low ceilings make it a little dark, the flow is a little confusing
author: Olivia F.

description: Complimentary chips were great! Amazing passion fruit marg (marg of the day) but they didn't let us blend it. Average Mexican food. Good service. Dirty bathroom. Nice ambiance.
author: Jessica B.

description: I went based on yelp reviews. Margaritas not stellar. Service spotty but the place was packed. Very loud. Food was lackluster. Had the beef cheek taco appetizer, which was bland. Also had the three taco plate with carne asada (decent), carnitas, and barbacoa. House chips were average.
author: Ryan T.

description: Great place!  The food was authentic and the staff was very fast and friendly.  Great for a quick lunch or relaxing sit down.
author: Jeffry D.

description: One of the best Mexican food I ever had in San Francisco.Food is definitely traditional and authentic here.They have a wide variety of sauce dips.Must try!
author: Suma B.

description: Great food! Really good service! Line was a little big but we only waiting like 10 minutes to get through it! Salsas are the best!
author: Marysol A.

description:
Food was great. Our server was great. The hostess was horrifying. I needed a drink when I sat down because she stressed me out so much. 

*the restaurant contacted me after I left this review to ask what happened. I appreciate the follow up and I think now I would give this place another go. The food really is excellent.
author: Bliss B.

description: Really sub par Mexican food and awful service. Ordered ceviche, guacamole and a torta. The ceviche dish was so sparse I thought it was a garnish. The guacamole was on par with the stuff you get in a bag from the grocery store.  The torta was the best thing we ate; it was aggressively mediocre.
author: Jason V.

description:
I was meeting an out-of-town friend for a low budget early dinner. He lives in Chicago and loves Mexican food (his wife does not). It was between going here and going to Don Pistos (I have never been to either).  This was closer to my office and near his meeting so we got there at about 4:50pm on a Wed. night.

The hostess took my cell number and said there were a lot of reservations and she wasn't sure if we would get seated at 5:30 when they open the dining room for dinner (but no problem at all as it turns out).

We squatted at the bar and had a couple margaritas (good but too much ice, the salt they used is a bit smoky and good). We were served some of their thin, delicious and WARM chips and a trio of salsas. The service was a little spotty at the bar - we had to ask a few times to get some water -and the bar quickly filled up.

I got a text at 5:30 on the nose and we were seated.  The waitress (Crystal) "explained " the specials, not sure what kind of country bumpkins usually eat here, but I do not need an explanation of "Chile con Queso", but she was off and describing it as melted cheese, etc, etc. 

My friend had the  1/2 chicken and loved it enough to say if he ever came back he would get it again. I got a combo plate of a chili Colorado enchilada and a chicken tinga flauta. Cyrstal suggested the green sauce for my enchilada (I had ordered it with Mole) I THOUGHT we agreed to go with her suggestions but a small taste of the mole on the side (that is not how it turned out  - I got the Mole and no taste of the green sauce).

What was weird was that a lot of  the food around us was coming out very quickly and being served by workers with disposable bright purple gloves on - it was just weird, and not so appealing (our food was not served by purple gloved hands).

Frankly the happy hour food coming out at the bar looked better, so that is what I will do next time.

My food was good but not hot.

I didn't see the bill. (Thanks Keith!)
author: Amy W.

description:
PROTIP:  For lunch, get here before 11:40 or after 12:30 to avoid the line.

Went here for lunch with a coworker. We both had the Fajitas.  All I can say is that they know what they're doing here!
author: Flint W.

description:
We picked out Tropisueño as a lunch stop before our visit to SFMOMA: Tropisueño had good Yelp reviews and seemed like a standout in the immediate area.

I ordered a chile verde mole plate with black beans and corn tortillas.  The resulting plato ($12.95 + tax, I think) was the perfect analogue of a dish that I order quite often at Picante Berkeley.  My view is that Picante's version is tastier, though not by a mile.  Meanwhile you can't find any first-rate art museums in West Berkeley.

Conclusion:  I don't regret our choice but wasn't especially bowled over.  Said differently, Tropisueño is alright!  I hope to make periodic visits to SF's MOMA and can see myself returning to Tropisueño on occasion.
author: Kenneth R.

description:
Not bad, but I wouldn't go here again.

They were jam packed (which is fine, considering we went on Saturday night), so we couldn't get a table, but there was a long table with six chairs on either side we were able to sit on.  Wife ordered a quesadilla, I got a margarita and two tacos.  That's where the problems began...

First. my margarita was the most watered down drink I ever had.  Cup was completely filled with ice, and I was able to finish my drink in about three seconds.  I was completely ripped off for the $6.50 I spent on that drink.  Most restaurants try to jip you on drinks, but this was the worst case I've ever seen.  Was basically a shot of margarita in a cup of ice.

Then, they almost gave my wife's quesadilla to the wrong person.  There's only a few things on the menu (taco, burrito, quesadilla), and with 12 people bunched together at a small table, people are bound to order the same things.  It would be helpful if the staff would actually make sure they're giving the food to the right person.  They almost gave my margarita to the wrong person too (who also ordered one), but my wife and I sat down and ordered a good 10 minutes before they did, so we knew it was my drink.  The staff is in such a hurry to get work done, they just give food and drinks to whoever claims them first.  Would be nice if they were more thorough to avoid mix ups.

Finally, I had to wait about 30 minutes for my two tacos.  We reminded the wait staff twice before they finally brought them out.  I ate while my wife, who had finished her meal 10 minutes prior, sat and watched me eat.  The wait staff kept telling us "your food is on it's way", but it was clear they just forgot to make the food.  I had a fish taco and street taco.  They were ok, but fish taco was very overcooked.  Way too crispy.

I'd give them two stars, but they comped me on my two tacos since they came so late.  Was nice of them to do that, but slow service, making sure the wait staff doesn't give my food to someone else, and not getting insanely ripped off on drinks isn't a way to spend an evening.  Won't be going back.
author: Samuel B.

description: Everytime I come here, I love the food and the drinks. The salsas provided with the chips are awesome. The guac is a little small, but very tasty. I usually get a choose two combo and I have never left hungry!
author: Susan M.

description: Crazy good food and cocktails. Micheladas (so amazing and full of unique flavors...coming back for more). Margaritas (bright and refreshing) and the Queso, (more now please). Sopa (wow, delish). Chill R, must have!!!
author: E ..

description:
Great Taco's! Amazing location on Market St.  The staff was very attentive as well.  Enjoy

Ex Restaurant Manager
Purdue Hospitality Graduate
author: Jon R.

description: About a month ago we were in SF on vacay and we had a taco-urge so we chose Tropisueno. It's a lot like a QDoba or a Chipotle, but with a full bar.  It was good but not really anything special. Fun atmosphere, great location, would go back but i'm sure there are hundreds of other mexican places to try around this area.
author: Brian S.

description: I was visiting SF for the day and needed a quick meal before heading to the airport. I read good reviews for this place so decided to try it out. It was pretty crowded, even for a Thursday night, but since I was alone I was seated within about 10 minutes. I got the sopa del pollo which comes with a plate of rice (I just added some of it to the soup which tasted good). The chips and three types of salsa are delicious and I honestly could have eaten just that and been satisfied, haha! I didn't have any of the drinks but those looked good so I'd like to try them next time. The prices are a bit high, although I assume normal for this area of SF. That being said, the soup was delicious and the server was attentive despite the place being very busy. I'll definitely come back here to try some drinks!
author: Pooja C.

description:
This restaurant is super cute and has a good vibe.

The queso with goat cheese is literally one of the best things I've eaten!! I never thought goat cheese and queso would go together but they do, and it's perfect. 

The margaritas were ok. Not the best but not the worst. They came in large glasses which was great but the strawberry margarita was pretty flavorless. 

Overall the entrees were mediocre. Nothing too memorable except for the 3 types carnitas which my mom loved!! But nothing topped the queso. Go to this restaurant ....get the queso....and bounce. Haha :)
author: Courtney S.

description: Straight up gringo style, Tex Mex Mexican food. If you're from California and you appreciate good Mexican food, you will absolutely hate this place. Nothing is authentic. Bagged chips and tortillas, canned beans and assembly line style food.  I would've given it one star but they were nice and gave us back our money on a couple of inedible items. I don't know what you call this but it is not Mexican food.
author: Cynthia H.

description: This place is dope, especially for dinner. Tons of vegetarian options with really fresh ingredients. Portions are the perfect size, filling but not crazy. Ambience is pretty casual but cool enough for a nice date. Veggie tacos, veggie enchiladas and cheese tamales are all bomb af. Bottom line: the best bang for your buck. Can't go wrong with Trop.
author: Shubh J.

description: Good selection of entrees and sauces. Service was very good. Relatively easy for us to get a 7 person table on a Saturday night. There were gluten free options. Interior and music were enjoyable. Good date spot. Mole poblano sauce was bomb . Guacamole was pretty small.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Awesome food! Very crowded, hostess might have been having a bad night. Food and fast service made up for it though. My husband said "best Mexican food I've ever eaten," so there's that. Extensive drink menu, I had the pineapple Mezcal drink and he had a margarita that was also very tasty. The waitress was busy, but could have been slightly more attentive. Overall would recommend and def. would eat again. Enjoy
author: Tiffany W.

description: I would have given our food 2* but the service was so good I'll go with 3*.  We got right in despite there being a 45+ minute wait for walk-ins {just happened to get lucky}.  Hubby ordered a combo platter and it was good but some of the food was warm-ish.  I ordered the carne asada medium rare and received it charred and very well done.  I didn't send it back because we were told upon being seated had exactly an hour and thirty minutes for our stay.  Overall it was okay - beautiful restaurant with an amazing patio we would have sat at had it not been raining.  Food prep/cooking/delivery could use some work.  The margaritas were excellent and definitely didn't skimp on the alcohol.  I would come back but would get something different next time.
author: Samantha T.

description: Great location, great food, great happy hour, and great ambiance. Definitely check this place out if you are craving a sitdown mexican restaurant in the city.
author: Mark A.

description: Been here several times, always excellent and a happening spot. Chicken Mole is superb. Margaritas also fantastic.
author: Hila B.

description: Awesome food/service.  Dwayne the bartender rocked and the other cocktail slinger was a wildman.  The food was great and accomodated one of my vegetarian friends.  The tamales were good and the tacos over the top.
author: Michael D.

description: Awesome customer service, as soon as we sat down outside we received chips from a server and he also mentioned what was good on the menu. Didn't take long for our food and everything was delicious! Will come back here when I come to the city!
author: Mariii L.

description:
This place was bomb.com! I came here with Emma H. because we both had the place bookmarked and was not disappointed (well, ok, maybe a little because they no longer have the "gringo" taco salad *:-(*). Anyway, I was running a little late and the awesome bartender, Rachel, saved a seat for me at the bar and defended it to the death when her coworker tried to give it to someone else. But seriously, she was the best server/bartender and constantly had a smile on her face. I wish I could smile all the time, but my resting bitch face prevents it :-p

Any who, I got the combo plate with a taco and enchilada, both carne asada, and  the taco was excellent! I loved that they put the green salsa on it because it had this delicious tangy flavor that I couldn't get enough of. By the time I got to the enchilada I was pretty full, so I can't really comment on it, but it looked good! Oh and the salsas that came with the chips were super good, my favorite being the verde. I also like the orange one, but it was a tad too spicy for me. Emma ordered the nopalita enchiladas and they looked awesome!

The service was amazing, aside from the male bartender who was a cocky douch, and the drinks were perfect! I wouldn't hesitate to come back when shopping or running errands downtown :-)
author: Steph L.

description:
Since my initial experience at Tropisueno, I have recommended and brought multiple friends to this restaurant and they have all loved it. 

The ambience is definitely something they've commented about. It's perfect for a group outing and date night. The drinks and food are amazing. The staff has been great as of late!!

The food is definitely noteworthy. In an effort to sway from my usual choices, I got the Plantanos Fritos, which are plantains with black beans and some sort of sauce. This tastes very similar to potatoes and is extremely yummy and something like I've never tasted before. The sampler (I don't remember exactly what it's called) plate was convenient for sharing and trying the enchilada, tamale, and chicken flauta. All are really good!

I will definitely be back, tropisueno never fails to amaze me!
author: Deepti N.

description:
I had a really great time here with my friends, and also one guy that I say is my friend but I'm really using him to get closer to Jessica. 

At first I was a little annoyed I couldn't sit and order my food, but the ladies at the register were really friendly and awesome. I got a wet burrito and some horchata and chips. My meal arrived quickly and there are a multitude of wonderful salsas and sauces to choose from at the 'salsa bar.' I thought the food was delicious. Also there's something about toasty warm chips and salsa that makes me smile. 

The service was great all around as everyone there appeared to be pretty jazzed to be working there. It made me feel jazzed to be eating there. And then I got jazzed about potentially being able to write the word "jazzed" in my review; here we are now living the dream. 

The seating was a bit tight because the restaurant was poppin' off, but I can't blame them for being popular. If I lived in the area I would definitely come back and try out everything they have over a long and slow process that inevitably leads to the restaurant closing before I can try everything, and then I get that hopeless realization that nothing you love in this life lasts and we're all doomed. 

I also hear this place is an awesome location to have a party.
author: Justin E.

description:
It's really confusing to me why Tropisueno still rates four stars after all these years. The food is really bland Mexican cuisine, the atmosphere is loud and annoying, the service is indifferent at best, and you usually have to wait quite a while to enjoy any of it - you're often looking at over an hour to dine and you almost always have a wait regardless of whether or not you booked a reservation. I'm not using hyperbole when I say you'd probably have a comparable overall experience at the now defunct but once nearby Chevy's.

If you need some really good Mexican food you are a short Uber ride away from the Mission so don't be lazy. If that's too much of a hassle for you, Delarosa and Amber are right next door and are far better places to eat.
author: Matt M.

description:
I'm so confused by this place. 3k reviews with 4 stars in SF made me think this would be a guaranteed hit. Yelp can certainly lead you astray once in a while but I didn't expect that anything with more than 1k reviews could be wrong. 

First off, if you do end up going try and make a reservation. We went on a Weds night and people were being told there was a 30 min wait; luckily we had a reservation so were seated immediately.

The chips and salsa were actually decent but what's the deal with the stingy guacamole? For $8 I was definitely expecting enough guac to fill a crowd of people but they literally used an ice cream scoop and we got a single scoop of guac to share for the $8. This wouldn't have been enough for me alone. By the way, avocados cost like $1.50 at Whole Foods. Jeez. At least it tasted alright.

The drinks to me were very weak (read: low in alcohol) but also super uninspired. Not sure how to explain that one but none of the drinks seemed "interesting". I even asked the waiter which he likes and you'd think I asked him to read a drivers manual given how uninterested he seemed in all of them. 

If you end up going, just realize that it's a pretty average tex mex bar. The steak I got was fine but sadly lukewarm. The rice was too dry even for me to eat (I LOVE rice!). Overall it was very average and deserves more like 3-3.5 stars. Sounds like a lot of other people enjoyed it but this Yelper will not be returning. Too many amazing restaurants in SF!
author: Neechi M.

description: What a JOKE. We came with a party of 10 and they said they couldn't accommodate our party. We asked if we could do 2 parties of 5, and they said they would seat us. Apparently we haven't SEEN THE LAYOUT OF THEIR RESTAURANT" which does not accommodate that size of a party.. is 10 really that big of a deal? Then they seated us with a table for 8 and a table for 2 in a different area. We left disappointed before we ordered. Honestly if a restaurant can't accommodate a group of 10 they aren't worth going to.. what a bunch of amateurs. went to de la Rosa and were seated immediately.
author: Haley G.

description:
ORANGE SALSA! Pink salsa? Queso salsa? Whatever it is, I could drink that stuff out of a cup. I love that they bring a tri-salsa plate with fresh chips - all three were really good (& spicy!) but as you probably have figured from the beginning of this review I lovvvveeeddd the orangey-pink salsa.

I got a 2 items dinner plate - one carnitas taco and one pollo asado enchilada. The taco was my fave, but both were awesome. It was plenty of food for me with the rice and beans.

Service was great - they kept refilling our chips/salsa and waters like their life depended on it. 

Came out to about $18 a person
author: Kelly G.

description: This place always had dependably good food. You can taste it is fresh good ingredients. We always enjoy it. There is usually a wait.
author: Tracy R.

description: I wasn't sure what to expect from a restaurant right under a hotel at Moscone Center but this was not the place. We where looking for some good mexican food and got not much flavor and the salsas were bland. The service was very good but then the atmosphere was noisy. If you want to come for drinks with this will work just don't count on the food
author: Lloyd D.

description: The mix and match deal is the best! A person can try different dishes (taco and enchiladas) around $12ish. Those chips and salsa are the best in town!
author: Jt G.

description:
The food and drinks are are great. Lovely margaritas and delicious Mexican food. I'm a big fan of the Mole, rich sauce and plentiful portions.

It's always difficult to get a table, so make a reservation in advance!
author: Kevin G.

description: Service was not good hostess rude.. they don't deserve one star!Its not like how it used to be with great customer service
author: Rene M.

description: 3.5 Pretty good. The chips were lightly crisped and in general, the food was good for a rainy day that we went in. The water had a hint of cucumber! Value is not as good as taquerias in the mission, but more affordable than upscale Mexican restaurants in Fi-di ("Rosa Mexicana").
author: Dion L.

description: Was very excited to try after hearing it was "the best Mexican food in the city" from my sister but utterly disappointed with the food, service, and experience.  Not a fan of the self service prior to 4 pm thing and had to wait about 30 minutes to order my drink after ordering my food.  The drink was not what I ordered but tried to choke down after paying $15 for it.  I ordered a combo platter with chicken enchiladas and a carnitas taco.  Both were cold and lacked flavor.  Salsa and sauces were also leaving a lot to be desired.  Add in the cracked out guy begging for money that came by our table and the barking dog that no one tried to silence its safe to say I will not be going back or recommending to anyone.  Proceed with caution!!!
author: Cassy O.

description:
Please be careful coming out to this Restaurant and when we came 1st time it Cute Little Place but they charge you different from whatever they advise you 
Look at your receipt and they automatically charge the tip also. I never go back to this bouquet place
author: Barbara L.

description:
Can't really even give this place a 1 as we were never serviced, and finally left. 

We came in at 5:35 for dinner. We noticed they had happy hour till 6 and were invited to open seating on the deck. We sat down opposite a couple who was being invited to order for happy hour. They declined and We asked the waitress for a happy hour menu, which she declined to give us and told us we were too late. We went in to ask the manager to explain why at 5:40 we were being declined service for happy hour. He apologized and told us someone would be right with us -- 5:45, someone came out and gave us a happy hour menu but wouldn't take an order. I was excited to order a couple simple tacos and a cocktail. My husband was going to order off the regular menu. 5:55, a bus boy offered us more chips, we asked to place an order. 6:05, still no service -- no water. no drink order, no food order, no service at all -- half and hour in, we just got up and left. 

Worst service we've ever experienced. 

We are hard working business people who live each day in service of our customers. We are great tippers, and nice people. we would never personally treat our customers this way, and would be appalled to learn anyone on our team's did. Too bad. We both work nearby and could have been return customers, but we won't be back.
author: KoAnn S.

description: We celebrated my birthday Saturday. Party of eight. This was my first time here snd i can say the atmosphere is fantastic! I felt so comfortable, the service is A+. The food is A+. We did notice most of the dishes are pretty spicy  hot! But still delicious! Try the Spicy Mango Margarita! I will definitely return. Thank you Tropisueno for making my Birthday a memorable experience!! Oh yeah, the Chupa Chupas (candy) are off the hook! I need to go buy more. Like Kool Aid OH YAH!!
author: Raquel Q.

description: I got the Salmon Ceveche and had trouble finding the Salmon in it . It was not good at all, covered in spicy cheese . Then the house margaritas tasted terrible .
author: Sara M.

description: I originally thought this was a fancy Mexican restaurant. I got around to go and discovered it was good, but very affordable. You order at the counter and then find your own seat. The fajitas were quite good.
author: Thomas C.

description: Lovely restaurant. Beautiful decor, very warm and inviting. Friendly wait staff was very accommodating and attentive. Food was good, not great. It just wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked, for a Mexican place.
author: Nicole A.

description: Good tacos and margs. A little busy and touristy but solid. Easy to get to if you're at a conference in SOMA.
author: Michael C.

description: Food was good and the price was right! Salsas were awesome. For a five star the margaritas need a little something. They were ok but not amazing. The ceviche dish was really small but delicious.
author: Sarah C.

description: Great selection at a surprisingly affordable price point given its location. Some very knowledgeable staff regarding tequila offerings. Highly recommended for any reason, but especially for the area.
author: Shaun P.

description: This is a Mexican place in the heart of downtown with a really fun ambiance but whose food prices are quite reasonable for its central location. It's no hole in the wall, but it's spacious and there's music; at the same time, lunch is fast and efficient, from ordering at the counter to them bringing out chips and your order to you. The menu has a good bit of variety, and a decent priced meal can be had for around $10, give or take. I thoroughly enjoyed my torta, which was pretty big and loaded with tender carne asada and the standard fillings. I also found it really nice that the chips came with a number of different salsas for dipping. Finally, they have some sweet agua frescas available--I got a hibiscus and it was the perfect balance of sweet and tangy.
author: Tony D.

description: We came here 2 years ago and this was a higher end Mexican restaurant. The food and service was amazing and worth the 2 hr wait. We were excited to visit SF again and eat here. This time it's more like Chipotle where they scoop your food right in front of you. I ordered the Carne Asada it was bland and over cooked. The rice & beans also were nothing special. The only good thing was the free chips & salsa. Im sad that this is not the same restaurant it was 2 years ago.
author: Alexandra Z.

description: Hands down one of the best bangs for your buck for downtown dining. Came for lunch, which is described more as taqueria during the day, rather than the full scale restaurant they do in the eve. The carne asada tacos were authentic street style tacos: savory and delicious. The ceviche fresh with the right amount of onion and acid! The margarita hit the spot after a day of shopping.
author: Liz C.

description: Fantastic food at amazing prices. If you are in the area, I think this is really the best Mexican.
author: Yan Z.

description:
A happening spot! Great service. Strong drinks. Nice sized portions. Can be somewhat loud, making it hard to hear the person you're sitting next to. 
I love the chips and 3 salsas. Not super authentic food but still good. Definitely recommend if you're in the area and looking for a fun, trendy, location.
author: T E.

description: Maybe other dishes are better, but I ordered the Tampiqueño and my meat was all gristle. I spent ~20min chewing each piece, and then had to spit it back out. Gross!!! I basically paid for an embarrassing jaw workout :(
author: Ash B.

description:
We stumbled upon Tropisueño while looking for a place to eat. The food smelled terrific outside, which is basically what drew us in. 

It was a Sunday around 7:00, and we got a table right away, though there restaurant was quite full. 

Although noisy (the main reason for the one star deduction) we were able to have a normal conversation. 
Our waiter suggested we order the house margarita and upgrade the tequila. We followed his suggestion and were not disappointed. They were fantastic. We each ended up having two, which is rare for my partner. 

Our food was delicious, though my steak was a little on the rare side vs. the medium rare I had ordered. Not a big deal to me, because the flavor was spot on.
