I definitely recommend giving this place a try, even if just for a drink.
author: Steve W.

description: Great vegetarian options, affordable, excellent service even when the place was packed. Would definitely come back again
author: Andrew S.

description: Everything was so delicious here, especially the orange salsa and the margs. Staff was super nice and the place had good vibes. Loved it.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Had the stake bowl and it was a great dish size and very satisfying. The chips in the beginning were sooo good!
author: Anat S.

description: My sister and I came here for lunch and shared the ceviche, guacamole, and beef fajitas. The chips that the guacamole comes with are so good. Sometimes tortilla chips are too dense and oily, but these were perfectly crispy yet not too thin that they couldn't hold up the guac. The ceviche was a little lackluster--it was mostly avocado, and the seafood was not that interesting. The margaritas were good -- strong enough to be worth it but still tasty. Overall, a good meal. Would recommend the guacamole and margs, would not recommend the ceviche.
author: Camille J.

description: The service is not the same as it was. They need to open up the patio area. Space is tight and host was so rude, it's been a year since I've been here and it did not hold up the expectations as last time.
author: Arasi S.

description:
I wish I could review the food and drinks here, but unfortunately they never arrived. I came a little late and the rest of my party had already started with a round of drinks and an appetizer so I wasn't too far behind. I flagged the waiter and ordered my drink and the veggie enchiladas. Almost an hour later, I asked where everything was thinking the hold up was due to him wanting to bring my food and drink at the same time, but nope, he straight up admitted he didn't even put in my drink order at all. By this time, everyone else was done with their main course and they were just waiting on me. I had to get my enchiladas to go and cancel my drink order. If it is any consolation, the one platano I did have wasn't too shabby, but overall, awful service and non-existent food or drinks.

EDIT: Forgot we asked for chips at around 8:30 and those never came either. It was just a hungry and sober meal
author: Vaibhav S.

description:
Good food, but bad customer service. We were sitting at a table that had no reservation sign, but as we were eating they placed the sign on our table. We were done eating, but we were relaxing nonetheless. No longer than an hour and a server in a red shirt asks us "are you guys done eating?" My friend responds yes, but we all three bought a fair amount of food. He points his thumb to the exit and says because they've got a lot of reservations. We don't leave ane then we're stared down by one of the managers. Look, I'm a chef. I know how this works. I've been a server too. Get your shit together.

PS: Be careful. There was a hair in the salsa/chips.
author: Clinton D.

description:
Came here for happy hour. It was awesome. Their mango margarita is so good. Had a little spice to it, was a good kick.

Friends ordered the chicken quesadilla, both of their quesadillas had really burnt chicken in them. Wouldn't recommend, unless we just happened to get a bad order of chicken.

Ceviche is super tasty. Fish tacos are okay.
author: Mindy E.

description:
This place had such great reviews so we decided to make a reservation weeks in advance for an evening when we were visiting in town. 

The goods:
-we were seated promptly 
-the ambiance and decor is super cute 
-the food was pretty good (average) but some different options than a typical Mexican restaurant 
-the chips and salsa were flavorful and spicy

The bads:
-the slow, incompetent waiter (who I'm 95% sure was high on something) 
-we had to ask water b/c it hadn't been served for a half hour
-we ordered margaritas and had to ask for them twice, when finally the manager had to come and get our drink order again, and they were finally served when we were done with our meals
-the drinks were just alright and not worth the long wait.
-we had to ask for our bill 4 times and every time our waiter asked if we wanted another margarita (like no dude, it took you an hour and half to bring us the first one and we already said no please bring us the bill).
-the incompetent waiter who brought us 2 different bills (both charged to our credit card already) that we're both incorrect! The manager had to once again come by and redo our itemized receipt, give us the correct bill, and reverse the previous transactions.

I wouldn't recommend this place as there are SO many other great restaurants in the SF area to check out.
author: J P.

description: The host was not inviting at all. He was very rude to us and everyone else that was waiting for the dinner hours to start. We ended up leaving because of how he was treating Everyone that was walking in, and we could only imagine how it would be inside the actual restaurant..
author: Alejandra M.

description: Had dinner at this awesome restaurant last night, the daughters took us out.  Excellent food, great service and loved the Mango margarita!  Liz was our server and was the best!  She was very attentive, personable and a pleasure to meet!  Of course I overindulged on the chips & salsa.  Shrimp ceviche was great and everything was so fresh and tasty.   The guacamole was very good, as well as the shrimp tacos and chicken enchiladas.  We definitely will be back on our next trip to San Francisco!
author: Kathy E.

description: The wait staff here is amazing and will cater to your every need.  Will not except same-day reservations, So probably best to have someone in your group, arrive early to wait for a table. Loud and fun, just about any night of the week. Not my favorite margarita, but the food was good.  Not your traditional Mexican menu. Go here for a lively atmosphere.
author: Mrs. P.

description: Went in for dinner around 10pm. Kitchen closes at 10:30pm. We sat there for 25 minutes and no one ever came to take our orders. Meanwhile the wait staff cleared tables all around us and the host ignored us.
author: Lynda M.

description:
Pretty good! 

I come here every so often when I'm craving Mexican around this area. The food and drinks are alright, they certainly hit the spot but also aren't out of this world. 

The staff are always very accommodating and polite. I never have a problem with seating, as I do like bar seating as well. 

Whenever I order Mexican food, I'll get a seafood dish. Their shrimp special is pretty tasty. 

If you want Mexican food in this area, look no further!
author: Taylor M.

description:
At 4:54pm on a Sunday, they are 'transitioning' from lunch to dinner. We can sit in the bar if we like for beverages, chips and salsa, no guacamole. Or we can sit in the dining room where there will be NO SERVICE until 5:30.

No Bueno and adios. There should have been signs to make that perfectly clear since we had already been inside and had stepped outside to choose our menu items.

In a city full of choices, never again will we choose this one.
author: Dexter D.

description:
Tropisueno! My heart yearns for you and I am upset that we have been apart for so long. SADNESS! Entirely my fault however. I take the blame. Here's why I adore you so:

- goodness the ambiance!!! Not only is this place in one of the cutest little spots in SF  (a sort of enclave area with other cute spots around) but it does a stellar job in the inside as well! A very merry and happy place! 

- FOOD! Holy moly it's delish. They are GREAT with accommodating you if you ask for something special. And uuuhhhmazing veggie food! I'm not vegetarian myself but a few of my friends are and they stuffed themselves silly let me tell you.

DEFINITELY worth a visit if you love Mexican food and want to have a merry night somewhere classy! You'll be saying Woot Woot and "har har" all nighttttt!!
author: Sarah M.

description: Great food great salsa great everything! Absolutely set the mood for our honeymoon. Great service environment. Wasn't to busy when we got there but glad we had a reservation cuz it got busy before close.locals love it seem. The couples besides us were on a date!
author: Joseph V.

description: Weekend getaway should get me around here with my beau for a brunch with suntea on ice for two.
author: Angela T.

description: While I am not so much a fan of paying real SF prices for Mexican food, this place is somewhat worth it for me. Why? The salsa is totally worth coming in for. I normally order taco salads here, and use their house made spicy salsa as a dressing. This stuff is addicting, and does not leave your mouth on fire, but does have a nice kick. I have been here many times, and would continue to come back.
author: Tracy C.

description: Great food!  Chile Verde wasn't as tender as I think it should be, but good flavor.  Guacamole was a little bland, need to spice it up a bit.  Drinks were great!
author: Christopher L.

description: Been coming here for years after shopping. Customer service is always perfection. Food & drinks on point. The chips & 3 salsas-amazing. They gave me the recipe for the salsas once & I lost it. Blame the good drinks. I need that recipe again!!
author: Deseemo F.

description: Tropsueno is one of my boyfriend and I'd go to. What really stands out is the Irish bartender. To find an Irish bartender in a Mexican restaurant is probably very rare but this guy is a rockstar, thanks for making our experience an excellent one!!
author: Shannon B.

description: 2.5 stars. All around mediocre food. I don't know why it has 4 stars. The guacamole looks like it came from the guacamole bags you can buy at the grocery store. I got the fish tacos and beef enchiladas and I'm pretty sure I could have made it better at my own house.
author: Carrie P.

description: Came during happy hour. Ordered ceviche & 3 fish tacos. $20. Great service, decent chips and salsa. The food was meh.
author: Anto A.

description: Delish, I love that it's quick service by day and sit down service by night.  They've got their formula figured out and to food rocks, even baby was happy with her meal!
author: Tim M.

description: The queso is bomb! The food and drinks are off the hook. Definitely a place that is worth the wait.
author: Dominique R.

description:
Ambiance, margs, and laid-back attitude...Tropisueno has gained a new fan!

Came here for a late-ish dinner around 8PM before attending a concert at the Mezz. Our party of two didn't have to wait long (~20 mins) to get a table even though the hostesses said it would be about 30-40 mins. Lies! This was a Saturday night, and we were the only party waiting for a table around 8PM. Useful fact, there is a single restroom for the ladies' room, so time your pee breaks accordingly!

Our server Adam was very polite, but not as prompt. He was a sweetie and very courteous though, so shoutout to you Adam! We had the Petito (CUCUMBER FTW) and Tropisueno (sour bitters) margs, and started with their seared scallop ceviche. It actually wasn't very ceviche-like, and more like an appetizer. See pics for details :) We also shared the nopales enchiladas (the only veggie option under the enchiladas section), which were delicioso! SO GOOD. We debated between sharing the salmon plate or nopales, but they're known for their enchiladas, so we went with the nopales plate.

I think that because I'm not from the city, Tropisueno isn't really a "diamond in the rough." I've had amazing Mexican food down in South Bay where the food prices are much cheaper and the margs are still delicious! BUT if you're in the SOMA/Union Square area and looking for a place for an intimate but still loud date, this is your jam. They have candles, tahitian-style flowy window covers and dark lighting around dinner time, so this is a great place aesthetic-wise. Don't think I'd come back particularly for their food, but if I'm looking for a good place for a date, intimate night for some girl talk, or chill/barely-there service, this will be the place.
author: Jodi H.

description: A great place to have an evening happy hour. Their margaritas are awesome and pairs well with their chips and guac!
author: Hemant J.

description: The food was good and service was great. Nothing particularly stood out to me, but if you looking for some good tasting mexican food this is a great choice.
author: Alex U.

description: Great Margaritas and nice ambiance.  Great salsa and good food.  I'll be back for sure!
author: jennie r.

description:
We just returned from our first time dinner at Tropiesueno and it was terrific. We're both strict vegetarians and although there weren't a ton of choices, what we ordered (Chile Relleno & Veggie Enchilada with Creamy Corn Sauce) were both yummy. The three salsas and chips delivered to the table when we sat down were all so delicious too. We ordered the guacamole was it was perfect and my lemonade was the perfect balance of tart and sweet which I love. 

Too bad we live so far away!
author: Kati P.

description: Met a friend here for happy hour on a Friday after work. Luckily she got there right at 5 and was able to grab us the last available table outside. We had the chips and salsa, guacamole, and house margaritas and I would recommend all of them. I hope to return to a proper dinner soon and will definitely suggest Tropisueno for future happy hours!
author: April H.

description:
Authentic Mexican food at a very good price..... two meals, 1 starter and two beers for $55. The service was friendly, attentive and refreshingly honest - they did not try suggest too much food when asked about how much to order. 
The only down side was the taste.... it was all ok, very eatable, but no real flavors that stood out.
author: Barry O.

description: My wife and I had a fun time at this delicious Mexican spot. They were full that night and we didn't make a reservation, but luckily there was a cancelation and they squeezed us in. The food was delicious and the service was great! Music was maybe a tad too loud, but i don't think it's a big enough deal to take a star away. Loved it!
author: Israel L.

description: Great location, yummy Mexican food, great margaritas, dog friendly outdoor seating, friendly staff
author: Mika H.

description:
Went here yesterday (8.31.15) with girlfriends for happy hour. We got there around 5pm. Happy Hour was from 4-6pm. I would definitely recommend checking it out if you're downtown. The happy hour includes $6.50 margaritas, $2.95 chicken, carnitas or steak street tacos and fish tacos (unsure of the price). We also ordered the quesadilla and steak nachos. All the food was more than enough for 4 hungry ladies. They also offer free chips & salsa. I loved the atmosphere along with the friendly waiting staff & hosts. 

The service, however, was painstakingly slow. There really wasn't much excuse because we got there before the dinner service (which starts at 5:30pm). In fact, I recall a similar rate of service the first time I came here for happy hour. It just didn't make sense to me. Hence, I bumped them down a star. Regardless, we had a fun time. Yes, it was loud but what do you expect with a full house & some music playing in the background. I definitely will be back if I'm ever back downtown and need a taco fix.
author: Brittany D.

description: Get here early for a seat in the bar. Happy hour drinks and menus are amazing. I had a carnitas taco and it was so fresh and delicious and huge. Guacamole was fresh. Happy menu prices are a steal.
author: Nunyo B.

description:
It's hard to find a good sit down lunch spot when shopping near Union Square that isn't spendy or touristy. (There's the Rotunda or MKT if you want a fancy -- and spendy -- lunch, but what about when you want to sit down with your family and would prefer not doing that at a food court slash human zoo?)

Tropisueno is one of my favorite lunch options. (I can't vouch for it for dinner, but it has my lunch vote.)  It is relatively relaxed and right near Yuerba Buena. They have solid Mexican food at lunch: tortas, burritos and combination plates. A plentiful salsa bar. This is not a hole in the wall but it is seat-yourself. Inside, they've created a harmonious atmosphere in their roomy dining room, complete with twinkle lights and carved wood furniture, despite the cafeteria style line-up. It's a relatively quick and easy lunch stop, providing a welcome respite from nearby crowds. 

The food is surprisingly hearty and good. The best orders are tortas and combo plates. They pass the good chip test: complimentary and taste deliciously handmade. Mole is a somewhat weaker link: saucy sweet versus packing good warm heat, but maybe still good for those who like a sweeter option.Careful at the salsa bar because some of the items marked as "mild" are anything but, and you'll find plentiful help-yourself sliced radishes, cilantro and fresh pico de gallo left out for the taking.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I'm in SF for work about once a month and I always hit up Tropisueño when I get in on Sundays. I love it because it's more than tacos. Most Mexican joints in SF really tout the tacos and burritos, which is fine, but Tropisueño is so much more. I usually get the enchiladas which are amazing. I've had the cheese and the beef and enjoyed both. 

Great outdoor seating area and a quiet little place to grab lunch on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Mallory S.

description:
Lunch menu is HUCH in size and posted on the wall.  You can decide as you are in line and you order/pay the cashier. Very efficient process but the only thing for me was I sometimes can't hear what the workers are asking me on my order because the place is typically full of polls and noisy.  The lines look long but I have not had to wait more than 5 mins every time I have been here.  

You choose your table and your order is brought to you.  The chips are complimentary and for me, are the BEST tortilla chips I've had at a Mexican restaurant.  If you eat too fast and run out, you can ask for more ( they have never said no to me).  

I usually have the soft chicken tacos (2 is enough for me) or their burritos.  Their service is good, always checking if you need more water or anything else.  This is a good place for a great lunch, especially on a sunny day you can sit outside and enjoy the fresh air.  

Dinner time turns into a full service restaurant.  There is a pork dish that comes served cooked in 3 different styles and plated separately. I forgot the name of it but that is my favorite.  Very tender, fresh and seasoned well.   Their ceviche was also very good, you taste the fish and the fish is not over powered by the seasoning.  That to me usually means the fish may not be as fresh as it should be when served. 

Overall, service, quality of food, wait time, ambiance were all good and have not had a bad experience here.
author: mimi c.

description: I gave them another chance and they still failed. They gave me a teaspoon of guacamole and sour cream and told me I had to pay for more. This will be my last time ordering from here
author: Devin W.

description:
After we have dropped off our suitcases at the hotel, Mr A and I decided to come here for a late lunch as it it is open all day. 

Food:
Complimentary chips and salsa: Delicious!The tortilla chips were fresh out of the fryer: hot and crispy! The salsa was not spicy at all. 
Chicken burrito: Portion was ginormous but Mr A said it wasn't tasty at all.
 Chicken mole with black beans, rice and guac: The mole was sweet and not spicy either, but the flavour was not as complex as the ones offered at Red O( Newport Beach, CA) or Red Iguana( Salt Lake City Utah). I nearly cleaned the plate( except the rice) nonetheless.
author: I L.

description:
Came here twice in a row on my birthday for dinner and lunch the next day after my husband and I checked out of our hotel. I knew this place would be busy so I made reservations ahead of time and boy am I glad I did. It has a nice comfy feeling as if you were in Mexico. Lights are very minimal here, I mean so dim that my hubby had to bust out his flashlight on his phone dim (we all laughed!) 

We were served tortilla chips with three different salsas which were all good. We started off with Platanos Fritos then for entrées, my cousin and I ordered Tampiqueño, my other cousin had Chicken Quesadillas and my hubby had their Tacos Plate. Everyone said it was good and the portions are perfect. The service was great and the server brought over a free dessert and sang happy birthday. 

The next day, my hubby and I came back and I believe he was the manager saw us and recognized me from the night before. He explained to us how lunch works and we ordered at the counter then we're given a number so that the servers can bring our food to the table. The water, utensils, napkins and salsa bar is self-service and we seated ourselves. I tried their Carnitas tacos and it was pretty good. I dig this spot, no wonder it's always crowded.
author: Candice J.

description:
Great chips and big portions! Pricey for Mexican food, but we went with friends before an event for a light meal. My husband and I shared enchalada's and it was good for the two of us with the chips. The drinks were also really good.

I would go back if we were going out closeby, but it wouldn't necessarily be a destination spot. Busy and pricey.
author: Jennifer S. C.

description:
Tropisueno had been on my list for a long time, but every time I looked at pictures it seemed a little meh and I expected Chevy's-esque food. I'd learned my lesson with upscale Mexican food at Nopalito i.e. the most $$$ and smallest portions I've ever encountered for Mexican food. Tropisueno was finally put on the calendar when I was summoned to pick a dinner place around Powell, and when I realized they have normal-people portions instead of tapas, which is a euphemism for the fastest way to unknowingly go broke. 

Anyways, enough of Nopalito bashing. Here is my take on Tropisueno:

(+/-) Chips and salsa, complimentary: Not particularly outstanding, and the chips aren't warm. Quite possibly bought in bulk from a wholesaler. The salsa is alright and the orange one is interestingly spicy, but otherwise it's average.

(+) Rice and beans, complimentary: Choice of pinto, black, and white Peruvian. White beans! What a nice change from the age-old question of pinto or black.

(++) Chile Verde, $14 (tender pieces of pork simmered in tangy tomatillos, green peppers, chiles and herbs. house favorite): Pork is so tender, it's like pork belly minus the fat. The seasoning is intense and complex: piquant, earthy, aromatic.

(++) Enchiladas de Nopales, $14 (grilled chicken or veggies, corn, cactus and chiles in a fresh corn cream sauce): Hearty and creative take on enchiladas (cactus!!)

(+) Margarita, $10: Much better than your average margarita at a random bar.

(+) Margarita with violet liquor, $10: Personally I couldn't really taste the violet liquor, and I found it funny that it looked exactly like the regular margarita, except in a old fashioned glass rather than a Collins.

Portions are huge and could last two meals. (Secret: I got a box for leftovers, but it was so tasty that I ended up finishing it while waiting for a movie at the Metreon)

The ambiance is upscale and nice--a theme of polished wood and dim lighting with an elegant storefront. They pay attention to details, like the wispy curtains in the windows and pebble-lined candles.

Takes reservations with the easy online Yelp system, so we got a table at 7pm on a Saturday with no wait. One of those win moments when I felt like a savvy SF local :3
author: Edna C.

description: Very cool vibe place but it's a bit confusing if you have never been there.  Lots of food.  Not your tacqueria.  More upscale and enjoyable.
author: donna a.

description: Food was good but the place was a madhouse with people packed in and shouting to hear each other. Not a relaxing place, but if you have misbehaving, screaming small children,  this is the place for you -- no one will ever notice or be disturbed. Additionally, you will be in and out of there in under half an hour. They know how to turn those tables. But again, this is a plus-- you really won't want to stay longer if you value your hearing or your sanity. Take out perhaps?
author: Carolyn E.

description:
Love coming to Tropisueno when I'm in town. Their Happy Hour eats and drinks are on par for sure! It's down this lovely corridor with some nice restaurants attached to the Marriott. 
I enjoy the fact that it has patio seating in addition to indoor. Makes for awesome people watching!
$6.50 house margarita and some $7 nachos that can feed 3 people and you're set! Add $2 for some meat on those and I'm in heaven. Their carnitas are flavorful and tender. Free chips and salsa as always. I enjoy that they have 3 different salsas on one plate. All taste great and love the spicy habanero one! 
Prices are fair which makes me happy considering San Fran prices can be expensive. 
Staff here are always nice but wait times and service can tend to be slow around HH and dinner rushes no matter what day it is. 
If you're coming to have a conversation, certainly don't sit in the bar. It is super noisy and the bartenders have a hard time hearing your order. All in all though the food is consistently good and is a nice spot to grab some decent Mexican food.
author: Valerie W.

description: Great atmosphere, great food. Very short wait after joining the wait list through yelp prior to arriving.
author: Kristina L.

description:
It's more like 3.5 stars, tbh..I was visiting my bff in SF and we decided to have dinner at Tropisueno. We didn't know what time dinner would be so it was too late to make reservations. After parking at a structure nearby, we arrived to put our name down and the lady said it'll be about 45 minutes wait for a table for 2. We left our phone number so they can text us when the table is ready (love that service!). 

While we waited, we stumbled across Yerba Buena Gardens and so we sat there and chit chat for a bit. Sure enough, our table was ready about 45 minutes later..

The ambiance here is super romantic with dimmed lightings and adorable strings of lights and decors all over. However, the noise level did get a bit loud and I had a hard time hearing my friend sometimes. Our table was super close to two other tables so I was a bit bothered but not so much.

I was starving so I munched on so much of the complimentary chip and salsas. They provide you with 3 types of salsa and they're all unique in their taste and spiciness. Although the orange one was yummy, it was too spicy for my liking so I stuck with the green salsa. You can tell the quality of the chip is freshly made and they're the thin type so it's not too filling.

The water here tasted really good, too, almost like mineral water..

My best friend who has been here many of times before said she always got the Tropisueno Camarones (shrimp dish w/ rice). However, this time, she did notice that the sauce was less thick and less filling so she was able to finish it, unlike previous times. It was still good for her, but not as good as before.

Going away from my bff's suggestion and trying to be healthy, I got the Salmón En Hoja De Platano and it was similar to my friend's dish but with salmon on a banana leaf. I thought the salmon was delicious but everything else on the plate was weird tasting for me and it didn't go well with the salmon so I finished only the salmon portion. 

I love Mexican food but I was a bit let down by the overall taste blending of all the ingredients on this plate. Maybe if I had another opportunity, I would just get what my friend suggested. We spent about $25 each after tax and tip, and I don't think it was worth it.

Check out their happy hour Mon-Fri 4-6 PM!
author: Minh-An C.

description:
WE FOUND ALUMINIUM IN OUR FOOD ! That was the lowest point of this diner. The RUDE waitress got our order wrong and when asking to get it corrected we could hear a disdainful "que le paso"
When the order was corrected we got overcharged. We had to ask the manager to get everything corrected. Not one apology. Never coming back to this place. The food was ok.
author: David D.

description:
Y'all, I cannot talk about this place enough. If you can believe it, before moving to San Francisco I was not much  of a Mexican Food fan. Living here, burritos and enchiladas have now become part of my regular diet and normally I'd say that your best best is somewhere in the Mission.

But Tropisueño is just so, so worth it.

The food selection is amazingly varied, and all amazing. If you come for lunch, they have the full menu but serve it in an ordering line where you say what you'd like, and they give you a number for your table. At night, it reverts to a classic waitstaff setting. Either way, plan your visit because this place is very popular. I try to call ahead for a table if coming at night anytime after seven.

That said, come hungry because they serve a lot! I always get their enchiladas, which are delicious and very very filling. The make heavy drinks, so if you want a mean margarita, this is your new place.
author: Kristen T.

description: 2 days in a row closed due to sales force. No one answer phone and nothing posted online. Lost a locals business
author: Josh S.

description:
Great service, fast and friendly! Did I mention GREAT food?!

I've been coming here for over a year since I started working in the city. This place is great for lunch, the staff on the line are always fast and awesome! The quality of the food doesn't suffer for how quick it comes out and it's unbelievable. Burritos are great, quesadillas are perfect. Quick, easy, simple, not too expensive great spot for lunch, go before 12, the line can be out the door...

Dinner is not disappointing at all! Loved every bite. One thing I would suggest to others is, try a flavored margarita instead of the regular, it was a little sweet for my taste. 

Definetley recommend to everyone I know!
author: Brett F.

description: This place gets very crowded for lunch. There are tables inside and out but seating is still limited. You order at a window but they bring the food to your table. I had a fish taco. It was ok but on the smaller side. Same for the shrimp taco. The guac was yummy though. I had the watermelon juice and it was way too sweet for me. They do not have cheese dip which is a bummer. Not sure I would be back
author: Misty W.

description: Actually not super impressed. I ordered different kind of tacos. Not your typical taco. Maybe the other food is good
author: Devin H.

description: Walked in with 2 friends at around 6 PM last Tuesday, the 2 hosts? in street dress couldn't be bothered to turn around from their work station to greet us properly, generally gave us the cold shoulder (literally, it was a cold night and they talked over their shoulders at us lol)  Easy come, easy go, I guess.
author: Paul E.

description:
My family and I are from Los Angeles and we go to the same Mexican restaurant every Friday night. So being in San Fran we decided to try to find a local Mexican restaurant to go to. We were staying at the Marriott and this place was basically in the hotel (just outside the backdoor). 

We walked in about 7pm and it was very busy, expecting a wait (hearing someone walk out mumbling "20 - 30 minutes") the hostess said she could seat us right away as long as we left by 8:30pm... totally fine! Then after that everything was just great. Service was excellent, drinks were great (super strong, which I like), food was great, and chips and salsa was perfect. We couldn't have been happier filling our Friday night Mexican food void. Only a 1 star deduction becuase as we were trying to leave (about one the hour mark) we waited a really long time to get the check. We ate, drank, and wanted to leave (tired kids). Guess this restaurant must have issues with "squatters". Anyway well done, thanks!!!!
author: Jim M.

description:
Great lunch options.

Its more of a self serve place where you pick up your own cutlery and salsas. The chips are warm and freshly made and the food is pretty tasty.
author: Anoop K.

description:
Okay...definitely a GREAT atmosphere and fun place to come with friends.

Food - eh I think I need to go back and try again.
I got the enchiladas and compared to enchiladas at a Mexican place, they just didn't compare.

Cocktails were strong, so that's good. The wait is FOREVER if you don't make a reservation the AT LEAST the day before. They don't take any same day reservations.

Best thing to do if you really want to go here is put your name down and then head to the Press Lounge across the way for some drinks while you wait.
author: Anastacia W.

description:
Ummmm.....Wow!! This place is delicious!! Food was fresh and tasted very authentic! I love Mexican food and I will have to say, this place is probably my favorite!

We ordered 2 super tacos with carne asada with rice and beans, a tamale, shrimp burrito, and chips and guacamole (there is a VERY YUMMY salsa bar with plenty of choices). 

The meat was flavorful and the portions were great! I'm a taco fanatic and I ordered 2 tacos and I was full after the first! The burrito was also a huge portion so we ended up taking the tamale home (we had it for breakfast....soo delicious!) The chips are refillable and the drinks are tasty as well. I ordered a modelo negra chavela...had to be one of the most refreshing chavelas I've had!  My boyfriend had a strawberry margarita and the strawberry purée is fresh and made in house!

Overall great place. I love the location and the ambiance of the restaurant. I cannot wait to come back! Yum!!
author: Desirae P.

description:
This place is BUSY. After work on a Wednesday night, the place was crowded and we had to wait a good half an hour before getting seated.  What was odd was that the waitress asked us, before even leading us to our table, if we were ok with limiting our dinner to an hour and a half because there were reservations and they were running behind.  It put us a bit off, but it wasn't a huge deal and we agreed.

The restaurant/bar is smaller than I would have expected it to be, but they decorate the interior in a fun yet neat way.  It had a cool, fun and new atmosphere.  The drinks were very strong (I heard each had 2 tequila shots). Overall we all ordered multiple drinks and had a great time. We continued to sit, drink and flag him down for more drinks, but never once did he ask if we were ready to our dinner orders.  45 minutes had gone by until he finally came by to see what we had wanted. We didn't mind so much because we were having a good time catching up and talking, but if the restaurant had gone through the trouble to ask us to shorten our stay, they didn't seem to put in the effort to follow through. 

The food arrived in a decent time after placing our orders.  Everything was delicious as were the drinks. I had a chicken plate and my meat was so wonderfully flavored as well as tender and juicy.  I also usually don't like black beans or pickled radish, but both were absolutely tasty.  I believe everyone's food and drink were great as well.

Another mishap was that a friend had ordered a drink, but it never came.  By the time we had finished eating, it still hadn't arrived and he didn't think it was worth to ask again.  Though the food and drink are well worth 4-4.5 stars, their service is pretty poor and they obviously don't know how to cater to the customer. 

I may return just because I had a great time, with great eats in a cool place, but the service is a bit weak.

Atmosphere: 4/5
Food and drink: 4.5/5
Service: 2/5
Overall Experience: 3.5/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Was at a convention and this place was near hotel.  Glad we stopped in! Was amazing! One of the FEW Mexican places I actually like on the West coast! The carne Asada was super flavorful as was the chili con queso and tacos!
author: Chris F.

description: This is my favorite place for lunch in SOMA. In fact, it's my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF. The chips are awesome and the burritos are always amazing.
author: Russ S.

description:
I've been an old timer at Tropisueño for the past 5+ years. I've admired their food, drinks and salsas (the hot one, and the habanero hotter one). 

Most recently (since Oct I believe), they've had a change in management/chef or something else that the food hasn't been tasting as well as it used to. 

There have been lapses in service as well. The food has become kind of bland (with the pozole not having salt sometimes). 

Anyone else feeling the same about Tropisueño?
author: C K.

description: Their chips/salsas are amazeballs. Also tamales. Also margaritas. And their mole, their HOLY mole. Just order the whole menu.
author: Paola D.

description:
I was fortunate to be shown this fantastic restaurant while I was visiting San Francisco, or I may have never tried its delicious cuisine. Walking up during lunch hours on a Friday, it was packed; actually, it was more than packed - there was a 30-foot line out of the door. If perceived quality alone could sell me, I would have stopped here in a heartbeat to see what all the fuss was about. After standing in line for not too long, we made it in to see the menu and proceed with our foray into superior Mexicana. 

They serve everything you'd imagine a Mexican restaurant to have (no surprise) and quite a bit more. I hadn't seen tortas on any menu in a long time, and I was further inspired by trying the eponymous dish, so I ordered the - you guessed it - Tropisueno Torta, which was loaded with carne asada, grilled chicken, carnitas and chorizo. With the addition of a couple horchatas and guacamole dishes, we were ready for the feast. 

The guacamole was perfectly consistent, savory, and dip-able, and the torta was fantastic. Sort of like a Mexican sloppy joe, but with none of the questionable quality, I couldn't help myself from devouring every morsel. Washing it down with some not-too-sweet horchata and sitting out in the California sunshine definitely helped shape my opinion as well. Without a doubt, I'll be returning here the next time I'm in SF.
author: Chase T.

description:
We came here for dinner. We arrived around 5:15pm which was happy hour time. Since there was no room at the bar and we didn't want to sit outside in the cold, we decided to just do dinner.
The menu has good variety. We decided to order the sopa de pollo and the huaraches tres Conchita's. The soup was good and filling - it comes with a side of rice. The huaraches were good. I liked the corn patties that came with the huaraches but the three different pork meats were overly salty. It ruined our pallet a bit. They also have complimentary chips and dip. The sauces were fairly good.
The lighting in the restaurant was poor - so many were using camera flashlights to look at the menu. I also hate not knowing how my food looks and seeing what I'm eating. 
Service was decent but definitely felt rushed to eat and leave which was annoying. 
Probably will try other Mexican restaurants before coming back to this one.
author: Goku U.

description:
It's the salsa. The smooth orangish one. That 's why I go back. That's why I must go back. This place is BUSY taqueria by day, and a Mexican Dinner House by night.

Excellent food and a variety of fresh made salsas... 

The only thing that's missing are the eggs. I love a good huevos  rancheros.
Quite honestly, I enjoy a good fried egg or two on most Mexican meals.

Where are the huevos???

Still love this place with or without the huevos
author: Kris M.

description:
You can judge a cantina by its tortilla chips...

I've always believed you can judge a good cantina or taqueria by its tortilla chips and salsa. Tropisueno has the best tortilla chips I've ever had: thin, lightly salted, and crunchy. Making a good tortilla chip is an art. The complimentary tortilla chips (let's face it, good restaurants have these complementary) are accompanied by three delicious salsa choices. 

What goes well with tortilla chips & salsa? Margaritas of course! Tropisueno has fantastic margaritas! 

I love the vibrant, yet casual atmosphere and homey yet decadent food. You can get anything from chorizo scallops to a typical bean and rice taco plate. This is also one of the more affordable comparable restaurants in Yerba Buena Lane and in the Financial District in general.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Love happy hours there!  Good beer selection and margaritas are great.  Chips with three selection of salsas served free of charge non-stop.  Small bites are also cheap on happy hours and hit the spot.  
Lots of tourists, fun place to be for happy hours after rough day on the office.   For $20-30 enough to get few drinks and bites to eat.  Try it at Thirsty Bear few blocks away.  You'll end up paying hundreds!
author: Alex R.

description: So yummy! They give good sized portions and I was pleasantly surprised at the prices. I went at lunch time. It was pretty busy, but the line moved quickly and they food came out fast. I tried 4 different salsas and they were all amazing. Definitely coming back again, maybe for happy hour next time!!
author: Jackie L.

description: The five stars go out to the outstanding service at the bar and the food, I come here on the weekends, and the bar staff is amazing, Alejandro and Roger are very professional and courteous, the drinks taste better each time. Gustavo behind the register is very friendly and accommodating, I would give this place 10 golden stars, the food is always good and so fresh.
author: khawla m.

description:
Location: off Market, easily accessible by bart and muni. Inside is pretty dark, cramped, and busy. 

Service: Host needs to do a better job of actually greeting people; we had a reservation and she didn't even acknowledge we were standing there because she was talking to her friends.. odd. 

Food:
-Chips/salsas (5/5): amazing, warmly toasted chips. I love that these chips aren't too thick - they're super thin! Salsas are all fresh and great - careful, the cheesy one is pretty darn spicy
-Chile verde plates (4/5): it was a pretty decent portion with great beans (usually not a bean person) and rice. I do wish the pork would come out pre-shredded in the sauce. It was just two huge chunks of meat that were really hard to cut with the knives. I pretty much couldn't cut the second one bc it was so tough.
author: Shelley K.

description: I went on a family trip to SF on 9/21/17. I yelped restaurants and chose this one. Parking was difficult to find I parked like 3 long blocks traffic lights down at a private parking garage. We got there at 3:50pm. The person in front(manager) was abrupt told us it was taqueria time until 4pm that we order and seat ourselves. Or at 4pm dinner menu started. Well desperately hungry went for the taqueria which im not a big fan of eating at taquerias. My father is disabled in a wheel chair. So when we go to sit down after we ordered. There was only a 2 seat table available. They had a rope dividing the tables. Taqueria time only has like 5 tables. I guess when its dinner they remove the rope and all tables are available. SO the front desk guy tells us theres only that table and cant seat us in a larger table because that area is closed. It was 4 of us and he expected us to sit at a mini 2 chair table. Luckily there were good samaritans, young couple sitting in a booth and offered their table and they'd sit at the one available. So that there was a big no! The food isnt mexican authentic the rice tastes too can tomatoey, the beans taste canned too. I ordered enchiladas not to wow. My mom really like her enchilada and my father did like his pollo en mole. I wouldnt return for the bad service on a disabled person. He should've opened the area for us to sit in. Plus hes not friendly I don't know what hes doing as a manager and in front.
author: Ivette A.

description:
I loved the happy hour at Tropisueño! I came on a Friday evening before a Giants game (hoping to fill up and avoid buying overpriced food and drinks at the ballpark). We ordered fish tacos (3-4) and house margaritas (5), and unlimited chips and salsa came with the order. We were definitely starving, as we went through a lot of chips and salsa before our orders arrived. They provided a platter of three different types of salsa, which was delicious and generous on their part. 

Seating was unbelievably crowded - they roped off over half the restaurant either for cleaning or for non-happy hour patrons, I couldn't tell, so the only seating available was at the bar or on a long skinny bench across the bar. My friend and I had to request another group of patrons to rearrange their seating in order to squeeze in. As such, I'd highly recommend getting there early for happy hour and grabbing a seat immediately - it's free seating. We had to motion the waiters quite a few times to get food and water, but this was understandable as it was loud and crowded inside. The quality of the food made up for it. The margaritas weren't particularly amazing but they were incredibly strong - so if you're happy hour hopping I recommend sharing with a friend or sticking to Tropisueño for the duration of your evening. It is slightly more upscale than what I'd expect from happy hour, but then again, a lot of seemingly casual places are slightly fancier in San Francisco.
author: Mili P.

description:
On a lunch outing with coworkers before seeing Pitch Perfect 2 we stopped off at Tropisueno.

Mole was fantastic- gigantic portion of tender beef bathed in a well balanced mole sauce (sweet, savory, gentle heat notes with a hint of acidity) 

Love the condiment bar section, really helps to add whole new layers to your meal

Come early to snag a table especially for large groups (after 11:30 it already starts to get packed fast) 

Overall Thoughts

Glad to see lunch can be just as satisfying as their dinner menu
author: Eddie W.

description: Awesome place and vibe. Service was great. Everyone was so friendly from the moment we got in the door to getting the check.I definitely suggest coming here.
author: Apoorva S.

description:
Grabbed three tacos to go... or tried to, anyway. Line wasn't very long but I had to wait almost 20 minutes for my order. You can order ahead but there's a ~$1.50 surcharge.

The interior didn't seem very big, but then again, I didn't stay that long.

On to the tacos!

Carne Asada (2.95) - pass on this one. Very dry; not very flavourful. 2/5.
Chorizo (2.95) - Yum! Easily the best one I had. Super moist. It's not very hot, but you can definitely taste the spices. The texture wasn't that appealing though. 4/5
Baja Fish (4.75) - It was alright. It costs about 1.5x a normal taco, but it's a fair bit bigger too. The fish was pleasantly crispy. 3/5

In addition to your order, they also give you a little bag of chips. I imagine this would be better if you were eating in, since you could snack on them while waiting for your food. Even though I had to wait so long for my order, they didn't give me the chips to help me pass the time. The various salsas they had were decent.
author: Yves L.

description: Interesting brunch. They have the menu on the wall when you walk in, you order and pay upfront and then they'll bring it to you. Super nice technology. Like it. Food was delicious as well.
author: Gabriella M.

description:
I checked in at my hotel(The W San Fran) after a cross country flight hungry as dog.  We have a serious lack of Mexican food in Burlington(VT) and anytime I'm in a city it sits at the top of my list next to Thai cuisine.  Yelp helped me out and showed that Tropisueno was just a 5 minute walk away and had plenty of positive review to encourage my visit.  Thanks errybody!

I was greeted promptly and made myself at home at the bar.  The bartenders were friendly, primarily the gal that took care of me; she guided me to both a drink choice and an entree choice.  They start you off with fresh chips and three fresh salsas, all of which were balanced and exploding with flavor... the orange one was my personal fave.

My spicy Margarita was the perfect concoction for me, sour and spicy.  The shrimp dish I had was unbelievably delicious... WOW.  Garlicky, creamy, spicy tender shrimp along side piping hot and generously portioned rice and white beans(which I chose from when offered refried, black or white).  Hot corn tortillas too.  I ate it so fast I'm almost embarrassed!  So of course I was instantly full to the brim... I washed it down with my all time fav digestif Fernet Branca... ummm for $3!! Are you kidding me that's a damn deal right there.

The service was amazing and the food exceeded my expectation.  Two minor complaints... as it was toward the end of the night they were doing some of their end of night cleaning and there was an excess of clanging metal.  The other is that the washroom was pretty messy and in general felt like it could use a good cleaning.  Those things do contribute to an over all review, but if it were food and service alone I'd give it 10 stars!  Quiero mas!!!
author: Rachel A.

description:
Always crowded, and for good reason - the chicken mole is bomb.

The other day, some friend and I met here for a belated b-day celebration, and I had never really heard of the place before (of course, I have been out of the country for two years...but still). I was surprised how many people were waiting. Luckily, my friend put in our names for a reservation around 6pm. We arrived around 7 and were seated close to 7:30pm. During this time, we made our way to the bar to grab some margaritas and chips.

The bar can get a bit crowded - due to narrow walkways - so much so, that a waiter accidentally spilled a drink on my friend while trying to move past him. Later, the manager came by to personally apologize, offer to pay for any dry cleaning for the jacket, and sent our table a round of tequila shots - although it was unfortunate, I was impressed with the cordiality of the manager to keep our business.

The food though. Holy mole-y (haha), I haven't had chicken mole in a long time, and this really hit the spot for me. Huge thighs smothered in semi-chocolatey goodness with rice and beans on the side. Quite large and surprisingly affordable (around $14). The chicken was cooked fantastically - not dry at all, and I was pleased with my choice.

If you can stand the wait, or make a walk-in reservation in advance, definitely check this place out.
author: Brandon Y.

description:
Overall experience wasn't bad but marred by a few things. Few things to keep in mind:

Tips:
1. Definitely make a rezzy on yelp - we went on Friday night and there was a long line of people waiting for seats. They were ready to seat us early as well.
2. This place has an expansive drink menu on which they add their own twist for a lot of classics so might be worth getting something!

Pros:
-chips and salsa were delicious, the orange one has a pretty strong kick
-good drinks especially the Mexican sidecar

Cons:
-ordered the Tampiqueño which is basically a steak with beans, an enchilada, rice, and guac. I didn't know to specify how I wanted my meat cooked and they gave it to me rare. Meat was tough and cut thick, so it was even harder to chew. Not impressed with the entree at all. 

Learn from my mistakes and maybe your experience will be better next time!
author: Jonathan X.

description:
This is the defining Mexican restaurant in San Francisco's Mission District. The food is beyond authentic, the tacos (I had the al pastor and carnita) are incredible, and there are so many varieties of salsa to choose from to go with your chips (and any other dish you get) that you won't want to leave.

The workers here are fantastic - speedy, efficient, and kind in answering any questions you may have. When in the Mission or just even in SF, this is a must-try location!
author: Angela Y.

description: Yes the food seems authentic but not much else. I've few conflicts and unpleasant behavior from staff during our short visit. We had a good time but nobody seemed happy working here and they didn't even bother to treat customers well for tips.
author: Kasra M.

description:
Great good! Fast service and awesome salsa bar at lunch time! They offer free chips and whether you eat here or order to go during lunch! The servers are always friendly ad they are quick to clean up a table to make room for new guests! 

Try the juices: they have fresh watermelon juice and hibiscus. Both  are light and refreshing without being too sugary! They also have horchata!

You've got to try the orange salsa! It's the best one!
author: Ruby S.

description:
If you need to go to the washroom... do it before you get here. There's only two restrooms for both genders so expect a long wait after your refreshing margarita lol.

Aside from that, the food was great! This place gets really packed for dinner. Get a side of guac to go w/ those chips and salsa they already give you.

Huraches "tres Cochinitas" - the thick tortilla was great. Crispy on the edges and enough to hold the contents. This is quite the varietal plate that just hit the spot. The al pastor w/ pineapple added a refreshing element to the plate. Overall, the meats were flavorful - three types of pork!
author: James N.

description: I went here for lunch during a conference. There is a nice patio area so we opted for this place but it wasn't clear we had to order inside (sort of like Chipotle style). So we reserved our seats outside and went inside to order. The menu is pretty large so I went with the grilled prawn plate which had salad, rice, beans, and shrimp. With a drink, I spent about $20. Not cheap for "fast food". Everyone else in our party got their food within 5 minutes but I didn't get mine until 25+ minutes later after I checked with an employee. The food was simple and tasty but my god, that wait was terrible. I'd pass, especially if you're in a rush.
author: Regina W.

description:
I am never disappointed whenever I come here. The burritos are very flavorful and reasonably priced. The carne asada burrito is my go to. The beef is perfectly seasoned and marinated. The burritos are massive and I guarantee that you will be full after your meal. 

With every order they give you a side of their Cantina style tortilla chips. They have a salsa bar/ sauces for all of your salsa needs. My favorite salsa is the pico de gallo and their orange sauce. Its basically their own "La Vic" sauce. I think their orange sauce is better than La Vic's. More flavor and it has more of a kick. I definitely recommend this place.

One last thing, this place gets packed during lunch time (of course, why wouldn't it). I recommend that you get here early or anytime after 1pm. Whenever you see a restaurant that is busy, you know it good!
author: Marc U.

description:
I had the chicken enchiladas, refried beans and rice = the enchiladas were delicious!

The man had the Chicken Gringo Taco salad (how fitting as he is a gringo lol) = he said it was pretty tasty.

The fresh guacamole was very good.  They have a salsa bar which we enjoyed!
Try the green salsa, man, that's some good ass salsa!

They serve micheladas (it's like mexican bloody mary's?) which are very good while having authentic Mexican food :)
author: Veronica A.

description: Absolutely amazing food and service. Tomás was so helpful, informative and friendly. The tomales and enchiladas are unbelievable. This place must be experienced. It's awesome!!
author: Heather W.

description:
We visited here because there were a lot of 4 star reviews. I now believe that mostly tourist have rated this restaurant. If you are a foodie and looking for an authentic spot, this is not the place. If you are looking for a decent meal with margaritas, then give it a try. 

Lastly, they put cilantro on everything...
author: Theresa H.

description: Amazing cocktails, delicious food, and excellent service. The salsa selection was a delicious start. I ordered the Camarones Tropisueño and it was AMAZING. I told my waiter what kind of cocktails I liked, so he suggested two. I tried both. The Jamaicazo was delicious but a little too sweet. The spicy strawberry margarita was perfect though.
author: Traci L.

description: Great place in a great location. The food is very good. Tried the enchiladas verde with a margarita this time which was very good. This is my third or fourth visit and each time the service and good has been very good. Highly recommend fo lunch or dinner.
author: Sue J.

description:
Consistently tasty food and friendly service! Definitely make reservations, as Tropisueno gets very crowded on weekend nights. 

They start you off with free chips and salsa, which are always fresh and delicious! Entree portions are huge and the flavors are bold. My favorite is probably the Huaraches Tres Cochinitas - I enjoy getting to sample the pork cooked in three different ways. Also, they give you Chupa Chups with your check!

Overall, a solid option for dinner with friends, or even a date (maybe not a first date though, as it can get kind of loud!) And in a super convenient location downtown.
author: Delia Z.

description: The food and ambience was excellent. My only issue was that there was nothing on the menu that wasn't very spicy. I love spicy foods, but was trying to avoid it that night, and everything we ordered was spicy. Actually, the black beans were very plain (maybe right out of a can) so I mixed my food with the beans and it really toned it down. The chips were excellent, too.
author: Cathy O.

description: Disappointed.  This place used to be a solid 4.5 but dropped in my latest visit.  Got reservations this time only to find out happy hour is only bar and outside seating.  I was looking forward to the awesome salsa bar they used to have to find out that was removed.  I ordered the mole chicken b/c they used to have an awesome mole sauce only to be let down by luke warm chicken and cold sauce. The flavor of the sauce was also sweeter than usual.  My wife ordered the salmon and it was very flavorful and cooked just right.  She also ordered a couple margaritas and they were good and would definitely come back for the margaritas alone. Also, service was excellent.  Overall, I was disappointed but my wife love her food and drinks and I've had good experiences in the past so I'll be back.
author: Mike S.

description: Food was very reasonable and delicious. Chips and salsa are delivered to ur table without requesting it which is rare in this day. They were light and tasty with 3 different salsas to sample from.  Chili Verde was not too spicy, tender and very fatty if u like that.  The black beans were delish but rice was undercooked and many hard pieces that would crack ur teeth, so be careful.  I'm sure it is usually better but it was Friday night and super packed.  Request they NOT put coleslaw on top of rice if u don't like it that way.  Also, the flautas were very good too.  Regarding restaurant, it was dark so couldn't see if the restaurant was actually as slimy as it seemed;  also was very loud!  So, overall, they were careless in many areas which warranted the 3 stars but wanna try again later.
author: Mikala K.

description: Rachel kills it as a bartender. Very professional and knows her stuff. Can make any drink you can think of and ever pours a killer draft beer. Ask for the "Christy".
author: Joe K.

description:
Well, I really wanted to love this place based on the reviews but left feeling annoyed. 

Dining time: lunch

Ordering: we had to wait in line and individually place our orders. Then the cashier has to gather all the tickets together, decipher what you order and you pay. You then find a table, order drinks separately, wait for chips, get your own utensils, salsa, napkins etc and wait for your food. 

The salsa "bar" is really tiny and there's a line. Half the salsas are empty as well. Salsa is tasty but i spent so much time up and down from my seat I can't recall. 

Waited a long time for chips to be delivered to the table. 

Food service: every entree got delivered individually - so one taco comes, then one salad, and so on. Every person at our table has almost completed their meal and we are still arguing with multiple servers that one burrito has not been delivered. We're all all done eating at this point, minus the burrito. That is totally unacceptable. The wait staff came to our table at least three times to discuss the matter.  Make the burrito already!! Geez! And how about apologizing?? 

So. The food was good, but the meal not very relaxing, and just way too much work to be enjoyable.

Verdict: Tropisue-ño
author: Caryn U.

description: Was at Yerba Buena for a conference and stopped in. Loved it.  Very efficient service. Nice vi be.  Delicious soup and appetizer. Loved the experience and left feeling totally well fed. Will definitely go back.
author: Carol M.

description: Disappointed  the price, looks, smells, location, all good. The food flavor was shit! I was hoping that i had found a new regular spot..
author: Keith L.

description: We were there on a busy Thursday before we caught a nearby 7:30pm movie. The service was great as were the drinks. We'll be back.
author: Tess G.

description: The food was just ok. You order your food ahead of time which kind of takes away from the dining experience feels more like a cafeteria then a restaurant.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Some of the best Mexican I've had! I came here on a Friday night with my mom around 8:30 pm and it was packed! We were told it was a 40 min wait, but we were willing to wait and just grab a drink at the bar. It was perfect timing when 2 people got up from the bar so we just decided to sit there and order our meals at the bar! We both got the classic margs and they were delicious. They also serve you unlimited chips and a tray of 3 different sauces. Our bartender was great too and even brought me out some habanero sauce (I love spicy!). Our meals came out quick and were delicious. You get a ton of food for the price! I would highly recommend this Mexican restaurant and will be back when I'm in town again!
author: Despina P.

description:
This place is BUSY! Came here on a Friday night and had to wait for about 45 minutes. They take down your number and send you a text when you're up which is good, because we managed to walk around a little bit during our wait. 

FREE CHIPS AND SALSA! 
I loved this little appetizer that they brought out. Especially that orangey, hot one. 

Chicken Mole (4.5/5) 
I had the chicken mole with refried beans and rice and loved it! The chicken was tender, the sauce was amazing. Be careful though, I have a very mild peanut allergy and this dish has some peanuts in it. 

Watermelon Marguerita (5/5)
Really refreshing! Careful though, if you don't have a high tolerance to alcohol this might not be for you. Fortunately (or not), I do and I really enjoyed this drink. Not enough to make you drunk, but will make you tipsy. 

Service: (5/5) 
Our server explained to us very patiently all the hot items and gave us recommendations. She was very kind and had a great attitude.
author: Andrew L.

description: This was an awesome last minute choice with delicious food and really great drinks! The service was pretty great too, the one thing I would say I didnt enjoy was that we were sandwiched between 2 other tables and had little to no privacy.
author: Sabra M.

description: Loved it! Went twice in one week. Yummy food, great service and ambiance. Margaritas were on point and the menu options were so good I don't know what to pick! Scallops, shrimp, salmon, beef... all tasty!
author: Sangita P.

description: Went with a group of folks from a work conference. The drinks weren't consistent. The first Margarita was fine. The 2nd one wasn't good at all. Their quest sauce tasted like Gerber Carrots. I ordered some steak, which came with a small burrito. The steak was outstanding. The burrito contained a sauce that also tasted like gerber carrots baby food. People at my table agreed, so it wasn't just me. I wouldn't recommend taking clients here or just eating here in general.
author: Alex B.

description: Great experience, though a tad confusing at first. After ordering at the counter, the rest is mostly self severed. You order drinks at the bar, water from the water station, and serve your own salsa from the salsa cart. After watching a few people we figured it out- signs or a heads up would have been nice though. The food is very delicious. I especially loved the chips and salsa. It was fun trying the different flavors available. The steak super taco and chicken super quesadilla were very good too. Overall, good food for a reasonable price.
author: Caitlyn W.

description: Awesome food, awesome Michelada... Terrible, forgetful bartenders... Dad and I got our food just right as my sister and her husband was about to leave. Oh and we were still charged for it!
author: Nathan D.

description:
Wow, this place has gone waaaaay down hill.  I was hoping it would rebound because it's really the only place nearby that makes decent burritos for lunch.  Maybe their dinner plates are better...  But this place has been faltering for a while now.

The food recently has been slushy and unappetizing.  I ordered a Shrimp burrito and it had this old texture and smelled pungent.  Too much sea; not for me.  

The burritos are usually haphazardly and unevenly put together.  The rice is doughy and mushy.  They put so little sour cream and avocado that you can't taste them.

It would seem that whoever is running this place no longer loves it like they mean to.  You can't expect a good business to stay good if you don't spend the time to keep it up and running well constantly.

I would recommend you eat something else like a chicken quesadilla if you have to eat here, but you may still end up with a great burrito if you want to take the chance.
author: John M.

description:
Boyfriend and I went to Tropisueno for a date night Sunday night. This was our second time there, but our first time for dinner. We had reservations, but they weren't necessary and we were seated right away. We were immediately brought a hot and fresh basket of chips and three different kinds of salsa, all of which were extremely delicious. Overall, we both loved our food and drinks. 

I ordered the house margarita, carnitas taco and cheese enchilada. My boyfriend ordered the Tropisueno margarita, the barbacoa taco, and cheese tamales. Highly recommend all of them!
author: Anne W.

description: Ducked in here on a rainy night.  The stars of this place are the sauces and the slow cooked meats (especially if cooked or marinated in the sauces).  The bartender is friendly and great at working through the crowd, even on crowded, busy nights.  He even took the time to explain the menu (and it was busy).  Great margaritas.  Fun atmosphere.
author: Greta R.

description: Great place for a drink and dinner. One of my favorite places in SF for Mexican food and margaritas. Try their hibiscus Margs. Yummmmm
author: Nabpreet K.

description:
One of the best all around dining spots in SF for sure. 
Friendly and personable staff despite it being busy and packed all the time. 
A great happy hour, delicious main entrees, and endless chips and salsa!

Came here once for HH which runs from 4-6pm M-F @ the bar and patio area - the place fills up quick so the outside patio area is probably your best bet unless you get there early.
$5 cocktails and $3 tacos - chicken and beef were my favorite. They have a lot of other hh items like ceviche which was delicious! They have an extensive margarita list but I'm not big on tequila based drinks - so I went with a mango mojito - amazing!

Dinner is equally good - however make reservations if you can - they are pretty much always busy and the wait can be from 30mins-1hr. I've gotten the chicken w mole poblano - very good, chicken was cooked juicy and tender. The chili verde was my favorite - super flavorful and tender pork in tomatoes/spices. The rice and beans are on point and of course the endless chips and salsa. Theres 3 salsas - a green verde sauce (not that hot), tomato salsa (med), and the creamier tomato salsa (hot) - all are good!

The staff are wonderful - always checking in to make sure your table is ok. Refilling chips/salsa and water without us asking. Awesome food, great staff, good happy hour, and very decent prices for quality of food and service - no complaints.
author: Brenda L.

description: Great Vibe and ambiance! Would definitely go Again. Their chips and 3 different sauces which come along with it is delicious. The yellow sauce is super spicy! An amazing place to hang out!
author: Zunaira C.

description: Used to be one of my favorite places downtown. But everything about the meal was bad. The chile relleno was soggy and the beans tasteless. The service was also disorganized even though there weren't that many people.
author: Sutee D.

description: I went back again and this time for the Chicken with Mole Poblano. Let me tell you..it was absolutely amazing. I've always wanted to try mole and I finally got to. The chicken was a leg and thigh. It is braised in the mole sauce which is made with dry chiles, spices, nuts, herbs and chocolate. The mole sauce a wonderful combination of sweet, nutty, and smoke-y. The chicken was nice and juicy, and Isoped up every last bit of the sauce with it. The Chicken Mole is not to be missed here!
author: Joy W.

description: Rachel the bartender is amazing! Sit at the bar and watch this pro mixologist go to work for ya! Rachel is da bomb!
author: Christy S.

description:
Let's say you were clickin heels with an ethnically vague Girl in a small Latin American country and she said let's get happy hr at this kind of Americanized happy hour localation stuffed to the proverbial gills with girls who scream "Hola!!!!" but can't speak any actual Spanish and then someone gave you the bill and you were like to what Southeast Asian country is this a foreign aid check and then you passed out on the steps because the itsy bitsy tacoish stuff you bought with ASEAN aid was smaller than.....

Gadunk.
author: Tom K.

description:
I was in San Francisco Memorial Day weekend and my friends and I and we saw the reviews were great for this place so we stopped by given we were nearby! First of all I did not expect it to be like chipotle but then very nice modern to sit down in after grabbing your food.

All I know is, I saw the women cooking behind the counter and I knew it was going to be Authentic Hispanic food. All the food was being cooked in front of you. The prices were a little high for being a chipotle type restaurant but *faints* it was worth the price. The food was incredible. I ordered the enchiladas with chicken and a pork tamale. The sauce in the enchiladas was so tasty not too tomato-ey and a little spicy! I've never ordered a tamal from anywhere except my grandmas but this came fairly close to being the best tamale I've had (love you grams) 

Would I drive five hours again and come back here? 100 times yes!
author: Natalia M.

description: Came here for a quick lunch on Saturday. Was really disappointed. We sat outside and the place was over run by pigeons. It's really just a fast-food joint where you have to wait in line for 15 minutes just to put in your order. The Only redeeming quality about this place is that they give you a lot of free deep fried chips. I got the veggie quesadilla and my boyfriend got the carnitas burrito. My veggie quesadilla was accidently delivered to another table. I was so hungry out of desperation i took a bite of my boyfriend burrito. It was terrible. I couldn't even take more than 2 bites it was so gross. We also ordered guacomole which was the most waterdown disgusting excuse for guacomole i have ever had outside of a grocery store brands...definitely not homemade. It was awful. The veggie quesadilla finally came and it was full of yummy veggies but barely any cheese! Isn't this supposed to be a quesadilla?!?!? Don't come here. It is cheap but seriously not worth the 8 dollars.
author: Anne S.

description:
Made reservations here based on the volume of good Yelp reviews, but very disappointed. Taking a trip into the city, on a weekend night, fighting 101 traffic, finding parking downtown is already a challenge. Finding this restaurant for the first time, at night, without your cell gps telling you where it is ... also a big challenge. 

Upon entry, a line of about ten people. No hostess and no eye contact from serving staff. Very busy, peak dinner service, I get it. Not worried since we have a reservation. Hostess finally returns and seats us right away. Table for two in the corner, but seating is extremely tight. I could bump elbows with the woman sharing the benched against the wall seating next to me if I ate left-handed. Oh and because of that our conversation could not be at all private, so we kept it to chit chat and about the food and drink.

Husband requested ice water while we were deciding on apps... We got room temp flat water. Ok, we will ask our actual waiter when he comes. The chips and salsa were very good... Freshly baked and perfectly salty with three salsas to choose from. I could eat just this and be perfectly happy, honestly. We ordered empenadas, guacamole, and chicken flauta appetizers and each a margarita. It was about ten minutes until we got our drinks and guacamole. House margarita was fine. The guacamole was a little on the small side, but very good and flavorful. Not too chunky not too creamy, just right. The empenadas were too cheesy gooey on the inside for my liking, but the flautas were good. Crispy on the outside and the chicken very tender on the inside and the sauce was pretty good.

Upon the waiter return we placed our dinner order for enchiladas nopales and my husband ordered shrimp sauteed with onions in a red sauce (not sure menu name). He also, again , asked for ice water and some tortillas and a side of cheese. We both ordered drink refills. Here is where dinner service began its steep decline. We waited what seemed forever for our food. In the meantime, another lukewarm glass of water with no ice is delivered to the table. Ok, so if you want ice, order a margarita. Note taken. But wait, here comes a drink... Only one? Before we can ask, that server is off and running, probably from the angered look on my husbands face... Neither of us want our warm water, and now only one of us has a cold drink. So we share it . Not much fun. But I digress. 

Dinner plates are finally delivered... Well mine is a dinner plate. My husbands is an appetizer? Um all he has had so far is a bit of guac, the two empanadas and a margarita... And he is looking at six smallish shrimp in some sauce. They hand him a towel, which turns out has the tortillas... But he can fit all the shrimp in one tortilla, so he was not happy. He made it work into two, so it was more like a meal, but not really. No cheese to be found and no second drink for me... Oh did I mention we were here to celebrate my birthday? 

My enchiladas probably would have tasted a lot better, if I didnt have an unhappy husband, an empty cocktail glass and no server in sight... and rightfully so. The service was not on point, not delivering what is ordered, not informing the small size of the shrimp and no ice, no cheese, no margarita, and no waiter to relay this to because he doesnt check back. By the time he comes over with a complimentary dessert, proceeds to sing happy birthday with my husband... Which ok thank you. And which in theory is a nice gesture, but I happen to be allergic to strawberries so I could not even sample it, lol. Sorry, but those of us with food allergies know how frustrating this can be. it was not worth even saying anything but thank you at that point. We were done and ready to go home. 

When he did bring the bill, I did address him saying, I hope there was no cheese and no second margarita for me since they were never delivered. Oh, no they are not on the bill, he says... but the cake is on me... Um okay. So what you are saying is you never ordered it so thats why we never got it. Makes sense, but we should overlook that for the free cake and song... Mmm no. 

It was so not worth $100 before the tip. About 25% overpriced based on the poor service level. My husband would have been happier taking me to Chevys, getting fast service and only a tab of $75 with tip. But he wanted to do something nice for my birthday. Plus add the thirty minute drive into the city  and the SF weekend night parking fees. Just saying. No matter how good some of the food may be here, you need wait staff to support the prices you are demanding. Only when you have that will you get these customers to return. And unfortunately I dont foresee that happening.
author: Kelly H.

description: This place is cute! Lots of good drink options and a fun atmosphere. We ordered the fried plantains and tacos al pastor. The plantains were delicious. The drinks were nice and strong. The tacos were bland and boring. Also rice and beans were ok but nothing great.
author: Erin M.

description: I don't know San Francisco area very well, but i am Mexican and this was the most FAKE Mexican food, you might as well serve Taco Bell. The restuarant cover is great, it's super cute and the drinks are STRONG, which is a good thing, but the food is NOT GOOD. I waited in line for 40 minutes on a VERY busy Friday night. To top it off, that dinner & drinks for 2 was stupidly OVERPRICED at $89. Gosh, i can still remember how bad that salsa was, they give you 3 and they're all bad.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I have been coming here for 6 momths (probably about 6 times = one a month) and LOVE IT! I can't believe it has taken this long to review! I haven't had a bad thing on the menu. Oh, the scallop appetizer - skip it. The scallops were over-salted and over-cooked.

The huarache and tacos are my go-tos. The salsa and chips are AH-MAZING! The chips, so fresh and crispy, not overly salty.

The pork dishes are also good and the shrimp appetizer (with butter and garlic) is so good I could eat it all day long.

Check it out but if you're going for dinner, make reservations. They get pretty packed pretty quick and the wait can be over an hour long. Oh, and make reservations at least a week in advance, it can be tough to get in. 

The atmosphere is pretty noisy and the service has been hit or miss. They've messed up some orders here and there (put sour cream on when I specified no dairy) and at times taken a long time to take an order or deliver the food after ordering. But the food is so good I will keep coming back.
author: Jess A.

description: Great drinks, good "upscale" Mexican food (read: not burritos from the Mission), friendly staff, and good vibes all around. I'd recommend this as a lively place to grab dinner and drinks after work.
author: Cynthia S.

description: My wife and I found this great restaurant on yelp while in SF and we're so glad we did. We've been there twice in the past month. The location is excellent (walkable from Union Square) but the best part is the food. Authentic, fresh and delicious. Both times we sat at the bar and the guys (Sergio and Gage) kept us entertained while making us great drinks (nice and strong). Come early because this place gets packed. This will be our go-to place whenever we're in SF. Keep up the great job Tropisueno!
author: Ricardo G.

description:
