I love this place so much and my husband go here as much as we can (probably too much, if we're being honest). It's our go-to spot to take out of town visitors. 
The margaritas are SO good and expertly made. And all of the bartenders are so nice and knowledgeable! All of the food we've had is amazing but the standouts for us are the Platanos Fritos, Camarones al Mojo de ajo, and the Chile Verde. You really can't go wrong with anything here. 

One note: they are VERY busy! Sometimes you can get lucky and find a spot at the bar, but it's best to have a reservation.
author: Ashley F.

description: The service was way slow, the portion of Guacamole was small for the price! They did have some Amazing salsas which was the highlight of my dinner! When the food came out the beans and rice were just like warm as if they had been sitting on the plate. The lighting is very dark and the music/bar is pretty loud.
author: J.C. F.

description: Good decor, decent salsas, friendly staff. But the Food is just very bland, uninspiring, and ingredients don't seem fresh. Can't think of a reason to come back.
author: Alexander S.

description: I must say that I Head heard the food is good. I just stopped by for happy hour. No  complaints on the drinks and apps I had at the Bar. I do want to say that the two bartenders were excellent. They provided excellent service. One bartender name was Wayne and I forgot the other. Maybe Andre, but not positive.
author: L P.

description:
Pretty cool place for mexican food!

We finally had a chance to visit this place! Walked by a few times and it was always full and had a wait. The decor inside is pretty nice, with a lively atmosphere and warm soft lighting. The seats are a little crowded--you can hear the folks talking in the other tables because they sit so close to you, but it's SF so that's fine. The wait staff are also pretty nice and professional. You even get a candy at the end :)

The food itself is also pretty good. The chips/appetizer had 3 kinds of dip, and each was pretty interesting, especially the orange one--had a kick to it. For the main meal I got the seafood soup. When I ordered it the waiter said it was "spicy", and man, was he right! It was SO spicy I had trouble talking, even with water. So if you like spicy, this is the soup for you.

In terms of price, the place is ok. The price is a little high, but was worth it (the seafood soup had a lot of seafood, like large chunks of scallop etc).

Overall, a pretty good place for a meal or hang out in the bar area.
author: Henry L.

description:
I live closer to the mission so I always default there for cheap burritos and tacos. Given that I prefer this place to any taqueria in the mission I've visited.

Anyways this place is pretty good for what it is! Great location and prices aren't too bad. $8 for a regular burrito. Chips and salsa are complimentary. The chips are so yummy! I like how light and thin they are. 

Beef burrito, fajitas style is what I got and I liked. Will return again or default here for lunch when in area!
author: Mimi T.

description: Seriously da bomb. Tons of Mexican spices. Fun bartenders. Margaritas that makes you want to salsa. Food that you wish you had two stomach. I got the fish of the day and it was so much food. Super good value too. Totes coming back here.
author: Christine H.

description: Awesome happy hour! Great house margaritas and plenty of small dishes to pick from. Guac was fantastic as were the chips and salsa. Service was slow but very considerate - even offered us blankets and a heat lamp on the patio!
author: Sam M.

description:
If you are taking someone on a date around the sf downtown area, this is a great place. Go shopping, eat at a fun mexican restaurant, watch a movie after!
I really liked the vibe, foods and drinks. Service was just ok.

Chips-fantastic
Chile Verde- really good
author: Moto B.

description:
The service is always good, but the food is always lackluster.

Came here with a friend who wanted to try this place. I knew from a prior experience that it was so-so that time, so I wasn't hopeful.

With good reason. The portions of some dishes are smallish, many of the flavors just not authentic tasting. 

The drinks are good, at least there's that. Music can be too much at times.
author: William M.

description: This place definitely deserves at least 4 stars. Good food, happy ambient, polite staff. Will definitely go back.
author: Iman S.

description:
This hotspot is clearly a fav to many. Bar was packed to the gills! That why we were delighted to be whisked to a table due to a cancellation after initially being quoted an hour wait. Good on ya, hostess!

From there, you can measure the experience two-fold:

Food, 5 stars, from start to finish. Lovely house margaritas with a smoky salt rim, warm chips with three kinds of yummy salsas with heat variations, guacamole (not done table-side, but lovely nonetheless), a delicious mexican shrimp entree in creamy red sauce, warm mushroom empanadas, a lively salad, and a simple bean and cheese burrito for the kid (although, rice was added inside, to the kid's dismay and disappointment).

Service, 3 stars. We had a busy server, so it wasn't as stellar as it could've been. Hostess was awesome, so much so that we tipped her. 

All's well that ends well with a sharp and authentic experience.
author: Lisa A.

description: Years a go this used to be a good choice for Mexican food in the Moscone Center Area. They had a good menu. I came here again after many years at lunch time, when they have a fast menu where you order at the counter and they bring your food to your table. You have to get alcoholic drinks separately at the bar, where the service was terrible. The food was also very bad. I had chile relleno - which  looked like it was covered by a tick layer of  pancake mix as batter. The filling (picadillo) was crumpy. I was hungry and I ate it, mostly filling with the accompanying rice and beans, but honesty afterwards I regretted it. Nearby there are better choices to eat and I went for this because my old memories and the high Yelp review. I am guessing most reviewers don't now about authentic Mexican food and just say four starts if they feel full. My conclusion was to avoid this place in the future. And for better Mexican food go to the Mission.
author: Paco R.

description: I'm from Los Angeles, so I get to enjoy the best mexican food in the whole state. The service here was great! However, the food was not. No taste and the tamales were 90% masa. Come down to So. Cal to have a real taste of Mexico! ;)
author: Brett J.

description:
I went there for a dinner on a Thursday night since I was in the mood for some Mexican and didn`t want to walk too far. I went there expecting a long wait but got a seat within 5 minutes. I read some great reviews about the Chips and Salsa( 3 types) and boy, it didn`t disappoint. Do get them without fail !!! I had the Huaraches Tres Cochinitas along with a Tecate and it was awesome. The portion size was huge as well for the prices paid( 10$ for an entree, AMAZING :) ). 

Only complaint was that the servers were kind of missing after taking our orders and that can get a bit frustrating especially after a long day`s work. 

But, do check this place out if you`re in the SOMA neighborhood.
author: Pranav B.

description: We ordered the dish with carne asada and it came out tasting dry, burnt & full of salt. We also got the ceviche flight and two of them were inedible due to how salty they were. Two stars are only for the decent chips and salsa.
author: Chelsea V.

description:
Awesome food, creative and strong margaritas, friendly service, stupendous chips... overall great, would go back anytime I was visiting the Yerba Buena area! I love that they take reservations, because they get so busy.

We got our table really fast-- even a little earlier than the reservation, and they gave us the best chips I've ever had in a Mexican restaurant... Good enough that I remember them and want to comment on them. The salsa that came with them was equally delicious and different.

We got the platanos fritos to start, which were fantastic. I love plantains anywhere, everywhere, and these were a fantastic, and pretty light way to start our meal. They were both seasoned and cooked beautifully.

For entrees, my husband ordered the camarones tropisueno which he loved. I tasted them and agreed they were really wonderful. I had the veggie and cheese enchiladas, which were fantastic and easy to finish all of... even on top of chips, plantains, and some killer margaritas. I'm pretty sure mine had elderflower liqueur in it, which is always my go-to, but I think my husband's house margarita was actually a little better.

Recommend to anyone looking for a fun, festive meal in the Yerba Buena area! My only complaint is the noise-- it was incredibly loud at dinnertime so not ideal for a date or catching up with someone you haven't seen in awhile!
author: Allison M.

description:
We came for lunch in a Saturday. The chips are amazing and the Salsa bar has everything you want! Don't be intimidated by the order on the fly concept... Just walk up at tell them what you want... We sat at the bar are had the best margaritas. Johnathan was awesome and help us get in the groove. Loved it so much we came back a day later and we are old pros. 
Mucho Garcia's
author: Mark M.

description:
Food, authenticity, service, and locale. I look for those qualities in a restaurant. Tropisueño has all those and does them well. One drawback that I was surprised with is that they gave me flour tortillas. I wish they would offer flour tortillas as optional instead of the default. Next time I will ask for corn tortillas.

I had the chicken fajitas and they were very delicious.  Another plus is that they have a salsa bar with a wide selection. 

I noticed that they have margaritas. They go well with the coming summer months. 

I think I will make this my default Mexican restaurant in the financial district unless I find a better one.
author: Julio E.

description:
Tropisueno ruined my expectation for chips & salsa! I can never see them and taste them the same way I did! And my self-control had been seriously tested. (It failed.)

It is valued and delicious eat in the middle of downtown SF, I heard it is also a good and efficient spot for lunch. Truly best chips and salsa, and it is free and unlimited!
We came on a busy Friday happy hour, very crowded but the outside seat was nice. Ordered nachos and it was really delicious and huge! After happy hour, we ordered chicken soup and a combo plate to share. The portion was gigantic--or maybe we just ate too much chips and salsa :P
The cocktail Jamaicazo is AMAZING....! The alcohol wasn't too strong, which to some might be bad, but for a lightweight like me I LOVE IT. It was also really refreshing!

Now I keep thinking about those chips & salsa...need to go back again! I will gladly run 10 miles just so I can stuff 3 bowls of them next time.
author: Ya K.

description: Stopped in on a Sunday evening for dinner after seeing a flick at Metreon. Surprisingly the place was hopping but there were some tables available so we were seated immediately. I liked that the menu clearly identified gluten free options. Service was good but not stellar. The food was a solid 3+ stars and the chips are dangerous. Meals are generously proportioned - my husband brought home more than half his meal. We went a little over a week ago and I already forgot what I had so not the most memorable meal ever. Even so, Tropisueno is a fine choice with a nice atmosphere.
author: Robin N.

description:
Visited this place for my second time last night on a busy Tuesday. I left the restaurant somewhat disappointed. Mostly disappointed in the food. 

Food: I was so disappointed in the food :(   (please note that this called for a sad face)
We walked in here expecting amazing Mexican food, but it was mediocre. The salsas all tasted the same. Maybe my tastebuds are broken. The taco was just okay. The enchilada was also just okay. I guess what we paid didn't seem to be worth what we got. 
             Enchilada/Taco plate....12.95
             Pinot Noir glass....11
             Tampiqueno....17
             Corona.....6

~$60 with Tax/Tip/SF Surcharge

Service: The service was great. They're always busy during dinner time so I knew we'd have a wait. They take reservations but can only make them online. I accidentally canceled my reservations, so we had to wait for about half an hour for a party of two. The hostess and our server were both very friendly and accommodating. Our server tried making small talk with me which showed a lot of effort on her part, most servers don't really take the time to do so. 

Atmosphere/Location: Driving to downtown is always a pain. But parking at the 5th and Mission garage makes things a bit more bearable. Tropisueño has a very fun/laid back vibe, with latin music blasting at full force, and everyone chatting it up. It's somewhat on the smaller side so it has a cozy feel to it.
author: Stefany Z.

description: Saw the reviews and photos on Yelp so wanted to try it out. The lighting was a little dark inside. Almost too dark to read the menu. Went on a Saturday night. 45 minute wait. No reservations allowed. Was a little loud inside but not necessarily to the point where you had to yell to hear each other. Carne Asada was excellent!! Chips and a selection of 3 salsas was very tasty. Service was 6-7/10. Short glasses of margarita were $11.50, which is way too expensive in my opinion. I would go back. Just not very often.
author: Lauren S.

description: Chips and salsa was bomb, the chips were lightly fried and really nice. The tamale isn't great but the carne asada and carnitas enchilada was delicious. Order the plantains as an appetizer they were perfect. I wasn't amazed by anything else
author: Arrieyana C.

description:
Yayyy! for the food!
amazing food and quick service.
this place is a taqueria by day. You order your food and find your self a seat. can get very busy..but for a stag- finding a seat wasnt difficult at all
author: Susmitha D.

description: Good choice for Mexican in the city (outside of the mission). They do a great job with food and drinks here. It tends to be more traditional Mexican versus Californian interpretations. I have had several things here for dinner and lunch. Always great. Try the homemade hot sauce!
author: Jonah K.

description: Hidden gem..Been to a lot Of Mexican place.This one is Best!!Food is Authentic and fresh.Mango spicy Margarita is too good.During lunch time they have Salsa bar ..Love it.specially Green Salsa.Few time I had dinner too.During dinner time this place become fine dine.Please serve Salsa during dinner time too.
author: Ruchi M.

description: This is probably the best Mexican food I have tried recently. The pork sandwich is very special. I will try mole next time
author: Yinjia Z.

description: Went here for lunch today. Ordered the gringo salad with grilled chicken.  The salad greens were not fresh and there was no salad dressing. The chicken breast was smashed so it was overcooked and dry as jerky. One side was burnt black. The chicken was cold and tough.  It would have been better to get a box salad at Marriott market. Not a place I would return to.
author: Marlene B.

description: They were full but accommodated a party of 3 as long as we left within 1.5 hours for an upcoming reservation. Server was to the point, chips and salsa had an amazing taste. One of our party had his food cooked on the rare side and a server immediately got him a new plate within 5 minutes. All of us loved the food and we were appreciative of the constant refills of chips, salsa, and water. Would highly recommend this place.
author: Simran S.

description:
I fell in love with al pastor for the very first time when I tried it here. It's so flavorful, tender, and juicy. The pineapple doesn't make it too overly sweet. I usually order 3 al pastor tacos and eat them with a variety of salsa from their salsa bar. 

The complimentary chips are fried really thin, which I like. 

The quesadillas are good too, lots and lots of cheese, and it's huge. 

I always get the watermelon agua fresca - it's very refershing and not overly sweet.  

If you come here, you must try the al pastor. The enchilada with al pastor is next on my list of things to try, well, actually, anything I can add al pastor to is on my list of things to try next.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I was looking at the pictures and almost did not recognize this place! The pictures are way outdated and the place looks better than it does in those old photos. They have a whole section for outdoor seating, they have a full bar and dining area. Happy hour ends at 6pm. 

This place gets packed so either make reservations or come early. Happy hour is worth trying. Cheap and huge proportions for happy hour food. The house margarita wasn't as strong as I would like it but still refreshing. The food wasn't spectacular but it wasn't bad either. Their chips was delicious though and their three salsas are crackin'! Our waiter was hilarious and very personable.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Tropisueno is one of my favorite restaurants in the city to get Baja Fish Tacos and chips with salsa. 
(Note: Chips & Salsa are free if you're ordering food "for here" and cost ~ $1 something if ordering your food "to go"). They have a nice salsa bar. Totally feel free to sample all of them! 
They also have very tasty horchata and margaritas. Try going to this place for lunch or happy hour. If you plan to go to their happy hour and want a place to sit, I suggest getting there early around 3pm.
author: Vivian L.

description: I haven't tried the food yet, but I called to make a reservation for a Saturday lunch and the woman said "you have to go to yelp.com" and hung up on me. She didn't give me a chance to say that yelp is not currently supporting lunch reservations which was why I called in the first place.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I made a reservation for 6:30 pm on a Friday night--an extremely busy time to visit--but we were seated right on time with no wait. +1 star

The chips and 3 kinds of salsa (red, green, and cheese) were great, and refills were easy to get, too.  +1 star

I ordered some guacamole to go with the chips, and it was delicious.  It was a little smaller than I would have expected, but it tasted great, and it was a perfect compliment to the 3 salsas. +1 star

I ordered the Huaraches "Tres Cochinitas" (three thick tortilla "sandals" with three kinds of pork, chile verde, carnitas and al pastor w pineapple).  OMG, it was amazing, and I ate every last bite and still wanted more.  I had never had a thick tortilla sandal, but I want more!  +1 star

We ordered the flan and the tres leches cake for desert, and both were great, too. +1 star

Overall, I loved the food, and I will DEFINITELY go back.  It's hard to find good Mexican food in the Bay Area, but this one is a keeper.
author: George K.

description: I had the grilled Carne Asada dish. The food was ok, but kind of reminded me of Chevy's. Also, they forgot my tortillas!!!
author: Gena K.

description: Very nice staff and the label was clearly marked for dairy free, gluten free, and vegetarian items, but the pozole vegetariano that I had was just okay. The house margarita was awesome.
author: Tonya H.

description:
The best thing they have on the menu is their orange salsa. It's as addictive as nicotine. If I go a few days without it I start having lucid dreams about Chow Yun Fat. When I'm in the office late I take off my shirt and massage the salsa into my naked chest. 

Their lunch menu is infinitely better than their dinner menu because lunch offers burritos. I like their shrimp burrito but that's just my preference, innit? Get whatever meat you want just get the orange salsa or you will regret it your whole life.
author: Rod A.

description: My favorite go-to while in San Fran. I love love love this place. There is always a line either during lunch or at night. Best Mexican food out there. Can't go wrong with anything you order - tacos, nachos, stuffed peppers, guac, fresh fruit drinks (at lunch time), etc.
author: Kim A.

description: Solid food. Love the salsa bar. Lines are long and it's not fast.  I wish they could split the sit-down vs to-go orders.  To go takes a while when you're trying to get back to work.
author: Jon M.

description: Absolutely delicious authentic Mexican food! Loved everything about this place. The margaritas were outstanding
author: Kim C.

description: Came here right at 5:15 and was with my boyfriend who was on crutches. They literally sat us at a tiny table. We put the table next to us cuz he need to prop his leg up . They then sat someone right next to us I told the manger to reseat us which he did , which was cool of him. The food is NOT good , similar to chevys . The drink was nothing special and the waitress had a resting b*** face and bad energy. Even my boyfriend noticed it. My food came out cold and I had to send it back . We are staying at the four seasons Hotel and I regret just not going to their lobby bar/restaurant. I have a friend who told me she had a similar experience here . Will never repeat . Not authentic Mexican food .
author: Danielle M.

description:
Came here before with my wife and some friends. The food was decent, the place was a bit loud but I was up for coming back.

Made a reservation for 6 people over a week ahead of time, Tropisueno apparently booked a private event the same night and didn't decide to tell us until the night before, sending us scrambling & looking for another place that could accommodate a group at the last minute.

So be careful about relying on reservations made here, they apparently haven't gotten all of the logistics figured out yet.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I visit San Francisco for work and every time I come, I have to go to Tropisueno for lunch.  The lunch taqueria is absolutely delicious and filling.  This time around, I was able to go to Tropisueno for dinner without realizing that the menu for lunch and dinner are completely different.  

I like the fact that they "transform" into a modern Mexican restaurant for dinner with traditional plates as well as excellent dinner plates.  The appetizers all looked delicious as well.

My wife and I spit the appetizer and the main meal.  I remembered that the servings here were big so we didn't want to be overstuffed plus they start your meal off with the best tortilla chips you will ever have.  They are light, crispy and perfectly salted, they come with 3 excellent salsa's that range from Hot to Standard, the orange one (hot) is my favorite as the heat isn't overpowering (keep in mind, I like spicy food), but, leaves a great flavor with the heat.  For my wife who doesn't like spicy food, the orange was too hot but the green and red were excellent.  The red one has a small kick to it, but, nothing overpowering.  The green one was excellent as it tasted extremely fresh.  We added on a guacamole because I remembered how much I like it and how fresh it was.  They add jalapeno and cilantro, which I generally don't like in my guacamole but we weren't disappointed. 

For appetizer, we had the Platanos Fritos and the Empanadas De Hongos.  We both loved the Platanos and my wife was not a fan of the Empanadas, however, I didn't think they were great but I enjoyed them.  We finished the Platanos, but, not the Empanadas.

For dinner, we split the Tampiqueño and it was excellent.  The steak was cooked perfectly with an excellent seasoning.  I mixed it with the pinto beans, mexican rice and guacamole and absolutely loved it.  The beef enchilada was very good as well, I love the dough (?) they use to make the enchilada, its a little dense but extremely tasty.

I can't wait to go back the next time I am in San Francisco, I highly recommend it as it is an excellent Mexican restaurant.
author: MichaelAnthony C.

description: Long wait without reservations on a Saturday night. So fortunate to be seated 45 min wait. Service is very very slow. Do not come here if expecting to be in and out. We come here for the amazing food. It is so authentic with such flavor. The drinks seemed to have been watered down this time around. This visit was just ok. Next time I'll just stop by for lunch.
author: Christina J.

description:
The place is usually crowded, so be prepared to wait. As for us, the host saw us leaving because we dint want to wait & offered us a table for 5 in ten mins. :) 

The chips & salsa were amazing & the cocktails too. And the rice with the main dish is tasty as well. Only con is portion sizes for the appetizers are very small.
author: A S.

description: Amazing food! We were seated quickly and seriously, everything was so good. We ordered the enchiladas de nopal, empanadas de queso y hongos, and ceviche. Delicious cocktails and great atmosphere. Tropisueño is one of my new favorite places. Check it out!
author: Elizabeth V.

description: I thought this was just okay & honestly was disappointed after all the amazing reviews. The chips & salsa bar were awesome, but the fish taco was soggy & tasteless. The shredded beef enchilada was flavorful, but it was fatty. I only gave it a third star because the pico was spot on & the green salsa was delicious.
author: Andrea R.

description: Omg! This place was fantastic! The food was fresh and the staff was friendly. I went for lunch while visiting the area for a work conference. It was by far one of my favorite restaurants near the Moscone Center! Service was fast and the chips provided were thin and fresh! The guacamole was amazing too! If you're craving veggie quesadillas or guac go for it!
author: T M.

description: Went here for lunch and it was delicious! It was definitely more of a taqueria style setup where you go and order and then seat yourself. I'm excited to try the dinner menu.
author: Diana K.

description: Came here with a coworker twice last week I had the fish tacos the first time around and the chile relleno plate the second time. My coworker had a two item plate and a burrito. The plates come with plenty of food and the burrito was pretty big both of us were full getting the plates. The fish tacos are a nice size for the price but lack taste although nothing some of their salsa couldn't fix. They have a wide range of different salsas which all are pretty good and two are on the spicier side. They have outdoor seating and are pet friendly.  The service is really good if you ask for something they are on top of it. The things keeping me from giving 5 stars is the salsa bar is small only accommodates one person at a time unless you know the person you can butt elbows to grab salsa and the lack of flavor on the fish tacos.
author: Miguel C.

description: Really nice service but the food was not the greatest Mexican food I have had. Felt overprice for the simple flavors and average quality. Wished it was more special.
author: Cindy S.

description:
Came here to Tropisueno for National Margarita Day this past Monday.  I've been waving the flag for margaritas for a long time since it is THE most popular drink in the country.  Thus when I got there, I was quite surprised at how uncrowded it was.  We sat outside in their "patio", if you think a bunch of tables and chairs in that walkway count as a patio.  Since it was happy hour the crowds did build up and since the happy hour order deadline was 5:45pm, my group was itching to get our final orders in before the window closed.  After multiple times trying to find a server to take our order, we did indeed find someone to put in orders for a fish taco, nachos, ceviche, and guacamole.  The food was OK, decently cheap and not really authentic.  

I probably should try their regular menu on another visit but for now, they stay at this rating.
author: Ben H L.

description:
After checking out a pop-up Etsy fair we stopped here for a bite to eat. My bestie and I were thrilled to see it was GOOD! Honestly it wasn't 5 stars good but a consistent "if I am ever in the area again I'll eat here again" good. I had the combo platter with a chicken taco and cheese enchilada. The taco was more authentic with cabbage, meat, and onions (no onions for me). The enchilada was great. The typical beans and rice accompaniment went well. The chips were going to be the death of us though lol. 
My bestie loved her meal but she DID say she was so hungry a leather boot probably would have been ok that point. I believe she had a combo plate as well. 
I'm rarely in SF but if ever in the area again, I'd like to come back and try their build your own taco bar. 

Now, it was kinda loud and dinner service does NOT start until 5:30. So an early dinner is not possible. Keep that in mind when making plans!!!!!

I dont see how this place could disappoint other than the hours issues :)
author: Christina T.

description: Had an excellent dinner here with my 12yo daughter while visiting SF for the weekend. The food was delicious, the atmosphere fun and vibrant, and the waitstaff were super friendly and attentive. What a great time we had!
author: Myriam G.

description: The food was fine but the place is a little too commercial for my sensibilities. Caters to tourists (which, as a visitor to the city, I guess that is what I was...but I'd rather indulge in neighborhood joints).
author: Celina C. N.

description: Came here around 7 PM on Thursday night and was told the wait would be around 40 minutes for two people. No problem, so we gave them my number and they texted us that the table was ready only about 20 minutes later! As soon as we sat down we were given delicious tortilla chips with three types of salsa. I ordered the Chili Verde - delicious tender pork with rice and beans. My husband ordered the Tampiqueno - marinated steak with rice and beans. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals! Server was very nice and the manager came over to fill our glasses and ask how we were doing. If I ever make it back to San Francisco, I will be visiting again!
author: Tara Q.

description: I was staying at the Marriott Marquis and was looking for a place to eat for dinner. I noticed that this Mexican place had some great reviews. It is located on Yerba Buena street on the rear side of the hotel, which was very convenient. I got there at about 9:15 PM on a Tuesday night. (They close at 10 PM). There are lots of tables there but I chose to sit at the bar instead of being "seated". The bartenders there were very nice and helpful. There was also a ?manager? walking around and asking the customers how everything is going, which was nice to see. I ordered three pastor tacos (about $17) which come with rice and beans. I ordered a Modelo Negro which they had on draft (about $7). The food came out fairly quickly in about 10-15 minutes. The food was really good. I am a fan of Mexican food and this place was very good. I was in and out of there in about 30 minutes which is always a plus. The setting is nice in the evening and I can see a group of co-workers going there for drinks after a busy day. I would definitely return there when I am in the area again.
author: Jason P.

description: So so. It had good reviews so we went there.  Limited menu. Just ok service. It's in the side of a hotel.  I wouldn't go back if in the neighborhood again. My beef was so tough I couldn't eat it.
author: Lori R.

description:
For starters we had the Guacamole and it was tasty with their unlimited chips. 

The one thing that was odd and I'll take a star off just for that was that they all our small plates away for 20 minutes preparing for food that hasn't come in yet.  I realize that they are trying to make sure we get out for the next setting but that was odd.   And bugged me a bit.   Take a star off for that kind of  stuff. 

I liked the Pollo Asado chicken was slighly dry but I still recommend it.    

My Sister in law had the steak and that was good. 

My daughter had a kids burritto they make special and it was pretty huge. 

Two other things I came here for Happy hour and the tequila was $4 bucks so that was good.   But then it gets packed fast for Happy Hour and tight.   So the seating is really prime. 

The outside seating you might have to deal with pigeons bothering you.  

Single Bathroom stalls for men and women so line can get annoying.  If its too long try your luck in Marriott.
author: Homer S.

description:
Great food and honest prices! The food here will run you less than a trip to Chevy's people. The drinks are semi-pricey but they are worth it. The margs are almost all $10, there is one that's $14. The other cockies are between $11-$14, but they really are such thoughtfully crafted drinks with lovely combinations. They have a special salt rim paired with each tequila-based cocktail and these drinks really pack a punch too. I may or may not have gotten an insider tip that while the Marg de la Casa is in a pint glass and the others are in small rock glasses, the Casa has less alcy-hol lol. Don't ask how I found that out, but let's just be clear, I didn't drunkenly ask, ok? Rude. 

I had the Tropisueno margarita and it was great and sour and bitter just like I like my men. Rachel, the bartender, suggested the Violeta next so I took her recommendation and it was a lovely sweet reprieve for my bitter soul and palate. 

I got the nopales enchiladas and they were fab. These ain't your madre's enchiladas, but they are delicious and double-stuffed!  I only finished a little less than half the food on my plate. The corn sauce on these enchiladas is great.  Next time I want to try their Mole.  My compadre, Stephanie, got a combo plate with a taco and enchilada.  I'll toss a link to her review once she posts :)

Chips and salsa were great, the orange salsa is delish, just like everybody says, but my favorite was the red because it was fire-roasty, with just the right amount of heat.

I would make a reservation if I could next time.  When I got there, around 6 on a Wednesday, there were plenty of tables, but my girlfriend was running a little late, and when she got there around 6:30, the place had totally filled up.  I originally planned to just sit and wait for my friend and have a drink at the bar but when Rachel asked if I wanted to order food and I told her I was waiting on somebody, she stuck a menu and napkin on the place setting of the empty stool next to me.  That was really nice of her and even though I had envisioned us getting a table, I changed my mind and decided to take her up on her offer to save the seat for my friend because it was obvious that she was going to give great service.  And she totally did.  

She is so awesome, I would honestly return to Tropisueno just for her.  Sitting at the bar, I could hear other patrons talking about how lovely she is too. Her male counterpart, a heavy-set guy with a beard and mustache, who was making drinks for the restaurant, not the bar, was much more aggressive than he needed to be.  I witnessed several people try to order a drink from him (maybe because he is making drinks behind a bar...you know, like a bartender...) and he was pretty short with them in informing them that he was not available to help them.  He also scolded me for holding a seat for my friend, but it wasn't even my intention to hold the seat.  Luckily Rachel interjected and threw me a bone. Thanks Rach!
author: Emma H.

description: Have previously had good experiences here but today was chaos. Rolled in for happy hour bar was slammed got 2 margaritas (which were super weak hello lime juice) but there was no where to be at the bar so we sat at a small table there was no host or aparent servers. About 5 minutes later a rude guy comes up asking us if we have a reservation we didn't know we needed one aparently the whole restaurant was prebooked but random people were seating themselves everywhere so epic fail on regulating chaos and way to lose two customers who were looking to get dinner. I think the mission won't be too boougie to feed us some Mexican food.
author: Drew V.

description:
What's not to love about a restaurant that, for under/around $20, will give you enough food to last TWO meals??

Tropisueno accomplishes this by loading you up on chips and three different types of salsa before a waiter ever comes around to take your order.  Seriously.  The chips are thin, crispy, and lightly salted, while each of the three salsas has a distinct color, texture, flavor, and level of spiciness.  Green was the most mild, red kicked it up a notch, and the orange one had me reaching for my glass of water.  My friends and I must have gone through a basket by the time someone came around to take our order, and then another before our order came out.  We came for dinner on a Thursday night, though, and were fine with the wait because it provided us ample time to catch up.

Here's what we ordered:

Jacque C:
pozole vegetariano - 12

Iona C. (Me):
combo 2 - 12.95
carnitas enchilada & chicken tamale

Lisa L:
tropiseuno margarita - 10
sopa de pollo - 12

Both the pozole and sopa came with rice, while my Combo 2 order came with rice and a choice of beans (I opted for black beans).

As I mentioned before, with my stomach already half full of chips and salsa, I knew I had to be strategic about what I would eat there at the restaurant, choosing to eat things that would probably not be in great shape the next day for lunch.  I ended up picking my way through the rice and beans, and then taking the enchilada and tamale to-go.  

I tend to prefer to eat jasmine rice that is still somewhat chewy/al-dente, as it's the kind of rice my mom would make with a variety of Filipino dishes growing up.  I find soggy, soft rice is anathema to me.  While the red rice at Tropisueno was softer than what I usually prefer, it wasn't soggy, and it had a lot of great flavor.  The simple black beans were just what I wanted in terms of having a counterpart to the richness of my combo items and the rice.

As for the carnitas enchilada and chicken tamale... I nuked them for two minutes on high and they were still really good.  I appreciated the corn meal to meat ratio in the tamale, just about even.  Both the chicken and the carnitas were well-seasoned.  The corn tortilla pretty much fell apart, but that was to be expected.  Mixing it into the carnitas was an easy fix, and I still enjoyed it a lot.

Tropisueno was packed when we came for dinner, and I think we narrowly avoided having a long wait for a table.  Next time around, I will definitely try to make a reservation.   Yes, I am very much looking forward to another food-venture here (perhaps with a $5 Happy Hour margarita).  ;)
author: Iona C.

description:
This place is busy- all the time! I always make reservations ahead of time. Sometimes you can find seating outside, but it can get a bit chilly. The food is pretty good overall- I would not say is it anything spectacular, but I really did enjoy it. It seems to be a really popular place since it is right around the corner from Moscone center. 

But something to note: Free chips and salsa
I have to say, their orange colored salsa is to die for! It is tangy and spicy- so so so good!
author: Umang P.

description:
This was a fantastic find. Just steps out the back exit from Marriott Marquis, close to Yerba Buena gardens and MOMA. The guacamole is excellent albeit a little small. The chips are light and crunchy and not too oily. The salsa bar is impressive with quite a selection. The food was quite good. The carne asadas were solid. The mole was pretty good. The kids quesadillas were good. The fish taco came out soggy... that was the only negative. 

Order at the front and find a seat. They food comes out pretty quickly.
author: John L.

description:
This is my fav Mexican place. Lunch and dinner is different. Lunch is like a semi fast food place because of the crowd and dinner is a sit down restaurant. It is pretty cheap for a nice Mexican place and the food is delicious. My fav is their lunch salsa bar, they have like 8 variety of different salsa and dips! every single time I always end up eating too much salsa and have no room
For my food which is also very delicious. Their drinks are pretty strong as well. My fav is fish taco, chille relleno, and vegetarian casadija(really sorry for my spelling of Mexican food!)
author: Lijia W.

description:
Great veggie options. Delicious, fresh, authentic mole sauce and husband really liked his burrito. 
Great reasonably priced lunch in the union square area!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I had been here for lunch once before - the line gets insanely long and the burritos are MASSIVE. The atmosphere is much more casual during lunch. 

I came here for dinner last night on Taco Tuesday and ordered a margarita and 2 tacos - Carne Asada and Pollo Asado - both flavorful, juicy and delicious. The two tacos were served on a large dinner plate with a generous portion of rice and beans. I should have ordered guac and sour cream on the side, because let's be honest, that is what truly makes Mexican food.

The margaritas were great, served in a pint glass and pretty strong. No complaints here. I would definitely go back.
author: Ilana B.

description: The food was great. Enchiladas, tamales, tacos were all wonderful. There were a lot other more adventures food options that looked wonderful. However, they only have one fryer in which they fry fish products. Many establishments have one dedicated and another for non-fish products. So everything fried may be contaminated with fish and shellfish allergens to include the chips. One in our party has an allergy so we passed on all that. Just FYI if you are unlucky enough to to have such an allergy.
author: Peter P.

description:
My review will be all over the place, but i hope it gets the point across.

This place is not the Mission when it comes to hole-in-the-wall, meat-hanging-in-the-window, gut-busting, i-think-I'm-actually-in-Mexico, good o'l Mexican food... but the food here is still really good. For lunch, you walk up to the "kitchen", tell them your order, pay, sit, and wait for your food to come out; for dinner, its a regular restaurant with waiters. This place is in a decent location near union square and Moscone, no street parking but I'm sure there's garages nearby. They have a happy hour (bar too) and from my experiences the staff is very friendly. I have been here at least four times because its in a decent location, fair prices, and tasty food with appropriate portions too. I use this place as my go to when I'm in the area with other people because there is really nothing controversial about it; its good Mexican food - period.
author: Caleb R.

description:
This place is Still awesome!! 

It's been a long time since I've been back. 
The margaritas are still good!! 

I didn't know they had a to go section at this place. The other times I've been here is after work so that food section is hidden behind a wall. 
That's pretty cool. 

I wanted to try something different this time so I got the Prickly Pear margarita. It was so good. 

The service at this restaurant/bar is great. I will be coming back with my friends for more margaritas.
author: Edie G.

description: I love this place. If you come at the right time, the line is not that long. Weekday lunch can be very busy, but they move fast. Kids friendly and have so many choices for everybody.
author: Akiko I.

description:
This place was amazing! Dropped in around the holidays to have a birthday dinner celebration. The chips and salsa were amazing. We both had combo plates with enchiladas tamales and rice and beans. Everything was delicious! The waitress was very attentive and gave us a free margarita because there was a mistake in the bar. 
The atmosphere is very charming and festive. The lighting at night is very romantic! Very fun place to visit and would try again!
author: Jazmin L.

description: My family and I are not from the area and had no idea how busy this place gets. Make sure to make reservations! We are a family of 6. When we walked in we were told that the wait would be an hour and we were all hangry at this point - desperate for food. Fortunately they were able to accommodate us quickly and they won our hearts. Great customer service! The food came out quickly and it was all made fresh. I order the tacos, beware and ask if they are spices before  you order them if you are someone who doesn't like spice. Thankfully, I like spices food but even for me it was a little too much. We wanted to order there tamales but they were out - bummer. Their plantains are delicious and I loved their chips and salsa.
author: Cristina V.

description: Loud!! I can't hear my friend even we are just seat face to face :(  I can't believe that I waiting for 30mins and check it back, they said they don't have my name on the waiting list!!! I leave my phone number and my name, but they just said they don't have my name on list. CAN'T BELIEVE THAT!!!!
author: Faye L.

description: My friends and our partners went here for dinner before we headed out to da club. I ordered the Camarones Tropisueno and thought it was pretty good. The chips and salsa they give you beforehand is good as well, especially the red salsa that tastes a bit like tomatoes. We enjoyed the cocktails as well. Ambiance was chill and parking wasn't too difficult given the location of the restaurant  My partner ordered the carnitas and that's where it went downhill, even the taco carts outside of the bars usually taste better than Tropisueno's carnitas tacos AND for half the price so all in all, i would recommend Tropisueno just stay away from the Carnitas tacos.
author: Tina P.

description: This place is awesome. We were at the moscone center and got out around 5pm looking for dinner. Luckily this place still had happy hour going! We had so much food it was ridiculous and when we got the check it was crazy inexpensive. We ordered a margartia, ceviche, regular tacos, fish tacos, guacamole, chips, and salsa. EVERYTHING was delicious. If you're around for happy hour there you got to go and order it all. So good and so well priced!
author: Julie L.

description:
I went for lunch before visiting SFMOMA. Lunchtime gets extremely busy, and I will say I was able to take advantage of being a solo diner and easily snagged a spot at the bar. For larger groups, it would probably be hard to eat here at lunch. Nonetheless, the line to order moved quickly and my food came out in a reasonable timeframe. I ordered two tacos (one fish, one al pastor), one enchilada (chicken tinga), and a side of guac. The fish taco was not quite worth the $5 price tag but the al pastor was amazing! The enchilada also had a nice amount of heat and didn't rely on being smothered in cheese to be tasty (unlike a lot of places back home).

Every order gets a basket of chips and access to the salsa bar, which has plenty of yummy selections for all palates. Overall, I would probably give the food 4 to 4.5 stars, but the service I received on my visit gets an extra star. First, I decided to order a margarita at the bar, and upon looking at my ID, the bartender gave me a comp tequila shot (of surprisingly good quality) because "we were born a month apart and happy belated birthday." It was a bit aggressive for lunch, but it was free and I didn't have to work, so the gesture was much appreciated! Then, my food runner accidentally brought out two orders of guacamole when I had ordered one, and when I pointed it out, said that I was welcome to have the second one free of charge. So overall, I had a great experience here! I will return next time I am in the Bay Area and would recommend for small lunch groups.
author: E N.

description:
Tropisueno's no taqueria. It's upper scale Mexican for a decent price tag and while the food is definitely above average, I think they might have one of the best Margarita/free chips and salsa combo's in San Francisco...err at least in the financial district. 

They bring a huge pile of chips fresh from the oven and they keep 'em coming. Served with three different spice intensities, you could almost make a meal out of it if the salsas were a bit thicker. 

Margs are a perfect balance of sweet and sour and for under $8 you're getting a steal for the area. Overall it's a great place for happy hour and if you don't fill up on free chips an excellent option to stay for dinner as well.
author: Danny W.

description:
Margaritas were delicious and strong. 
Service was ok, not great.
Everyone was happy with their order.
author: Le E.

description:
The high rating drew us to this restaurant as we wanted to dine at a non-chain spot. We were seated right away and the staff was very friendly.
The place was rather tightly packed, the way their tables are set up, a little too close.
The food was the real let down. It looked amazing and tasted pretty bland. I would categorize this as the Chili's or Applebee's of Mexican food. 

Doubtful we'd dine here again as there are numerous other restaurants to try in the area.
author: Tony H.

description:
I have say that I really love tropisueno, it hurts me to give a poor review. The food is flavorful and amazing and I took a friend there for her birthday tonight, she LOVED it. 

I'm writing this review because after eating less than half of my food I was hoping to eat the remainder for lunch and asked for a box. When the server boxed up my food I thought the bag felt really light but didn't think much of it...I wish I would have checked. I don't know if the person who boxed my food accidentally trashed part of it or got hungry and decided to take a few bites (lol), but when I got home I opened my box and found that it was practically empty. There was only about a tablespoon each of rice and beans left and I KNOW there was more because I intentionally saved a good portion. I'm really disappointed and annoyed.
author: Kadé S.

description: I love going here. The food is great. The decor is really pretty as well. It's smack dab in the middle of the financial district so you get a lot of patrons that come here for lunch during their lunch break. I wouldn't go here for lunch. It will just end up being way too packed and you'll run into some annoying coworker. I really like going here for dinner. The financial district crowd dies down and you have a cool mix of some tourists that have wander in and couples. The drinks are good as well. Keep in mind this is not the best Mexican food I have ever had. But definitely the best Mexican food you will find in the financial district plus coolest ambiance.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
This place is overrated. The food was good but not exceptionally good to deserve 4 starts from 3k people! Plus it's overpriced for what it really is. 

If you have the time and really want Mexican food at whatever cost, this place is for you. But honestly, there are better places with better food and reasonably priced.
author: Cammy L.

description: First of all, you need to make a reservation. House chips and guacamole were delicious.My food was tasty.Prices are reasonable. I like this place and can say it was the best Mexican restaurant I've experienced around the Bay area so far!
author: Pinar D.

description: Rude management wanted us to leave even though we bout over $50 worth of food we were just sitting and talking and eating just because we were there for more than 30mins
author: Terrisha R.

description: Great food, aesthetic place. Ordering was simple and straightforward, however pricing was not very clear. Ordered the fish taco and it was pretty large.
author: Connie ..

description: This is definitely a WOW restaurant. We ate lunch there in their cantina like setting. I had the Carnitas. It was so good!!! Don't miss this one!
author: Eli E.

description:
I'm a little spoiled when it comes to great Mexican food. As an LA native, there are so many Mexican picks there that are just bomb diggity. However, I wanted a taste of home so I found myself at Tropisueño for what everyone raves about: enchiladas and house margarita.

The food and drink were both solid. I personally enjoyed the salsa trio that came with the chips. The tortilla chips need a little help though. I think it was store-bought tortilla rather than homemade. They were too thin for my liking.

I made a reservation, and it's a good thing I did because this joint was packed! The place was beautifully dimly lit and the perfect ambiance for a laid back meal. 

Nothing really stood out to me. Service was subpar and the food was typical of finer Mexican fare.
author: Nitar L.

description:
Review for a take out order:

I've been here a few times for take out and the first time I had a serious problem with the portion size, but that was only because I accidentally ordered an appetizer (oops!). Lesson learned: don't order just the Ceviche for a take out dinner unless you're a seriously light eater.

This time, I ordered the Chile Verde, which came with a serious amount of pork and a heaping of refried beans (you can have other beans if you prefer black, etc.) stewed in a green sauce of sorts. I ordered the Ceviche for a side. The Chile Verde was incredible. So rich with a little heat and tender pork, which was very soft as it seemed to have boiled / slow-cooked right in the green sauce. There were also bits of cabbage (or another slaw-like radish?) which added a nice crunch and balance to the dish.

The service was fast, the Ceviche was great (tilapia, avocado, lime juice, cilantro, onion) and the price was fair. I'd definitely come back. It was a great meal to decompress back in the hotel room (Park Central, which is right nearby).
author: Alex L.

description:
"Nice" mexican food sometimes deters me, but I'll admit sometimes I like places like this for the ambiance.  It was very poppin on a Friday night.  I was feeling basic (surprise surprise) so I did the Old School plate with a carnitas taco and pork tamale.  Pretty legit and just enough food for my small portions appetite.  The chips and salsa were also really addicting, there were 3 different salsas and I really liked the green salsa.  

I dig the vibe here and would come back.  Don't be boring like me and try some of the other stuff on the menu!
author: Lyn C.

description: The place was confusing. It was half self service and half restaurant. I also got attacked by pigeons and yelled at by a homeless person. The food was pretty decent though.
author: Chris T.

description: Loved the food here. We went for lunch. It was a casual setup with good quality ingredients and produce. Loved the salsa bar. Will definitely be back!
author: Shabina M.

description:
I was excited to see what San Francisco had to offer after I had spent a long day traveling. Tropisueño was close to my hotel had great reviews. I was a little worried as I walked up because it looked really busy, but my party of 4 was seated in less than 5 minutes. 

The dim lighting, bustling atmosphere, and simple decor almost made me feel like I had been transported south of the border. 

I ordered the Tampiqueño: niman ranch beef, thin-cut grilled carne asada, served with a beef barbacoa enchilada and guacamole. All of that topped off with Mexican rice and black beans left me completely satisfied. 

At the end of the night the server brought us one ticket and asked us to split it up and write our personal totals on the back. It seemed a little strange to me. Overall the meal was delicious, filling, and a great sta
author: Jared P.

description:
I enjoyed meal. The portions are really large. The drinks were pretty good too. They are usually packed and a reservation is in order.

Try it out. There might be better Mexican restaurants in the city but this one is one of the oldest.
author: Shawn P.

description: Great service and margaritas! Guacamole was excellent, if you like it spicy, order one level up from what you usually get. They seemed to be a little shy when it came to seasoning the guac, and everything we ordered. Filet mignon was tender and good, but I ordered it medium and it was almost well done. Still a very good meal.
author: A S.

description:
Just go!  the food is excellent and the service is spot on!  I had eaten there a couple of years ago while at a conference and looked it up again.  Many people were there for happy hour but I ordered off of the menu as I wanted a particular item.
It has become a place I will visit any time in San Francisco.
author: Kathi N.

description:
I've seen so many of my friends ' reviews of this place and passed by it numerous times.  I thought it was more of a traditional restaurant setting because it looked like it was everytime I'd pass by it, plus since they take reservations in the evening.  So, I chose to meet my aunt there for a lunch break.  

I got there around 11:45 and there was a line out the door.  I was thinking was this to get seated?  I did see what looked like an unmanned host stand. Turns out it was to order.  It's set up cafeteria like style like traditional taquerias.  Menu is posted a little before you order and then they get your order then you pay and get your number to sit at the table and they bring it to you.  If you want a bar drink you have to stand in yet another line to order that at the bar.  My aunt got the tamale plate with more rice no beans and I got the carnitas burrito.  The total after tax was around $19.  

The wait wasn't long for our dishes and chips to be brought to us. I was a little turned off that they served me my guacamole in a little container vs putting it in the burrito but we ended up using the majority for our chips.  She said her tamale was fine, which means average.  I thought my burrito was good as the meat was moist and it was still a good size.  I ended up asking for more foil to take half home.  The chips were nicely salted and fried.  Definitely not a bad option if you want something a little less pricey in the area.  I still like Gordo's more for burritos due to price and quality but I wouldn't mind coming back to Tropisueno, especially when I'm not on a time crunch to enjoy one of their margaritas.  3ish for now.
author: Cat C.

description: 2.5 stars. Very average Mexican. Fish taco average. Tostadas below average. There special carne Asada very very tough meat.
author: Frank P.

description: Really good Mexican restaurant that is very popular. We went there for lunch and had a great time. Good food at a decent price. If you for lunch, be there at 11:15, at 11:30+ it's packed.
author: Kurt V.

description: Tropisueno was lively, action-packed and fun! It has great margaritas, killer guacamole and a staff of great folks. We enjoyed our dinners , delicious and ample portions. Reservations are highly recommended as it is a very popular place in downtown San Francisco. While we waited for a table, we were served delicious chips with a wonderful selection of salsas and those tasty margaritas at the bar. The bartender was so busy but very attentive and friendly to those waiting.
author: Carol D.

description: This is my second time here and boy did I miss this place. So we had a party of four and the wait was a little over an hour since it's the dinner time rush but awesome thing is you can roam around and they text you when your table is ready. I ordered the salmon en hoja and was thorougly disappointed because the sauce was just inedible in my opinion. However our kibd waitress let me switch dishes to the tampiqueño which was delicious! The meat is flavored very nicely and the guacamole and beans and rice are a very nice addition. I loved the pickled cabbage on top because it really gives the dish a little kick. The atmosphere is lively and the restaurant is dimly lit. Get a mexican coca cola while youre there because it just brings everything together.
author: Jane K.

description: Very busy for Happy Hour! Although it was extremely busy, the service was great and efficient. I didn't order much - just a cocktail, ceviche, and guacamole which were all very good. I'll definitely come back to try more!
author: A. C.

description:
Cafeteria style dining.

Came here for chips & guac + a bloody mary, but strangely the salsa bar was the highlight of my trip. Guacamole was just OK, not enough flavor. Not sure if I'd come back to try the other menu items considering the place was way too cluttered. The vibe was not right.
author: Anna M.

description:
Waited long on a Sat night.. Chips were served warm but mostly crumbled pieces on half.  Salsa was good but not the best.  Server was nice but food was nothing to rave about.
Ambience was nice.  Pricey for average taste.  Mission district better Mex
author: Sasha P.

description:
This was my second visit to Tropisueño in the past year. Everyone raves about this place, but on neither occasion was I particularly impressed.
The atmosphere is cute and the service is great, but to me that's not reason enough to come back to a restaurant if I don't love the food.
I had the carne asada enchiladas this time, and they were a bit soggy from being soaked in too much sauce and kind of stingy on the cheese. The flan was more like a cake: very dense and kind of crumbly. Tasted nothing like how flan should be... I took one bite and let my dining companion finish the rest.
author: Kate M.

description: Very good food, great location and great service. The bathroom line can get a bit long and they can manage that better I would suggest.
author: JackieAaron B.

description: This place is bomb !!! Great customer service ! Super fast drink and food delivery! And the staff communicates so well, perfect rush hour experience ! Will be back !!!!
author: Cory T.

description: Absolutely loved the food, atmosphere, and service! Everyone was so welcoming and attentive. Food was delish and prompt. Would definitely go again!
author: Adriana R.

description: Nice place very good service in the bar area, tasty margaritas but weak, food was good but portions are small, probably wouldn't come back
author: Peggy G.

description: Got my meal to go and they were nice enough to include some chips and salsa with my order. I got the enchiladas and while not mind blowing, they were very tasty and were a solid offering. The advice from the host regarding the quality of the meat they use in their steak enchilada was pretty spot on - definitely above par meat as far as steak enchiladas I've had in the past.
author: Dan N.

description: My friend and I came here for lunch on Sunday. It was order and pay at the front, grab a number, grab your own utensils, water, salsa, etc. If you want an alcoholic drink, you purchase it separately at the bar. The waiters will bring you your food and free chips. I ordered the two-item combination (pork tamale and chile relleno), my friend ordered the chicken and vegetable soup. The good: huge portions and good prices. My plate was enormous and everything was very cheesy. I had enough to take home for another meal. My friend's soup was a huge bowl with probably an entire breast of chicken in it. The chips and salsa were surprisingly good and satisfied my craving. The bad: the chile relleno was super cheesy and not bad, but it had a thicker than normal breading on it (sort of like a corn dog breading). My tamale was really dense, hard, and dry. I could barely cut through it with my fork. Would not order the tamale again.
author: Annie L.

description: Came here for dinner with friends. You can't reserve for a party of more than 8, I tried calling their contact number, no one answers except for a lady(answering machine)  that says go to their website and on their website it says call them, it was confusing. I ordered the camarones, it was too spicy and too salty for me, have to apologized for my kidneys and tongue.  Ohh well. I'll give Tropisueno a chance.
author: Jo C.

description:
Possibly one of my favorite happy hour spots! 

It's pretty hard to grab a seat here once happy hour hits so I do recommend coming here a bit early. So worth! They give you free chips and salsa (with unlimited refills, haaayyy) which is my favorite part! The guac is delish if you want to order something extra. 

As for the drinks, $3 beer or a $6.50 margarita? Definitely my type of happy hour. The service is pretty fast-ish , depending on the day that you're there and the hour. Overall, I definitely recommend checking this place out after a long day of work :) 

PS. WATCH OUT FOR THE PIGEONS. THEY'RE NOT AFRAID TO ATTACK.
author: Tram N.

description:
To sum it up:

Pros: 
Love their salsas (ALL of them)
Guacamole is cilantrolicious and refreshingly bright!
Love the ambiance
Pay before you eat, then leave when you're done
FRESH tortillas, nommmm
Burritos are large and in charge

Cons: Fajitas weren't sizzling, came out on a plate, womp.

Been here twice now. The food is consistent, as tasty as it was when I came here in 2008.
author: Shereen A.

description:
I'd actually give this place a 4.5 if I could. Had the chile verde - which was delicious. It tastes authentic and clean, if you know what I mean. The chips were thin and super tasty, too. 

The wait is pretty long even at awkward hours like 8:30pm. I'd recommend making reservations in advance!
author: Juliana P.

description:
Authentic Mexican, moderately priced and awesome staff. Must try their cocktails.
Complimentary nacho chips with 3 different sauce - so fresh and crispy.
Shrimp curry with rice and beans (can't remember the name) - very creamy and well cooked. Being relatively new to eating shrimp..I thoroughly enjoyed it. 
Tiramisu- very different from what I had in philly but very tasty in the shape of cupcake with fresh strawberries topping
author: Bhavika P.

description:
I love their complimentary salsas and chips. 

We got the house margarita, and it was good!

Highly recommend the Sautéed Vegetables enchiladas with cream sauce. It is very delicious. 

Service could be improved. 

Very loud like a typical Mexican restaurant.
author: Hiral P.

description: When we checked in the gal at the host stand said we only had 1.5 hours at our table. I thought she was talking about the wait time and I clarified that we were answering her text. She rudely said, "no at your table". I said unless the service was slow, that wasn't going to be a problem for our party of 2 adults, 2 kids. That was about par for the service in general. Food is good. Service leaves something to be desired.
author: Erin W.

description: I have gone here to get lunch to go twice and I love the ambiance. I felt at home and very relaxed while waiting for my food to come out. The first time I came here, I got the one item combo plate and chose the Chicken Enchilada. The Enchilada was too bland for me but everything else was delicious! The salsa cart is amazing and adding a lot of the mild red salsa to the Enchilada helped add more flavor to it. I was only going to give 4 stars initially but I came back to get lunch here and the two Chicken Tostadas that I ordered totally made up for the Enchilada from the first time I came here. One of them ended up being soggy but go figure; I did get it to go so that was expected. They give generous portions of meat, guacamole, everything and did I mention how much I love their chips? Whenever I am in San Francisco and I want Mexican food, I'm for sure coming here!
author: M T.

description:
mexican food isn't really my go-to-food choice, but this place is pretty good. i ordered a chicken quesdilla with guacamole and sour cream (might've been charged extra for them, not sure). it's definitely a filling meal for $6.95!! did i also mention that every meal you order comes with free chips?! there's a section where you get to pick dips based on the level of spice you want. i was super satisfied with my meal and i still feel really full after 2 hours. all my coworkers really enjoyed their burritos. 

location: you can't find parking. definitely one of the most busiest locations in the FiDi/SoMa area. 

setting: there's plenty of open seating, including outdoor seating!

food: it's authentic. delicious, and pretty quick! every meal comes with free chips and you get to choose your dip! a good spot to come for lunch!
author: Sylvia H.

description: RAISED PRICES & SMALL PORTIONS.  This used to be my favorite Mexican restaurant downtown.  I go in there occasionally for lunch (every few months).  Every time I go, they get more expensive & their portions get smaller and smaller. I went in there the day before yesterday and I ordered 1 taco, 1 ceviche & a soda.  When they handed over my food I was completely shocked at the portion sizes.  My bill was $17.  I was appalled.  When they gave me my ceviche, it was served in a little container the size of a Ramekin.  There was probably two table spoons in it at that is it.  There was barely any fish at all in the ceviche mix.  They used to actually give you at least one cup of ceviche and now 2 tablespoons for $8.00.  The size of the taco was teeny tiny.  I will not be going back.  I left hungry & extremely disappointed.  Not worth the $ at all.
author: Darlene T.

description:
For having almost 3K reviews and an overall 4-star rating, I expected SO MUCH MORE.

I've been here twice so far: once just for appetizers and drinks, and the second time for dinner. Sure, the drinks are great (and I'm sure they're even better when you're paying happy hour prices), but the food is seriously lackluster. Like, wtf? Flavorless, dry enchiladas. The assorted ceviche had plenty of seafood, but tasted like 110% lime and nothing else. And the Camarones Al Mojo De Ajo (sautéed shrimp) was too salty. The only dish I liked was the empanadas. Because who messes up empanadas?

Service was great at first, but began to rapidly decline after we got our order in. It took us 20 minutes to flag down a waiter to get our check. Ugh.

COME HERE IF YOU LIKE OVERPRICED + DRY + FLAVORLESS MEXICAN FOOD and SLOOOW SERVICE.
author: Jennifer K.

description: First of all sf is a Mecca for bomb Mexican food. This place is overpriced and the meat taste burnt. I guess sf techies love the food here. But in my opinion it's expensive and not filling at all.
author: Josie M.

description:
Had dinner here with a group of coworkers. We share guacamole, I got the carne asada plate, and washed it all down with their house Margarita.   

The food was really good. The guacamole to share was tiny but the main dish was good size and I didn't even finish all of it. The drink was perfect.
author: Tim R.

description:
Went here for a meal at 4:35pm- I know the time because the arrangements of the restaurant was so strange. I ordered food at the counter and by the time I went to sit down, most of the dining room had been roped off for table service. Why didn't anyone tell me this was about to happen? I could barely find a seat (baby under 1 arm and starving...). It is also a hassle to have to buy food and alcohol at separate places during the day -seriously just consolidate the payments! And it was rude for staff to then put a sign on my table indicating I needed to leave by 5:45 for reservations. 
Despite the annoyance, the vegetable and chicken burritos were good, and I liked the fact that the veg was not cooked to a paste- each bite was recognizable. 
Overall too much of a hassle without a reservation but decent food
author: Maureen D.

description:
Yum! 
The salsa with the chips is amazing! Even the chips are freshly made. 3 different kinds of salsa. Must try. 
My mango Margarita was quite spicy, a warning would have been nice ;)
I ordered the pollo Asada for main course and it was delicious. The chicken was tender and fresh. Almost like Indian style tandoori chicken. Perhaps some lemon would go well with it next time. 
The rice , beans , veggies were fine, nothing out of the ordinary. But the salsa and chicken made this well worth the wait. 

Yes there is definitely a long wait. Even on a Monday evening. Call in early or be prepared to sit at the bar, which actually worked out well for me and my friend. 

The ambience is nice and not too loud. 
If the beans,rice and veggies improved just a little bit I'd have no hesitation in giving this a five star!
author: Arjan N.

description:
I had high expectations for this place, since most reviews are really good. Maybe that's why I was disappointed. 
Had a drink at the bar. It was around $14 for a really small, really bitter, not so great tasting cocktail (Hibiscus Infused Tequila, Lime, Agave Nectar, Cucumber).

The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. Our server was decent.
Make sure to have reservations, cause it seems to be packed all the time.

$85 for two entrees, two cocktails, an appetizer, and a beer. I'm not sure it was worth it.
author: Fernando B.

description:
I came here once for lunch with a close friend as we were in the SF downtown area. The restaurant is conveniently located just right off of the Powell BART station.

The food was alright. I ordered the carne asada burrito, which was very flavorful; however towards the end, it became very soggy and was hard to eat. The burrito also came with a side of chips and salsa -- I found the chips a tad too oily.

Overall, a good experience. Would recommend a try.
author: Alvin W.

description: Margaritas!!!! Yes please. I've only come for happy hour so the chips and guacamole and quesadillas are excellent. Did I mention margaritas??? ;)
author: Christigale F.

description: In my opinion the best Mexican restaurant in SF, the margaritas are great, queso fundido is incredible and I have to get it every time I visit. My favorite dish is the tres conchitas, but you really can't go wrong here. The value for your dollar here is also amazing as they make fantastic food here and give out pretty large portions, you won't leave hungry. The wait can sometimes be a while but well worth it!
author: Derrick W.

description: On a Friday there's nothing better than some beer and free chips and a shrimp burrito at tropisueno. The salsa they have rivals papalote and the fact that they don't overcharge everything makes it a 5 star dream of soma
author: Laura G.

description:
One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. There are typical taquerias in San Francisco, and then there are upscale Mexican restaurants. This is the latter (though it moonlights as a taqueria during the day). I've been to Tropisueño for both dinner and daytime taqueria, so I'll review both. 

Overall, the food and service are both incredible and the ambience is always fun and upbeat. The only downside is there are only 2 bathroom stalls, one for men and one for women, so you can imagine how long the wait can be if it's packed (and it's always packed)

The Food Overall
Chicken fajitas are delicious, not too greasy and the flour tortillas are cooked perfectly. The salsas are incredible and the chips are great.

Dinner
Tropisueño is incredibly busy for dinner. I can't stress the need for reservations enough, they often won't have any available reservations at all between 530 and 9 (dinner starts st 5:30pm), and I've even seen it have no reservations available for days on end. They also do drop-ins, but you can wait more than an hour. it's fairly dark inside - both bar and table seating available with great ambience. Expensive drinks (~$11 for a margarita) and the food is fairly pricey, but the portions are huge and it can definitely be shared. I've had taco combinations plates and chicken fajitas - they're both good but I'd recommend the chicken fajitas. Rice and your choice of beans are included, and the price is $13.95. 3 flour tortillas are included, and this is enough to fill 2 people (unless you eat like a horse).

Salsa and chips are complimentary. There are 3 main types of salsa provided and they're all delicious. The orange salsa is vaguely cheesy and spicy, it seems like habanero, and I could eat it forever. If you're a fan of spicy, you absolutely have to try it.

Taqueria
Tropisueño does not take reservations for the taqueria lunchtime (which is before 4pm on weekdays and 5pm on weekends). Dinner starts at 5:30pm but the same menu is available during the day. The only difference is you're not waited on, you order food at the kitchen counter and take a number. Drinks are also ordered at the bar. Salsa and chips are still complimentary, but the salsa is serve yourself style.
author: Taylor S.

description: A very cool and lively environment with great music.  The margaritas are great.  The chips and salsa they give at the table is addicting, so try not to fill up on that!  The food was delicious, huge portions and very tasty.  Overall a great place to go if you want really good quality food.
author: Max W.

description:
Came here for Happy Hour and dinner after with some friends who have been wanting to try this restaurant out.  Happy Hour is a great deal for some good house margaritas on the rocks or some cerveza.  The chips come with three different dipping sauces which are delish.  The orange one is really hot!  Watch out.  The chips are nothing special, thin salty tortilla chips.  I prefer thicker and oily chips that just came out of the oil that give a little fight when you bite them.  

For dinner I had the tacos.  I tried the carne asada and the al pastor.  The al pastor was better of the two in my opinion.  The carne asada was just a lot of meat without any flavor.  Tropisueno is not skimpy on the food but the overall taste of the taco pales in comparison to LA taco trucks with $1 tacos.  The rice that came with the dinner was flavorful and moist.  Overall a good meal but not very memorable.  Nothing stood out to me.  Come to SoCal for tacos.  

Service here was excellent though.  The host, waiter, and bartender were all great and quick.  I just did not favor the tacos or chips that much.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I loved the food and service here.

Ambience: 
Its pretty nice but u should be ready for the loud mexican music.
They have very dim lights. little difficult to read the menu.

I would say 5* but gave only 4 because of loud music and after dinner side effects.


Food:
you get chips and salsa for free. all u can eat.
Mild, Medium and Spicy 3 diff varieties of Salsa.
Spicy is the best

I ordered a side of Guacamole which tasted heaven and Fish of the day with side of beans and rice.

Everything tasted good.
author: Siva Sankar G.

description: Absolutely delicious and fresh food. Excellent and personalized service. You can never go wrong for dinner at a restaurant owned by this host.
author: Aron M.

description:
WORST RESTAURANT experience of my life. Please avoid this place at all costs, the people here especially the manager John know nothing about customer service! 

I went in here on Saturday and we sat at the bar and ordered some appetizers and then went on to order some food. We got here at approximately 7:35 and ordered our appetizer by 7:45, our appetizer took 1 hour and 10 minutes to get to our table, ONE HOUR AND TEN MINUTES FOR THE APPETIZER TO ARRIVE. We saw individuals sitting next to us, come eat and go, and it was so frustrating because we were all extremely upset and we just kept being told "the food is coming, coming, it's coming" after about an hour we were told that something "broke" and that was the reason our appetizer took so long, we were so upset but we're starving and knew if we left anywhere else it would be at least a 20 minute wait. 

Minutes before deciding to leave our appetizer finally showed up at our table. Finally we were asked if we wanted to speak to the manager John and we wanted to explain how upset we were.
