Then this guys shows up and rambles something about the food coming, didn't even bother to let our table talk and say anything and didn't even bother to apologize he spoke so fast and left so incredibly fast that it was imposible to understand, turns out that was the manager of the restaurant-JOHN.

Honestly this was the worst restaurant experience I have ever had in my life, the people didn't care, their excuse to things were "something was broken" and despite taking forever with the food they even managed to get the orders wrong. I will never in my life be coming back to this place, the customer service is horrible especially from the restaurants own manager.
author: Allie A.

description:
Tropisueño is pretty great. The cuisine isn't anything mind blowing, but you can expect solid Mexican food in a fun -- albeit noisy -- atmosphere. Although the restaurant is large, it attracts the post-work crowd and fills up pretty quickly, so I would suggest making a reservation ahead of time. 

I ordered the salmon baked in a banana leaf (super moist and flavorful), as well as the sides (black beans, rice). It managed to be delicious and fairly healthy at the same time. The server told me it would take ~30 minutes but it actually came out with all the other food. Would definitely order it again. The salsa they give you when you sit down is great, but the pink one is extremely spicy so be careful! I will need to venture back for happy hour one of these days.
author: Valerie L.

description: Make a reservation in advance, it gets really busy.  Perfect place to socialize with friends.  Great ambience.  We ordered a ton of appetizers.  Platanos Fritos soooo good!! Tacos De Cachete meat was so soft and tender, Empanadas De Hongos, tostaditas De Carnitas, Crispy Flautas all good! would definitely go there again!
author: KB B.

description:
When I first wrote this review I had stopped by for drinks and chips. I came back for the lobster / seafood soup and it was surprisingly delicious. I had huge doubts - any restaurant in Union Square is a red flag since you're typically paying the tourist fee. But the food and wine were really quality, a bit on the pricey end but still worthwhile.

* GUACAMOLE ($7) 3.5 STARS:
Pretty good and fresh (tastes like what I make at home), but it was TINY! The chips are incredibly fresh and crunchy, and they offer 3 types of complimentary salsa. Nice way to start, but if you're looking for a good guacamole, I'm embarrassed to admit I really like Rosa Mexicano's.

* CALDO DE MARISCOS ($19) - 4.5 STARS: 
Seafood soup with large shrimp, calamari, sea scallops, mussels and fresh fish in a lobster-chile broth topped with crispy tortillas. I've lots of Mexican soups, from upscale to hole in the wall and while I really appreciate every style and version, none of them have been particularly high quality. This on the other hand was flavorful and fresh - the broth was the big stand out, and there was a generous amount of really fresh seafood. It was hearty and delicious all at once and while a bit on the expensive side, I think it was worth it.
author: Jess C.

description:
An upscale Mexican Restaurant located near Yerba Buena and the Jewish Center in downtown SF. While my bf and I were in the area and looking for a place for dinner, we stumbled upon this restaurant. He's always down for Mexican food, and I'm not too picky in trying new places. We entered into a dimly lit restaurant, and was quickly seated amongst the busy crowd. We were offered a complimentary nachos and three types of dips (the orange spicy kind was my bf's favorite- he literally had like 6 small servings of that).

ATMOSPHERE: A fun, intimate, upscale atmosphere but attire can range from casual to business casual. It's feels sort of cramped in there, but not squished. Busy, so it can get pretty loud. Great place for groups of friends, coworkers, and family, GNO, drinks after work, etc.

SERVICE: Attentive and accommodating.

FOOD: I ordered the Chicken Mole and the portion was huge!! The price was up there but the food, location, atmosphere, and service make it so. I don't think you can go wrong with what you choose on the menu.
author: Winnie T.

description: Horrible table accommodations . Hostess was rude . We waited an hour! We had a party of 9 and gave us a table for 6!! So stupid gonna blog about this on social media
author: Daniel A.

description: First night in San Fran and we were craving authentic Mexican food.  Made reservations and even on Tuesday night it was over an hour wait. But they text when table is ready so we walked around a bit. The chips and salsa tray were fresh and amazing. Excellent service, attentive and quick. Ordered chicken poblano mole and steak/enchiladas. Amazing food!  Good quantity and very fresh.  The bar was packed so had a jalapeño margarita there which was fantastic.  Highly recommend!  We plan to go back at least once more.
author: A S.

description:
I've been to Tropisueno a few times and they never disappoint! I always get the salad with grilled chicken topping. It has a Mexican twist with its dressing. For around $10, the portion is huge and they are very generous with the chicken. I could only finish half for lunch and ate the other half for dinner. Lunch and dinner for $10?! Yes, please! You can also get as many sauces/salsas as you want (open bar) and add them to the salad, but the salad is good on its own.

It's usually busy around lunch time and there's always a line, but we were able to get a table everytime. You line up to order and pay and grab a number to a table where they'll bring your food to you. Service is also friendly and efficient.

They offer a lot of Mexican dishes (tacos, burritos, enchiladas, tamales, quesadillas, Mexican sandwiches, etc.) and the portions are generous. Next time I'm back, I'll try something new!
author: Maranda C.

description:
I've been here twice now and the food is amazing! Super authentic and the tortilla chips and dips they give you at the beginning are incredible. 

Biggest complaint is that since it's so good there's almost always a wait time I've heard. Both times I've been here I waited around 45 minutes, although it was well worth the wait. I've also noticed that since it's always crazy busy the servers are somewhat inattentive, but the food is so good I'll come back anyway, haha.
author: Cam P.

description: This place is poppin! So wait time is no joke. I came here with my coworkers on a week night and a table of five took almost half an hour to be seated. Skip the appetizers peeps, thanks to unlimited mouthwatering chips and salsa (JK about skipping the appetizers though, those looked bomb too). I ordered the veggie enchilada's and it was mm mm guuuud. Vegetarian food can sometimes taste a little bland, but Tropisueño turned up the heat and served your girl some fire. Portions were just right. I normally find servings to be huge at Mexican restaurants, but I killed my plate. My total came out to be around $15 after tax and tip, which is a little pricier than what I'm used to paying for a platter in the Mission. But this is the financial district, and the restaurant definitely has high-energy. Service was amazing, food was to die for (especially if you're hungry), atmosphere was hip and trendy. I'll have to come back and hit up happy hour and kill a margarita or two.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Had a reservation kind of last minute.  Set for 7pm on a Saturday night for a very VERY belated birthday dinner..(all good).  We didn't wait at all to get seated. Had the tampiqueno - carne asada w/ black beans, spanish rice and pickled red onions.  It was really really good.  Meat was super tender and everything else that came along with it was just right.  We also had the scallops appetizer - this was probably the highlight of the dining experience.  The scallops were very soft and huge.  Just the way I like it!  Definitely coming back.  Oh, and thumbs up on the chips and salsa that they hand out while waiting for your meals.
author: Jill P.

description: The happy hour is a great deal.  My friend ordered the pork quesadilla and it was huge and a meal unto itself. The service left a bit to be desired, as even though there were several empty tables outside in the patio, the waiter seemed to be in a hurry.  He grabbed the menu almost before I had the chance to decide and also grabbed my friend's plate while she was in the middle of eating something, which he claimed he didn't see.  Still, it could have been worse and the food is great!
author: a f.

description:
Used to be a great place, however the service has really gone downhill. Met a friend for happy hour and was going to have dinner as well but ended up leaving after the terrible, rude service at the bar. 

The bartender was shockingly beyond rude to my friend who was waiting for me to arrive (BART was running about 10 mins late). She saved me a seat and ordered a lot of food and a drink while waiting for me. He told her repeatedly and unprofessionally that she couldn't save the seat and was preventing him personally from making money. Well guess what Sergio... you not only prevented yourself from making money but the owners as well. Lost business forever. I sat down 5 minutes before happy hour ended and wasn't served or asked if I wanted a drink. Others came up to the bar after me and were served ahead of me (while I was trying to get his attention as he was directly in front of me). To top it off, I was charged the non-happy hour price for a glass full of mostly ice with just a little tequila that should have been the happy hour price.

I always leave a tip even if the service is bad, however this is the first time in my life I left without doing so.

If he was my employee, I would have fired him. As customers, we will never go back.
author: Shannon S.

description:
Although I have never visited Mexico, I have grown to love it through the great choice of Mexican food available throughout the US and, in particular, on the west coast. Every time I visit I get my fair share of it as, this is one type of food that is hard to find in Europe and, is pretty poor in quality and taste :-(

This place happened to be close by and we decided to check it out. It was packed and they were serving cafe style. You order and pay for your food and they deliver it to your table. The whole process was quick and you could see the open kitchen and all the female chefs preparing your meals. 

The prices are quite reasonable and for under $10 you can have a good meal. I had the solo carne for main and it came with rice and beans. The meat was delicious and tender, the rice and beans packed a punch and I did not have to use the hot sauce at all.

Great place for a meal and I would happily come back in a heartbeat :-)) one of the nicest Mexican places in the area.
author: Sam S.

description:
So the angel on your shoulder is like, "Dude, we been waaay too chillaxed lately. Ever since we  left home we been hangin' out, watchin' cable TV, eatin' that crappy airport food, no time at the gym, what gives?" And the Devil be like "My man, are we on vacation, or what? You work, like, all the time, dude. You got one week in San Fran, can you let it go, already? Eat what ya want."

So the Angel orders ceviche (translation: veggies, seafood, healthy) and the Devil goes for the nachos (greasy cheese, beef and that crema yumminess). When the ordeal is finished, you're in culinary purgatory. And you're totally impressed. And those bastards on your shoulders will be snoring away.

The ceviche, honestly, ranks up there with the best I've tried anywhere. And here's the bonus on this particular meal: it feeds three people. When this restaurant meets its maker, it deserves a special spot in heaven.
author: Howie K.

description: I feel like I need to mention one more time how awesome this place is both food wise and the vibe. Walked in after a long movie around 10 pm sat st the bar got to chat with super friendly bartender and enjoy our meal. This place never disappoints me, thank you
author: Rana K.

description:
Are you freaking kidding me? We were told we could sit at the only available table outside. So we did. So we waited, and waited, and waited..
Then they came out with a rope and put it tables and didn't say a thing. We got up to ask about the rope and they told us that our tables will not be served. You could've told us that before we shut down. So, we go find a table and they put the rope up again and tell us we cannot sit here either. Hottest weekend of the year and they're kicking people out. Crowds of people everywhere. The owner of this restaurant is to learn a bit about business sense. I saw this place on  check please and really wanted to try it out. I won't be back.
 my curiosity has been satisfied went next-door to the pizzeria and had a great meal
author: john o.

description:
I've been here for drinks and they're pretty decent, although a bit pricey and there always seems to be a wait.

This review, however, is for their food and service--specifically for their take out food.  We had ordered through their online system.  We (there were four of us) had all added a side of guacamole, but when my co-worker showed up, the restaurant told us that because of a shortage, we would not get our guac.  I'm fine with them not having guacamole since I understand there was a strike from the avocado farmers, but when we asked for our money back, they told us they couldn't do it because we had ordered through the website.  BUT IT WAS THEIR WEBSITE!!

Secondly, I had ordered an al pastor quesadilla and I've never had such a mediocre/bad quasedilla.  The al pastor was dry and had no flavor.  The meat is like a super bland version of chinese char-siu.  The flavors were just all wrong in the quesadilla.

I'm not sure how the burritos and tacos turned out, but we all agreed tropisueno is off our list of restaurants to order from int he future.
author: Carrie L.

description: Nice clean place with great food and service. Tampaqueno carne steak was cooked to perfection. Everyone was very professional and welcoming
author: Kathleen M.

description: The food was quite good even though the service could be better. I had a shrimp dish and it was delicious, although I hoped that the serving size was bigger.
author: Ken W.

description: This place was fun, the food was good and everyone looked like they were having a nice time. Margaritas could have been stronger, just saying. It is really loud so plan accordingly.
author: P. E.

description: Great food and fun place to come with the family. Good portions too. I'd recommend sharing!
author: Michelle W.

description:
It's lunchtime. You're starving. You are also in a group of about 15 people that are all having the same stomach growls. 

And then you walk into Tropisueno and your heart falls because the line is loooooong. 

But never fear! As everyone else mentioned, it moves really quickly! 

I stepped up and ordered a few chile rellenos, cause I'm a creature of habit, but noooooo! They were out! Trying to think quickly, I opted for the carnitas, and had a seat. 

The food came out super quick... and there was a huge plate of delicious and flavorful pork, and side plates with tortillas and fixings. The pork was missing a bit of the "crunch" I love, but that's ok... and the quac was pretty good as well!

And just as quicly as we walked in, ordered, the food disappeared and we did as well. 

Given the size of the group (and we were loud), the fast moving line, the availability of a large table to seat us all, good food, during a crazy lunch hour... made me a fan.
author: Allie A.

description: Oh man, food was amazing, had the half chicken.  For being in the middle of SF I was expecting a small expensive plate of food, but I had trouble finishing my plate, which does not happen often...
author: Eric G.

description:
I came here with a group of people from work. We had made the reservation about a week earlier for 8 of us at 6pm. We had training that day and realized we would actually be able to make it to dinner earlier. We tried calling the restaurant, but no one answered. 

We decided to try our luck and show up about 30 minutes early to see if they could seat us. The hostess was RUDE RUDE RUDE!! She was completely unwilling to help us and kept telling us how much they really couldn't accommodate 8 of us - umm, then why did you take the reservation? It was like she preferred if we left. 

When we were finally seated, the 8 of us were asked to cram into a booth that was really meant for four people with two chairs on the end. This is just unacceptable. 

Yes, the food was amazing and our server was actually great with us. If it wasn't for the way the dinner started, I would have no problem giving this place a four, or even a five. But when your hostess treats customers liked they're not at all valued, it makes for a crappy experience.
author: Kristy P.

description:
Love this place. Great tacos and the chips are outstanding. They have a much better texture than other places.

Also don't miss out from their taqueria hours, totally worth it,
author: Joseph L.

description:
Does this place need more hype? Probably not, but Tropiseuno is quietly one of my favorite spots is the financial district. All corporate happy hours somehow end up here, so a lot of people who work in the area are not strangers, but everyone keeps skipping the food! What a mistake.

While I am not usually a fan of paying a premium for Mexican food, I will always do it for Tropisueno. Flavor, flavor, flavor! Do try their Chile Verde.

For lunch on weekends, I've found they turn taqueria style, which only means you get your food faster. Of course, free chips and salsa no matter when you go!
author: Patricia K.

description:
You know the food is going to be good when all three of their complimentary salsas are amazing.

Ordered:
-Ceviche sampler (all three of their ceviches): I liked the shrimp one the best because of the intense lime juice. The swordfish was good but my least favorite was the salmon..the spicy sauce was a bit off putting for me
-Plantains: SOOOOO good and even the black beans that came with it was so flavorful
-Chile and cheese tamale: I'm not a fan of tamales but this one was enjoyable esp the nice little spice it had

The service was good and I would def want to come back..only comment is that they're not super veggie friendly.
author: Jenn K.

description: Made a reservation for 5:30pm on a Saturday night. We arrive early and were ushered to the bar area as seating not doesn't begin until 5:30. Our house margaritas were delicious with the chili pepper flakes on the rim. Complimentary chips and three different types of salsas helped to hold us over until we sat down for dinner. The ambiance was nice, low lighting! The room filled quickly once we were seated. The service was great; not too pushy but also didn't forget about us. I wish I could remember the name of the dishes we got....but both were amazing! Warm tortillas were served complimentary as well. Overall, perfect restaurant for a nice dinner date!
author: Madeline A.

description: Went here for happy hour after work with a group of friends. Really good HH food and I will be coming back for more of their house margaritas. Only downside to sitting outside on their nice patio is the amount of pigeons that can sometimes be a bit too aggressive. Had a couple of close calls but we just took it as a interactive happy hour and had a blast.
author: Austin R.

description:
I had the 3 combo plate (burp) : Enchilada, Chile Rellenos, Traditional Taco (taco truck style with soft corn tortilla).   Everything was so delicious!!!
The taco was very impressive - great mix of flavours with some grilled pineapple and amazingly tender and tasty meat chunks. 
This was my first time having Chile Rellenos and boy was it flavourful and amazing.
author: Cameron M.

description:
It seems like everything took forever. It took forever to get our order. Forever to get our water/drink refills. Forever to get a check. The server was extremely overworked. Although she remained friendly, waiting 15 minutes on a water refill is a bit too much. 

The food was alright. Kinda like an upper scale mexican food compared to an average whole in the wall run by a family. The chips and salsas were great.
author: Lana S.

description:
I came here for dinner so this rating is mainly for the dinner ambience, service and food at Tropisueno. The food was not fresh, tasted way too salty, and lacked unique flavors. For American-style Mexican food, I would venture elsewhere or you may disappointed from an underwhelming experience. 

Food
We ordered a few dishes and every single one was bland and salty. I had the chicken enchilada and pork tamale. Both tasted basically the same and my tamale was really hard like it was premade and had just been heated up. The enchilada was also not fresh. The rice was really salty and over seasoned - my friends all agreed. And the 3 salsas they served with the complimentary chips looked nice in various colors, but didn't have distinguishable flavors. Each tasted a little spicy and not very fresh. My friend had the camarones (prawns) dish which came in a soupy reddish color sauce and not much else except for the rice and beans. 

Service
The service was okay. The hostess was prompt and kind, but our server wasn't very friendly. She also disappeared in the middle of our meal and we had to flag someone else down for water. It was a little odd. It wasn't the worst but certainly wasn't anywhere near good. 

Ambience
This is a noisy place, especially during dinner hours, as many of the patrons are at the bar drinking and chatting. While pleasantly decorated, the main dining area is dimly lit with low ceilings and a themed bar area. It seemed a little crowded at times. I can see why people would like to come here for pre-dinner drinks or happy hour and socialize with friends. But it's not the ideal place to hold an intimate conversation with friends as it was hard to talk over all the noise.
author: Kate L.

description: Had dinner here the other night. While being seated, we were told by the host that we had only 1 1/2 hours to eat our meal... We had not be seated or ordered our food. When the food eventually arrived, it was not hot and almost cold. I asked for a blended strawberry Margarita which seemed reasonable but they told me that they didn't do blended drinks. Mediocre food, lack of accommodating service and drink limitations have contributed to this review. The only redemption is the chips and salsas were quite tasty. I wouldn't ever come back here for a host of reasons.
author: Alex C.

description: Overpriced Mexican food . I'm not sure what the hype is about . My friend and I were seated fairly quickly during a weekday dinner rush . We were asked if we wanted house guac and I assumed it was complimentary but it was actually $4 for a small scoop . We both ordered a margarita to start. I wasn't a fan of my watermelon margarita . For entrees I had the taco and flauta combo . The meat was dry and the rice was bland . I've had better from a taco truck . When we were ready to pay, we asked our waitress to split the check evenly and she ended up charging the same card twice. I suppose this is what you get when you get Mexican food on market ! I don't need to come back .
author: Vivian S.

description:
This review is solely on their happy hour cause, well, I've only been here for happy hour. (Not an alchy, I promise!)

My friends raved about the happy hour here, and I must say, I was quite impressed. Their house margarita ($6.50) is delicious and a bit on the strong side. Besides the yummy drink, the complimentary chips were bomb dot com. It comes with three different kinds of salsa, and they'll refill for you! We also ordered a chicken quesadilla. It's one of the best quesadillas I've ever had before. 

It seems like a lot of people like to come here for happy hour. We grabbed the last table outside when we got here!
author: Christine S.

description: When you spend 150 dollars on rice, beans , chips and salsa and the food takes 1 hour to be serve you realize one thing! That this is he perfect example of people with money playing at having restaurants, the best thing in the menu were in fact my jack and cokes ! But again how hard is it to ruin a drink? I wish you luck on your journey of trying to have a reputable place!
author: Francisco D.

description:
Tropisueño was a welcome sight - and delightful find while visiting San Francisco. As a California girl now trapped in Michigan, I so had my heart set on running to the closest In-N-Out but alas I had faced flight delays and I was tired down to my soul when I finally arrived... but still hungry. 

I'm always hungry but that's another topic for another time. 

But hey, on the same token, it was my gluttony that led me to the job that I flew out to San Francisco to train for. So, I've that going for me. 

So, what does a California girl search for when the closest In-N-Out is too far away? She searches for tacos... or sushi. Actually I was searching out sushi first, however all of the menus at the local sushi restaurants had one thing in common, they were all missing prices. Normally I don't feel intimidated by menus with missing prices but in a city like San Francisco missing prices on anything scare the pants off of me. At this time in my life I really need to know if I'm going to have to choose between a delicious sushi meal or making my car payment and it's just too high of a risk. 

So enter Tropisueño. 

After a quick jaunt from my hotel I was met by the friendly hostess who I placed my to-go order with. Had my plane landed on time I would have been happy to stay and have a margarita at their warm and welcoming bar; I really feel as if American Airlines should buy me a drink... 

Even though the restaurant was absolutely packed, even on a Wednesday night, my food came out promptly. 

I ordered a side of homemade guacamole, a chicken tinga taco, and a beef taco. They also gave me a side of fresh chips and three of their salsas to take back to the hotel.

The food was great, as it turned out others in my workgroup had the same idea the night we arrived and then we were able to enjoy eating lunch here two days later. For lunch I had more of the guacamole with a crisp tostada. 

I think that no matter what your order here, you'll be pleased with your choice. 

++++++++++++++++

Traditional drinks like Horchata and Jamaica offered. There is a full bar as well. 

Two doors down from Beard Papa if you really start to feel the foodie gluttony overtake you. 

Line is usually way out the door during lunchtime, plan accordingly. 

Dinner is set up differently, sit-down with servers. Lunch is a line where you order, pay, and then have the food brought out to the table.
author: Amanda I.

description:
Holy crowded lunch batman! This place is good but wait in line forever good? I think so. We also chose a Friday lunch to try this place so I'm sure it's a bit crazier. So you see the menu ahead of time and order when you get to the counter and then your food is delivered. If you want a margarita you have to order from the bartender. Prices seem reasonable (for the food- my margie was $10!) , and their menu is extensive.

So, seating is first come, first served. This is especially annoying when people come in large groups. I actually witnessed a guy hogging a table of 12, who sat there from the time I arrived to the time I left. Please do the rest of us a favor and don't come with more than 5 people. I could have eaten my meal there instead of circling the restaurant for 10 minutes.

The order- margarita, carnitas taco, and carna asada super taco. I'm pretty sure that was the right move. Do yourself a favor and check out the salsa bar- lots o' goodies in there. Everything was delicious and I think I hoovered it up in about 10 minutes.

We'll be back- they have a Happy Hour!
author: Alyssa J.

description: I love their lunch menu but it's sad how they completely change it for dinner. I would love if they gave you the option to order the same lunch items also during dinner time. The lunch options are to die for. My personal favorites are the tamales.
author: Jenna G.

description:
Damn. I have no idea why Trop is so good but it is! The service, the food, the prices.. all on point (on point = well executed). 

Lunchtime = cantina style! Cantina style is mexican for going up and ordering at the counter similar to cafateria style. Note that burritos are only served during lunchtime (even though it's one of Trop's best items). I suggest the Mojado Burrito (~$10) if you like it wet and flavorful. 

Service: Everyone's no nonsense which I like (?). For dinner, the waitress told me to go drink at the bar to wait for my party. The bartender told me to update my ID picture. When the rest of my party came, the waitress told me to close out my bar tab and bring my beer to the table (Modelo Negro was ~$4 during HH btw). From this experience, I learned I'm really, really good at following directions. More importantly, I didn't really have to think about anything other than what I wanted to eat. 

Food: Everyone talks about the food so I'm not going to bore anyone with the details. Definitely order the guac and hit the Mole if you're into that. Everything on the menu is solid. I. mean. everything. FYI - the cheese tamale isn't vegetarian because they add secret goodness into the maize. ;)

Location: Yerba Buena, Westfield Mall, Metreon, tourist stuff, etc. Needless to say it's an awesome location that's easily accessible by bike, BART, MUNI, pretty much anything.. Keep in mind the restaurant is located in between the Powell and Montgomery street stations. 

Other suggestions: This would be a cool first date place on a weekday, if you're into that. Good food, full bar, loud enough of a restaurant so there's never really an awkward silence and tons of options in the area to hit up. 

Tropisueno is highly raved and for good reason. It's definitely a must-try.
author: Chris W.

description: I love this place!!! Such great food in the financial district. You really can't go wrong with whatever you order, I do however love the chicken tamales, rice, and burritos. Oh my gosh and the drinks.... margaritas, agua fresca (especially watermelon), and horchata are so amazing! Also, try the sauces...you can thank me later:).
author: Gita r.

description:
Stopped by for dinner on a business trip recently.  The restaurant was next door to our hotel.  My boss and I had talked about getting margaritas the previous day after a tough afternoon.  So it seemed a great convenience this was close by.  The place is packed and busy.  We originally put our name down for a 30 minute wait, but a spot by the bar area opened up and we grabbed it.

After a couple of margaritas each, we were ready for food.  I got the Caldo De Mariscos (seafood soup with large shrimp, calamari, sea scallops, mussels and fresh fish in a lobster-chile broth topped with crispy tortillas).  Although nothing particularly special about it, I thought it was a fine meal.  Nice heat to it and I thought it was a nice complement to the margaritas.  My boss got the Chile Verde
(tender pieces of pork simmered in tangy tomatillos, green peppers, chiles and herbs. house favorite.)  He seemed to like it - finished it all.

Overall a good experience. Our waiter was a bit forgetful as we had to remind him on a couple of things - water, another round of margaritas, a beer order.  But he was a nice guy.  Other than that, nothing to complain about here.
author: Thai N.

description: Come here every time I'm in the City! One of my family's favorite restaurant...Awsome food, great margaritas, nicest staff ever!
author: Brad M.

description:
I've gotta say, Tropisueno surprised me! I was expecting a reasonable, if not authentic Mexican meal, and a Vancouver sized drink (read: small). Try again, expectations!

I walked in at about 4.30pm, hungry and thirsty. I didn't realise that they were gearing up for their transition from taqueria to full service restaurant, so that probably explains why the hostess was zipping around and not immediately able to help me. Once I grabbed her she quickly explained that I just needed to go to the window, order, grab a number and pay before finding a seat. Ohhh I get it now, so simple (cut me some slack, my brain was working backwards after a week of amazing and intense learning, and a nasty cold working it's way through my body.)

I ordered a chicken enchilada plate and found a spot at the bar to tuck myself into. Once I'd squeezed in I ordered a margarita from Ale, the lovely bartender, and moments later my food arrived! I was super impressed with the speed, although my delight faded for a moment as I realised I need to wiggle back out of my seat to grab cutlery and salsa! (Ale came to the rescue on the cutlery, but couldn't reach the salsa for me!) I loaded up on three delicious salsas and mowed down on some fan-freaking-tastic food! 

The food was way more authentic than most I've had in Van, and a giant portion! I only got one enchilada and I was super stuffed. Not that that stopped me from eating the complimentary tortilla chips and salsa that were delivered in front of me... 

The first margarita I got was huge - a 16oz glass filled with ice and delicious booze and oh boy was it good! I really enjoyed it and can't believe it was only $10! The second one was half the size, but stronger - the rose salt rim was tasty, and the ginger was a nice touch although it could have been stronger (but I REALLY like ginger!)

This place was really excellent and I can't wait to go back next time I'm in SF!
author: Ayla C.

description: BOMB FOOD. My friends and I stumbled upon this place during our trip to SF. We tried it out and we were not disappointed. The chips and salsa were fresh and delicious... full of flavor. The drinks were also delicious and not super deadly. And our entrees were cooked to perfection. Please bring one to SOCAL! Must have those chips and salsa!!!
author: Jamila H.

description:
Sorry, I dont really give 1 star here too often but bartender people and host lady up front annoyed me so much that I have to do this.

Delicious food with the worst service.. I felt like they are doing me a favor serving me food. 
Everything took forever, had to ask for almost everything 2 times or 3 times.

Even asked for main course 3 times..
0 star for the service but food is real good
author: tolgay k.

description: Awesome happy hour from 4-6. Cheap eats that were delicious. Their homemade chips and salsa with three different flavors were amazing. I had a fish taco, carnitas, and carne asafa.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Worst place ever!!! Cannot believe we were told that we could be seated and then refused after we waited 45 minutes to an hour...have never felt so discriminated against. Just poor service all around. We were a party with guests from Sacramento, LA, Seattle, and as far as Canada so it was embarassing to say the least. There was a guy in the leather jacket who was simply unbearable. He wouldn't even look us in the eye. Just despicable. What a sad representation of SF, Tropisueño.

Word of advice:  Don't do it.
author: Mary Anne O.

description:
Food was okay - basic tacos and margaritas. Service was terrible. It was a beautiful evening and we asked to sit outside. After our first round of drinks, the wind picked up and homeless started heckling us. We asked to move inside and were told the wait would be 25 minutes, even though there were several tables available. After approaching again after 10 minutes of seeing even more tables open up inside, we were told we can't move after ordering food. 

I won't return after the non-service oriented experience.
author: Sean S.

description: I came here for dinner for the first time last night and I loved it! I had the combo plate with carne asada taco and chicken tinga flauta and both were delicious. I also had the shrimp appetizer which was absolutely amazing because I am a big fan of lemon butter flavoring. I really enjoyed the ambiance of this place, which gave it a very authentic feel when you first walk in. I wish I could give this place 4.5 stars, but I took off one star (since this app won't let me deduct half) for the 30 minute wait for a party of only 2 people.
author: Adrienne B.

description:
UGH. Where do I even begin...this place is amazing. A couple friends and I were looking for dinner, and we randomly decided to come here after wandering around Union Square. I don't consider myself a Mexican food expert by any means, but this place is definitely so unique and very different from any Mexican restaurant I've been to.

After perusing other Yelp reviews and staring at the menu for the longest time, I decided on the "house favorite", the Chile Verde. Oh my, I just want to go back and relive that dish! The pork was so incredibly tender; if it came down to it, you wouldn't even need to use a knife to cut it apart. The flavors of the pork, the sauce, and rice (I skipped on the beans since I'm not a fan, although I'm sure they're great) came together so beautifully. The chips and salsas that came at the beginning of the meal were fantastic as well.

Our check came face down, with "Gracias!" written on the back, along with Chupa Chups lollipops for each person -- small gestures that go a long way, but makes the experience so much more memorable. Also, I don't know how she did this, but our waitress didn't have to write down a single order at our table of four and managed to get everything spot on...
author: Sabrina C.

description:
I liked this place, but I could not love it. I could not enjoy my food because I waited too long for it and filled myself up with chips and salsa. Make sure you make a reservation otherwise, you are going to wait for a very very long time to get a table. When we got to our table, my husband and I got seated at an extremely cramps table that I could not even put my purse on. From what I ate, the food was pretty good. i am from Texas and I am particular about my Salsa, and it stood up to my standards. ;) 

I had the Scallops appetizer, which was pretty amazing. It was on a bed of plantain hash. It would have been better if there were more plantains on it, but it was still delicious. My husband got the enchiladas, which was good. I wish they had more vegetarian options for him to choose from rather than the regular Mexican options which are usually just tacos and enchiladas.
author: Lily C.

description: The service is fast and the street style tacos were good but the price was really high. I guess you expect that in the Market District but this still seemed off the scale.
author: Terry D.

description: The best chicken Milanese's torta in San Francisco. Awesome salsa bar. Will def be recommending this place to friends.
author: Jake W.

description: I went here today for lunch.  At lunch it is cafeteria style; line up, order, pay, then sit.  It was pretty busy, but the line moved fast.  There were lots of options for a vegetarian like myself.  I ordered the combo plate with black bean and the tofu rojo.  It also came with 4  corn tortilla.  My friend had steak quesadillas and he said they were very good.  Definitely some good Mexican food and I will be back to try some of the other stuff on the menu.  Yum!
author: Megan M.

description: Food was meh - Barbacoa smelled funny. Margarita was tasteless but strong. Decor is cute
author: Koel B.

description: They have an efficient set up for lunch. Food was good, but the tacos were small for the price. I ordered guacamole and was charged for it, but didn't get it so check your order before you leave. Chips and salsa were great.
author: Danielle M.

description:
Grab a hot pocket and a six pack instead of wasting your time here. Do yourself a favor and search the reviews for the words "cold" or "lukewarm". You'll see a lot of people complaining about cold food... You know why? They basically heat you your meal up after its been made for 17 gazillion hours. NOT FRESHLY MADE. Cold beans, cold rice, cold tamales, cold enchiladas, cold tampiqueño. The worst.

The waiter and manager were nice enough to bring us some luke-warm food to replace it. Lucky us. I seriously feel bad for the people working here trying to sell this as a legitimate restaurant. 

I would rather drown in Chipotle.

Pro: the beer was cold....
author: G D.

description:
I'm very picky when it comes to Mexican food since I'm always comparing it to my mama's but Tropisueño- you are up there! My friend & I stopped by for a late lunch. There is a huge menu on the wall- make your selection and then tell the nice ladies your order. You pay for your meal, take a number, and pick your seat. We sat at the bar and I wish I got his name but the bartender was awesome. The drinks he made were strong or maybe that's because I had the drink called "La Muerte" aka Death. 

For $9.95 I had the Tropisueño torta- comes with carne asada, grilled chicken, carnitas, and chorizo. If that wasn't enough I also added a side of rice. Everything was perfect. In the top 3 meals I had while I was in SF!  If you need to add a kick to your food -there is an area right by the bar  where you can choose from several different salsas. I heard the bartender saying that during dinner time it's best to call to make reservations so I can imagine how the place gets. But during lunch, I loved their method of ordering yourself. Quick, delicious, affordable!
author: Yeraldine S.

description: Fun menu but horrible service. I will come back for another try. This place has a lot of potential.
author: gene m.

description: I have to give this place only 3 stars because it was incredibly loud. The food was amazing but my wife and I couldn't even talk without yelling to one another. Not at all a relaxing evening...
author: Brian M.

description:
Sometimes, you just want really authentic Mexican food without going to a hole-in-the-wall (although there's absolutely nothing wrong with hole-in-the-walls, see review for El Farolito). 

Tropisueno is a swanky, dimly lit, and lively Mexican restaurant with a wide menu of fun (read: strong) tequila-based drinks and bold flavors. Everything from tamales (my personal favorite) to enchiladas to crudos. I like getting the los favoritos (favorites) old school combo plates so I can try a "little" of everything. 

I've been here a few times and have never left disappointed (just really really full). They also have an awesome happy hour from 4-6pm weekdays.

Enjoy!
author: Linda X.

description: Favorite Mexican in sf!!! Shrimp ceviche, spicy margarita, chicken Tonga tacos are the best!!! Also, the staff is super nice and attentive.
author: Ashley F.

description: This place is good for a friend hangout! It is really packed and fun. The food is good too, nothing crazy amazing. Just standard Mexican fare, but it was at a decent price in SF and the service was fast. The chips and salsa  were delicious. Overall, if you want to have a good place to get some carbs into you before heading out and still be at a nice place, this is it.
author: Vivian X.

description:
I came here last year and had a wonderful lunch here. However, this time I came with my friends at 4pm, which was the happy hour, and the experience was not as pleasant as my last time. (FYI: during the happy hour, only selectively few dishes are available, not everything on the menu)

We had fish taco ($3.5/each), quesadillas suiza ($7) and ceviche ($5). The food was delicious and I would say quesadillas suiza is the best among the three. We were satisfied with the food and the ambience, however, the service was a little frustrating. We weren't served with water while other tables were, and the chips and salsa (which was delicious!) didn't come until we asked for the third time.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Great Mexican food, 2nd time here & so glad we came back.  Hubby & I split the vegetarian pozole .... yummy
Also had nopales enchiladas with cream corn sauce, WOW! Will definitely be back next time in San Francisco.  Good service too.
author: Gina J.

description: I saw this place on Check Please, the PBS show...I thought I would try it out...I was seated at bar because it was just me. I was fine with that. I ordered a margarita, which was good, then 2 fish tacos. I wasn't offered the dinner menu when I asked for one. When I did, the bartender said the bar menu was the menu. I waited for about 20 minutes and still no fish tacos. So, I ordered another drink, thinking they were busy, so I  was patient. Then I noticed people started getting meals after I ordered; so once 30 minutes came around I asked if my tacos were coming up soon. He said he didn't put the order in and they would be out in 10 minutes...needless to say, my first impression is not good. I will think twice about returning.
author: Perry N.

description: Five of us came to Tropisueno for dinner on a weekday. We had to wait for an hour, and maybe it was because of the long wait, but I wasn't satisfied with the food at all. I had a combination with 2 items (chile verde enchilada and chicken tinga flauta), rice and beans. The enchilada and flauta were literally the size of one finger and a half. The chile verde was suggested by the waitress, and it tasted nada. There was way too much beans, it filled more than half the plate. The only thing that was ok good was the unlimited nachos that were fresh and crispy. And maybe also the lollipop at the end. Definitely not worth it for the price. There are way better Mexican food out there for cheaper.
author: Ivy L.

description: Really enjoyed this place! Great food and great ambience! But the wait times are really long. Make a reservation if possible!
author: Sharanya P.

description:
Maybe I should carry around a Leprechaun when I go out with S for lunch, because between this place and Marlowe...I'm sure she's thinking that I choose the crappiest restaurants. 

Maybe a magical Leprechaun would grant me luck and give us a good dining experience.

The line here is long, which I mistakingly took as a good sign. But maybe it was due to the MacWorld conference everyone was attending.

I ordered a 3 item combo. Beef enchilada, chili relleno, and a beef flauta. And of course a horchata.

It was a zoo finding a place to sit, and when I asked the buser to please clean the table he directer me towards the napkins in the front. So I cleaned off my own table.

Then when my order came, they forgot my enchilada!

They also gave my friend the wrong size guacamole. They gave here the small one instead of the appetizer portion.

It took forever for my enchilada to arrive and when it did, the tortilla surrounding it was tough...like eating a leather enchilada. It was awful.

Instead of spending money on this place, I should have placed it in a Leprechaun fund....
author: Jack R.

description: Mediocre Mexican restaurant with a poor service and dirty restrooms but in a good location
author: Babak G.

description:
--Happy hour review--

My friends and I got here past 5pm on a weekday and hh was quite busy. FYI, it's only at the bar section and outside, and ends at 6pm. I would say get here early or even around 5:30 as we saw tables starting to free up at that time. 

We found a table outside and ordered margaritas and shots of jimador. For the margaritas, they have regular house ones, and the special that day was strawberry. I preferred the house margarita which was more citrus flavored. 

For substance, we had the guacamole, tostada with chicken, quesadilla suiza with beef, fish taco, flautas, and cevice. I was pretty disappointed with the fish taco and ceviche which were lacking in flavor, but I really enjoyed the tostada and quesadilla suiza. Also, you do get chips and salsa which are fresh and delicious but keep in mind, the orange salsa is ssspicy. 

Service was excellent, and our waiter made sure we could take advantage of the hh prices before it ended.
author: Maya S.

description:
This place is popping during lunch, and even when you think you've rolled in early or late for the typical lunch crowd, there's still a decent line and limited seating. Love their burritos. I usually order the carne asada but the other day I accidentally started eating the burrito of the attorney I work for and he got al pastor (it was so good I was only like 4 percent embarrassed when he realized I was an unknowing burrito thief). And of course -- love love love their salsa bar (particularly the creamy one, and verde). Chips are thin, hot and salty. Horchatas are refreshing and cinnamony rice heaven. 

Went here for dinner last Friday without reservations. Apparently I had to leave the table by 7 for a reservation, but it was plenty of time to chow down on their chile verde. Tried the Peruvano beans because that was new to me, but it more or less tastes like the pinto bean. Chile verde was flavorful, mild in spice, and very tender. Plenty for dinner, and the leftovers are excellent for tacos the next day when watching some old episodes of Californication.
author: Natasha P.

description: My girlfriends & I came here on a Friday night & were not disappointed with the food, cocktails or service! Their happy hour is between 4 & 6 pm so get there early to grab a seat.
author: Maneesha C.

description:
After our "Night" tour of San Fran with the City Tours busses, I played Roulette with Yelp and let it decide where we were going to dinner. I'm glad I looked at this because I saw my friend Brett N's review!

I value his words, so that weighed even heavier in the choice.. and off to TropisueÑo we went.  I did not put in reservations, so I expected a wait, and there was one, but it was minimal.  We were shown to a dark little corner booth and given chips and sauces. They were spicy but GOOD. I especially liked the Avacodo/cilantro/lime and the roasted jalapeno ones. 

We placed our orders for the Tres.. Yeah, The three pork dish and the 2 platter. I chose the steak taco and the chicken flauta. It didn't take them long to put the food on the table either! Less than a 7 minute wait from the time we put the order in until our food was before us.   Each of our mains was served with seasoned black beans and Spanish rice.  

The spice on each dish was good. Even my husband, who eats ghost peppers for fun, was saying how much he liked the heat. Me, it was a bit warm, but I survived. And I enjoyed the experience.  We were both able to eat the proteins but not the filler, and that's OK!  This meant that we still had a bit of room for dessert.

Ah! Dessert.. Original flan was our choice, it came to us, beautifully presented, topped with caramel sauce and strawberries. This consistency was more like cheese cake, but OH MY! The flavour was divine, and when you ate it with a strawberry, it was utter perfection!  I have to say, I was delighted. 

But the reason I took off a star and didn't give it 5: Canned coke at $2?  Iced tea at $4? That's just ridiculous. They have a bar.. they should have coke on tap. And in what planet does iced tea - even the two they serve cost that much. That's just a gouge. Stick with water or alcohol if you're drinking. 


Also be aware, it is -very- dark in some areas.  I had to use a flashlight to see my menu.
author: Dianna B.

description:
Make a reservation otherwise you won't be able to get a table. While you wait, go to the bar and order a margarita or their house sangria. The ambience is warm and inviting. The chips are handmade and the 3 salsas are all delicious. I ordered the chili verde enchiladas. Overall, best Mexican food I've had in the city so far. 

P.s. The servers are diligent & most importantly, friendly. 

Enjoy!
author: Alyssia J.

description: Went here for lunch late Saturday afternoon. Service was quick, the ambience was cool, and the food was good. I got the grilled chicken fajita plate and was a little disappointed with how lukewarm it was temperature-wise, but the chicken was tender and everything tasted as it should. Quick, convenient, tasty lunch spot.
author: Sarah W.

description:
As good as this place gets!! Perfect hotspot to quench your mexican taste buds. Relaxed mexico style restaurant located just off the yerba buena centre in sfo, this casual eatery should be on your top list if you feel like savouring everything mexicans. The cocktails, the tostadas and not to forget the burritos. Been here a couple of times and never been disappointed. I willingly recommend this place to anyone looking to try the best mexican food combined with their myriad of sauces...Yes I love them all!! 

Tip: Parking can be an issue so look for the cheapest parking on park me app or just take the muni.
Tip2: Plenty of veggie options..woohooo!!
author: Priyanka S.

description: Went here early to beat the lunch rush, but didn't get my food until 45min after. Ridiculous wait, but the food was good. Probably will skip next time.
author: Philip M.

description:
You better come hungry. 

How many times can you say that about an urban restaurant, especially in an expensive metropolis? Tropisueno. Say it out loud.

I walked in on a Wednesday night and it was packed. I was able to snag two seats at the bar, ordered up my casa de margarita ($10). It was good. Definitely boozy, I had two and I was funked up. 

Those chips and salsa. DAMN YOU, you chips and salsa. You are the bane to my existence. I just CAN'T STOP EATING YOU. Those salsas were just so spicy and flavorful to boot. Feckin' a. Bonus: ask for the habanero salsa, it will get your taste buds going. The bartender offered it up after my brother and I basically told him were inhuman when it comes to spice and just to bring it on! He did.

No need for apps here since I ate a bag of chips and salsa. I opted for the two enchilada combo plate. I absolutely loved that they let me order different ones! I opted for the chicken tinga in rojo and the chile verde in verde sauce. Throw a crap ton of rice and beans in to the dish and there you go. So.Much.Food. I wish I could tell you I didn't finish it, ::sigh::. I ate it all (actually, I spied a few black beans and rice on the plate). All of this for like $15. DAYUM. Still more expensive than some hole-in-the-wall spot in the Mission, but this is the FiDI and it's trendy, yo!

The enchilada's were good. I preferred the chicken tinga more for the spice factor. The pork in the chile verde was so tender, but ultimately lacked the flavor that green chile is known for! Huge chunks of pork, though; no denying that.

Service at the bar was ah-mazing. If all servers were on top of it as mah dude at the bar, the world would be a better place. Friendly, quick, informative, fun and passionate about what he's doing and where he's working. I wish I got your name, since your manager needs to know!

Food - 4 stars
Service - 5 stars
Atmosphere - 5 stars. I like bustling restaurants that are loud and high energy, if this place was empty, I don't think I'd enjoy it as much!
Drinks - 4 stars

I'll definitely be coming again, fo' sho' when I've got some serious hunger pains and looked to satiate with some solid Mexican eats!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Seriously I love this place.  Open bar salsa.
Busy during lunch time, line move up quickly. Order ur food, take the number, look for a seat and wait about 10-15mins for food. During lunch the Staffs are act super quick to clean up and bring chips to the table.  They are super friendly.  
I ordered shrimp burrito and added guacamole $1.50 but I don't see and taste any guacamole in my burrito.  Since they r too busy I dont want to go up and ask.  so maybe Next time I won't add any guacamole in it. Beside the guacamole I'm happy with my meal.  Don't forget to get horchata.  I wasn't a fan of horchata until I got one from them.  It was delicious, the drink it wasn't too sweet and too rich of cinnamon which I love it.  
Awesome to my tummy.  I will try their dinner meal next time
author: Beth G.

description: Loved the location of this restaurant, the decor inside of the restaurant was very pleasant, very traditional. My fiance and I sat outside (faster seating) the views from outside seating were beautiful! I ordered the spicy mango margarita and loved it, had the shrimp ceviche for dinner and it was delicious. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Mayumi H.

description:
TL;DR - Great happy hour!

Didn't try the food but amazing deal on the happy hour after shopping all day. Get the strawberry margarita with vodka. Its so good. (Hey, don't hate that I can't do tequila after my college years!)
author: Crystal Z.

description: It was fine but I didn't find the food particularly less greasy or more complexly flavored than cheaper alternatives. Nice decor. Loud.
author: S M.

description: Came for lunch on Monday. Got "solo carne" with pork salsa verde. It was great. The line was pretty long, but it was worth the wait. Would definitely come back.
author: Stu S.

description:
My brother and I had an amazing meal here last weekend. We were still talking and thinking about it for the next couple days after, but there are just too many food options in SF and we wanted to try other places during our short visit. Otherwise we surely would have returned again and again.

Tropisueño is tucked away on Yerba Buena Lane, a pedestrian-only thoroughfare that is located on the backside of the Marriott Marquis. It's easy to miss since Tropisueño is only lightly etched on the window, therefore look for the lit exterior sign that reads "Mexican Kitchen".

I highly recommend making a reservation which you can do so on OpenTable. We weren't able to make a reservation since it was a Saturday night and very last minute and we therefore ended up testing our luck as a walk in customer. It was about a quarter after 7pm and the wait was about an hour.  They asked us to check in with them in about 30-40 minutes which worked out perfectly since it allowed us time to head over to Union Square to snap some photos of the Christmas tree and decorated Macy's building. We headed back in the time they suggested and were promptly seated 5 minutes later.

Shortly after being seated, they delivered complimentary chips and salsa. The chips were freshly made and thin, just the way I like it. There were 3 homemade salsas provided...chili diablo (spicy), tomatillo avocado (mild but flavorful) and roasted tomato (lightly smoky)...all delicious!

My brother and I started with Strawberry Margaritas which were disappointing. We both thought the drinks were rather sour with no strawberry flavor at all. But to be fair, I don't usually order margaritas or tequila-made drinks so maybe it was supposed to taste like that??? On a positive note, the drinks were pretty strong. I read a review where the reviewer said him and his wife each had 3 house margaritas and walked out with zero buzz. Either I'm truly weak sauce or was just lucky to have a bartender with a heavy pouring hand because I was warm & tingly after only half my drink.

But the main purpose of our visit wasn't to drink, but rather to eat. Therefore onto the food...

I ordered the Camarones Tropisueño. Large wild shrimp in a creamy chile de arbol sauce finished with tequila, lime and cilantro. WOW...the sauce of this dish was OMFG delicious!!! It stated on the menu it was supposed to be spicy. Perhaps because I really like spicy, I didn't think there was much heat but regardless, it was perfect in every way. I about licked my plate clean and was hoping for more. My brother said this is the dish he would order if we came back.  If you like seafood, then I highly recommend ordering the CAMARONES TROPISUEÑO.

My brother ordered the Chicken with Mole Poblano. Leg and thigh braised in a traditional sauce made with dry chiles, spices, nuts, herb and chocolate. It was good. The chicken was moist and sauce well balanced.  Both entrees come with a side of rice and beans which you have a choice of pinto, white or black. They also provide fresh, warm tortillas.

Service was great!  The hostess was friendly and our server, Sergio, was helpful & attentive.

Tropisueño will definitely be a must for me on any future SF trips. Without a doubt...5 stars!!!
author: Angela C.

description:
182. I got the chicken with mole poblano and it was delicious.  My first experience with chicken and mole did not go well, so I'm glad I didn't have to relive that night again.  The triple dip that went with the chips was somewhat unique.  I couldn't handle the spiciness but I still tried to eat as much as I could.

Service was good... until the end.  It was really obvious that they were trying to get us to leave.  Not cool.

__________
My 2¢:
- RSVP.  You will be waiting for an hour if you don't.
author: Katherine C.

description:
The service was really good. I was impressed that the manager was walking around checking on everything. And the waitstaff seemed to really care when my vegetarian boyfriend didn't really love his food. (they don't have as many veggie options as some other Mexican places). But neither of us were really impressed with our meals (the mushroom empanadas, veggie pozole, and shrimp tropisueno). And the margaritas were just fine. 
The price tag is as much as any nice restaurant in SF, so didn't seem worth the wait and cost for us.
author: Kristina C.

description:
I've never been here for lunch, so I can't speak for the lunch experience. But dinner is pretty good. They've got all your normal Mexican dishes, but also a surprising amount of seafood on the menu. The tortilla chips were thin and crispy and came with not one, not two, but THREE different colors of salsa! Their tortillas come wrapped in towels -- not foil -- and you can get more for free! 

They have pretty good service. Staff was friendly and helpful about menu questions. 

The only downside is that it's a little on the expensive side ($13-20 per entree) and the place is insanely loud. You pretty much have to yell for the people on the other side of the table to hear. 

If you come without a reservation, expect a 30-45 minute wait time. That's alright though, I just put down my phone number and walked around Yerba Buena Gardens for a bit. They send a text when your table is ready.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Really good Mexican restaurant, tried the taqueria for lunch, good flavors, not spicy, pretty laid back place with not many people. 
Tried the tropisueño torta and the beef and chicken tacos they where both great options. Really enjoyed the horchata and the Mexican coke (go real sugar)!
author: Luis P.

description: Wow what a very reasonable priced restaurant close to everything. It's within walking distance of Yerba Buena Center, Moscone center and all the museums.  Now on to the food. They place a bowl of warm tortilla chips and salsa (3 flavors from mild to spicy) when You're first seated. I ordered the empanadas.  They came with a spicy sauce and cortido. It was light and very flavorful.  Also filled with veggies and no meat. (BTW this place has lots of vegetarian options from appetizers to main course). I then ordered the veggie Posole. It was filled with veggies and hominy with a perfectly chili flavored broth. I asked for lemon and it added just the right amount of zest. Seating was immediate although by the time I left it was getting full so if you're going after 6 I recommend making a reservation. The service was excellent.  Can't wait to return. BTW they are also within walking distance of 5rh/mission parking garage and Powell Street BART.
author: Rachelle L.

description:
Just found this hidden gem with the help of a friend that was craving some Bearded Papa's a few doors down. I ordered the nachos since I was feeling like snacking over an entree and a strawberry margarita. Ordering food is a little odd since you need to order your regular food and pay and get your #. Then, you go around to the bar to get your alcoholic beverage of choice. 

The nachos were amazing with the carne asada I added to all the fixings- salsa, guac, sour cream and cheese galore. I couldn't even eat through half of it so I suggest ordering it with a friend or ordering a regular entree so you don't have a too large pile of chips covered in amazing-ness. 

My margarita, on the other hand, seemed a bit off. My friend has a spicy strawberry margarita that he downed like water that had jalepenos to give it that extra kick. Mine was just ok. For $12, I either want it to be a little better than just ok, or be at some fancy bar.
author: Leina K.

description: Very accommodating staff as we showed up to a packed restaurant without a reservation.  Awesome bartender and bar back followed by a great server and support/management staff.  Everyone is smiling and friendly.  Food was priced appropriately and portions were great.  Loved that managers were on the floor keeping everything running smoothly.  Great find!
author: Melissa Z.

description: Busy cause of location in my opinion. Wrapped mush and the selection of draft beer at the bar is awful.
author: R R.

description: Love the Chile Verde here. It's my favorite. Apparently it's trendy to have undercooked pork chops so I tried it once here. I'm sure the restaurant did it well, but I just didn't like it. Awesome place. It gets crowded so go off hours if you can. They also won't seat you until everyone is there which is fair. It could use a fee more heat lamps outside.
author: Anthony W.

description: One of my favorite hh/Mexican spots in the area. The food is just excellent and so are the drinks. Reasonable prices for the area as well.
author: Holly O.

description: This place is a hit & a miss at times.  Long lines at noon.  Our party of 5 all order different items; however, some came within 5 minutes of sitting down and others 15 minutes later... I love tacos and $3.50 tacos with little meat and flavor are not worth the wait nor the $  Good for groups and I do recommend their carnitas.
author: Aaron H.

description: THE BEST SALSA I have ever had in my life. Also, nice bartenders and killer margaritas.
author: Anika H.

description:
Really cool easy atmosphere and manages to be chic as well. Easy wait with text message alerts for when your table is ready. Also very close to many things like shoppppping (& our apartment) which is a plus! 

Complimentary salsas are deeelicious especially that salsa verde. What is that...? Tomatillo? Holy heaven.

Portions are so large you will have left overs big enough for tomorrow's lunch for sure :)

I got some carnitas tamales and while they were really tasty, they were a tad lukewarm when served. I understand they probably have batches prepared beforehand...probably just needed more warming and that's fine. I still enjoyed em and left overs were fantastic.
author: Lisa K.

description:
My most recent trip to Tropisueno was an unforgettable/forgettable experience. Lets start with the good.

The FOOD!!! Absolutely amazing! The tropisueno camarones was fantastic! The Chicken Tinga tacos were a hit as well!  The chips and salsa as always are fantastic! 

The bad....  I wanted to place a to go order online, when I attempted to do so the website stated that online orders were not being accepted.  I called to see if I could place an order with the restaurant and was placed on hold while the gentlemen checked with a manager. 5 minutes later I was still on hold.... Since I was only next door at the Marriott I decided to walk over and dine in.  I was very surprised by how slow it was when arrived.  We were promptly sat but that where the promptness ended.  
Our service was slow... the order came out wrong... getting my check was like pulling teeth and was poorly presented when I did receive it. 

Long story short, food was great service was poor.  I personally value service.  I won't be back.
author: Terrance H.

description:
3.5 stars. Excellent chips and salsa. The shrimp w/butter appetizer has smooth garlicky taste. The chili verde is usually tender and has great flavor but sometimes you will get a very fatty cut. It is worth rolling the dice though. The plantains are sweet and juicy! Tacos are fairly average.

This place gets quite busy so make a reservation or you will be waiting a long time. The service is usually solid.
author: Luke M.

description:
We were in the city around Christmas, and after reading a lot of good things about this restaurant, we decided to have dinner here. 

It was busy in the evening, and we had to wait nearly 25-30 mins to get a table, but it was worth the wait. We are vegetarians, and we knew better to ask the waiter for veggie options. There are two options - Veggie Tacos and Enchiladas combo option. We ordered two plates of them, and did not regret one bit. The drinks were good and reasonably priced. 

The chips and the three salsas that came with it were so amazing, that we were half full just munching on them. As all the reviews say, the jalapeno cheese salsa was the spiciest and is unique at this place. 

The ambience itself was very good, the music lively and service - friendly. 

Overall, a good place to eat great Mexican food. May not be the ideal place if there is a large group of vegetarians as options are limited, but it is good as long as the group is small.
author: Prashant I.

description: Hands down my favorite spot in SF. I always come back! I really try to explore the menu and order different things each time. I am so impressed. The service is amazing and their food is well prepared and delicious. It is truly the most authentic and I love how they aren't afraid to uses spices. Drinks are just right and the music is not as loud as it used to be. Please I recommend you make a reservation, I know we all get busy but trust me, you do not want to sit and wait for the next table because it might be a while.
author: Anu C.

description:
After walking by Tropisueno many times, I finally decided to trust the thousands of reviews and give it a shot. What started of with a 30 min wait and high expectations ended in me wondering if they give out free sombreros like Chevys...

[Ambiance 3/5] While very cliche, the decor wasn't that bad. It felt like you were in a slightly cleaner, slightly more upscale Chevys... or a stereotypical cantina

[Service 4/5] The service was probably the one redeaming quality of Tropisueno. Our server was very friendly, joked around with my friend and I, and was fairly attentive throughout the meal. She checked on us several times, and made sure our water was always filled.

[Food 2/5] The highlight was probably the free chips and salsa... although the salsa was extremely bland and had no bite whatsoever. Given I wasn't at a taqueria, I decided to go for a more conventional dish and ordered the mole. While I wasn't expecting spectacular, hours over a pot mole, I was extremely disappointed with the dish. The mole came out cold and lacked any sort of complexity. It seemed to have a fairly mundane single note of cacao. The chicken was overcooked and didn't fall off the bone. And worst of all, it seemed like they microwaved a stack of tortillas before bringing them to the table. The tortillas were stuck together and mushy, resulting in them falling appart when trying to remove them from the towel. I guess it didn't matter that much, seeing as there was barely any mole on the plate to be sapped up by the tortilla...

[Value 3/5] While I was extremely disappointed by the mole, I was surprised that the prices weren't that bad, given their downtown SOMA location. And seeing as there's always a line out the door, either they're known for the cliche staples of burritos and enchiladas, or their drinks must be so strong that the food no longer matters. Either way, Tropisueno is not the place to go to if you're looking for proper Mexican food, but may have other redeeming factors which I have yet to discover.
author: Francis D.

description: This place has an amazing happy hour menu! Super affordable, and chips / salsa are constantly coming to your table. You can get a beer for as low as $4 and a margarita as low as $7 from 4-6pm. Their only downfall is that it's always FREEZING on the patio. They desperately need heat lamps. If they did, it would be five stars for sure!
author: Maureen L.

description:
Love the location and concept. A quick step off of Market next to the Marriott Marquis and you're immediately drawn in by the large crowd inside. Ordering is walk up and you pay at the cashier, then you seat yourself with your table number. Help yourself to the large salsa bar and ask the wait staff to grab you a basket of hot chips! Enchiladas are great and the margaritas are nice and strong.

Stop by here for a quick bite and surround yourself with locals and tourists alike!
author: Jon S.

description: This place is legit. The prices and quality of the food make them a good place for lunch. The team ordered burritos, entrees, quesdadillas and tortas. Everything smelled and looked great. I had the Fish tacos which were a good size and filling after just eating 1 taco. Would recommend and reorder via doordashers again!
author: Kam H.

description:
Stopped in here on the Sunday after Thanksgiving. Everyone knows how crazy SF is during the holidays so I was on the hunt for a place that would offer quality Mexican food without a crazy long wait. 

Came in with a party of 7. Im happy I did my research so I knew lunch time meant order at the counter, grab a number, and try to find a table. Surprisingly, we found a booth and squeezed everyone in. 

Chips came to the table about 30 seconds after we sat down. Perfect! Salsa bar is self serve. So are utensils and water. Salas were good, chips were really good and thin. My boyfriends only complaint was that the chips are a little too thin and kept breaking off in the salsa.. but that's just being picky. 

I ordered the steak nachos. They were decent. Nothing amazing. Big portions! Next time I think ill try and chicken as the steak was a little too chewy for my personal taste.  We grabbed margaritas at the bar... and this is where Tropisueno lost a star... their margaritas had SO MUCH ice in them. Seriously, so so much! So much ice that we felt like we were getting ripped off for an $11 margarita. 

Besides the heavily ice filled margaritas. This place was good. I like the atmosphere and the seating area. 

Overall 4 stars.
author: Roxy N.

description: I ordered a grilled veggie quesadilla and it was amazing. It was very well done & authentic. However, the horchata is a bit too sweet for me because of the much cinnamon added in. Service was great. I would go back & eat there again.
author: Rickie H.

description: Chile Relleno Burrito.....probably one of the best around period. That's all I have to say!!
author: Carlos S.

description:
Very average! The house margarita was more like margarita-flavored ice. Service was poor as well. Our appetizers never arrived and we directly received our entrees, after which we just asked our server to cancel that order and he made a face. Didn't receive a single water refill. On a Tuesday evening, the place was as loud as a pub on Friday night. I'm usually okay with noise but the tables are so close that you can't help but over hear the next table bitching about their jobs and bosses.

The food was good but left something lacking. You can get similar taste and quality at any average Mexican restaurant. Nothing extraordinary here... 

This place is not worth the wait or the hype...
author: Gaurav M.

description:
I could write a lengthy, verbose review but I think I can cover this in a minimalist way...

I rate this as no better or worse than the chain "On The Border".

I had Tropisueno - basically Carne Asada.  It was dry, chewy and not special.

My review in summary is:

Not special.....just OK
author: Jeff M.

description:
I came back twice in a row. And I'll be back next time I'm in the city. Thank you for amazing food and friendly staff!
Que bueno!
author: Adelaide M.

description:
LOVE this place... been going there kind of regularly for the past year and the service is always great, drinks are great, atmosphere is great!  It is A MUST for Happy Hour!!  It can get a little crowded (as most popular places in SF) no matter what day it is, so plan ahead. 

My dad, who is not a Mexican food lover tried some take out I brought to him and he said it was the best Mexican food he has tasted - this coming from a man who is VERY picky says alot.    

If you haven't tried this place ever, you HAVE got to go! If you have tried it, you MUST love it and you gotta go again :)  If you have tried it and didn't have a good experience, remember everyone has an off night (eventhough I have not experienced this there at least in the past year that I have been going there) so go back and give it another shot! 

Their house margarita is my favorite margarita, but all of their drinks are really good and not too strong or too light - JUST RIGHT. The server/bartender Tony is my absolute favorite staff person there... super sweet, attentive and always has such fun positive energy.  Most of the staff there even remember my "usual" LOL - makes me feel right at home.  Prices are pretty standard/comparable for the area and lots of fun SF places around to enjoy after dinner and drinks.
author: Cristina H.

description: The chips are great and I really liked the salsa! Decent interior setting.
author: Jeff B.

description:
I love the food here, but the last time we went we saw 2 cockroaches and had horrible service. 

A good friend was in town and loves Tropisueno's margaritas. We made a reservation for 3 at 8:30 PM on a Friday night. When we arrived at 8:25, the hostess seemed irritated we showed up and said it would be a 15 minute wait. While waiting, we had to stand on trash from previous customers in the entryway- used paper towels from the bathroom, a crushed Starbucks cup, an empty shopping bag, etc. My friends and I were chatting when a cockroach darted across the mirror on the wall. I let the host know and he killed it with a napkin. He acted like it happened all the time- gross!

When we were finally seated, our table was so wet our napkins immediately were soaked. We asked our server for drinks while we looked at the menu. Our drinks didn't come until after our food did! We saw another cockroach on the ceiling and immediately lost our appetites. 

I went to use the bathroom before we left and there was trash overflowing from the bin, and no toilet paper. I told the hostess they were out of TP and she said "it's okay, we're closing soon." Ummm no it's not okay!

Horrible customer service and really gross conditions.
author: Melissa M.

description: My wife and I were on vacation, visiting our daughter, who lives in San Francisco. Since we were staying downtown, and our daughter works downtown, we found this restaurant had good reviews.  So we decided to try it.  It was going to be an hour wait for a table, and it wasn't warm enough to sit outside.  So we decided to wait.  My wife went to the bar and ordered 2 drinks.  This was after being ignored for 10 minutes by the bartender.  When she finally got her drinks (2), the cost was $26.  Because of the poor service there, she tipped the bartender $2, and put it on a credit card.  At that point, seats opened up at a community table in the bar area.  We took the 3 seats and ordered our meals.  The food was hot, fresh, and very good.  Our server was very attentive to our needs, and because of him, we had a very pleasant dining experience.
