Around a month later, I get my credit card statement in the mail, and I compared my receipts with the statement.  That bar bill that we had a receipt for $28 became a $31 charge on our statement.  I tried calling Tropisueno, but the only means to contact them was through email.  Evidently, the bartender somehow turned that $2 tip to a $5 tip.  We did a dispute with the credit card company and got the $3 credited to our statement.  I also emailed Tropisueno to describe what happened, and they never responded back to me.  Hence, my review on TA.
author: Eric G.

description:
Over 3,000 reviews and it still has 4 stars?? Something is not right here. The only thing I can think of is that none of the people reviewing know what real Mexican food tastes like. I REALLY wanted to love this place. I loved the chips and salsa guy & I loved our sweet waitress but that's where the love ended. 
   My husband and I both ordered the "seafood caldo"
(Seafood soup) and it was missing one major ingredient... SEAFOOD!! It really should have been called fish and garlic soup. Almost every spoonful of soup I ate was just garlic and fish. There was literally ZERO shrimp in my soup so my waitress had the manager bring me four. LOL! I cannot make this stuff up. I really thought I was gonna get a giant bowl of amazing caldo de 7 mares or some crazy Mexican chiopinno but it was a $20 bowl of fish & garlic soup. This place fell very short of its 4 stars. If you San Franciscoans want real Mexican food, go elsewhere! FYI...Mexican food costs very little money to make. You're getting ripped off here! I could've made a giant pot of seafood caldo for the $50 we paid for fish & garlic soup.
author: Patricia J.

description: Beautiful evening outside and enjoyed the patio. The service was quick, portions were large and the food delicious. I had a spicy margarita which was rather small but delicious. The pork chili verde fell apart and was smothered in a warm green salsa. Highly recommend.
author: chad w.

description:
Everything is good about this place except the huge queue during lunch. Tacos , tamales , enchiladas .. You name it ! 

They bring fresh n warm chips out to the table during lunch. Their bar is also pretty good at margaritas although a tad expensive. 

Go late during lunch hours if you can to beat the queues..
author: Anand V.

description: The food is ok to good, but the happy hour prices and menu are great, as are the staff. Margaritas were delicious- I would totally come here just for the happy hour at the bar, get a couple margaritas, some chips and guac, and call it good! Our waitress was very attentive and helpful, and food comes out promptly.
author: Alyx K.

description:
This place has a nice and pretty lively ambiance inside. As my friend said, "it's a good first date spot." And that's about as good as it got for me. We were here for dinner and our plates came out 75% covered with a boring spanish rice and "sat-under-the-heat-lamp-too-long-and-now-there's-a-crust-over-me" beans. After a bit of excavating on my plate, I found my taco and flauta, as miniature as they could be, come out from the pile of rice and beans. Clever way to trick us into thinking we're getting more food, Tropisueno. But maybe I'm just a tough critic because my friends loved their food. They did get more "meaty" options such as the carnitas and steak, so who knows, maybe that tasted better too.

I gave this place 3 stars because there were a few redeeming factors. I had chicken on my miniature taco and flauta, which was cooked very well and had great flavor. Too bad it lasted only two bites. Second, we had some of their cocktails, which were delicious. Highly recommend the Tropisueno margarita. Third, they serve you free chips and salsa almost the second your bottom touches your seat...so I can't complain about that. The trio of salsas that come with the chips is pretty good too.

Overall, I'm not dying to come back to this place for the food, but I wouldn't mind coming back here for some pre-dinner drinks with friends.
author: Renu A.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants in the city. Delicious food and drinks. Service is hit or miss, meaning complete hit or complete miss. Great location too. Pricy though considering there's a lot of great inexpensive Mexican restaurants around.
author: Keagan G.

description: I went here last night when I was in town because the restaurant had so many reviews, so I figured I'd give it a try. The staff who greeted us was very friendly, as well as everyone else throughout the night. The restaurant has a fun atmosphere, especially at night. However, the food was awful. I ordered the pick 3, and got a chicken tamale, taquito, and carne asada taco. The tamale and carne asada taco had no flavor, and the chunks of meat were so thick, making it hard to chew. The taquito was the only thing I liked, but that may or may not be because I put a bunch of salsa on it. Chips were good too, and they give you a little dish with 3 types of salsa to go with it. Overall I feel I wasted my money. Food did not taste authentic and ended up being disappointing.
author: Jacqueline D.

description: Entrees we're very good, and the guacamole was ok. A lot of onion. The first time I've had Huaraches and they were fantastic. Also offer option of black beans with dinners. Margaritas were not super sugary and quite tasty. Service was pretty bad though. Very busy at night and we sat outside (me and the wife). Only one waitress for about 15-20 tables. Not really pleased with that. They're lucky the food is good and not super expensive to keep people coming.
author: Paul G.

description:
Shockingly good place in the most inauthentic, and my least favorite neighborhood in San Francisco.

Got stuck staying at the GloboHotel Marriott Marquis for business, which is attached to the restaurant. Not a lot of interesting places to eat within a few blocks of the hotel and was skeptical of this place given its location but I was pleasantly and profoundly incorrect.

Super legit food and great service. Salsas are scratch made, as is their sour/margarita mix. They serve several dishes which are legit Yucatan recipes. Their Pescado Veracruz and Camarones Ala Diabla are amazing. 

Highly recommend, though good luck getting a seat when the Dunder Mifflin conference is in town.
author: Paul D.

description: The best Mexican I've ever had. We came in without reservations and found two seats at the bar. Try and sit at the bar and ask for Rachael, the bartender. Mango margarita is amazing!!!!  Will definitely definitely come back!!!
author: Caitlyn C.

description: Amazing awesome great food. Highly recommended! Everyone was fantastic and OMG the food. So so so good.
author: Ryan I.

description: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants! Located in a convenient area close to Powell. Awesome vibe from the moment you walk in. I've had the tacos, enchiladas, and tamales here. The service here is wicked fast! And I love the warm complimentary chips. You can pick your own dips and bring them back to your table. Overall good food, the tacos are my favorite. Tamales being the least. It can get busy here during the lunch hour but I usually find a seat regardless.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Good food and prices. Restaurant was clean and customer service was great. They had a salsa bar, very tasty and spicy options available. Ordered the carnitas burrito, authentic and very tasty. Would definitely recommend and visit again when back in town.
author: Angy C.

description: Second time here. Food was really great. Had the three ceviches as an appetizer and they were fresh and each unique. Chile verde for dinner was also great mixed with a margarita. The place is crazy busy and service was a bit slow. Probably due to being stuck in a corner table for two. Still great experience and would recommend.
author: James F.

description: I've been here several times and the food is always on point.  The chips and salsa are the best in the city.  I always order the tampiqueno which is a carne asada steak, rice, beans and an enchilada.  Drinks are good too.
author: David S.

description:
I've had Tropisueno bookmarked for awhile so I was really looking forward to finally trying them out. There weren't any reservations available through their website at the time we wanted but we ended up getting a table at 7:00 p.m. on a busy, Wednesday night.

The food and ambiance is easily 5 STARS - I enjoyed everything about my house margarita, the carne asada tacos I ordered, and I loved the whole vibe and decor. However, what left much to be desired was the service. I know we didn't have a reservation, and that the restaurant was busy, but we were told by the hostess that they needed our table for a 8:15 p.m. reservation and that we would have to be done by then. I have NEVER been told this at any restaurant and was amazed at how aloof the hostess was about the whole thing. I was having dinner with an old friend and didn't want to rush with dinner, but I honestly felt like our whole experience there was totally rushed.

Will I be back? Possibly - I did enjoy the food and drinks and it wouldn't be fair to not give Tropisueno another chance, but it'll be difficult to not keep this first experience in mind.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Food is authentic delicious and the service makes it even better. The vibe is fun and relaxing. They make you feel like your at their home enjoying a meal. The prices are very reasonable for San Francisco. For me personally this is the best happy hour in town it's EVERYDAY 4pm-6pm. I guarantee for happy hour you will order everything on the menu. I saved the best for last their House Margarita is the best in town they use fresh squeeze lime I know because the bartenders prep it in thru out the day In front of you at the bar. They also use Agave. My favorite is the rimmed chili salt they use. I also tried the strawberry and jalapeño margarita both delicious and refreshing. Also check out their drink menu unique drinks that will having you come back again and again.
author: Bedilia V.

description:
DELICIOUSNESS 
(4.25 stars)

That awkward moment when you're satisfied, happy, AND IN A STATE OF BEING FLATULENT!!!! We are human, it's expected ;)

- FOOD, delicious 
- PRICES, fair 
- SERVICE, good 
- AMBIANCE, "mexican"

Usually avoid places in this area because the prices are higher for not so great food. LIES! That's not always true. You usually go to the Mission for good Mexican food... True, but not always!!! Mexican food is not my forte but if a place can impress me, THAT speaks volumes.

HEFER STATUS.

- CHIPS & SALSA (free) - with a food order they are free. The servers will drop a huge bowl of fresh made tortilla chips. Great selection of dips that is self served located near the bar. 

- COMBINACION one item ($8.72) - choice of one item, rice, and beans plate. I love tamales and it'll be the best item for me to judge a Mexican restaurant by their tamale. When my plate arrived, it was beautiful and the portions were HUGE. This was an one item combo and it was a lot. The rice was packed with flavor, the beans were delicious, the tamale was out of this world. Good stuff!

Will I be back? Hell yah!!!

Jaba approved. Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description:
Have been back several times since my first review.  Love love love this place! Great food with some unusual extras that take the food to the next level - a huge assortment of different salsas, fried plantains and several kinds of beans, and things like mole, tamales and excellent seafood dishes raise this above a standard Mexican restaurant. 

By day they are a counter restaurant, where you order your food at the counter and pay there, then choose your own table. The bar is open at lunchtime, but same deal, you go get your own drinks. They do bus and clean the tables at lunch. Dinnertime is a sit-down restaurant experience with servers and waitstaff. The menu is very similar but some things, like the plantains, are only available at dinner. Their chips (available all day) are really special, very light and crispy and delicious with all the amazing salsas. You can eat WAY too many of these chips!! Especially with their excellent cocktails - margaritas are very good and they have spicy ones that are a bit too drinkable for my own good. Great service too.

This place gets VERY busy, for good reason, so plan ahead. They do not take reservations at lunch so go early or late. They do take dinner reservations and you do need a reservation! Otherwise, plan on an hour+ wait at dinnertime, and longer on Fridays and weekends. I have not tried the brunch but I bet it's pretty great too :-) Highly recommend Tropisueno!!
author: Robyn B.

description: Centrally located for the convention-goer and popular with the local happy hour and lunch crowds, so it is loud in here.  You can get cheaper Mexican food elsewhere but for a sit down, was a large meal and tasty.  I wouldn't mind having dinner here again.
author: Grace C.

description:
Hip atmosphere and friendly staff. A few friends and I had a great time over chips, guac, and authentic Mexican food. 

This restaurant is in a quirky walkway between two busy streets but it was very easy to find. It gets busy during lunchtime as it's next to many office buildings. Dinner, too, can get busy. But definitely worth the wait! I'm coming back.
author: Nick M.

description: This place was so great! I read a lot of reviews that said it was so busy you had to wait a long time to get seated but we must have came during the sweet spot! We came at 430 ordered our food and sat at this bench right beside the order counter and was pleasantly surprised at how fast the food ended up coming! We ordered the guac which I would highly recommend! I got the cheese enchiladas they are a bit spicy but so yummy. My boyfriend got the fish burrito and it was HUGE! He ate the entire thing and even had some room for mine! I'm so glad we ended up coming and wasn't scared off by the too busy reviews. I would highly recommend it's in the cutest square too! In walking distance of a lot of stuff to do as well
author: Taylor B.

description: We have eaten here before and had great food,  it we stayed at the Marriott and this restaurant played super loud music that we could hear in our room. Sadly I was sick in my room and had to listen to it all day. I understand it's a bar and you are creating an atmosphere but think of the places around you. I was excited to eat here again but it's not going to happen due to lack of respect.
author: Angela K.

description: Been here several times and while they're a bit on the pricy side, I thoroughly enjoy their atmosphere. Tucked in between two main streets, Tropisueno is a brightly colored Mexican restaurant that features an impressive menu full of tasty options. I've indulged in their burritos, ceviche, chips and guac, and platanos and all are wonderful! It's such a great place to come with friends or after work!
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
I'm not going to tell you not to eat here,but I will not ever eat here again and I served a cold burrito so salty and the chips are so so nasty dripped in  bad old oil and extremely salty as well..
The people who works here are nice and they have a big place to seat anywhere you want and their price a very good,too bad they served bad food to a potential new customer who lives by..
author: Pedro D.

description: The place has a nice vibe and is great for mid-week post work dinner. I'd say however that the food did not blow me away and the service was fine, nothing extraordinary.
author: Vin M.

description: More tex-mex than authentic mexican food. The place was packed so the service was a bit slow, but good. Food was tasty and portions were good sized, not the most memorable meal but a good place to try.
author: Roberto D.

description:
So disappointed about their customer service.  I. Wanted to make my fiance try this.place for.the first time for happy hour but at the same time order some food and one waitress redirect us to table 21 when 
Another one came make us stand up and trying to fit us in a bar that was extremely full. Our decision best to leave and don't return any more! They should have better service and be more flexible
author: Veronika L.

description: Great for vegetarians. Got a huge veggie burrito, that was delicious then I covered it with habanero sauce. The food came out quickly and they gave us some complimentary chips. Also they have cantaloupe juice that was very tasty.
author: Nicholas A.

description: Great experience and I completely enjoyed my lunch. The only reason why I'm not giving 5 stars is because once you order, you have to find a seat, which can be really challenging if its busy.
author: M M.

description:
Just went to tropiseueno yesterday, and after being away for a year was still very impressed with them! Service is top notch, the second you sit down from counter service you get a very friendly worker bringing a bowl of fresh made tortilla chips where you can HELP YOURSELF to a fully loaded salsa bar, and... Wait for it, endless cut limes!! Dying. 

We got: torta Milanesa (3/5)-- meat was hard as a rock. Carne asada street tacos (5/5)-- just add lots of lime. Shrimp burrito (5/5)-- it truly is as big as your face! Carne asada burrito supreme (5/5)-- again, your face! 

They also have amazing outdoor seating, it's right near union square but far enough so you're not trampled by angry shoppers looking for the next sale as you eat.
author: Demsina B.

description:
Came here at 7:30, ordered food then waited an hour and a half for it to arrive. ON TOP OF THAT, only half of us got food. After waiting for a full two hours, we finally were able to flag down our waitress to ask about our order. She had not come to check on us since taking our orders. We then found out our order was not filled because their printer broke down. 

Then they still made us pay for drinks. This was terrible.
author: Sarah M.

description: Im not sure why this place was so delicious, but it was! It was nice to have a restaurant feel with some great food that tasted like grandma was in the back cooking it. I got the enchilada and chile relleno combo. Rice and beans were delish, as were the main dishes. Large portions so next time I dont need two items. They also give you complimentary chips and salsa bar, all very good. Salsa was HOT haha so we stuck to the pico de gallo which was the least hot of them all for these two white girls!
author: Amy S.

description: Huge disappointment ! Out of all the restaurants in San Francisco I made the huge mistake of coming here. Came for a late lunch/early dinner but they were still in lunch hours so they had us order and they gave us a number. I got the enchiladas and a Jamaica drink. The Jamaica was fresh and did not taste like a powdered drink like most Mexican restaurants. We were given tortilla chips and their was a salsa bar where one could help themselves. Our entrées came out about 10min later. The enchiladas were generously stuffed with chicken but lacked flavor. As for the rice and bean they were also lacking flavor and salt!! The beans and rice are the one thing that should be perfected in a Mexican restaurant but this place obviously has completely overlooked that. Also the prices are a little high for mediocre food. Wouldn't recommend anyone come here, especially if you're from Southern California and know about good Mexican food!
author: Fernanda R.

description:
Fast service. Cute place 


But... a friend and I went there just to kill some time and grab a quick bite before heading out 

Our food took awhile and they didn't even bring out everything we ordered (we didn't get charged either) but still.... we weren't too worried we shared the plate but I hope next time this doesn't happen again! 

I'll give it a second shot
author: Maryam A.

description: It was good but not like you would get in Texas.  The mole was very good and recommend that.  The three types of salsa were really good and really complimented each other.  Worth trying if you are looking for mexican in San Fran.
author: Doug V.

description:
The food was amazing!
The drinks were great size, decently priced, and strong. Best combo !
The bathroom could use some cleaning hence the 4 stars. However, do not let that deter you! Amazing place!!
author: Vera D.

description:
I came in around 9:30 on a Sunday night and there was a nice crowd of people there. The two of us sat at the bar, the bartender (very friendly) told us the kitchen closed at 10 so we should get our food orders in. 

While munching on the delicious salsa trio with fresh chips I ordered the "Camarones Tropisueno" entree. They  did not skimp on anything. It was a plate of delicious wild shrimp, a creamy spicy sauce, rice, refried beans and a red cabbage slaw. It was soooo damn spicy but sooooo delicious. My friend got the chile relleno which she also loved. The bartender was really descriptive about the drinks and we both settled on a mango margarita with agave and serrano chiles. Very sweet, spicy and refreshing. 

The only pitfall was the bathroom. At 10:00pm the bathroom was pure filth, several bags of garbage just sitting on the floor, mess everywhere.
author: Christina V.

description: I loved this place! The margarita is great, food is selfish and the price is pretty inexpensive! Will deff come here next time I'm in San Fran!
author: Jennifer B.

description: I am so thankful that they haven't banned me from this place yet LOL. I come here everytime I'm in the area with friends and we always order a round or two of tropisuenos and immediately get loud and have pretended that the tortilla chips are candles *i promise we will never do that again* the best part is, no matter how many tropisuenos we order, we feel amazing the next day! Haha. The chips and salsa have been our lifesavers on a few occasions, and the food is very tasty as well. The overall ambiance of the restaurant feels very homey and not bougie at all. The service is extremely friendly and they even give you chupa chup lollipops with your bill. Definitely a great place to check out if you're downtown!
author: Christine G.

description:
Not bad, but nothing special. 
Pros
Three salsas offered with free chips
Decent prices
Good location near Union Sq. 

Cons
Average Mexican food
Hit-miss service: waiter disappeared for large chunks of time
Two single uni bathrooms

In general, nothing terrible, but not worth a return trip.
author: Chris F.

description:
Good happy hour/dinner place. Price is on the high side as expected for the area. It can get really busy during so come expecting to wait a little bit especially with a larger group.

Chips/Salsa are automatically provided. Good selection of Mexican dishes. The Empanada, tacos, and appetizers we tried were all consistently in the 4 star level.
author: Lester L.

description: Wow.. Authentic Mexican food!! So delicious! You won't go wrong going here, if your looking for bomb MEXICAN food!! Definitely coming back when I visit San Francisco!!
author: Mark D.

description: Went to this restaurant twice for lunch while in San Francisco for a trip. It was conveniently located right below our hotel. Food was delicious! Staff was very friendly. Tried going there for dinner but it was much more rowdy than I'd like and so loud I could barely hear myself talk. Recommend going for lunch unless you're into the sports bar sort of crowd.
author: Sophia H.

description: Fun Mexican place tucked between the Marriott and St. Patrick's. Food is delish and the bartenders are super fun. The margaritas are perfection! Make sure and make a reservation, especially on the weekend. The bar area is FCFS, but it can be difficult to find seats on a Saturday night. Walk-in wait was going to be 45 minutes at about 7 on a Saturday. Luckily we found a spot at the bar after standing for about 30 mins.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Came around 4:30 for an early dinner on a Sunday with a small group. The place is lively, warm, and vibrating with good energy. The place and clean and the service is speedy --which was great because we we starving! The portions are great. I had the carne asada torta and it was delicious! The bun was crispy, the meat was well cooked and marinated, and the sandwhich balanced with spice and flavor. 

Will definitely come back again!
author: Hina M.

description:
This is the best Mexican food I've had since I arrived to this Country two years ago. I'm Mexican and I can say the mole poblano and the barbacoa tacos are amazing!!!
Great place, very nice people and service is fast and efficient.
Loved it.
author: Alejandra R.

description: Our dinner was quite disappointing.  The carnitas in my tacos had a strange burnt taste.  The server kindly switched them out for chile verde tacos which were just OK. Our food was not hot when it arrived at our table.  Overall, the food quality was not very good. It was a madhouse the night we were there, so loud you had to yell across the table. The servers were very good and did their best to accommodate their customers however I cannot recommend this restaurant as the food quality is not good.
author: Lilikoikitchen M.

description: Surprisingly good and fast. There was a huge line but it moves fast, they are a smooth running operation. One friend held a table while the rest of us waited maybe 10 min. I rodered a chicken quesadilla with everything and the chicken was grilled, moist and delicious. Maybe one of the best I've ever had. Can't comment on the rest but everyone enjoyed their food. Definitely a lunch time FiDi type place.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Amazing! I've been here a couple times and first time I ordered the Camarones tropisueno. The dish consisted of nine shrimp in a creamy, spicy orange sauce with mexican rice and beans. The sauce was so tasty without being overly salty or spicy (if I could by just this sauce i'd probably put it on everything). The shrimp was cooked perfectly too and was not rubbery or chewy at all.

The second time I got the chicken in mole sauce that also came with rice and beans. There were two chicken legs and two thighs and was very tender. The chicken itself didnt have a ton of flavor but when paired with the mole sauce... wow it was damn good. Mole sauce was just right.

I've also come here for lunch before and its similar to chipotle where they have all the food laid out and you can build your own plates, tacos, burritos. You also have the option of ordering a plate of something and they bring it to your table. The best thing is they have a salsa bar so you can get all the salsa you want (I love the orange one... so tasty!)

I love this place... great drinks and great food. One of my faves in downtown SF. I recommend making a reservation because theres usually a wait anytime i've come here.
author: Sheena N.

description:
I love this spot! 

The Mexican food here is Bommmmb! 
Prices are cheap and the quality of the food is still great. Flautas are super crispy! The meat is delicious, tacos and burritos are also tasty. 

They also have a salsa bar with a huge assortment of sides such as sour cream, salsa, jalapeños, carrots, radish etc.

It's pretty dark in the main dinning room but you can also sit outside on a nice day

They give you complementary Chips with your order

I have yet to try the bar yet but I'm sure that disappoint as well. 

Beard Papas is also right next to the location and they have delicious Cream Puffs

I also love the location because it's in Yerba Bueno, nice area to walk, sit and eat lunch. It's also next to the Metrion and the 5th and Minna parking garage. 

If your looking for a quick and cost effective bite. This is the place!
author: Arron E.

description: This place is great!! Walk in and order your food. Kind of looks like Chipotle style. But WAY better. Big menu and even have Vegan options!! Several choices of meats and beans. Very fresh. The chips are amazing! Also the red enchilada sauce is amazing!! They have a salsa bar too!! Oh and an open bar. No fountain drinks. Plenary of nice seating area and outdoor area.
author: Lori C.

description:
Came here on a busy day because there was a convention at the Moscone center. Waited in line for them to take our order for about fifteen minutes. The lady taking the orders was very competent and orderly. Then we sat ourselves because it was lunchtime (taqueria style). 

The chips and dip was self serve and amazing! My favorite was the green sauce and the super spicy habenero sauce. 

I had the fajitas and thought it was really good. It came with a side of 3-4 mini tortillas. You can choose what kind of beans you want (black, pinto, or refried). I got black and liked it (healthy and tasty!). 

I would definitely come back again for the chips!!!! (+the pretty good food)
author: Caitlin H.

description:
This is a crazy happy hour. Strong margaritas, hefty suizas, free chips and salsa. It's super popular so it can be hard to get a stand and rest your drink, let alone sit. The bartenders take the hh rush with grace, though. Props.

I've also been there for dinner, and their cocktails and ceviche are on point.
author: Vivian H.

description:
- Girlfriend and I were told to be out within an hour of getting there as they were busy
- "quesadillas" didn't have any cheese inside. They sprinkled maybe a teaspoon worth of mozzarella (or goat cheese?) on top. When we inquired about the cheese situation, we were brought back the same quesadilla with the teaspoon of cheese inside, instead of on top. And it wasn't melted in any way. Maybe all the other places are doing quesadillas wrong?
- Quesadillas were tiny, they were basically tacos that were wrapped and had a sprinkle of cheese on top.
- I got 2 small-sized tacos, a ton of beans and rice for $13, same with the quesadilla situation. It felt like this restaurant is just trying to give us filler foods instead of the actual dish.
+ salsa was great
+ our server was nice
+ interior is pretty cool as well

Stick with the taco truck.
author: Dmitri T.

description: Very delicious lunch spot as you explore the city. The salsas are flavorful and are perfect with the chips that they bring to the table. The house margarita was perfect - not too sweet and not too strong.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Service started out great, despite the restaurant being very crowded. The hostess seated us immediately as long as we agreed to be done within an hour and a half when a reservation was coming. I did end up spending my first 15 minutes there in line waiting for a bathroom because there were only 2, and they were single person. Even the kitchen staff were in line waiting to use it. When I got back to the table, they'd brought us chips with what they may consider salsa but more resembled 3 various hot sauces to me. 

I wish I would have better read the menu before we settled on eating here, because nothing really jumped out as fantastic or unique. Both my husband and I were underwhelmed with what we ended up getting and didn't even eat half. Also, the restaurant was SO LOUD. I couldn't hear anything my husband said even when I leaned in to hear him. We just stopped trying to even talk there because we would end up shouting and still had difficulty hearing each other. The music was just very loud and everyone else is shouting in their efforts to have a conversation with each other. Pretty sure this would be a one star option for a first date unless you sat outside. 

It took awhile to get our bill after our waiter disappeared for a good amount of time (maybe he had to wait in the bathroom line too). When we signaled that we were ready he seemed pretty irritated and essentially threw some suckers and the bill at our table. It was busy and he might have been stressed and honestly we didn't care at that point because we just wanted out of there. 

We had been so hungry we didn't scroll through all the reviews. We saw 4 stars on Yelp and just headed that way, a mistake I won't make again!
author: Julia P.

description:
My suggestion is to get here early or wait till the normal lunch crowd calms down, since this place gets packed.  The long lines should tell you and your stomach that they are in for a treat.  

I always seem to order a burrito of some type, so it's my "go to" option.  I guess I need to expand it and order something else, but when it's good why switch?  The burrito's are HUGE!  You definitely get your money's worth.  The bottomless baskets of chips just allows you to sample all the various salsa's Tropisueno has to offer.  I personally like the orange salsa best.  However, I seem to like several.  

Staff is friendly and attentive.  It's close to work, which is a bonus, but I'm usually in a food coma afterwards..........
author: Lon H.

description: Not impressed... maybe we caught them on a bad night or whatever but given all the great reviews and our possibly inflated expectations, it just wasn't what we expected.  Service was sporadic at best and the food was just average compared to any other normal Mexican spot.  Prob won't go back but I'm sure it works for some.
author: Jay O.

description: Always a long wait for a table on a Friday or Saturday night, but always worth the wait! The margaritas are perfectly mixed (and strong), the staff are friendly, and the carne asada enchiladas are perfectly packed with juicy meat, slightly spicy sauce, and a dash of cheese. A must have any time I am in San Francisco! Note: this place is not good for groups larger than 4 people. We tried it..we failed, miserably.
author: Nicole H.

description: Food and service are good, but it's SUPER loud and the tables very close together. You basically have to yell at your companion to communicate over dinner. If you get stuck with a punisher table beside you, you might be subjected (as I was) to overhearing someone complain to their friend about their boss, during your entire meal. And it's very dark -  keep your phone handy to light up your menu. I like romance, but man, it was hard to read the menu. Plantain appetizer was good, as well as the cactus enchiladas and grilled prawn entrees. House margaritas were nice, very good complimentary chips and salsa (3 kinds - all delicious!) I might try again for lunch or maybe dinner earlier in the week (this was a Thursday night), but the congestion of people was a turn-off.
author: Barbara K.

description:
This place is always so ridiculously busy. Luckily you can make reservations via Yelp, which is super convenient. It's also in a really convenient location if you work downtown and want a nearby place to meet for drinks (good margaritas!) and dinner.

Everything I've ordered here has been very flavorful. Most dishes are something like this: tender and well-cooked meat, delicious sauces/mole, paired with hefty servings of rice and beans and tortillas. I've been here a few times and whenever I look at the menu, I always wish everything was half the price listed. But then, halfway through the meal, I always realize there's twice as much food as I expected and I'll have a leftover meal. So I guess it works out. (Unless I decide to eat everything, in which case I usually end up feeling a little terrible but also very satisfied.)

The staff here is attentive, helpful, and really ridiculously friendly. They'll check on you, then double-check to make sure you're having a good time. Probably among the best service I've experienced at a casual place. No wonder it's always so crowded!
author: Brittany C.

description: It is so hard getting in here for dinner on a Friday night, but eventually two seats at the bar opened up.  The bartenders were helpful, Pleasant and very good at what they do. We loved the chili verde and the Salsa's with chips. I would come back. Good atmosphere.
author: Robin B.

description:
Preface : I don't really like pork. But I got pork anyways upon the waiters suggestion, and it was the best non rib pork dish I've had recently. 

We had Carne something, steak, with beans and rice. The steak was tasty, I got a lot of fat in the bites I stole from her, but it tasted good from what was edible. 

The chips were delicious but I think the hunger that mounts when you're waiting for your food makes them more appealing than they would be otherwise. None of them had the inconsistent firmness of say a Qdoba or Moe's, all of them were cooked nicely and tasted good.

 The corn tortillas I received with my meal are the reason this place isn't getting a 5. They tasted like a floppy cardboard disk, which was a staunch contrast to the food and ultimately dragged it down. Sad day. 

Otherwise, it was a nice experience albeit a little loud in the waiting area.  The staff was helpful and worked together well (I say that because I was able to give the bus boy my credit card and then the waiter returned with the book to sign on). 

They also refilled our chips pretty quickly. With enough swiftness for us to make the poor decision to accept that next basket despite us probably being almost full from chips alone. Yep.
author: Mackenzie P.

description:
Great food that is delicious. Haven't run into anything on the menu I didn't like.

Very popular so seating is hard to find. Reserve seating in advance.
author: V V.

description:
Best quesadillas on the planet. And they have an insane salsa collection. Free chips to top that off. Would go here everyday if the lines aren't long as they are.

The Burrito isn't to be trifled with as well. They make some heavenly tortillas.
author: Ganesh K.

description: First place we ate in SF on this trip, as we were hungry and it was close to the hotel. I had a chicken burrito and it was awesome. They have a salsa bar with 8 different salsas. They were all really good. I will definitely return.
author: Evan T.

description:
The food is good! Gets really crazy at lunch time, so get here early to avoid the line. I love the lunch/dinner here but made the mistake of coming for their newly introduced breakfast menu, and it was an odd experience.

The food was gross. Eggs hard and overcooked, potatoes burned, vegetables soft. Wouldn't return for the breakfast...
author: Christine E.

description:
Okay. So there HAS to be a reason why this place is bumping all the time, right? So I came here with a few friends (with reservations) on the Saturday evening at 9 PM. We passed by this place a-many times, but we decided that we should FINALLY get reservations. Finally.

So we sat down and had a wonderful waitress. We all ordered ourselves a margarita, and got a BUNCH of food, including the following:

1) GUACAMOLE DE LA CASA: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. A definite recommend.
2) CEVICHE DE PESCADO: Definite recommend this as well. I really wanted to have ceviche -- it had been a while since I had any ceviche, so I was really excited. Boy, did this deliver.
3) LOS FAVORITOS: I had myself a chile verde taco with a chicken tinga flauta. They were okay - I found the chile verde to be slightly dry.

What had made my day at Tropisueño was our waitress. She had accidentally spilled some stuff on my friend (which was bad), but came back with a dessert for us to say sorry. I don't think I've ever had such great service before.

Will definitely have to bring my friends here for more Mexican foods!
author: Joanne W.

description: Love how cultured this place looks, makes me feel like I am at my moms house having a taco.  The food was good and the salsa and chips actually taste like salsa and chips not like your typical corporate restaurants that  lost the Mexican touch.
author: Damiana G.

description:
This place is awesome.

Great servers, amazing drinks and full blast of fun.

The appetizer side could be improved a little more with quality and quantity. But the maragaritas make up for it.

PS: the server for our table could definitely wear a smile next time.. It wasn't great seeing unhappy people in such a fun place
author: Pranamee S.

description:
Took my girlfriend to this spot today, since we stayed at the Marriott Marquis for our anniversary weekend and were looking for something good. food was decent. Had to wait over an hour to get seated only for the waiter that seated us to tell us he needed the table back by 8:00(it was 7 when they finally seated us) we thought that was pretty rude. As soon as we sat down it seemed as if they wanted us out of there as soon as possible. We ate our food and as soon as we had a semi empty plate the bus boy came and grabbed it from us. My girlfriend was still eating the chips and dip and they took that away also.

The Waitress only came to bring us water and check on us once. We felt really out of place in there(we're Mexican!) it made us feel like they didn't think we were important enough and their other guests were. They need to take care of every customer equally and make everyone feel important. Had a bad experience at this restaurant and we will never be coming back again.
author: Zanti R.

description: The food here is UHMAZING but who the hell chargeds $17 for a quesadilla at dinner time?!?! Ridiculous honestly
author: Reisha T.

description:
Went for the burrito, actually enjoyed the chips and salsa more than the burrito.

I stopped at Tropisueno for lunch and ordered the shrimp burrito with refried beans. The host explained the setup for me and a few other people who walked in at the same time (order and pay through a cafeteria style line, pick a seat, food is brought out to you, salsa bar around the corner). They have glasses of iced water but also offer cans (and some bottles) of soda. 

I grabbed a couple types of salsa but the one I really enjoyed was the only one with a label that said "mild/med." The chips were that perfect middle group of crispy. They had a great crunch without being cut your mouth hard (that's what she said).

My food came out pretty quickly and I was shocked at how gigantic the burrito was. I was expecting something kind of small that would be picked up and eaten. This burrito definitely required a knife and fork.

I had spent my morning walking all over the city so I was super hungry and...meh, it was kind of a let down. It was a terrible burrito but it wasn't a great one either. There aren't a ton of shrimp, which turned out to be a good thing. The couple of shrimp I encountered (I ate about half of the burrito) had an oddly fishy taste to them. The filling was warm, but not hot (to the point that the cheese wasn't even really melted inside). 

The staff I interacted with was very friendly, the place is not only clean but has a really fun look, and the chips and salsa were fantastic. I was a little sad I wasted an entire meal in SF on that burrito, though. Just not worth it for me.
author: Kristina K.

description:
iQuiero una margarita!

After a year of walking by the daunting lunch lines and never planning far ahead enough to score a dinner res, I finally made it here today for linner! We arrived at 3:50pm & in retrospect should have waited until happy hour started at 4 to order. There was a bit of confusion surrounding the HH menu since the day shift employees get off at 4 and couldn't explain what food the menu includes. See attached photos for the menu. Oh well, I know for next time!

We ordered shrimp quesadilla, ceviche, two fish tacos and carnitas taco. The Baja fish tacos (3.95) are Modelo battered and pretty darn hefty! The sweet slaw and tangy salsa verde complemented the fish nicely- totally worth making a mess of myself for. The shrimp in the quesadilla were perfectly cooked. Make sure to eat these first because the tortilla gets soggy fast.

For 6.50 during HH, you can get a margarita with 2 oz of tequila in it. Strong, refreshing, yet doesn't taste overwhelmingly boozy! Instant love. I gladly polished off the rest of my lightweight friend's before leaving. Thanks, lightweight friend! :D

If you invite 5+ people to have drinks at the bar, they'll buy you (the host) drinks "all night". Holla! I'd love to come back for another midweek tropical getaway ;)
author: Jenny Q.

description:
3-3.5 STARS.

This review is based on their Happy Hour during the weekdays from 4-6. My friend and fellow yelper, Lori K., were seated right away at the community table near the bar. 

We were aware of their HH menu, so we went ahead and ordered directly off that menu. We ordered two house margaritas ($6), ceviche ($5), baja fish taco ($3.50), flautas ($4) with complimentary chips and salsa. 

Everything was decent - the winner of the bunch was the chips and salsa, which as many yelpers mentioned are freshly out of the fryer, thin, slightly salted with three great options for salsa and the flautas. The ceviche, which is made with tilapia was a little too fishy for me, and I officially learned after this dining experience that I prefer Peruvian ceviche that's cooked with the lime juice and other ingredients. The ceviche here is filled with tomato and avocado - in any case, it wasn't bad but it just wasn't my preference. The fish taco was tasteless and could've used extra lemon and fixin's. The drinks were good, strong enough, but could've been stronger. 

I'd definitely like to come back to have something off of their dinner menu because I love the décor and interior of the restaurant and overall vibe, so I will definitely give it another chance.
author: Kathleene E.

description:
Tourists and SF locals rejoice! Tropisueño is a great place for authentic Mexican food, strong margaritas, and it's all conveniently located smack dab in the middle of the city! 

\O/  -hooray!  (happy tourist/local rejoicing with hands in the air)   

What I like about this place is that they serve up authentic Mexican food far beyond your average Chevy's/GorditaDoubleStuffedDoritosChulupa nonsense that you come out to the city to avoid. Try their Callos Borrachos (scallops with orange, lemon, peppers, el jimador, and habañero) and mole! This was the first time I ever tried it and I'm glad I was able to. It's very easy to be skeptical of the concept of savory chocolate, but they seem to have it mastered here. On top of that, they provide an unending supply of hot tortilla chips with guacamole and dipping sauces which go great with their tasty margaritas. 

Finally, the dimly lit atmosphere is perfect for after-work imbibing with chums or an ethnic date! I mean, what better way to give your person of interest chocolate than having it gloriously smothered all over chicken and rice? mmm, QUE ROMANTICA!!!
author: Stephen D.

description:
This place is such a nice surprise!! I usually meet my sister for lunch. Super fast easy service, taqueria style seat yourself. If you're here for dinner it's a total different atmosphere. It's sit down slightly more fancy. 

Everything I've had here is so good and fresh! My favorite is their salsa bar/ salsas at dinner. There's a creamy spicy orange one that I wish I could bathe in. It's so good! I usually ask to take some home. 

The staff is always polite. A must try in SF especially if you are near!
author: Veronica R.

description: Food was ok, rice had an oregano after taste. 12 dollar ceviche was the size of a thimble. I was a little underwhelmed.
author: Carlos G.

description: Service is horrible here, staff is confused and inept. Food may be decent but when staff fails at being able to accommodate guests, their short success won't last.
author: Sf R.

description:
It was an adventure -- two directionally-challenged childhood besties finding the alley where Tropisueño is located. 

Casual ordering system: line up, pay for your order, reiterate order to ladies making your grub, find a table, load up at the salsa bar, wait for food to come to you. 

Love the thin homemade tortilla chips & creamy, flavorful guac. Orange salsa is delicious. Combo of cheese tamale & shredded chicken flauta (or rolled taco) is the perfect portion. Everything gets a thumbs up. 

Although it seems the Mission has a monopoly on Mexican food, San Francisco's actually got some grubbin-ass tacos & tamales in the unlikeliest of neighborhoods. Tropisueño is a fun option for Mexican when downtown, especially because of the festive, if not stereotypical cantina decor.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I really liked this place! Besides the complimentary chips and salsa (which were delicious), I ordered the Tampiqueño (carne asada with an enchilada), a side of fried plaintains (I can never resist these) and a cocktail called the Violeta. I completely devoured the Tampiqueño; the carne asada was cooked to a perfect medium rare and packed full of flavor. The fried plantains were good, and just what you'd expect at a Mexican restaurant. The Violeta was what I took off a star for. It's basically a more advanced margarita, with vanilla salt on the brim and some other ingredients I can't remember. It's not like it tasted bad or watery (it was in fact really strong!) but it was just very average for me.  

The servers were all SO friendly and inviting, which made me feel at ease especially for my first dinner in SF. Beware that the wait can get pretty long though, expect ~45 minutes during dinner hours.
author: Claudia C.

description:
First time here. Very friendly and helpful staff! Such a great menu and selection! I had the beef fajitas!!! SO GOOD. The black beans were delicious. The salsa bar had a lot of selections. The free water was also accessible.
I recommend this place and I will be back here next time I come down to the city!!!
author: Olivia O.

description: 4 stars for the food. 2.5 for the facilities.  Not bad...just average. Love the salsa selections. I'm a big chips and salsa fan and they definitely have it covered. If you want a drink then the bar is small and when it's busy you'll be waiting a while. The bartender was super cool. Very friendly. He was not an amateur. Working the crowd for sure. I had a shrimp burrito which was where the 4 stars came from. My wife was not thrilled with he tacos. The meat was dry and salty. We were there right at the end of lunch/ beginning of happy hour where the restaurant becomes less chipotle and more of a standard restaurant. It was said change so maybe she got the end of the prepared lunch meat. I dunno but it seems logical. The staff was super friendly.  My burrito was a solid burrito. Not special but satisfying. I'd go again. Safe option in the area.
author: Jordan B.

description: I came here for lunch due to the positive reviews. The line was quite long. At lunchtime you order, take a number, and then wait for the food to be called out or delivered. The lunch menu is more limited than the dinner offerings. I got the shrimp with beans, rice, salad and tortillas. The shrimp and rice were very tasty, the beans could have used a little more flavoring, and the salad and tortillas were typical salads and tortillas. I wasn't given any salsa with my to-go order and the aqua fresca made from hyacinth flowers had a lovely flavor, but was sweeter than it needed to be. It was a filling meal at a reasonable value, but the food didn't strike me as amazing. I'd return for dinner since there are more choices available then.
author: j j.

description:
Admittedly, I wasn't here for long enough to give it a very thorough review. First impression: the place is packed! I joined my friends for happy hour around 5 and it was already pretty crowded. If you're looking for a quiet night--look elsewhere! 

I played it safe and ordered a cheese quesadilla ($7)--large, cheesy and yummy! Their margartias are delicious--well made and nicely rimmed. 

Service is fast and friendly, despite the rush. I love that they give out lollipops with your bill.
author: Naveena S.

description:
Alright, I hate over-priced and glorified Mexican food. I grew up with Taquerias and Alberto's and King's Tacos (Cali-Mexi food in hole-in-the-wall places). This is one of the few pricey Mexican food restaurants that I truly love. You have to be forgiving because it IS San Francisco after all. Don't expect the 'burb prices.

This is one of my favorite SF restaurants. It's not that the food blows my mind. Don't get me wrong. The food is great. But would I pay that much for food like this if it were located elsewhere? If it didn't have the ambiance and classy but fiesta vibes? Probably not. But I would choose here over Colibrí for that fun atmosphere and Colibrí is just slightly more expensive. All Tropiseuńo is missing are a dance floor and salsa dancing. 

The bar usually has impressively competent bartenders who keep the drinks flowing on a busy night. House Margaritas specifically. The complimentary chips come with three highly addictive salsas. I normally get full before my actual meals because I am eating endless chips to polish off those salsas. 

The margaritas coupled with colorful string lights that glow up the dim-lit place and the perpetually busy/loud crowd make for a great night. 

I normally get the Camarones Tropisueño, and I recommend coming for dinner.  I've tried a burrito during their lunch hour which wasn't bad, but it isn't table service and is order-at-the-window, chipotle style. MAKE RESERVATIONS. This is one of the restaurants that I never get to eat at because I naively fail to make reservations every time.
author: Pearl K.

description:
Overall, a good experience except for the fact that their happy hour, which they advertise on their website as going from 4-6pm, actually ends at 5:45pm. If your last call for happy hour is at 5:45, then put on the website that it ends at 5:45! It was super frustrating to get there trying to make happy hour, only to have no one help us for 10 minutes, then be told that happy hour is over. 

The service was pretty poor, although that can be forgiven with our large group. The food and ambience was great, and free chips and salsa is always a plus.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Some friends and I were visiting from Milwaukee and craving some good Mexican food. This place wasn't anything special. Server took a little too long and the food was just... fine. The salsas were tasty! But go somewhere else. You deserve better.
author: Robby M.

description: Worst service ever. Asked for salsa 4x before anyone wanted to do their job. Food was served lukewarm/cold. The salsa was great though, which is why I'm giving it one star instead of zero (if I could). Lesson to all restaraunts: if you don't have the employees to serve your patrons, don't take their hard earned money. SF is expensive!
author: Varun U.

description: I went at a non-peak time -- about 2:30 in the afternoon, just after a visit to the museum next door and I was hungry.  I spotted the restaurant just off of Mission St. and was pleasantly surprised at the prices.  Customers order before sitting down, and they bring your food to the table.  Nicely decorated, very tasty food, and very courteous staff.  Highly recommended for a casual meal !!
author: Paul M.

description:
Tropisueño is really a tropical dream off the beaten path of Mission street.  The secret is out.  So expect to wait without reservations.

Inside, they have adhered to the tropical dream theme.  The carnivalesque lights add to the festivities with all the green foliage and dramatic lighting.  I felt like I was in a fancy restaurant in Cabo walking in here.  The service is excellent whether sitting at table or dealing with the bartenders.  People are friendly and like to be here.  

We came in here last minute with our party of five, and they were able to seat us under the conditions of leaving in an hour and a half to accommodate another party.  We appreciated that and were able to enjoy our tasty meals and relax in good time. 

I ordered the Pollo Asado with black beans.  The portion size was massive.  I consumed as much as I could though and was sad I couldn't finish it.  The flavors were fresh and fun like a party in my mouth.  Some lucky homeless guy got the rest of my chicken.

I can't remember what other members of the party ordered, but if clean plates mean anything- enough said.  

Their house margaritas (Margarita de la Casa) are great.  Unlike most Mexican joints, the house margaritas here are refreshing with a nice chile salted rim.  They are not weighed down with excessive amounts of sugar.  They also have about 130 different tequilas here for some of you tequila connoisseurs.  A nice shot of Grand Centenario will cost you $60.

Nothing but quality in here:  drinks, food, service, atmosphere and even pricing
I would go out of my way and come to SF and enjoy the fiesta to be had in here.  -best exceptional experience for dining at a Mexican restaurant around!!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: This restaurant has been on my radar for awhile, and I was kind of disappointed. My friend and I got there around 7, and it was a 40 minute wait, so we opted to sit outside (which is a first come, first served basis). The service outside was pretty good, and luckily it wasn't too cold. Everyone immediately gets chips and salsa, which were pretty tasty. For my main dish, I got the salmon cooked in a banana leaf, and while it was cooked perfectly, there was way too much seasoning on it. That kind of killed the whole dish. I was also supposed to get flour tortillas on the side, but they never came. :( I feel like they would have soaked up the spices a little better. Anyway, this is just a typical Mexican restaurant; nothing really special or different about the food.
author: Rachel H.

description: my favorite place to come during my lunch!! happy hour is amazing; great place and vibe, love the fast service and Jonathan the bartender is the best :)
author: Sasha G.

description: Nothing special. The chips weren't great. Salsa and cheese dip were tasty though. The empanadas were bland. The shrimp wasn't cooked fully and served cold - may have been frozen shrimp not cooked all the way. Busy restaurant. Servers were running around.
author: Ken L.

description: Very creative menu. Fresh, warm chips served with three different salsas. Delicious margaritas and other creative cocktails. Very good food. We were seated early with no issues. All the waitstaff was efficient and polite. Servings are large. The place was packed on Saturday night, and the ambient noise level in the room prohibited normal conversations.
author: John D.

description:
Happy hour? Yes please.

Strictly happy hour review. Alright. Alcohol right? It's good right? Of course it is. We got the house margaritas ($6 I think?) and they were fantastic. Strong, limey and alcoholy. We also finished it off with Michelada, Tecate as the beer ($2.50 for beer,$1 for tomato juice). I'm not a beer guy really so Tecate wasn't the best, but it worked. Also got the Carne Asada Quesadilla ($6) and it was sooo good. Loaded with cheese and meat, LOADED. 

You can't go wrong here.
author: David T.

description:
Great margaritas, super friendly staff, quick service and good food.

My dinner was VERY tasty. Felt authentic, but prepared in the restaurant's own style. You can tell a lot about the quality of the beans and rice, both were great at Tropisueño. 

I had a plate with three sopes. The masa was prepared deep fried, taking me back to the 'puestos' in central Mexico I grew up loving.

The three meats were flavorful and very well seasoned. I had cochinita, carnitas and chicken. Better than I expected, to be honest. Very likely I will stop again next time I am in town.
author: Gerardo D.

description: While it's a little but difficult to find, this place is indeed a gem tucked away behind the Marriott. Unique in that the restaurant is a walk-up, order, pay and seat yourself set up for lunch hours, it felt very comfortable to take your time and peruse the large hanging menu on the wall. I ordered the shrimp, fish, and al pastor tacos in combo with refried beans and rice. The shrimp and fish tacos cost a premium and were not as good as the al pastor, but I have to say all three were quite delicious. Complimentary tortilla chips and salsa bar were also a nice touch, although beware the "hot" spoons were in the mild salsa and the hot salsa had unmarked spoons -- I learned the hard way. All in all, a great spot to get some delicious Mexican food if you're in the area!
author: Vitaliy N.

description:
I absolutely loved this restaurant! It was a really nice, chill ( a bit loud) vibe. 
They give you chips and salsa as appetizers which is always a plus. I've tried their shrimp tacos which came with beans and rice and the food was delicious! Usually Mexican food tend to be salty but it was not salty and the fish tacos were very simply yet flavorful! I wish they also had the fish tacos but they didn't. 
Next time, I want to try their happy hour menu. 
I recommend that you come super early or make reservations because the wait can get really long (up to an hour!)
The owner/manager even walks around to make sure that everyone is satisfied with their food :)
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description:
This is a very solid Mexican option in the neighborhood. It has enough ambiance for a date night, but it's casual enough to bring your kids or baby for dinner. 

I loved the veggie chile relleno; I left stuffed and happy!
author: Margs K.

description:
Happy hour review only:

Small bar area for their happy hour specials. Their margaritas are pretty good and only $5, and a small selection of Mexican beers too. Make sure to ask for the chips and salsa!
author: Angela K.

description:
This place has a really energetic vibe and is great for groups (despite the slightly dim interior lighting)!  For dinner, make a reservation beforehand if you can -- otherwise nice excuse to take a stroll at Yerba Buena Park across the street while you wait.

Our food and service were spot-on. The waitress was pleasant and came to our table at all the right times without over-attending. Don't fall into the trap of gorging on the amazing salsas and chips that they constantly re-fill. My favorite salsa (of the three) is the slightly warm and spicy orange.

Portions are huge! They can definitely last you two meals, especially if you're already partially full with salsa and chips...which you most likely will be. I ordered the "Tres Cochinitas" which was a three-combo Pork taco dish including Chile Verde, Al Pastor, and Carnitas. Really loved the Carnitas and Al Pastor; the chile verde meat was a little too fatty for me. 

They offer options for refried beans, black beans, and Peruana beans. Try the Peruana! It is a mild-tasting white bean simmered in broth, bay leaves (?), and some spices. Very comforting side dish. 

Definitely coming back to try the margaritas.
author: Arushi S.

description: I've walked past here a dozen times, but finally ate here.  Great food!  Get the guac and chips -they're great!
author: Todd C.

description: Stop in after work yesterday.  Wow what a great time. I had this amazing pork chop and the drinks were on point.  It's always busy, however the food and drinks make up for it as well as the great atmosphere.  Love the food, staff and overall just Tropisueno.
author: Jerome S.

description: Hella busy especially during lunch hour. It's  very fast paced so ordering is a bit stressful and loud. Our food arrived pretty fast. I ordered standard carnitas tacos and they were pretty delish. The sizes were bigger than I anticipated,  so that's  definitely  a plus in my world. The tortilla chips were pretty crispy and the sauces were flavorful.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Heaps of affordable and delicious traditional Mexican food (no ground beef tacos schmucks).  Chili Verde and Chicken Mole had my man and I grinning ear to ear as we descended into an irrecoverable food coma.

In a city where there are many very nice things (and you pay accordingly), it is nice when you don't pay nearly as much as you expected, and get way more than is reasonable.  

I'm sure they are still making a profit, but if you are looking for a good deal, great ambiance, friendly staff, and a box full of leftovers--Check out Tropisueno.  You wont be sorry.

Did I mention that their daily special fresh fruit margaritas had, even this tequila-fearing-Susan, happily stealing her man's drink?
author: Susan C.

description: Very busy and it's an order then find a place to sit kind of place. With how busy it was, I would have though it would be good, but definitely not very flavorful. Might just have been busy because it's connected to the Marriott where we happened to be staying for a pharmacy conference. It was quick and easy, but wished we traveled a little further instead of taking the easy way out.
author: Erika C.

description:
Local friends took me here then I returned during my weeklong visit. Delicious and fresh dishes that have complex flavors. Wonderful margaritas. Great service. I had soft tacos with Barbacoa and house chicken. On my return visit the waiter recommended chile verde pork - amazing cilantro and onion flavors. The black beans are flavorful with good texture, not overcooked. Chips and trio of dips also delicious. The salad (mango, jicama, cuke, pumpkin seeds) was crispy and refreshing. My friend and I stayed late and they generously let us longer as they cleared up around us. 

This was very convenient to the Marriott Marquis and Yerba Buena Gardens.
author: FoodGirl G.

description:
We got takeout here tonight, the veggie enchiladas and chili cheese tamales. The sauce on the enchiladas was good, but they had given us chicken enchiladas, so I couldn't eat them because I'm vegetarian. My husband ate them instead and pulled out several pieces too charred to eat. 

I ate the tamales, and halfway through the second I tasted mold. I had my husband taste it too, and he also tasted mold. He had eaten most of the first tamale before we switched, and said the other one had tasted fine. 

The only plus for me in this experience was that the rice that came with the entrees was quite tasty. I ended up ordering a second meal through a nearby chain restaurant because I wasn't able to eat much of our order, and while the meal there was pretty mediocre, at least it met the basic standards of being the correct order and not containing mold.
author: Keri C.

description: We had beef tacos (so so) and mole platter (ok). Portions were big which may explain the crowds, because the quality of food doesn't. Prices were ok, $25 with sift drinks. Service is good but lines were long. But I wouldn't come back because the food is just so so.
author: Phil J.

description:
Went here once for dinner and waited a while for a table so I would recommend a reservation if you tend to get hangry. Food was delicious but the place was packed and service was a bit slow, but friendly.

Went here recently during lunch when the place is taquieria (sp?!) style and it was fantastic. Menu is big, my mojado burrito was ENORMOUS and though the bar seating was full I still didn't have to wait long for my mezcal margs. 

Big salsa bar selection during lunch --- tasty!!!
author: Katie N.

description:
Had a great lunch at Tropisueño! We didn't know what the website meant by taqueria at lunch, full service at dinner, but as far as I could tell the menu was the same; only difference is you order at the counter and then just go find a seat. We had the fish tacos and an enchilada --
 both great -- and then stayed behind for a few hours talking (I was with my dad, who had a suitcase, so we didn't really want to go wander). The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating and we had a great experience! Will happily go back again.
author: Rina F.

description:
Had dinner with a friend last night at Tropisueno. I'd never been but after looking at their menu online I was really pumped about dinner. 

The salsas are so delicious, especially the really spicy yellow one! Yum! We ordered some guac that was good but nothing special.

My friend had the cheese enchiladas which were generously covered with sauce, she liked them a lot. I tried the Huarachas "tres Conchinitas with re-fried beans (w/lard!) and rice, it was a great sampling of delicious porky goodness. The thicker tortillas are a nice touch, I ended up using them kind of like chips and scooped by my rice and beans. I also had a Margarita which was nice and stiff.

Service was friendly and fast, and prices seemed pretty reasonable. They were also great at helping us get out the door for a show. (Pro-tip - Always tell a restaurant if you need to be somewhere they're not mind readers.)
author: Margaret I.

description:
The server was so nice. He was cute too, and I'm married to a woman that I love making love to. Basically: a friendly/cute combo transcends all in dining.

Furthermore, the servers' assistants are INCREDIBLE. They kept our table so clean and all of our water glasses full. Watching them turn tables so quickly made me honored to eat here.

The chips and salsas arrived so fast, our server hadn't even finished taking our three drink orders--same with the "fucking-incredible" guacamole. Seriously, so fresh and so clean.

Okay, then the drinks came. Also very prompt. They've got Modelo Especial on draught here, and that's super cool.

Aaaaaaaand the food. The food was splendid. I ate the ground beef-stuffed pepper and had refried beans (per cute server's suggestion). All the food was amazing.

Remember: this is San Francisco, people. For the price, this restaurant is hands-down your best bet for Mexican food in the Financial District / South of Market area.

Cuz I don't know where the hell I am anyway! :)
author: Scott E.

description: Great little Mexican find! We found this place in the middle of a monsoon one night. We only had to wait about 15 minutes before being seated. I had a great beer on draft. The 3 salsas they give you are all amazing. My husband had a skirt steak and it was wonderful. My sone and I split the carne asada tacos and they were good as well. Solid food and service here.
author: Meg R.

description: Nice place. Great ambience for a relaxed afternoon. The food is average. Being in SF, there's high pressure on any Mexican restaurant to match up to mission standards. Tropisueno doesn't come close but is definitely a decent choice if in the Yerba Buena area
author: Ashmita V.

description:
Yum! I have now been here for lunch and dinner (pretty different menus). It's close to work and BART. I went for dinner most recently and had a house margarita, it was delicious. My brother had the appetizer tacos (he wasn't that hungry), but he was wow'd but how flavorful it was. Their salsa is the best. There are so many to choose from, and they are all good. 

Highly recommended!
author: Melissa S.

description: Bahaha.  This  place does not give a rats ass about their customers.  Bartender....rude. While waiting at bar waiter mocked customer because she asked for napkins (for the third time). Seated..... uh 20 minutes, no water, no waiter. We left and told host at the front desk why. He literally said, "so?" Food might be good but we will never know.  Ugh. Why do people support places like this?
author: Jen B.

description:
We decided to celebrate a little holiday season joy and procrastinate our holiday shopping by meeting up for Happy Hour one night at Tropisueno. 

The happy hour here is pretty popular, so get there early to save room for friends. Just know that others will be eyeing those seats until your whole party arrives. The Happy Hour here is worth the wait. 

We ordered many many $8.00 Happy Hour Margaritas, even joking with our waiter that he was a "Maragrita Hustler". We tried the guacamole, the trio of salsas, the ceviche, the nachos, the tacos, basically all the HH treats we could get our hands on. 

Although we had more fun drinking than getting ready to do our holiday shopping, the cocktails put us in a holiday fun mood. Pretty soon we were ready to get our lists tackled after a fun happy hour at Tropisueno.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
My fav FiDi Fresh Mex!

During lunch hour, the line will bust out the door and curve around the outdoor seated area.  So, like any 'smart' lunch muncher, I'll get there at 11:30AM to beat the madness.  There's usually a line of  5-8 people ahead of you but once the clock strikes 12pm, the line forms into 25-30 people long.  

Each time I come here,  I order the chili rejeno burrito.  This is actually a 3-part meal for me, folks.  It's a big o' burrito about the size of my Llasa Apso poochie at home!  Sometimes, I see my dog as a super burrito... but that's a different story.

When you dine in, which I always do, they give you a big bowl of fresh chips.  You can pick as many flavors as you want from the salsa bar.  The chips are super addictive because both chips and salsa are fresh fresh fresh prince fresh!  Okay, this is probably why I can't finish my burrito...because I eat more chips and salsa than I do my burrito - Ha!

BOTTOM LINE:  This place is a great restaurant, the decor is cute and decorated with traditional Mexican gear.  The food is good and super sized.  Free chips and salsa to go with your meal - that is very very rare in FiDi!!!  

NOTE:  Service sometimes lacks.  Several times, the waiter couldn't find your number on the table, so, it goes back to the kitchen and just sits there.  By the time, you call the waiter for your order, it is cold.  Then you have to return it to the kitchen to get it heated up.  No Bueno.  Deduct 1 star due to dazed and confused service.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Go for Mexican in the Mission - you'll have a better experience for a much more affordable price.

It's six years later since my first review and unfortunately, I can't report anything better.  Now granted, I had reported a one-star experience based on some horrible service I had with one of the (former?) owners at the restaurant named Rodrigo.  But for some reason, my review wasn't allowed so I thought, maybe I should go back and give it a try.

Here's my conclusion: The food is mediocre, the prices are elevated, and let's get real - if you want Mexican food of this quality, then go to Valerta in la Mission.

Ok? Done and done.
author: Angella S.

description: OMG!!!! I love this cute little place and set up. It's really extremely busy when u read reviews that say make a reservation do it! It's quick and easy. I'm very picky when it comes to Mexican restaurants and let me say I loved their food!!! I had a ceviche de Cameron plate, the serving was sort of like an appetizer but it was to die for. It had purple onion, shrimp, lemon, chile cerrano, and mango, yes mango! It was great! My boyfriend had the chile verde platter, the meat was so soft and delicious comes with rice, tortillas and beans. Also ordered the plantains wished it came with sugar but instead it comes with a side of black beans which I decided not to order. Dinner time is busy. And parking, use the parking garage nearby. Come early so you can shop around
author: Daisy M.

description:
Keep in mind that lunch is a different style of service from dinner! For dinner it's a sit down place and for lunch it's cafeteria style! 
Ok, the lowdown for lunch that you line up to order food and then brawl it out for a table. This place was PACKED when I went, and none of the reviews I had read talked about how this place is run. 

I had the pollo tinga in my taco and it was SO GOOD. SO FLAVORFUL. I almost didn't need to put one of their various sauces from the super awesome sauce bar. 

I will say that they are a little disorganized -- they served my vegetarian aunt a chicken tostada, forcing me to then go vy for the cashier's attention to get that fixed.
author: Ria D.

description: Just moved to SF and this now one of my favorite Mexican restaurants to go to! Friendly staff and the food is beyond excellent. I highly recommend, you won't be disappointed!!
author: Nate B.

description: The food and drinks were awesome. I was a bit hesitant to eat in Mexican restaurant located in downtown San Francisco but I can assure you it was a great!
author: Jose A.

description: We visited Tropisueno for weeknight happy hour to meet some friends and brought our infant. I can't express how impressed I was with the service from the manager. I asked to switch a bar stool for another with a back to make it easier to feed my baby and he did this without question although they clearly have specific places for both stools. Then, when we were looking to use the bathroom to change the baby he mentioned that while they don't have changing tables in their bathroom he can help us over to the Marriott next door to change him. (He brought us through the back so we didn't have to go outside in the cold and even waited for us to return so we weren't stuck). Beyond this excellent experience with the staff, the endless chips and salsa which should be standard but is often not anymore is fantastic! We loved the avo salsa. The happy hour food specials are nice. We had flautas and tacos. And drink deals made our evening. We will absolutely be back!
author: Sloane D.

description:
Astoundingly bad service. I really can't believe it. We sat outside after checking in with the hostess and waited just over 20 minutes before anyone came to speak with us. It was all downhill from there. The waiter forgot to give us water, silverware and menus over and over again. He kept walking past us saying, Oh yeah! Turning around again and never coming back with anything. Eventually we went inside and  got them ourselves. Repeat with our drink orders. After we finally got our food (we were there two hours total for appetizers and drinks) we could not get this guy to give us our check. It was insanity. Had to go inside, tell the hostess what we ordered and get check from there. 

Never have I ever dined and ditched but goddamn it I was close in this one.
author: Carly W.

description:
Burrito is HUGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Chips is DELICOUS!!!!!!!!

Salsa is BETTER THAN EVERYWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!

We randomly came here for Mexican food.  I had very high standard of Mexican food because I am from San Diego.  The food here is definitely delicious.  The line is long, but the wait is short.  You can quickly get to order immediately and then get the seat.  Come here for Mexican food.
author: Brandy C.

description: Where to start... free chips and salsa, great margaritas, friendly staff, and great food... this place was awesome! I had a chicken enchilada and chicken tamale. At first, I was skeptical, because the tamale was skinny and came unwrapped, but boy was it delicious! The chips and salsa were also delicious, and just somehow kept appearing at our table. I think the only downside is that it was a bit noisy. We didn't care because we were dining with friends that have a baby who was making some of his own noise. Just don't go here if you are expecting to have a romantic or intimate conversation.
author: Tonya G.

description:
Surprising choice right in the heart of shopping, hotels and museums between Market and Mission just east of 4th St.
We stopped in for dinner without a reservation and found a bustling vibrant crowd and accommodative staff. After a 5 minute wait we had a table and received excellent service. The food and drinks were exceptional.. not the normal Americanized version of Latin food with too much sauce and cheese. Clean and delicious with great flavor combinations... try the Molotes!
author: Mike H.

description:
Great place in Soma for fast,dependable, and affordable mexi food. 

From the outside it looks like nothing, but once you step inside you are transported far away from market street.

Love the salsa bar with a great selection of salsas and marinated vegtables.

Great guac and chips. Killer top shelf margaritas....they top em off with grand mariner or contreau....I forget.
