I had the carnitas which was very good, great beans and rice...tortillas were meh.

My bud had the shrimp and they looked amazing.

Prices are really good for downtown...place gets crazy busy starting around 12:15.....I had my eye on da watch.

Really fun place,,,,check it out.
author: David G.

description: We came here because of the great reviews. My boyfriend liked the chicken mole dish but said it wasn't spectacular. I got the favorites plate and left the tamale uneaten. Quite frankly, the enchilada left a lot to be desired as well. You're basically sitting on top of the people next to you so I feel like the food should make up for it but definitely doesn't. Overrated.
author: Aishani P.

description:
Came here after the world series parade, and of course, dining area is closed until 5pm. No big deal, we'll just wait in the bar area during happy hour.

Convo with host:
Friend: So we can be seated during dinner time right?
Host: yes, once the rope comes down, its first come, first serve.
Friend: Cool, we'll wait.

Ended up getting the house margarita and snacked on chips with the three salsa options. SOOOO GOOD! I wish I could take the salsa's home! The margarita was really good too.

As 5pm hit, of course we naturally go in to grab a table as their was a line forming.
Well, the manager stopped us asking what the hell are we doing. Uhhh grabbing a seat? He told us we had to put our name on the list, and of course a long discussion came along after about what his host told us.

Eventually, they realized they made a mistake, and sat us right away. Well, service wasn't that great either. Its as if they put us in our corner, and purposely forgot about us. Until after we finally spoke up, and waiter came and told us he didn't know our table was his. Really?

The food was really good. I ended up getting the chicken poblano (?).

Interior decor is nice, and seating isn't too bad, but it is small inside. 

If the service was up to par, and we didn't have the little mishap in the beginning I would give it a five star.  Place gets super packed so come early.

Prices are meh, but hey, it ain't the mission!
author: Nika K.

description:
Very impressed! Tropisueno is a well-rounded restaurant. Here's the prognosis: 

1. The Wait: You're greeted at the door, asked for your name, etc. etc. The wait was about 30-45 minutes, so not terrible. And they text you when your table is ready. Why can't all restaurants do this? I'd rather have them text me than hand me a grimy buzzer or force my party to wait around in a confined space for extended periods. I was able to wander over to the Union Square during the wait.

2. The Bar/The Alcohol: The bar is POPPING! Its a party up in there. The drinks had good flavor, but oh boy were they stronger than what I expected! I got whatever their "lightest, fruitiest, sweetest drink" was and that had me glowing in a few minutes. So all you light-weights out there like myself, be careful with those things. :) 

3. The Food: You get bottomless chips and an assortment of three dips - thats FRESH! How could I tell? All three dips come in one plate, but two of the three dips came out chilled every time, and the third dip (the red pepper one) came out hot. I appreciate that they're poured for every serve and not pre-prepped/sitting out.  

I got the Enchiladas De Nopales - one veggie and one chicken all soaked in a creamy corn sauce (if you're picky about sauce-to-food ratios, may want to ask for it on the side). It was so delicious! Wish there was more chicken in that enchilada, but otherwise I have no complaints. Also, exxxxecellent beans and rice. 

I also tried the Salmn En Hoja De Platano, a salmon entree thats slow-cooked with pasilla peppers and onions in a banana leaf. ITS AMAZING!!! I ordered it medium-rare, and it simply melted in my mouth. I had no idea salmon could hold such a punch of flavor. It's a must-try. 

4. The Service: So friendly, genuine and attentive. My water glass was always topped and we were checked-in with at appropriate moments. I also received honest feedback on menu items, which is always appreciated...Shout-out to our awesome server RACHEL!!! :) 

5. The Price: Ouch. A bit high...I wouldn't come here for a casual dinner. But I still walked away feeling like the experience was well worth it. 

6. Other Tips: This is not the location to catch up with somebody you haven't seen in ages. If I recall correctly, you're given 1.5 Hrs to dine. 

I'll be back!
author: Clare S.

description: Pretty tasty chow with a ton of variety of salsas to try. Busy place with unique set up.
author: Mippy P.

description:
I'm guessing most of the great reviews are for lunch. I went for dinner on a Friday. I was busy, but I counted 15 tables for two severs. Needless to say, they forgot stuff, it was almost impossible to get water, etc. 

Chips and salsa were pretty good. I got the house salad, which was huge. I ate like half. The dressing needed to be better, but was fresh. 

My entree was totally unimpressive. Their rice tastes like dirty dish water. Retried beans are runny and just taste odd. The enchilada tasted off and the steak was unseasoned and tough. I'll never be back.
author: Norman F.

description: Bad service. Food was okay. I ordered a Diet Coke and it came at the end of the meal. Check was wrong. There are so many better places in sf to get Mexican food.
author: Eric R.

description:
Nice chips, salsa - not as great as chevys, decent service. Guacamole is very overpriced for what you get. Dishes were not clean, wait time for dinner was 20 minutes at 8PM. Appetizers were not substantial, very much like tapas. Enchiladas were mediocre at best. Overall, pricey and not worth the trip.

Oh, and lollipops at the end were probably the highlight of the meal.
author: V D.

description: 2nd time being here and it was extremely disappointed!  Service from the beginning was noticeably poor specifically towards us.  Told us an 1 1/2 hour wait but seated many individuals without reservations right away.  Only when I pushed for an answer on why, did she seat us shortly after.  Then when we were seated, it was 10-15 min before the waiter even came by to get our drinks.  We ordered immediately and they didn't bring us our drinks until after our food came and that's after asking for it twice.  Our order of guacamole didn't come either until after our food came.  By this time, we were so fed up that when our order finally came...3 of the 5 dishes came cold and one was wrong...we didn't even bother saying anything.  I was embarrassed...we were celebrating my dad's 65th birthday and it was very disappointing!
author: Rashmi B.

description: Was the best Mexican restaurant I've been to. They made my super asada burrito mojado in less than 4 minutes, amazing! They also have a beautiful selection of drinks and sauces!
author: Julio C.

description: The food here is just OK. We were visiting from LA and used to good mexican food. This is the only mexican restaurant that i felt I did not have many options to choose from. If you do not eat red meat or seafood, there isn't much on the menu to choose from. The tacos were average, and the portions are a little smaller than expected. The chips and sauces in the beginning were great. Service was 7/10.
author: Leo R.

description: A friend who lived out in the city recommended this place based on our current location. It's not your typical taqueria type mexican restaurant, but it comes pretty close. I ordered their Street Tacos which were the same size as the one you would get at a taco truck, but a few extra dollars more. You order through a line at their open face kitchen, pay at the cashier, and take your number to any table. The food runner comes out with free chips and salsa while you wait for the food to be delivered. I heard their Margaritas are DELISH here and super strong. Unfortunately, we didn't get any this time. I do love their salsa bar too located next to the bar. Their chips though...damn. SO GOOD! Just enough crispiness and salt. Couldn't stop eating them! You will definitely leave this place full though.
author: Marissa C.

description:
Two-thumbs up! My party of three was impressed. 

Hostess Ashley was sweet and super friendly, the chips and salsa were fresh and flavorful, guacamole small but mighty, margaritas strong, and dinner delicious. 

The carne asada was not what I'm used to, seasoned differently, but it was good for not carne asada. The shrimp tropisueno was good and the rice that the entrees came with was really unique, great flavor. And lastly, the best dish, the scallops with chorizo and plantanos hash, incredible! It's an appetizer size but with chips and salsa, was the right amount. 

Our waiter seemed distracted and was slow, but overall, we had a good experience and we would recommend.
author: Lisa S.

description: The worst experience ever. I've never encountered a more rude manager than Lorena. After waiting 30 minutes for my plate it came back wrong twice. After the second time I asked to speak to a manager when she walked up telling me I can't get rice and beans with my order but the person who took my order said I could and the cashier rung me up as well. She stepped in the kitchen and she was talking in Spanish thinking I did not understand and it was not nice things. I will never eat here again nor recommend it to anyone.
author: AC ..

description:
Have heard a good amount about the place so was pretty excited to come and check it out. There's almost always a wait, so just be aware, but seems like they tend to overestimate and there are tons of places to walk/shop around so the time goes by really fast. 

The chips and salsa is probably my favorite thing about the restaurant. Chips are thin and amazing and all three salsas/dips are amazing and the service staff makes sure you always have a fresh batch. 

We got the Tampiqueno and the Huaraches. The Tampiqueno was the way to go...carne asada was delish as was the barbacoa enchilada. Of the tres huaraches, there were some of the meats that tasted a bit dry and the corn tortillas that came along with the orders were bland and a bit soggy. Will probably be frequenting the place after/before some shopping sprees for solid Tex-Mex.
author: Annie S.

description: Wow! Best food in town! The tortas and burritos are all so delicious. The agua frescas are natural and no machine. Their salsas and chips are on point ! Love love the green salsa it's our favorite. Will def make a point to stop by here when passing thru town. Staff is so friendly and helpful too.
author: Miss J.

description:
Tropisueno is delicious. They have a killer happy hour, but it gets packed. 

The margaritas are great and I love that they have different flavors to choose from. The salsas they have are so good. I love all their salsas. 

My favorite dish that I always get is the shrimp one. I can't remember the exact name.
But it is delicious. It's shrimp cooked in this spicy, creamy sauce.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: One of the best Happy Hour deals in the South of Market/ Convention Center area of San Francisco. But you have to hurry because the place fills up as soon as 4pm hits. The quesadillas with chicken or steak and the nachos with chicken or steak are the best deals from 5-8 bucks. You can't go wrong! That alongside with affordable margaritas and well drinks during Happy Hour, plus a buzzy crowd makes Tropisueno your best option before a movie at the Century Theatre or the AMC nearby or a meeting convention center or just hanging out with friends when needing an affordable option. I highly recommend this place, not necessarily remarkable but always affordable.
author: Jason F.

description: Was here on Saturday night for dinner. Flavors are good. Attentive service and great dining atmosphere. But I docked a star because of the appetizer portion sizes. They're small for the price.
author: Eu V.

description:
The food was fantastic. I had the beef cheek taco app and the chicken mole dinner. The cheek was served on fresh Masa shells with radish; it was unctuous.

The mole sauce tasted like Quetzalcoatl picked and roasted the cacao beans himself. And the Spanish rice was so flavorful.

I was so full I didn't even look at dessert. 

The bad. The hostess was rude. And the server, while nice, was inattentive. I had one beer. One. That is a personal low. Had I been able to get his attention, I would have had three.

I would try again. Everyone has a bad day. And the food was worth it.
author: Biff W.

description:
Pricey but that's how it is in the Financial District.  Taste is good, service is good.

Come here for lunch all the time with the boys
author: Sam S.

description:
This restaurant serves fresh and tasty Mexican food in semi-fast food style. It is very well priced and the bartender went beyond the usual to make our drinks. 

It gets packed very easily so I would recommend reservations. Although extremely busy, the waiters found me a table very fast just because I told them that it was my first time. The complimentary corn chips (available all day), very light and crispy and delicious with all the amazing salsas, are a great feature.

The atmosphere was exceptional, even making  me feel like I was in Mexico!

I will return soon for sure!
author: Pablo R.

description:
My bf and I went here for dinner last night. It was around 9 pm but there were still several people waiting to be seated. Crazy on a Thursday night! I have been here a few times before but my man hasn't so I was excited to bring him here so he can try the food. The first thing he said walking - in was.. "Baby, it smells good in here". The hostess said there's a 35 minute wait but we didn't mind. We sat inside as we watch people coming in to the restaurant. People keep coming and it is passed 9:15! We both loved it since it gave him an impression that the food will be good. We got seated after 25 minutes. We started with the Platanos Fritos: Sweet, fried plantains, black beans, Mexican crema. They came up so warm and well cooked. So soft that it melts your mouth. The black beans were cooked so well; it didn't tasted bitter at all. 

Then we had the Ceviche De Camarones : white shrimp and sweet mango, cured in citrus with red onion, red pepper, cilantro, jalepeno. My bf really enjoyed this! The sourness of the mango with the freshness of the shrimp made it so tasty. 

Then we shared the 3-item Enchilada platter. Barbacoa of course! I only had one since it was sufficient enough for me. My bf ate the other 2 and inhaled it. It was SOOOOO GOOOOODDD!!! 

The best part of this whole experience was our waitress who made our experience all worthwhile. Her name is Rachel. She's probably the best waitress we've ever had in SF so far. She's very hospitable, charming and quite engaged with us the whole time. (And she keeps saying that we looked cute together. Aww..) We will come back for her, that's for sure. 

Over-all, I will give this 5 stars. Great food, romantic atmosphere (dim lights, not too loud, candles everywhere). Definitely worth it. Thanks, Rachel!
author: Anna Y.

description:
And back down to 4 stars.  No tortillas other than flour for the past 3 visits  :-(

It's a bummer since I got a glimmer of hope when they brought the wheat and spinach ones back.
author: Buddha B.

description:
I'm writing this review because I miss the tacos so. Why oh why doesn't this place exist in Western NY!

My first visit was for lunch. I was instantly overwhelmed by the large menu full of delicious options, all of which I wanted to try. I settled on the regular tacos - meat of your choice, cilantro and onions. A perfect lunch order. At first, I thought, "will this fill me up?" Yes, it did. Plus, with a side of chips and their fresh salsas you can't go wrong. Ever! You grab the salsas yourself at a little serving station by the bar. I've never seen so many options. I favored the salsa verde. It had a subtle, but impactful kick of heat. Top some of that on the taco and you're good. 

I suppose it can be a hassle during the lunch rush trying to find a seat in this always-packed taqueria, but we had no struggles at all, landing a spot at a family style table, joining another group of coworkers. With our table lined with our order numbers, the food runners had our food to us promptly, albeit staggered since we all ordered individually. Next time I'll give the burritos a try since the reviews rave about them... I wish it were tomorrow. Patience is a virtue, they say.
author: Breanna B.

description:
This place was amazing! i was visiting the area and I found this gem on Yelp, so naturally I had to try it. 

I came with my family on a Monday night and they said it was 45 minute wait. We were able to get seated in 30 minutes. However, since this place does take reservations they told us that we can be seated early as long as we're done within an hour and forty five minutes. Which is a little weird but overall it was a good experience. Here is the break down:

SERVICE: The service was perfect. Extremely friendly hostess and waitress all night long. The food came out pretty quickly despite the time limit we were given. We didn't feel rushed at all. The waitress was more than happy to tend to our needs. 

FOOD: Amazing to say the least. They start you off with chips and salsa, and its pretty unique bc they give you three different salsas. 2 out of the 3 are a bit spicy so be careful if you're not big on spicy food. I had the plate combo which is a pretty food deal. I believe it was $12.95 for two items so I got 1 cheese enchilada, and 1 cheese tamale. Both were amazing. It also comes with rice and your choice of beans.

AMBIENCE: Dimly lit, but tons noise. This is definitely a fun spot. The atmosphere is very lively, and fun. 

I would definitely be back!
author: Shivangi S.

description:
Strong margaritas. So strong that I even requested them to add more lemon juice. Aka they make great drinks.

Friendly service and with $6.50 margaritas during happy hour near the financial district? I'll be back. Just sad they don't blend their margaritas.
author: Janet L.

description:
My partner and I stopped here for lunch to avoid the oft-mentioned hourlong wait for dinner. By day, Tropisueno is a taqueria. Order at the counter, grab a seat, and your food is delivered.

I liked that Tropisueno features more southern, tropical Mexican fare, which is harder to find in the US, but I wasn't crazy. I liked my chile relleno, but the rice was over spiced. The guacamole was tasty, but a bit too salty for me to eat in large amounts.

Service was very good, and everyone was friendly. The decor was also very cool. All in all, and all right, but not stellar, experience.
author: Victoria B.

description:
I wanted to try this place out for a long time and frankly, I didn't get what the hype was all about.

My friend and I came here on a Friday night with a reservation. Seated quickly which was always a plus. We got empanadas to start with and they were pretty good and crispy on the outside and hot on the inside. I got the tacos with a chicken flauta plato and it came with Spanish rice and beans. Maybe I'm used to taqueria food because this tasted just as good, but for $15 a plate. Not sure if it's worth it or not. Especially with the 10 dollar margaritas in the small glasses. 

I loved the atmosphere though. It was super casual and mood lighting was ambient. There was only one small tv showing the Giants game by the bar. At times, it did seem like it was a little too loud for good conversation here but that's all I'd have to complain about. I'd maybe come back with another reservation but I wouldn't wait an hour for food.
author: Cathy N.

description:
I used to rave about this place... but that was back when I could get a seat and hold my own after 4-5 margaritas.

Went for dinner recently and waited a solid hour, service was kinda awkward... inauthentic may be the right word.

The three types of salsa with chips are always a win.. but the dinner itself was pretty good, but not worth that long wait. If you are going to do 'fine-mexican' you've got to do something better than a taqueria.

Three stars, not because it's bad - but it's just not worth the extra effort when I could comparable food from a guy out of a truck.
author: Ross H.

description: If you're looking for unique Mexican dishes then Tropisueño is definitely your place to be. I have been here as of lately and it seems like their food has only gotten better. They're busy but that's the price you pay to get a table at a good restaurant. Parking can be somewhat tricky as well, and that's the price you pay when you go to a small and crowded city as San Francisco. However it is definitely worth it. I love the queso dip here as well as the Enchiladas de Nopales (Vegetable Enchiladas) which is made with very fresh ingredients. You can also expect other great finds like their combination plates which can have either flautas, tacos, tamales or a few other items that I do not recall (well I always order the 3 I mentioned). The plates are visually appealing and the portions are very generous. Tropisueño  is a great restaurant to go enjoy Mexican food knowing that you won't leave disappointed.
author: Diego R.

description:
If I may be so bold, this is a 3 star place because it is nothing special. The food, service, and decor are run-of-the mill. In fact, I would argue that the service is sub-par, given the unhelpful nature of the server when it came to ordering (we had foreign guests over who were clearly struggling and our server gave them a persistent impatient look as opposed to offering any suggestions). 

This place reminds me of NYC's Dos Caminos, which has very standard, higher quality go-to Mexican food for people in Midtown Manhattan.
author: Lee T.

description: Food was good. Service was ok. Good place for lunch around moscone center. Will come here again.
author: Megna S.

description:
I was hoping to have a better experience after reading the reviews prior to coming in for dinner.  My dinner was nothing impressive and my margarita was full of ice.  I ordered chips and guacamole which wasn't too bad but when I ordered my chicken with rice and beans I honestly didn't get much taste from any of it.  The chicken seemed dry and not enough meat just mostly bones.

The staff is very friendly and helpful so that's a good thing.  Not sure I would come back after having a meal with a lack of taste.
author: Sean D.

description: This place is better for drinks. Good place to go if you love tequilla. They actually have a list of egg white tequilla drinks, which are hard to find. To drink I had the la mujer otra and picante. Both were decent. To eat I ordered their special enchilda for the night which was crab with zuchini. It was ok. We also ordered some sides, the gucamole de casa and cerviche de camorones. The guacamole tasted store bought and was very bland. I wouldn't recommend it. The cerviche was good. Watch out for the silverware here. They have sharp edges. I actually cut my finger on the knife handle. Service was ok, but our server disappeared for a while when we needed him at the end. This place is probably better for happy hour at the bar.
author: Lisa T.

description:
As an Office Manager for a group of foodies, Tropisueno is on the 'approved' list for me to order as an option for our weekly Friday catered in meal.  We also like the Taco Truck ordering option - we've done that too for special events!     We love ordering a variety of tacos and sides then having a smorgasbord of options.   

Very flavorful, great options (even have chile relleno - my personal favorite and vegetarian options for my vegetarians) and great value! 

Great customer service too!      We'll be ordering again!
author: Nicole D.

description:
If this place were several times larger, my review would be 4 stars; the food and drinks are great, and the prices and service are pretty good.

The problem is that you can hardly ever get a table here. 7/10 times I've been, the wait for a table was 45 minutes plus, which is unacceptable for me. The other 3/10 times, we've gotten a place to sit (most of the time at the bar), but you're sitting elbow to elbow with strangers, there's tons of other people lurking around hoping to get a seat, it's crazy loud, the servers/other-patrons are constantly bumping into you trying to squeeze past the crowds. It just makes it impossible for me to properly enjoy myself. I've decided it's just not worth the trouble.
author: Anthony P.

description:
This place was really good.

We were stuck for a place near our hotel and discovered this was 1 block away. It is hard to call it typical Mexican,.. it is a bit more like a chain like Cheesecake Factory on the operations level but somehow didn't lose the charm.

I really liked our waiter and the decor, it remained rustic and cozy but I suspect that is more a function of a good designer because the building is anything but old.

What got me was how good the food was, and pretty decent value. We had a trio of ceviches and they were all good, as were the chips and salsas.  We shared the Carnitas and it was fricking huge! So glad we shared!  So good!

I tend to like Mexican but think of it more like filler food.  This is beyond that, and If we had one in my city I'd revisit for sure.
author: Steve V.

description:
Food was amazing, service was subpar.

Salmon dish is delicious and has some kick to it. Love the accompanying black beans, slaw, etc. 

Fresh chips and salsas are really great (and unlimited). 

It took FOREVER to get our drink order and then FOREVER to get our entrees. No one came to check on us and it sort of ruined the night :/
author: Semuteh F.

description: They screwed up the order, then charged me extra for the enchilada that they should've brought in the first place. Food also came out cold. Cold meat, cold beans, cold sauce. Carne Asada was also over cooked and dry. Terrible experience.
author: Matt H.

description:
Fantastico. Went here for happy hour on a Friday and it was great. The place gets real crowded by 5:30, so unless you're ready to do battle for your tequila shots, than this place isn't for you. 

Happy hour prices are on par with what you are getting, the tequila and margaritas were super tasty. Yes, the tequila did not actually make me want to instantly projectile vomit on the bartender, which in my book, is a true sign of good tequila. 

The nachos and quesadillas were fresh, quick after we ordered, and delicious. 

The only thing is, the bartender got super flustered when there were a lot of people ordering and sassed us when we ordered more drinks. Mo' money mo' problems for this guy. But seriously, you're a bartender at a mexican restuarant during Happy Hour, check yo' attitude and hire another bartender if you're so overwhelmed. Aye caramba.
author: Molly S.

description:
Saw this restaurant on Check Please and decided to try it out for a belated bday dinner. 
I would absolutely come back for a drink but the food wasn't the best :(

On the downside the food did not taste fresh. The ceviche sampler had a bitter after taste to two out of the three ceviches and the flautas were pretty tough as if they had been refried a couple of times. They also repurposed the shredding beef in a few of their dishes so everything kind of tasted the same.

On the upside the ambience was nice, romantical lighting ;) ..perfect for a date, & the service was very attentive. 
I was excited to try their drinks seeing that they offered a huge variety of tequilas and I am a sucker for a good Margarita!
I ordered The Cena del Oso which was good but not as good as the Violeta that i also ordered. The Violeta has a Violet liqueur and vanilla salt..so yum!
They also offer a pretty great deal for groups of 5...if you invite five of your friends to the bar, they will pay for you to drink for free all night!!

Sooo like I said..I'll definitely be back for a drink!

::UPDATE::
The business owner contacted me right after I posted this review. I'm impressed and will definitely return to give the food a second chance! Also wanted to add an extra star for integrity..its nice to see there are business owners who really value the opinion & feedback of their customers!
author: Luz T.

description:
Given it's location in the touristy SOMA with it's 99% non-Latino clientele, I black-labeled Tropisueno in the wack "Mexican Chain" category with Chevy's, Celia's, and since they serve Fajitas, Chili's.

EFFFFF I was wrong! 

Came for dinner after happy hour'n at Amber India with my boys a few doors down, so maybe I was a little, or a lotta buzzed, but I really enjoyed the food.  

It's a little more high end with organic this and that than your standard taqueria but the flavors were all there. Reminded me of Rick Bayless' shop in Chicago.

It's easy to get full of their FREE non-stop crispy and light tortilla chips with 3 home made salsas but don't! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/_EncdQezAzcShATMFXL0dA?select=BBBGfiInJqFEoBrKyFNSbQ#BBBGfiInJqFEoBrKyFNSbQ)

Order the pork chop! A juicy and meaty Niman ranch bone in chop that's been brined with all sorts of Mexican flavor via chilies and spices to make it bright, vibrant, and porkie. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/_EncdQezAzcShATMFXL0dA?select=9TgktVRTxaLmq1TXMiMk3g)

I bartered some of my chop with my friends tampiqueno (flank steak) and chile relleno and those were really good too.(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/_EncdQezAzcShATMFXL0dA?select=1IL1tUCbAab4M5GwUWuygw#1IL1tUCbAab4M5GwUWuygw)

Definitely a fan. The prices are good, the service friendly. Maybe because I wasn't  expecting it, they over-delivered.  

What sets them over the top and I'm going to have to remember for next happy hour is that if you....."Invite 5 friends to drink at the bar, the host drinks for the whole evening for FREE!"  Since we came as 6, I would have had drinks free. Next time. 

All sorts of awesome.
author: Earl G.

description:
Was visiting SFO and staying at Marriott Marquis - bellman recommended it for lunch right when we arrived in town - and it was so good, we went again for our last dinner in the city.

At lunch, it's more quasi-fast food, cafeteria style - so faster service but still great quality.  I had to combo with a mole chicken enchilada - FANTASTIC! and a green chile cheese tamale - it was okay, but I would not order again.  

For dinner, I had the taco plate with one carne asada taco and one al pastor - both were excellent and would definitely order again.  We had the $7.50 guacamole appetizer - but was barely enough for one person - but still very good.  At dinner they provided chips and a sampler of 3 salsas - we had to have more salsa brought, every one of them was authentic and excellent.

PS:  For outside diners during the day, BEWARE of the dive bomb pigeons who are very familiar with eating off plates.  People were having to protect their children from getting hit by pigeons - we ended up going back inside because the pigeons were just too threatening.
author: Travel Mom C.

description: Crispy chips and salsa trio before you order. Good portions, good value and very tasty food. Staff very courteous. Nice ambiance include outdoor seating. Music could be slightly softer. Go early for best experience. Definitely gets crowded.
author: Lena R.

description: Overhyped restaurant, Yelp reviews fooled me once again. The lone star is for the cheap price.
author: Say G.

description: Went here based on the reviews and the food was just below average. To start the chips and salsas were delicious, next we had the empanadas and these were decent, step above microwaved hot pockets. Finally we had the steak and it came well done and dryer than the Sahara, when we ordered it medium rare. The cheese enchilada that came on the side had a hard brick of cheese in it and unedible. Lastly, to top it all off the service was just bland and unattentive. Don't recommend this place whatsoever especially with all the better options around.
author: Ameer B.

description: I love this place ! The food and drinks are always on point and the staff is awesome! The only downside is the one person bathroom men and women other than that I love it! My favorite meal is the pollo asada it's amazing juicy and tender ! Great prices also considering the location !
author: Jessica S.

description:
This review is only for their chicken soup!

I came here for lunch the other day at around 11:45am (right before the rush) and there were only a few people in line.  Not sure how it works during dinner, but during lunch, you order your food at the counter and they bring it out to you.  The  soup took about 15min which isn't too bad.

The soup itself was absolutely delicious, hearty, and spicy!  It was a light broth, full of a variety of vegetables and tender chicken.  Not to mention, the portion was so big, that I could only finish about half of it.  

If you are feeling under the weather, heal yourself with some of this spicy chicken soup!
author: Juliana K.

description:
Richie K. and I went to ThirstyBear for some beers and dinner, but weren't really feeling the menu, so we decided to take a short walk to Tropisueno for dinner after our beers. I'm glad we did.

The hostess estimated a 35 minute wait, but it was only 20 minutes! This was an extra good thing because the bar was packed and we were just kind of hovering near the bathrooms.

The packed bar meant that our (delicious and large) margaritas (with salt *and* chile powder on the rims!) arrived at the same time as our meals. I got the chile verde which was divine and Richie got the salad. I meant to steal some jicama, but was distracted by my meal. Seriously, if you eat pork, get it.

The chips and salsa are also great, especially the orange one. I meant to ask about what it was. I'm telling you, I was really distracted by the chile verde!

Note: if you are hard of hearing or want to have a deep or detailed conversation, do not eat here for dinner.
author: Nina B.

description:
I give it four stars mainly for the vibe and ambience 

Ambience : Super crowded and expect a wait time of 30-45 mins if you haven't reserved so if you want to prevent that, make sure you have a reservation. If you don't, try and wait at the restaurant for quicker seating rather than going off somewhere else and waiting for a message. Iv noticed if you are in front of them , you'll be seated faster.
Coming back to the place, the decor is beautiful with the fairy lightings and fun atmosphere . The bar is great and everyone seems to be having a lot of fun

Service : Very friendly. They will ask you for preferences and suggest dishes accordingly. The service is quite fast for the crowd as well.

Food and drinks : The margaritas are nice. I ordered the Tropiseuno and it was not too sweet nor bitter. Loved it 
The food is decent , not out of the world but good . Expect huge portions
We had the enchilada and flautas which was ok and chile verde which was a better dish.
Nachos are given complimentary with three sauces which are tasty but pretty spicy.

Pricing: Pricing is decent for mains . The only over- priced dish I thought was the gaucamole. $7+ for is quite a bit.

Overall I enjoyed my experience here and I'm definitely coming back to try more of the items
author: Nupur S.

description:
The salsa here is to die for. I'd go there just for the salsa if I could. I've been here both for lunch and dinner. During lunch time they open up a food line to get those in a hurry in and out. There is no seating outside during dinner...I'm guessing it's because they are worried that people will dine and dash. 

Overall, this place is great. Delicious food!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Their orange sauce is the best sauce on the planet, hands down.

The hostesses / hosts can be a bit gruff, but that's OK. It's worth it.
author: H. T.

description:
Any place that has margaritas for Happy Hour (HH) will always get me every time! With $6 house and strawberry margaritas available, Tropisueno was definitely calling my name. 

However, due to its popularity and location downtown, you must come here EARLY. By 4:30 or 5pm at the latest, or else you'll spend at least 30 minutes waiting for a spot. It's open seating during HH. The tables with booths require at least 4 people to be able to sit down.

Drink this:
+ MARGARITAS -- of course! I personally prefer the house margarita because it seems a bit stronger and less sweet. My friend likes the sweeter taste of the strawberry margarita. 

Eat this:
+ CHIPS & SALSA -- even better...they're free! I love the freshly heated chips along with the spicy salsas. They pair perfectly with the margaritas.
+ BAJA FISH TACO -- this is a hefty taco, which makes it a great snack when you're slightly hungry. The tilapia was flaky but I wish the batter was more crispy. I enjoyed the citrusy slaw and salsa verde on top. 
+ QUESADILLAS -- you can't really go wrong with melted cheese between tortillas. I really enjoyed the corn tortillas here.

I've only come here during Happy Hour, but would like to visit again during lunch or dinner time to try out more of their food options. Til next time!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
The best thing about this restaurant is the chips and salsa! 

Red,green, and orange sauce. Probably the best salsa I've had. I have no idea what the sauces are called but its their take on traditional salsa, salsa verde, and this spicy cheesy one. 

Their food is also traditional and uncommon to most Mexican restaurants in the city. Giving you big portion of meat, rice and beans for a $15-20 price average. Although everything was cooked properly, the flavors were to foreign for me to enjoy. Most of the seasoning is more rustic taste then salty and savory that I'm use to. With that said, most people enjoy it. 

Margaritas i think are over priced for something that taste like juice and tequila. Although are much cheaper during HH and would be enjoyable with a bowl of chips and salsa. 

I do enjoy coming here, its a beautiful restaurant in a perfect location. I will come back here, but not when I'm craving mexican food.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Finally a decent mexican.  There are too many american tex mex out there to give the thumbs down too but Tropisueño can be safe.

Hubbie and I ate here on our 2nd last night and were pleased with the dishes we ordered.  The both had kick in them and the ingredients semmed to be fresh too.

I had the pork sandles and hubbie had the chilli.

Both were substantial portions and we were pretty full when we left.  

It's really close to Yerba buena gardens so you could just go and and sit and chill after lunch.
author: Emma W.

description: First time visit. Chips and salsa were great, plantain appetizer was amazing, and the enchiladas phenomenal!!!  They had a large selection of custom margaritas. We tested 5 of them, they were all amazing!!!
author: Derrell R.

description:
This place is 4 stars good, but loses one because their bathroom is by far the worst I've ever seen. Seriously over loaded (1 male 1 female for the whole restaurant), filthy, stinky and a mess. They say judge a kitchen by their bathroom, if that's true i dont want to eat here.

Still the food is good and the price is right, youre best having a reservation.
author: Mike G.

description:
We walked in here for a late dinner and were very impressed.  We were seated pretty quickly.  It had a nice ambiance, but it was crowded and a bit noisy. They not only had excellent food, but great service and a good value.  

Our waiter quickly brought us chips and salsa.  The salsa (actually three choices) was good but the salsa verde really blew me away with how much flavor there was in there.  He also had a lot of knowledge about their fairly expansive tequila bar which my husband thoroughly enjoyed. 

I am glad we skipped an appetizer because the entrees are HUGE!   I ordered the fish Vercruz which is a nice medley with peppers, onion and salsa and it also came with rice and beans.  The fish was fresh and cooked perfectly.   My husband ordered the tampiqueno which was a carne asade beef with an barbacoa enchilada served with guac, rice and beans.  His was also very good and the beef was so tender. He was as bold to say that it was the best Mexican food he has ever had (I'd agree that it was in the top few spots but have spent some time in Mexico). We left stuffed and our wallets were feeling pretty good too.
author: Ashley C.

description: This place is so good! It's a walk up and pay first kind of restaurant, but I tend to like that, because the food is usually very fast. This place has tons of food runners, staff to pick up plates, and help the tables. The food is amazing. It's the best NON greasy Mexican food I've ever had! I tend to not like super greasy, and it definitely was not greasy, yet so flavorful and stacked with ingredients at the same time. The orange sauce is probably the best part about this place. It's so super yummy! I had to pack some of it with the left overs. If ever in SF, this is a great place to eat!
author: Jacklyn C.

description:
We came here after striking out on many other desirable restaurants. Maybe I was a little disappointed about not being able to get into the other restaurants, so I'm not rating this restaurant so fairly. Or maybe that being from SoCal I've eaten at a number of delicious Mexican restaurants. 

The food was nothing spectacular, and the drinks were a bit overpriced but it's what you can expect for San Francisco. I did like the chips and salsa, though the first time around our chips were stale. I think I filled up on that before the food even arrived. The carne asada plate was whatevers.

I'd come back for the complimentary chips and salsa.
author: Lina T.

description:
I've been coming for years here and the food is excellent and one of my favorite happy hours in the area. I am always happy to bring visiting friends here as the food is great and the margaritas are strong.

Today was my worst experience, I waited for 10 mins without even a greeting. I had to go in to let people know I was there. I checked with the maitre d' and we are NOT supposed to check in, we are supposed to just seat ourself outside if we are here for happy hour and a server would just check in with us. That said, it wasn't my fault that nobody ever came. The matte d' didn't apologize either for the wait, she just said "No, you are not supposed to check in, I'll have him come out. Here is a menu." Someone else comes out and serves me chips and salsa and takes my order. 

So the star rating is for the years of great service/food and the lack of one star was for the one experience. Def coming back but will def let the metre' d know where I am sitting.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Came here early with a group of work friends. When we arrived we were pretty rudely told that we would need to get up at 7 for a reservation already in place. Completely understand the reservation thing but it was such a turnoff the way they approached the situation. 

Anyways, I ordered the Dueno (I believe that is what it is called). Completely disgusting....though, i finished it because it was $10 and I simply cant leave drinks behind! Some of my co-workers got other margaritas and loved them though!

We ordered the guacamole before our meal. The guac was actually very very good. Super flavorful. However, it wasnt really that big of a portion for the money spent. In addition to the guac, three salsas came out: salsa verde, red cilantro, and spicy. The spicy was very very spicy but the other two salsas were delish! I think we ate our body weight in chips and salsa. I know other reviewers mentioned a salsa bar but I didnt see such a thing and we werent directed anywhere to a salsa bar. 

I ordered the the carne asada. The steak was cooked perfectly. It came with rice and beans and a carnitas enchilada. Very good. The carnitas enchilada was a bit spicy but I like a little spice in my life. Crazy huge portions. I mean I could have easily split that meal with someone else! 

Service was a bit off. Like we asked if they had queso. The waiter said yes and then brought us shredded cheese. We laughed for like 5 minutes over this one! One time the waiter just grabbed one of my co-workers water glasses and walked away with it, never returning. Just a few weird things like that happened. 

Anyways, price was good and food was good. Nothing over the top amazing but if I ever return to San Fran, I will absolutely come back!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
This is some pretty solid mexican food. They have great margaritas, good chips and salsa, and I've never had anything here I definitely DIDN'T like. The portions are huge so it's worth the $$. I wouldn't say it's the best mexican food I've had, this place has a fun vibe and is especially great for a good lunch with coworkers/friends.

It does get crazy busy though, so expect to wait 30-60 minutes for a table during peak dinner/lunch hours.
author: Rachael H.

description:
Here for the weekend with a girlfriend and the concierge recommended it as the best Mexican restaurant in the area without having to take a cab ride.

We we're not disappointed.its steps from the Marriott which was a plus, and the bartender knows his stuff!
author: J. Denise P.

description: I have been to Tropisueño in the past with colleagues for happy hour so when my friend from college came to visit me, I recommended it as a favorite spot. The food was great as usual by the service was a little spotty. At 5:45pm the last call for the happy hour bar was announced -- the sign in plain view said Happy Hour 4-6pm. With a restaurant like this, an early last call is not surprising, but it was not announced that the happy hour kitchen was also on its last call. When we receive our check for our drinks, it was explained that the prices had been changed but not on the menu yet. The waiter nor the bartender could explain why. After 10min of unsuccessfully flagging down the waitstaff for water, our table mate graciously gave me his glass of water after having witnessed the service we were receiving. Our check arrived before the requested water.
author: Lourdes R.

description:
This place is pretty bomb! I love their sauce bar, so many sauces to choose from! 
Ordering was a bit confusing, but the people were nice enough to explain to us. They also offer free chips, which was good while waiting and also to dip in the sauces to choose my favorite before the food got here. I got the torta with el pastor meat. Huge sandwich with lots of meat, beans, veggies and guac. The bread was also super soft! Loved it!
author: Kristy K.

description:
Service: 0/5 
food: 3/5 
atmosphere/decor: 2/5 cramp and loud

Never coming back, terrible service: from hostess, kitchen, waiters

This place has one of the absolute worst service I have ever experienced. It first started when both hostesses were extremely rude to me when I wanted to change tables in a half EMPTY restaurant. I had made a reservation, so there was no reason why I had to be in the back of the place when all the window seats where I wanted to be were empty. I came right before rush hour just to avoid all this and get a good seat, did not work. The place was packed within 15 minutes and other people got the seats I wanted. Lazy hostesses need to get off their high horse and do their job. Don't let the high number of reviews fool you, they are mostly from the workers in the surrounding area who just come here to eat after work and go. So they don't really care if the experience is good or not. 

My party got our meals after 1 hour of waiting. The surrounding tables who came after us got their meals and had left before we even finished. Not only that, they have a policy during dinners you can only stay 1.5 hours because the place is busy. I had to tell my waiter that I did not want to be kicked out before I finished my food. The waiter did not care that my table was waiting an hour for food, no updates even after asking twice. No sincere apologies or anything to make our time there better. They just kept on insisting we buy extra drinks to pass the time. I did not pester them and was as kind as possible, and I still get treated like trash from everyone who works there. Food is not nearly good enough to charge $15-20 per plate and $10-15 drinks.
author: Cecile S.

description:
I came here for dinner on a weekday night and there wasn't too long of a wait. 

The chips and salsas they served were fresh and delicious! I didn't expect the queso sauce to be spicy, so that was a pleasant surprise.

I had the Pollo Asado for dinner. Portion size is very generous! My dish came with rice and beans and veggies. The chicken was flavorful and tender. It was slow cooked so took about twenty minutes but totally worth the wait. =]
author: Aimee Z.

description:
I have no idea why this place has just high ratings!  I'm not a food snob, but I was certainly hoping for more on a Sunday afternoon.

Staff:  Didn't really seem to engage with me, when I was speaking to them.  Their overall feeling, "Meh."

Prices:  I paid 15+ for ONE dish for lunch.

Food:  Truly bad!  Like, with my husband's quesadilla he remarked, "I could have made better!" Which is saying a lot . . .  since he is kind of a BAD cook.  My chicken fajitas were dry and flavorless.  Our friend's combo meal looked mushy and he complained, "I hope salt will save this!"  It didn't . . .

The patio is, however, really nice and it was a pleasure to catch up with an old friend during beautiful weather.  Inside was pleasant too, decor wise, so if that is your only wish in a restaurant - come here.  Otherwise?  GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.
author: Sabrina A.

description:
Not a bad place to eat, but the entire experience was strictly average with the one notable exception of the staff being very friendly. I don't get the crazy popularity of the place

So...Meh+
author: Brandon S.

description: This is certainly a popular place. There was a 45 min wait for a table at 5:30. We choose to sit outside as that was part of the bar and we could order food. We ordered 2 house margaritas which were not too strong. We also ordered a nacho with shredded chicken and two tacos with shredded chicken. The server forgot to put our order in. We reminded her once we saw others getting food who came long after we did. It still took an additional 25min to get our food and it came with grilled chicken instead of what we ordered. The server knew she messed up all around and took off the bill for the nachos. I ended up tipping well since she admitted her mistake.
author: Sandra K.

description:
This review was due over a month ago.
I love me some Mexican food and the best has been Nuevo León in Chicago. In SF....head to the Mission. Here? Overpriced, tourist trap and so so food. I ordered al pastor tacos and the meat was very dry. BF ordered chicken burrito and it was packed with black beans, little meat. Hibiscus tea...super sweet. Took 3 sips and I had to toss it. Not to my palate and would not come back
author: Hanah P.

description: On the last night of our trip to San Fran, we had a major craving for some Mexican food. This place did not disappoint. We had the chile verde. Was really really good. The chips and salsa were awesome, a huge must for any Mexican place we like. Loved it! Would definitely recommend.
author: J S.

description: After a long day of travel, this was a great place to eat. Even though I was by myself, they made me feel welcome.  The chips are great and they had a trip of salsa/dips. I had the empanadas which were very good. The tacos, while small, were full of flavor and the beans and rice were excellent.  I may have to come back before I leave.
author: Steve M.

description: I was visiting San Francisco for my birthday weekend and I am a lover of all things food so I did my research and I came upon this beauty! I Had the absolute most amazing birthday thanks to this little gem ! Let me start with the chips and salsa, I've never had better chips and salsa I probably had 2 bowls of chips before dinner they were that good! My drink was just perfect, tangy and sweet just how I like it. Our food was so flavorful we had the Scallops with chorizo there was so so much delicious flavor and for dinner I had the tampiqueno so yummy and the desert was to die for !!! Their service is awesome and although hey had told me I wasn't able to sit in Area 51 they made it happen and I sat there with my crew . The perfect gem in the perfect city!
author: Orduno M.

description:
Dinner for two at 10:45PM after a world series game.  A nice walk from AT+T park (.9 mi) on the way back to Marriot Marquis (Moscone area).

Place was about 2/3 full when we arrived.  Very dark (hard to read menus), and easy conversation levels.  Wait staff was limited (Joshue was serving our entire area) - probably due to our late arrival, but was helpful, friendly, and did his best to serve us with all of his other duties.

Started with some great chips and three salsas - refined and not overpowering.

Interesting Margarita selections (tried both the Exquisite and the Ginger Margararita - which was quite tasty).

Halibut was overcooked, but the sides, sauces and Mexican flavors were authentic, portions plentiful and prices very low!
author: Bill H.

description:
La Vic's orange sauce has nothing on Tropisueno's.  Fer sure.  

Best.  Orange.  Sauce.
author: Daniel M.

description:
A good solid meal. While my husband attended a work event, I stopped by this place for dinner by myself since it was close to our hotel. The chips and salsa were very good, with the three salsas offering nice variety. All three were excellent and much better than I would have expected from this kind of place. I ordered the Enchiladas de Nopales with chicken and was happy with the meal. The enchiladas had a light cream sauce and were filled with sweet corn and other veggies. Very tasty. I would definitely get that entree again. 

I'm giving this spot four stars because of the service. I felt like an outcast because I was dining alone in a hip, busy place. Given their proximity to a few big hotels, I'm assuming they get single diners all the time and should probably be a little more welcoming. Otherwise, the food was pretty good and I would go back.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Chips and salsa- BOMB.COM!
Lunch here is pay at the counter and they bring you your food.
Dinner here is sit-down, full-service.
I would say best bet is going for lunch here (prices are like double during dinner).
Get the orange salsa!
author: Angela D.

description: The chili verde was out of this world. Each bite was an explosion of multiple flavors. This place appears to be packed all the time but luckily they let you order food to go.
author: Nin A.

description: Hit this place up on a Saturday night about 530 PM.  There was a small wait for my party of 6, but we got a table in under 10 minutes.  Just enough time to buy some cream puffs while we waited :)  The wait staff was excellent, and my chip basket was never empty.  That's an important feature in a Mexican restaurant IMO.  The drinks were OK, but probably over priced (though it's in the city, so the price was probably standard).  The food though, the food was yummy.  I got the Tres Honcharitos (sp?), a dish with rice, beans and 2 different styles of pork.  All 3 of which were excellent.  The rest of my party also seemed pleased with their dishes, so I'm calling it a huge success!  I'd go back again for sure.
author: Corey S.

description: Heard so much about the restaurant but had the worst service. We had a party of 11, and they were so rude and refused to accommodate us!  The manager was the rudest person ever! Don't wash your money or time! We had kids with us and they refused!
author: Tori S.

description:
One of my favorite places to go to around downtown San Francisco! It's super close to Westfield, the Metreon, and Yerba Buena. 

I came to Tropisueño for lunch as well as dinner on separate days. The restaurant has excellent service and excellent food! The decor has a very rustic feel and there's even a bar!

Free chips and sauce are offered for both lunch and dinner. 

For lunch, Tropisueño offers fast-casual dining, where you pay at the counter for your order and seat yourself. My girlfriend, who is a huge fan of Mexican cuisine, thoroughly enjoyed the entree plate with Mole.
I ordered a Mojado, which is a wet-burrito. For less than $10, it was a HUGE portion of food that I could barely finish. Needless to say, the burrito was delicious and I love the addition of sauce on top. Well worth the price. 

For dinner, Tropisueño offers a casual dining experience, with waiters taking your order. The restaurant was quite dark and loud for dinner though. I ordered the Huaraches "tres Cochinitas", which had tortillas and 3 kinds of pork. The pork was tender and the whole dish was very filling and flavorful.

I definitely recommend this place for casual dining, as the atmosphere is very clean and comfortable and the food is well-made, authentic, and well-priced.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Tropisueno is one of those places where it's hard to have a conversation because you can't.stop.eating.salsa. The chips are the perfect vehicle for the spicy, salty, fresh concoction of salsa perfection- as soon as I had my first chip, I knew we had made an excellent restaurant selection.

They serve you a dish with three salsa options- and we could not stop asking for more. 

For our dinner, the Mole Pobleno Chicken was juicy, tender, and the best chicken thigh I've had in years. I usually don't even like chicken thigh but this dish was awesome. 

Tropisueno also offers a trendy, comfortable atmosphere and we can't wait to go back! HIGHLY recommended from an out-of-towner.
author: Mandy L.

description:
Great atmosphere in this hidden gem! We had to wait about 45 mins for a table, but that is nothing unusual on a Friday night in SF. 

Loved the bottomless nachos served complimentary with 3 delicious salsas. We ordered the house guacamole, and we're disappointed by how small it was for the cost ($7.50 for a small cup), but can't fail to mention how good it was! Being a vegan, I ordered the veggie tacos (served without cheese) which came with rice and black beans, which was delicious.

Overall, the food was great, service was great and the atmosphere felt superbly authentic! The music is quite loud here though, so maybe skip this place if you're on a first date.
author: Samaneh Z.

description:
Big entree portions.

Affordable prices. 

Nice ambiance.

And a parking garage 1/2 block away?!

Am I in SF?!? 

It does sound too good to be true, so I made sure to rub my eyes twice and blink a couple of times to make sure I wasn't seeing things. Indeed, Tropisueno is REAL.  

As soon as we sat down,  hot, crispy thin chips with three different salsas (watch out for that bright orange habanero!) magically appeared out of nowhere.  Our hands just kept diving back into the bowl and next thing you know it was empty. But, two minutes later, it was full again!  whoa! magic I tell ya!

Then the rest of the food came: fried sweet plantains, corn masa filled with chorizo and corn, chicken with mole poblano, carne asada tampiqueno and camarones tropisueno.  We couldn't believe how big the portions were for a restaurant in this part of town AND how affordable it is. It was pretty tasty too.  (And that's not the margarita talking!)

Service was just plain awesome.  Fast, efficient and professional.  I can't believe it's taken me this long to return here and try dinner.  I highly recommend it for casual date nights or big groups looking to celebrate birthdays.  Tropisueno is muy bueno!
author: Janice C.

description: Lunch is very chaotic. You need to line up, and hopefully find a seating post ordering. Food is very ok, don't think we will go back to this place again. Especially if with a baby/ toddler, this place is not somewhere you would want to go. Try somewhere else.
author: Anisha Y.

description:
By far one of my favorite taco places of all time. I don't really like Mexican food, but I love tacos and this place does an amazing job. So lets start with the pros.

1. Flavorful meat and at a great price (get the carnitas which is the best)
2. Unlimited chips that are super fresh and thin

That is all you need to know. The mixed drinks there is also bomb. Try it out and don't skimp.
author: Nathan L.

description:
The place was crackin' but the food and drinks were alright. 

The restaurant is nicely decorated and there are seats outside. We came on a Wednesday around 5pm.  It was super crowded. Everyone in the party have to be present in order to be seated.  We were on the wait list and we waited about 30 min for our table. 

Service was good.

My group and I shared guac and chips before we got our food. 

I got chicken tacos. But they weren't very memorable...

I recommend making reservations if you decide to come here.
author: R R.

description:
I am writing this review now that I am calm from what had happened on Friday.

I am still appalled by the rude treatment, broken system and terrible service we experienced at Tropisueno on Friday night. It was so bad that I think I will make a detour on my daily morning commute to work, just so I don't have to see this place and remind me of that horrible Friday night.

If you don't want to read the whole story, here is what I suggest: Don't go here. 
You might not hit the jackpot and get the same treatment, but why risk it.? You deserve better.
Few nearby alternatives: "Garaje" on 3rd has much better mexican food for much lower prices, "Zero Zero" for drinks and pizza, awesome service. "Marlowe" if you want a really nice burger. "Jamber" if you want beer and wine on tap with good eats. "Nordstorm Cafe" if you want a classy place, good services, and good eats.

So, here is what happened.
Me and some friends were hanging out around Soma on Friday night and we ended up in Tropisueno for some margaritas and dinner. 

We asked for a table, and was told the wait would be about 45 minutes. So we were debating if we should get some drinks and wait or go somewhere else. After 15 minutes or so, few seats at the bar area opened up. So logically, the 3 of us grab the seats and ordered some drinks. We were getting hungry too, so we ordered some food as well, while we wait for our other friend who is running late since.

And that's when things started to get complicated, fast. 
Since there were 3 of us, and 1 friend coming, we have 1 seat thats "opened" next to us.  The server came over, cleared the surface of that 1 seat and said, "no miss, you can't save this seat, this area is first come first serve." 

We figured, no biggie, we will just move to the table when it becomes available. We went to the hostess and asked them if our table is available. They then said "oh, if you had ordered food, then you can't move the the tables. Thats the rule" 

"But we have another friend coming!" we said
"Sorry" the manager said

We went back to the bar, the server came over again and asked us what the manager said. "The manager said we can't move to the table because we already ordered food" The server said " ah , yea, but you can't save this seat, this is first come first serve"

We were really stuck. Our food had just arrived, we couldn't switch to a table, and our friend is coming, with the seat next to us possibly taken at anytime. 
One of our friend asked the server "What should we do then? Our friend is coming" Server answered simply  "Sorry"

Not having much of an option, we were pissed and started eating hoping no one would take the seat, or we would just finish eating and get out of there. Then our friend send a text saying that he is 5 minutes away. At that time, a couple came over to the bar and asked if anyone is taking the seat. "yea we have a friend coming" The server immediately stepped up and push his face really close to  my face and said "No miss, you can't do that, you can't save the seat" 
Then gave the 1 seat away to the couple.

As expected, our friend arrived 3 minutes later, as he arrived, we told him, sorry, your seat were just taken like 3 minutes ago. The couple saw our friend and kindly said "Oh, you guys can have this seat, no worries" and moved.
Then immediately, the server came up again, and said "No miss, you can't do that. You can't save the seat."

I was furious at that point. That man had interrupted our dinner 4 TIMES at that point. I then told him "No! The couple offered to let our friend have the seat!! She gave it to us!" Server then said "oh oh.. ok, it was just that the manager sees this and he won't allow it and I would get into trouble" 
I then told him "ok, why don't WE go and talk to your manager together then? where is he?" Server pointed at the black suit wearing man, the same guy who told us we couldn't move to our table because we had already ordered food.

Furious and frustrated I went up to the manager, with the server quickly followed. I then told him "So we were the 3 people who ordered food and couldn't get transferred to a table, and now the server here said he would get into trouble since we were trying to save our 4th friend a seat. I just want to let you know that the very nice couple who was assigned the 1 seat at the bar, nicely offered us the 1 seat to our 4th friend is that ok?" the manager said "what? I don't know whats happening. yea yea its fine. "

Needless to say, we will never to return to this restaurant ever again. This place is always crowded and their food is decent, but neither me or my friends had ever been in a situation where we felt SCREWED at a Friday night drinks and dinner. 

There are better options out there, you can do better. YOU DESERVE BETTER. Go somewhere else!
author: Ellen W.

description: I came in today for happy hour, and boy, does it get packed! Come early, because the happy hour does not disappoint. For starters, you get a large plate of chips with 3 different dips for free. Between two people, we ordered the quesadilla  with steak (big portions!), flautas (comes in 2 pieces), the fish taco (one piece), and a beer. In the end, we were full. I would recommend the quesadilla for sure since it is so filling, but I wouldn't order the fish taco again. Dishes range from $5-7 dollars from what I recall. Don't quote me on that. Beer is $3 and margaritas are $7. I will definitely be back to try their dinner courses.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Three cheers for mexican! 
Hubs and I loved this place. Their house marg (though $10) is really good. We had a couple other margs too that were all tasty but I can't remember the names and of course I cannot find them on the website.
I noticed some bad reviews for service. We sat at the bar and had no complaints, but of course that can be different from table service.
The food was delicious! We started with the Callos a la Plancha (Scallops on a chorizo-plantain hash) and they were yummy. I'd definitely recommend this dish. The second item we ordered were the Tacos de Cachete (braised beef cheeks with salsa). It was a server recommendation and although they were good and the beef super tender, it was our least favorite. It tasted a lot like a pot roast and something I could make at home.
Our last and FAVORITE dish of the evening was the Camarones Tropisueno. Oh fantastic!! Hubs doesn't even care for shrimp that much and he was licking the plate. It comes smothered in this spicy chile de arbol sauce that makes you want to ask to put it on everything. It was so good, I asked if they put crack in it. Very addicting. 
This is a great place and I hear they have a fantastic happy hour. Awesome drinks and food at cheaper prices? Why aren't you there right now?
author: Andrea K.

description: My husband and I have been here twice and had well prepared dishes both times. We particularly enjoyed the Mole Chicken and Nopales Enchiladas. The service is pretty quick, very friendly and courteous; I had to send my meal back because the food was not hot, and they prepared me a new plate that came out of the kitchen piping hot. The server even thanked me for letting him know about the problem - great service recovery! Do not come here if you want a quiet meal; the place is pretty noisy with lots of good "having fun" energy.
author: Kathy B.

description:
I wish i lived closer to this restaurant!  Fabulous meal. Jam packed (for soon to be obvious reasons) so hard to get a table we had to eat at the bar.  

Copious amounts of addictively tasty hot chips and salsas. The Callos a La Plancha was fabulous - fresh and hot and juicy! Best scallops I've had in a long long time. The chicken in the Mole Poblano was cooked to perfection and the sauce super tasty. Generous portions.

My only quibble is that if you dont drink alchol or junk soda drinks there was no alternatives available and it was hard to discuss this with my server due to the language barrier - I must improve on my Spanish.
author: Kaz L.

description:
For some reason, everytime I go to downtown San Francisco, I always want to eat here. Maybe it's the chips and the 3 dips or the huge plate that satisfies my hunger, but I keep coming back here. 

Chicken Enchilada with Mole sauce - someone who worked here recommended this to me, and the sauce was really good! Chicken was surprising not dry and it was really good! 

Al pastor Enchilada - also good but not as good as the chicken mole one. There was pieces of pineapple too!
author: Carmen C.

description: Great food and great service!
author: Sarah S.

description:
My company catered from here for lunch.

I had the shrimp taco and beef taco. The shrimp taco was very tasty although slightly bland. However, add a little salsa and it is perfect.

I also enjoyed the beef taco very much. The beef is well seasoned and not dried out. 

The chips with trio of salsa was super yums, although they are pretty spicy if you're not good with spiciness. 

Will definitely order again or head to the restaurant! :D
author: Christina N.

description:
Maybe the endorphins from my workout were in full-effect, maybe I was relieved to be out of the gale-force winds SF was experiencing last night. Whatever the reason was, I had such a pleasant experience at Tropisueno last night. I was jonesin' for a cold, refreshing margarita and met boyfriend at Men's Warehouse nearby.

We waited for about 10 minutes before snagging two seats at the island-style bar (a long, thin, floating table in front of the bar stools and bar). Our server approached us quickly and took our order of Guacamole, Salsa, and Chips, and my on-the-rocks Margarita. A dish containing three compartments with different salsas each arrived with fresh, warm chips and we were in heaven. 

It took about 10 more minutes for the guac and my drink to arrive, but that gave us some time to chat and munch on the spicy salsas. My favorite is the orange habenero, not sure how they make it but it was warm and grand. The guac was creamy, thick, and chunky, very good. My margarita was tart and cold, just what I wanted.

Knocked off a star because the bill came to $19.50. I didn't realize HH margaritas were $10 a pop, and considering I only had one, I was a little surprised at how pricey it was. Either way, I'm a new believer in Mexican in the Financial and will be back again soon.
author: Crystal C.

description: The happy hour was great.  Everyone gets one big plate of chips with three kinds of dips.  The orange one was spicy and delicious, but I wasn't sure what it was.  The bean dip was flavorful.  The guacamole dip was only ok.  The chip that came with the ceviche was good, too.
author: Yvonne J.

description:
Food (5/5): Definitely one of the best Mexican places I've been to. My friend got the Tampiqueno, which consisted of a thin-cut steak, beef barbacoa enchilada, and guac. I tried some of the steak, which was super tender and flavorful. I got the veggie enchiladas de nopales, which had grilled veggies in a creamy corn sauce. The tortillas were a bit thick for my liking, but the sauce was addicting. Both plates came with rice and beans. I tried the Peruvian white beans, which were really creamy!

Service (5/5): Complimentary chips and salsa is always a plus! The servers were all super friendly and kept our waters filled, and food came out fairly quickly. 

Value (4/5): Prices are super reasonable for the location, portions, and quality. I paid ~17.50 including tax and tip for my dish, while my friend paid about $21.
author: Abby S.

description: Great food. Loved all the sauces and salsas. Awesome margarita's. And attentive waiters. Surprised how busy they were on a Monday night. Glad we made reservations.
author: Tianna M.

description:
Meh.... it was just meh....
I guess I got a little carried away with all the good reviews and was expecting a fabulous meal. Everything we ordered was just okay. Nothing was too bad.
Maybe the good reviews are not because of their vegetarian food
Probably not going back!
author: Bhavya K.

description:
Came for dinner. Food was fresh, place was lively, service was good, drinks were strong, and the trio of salsas were delicious. Great place to go with a group. 

They have a variety of margs to choose from and they're all quite potent. Their menu is also filled with mouthwatering choices. Loved their chicken enchiladas. Will be back! 

Heard they have a great lunch as well.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Pitch Perfect 2 + dinner at Tropisueno was aca-awesome! 

Chips & Guac + margaritas make me a happy girl, even though I'm slightly allergic to tequila ;) 

I came here w a coworker of mine aka my work boyfriend for dinner. We made reservations in advance for 530p. It was walking distance from work and close to the theatre. We walked in and the bar area was packed w those who were there for HH already. I loved the setup, furniture and decor of the place-- it makes it a fun and casual environment! We grabbed some house margaritas and headed to our table. (mMm, margaritas!) He ordered the carne asada plate and I ordered chicken enchiladas. The portions are big and I would recommend sharing! Although my coworker has a hole in his stomach and was able to finish his plate + half of mine.

I would say this place kept their food somewhat authentic without Americanizing it too much-- I'll be back again when I crave for Mexican food, which will probably be next week! 

I also reached out recently to see if I could buy out the venue for a private work outing but turns out they only close the restaurant down for 1 day of the month and they were already booked for Sept, boo! Ah well, next time!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
It is fine. The creamy salsa is memorable. The basic margarita tastes good. Burritos are pretty subjective, but I think they accomplished what they intended. In that part of town, there aren't  many choices for reasonable lunches, so it works. 

It's counter order, and table delivery, so you have to be in the mood for that. The person I was with completed his quesadilla before my burrito was delivered 25 minutes later (according to the time on the single receipt for both meals with a single table delivery number), so don't go there for normal levels of service.

Don't sit outside unless you want pigeons shitting in your salsa.
author: doug d.

description:
Overall experience: 4/5
Food:5/5 & 3/5

First time here I really loved the food! It was very yummy & we just had to wait long time. It was a weekday happy hour. 
Today was my second time here & the food was ok. It was not remotely busy compared to the first time. I got the chicken enchilada & shared the carnitas nachos. The first time i had carnitas quesadilla & carne asada nachos. I definitely recommend the quesadilla over the enchilada as it is more filling & flavorful
author: Jeanette L.

description: Yum!! Great drinks, chips and salsas, tacos, enchiladas and more. My absolute favorite is an appetizer is the sweet plantain appetizer with black beans (weird combo but really works) and a barbicoa enchiladas.  I really enjoy their sangaria too.
author: Sarah M.

description: Really solid Mexican food and a good convenient location. I had the enchiladas and the sauces were absolutely delicious. Their salsas are also great! Recommend making reservations in advance as the place can get pretty busy
author: Prajakta J.

description: I definitely thought this place was a traditional site out spot but instead this is a great group lunch place! Order your meal (under $15) grab a number, and help yourself to free chips and their salsa bar as you wait at your table. THey also have a bar with strong margaritas.
author: Lily P.

description:
Tropisueño should just change the sign outside to read "Yelp HQ #2" since you are very likely to see a slew of Yelp employees grabbing lunch or the customary after work margarita. 

A little bit of a wait is politely served during the midday rush, but don't fret, the line moves quickly. Dig into those chips and salsa after ordering but try not to fill up on them as the food will come out shortly and the portions are hefty, hefty, hefty. Not wimpy, wimpy, wimpy - at least for the carnitas plate. I like to pour the various salsas all over the plate and go to work. My fave? The habenero salsa, which packs a little punch for the well-trained mouth but will be a knockout for anyone less adept to the art of fire breathing.  

This place is a solid four-stars and my suggestion is to slip in after work, catch a happy hour house margarita and see where the night takes you. Tequila can make you do crazy things, you know?
author: Brad B.

description: One of the best Mexican places in downtown San Francisco. They have variety of Mexican sauces (salsa etc) and you can try them all :-). Pretty awesome. Loved the place and will definitely go back.
author: Deeksha R.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and it was very busy! We left our name and number for a table for 2 and sat at the bar and had drinks while waiting. They gave us salsa and chips, too! I had the pepino margarita and it was delicious! My boyfriend had the Jamaica cocktail drink which was also very good! We got a text message when our table was ready. 

Service and food were amazing! The portion sizes were very generous. I wouldn't recommend an appetizer because the chips and salsa were good enough to hold you over to your humongous meal! We did order carnitas tostaditas for an appetizer though and it was so good! But it was just 2 tostaditas for $8. I had the chile verde and I would highly recommend! 

Definitely would recommend this place to others. Authentic, affordable and fun Mexican restaurant with great servers, food and drinks! 

The only downside: there was one host that was uninviting. She had her back turned toward us, was staring into space, didn't acknowledge customers, and we even seen her when we were leaving an HOUR later- still staring into space. Seemed like she didn't wanna be there. Everyone else was upbeat and friendly!
author: Angelica A.

description: Really enjoyed my lunch here. Great spot to go with friends or coworkers. We got there around 12:30 and the line was out the door but it moved quickly. Tables get snatched up very quickly so if you can, make sure you have someone in your group save a table while you wait on line. I had the prawns and it was delicious, cooked perfectly. I really like the salsa bar and how they let you sample as many as you want. The outdoor seating is awesome on a nice day.
author: Andie L.

description: Bruce the manager was extremely rude to our table. I am one who doesn't leave bad reviews since I come from customer service and work closely with the public.
