Bruce came to our table (who was NOT our server) and told us to our table was reserved for a party during happy hour. ( we came in during happy hour, order all the happy specials including drinks) when he approached our table there was no line nor anyone waiting to be seated. On top of that the table next is was AVAILABLE for the last hour! Next time you get "Bruce" run far away! AHHHHHH !!!
author: Jazmine E.

description: Went here for lunch based on the high ratings, feels like a glorified chipotle. The mole sauce is good but kinda pricey if you have to stand in line to get your burrito bowl and also no table service.
author: Sree S.

description: Super great in and out for a tasty burrito, just be sure to be a little early and beat the lunch rush.
author: Tim M.

description: I am currently sitting at the bar, waiting for my table that I was told would be ready 30 minutes ago.  Upon talking to the hostess, we were told they canceled our reservation.  When asked to be seated, we were told "I can't just make people leave".  We are sitting next to a party who also never got a table, despite waiting for 90 minutes.  No one has apologized, or offered any drinks for the inconvenience.  I have no idea how the food is because no one will seat me. Don't waste your time.
author: Katie F.

description: Absolutely delicious house salad with grilled chicken and avocado.  Imagine a bed of mixed greens dotted with jicama, bits of mexican cheese, sunflower seeds, peppercorns, then topped with the aforementioned grilled chicken diced into pieces.  Finally, fresh sliced avocado to complete this healthy masterpiece.  Its a taste and texture explosion in your mouth that Remy (http://youtu.be/VXoJjgxMj9M) would be proud of!
author: Joe I.

description:
We came to Tropisueño during their weeklong Cinco de Mayo celebration, during which they offered a daily premium tequila and margarita special. We waited for about half an hour for a table; the atmosphere was incredibly loud but not boisterous. Music and loud conversations were at times overwhelming.  

We had tostaditos de carnitas, open-face pork taco appetizers, and they were excellent. Flavorful and weighty, they were worth the trip! As was the house guacamole, which was smooth smooth smooth and had tender bits of identifiable avocado that were still somehow soft as a pillow. The callos a la plancha were delicious (sea scallops with salsa and chorizo-plantain "hash") and filling - it was fine as a main dish but it's listed as an app. I stole a carne asada taco from my beloved's huge taco plate, and I in turn benevolently shared the extras on my plate of pollo asado. But not the pollo asado. I'm not THAT kind. This was some delicious chicken. 

The staff members were kind and not pushy, happy to let us linger long after we had paid the check.  

Make sure that if you park at the nearby parking garage, you get your car by 11pm because if you don't, you can't get your car out until the next morning!
author: Austin J. A.

description: Awesome food, great salsas, decent portions, and good service. It's cafeteria style at lunch, but dinner  service is great.
author: Roca M.

description:
Bad food

Not a restaurant.. more of a moes..no table service.

Rude smug bartender .  

Did I mention the food is terrible?
author: Florencio G.

description: Great flavors.  Tried the plantains for appetizers. Service was adequate or better. Beer selection was limited to Mexico beers. Dinner was pretty solid.  Tried the scallops and chorizo.
author: Bobby J.

description: Get the Pollo Asado. It's the best I've ever tasted. Don't get tamales, the enchiladas are okay, but get the POLLO ASADO. You cannot go wrong. Maybe the chicken tacos. They might have a good chicken thing going.
author: Jay R.

description:
Really good Mexican food. You get complimentary warm nachos with a variety of dips, with refills as well. Food was great and all meals come with three tortillas. Staff was responsive to requests. It's a really busy place so be prepared to wait 40 minutes for a seat. 

Prices are good too considering it's in a prime downtown location. Great Mexican atmosphere too.
author: Jonathan D.

description: I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.  Food here is solid, not spectacular.  Margaritas are always on point, however no pitchers?  Interesting. Great salsa selection for lunch and chips are always cooked perfectly. There are a lot of good items in the menu,  but I always ask the staff at the walk up counter for their recommendations.   It's odd though, you get your food, than have to wait at the bar for your drinks in a separate line. Kind of a pain but overall it is a pretty darn good place.
author: Chris G.

description:
I love that my takeaway burrito came with a portion of warm tortilla chips!!

Got the super veggie burrito which was good but probably could have done with some cheese. But I loved the array of salsas available. Yum!
author: Ada C.

description:
This place would get more stars if the service wasn't terrible. But the fact that I have to stand in one line to order food, and order food where there isn't a visible menu....then stand in a completely different line to get a drink from the world's slowest bartender....who then rushes you to get your ID out before serving you....and is the rude when the other person your party doesn't immediately show up with their ID.

....I haven't even gotten my food yet and this place has already been a huge headache. Wouldn't recommend coming here if you want a smooth dining experience.

[EDIT]
....and now I've downgraded this to one star (from 3) because the "manager" was so rude to me that I've decided to return my food. I'm not about to eat somewhere where the "manager" has attitude with me because I didn't get him an ID fast enough.

[EDIT]
And now they are back up to 2 stars because the general manager spoke with me to try to make things right. 

Here's the whole story--so I order my food and am directed to the bar to order my drink. Ok. That's fine. It's inconvenient, but not a deal breaker. I order 3 drinks, 1 for me and 2 for my other companions. Well, SFPD are eating right behind me so the bartender is very insistent on getting my ID. Again, this is fine. But he needs ID from my two other friends. This is where things start to get weird. I text my friends to come over with their IDs. While I'm waiting, the bartender tells me 3 more times about how he needs to see their IDs. Yeah buddy, this is fine, I'm not arguing about this, I'm not making a fuss...I'm WAITING for them to come over with their IDs. My husband comes over, takes his ID out....but now the bartender has waved us off saying "I'm not dealing with this today, I'm not going to serve you." Umm...ok?? We sit back down at our table. 

After dealing with the parking nightmare that is SF, all I wanted was a freaking margarita. So I head back up to the bar to try my luck. This time I order just one margarita for me. I have my ID out and ready. Bartender looks at me and initially decides that fine, he'll help me. I order my margarita....but instead of making my margarita, the bartender proceeds to scold me about how the SFPD are sitting behind me and that's why he has to ID me. Listen....I don't need to be scolded. I never objected to showing my ID. But what's ridiculous is that if it's so important that he checks ID (apparently only when the police are around)--then it should be unacceptable to have me bring the IDs of my two friends up, because I could just grab IDs from any two random people over 21 to get drinks! Thus....it is necessary for the person with the ID to present it themselves. So thus, the attitude that the bartender copped with me not once, but twice, was completely unwarranted. The fact that he refused to serve me for....taking too long to produce an ID (and complaining a little bit about the process...cuz come on, it's inconvenient in that cramped space)...unacceptable. And then the fact that he felt the need to "educate" me? I'm being nice by saying he was "educating" me on how when the police are present he needs to check ID...but really he was "mansplaining." Well...at that point he refused to serve me again because I became visibly upset over the scolding that I was getting.

At that point I asked to talk to a manager. He informed me that "I AM THE MANAGER." Wow. Honestly if a place puts someone like that in a management position....I don't even have words.

So I did the only thing I could think about doing, which was ask for a full refund on my meal and refuse to eat there. Thankfully the person at the register immediately refunded me without scolding me.

Kicker is...by the time all of this went down, they had delivered our food. I barely ate it because I was still upset. But what I did eat....meh. Seriously, it wasn't flavorful or exciting. I would rate it at mediocre at best...but even that's a stretch. When you consider the service here, the food is NOT worth it.

The general manager eventually came over to check out the situation and I explained what happened. He listened intently and even said to me "[based on what the bartender was saying] I thought I would be dealing with a much more mentally ill person." Obviously the general manager (Alex) didn't have a problem talking with me...so I don't know what's wrong with that bartender.
author: Sarah C.

description: This place is bomb but their appetizer guac is a rip off. Don't do it. v. small portion for a decent amount of money.
author: AJ K.

description: The food is great, you can taste the quality in the ingredients and while most places strive for authenticity, they seem to have captured at least a little of it. But the best part is the watermelon Agua Fresca. That stuff is ridiculous.
author: Ryan R.

description:
4 years later of being introduced to this place and I can proudly say that this is still my FAVORITE and GO-TO restaurant in all of San Francisco. Everytime someone asks for recommendations in the area, I ALWAYS give them this place!

I recently moved to SoCal and can't find ANY authentic Mexican restaurant like this. The worst part is, I actually find myself craving their house chips and salsa!!!!! Why aren't there any other restaurants like this one here!!! :(

I'm seriously contemplating flying back to San Francisco just to get my Tropisueño fix. That's how good the food and fantastic the service here is. Sometimes their restaurant gets really busy and their service slows down, but their waiters always keep you in the loop and try to keep you comfortable.

To the owners of Tropisueño: PLEASE OPEN A LOCATION IN SOCAL. I miss you guys!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I can't believe I've never written a review for this place until now! I've been going to Tropisueno for years and I'm always impressed at how great the food and service are and how inexpensive it for San Francisco standards. 

First off the location is in a great part of SF right across the street from Yerba Buena and very close to Market St in SOMA. The moment you walk in you get to experience the fun side of Mexican food in non "nose in the air" vibe. The staff is generally very friendly and will take your name and put you on a waitlist if the restaurant is full. You can wait in the small waiting area, outside, or preferably at their decent sized bar with a margarita!

After you get seated be sure to indulge in the delicious complimentary chips and salsa. They are one of my favorite chips and salsa anywhere in the Bay Area (just make sure to save some room for your main course).  The margaritas here are great as well.  Once you order, be prepared to start eating shortly thereafter because the food comes before you know it.

The food here is delicious and they have a wide variety of food options for both meat eaters and vegetarians.  If you want a fun but casual dinner out, you can't go wrong at Tropisueno.
author: Ash S.

description:
After a long morning of walking around the city we stopped in here for lunch. The menu is posted on the wall and you order cafeteria style with the ladies behind the counter. After paying we took a seat and realized that they had a huge salsa bar selection. I mean HUGE! We got each type of salsa and tried them all with chips. They were all delish, in particular I liked the dark green one mixed with the orange-y spicy one.

I ordered the barbacoa and chicken tinga super tacos. There was load of meat on there and lots of guac as well. The flavor was excellent. I also had the horchata, which was very fresh and I could probably have drank a gallon of it. Great informal setting, great food, great prices. I would defo go back next time I'm in SF!
author: Amy S.

description: Sooo good and authentic. Wish they were open for breakfast cause it would be awesome.
author: Susan F.

description:
Was encouraged to go here for lunch while visiting San Fran by my favorite Elite Yelper (Carrie D.), and boy was it fabulous!

We arrived in San Fran starving, so after we checked into the St. Regis, we bopped on over to Tropisueno.  As soon as you walk in, the delicious smells hit you and you want to eat everything in sight.  

To the left is the ordering bar station, where you see all the food and fixin's lined up.  You place your order here, pay the cashier, and take your table number to your seat (seat yourself).

We ordered:
*Carne Asada Tostada - it was piled high with freshly cooked carne asada, guac, fresh tomato salsa, and cheese on top of a freshly fried up light tostada.  The tostada itself was so amazing - lightly toasted, flavorful, and delicious.
*mahi mahi taco, and shrimp taco.  These were larger than we thought they were going to be and we ordered them a la carte.  Hubby says they were delicious and since they disappeared within minutes of being placed in front of him, I cannot confirm or deny myself.
*Hubby ordered a house special margarita (he says it was oh so good and full of tequila) and I had a watermelon juice (it tasted like a watermelon - literally like someone was squeezing a sugary, juicy, watermelon straight down your gullet).

SO GOOD.  MUST RETURN.
author: Heather T.

description:
This place holds a special place in my heart or should I say stomach.

My first experience here was with a girlfriend and we had a BLAST!  I love the atmosphere...its lively, but can be a romantic date spot as well.  Low lights, candlelight dining, delicious drinks, and tasty food.  Everything you need for an awesome night out in SF.

We indulged in the complimentary chips and not 1 BUT 3 different yummy salsas.  We also had the garlic shrimp app, fish Veracruz, and camarones (shrimp) tropisueno.  All were delicioso!  

Now...The reason why I docked 1 star.  The line for the bathroom =\  Literally waited 15 minutes in line to use the ladies room.  Why ONLY 1 ladies room, Tropisueno??!!  A few women that were waiting ended up using the men's =X because they just couldn't wait any longer.  Also, the restroom was a disaster zone!  *cringe* 

Nonetheless, had fun times here lol
author: Farhana D.

description:
After dining at Tropisueno four times, I've come to the conclusion that this place is a well-dressed fast-food joint. That there's the sad truth. Some of us constantly crave guacamole, and so return to places where it's easy to get - convenient location! open late! mere steps from BART! - despite the fact that the food is only mediocre. 

There was cardboard in my last burrito. It didn't taste like cardboard, there was literally a stiff piece of paper that cut my mouth. And the last two times I was here the wait exceeded 45 minutes. The margaritas are weak and cloyingly sweet. And the food itself it heavy and overly salted. All of which put a bad taste in my mouth (pun intended. Because it's not a pun. There was literally a bad taste in my mouth. It was the taste of cardboard and overly sweet Margarita mix).

The staff were perfectly nice about the mishaps - they gave me drink vouchers - but I don't think I could get drunk off of their margaritas even if I pounded them simultaneously, because that requires actually using tequila. Next stop: The Mission.
author: Ray J.

description:
Was in town for a friends birthday party, I knew she loved Mexican and wanted to try this place. We put in our online reservation for five just 48 hours before for a Thursday at 7:30. When we arrived were seated within 5 minutes, :) Had the veggie soup here, and tried the fish tacos.  Everything purchased tasted fresh and yummy. The only setback might be having so few bathrooms, but that has nothing to do with the food.  My friend who's birthday it was got the veggie soup and said it was really flavorful and delicious. I tried it and had to agree so I'm giving this a 5 star.  

The service was really on point too. Our waiter was super responsive and with just looking for them they would come over to ask if we needed anything. I told the manager that it was my girlfriend's birthday and I'd like there to be tequila shots sent over, they charged me for only four (Amazing). Centrally located, great customer service, awesome atmosphere, really yummy food. I will be setting up a few more outings here in the near future.
author: Safiyah B.

description:
While the decor was delightful and the drinks looked tempting, my al pastor quesadilla left much to be desired. I jumped in line for a quick takeout lunch and drooled over what seemed like an extensive, fairly authentic menu of Mexican fare. Plus, Mexican food tends to be so much better in California than (predictably) in the Northeast so I was pretty excited to dig in.

What should have been a delectable marriage of marinated pork with pineapple, spices and chiles was a dry as sand mess of tough chunks of meat with a scoop of what tasted like canned pineapple pieces haphazardly thrown on. So, so disappointing. Still, the salsa was fresh and delicious so I guess it's not all bad!
author: Emily C.

description:
Yum! Stopped by this always-popular spot to grab lunch to bring back to my hotel room. Id heard tons of wonderful things about this place, and I was excited to sample some of their stuff.

We got in line with a ton of other people, and the service was really efficient. You check the menu board then are asked for your order and if it's to-go. You're the handed a number, and you move on to the cash to pay your bill. You then hang out with your number until your take-out bag is brought to you. 

I ordered the chicken quesadillas and it only took about 8 minutes for my order to arrive. I then headed over to the awesome salsa bar and got a bunch of them to-go including the salsa verde and a mild one. Both were fresh and lovely! The quesadillas also came with some of their homemade chips, which were great!

I really enjoyed the food, though I did find the quesadillas was a bit uneven, so one bite was all cheese, and the next all chicken. But whatever, it still tasted great. I also appreciate that they include sour cream and guacamole with your order.

I'd definitely head back here next time I'm in San Fran to try the tacos, which are supposed to be awesome. Solid Mexican, and what looked like a great atmosphere, the staff knows what they're doing and the food is fresh. Delish!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Did not disappoint at all! Just came here for a late lunch/early dinner (flew in from NYC) and the taqueria prices and quality can't be beat! 

Beef enchiladas and shrimp tacos were delicious and filling - add the free chips and tons of different salsas available and I had a wonderful meal for $13.50 (with a watermelon juice!). 

Wish this place would open up in NYC!
author: Julie D.

description:
Very nice Agua de jamaica, delicious street style tacos, solid and beautifully presented salads. The decor and ambiance is fun and the open kitchen/cafeteria style line really adds to it.

Service was prompt. The only drawback was the carne asada on my taco was a bit dry. I'll be back.
author: Eric J.

description:
I love tropisueno. We go there a couple of times a month. We have found that our favorite dish is the pork three ways served only at dinner. Their green salsa is the best. 
Sometimes their take out is hit or miss where sometimes we are given chips, sometimes we are not, sometimes they include the salsa, sometimes they tell me to get it myself from the bar, sometimes it's warm, sometimes it's not. I've tried other dishes and nothing is life changing but the pork three ways is definitely worth trying.
author: Dani T.

description:
A very good lunch spot for mexican food. Their salsa bar is very good and has many options (just like some taqueria in Mission). The atmosphere and ambiance are much better than regular taquerias. The service is decent. Complimentary chips were very good as well. We went through two baskets during lunch sampling all salsas.

This place had a good vibe and I enjoyed hanging out there lunch (Maybe I was high on caffine). A good place to chill and hangout.

I ordered Chili Relleno burrito (because the menu on the wall claims "You will love it"). It was pricey for a burrito but I went with it anyways. Later, I was worried because I did not specify if I wanted Chilli Relleno with Cheese or beef (they serve both). By default, they serve cheese chili relleno. The cheese chili relleno burrito was ok; I did not love it :(. My friend had ordered a Carne Asada burrito. He was not impressed with it either.

I would definitely come back here again for the salsa bar, chips, ambiance/vibe/decor, and location. I will stick with vegetarian or tofu burrito and enjoy their flavorful salsa bar.
author: Sid P.

description: I went here on a Sunday night. It was fairly busy but they seated me right away because I was dining alone. The food was delicious but the service was bad. I ate the first half of my meal with my hands because nobody brought me silverware nor my beverage until I was halfway finished. Nobody ever stopped by to ask how my food and service were.
author: Albert V.

description:
The grilled vegetable enchiladas I had were delicious. But I don't see myself going back here because of their deceptive drink prices. I came for happy hour. The happy hour menu stated that well drinks were five dollars. I started a tab with my credit card. I ended up only having to happy hour well drinks. When I went to pay, I assumed my bill would be $10, however, my bill was almost $16.($15.87 to be exact).
I ordered two well vodkas, with club soda and a splash of cranberry juice. 
They had charged me $5.50 for each well vodka, plus $1.50 extra for each drink's splash of cranberry juice, plus $0.50 extra for each drink's club soda!  So the "$5 well drink" on the menu actually cost $7.50!  Also, when we sat down for dinner, I was going to order one glass of white wine. The menu had it listed for $7 a glass. I asked the waiter if the $7 glass of wine was really $7. He told me: "no, The prices have gone up since that menu was printed." I asked how much the $7 white wine was actually going to cost me. He said it was now $11.  I do not like, nor appreciate deceptive menu pricing. Therefore, I guess I have to say Adios to Tropisueno.
author: Suzanne E.

description:
We ordered the pollo asado and carne asada with barbacoa enchilada. Both entrees were large portions, very flavorful and overall very good. The chips and salsa were excellent, thin, crispy, fresh chips and three different salsas to try.
We also tried the tropisueno and violeta margaritas, both were very good and we want to come back and try some others.

The restaurant seemed to get very busy very quickly, luckily we came in before dinner started at 5:30 and were seated right away. Our server was great, very attentive and we had a terrific first experience.
author: C K.

description: I love this place so much. I lived in SF for 5 years and this was one of my fav places. I go there every time I come back! Great food great drinks great service. Can't be beat!
author: Savannah T.

description:
I had mixed hopes about this place because despite the good reviews here, my sister didn't remember it being that good. So, I went in tonight with a couple friends without too high of an expectation. Luckily, my expectations were exceeded :)

Unlimited chips and salsa (3 different kinds) for your meal -- I know I'm off to a great start. Plus, the chips are light and crunchy with just the right amount of salt. We definitely had too many of these, and I spoiled my meal a bit but oh well!

I ordered the 3 item combo, with 2 al pastor tacos and a pork tamale. Everything on the menu sounded good though! We all had trouble deciding what to get. I really liked the tacos (they had pineapple on them, which added a nice element), but the tamale was only fine - not bad, but nothing special. Rice was good, too - it was more flavorful than other places.

This is a great place for dinner & drinks after work - it can get crowded at dinner time, though, so I'd recommend making reservations if you can.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I have not tried any of the food there, as the menu is very meat-heavy, but they make an excellent margarita. 

Go on a weekday between 4 and 6, because  Happy Hour prices are where it's at. For $5.50 a pop, they really can't be beat. Their 'ritas are strong, but so fresh and sweet. The chips and dip are amazing. I could just munch on these all night (and I'm pretty sure I did). 

To be quite candid, I'm usually not a tequila gal, but I gulped down three before I even realized just how intoxicated I really was. Oh well, I made it home safely and didn't make (too many) bad decisions afterwards.
author: Brandi W.

description:
First off, Tropisueno has a great vibe. They're always playing fun Latin music and have great decor goin on. It gets pretty crowded, so make sure to make a reservation!

Simply put, Tropisueno has some great Mexican food. For the most part, they have relatively simple food, but execute this food perfectly. The rice is good, but their black beans are the best I've ever had. I had their pollo asado (which was a tastier quarter leg instead of the usual chicken breast) and it was oh so good. The skin was crunchy while the chicken was still SUPER moist. My mom had the tres cochinitas, which are 3 huaraches witch chile verde, carnitas, and al pastor. Now she cooks Mexican food for a living, so she's pickier than I am, and she really enjoyed the food. Overall, don't expect too much of an out of the box Mexican cuisine, but a VERY well executed typical Mexican dinner (NOT TEX-MEX DINNER)......so it might be out of the box if the only Mexican food you've ever had consists of tacos and burritos.

Lastly, they have an AWESOME selection of tequilas, OVER 100 kinds! They had some great tequilas that I could only find in Mexico, but obviously, there is a price tag that goes along with it.

Overall, if your looking for a nice sit down Mexican restaurant that has great food and a genuine Mexican feel, give Tropisueno a try.
author: Adrian D.

description: A great place for a reasonably priced meal before or after exploring the nearby museums. Their salsa bar was an extra treat. Noisy enough that small children will not be an issue. Outside seating can be difficult on warm weekend days.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Okay so every time I'm in San Francisco I stop by and have lunch or dinner. Since it opened its been one of my favorite places. That being said this last time around I   was really disappointed. 
I ordered the fish tacos (as always) and I got what looked like a fish stick.  Two of the three tacos were this frozen fishstick looking meat. Very disappointing. The rest of our meal (pork taco, chicken taco and burrito were fine) the other issue is the wait times. I realize the placehas become popular but 1.5 hrs wait is crazy
author: Eric S.

description:
I love Tropisueno for their lunches and happy hour, but at dinner... not so much.

Now the cons... I felt rushed to order and leave. If you have a reservation coming in for that table in an hour, let me know in advance so that I won't take my sweet ass time (as I usually do). I met up with a friend around 5:00 and we couldn't swoop any spots at the bar for happy hour, so we settled for a dinner table (with no happy hour deals...).

My biggest pet peeve was that every time a server came to bring/move/take-away plates from the table next to us, their butt would brush our chip bowl and knock a couple chips down. Mind you, we had a tiny table, with our chip bowl pretty close to the center of the table already.

Jeans in San Francisco. Jeans that have been on public transit. Everything that's anything that has touched public transit. 

Transitive property. 

SO MANY FALLEN [free...] CHIPS!

Anyway, if it's not clear how I feel about that, then re-read it again with the theme song from any major scary movie.

All in all, great food, everything kind of has a spicy kick to it (salsa, guacamole, ceviche), and strong drinks. It may not be the amazing food that I get in the Mission, but with this ambiance, it's worth it.

Perhaps.... I'll stick to happy hour, when I can just eat, drink, and be merry.
author: Colleen M.

description: Amazing food and decoration. The burritos are big enough for you to brutally fight someone afterwards.
author: Perla S.

description:
Sometimes, there are instances where I become filled with regret after receiving my food. The cause of this is usually because menu descriptions mislead me into thinking that the food is far more appetizing than it actually is. You know this pain! 

What I can say though, is that there are no regrets here.

The BF and I called our order in to do take out. Definitely a good choice on our part. Choosing this restaurant was like shooting fish in a barrel; hungry, lazy, and not in the mood to sit down, we chose from a Yelp search for restaurants nearby our hotel and settled on Tropisueno. Who knew that the place would be so poppin?! Thirty minutes after placing our order, we showed up and saw a small crowd outside the restaurant waiting to be seated. Lucky us--I was definitely in no mood to wait after a day of running around the city.

The hostess was friendly, and brought out our food quick and easy. We ordered: Ceviche de Pescado, Chile Verde, and Crispy Flautas. Our take out order also came with some crispy tortilla chips and yummy salsa. Awesome deal for so much food.

I can't remember what salsas we had now, but I do remember one that had a slightly smoky flavor. This was lighter in color (not exactly red, more orangey), and I thought it would be more mild, but dang this was HOT. So was the ceviche. I definitely enjoyed the ceviche though; at first glance, the serving looked a little small, but it rounded out perfectly. It was light, fresh, and citrusy. Winner!

The BF ordered the Chile Verde and the Crispy Flautas. The Chile Verde was absolute bursting with flavor, and the portion size was huge.  The pork was mind blowingly tender. The Flautas were a pre-emptive order in case he was still hungry, but he definitely struggled to finish everything. The flatuas were just OK, crispy and good flavor, but also a little dry for my tastes.

A little pricey, but portions are generous and flavor is on par. Take out is an awesome option if you're craving the food but want to circumvent the wait, but I definitely want to try eating in next time, if only to try out the fabulous salsa bar and to sample the margaritas!
author: Donna M.

description:
Been here , eaten all :)

Hats off to best mexican food  you can get in the bay area. They have everything- good location, quick service and most important the great food.

When ever i crave for mexican food, this is the only place I come.
author: Sumit S.

description: This place is very very good.  I had the scallops with chorizo-plantain hash, shrimp in a cream Saudi and enchiladas with chicken and cactus.  All really really good.  Drinks were ok - nothing special (had the tropisueno and house Marg).  As many reviewers said it's very good but a bit over priced...
author: Tim B.

description:
Bangin'.....

Failed to make reservations thus the hour wait...none the less, the hostess made mention we could order drinks chips n salsa etc... and take everything outside while we wait! way cool...made our wait seem like 5 minutes...tons of seating outside to wait n chill...

Our waitress Rachel was super duper prompt! attentive, with a great personality...

Our Drinks (Margarita Exclusiva) was AMAZING ! ! ! !

Forgot what my wife had....

I had the Huaraches, WOWWAWEEWAA....AMAZING. Portion portion portion! Very happy.

Brought my 4 year old, everyone was very inviting, loud inside the bar from everyone having a good time, yet very reasonable in the dining area...

Professional clean laidback environment, come Hip, casual, dress up, dress down, button up, or chuck taylors all will fly here....

Coming from the eastbay this is my new GO TO JOINT ! !

Price Point: CHEAP ! ! especially for the city and everything that goes with this environment, waay affordable....
author: Ricardo D.

description:
Why didn't I know about this place sooner!?  YOU MUST GET THE GUACAMOLE!  It's absolutely amazing.  The avocados are ripe and packed with flavor, and I know it's so simple you can make it at home, but still.. you need to try it!  As with any Mexican restaurant, there's always chips and salsa.. however here, you get three different sauces!  The salsa verde is my favorite.  The chips are warm and freshly made.. yum!  Beware, you will have a hard time stopping.

The cocktails and margaritas are amazing too.  Quality tequila... need I say more?  Not a tequila drinker?  Try the Gloria.  I don't really remember what was in it, but I do know I remember seeing elderflower liqueur and egg whites.. yum my favorite!

Now the food... oh man.....

I had the Chile Verde (tender pieces of pork simmered in tangy tomatillos, pepper, chiles and herbs).  I almost chewed my tongue off.  The pork was really tender and fatty - totally unhealthy, but totally delicious.  I loved the chilies and the whole dish just blended so well together.  Loved it!

My friend had the Tampiqueño (Niman Ranch beef, thin-cut carne asada, and served with a beef barbacoa enchilada).  WOAH, what just happened there?  I'm oblivious to everything around me because this was just like a little piece of heaven on Earth.  The beef was super tender and packed with flavor.  I almost wanted to switch dishes, but the pork from my Chile Verde was calling out to me too.. 

Needless to say, I was a very happy eater :)

Service was excellent.  I loved the decor.  It felt very intimate yet inviting at the same time.  Portions were very decent.  Best of all, it's totally affordable!  

I'm totally coming back!  Next time, I'll try their lunch... tacos here I come!
author: Cecilia S.

description: Service was slow. Food was only average. I took guests here for a birthday dinner, and was horrified to learn they had to complain to the manager about how dirty the bathroom was. It was a disappointing evening.
author: Joan D.

description: Friends and I dined at Tropisueno on a surprisingly packed Wednesday evening. Granted, it was the week of Fleet Week air show, a real estate convention, and Kaskade was in town for two nights (the most important of the 3, of course). To our surprise and delight, we were sat right away, but were told we needed to be done no later than 8:30pm. We sat down at 7pm, so it was definitely a do-able time frame. We were very appreciative and thanked the host. The service was friendly and prompt. The food was just okay. The shots of tequila however, were huge! We ordered one round, and I would say one shot equated to a good 2.5 shots at a bar. I would come back to Tropisueno for their HH and for the polite and accomodating service.
author: Josh S.

description: Staff is super friendly and the pollo tinga is awesome on the Tostada Super! I even added a delicious chicken flautist to the mix
author: Rickey G.

description:
So glad we had a reservation here. On a rainy Saturday night, this place was packed!! It must be the free chips and salsa! ;-) I think they are number one in my book from any Mexican restaurant. They come out warm from your sever and the 3 salsas are delicious. A tomatillo, a smokey/fire roasted one, and a habanero. A deliciously equal!
Easing their menu and trying to figure out what I wanted was not easy. I wanted to try something "different" that what I'd usually pick, so I got their chili verde. It was comfort food at it's finest!! Chunks of pork in a green sauce was delicious!! I almost finished it, but had to stop since it came with rice, beans, AND tortillas. Combined with the free chips, I was going to be on carb-overload that night. 
Tony, our server was epic!! Provided great service and talked to us like he was one of our friends. 
Their drinks are yummy! I was looking for something on the sweeter side and Tony recommended their strawberry as well as spicy mango margaritas which was not on their menu. 
We ended our night with their chocolate flan. I normally don't like flan, but since it was chocolate, I was in! So creamy. It almost tasted like ice cream!!
And finally our dessert after dessert (with the check( was their Chupa Chups. Very cute!!  This place rocks!!!! I'm a satisfied customer.
author: Mimie L.

description: Great service but I have to say the food and drinks are only average. Right by my hotel at union square so I went for take out one night and had a chile relleno and a margarita while I waited. Marg was way too sweet and relleno had too much breading. Went back with friends for happy hour and the bartender brought me the agave for the marg on the side, which made all the difference. My friend also ordered veggie nachos which were delicious.
author: Laura W.

description: Delicous fast casual Mexican food during the day with a very tasty House Margarita. They're al pastor is the bomb as is the chips & salsa bar. Turns into a full-service restaurant at night. Worth the trip if you're staying or shopping near Union Square. Cheers!
author: Andy P.

description:
Hands down the best classic margarita on the rocks I have ever had.  No frills, just fresh and not over sweetened.  Other standouts, the trio of salsa's they serve with nachos for dinner.  Also loved the ceviche trio.  The lunch experience is completely different from dinner but still on point.  It's kind of fast-food style, you order what you want, are given a number, and then it's served to you quite quickly.  I had the pork tostada and the meat was so tender and perfect.   They also have a self-service bar of all of their delicious assorted salsas during the lunch service.

They are a very busy restaurant located next to the Marriott Marquis so peoples' complaints (I see some petty one star reviews on 12/30 about not being able to seat big parties).  They have to deal with the locals as well as tourist crowd.  This is a place where you need to plan in advance - come early, come during off-peak times or make a reservation.  Standard practice at popular restaurants, especially ones with super reasonable prices.  However, even at 9 pm on a Saturday  night, a friend and I were able to snag a table and the host was courteous.  The servers were super busy but I just flagged ours down when I needed to order and it's not like he was just twiddling his thumbs, he was running around taking care of customers,  it was Saturday night after all.
author: Nina P.

description:
Marcienna and tomas were good as servers.Went in a group of 4.They don't take reservations on phone which is a bit irritating.Anyways,tried some La Sombra,tropisueno,duendo,virgin strawberry marg.We got some empanadas(really good).enchilada nopales,pozole vegetariano,combo 2,pepino,mango margarita and florecer.Phew!

having food family style was fun.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
Food great
Service awesome
Ambiance just lively enough

Overall great place for lunch or dinner
author: Erika C.

description:
Oh my goodness... what a great place this is!!  Yes, there is a long line (book ahead).  Yes, it's noisy (don't go for a quiet dinner), but the food, service and drinks are the bomb!

I was gagging for a Margarita after an extremely long day and it came in a pint glass!  How awesome it THAT!?!  

The 3 salsas they give you with the chips are not the chunky canned variety.  They are smooth and range in spiciness from hot to mild.  I had the Chile Verde for dinner with rice and black beans.  The portion size was good and the meat was perfectly cooked and spiced.
author: Vikkie N.

description:
Pros:
The food was amazing. Everytime we finished a complimentary chips and salsa, they would bring our table another one without even having to ask. Our entrees were also top notch. Everyone enjoyed their food and we had a grand time. The servers are also extremely friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. 
 
Cons:
The service felt somewhat rushed. It's understandable because there are huge lines waiting to get a table, however it would have been nice to be able to have a nice social meal. 

Tips:
Make a reservation. The wait can be upwards of an hour for a walk in because this is one of the most popular locations in the city. Our reservation was immediately seated and we didn't have to wait at all.
author: Eric L.

description:
I found this restaurant on Yelp, and tried to make a reservation here, but was rejected because it was fully booked. Sooo I called Tropisueno and the receptionist said that although they were fully booked, she could make an exception for me and put me on the wait list, so long as I got there by 5:30 to be seated at 6. Hurrah! 

We were immediately seated once we got there (since we were first on the wait list), and were greeted by Anthony, who was extremely friendly and helpful in his recommendations. We said we wanted regular margaritas, but he recommended the seasonal pomegranate margaritas to be a little more festive. Sounds good!

So we ended up ordering:
Tres cochinitas $14
Tampiqueno $16
Pomegranate margaritas $10 

The complimentary chips and salsas came out first. I almost wish they didn't because they were so good, I had to stop myself from eating the whole bowl before our food arrived! The salsas were just enough spicy and so addicting.

Next came our drinks - whoo they're kind of strong! (Probably because I'm a lightweight, heh) but after one drink I was pretty buzzed. They were great paired with our food.

My boyfriend got the tampiqueno, while I got the tres cochinitas. Both were so delicious! And the portions were big! Neither of us could finish our dishes (but in a good way). The tres cochinitas were were three "tacos", each with different types of pork. I loved how the tacos were crispy on the edges, and the meat were all so good on their own, and combined. The rice and beans were nicely seasoned as well. My boyfriend's tampiqueno dish was came with carne asada beef, rice, beans, guacamole, and an enchilada. I had a piece of the enchilada and carne asada and I loved both, but did not eat enough of it to review it. 

Even though the food was superb, I subtracted a star from my rating because after eating my dish for a while, it felt a little too oily.

Overall, it was a great experience and the food was superb. I would go back later!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Came here for lunch around 12:30PM. This place gets super crowded since it's in the heart of downtown. Very popular lunch and happy hour spot, so go early to secure seats if possible. It's too cold now to be sitting outdoors in their outdoor seating area!

They don't take reservations for lunch; only dinner. The food was one of the better Mexican food I've had in the area for a decent price and serving size. Would definitely come back for take out or dine in if time permits with work!
author: Brian T.

description: Terrible customer service! Everytime you go in it is an hour wait, with an attitude! It ends up being 1/2 hour, but who wants to be treated like that?
author: Derek H.

description:
11/22/13  Dinner

3.5*  Friday night we had a reservation here at 7pm. The restaurant was packed to the gun wales when we checked in. The table was ready but the place was hot like a furnace. I felt very uncomfortable as soon as I walked in. The deafening volume of conversations didn't help. At least they don't blast music. Tropisueño is located on the ground floor of the backside of JW Marriott so they should have air condition but obviously they were too cheap to turn it on. 

Water arrived and I gulped down the whole glass. The guacamole appetizer ($7) was not served until AFTER our dinner came. It was too tart. We should have stayed with the complimentary warm tortilla chips with three dips including a salsa and a habanero chili sauce.

*Enchilada and Taco Combo ($14): served with rice and black beans. Enchilada was a pollo with red sauce, taco was beef. Both very tasty.

*Chile Verde ($17): very tender pork cooked in green tomatillo sauce. It's one of the tastiest and most tender chile verde I've had. I devoured the whole plate and all the rice, which I usually skipped. 

Food is very tasty here, above par compared with many Mexican joints in town. But we did not like the claustrophobic, noisy atmosphere. Constant coming and going, I guess people were being seated from the bar and if you do not have reservations, be prepared to wait at least an hour. The line at lunch is just as long. I might come back here early for happy hour but I do not miss the craziness.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Tropisueño was my group meal go-to in SoMa when I lived on the East Coast and in London (aka: when I lacked access to decent Mexican food).  After a dinner here last month, I'm rethinking its previous position in my dining rotation.

I thoroughly enjoyed my spicy mango margarita but my chile y cheese tamale was dry as a desert and essentially inedible. Thank goodness I ate lots of chips, salsa and guacamole before it arrived, otherwise I'd have been pretty hungry!

I may come back for happy hour but certainly not for a proper meal.
author: Miriam W.

description: Cool place..lots of fun..salsa bar. The chicken mole and the pork carnitas were excellent. Good horchata too! It's always full, and a LOT of food - far more black beans and Mexican rice than I could, I mean should, eat in one sitting.
author: Robert B.

description:
LOVE this place!  

When I worked a block from here, this was my lunch spot at least 2x a week.

They also have great happy hour specials.  Get there early, seats fill up.
author: Jill S.

description:
Great meal. Came here on a Sunday night at about 7pm and the place was pretty full but they were able to seat us almost immediately. Note that when I left (8:45-ish) there was a wait to get in.

We were immediately given chips and salsa as well as water. The chips were pretty standard chips and there were three salsas: hot, verde, and spicy queso. The queso was too spicy for me to eat a lot of (I'm a medium spicy kind of person), so I stuck with the verde and hot and they were quite good. We ordered drinks and I had the Tropisueño margarita which was really tasty. I tried my friend's drink as well (don't remember what it was) and it was good. I'd love to come here for happy hour or something and try more of them.

I ordered the barbacoa entree (Tampiqueño I believe) and it was very good and very filling. Probably a little too much for me but I ate it all anyway. It came with rice, your choice of beans (black, refried, or one other), a healthy portion of guacamole and an enchilada. All of it was really good, some of the better Mexican food I've had. The waiter stayed very attentive the whole meal and kept coming by to check up on us.

Definitely will check Tropisueño out again when I'm looking for Mexican in SoMa.
author: Matt B.

description: This place get's slammed at lunch so be prepared to wait if you get there mid rush. The line moves pretty quick but most days will have a line. I've heard at dinner, they do normal sit down service but for lunch its walk up and order, then they serve the food to the table. It works well for lunch and keeps the tables moving faster. During my most recent visit, I had the Carnitas. The plate of food was enormous. Way more than enough for lunch. The quac here is one of my favorites ever. I think it's the jalapeno in it that puts it over the top for me. Typically I'm not a huge fan but I love it here. If you're going with a group, just order a few entree's and apps then share. You'll have plenty of food and get some variety in your life.
author: Scotty C.

description: The place is off the charts. First of all the location,in the heart of the financial district,right by St Patrick's Cathedral, makes it easy to get to. The decor of the place is so inviting,it combines the styles of a Mexican restaurant with the trappings of San Francisco's financial district. For the food, I always start with Steak Burrito rice,Black beans sour cream...to find out about a place. The first bite was heavenly! The ingredients are a very high quality,and put together perfectly also the chips are delicious,thin and tasty. The Salsa keeps it going being fresh with a large selection.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
The location is great. One of those  Mexican restaurants with a nice ambience and lively crowd, we went there on a Friday evening and the place was crazy busy. Their chips and 3 salsa combination is awesome and guess what - it's free!! Service is very quick. We tried their tilapia ceviche, not a great fan, tasted very average, I make better ceviches at home . For main course we ordered the tres cochinatas, 3 styles of pork and camarones tropisueno, shrimp in cream sauce. They tasted just about alright, we were expecting better. 
Not the best Mexican food but I would go back for the location and their free chips and salsa.
author: Vidisha S.

description: Had dinner here for date night yesterday before heading off to the movies. Loved the food, atmosphere and service. Prices are extremely reasonable and food is delicious + generous portions! I'll def be coming back here again. We ordered the seasoned pork chop (approx $18) and the chicken enchiladas (approx $14) + cocktails.
author: Anisa M.

description:
My friends and I walked in on a Friday evening, and the place was packed! After a 40-minute wait, we were seated by a friendly waitress who recommended the white/Peruano beans (YUM) to go with my vegetable enchilada. If you like your food spicy, make sure to let your waiter know. My enchilada was a little bland. 

While we waited, we finished two rounds of chips and 3 different types of salsa (ALL to die for, but my favorite was the creamy orange one.)

The ambiance of this place is nice, but it's a little too dimly lit for my liking. However, our waitress made up for this with her great service. 

By the end, we were all stuffed and satisfied (the plates are seriously huge). The check came with lollipops -- always a bonus. :)
author: Nidhi K.

description: Quick casual dining place to grab Mexican foods in better environment. Foods were priced well and tasted fair, though their margaritas were not well made. We had chicken mole and chiles rellenos. Both were decent though not the best that you can get easily in Mexico.
author: Tommy C.

description:
My husband and I went to Tropisueno for our weekly date night. What a huge disappointment.  First, the restaurant was hotter than Dantes Inferno. When I asked if there was some way to cool it down I was told the A/C was broken. While waiting for our food I finally went to the ladies room to put my hair up so I could cool down. Meanwhile it was awful to watch the sweat pour down my husband's face. Of course I couldn't tell him anything because it was so loud we couldn't hear each other, and our waiter couldn't hear us either.

While the room was hot, the food was not. My beans were a mixture of warm and cold, my Pollo asado taco was flavorless, and the chicken tamale and barbacoa enchilada were nothing to write home about. My husband liked his chicken mole, but it was way too sweet for my taste. 

Considering the vast quantity of great taquerias in San Francisco,  I'd say save your money by going to one of them instead of to Tropisueno. Or maybe to Chevy's.

Oh, and they FINALLY opened the door to cool the place off, but by then the night was too far gone. 

After deciding to give up on the food (mine was lousy, and my husband filled up on the two bowls of chips and salsa they brought to us while we waited...and waited) our waiter finally decided to check back on us. Noticing my half eaten plate he asked how it was. So I told him. He asked if I wanted something else, but since we'd already been at the restaurant for almost an hour I just asked him to pack it up. Maybe one of the kids would like it.

Bottom line, if you want mediocre Mexican food in a hot restaurant where you can't hear each other, and it costs three times what you should pay for the same meal at a local place, then this is definitely your restaurant.
author: Michele J.

description:
Service was really bad. We did not get our drinks till after we were done with our food and to top it off when the server asked us how is everything I replied saying while food in my mouth, if we could get more salsa to which he replied " but I'm asking how is your food" what a rude guy!!! We never got the extra salsa .. It looked like nobody had time for us!! We waited for our bill for 30 mins. 
The food on the upside was really good. Too bad their service sucked
author: Anshul N Eypsa T.

description:
Really disappointing.  My office is nearby and I was a regular lunchtime customer, sometimes coming in multiple times a week.  Frankly, it was some of the best Mexican food in San Francisco.  

A few months ago, they starting lining all of the steam trays in plastic wrap/plastic bags.  It's really concerning - my food is simmering all day in plastic, leaching god knows what into the food.  It also looks really unappetizing!  I don't know what made them make this change (less cleaning?) but I really have no desire to eat chemical leached food.

Management, if you're reading this, please get rid of the plastic!!
author: Steve B.

description: Good service, quick and efficient. Enjoyed the vibe of the place. Food was good too, I had the carne asada torta. Thumbs up, looking forward to trying happy hour
author: Alex S.

description: Spent a good friends birthday here, wish we hadn't. The only good thing was the queso which is kinda sad...had the chile verde and it was palatable at best. I tried my friends mole and it was barf tastic; sweet mole with the floppy chicken skin still on. Like grandma used to make right? No. No Sir, I will not be back!
author: Sonja D.

description:
Still on my margarita and tortilla chip kick, I decided to hit up Tropisueño before heading back over the bridge to Oakland. I haven't been to this spot in several years. I was hoping to get a seat at the bar, but it was reserved for a private party. What? For reals? Who does that? Anywho, we waited a short while for a table, had chips and salsa, house margaritas, and plates of ceviche de pescado and callos a la plancha. This totaled close to $40. The corn tostaditas that came with my ceviche were way too hard, so I ate it with the chips. Both dishes were tasty, but there wasn't much of either. The margaritas were just okay--not strong enough for my liking. 

The restaurant was cramped and super crowded with the gentrifying crowd that seems to permeate every nook and cranny of San Francisco these days. I doubt that I'll return.
author: Felicia P.

description:
Portions are plenty and quality is pretty good. I got the chicken quesadilla. I could not finish it myself. They have a salsa bar so go crazy. The waiters who bring your food (you order at the counter) are really hard working and accommodating. Tip them!
My sister loves coming here for lunch with her co-workers. It has a bar too.
author: Holla F.

description: Nice atmosphere but the food was just average. We had the chicken mole - it was actually cold. We also had the salmon which was warm and good but not great. Would not return unless we happened to be real hungry and standing right outside.
author: B J.

description:
My gf and I just went in there for dinner this evening.  We have eaten there for lunch several times and it's always outstanding.  Our first dinner experience, we ordered salmon ceviche to start.  It was amazing.  Dinner comes out, I ordered the tampiqueno (a bunch of beef stuff) and it's delicious.  My gf ordered the salmon, cooked in banana leaves.  After two bites, she realizes her salmon is raw.  And I don't mean undercooked, I mean straight up cold and raw and could probably still swim.  We send it back and our waitress, who I think was the only server on the entire floor, just nodded and took the plate back.  My gf ordered veggie enchiladas and they come out super quick...except its just enchiladas on a mini plate, no rice, no beans no anything.  The waitress comes by again and I ask her if she looked at the salmon and she nodded and said that the owner of the restaurant was told and he was talking to the chefs.  They comped us a desert, strawberry shortcake, which was nice but they didn't tell us and just brought it out.  What, I believe anyway, to be total BS is that there was no mention of any of this.  Our dinner was $100 and the manager and/or owner never came out and apologized or told us they can just comp the meal or whatever.  I thought this was an upscale, fancy place.  Clearly I was wrong.  If this happened at an actual respectable place, you can bet the manager and/or owner would be out they'd be making sure everything was stellar and apologizing profusely.  That didn't happen.  Instead they're okay with accepting the risk that we, or anyone else ordering the fish, could get really sick from FOOD POISONING, SALMONELLA or any other food borne illness from raw fish that isn't sushi grade.

Super lame.  


In typical SF fashion, the customer is expected to just accept less than what they pay for.  We won't be back here.
author: David P.

description: This place is awesome.  I've had their quesadillas, fajitas, tacos, and burritos and they are all awesome.  Customer service is excellent and they have a good variety of homemade salsas.  They also have a bar which is awesome.  Price is reasonable and I will definitely be coming here regularly!
author: Mason W.

description: I hate to give this place 1 star because I been going here for years. But this is the first time I encountered this. I ordered my tacos to go and packed up some salsa in the to go containers. As I am eating the chips and salsa halfway through I encounter this sharp Metal wire inside my salsa. Very disappointed because their food is delicious however this is a health and safety hazard. I posted a photo in their photo album to show exactly what I am talking about
author: Jessica T.

description: Definitely make a reservation, there was a long wait but I had my table for 2 reserved via Yelp the week before. Nice staff, good food, fun vibe. A little over hyped, but still better than average. A bunch of variations of margaritas, cool decor. Good (but loud) date spot.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
I really liked this place!  I was able to get 7pm reservations through Yelp and I'm glad I did!  It was pretty packed until about 8pm when it slowed down.  The wait staff was super friendly and helpful with recommending food and drinks.

I really enjoyed the food, it is more on the pricey side for Mexican food, but I was full and satisfied at the end of the meal.  I had the 3 pork dish and the Tropisueno margaritta, both were very enjoyable!  Also they give you free chips and 3 types of salsa which was a big plus to me.  I would definitely recommend this place, but make sure you make reservations or you might have to wait awhile!
author: Nick D.

description: Loved the atmosphere! The recommendations from the alejandro and my server Jose!  Will def. come back!
author: Fernando D.

description:
This is one of my frequent-return spots. We went on New Year's Eve. I'd made reservations over the phone with a young lady who seemed to be unsure of what she was doing. I felt a little uneasy after hanging up the phone.

Well, sure enough, four of us arrived that evening and lo and behold, they had no reservation for us.  Very annoying. BUT, they did have an available table for us, so it turned out okay.  I've been here several times before and this is the only time that this has happened, so no star deduction for that.

As usual, they hit it out of the park with the chips and guacamole. I showed some restraint this time, though, so I'd have room to try new dishes. But, I still had to take a doggy bag home.
author: L.E. W.

description:
We came here immediately after landing in San Fran. We hadn't packed snacks on the plane and didn't indulge in $12 crackers and hummus, so we were famished. In a daze, we stumbled out of the airport without getting any food court junk and got on the BART. That was when we realized we were in trouble. Dizzy with hunger and plane-ness (you know, that feeling when you get off of a plane--gross, perhaps groggy from a bad nap, and in a different time zone), we survived the zombie ride and my husband immediately steered us toward Tropisueno. He had the pleasure of dining here during his last business visit to the city, and I was thankful he knew about it just because they serve food. 

But they don't just serve any food. They serve DELICIOUS food. We both got entrees with chicken and green sauce. The green sauce was amazing and the whole entree was quite short lived.  I ate more than I expected to and was so happy. The black beans and rice were great sides and the fresh avocado on the side was so creamy  and mouth watering--that's something you earn a great appreciation for in Ohio. Finished with a Coca Cola and the meal was perfect! The service was also fantastic. Everyone was nice and made sure that we were taken care of--I think we looked a little disheveled with our baggage and gaunt, hungry faces. 

Definitely recommended! Granted, I was incredibly hungry when I scarfed this food down, but I don't think I'm wrong when I say it was tasty. I'm sure we'll be back the next time we make the trip!
author: Kaitlin D.

description:
The drinks here are AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! The house margarita was soooooo good and I was pretty tipsy after two lol and I'm 6'6 and I drink kinda often but anyways the chips and salsa are even super good I ordered a combo plate I forget what it's called with steak and a taquito and it was bomb definitely go here it's great 

Oh and there's this drink serve with a cucumber garnish that is amazing super refreshing try it lol
author: Anthony A.

description: Amazing place!! The ambiance is warm, great service, had as a server Omar which made dinner extremely pleasant. I ordered the 3 ceviches; salmon, shrimp and fish, a little spicy for my palette but they changed my plate without an issue to the Salmon Ceviche which was exquisite. My husband ordered the Tacos al Cachete, really good! Also had some drinks, Margarita was really good but I am more into Mojitos and I have to say I will remember theirs, it was extremely good and refreshing!! Will definitely love to come back from Miami! The place is packed and I highly recommend reservations!
author: Maria C.

description: We visited this past Friday and we're really looking forward to it. We went in, I believe it was around 9:30-10 PM, and there were several open tables. We were sat crunched between another couple and three people at a two-person table. Our waitress and the food had started off pretty good. We were digging it! The people sitting to my right, however, were horrendous. They were speaking very vulgar in Spanish, which my boyfriend and I speak. They were pretty drunk and had brought their maybe 10 year-old daughter who had kicked my leg a few times and put her hands on our table as well. We didn't want to say anything at first because we were really tired from a long day of sightseeing so we ignored it; kids can be tough, we get it. As we got our food, the woman kept getting closer to the point where as I was eating and my elbows kept being tapped by her back and hair several times - without a flinch from her or an "oops! I didn't realize I was that close to you." I thought it was really strange, but then it didn't stop. When I went to get up to go to the restroom I asked her if I could sneak by because there was no room really between the tables, and she didn't even answer me or move! When I came back from the restroom I went in via the other side with the other nice couple sitting and eating. It was so tight I almost knocked over their nacho chips - I apologize profusely having to get that close to their table! Ps- I'm petite at 110 lbs; it's not usually a problem. I also saw the rude table had moved my jacket and purse closer to the other table. A lot of the workers saw what was going on and finally my boyfriend got up and asked a busboy if we could just sit somewhere else to finish our meal (since there was a pretty good availability). He was super sweet and said he was OK with it - looked like he saw everything. I wouldn't normally blame the restaurant for a really rude guest, but some other waiter kept coming by and taking shots with the really rude guests. They were all plastered. When our waitress realized that we had asked to be moved, she all of a sudden became very standoffish with us and borderline rude herself. I thought she was going to be a bit nicer and accommodating, as my boyfriend and I were pretty calm about the whole situation. We told her that we didn't want to say anything to the rude customers and that we just wanted to have a nice night so we asked to moved. It was probably the strangest experience/interaction I have had in a restaurant... I'm still not quite sure why the rude table was being rude nor do I understand the waitress' demeanor to us after the experience we had near the rude table of guests... maybe they were friends with the staff and that's why? We tipped 20% because it wasn't the waitress' fault for the rude customers, but it left a very bad enough taste in our mouthes of the whole place that I wanted to leave this review at the very least. Maybe it's a fluke and it generally is a great spot?! Definitely not our experience though.
author: Ms. R.

description:
Went here for breakfast this morning and was real impressed. The restaurant was very clean and inviting.all the staff was very friendly. I had the breakfast plate with the chorizo and scrambled eggs. It came with rice and refried beans. They also give you a generous bowl of chips and there was a great salsa bar. The chorizo and eggs were great as was the rice and beans. All had very good flavor. The chips were  killer and the 3 different  salsas I tried were all fantastic, especially  the guacamole salsa.
Will definately be coming back here soon!
author: Steve C.

description: Checked out this pace for the second time, still consistently good food, amazingly nice service (with lots of vegetarian options). Chips and Salsa on the table was really fresh and good. We tried Enchilada, Cheese Tacos and Tamales (all vegetarian) everything was good.
author: Suresh S.

description:
Delicious food and great service!
I've been passing by this place for a couple of years, and finally came in for dinner. They start dinner at 5:30 on Sunday, we came in at 5:20, put our names on the list and we got a text message that the table was ready at 5:35! It is worth mentioning that there were a lot of reservations at 5:30 and the place got packed pretty quick. The moment we were seated, we were served with chips and salsa, which were refilled during the meal. Our server was friendly and quick, all that you can ask for! 
We had Violeta and Tropisueño margaritas, the first was nicely sweet, the second one was pleasantly refreshing, good choice! For the food I had Salmon, my friend had Tropiqueño I believe, and we were 100% satisfied! The side dishes are savory, I liked the rice particularly. 
The most exciting part of the night was a Chupa Chups lollipop. If you have been to Spain, you might be addicted to them as well:)
Though it was Sunday, there were kids at the tables. You won't see kids that often, but they don't bother at all, as everyone has enough room. 
Highly recommend!
author: Katie K.

description:
W hotel( I am staying at) referred me and my business colleagues to this place. It was close by my hotel n we were hungry so we walked over... OMG!!! All 4 of us so enjoyed our food and the experience!!!! Tasty, pretty much in touch with authenticity (being 1/2 Mexican myself) as well as service on point! 
The minute we sat down at our table we were introduced to a large portion of tortilla chips with 3 AMAZING salsa's to tantalize our pallets. Although the guacamole for 4 was quite small... We all enjoyed our entrees. I decided to take a risk ordering a combo plate ( tamale, taco and enchilada) of chicken accompanied by retried beans, and Mexican rice( so, so. Too much cumin!)
In a nutshell, I'd definitely recommend this place for a DELICIOUS meal and a good atmosphere!!!
author: Mark H.

description:
My Happy Hour Experience at Tropisueno...

Positives:
+ Free chips and salsa!  You get 3 different kinds of salsa too!  
+ Large nachos
+ Tasty margaritas!  They are pretty strong though...
+ Friendly staff

Negatives:
- Happy hour seating is first come, first serve... It can take some time to get a spot, especially if there are more than two of you in your party.  The place gets busy and seating is limited.  
- The door to the Women's Restroom doesn't lock.  Sorry to the lady I accidentally walked in on.  Make sure you have someone guard the door for you.  Another alternative is to pee really fast before someone opens the door on you... This is what I did...

I also like that Tropisueno is walking-distance to Powell BART!
author: Francesca L.

description: The food is delicious and the service is compassionate and personal. The atmosphere is themed for intimacy. Sylvia is awesome.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Chile verde was excellent!  Tender pork with flavor bursting in every bite!  
Also really loved the violeta margarita...I wasn't sure what to expect but it was smooth and delicious.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Food is bland, been here a couple times and I keep giving it a chance. The Mexican place at the food court in the mall has better flavor. Trust me. 

Also first time I've come here for lunch and the setup is ridiculous. You have to wait in a lunch line, no place to come for a work lunch because after you sit down you're pretty much screwed, can't get anymore for drinks or food without waiting another 30 minutes. 

I tried it. But I'm over it. It's not worth the wait. Mexican food needs spice and flavor. 

Only thing I really enjoyed was the music playing over the PA.
author: S F.

description: Great lunch spot near Yerba Buena Gardens.  Lovely wait staff and delicious food.  Fantastic margaritas and wonderful bartender.  We sat outside and enjoyed the sun.
author: Ben S.

description:
Came here again with friends on a Monday and very much enjoyed it! Tropisueno rarely fails in food quality and consistency! It's delicious every time. The orange/yellow salsa is soooo tasty! We usually have to ask for more!

I tried the salmon and it was SO good! I usually have the shrimp dish but this was fantastic. It was light and full of flavor very good! I asked for veggies instead of rice and had it with black beans. The veggies are full of flavor soooo good and not bland in the least bit! I was super impressed by how tasty the veggies were.

I wish the margaritas were stronger!
author: Priya S.

description:
I've been here 3-5 times over several months, and have received consistently great food. The chips and salsa are probably the best I've had anywhere, and I eat a ton of Mexican food. So good!

This review is about the service, which has been mind-bogglingly terrible every time. I kept going back because the food is really good, but I've finally hit my limit.

Once: I ordered only soup, while dining with one other person. His food came out promptly, but my soup never came. Various employees came by to ask how the experience was, and each time I asked after my soup, each time to be reassured that it would be out ASAP. My friend was nearly done with his food, so I went up to the cashier for to-go orders and asked after it -- was told the same thing. I went back to my table and waited for so long that I went back up to the cashier, only to be told the same thing. Come on now, you're not concocting it from scratch... just ladle it into a bowl and give it to me! By this point it had been over an hour of just waiting for soup, so I went back to the cashier a third time and asked for my soup money back. He rushed to get a bowl of it from the back but I said no, for pete's sake, just give me my money back. By the time I returned to the table to retrieve my friend someone had arrived with it, but forget it -- my lunch break was over and my desire to eat there had evaporated.

Two friends and I went there last night, which will be the last time I ever go back. We were shown to the outside seating, and proceeded to wait for 10-20 minutes while at least seven different employees flew by with various items for every table but ours. We got chips and salsa (which we requested refills for several times before ever seeing a menu, it took so long) but did not get silverware until after our food had arrived. When someone came by after our second bowl of chips and asked if we wanted menus, I nearly laughed out loud -- we'd been there nearly half an hour! At this point we had not even met our waitress -- who, when she came, had the affectation of "this place, the service, I know, right?" A while later a completely new runner confidently tucked plates in front of each of us, not asking who had what, then said, "I'll get you silverware" and never came back. They weren't our dishes at all, but another table's! We sat and stared at this food until we were able to flag down our waitress.

I get this place is crazy busy just about all the time, but their inability to coordinate service while employing what felt like an endless supply of bussers, runners and waitresses, is completely beyond me. The outside seating is first-come, but you must have a system for keeping track of and taking care of your tables! It's glaringly obvious there is little to no staff communication or coordination at all. My boyfriend has worked in fast-paced fine dining for over a decade and if I brought him here he would be disgusted and confused. On that point we are in agreement.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
I am only giving this 3 stars because the service and drinks are good.

I came here awhile and immediately fell in love. Everything was full of flavor! The enchiladas in corn sauce I had were amazing, and they modified my order so there would be cheese inside along with the vegetables. It was quite possibly the best Mexican food I've ever had.

Today I made a trip to the city just to experience that greatness again, but learned they have a new chef. The new chef and his crew apparently can't handle simple modifications (like just putting some cheese in the enchilada, not hard). That's not my only issue, though. The food just tasted so much more bland in general. The corn sauce before was so rich and creamy (and there was a lot more of it). I didn't leave a single scrap on my plate, and scooped the remained of the corn sauce up with chips. This time, it barely had any flavor at all. It wasn't thick and creamy, but more of a thin liquidy sauce. There was also a lot less of it. The whole thing was so disappointing I barely ate any of it. I asked my partner how his meal tasted, and while he said it wasn't terrible, it was far from anything special. I wish he could have tried the food while the old chef was there. There was nothing like it! 

The wait staff was very nice and offered to remove my meal from the bill, and even offered to make me something new. I didn't want to bother with anything else, but I do appreciate their dedication to good service. The drink menu offers tons of delicious and unique cocktails. Were I just basing my review on the drinks and staff, it would be very positive. I can't, however, give it more stars when the food itself was so lacking. If you're just looking for a place to have cocktails and chips, though, this is your place.

(I wrote this and never posted it a few months back)
author: Leah S.

description:
As a San Diegan that eats MXN food on the regular, in the best place in the US to do so, I can say this place hits the nail on the head. Best tasting quesadilla I've ever had. The tortilla was the most flavorful thing ever. Not sure what they use or do, probably tons of butter, but amen brother. Meat was bomb too, not cheap junk meat. 

Cool place, great for locals and tourists, as it is hidden, but in perfect location if you have a conference at the Marquis. 

Drinks are stiff. 

Lines are long, seating is tough, so be prepared.
author: Tommy K.

description:
Great food. Some of the better $$ food I've had in SF. Great, friendly service. Nice ambience that's good for a family dinner and also good for a date.

Loved the carne asada. It was well seasoned and rare like I asked for.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Been to Tropisueño twice now.
Friendly waitstaff.
Salsas (3) are delicious.
Plates were great (Carnitas esp.).
Atmosphere is warmly lit.
Will return.
author: Mike P.

description:
Simply the best Mexican Restaurant in San Francisco.

Full flavor and great service.  The salsa bar is just perfect.
author: Martin Q.

description: Amazing salsa variety! Fish tacos were great also!
author: Daniel L.

description: Very tightly packed seating makes for a very very noisy experience and too few servers, especially on a weekend evening. Add to that the din of over-lubricated happy hour celebrants and the whole thing becomes rapidly unpleasant. The food was adequate, but there's certainly better (and cheaper) all over SF.
author: Chris H.

description: This 5 star review is solely for Alex. Went in here with two gfs and was greeted by a not so friendly host. Ok- giving him the benefit of the doubt- we all have off days. Didn't seem too interested in helping us or seating us so we decided we would leave. Alex stopped us from leaving, got us tequila shots, chips n Guac and told us we would have a table asap. Once we were seated he continued to come by and check on us. Tropisueño is lucky to have him- this is true customer service.
author: Sarah D.

description: My family and I really liked this place. They had a broad menu where you can't really go wrong. We all ordered different types of Mexican food. Everyone lived their food. My only critique was that they did not have fresh ice tea. They had a bottled tea which was ok but not brewed. The chips and salsa were very fresh. The staff was very nice. When you go definitely make reservations. Getting seated is very tricky. There isn't much leadership at the front when you walk in. You have to actively find someone to seat you.
author: Dustin F.

description:
Cozy and welcoming, Tropisueño pulls you in as soon as you open the door. 

They have a menu board that you order off of, which is fine, but it's not above where you order like at most places, it's off to the side....so by the time I got up to tell them what I wanted, I actually forgot what it was I wanted!
