But thankfully it was not busy, so I was able to go check out the menu board quickly and remember (so maybe if you're a first timer like I was, just repeat what you want over and over in your head so you don't forget).

I really liked that they had a self-serve salsa station so you were able to try a few different things. I'm a big fan of tortilla chips and salsa, so this was a great touch.

Everything was delicious, reasonably priced, and good portions! I had a shrimp quesadilla, and I don't think I ended up eating all of it before I was full. I don't live in SF (or even somewhat close!), so I've only been here once and have only tried the quesadilla. My friends got burritos, and they were very happy.

It's not a huge restaurant, so I could definitely see this place filling up quickly.
author: Jackie H.

description:
Loved loved loved this place!
Went here for date night with my Hubby and as always it was nice and busy! They quoted us a 45 minute wait, but we patiently waited only 15 minutes. The host (a man) was very pleasant and helped us get a seat sooner than later. He was very nice and welcoming and I really appreciated that. Okay, so theeeen we get to our table and our server a Young man, Skinny, Tall with nice brown hair greeted us. ( I love the guayaberas that they wear btw) He brought us that famous tray of salsas that are by far as good as people say they are and then shortly returned to take our order. He recommend the Mole dish to me and omg it was GREAT! He amazed me with how well he remembered everything and he didn't even write anything down. 
Overall this place is great! 
Food, ambiance, and service is great here! Will forever highly recommend! :D
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
I enjoyed the drinks but that was the extent of it.
-We were told to please leave the table as soon as possible, which is no big deal if anyone actually serves us.
-We waited for at least 45 minutes with no service before we had to ask a manager to send a waiter over. 
-Once we ordered we waited an hour and a half for one taco and one enchilada, which never came. 
-Tables next to us sat at a similar time and we watched as people came, ordered full meals/drinks, ate and left before we ever received our one taco and one enchilada. 

The drinks were fantastic but the service leaves much to be desired. For an hour and a half we only ate chips and salsa and eventually had to cancel our meal (one taco and one enchilada!) because of an appointment.  Having a reservation is one thing (which we had),but the restaurant needs to work on getting servers to customers and getting food out in a timely manner.
author: B S.

description: Very tasty food! Extremely busy on a Monday night, so we ordered to go rather than wait the 1.5 hours. All of the meat was excellent. The black beans were beautifully seasoned. We did find the masa a bit sweet for our liking, but overall, really enjoyed all our food!
author: Emilia S.

description:
Definitely satisfied my cravings for Mexican food!

My boyfriend and I shared a seafood soup and the pollo asado entree. This was more than enough food especially after all the chips and salsa!

Sopa de mariscos : Abundant amount of scallops, white fish, shrimp, and mussels in a tomato soup. It was very flavorful and not salty! 

Pollo asado: 2 grilled marinated chicken thighs with rice, beans, grilled veggies (not enough though!) and 4 corn tortillas. The chicken was very moist! I'm glad they didn't add cheese to the black beans.

Service was excellent! Our waiter occasionally stopped by to refill our water cups even though the pitcher was on our table. They even split up the soup for us!
author: Christine C.

description:
Unfortunately, I don't live close to this place to go there enough times to try majority of the menu -- or I would have; hell, if I wasn't there on business, I'd have stayed all day to do just that. This place was great and the service was phenomenal. All people want from a server is a personable, upbeat attitude, friendly smiles and a genuine concern for your comfort and enjoyment. This place delivered!

My go-to entree at a Mexican place is usually a burrito or chili relleno; I can tell the authenticity by either of these two things. However, the burritos are only on their lunch menu. So, I went with my Plan B and simply asked the waiter what he'd suggest. Right away he started pointing out the enchiladas with cream sauce. I was sold and decided to try that with the black beans. It was amazing! Definitely had fresh ingredients, fresh sauce and homemade beans -- not something dumped from a can.

I also asked for a margarita of his choosing and he brought me the house margarita...or two. 

This place can get pretty packed -- understandably so -- so when I went, I was shown to a long, narrow table that had others sitting at it, already. I'm from Los Angeles, now living in Reno and I have NEVER seen something like this. I asked the hostess, "So, you want me to sit right THERE?" pointing to the only spot that was right across from a couple that were clearly on their first date. I smiled awkwardly before sitting down and waiting to order. This was all new to me, so I almost thought that since the table was so narrow, that we'd share the chips and salsas -- thankfully, I waited and didn't make a fool out of myself by snagging up someone else's chips, even though they were, literally, right under my nose.

I'd have to come back here a second time to determine the consistency of the food/service to give a 5-star, but this place will forever be on my radar when I'm back in town.
author: Elaina B.

description: We were wandering around and stopped in here for dinner. The service was ok and it was busy but I felt our server could have been more attentive. He kept forgetting our drinks and was visibly annoyed I didn't get anything alcoholic. The food was ok--nothing special and overpriced.
author: Lauren H.

description: I'd give the food four stars but our server was horrible. We have been here often and it's never been bad service. Our server could not describe the dishes and made very little effort to inquire with someone else.  My husband and I both ordered enchiladas but with different fillings. My husband had the carne asada,which I do not eat. Our server mixed up the plates. Luckily my husband started eating first and noticed so we asked the server to be sure. He assured us he had it right. I didn't believe him. I then asked the host at the front to confirm. He checked and said the plates had been mixed up. Our server could have cared less. Mistakes happen, but you should own up to them and make an effort.
author: Sweta P.

description:
Delivious margaritas. Its crowded but service is fast and professional. I wish there had been some cheese in the enchiladas but the flavors were great. 
The chips and salsa are dangerously addictive. My girl got the chille relleno and loved it.
author: L. S.

description:
Came for cantina-style lunch.  Definitely very long lines during meal times, but it goes super fast once you get past the cashier.

It's hard to order since there's no menu behind the employees taking your order...my dory/goldfish brain can't remember that far. Next time I'll grab a paper menu or something!

1 cheap side combo (enchilada) way enough for me- TONS of rice/beans. Tiny microscopic sliver of avocado though.  Free chips/salsa bar!  But they only have Tapatio hot sauce, no Cholula :(

Pricey drinks for the volume, but really strong!  You have to order and pay for them at the separate bar counter across from where you order food.  Not as tasty as the menu descriptions make them seem but will definitely get you tipsy.

I'll be back!
author: Micha Z.

description:
Like I said, I love burritos and the burritos here are pretty darn delicious!  I love how the carne asada is cut into chunks of meat.  The quality is instantly noticeable.  The chips are so addicting, very thin and freshly made.  Last but certainly not least, the cerviche is soooo good with just the right amount of zest.  Definitely, a must-try!  

Lots of seating with nice, Spanish-style decor.  Order up front then seat yourself.  They will bring out your food quickly.
author: Erin V.

description:
After my workout yesterday, I came here to grab some lunch. It was pretty busy, but I was hungry and Mexican food sounded pretty good! I ended up just getting regular chicken tacos to go. But while waiting in line to pay for my order, I saw they had signs for El Gusano. So Tropisueño is the same as El Gusano and vice versa. It all made sense. The whole layout of this place was similar, but this place is smaller. 

My only really complaint is where they have their salsas located. I had to actually wait in a line so one person can get their salsa fill. It was next to the bar and servers going back and forth. Though the food is good and the salsas are great, I'm going to just go to El Gusano. Plus, it's not far from me :)
author: Vanessa S.

description: Freshly made chips, salsa and guac + signature margaritas + carnitas = a satisfied belly! A must try if you're in the area. Have not yet had a bad meal.
author: David B.

description: This place was lame. I work in the service industry and we came in with a larger party and they acted so flustered with our party. The said they wouldn't accept a party of our size and literally asked me if I has seen the layout of their restaurant as if I was asking the most ridiculous request. This was at 4:30pm. They said they could not accommodate us. I'm sorry, what? Then they said they could split up our party and seat us at 5pm and we would have to be out of the restaurant in and hour and change. We were taken in at 5pm and the place was EMPTY. We sat down with a split party and decided to leave. There were eye rolls when we came in and it was just awkward. I've never felt like this at a dining experience. Such a bummer. We went next door to Delacosa and they sat us immediately. So sorry to have interrupted this restaurant with a large family party. Seriously so bummed that people are so rude in this world. Will never return.
author: Katie G.

description:
Went here after the Fan Experience at Moscone due to the 4 star ratings.  Disappointed.  The food was just ok, but the Drinks were good, that is why this is 2 stars.  Ordered 2 dishes, Chicken Tacos and Grilled Shrimp plate.  Got the tacos quickly - seemed like there was tofu in it, maybe mushy chicken?  Took 25 minutes AFTER my dish came out to get the grilled shrimp. I think they forgot about it. The manager was hanging around our area, so you would think he would have noticed a missing dish.  Asked the manager after 15 minutes of waiting, took another 10 to get it. Only takes a few minutes to grill shrimp.  Right after the plate came out they closed the kitchen.  No apology or anything from the manager. 

Most bizarre thing, as  they were getting ready to close the kitchen - they roped off the dining area with people still in the area.  A lot of people were stepping over the rope, which was at least 3 feet high. Accident waiting to happen.  Had to get some silverware and water (all self-service) and went to open the rope, sorry not stepping over, the manager grabbed it and did it for me, not without commenting that I could make it over. Sorry not going to happen. It makes no sense to rope the area off as the kitchen was closed. Surprised no one has fallen.
author: Patty P.

description:
I'm obsessed with Tropisueno! Making a reservation before coming here is pretty much mandatory since the place is always packed. I've been on a Tuesday and a Wednesday, and both days were super packed despite being random weekdays.

I think what makes them stand out from the rest are their chips and salsa. Their chips are so thin and fresh, and the trio of salsas are all unique. Both times I've been here, we polished off one round of chips and salsa so quickly, it's quite embarrassing. I really like all of the salsas, but the warm orange one was very unique.  I've also had the margarita de la casa, and it was pretttty strong ;)

Both times I had the two item combination, and I've tried it with two enchiladas and one enchilada/ one taco, and the combinations come with rice, beans, and a little bit of salad. The food is really good and filling (or maybe the chips were so filling I didn't have room for my main entree!). I've also had the fried plantains with beans for appetizer, and they're very yummy.

Would I come back? YES! I want those chips/salsa!!!
author: Shrina S.

description:
The chips and dip may be the best part of the entire meal... 

There was a 30 minute wait when we got there, so we wandered around on empty stomachs, slightly tempted by the food in the food court across the street. When they finally texted us that our table was ready, we started eating the warm chips and three types of dip immediately.

We decided to get the guacamole and a vegetarian enchilada to split, and thank goodness we decided to split. 

The $7 guacamole was served in a smaaaall bowl without extra chips (by then we were down to pretty much all the broken pieces at the bottom). Well, I thought, if this was the best guacamole I've ever had, it might be worth it. It was only okay.

Then, the enchiladas came, two small rolls served with a huge heaping of rice and black beans. Taste-wise, they were pretty good. Not the most amazing Mexican I've ever had, but decent.

Overall: For the long wait, if you're not planning on getting any of the drinks, the food court across the street might be a better option.
author: Cecille Y.

description:
School buddy was in town for a medical conference & Tropisueno had been on my list for some time, so seemed like the perfect opportunity to catch up in a fun & delish atmosphere

Margaritas were tasty & those of the group who stuck w/ the "traditional" were pleased - Sis got a Mango Margarita & said it was too sicky-sweet.

All the food was brought out at the same time & we were hoping for the appies before the main course....but whatever

Plantains were sweet & breaded in some sort of crispy coating which made them even more delish

Empanadas were okay - filled w/ mushrooms & other veggies

Veggie Enchiladas & Veggie Tamales for the table as mains & there were many more accolades for the tamale over the enchilada - loved the soft mushed corn!

For dessert we got a Flan & a Tres Leche Cake to all share & both were delish however the Flan probably beat out the cake

That Flan was like a light custardy cheesecake & even though the table was more excited about the Tres Leche, after 1 taste of the flan, spoons were fighting over those precious bites......do yourselves a favor & just get both

Super loud in there & a huge crowd all around for Happy Hour & waiting on tables.  They won't seat you until your whole party arrives which I find pretty annoying - but we had a good time & would certainly come back
author: Adrienne G.

description: Seriously, love the shit out of this place!  The chorizo tostado is what I order everytime and have never been disappointed!  They have a great salsa bar with unlimited cilantro which also wins my heart everytime!  Go here, just not at noon- lunch hour.
author: Kristine P.

description: Very good Mexican food, quick service.. Large portions. Setup was a bit confusing at first but we got the hang of it.. Think Chipolte but with servers. Highly recommend if you want a great burrito or another one of their fine dishes.
author: Nicholas D.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. The ambience is intimate but alive. The food is full of flavor and the portions are pretty hearty. 

Empanadas and shrimp/rice dish are PERFECTION!
author: Marjan J.

description: My local friend took me to this taco place, cool deco and atmosphere. Always order carnitas for tacos, but she recommended me to try chile verde, and yeah it was pretty good as well! But didn't know that the regular taco was SO SMALL ($2.95 each), couldn't satisfy my needs at all , fortunately I still had chicken fajita as a side dish!!
author: Shin-chi C.

description: Amazinggggg food! Sort of strict with all their rules but if you can get past it, it's so good!
author: Aryan R.

description:
Food is okay.
Service is good
The shrimp and fish Ceviche are good
The other stuff is just okay
The atmosphere are vibrant. The restaurant is very noisy and full of young people so not a place to have a calm or romantic dinner.
author: Ritawa R.

description:
Me and my husband were out spending the day in Sf. Had a very pleasant day so far, shopping and walking around the city. We got hungry so decided to go eat somewhere. We're not from Sf so don't know the restaurants very well. We passed by this "Mexican" restaurant (Tropisueño) it didn't look like what we're used to. Being Mexican ourselves, we might've prejudged, because we have been to places in the city where it's mostly just ambiance and the food ain't that great. We kept looking for somewhere else to eat but we didn't see anything tht looked good near by so we decided to go back to Tropisueño and give it a try, we were starving at this point. 
When we arrived the host looked at us with a blank stare, we asked for a table for two, he said something along the lines of it was lunch style taqueria hour, don't really remember exactly. But basically we had to go order and seat ourselves. Tht wasn't a problem. We ordered our food, paid $24 for 3 tacos a tamale and an enchilada with rice and beans on the side. It was reasonable not too overpriced for sf prices. As we proceeded to seat ourselves we tried sitting in an area where it was 90% empty, so many tables available. This guy that worked there stepped up to us and started dancing to the music that was playing, waving his hands side to side, I guess trying to say that we couldn't sit there. Didn't say a word, didn't tell us why we couldn't. I don't understand why he couldn't just say sorry this is for reservations only, because that's what we assumed since he couldn't communicate like a normal respectful person. We were getting sketchy vibes from this place already, the staff was just looking at us in a weird way. But we decided to get drinks while we waited for our food, we went up to the bar and my husband asked what kind of beer they served, the bartender answered in a very rude way "Mexican beer" with this rude ass look on his face. It was very weird because we seen all the staff being extra friendly to all the Caucasian customers but to us they were very rude and giving us the side eye. I Don't know but it was very uncomfortable and the food wasn't that great, mediocre at best. DONT Recommend this place to anyone unless Your white and don't want real Mexican food.
author: Mina O.

description: JUANA attitude and customer service is HORRIBLE !! i literally wanted to get a refund but i've been coming here for quite some time .. she's the only person i've ever had a problem w/ , the rest of the staff are real friendly .. you can tell she doesn't enjoy her job based off her entire demeanor ... im so disgusted , i order from this place for my company ALL THE TIME !! and even if i didn't, every customer should feel APPRECIATED and as a loyal customer its even worse
author: Brit B.

description: Service was excellent, kind and attentive despite being busy. Atmosphere was a fun, old school Mexican restaurant vibe. Mole for the win and if you are looking for a nonalcoholic drink... ask for a pineapple juice/Soda water type drink--- whatever the bartender made was fantastic!
author: J K.

description:
Wow. So glad we went here! Love the free chips and salsa that is provided at the beginning. The salsa verde was SOOO good. Be careful of the orange one! It was pretty spicy. 

We got the Chicken Mole and the Tampiqueno and then I ordered the House Margarita.  I was pretty hungry and the first things that came out were the Margarita and the chips. It was my first time getting a margarita so I definitely did not expect it to be as strong as it was! It tasted good, but felt a little silly by the time our food came. Pace yourself with it!

The Chicken Mole was so good. Tender bone-in chicken covered in mole. Came with beans, rice and pickled cabbage. All together, this dish was sooo good with or without a tortilla wrap. 

The Tampiqueno had SUCH tender carne asada! I took one bite of this and paused with glistening eyes! SO good. It comes with refried beans and an enchilada, which I don't think I tried. Looked good though!

Overall, really good food. I think this has to be the one of the nicest Mexican places that I've been to. The flavors were not BAM in your face, but everything was cooked so well and paired up perfectly together. Will be back if I'm in the area! 

*Note* Went on a Saturday night and it was ROARING loud in there! Not a place to go to if you're trying to get to know someone new, but if you're looking for a chill place to hang with friends and have good food, I recommend!
author: Shasta L.

description: Love their chicken mole. Love their shrimp ceviche and shrimp appetizer with garlic. Chips and salsa yummy too. Lots of reasons to go every other week or so.
author: Natasha M.

description: Warning: tourist trap. I actually really like the service here, and I admit, you can find way better Mexican food in the Mission, but this is a fun place! This place is chic and very modern. I suggest for people to come with a small party and sit at the bar. The bartender is super attentive and he can recommend some great tasting tequila as well!
author: Minette C.

description:
I came here years ago and thought it was ok. I didn't think it was anything extraordinary, especially being a short BART ride away from the real deal in the Mission. 
Tried it again today after remembering I had seen it on Check Please with someone raving about the Mole. 
So, naturally, I tried the Mole. It was on point and tasted quite good. The meal was huge which was a plus. I liked their salsa bar, which had about 8 salsas. The ones I tried were great.
I still think this place is good but not necessarily amazing. We came in right before they opened for dinner service and most of the restaurant became roped off from the public. We had just gotten a table before they roped it off so I was climbing over the rope on my trips back to the salsa bar and to get chips, which weren't offered to me until I realized I didn't get any when I sat down. So, I guess the concept is order your own food taqueria style during the day and then table service for dinner. That's fine but it's a liability risk to have people climbing over roped off sections. Just a matter of time before someone trips or falls and sues. 
Aside from that my food was definitely good enough to merit a return visit. Also, when they were clearing my table one of the bus boys cheerfully ran up to me and gave me my iPhone, which I had dumbly left on the table. Huge bonus for that. He didn't have to do that, and I've had my iPhone stolen from restaurants in similar situations. So, you'd think honesty could be expected but that usually falls under the "in a perfect world" category, so today was a nice treat. 
Looking forward to returning to Tropisueno.
author: Matt H.

description:
Good Food.
Enjoyed the three choices of salsa.  The Chile Verde was excellent, with a large portion of meat which was tender.
author: K M.

description: What a lovely surprise to stumble upon on our trip to San Fran. The wait staff is incredible, gracious, kind and very accommodating. The food is authentic and beautifully executed. They were very open to accommodating our friend who has Celiac disease. Highly recommend this charming restaurant.
author: elizabeth m.

description:
Ok after three tries, I officially hate this overrated place. 
If it was a guy, it would definitely want to suck its own d*ck. 

First visit: ok experience for Happy Hour. 
PACKED! Food was decent, service slow. 

Second visit: went with a group of girlfriends for lunch. We got there by noon and missed the usually obnoxiously long line. I ordered the enchiladas and guac/chips. Both were fine, B/B+. 
Service? Horrible. First the women who took our order at the register looked like she was one step away from diving off the Golden Gate Bridge. Ok, it's a shit job, I get it. 
Then at lunch while salting my meal, the entire salt shaker emptied on my meal. Perfect. 
Several minutes to wave over a server. Did I get an apology? Nope. In fact he was super rude and demanded my receipt for my lunch. Wtf. I was pissed but handed it over. 
Yes, you're right I didn't pay for my lunch. 
I stood in line and then hopped the counter and jacked some shit. Idiot. 

Third and final visit: raced over to make it there by noon. Phew! Got a spot! Eyeballed the long line of suckers w smug glee. 
Finally get the bartender's attention. Ordered a Michelada and a menu. 
Bartender" I can serve you booze but you
have to stand in line for food"
Me: "You're kidding, that's ridiculous"
Him: "Yup."
Packed up and left. 


Let people make lunch reservations!
author: Amy P.

description: Good tacos, good service with friendly staff. Comp chips and condiments. Nice relaxing ambiance. Will definitely come back! Highly recommend.
author: Vanessa E.

description:
Great happy hour!! Food AND drinks! The margaritas were strong and their food prices for happy hour are very reasonable - guac for only $3 and many other small plates for under $6.  It's just difficult to find a place to sit (they don't open up the dining room until after HH for dinner).  Happy hour runs 4-6.  

I've also been for lunch.  It's set up cafeteria style, you order and then they give you a number and bring the food to you.  It was pretty crazy right at noon, probably waited about 10-15 minutes in the food line but the food came quickly.  And it was delicious!  I had the super burrito with shrimp. Yum yum!
author: Hannah C. R.

description: Fantastic lively atmosphere and good food!  Chips and salsa, enchiladas and quesadillas were my favorites.  We had a reservation for 7:00pm, we walked in at 7:00 and were seated immediately, now that's what reservations are for!
author: Quendrida W.

description: Tropisueno is pretty good, not amazing. I've been here a few times and was mildly disappointed with the experience. There's definitely better Mexican food elsewhere in SF! It's also super crowded, but if you make a reservation I think it would be great for groups. So for a casual group happy hour in FiDi, sure, why not. But for the best Mexican food in SF? Go to the Mission.
author: Lee A.

description:
Living on the East Coast, good Mexican food is hard to find. Unfortunately I didn't love my dining experience here although I didn't hate it either. 

Chips and salsas were tasty but I found my margarita and food to be average. Seating was very tight and restaurant is loud. Prices were typical for a city restaurant - 2 drinks and 2 entrees came to $65 total with tax and tip. 

Not sorry I went but I probably wouldn't go back in the near future.
author: Kim G.

description:
My new favorite Mexican food in SF.  Located in a fun area of SoMa, it's a very attractive place with an elegant atmosphere.

The complimentary chips were hot and accompanied by three fantastic salsas, including one house specialty made with adobo chiles that was spicy and so good I begged the waitress for the recipe.

Though the were not on the menu, I ordered mole enchiladas which were simply delicious, as were the rice and beans they came with.  There was so much food I could not finish it, and I'm a big guy who eats a lot.

The service was gracious and friendly.

I've been recommending this place like crazy and I plan on returning before my business trip to SF is completed.  Well done, Tropisueno, you've made me a fan.
author: Ray I.

description:
Yum! Walking around Yerba Buena in the early evening hours with work colleagues we hit Yelp to find some decent Mexican food in the area. Saw the amount of reviews on Topisqueño and decided to go to for it. And we didn't regret it.

The place is well located, busy but moves quick. Good is pretty authentic and tasty. Lots of options and really great service.

They serve nice margaritas (careful if you're not into very sweet drinks). The hot sauce is hot and good, the atmosphere is nice too. All in all, prices and value are decent (margaritas go for $10-12 each, plates of food run from $14.95 to $19.95). They serve free chips with 3 types of salsa - mild, medium and very spicy. 

You won't go wrong with this choice. Enjoy.
author: Morenita C.

description: My first time here I wasn't too impressed but decided to come back and give it a second try! I order the veggie enchiladas, they were delicious! They were severed with a cabbage slaw which was tangy and flavorful! The margaritas are pretty strong! I love that they serve 3 different salsas with chips at the beginning one of them is pretty spicy!! There's not very many good Mexican restaurants in soma/financial so this is a great option !
author: Hetal P.

description: Very good Mexican food, with a fast-foodish lunch operation. Rick Bayless shouldn't be scared, but it's better than Chipotle.
author: Mike D.

description: My review is for hosting a private party at this venue for a corporate customer appreciation cocktail party during a convention. First, you can't beat the location and convenience if you're at Moscone Center for a tradeshow. Second, the manager (James) and his staff are really great to work with. Very attentive, worked with me on every detail (I'm an event planner, so I asked 1000 questions) and on the night of, the staff was so polite and helpful and helped add to the good time. We came up with two "signature drinks" the same colors as products we were launching. We did a "buyout" for the evening which included open bar and unlimited food for up to 400 people from 5-9pm. The rate I got per person was fantastic for the size of the event and location.  I would say that maybe 100-200 could fit in there at a time, so we had a flow of people through the evening. We moved tables around and set it up for more of a cocktail party, not a sit and serve dinner. They let me put company banners up, branded tent cards and used our company napkins and coasters so our event had a great Branded feel. Everyone ordered at the bar for drinks and could help themselves at the Taco bar all through the night. It is loud and gets a little cramped (bottle neck by the bar into restaurant area). But for the vibe we were going for "A fun, lively, cocktail party" it was perfect. People still talk about this party and how it was the best we've thrown. OH and the FOOD is Delicious of course.
author: Emily I.

description:
Overrated and expensive. Apparently they have a great lunch time deal but for dinner, I found Tropisueno totally not worth the price.

I made a reservation for 5:30 as I knew that Happy Hour lasted til 6 and that they had a great outdoor patio. Upon arriving, I was informed that with a reservation I wasn't allowed to sit outside as outside was only for happy hour and happy hour was over. Thankfully I had done my research and so knew better than to let her outsmart me. "No your happy hour goes for 30 more minutes. Please sit me outside." "Well our last call is in 15 minutes and our reservations are for inside only." I'm sorry but what a dumb policy! Walk-ins get the prime outdoor seats while those with reservations are punished for thinking ahead?? And if your website says happy hour goes til 6, don't be cheap and turn people away 30 minutes before that. This totally left a sour taste in my mouth and if I wasn't waiting for someone to meet me here, I would have left right away.

This isn't to say their indoor seating is bad. It's actually quite charming and has a great ambiance. But on one of the hottest days of the year, outdoors is obviously preferable. Especially when they continued to seat people outside even after 6.  Hostess, you are a house full of lies.

Our waiter was slow, but super friendly and helpful in ensuring we ordered the right drinks and food. Drinks were delicious and he even offered to provide me with more agave since I had mentioned I prefer sweet drinks. Thumbs up for the wait staff!

Food-wise, I've definitely experienced better. Chips were lame and guacamole was unmemorable. My chicken enchiladas were good, but nothing special. For an $80 bill for two people, I expect more.

Overall, fun ambiance, meh overpriced food, and horrible hostess + happy hour policy. I'd be willing to try them for lunch, but would never return for dinner.
author: Rachel L.

description: Came to this place with a group of 6. I would definitely get a reservation because it gets really crowded. I tried the Carnitas Enchilada and the Chicken Tamale. The portion was HUGE and it was really tasty. I also got the Duende margarita which was great.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Wow, what a treat!  We were able to get a table without waiting and enjoyed a delicious meal.  The shrimp I ordered were delicious and so was the margarita.  The wait staff were attentive and happy to make recommendations.  Outside patio seating was perfect.
author: Kris L.

description: I came here last week for dinner with a group of friends. Luckily we had a reservation because it was super busy! We started with a few margaritas and chips and salsa, both were great but we really enjoyed the drinks. I had the Enchiladas de Nopales with chicken and loved them, I really want to come back just to have them again! There were a lot of other things on the menu that I can't wait to try as well.  I  also really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant it was very fun. We definitely had a great time and I can't wait to go back!
author: Jenna H.

description:
I only rate the food...if you don't have good food go some place that does. If you are looking for a place for a good burrito this is not your place. I had the pastor burrito and my buddy had the carne asada burrito, neither of us were impressed. The key is in the meat and neither were very flavorful. If they are going to market this place as a taqueria style place they need to  get the basics right. Try you own meat and try harder!

pros: chips,salsa,bar
author: Nick R.

description: I used to love coming here for my much needed mole and margarita fix (it was serious) at least 1x per month. Today, I was hoping for the same experience, and the margaritas were watered down, and the mole was bland and flavorless. My friend's enchilada was freezing cold. So uncharacteristic and so disappointing. I doubt I'll return.  I need to find another spot to satisfy my cravings.  I'm taking suggestions...
author: Rebecca K.

description: Great place if you're in the mood for some good Mexican food and drinks. I was here for a conference and stayed at the Marriott Marquis. This place is somewhat hidden just behind the hotel, and is a jewel. Very friendly staff, and great food! Will surely come again when in the area.
author: Antone C.

description:
Great shredded beef tacos. 
Tastes salsa
Helpful staff
author: Morgan C.

description: Great and fast! No wonder there is a huge line outside. I got a veggie enchilada combo platter with black beans. The enchilada was good and spicy. I think it had jalapeños in the veggie mixture. The black beans were topped with crumbly white cheese, which was a nice touch. It also came with a small slice of avocado. Someone brought delicious, homemade chips over to our table as well. There were plenty of places to sit inside even though it was crowded.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Found this little treasure while yelping. Great, authentic fare!!  Scallop appetizer was ridiculous. Mole sauce is off the hook!  Eliseo (our server) picked our entire meal and totally hit a home run. Ambiance is adorable.
author: Liz P.

description: My friend suggested we try this place since she has only been here for lunch (which is a different menu from dinner per my friend).  Great pick!! We did not make reservations (which I suggest guests should make because it gets crowded) but walked-in (at 5:30pm) and got a table immediately though we just had to be done in one hour and half due reservations in place (reasonably enough).  The hosts were very friendly and accommodating-- working with us on getting us a seating.  We got our trio salsas dips which were all yummo with a generous bowl of tortilla chips which is bottomless. I ordered their signature margarita which was totally worth the order.  I also ordered their house favorite, the Chile Verde which was so tasty!! The service was fantastic--warm and attentive. I could not finished my entree and they packed it so nicely in a reusable plastic bag which I appreciated especially because it was a rainy night. I would definitely return here and try their happy hour next time.
author: N L.

description:
Yummy Ceviche ! Remy makes The Best Micheladas and I love the chips and the salsa bar!  My favorites are the orange salsa and the green one.  I usually get the tostada, or sometimes the burrito.  I ask for no lettuce and sour cream in my burrito.  One burrito is two meals, its so big!  Sometimes a friend and I will split one! 
They have a happy hour that starts at 4pm during the week!
author: Lily S.

description:
Hungry, and wanting to explore the area around my hotel, I found this joint on the Yelp app.  Since I didn't have any reservations and was dining alone, I saddled up to an empty seat at the bar and settled in for a meal and some drinks.  

The bartender immediately gave me a menu and some complimentary Chips & Salsa. They offer a dish of 3 different flavors of Salsa with the Chips.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tropisue%C3%B1o-san-francisco-3?select=38y6nkNhwpJz_fQfoH8zeg#38y6nkNhwpJz_fQfoH8zeg
The flavors are Chipotle, Salsa Verde, and Habanero.....you can probably guess that the 3rd one is pretty hot....just how I like it! :)

After browsing the menu, I decided to get the Tampiqueno (Thin cut Carne Asada with a side of Beef Barbacoa Enchilada & Guacamole), $15.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tropisue%C3%B1o-san-francisco-3?select=1ZFKptdUNB2gdUsHLzSdQw#1ZFKptdUNB2gdUsHLzSdQw
The Carne Asada was very tasty...and cooked perfectly so that it was tender and juicy.  I was curious how the Beef Barbacoa Enchilada would turn out....and it surprised me with it's flavorful taste.

I washed it down with a Dos XX and was stuffed by the end of the meal.  

By the time I left, the place was jam packed with people and people who were waiting in the bar for a table were reaching over my shoulder ordering drinks, etc....I don't recommend dining at the bar unless you have to....it was kind of annoying, but to be expected.

Return Factor - 85%
author: J D.

description:
I've read about the potentially slow food service so I made reservations at 5:30pm for myself and some friends.

The decor was warm, welcoming and classy. It was busy but didn't feel crowded.

We were seated right away and chips came almost instantly. The chips and the salsas they came with were great--definitely not from a bag/jar.

Our food came at a decent time--not suspiciously quick but not noticeably late. I ordered a combo plate with a chicken (I forget what it was called...it was the spicy shredded chicken though) taco and a chicken tamale. The food was DELICIOUS. It had the perfect amount of flavor (not bland like many ethnic food places in the states) but not overwhelming.

Service was friendly but not in your face.

My mouth is drooling just thinking about the meal I had and I'll be sure to stop by Tropisueño whenever I return to SF!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Excellent Mex! Delicious and colorful. Lots of gluten free options.  Friendly and great service!
Easy parking at mission garage too
author: Susan O.

description: What a nice find!  We went for dinner one night and lunch the very next day.  For dinner, we had the chili rellenos, enchiladas and carne asada steak.  The beans could have used more salt and the rice could have been fluffier, but overall the food was really good.  While we were told there would be a 45 minute wait for our table (you give your cell number to the host/hostess and they text you when your table is ready), the time went really fast because the weather was excellent and we got to sit outside enjoying some great margaritas.  Also, the service was excellent that evening (2/13/15 dinner service, female waitress - forget her name).  For lunch, the next day, we ordered the chili rellenos again, a carnitas taco and a torta.  Aside from the same comments about the beans and rice, the rest of the meal was delicious.  Lunch is more self service - you wait in line and order, pay, get a number and find a table.  For dinner and lunch, we were served chips and salsa.  The chips are crispy and salty (yum) and there are 3 different types of salsas.  All of them are good.  I was happy to have found this place.  I am a fan, and I will return.
author: Theresa C.

description:
They start you off with complimentary variety of salsa's and chips. The food menu is nothing too crazy. The portions are big and easily shareable.

Got the vegetarian enchilada's which were good, and also got the tostadito's with chicken, which were ok. 

Our server wasn't as attentive as we'd like, we always had to look around the room for him and call him over when we needed something. The tables are pretty small..esp when you have 4 people in a booth style table. It was hard to put all of our plates and drinks on the table without being too clustered.
author: Payal P.

description: Usually great food. BUT today there was terrible customer service. Also their chip machine broke and there were no chips and salsa. I'm SHOOK. And the waiter didn't even apologize as if not having chips and salsa at a Mexican restaurant is normal. Also, we sat at our table for 10 minutes and were ignored. The waiters and hostess were really rude and unaccommodating. Will probably come back for the food but the employees highkey are mean.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Only place I have ever been where the staff is faster than you are! Went to ask for more chips and they were already bringing me some. The salsa bar is pretty awesome as well.
author: K A.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant in the city to take my out of town friends too! Their wide selection of tequila and cocktails pair wonderfully with their entrees. I also love how easy it is to make a reservation and I've never been disappointed!
author: Nimisa P.

description: Chips and salsa were great but this place is extremely overpriced.  $8 for guac that is the size of a baseball.  My plantains were rancid and the empanadas were more dough/mesa than anything and the inside was mushy.  Don't go here if you're vegetarian because there is only one dish that's vegetarian and then the other two appetizers I just wrote about.
author: Imabrowngirl B.

description: The food arrived late (took about an hour and a half). And when it did the portions were nowhere sufficient. Wouldn't recommend this place over other amazing places in downtown sfo.
author: Lakshmi Lavanya S.

description:
Tropisueno - you're tropibueno. 

I loved being able to walk in - ask for a burrito and say - you choose. (I know! I had just made way too many decisions already that day and wanted someone else to make one for me and wanted 'comfort food'.) The outcome was fabulous. Delicious pork, tender, great flavor. It was a fantastic first experience. Will definitely return.
author: Sheryl F.

description:
1st Time diner - party of 4 on a Tuesday night at 5:30

I have to separate my rating:

Ambiance- 4-5 Stars. very lively and happening
Food- 4 star My Mahi mahi was good, I would get it again. Carne Asada dish ordered by others looked good as well.
Service - 3-4  Star. We had to wait probably 10 minutes to be seated even though there were empty tables.  It also took a fair time for server to take our order. After that, service was fine.
Price: Price point for food and ambiance very good.  

Other: Unfortunately, we got a bowl of chips that at the bottom there were 2 charred pieces of something and more disturbing was a piece of lettuce that did not look fresh. If not for this, I probably would have given overall rating 4 stars. In spite of this, i would probably try this place again.
author: Martin F.

description: Came here for dinner last week. Food was good, service was just OK. Just checked my credit card statement that this restaurant charged more than what was authorized. I called and left a message to the manager. I'm hoping this can get resolve soon. People.. please save your receipt and check your credit card statement.
author: Ind B.

description:
Carnitas taco:  Lots of meat, decent tasting.  Pastor Enchilada:  Nice pineapple chunks with tasty meat and enchilada sauce.  The highlight was the chips and salsas.  The chips are super thin like Chevy's "crack" chips!  Arguably, they're better than Chevy's chips because they are more corn-y.  No pun intended.

Based on the above, sounds like a 3 star place at least, right?  Yup, but if you factor in the awkward service, only 2 stars.  When my friend asked to substitute the rice and beans for a simple green salad, he said they couldn't make that substitution.  Then, when I ordered, he told me I could substitute the rice and beans with steamed veggies.  Not sure why he didn't offer that as an option to my friend that actually wanted to eat green stuff, I mean vegetables.

After ordering, they tried to give our order to the table next to us, even though it was obvious that they hadn't even ordered yet; they were still looking at the menus in front of them.  Then, a few minutes after we got our food, they started asking if we were done and trying to clear off our table, even though we obviously hadn't finished; more than half of our food was still on the plate.  I felt like they were trying to rush us out the door.

Anyway, mediocre food plus awkward service equals me not coming again.
author: Christina L.

description: My friend and I walked in a few minutes before our reservation and were seated right away by a friendly hostess. We both ordered the house margarita, which was delicious but unfortunately pretty iced down considered the $10 price tag. I ordered the favorites plate with one enchilada and one taco. The food was good and the portions were really large. The restaurant is clean and in a great location, however, it was super loud the whole time. We were practically yelling at one another the whole meal. Other than the noise, our meal and drinks were yummy and I will come back again for margaritas, hopefully, next time with more margarita and less ice!
author: Laura C.

description: Food was great , people were so nice and the waitress Cayla was a hoot  The flautas were great and the ambience of the place was okay though ! There was a long queue on a Friday night, but what do you expect !
author: Mak T.

description:
Chips and three salsas are served and the guacamole is great as well. The orange salsa is spicy and serious bomb-dot-com status.

For dinner, we got the Tampiqueño steak and enchilada plate and the Camarones Tropisueño which is a shrimp plate with spicy orange salsa. Both come with rice and beans and are all at just the right temperature. The steak was nice and medium rare. A little tough to cut  the rare parts but very easy to eat as the flavors popped out. The shrimp was dressed in a similar salsa as the orange chips salsa which was spicy and-- as previously stated-- bomb dot com.

There was a 25-minute wait and we were about to go somewhere else but I'm so glad we stayed.

Tropisueno offers really good plated Mexican dishes with flavors that jump out.
author: Jerry Y.

description: The food here was very good and the Guacamole dip was delicious. The service here was really fast. We ordered and the food came out in no time at all. Try the house Margarita and the spicy Mango Margarita, both were good. It can get very loud in here, so if your looking for a quiet, romantic dinner, this is not for you. We didn't mind the Music. It was to our looking.
author: Tj L.

description: Love love love! I loved everything. This is a authentic Mexican restaurant, that has excellent food. Even though they are super busy, the line moves fast and you get your delicious food right away! The employees, especially waiters working the table are incredibly sweet. First time here & will most likely always come back when in SF. Can't wait to recommend to others!
author: Pavnit K.

description:
Price: I get that it's SF and in the city so prices are a bit higher. For that reason I think we got decent food for the money. Ends up being around $20 per person. If it were anywhere else, I don't think I got my money's worth for three tacos at $15. 

Quality: Had the carne asada, chicken tings, and al pastor tacos. All pretty solid, come with rice and choice of beans. Portions are average. The tortillas I felt were too flour-y perhaps and overtook the flavor of the other ingredients. 

Service: Had a reservation here and the staff was very kind about giving us some extra time for the rest of the group to arrive, and not giving up our table. Our server however seemed to rush us out, and cleared our plates even though we were taking our time to finish the food. We felt pressured to finish up and leave. Our group was there for about an hour or less. 

Overall, just felt like an average experience and nothing really stood out. Wouldn't mind coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way either.
author: Chris H.

description:
This review is for lunch ( 5) AND dinner (3).

This place has amazing authentic delicious Mexican food, so why the two stars? well that comes because of the dinner but we will get to that, lets first talk about lunch.

Lunch is affordable, and very good.  You walk into the restaurant to a menu, place your order, receive a number, take a seat and receive your food promptly. 
Since there was less interaction with the staff, initially I did not think too much of the service as being "bad".  I had a chicken quesadilla for $6!!! in this district that is a steal.

Thinking this was amazing I decided to come back for dinner thinking that the set up was the same, it wasn't.  The people might be better?, it wasn't.  The food still held its high quality.

Dinner was a No-No for me.  First of all the menu is completely different and something I was NOT accustomed to.  I ended up ordering the mahi-mahi and huranches? not too sure but both dishes were very appetizing and pleasing, it was very flavorful, and the pork was practically melt in your melt quality.

The PROBLEM? the service. 

The Hostess who is suppose to greet people at the door is instead flirting with the customers drinking at the bar. Come on honey, your job is to greet the front door, not trying to get dates with those at the bar.

The waiters and waitresses seem confused on their tables and never even so much as smile when they serve.  The waitresses in particular are very rude, when I asked a simple question of if I could order, she condescendingly told me to wait for my own waiter, there is a nicer way to talk to people ( you B*$&$).

I would give this place a 2 but when the bill came out, I received the wrong amount of change, it was 10 cents short, but hey if you can short me on that, there is no telling what else you can short me on. what you can't do math, while you stand there and talk to your buddies while I wait for my hard earn money change...no thank you, I won't be returning.

The food here is amazing, but the service is horrible, retrain or rehire your horrible staff, I will be telling my friends to STAY AWAY.
author: Steph Q.

description: Chips, drinks and salsa are great. The tortillas are processed, which means they had no flavor. Left a lot to be desired.
author: Neil R.

description: The food is great, but most of all the chips and dips are the best we ever ate! Even on a weekday we needed to come back after half an hour, which was okay, but so I would  recommend making reservations.
author: Annelies B.

description:
What can I say? Since the last time we visited one year ago, this year we went here two days in a row while we were in SF for 3 days. It's just great food with amazing specialty cocktails. Service is awesome since servers are very accomodating. They are always busy but they try really hard to get you a seat either at the bar or dining tables. Drinks are GREAT and bartenders are fun and creative.

We decided to have my sister's graduation dinner here and they were able to snag us a 10 person table overnight. Shout out to our half-persian server Majid! He hooked us up with fab drinks and great recommendations. 

A few dishes to try:
Ceviche- get all three
Chicken Mole
Tamales (BEST I HAVE HAD)
Shredded pork (can't remember the name, just ask)

Will always go back, will always recommend. Love.
author: Shar A.

description: The food was pretty decent, but that was the strongest point. Messed up the order twice, overly crowded. Had a very "conveyor belt" feel. The michelada was pretty good, the green sauce and red sauces were both meh. The chile relleno was fine. The tamale was bad.
author: Andrew T.

description: Delicious chips and three different kinds of salsa. Definitely the cops were the best part of the meal. The food was ok but nothing special. The al pastor was smoky and sweet with chunks of pineapple but nothing like The real thing. The place was so loud it was impossible to hold a conversation.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
I'm wondering if there's another 'Tropisueno' or if I was in the wrong one. I don't understand the high reviews, maybe it's en su suenos but this wasn't happening for me. 

Long 45 minute wait, fine. 3.5 star Sangria's, but they were small. 1 star  for the bathroom situation because there was just one bathroom for each member of respective sex. Trash was overflowing and wasn't maintained. 

The chips were good, the salsa was fine. I liked the green and the red salsa but that creamy one was just something odd. 

I got the Chile Verde, my beans (peruano) were not cooked, every other bean was underdone, peruano's are known to be very smooth and creamy, they weren't salted either. My Chile Verde was so fatty, that I removed about 1/3 of the portion. The rice was dry, chewy like it was sitting in the bottom of a hot water pan for a bit and overdone with cumin. My husband's mole was dry as well, it looked iike it was under a lamp dying on the line because the sauce had a skin on it when it was served. 

Service was slow and somewhat inattentive. Once the order was taken, we only saw our server once, and that was because we had to flag him down, we even had to go the front to pay our bill. 

I've been wanting to try this place every time I come to the city, glad I did but with so many choices out here, I wont be coming back.
author: Elle M.

description: Excellent food! Great service came here for a friends birthday party and had a great time. It was my 1st time eating here during their dinner menu hours and it is a very nice atmosphere. I've been here for lunch in the past which is great but much more casual. Their Margaritas weren't too sweet which a huge plus +!
author: Teresa V.

description: Blink and you'll miss it Mexican restaurant in the Yerba Buena Square area, the next store up from Beard Papa's, and near Press Club. The place does not have it's name on the marquee on top of the restaurant; it's only written on the front window, so just look for the yellow sign on top that says "Mexican Kitchen" and that's it. I actually like this place better for drinks than Press Club...although most are tequila-centric, there's a brandy one with egg white (they actually have a whole set of egg white cocktails, which is pretty unique for a Mexican joint) that is pretty tasty. We were running late (parking is a little tough; we got one down near Mission and Third, which is about a 5-7 minute walk to the venue) and couldn't find the place, but the staff was still able to accommodate us and get us our table, which was great. Definitely make reservations in advance; you can't really modify them online once you're about 2 hours out; and when you call their phone number you get a recording to use their website for all reservations, inquiries, etc. You have to keep calling until you get a recording to press "1" to speak to a live person for assistance. I tried about three times before getting a hold of someone, so something to look out for (and maybe for the restaurant to improve on...they technically open for dinner around 5:30, but I called slightly before that and had to wait awhile before getting a staff member, although the restaurant is open at that time). The food is quite good; the guacamole can be skipped, as it's kind of bland (it's jazzed up slightly by mixing it with the spicy dip they offer you with the complimentary AYCE chips. You actually get three dipping sauces, each one of varying spice). The ceviche was fresh and I liked the mangoes inside. My main course was the "old school combo plate", a chicken tamale and carne asada enchilada. Beef on the enchilada was seasoned well, although I wish you got more of the Mexican rice with it, that rice is boss. The pork tamale my girlfriend got was definitely better than the chicken tamale I ordered. The crab enchilada, the special, was good, just different. Probably wouldn't be in a huge rush to get it again. Beers (Presidente, Modelo, and Pacifico on draft only) will run you $5. The service is a little spotty; I think you can flag down anyone for help, but it's so busy on a Saturday night, you may have to wait a bit. There's a TV at the front with a full bar, and the bathrooms have a really cool matador poster inside...it's possible you will have to wait awhile though; only one toilet per bathroom. Overall, if I'm in the area for Happy Hour, I'd probably make a left turn and hit this place over some of the other establishments in the plaza.
author: Dan M.

description: For just a few dollars more than Chipotle you get a much bigger, higher quality burrito. The pork and pineapple meat (al pastor) is incredible and the margaritas / mexi cokes are a great addition. Chips are usually free and they let dogs on the patio.
author: Brandon N.

description:
Presidential.

There were mixed emotions upon learning our president was leaving. Excited for his deserved next chapter but at the same time will miss him as a leader and mentor.

Clearly he could not leave without us going on a lunch adventure.

Few options were suggested and this one sounded the best. Walking up was a bit worried with the long line out the door. Goes to show the enduring popularity.

But inside was an efficient operation. After ordering at the counter grab one of the surprisingly numerous open tables. Food is delivered shortly thereafter.

Delicious grilled shrimp, lettuce, tomato and extra black beans in a spinach tortilla didn't last long. Perfect balance of substance and a juicy utensil required mess.

Cheese and rice come standard too.

Across the table my soon to be former president was taking great pleasure making his tacos soon to be gone.

Bill was around $20 for the pair which seemed reasonable considering the quality, portion size, great staff and table service. Plus the special company.

Returned the next morning to try their new breakfast options. Cup of lowfat Greek yogurt, strawberry slices and large, sweet chunks of granola was a tasty $4.50 treat.

President Obama, you know how to reach me.
author: Jason B.

description:
Amazing drinks!
Variety of cocktail is great,  beautiful settling
Salsa simply delicious
author: Gg N.

description:
I hate reviews like this, where I came to Tropisueno in hopes that it would be amazing, but I left disappointed. I actually took some time to figure out exactly what to say and where Tropisueno went wrong.

First off, the service. We waited for a very long time, and each time we very politely asked how much longer it would be, the man at the front very rudely told us it would be another 45 minutes. He originally told us 45 minutes total, but we ended up waiting almost two hours, which would have been fine if the man hadn't been extremely rude every time we went to inquire how much longer it would be. When it finally was our turn, the man didn't even call our name, and when we asked why, he replied, "Well, I figured you would just be up here again in a few minutes, so I didn't even bother." Maybe it was sarcasm. 

But onto the food. I ordered a combo plate with a carne asada enchilada and a taquito sort of thing. Don't get the taquito. The carne asada was really, really tasty. Get multiple enchiladas. They are so good!

I was left with a bad taste in my mouth, however, because of the bad service we received at the beginning. Our waiter wasn't extraordinary, and the lighting in the restaurant was so dark that we couldn't even see our menus.

I won't be back to Tropisueno, despite how tasty the carne asada was.
author: Christina S.

description: So bomb. Probably the best salsa bar in SF. Thin crispy chips are free with all food purchases. Amazing burritos. I love this place for the Carne Asada, its not chewy, always tender. Prompt service and fair prices. Best mexican burrito taco spot in downtown.
author: Adam M.

description:
Okay, maybe this was just me, but is this weird? we had a reservation for 5:30, arrived at 5:26 and the waitress said that we could be seated in four minutes. So we were seated 5:30 on the dot, even when there were about 15 tables open. Do they not open up for dinner until then...? 

Anyway.... 


Chips & salsa and drinks are amazing - rest of the food is bland.  Probably a better happy hour place than a dinner place??
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
Very tightly packed, crowded, and (at least after sunset) dark.  More a place for social chatter than to relax over your food.

Chicken mole was quite generous: two leg-thigh pieces, with all the bones and skin, but the sharp knives made it easy to cut.  The accompanying rice was delicious, but I found the mole sauce more bitter and less full of complex notes than I'd prefer.

Chips came with three flavors of salsa, all of them weird.

The front desk staff was amazingly efficient in juggling a large number of walk-ins.  Table service was very friendly, though I did have to ask three times for water before someone brought it.

This would get a higher rating if the decor/atmosphere were more to my taste, and the menu selection broader.
author: David B.

description:
One of the few lunch spots in SoMa where a person could score lunch for under $10! Build-you-own taco bar (lunch only, folks!) where a super taco or shrimp taco runs about $3.95, not too shabby. One of each, a Jarritos and tip costs $12. This also includes complimentary water and chips. 

Tacos are large, two will feed a relatively hungry person. Just don't wait until you're "hangry" or the line to order might kill you.
author: Abby S.

description:
Aye aYe AyE! I had no idea this swanky cantina transforms into a Chipotle-style assembly line taqueria during lunch time. This is a great way to grab a quick, cheap lunch but still be able to enjoy the classy digs you love during happy hour. 

Lunch is definitely more chaotic, with a line out the door before noon. But the ordering line moves fast, and the shrimp or super tacos are my recommendation. Prices range from $3-5ish for tacos, well worth the setting and salsa bar perks.

I will be here A LOT more now. If you haven't experience lunch time at Trop, you must!
author: Nique F.

description: Got ourselves some empanadas, the staff is great and so is the food. Small seating area (about 20). They have guava juices and watermelon (plus others). The sauces are a great addition to your empanadas and would recommend the basil/cilantro one.
author: Tricia C.

description:
Living on the East Bay, I'm not nearly as knowledgeable of the SF restaurant scene as I'd like to be.....so I asked my SF foodie friend for her TOP 5 places in The City right now. TROPISUENO was one of them! Being close to BART was a bonus and it's situated in a cool area right by the Jewish Museum on Yerba Buena Lane.

SO I decided to give it a shot on a First Date and it was a great environment for the situation: FESTIVE, loud (but not in an obnoxious way), and fun. Let's get to the meal:

--DRINKS--
There was a running joke throughout the whole night as I asked the waiter for any drink OTHER than a margarita....where he promptly brought us both margaritas....no biggie....the margarita was a margarita....nothing special. If you're into TEQUILA, they have over 80 selections at the bar and decent variety of specialty margaritas.

--APPETIZERS--
We went with the GUACAMOLE for $7.50 with jalepeno, tomato, onion, fresh lime, plenty of chips and three types of salsa. This hit the spot, and maybe I was just feeling avocado at the moment, but it was awesome.

There were a bunch of additional appetizer options: fritos, carnitas, flautas, ceviche, crudo, tamales, tacos, and enchiladas. You're bound to find something that fits your palette. 

--ENTREE/MAIN--
I'll start off by saying portion size (at least for what we got) was huge. We both were not able to completely finish our plates. All entrees are served with traditional Mexican rice, beans, and tortillas.

I chose TAMPIQUENO for $16 - niman ranch beef, thin-cut grilled carne asada, served with beef barbacoa enchilada, and guacamole. The meat was great, I liked getting a small taste of the enchilada on the side, and it was a lot of food to consume. Very hearty and filling plate with lots of flavor.

My date had the HUARACHES "TRES COCHINITAS" for $14 which included three thick tortilla "sandals" with three kinds of pork, chile verde, carnitas, and al pastor with pineapple. Obviously, if you're looking for a diverse selection of meats this is a great option.

Another intriguing option - Camarones Tropisueno: large wild white shrimp, in a creamy chile de arbol sauce finished with tequila, lime, and cilantro.

--DESSERT--
We skipped dessert....but not to worry! Our check came with Chupa Chups lollipops.

--CONCLUSION--
I'll be coming back! Definitely want to try the ceviche. And they have good Happy Hour specials: $2.50 can of Tecate, $5 wells, $2.50 tacos. This place is fun, in a good location, and has great Mexican food. I recommend this place to all!

Until my next review...HAPPY EATING AND TRAVELING!

Tyler
author: Tyler J.

description: I loooove coming here when I'm in the city! It's a nice quick walk from union square and the area it's in is so nice and trendy. as soon as you walk in you feel the positive energy from not only the staff but the fun and vibrant ambiance. The bartenders are extremely friendly and the cocktails are creative and very yummy! I got the flauta and taco combo plate, and was thoroughly impressed! I loved the idea of being able to pick one of each - I'm extremely indecisive. The wait staff was very nice and made the overall experience very enjoyable. The only down side of this spot is that I thought the drinks were a bit pricey- but it is the city so it's nothing out of the ordinary. Definitely hope to go back soon!
author: Joanne S.

description:
Passed by this place on a Friday night, and wondered what this restaurant was about because it was super packed with people practically spilling out of the entranceway. Finally got to try it for Sunday late brunch, and I was happy to see that it was a lot less busy, with indoor seating available (and no wait). It was also a "seat yourself" type of situation, which I prefer especially for daytime dining.

First, the chips. My friend already prefaced our meal by telling me how much their chips rocked. Can confirm that they are, indeed, very good. Not salty, greasy, or thick... rather, very light and crispy. Almost like a potato chip, except it's made of corn. They also have a salsa/dip bar, with a variety of options. Liked that, though, I have to wonder how sanitary it is with so many people stopping by to use it. Still, it looked to be kept in pretty good condition.

OK, onto the food: we ordered the chicken salad (was 'meh' maybe bc the chicken tasted like it belonged only in a burrito and not a regular salad), nachos (good but the chips didn't hold up so well because they were so thin), and ceviche (not bad, but they should serve it with more than just 2 taco wraps).

I'm told that the empanadas here are really good, but they only serve it at dinnertime... so, I'll have to come back another time to try them... if I dare to brave the dinnertime crowd.
author: Diana K.

description:
Why 4 stars? Because it's seemingly a Yelp staple.

   ---   ---   ---

I don't think there's a business on Yelp that more of my friends have reviewed than this one. Located near Yelp HQ, I'd assume those that work in the SF office have all been here at least a dozen times. 

It's convenient if you're nearby... but you could say that about every business, ever... depending on your relative location. So I'm pretty much just wasting everyone's time with this paragraph. So let's start fresh.

Much better. It's between average and spectacular... firmly placing it in the 4-star region of my expectation scale. The separate drink bar does not bode well with the crowds that this cantina attracts, but apparently this inconvenience doesn't shy anyone away. 

I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Brett N.

description:
We showed up with a reservation (mind you - the only available one all evening) at 9pm for 4 people. We waited for about 4-5 minutes, when the hostess came back and informed us the people at our table were taking a little longer than expected. She offered us margaritas to help ease our wait - and we opted for tequila shots (on the house).  It was a great way to put us at ease, and buy some time for the other diners. Class act!

When we got seated, chips/salsa (delicious) and water were served immediately. The waitstaff was very attentive - nobody ever had empty glasses or chip baskets. Awesome. All our food was excellent - each of us ordered different things (pozole for me!) and everyone was impressed. 

We will absolutely be back - and make a reservation again for sure!
author: Anika B.

description:
It's not a south of the border hole in the wall that you can crawl into and expect authentic family Mexican... But damn this place upscales the experience nicely.

- Worth the price for the location 
- Excellent margaritas
author: Sam J.

description:
We searched for most reviewed and highest ratings on yelp for Mexican plus closest location...so we decided to check it out.  Walked in around 7:30 on a Sunday night hoping to grab a quick dinner.  One hour wait...darn it, I should have expected it.  Fortunately man friend found two seats at the bar!  Score!  Good start for date night.  Too bad they didn't have warmers for the chilly night for the outside tables, cause there was like about a dozen tables for I don't know what.

Appetizer was ceviche - salmon was out, so we had to pick the white fish...I'm not saying it's bad but I wouldn't get it again and I've had better...if anyone know an awesome place in a city, let me know!

I had the enchiladas...the skin was a bit different for my taste buds but the meat was cooked to perfection, and I normally don't even like chicken; although they made me a fan.  I opted out of beans cause...well...uh..date night...bean?  no thanks.  More rice as my substitute for the bean-o.  Plus, our awesome bartender (Zac) was cool and recommended veggies...that was a plus.

Complimentary nachos were good too, the thin kind that doesn't break when you scoop some salsa, just right...ate two bowls myself...almost could eat three but my dinner arrived!!
author: Gia C.

description:
I always raise an eyebrow at fancy Mexican places. The best Mexican I've ever had tend to be in divey hole-in-the-walls, so I was already a little skeptical as I walked in. With a giant menu up front, you walk up to the open kitchen, where you put in an order much in the same way you would at a Chipotle. The difference here is that, after paying, you're given a number, find a seat, and wait as they bring the food out to you. 

While my friend got an order of their pork enchiladas, I took the advice of fellow Yelpers and got myself a chicken mole poblano for ~$13. Taking a few bites of both, my earlier assumption turned out to be correct - not spectacular, and just another average Mexican joint. Though, I did appreciate the mole for not being overly sweet as most mole dishes seem to end up, but they ran into the issue of oversalting.

And while prices are just okay, you do get free chips, portions are large, food is served quickly, and the staff are all pretty nice.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Visiting San Francisco for the first time and my bf and I were looking for a great Mexican restaurant with a hip scene.  We were staying in Union Square and wanted something within walking distance.  After consulting websites, concierges and everything in between, we decided to go to Macys first so my bf could find shoes.  As I'm sitting there pursuing Yelp for ideas, my bf asks the salesperson if he could recommend any Mexican restaurants.  He said no, but called a colleague over and this guy gave several options, one being Tropisueno. I looked them up on Yelp and saw mixed reviews and thought it was far so by the time we left Macys we just decided to walk on Market and see where we end up. We were starving at this point and after a short stroll I see a sandwich sign out for Tropisueno and figure since it's close and he first thing we see let's check it out!

It's Friday evening an we got there around 5:30 and several people were eating outside in the cold, which I was not gonna do.  Once we got in we saw several tables open so our chances were good to get a table immediately.  The host asked us if we would be done by 7:30pm since there were reservations and we were totally cool with that.  Let me now say that I am so glad that guy in Macys mentioned it because it was the best gem found in the Financial District!

First, they bring out fresh, warm chips and a trio of salsa.  The orange and red salsa was delicious and the chips were sooooo goood!  I was trying not to eat a lot so I could save room for real food.  We ordered the plantains in black bean sauce and it was so divine that I wanted to take it home with me!  I had a spicy mango margarita which was refreshing and a shrimp plate with rice, red cabbage and black beans.  The whole experience was amazing and the food was so good that we went back the next day!  I have never done that with a restaurant, let alone one on a trip so that really means it's good. 

We got there for round 2 at 4pm on Saturday before our flight and was told that they don't serve dinner until 5:30 pm.  I was really craving the plantains again but oh well.  They have an a la carte food line to order from, so we sat at the bar and guess what?  Got more chips, and a wider array of salsa options where it was help yourself!   I tried the strawberry margarita and white sangria and both were tasty.  Now my meal was a chicken quesadilla which was so good that I took half of that sucker home back to LA and had it for lunch the next day!  Tropisueno was such a fab find and I will definitely go back anytime I am in San Francisco.  I was telling everybody about it when I got back to LA and still am. It was that good!
author: Stacy B.

description: Cute atmosphere, Food was good, Drinks a little on the strong side and unfortunately the service wasn't the best.  before we sat we were told they could seat us now only if we would be done in and hour and 15mins. Not the right thing to say to someone that wants to relax on their vacation and not feel rushed.
author: Michelle L.

description: Super cute restaurant, great ambiance, and the food was very yummy. I was also impressed about the prices so much that I thought they had given us the wrong bill :)
author: Karla D.

description: We were told by the hostess to keep our meal less than 1.5 hours long. Was greeted by the server after 30 minutes of waiting. Received our drinks after another 15 minutes, and after watching every other table around us receive food, we were able to flag down our server after another 5 minutes of searching. At this point we'd been waiting for 50 minutes, leaving us 40 minutes to receive our food, eat quickly and probably not get dessert or a second drink- all so that we could respect the hostess's time limit.  After an hour of no food arriving we left. No visit from the manager to apologize.  And just so we're clear, we ordered  single taco and enchilada- no beans or rice. The drinks, however, were amazing.
author: C B.

description: Longer wait than they estimate. Chips and dips (salsa, salsa verde and quest) were good. Food was ok, wouldn't wait that long again.
author: Diane K.

description:
The food was terrible, we ordered the fish of the day and chef special, they were all very bad.  The only food that was good were the chips.
The place was so loud and noisy, we were not able to hear each other at all. The waiter only appeared to take the order and disappeared the whole night.
author: Janet T.

description: EXCELLENT Food and Service. We were in SanFran on vacation and this was our last night - the menu was very authentic and food incredible. Honestly, we wanted to order everything on the menu and if I was local I'd be back regularly. It was super busy we had a reservation, no issue and the service was impeccable. Even the rice and beans were awesome! Had ceviche, soup, guacamole, and asado. Margarita's were awesome too - no scaling back on the Tequila! Highly recommend - LOVE!
author: Brandie D.

description: The service and food were perfect. Rachel was an excellent waitress...she was friendly, offered great suggestions, and made the experience fantastic. The margaritas were delicious!
author: Tasha K.

description:
My girlfriend and I had alot of trouble finding this place. Googlemaps was misleading but the trick is you gotta walk through the Marriott. Don't walk around the hotel...especially don't walk around the hotel about 34 times. Face palm.

There was a crazy wait for dinner so we opted for the bar. Open seating and immediately greeted by chips and salsa. Sure! Don't mind if I do. Best chips and BEST salsa I've tasted in awhile. Their salsa is on the spicy side, but SO good. I should have just skipped dinner just to make more room for the chips n salsa.

I got the Tampiqueño for dinner and it was massive. Two huge pieces of steak, enchilada, rice, beans, AND guac. They really outdid themselves with this dish - so delicious! I also got the watermelon marg that was seasonal and special for the night. Yum-o!
author: Qui C.

description:
The burritos here are killer, not only in the sense that they're awfully delicious, but also in the sense that they will kill part of your afternoons, which is especially problematic if you're a member of the workforce.

I usually just order a standard carnitas burrito, in which they roll up all the standard ingredients (salsa, cheese, beans, etc.), except the burrito isn't standard at all. It is extraordinary in both size and taste, and this is precisely the root of several unproductive afternoons. They also throw in chips and salsa along with the main course!

I've never actually eaten at the premises before, since I usually opt for take-out. The several times I've been during lunch time, the wait has been around 20 minutes long.
