It gets borderline hectic in there, as they scramble to satisfy both eat-in and take-out orders, both of which there are many.

The best part of Tropisueno is the modest price. If you just order a burrito, it should not exceed $10, which is great, considering the big hunk of food they supply you with.

Since this place is located near my workplace, I will undoubtedly be going back for more!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Waited for 20 minutes to get a table on Thursday night but definitely worth the wait. Chips were nothing special but the sauces they provided were very tasty and authentic (I think haha)

The vegetarian enchiladas were delicious and definitely the highlight of my food experience here! Definitely coming back soon.
author: Ashwin M.

description: Perfect place to come to as a break from the new SF MoMA. Only a 5 minute walk across the YB Gardens, it's the perfect afternoon lunch spot taqueria. So many options, all within a reasonable price range, given the relatively large sizes. They offer free chips as well. The environment was fun and decor was really nice as well. Food tasted very fresh - I got a veggie burrito, and it was definitely more than just your typical peppers and onions. Would definitely come back!
author: Puja S.

description:
Was in the downtown area and was hungry with my friend and decided to check yelp. Saw Tropisueno with 1000+ reviews ~4 stars and decided why not. 

Made reservations through the OpenTable application via yelp for 5:30 and we were seated at 5:30.

Once we were seated, the tortilla chips were served to us with 3 different dips and I must say this was the best part of the meal! We devoured one bowl and asked for a refill. The chips were thin, crispy, and hot and were very delicious. The chips would be the main reason I come back, and trying out a different dish would just be additional icing on the cake. 

I came in craving a carne asada burrito but ended up ordering a carne asada rice plate. Roughly $15, and it was huge... couldn't finish it. Came with a spicy enchilada, refried beans, 3 corn tortilla wraps, wild rice, overall it was just a really big portion. 

The meat was slightly cooked to not what we desired, so next time I'll ask for medium well... it was slightly too rare for my own taste. 

Definitely coming back another time to try out a different dish. There's a bar at the entrance with a TV, mainly sports being played. The atmosphere is really good too.

Not to mention, service is top-notch, our water was constantly refilled. Chips were refilled and so was dip. 

*Cash and Plastic accepted. 

*Parking always rough in downtown
author: Sam K.

description:
Came here with my dad for father's day. Was pleasantly surprised!

AMBIANCE
The atmosphere in this FiDi venue was comfortable yet sophisticated, with rock-filled lanterns on the table and intricate lamps on the ceiling. Large streetside windows with cloth blinders allowed for people watching without feeling vulnerable. 

CUISINE
Tropisueño offered us a scrumptious meal, from the appetizers to the entrees. We thoroughly enjoyed the presentation and bright colors of the food, which turned the meal into an experience to remember.

+ Baby Fried Bananas - sweet delish treat
+ Crispy Chicken Flautas - flaky goodness
+ Banana-baked salmon, w/rice & beans - delish, tropical, spicy
+ Large wild shrimp, w/rice & beans - saucy, spicy, bright

SERVICE
Our waiter went above and beyond. When my dad asked for a drink on the menu that the waiter was unfamiliar with, he switched to a different drink. However, the waiter went on to scour the shelves for the  drink and ended up finding it for us. That's what I call good service.
author: Chelsea M.

description: I really enjoy Tropisueno. I've been there a few times now and the food is always really good. I got the shrimp tacos and my girlfriend got the chicken tacos on our latest visit. They were both fantastic. Plus, the free chips and salsa is always a way to win my heart. I've gotten lucky here a few times as well as I have beaten the long lines at the door. If you can avoid the long lines, you'll be happier than a mailman on a national holiday.
author: Tyler K.

description:
This is a great happy hour spot.

I have been here many times and mostly for their happy hour. It can get packed here, so you will probably have to wait and scout around a while before finding some seats inside. The open seating areas are the the chairs along the bar (duh), the long table next to the bar, and the tables outside. You have to get lucky to find a open seat inside. Usually my friends and I end up sitting outside, it gets chilly so have a light jacket on hand. 

First, the free chips and dip are DELICIOUS. The chips are freshly fried and are thin and crispy. There are three delicious sauces, red, orange, and green. All are good. They will give you more chips and sauce without you even asking. From the happy hour menu, I usually get the quesadilla and tacos and they are amazing. 

The bartender is very nice and informative. They have a great selection of tequila. Their margaritas are really good. Its not too strong and its not too light, it's perfect. They offer strawberry, and regular. I prefer the strawberry. Don't try to drink it too fast, you will get a brain freeze!

The service is great, even if you are at the bar. They tend to you immediately serve you up fresh chips, and dip right when you arrive. 

Overall, one of my favorite places to get drinks and food during happy hour.
author: Allen C.

description:
Great go-to near the financial district if you are in from out of town. 

Love all 3 salsas - great variety and heat.

Camarones entree was delicious. The rice was very unique (cumin?). Shrimp were well cooked, though maybe sauce heavy. 

Margs were also legit!
author: Jessica N.

description:
I've come to this restaurant couple times, mostly in the afternoon and away from the evening rush after work. The times I've been here, it has not disappointed. 

At my recent outing, I suggested this place to meet up with a friend. I wasn't in the city at the time so I called to schedule ahead, as did my friend and we've found that it wasn't possible to schedule an appointment. Not a surprise, the place is just swarming with people. My friend went ahead to get us tables for two, seatings to be available to us at 7pm. I got there late, and apologetic, arriving 25 minutes past the scheduled time. To my surprise, and the servers delight, we were able to be seated the moment I bursted through the door. 

Compared to my previous afternoon outings, where you ordered at the register, the night time options had you order from their menu pamphlets. To start, the servers had us with a bowl of chips and 3 sauces for the sides. One sauce was a spicy nacho cheese, salsa verde I believe, and just regular salsa. Before I could even think to ask, they inquired if we wanted guacamole. Absolutely yes. 

I was kind of excited to be honest, I wasn't too brave in choosing the options from the board, like a taco or enchilada. I had read a review earlier on one of this dishes, Salmon En Hoja De Platano, which I ended up ordering. Fantastic fish, cooked to medium, had a bite to it that would quickly fall apart in my mouth. To top it off, a big serving as well. An absolute plethora of sides dotted the dishes and I was sure as hell unable to finish it. My friend wasn't into beans, and requested a side of salad if possible. The server told us that they don't have a salad option, but he could try to see if they would whip up something. Fortunately, they were and surprisingly the salad was decent and did not end up being a more garnished shredded cabbage. 

The service is fantastic, speedy, and attentive. There wasn't much we needed, but water was always quickly filled, peoples foods were coming out in a timely manner and the appetizers were fast enough to tide the starving people over. Maybe one niggling issue, our over attentive waiter who would sometimes  break into our conversation just to ask if we needed anything, but we laughed it off.

The scene is very divey at night, feels casual in the afternoon. That means if you want those nicely lit Instagram photos, you won't get them during the night menu and don't even try. 

Overall, a solid choice if you have to get something to eat in SoMa.
author: Albert H.

description:
I'll admit it, I was thinking about getting a quesadilla. But I asked one Ruggeford J what I should order and he said, "A burrito. Because burritos suck in NYC."

And I really couldn't argue with that. Because although I'll let you taste the back of my hand* for saying there's no good Mexican in NYC, there are no burritos that I would put in the Mission class. Tropisueño might not be in the Mission, but it's a DAMN good alternative near the Yelp office (so close it's been called the "Yelp Cafeteria").

Basically, I'll never say no to an al pastor super burrito; it's quick, it's efficient, and it's ever so tasty. The major downside is that eating an entire delicious burrito log will render you useless for the rest of the day. 

But don't even think about eating half and sticking the rest in the fridge. You're just going to forget to grab it over and over again and then you'll want to cry on your flight home as you bite into that tasteless, mealy, non-burrito sandwich.
___________

*Provided you are substantially smaller than me.
author: Peter D.

description:
I've heard about this place so many times and really didn't think too much of it, I figured it'd be overpriced Mexican food, but it was actually pretty damn decent! (I HAVE YET TO STOP BY FOR HAPPY HOUR BY THE WAY - it's sort of ridic here during HH btw which is one reason why I haven't been able to experience it yet, BOO!)

Food- I forgot what we ordered, but it was pretty solid and good for the price. It's pretty on-par to what you'd pay in the Mission, MAYBE a TAD more - you're in Union Square though, can't complain too much.
I love the chips here and the variety of salsas they have at the salsa bar. They also have a variety of Mexican food, from tacos, to burritos, to mole, enchilada - love it!

This is definitely a place I'll stop by to get a quick bite while I'm in downtown - so good for the price and value. Not to mention, the decor is so cute! It makes me feel like I'm on vacation since it kinda has a beach hut feel to it.
author: Emily C.

description: Hubby and I love this place and it's one of our very favorite spots for mixed drinks. we love their bar. friendly bartenders, amazing drinks, great salsa background music. Food is also good and love their chips n salsa. few of our fav drinks are the Jamaicazo, San espadín and herradura cocktail. I give them 5 stars!!!
author: Sarah G.

description:
Best authentic Mexican food in SF. Lunch. Time is more of a taco shop order at the front style while night time is a traditional restaurant where you are seated by a host/hostess. 

Everything is amazing. Empanadas as an appetizer along with the complimentary chips and salsa.

Lunch I get an assortment of tacos and dinner either the carne or pollo asada plate.

Above all, the orange sauce is the shit. Order a small cup of it and drink it down.
author: Danny B.

description: It's changed.  There once was a lovely cocktail menu with craft cocktails.  In it's place are pretty generic margaritas that are very inconsistent quality and taste wise.  Guacamole is now lacklustre.  Even the Al Pastore was boring in it's seasoning. (Taqueria Cancun's is far better.)  I'm pretty disappointed in the changes to menu and quality.  It's a shame as I have so enjoyed this place previously.   Side note also:  this visit the bathrooms were an absolute disaster and the hostess seemed non-plussed.  We're probably not going to be back.
author: Rachel B.

description: Average sums up this place. The food was ok, not spectacular. The margarita was average and expensive. The place is more authentic than Moes but similar in style  in that the menu is on the wall, you order in a buffet line facing ingredients, and then you pay.  Owner was very attentive.
author: Jane D.

description: Had the fish of the day, halibut with an executive margarita. Wonderful food and service. The wait of long but with it, reservations are a very good idea.
author: Brandon B.

description:
After a long day of exploring SF, my fiance and I were too tired to go far from our hotel to grab dinner. Not wanting to settle on fast food/hotel restaurant/or delivery. We decided to yelp around! We were sooooo lucky that we stayed only a block around Tropisueno. Opentable had no reservations available so we tried to drop by and see if there were any seats for us. Upon arriving at 8PM, our hostess notified us that there was a 45 mins wait but the bar is first come first serve. We dived right towards the bar and found 2 seats available. Upon seating, the bartender immediately place a bowl of home made chips with 3 types of dips in front of us and handed us the menu. Before I had a chance to even open the menu, I was already stuffing my face with their AH-AMAZING chips and dips already. After munching away half of the bowl and finishing one whole sauce dip, we were finally ready to order - my fiance ordered the skirt steak with pulled pork enchilada with rice, black beans, salsa + avocado and I went with cauldo de marisco which came with a side order of rice.

After placing our food order, the bartender paused and asked if we were over 21 lol. We confirmed that we were and were not interested in ordering drinks. He was more than okay with us refusing drinks despite the fact that we were sitting at the bar. Even though he was the bartender, he was extremely attentive in serving us and refilling our water. He even refilled our chips twice and sauces 3 times! I guess he's used to it since their chips are so yummy - other customers must ask for refills all the time! Our entrees were HUGE yet soooo tasty. I'm easily salted out yet the soup was sooo perfectly seasoned and I drank every last drop. My fiance woofed down his entree and couldn't stop raving about it through out. It was the best Mexican food we had together. Wayyyyyyy better than Dos Caminos or Rosa Mexicano here in the city. Even after I finished my entree, I couldn't help but eat more chips and dips as desserts lol. If only we can replace every Dos Caminos and Rosa Mexicano with Tropisueno in the city. Thanks for the amazing service and yummy food!
author: Wing C.

description: This place was a hidden gem! Refried beans made with real lard, perfecto! The drinks are beautifully crafted. Just what I was craving and their salsas are delicious! Will be coming back. We weren't there for happy hour, but seemed like it would be great!
author: Lana M.

description: Cute interior with good food. I got the vegetable enchiladas with rice and beans and they definitely hit the spot after a long day. The service was quick, and they served chips with three different sauces/salsas as soon as I sat down.
author: Chandni L.

description: Tropisueño is fine, no big whoop. Sat near the bar area for a quiet Monday night dinner with a friend. Two decent margueritas, free chips with three kinds of salsa, large portions, attentive service, and a decently flavored vegetable caldo. Nothing spectacular, just fine. If I could rate at 3.5, I would.
author: Will V.

description:
Amazing Mexican inspired craft cocktails and margaritas.

Fresh, hot chips are awesome. They also come with 6+ (salsa bar) types of salsas that are amazing. Mango habanero, smoky chipotle, etc. I was in salsa heaven.

The cocktails are all craft/Latino inspired, so many use tequila in unique ways. Big fan.

Food is also 20x better than a Chevy's. Get the various mole and enchilada dishes and specials or the gourmet tacos. I'll def be back.
author: Chuck N.

description: I'm giving this place 5 stars for their customer service! We went here on a late Monday night for margaritas and the staff were just incredible. They took care of us. They didn't disappoint. When you come in, they do give free chips and three types of salsa. There were four of us last night and they were generous enough to give us another big bowl of chips and another plate of the salsa trio. Their margis are unique and on point and we will definitely be coming back here again for food. Can't wait! :)
author: Leah Anne B.

description:
I really can't recommend this place. Here's how my experience went down.
  Went there with a party of 8. We had about a 45 minute wait, which was fine and accurate. Problem started with the table. It was a booth for 6 not 8 and eventually they stuck some chairs at the end of the table. We asked from some thing different and they started whining they are not really prepared to handle parties this size. So why did they tell us they could?
  The waitress was not too pleasant not was she very good. We ordered drinks which took about 20 minutes to arrive. We had glasses of water hold the ice. I ordered a club soda which came in a bottle. When it arrived and I opened it it sprayed all over me. I was not too happy. The waitress was like what do you want me to do? The host came over and offered me some warm white dish rag to clean my blue pants up. White cloth...blue pants bad combo and I was pretty angry at that point.
  As for the food is was ok..not bad but nothing to write home about. I had tacos but they have no corn tacos just soft flower. Kind of weak on my view. Also the chips for the salsa were super thin which I also don't like.
  The bathrooms really a joke. One men's and one women's room to accommodate 1 person.
 The host did apologize and was nice enough. Maybe for  a smaller party it's ok. But lots of excuses for bad table and bad service. The reality is there is no excuse. Also you would think maybe they would offer a drink or dessert or something. The host did mention that was coming next, yet it never came. But just warm dish rag to clean the mess. 
  All this said. 2 stars is actually being kind. Really one of the worse restaurant experiences I have had in a long time. It's hard to believe in SF you can't do a lot better than this place.
author: Andy H.

description:
Nice tasting entrees
Awesome chips and salsa on the tables
Tonight the bar had a tight wrist - very weak $13 margarita
author: Peter B.

description:
I end up coming here a couple times each quarter for work, and I always feel mixed about it. Everything is just... fine... and yet it's packed all the time. Probably because it's the only Mexican food in the area. For a regular lunch, the portions are generous but there always seems to be a huge line out the door and the restaurant interior is noisy. Seating, especially if you come in a group, is hard to come by. I always feel in the way (even seated!) with the constant comings and goings of patrons and staff.

I also tried ordering catering by phone, but the person who answered said they won't take phone orders or deliver if the total is under $200. So I walked to the restaurant to order in person for later that afternoon, but of course they were in the middle of lunch rush so the staff was running around. Sylvia (I think?) was friendly and accommodating but from the moment I called I felt like I was asking the restaurant an unusual favor to order some take-out appetizers several hours in advance. 

It does the job of being a cheap and mostly efficient restaurant, but ambiance and overall experience are not its strong suits.
author: Krista L.

description: Good nachos (tons of toppings & melted cheese), salad was also good but on the small side, & free chips were my fav.
author: Corrie C.

description: This is my favorite after work spot to grab a happy hour marg. They get busy, so chill out about your free chips and salsa.
author: Rachael P.

description: Delicious food! I got the Chile Relleno Picadillo and I had never had anything like it. Highly recommend it. It was quite loud on a Friday evening, but after all it was a Friday evening. Do wish that the cocktails had come out much earlier since they came out right with/a little after the meal.
author: Irena F.

description: This place is legit for breakfast. Authentic- down to the cafe de olla! I look fwd to trying their lunch and dinner!
author: Karla E.

description: This place is great. Fantastic, high quality Mexican food in the heart of SF. Reasonable prices, too. Highly recommend.
author: Daniel K.

description: Based on the ratings of this place I expected good food. This was the worst Mexican food I have ever had.
author: Jo P.

description:
Either street parking or private lots, with option to valet with the hotel nearby. The restaurant is really cute with hand-made tables. The atmosphere is lively and young. The food is amazing. I had the Barbacoa, and even the leftovers heated by microwave the next day was mouth-watering good. My friend had the Pollo Asado, which looked very good from across the table and came with very generous portions. 

The only downside was our waiter. He was sweaty and not too friendly. He was brisk and didn't really offer any recommendations when we asked for favorites. And at the end, he flipped over our receipts front in front of us to see how much tip we had given him.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
lunch

food: nachos. yea... not the best thing to order from a mexican place. i didnt know they offer complimentary chips or i wouldve ordered something else. ***2/5

service: service was great. order from the counter and you get a number. the servers will deliver to your table. the place is clean. i liked the natural lighting from the windows. totally cool spot to people watch. ***4/5

value: expensive for what i ordered. however, the portion was huge. i didnt fully finish my order. they give you complimentary chips as well. perhaps what i ordered was lacking. ***3/5
author: Andy Z.

description:
While working in San Francisco, I was lucky enough to find this place right next to my office.  In fact, I felt so lucky, I went twice that week. 

The first time was for lunch.  While the service was fantastic, the overall experience was a bit hectic.  The food is fantastic, so the fact that is was packed shouldn't come as a surprise.  In the day, you walk through an ordering line, then get drinks from the bar.  We happened to have a group, which never eases things.  We dined on Guacamole, fajitas, nachos, burritos, and more.  Top notch, all the way around.

My second experience was at dinner.  When I walked in, I did a double take to make sure I was at the right place.  The open ordering window that I experienced during lunch, was totally gone and replaced by a highly decorated wall.  We were seated by a hostess, waited on by a server, and enjoyed the high brow Mexican offerings.  

While I'd describe it as fancy-pants Mexican, it's totally affordable and delicious to boot.
author: Will L.

description: Good food and ambiance for get together with friends. We ordered multiple ceviche dishes and guac to start with and it was delicious. Main portions are huge, so def plan around that.
author: Aigerim D.

description: My type of happy hour spot! Drinks are nice and strong (2 shots per drink), free chips and salsa, and delicious street tacos (chicken, steak, and carnitas - I got all 3 but my favorite was the steak!) - that's all I need! Deducted 1 star because the ceviche was bizarre. The only seafood in it was tilapia, and it consisted mostly of chopped onions. We just used it as a dip for the chips. I'm excited to try their lunch/dinner foods too, so I will be coming back!
author: Shawna C.

description: With it's close proximity to the FiDi and several hotels, be prepared for crowds!  We waited ~1.5 hours for a table on a Friday night, which was fine because we were able to kill most of this time at the Target across the street.  The margaritas were very good, as were the complimentary chips and salsas that came out promptly after we were seated.  I opted for the Camarones Tropisueno (shrimp in a spicy red sauce) which was very good, though the accompanying rice and beans were just okay.  Unfortunately my friends who ordered the enchiladas were not super impressed, so perhaps some items are better than others.  Service was ok.  Not a place I would go out of my way to visit, but if I happened to be in the area I would give it another try.
author: Andrea P.

description: We went for lunch and loved the super and regular tacos! Guac was top notch. Amazing service, the food came out super fast. Super nice staff!
author: Ryan F.

description:
Chips and salsa are the BOMBBBBB if that's a saying anymore..3 type of salsa..i like the orange one the most..and then the red chunky tomato..just didn't like green one..

The ceviche trio is eh..the salmon is good along with the shrimp..but not the fish..

The pork pineapple tacos are good..plates are pretty big..

Service is not bad either..just took awhile to get food to us..

Would come back again for the chips..it's really good..
author: Minerva L.

description: Absolutely amazing. I loved their fajitas and I usually don't like fajitas. I would eat here far too often if I was a local.
author: Carlyn B.

description:
Dropped in for lunch and was pleasantly surprised by the delicious food and great atmosphere.  

The watermelon drink was especially yummy and the "self serve" salsa station for your meal was awesome!  Lots of seating and delicious and affordable lunch options.

Totally loved it and would come again next time we are in SF.
author: Lori T.

description:
Last night was my birthday, so my husband decided to take me to dinner anywhere I wanted.  We are new to the east bay, so we asked one of our new friends where a good spot for great Mexican food.  He told us the best place to go was to head into the city and trying Tropisueno.  My google map said it was only 20 minutes away, plus it was still pretty early, so we figured "why not?!"

Well, being that it was Halloween night AND the same day as the Giants world series victory parade, we hit some pretty bad traffic and didnt make it to Tropisueno until later.  When we got in, we were greeted by the manager and hostess whom told us the restaurant was closing, and they were no longer seating but there was room in the bar.  When my husband mentioned it was my birthday, the manager stepped in and got us seated at a table!

We ordered the carne asada plate and my husband got some kind of a combination...but before our dinner even reached us, we were pretty full off the AMAZING cilantro salsa they give you with chips (seriously, they give you three different kinds, but the one with the cilantro is THEE best!)

Dinner was fantastic, and I got to enjoy it again for lunch this afternoon.  Plus, they surprised me with THE BEST FLAN IVE EVER HAVE IN MY LIFE for my birthday.  

The experience, the food, the customer service...all 5 stars!
author: Allison H.

description: This place has one the best mexican food I have ever eaten. They have these 3 dips that they serve with chips. They were spicy, tangy and perfect. We ordered shrimp and pork with side of rice. Both the entrees were cooked to perfection. Service was good. This place is little cramped up and crowded but its worth the amazing food we get to experience.
author: Raji T.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the city! This place is trendy and is in an amazing location - across the street from Yerba Buena Gardens. 

They give you a platter of three salsa's the minute you sit down - and I can't tell you which one I liked more! There is a bar side area to wait while your table gets ready - which you definitely have to take advantage of. 

I opted for the steak and shrimp tacos and my friend had the chicken and steak - AMAZING. I honestly have not stopped craving this place since I went here a few weeks ago. 

Pros: 
- TRENDY & CASUAL
- AMBIANCE - 
- PRICING IS REASONABLE
- FOOD IS SCRUMPTIOUS 
- DRINKS = DELISH 

This is the perfect date spot, perfect spot to grab dinner and drinks with your friends. Definitely coming back!
author: Raji R.

description:
What happened over the last seven years??? Dinner service was horrible. Not the service but the food. And the bathroom was FILTHTY. This is a much better spot for lunch. I ordered the caldo de mariscos. A few pieces of seafood swimming in a huge bowl of broth which tasted so-so. It came with rice that seemed leftover from yesterday. Hubby's rice served with his chile relleno was hard and stale too. 

The only saving grace was the tortilla chips, salsas, and margaritas.
author: Maria C.

description: This is the place to be during happy hour! The restaurant gets packed, so try to come early or be prepared to wait and grab a seat as soon as you see it open up. The margaritas are delicious and super strong. I prefer the strawberry because the house marg is too strong for me. My friends and I were tipsy and happy enjoying the chips and salsas (which are super delicious, btw - the servers make sure that you have refills too), and decided to try a few of the small plates. I loved the chicken quesadilla as well as the street tacos. The food is really yummy and everything came out in a timely manner despite the packed spot. Definitely one of the better restaurants for happy hour in the FiDi!
author: Hannah P.

description: I went here back in November and experienced a very rude waitress.  The food was good, though.  And, drinks were on point.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
I'm from Texas, and after spending a week in San Francisco I was hard core craving some Mexican food. Tropisueño was only a few blocks away from where I was staying, and had pretty decent ratings here on Yelp  I honestly didn't have high hopes for 'Mexican' food outside of Texas, but I was happily surprised.

When I got to the restaurant I was greeted with a 'it's going to be 45 mins for a table' - for one! I decided to stick it out, and I think I only waited about 15 minutes before being seated, so that was the first nice surprise. 

The service was fast and the waiter was super friendly. I have no idea how he managed to be so fast with everything- I was never without water or chips. 
I tried the cucumber margarita, and wasn't impressed. I'm not a huge fan of cucumber, though, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who doesn't have a strong feeling of 'like' for cucumber flavored items. 

I had ordered the guacamole, which I think they forgot to bring, but I asked about it when my food came out (10 minutes after ordering it!) and the waiter brought me a side dish of it for free. Second surprise!

The guac was delicious! Highly recommend it. The ambience of the place was some of the best I've ever seen in a Mexican restaurant- I felt as if I was in a fancy resort in Mexico. Great intimate atmosphere for a date. 

Over all, I really enjoyed the place. I wasn't blown away by the margarita, salsa, or enchilada sauce (tastes like Cannes enchilada sauce) so I'm only giving the place 4 stars. I'd definitely return if I'm in the city again.
author: Melinda R.

description:
Busy busy busy! This place gets packed fast. Reservations are recommended. 

The margaritas are delicious. The salsa & chips are spicy/salty goodness. The entrees are...huge. If your'e ordering a few appetizers, I'd suggest thinking about sharing an entree. It's very good food and verrrry plentiful. 

Great place for drinks & chips after work!
author: Ashley S.

description: Soo good, so much food. Great location too. Margarita was $12...I highly suggest waiting for happy hour.
author: Molly D.

description:
Abysmal service, good food.

Our waiter told us if we did not order soon we would not get food (because it was taking an hour to come out) Our food arrived around 10 minutes after ordering, we think he just wanted to get us in and out as soon as possible. We had reservations and had to wait 30 minutes before being seated.
author: Ami P.

description:
Oh my gosh I hate Happy Hour! ... said no one ever! 

I come for the salty margaritas. And I say salty with love. It's the spicy kind of salty which reminds me a lot of my elementary school days where I would buy mexican candy for like 10 cents. 

Happy hour is half off margaritas.. sometimes if you are sweet enough the bartenders make your drink a little strong. He always say "thanks mija" and give me a wink.. That's when I know... I cannot take heaping gulps. I need to be sipping... But who follow rules anyway. I take my gulps and leave my tab open for the next round. Did I mention there's unlimited chips and three different salsa. 

I have not tried the food here yet, but I am very tempted to. Maybe I can check this out during more relaxed night. Seems like a spot that pleases everyone!
author: Phuong V.

description:
Now this is what Mexican food is all about.

Tucked away off Mission St in the Financial District,Tropisueño was a pleasant surprise  My family and I stopped by for lunch on Friday afternoon and this place did not disappoint.

First off, lunch here is totally different than dinner. You order off the menu board and the food is brought to you as opposed to sit-down service during the dinner. The menu for lunch is well priced with few options over $10. Its like much better version of Cafe Rio. A large self-serve salsa bar with a variety of dips and toppings is there to satisfy any pallet. I had the Tropisueño torta sandwich with features four different meats along and it did not disappoint. The carne asada was delicious and the chorizo was full of flavor, I'd definitely get it again.

I want to try the chile relleno burrito next time as I've heard great things about it. The restaurant itself is well appointed and service was great. No complaints at all means this spot gets a rare 5 star review!
author: Justin G.

description: I love this place. Good prices, large portions, authentic fresh food that is so flavorful and cute inside! The flauta was my favorite and made with corn tortilla instead of flour like most places make.
author: Lisa P.

description:
I don't usually go out of my way to eat Mexican food (beans, rice, and meat paired with some sort of tortilla? MIND BLOWN!), but this place was close to our hotel and looked pretty decent.

It was busy at the dinner hour, but we were still able to get a table for 2 right away. Definitely pretty dark in here - I think someone said something, because it got noticeably lighter about halfway through our meal.

I got the Tampiqueno, which is essentially their carne asada. I wouldn't call it "thin sliced" as it says on the menu, but it was still tender and well seasoned. They give you two HUGE pieces of it, and I didn't come close to finishing. 

The beef barbacoa enchilada was awesome...I kind of wish that I had just gotten a plate full of those, just to make eating a little easier than having to constantly saw through thick pieces of carne asada.

Service was attentive throughout our meal. I was nervous at first that I'd constantly be waiting for my water to be replenished (glasses are small-ish), but thankfully the waiter came by with a jar of water to leave on our table.

Just a note if you need to split the check - tell the server at the beginning of the meal. We told him as he was taking our entree plates away, and he said that it was too late. After a pause on our end, he said he'd see what he could do, and then came back with split checks. You think they'd be a little more prepared to split checks given that this is next to an enormous hotel full of business travelers. At any rate, save yourself some trouble and tell your waiter at the beginning.

Also, huge list of tequilas, if you're into that sort of thing.
author: Aubrey S.

description: We were traveling to San Francisco and trying to eat at a different restaurant every night. We went back here for a repeat visit, even knowing there were so many other places we hadn't visited yet, because it was that good. Love the margarita de la casa, love the three sauces they gave you with chips to start, love the enchiladas de nopales with peruanos beans. The sauce on the enchiladas de nopales was amazing, I couldn't stop eating it. Great service, too.
author: Sarah V.

description: I went there with friends last night, and, wanting something light, I ordered the shrimp ceviche. Big mistake! I was lucky I made it home before a bad case of food poisoning set in. Never again!
author: Barbara L.

description: This place gets pretty busy, but the group I was with was able to snag the open seating on the patio. The service was fantastic and the food was delicious. The cocktails were the real MVP! We had the tropisueno, house margarita, and both drinks with jamaica juice in them.
author: Bobby C.

description: Fresh, local. Salsas are great. But honestly I'm not sure why it was hyped up quite so much- it's not THAT different from any other upscale Mexican place, and my fish was 3.5/5.
author: Mo S.

description: Living three blocks away, I came here often for a couple years because I liked the food but a few weeks ago there was a piece of plastic wrapper from a hot sauce bottle or something in my food.  The manager was not apologetic and just didn't seem to care.  He just offered to refund the cost of plate.  I'm never coming back.
author: Zebra F.

description: They messed up our order twice, even though we ordered our burritos vegan and emphasized "no cheese" multiple times, the still put cheese on both. Also, the guy carrying out orders was rude and customer service was lacking. Never coming here again!
author: April B.

description:
The chips and salsa here are so addicting! 

Tropisueno is a great place to eat with a group of friends - the margaritas are always good (mango is my favorite) and the food is easy to share. It can be tough getting a table if you come to dinner with a group larger than 6 - I have had to reserve on opentable over a month in advance (or maybe I was just unlucky??)
author: Jenny M.

description: Not as good as usual - I thought the quality had gone downhill a bit.  The ceviche was nice, the entrée (chicken enchiladas) just seemed a little bland and unauthentic.  I will give it one more chance, maybe it was an off night.
author: Lauren C.

description: There's not too many medium-high end Mexican places in SF, but this place is pretty solid. I wish they had more veggie items though. I haven't tried any of the meat products there but they sound fantastic. Their ceviches are really good. Service is prompt and with a smile, even when the place is slammed. The drinks are really good too. The salsas that come with the chips are great, I like how there's 3 different kinds of different textures and flavor profiles.
author: Samir K.

description:
everthing about this palce is good.

margaritas = good and strong!
service = good
free ships and salsa = FABULOUS!
ceviche = craving for more already

got the seafood soup = defintely hit the spot because it was a cold night in the city.
my friend got the carnitas plate = wow. huge portions. she couldnt finished it but then again we were snacking on chips and ceviche the whole time so that didnt help.

will definitely come here again.

prices are average and with the great customer service its worth it. :)
author: Carol Y.

description: Often go to this place during an happy hour and the foods are so good and authentic. Also great service :)
author: Daisy L.

description: Great Mexican food. Love the amazing salsa bar. The portions are generous. Great chips. It's kinda semi-fast food place where you line up to order. Then find a table to sit and they will bring the food to you.
author: Tina C.

description:
The decor is enough to step foot inside the building! It has sort of a Mediterranean feel to it, but almost Havana-like, which I guess would be Casablanca-esque. 

Anyway, a part from the actual set-up, and why I rated this place only 3 stars (mind you this is for the decor only), is because my husband and I arrived on a Saturday around 4:00pm for some Michelada drinks, and we almost walked out after 30 minutes since our drinks had not arrived ye to our table. We sat at the communal table near the bar. We saw the 2 bartenders pouring drinks for others, so we couldn't figure out what the delay was.

The waiter was nice enough to bring us chips and their 3 salsa platter the minute we sat down, but it was not substantial time for us to wait there for 30 minutes before our drinks arrived at our table. 

The verdict? The Micheladas were so salty that I think my blood pressure spiked after the visit. I will come again to try the food and sit in one of the booths, but I sure will NOT dish out any mullah on the subpar drinks (0 stars for the drinks). I'll save it for a worthwhile drink down the street.
author: Elidia C.

description: Great food and even better service!! Waitress was very patient and accommodating. We ordered appetizers but the cozy atmosphere gave us a view of others around. Our guacamole was the best!! You can order the "spicy" according to your taste. It was served with freshly-made white corn tortillas and we ordered the fresh-made chips as well.  Worth the extra $2! Empanadas and sopes were delicious as well.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Great place to try in San Francisco! Our waitress was super informative and actually knows the dishes she's talking about! Our party tried the salmon, pulled pork in chili verde, and carne asana. Free chips came aflowing once we sat down with 3 different types of salsa. Don't think the entrees are pricey, you get a lot for your buck! If you don't want any refried, white, or black beans with your entree, you can ask to change to vegetables. It's a beautiful restaurant and a little small. Be sure to make reservations if you can and always have you're entire party present or they won't seat you!
author: Jen C.

description: This place is probably one of the best Mexican food in SF, but it is not the best service. Service was exceptionally slow kinda careless. They took forever with any request, and several times servers would say they'll do it, but we had to ask many times  :(
author: Maki J.

description: Had the seafood and chicken soup both were amazing! I was pretty bummed they were out of ceviche which I was really craving.  Drinks were good not amazing and service was efficient but not overly friendly.  Would go back for that soup!
author: Dana G.

description:
Y'all know how much I love a good rezzo. This place takes reservations, has a great atmosphere, friendly staff, good food, great cocktails and Chupa Chups (the lollipops). Perfect for after work dinner with your pals. 

I deem this spot as another ol' reliable.
author: Adele A.

description: Mexican food, specifically burritos the size of small children. Yes!! Plenty of vegan options. And after filling up on said burritos, lots of cute stores in the vicinity. Definitely worth checking out for a delicious and filling lunch.
author: Alyssa J P.

description: We arrived early and enjoyed the bar while waiting for our table.   The bar tenders were thoughtful and helpful in their recommendations along with being positive and showing enthusiasm.  Dinner was great quality in the food and preparation.   The service was attentive, friendly, and responsive when we were ready to order.   The restaurant was full and had great energy with a mix of young, business, and visitors.
author: Morgan E.

description: The chips they give you as appetisers are really thin, warm, and crispy -- just how I like them. I don't remember what my main course was, but it was some kind of meat that was very tender and tasty. Good stuff.
author: Kevin C.

description:
The neon orange salsa is the truth!

-1 star for the bratty male host. He sucks. If you're going to tell people about a wait don't make it so condescending, yall just sell Mexican food.
author: Kendra S.

description:
I wanted to give Trop a 5 but I can't, it's more of a 4.8 kinda stars... because the family behind us were retarded and had let their child play phone games on full volume blast like it's their living room, WTF people, get the fuck away from me.

Otherwise it's always been a nice fat 5 stars for at least a dozen times this year alone. This is one of those places where I don't mind waiting for food served by the gods. The drinks are great, the chips and salsa are like crack candy... and the enchiladas de nopales with the creamy corn sauce is drop to your knees orgasmicly delicious. 

Also, happy hour gets filled up faster than you can click your heels, so do your best to Uber your ass out here.
author: Hungry Dan o.

description: Never eaten here, but I had a good margarita once.  Good convenient location and always seems to be busy.  The food must be good.  Will come back and update this when I get a chance to try it.
author: Jeff B.

description: Stopped in to watch the Warriors game and had some delicious guacamole and plays of fritas with black bean. The chips are served warm and the place was packed. I got a spot at the communal table and enjoyed my food while watching the game.
author: Debra R.

description:
Do you ever wish you could eat mexican food without feeling the mexican after effects? Well, not to say that there is a correlation, but you should probably try some more authentic food. Who am I kidding, maybe Mexican is just a lost cause for you, but you should definitely come here anyways. 

First off, the normal food. It is great. Tastes like actual Mexico. And the interior of Tropisueno reminds me of a beach side taqueria on the Sea of Cortez. I actually love it inside (they have a bar too) because it looks so nice, but maybe that's because the people around here look so much better than they do south of 5th street... oh well divergent much, but yes, the lunch combos come with a huge serving of beans and rice and some tomatoes, avocado, and cabbage. Normal Mexican places have good food too, you say? Perhaps, but I would argue that it is not quite this good. And you know what the best part is? Its the...

SALSAS!!! Some of the best that I've had in any Mexican restaurant, seriously. There are about 9-12 different kinds from tomato based to chili blends, from mild to pretty darn spicy, as well as an assortment of limes, cilantro, and the like. Your chips come with your food, so dig in because this sh*t is goooooood. I'm getting hyper right now just thinking about it
author: Kevin S.

description:
Every meal at Tropisueño begins with warm/super fresh tortilla chips, accompanied by 3 different types of salsa.

You have the traditional red, which has a tomato taste with a slight medium spice.

Next is the green verde sauce & is the least mild...delicious and perf for those who can't handle.

The third variety is queso, a spicy cheesy blend that will leave your mouth ablaze... in a good way.

For our appetizer: we had the ceviche sampler because we couldn't decide on which one we wanted. ($16 for the sampler // or $10 each)

Dinner Entrees are all served with traditional Mexican rice, beans & tortillas classic refried pinto, white or black beans.

 + Camarones Tropisueño ($17): large wild white shrimp, in a creamy chile de arbol sauce finished with tequila, lime and cilantro. MUST GET. 

+ Tampiqueno ($16): niman ranch beef, thin-cut grilled carne asada, served with a beef barbacoa enchilada, and guac.

Besides the amazing food & reasonable prices, the homey atmosphere and attentive service was also a major highlight of my meal. This is probably why on most days, you'll find yourself waiting for a table during prime lunch and dinner times. 

Note: make your ressies in advance!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
This place was highly rated and recommended by one of Chris's friends so we came for dinner on Sunday. It is such a fun environment and the waitstaff were so friendly! They were great at giving recommendations and were so patient with us! It was really full even at 9PM and the great thing about this place, is that its location is right next to MOMA. So go to the museum and then come here to eat!

Chris ordered the ceviche sampler and the Callos a la Plancha. The second dish was seared sea scallops on a plantain chorizo hash and avocado-tomatillo salsa and she says it was her favorite and it was also the restaurant specialty. 

I had the chile relleno de beef picadillo, which was stuffed with beef, pine nuts, olives and cheese. I really liked it with the rice and I was so full afterwards!

Apparently not full enough though, because we got their famous margaritas. I got the watermelon margarita which was super fresh and I tasted all the fresh fruit in it!
author: Julianne Z.

description: Some of the best Mexican we've ever had, Carne Asada tacos and the carnitas nachos are excellent
author: Casey M.

description: Hoping for a real good Mexican meal especially after a 45 minute wait. I will say the chips and salsa were very good but I had the Tampiqueno where the steak was so over cooked I couldn't cut it and it came barely warm. The rest of my parties food was good but not great. A little disappointing overall.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Came here wanting dinner but were a bit early so we sat at the bar for happy hour food & drinks. Glad we did!

Great happy hour food portions for cheap prices (range from $3-5) - such good portions that we ended up ordering just two items and were more than stuffed (didn't end up needing dinner after all!).

Sitting at the bar, you automatically get free chips & salsa (3 types) for FREE!

House margaritas at happy hour are $5.50. Bartenders are great -- very attentive! Tip them nicely! :)
author: Sharon O.

description:
I always thought I didn't like this place. In fact I thought I hated it. There are so many reasons why I kept coming back here despite the thought of disliking it.

I like the margaritas, they really will whoop you in the butt after one glass. If you come at the right time during happy hour, you're all beaten up by that stiff margarita before you could remember to ask for the menu. And you would not want it anymore because those chips will keep on coming! If you figured out the trick, eat less chips and try the food on their menu, I know they are not free like those chips but hella worth it cuz they're good. My favorite here is the scallops and chorize but they have good combos too!

If you ever wondered what I hate about it? It's just so loud inside, people are talking on top of their lungs. It drives me crazy. It drives me crazy because I typically come here alone, trying to have a quite meal, wrong place! My solution? I bring friends everytime I want to eat and have margaritas here and did exactly what the rest are doing. Cuz if you can't beat them, join them! Ha!
author: Lora M.

description: Everything is flawless. The orange arbol salsa, beef tacos, chocolatey mole, thin flaky chips, pastor burrito. Simply incredible food.
author: Dave J.

description: Came for dinner before a show early on a Friday night.  The place was packed, and very, very loud (everyone's trying to talk over the loud music).  Our table and our neighbor's table were not level.  The food was fine, service was prompt and efficient.  The chips and salsa selection they start you with are nice.
author: pat t.

description: So I've only experienced this having it catered to my office. The food is always amazing, having our own taco bar ect. With it being a block away I decided, maybe I should actually go in and see what else is on the menu. Yes it was horrendously busy, especially with a convention going on, but the wait was well worth it. I ordered a super fish burrito. Holy moly- a party in my mouth. I am a huge fan of fish tacos (good ones) and it was like a fish taco with in a burrito. Best thing in the world. I was so full but I kept eating it until it was all gone. I would totally come back here and order
author: Heather S.

description: Great Mexican place tucked away in an interior walkway area next to a museum. we had the salsa sampler, guacamole and queso...family of 5! the magaritas come in pint glasses! For dinner everyone had various tacos/enchilada combos...my favorite was the verde pork. least favorite was the chicken. carne asada was very good too. I saw a table with nachos...didn't see it on the menu. but maybe you can order it anyway? i'll try next time...
author: John D.

description:
With a friendly staff, fun environment, large portions, affordability, and great tasting food, this place definitely lives up to its advertising. 

The staff was hospitable and benevolent. Once I ordered, it wasn't too long before my food came. The only issue was that out of the group of four I was with, it took much longer for the last plate to arrive than it did for the prior three. There was about a 2 minute interval between the three plates and a 5-7 minutes interval between the third and last one. 

Nonetheless, the portions were large and the food was well prepared. It was delicious and visually appealing. The environment felt very lively and the decor truly reminded me of an authentic spanish pueblo. The pricing for the food was not at all that expensive. 

I ordered the Chicken Enchiladas. There were two enchiladas with spanish rice, black beans, and a salad with an avocado slice. The chicken was a bit spicy yet still full of flavor. Overall, the food was well worth the affordable price of $8. 

All in all this place was truly authentic, affordable, comfortable, and delicious. I would definitely come back another time!
author: Mark S.

description:
Fantastic. 
The margaritas are so good. 
The enchiladas, guac, salsa - all amazing. 
Best Mexican restaurant I have been too besides a few in Mexico. Ha. But this was a great place to have a wonderful dinner.
author: T B.

description:
I've been here many times covering all times of the day from breakfast to lunch to happy hour to dinner! 
Food here is to die for! Salsa bar opens up for lunch and is the only reason for me to ignore how long the queue is! About 12 different salsas and condiments can pep up any kind of plate. Horchata and Hibiscus drink make up my list of must haves.  
Reservations for dinner can be extremely challenging especially for larger groups. You are better off with at-the-door than an online reservation.
author: Deepthi M.

description:
I love my ladies. Seriously. I was introduced to this place by Lora.

Lora, Vi and I wanted to catch up on life stories and decided to do eat a meal in San Francisco. So we ended up at this gem.
 
It was packed! So we placed our names on the list, but the wait was about an hour. So we decided to go to the bar area and some friendly men (they were probably friendly because you have to realize that Lora and Vi are some lovely ladies) offered their seats. 

The waiter was friendly and offer us chips and salsa immediately. The chips were probably the best tortilla chips I ever had. We went through a few bowls of them. They didn't mind giving it to us either! 

Since Lora and I had some snacks at The Marriott earlier that day, I wasn't too hungry so I ordered an appetizer. I ordered Callos a la Plancha per Lora's suggestion. DELICIOUS! The scallops were perfectly prepared and the spiciness of the plantain and chorizo hash added a nice sweet/spicy touch to the succulent scallops. Omg, it was delicious and the perfect size. Reminded me of a tapas serving. 

For desert I had chocolate flan, and really it wasn't something I would probably order again. I love flan but the concept fell flat and the flavors were not what I expected it to be.

The vibe and environment was awesome. Young and hip. Very lively and gave us an opportunity to girl talk since it was very casual in ambiance! I love these moments! 

Would I come back again? Sure! :-) I know the ladies sure love their margaritas and they apparently serve great ones here. Even better is when Lora and I tried to be artist on the receipt. I was trying to depict "69" image and it ended up looking like a bull. Don't ask me how. LOL!!!
author: Elsvette B.

description: I've been 3 times now, and have yet to be impressed, which is why I think I won't be returning. The food is, overall, just very mediocre. It has a nice look and feel, but that doesn't make up for food quality.
author: Captain B.

description: We just had appetizers - empanadas, tacos and ceviche.  All very tasty.  The salsas were great.  One for every persuasion, including a very spicy one.  Margaritas were good too.  We were there at 5:30 on a Thursday and it was already very crowded.  Service was attentive.
author: Jo Anne G.

description: My organization had an event here in November of 2015. The management and staff couldn't have been more helpful, attentive, and courteous. The management went above and beyond with preparation, including setting up our A/V equipment. The food, drink, and service were impeccable. Many of our guests were so impressed that they went back for dinner over the remainder of the conference. I continue to receive compliments for the event. I would book an event here again in a heartbeat.
author: Ryan C.

description: I am a bit surprised by a 4 star review.  Although the Margaritas are awesome (4 stars to the bartender) the food is a little bland.  The fish burrito was deep fried and obviously sat in a warmer for a while as the breeding was soggy.  Also the guacamole side is a bit over priced for a small ice cream scoop.
author: Brian F.

description: Not bad for a lunch time meal. My coworkers and I decided to check it out. No reservations during lunch. Order at the counter to the left, take a number and grab an open table. Chaotic but I guess it works since there is quick turn over. I ordered the combo plate, tamal and steak taco. The beans and rice were pretty good. So was the steak taco. I couldn't get to the tamal because I was so full! Chips and the salsa bar were great. I'd love to come back for dinner to check out their more extensive menu.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I finally came here(I know I'm very late to the party) and my goodness it was excellent.The food freshness is stellar,the salsas are outstanding,and THE MARGARITAS ARE KILLER.Regular is dope,but the strawberry one is off the chain.Shouts to Jose our wonderful bartender who was a pleasure while my friend and I sat and ate at the bar.I wish I was still there eating.
author: Lauren V.

description: AMAZING! Perfect place for a bumpin Friday night. I got the enchiladas de nopales and the flavors were so unique and savory. Must try if you're in SF!
author: Saadhya S.

description:
The food was really good and for the price, this place was really great! I had the chicken mole and a beef dish -- both were perfect. The chicken mole was not overly salty like many others. For the food, I can see myself coming back.

I gave this place 4 stars, because I was not thrilled about the service. I used the yelp reservation function, and that was all very smooth -- seated promptly and everything. We had a a 7pm reservation, and our food did not come to our table until 7:40. The people next to us definitely got their food first. 4 stars, only because I'll come back for the food, but when the hunger anger kicks in, I'm not thrilled.
author: TY W.

description: Modern, fun and welcoming. Our bartender was excellent. Great place to hang out with a group of friends.
author: Sergio T.

description: Their green salsa is delicious and the chips were truly bottomless.  We hung out for two hours and never felt rushed. The happy hour margarita was super strong yet still delicious!
author: Jason A.

description:
fast service, amazing food, beautiful ambience/vibe!
would definitely come here again !!
author: Amrita P.

description: I've been coming here for a while now.  The Chile Relleno is out of this world delicious.  I'm not a fan of really spicy food, so I will usually order chile relleno anything I eat Mexican. Needless to say I've eaten many variations of the dish.  Tropisueno by far makes the best chili relleno.  Not soggy or bitter.  They cook it perfect, so its good down to the last bite.
author: Don S.

description: I had three carne asada tacos along with a side of refried beans and they were really good!  Tortillas and all ingredients were fresh and the meat wasn't fatty.  I will definitely return to try out some drinks and other dishes!
author: Matt E.

description: This place was satisfactory. The margaritas weren't that good - way too sour. But the tamales, tacos, enchiladas were all filling and good. Service was faulty. They made mistakes on our orders but fixed them graciously. My food came out cold but they replaced it with a new, hot plate.
author: Marilynn L.

description:
Very courteous staff, they arranged for a whole of 15 people outside the restaurant within no time. Food was ok, taste doesn't linger for a long time.
Restroom is pathetic for such a big restaurant.
author: TheLazyYelper A.

description:
4-star quality food.
3-star quality service.
1-star review because my waiter took advantage of the fact that I paid by card and added his preferred tip amount onto my bill after I signed it.
author: Oliver K.

description: yummy fresh food you can "mix and match" cafeteria style in burritos, tacos, etc.  Along with a full bar serving very good margaritas!
author: Cathy C.

description:
This restaurant gives out good vibes. Came in seat right away
really friendly servers/waiters. I got the Sopa de pollo under "Caldo"
It was larger than I expected, had LOTS of shredded chicken and a good
amount of veggies. Broth was tasteful also. At first I was expecting a chicken yellowish broth, but instead the broth was red. It was so delish.
The girlfriend got the Pollo Asada, chicken was really moist and had flavor deep
down to the bone! Whats good are the unlimted (I believe) chips and salsa, they
had a tray that offered 3, 2 mild (dark red salsa, and a guacamole mixed with green tomatillos) and one with a "kick" which was like a creamy nacho cheesy taste. Def weird but very tasteful.

Cons, its really hot in there :(
author: Hong H.

description:
Great place! In a cool area, cute small dark little restaurant (I ate there around 9pm), festive, and very friendly! Waiter was great, when he carded me for a margarita (Violeto - strong!) he noticed it was my birthday!! :) very nice, but on top of that, he was taking long to grab our check at the end....but it was only because he was grabbing me a slice of flan and a candle :) SO SWEET!!! 

Also the first Mexican restaurant I've been to that serves a trio of dips with the chips!! It was great :)
author: Sara P.

description:
Cocktails were worth 4 stars. Food was worth 3 stars. 

The one-star review is for the hostile little host who was snotty and condescending when he sat us, and then came up to our table and asked us to leave so he could seat another party not FIVE MINUTES after we paid our bill, while we were still finishing our drinks. Rude, rude, rude.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Loved the laid back feel for lunch -- ordering at the counter and choosing your table. There was no rush to leave. The margaritas are tasty and they do not go light on tequila . Shrimp tacos are full of flavor, light,  and not too messy. The guac and chips were great too. Guac had just the right amount of heat and the chips were fresh and not heavily fried or salted. We could live without the ceviche, you couldn't taste much lime or citrus. All in all a great dining experience.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Stopped here for a quick bite to eat last night and was very pleased with the food and drink.  It was happy hour and the street tacos were $2.95, I had the steak and chicken tacos and chips and guacamole both were terrific, steak was cooked perfectly. The margarita was awesome, they use agave lime juice and not simple syrup which I hate.  The margarita tasted delicious and not overly sweet.
author: Heather S.

description:
I was brought here recently with some workmates. I am usually skeptical of Mexican food outside of the mission, but my expectations were by far exceeded here. Tropisueño is a beautiful Mexican place that manages to combine affordability, decent ambiance, and very good food. Good rice and beans. Meat is tasty and of good quality.

What makes this place worth the trip is the fantastic salsa. There is a large range that fits every spice tolerance/desire. Beyond that, the flavors of the salsas are complex and don't just rely on spice to give it kick. Every salsa (of which there are many) has subtle flavor and isy complimented, but not overpowered by the spicy elements. The orange mole is particularly awesome. 

Beyond the typical Mexican offerings, this place does great burritos, surprisingly good salads, and fantastic combos for when you're super hungry. To top it off, it's not much more expensive than a Mission Taqueria and is way cleaner. If I'm downtown and looking for Mexican, you can find me here!
author: Nicolas H.

description: Service good given how busy this place is. Atmosphere also very good (manic but with order!)... The big let down was the food. We're on vacation in the US and have had 3 or 4 Mexican meals in the past 2 weeks or so but this was at the bottom of the list really...
author: Naz S.

description: Tasty Mexican food. So tasty that you'll need a reservation if you're coming here for dinner, even on a weeknight. Because the place is so busy/packed, there isn't much time for the waiters to take the time to give you quality recommendations on food/drink.
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description:
First Visit = The Best
One of the best Mexican food I've eaten. Instead of dull and semi flavored food, theirs are amazingly specific, sharp, and powerful taste. 

Their main dish portions are humungous. Best to just share a plate for two, unless you're hungry.Price is moderate ranging from $10-20

Service was FANTASTIC! Their smile always looked sincere even when we were being a little difficult. 

Second Day Visit = Bad
Some days, the food is good but not as good as some other days, and this day was just above average. We got a FML server and had a temper tantrum when I found a white strand of hair that I pulled out from my mouth from my tamale. (For the record, I have natural pure black hair and have not gotten a white hair on my young head yet) The server says, "Sorry, (nice try) we don't have any women working in the back. (So it's not my problem)" Then walks away. Well, that was a bit rude.

Later, a manager checked up on our "hairy" dish. I said the same thing to him as I had said to the server. The manager apologizes and said that every once a week they have volunteers to cook for them.They didn't charge me for the tamale in which I appreciate. But the server from there on started to ignore me and talked to only my boyfriend. "How was YOUR dish, sir?", "anything else I can get for YOU?"; giving him eye contact only and not me. Well shucks, I don't like you either FML server.

Anyways, food is good, atmosphere is great, interior design is wonderful, and service is amazing...but just not that guy.
author: Elaine N.

description:
The ambience was very nice, essentially a candlelit Mexican dinner, located right across from the MOMA. Our waitress was super sweet and attentive. We didn't make reservations and we were told the wait would be 40 minutes for two people, but we were still seated in about 15 minutes for a busy night. 

In general, SF is a city that leaves something to be desired when it comes to good mexican food. That said, the steak and the salmon dishes we ordered were very flavorful and something we would get again. They were just tangy and spicy enough. 

BUT, do not get the guacamole. It was unseasoned and it literally came in a tiny dipping dish...for $7.50. That shit not worth it!!

Overall, we'd come here again. Just will not get that guac :(
author: Mark T.

description: Love the concept here: Order at the counter where you can see the steaming trays of yummy food ready to be served up. Then pay and sit at your table and wait for it to be served. Fresh, delicious. It's located on a little alley in the block between Mission and Market which is also the path between the Metreon Center (Target) and The Westfield Center. So it's very convenient.
author: Paula H.

description: Had the fish burrito and it was good. Was weird to be have to walk up and order like I was at chipotle but people were nice.
author: Alan S.

description:
The food here is good and generous.  Everything is a little more expensive, but it is because everything is a little bigger.  Even a taco is $4 because it is the size of your fist.

Get:
Carne Asada Entree Size with Mole Sauce = $14
     It was super delicious and I couldn't even finish it.  If i did i would've had to go into fatboy beast mode and then immediately passed out afterwards.

They got a huge salsa bar and free chips (they are the super thin type).
author: Steven F.

description: I came here for dinner once, it was half decent. Came for lunch and it was like a food truck attached to a restaurant. The bartender was not really friendly; you cannot order food from the bar. You have to stand in line like its a Taco Bell and order. Food quality and price were not really in line with one another.
author: Christian H.

description:
Specifically for their happy hour: Tropisueño is awesome. These guys have a weekday happy hour until 6:30 (last call at 6) with cheap margaritas, free chips, and affordable dinner fare.

Many a good nights have been started by those margaritas. Fresh lime, agave, and decent tequila. Bartenders are super nice and servers are extremely attentive.

If you're sitting outside, bring a jacket. It's typically cold with the wind.
author: Kellen F.

description: I always get excited when I find a Mexican restaurant that serves black beans... This place didn't disappoint. The ONLY reason I gave this place 4 stars is because of the guacamole. When our guac came out it didn't seem like it was very fresh, and it had that pre-made grocery taste to it, but the 3 different selections of chili made up for it. I got the Chicken with Mole Poblano and my boyfriend got the Grilled Chicken Enchiladas. Very delicious and so much flavor and we definitely plan on returning!
author: Roxanne L.

description: I think this may be one of my few, of not first, 5-star rating. Tropisueno is now one of my favorite Mexican establishments around. My only complaint is that I left overful. Everything was ideal. The food, the drinks and the service all tucked into a fun, lively atmoshphere. WHEN I go back, I am ordering the Nopales Chicken for a second time. They are enchiladas with chicken, corn and cactus as the primary ingredients. They are sided with an awesome sauce, black beans (your choice of beans), Spanish rise and pickled cabbage. Wow! If you have never had catcus, do not be afraid my friend. Picture the density and  texture of a green pepper with a slightly sweet flavored. It is pop-delisious (my new word). Enjoy!
author: Bryan B.

description: We came here twice during our visit to San Francisco at first because it was really close to the hotel but the second time because the first visit was sooooo good.  First night had drinks at happy hour then dinner.  Great service and cool place.  The second time we came back for happy hour drinks and food and it was delicious and so reasonable priced.  Loved it!
author: Nicole D.

description:
One of the few places around SoMa that is not tourist infested.. 
Great food, good service.. friendly and fast.
Love , love their carnitas.. So tasty, perfectly melts in your mouth.
The guacamole is fresh and delish!
The chips are awesome.
Would definitely come back here again..
Believe in your senses!!!
author: Claudine V.

description:
3.5 stars!

I usually don't like to eat Mexican food, but Tropisueno is pretty good. I ordered the Camarones Tropisueno (shrimp with spicy tequila sauce) with rice. The sauce went really well with the rice, and you can actually taste the tequila in it. I wish the tequila was more mute though as it semi detracted from the overall spiciness of the sauce. The shrimps were fresh and large. The portion was very generous, about 10 shrimps in that dish. I wish there were more rice cause the sauce would've gone really nice with it.
author: Michelle L.

description: First off, I am incredibly disappointed in this place. I decided to dine here solely based off Yelp reviews because it has never wronged me before. So let's start with the basics. The hosts had a huge chip on their shoulders and too much attitude. We were hoping to dine in but due to the long wait, we decided to order food to go instead. Once we found a server to take our order, he was unsure of the menu and the system. After we got our to go and headed back to the hotel, we found out that they got our order completely wrong, we ordered chips and salsa, had no chips, 2 tacos came with the wrong kind of meat. And then lastly, the tacos we did get were dry as the Sahara. Thumbs down all around. Very disappointed.
author: Randy T.

description:
On a second visit, I went after a food and wine pairing event. Once again we ordered the "Tacos al Pastor" and "Yucatan Poc Chuc" since those were good. This time also tried their "Ceviche" and "Empanadas de Hongos" with habanero salsa. While both apps were decent, we didn't devour the them quickly; too much lime juice and doughy, respectively. We also ordered sangrias - sweet was the consensus - to go with their awesome chips & salsa. We did finish everything by the end, however!

Back to the first visit. It was after a HH event. Even after having many strong drinks that evening, we ordered a Corona. Got the 2-item "Old-school combo plates with rice and beans", choosing enchilada and tamale. Also tried the "Tacos al Pastor" and "Yucatan Poc Chuc". Everything was memorable and I thought it was worthy of future visits.

This place is rustic by design, from the surroundings to the tables right down to the seats along with some pyramid-looking pillows separating different parties. There's a communal table as well as regular open tables and even more secluded private tables. Not bad on foods and drinks and quite reasonable prices for this part of the City.
author: Peter L.

description:
Came here yesterday for lunch.

Pro tip: Don't sit outside unless you want to get harassed by the flying rat pigeons all over the place. It was so gross. 

I got the wet super burrito with chicken. It was all right. Nothing spectacular. 

Overall the restaurant is pretty nice though, they've got a bar, you order at the window, they give you a number, and you find a seat. They also had some hibiscus flavored agua fresca that was strong but pretty good. They also have combination plates which are pretty good deals.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Did not know about this some what of a hidden gem. My coworker raved about this place, so we trekked over here for lunch on a busy Wednesday. During lunch, it's not a sit and dine restaurant, but stand in line, order, grab your number and find a seat. The waiter brings your order to the table. I had the two item combo. I initially wanted the Baja Fish Taco and meat Enchilada but Fish and Shrimp are excluded from the two item combo so I ordered the Chicken Taco and Beef Enchilada. Also included a Guac appetizer with the meal. We quickly found a table and the dishes arrived in a timely manner. Portions are generous and the food was GOOD! Nor the chicken or beef were dry, but very flavorful. And of course, the guac was chunky and fresh. I will definitely come back here!
author: Dee T.

description:
Tropisueño kind of almost feels like a chain restaurant, especially if you come before 5pm when you go through the hot food line, pay for your food, and then wait at the bar for a drink. The whole set-up has me a tad disoriented.

However, they make SUCH good cocktails. A single mezcal margarita will definitely get you buzzed-to-mildly drunk. Hats off to you if you go in for a second. The bar staff are funny and rad guys too.

This seems like a pretty good spot for happy hour drinks if you're going to be sitting at the bar. Come after work and eat an entire guacamole appetizer platter for dinner - you're an adult, god damn it.
author: K M.

description:
I'm amazed a place like this exists.  I had written off all Mexican around the financial district, but this spot finally meets my approval.  Great free chips.  Salsa bar is outstanding; really liked the dark green variety.  I had a beef quesadilla and it was $6.70 with tax.  A good amount for lunch.  Beef was good, but not great.  Still, very enjoyable and a good place to go with a group.  Outdoor seating looked like it would be nice, if weather is ok.

Note: they do partake in the scam surcharge binge at this place.  and it's labeled as "CODB Surcharge" of about 4%.  Maybe "Cost of Doing Business"?  Which is exactly why it's a scam to charge for this.  Raise you price if your cost of doing business is too high!  But I enjoyed enough to not take away a star for this.
author: Marc S.

description:
I mostly come here for the happy hours, which is quickly becoming one faves.  The drinks are priced really well.  $5 for a margarita and $2 for a tecate!  The margarita's are delicious, some of the best in the city.  The chili salt just completes it.

The complimentary chips and salsa are amazing.  The chips are fresh and still warm when they are served.  Rivals and owns Chevy's Chips.  You get three salsa.  A creamy orange sauce like one, a roasted one, and green one.  All outstanding on their own.  

The food is also very good and and flavorful.  This might not be the most authentic Mexican restaurant, but the portions, quality and tastes are all top notch.

Pro Tip:  Get HH Tecate with the chili salt and a lime on the side.  Best thing ever!!!

The bar are is small and packs up really fast. Dinning area also gets really busy!
author: Veasna H.

description:
I always tell everyone that I know that after living in San Diego for 3 years, I've become picky with my Mexican food that no other city or place can beat SD's. After visiting SF last weekend with my family, we decided to go to this little restaurant that was moments away from our hotel.  It had excellent reviews and a short wait, but it was a Mexican food joint.  I was skeptical.

Going in, you can immediately see that the interior is really neat!  The place is dimly lit and has an almost Inca-like atmosphere as the furniture and decor holds many art pieces of that culture.  

I decided to go classic and try the Chicken with Mole Poblano (that was my first time).  My family ordered a shrimp ceviche, tacos, and a flauta.  My chicken with mole poblano was amazing!  I've never tried such a thing, and don't let the "mexican chocolate" deceive you!  It's not sweet at all...in fact, the chocolate has a bitter taste that blends unbelievably well with the rich, savory taste of the chicken.  I loved my dish so much!  The tacos and flauta were really good as the meat inside was marinated extremely well, and the ceviche was great too!  The shrimps were very fresh, and the taste of the ceviche was simple but had great flavor!

Service here was very helpful and friendly as our waiter explained to us each dish and his favorites.  It can get pretty crowded here I bet during happy hours, but we went around 6pm for dinner, and it was decent with no wait!  

It's a little hidden from the main street, but I highly recommend all to try this place!  They really know how to make their Mexican food...guess SD doesn't have it all.
author: Kim H.

description:
My friends and I came for early dinner and drinks to celebrate my sister's birthday. Upon arrival we were seated at the bar.
