We ordered a first round of drinks to kick off the celebration, soon after we ordered food and began to have a great time laughing and participating in the self promoted lively experience of the restaurant. After 30mins, I asked to order another round of drinks for the table, at which time I was told we had been " cut off." We were shocked and quite confused as to why we were cut off after ONE drink.

I asked to speak with a manager, at which time I was directed to a man that had been standing by our table for the last 20 mins, which now heightened my discomfort. The manager, summoned 4 other men ( including the bartender) to also be included in this conversation that I thought was going to be between him and I- I suppose my 5'0 petite frame intimidated him.  I asked the manager why my friends and I had been cut off, he replied by saying  " it is our policy to cut people off after a point." Confused, I said, well is one drink that point- because that is all we have had. He then proceeded to tell me, he will no longer serve us alcohol because one person in our party appeared drunk and he no longer wanted to serve us alcohol.  I asked, so an entire group of people are cut off because of your perception of one person?  He again repeated the standard lines above, " it is our policy to cut people off after a point." 

At no point during our time at this restaurant was anyone in our party less than appropriate for the setting of the restaurant, and therefore the cause for the "cut off" was clearly motivated by something else.  

Our treatment was motivated by the fact that a group of young Black professionals were sitting in the restaurant laughing and interacting in a way that is outside of the white cultural norm of San Fransisco. Those interactions made the manager feel uncomfortable- and in a white hegemonic place like San Fransisco anything outside of white norms is decidedly not acceptable. 

We proceeded to pay our bill and leave the restaurant, it was clear, by the policing of our table and our behavior that we were not wanted. This Mexican restaurant that was being managed by a white man predominantly serving white people has created an atmosphere build on white norms and white comfortably and does not make room for norms outside of the status quo- and quite honestly has no problem dehumanizing and creating a frightening and uncomfortable atmosphere for people outside of their decided upon norms. This behavior is not unexpected, however, it is and will always be appalling.
author: Isha T.

description:
EEK! 

Got a salad to go - big mistake. 

Basically got wet, wilted greens (completely soaked in sauce from the meat and beans) topped with chicken (not much), beans (too much), sauteed veggies. I wish I had taken a photo of my sad salad. It was really, really, unappealing to eat it. Wasn't impressed with the taste either. 

Cute ambiance inside. I would have to come back for a sit-down meal to make up for this experience, but I have a feeling it won't be for a while..
author: Michelle K.

description: I think it helps to make a reservation, but don't go here for a quick meal - it took at least a half hour before our order was taken d/t the busyness (granted it was an early Friday night).  They serve the table with chips and salsa/guac/something else and I ended up eating more of those chips than my actual meal due to the long wait - could probably blame it on no self-restraint but I am glad I ordered only an appetizer for my main course!  The scallop dish was delicious!
author: Karen S.

description: Went on a really busy night, and was seated right away. The service was incredible and the mole sauce was the best I've ever had! Would go back a million times.
author: Courtney M.

description:
A few of us went out and were hungry and near Tropisueno, so despite me saying I would not go back to Tropisueno, I did, and the place totally redeemed itself. I had gone for lunch once and found the food lacking flavor. Well, whoever is cooking up dinner has the right touch! The chips and variety of salsas were very good. I ordered the Camarones Tropisueno (shrimp in a creamy spicy sauce) and fell in looooooove. So freakin good! I love rich foods, and am a sucker for anything in a cream sauce, so I tried this out and it was fantastic. 

Also, I forgot to specify re-fried beans as my side, and whole beans came out, which is the default type of beans you get. I quietly said "Aw man! I forgot to ask for re-fried beans!" to my husband, and the waiter heard me and offered to bring me out a side of re-fried beans! It was totally my fault for not specifying re-fried, so I thought it was very nice of him to fix my own mistake. I am now a fan of Tropisueno's and will definitely be coming back for the Camarones Tropisueno!
author: Liz M.

description: Good food, drinks and service. Very loud music that makes communication at table very difficult. Clean and inviting atmosphere.
author: Khaled S.

description:
This is one of my favorite HAPPY HOUR spots in the FiDi!! Though be warned, if the weather is crappy, the area in which you have to be happy is relatively small as Happy Hour prices are only available at the bar and patio. My suggestion: get there early or send someone to save some spots!! Happy Hour is from M-F, 4-6

THE GOOD:
They have 3 sauces available for consumption along with their never ending supply of chips. Each of the sauces has a different spice level (as expected) but the stand out sauce for me is a slightly creamy, spicy red sauce. i have no idea what they put into it but I like to mix the creamy one with the regular and I am in heaven. Can eat those damn addictive chips all night. Did I mention they never end??

Happy Hour food prices are also totally worth it. You can get tacos, guac, ceviche,  quesadillas and more for under $5. I will vouch for all the items on the happy hour menu :D

The staff has always been super friendly and accommodating even when we had groups of 12+ hanging out for happy hour. The food comes out quickly and the restaurant is always very clean and inviting.

THE SUPER GOOD (if drinking):
1) If you have 6 people drinking at the bar together the 6th person, or host, gets drinks all night for free!! (Ask/tell the bartender) 

2) The Violet Margarita is my most favorite drink in the city. It has violet liquor (never even heard of this before here) and vanilla salt on the rim... yes, vanilla, freaking salt. It's a little sweet from the vanilla with the tang of the tequila plus a slight floral under tone of the violet. It's a brilliantly balanced concoction. Plus, it's purple!!

THE NOT SO GOOD:
I have only eaten a sit down dinner here twice, even though I have been to the restaurant dozens upon dozens of times.  It has probably been over 2 years so read this with that in mind. I don't confess to remember all the specifics of the meals. What I do remember is that the beans and rice were pretty bland. Overall I would be open to giving them another try for dinner.
author: Dana V.

description:
The food at Tropisueno is very good but we were very disappointed with the service. I can't handle spicy food so I asked the waitress to tell me which items were not spicy. She told me that all of them could be made mild. When I tried to order a shrimp dish, she said, "oh that wouldn't be good without the spicy
sauce." Okay- so we had a nice meal and then signaled for the check. Then we waited and waited and waited for more than 10 minutes in which I tried to get the waitress's attention- and then finally flagged down a busboy to get the bill. After waiting another 5 minutes for the bill, I won't be rushing back here. I totally understand being busy but it literally takes 2 minutes to drop a check off.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Hmm, what can I say.  Efficient, good ingredients, nice cooking, practically no services.  Not really expensive.

The chips and (do it yourself) salsa were excellent.  My fish taco was slightly over-fried, but very well done.  Many people order the mission style thicker-than-your-forearm burrito.  It was too much for me to consume.
author: Sin-Yaw W.

description:
Shady practices and rude Service. Just so you know. Don't make reservations for a table unless you are okay with them running out of the dishes you want and then giving you a lecture when you don't order enough. Here's a thought: Don't run out of 3+ dishes and then don't say anything to customers who can't find anything other than one more thing off the menu. And don't arrive 10 minutes early and want to be seated in an almost empty dining section. I've spent hundreds of dollars drinking in their bar - you better believe I'm never going back. And neither should you. 

I should also mention that last time I was there they ran out of the beer that was on happy hour so I was forced to order a full priced drink. Now that I think about it, it was probably not a coincidence. 

Go over to the Press Club. I had a much better time and they didn't run out of Empanadas. I hope Tropisueno goes out of business so a better restaurant can take over the space.
author: Analisa S.

description: I came here with a big group for happy hour, and we were unfortunately seated outside in the freezing cold because there wasn't enough room inside. I got a shot of tequila and a margarita to warm up. The margarita is very strong! Which is how I like it, so I recommend it. I also got a beef taco and a fish taco, and I really was not impressed with either of them. I have heard excellent reviews from credible foodie friends about this place, so maybe I just have to give it a try not during happy hour.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Was in town for a conference so decided to stop here for lunch. This review may not reflect an average dinner so beware, tour experience may be higher.

My two work colleagues waited in a line out the door. We went thru a typical Chipotle style serving line. I ordered a chicken enchilada with mole sauce. It came with chips, black beans and rice. It was very good, but accurately priced. It wasn't a deal, nor over priced. Good solid Mexican food if on a corporate card but wasn't impressed.
author: Robert M.

description:
Remember:
*Your "smart" phone may not be that bright..because this restaurant is not on Jesse street.  You've been forewarned: saw man whip out his penis, peeing on the wall there.. along with a group of older men carrying half empty wine bottles outside some bar on Jesse St..
-It is next to the Marriot and labelled clearly.  (For a sec, I thought maybe it was some cool secret restaurant tucked in an alley...don't even go there.)

Food:
*guac: I have never had bad guac.  This was no exception.  Fresh, decent.
*huaraches: excited to see this on the menu.  The crisp huarache itself was yummy, topped with 3 types of pork..who doesn't love variety!?  Carnitas and chile verde so tender, flavorful.  Never knew I liked child verde that much.  Al pastor, not so much..was D-R-Y.  
*chips: as everyone said, light, crisp, but hard to dip into the guac bc it would keep breaking..so use a knife. Problem solved.

Cute spot. Liked the ambiance and interior.  Great service as well.
author: Kimberly C.

description: This place is pretty good--a bit over-hyped and a bit overpriced.  I had a salsa verde burrito and enjoyed it enough that I'd go back to try something else.  My friend and I beat the lunch crowd, which was a good thing, as this place seems to get PACKED.  All tables were gone and there was a line out the door, by the time we left.  With the great reviews and the huge crowd, I would have expected a bit more bang for my buck.  I've had comparable burritos off of a taco truck--that's not a dig on the quality, since Mexican food from a taco truck can be damn delicious--but, I probably paid $5-$6 for the taco truck burrito.  This one ran me about $11.  Like I said, I'd go back...but, most likely, it'd be on a day where a friend wants to head in. If it's just me, or up to me, I'd probably get my mexican fix elsewhere.
author: Pablo O.

description:
Note that this review is about the lunch menu.  

Super fast service but there's always a crazy long line.  On day one I got the chicken mole with a coke.  The salsa bar is awesome and has tons of options, with all different spice levels of salsa.  The next day I went for lunch I got the quesadilla with carnitas, a fish taco, and a horchata.  All very delicious.  

What did I learn today?  You know it has to be good if there is a line.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This place is great for happy hour!  Margaritas are $6.50, tacos are $2.50, Fernet shots are $3 (unheard of!).  The portions are very generous and chips and salsa are free!  It's hard these days to find free chips and salsa in the Bay area.  

Tropisueno has a designated happy hour area that gives the initial impression of having to go to the bar and order your own drink and food, but there is table service.  It's very nice when it gets really busy, which it tends to because it's such a great happy hour. 

Service is great, staff is friendly, ambiance is nice, and food and beverages are always good.  

There is outside seating as well.
author: Ellen B.

description:
When you're craving Mexican, this is exactly the experience you're looking for. Margaritas, Negro Modelos, fresh thin chips, salsa options and a big menu.

I had the carnitas tacos, which were absolutely delicious. My dp had the half-chicken, which he said was a little dry.

The wait for two on a Wednesday night was 45-50 minutes, so we ate at a communal table after just a few minutes' wait.

A short distance from BART.
author: Karen Z.

description:
Cute restaurant, very authentic but packed!
1 hour wait for dinner. But the staff is very sweet and warmth.
We ordered to go (ready in 10min).
Prices were different from what it is posted here in yelp.
Also, the fish tacos no longer exists.
And the drinks are more ice than anything.
The two item are tiny.
author: Natalia M.

description: This place was fabulous. The price was right, the ambiance, the service (semi full service), the food and the bartender shaking our margaritas to the perfect music!  It's hidden off the street and I'm so glad we found it.  After your eat, grab a cream puff at beard papas next door!
author: R. L.

description:
I love Tropisueno! I have been here quite a few and owe it a review. They don't use sweet n sour in their Margs!! I had the callos a la plancha, amazing! I'm
Usually not a fan of flan but theirs changed my life. Service was great as well.I will be back.
author: Monique Q.

description: Salsa, guacamole, margaritas...amazing...atmosphere...food...just okay.  This is our go to spot for margaritas, but not for Mexican.  Such a tourist spot, this place becomes often too much; however, the drinks are worth it!  Definitely better places to get Mexican food in the city...if you are willing to leave the FiDi area!  However, if you really just want some really good salsa or margaritas...it is worth the wait!
author: Sarah M.

description:
This place was fantastic.

I consider myself a Mexican connesieur, and I would recommend this place in an instant (I actually already have to multiple people in the last 18 hours!)

To start with, we stood at the bar and ordered margaritas. We were given complimentary chips with a trio of salsas while waiting for our table, and they were fantastic! I am not a huge margarita fan (they didn't have any beer that struck my fancy), but I didn't hate the drink. I have heard they are actually delicious, so don't take my word on the drink!

Next - the entree. I got the Tres Cochinitas - which is pork three ways on sopas (fried) - style planks. Woo were they delicious. The carnitas style was my favorite, but each and every one had their own great qualities.

I just can't stop raving about this place, and look forward to going back and trying new items on the menu!
author: Mitzy B.

description: Brought some out-of-town friends here for dinner. As crowded as it was (we were in the midst of RSA, so there was a huge post-Moscone crowd), we were able to walk in and snag the last table. The sauces for the chips were fantastic, and so was my vegetable stew. We also tried the Gloria, Spicy Mango Margarita and some raspberry cocktail whose name I forget. All very tasty and reasonably priced. If you're looking to glam up your nacho night, this is a good place to do it.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I like that the entrance is off to the side and not on a busy street. The interior is really cool and they did a great job decorating it. It felt very rustic and inviting.

The chips and salsa here are addicting! They give you three types which is awesome. My house margarita was pretty fantastic and you can definitely taste the tequila. For dinner, I ended up getting the mix and match 2 items- carne asada taco and chicken enchilada. Our food came out fast and boy was it a lot of food! The portions here are generous. The taco was flavorful and fresh, but I was underwhelmed by the enchilada. Very traditional food with no extra spark.

Everything was good, but nothing was extraordinary enough to make me want to come back. There are so many great Mexican places in San Francisco that are better and cheaper. You basically pay for the atmosphere and drinks here.
author: Alisha K.

description: Love this place!  Great food, good prices, fast service, friendly waitstaff.  It's an excellent spot for a work lunch.  The line is long but it moves quickly and everyone is so nice.  The salsas are excellent.  You will want to go back again and again for the enchiladas.
author: Elise G.

description:
I don't even know how to start this review because I can't fully blame the awful service on my waitress. I guess I'll start by saying the only part of our service that was amazing was how quickly they brought us chips, salsa, and water. 
Our waitress came over after about ten minutes to take our order. I ordered the moletes and the combo with two enchiladas and one chicken tamale. The moletes came out with out the black beans or pickled cabbage garnish but the food runner took them back and brought the correct dish in less than 5 minutes. However, when The entrée plate came out and was also wrong, I kid you not, it took 25 minutes to toss a tamale on a plate with two enchiladas. No one apologized for messing up the order, our waitress was stretched so thin she never really checked on us, and the manager honestly seemed to be a bit useless. If you have a waitress who has from my count more than 12 tables to care for on a Friday night you need to roll up your darn sleeves and jump in to help her. Bus tables, take drink orders, run drinks, check on tables who have complained because their food took over 30 minutes, do something other than awkwardly walking around the outside area. to finish off our dinner we sat outside waiting for 25 minutes to pay our bill I eventully got so irritated I went inside to pay. 
we come here for lunch quite often and dinner occasionally, hopefully tonight was just an off for the restaurant.
author: Ranesha M.

description:
Enjoyed our late night meal on a Wednesday after the Giants' World Series Win. The best item is the chicken soup. To die for! And it's huge! Not to mention the rice and pinto beans, just heavenly. 

As for drinks, the margarita is delicious.
author: Adrianne D.

description: Solid Mexican place with an extensive menu. I stopped by on a Saturday around noon and the line was very manageable. We found a table for four right away, and were eating less than ten minutes after we ordered our food. Shrimp burrito with pinto beans was absolutely fantastic, and lots of salsa to add. This is definitely more of an upscale Mexican joint than a hole-in-the-wall style mom & pop, but it's delicious regardless of your preference.
author: Kaysee T.

description:
Service: fast, friendly, easy to make reservations online (huge plus).

Food: overall good and no complaints. Seemingly endless chips and three different types of dip to try! I got the 2 combo plate with a chicken flauta, carne asada taco, black beans, and rice. The flauta was crispy and chicken was juicy. The taco was good but it didn't stand out to me-pretty standard. Around $12 for this option. 

Ambiance: seemed a little fancier but it fits the trend of the other restaurants in the Yerba Buena area. Good location close to BART.

After being away from the US for awhile any place with free water, good service, and Mexican food seems heavenly to me. A little pricey for Mexican considering what you can get in the Mission but if you care about a more upscale atmosphere this is a good spot.
author: Salma R.

description: Great food and atmosphere, definitely a Friday night with friends spot.  The drinks are gigantic and strong.  Best of all my end for food and drinks was only 30 bucks.  Can't beat that!!!
author: Rene M.

description:
Attn:  Families with children - this is not place to go at 5:30 PM on a weekday afternoon.  You'll be relegated to a corner table sentenced to bad service while the easier tables who are ordering nothing but drinks and guac get their food first.

We were staying nearby and wanted a good dinner that could accommodate our party of 5.  Yelp popped this baby to the top of the list.  We arrived shortly before dinner service started and was asked to return at 5:30 when the dinner service started.  No problem, plenty to see and do nearby.  (The MoMa store next door is a fun place to kill time!).

We returned, were seated, and told we needed to vacate our table by 7 PM as another reservation would be coming.  A Things that make you go HMM moment but okay, no biggie.  

We were walked past about 10 empty tables, and then seated in the corner next to a very large fern that the host had to shift otherwise it would be joining us for dinner.  Not kidding.

We ordered, and then waited.  And waited.  We watched every other table get their food except ours.  About 30 minutes later the food finally arrived.  Every time our server walked by he said 'your food is coming out' - and it never came.

Albondingas soup - way too spicy for children (we were warned that it would be a little spicy but even my husband, who lives for a good jalapeno pepper, said it was too spicy.

Guacamole - a rip off as usual.  Small bowl, maybe made with 1 or 2 avocados at best.

I had the taco sampler - carnitas - yummy.  asada - meh.  chicken - ugh.

We also had the pork adobo - tough meat.

We also had the ceviche - save yourself the $$ and skip it here. 

Overall it was a disappointing experience.  Follow other Yelpers advice and go to the Mission instead.    I don't think we're coming back.
author: N B.

description:
I have mixed feelings with  Tropisueno...  My friend ordered a ceviche and it was amazing!  I ended up eating all of it. He also ordered the chicken, which he enjoyed.  

I ordered the vegetarian pozole and could not eat it because it was too spicy!  Also, you are supposed to serve pozole with onions, avocado, lettuce and lime and it came with none of those.  Not even tortillas!  Finally, it had very few hominis (the corn), which are my favorites in this plate.

Besides that, service was slow and not particularly great.  I have eaten here before and had a better experience, but this time I was not pleased.  :(
author: Lucia M.

description:
Well I wanted one of their well touted margaritas.  But it was lunchtime and I had a long afternoon of meetings so it was to be food only on my visit.  But they sure looked good at the tables around me!

interesting concept.  It's like cafeteria style Mexican, or as one in our group put it, "fancy Chipotle".  Well fancy or not- the food was good, the prices were right and I liked being able to sit outside on a sunny day to enjoy it.

Know that you order at the counter so get in line and spend some time looking at the wall posted menu that lists out a wide range of offerings.  Once up to the counter- you place your order, continue on to the beverage station, and then you pay and are handed a number to put on your table.

My food came up quickly, two beef tostadas with rice and beans, and a wonderful ceviche to start.  And all of that for the low price of about $20!

Baskets of hot chips are brought to your table but if you want the salsa to go with them- you need to get that inside.  And don't forget (as I did) to pick up some napkins and flatware inside or you will be making another trip to retrieve it.

Good food served fast at reasonable prices.  Sounds like a winner to me!
author: Carol K.

description: I like this place more and more every time I go. The salsa bar is amazing - especially the orange one. And the salmon is serious off the chain. Like WOW good. They accommodated by Paleo-esque ways. The wait can be a little crazy at all times - for lunch and dinner. But this place is seriously good, and unique for the pricepoint/level in Mexican cuisine. In a touristy spot, but locals-worthy for sure.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The chips are fantastic. Probably the best item at the restaurant.

The food is strongly mediocre. My friend ordered the chicken mole and the chicken was diced into pieces. Never really seen this before with mole. I've had mole in Mexico City and Houston and was very unfamiliar with the version that they served at Tropisueno. I tried the mole and wasn't really impressed by it.

I ordered the barbacoa. My dish lacked flavor. I have high standards for barbacoa coming from Texas. They should just take this item off the menu if they can't cook barbacoa like the big dogs. 

Avoid the namesake Tropisueno torta. easily the worst torta I've had in my life and was still hungry after consuming. No idea what they were thinking putting that on the menu. 

It's a good spot to go for lunch if you have a medium size group of people, but get there early because the line can get out the door.

Not thrilled to return unless i get invited back by coworkers.
author: Anthony G.

description: I love this place. I love the casual lunch they do and their happy hour so I decided to give dinner a try. It was fantastic! Food was exciting and well executed, and the server Kayla was spot on. She was attentive and recommended food and cocktails based on her assessment of what we said our tastes are. Nailed it. Will definitely be back!
author: William A.

description:
Yes, I gave this place One star, because its lowest rating, it deserves none. Instead of "Tropisueno," which translates to Tropical Dream, it should be named, "Tropipesadilla," which translates to Tropical Nightmare!" OK, yes a bit harsh, it is like Taco Bell. I do have to disclose I am Mexican and a foodie, hence my Mexican food standards are high. 
The Place- You do order similarly as if you are in a fast food restaurant, like Taco Bell; choose from menu on wall, order, pay, take a number to your table then food is brought to table. Nice stereotype Mexican colors, furniture, etc. We were brought chips to our table and no salsa. I asked for salsa and the "restaurant attendant" pointed towards bar and said, "salsa is by the bar." OK, I thought, I walked over to bar, there are small 2 oz. plastic containers on bar counter, to put the salsa in, which is to the right of the bar. There was a guy ordering a drink at the bar, right where the plastic containers are placed, I said "excuse me," he would not move, so I extended my arm in front of him, grabbed containers, got salsa, back to my table; Phewww!
Food--I ordered the Chicken Mole, with rice and beans, It was not a problem to substitute corn for flower tortillas; Problem- tortillas are not home made. Mole, worst I have had, the mole at the , "Hispanic" isle at your grocery store is probably better. It tasted spicy, not good authentic Mexican spicy, it was black pepper spicy. The chicken was cut in chunks and dry, rice and beans were bland. It was like bad cafeteria Mexican food. 
My boyfriend, (Mexican, NOT a foodie), ordered grilled shrimp tacos. His description, they were ordinary, sauce was flavorless and tortillas. Definitely, will not be back, hopefully their lease is up soon and someone else who truly cares about serving authentic, fresh, seasonal ingredients, Mexican food will take over this place. 
P.S. In the business introductory, it states, "They wondered why pay more than $10.00 for a cocktail?" Our margaritas were more than $11.00 dollars, which is fine, just don't give the perception cocktails would be less than that..
author: Mari H.

description: Check marks all across the board: great food/flavors (so many sauces! and addicting chips), fair prices, lively atmosphere.
author: Howe L.

description: Wathery and tasteless guaca mole, salsa seamed to be those bought in can from the supper market. Ordered ceviche and tacos, both were absolutely nothing out from the ordinary and both seamed to be out of any kind of spice and tasteless. I love Mexican food and have already ate in so many different places and I can affirm, it's very easy to find better Mexican food than this one, definitely doesn't worth the trip.
author: Carla L.

description:
This place is great for lunch or dinner depending on what you are looking for.  I go here at least once a month for lunch and get their super burrito which is delicious.  They also have free chips and salsa as well as a salsa bar with a wide assortment to choose from.  Any Mexican restaurant that has a wide variety of salsas I usually find myself happy with.  Their orange sauce is awesome and I definitely recommend it.  

I have also gone here for dinner and at that time they go away from the line ordering style and it is a fancier sit down place with different menu options.  The food is good for dinner too, but I prefer their lunch atmosphere more.
author: Dan C.

description: LOVE this place ! Great service,food,atmosphere ! Make a reservation as this place is always packed. Well done !
author: Brittany M.

description:
This restaurant is wonderful! I'd thoroughly recommend it to anyone!

The food is to die for, surpassing any Mexican food I've tried elsewhere, with extraordinary flavours, vast options and plentiful portions! Our meals tasted fresh and authentic, which is just what you want when you dine out.

We had cocktails as well- a grapefruit margarita and a fruity fizzy cocktail - and these were delicious accompaniments to the food! Very tasty indeed.

The service was wonderful too! The staff were all extremely friendly, attentive and helpful despite it being a very packed night in the restaurant. Though it was heaving there was no sense of wing rushed or any grumpiness from the waiting staff either, who were clearly being run off their feet.

The biggest advice I would give here is book in advance or be prepared to wait. We luckily only had to wait for a short time, but we heard people being told there was an hours wait (on a Wednesday night) so it's something to bear in mind. Don't be disheartened by the wait though- it's well worth it!! Go grab a drink and come back, or you'll be missing out!
author: Kerry G.

description: This place was okay. There was a bit of a wait, but given the area and night we went, that's no big deal. Service was a little slow. The chips and salsa they give you were pretty good. I thought the options for vegetarians and vegans were lacking. The seasonal vegetable tacos were not very good. Wouldn't go back.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Based on the recommendation of the waiter, I got the Chicken Mole Poblano.  I did not enjoy it at all. The chicken just did not have enough flavor for me, even though it was covered in a sauce. I also got the Platanos Fritos without the toppings (beans and sour cream) which was average.  

Unfortunately, I wouldn't come back to this restaurant unless it was the last place open.
author: Lauren S.

description:
My friend and I had just flown into San Francisco in the morning and wanted to grab a late lunch/early dinner during our first day of sightseeing. This place was pretty close by to where we were doing some shopping, and we decided to give it a try.

I'm definitely glad we did! I liked that lunch was very casual (you order at a counter and food is brought to you). We just made a quick stop at the bar to order house margaritas before choosing a table outside to enjoy the beautiful, warm weather.

The margarita was fantastic. It definitely packed a punch but was still flavorful. As a bonus, they used some sort of rimming salt that had some extra spices in it. 

I had the regular pollo asada quesadilla (ordered it "super," meaning with sour cream and guacamole). My friend ordered a (HUGE) burrito. For my dish, the portion was also quite generous and everything came out hot. Everything on the quesadilla tasted very fresh and had tons of flavor. Even at an off-peak time (3 or 4pm) this place was pretty busy; I'm not surprised by this given how delicious the food was! I would definitely go back next time I'm in the area.
author: Brandon F.

description:
I've never felt so compelled to write a review until the experience I had here last night. After enjoying a great meal of enchiladas and margaritas, we came to find out that my sister's purse had been stolen. Now mind you, we were at the bar and she had used the hook right below her. After double checking everywhere around us, we alerted our waiter and he immediately reacted. We had the feeling that every staff member in the place was on high alert for her purse. The staff was quick to check the lost and found, with no luck. The management also responded and tried to place who could have been there last. We ended up parting ways so we could file the police report, but they made sure we were taken care of and kindly comped our meal. 
So, I would like to thank our awesome waiter (I'm so sorry for not remembering your name!!) for the great service and excellent tequila recommendations along with the rest of the staff for handling the situation as professionally as possible. There are good people in the world, thanks for restoring our faith in humanity :)
author: Nicole M.

description:
Need an upscale Mexican food locale in SoMa / financial district? Go no further! Great food, great ambiance,  great service, and holy crap their chips and salsa (complimentary of course) are GREAT.

The Tampiqueño is just MEAT MEAT MEAT (pause) and actually really good as well. Come here after happy hour down at Amber or something, but Tropisueño was definitely a place I'd love to frequent again and try other things  on the menu.

Solid solid solid, albeit not five star and mind blowing, but reallyyy close!
author: Joseph L.

description:
I had a break today right in the middle of lunch hour rush.  I walked by this place earlier and it looked interesting so I rushed back over.  A not-too-large foreign tour group arrived right before me.  So it was a bit chaotic as they did not understand Mexican food or the concept of ordering up front and grabbing a table and waiting for it to be delivered to you.

But the staff was awesome and patient and had all of our orders taken in record time.

Before I knew it the food was being set at my table.

The food was delicious and plentiful.  You will not leave hungry.  It was very affordable.

For meats we had carnitas (shredded pork) and chicken.  Both tender, juicy and bursting with flavor.

The chips were freshly made and the guacamole top notch. 

The food runners were awesome and attentive.
author: Don M.

description: This place has exceeded any and all expectations. The service is incredible. The manager Alex is fantastic and our waitress only recommended the absolute best. Highly recommended.
author: Katie V.

description: I'd like to like this place but it lacked in some areas. The costumer service was very good and speedy. The food is what I felt was lacking. I hope the next time I try this place out I have a better experience.
author: Joji V.

description:
I'm loving it so much I came here twice on a Friday night. 

This place is crackin'! We came here and the tiny bar area was packed! We squeezed our tooshies up to the bar to order and we were greeted with some super friendly bar tenders. I got the house margarita. It has the WOW factor I'm looking for in a drink. A margarita on the rocks rimmed with salt and chili powder, say what!!?? That's unique.

I heard the salsa was amazing so I had the bar tender hook me up with some. Another WOW factor item! You get three different salsas with your chips: orange, green and red. at first I really liked the orange salsa and I wanted to love it based on all the reviews but then the more I ate, the more I disliked the sunflower-ish flavor. However, the green, avocado salsa saved the day with it's special pizazz. The chips were warm and fresh too.

The thing that made me give this place 5 stars is their finishing touch. When they bring you your bill you get a Mexican lollipop. And I mean the good ones. Not the generic ones that your cousin gets for their kids pinata. I think the brand is Chupa. It is such a clever little treat!
author: Chanelle N.

description:
What an incredible experience at this authentic yet trendy Mexican eatery!

Came here for Valentine's Day with my partner and a friend and we were initially worried that there'd be a huge wait given the holiday, however, we were happy when we were seated within 2 minutes of arriving. The server was kind and attentive, making sure we were shown hospitality throughout our visit. They cleverly place jars of fresh water on your table for refills. I ordered the two tacos - one carne Asada and the other chicken tinga - and they were incredibly delicious! Decent portion sizes and they even serve 3 salsas with their house chips. To drink, I ordered the Pepino Margarita, which complemented my meal with its crisp and fresh taste. 

The only downside if any is the overt dim lighting in the restaurant. It didn't affect our experience, however we wouldn't have minded having the interior more lit. 

If you're in the Union Square area, this place is a must and worth all the commotion.
author: Simon C.

description:
This is my favorite Mexican spot in the city! I love spicy food and they have a habanero salsa available upon request - 10 points in my book for that alone! Their service is always great and the margaritas are bomb. Their agua frescas are also super yummy. I usually get their super chicken burritos for lunch, I love their enchiladas, the tamales are good but can sometimes be a little dry/too much masa, and the chile rellenos are delish. 

I recommend making reservations for dinner because there can be a bit of a wait, their happy hour is legit, and even though the lunch line is long it moves quickly.
author: Sumeena B.

description:
Nothing really special about this place. I thought the food was average.

I got the Tacos de Cachete...

I liked the free chips.
author: Margaret R.

description: The best chips and salsa I have ever had! They give you 3 different types of salsa and the chips are thin and crisp. The food was delicious too.  My husband and I split a meal because they give you so much. I got the house margarita, it wasn't my favorite but it was alright.  The vibe is very cool in there as well.  I will definitely be going back!
author: Leslie M.

description:
I am already in love with this restaurant. I went there with my friend for dinner. 
Food: 4 star We got chips as starters. With 3 different kinds of sauce. Then we got ceviche as starter. It was average. I have had better ceviche. As an Entree we had Combination place which was pretty flavourful.
We asked for Vanilla Flan but sadly they ran out. Then we got chocolate flan which was nice. I am personally a big fan of deserts. I would give the desert 3 out of 5.
Drinks: Wine (Malbec) , Beer (Modelo), Tequila ( they have a good selection of Tequila)
Ambiance: 5 star. I love the casual look of the restaurant and the lighting is nice. 
Service: 5 star. Our waitress was quite friendly. She made us feel welcomed at the restaurant and made sure that out food came on time. 
Overall the experience was quite nice. This is a nice place for casual outing.
author: Kirandeep K.

description:
I ordered a burrito with tinga (roasted chicken), rice, beans, veggies and other fixins. The tinga is delicious - a standout. I also got a salad. I thought it would be a small side salad but it was a big plate of salad - greens, jicama and other items with citrus vinaigrette. Very good. The bartender was busy making drinks and made me a spicy mango margarita, which I enjoyed.

I had a dark red, roasted salsa from their salsa bar that was wonderful too. This place gets so many people dining there that they line up out the door...

I would definitely come back.
author: Kathryn K.

description:
Tropiseuno deserves to be bumped up to 5 stars for being an always reliable happy hour spot.  This is one of my favorite HH spots in the City because the drinks are good and cheap, and the HH bar menu is extensive and legit.  Tacos, quesadillas, ceviche, flautas, and much more!  All very decently priced! You could even have an entire meal during happy hour, and save quite a bit of money thanks to those very happy prices!

Oh, and the chips and salsa are also delicious and always free!
author: Vivian C.

description: Great food especially coming from eating tasteless Mexican eating Seattleite. Alejandro was fantastic and a top notch tender of the bar.  Nice guy and made me a few great margaritas.  Recommend for sure!
author: Tylor G.

description: Happy Hour serendipity. Very good magaritas, housemade chips, guac etc. tacos too. The dining room opened up at 5:30 and filled quickly even on a rainy Monday night!
author: M F.

description: Dark, tropical place with tasty cocktails (that might come out a little sweet and weak, but the servers are always willing to bring your drinks back with a little extra tequila) and the most unbelievable enchiladas I've ever had. They come smothered in this creamy poblano sauce that is seriously ridiculously good. I could eat like 10 of those.
author: Amy Y.

description: The staff is very friendly! I did have an issue with my drink, (it was to strong) but I asked for my another tall glass w/ a little lemonade & some extra agave nectar. The waitress didn't hesitate! She followed through with making it right! It was perfect after that! Our food was so good!!!!!
author: Anna W.

description: Came for a quick night snack with a couple of friends. I tried the beef tacos and they were amazing. Very tasty. My friends got the different ceviche plates and they were all good. Would get 5 stars but the hostess was a little rude and unwelcoming, so they lose a star for that. Otherwise would come here again most definitely.
author: Zeid S.

description:
All my life I've dreamed of having pozole... okay, maybe not ALL my life, but defo within the last 2 years when I found out pozole existed. 

These past 2 years also coincided with the past 5 years of being vegetarian, just so you can see where this dream stemmed from. 

Today that dream came to fruition with Tropisueño's vegetarian pozole: Hallelujah, Jesus Cristo! I can die happy now. Okay, maybe not happy, per se. I mean, I don't wanna get off on the wrong foot and sign my own death wish, but I'm happy that I got to have some rendition of the dish before I move along to whatever Jesus Cristo, or whomever's in charge of all that reassignment jazz, has in store for me. 

As soon as our server warned of the pozole being the spiciest dish on their menu I was ripe with excitement. As a (Chicago Suburban) renowned hot-head, it's hard to make a dish too spicy for this senorita. After finishing off the ultra deep bowl, I'd rate this a sold 3 out of 5 chili peppers. For me, this dish hardly registered on the calliente scale but maybe for regular gringos it's something that heeds a warning. Still a delicious dish, despite not quite living up to my heat-seeking infrared taste buds.

The guac appetizer was a good, nothing I'd label as being too terribly memorable but I solid standard appetizer when doing Mex. Overall, I'd say I probably enjoyed the complimentary salsas the most- and that has nothing to do with the fact that they're complimentary. They're just damn good! With the options of orange, red, and green - and yes, I know they probably have real and more descriptive names, but I didn't ask and after my Santo (St. Germaine Margarita) it probably wouldn't have stuck either. My fave was the orange because - and this is gonna sound REAL weird - it kind of reminded me of how tuna casserole tastes (as far as I can remember). And I love a good home cooked tuna (or any other home-made version of) casserole. Had I not been present with a classy date (wink wink, JZ), I likely would have drank it straight from it's tiny, white, porcelain trough. 

As far as going back is concerned, I wouldn't rule it out. Even though it appears as though I already conquered their only vegetarian entree on the menu, I'd be down to chug a few more troughs of that orange salsa before I head back to the Chi 'Burbs.
author: Candice G.

description:
This is the type of place that it really depends when you come, the servers you get, and the manager who is on duty.

On a business trip, I came here twice - so why only 3 stars when I came back twice? Let me elaborate.

The first trip was with my coworkers, who definitely enjoyed their food.  I would have enjoyed mine, except they put the sauce/sour cream on my 1 fish and 1 shrimp tacos, after I asked them to be on the side.  Normally I'd just ask nicely for them to swap them out, however my tacos came 20 minutes after my coworkers' food arrived (we ordered at the same time), and I just wouldn't have time to wait another 20 minutes.  The manager was apologetic and gave me coupons for 2 free tacos.

I decided to come back for the tacos, as I was confident that my experience was not a normal one, and that their tacos will taste even better if I can control the amount of sauce and sour cream.  Upon ordering the tacos to go (I ordered 4 again, so I paid for 2 and used the coupons for the other 2), the manager was angry at the waiter for taking my order, instead of attending to people waiting to be seated.  I mentioned that I was also a customer, even if I'm not dining in, and he said another waitress will take my order.  The waitress eventually took my order, but my tacos came out almost 30 minutes later, which shouldn't take that long.

I really wanted to like Tropisueno and recommend folks to stop by here, however twice in two days I had uneven service.  I'd recommend coming here during non-busy hours, so they'd give you sufficient attention.
author: Sam L.

description:
They have Tostadas... It's not the same as El Taurino in SoCal, but it does the trick. This place is pretty cool and they have free chips with plenty of dipping choices. And one of them has a nice kick to it.

The portions are pretty fat so ignore your over ambitious inner-fatty and don't listen to him. I got a burrito and a tostada and ate a bunch of chips and wanted to kill myself after. I looked at myself with shame because I probably gained like 5 pounds from my meal.

Pretty solid Mexican food and it has a nice, chill atmosphere. Go at an odd hour otherwise it will be pretty crowded. TOSTADA FTW!

the Great,
GumZ
author: David C.

description: My daughters celebrating her birthday in San Francisco. She wanted Mexican food for lunch. Found this on yelp and we absolutely loved it! The food was authentic and tasted amazing. Prices were fine. Fun atmosphere. Would definitely recommend it and come back.
author: Charis C.

description:
Eating at Tropisueno is like ... watching a re-run of that 80s movie you secretly like. It's exactly as what you expect it to be -- no better, no worse. 

I've been to this little hideaway near Yerba twice: happy hour and dinner. If you have to make a choice between the two -- your priorities in life are all wrong. Go for the happy hour, grab yourself those gosh darn good margaritas, eat some of the appetizers, and then be off on your merry way to make illicit decisions only tequila can convince you to do. 

If you decide you want to dinner, make a reservation (because you'll be waiting for days if you don't) and come hungry like a hippo. The portions are huge enough to feed you, your mom and your cat. The tampiqueno should be your first choice along with the ceviche taster. And in case you're iffy on whether you want to get a margarita -- don't be lame just because you have to work at 5am the next day.  In the words of Nike -- just do it. Tequila always has room for new friends - including you.
author: Malori M.

description:
Solid Mexican food at the right price. 

I came here for lunch during the week around 1pm and there was a short wait to order but the food came out quickly.  They have a terrific salsa bar with about 10 different types of salsas that are self-serve.  I had a salad with grilled chicken and guacamole plus a side of black beans.  The chicken was really juicy and tender plus the salad had just the right amount of dressing on it.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Came here with a group without a reservation on a Friday night - what were we thinking right? 

It honestly worked out just fine! We grabbed a few seats in the bar area while we waited for our table and had some delicious margaritas and chips/salsa. The three salsas were so good - everyone was fighting to finish them off. We also got guacamole while we waited and that was a perfect mix with our second order of drinks.

Dinner was lovely as well! We all enjoyed our meals (I'm a sucker for Mexican food), and our out-of-towners were impressed as well. Will definitely go back.
author: Mitalee M.

description: Came here for drinks and a late dinner with friends. The drinks were good and the shrimp entree I ordered was delicious. I usually don't like Mexican restaurants unless they are authentic but this place does a good job with it's fusion flavors. The prices are on the higher side but the ambience makes it worth it.
author: H K.

description: Very tasty Mexican food and drinks. Ambience is very nice and romantic at night. Be warned this place is extremely busy and crowded.
author: Harpal G.

description:
Loved it.
We ordered the ceviche taster, tamales and some shrimp curry(spicy). The drinks were good too.

Kind of loud, but a great place nonetheless.
We will be back.
author: P D.

description: The salsas that come with the thin chips are delicious. The servers, hosts and manager were attentive and nice. I got the wrong sort of beans but that was not a big deal. The steak was tender, tasty and delicious. The rice was rice, the beans were beans, and the enchilada was an enchilada but I did enjoy the slaw. The portion was so generous that I got a huge lunch leftover for the following day. My companions enjoyed their dishes. I cannot address the drinks, but this place was noisy and crowded. I don't think this is a repeat restaurant for me because while the food was good and even very good, it wasn't exceptional. Expect for that creamy salsa, I would go to happy hour just to eat another basket of chips.
author: Susan B.

description: Good atmosphere and good food.  Good, not great, but overall a solid value for downtown dining.  We enjoyed ourselves.  They need air conditioning, though.
author: Areena M.

description:
Went here after work to try and grab a quick meal before the movies. Although extremely busy the waiters found me a table. The complimentary corn chips and dips are a great feature and I was served in good time.

The tamales were brilliant and at just under 13 dollars as a combo (2) served with rice and black beans were spot on. 

All in all a great experience. Would happily go again
author: Luke S.

description:
Always here at lunch. Great shrimp burritos...guac and tacos.

Solid place no matter what the occasion.

Amazing house margs. Only ingredients are agave, lime juice and tequila. What?? So delicious especially because they coat the rim of the glass with spicy salt. Yummy.

Fun to stay in or quick and easy to take togo.

Love the ladies behind the counter. Always quick fast and nice
author: T R.

description: Very good food their setup is like chipotle which i hate with a passion but staff are cool can get busy in a blink of an eye went in and no line went to sit down and there was a line out the door in less than 5 minutes
author: Ching C.

description:
Came here for a quick meal. At the super veggie taco and chips. Great rice and beans.
Also a good selection of salsas. The chips were nice and thin.
The service was very friendly. Staff was fantastic.
Would definitely come back again for a full meal.
author: Neesheet P.

description:
Excellent Mexican cuisine. 

Great selection of margaritas and the chips and salsa are always hot and fresh. They have a great selection of contemporary and regional food, the combination platters are great deals.

Although it gets quite busy, they typically are able to seat you faster than their initial estimates. Service is very responsive and attentive. Highly reccomend it. You will never leave here hungry.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Tropisueno is one of my favorite Mexican dinner spots for its fair prices, delicious and large portioned food, and large cocktail menu. It can be difficult to find if you aren't familiar with the area- it's located in the wide alley between 3rd, 4th, Mission, and Market. I've been there numerous times and always get the Chile Verde, consisting of huge tender hunks of pork in tomatilla sauce along with beans and rice. I often have left overs for a full lunch the next day and I'm not a wimpy snacker!

They give you chips and 3 kinds of salsa when you sit at your table or the bar. The orange and green salsas are relatively spicey. They have a large drink menu including a variety of margaritas as well as other mixed drinks. There can be a long wait for dinner and happy hour seems to get very crowded. 

It can be pretty loud but the atmosphere is cozy with dimmed lights and candles on all the tables. The tables are relatively small so with 2 entrees, drinks, the chips and salsas and your plate and silverware it can get pretty crowded! The servers are all very nice and attentive and very willing to help you choose a drink and entree.
author: Dino R.

description: This place was AWESOME!!! I came in to join friends for Happy hour and dinner the place was packed but had a great bar area with table service. Every single employee from the time I got into the door was SO kind and attentive, the food was excellent, and the manager even came to check on us as did the staff. I would recommend Tropisueno any nite of the week!!!
author: T M.

description:
I can't get enough of this place for Happy Hour. I have been a few times for lunch and their burritos are delicious. If you have time, grab a seat because the chips and salsa makes a trip to Tropisueno worht it.

If me and my friends cannot decide on wear to go for happy hour, we always end up at Tropisueno. Their $6 happy hour margarita packs quite a punch (p.s. their strawberry margarita is better in my opinion, you can ask for it instead of the house margarita). You can fill up on their crisp chips and salsa alone, but in case you want a more complete meal, their street tacos, nachos, and quesadilla will not disappoint.

I like that they have outdoor seating for happy hour, just make sure you go when it is not too windy or cold, or at least bring a jacket. If you're a SF local you should have one by default.
author: David C.

description:
I give their lunch 4 stars because the food is great but the seating set up can be a bit hectic. They give you a number and then you have to just grab a table and hope for the best. Since the bussers are running around delivering food they sometimes don't get to refill salsas and water during the busy hours and it can be hard flagging someone down. But I wake up thinking about their chile rellanos, beans, and rice plate so...yeah, totally worth it.

The happy hour is 5 stars all the way, though. The seating is 1st come 1st served so leave work early if you have to. The margaritas come in pint glasses and they are not cheap with the alcohol. Two of them and I am stumbling home happy with a bellyfull of that bomb orange salsa and chips that come to your table without you even having to ask for it. This is definitely my new go-to happy hour spot.
author: Tomaito E.

description: I would definitely recommend this place. The drinks are unique and yummy. The food is authentic and the staff always has a good attitude.
author: Laura S.

description:
Been here a few times already, it can get busy during lunch.  It is a bit far from my office but I occasionally make the trek out here for lunch.  So far I've had their tacos, it reminds me of the taco trucks in the east bay, and Tropiseño does not disappoint, well not much anyway.  I miss not having lengua tacos along Market!

The ladies at the production counter take your order, hand you an order number and a copy of your order to take to the cashier, pick a drink and pay.  The hardest part would be finding a table, but once you do remember to go and fetch the salsa you'll need for the basket of tortilla chips that will be served.  They have a wide selection of salsas, and every one is delectable.  Your food will be served quickly.  Plus if you don't finish it all, they provide aluminum foil to wrap up your unfinished meal.
author: Calvin T.

description: They messed up my order and since they charged me for the messed up order, they are not offering to fix it and I'm stuck with food I don't want. This is certainly a disappointing first (and likely last) visit to this establishment.
author: Patricia E.

description: Fantastic!! Nachos were delicious. I went at noon and the line was out the door. The line moved quickly. The spicy salsa is VERY spicy. Do not get a big bite the first time. This place rocks!
author: Michael W.

description:
Cucumber margarita was delicious.

Service was SO friendly and personable... cute, perky waitress with brown hair who was originally from SoCal. You made our evening fun!

I did my best to finish the giant plate of food that she served me. I also ate way too much of the chips and salsa.
author: Sheenae H.

description: This place is a lot of fun for groups. I think it is a little pricey, but it is also in a fantastic location so it figures. Food taste was good and they have some pretty good cocktails. I think if you are in this area of town Tropisueno is a solid choice for dinner.
author: Ali H.

description:
The hosting guy told us, we had to wait at least an hour to sit. 
We were at the restaurant around 6PM on Thursday. 
Should we go somewhere else?? 
We ordered to go. The menu was a bit different than other Mexican restaurants. Anyway we waited for our foods about 20 minutes. 
I ordered a margarita while I's waiting.
Margarita came in a glass without stem.
Strongest margarita I've ever had.
Not so sweet, a bit salty, I could say.
Food was soo good. Salsa, bean dip and guacamole, all was delicious.
Spicy shrimp with cream sauce was really good.

Next time I'll be at the restaurant early enough, so I can enjoy my food inside the restaurant..
author: Jean Y.

description: food was delicious.  place was hopping. not cheap. not expensive.  only problem is they really rushed us out of there.  seated   drinks. apps. dinner. check. gone. 55 min
author: kevin e.

description: Been here twice in the last 1.5 months and is easily one of the best Mexican places in SF. Excellent margs, and the best food is the barbacoa. Cannot recommend it enough!!
author: Jeff S.

description: Casual Mexican joint.  The queso was not the best, very greasy with a weird consistency.  The enchiladas and the margaritas were good.  The handle to the men's bathroom was broken and my boyfriend almost got stuck in there.  The server was very friendly, but not the best.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Skyfall. I was like "... Well... we could have chipotle or we could go to a nice dinner." and Wolf was like, "Baby, Imma take you to dinner and a movie!" 

So we went here and were like 'noms noms' before our movie. Ordered the 2 tacos with rice and black beans- ate it all but didn't feel too stuffed. I liked my classic margarita. 

Nice ambiance, nothing special. Reminded me of my favorite taco place at home, just more upscale and a bit more pricey.
author: Emily D.

description:
Cute and busy place, staff was pleasant, bartenders were great. Food was mediocre at best, I ordered the chicken tamales, they were dry and bland and had cheese on top which is usually a bad sign. 

Margaritas were not very good, they were served in a large glass overflowing with ice , after two drinks the glass was half empty, my GF ordered a second but asked the waiter to limit the ice as their was very little drink and he said "then I have to put it in a smaller glass" uhhhhh

So give it a mediocre rating on food and drink .
author: Phil A.

description:
Rude service and the food really was not worth it. Won't return.

I had a chicken quesadilla and a tamale and neither were great quality. The service though was the worst and they were rude. Owners were counting money at the tables in the dining room which is really tacky.
author: Barry F.

description: My girls and I decided to have our holiday dinner here, just 4 of us, a little white elephant and margarita fun for the holiday! I made the reservation weeks in advance. Bestie and I walk in and check in, they do not seat incomplete parties so we waited at the bar. We ordered margaritas while we waited, my bestie has high standards and always asks for top shelf..drinks were really just all ice, completely watered down and cost me $35! Should have just opted for a house marg, small glass maybe would have done the trick! ;-) Disappointed there. Once our other 2 girls came we checked back in and were seated within a couple minutes, cute little table in the corner. We had the guacamole and empanadas to start. Guacamole was pretty boring and bland and a very small portion. Empanadas were tasty, nothing too spectacular though. Favorite part of the meal was the entree, I ordered the spicy shrimp in their signature sauce, SPICY, so much flavor, YUM! Overall, fun ambiance and good entrees, but not worth the high prices.
author: Tiarra M.

description:
Expected to find better food here.  First, I tried to make a reservation online, but opentable had said it wasn't available.  So I then tried to call and a recording said it was a first come first served establishment.  When we got there, it was clear there was a way to make a reservation, I just didn't happen to figure it out.

Anyway, it seemed like the best foods were served only during happy hour, like fish tacos for example, and we couldn't even order it at the table. The guacamole was small and a disappointment.  They give free chips and salsa, and you're better off with that.  The service was was subpar, waitress seemed unsure of menu times, and got an order wrong, which was fine after corrected.

Overall, food was average, service was average and not worth waiting too long for a table in my opinion, use as option B.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Over 2000 reviews?! Crazy. I came across this place thanks to Yelp when searching for Mexican food some place other than the Mission. I live in Nob Hill and there is NOTHING Mexican worth eating so this seemed to be the closest walk to something good. I'm so glad I found it!

We went on Wednesday night and just needed a table for 2. Reservations were booked until 9:30pm so we had to wait 30 minutes for a table. We lucked out and chose to sit at a couple open bar stools at the community table instead of waiting. As the night got on it was more cramped but next time I know, MAKE A RESERVATION.

The guac was awesome and so was the sangria. I ordered Chili Verde which was delicious and my husband ordered carnitas. Both were great and the rice was my favorite. The waiter was helpful and the food came out fast. Also, they serve a spicy mango margarita. Try it.

I'll be back! Thanks for not being in the Mission Tropisueno!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Really enjoyed my dinner here. Loved the absinthe-tinged Duende margaritas. Got the tilapia ceviche and the fried bananas, both of which were excellent.

The place fills up, so get reservations. Arrived at 6pm on a Wednesday, and the bar was full. So if you don't have reservations, don't expect to chill at the bar until a table opens up.

The service was great--very attentive to refilling drinks, chips and salsa. The only downside I can possibly muster is that it's pretty loud with all the tables full.
author: No C.

description:
The two stars are for the chips, and the chips alone. That's it. And this review is for a weekend lunch, where you have to order at the counter. I wasn't expecting that.

So for lunch, they make everything ahead of time (for example, enchiladas) and MICROWAVE IT. That is an incredibly sucky way to do business, people of Tropisueno. The absolute worst way. My cheese enchilada was hard, unmelted cheese. I talked to them about it and they were kind enough to bring a replacement enchilada, which was exactly the same. Cheese still in hard, grated form, not melted at all. Putting a sauce on it doesn't help. Side of guacamole was astringent and inedible. Terrible guac, probably from a Cisco tub.

We will never darken their door again.

Have to weigh in about the bathroom. How can it be legal for a restaurant of this size to have ONE toilet for customers?
author: Kathy R.

description:
Let me start by saying I grew up in Mississippi on Tex Mex so my taste buds are slightly bias. 

I am not a huge fan of traditional mexican but decided to give it a shot based on some good reviews. Their was a wait on a Wednesday night at 700 so be prepared to wait no matter when you come. 

We were quickly seated and as soon as we sat down chips and three types of salsa were brought to our table. The red salsa was very good. The other two had good flavor but were  to hot for my taste. But I don't like super spicy so don't let that make you shy away. we both ordered the combinations and be within 5 minutes we got our food. The Carne asda is some of the best I have had and the portions were generous for the price. 

Service was superb. They leave jars of water at the table for you to pour but I never had too Jose was always right there to fill up my glass. He was super nice and provided some of the best service I have had in San fran. Add this to your must visit.
author: Davis W.

description: This place is so good.  Definitely one of my all-time favorite Mexican restaurants!!!
author: Eric D.

description: Love the mole, salsas (some many to choose from), chips (thin and crunchy), location, and decor. We ordered from the counter (we had breakfast/lunch on a weekend) like in a taqueria. A gem in Financial District, one that offers better value and taste. One minor deduction, the corn tortilla had somewhat an off smell. I don't believe that is consistent with how they operate.
author: Roy Z.

description: Went there again when I was in town.  The staff are one of the best staff.  Food and service is great.  Try their chicken soup.  Simply wonderful.  Carne is great.  Thanks again for the memorable meal, and thanks again for all the great menu recommendations isaihs
author: David L.

description:
A hip-looking joint but the food isn't that good - this place is about looks not substance. the torta used a thick bun, not a thin like it's supposed to be...pork itself was fine but overall taste was not impressive. It also took a while to get our food. Chips are way too oily with an oily aftertaste too. 

Portions are good, location is convenient, food just ok - three stars
author: Philip L.

description: We knew that this place was popular when we saw the line outside the door. It moves very quickly so don't let it scare you away. The concept is brilliant: fast casual by day; table service at night. The menu has something for everyone fresh chips and 3 salsas are delivered to the table. And they keep them coming. The chips are just like I like them: thin, crispy, salty (but not too salty). Looking forward to returning for dinner.
author: Amanda D.

description: It's a Saturday afternoon, Jan 21, around 330pm. Everything was great especially the staff, but the bartender was full of himself.
author: Shanni R.

description:
Where do I even start??? Tropisueno refers to "tropical dreams" and if you eat here, you will be thinking about their food in your dreams....in a very good way.

Tropisueno has the best atmosphere in the city.  The bar is packed and for good reason- their margaritas are delicious! Enjoy the fresh chips and three salsa options while you sip your heavenrita and then ask for more.  (you know you want to!)

Once you are lucky to sit down, the options are endless, making picking your dish as hard as trying to decide which salsa you liked best.  Decisions, decisions!

I have tried their vegetarian empanadas, enchiladas, fried fish and chile relleno and I can't even begin to rank them.  I WILL TAKE THEM ALL, THANKS.

Ok, time to plan my next trip to SF to get my Tropisueno fix.
author: Jax S.

description: Great food and atmosphere! Loved the chicken enchilada. Only wish I could have gone there on Cinco de Mayo!
author: Jennifer L.

description: My wife & I went here a few years ago and liked it. We decided to go back recently and definitely did not like it very much, it seems to have changed. The biggest complaint is that the portion size was extremely tiny, we don't remember it being like that before. It was literally one shrimp for the shrimp ceviche, for 12 bucks! This place just seems overpriced for what you get. Also we both agreed the lighting was too dim. I had to squint to see my wife. Will not be going back.
author: Nicholas B.

description:
Za Za Za Za Za Za!! Mesa, Mesa que mas aplauda! 

Yes, I went and got all Mexicano on ya'll! I love this restaurant. The bar tenders always take care of me. Wait staff is amazing, too!

This is my go to happy hour spot when I am in SF. Food is yummy but the drinks are what keep me coming back.

Jamaicaso's are to die for. (Hibiscus water) Margaritas are delicious! Home made tortillas and tacos complete the package. Oh, and did I mention the finger lickin chips and salsa!?

ZA ZA ZA!!!!
author: Lily M.

description: Mango margarita was delicious! You can choose from sweet or spicy!  I chose sweet and it was yummy! Had the chips and guacamole... Good guacamole, chips were to die for. Light crunchy YUM!!!
author: Carolynne A.

description:
Bad experience, never again.

We showed up at 430 and the hostess told us they were still serving lunch, we could order at the bar and sit anywhere.

We ordered and tried to sit, when the waitstaff told us we weren't allowed to sit at the tables, as they were cleaning them for dinner at 530. All the tables were visibly already cleaned.

We had the choice of eating standing up or sitting in the wind and cold outside -- way below comfortable temperatures. We tried outside where we got harassed by panhandlers.

The manager refused to speak to me and the hostess (who had 5 minutes prior told me they could seat two, no problem) just kept saying it wasn't her problem.

Food was pretty mediocre too.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
This is the best Mexican restaurant in SF. Hands down.

I'm from Phoenix, AZ, so I am insanely spoiled on great Mexican. It took me months of failed tries to find a Mexican restaurant I could love in SF. I think we can all admit it's more of an Italian and American fusion town up here. But everything at Tropisueno is incredible.
author: Emily R.

description: Had the chicken enchiladas with chicken and they were amazing! Def recommend this dish and this place! Restaurant is a little dark and it was a little hot inside as well. Not good for a group of more than 4. Also, they only serve horchata at lunch time, I was a little disappointed. Huge portions though and the food is great.
author: Anida H.

description:
Here's how I came up with five stars for this review: 
7 stars for chips and salsa
4 stars for everything else
Rounds up to five, yeah? Sounds like math? 

Seriously, since you're going to fill up on chips and salsa anyway, you may as well do it with the best. Tropisueño gives you three different salsas - one that's spicy red and kind of creamy and magical, a standard salsa verde, and then another red one with a hint of something that makes me wonder if they sell it by the gallon. The chips are the thin, greasy-translucent ones that I associate more with Tex-mex and love. The rest of the food wasn't quite life-changing but still very good. The vibe was less snooty and the portions more generous than similar places in the city, and they didn't hassle us for lingering at our table on a busy Thursday night.
author: Allison P.

description:
I definitely recommend happy hour here! It is a first come first serve seating and it's usually full inside but there's almost always outside seating. I will say that they need a heat lamp or something because Sf weather rarely permits comfortable outdoor seating, especially during happy hour times when the entire area is shaded from the sun. 
I haaave to get their house margaritas when I'm here. All margaritas everywhere should come with chili salt like Tropisueno. And the menu mentions that they make their margaritas with 2 oz of tequila--another plus! 
The free chips and salsa are also delicious. Thin and crispy, lightly salted with 3 different salsas.
As for the other happy hour food I've had were pretty mediocre. Flautas and tacos seemed a little stale.
Service is pretty mediocre too. Hostess doesn't ever seem to helpful and is always busy chattin it up. Our server this last time I visited was alright. Busy and preoccupied but still tried to assist us asap. Whatever, it's happy hour, I've got a drink or two in me, I'm easy going!
author: Athena L.

description:
Great food, service, music, and atmosphere!!!
Will definitely return when in San Francisco
author: Andrea H.

description:
Came here on a tuesday night for some late night grub and drinks.

We got seated as soon as we got there and our server was joking with us within minutes. He promptly gave us chips and 3 different types of salsa and they were all very yummy! The food was good and came out pretty fast. We ordered the enchiladas and they were very juicy and tasty. The only thing was we asked for refried beans but they gave us black beans :(. But the food enchiladas were good enough that I am willing to forgive that minor mistake. :P

As for drinks, our server recommended their currently special pomegranate margaritas and they were tasty but nothing special. A couple other friends ordered other things on the menu and they looked much fancier/different.

Overall a good experience and I would come back again to try some other things off their menu.
author: Seliya G.

description:
The salsa is off the hook good! The food is 4 star quality.

My favorite is the bartenders , the nicest guys ever, also their chupa chupa lollipops they give w your bill;)

Now let me tell why  I gave 3 stars.. The OWNER! This guy walks around in his suit thinking bc he owns the place he has to be aggressively assertive.

1st time their I came with 4 other work employees we asked for a table and then went straight into the bar, we were told our table was ready so we all stood up and waited, waited, waited until mr Owner man himself decided to rudely tell us to get out of his servers path. Umm excuse me you told us our table was ready 10 minutes ago and now our spot in the bar is gone...?? So that was just a whole other 10 minutes w o an apology ...

2nd time my co worker went in to grab a drink and of course bartenders were awesome... Owner decided to move my friends chair out of his way ... Without asking or saying anything ... He was sitting in it lol Hello a EXCUSE me would have been nice!! JESUS!!

I'll go back just for that orange sauce but I have no problem telling  the owner what a prick he is!
author: Silvia S.

description: When I visit California, I'm always on the hunt for some quality Mexican grub.  I can say that Tropiseuno is legit. The decor is pretty, if a little cheesy. Service was OK, although the shrimp that I ordered took far longer than the other chicken/beef entrees that my party ordered. But once it came out, it was to die for. The fresh salsa bar is a perfect complement to the already delicious food.  If you're anywhere near the convention center, you should check it out.
author: Ho L.

description:
The restaurant is super popular. We got there like 10pm on a Sunday and it was  still very packed. 

Im just not a fan of mexican food. But I gave it a try whenever i saw something might be good.... Good atmosphere.
author: Tracy D.

description:
Came here last night for Cinco De Mayo celebrations.

Unsurprisingly crowded, but I still got a very intimate and chic vibe.  Plus our waiter was super nice and attentive despite the crazy amount of people.

The chips and sauces are delicious, and if you go, you MUST get their namesake cocktail.  It was probably one of the best cocktails I've ever had.  

I'll definitely go back and try their food foods, but so far I'm happy to say that I'm impressed.
author: Michelle L.

description: I first visited this place 5 years ago and I have not stopped thinking about it since! Returned last night for dinner and was slightly afraid that it would not live up to expectations, but it did! The camarones tropisuno were to die for, and my family got the carne Asada and steak, which were also fantastic. Cannot wait to come back, just hope it's not another 5 years!
author: Amy E.

description:
I came here alone and although there was a slight wait, I was able to sit at the tables by the bar and skip the wait for the main dining area. 

Ambiance: It is a bit noisy but not too bad really. Just a packed place. The lighting and staff make it very relaxing and fun. 

Food: As soon as I sat down, a very friendly waiter greeted me, and promised to bring me chips and salsa immediately, which he did. They give you three different salsa's/dip for your chips, all of which are excellent but my advice is to save your favorite one and use some on your meal. I ordered the Tampiqueno which is Niman ranch beef, thin-cut grilled carne asada, served with a beef barbacoa enchilada, guacamole. They also give you fresh warm tortillas wrapped in a warm towel. Sooooo good! It was also delivered quickly. Came out in about 15 mins. 

Drinks: I ordered the Picante which is a spicy Tequila drink with orange slice and some other stuff I forget. Was well worth the $10. If you don't do spicy don't order it. But I love spicy. 

This was my second time eating here and it gets better each time. Can't wait to go back next time I visit SF.
author: Matt O.

description:
First off I have to laugh at the ridiculous reviewers who give low scores because "the place did not meet my standards for atmosphere/decor."  Who cares, we want to know about the FOOD!!

We came here for dinner on a busy Saturday night. The bar and restaurant were packed, but we made reservations which is a must for any restaurant in this area!
The 2 hostess were very friendly and we were seated promptly. Water, chips and salsa were brought to us within a few minutes of being seated. Our server and the food runners were very nice as well.

What we ordered:
Margarita de la casa
Margarita Santo
Mariscos Crudos, taste of 3 (shrimp, salmon and talapia)
Camarones Tropisueno
Chicken with mole poblano
