Chocolate flan
Tres leches cake

Drinks were amazing. Dinner entree comes with rice and your choice of refried, black or white beans. The dishes were very flavorful and portions are large, no complaints there. The desserts were good and the chocolate flan is to die for! The thing that amazed me the most was the great price point of everything. It's very difficult to find really good food for a fair price in that area of SF. 
I would like to return for happy hour since the drinks are so good!!
 It's a busy place so you must make reservations. Also use common sense and call ahead for a large party. Don't expect to walk-in on a busy night and just be seated.
author: Lee J.

description:
I love Mexican food!!!!!!! If you haven't already known from previous reviews...I totally dig chips & salsa as well as anything covered in melted cheese, cilantro and pico!!!! Nom nom nom!

We stopped here with a huge group for lunch on Tuesday and it was packed!!! A literal line out the door. While waiting (which thankfully was not that long of a wait) it was a great time to check out all the decor.  Awesome set up that really had you feeling like you were in an elegant hut and secretly whispered to you: have a margarita, u deserve it!! Hmmmm, maybe that was just telling myself that in my head?  Anyway, fresh flowers, low lighting, festive string lights and wooden tables; gorgeous!

Since I had a full day if work ahead I refrained from the margarita, again, I will have to revisit when I go back in 2 weeks!  I ordered 2 tacos, 1 chicken and 1 carnitas.  They were fresh open faced tacos with cheese, peco and cilantro.

The table had bowls of chips for everyone to share and heir salsa bar was chock full of amazingly fresh salsas! I am a simple girl when it comes to salsa so I went with the mild of course! It was delicious and not to pat myself on the back but it tasted like my homemade salsa but without corn, mmmm!

The pork taco was my favorite as it had so much more flavor than the chicken. The pork just melted in your mouth. If I had a machine in my kitchen that made me dinner every night, tacos like this would be on the menu at least 2x a week!

Overall great Mexican joint!!!!
author: Colleen B.

description: Been here for happy hour a few times.  The key is to get there early, however the bartenders are friendly, the margaritas are tasty and the food is tasty.  Haven't been for a full dinner service, as I usually just fill up during happy hour.
author: Dilly M.

description:
Aye caramba! Thursday night. 7pm. PACKED. 2-hour wait. Glad my reservations paid off! We were whisked into this ultra-busy cantina with an awesome ambiance and festive atmosphere. It's a wonder what lighting and decor can do to transform a place!

First up...chips and salsa. Piping hot and fresh...so good that we finished the entire bowl! Yikes.

For my main course, I ordered the chile relleno with cheese. It was accompanied by your choice of beans (I chose black beans), and Mexican rice. The entire dish was so delicious with the right blend of seasonings and flavors!

I can see why the place is so popular and packed! Prime location, great ambiance, amazing/plentiful food at great prices = no brainer! I'll definitely bring my family back here, since they enjoy Mexican food.

The only downfall? Three lame items on the dessert menu -- really? Two of them were various flavors of flan, and the other was tres leches cake. Word of advice: Beef up the dessert menu and people will avoid going elsewhere to indulge in their sweet tooth.
author: Mansi A.

description:
This place is solid.  Real Mexican food and the prices are not too bad.  For appetizer, we had a scoop of guacamole and it was a little too salty and thin for me.  I prefer my own plainer guacamole with just one ripe Haas avocado, curry powder and a little bit of salt and pepper.  They give you light, salty chips with three sauces so I recommend just eating that.  We were both stuffed.  For entrees, we each had the two-item plate.  The carne asada taco was pretty good and the pork enchilada with green sauce was delicious.  The vanilla caramel flan is really yummy.  They also give you chupchups (sp?) lollipops with your bill.

The original house margarita with chili lining the glass tasted pretty good.  And it was strong!  I had to wait until the ice melted and watered it down a bit (but I'm not complaining).  

Service was excellent.  They were patient with us when we were chatting away instead of looking at the drink menu and sent them back 3-4 times before we could decide what to order to eat.  The waiter had a lot of great recommendations and knew his food and menu well.  

Definitely would come back!
author: Chris L.

description: I made reservations here through Yelp and the hostess told me my table could only be there for 90 minutes and then my party would have to vacate the seats.  That's ridiculous, right?  As paying customers, we should be able to stay seated as long as necessary, right?  If it wasn't for the manager saving the day I would never come here again.
author: Jessica F.

description: Its my second time here and the food is great! I have only one problem with this place: I am not familiar with Mexican kitchen and they don't have translations to english in their menu, so I just order something and find out what it is after. So far it has been working out great!
author: Anton T.

description: Everything tastes delicious here. It gets really busy on weekends so reservations are recommended. Chips and Salsa are the best I have ever had anywhere in Bay Area
author: Kanchan S.

description: Overpriced.  Mediocre food.  Rude staff.  Would not go back.
author: Bertram W.

description:
We met some friends here, on a recommendation. Get a reservation. It gets packed tight.

We were lucky to find a spot at the bar and waited for our friends. All 3 bartenders were super nice and took good care of us. We had the house margs, and I loved the salt chili rim. Chili was a nice touch. Margs are good and $9! They offered chips and salsa. The habanero salsa was served slightly warm and what a great touch! Spicy but not fire. Well, we like spicy so...beware if you are a beginner.  The smoky tomato was the DEAL and tomatillo had a slight zesty kick that made it also very delightful.

I had the 3 pork tacos meal. Holy Guacamole. Smack yo mama good.  The refried beans were flavorful and I just tasted the rice...standard fare and not eventful. Did I mention the tacos were stupid good? My hubs got the veggie enchiladas and almost licked the plate. They also served warm tortillas in a tea towel for the table to use with dinner.. 

Our server was efficient and friendly. Service here, overall was stellar.

2 thumbs way up. Get some.
author: Amy G.

description:
We went to Tropisueno for my birthday, and we couldn't have asked for a better restaurant. The food is delicious, the service is amazing - even for a crazy busy and popular place. We went in around 6PM without a reservation - were told the wait was 26 minutes, but were seated much earlier. 

Their house margaritas were perfect. I was in the mood for Mole sauce and enchiladas, and even though it wasn't on the menu, our server (Marcela, I think) helped us with the custom order.

The manager was walking around and came by to our table to ask how the food was. My wife happened to mention that it was my birthday. And again, even though the restaurant was busy, he must have let our server know who then brought a candle along with our dessert order.

5-stars for a great experience all around!
author: Amit J.

description:
In the land of authentic, affordable Mexican yuminess...one might not think there was an oasis in this part of town.  But there is, and this is it. 

Go early (whether lunch or dinner) because it gets crowded.  Long, yummy menu, and you won't know what to get.  

Our group tried a lot and it was all amazing.  Stand outs:  the nachos, tortas and burritos.  Happy hour margaritas are legit, too. 

The salsa bar is the thing dreams are made of.
author: Mark M.

description: Loved the food here! Came here for dinner on a Friday and it was PACKED so we went next store to Delarosa (YUM!) and came back here for lunch the next day. Definitely more of a relaxed vibe, but still a lot of energy. It looks like at night they have table service but during the day you order at the counter. My chicken quesadilla was excellent, loved the salsa bar options and yummy chips. I also liked the location - near all the great shopping but nicely tucked away. I would definitely go back.
author: Brooke S.

description:
Okay. So, I sorta bullied a Scotsman into ordering enough food to feed 4 Scotsmen (or 1 American). When the plate of food arrived, he moaned, "What is wrong with you people?" I guess it's true that Americans over eat. Portion control? WTH is that? USA! USA! If you leave hungry at Tropisueño, something is very VERY wrong with you. 

You won't leave hungry. But, I don't know that you'll leave satisfied. Everyone always makes mention that the BEST Mexican food is in CA. I'm sorry to say that I haven't found it. Chicago may not be in CA (I know a little geography) but we've got it covered when it comes to slammin' Mexican cuisine whether some shorty is making burritos, a dona is making huaraches or Ric Bayless is making the definitive everything that is Mexican (I'm still not so comfortable with that statement). Point is, we've got good Mexican eats in Chicago. So, if I am going to travel mucho miles to eat Mexican food, I expect it to turn me out. Along those lines, the food here is an over-the-jeans squeeze.*

Chief amongst my complaints: the guac is really bland. No bueno. I get that the place gets slammed and they need to keep the line moving, but put a little love in your heart and some lime & salt in your guac! The burritos are shockingly large, full of meat, beans & cheese and you'll labor to get through one but, in my experience, it's not memorable. I've eaten here a few times (circumstance) and each time, I am stuffed full but not very satisfied. I feel as those I eat for sustenance rather than enjoyment here and if I am going up from a B to a C, I better be enjoying the process.

*The agua fresca, though, is 2nd base-worthy.
author: Johnny T.

description:
In terms of food, this place is extremely good !! 5-star for food. On the other hand the service is very poor, the manager Edward is very rude and not accommodating. We made a reservation for 4 person and wanted to add an additional person, the manager informed me that it will be a 2 hour wait which is ridiculous !! I tried calling the restaurant ahead of time but they don't have a live person you can talk to. 

i would definitely come back to this place if they improve their service.
author: Andy K.

description:
A hidden gem - right next to the Marriot Marquis in downtown San Francisco and lucky lucky us for finding it. I read about Tropisueno's on Yelp before we visited SF and thank you to my Yelpers. This place was cool and delicous. Terrific drinks, fresh chips and three kinds of salsa to start your meal. The creamy salsa was a bit too spicy for my taste, but the red and green were amazing. Mom and I shared the adobe chicken and it was tender, juicy, flavorful and HUGE. Thank goodness we shared a plate. Our plate came with a half chicken, three kinds of beans (all scrumptious) and warm tortillas. I swear we couldn't finish it all. My niece had enchiladas and they were wonderful as well. Service was attentive and friendly and our waiter gladly split the plate for us. Thanks again to my fellow Yelpers for steering me in the right direction.
Yum.
author: Deb S.

description: Best Margaritas EVER!  Food was tasty too, but a bit on the pricey side.
author: Raj G.

description:
I need to write a review about this place because I literally cannot stop thinking about the burrito I ate this weekend.  I ordered the Super Baja Fish Burrito and let me tell you...it did not disappoint.  I consider myself a Mexican food aficionado, and this was probably the best fish burrito I have ever had.

I also like to get Sauce-y.  Hot, medium, mild I don't care, as long as it helps me devour my food faster.  Their orange sauce, green tamatillo salsa, the pico, it was all amazing.  I'm moving to SF.
author: Aaron L.

description:
This was horrible
The worst tamales I ever ate without a doubt
Tasteless margaritas
When we were seated we were told we had a maximum of 1 1/2 hours at the table
What restaurant does that?
Never again
author: Madonna K.

description:
Dropped by for dinner on a Monday night. Waited  1/2 hour to get seated. Not terrible in my book, but it's all what you're used to. The highlights were the chips and salsa, margaritas, and the service. 

The Chips and Dip (BUENO) - It's tough to go wrong with chips and dip. At Tropisueno, they bring you three kinds of salsa and are generous about refilling both the chips and the dip. 

Margaritas (BUENO) - The choices were pretty unique (ie - spicy mango margarita), the drinks were decently strong, and each drink came with a different salted rim. The little details make all the difference. 

Service (BUENO) - When we asked the waiter to make our guacamole extra spicy, he not only upped the heat, he also brought us a habanero salsa that was several notches hotter than the three salsas they typically provide. We were BIG fans of the habanero salsa.

Beef Cheeks Taco (NO BUENO) - There was nothing wrong with the way this dish was cooked. I just didn't like how it tasted and couldn't take more than one bite. Who knew you could go wrong with a fatty cut of beef. 

Mole Chicken (NO BUENO)- When I think about good Mexican food, I think fresh ingredients and bursts of flavor from jalapeno, lime, and herbs. This dish was none of that. True, the plate looked beautiful and the chicken itself was tender. However, flabby chicken skin is a big no-no. There is a cardinal rule that if chicken includes skin, the skin should be crispy (ie - fried chicken). Otherwise, don't serve it. If I could have removed the skin, I wouldn't be making a big deal. However, it was so thoroughly smothered in mole sauce that it was impossible to figure out what was what without barbarically digging around with my fingers. In the end, I had to suck it up and eat it, flabby skin and all, along with my tasteless rice and less than memorable refried beans.   

Overall, I would come back for happy hour margaritas and chips with dip (especially the habanero salsa), but I'd head to dinner elsewhere.
author: Cindy T.

description: Not lowering my review, just thought I'd note that Tropisueno doesnt allow you to make a reservation for a party greater than 7. This was a total bummer because I really wanted to have my birthday dinner here next weekend and now I have to find a new spot. :(
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Excellent Happy Hour spot.

They give you bottomless chips & salsa.  I shared a plate with a carne asada taco & a chicken flauta & both were delicious. The beans were also great. The only thing I didn't like was the rice - I've had much better Mexican rice.

Very friendly & efficient service. I'll definitely be back.
author: Grace C.

description:
Food was great. Chips and salsas were phenomenal. Service made me feel like running away from here. I hate it when this happens, you love the food, but you never want to go back because you hated the service so so much!

The person who was serving us (possibly the owner, I'm not sure!!) got really pissed at us because no one at our table ordered drinks. I get it that it is a Sunday night and you make your money off alcoholic beverages, but some of us don't want to drink, thank you. One of the members of our group was not feeling too well and asked for a glass of warm water and the guy just went on to lambast us about how he cannot serve anything warm to us - they don't have a microwave in the kitchen, they only serve cold beverages. He then caveated it by saying "I don't want to be rude!" Then what did you want to be? 

When it came time to order the main course, one of us wanted to know what a caldo (it was on the menu) was - I know, noob question if you eat mexican food a lot, but we don't - the guy just did the biggest eye-roll I have seen in my history of eating out. What happened to being accommodating to your guests and being welcoming of all cultures and types of people? 

I think we frustrated him further by telling him that we were all vegetarian. By this time, whatever feelings we had about eating here were replaced with "can we just eat quickly and get out of here?". He single-handedly ruined our night. Thank you very much.
author: Harini S.

description: Feel so let down by my fellow yelpers.  Ordered chili verde, which is one of most favorite dishes.  Food came lukewarm so it didn't taste good.  Tortillas were old and crusty around the edges like they had been in the microwave too long.  So sad to give two stars but my experience warranted this valuation.  The sauces for the free tortilla chips were tasty.  Also had the tropisueno margarita and it tasted meh.  Not impressed.
author: QC L.

description: First off, our waiter Tony was fabulous!  He was helpful in explaining the menu and giving suggestions when we asked.  The chips and salsa were really good.  They had 3 types of salsas. The green was my favorite. The fried plantains were delicious as an appetizer.  We all loved our meals. Several of us got their delicious tacos.
author: Julie W.

description:
Great spot for upscale Mexican food in SoMa. You can easily take a date or group of friends here.

The Tampiqueño is Nimen ranch beef steak with a beef enchileda. It tastes great if you want something really meaty. The portion is quite substantial.

The Platanos Fritos (black bean sauce and crema) is a great side dish.

Overall, service is great and attentive. I'd definitely come again.
author: Victor W.

description: I am so bummed they don't serve burritos for dinner.  I love them that much!  I come here for lunch when I'm craving a carne asada burrito.  But when I'm craving one for dinner, no such luck!  The burritos here are so tasty!  And a good size as well!  When a Mexican craving comes on while I'm at work, you can find me here!
author: Elena N.

description: I am only giving this two stars because I actually genuinely enjoyed the food. The service on the other hand was horrible. Where was our waiter the whole night? It seemed like he was over whelmed with tables in multiples areas that could have been his section or not? As a server I don't want to assume that was his section but whether or not it was he needs to prioritize better or ask for help! It's okay to ask for help. I would call out the waiter but don't know is name, he didn't tell us and he wasn't wearing a name tag.
author: Noel M.

description: The server who served us was disrespectful and aggressive! Good food but low quality service!
author: Parastoo M.

description: Had lunch couple of days in a row while attending a conference in moscone center. Liked the food. Has the enchiladas and the burritos .. meats were tender and flavorful. Salsas were really good too. Could come here again.
author: Bhaskar D.

description:
This place has a great selection of tequila and great food with and old school Mexican charm. Pollo en Mole, home made tortillas, great chips and guacamole.... the list is long!  I love bringing friends here, but they usually can't stand around for the long wait. The drinks are off the hook!!! Great happy hour with delicious appetizers. 

Other favorites: Papitos on PH. Nopalito in Nopa
author: Fredo L.

description: Horrible experience. Sat down to a table right off the bat that was dirty, had to clean salsa off our hands and clothes. Tables are so tight and close that it was difficult to move. Our drink order took so long that our food actually came out before it. That is unacceptable. The waitress was very rude, and never checked on us. Now the food.....just ok.
author: Louie V.

description: My dining experience at Tropisueno was awkward. Our group of 3, later to be joined by a 4th, walked in a little after 4:30pm on a Sunday. We were told to order at the counter and seat ourselves, because waiter service didn't start until dinner (no time mentioned). After we ordered, but while we were waiting for our food to arrive, a rope was placed around the tables. One by one our dishes began to arrive, the last making it's way to the able around 5pm.  A woman approached us at 5:15 and told us we needed to finish up and move in 10 minutes, because reservations were coming in at 5:30. Apparently, on a Sunday in the business district the place was booked solid. The chips and guacamole were good but my chicken quesadilla was greasy and many of the chicken pieces were too fatty to enjoy. We were visiting from Philadelphia and chose to meet our San Fran friends here to catch up. Rather than have the opportunity to drink margaritas, eat food, and talk, we were rushed out of the place. While this place might be ideal for a grab and go lunch, their seating situation needs to be revisited. You're better off going to Chipotle where you can get the same food without being asked to leave.
author: Kristen M.

description: Good happy hour, good vegetarian options, chips and salsa are yummy. I will continue to be a happy returning customer.
author: Olivia G.

description: Came here a little early and they were only having the happy hour menu, I was a little disappointed but that feeling soon left. The atmosphere is very nice inside, cantina sort of feel. They brought us out some fresh chips and 3 kinds of salsa, all were delicious, especially the avocado salsa. I had a baja taco and a carnita street taco. Baja fish taco was crispy, flavorful and absolutely stuffed, the carnita was juicy delicious and again STUFFED! Totally worth a try, would like to try the dinner menu sometime also.
author: Mia C.

description: Had a great dinner here last night with friends and family. The drinks were amazing  I got the tropisueno margarita and the duende. Both great. The mussels appetizer was also Wonderdul. I highly recommend the pollo! It was delicious. Great vibe great food.
author: Bori B.

description: I came here for lunch last week and I was totally disappointed. Waiting in a long line to go to the counter to order, only to have the food delivered without napkins or silverware was definitely a let down. My fish tacos were edible but very very dry and lacked flavor, I'll say that the guacamole and chips are tasty. My husbands burrito he ordered with green sauce came with red but there was really no one around to tell. Service was non existent, even ordering our food was painful. The place was so packed it was hard to walk around and grab napkin and silverware. I definitely won't be coming back any time soon. Also, it was super expensive for a Mexican lunch. Definitely not worth the price or hassle.
author: Kelli H.

description:
I am now officially obsessed with their guacamole and dipping sauces during happy hour. Since I always find that I go overboard with chips - I just ask for a side portion of tortillas and just scoop away with their freshly made amazing guacamole. So what's up.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Great happy hour from 4-6 M-F. $6.50 house margaritas (SO GOOD!) I ordered mine spicy. Apps range between about $4-$6.50. Dinner service starts at 5:30. Friendly bartenders, good times!
author: Sarah B.

description: I had high hopes for this place, but maybe it was because we came at a bad time or I was incredibly hungover, but I could not even taste any flavor to the dishes. Our group of four came here before the JCole concert because it was close to the theater. We ordered the 2 entree plates with enchiladas and Tampiqueño. The enchiladas were mediocre, but the Tampiqueno definitely had some tender steak, but not big enough for a man to get SUPER full off of. The decor was really classy, but VERY dark. If you want to see your partner's face, I'd recommend meeting outside the restroom because it's so loud and dark you can barely have a conversation. I wish I came for happy hour as it seems like many people enjoy their margaritas, but honestly, I wasn't a fan!
author: Anh Thu P.

description: We loved our meal at Tropisueño!   The food was savory, well seasoned and nicely presented. I started with a Tropisueno margarita, my husband a beer.  He had chicken mole, really moist and tasty.  I had a meat fiilled chilli relleno. Nicely seasoned.  Also tried peruano beans.  Ooh. Ooh.  Smooth, creamy and slightly spicy. Our dinner companions were 30 minutes late and although the restaurant was jammed, no one hurried us.  Our companions had a harder time.  She got the wrong margarita and he got the wrong entree. Entree was resolved quickly, but the mistaken order was left on the bill.  Also it's noisy!!   They were a little unhappy with service.  I think it evened out.  Beloved and I will go there again.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
Chips and salsa was great!
Drinks were awesome!
Veggie taco was alright 
Veggie burrito was good
Tamale (cheese and pepper) horrible
author: Hiral A.

description:
Chips and salsa were great but sadly it ended there. Besides, chips and salsa is pretty hard to mess up.

Very disappointed. I ordered the Tampiqueño entree and it was really BAD. The barbacoa enchilada, rice and beans that came with the entree were okay but nothing to write about. I hardly touched the Niman Ranch beef. It was so incredibly chewy and I didn't like the marinate that was used. UGH. It's so unfortunate because I was looking forward to dinner since it was our last night in SF and it was such a miss!

The bill seemed unreasonable when we hardly touched our meals and left hungry.

The waiter didn't even ask how we liked anything or notice that the carne asada was untouched in order to leave room to comment. Oh well. Won't be back here again and definitely will not be recommending it to friends.
author: Nora N.

description: Food, 8 stars. Great Mexican is the great white whale in Boston and we were over the moon about the meal (enchiladas and tacos). Minus one star for some service issues: 1, we made a reservation, checked in, and were then forgotten about for 15 minutes while party after party walked in without reservations and were seated ahead of us.  2, the waiters don't write the orders down and both of our meals were wrong (but were generously corrected).
author: Brittney S.

description: Mediocre Mexican food, very loud. Less touristy than a lot of places around union square. Good chips and salsa.
author: crystela j.

description:
I had been wanting to try Tropisueno ever since I started my commute to and from the SOMA area. I thought it looked so cute and I'm a huge Mexican food fan. I'm happy to say that It definitely lived up to my expectations. 

The service is great. The food is yummy. The wine is excellent. 

The ONLY negative is that it's a little loud for a date.
author: Kimberly A.

description: Don't believe the good reviews, this place is awful. Served old nasty chips, hard as rocks tortillas, bad margarita. Really not good. You steered us wrong, Yelp.
author: Bridget F.

description: This place was awesome we wanted to make dinner reservation for Valentine's Day but they where completely booked. So me and the wife said lets go anyways when we showed up it was around 8:45PM waitress said wait time was around 30 to 45 min wait due to the fact that it was valentines we didn't care because we knew it was going to be full everywhere. So we waited after 20min we where called to our table really fast service once we seated down we knew what we wanted to order we ask for a menu while we waited. We ordered our cocktails which where really good and we ordered our food all at the same time. We got out cocktails which took about 2 min to get to us then out food we expected to take a while but it took no more than 8 min everything was fantastic.!!!
author: Jonathan R.

description:
To catch up with my school girlfriend who I hadn't seen in months, I suggested Tropisueno. Near Bart for her, walking distance for me, festive atmosphere and, most importantly, yummy and relatively healthy food (no dairy, no gluten, no soy). It was a blast!

At 6:30 pm on a Tuesday evening, there was a little bit of a wait for a table. Service was friendly and attentive from the beginning. We sat down and it took us almost an hour to order because we were chatting, but the waiter was super patient, and when time came, he helped with our choices.

We ended up having the same dish: fish of the day with black beans and rice. We ordered their amazingly fresh and chunky guacamole. Everything was so fresh and flavorful! Even my friend, who usually eats little, almost licked her plate. 

Just writing about it makes me want to have their food now. Do yourself a favor and go! :-)
author: Simone W.

description: Found this place on Yelp while visiting San Francisco. The food and service was great. Love the chips and salsa. I ordered the shrimp entree and my husband the tacos. Prices were reasonable. Ordered the flan for dessert, it was ok. Wouldn't order again.
author: Izzy C.

description: Great happy hour deals, although it's always jammed at happy hour. They offer free chips and a selection of salsas, both of which are delicious! The cocktails and food are delicious and a pretty reasonable price for the area
author: Kelsey M.

description: Best Mexican and Margherita in the city. I recommend the Al Pastor or Chorizo, even though everything besides the pork is good.
author: George K.

description:
We were craving Mexican food and picked this spot based on the rating for a dinner out with our friends. It was their anniversary and we indicated upfront to the hostess that we'd like to do something special. And it begins.

- We were informed of a wait of 10-15 mins, instead ended up waiting for close to 30 mins.
- This restaurant does not serve 'hot water'. Now, I find this quite alarming, however, it was conveyed in the most rudest way ever.
- Our server had no intentions of bothering to explain what a caldo was. I mean, yes, we could have googled it! But, he was extremely condescending about the fact that we did not know what it meant.
- Well, we got through our meal(yes, it was an ordeal) and expected them to get us a dessert to celebrate our friend's anniversary , but , absolutely nothing. 


Food was great. Salsas and chips -pretty epic. Tasty, warm, soulful Mexican. But, pathetic service. 

I can take my business somewhere else!
author: Akshaya M.

description:
When I first tried tamales, living in the dorms, gross was my first impression. Then I tried Trader Joe's tamales, and now, I just can't get enough of these little suckers. I know, I know, what kind of food person are you that eats microwaved tv dinner tamales? Bite me (unless you're a vampire). 

At Tropisueno, the cornmeal cover is perfect, the pork is tender, warm, succulent, and juicy. However, in between all that is way too much pepper! I'm a salt and pepper, heck, I eat white rice straight with butter, salt, and pepper, and nothing else. But when the taste of pepper overpowered the tamale deliciousness, I started questioning the universe. 

PS - Enchiladas no bueno. Haven't sat in the oven long enough for cheese to fuse into taco shell into pork. 
PPS - If you're around Market and craving some horchata, this place is probably your best bet.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I found my next go-to Mexican restaurant when I'm in the City near Market and Fifth Street. This place is out of this world when it comes to great food at very good prices. As a vegan, it can be really difficult to find delicious food at most restaurants. But with Tropisueno, they even have a selection of vegan dishes. 

We stopped by after an afternoon of hopping around to a couple of museums. As I sat outside the Museum of Modern Art Store, I looked over to see a really nice place that had a lot of happy faces sitting at the tables. Since it was early afternoon, we showed up when the place is set up like a regular tacqueria. You order your food at the counter after reviewing the menu just inside the front door. After you pay for your meai, you find a place to sit down and wait for your order. 

As I waited for our food, we were given fresh made tortilla chips that are absolutely the best I've had in a very long time. They were crispy and delicious, perfect for dipping into a salsa. And since they have a nice big salsa bar with a variety of tastes and temperatures, I was able to find one that was just right for me. 

I'm sorry I don't have any pictures, but we were so hungry and I just had to dig in and start eating right away. It was so good that I could only sigh with delight. It helps that we had a table that looked out over the pedestrian mall outside the restaurant. We could enjoy the view and the food!

If you want a good meal with great atmosphere at an affordable price, the Tropisueno is a great place to go! I can't wait to go back and try something else (and take pictures of my meal!)
author: Corey G.

description: I like it! Great food, great service, great location. Chicken fajitas were tasty. Pulled beef taco was great. Chicken enchilada was a bit funny / not so great. We didn't wait any line to order, seating was easy on a Sunday 12pm.
author: Tina B.

description:
3.5 stars still Chips still amazing our server was amazing but the 2 hosts in the front have attitude. Now to the food, Margaritas are CRAZY strong! Bueno. My friend and I shared a few small plates:
Scallops- these were nice and plump and tasty.
Prawns in butter and garlic- Well how can you go wrong, it was cooked perfectly not rubbery.
Shrimp on Tostada- This was Eh! Not a fan
Another friend got steak taco and cheese enchilada platter, it looked yummy I tried the enchilada, real good! 
Another friend had the Steak platter, I had a piece of her steak it was tasty but a bit tough. The steak was big!
author: Karen T.

description:
The atmosphere is nice, but the music was very loud.  Could not even hold a conversation.  Tables for too were crammed next to each other so you were closer to a stranger than your actual dining partner.  

The chips were good.  The enchiladas were good, the rice slightly clumpy but good, but the refried beams were cold.  The flautas were good but not very warm.

Staff was friendly
author: Chuck L.

description:
I have had a chance to eat here a few times. The good news is the food is pretty damn tasty. Like 5 stars tasty. My personal favorite is the chile verde. Perfectly cooked tender pork, super-tasty green sauce, and warm corn tortillas. It has never disappointed. The tacos, quesadillas, and everything else are good too.

Why 4 stars? Because the service is 2. Maybe 2.5 stars on a good day. How about the ambivalent hostess who would rather talk with her friends than customers, the line staff who look like you're ruining their day, and the busboys who are trying to take your plate, while you're still eating. Bonus points for arguing about whether you can get a refill on water and refusing to let people sit indoors while they let empty tables sit while they change for dinner service.

As I've mentioned in other posts, I'm willing to put up with a lot to get good food. Tropisueno is a perfect example. I expect bad service...but I'll be back.
author: Dave C.

description:
Towards the bottom of my list of places to go for tacos, guacamole, and margaritas in SF. I am not able to eat spicy food, and asked my waiter before ordering if any of the tacos were more spicy than the others, and if they could all be made mild. He assured me that they all could be made not spicy. I ordered the carnitas, vegetable, and the chicken tinga with no beans. My sister got three tacos with beans. We also got an order of guacamole and when I tried it it was very spicy. I asked my waiter if they could be made mild instead and he said no the guacamole was pre-made. I then asked again when it was time for our entrees and he finally said he would ask the kitchen. They made me a side order of guacamole without the jalapeños, which I did appreciate, but that should have been offered from the beginning and I was still charged for the extra guacamole.

When the tacos arrived, my dish had the beans and hers didn't. Then, I tried the chicken tinga tacos and they were beyond spicy. My sister has a good spice tolerance and she even thought they were really spicy. I ended up just wasting that taco. Another thing was that we both finished our first round of margaritas very quickly and before the entrees came, but the waiter never asked us if we wanted another round.

I will definitely be going elsewhere in the future.
author: Marley S.

description:
This place rocks! During the day for lunch there's a burrito bar where always get the super quesadilla because it's full of veggies and fresh!
At night it turned into more of a sitdown get served dining experience. I've been there for both lunch and dinner and I can tell you that both are very very busy. 
At least for lunch you can grab your food and go pick a table anywhere and sit down but you have to wait to be seated for dinner unless you choose to eat outside. Most people choose not to eat outside because it's either cold or there are people who hustle you for money sometimes walking by. 
The food is delicious and they have 1 million salsas for you to try! You should go!
author: Kellianne R.

description:
Two words: Muy bueno!

I was extremely impressed with my overall dining experience at Tropisueno. Mexican food, arguably, is my favorite ethnic cuisine. Since I moved up to the Bay Area, it's been difficult finding a decent Mexcian food joint in the city. After many failed attempts, I finally discovered Tropisueno... and I'm SO stoked I did!

ATMOSPHERE: Dim with nice decor. To be honest, the decor seemed a little on the girly side. In my opinion, the best way to describe the decor is "whimsical" - playful and quaint. But it wasn't over-the-top. The atmosphere sets the place up to be a great date spot. 

SERVICE: I made reservations for two at 7:45pm this past Sunday through Open Table. We were seated right away when we arrived. Our server (forgot his name) was really cool. He gave good recommendations and was on top of everything. 

FOOD: This is a bold statement but I probably had the best chips and salsa experience ever at Tropisueno. Right when you sit down, they bring over a bowl of tortilla chips and three different kinds of salsa. I couldn't really tell what two of them were but there was a red, green (most likely salsa verde) and orange one. The orange one was bomb. When I first tried it, it really took me by surprise because it was a warm salsa - really good. The green one was delicious as well. I didn't really care for the red one but it wasn't that bad. I ordered the Carne Asada Plate (Tampiqueo) which came with rice, beans and a beef barbacoa enchilada. The Carne Asada was cooked perfectly - tender, juicy, flavorful. Man, that shit was delicious! Everything else on the plate was good but they took a backseat to the amazing steak. I highly recommend the carne asada plate!

PRICE: I was shocked when the tab came. My buddy got two bears and an enchilada entree plate. I ordered two margaritas and the carne asada plate. Our bill came out to $58.55 before tip. I thought that was very reasonable, especially since my steak was BOMB. 

I highly recommend making reservations if you plan on having dinner here.
author: Bruce C.

description:
Came here with a couple friends for lunch. I ordered the two item combo plate with a flauta, a cheese enchilada and black beans. I also ordered a margarita at the bar.

The flauta was not what I was expecting. It was deep fried and then covered in a green sauce with cheese. It was good, just different than what I have had before.The enchilada super cheesy and came with red sauce. The sides were also, a-ok. It came with rice, black beans, and a side of avocado.

My favorite part about this place is the salsa bar. They have a ton of different types of salsa all varying in heat intensity levels. 

The margarita was also good, but it was pretty strong. I could mostly just taste the tequila. 

This place is pretty close to work, so I have been here on a couple other occasions. The food is always pretty decent and the service is fast.
author: Stephanie T.

description: We have been here several times with our kids and we all love it! The food and service is always good but you definitely need to make a reservation. We had the camarones dish which was spicy but tasty! The margaritas are really good! Prices are reasonable too!
author: Melinda K.

description:
My favorite work lunch place for Mexican by far. Just get there early, like 11:30-11:45 or you will be subject to a long line and if you are staying, you may not get a table.

The menu and food, aside from how crowded it gets, is definitely worth going for. The combo plates and everything I've ever tried is simply delicious. Speaking of lines, their salsa bar usually has one since people usually load up. So many different varieties and all very tasty.

The prices are very reasonable as well. For $10-$15, you will not leave hungry. Pick a menu item, tell the service folks what you want, get a number and take it to your table. Load up on some chips and salsa (careful not to overdo it, although I always do), and then the service brings out the food. Definitely keep your receipt because sometimes they mess up. Still, once your chomping down on your Chile Relleno Burrito, you'll forget all about the service madness.
author: Larry D.

description: Loved the service! And the food was great too. Ask for the habanero salsa if you can take the heat. 10/10 would come back again
author: Eileen N.

description:
For SOMA, Tropisueño is pretty good Mexican food!

Why you should go:

1. Great value. Prices are low and portions are big.
2. A little something for everyone. Like seafood? They've got it. Like meat? Check!
3. Fast service; great for groups.

Tacos al pastor were pretty good! Meat was well-seasoned and tender. Loved the bites of onion in there.

I got the Tampisueño, which is a whole lot of beef! Two long strips of steak that's well-marinated and grilled to medium-rare, served with a beef barbacoa enchilada too (which was really really delicious!). Comes with rice, guac, beans, and tortillas. It's like 2 meals!! My friend got the chicken mole, which was also ginormous.

I didn't check out the drinks menu, but gathering from the tables around us, they look pretty tasty!

Tropisueño is a great place to come with friends for dinner and pre-game. I wouldn't come here with a date though, unless you've already impressed them enough with fancy-schmancy places.
author: Sherry L.

description:
I hate to review on only one visit, but there is no way I'm going back unless someone foots the bill.  Wife and I had 3 house margaritas each and we walked out of here with zero buzz and a $100 bill(with tip...not the server's fault.)  At $8 per margarita you would expect to get some alcohol in it.  

The salsa was a trio of bland, the chips were light and tasty and were probably the highlight of the experience.  I got the chicken asado and it was flavorless from top to bottom, likewise wife's was lacking in imagination and flavor.

Yelp has failed me on this one...if you think this is 'authentic' or great Mexican food, you need to travel more.
author: Daniel W.

description:
Great margaritas and delicious Mexican food. What more can you ask for!?

Reservations are recommended. This place gets packed - especially during happy hour.

Convenient location - right by Bart

Great staff.
author: Lina K.

description:
Do NOT pay attention to the stars on this review. It's just an update:

Erin B. designated as the owner of Tropisueño on Yelp has written and told me she is sorry and that they take customer reviews seriously and are doing their best to make improvements. I appreciate that and I hope things get better. The fact that Jennifer L. had a similar nasty experience posted 7/2014 makes me think it might take some time for things to change.
author: Acid B.

description: Dining alone, ordered Guacamole and Empanadas De Hongos, both are very good!
author: Angela L.

description:
Yum! I want to come back here again immediately! My mom was raving about this place when she visited SF a few weeks ago. She'd had the albondigas soup and couldn't stop talking about it, and unfortunately I don't eat red meat so won't try it, but I decided to check the place out anyway since she liked it so much.

I went with a friend on a GORGEOUS Saturday and we snagged an outside table. We were both really hungry (or so we thought) so we caved and ordered burritos. YUM. SO FRESH. I'm not a burrito person, but everything went together perfectly. And like I said, we THOUGHT we were both really hungry...but in the end, that burrito lasted me 3 meals. Holy wow.
author: Katie V.

description:
With all of the high reviews, I thought I was going to be eating great Mexican food. But it was mediocre at best. Definitely not worth the hour long wait.

The carne asada was dry. The enchiladas were just horrible (was that tomato sauce and Parmesan cheese?) and the chile relleno was luke warm.

The service was ok. The atmosphere was good (nice mood lighting, music, decorations).
author: Charlene L.

description:
While stuck in San Francisco for the weekend due to inclement weather back in DC, I was looking for a relatively decently priced dinner within walking distance to the Market Street Westin.  On Yerba Buena Lane, the restaurant was less than a block away.

Easily one of the better if not the best Mexican food that I've had anywhere.

Once I got a seat at the bar, I asked which margarita the bartender would suggest.  He did not disappoint with the selection.  The fresh tasting margarita with a cucumber garnish was delicious.

As a starter I went with the Tacos de Cachete.  The beef was absolutely tender and the radish was quite tasty.  

I then went with the claimed "House Favorite" Chile Verde.  Tender pieces of pork in a tomatiilo sauce.  Combining it with the Mexican rice and black beans that accompanied the pork was delicious.

Come if you like a vast array of blue agave tequila and great Mexican food.
author: Matt S.

description: Was joined by 3 girlfriends here for dinner at 7 PM on a Saturday night for our friend's low-key bachelorette celebration.  The food was good, and it was a fun atmosphere with cute decor and a pretty hip crowd.  Our server was friendly and appropriately attentive.  Would recommend.
author: Leslie V.

description:
I would give food maybe a generous 3 and experience a 2. So rate this 2 1/2.

I had a 5:30 reservation and even after a slow stroll and window shopping from Opera House got there 5. No problem, figured I'd have one of the famous margaritas at the bar. Some restaurant bars are extension of dining room; same customers waiting for tables or maybe eating at bar. This was, simply, a bar. A lot of youngish guys who knew one another and bartender by name. I was the only woman. And way older. I looked and felt very out of place. They asked if I wanted margarita, I said yes. I later saw a strawberry version I would have preferred had I been told it was an option. Kept eyes down, sipped drink, halfway through they finally offered me the chips. They were very good, thin & crisp, liked salsa. I ate the whole bowl, probably a mistake to fill up but I had consumed half a margarita on empty stomach...

5:30 arrived, got table. Restaurant so dark I needed my flashlight to read menu. I got salad, thought of Mole Poblano but I sometimes make that so opted for the pork 3 ways as I'm less likely to cook that. Should have stuck with first choice. Salad good, had greens, seeds, jicama, something sweet (mango? could not tell since it was literally too dark to see my food). Asked for aqua fresca, told unavailable although it was on menu so just drank water. When pork arrived, I could see white squiggles, about all I could see in darkness, and knew them for crema. Not only do I dislike crema in itself, I think it mutes and ruins flavor of food. Had I known meat came with crema I'd have asked them to hold it; this may have been in fine print on menu but it was too dark for fine print even with flashlight. With no visual cues, I could not tell which pork was which. Corn pillows, however, very good. Crisp edges, soft interior, good corn flavor. Black beans, which waiter recommended, bland.

While I was eating salad another party sat at next table. Tables were so close together when the waiter stood between them to take their order, his ass was literally in my face, and he was not fat. I guess funny in a way but when I'm eating I do NOT want some dude's ass in my face! They need to train staff to stand behind diners, not between tables. 

Waiter recommended tres leches cake but I was feeling really unwell. Not just over full but out of sorts. I had an article I wanted to finish so had been reading by flashlight during dinner. I told him to give me a few minutes, hoping I'd feel better, instead room began tilting back and forth. I asked for check, which was promptly brought, paid, stuffed everything in my purse anyhow and got up dragging coat and gloves. When I stood room began to slowly revolve. I made it out the door, barely. Fortunately they have outdoor tables and after sitting in cold about 10 minutes stabilized and was able to get to BART. This was in NO WAY the fault of the restaurant, I want to stress. Reading by flashlight is not a steady light and that plus the alcohol threw my system out of whack for a short time. But still, combine the uncomfortable feeling at the bar, the inability to see my food, the crema which I really dislike, ass in my face, not having an item which is on the menu, and dizzy spell, it was just not a great time. I realized I would have had more fun getting Chinese takeout from the place on the corner and eating at home with my cats.
author: Carol S.

description: The food was very good. I got the tacos: al pastor and chile verde. The food arrived quickly and tasted fresh. The staff was very friendly. We arrived at 5:30 and they did tell us that they needed our table at 7 PM. We thought that was a little odd. We finished around 6:30.
author: Marianne A.

description:
tropisueno is one of those sly locations that doesn't explicity say "Tropisueno", but instead has a sign hanging outside that says "Mexican Kitchen". yet it still intrigues and attracts everyone because of the long, long line outside. the restaurant is located in the walkway between mission and market, across from the contemporary jewish museum and adjacent to beard papa's! 

came here for lunch a few weeks ago and ordered two super tacos ($4 each). it's an assembly line-esque ordering style. The line files by a huge menu on the wall, then by a counter where you order and pay.  it was pretty chaotic behind the counter with all the people and orders, but you can tell the workers know what they're doing. the line also moves pretty quickly.

food came out and i was pretty surprised (and excited) at the two substantial mountains of taco goodness placed before me.  i have no idea what everyone else ordered, but they had huge platters of food! the burritos were as big as my head. the chips and salsa (they offer 3 types!) were pretty bomb as well. it's a bit pricy for a lunch spot, but the portions are large and worth it.

I was here with a group of about 10 people, and we got extremely lucky with seating. you definitely have to come early and get lucky with the tables. I wouldn't recommend coming with a group, unless you want to designate one person to scope out the available seating and swoop. and for those who aren't the scope-and-swoop type, you can also walk across the street and eat your food at yerba buena gardens (outdoor) or metreon (indoor seating).
author: Caitlin C.

description: Delicious food. Tacos are of good size, and absolutely phenomenal. Will eat here again.
author: Choco L.

description: I don't rate a 5 star easily... but we ate here for the first time and enjoyed the Salmon in the banana leaf and it was one on the best dishes we have eaten and we are very well traveled.  We sat at the bar to eat as the restaurant was packed and had excellent service by Jose our bar tender.  Don't be shy to pull up a chair at the bar and engage with Jose's great personality and attentive service. If you have not tried this place the wait for a table will be worth your time... and we normally won't wait...
author: Shawn A.

description:
Arrived here at 8:00 PM on a Saturday night and was told there was a 45 minute wait, but there is a nice plaza, and good people watching, so we waited and were seated after 39 minutes. 

The waiter, host and hostess were all friendly, genial and the service was excellent.

We loved the chips and salsa, the chips were light and tasty, the three salsas were all good. My tablemate loved the green salsa, I loved the creamy warm salsa, that tasted like an excellent cream of tomato soup! the other salsa was a roasted tomato salsa that was good too.

I loved that they had albondigas on the menu, so I asked the waiter if it was appetizer sized, and he said it was a full meal, but he offered to split it into two smaller bowls, and we took him up on it. Truly excellent, served with rice on the side and full of perfectly cooked potatoes and carrots in a nice tomato-y broth. The meatballs were firm and tasty. Great soup for a cool San Francisco night. 

My partner ordered a triple combo: pork tamale, carne asada taco and barbacoa enchilada. I ordered the chile relleno. 

We really were full after the excellent soup. The chile relleno was excellent, with a picadillo like filling, ground beef, raisins, green olives and small pine nuts. The sauce was delicious. The refried beans were tasty and the cumin-y rice was firm and quite nice. 

My tablemate did not fair as well. The tamales ends were rock hard as if they'd been in a steamer far too long, and the masa had a funny licorice-y taste. The filling in the tamale was good. The enchilada with barbacoa was excellent. The carne asada was tasteless and seemed like it was just chopped up sirloin. There was a huge gristly piece which, unfortunately, was his first bite.

When we pointed out the problems with the entree, it was taken off the bill, which was appreciated. There were so many things right, that I do have to recommend Tropisueno because the chile relleno, the albondigas, the chips and salsa and enchilada were all excellent. As was the service.
author: Joe S.

description: Tropisueño, it's a great place to eat and I love their service, I highly recommend this place. Every employee make their effort to give their best service toward the costumer. I honestly value the fact that when it gets busy in lunch time the staff  work so hard to provide a very detailed information if the costumer does not understand the menu or have any  questions.  I also wanted to say that I really feel disappointed for those people who come to restaurants and treat bad the employees and makes them feel bad just for one mistake or for simple things that can be fixed; everyone makes mistakes and  I really think that as humans we should treat everyone as the way we would like to be treated. Don't  use your anger toward people who work in restaurants just because money matters be consider and don't behave like a jerk. Think if you were working in restaurants you wouldn't  last a day because it's very stressful to deal with so much pressure.
author: Karen F.

description:
Come here for your horchata fix! It's probably the cheapest and most decent tasting horchata you're going to find on the block.

I went with a friend and we decided to split a combo dish with 2 items. The food was more than enough for the both of us. HOWEVER, the food had too much pepper in it. The tamale didn't impress me at all. When you've had a freshly made tamale from your Mexican Bff's mom, all standards are instantly raised. The tamale dough was too hard and the tamale was peppery. I didn't enjoy it at all. The enchilada was decent, but still too peppery. 

Walking in, I was a little confused by their business model. I think they had a small sign or somewhere on Yelp it tells you about the business model. Apparently it's an order at the counter type of place for lunch and a sit down, more formal place to eat for dinner.

Walking inside, it's like the restaurant tried to make it feel like the tropics. The restaurant was way too hot, so we decided to sit outside. When it got cold outside, we decided to move inside.

I would be back for the horchata if I were craving some at the time, but probably not the food.
author: Christina L.

description: I went here last night for my birthday and had the most amazing time!! The best Mexican food I have ever had and the drinks!!!! Omg, they are delicious and STIFF!. Staff is so friendly and welcoming. Definitely my new favorite spot in San Francisco!
author: Mariana L.

description:
Food was fantastic and service is even better! We found this place after a long day of shopping at Westfield mall. 

Starting with Chips and salsa, the salsa is freshly made and you get a trio of red, green, and a warm orange salsa which is to die for. The chips are very thin and light... LOVE IT! 

For entree we ordered the carne asada steak dish, mole chicken, and sea scallops. ALL FANTASTIC! 

Dessert, chocolate flan.. a must try....

To top it all our waiter Tony was the most friendly, attentive, and helpful server I've seen in a very long time. 

We can't wait to go back and try their other yummy dishes.
author: Shell S.

description:
For a fist timer, it can be a bit caotic but with some simple questions you get it at the second.

The food was great, and pretty fast. It looks like a restaurant but it is mainly self service. 
Chips are always at the table. And the salsa bar is great.

They have a bar as well but you have to pay and order separately. I ordered a margarita, it was served in a plastic cup and I've tasted better ones.

I was for lunch meal.
author: Matias D.

description: I really enjoy the food here, but it is overcrowded and so loud that you really have a hard time having a conversation.  The next time I'm in SF, I don't think we will eat there.
author: Julie B.

description:
Coming from San Diego, and being spoiled on the amazing Mexican food there, it has been incredibly hard for me to find a really good place in the city for something that stands up to that caliber.  But, out of all the places that I have tried, Tropisueno is one that I have come back to on more than one occasion.  Granted, it is the more fancier side of Mexican, but it is a place that I rather enjoy.

Came here last night for my bestie's birthday.  I did not have a reservation.  But, upon telling the hostess that it was the BFF's birthday, she immediately got us a table.  Amazing service.  I was very pleased with all the staff last night. A+ guys!!!  And they brought her out an amazing Tres Leche cake for dessert.  I had a mini-bite.  Very sweet and tasty.  She loved it - as it was obviously from her complete devouring of it...

We weren't very hungry, however, deciding to spend the night sipping on some margaritas and munching on snacks, but it was still very good.  I love the trio of salsas that are presented here.  So amazing.  I scarfed on them.  And ordered more...

Margaritas were strong and good.  Though, I hate to say, I have had better.  But, they were still pretty good.

The ceviche sampler is amazing.  One of the fish is a bit too fishy.  But, it was still a very good ceviche.  I would recommend it.

And...unfortunately...that is all we had.  I would go back.  I mean, I have.  I continually have.  And...to add another plus to it, the restaurant is located right across the way from the Metreon.  So you can come here for a bite, head to the movies a little slushy and lushy after.  AWESOME!!!
author: Jenn S.

description:
I love Tropisueno, which by the way, I didn't know was actually called Tropisueno because the sign outside says T kitchen?  Idk, so I've actually been here about 3-4 times and the service is always great!  Something I also noticed is that every one of my servers has been male and the only women I've encountered, have been the hostesses.  

I've tried several things here like the ceviche de pescado (pretty tasty), the tampiqueno (a bit chewy but great flavor), the Pollo Asado (really good but the veggies were way over cooked and I didn't get any mushrooms), and the Huaraches "Tres Cochinitas"  which is amazing and will be the only thing I'll order in the future. In addition, the guacamole, chips, and salsa trio are devine and totally worth it if you're yoyo dieting like myself!  

One complaint, I ordered the house margarhita and ordered it spicy, the first was great but had too much ice, the second I had to send back and the third was just okay.  I guess it depends on the bartender.
author: Brandy B.

description:
House Margarita with chile salt = to die forrrrr

Atmosphere was very lively.

Joselito (our server around the bar) worked so fast and was so helpful! His friendliness and attentiveness definitely made up for the two not-so-pleasant hostesses at the front.

Everyone's talking about their chips and salsa because they are the bomb diggity. My chicken flautas were tasty and my boyfriend's tampiqueno was cooked perfectly.

Yum yum yum. Can't wait to go back to SF. I'd definitely come back!

Oh one more thing ... I just wish there was Happy Hour. Not like the place needs MORE business but it would just be the icing on the cake!
author: Taylor C.

description:
In other cities people would probably be falling all over themselves trying to get into Tropisueño for some authentic-ish-Mexican-food-combined with party-atmosphere. Kind of like a Chevy's but with a little more class.

Here in San Francisco, however, it's harder to objectively evaluate given how much excellent and actually authentic Mexican food is all over town. (And how many of these places also contain a party!) That said, Tropisueño checks off a whole lotta checkboxes and thus gets my pick for a large number of outings.

Vegetarian options? Check.
Fast? Check.
Bar area so I don't have to order a whole entree? Check.
Dinner area so I can order a full meal if I want to? Check.
Very proximal to most downtown offices? Check.
Salsa bar/chips? Check.
Pint-sized margaritas? Check. $4/said margarita happy hour 4-6? Check please!
HUGE BONUS: If I show up with five people, I drink for free all night? Excuse me, I think I have somewhere to be...
author: Stephanie T.

description:
UGH. I guess I got what I deserve for thinking that any food in the Yerba Buena area is going to be good. They have you hostage here, so basically anything decent seems great. I don't think this place deserves such a great star rating. 

The boyfriend and I came at lunchtime and shared a three option combo. A "super" tostada, super meaning it had old, brown guacamole added, a shredded chicken enchilada with mole sauce, and a greasy, flabby chile relleno. The refried beans weren't seasoned well and the rice was just rice. I did enjoy the pickled carrots and jalapenos they had on offer at the salsa station, but that was pretty much the extent of my enjoyment. I wanted FRESH, tasty Mexican food, something like Primavera at the Ferry Plaza Farmer's Market and I was sorely disappointed.
author: Victoria J.

description:
After a full day of work meeting, my co-workers and I decided to grab a drink. This place is right across the street.  The bar was full (its Friday night) so we ended up getting a table.
Ordered one of their margaritas, taquitos and plantains.
Margarita was pretty good.  Enough booze to get me buzzed.
Taquitos were bland
Plantains were good.
Their complimentary chips were salty for me.
The service was okay.
The place was full of couples on a date but was too loud to have a good conversation.

will come back for margaritas.  :o)
author: Learnee L.

description: The food was good but nothing spectacular. My boyfriend ordered the Chile Verde which he enjoyed for the most part, however the pork was extremely fatty. I ordered the Tampiqueno which came with a beef enchilada, steak, rice, and beans. The enchilada needed more sauce, it was pretty dry. The steak was cooked perfectly to medium-rare and had nice seasoning to it. The chips and salsa were honestly my favorite part of the meal. The chips were thin and crispy and all 3 salsas were delicious! I'd come back for happy hour but I don't know that I'd eat dinner here again.
author: Amy S.

description:
Very nice ambiance. The name on the building was something like 'Mexican kitchen'.. And when I went in, I found out it is the place I was looking for.

The chips that were brought out with the 3 sauces were pretty good.  I had to avoid eating too much so I could enjoy my dinner.

Got the shrimp, with beens and rice.. Pretty good but very spicy..

Service staff was busy but very friendly.  I got my first margarita, and I found it was very strong.  I had one sip and the waitress removed it from my bill without me asking for it to be removed.
author: Sabi A.

description:
The salsas they start you off with were great. I enjoyed all three of the options. Unfortunately, it sort of went downhill from there. The consensus around the table was that everyone's food was "ok". My aboldingas soup was just alright.
I would go back for drinks and chips and salsa if I had plans in the area, however, I would pass on dinner.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
If only Trop was easier to get to for me, I would be here everyday!  Hands down the best chips and salsa in the city.. who can beat 4 types of salsa?? And it's FREE, that's right people, your favorite 4-letter word.  Drinks are unbeatable in the tequilla department- have Roman make you anything and you won't regret it.  Service with a smile all around, I love to just come and watch the bartenders tear it up back there it on a busy night.  
Once I have a nice buzz on and have stuffed my face with far too many chips, the food is nothing to pass up.  Ceviche, tacos, and my new fave is a vegan tofu dish in a spicy red sauce (that's the english version of a much more elegantly named item). Mmm and the rice and beans- yum.
Come for lunch or dinner, eat, drink, be happy!
author: Laura P.

description:
Awesome variety of salsas!!! The food was excellent too and wonderful service

The veggie fajitas were really good!!
author: Nisha D.

description:
Customer service was out of this world friendly. Reservations were appreciated professionally and on time. The atmosphere is pretty deceiving from the outside. But overall great vibe with awesome decor. 

Their food was ridiculously good. If you haven't tried the Mole Poblano, I'd highly recommend you do. The sauce on the chicken is perfect. Huge portions, appropriately price. Great place overall.
author: Diane F.

description:
This is my go-to to-go spot when I'm working in the city. Conveniently located downtown a block off Market St. and a block away from the W Hotel, Tropisueno serves everything I need when I'm looking for a dose of authentic Mexican flavor. 

Their shrimp burritos are to die for. I know the burrito is actually an American creation but I could swear that after the first bite I was briefly transported through some rip in the fabric of time to a cafe on the coast of the Yucatan peninsula. If you're eating in house, wash one of these giant babies down with a chili salt rimmed margarita and you've got yourself a great meal deal. Viva Tropisueno! Viva shrimp burritos!
author: Alex L.

description:
The line moves quickly. The menu is reasonably priced. Chips & salsa are free. They have a creamy sauce similar to La Vic's orange sauce, but not nearly as spicy. 

They have outdoor seating, but beware of the pigeons. I witnessed a man get his dress shirt ruined.
author: Catheria S.

description:
Seriously cannot wait to come here again. I'm pretty picky about my Mexican food (LA has spoiled me rotten) and I loved Tropisueno. 

First, you get chips and a three salsa plate. ALL the salsas were amazing - I couldn't choose a favorite. I ordered the Tampiqueno, which is a plate of carne asade and a barbacoa enchilada on the side. HOLY CRAP. It is midnight and just writing about it is making me hungry.

Also, sit at the bar if you can snag a spot. The bartenders are really knowledgable and they make really amazing margaritas. This location is really convenient if you're working in the Financial District but be aware that it gets pretty busy after work and there is only one TV if you're looking for a place to watch a game.
author: Alli Q.

description:
Oh Tropisueño, how long I waited to see you!! 
But patience is a virtue, and you were well worth the wait! 
This adorable restaurant centrally located on the Financial District has energy, charm and flavor with very, very affordable prices!! 
The service was good, attentive and active. Except for when the clueless waiter poured water into my beer glass, that was disappointing. Other than that happening, the food her was good, and very authentic! The salsa bar offered quite the variety for your choice of tacos or burritos, they also offered Aguas Frescas, with the fresh and sweet smell of crisp Agua de Sandia, the Agua de Jamaica in its' luscious redness! Oh and the ever so dreamy Horchata, I was glad I selected the Horchata, it was simple, but deliciously great and refreshing!! 
As for my main dish, I went with the  Empanadas de Hongos, these were filled with pasilla peppers, mushrooms, and cheese, along with a sweet and spicy white salsa. 
OH SO DELICIOUS!! :) 
Those vanished out of my plate in an instant!! Then, to end my meal a Taco al Pastor, this little guy was so flavorful and juicy!, the meat was tender, very well seasoned and perfectly delectable!! 
  I was impressed with this place so much, that we decided to pay it a second visit and have their breakfast!! That tells you how much of a magnet and attraction it creates, it leaves you wanting more and then satisfied when obtained! 
Oh Tropisueño, you were all that I imagined!!

 Hope to see ya again on my next visit to this great city!!! :)

Yours Truly,
  Lizeth M.
author: Lizeth M.

description:
I was under the impression that this place was an authentic Mexican Restaurant, but I was disappointed by the quality of food. I ordered the cactus vegetarian meal and it hardly had any vegetables. My meal was mainly filled with beans and rice. The beans tasted old and the rice was salty. 
The only thing I enjoyed about this restaurant was the chips and salsa. The service was ok. The ambience was noisy and crowded. Not too much personal space in between the tables.
author: Nelly P.

description:
A definite go-to if you want Mexican, but not a gut bomb. You'll get your fix without passing out after. 
I have been happy with everything I've ordered so far. Great chips and salsa. Try the margaritas with the jalapeno slices.
author: Scott C.

description: Average experience. Everything is reasonably priced which is a plus. However, food is pretty plain with little flavor (had the chicken enchiladas and chicken tamales). The scene is good with a busy lively crowd at night. Our waiter was pretty unattentive (probably because he was so busy running around) but the busboys made up for his lack of care by always smiling and getting us more salsa etc. Final consensus: go here for the bustling atmosphere and reasonably priced drinks. If you want good mexican food, you are better off making the trek to the mission.
author: Jasmine G.

description:
I've been to this place a few times now for lunch and dinner and I've noticed it's consistently packed!

Priced right for the SOMA/Financial District Area, Tropisueno feels like a more authentic version of Chevy's.  The lunch line moves relatively close and the bustling atmosphere makes it a fun place to dine. Best thing is probably the free chips and dip.  There's another place down the street on (2nd) called Maya if you want to try better Mexican food.
author: Betty C.

description:
Saturday about 1pm.  Food is good.  Mexican food doesn't take much skill to do well.
You would have to gather several minds to come up with a way to run this plan more inefficiently.  These workers are clearly the same ones they use at subway (see my prior reviews)
author: Chris F.

description:
You can tell they care. 1 hr long wait, very busy saturday night. They communicated how long it would take, took our cell phone # down. Sat us down, got chips, awesome salsa (3 different types). Waitress was super nice, food was awesome. 

Corn sauce was amazing!
author: Kevin H.

description: Greeted by very nice hostess, didn't have to wait long for a table. When seated we were given chips and salsa, and that's all we had for about 25 minutes, when we finally succeeded in flagging down a waiter, he could barely understand what we were saying. After about 30 more minutes our food came, and was probably the most mediocre mexican food ive ever had on the west coast.
author: Jonah B.

description: Tasty Mexican food. The carne asada was excellent. Good salsa with chips. Margaritas were good but they don't make blended ones - only on the rocks. Decent size portions, reasonable prices. Comfortable, trendy atmosphere.
author: Larry P.

description:
Tropisueno is like a diamond in the rough, but rarer. It's a great Mexican restaurant in FiDi. There's diamonds all over that neighborhood, but nobody near Market knows their way around carnitas like Tropisueno. 

Their dinners are a great cross between the margarita happy hour crowd, and those of us who love Mexican food, but want a break from the dingy taquerias. (No disrespect, some of them are wonderful, but now and then we like to dress up.) My friend and I shared the ceviche (great, though I wanted more tomatoes), and I had the 'Tres Cochinitas', which is three tacos, rice and beans. That will annihilate any hunger for days. 

Don't forget about them for lunch, they become a walk-in taco/burrito restaurant with a much more laid-back atmosphere (think Chipotle, but good), in fact, I'm kicking myself for the number of times I wanted great Mexican and forgot it was there. Don't make the same mistake I did. Check it out!
author: Kevin B.

description: Great Mexican food and great service I would recommend this restaurant. I ordered the tacos
author: Des D.

description: We had a terrific meal tonight at Tropisueno. From the chips and salsa to the margaritas, service and atmosphere, everything was top notch. The food was authentic-- and the chef is not afraid to bring the heat! Alex, the manager, was charming and attentive and made sure my best friend and I had a special evening as we were celebrating our move to the Bay Area. Couldn't recommend it more highly!
author: Amber W.

description:
Not sure why all the 5 star reviews.  This was OK, nice atmosphere, food was OK but not spectacular, just OK. I had the spicy shrimp dish and was not blown away by it.

The service was slow and ti was difficult getting drinks to the point where we had to cancel drink orders.

I would not make a special trip back but it's OK if you want Mexican Food.
author: Drew M.

description:
My favorite Latin restaurant everrrrr. I think the best time is to come around the lunch hour while the taco bar is open. It is super popular during that time, but it moves fast. I always get a shrimp taco and some barbacoa tacos. They put a really decent amount of meat with onion/cilantro that you can split between the two soft tortillas. 

I LOVE the spicy salsa here, I haven't come across it anywhere else yet. The chips are unlimited and always warm. :) 

Dinner here is great too, extremely large portions and fun ambience. I love the interior of the restaurant and the lighting at evening time. I think it's a fun date place, but just as suitable for a casual meal as well.
author: Kathy Z.

description:
I went to Tropisueno last night after hearing about the wonderful happy hour multiple times.  If you want to eat dinner here at 5:30pm on a Friday, you NEED to make reservations.  They did a great job at accommodating for us even though we had to push our reservation back by one hour.  They made sure our table was ready right on the dot.

We went to the bar and you get free chips and salsa on the house.  There are three types of salsa and each one is super tasty.  I basically ended up finishing an entire serving of chips by myself.  I literally got full off of the chips and a few beers.

For dinner, I ordered their specialty.  The name escapes me, but it was a shrimp dish with creamy sauce with rice and black beans.  It was spectacular, and I highly suggest ordering it.

Also to note: the bartenders are super quick!  Whenever you want a drink at the bar, they whip it up in a matter of minutes despite being super busy.  The bartenders were very personable and always will refill your chips and / or salsa upon request.

In conclusion, the environment and food was incredible.  I won't hesitate to go back.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Tropisueño gets insanely busy at lunch on a weekday.  Seriously, I don't think I would bother unless you can step out of the office early or if you're a tourist and have some time to kill.  It can be pretty busy at dinner too (especially with the happy hour crowd.  The wait is worth it though--their salsas are amazing, the food delicious and the cocktails are fantastic.  I come here every time I visit SF.

Lunch tip: try the chile relleño burrito!  It's amazing!

Dinner tip: get the Camarones Tropisueño!  The shrimp are sautéed in a delicious chile de arbol sauce!

Cocktail tip: If you like absinthe, get the Duende.
author: Nick H.

description:
$5 HHour margs made with lime, agave and El Jimador? Uhm, yes please. 

Seriously though, the food at this joint is plenty good, their house-made salsas are incredible, and those margaritas... dayumn! The could make a tough man tumble.
author: Don B.

description: One time dining while visiting San Francisco. The place is great. We walked in without a reservation on Thursday night at 7pm- party of 4. We were told 45-60 minutes wait. We got drinks at the bar (very very crowded bar and this took a while, but no matter how busy bartender was he still took the time to make drinks proper!) and went to drink outside, the seating area outside also didn't have any space, so we stayed at the curb:) We were seated in around 30 minutes instead of an hour! The food was very good. I had chicken quesadilla (wasn't on the dinner menu but I asked for it since it's my favorite) and shared guacamole and chicken tacos along with the yummy house margaritas. Left very satisfying. Highly recommend this place!
author: Nadia R.

description:
BIENVENIDOS!  Birthday dinner with my family. Table for 11. Reservations at 6:00pm. Hacienda -type, pretty, upbeat vibe and welcoming atmosphere! Waitstaff was extreamly friendly, considering its Valentine's day and is extreamly crowded. We each started with their infamous Margaritas. Might be the best in SF. We were given the complimentary warm tortilla chips with three dips to nosh on. Of course we HAD to order the Guacamole appetizer. It was terrific, creamy yet chunky. Wow! We also ordered the "cigars", corn masa filled with mexican bbq beef, corn, cotija cheese, black bean sauce & crema. Fabulouso! A few of us ordered a cup of mexican Albondigas soup. Soooo good!!
