We ordered Sangria with our meal, which was refreshing.  I had the two item combo, chicken enchilada & fish taco with ruce & black beans. Mine was very flavorful & big portion. Everyone loved their specific dishes, plates were cleaned. My family got me a gorgeous St. Honore cake (from Diandra's) which was the Bomb.com....
The restaurant was very busy but highly recommend. A super great time & birthday!
author: Janet T.

description: This place is good. VERY PACKED during lunch. They offer a lot of choices. I ordered a chicken bowl and it was simple, but tasty. Portions are pretty big and everything seems so fresh! OH! How could I forget about their orange sauce?!?! Probably what makes this place THAT great! I had to control myself with the chips and orange sauce.
author: Kirby P.

description:
Being off Yelp for over two weeks was like that scene when Diana Ross goes ape-looney from heroin withdrawal in a strait-jacket at the opening of "Lady Sings the Blues". OK, it wasn't that bad. But I came back from a vacation abroad to rediscover a pleasant surprise in Tropisueno. It was actually the second time I tried the place after nearby Yelp staff was praising it to the heavens when it first opened a few months ago.

A decent Mexican restaurant was desperately needed in the area ever since the Cadillac Bar died a tragic death many years back to make way for the Moscone Center. You can have Chevy's though that tortilla machine is pretty entertaining, and don't get me started on Andale in Westfield where mediocrity is a requirement in that pricey food court. Tropisueno turns out to offer good, fresh Cali-Mexican dishes (...that's the way I would describe them anyway) right on Yerba Buena Lane opposite the big, tilted cube of the Jewish Museum.

Well, first, the mandatory chips are excellent and always fryer-hot - so watch your piggies when devouring them with the two bowls of tasty salsa that come with them (see my photo). The $8 Molotes de Papa y Chorizo make a nice starter - a masa concoction shaped like an empanada that they fill with potato and chorizo and then drizzle with crema and black bean sauce (see my blurry photo).

I've now tried two of their entrees, both solid choices and not overly ambitious on their part. The $14 Tampiqueno is the more intriguing of the two - thinly sliced carne asada that they top with grilled onions which is complemented by an enchilada, rice, a small scoop of fresh guac and fresh uncut scallions. your choice of enchilada (see my photo). I also liked the $13 Traditional Oaxacan Mole Poblano where I went for a chicken leg and thigh that was swimming in a thick sauce filled with dry chiles, spices, nuts, herbs and chocolate. I had wanted to try the $13 Pollo Asado where they marinate the chicken with citrus and achiote, but I was forewarned that it takes 25 minutes to prepare. Maybe I'll be more patient next time...not!

No pinatas, no bullfighting posters, no mariachi jukeboxes, no senoritas in off-the-shoulder peasant blouses sharing their maracas (ahem). The place has more of a California feel after a day in the Cost Plus furniture area, but it works. I still haven't touched the small bar area yet, but it looks lively enough.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, reasonably priced  Cali-Mexican dishes will allow Chevy's to be the sole bastion of the tourists
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...Cost Plus, like I said...though darker and more cozy
SERVICE - 4 stars...quite attentive without making you feel you want to swat them like a fly
TOTAL - 4 stars...good, semi-upscale Mexican closer to my part of SoMa...yeah!
author: Ed U.

description:
I like the decor, the rustic furniture, and the convenient FiDi location of this Mexican restaurant. It's a nicer choice to have a group lunch other than Chevy's. I cannot help to compare it to Chevy's, because you get a similar serving of complimentary thin tortilla chips and salsas. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/32lqhWMpq_YpGUbfYg_ZDQ/l The only reason they get a low rating, was because the last time I was here my dinner was disappointing.

When I came the place was packed and busy, most of the tables had groups of 6 or 8 people. So I knew that food service would be slow. Usually not a problem, "IF" the food is prepared well.

The appetizer of mushroom & cheese empanadas topped with guacamole was good. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/I1ZXgKoM0RAVch8qoI1QWQ/l After that I had to wait a very long time - more than 45 minutes. Somehow the waitress forgot to place my order or maybe my entree went to a different table, I really don't know what happened. I realized something was wrong after the staff tried to clear my table thinking that I had already finished my meal. I had to tell them that I was still waiting to get my food order.

My waitress came back (I guess the bus boy told her) immediately apologized, said that she'd have my plate in 2 minutes and left. I thought to myself, wait a minute how do you cook a steak in 2 minutes? I had a feeling that the meat would probably be overcooked (I imagined an angry cook overwhelmed with orders, burning the meat at high heat to complete the rush order for my plate), and after about 4 or 5 minutes I saw exactly that I was right. The pieces of meat on my plate were mostly burnt (you couldn't see any grill marks). The exact same dish at the next table to my right had better looking meat (not burned) with nice grill marks.

In my opinion, the wait staff looked tired and flustered from all the people they had to serve that night. For that reason, I didn't feel like making a fuzz or sending the dish back, it would have been a waste of more time too (yeah, I'm a fool for not pointing out their error). I had lost most of my appetite anyways, while waiting and eating tortilla chips. I cut the edges of the meat thinking that the center would be less burned, ate what I could and left the rest. I filled up with the enchilada and beans side dish.

Here's the picture of my "carbonized" beef:
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/PwhED8Yw1V3bQJUFtxpLbw/l

Side of beans and tortillas that comes with every entree:
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/yBr7XJu4-IkKjwRhekpN3w/l

The long wait time and the burned meat = wasting my time and my money, should merit only one star. But since the place was really busy and the waitress seemed to be trying hard to please all her customers, I'm giving them a 2nd star. I might visit them again in the future, MAYBE. If that results in a better experience, I'll revise my review and rating then.

*********************************
Note: I've corresponded with one the owners. She mentioned that they're working on improving the consistency of preparation of the beef dish. Also they're welcome to use my photograph of the empanadas, and any other future pictures.
author: Luis C.

description:
Never would have thought to pop into here for dinner, but glad a friend suggested we eat here before Muppets action.

We were seated pretty quickly since it was a random weekday night, but the place was pretty packed. Good signs, good signs. Before ordering, you get a huge basket of warm chips with a trio of salsas. I really liked the orange one that had a creamy spicy kick. All of the salsas had some heat to them, which was a nice surprise.

My albondigas stew was really hefty and I ended up taking half home to eat as a great breakfast the next morning. Lots of meatballs with carrots and potatoes in a velvety stew. A little on the salty side, but that just means you have an excuse to eat a ton of the cilantro'd rice.

The different margaritas here were tasty too! Definitely liked the Tropisueño margarita. Just the description is enough: canton ginger liqueur is balanced with meyer lemon and tequila. 
Served up with rose-infused sugar and lemon salt.
author: Kevin L.

description:
It's a quaint place for a romantic dinner! The cocktails are amazing and the food was great considering I'm vegetarian. Other than the place being a little noisy everything else is amazing! 

PS: make sure you make a reservation on a weekend night cos the waiting goes up to 2 hours :-/
author: Pavitra B.

description: Chile Verde was exquisite. Excellent service. Great, chill atmosphere. The place was full and everything ran smoothly. I'll absolutely be back here next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
More than anything else, I just like the sound of 'Tropisueño'. It's fun to say and read and even listen to. Try it - 'Tropisueño' - see?

Ok, so really I've only ever been here for drinks with my colleagues/friends. We're very lucky that it's not only a two minute walk from the office, but that these drinks are strong and tasty. That's how I like 'em. Their mojitos are super good with a perfect hit of mint and not too much sugar. Pair them with the little tray of salsas they bring you, and you have a delightful little after-work cocktail party. Fun!

I've heard from several of my colleagues that the food is authentic and mui tasty, and I trust them since we work for Yelp - and we like to think of ourselves as the tastiest of taste-makers. The place is right off Market St, so it can fill up right quick, but the service is great and the energy is fun, so it's worth knocking elbie-bones with a few strangers to stick around and enjoy.
author: Hilary H.

description: I stopped at this place during my last trip to SF. The cocktails were great, the food was delicious and the service was on point. If you are in the area and want to have some great authentic Mexican food make sure to stop here.
author: Michael P.

description: Great complimentary chips with three dips! Had the carne asada plate - great flavor and big portions!
author: Sheila L.

description: This place was a nice surprise. Given the location in Yerba Burma gardens I was concerned that this would be another over priced, mediocre Mexican restaurant however was exactly the opposite. It offers a fun, relaxed atmosphere - you walk up to the counter to order food (Chipoltle style) but then they give you a table marker and bring the food out when ready more like a typical sit down restaurant. The chips were on the better side and the salsas were amazing - try out the tomatillo salsa. The food was reasonably priced (~10 bucks a meal) and very filling. I got the shrimp tacos which I would highly recommend and a pork tamale which was was also good - to be fair I've never had a tamale that I've been blown away by but I still love them and order them often. My GF got a mole chicken taco which was also great. We didn't indulge in margaritas but they seemed to have a nice tequila selection and will when we come back in the future.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Really great tasting food! 
I highly recommend the happy hour as well as the enchiladas. They give you three types of salsa which are all delicious! 
It can be extremely busy being so close to the conference center so reservations on open table are a good way to go especially for a larger group.
The restaurant is usually packed and can be loud but is casual and tasty.
author: Tory C.

description: Everything about this place was fun fun FUN! The atmosphere is energetic and lively. We sat at the bar and the bartenders are chemical geniuses and friendly to boot. They provided us with great recommendations and conversation all night long. The drinks are fabulous and combine many great flavors - the salt on the margaritas is specific to each drink. I recommend the Huaraches "tres Cochinitas" (pork three ways). It's perfection on a plate.
author: Jacky J.

description:
Adding 4-stars to the already 220 something reviews for this hoppin joint.  I seriously felt like I was on vacation somewhere... the ambiance is fun and very nicely themed.  

EXCELENT and friendly service.  Our server was very passionate about the food and gave tons of recommendations...even adding the eyebrow lifts when we ordered the Mole Poblano Chicken dish and drinks :) funny..

Stiff, smooth tequila... danger... but good place to get drinks if you wanna get hams... ($8+)

The food overall wasn't amazing...  I'm not really a fan of mole poblano (it's the chocolate-y/nutty flavor that I'm not used to... I know, you must think I'm craze...) and our steak was kind of dry/burnt tasting.  BUT the enchiladas were really good.  They were chunky and flavorful.  Next time, I'll def have to get the combo plate and get tacos and enchiladas.  NOTED

restaurant.com coupon for $10 off $20 helped bedazzle our bill.  $40 for 2 entrees and 2 drinks plus yummy chips and dip (yeowmmy spicyness but not unbearable) 

Side note: eat the tortillas while theyre still warm!  I waited and they got rock hard ... like my head jerked like those car safety test commercials when I tried tearing it with my teeth.. :(

I want enchiladas!
author: Kat C.

description:
The first time I ate at Tropisueno was in 2011 during the Nike Women's Marathon weekend.  I had stumbled across it by accident and had the most amazing al pastor tacos I've ever had, so when were trying to figure out where to grab dinner last Wednesday night, this was the first place that popped in my mind.

The salsas served with the chips to start are fantastic.  We also ordered the guacamole, which is some of the best guac I've ever had; the perfect amount of spicy without being overwhelming.

I had the Huaraches "Tres Cochinitas" since it was the closest thing to the straight up al pastor tacos I had two years ago.  The chile verde and carnitas were AMAZING, but sadly the al pastor was overcooked and lacking the pineapple, which really does the dish wonders.  The verde and carnitas more than made up for it, though!

The food and service overall were really great.  We called at 630 and were able to make a 730 reservation, but this was also the night before Thanksgiving; the place was busy, but wasn't packed.  I'd recommend making a reservation if you're planning on checking it out.
author: Ashleigh B.

description:
Fairly cheap, huge portions for lunch with good vegetarian options, but I really don't like having to scramble to find a table for our group amidst the lunch rush.  It's a good place to go with a group if you're willing to leave a few minutes early to make sure you get a seat, but can otherwise be hectic and loud.

I recently saw that they now provide online ordering to pick up, I may try that route next!
author: Jenni S.

description:
In for a last minute Post Star Wars dinner this week.  Ordered :

Chile Verde
savory pork stewed in green sauce

Entreé Style - Chile Rellenos
ground beef, spices, green olives, raisins, pine nuts

Camarones Al Mojo De Ajo
Wild white shrimp sautéed with butter and lots of roasted garlic, onions, squeeze of lime

...everything was 5-Star ! The Chile Verde in particular was an outrageous flavor-bomb. Best we've had in SF in 10-years.  The Camarones were simple and executed to perfection again maxing the freshest flavor possible from very few ingredients and made for an excellent shareable app.

Many folks often overlook the Chile Rellenos at a place like this based on prior Ho Hum Rellenos, at TS that would be a mistake. This chile is a legit entree or perfect shareable item for the table.

Don't hesitate to saddle up to a community table if you can't get into the dining room ... You will not be disappointed.  Enjoy!
author: Tom B.

description:
KInd of a whacked up margarita list. You might even find one made with a near extinct southern Peruvian tangerine that was found on the dark side of the moon.

Ok, I'll get back to the margaritas in a second.

The food here is very good. The menu includes all your favorites and prepared to near authentic standards. Some will argue that it's over priced, but this isn't the Mission nor is it a place where you go chow down on a honkin' burrito in less than four minutes. Tropisueno is a place to meet up with friends and lounge for a few hours.

Now back to the margaritas. I liked them, but did not love them. I think the problem here is they try too hard. Too much emphasis is put on finding the most creative ingredients and mixes rather than concentrate on just a few quality tequilas and a simple mix. 

I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars, but since I did get a nice little buzz on I will go with 4.
author: Rene C.

description: This place deserves it's stars not just for the food but for the people who work there. These guys and gals have so much charisma and were awesome to make conversation with. Whether it was a story or just analyzing a random thing that was happening. Oh also the enchiladas is the bomb dot com right after their margaritas.
author: John L.

description:
For a burrito the size of a toddler, Tropisueno has it covered. Was it a tasty 'ritto? Sure. The best I ever had? Nope, but it'll suffice for lunch.

The chicken burrito was pretty tasty with nicely cooked black beans and stuffed with plenty of cheese and sour cream. Gracias, amigo. Oh, and the chips, hot, salty and tons 'o options at the salsa bar.

So, A-OK for me...fast, friendly service and a giant silver bullet of a burrito.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I had just flown in for a work conference and was starving.  I was craving Mexican and this was right behind my hotel.  A coworker and I went and it was amazing!

The atmosphere was welcoming and the decor was happy and bright.  The music was upbeat and it made me want to get up and dance.

The service was excellent and fast.  We got our guacamole appetizer in 3 min and our food in 10 min if that!  The servers helped each other out so we were never out of water.  The guac was so good and spicy but not too spicy.  The free fresh tortilla chips came with 3 delicious spicy sauces.  My chicken and steak enchiladas with the green sauce were soooooooo goooood.  Came out hot and fresh.  The refried beans were still steaming!  My meal was complimented by a mango margarita.  And let me tell you, THEY USED REAL MANGOS!  Not the fake mango flavor that some other restaurants give you.  Pure rich mangos.  I was in heaven!  And now I want some.  Wish I could find a real mango margarita on the East coast.

The next time I visit San Francisco, I am going back here!
author: Jean F.

description:
Food is Awesome... worth the wait (there was a long queue when we went.) The salsa bar with atleast 8 - 10 types was my favorite part, and they served fresh chips to go with that. 
I had Michelada which was really good and complemented my sandwich. 
would love to go there again when I'm in the area.
author: Misha M.

description:
Ooooh yea ... talk about some good flavored mexican food!

I work right around the corner from here and frequent this place often for lunchtime.

I always get tacos with grilled chicken or steak and a side of black beans.

Other goodies are the enchilados and the mole... ummm...

Not that expensive if you get tacos for lunch and load up on good crispy chips with salsa.

Speaking of salsa, I have never had such a good variety and such great tasting salsa. There is something about the yellow-orange one that keeps me feenin' for more!

Makes my mouth water just thinking about it.

The seating around 12-1 is packed! Come by for an early or late lunch unless you want to yell over typical lunch crowds. Personally I come with a book and my computer and wanna chill so I come later.

Happy Hour is da bomb! Its super cheap for regular size margaritas, I think they are like $3 each and they are STRONG! Hand squeezed limes to make it. Oh yea baby!

The seating for HH is just okay, get here early or you will not get a seat!

They open the regular menu for dinner so the lunch line goes away and I have never been for dinner, yet! But if I am ever in the area after happy hour, I will be by!
author: Gina H.

description:
I had lunch here today with my coworker, and I was surprised how nice it was inside.  It's convenient in the sense that you order your food in line and get a number and your food is brought out to you.  I was disappointed because the description of the torta sounded so amazing, so I ordered one and was told there was no bread to make a torta!  I opted for three tacos, my friend had the same, and I was surprised that our total came to $15.  That's a lot of money for six little tacos which were standard in flavor.  The tortilla chips were akin to corn tortillas that sopped up an oil spill of the vegetable or corn variety.  They were so greasy, I didn't eat them.  

I will indeed come back to Tropisueno at least once more because I definitely want to try their torta and experience what their bar has to offer.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I've must've walked by Tropisueno a million times before while downtown but finally came here for dinner from a tip from a friend.
I was pleasantly surprised! The inside is very nice and is separate from the bar area (which was pretty loud and energetic). Service here was speedy and friendly.
I ordered the 3 item combo with a beef and chicken enchilada and a carnitas taco. My dish also came with rice and a trio of beans and tortillas. My dish was good (not as good as a typical family owned joint) but otherwise it was satisfying for a nice Mexican restaurant in the city-very tasty. 
Prices here were also reasonable-under $20 for most entrees and combo plates were only around $13.
I'd definitely return here in the future to try more dishes...need to try the Mole chicken!
Great place for groups/date or to grab a drink after work.
author: Miss H K.

description: They took two hours to deliver on a Tuesday night. Got our order completely wrong, and then when we called said it wasn't there responsibility to check the accuracy of the order. Absolutely unacceptable! The worst part of all, the food was mediocre and cold. NEVER ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE.
author: Dave T.

description: Worth the hype. Worth the wait. Get a drink at the bar, enjoy the atmosphere and get excited for a great meal. I'm gluten intolerant and was stoked to find many of the dishes were gluten free. Just ask the waiters, they're super nice!!!! You'll love it. Go here. Now.
author: Leah M.

description: First off the margaritas were awesome and they were huge they were in pint glasses. It was great for the price. The waitress we had rocked and I really enjoyed sitting at the community tables by the bar overall the experience was great the food was great. I went with the standard enchiladas and they're really good and my friend had a chicken dish that was incredible. We also had the plantain appetizer and we great. It definitely wasn't your standard Barito hole in the wall spot but if you want  step up from that, this place is good
author: Roo P.

description:
I would love to come back and come for dinner but their lunch was amazing. 

For lunch you stand in line and order at the counter. They bring the food to you when ready at your table.

Drinks are ordered at the bar. 

I believe in the evening it becomes a full sit down menu.

I had a girlfriend in town from New Jersey and she was staying at the W. Lord knows you can't get good Mexican food in Jersey so she was craving it but didn't want to go far, so of course I pulled up my trusty Yelp app and found Tropisueno.

Very good! The guac was fresh and not greasy. My fajita platter was huge and very tasty. 

I had the traditional margarita which went down nice and easy and I usually don't like tequila drinks. My friend had the vanilla margarita which had a good vanilla crusted rim.

We had a ton of left overs, which made her hubby very happy. I wonder how much larger the dinner portions are!

Come hungry.
author: Alexis M.

description:
When I used to work nearby I would come here for lunch.  But, I recently came here with an alumni group for a happy hour.  I didn't realize they did such a good business in the evening, since I was just used to lunch here.  As the night went on, more and more of our group started to show up.  We were sitting at the one rounded booth, and noticed the long table next to us was being cleared.  We asked our waitress if we could have the table, since we had outgrown the smaller booth, and she went to check with the host.  The host told us we couldn't have the bigger table because it was already accounted for, and that typically the restaurant does not take reservations for groups larger than 4.  We went with it, but then he seated two people at the massive table.  It just seemed logical to us that we should take the larger table, having 8 people and give the 4 person booth we were squeezing into to the couple.  So, lesson learned - not suited for groups during happy hour if you plan to sit in the restaurant section.  

Other than the strange table arrangements, everything was great. Food was amazing - we got a bunch of happy hour tacos, and the drinks were tasty.  Our waitress was incredibly nice and she really tried her best to get us that larger table.
author: Stephanie V.

description: I think the decor and drinks are what makes this place. The food...Nothing authentic about it and it is overpriced. Servings are small for what you pay for.  There is no parking so you would need to find a parking garage.  I suggest make a reservation as it can get very busy and packed.
author: Andrea R.

description: Great Mexican food and margarita!!! It's our favorite Mexican restaurant in the city:)
author: Yu H.

description: Dinner the other night was simply amazing, the shrimp tropesiuno was incredible! Very authentic and price is great!
author: Sherman C.

description: Great meeting place before a movie or museum visit.  Great margaritas and happy hour is the ticket!
author: karen c.

description:
This review is based purely on the service. The food was exceptional. 

The manager, hostess, and server were all extremely rude. 

So I came in for happy hour after a long day of work with a friend, and I did NOT leave happy.  I frequent happy hours along the Embarcadero and in the Financial District so I understand the protocol.  I've also worked in restaurants so I understand what its like to be in both the hostess and servers position. 

Happy hour is only in the bar area, but there were no seats in the bar.  I asked the hostess if we could grab a table inside and she said no and didn't try to accommodate us at all whatsoever.  So I inquired about the tables outside, which she permitted us to sit at.  We go outside and the tables are all covered in bird poop.  Classy.  My friend and I decided to just grab an appetizer off the "non happy hour menu" so we could actually sit down at this place.

The server looked completely baffled when we told him we just wanted one appetizer.  Having worked in a restaurant, I know he was just pissed that we were taking up a table in his section and not really ordering food (in order words small bill = small tip).  But seriously get over, it happens to servers all the time.  He literally said "well I can't even get you drinks because you already got them from the bar". 

We were there for probably about an hour...and yes we weren't ordering anything else.  But we were talking and enjoying ourselves.  The hostess comes over and asks us to get up because there is a reservation.  HOW TACKY.  

The food was exceptional and the margarita was stiff and tasty.  Fortunately there are thousands of restaurants that have amazing food/drinks AND great, accommodating service.  With that being said I will never return to this place.
author: Angelica  C.

description: Love this place !!! Awesome quality food you won't be disappointed .... The fish ceviche was bananas and the taco plate was also awesome... The pastor taco was just like they make it in the motherland (Mexico) :)... Gotta love it ...
author: Eileen P.

description:
My wife and I took a short getaway trip to San Francisco for the weekend and on the last night my wife said she was craving Mexican food. Being from Texas, I was skeptical but we found Tropisuno nearby and decided to give it a try. Short answer is that I was blown away.

We arrived at 5pm on Sunday night and they had just started some kind of transition where I guess they were changing out the kitchen staff or something, but they said they wouldn't start seating people or serving food until 5:30. We weren't pressed for time so we just went to the bar and ordered a couple of margaritas. They do not serve any kind of frozen drinks here, including frozen margaritas, which is fine with me but it caught a few of the other patrons off guard. I ordered the top shelf margarita with cointreau and my wife got the house margarita. I ended up ordering a house margarita myself because it was absolutely the best house margarita I have ever had, and remember that I live in Texas. The bartender, Alejandro, was phenomenal and we ended up just staying at the bar to eat instead of swapping to a table at 5:30. Alejandro had us try a tequila that was made in Austin, TX and also showed us some infused tequila that they were making. 

The chips and salsa are fantastic. There are three different salsas (traditional salsa, verde, and a spicy habanero one) and each one was very good. I think my favorite was the verde, but my wife claimed all three were the best salsas that she had ever had. The food was also very good, but I would recommend trying something new and veering from the traditional Mexican food offerings. Overall we not only had good food and drinks but thanks to the energetic atmosphere and Alejandro, we had a great time.
author: Carlton H.

description: Excellent food and service! While I'm not the expert on Mexican cuisine this was one of the best I've had outside of Texas.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
The place had a very rustic and was dimly lit, which made a perfect date night spot. Scintillating flavors of Salsas and the fresh/warm/crunchy chips, was a great start to the dinning experience.

Very interesting choices for Margaritas. We had the best server, Kelly, she was very attentive, so hospitable and that made our experience top notch. 

We ordered the top three dinner recommendations given by her:
Chili Verde (5/5)
Camarones Tropisueño (5/5)
Tampiqueño (4/5)

Camarones Tropisueño was an absolute delight. Sauce was sparkling in taste and meant for the spice craving palettes.

Pork was perfectly cooked in Chili verde. We tried all the three beans as a side to each dish, they were very tasty and so were rice (aptly flavored).

Tortillas were served so hot and fresh,   it was unbelievable.

Food  5/5, service was 5/5, Drinks 4.5/5 - Overall made a great night.
author: Hitashi D.

description:
I think Tropisueño is the best Mexican restaurant I've ever eaten at - on my last trip to San Francisco I ate dinner here twice. The complimentary chips and dips, the guacamole, and the margaritas (both the house and spicy mango varieties) were all excellent, as were the mains. 

On my first visit I had the Huaraches "Tres Cochinitas", and on my second I had the Tampiqueño - both were, very, very tasty, and the portions were quite generous. I also tasted the shrimp dish my girlfriend ordered (the Camarones Tropisueño), which had a fantastic sauce.

Big portions, reasonable prices, great service, and dishes that are actually spicy. I can't recommend Tropisueño highly enough.
author: Charles J.

description:
The Dish: First of all, I love this place because it's literally 30 seconds from my work. Second of all, I LOVE THIS PLACE. Why? The food is amazing. For the price (~$15), they give A LOT of food. My friend and I were pretty hungry going in and we couldn't finish. I highly recommend the Tampiqueno (I think that's how it's spelled) and the Carne Verde (amazingly amazing). The chips & dips were great too. Happy hour margaritas were good - our waiter (Marco) gave us the margaritas on the house. The food is just hands down quality-Mexican food. 

Ambiance: It's loud & nice - very energetic environment. I think overall food is a 4 star, but the service is 5 stars. Marco was INCREDIBLE. He recommended a myriad of dishes, gave us free drinks, came back several times to make sure we were okay. The restaurant manager came out to make sure we enjoyed his margarita. It was just FABULOUS service. I can't remember the last time I tipped this much. I'd say it's pretty difficult to impress me - service wise...but Tropisueno, you've done it.
author: Gina T.

description:
5 stars!

I had a hunkering for quality mexican food, so with a little help from my Yelp app and the hotel concierge, we decided upon Tropisueno. 

First of all, this place is really easy to miss if you dont know exactly where to look. Anyway, once you find it, its all uphill from there! We went seated promptly and our host/waiter greeted us jovially with the chips and salsa. There were 3 kinds of dips for the chips: Salsa, green salsa and a chipotle-type dip. ALL of them were amazing! Especially the chipotle-type dip. Mmmm..

Our waiter/host said we should order a margarita because they use 'quality tequila'. So we did. And MAN that was quality tequila because this drink was STRONG! 

I ordered the mole chicken and my date ordered the seafood stew. My mole chicken was out of this WORLD. Believe me when I say this, because I am not usually a fan of Mexican food, but at Tropisueno, I was SOLD! My date's seafood stew was great too, but my mole chicken - YUM! And the portions were SO generous! My dish was only $15, and I could only eat half of it! The rest of it, I took home and clung on to for dear life so I could save it for lunch the next day. 

The restaurant was pretty, the service was GREAT, food was DELICIOUS and pricing was just right. If I am back in San Francisco, I will be back!
author: Sab N.

description:
We walked by here right after the Lunar New Year parade trying to look for a bite. The wait wasn't bad at all on a Saturday night -- around 20~30 mins for a party of 2.

We started with their house margaritas. They actually rimmed the glass with a special blend of salt -- more flavorful than regular table salt that other places use. Yum yum!!

I had their sea scallops appetizer as my meal, and it was amazing! The scallops were rich and creamy, well spiced, and paired well with the chorizo. I was surprised a Mexican place can deal with such a delicate seafood item so well -- I usually only see shrimps and fish done well in a Mexican-style dish.

The mister got the chicken molé and was really impressed with how tender the chicken was. The molé was pretty good too, not the best we've had but certainly not shabby.

Their complimentary chips and salsa are another crowd pleaser. Chips are similar style to Chevy's (thin), but with a richer corn taste, and they serve it with 3 kinds of salsa, one for every tastebud out there ;)

Overall I am very impressed. I usually like to go to taquerias or taco trucks but once in a while it's nice to have a sit-down Mexican place to chill at. Especially one that makes good drinks.
author: Alice C.

description:
Nothing says lazy Sunday afternoon like these two words:

Corona and nachos.

We happened to stumble upon this spot while waiting to board the party school bus for Napa. Thought we can grab a bite to eat and some cerveza before we head out. As you walk in, the rustic wood finishing and the colorful lights and palm trees teleports you into another place where time passes slowly. Having traveled to Mexico a few times in the past, this truly feels like an authentic Mexican restaurant!

There was something pleasantly peculiar with our nachos that we shared. We noticed that the carne asada had a bit of a sweetness to it...almost like brown sugar. It was different, unexpected, but still delicious. We wanted to eat more just to figure out exactly what it was.

Minus one and a half stars for attentiveness. In case you don't know, Tropisueno is a restaurant where you order your food at the register, sit down with a number, and they bring your food to you. After your food is served, there was a great lack of service. No one was checking in on us (or anyone for that matter) to make sure everything was okay. We needed more napkins and most importantly, utensils. After a few minutes, I had to get up and get them myself from their waiter station. I know doing so breaks an etiquette rule, but I couldn't wait any longer. 

Overall, this place is really cool. I would come here again if I was in the area in hopes that the wait staff would be more attentive the second time around.
author: Grace L.

description:
Conference Room T, do I really have to do this? Yes.

After almost three years of setting meetings here over $5 Margs with hab sauce & chips, the four of us -- all regulars and neighbors of the bar -- ran into a young man, the Host, who saw himself plush with more regard for himself than necessary. Because a young four set inquires about the happy hour and dinner at the same time, does not mean we don't want dinner, it means we want both. A fair question. So we all decided we'd like to sit and have dinner without the happy hour deals. But the Host didn't like our decision: "Let me see if I can find you a table." Cue the camera to pan across the empty dining room. Host turns away from us, seats other people. Forgets about us. Roger that. Not coming back. 

Rarely, if ever, do I write a review based on an experience like this, or in particular about a specific staff member. I've had countless straight forward experiences with the staff here and nothing was of it. This time... the oddity stood out to be enough of an aberration that something had to be said. 

Note: this sad tale happened back in December.
author: Jon A.

description: Had the shrimp burrito. The rice was great - slightly toasted like the rice at the bottom of the rice cooker. Everything else about it was average, and I didn't like the shrimp. Granted, I'm very particular about shrimp! It's nice that they have a condiments bar with pico de gallo and salsa etc., free corn tortillas and a few waiters to bring you chips or clear your plates even though it's largely self-service. I'd go for the ambience not the food.
author: Nicola L.

description: I wasn't quite sure about this place from looking at the pictures, but this place is great for a weekday lunch hour!  It's setup like a Chipotle where you order in a line, but then you go sit down and eat free chips and salsa while the servers bring your food out to you.  It's fast and seating was pretty easy to find.  I ordered 2 tacos which was pretty filling for me.  I also tried their tamales which wasn't my favorite.  It's a banana leaf tamale instead of a corn husk, and really dense.
author: Krystle L.

description:
this place definitely lives up to the hype! i brought my family here, and even though they aren't big fans of mexican food, they LOVED it! 

first, the chips & salsa is REALLY amazing. some of the BEST i've ever had! amazingly, all THREE are delicious, though uniquely different. our fave was the orange-y colored one. the chips are also on the thinner side, just the way i like them! and they are happily willing to refill either/or as much as you like!

we also ordered the cervice, which unfortunately was not so great. it tasted too fish-y, which is never a good sign. luckily, this was the only disappointment of the night. 

i ordered traditional chicken enchiladas, though i suggest getting the one with the corn cream sauce (best dish of the night!). my brother ordered the shrimp that was made in a similar sauce as the orange-y salsa, and it was also very tasty.

all in all, we were extremely happy with our meal & drinks! the prices are incredibly fair. service is attentive, and friendly. heads up, it was packed on a random Wednesday night, so i'm sure the wait time can be long on the weekends. but regardless, i would def rec'd this place to my friends and would love to come back!
author: Asmita J.

description: Slightly overpriced, but that's SF for you. Great drinks, salsa and tacos! Would definitely come back for the super tender beef cheek tacos. Mmm!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Pretty decent. The tacos had great flavor. The fish tacos were by far the best, the beef and chicken tacos were comically small (about the size of the top of a pint glass in diameter). The best item by far was the free guacamole. If you're looking for a quick place to eat right next to the MOMA this place is okay for that purpose.
author: Luke L.

description: Wow, I rarely take the time to write reviews unless it's amazing or atrocious. Unfortunately we had a terrible time here.  I have loved coming here for lunches and this was our first time trying dinner.  We were very impressed with how they change over the facility for dinner, quite neat!  From the moment our waiter met us, he either hated us, or hates working there.  Joselito stepped on my wife's foot when he first came up to our table and it went downhill from there.  We had to request a water for our child after he only brought some for us.  He left before we could finish telling him what kind of beans we wanted (there are 3 choices).  Our appetizers came over 10 minutes after our entres despite us specifically asking for them first (which is going above and beyond what you should have to do anyways) as one was our kids meal.  We had to flag him down to get tortillas that were supposed to come with our entrees and he only brought a couple.  We had to ask if he was bringing our guacamole appetizer and he brought it right out then.  A separate issue, but pretty sure he brought us just a side of guacamole as it was a tiny 1/2 cup scoop in a bowl.  If that's really $8, that's another issue!  He genuinely disliked us or perhaps he should no longer be part of the front of house staff.  That being said, everyone else we encountered was excellent.  The people next to us had Omar as their waiter.  He was a normal great waiter like you encounter all over SF but seemed like the best in the whole city compared to our experience with Joselito.  There is only one other time in my whole life I have left less than a 20% tip, it was that terrible.  My family has worked hard just to survive living in the city as non-techies and we can only afford 1-2 meals out a week.  I suppose we won't need to return to Tropisueno anymore. Sad. Cross your fingers you don't get Joselito if you decide to go because the food is tasty.
author: J C.

description:
Great food, they said an hour when we got there and were seated one great margarita later.  My wife is Mexican and can turn her nose up quickly to poorly executed rice and beans, she thought theirs were top notch.  Will be going back again, only regrets is that I ate too many chips to get desert (per usual).

One thing is that it's a bit dark, so if you're a dine in the bright type you may not enjoy it.
author: Drew Z.

description: I unfortunately will not have the opportunity to eat the food here. I only had an hour and assumed that I could grab a bar seat and help cure my hangover.  The ordering procedure forces all patrons who have the audacity to want to eat to stand in an ordering line much like many diners in the southwest. I don't doubt that the food is awesome considering the was much longer than this review. Also, the line seemed to move fast, but I move faster.... Great margaritas though.
author: christopher b.

description:
LOVE coming here for lunch. The line to order is a bit long, but the food is amazing and very affordable.

Totally different, but equally wonderful vibe for dinner. A tad pricier and there are no burrito options for dinner. The food felt very authentic.
author: Allison S.

description:
We booked using Open Table and within 2 minutes of arriving we were seated, eating tortilla chips and had glasses full of water. :-)

I got a veggie enchilada which was great. They fill the plate with rice and beans and salad all of which was really good. It was a huge plate but I ate every last bite cos it was so tasty.

Would definitely recommend the place. 
(they have good margaritas too)
:-)
author: Michelle O.

description:
2 stars for good food. Drinks are hit or miss. Service is absolutely horrible! This used to be our favorite spot in downtown with great ambiance, friendly and attentive service and great margaritas. My past few visits were terrible. I went there last night with couple of my friends. I had to wait for 25 minutes for a bartender to notice me at the bar. That didn't mean I was helped. I went to the other side of the bar only to hear from bartender "There is no need to stand here, I'll be with you when I have time". I didn't have a chair, so when a woman next to me closed her tab and left, I didn't hesitate to take her sit. Same bartender immediately told me that I couldn't take that sit since it belongs to a different area and called someone to take it away! Seriously?! People were sitting there just fine and I couldn't? I understand there are certain rules, I manage a bar myself in Marina and I know no matter how busy you are a smile and good attitude make a big difference. Being rude like that without saying a single nice word is absolutely inexcusable. Another time I had dinner there with my friend I only ordered an appetizer while my friend had a full dinner. I apologized to our server for not being very hungry and told him I'd make up for it with drinks. He got so pissed of, he literally told us we need to hurry up because other people were waiting for a table. And took my margarita from me half full! 
I guess their policy is to pay little attention to service since their location will keep them busy no matter what, but I really wish they could improve their attitude a little bit.
author: Olga S.

description: It was pretty good,  great location. chips had three dips, margaritas were great and the food was great as well. There was a note that vegetarians love this place as a tip. But honestly the vegetarian menu was extremely limited. But the food was still pretty good. The hostess gave us a half hour wait time but it was more like 10 min. Actually saw another couple leave when she said that to them.
author: Joe C.

description:
You call this mexican food?! HA!

Its not that its THAT bad, its just not THAT good. 
The best thing about this place is their drinks.

I like that they give you 3 salsas but honestly, they taste canned.

Cool atmosphere and always a fan of free chips. But the food ain't the business.
author: Brittini S.

description:
This place is very touristy yet being Latina I love the atmosphere here. The three stars is for my overall experiences here...it can be hit or miss.

If you want a table, you need a reservation...it is always crowded. Normally the wait is about an hour during the weekends without a reservation. I have always managed to wait and get a spot by the bar which is first come first served. 

I give four stars to their tasty margaritas...their names and flavor combinations are very creative.

Service...one day I had one of the best services ever by one of the waiters by he bar...but this was just once. Every
Time I come I wish he was always there! But other times we have been rushed and you can't even enjoy your drinks as you wished.

The food is ok...it is traditional Mexican but again this is a very touristy place so you may find better Mexican food in other spots of the city. The tamales are my favorite! And the free tortillas with the tasty sauces always make you smile.

I love the locale. Love the music, the low lights and everything inside the restaurant brings you to a little Mexican town...that I appreciate very much!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Great Mexican food at reasonable prices. Tropisueño provides great quality at fast food prices. 

You order your food at the counter and the food is brought to your table. The atmosphere is like a sit down restaurant.

The food is delicious. I order the Civiche appetizer which was fresh and not too acidic. I also had a steak taco and the meat was quite tender. I also loved the free chips that they give you. They are super light ans crispy. It goes great with the various salsas they have at the bar!

This place definitely exceeded my expectations!
author: Richard P.

description: Fun environment and the food was great! Went on a Thursday night and the place was packed! Great, authentic Mexican food, and the portions are extremely generous. The Chile Verde melted in my mouth, the beans and rice were delicious, and the cucumber margarita topped it off! Would definitely go back.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Loooove Tropisueno! This place is definitely my #1 go to spot for lunch. Awesome location - gets busy at lunch but they are very efficient and quick. I've had everything from tacos, to enchiladas, to the torta, to the burrito and i would recommend them all!!  The 1 item combo plate is a really good value. It's like 8 bucks and you will leave very full! Love that they also have outside seating.

They have free chips and salsa. The salsa bar is also awesome. I wish they sold their chipotle salsa! 

They also just started serving breakfast! I can only imagine how tasty their breakfast burritos are! Can't wait to try it!
author: Clarice C.

description:
Worth the hype!

Stayed at a hotel close to Tropisueno and decided to visit based on the positive Yelp reviews.

Arrived at 8pm on a Wed night and it was a 45 minute wait! Although the bar was open seating, i opted for the dining area and was hopeful it was a good sign. I planned to order the Chile Verde and try the chips and salsa, of course. I also wanted to try the plantains.

The bar area was lively and the dinner area a bit more subdued. Since I wanted to savor the meal I opted to avoid the bar. What was really pleasantly surprising was the 45 minute wait ended up being 10. Awesome!

It just got better from there. 

The chips were good. A bit greasy. The Salsa was excellent. The plantains came with black beans and was served as an appetizer. It was good but I found it a bit salty at first but once you ate it with the chips and salsa all the flavors and textures started coming together. Wow! The chile verde came with rice and freshly made corn tortillas. The portion size was huge and the flavors were on point!

Add to the great food was great service and a super attentive staff.

Now I know what all the hype is about. Next time Ill try the albondingas and the chicken asada.

Visit Tropisueno if you're ever in the City. It's well worth it!
author: Roehl A.

description:
We had a wonderful experience. We were quoted 45 minutes and maybe waited 20. Our server was so nice and helpful. My husband and I had the "ole school" pick 2 combos and both were great! The chips and dips were fresh and a nice touch.  

*On a personal note.. Our server asked if he could box up the food we didn't want so that it could be given to one of the many homeless in the city. I thought that was very thoughtful and touching.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I attended a Yelp event here when they first opened and everything was tasty, good drinks, and fun atmosphere. 

Love the Flautas, Chile Verde,and my mom loves the Albondigas soup. I'm also a regular for the Camarones. And fresh made house chips with 3 types of salsas. 

They somehow got a hold of my fav bartender from Ti Couz... ROMAN!!

Hes the best, and i found out hes not only bartending but serving, so everyone gets the best of all worlds. Ask for Roman... he makes the best Margi in SF. 

Good job to the Tropisueno management.
author: Adam X.

description:
We were able to make reservations for 6 on a Friday night at prime time (8pm ish).  Then we were able to add 2 more after more friends confirmed.  RESOS (and espeically those on Opentable) are a HUGE plus.

The inside is nice and pretty big, and the atmosphere was energetic.  Lots of peopled seemed to be winding down the week by just relaxing at Tropisueno.

I got the tamale and a taco, and wasn't too impressed, but I could be biased, as I compare all Mexican food to San Diego Mexican food.  Perhaps that is not wise.

Anyway, would maybe come back here again, but not really for the food.  Moreso the locatoin downtown, and atmosphere.
author: Adele Z.

description:
House margarita is rimmed with lemony spicy goodness. Everything I've tried on the menu has been nothing but delicious! 
I like coming in for lunch, it's a really casual and the food comes out really quickly. Not to mention the amazing salsa bar during lunch! So many salsas, not enough chips to eat them with.  No but really, sometimes I wish they gave you more chips. 
During dinner the ambiance completely changes, the lights are dimmed and romantic. Hard to get a dinner reservation the day of, so plan ahead. 
I would say that a plate can easily be shared, but it's not because you are going to think it's so tasty and wouldn't want anyone to take a bite from your plate.
author: Lissette V.

description: Way better that anticipated. The camarones were excellent. Considering how busy it was, the service was great.
author: Mike N.

description:
Tropisueno is a great fancy Mexican restaurant in the city. I add the fancy caveat because if I personally wanted Mexican, I would find myself in the Mission, but Tropisueno will definitely fill the void in the financial district. I think the ambiance and the decor is great, but due to its proximity to the big office buildings, its quite crowded and very loud. Also, the margaritas were great, but really pricey. Definitely not a place to go if I want to get drunk. Beers were reasonably priced so if I go back, I'm definitely grabbing beers. The food was awesome. I'm a huge fan of Ceviche and both Ceviches were great here. 

While I'm a firm believer in going to the Mission for cheap, Mexican food, Tropisueno gives you the bang for your bucks. As my roommate explains it, its like I'm paying for two burritos but getting two burritos worth of food. Definitely recommend hitting up once if you work in the area.
author: Cody M.

description:
What a hidden gem! Had never heard of this place but came with a friend for lunch today. Yummy! There was QUITE a line, it went medium fast. The food came out pretty quickly but they forgot to give us chips so we had to ask numerous times after our foo came.

I got the fish tacos and they were really yummy!! Definitely recommend this place for a friday night happy hour/dinner kind of place.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
The boyfriend and I wanted to celebrate my new job. We didn't need anything fancy- just a good margarita and some good food!

The atmosphere at Tropisueno ROCKS. I absolutely felt like I'd been transported into that hot, humid, paradise that is the coast of Mexico. 5 stars for ambiance! However, this place gets a little LOUD!

The service was friendly and attentive, and I liked that we never felt rushed. 

The chips are fresh, light,and, warm and possibly the best chip I've had in the city to date. I also enjoyed the trio of salsas- especially the tomatillo guac salsa and the red. Didn't really care for the queso dip, but boyfriend loved it!

We also ordered 2 margaritas- each. While I enjoyed it, Velvet Cantina still gets my vote for best margarita in the city. The proportions in this one were a little "off" for my taste.

Boyfriend ordered the Camarones Tropisueno and I ordered the Chili Verde. Both were quite good, but they didn't "wow" me overall. The pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the shrimp were plump and juicy (the sauce is the hot queso dip, which is probably why I didn't love this dish.) Mine was very flavorful, but I found it to be a little spicy (and usually, I like spice!)

Note: MAKE A RESERVATION! Otherwise, you'll wait...and wait...and maybe wait some more!
author: Annalise F.

description:
If in Soma and craving Mexican, visit Tropisueno! We went with a couple of our good friends who recommended this place and really enjoyed the margaritas, shrimp/camarones dish and warm chips with three different types of sauces/salsas. The mushroom empenadas were delish as well. Also, for the location, the prices are pretty reasonable (as we all know, Mex food should never be overpriced!)
I hear they have a good happy hour and would come back to try that next time around!
author: Kinjal N.

description: Lord oh lord, this is what Mexican food should be like. I wish that DC had food like this. Got some fish tacos which were meh. The chicken fajitas were baller and the burritos that we got were amazing as well. I think what made this place was the freshness of the ingredients and the sauces that they have. Some of the best Mexican food that I've had.
author: Izzat A.

description: Good food, good flavor and fair prices.  Crowded and noisy but still acceptable.  Absolutely no compliant about serving size and our waitress was outstanding. The one complaint was that out $10 margaritas came in a 12 ounce glass that looked great but was mostly ice. Two sips from the straw and all that was left was 10 ounces of melting ice cubes.  Still, we'd go back in a minute but would order beer instead.
author: Bill J.

description:
Excellent service with exquisite and authentic Mexican cuisine. We had a great time having dinner the first night in San Francisco.

Loved the complimentary chips and salsa, and the guacamole brought the appetizer to another level. In terms of entrees, we had Pollo Asado and Empanadas, and they were both really delicious. Chicken was cooked to perfection, it's tender and moist yet still falls right off the bone. The portions are generous and thoughtfully served in perfect balance and harmony.

Overall, would love to come back and enjoy a great evening in this warm and cozy restaurant.
author: Chris Z.

description:
Great salsa!
Good food and crazy loud atmosphere. Highly recommended! They give you a large amount of food so you will most likely be more then full on your way out. The service was amazing. I can't say for sure what made it such a good restaurant but I just really liked it and if you like Mexican I'm sure you will too! Seriously though, their chips and salsa is the best.
author: Michael R.

description:
Early for our 8pm rezzie so saddled up to the bar. Chips and Modelos carried us past 8 so I checked the hostess and find  I'm not on the rezzie. Turns out Open Table booked us for Thursday rather than today. Evidently this happens often when doing same day booking. I didn't know but hostess did. She felt quite bad for us and said she'd work to get is something. I returned to bar, where we had been gifted stools after ten minutes standing drinking, and my guest offers, "let's eat here at the bar." The bartender heard that, cleared the detritus away and placed our setting with weapons and two complimentary (and complementary) shots of organic tequila... Whatever that is.... We ordered up and had the best attention and service one could have. And when they were just a bit late with my guest's entrée... They comped it.

Good food, good night, all right.
author: S L.

description:
Stopped in for lunch after a morning filled with shopping. The food and atmosphere are awesome. 

Ordered the Tropisueo Torta which was packed with flavor. Also really enjoyed several salsas the salsa bar and the house margarita. 

We'll def be back before we leave town.
author: Dean P.

description: Today was our first time having lunch here and we had a great experience! The customer service was very attentive and we appreciated almost as much as we did their delicious food! We will definitely be back :-)
author: Alex R.

description:
The 4* review is for lunch.

I was looking for a quick place to have a burrito for lunch and Yelped from my hotel room to find a good place in the general area.  I stumbled across a raving Joi B review and since Tropisueno is literally in the same building as the Marriott Marquis I decided to give it a shot.

A Yelp truth, if Joi B says a place is really good, it is really good!

For lunch, this is a Mission style burrito place and it is really good.  $10 for a huge burrito with fresh ingredients and great service.  For lunch, this is a 4* place.

Sadly, I went back for dinner a few nights later and if I understand correctly, the dinner service is managed by a completely different set of people.  The waiter told me that the "lunch kitchen" is locked and that he could not obtain any ingredients that were utilized during lunch.  The dinner was ok, kind of pricey and the service was slow.  I had the Carne Asada type dish and it cost about $25.  

In summary, I would not go back for dinner but I would definitely go back for lunch.
author: Lance W.

description: My first time here & guaranteed it won't be our last! We had the best service from the the time we walked in to the time we left. We ate the chile verde & drank Micheladas and the Pepino Margarita!!
author: Brenda M.

description:
I'm from out of town and came in for a conference on Friday the 26th with a group of friends- we headed here on our first night for dinner and drinks because it was recommended to us, especially as somewhere near the financial district but reasonably priced.

First, the bad, just to get that out of the way: I've never experienced a more rude host in my life. We walked in the door and asked for a table for 3, and were immediately greeted with "well it's going to be at least an hour". No hi, no hello, nothing. So we asked if it'd be okay to grab drinks from the bar while we wait, and he replied with "well if you want to try, but the bar's small and it's full right now".

The rest of the exchange was even worse- the host snapped at us, skirted around answering fairly simple questions, and at one point interrupted my friend's question to chastise her for speaking when he wasn't done yet (while still not answering any questions). I've done food service, I get that employees get frazzled, but this wasn't just a stressed out employee. This guy was a complete jerk. 

And that point, I was tempted to say screw it and walk out. But the recommendations we'd gotten were so glowing, and honestly we were so hungry after travelling all day, that we decided to stick it out. I'm glad we did. Everything else was fabulous.

We got a margarita at the bar while we waited- despite the bar being very busy, the bartender was fast, friendly, and mixed a wonderful margarita. Ultimately, our wait ended up only being 30 minutes or so, totally reasonable given how busy they were. I got the chili verde, which was fantastic and a huge portion. My friends got a vegetarian dish and another pork dish, and both seemed to like them. The fresh guacamole was great, as was the second margarita ;) The vegetarian options on the menu weren't super obvious, but there are a few.

Thankfully, the rest of the staff here was great. Bartender was so friendly and quick, the waiter was extremely nice and explained all the options to my friend who was a vegetarian.

Ultimately, I'm glad we got past the awful host and stayed here, because we had a great time. But if I hadn't been so determined to stay there, I probably would have walked out and left an awful review- it's sad how one person can really ruin a place, especially when they're the person who is supposed to greet people.

Suggestions to the owners: Train your hosts to actually greet people. If possible, try to put more than one stall per bathroom (there was quite a line). Mark the vegetarian options on the menu to make it a bit easier to choose. Then this place would be perfect ;)
author: Amanda B.

description:
I took my husband here for lunch and I must say that the food was really good! My husband and I don't frequent SF often, but he said that he loves this place and will be back soon!! 

It's a must try...

Your friend,

OB
author: Ozzetta B.

description:
Very good quick Mexican option. For lunch, you can get your order in at the front and sit at the tables. Solid carnitas. Salsa bar lets you get more fixins too or pack yourself to go. The burritos can be massive. Order a huge for for two...

A solid Mexican food fix without the trip to Mission.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Trop is 2 blocks from my work. It's delicious. I love it. Everything is amazing - tacos (with the chicken tinga!), burritos, quesadillas and a must try favorite of mine - the Chicken and Vegetable Soup. 

I'm sure you haven't had it because you only go there for tacos and burritos, but trust me, it's just like the Soup Nazi's crab bisque, you can't eat it standing up. Your knees will buckle!

It's a huge bowl full of shredded chicken, vegetables and avocado in an incredible broth served with tortilla strips on the side. It's the best Jerry, the best.
author: John D.

description: Cochinita was pretty tasty. The place has nice ambiance, though it can get a little cramped (what do you expect in SF). Service was fast and friendly.
author: Gabby W.

description: KILLER vegetarian soup (pozuelo vegetariano and margaritas. I took a second order home - of soup, if you're wondering.
author: Pablo P.

description: I've been back a handful of times, and I'm upgrading my rating to 5 stars. I just love love this place (dinner only.. reservations is a MUST). Oh get the barbacoa..  in a taco or enchilada.. it is amazing.
author: Vol T.

description: Great lunch place. Line up to order then get a #. The sautéed veggie burrito is REALLY good. Free chips with lunch and they have a salsa bar.
author: Christine L.

description: very popular place w good ambiance. I liked the fact I can see food preparing. I had shrimp taco w fish taco & both were very good ! I did have stomach cramp after, don't know why. I just could not walk the city around after... May be it was just my bad day
author: Takae K.

description: This place is usually impossible to get in, so I was thrilled to finally have reservations. Loved it that they were accommodating when we changed the reservations to include more people at the last minute as well as when we were running 5-10 mins late. Service was very friendly. Plantains were great, the guac was fresh and my spicy shrimp was to die for. Overall, I give the food 2 giant thumbs up. The only thing I would recommend would be a tad more light to read the menus , (though I love the ambiance )and a little more efficiency with the table service. ( We had to make several requests for cutlery, plates , water etc)
author: Neha K.

description:
Wow I would have never imagined an amazing Mexican restaurant being located in the SOMA over the Mission.

I bookmarked Tropisueno after seeing how highly rated it was. Most people seemed to agree that it had the best damn chips and salsa in the city. Boy were they right! 

The first time I came here it was during lunch hours, which make seating and ordering more casual. You order at the counter and sit where you choose and they bring your order out. I settled on the chile relleno platter. While waiting for my entree, I had a tremendous amount of chips and salsa. The chipotle and salsa verde are to die for. Both are very flavorful and give you that extra kick you crave when chomping on tortilla chips. The chips were fried to perfection and were bottomless.

When my order came, it was drizzled in the appropriate amount of cheese and sauce. The ingredients were fresh and everything has an amazing amount of flavor. This was definitely the best chile relleno outside of my grandma's cooking I have had.

The second time I went here was with the boyfriend to show him how amazing the food was. He loves chile rellenos as well, but decided on the beef stuffed one, which both of us agreed was amazing. Our server was attentive and kind and we got flour tortillas with our entrees! 

If you are in the city, visiting Yerba Buena or are in the downtown area, YOU MUST GO EAT HERE. You would be cheating yourself not to!
author: Surge C.

description: We are staying at the Marriott next door and we're looking for a close dinner option. We couldn't have been happier. Right outside the hotel and the food was excellent. I had the Pollo Asado - moist and cooked perfectly. My sig other had Chili Rellenos, her favorite, and said it was the best she had tasted in a long time. The staff was friendly and Jorge went above and beyond to take care of us. Overall, a great experience and we are likely to return.
author: Gary P.

description: A coworker and I stopped by here for dinner and the wait was 1.5 hours. Since he was really excited to try the place, we decided to wait. I was hoping that the wait reflect how good the food is but I was disappointed. The chips and salsa were good, but the salsa wasn't very spicy. Our server was verrrrryy slow and borderline rude. I ordered the mole poblano, which I think is hard to ruin. The chicken was more bone than anything, the rice tasted fake, but the beans were okay. I decided to give this place one last try and ordered a tres leches cake, which was far too dry and was missing the key "tres leches" taste. Sigh. A bit pricey for mediocre food.
author: Cyn N.

description:
i think tropisueno has some of the best mexican food found in the city (well, outside of the mission at least).

BUT what is beyond frustrating is that their happy hour is completely exclusive!!! it is nearly impossible to ever get a seat in this place during happy hour. that didn't used to be the case, but now it is. for at least the past 8 or 9 months, my coworkers and i walk in for happy hour, and then are forced to walk right back out as there are never any tables, or spots at the bar, or places to stand/move/breathe. ever!!!

and yet there is a completely empty 75% of the restaurant that is roped off! i'm sorry, but that is just inexcusable when you have a bunch of people waiting around wanting to give you their patronage. i know you want to make more money by saving those tables for people who will eventually be coming in and buying dinner, but obviously you have out grown your designated happy hour area. and we want our margaritas!!!
author: Molly E.

description: Damn! Best Mexican food I've had in years! The lunch-time line to get in almost made me walk away. Would have been a huge mistake. Good drinks too.
author: Tony G.

description:
I love this place! Except when it's suuuper busy =/

Happy Hour at the bar is the way to go. It's from 4pm - 6pm Mon - Fri

What can I say, all the food is delicious. Very good quality. They have some tasty margaritas, and micheladas. Great service at the bar!
author: Michelle W.

description: Our dinner here was awful. Extremely slow service, no plates with our app, slow drink service, absent server, salty, odd flavored food. The seafood stew came with little seafood and the broth was unimpressive. This seems to be a hangout spot for mostly drinking and downing tortilla chips.
author: Jesse P.

description: Food terrific but don't bother going on a game night.  We had 5:30pm reservations but went early for happy hour.  Happy hour so packed no possibility of getting a table or drink but they won't let you sit down in the huge (empty) dining room until 5:30 when it opens for dinner so we sat in the lobby--just waiting for our table. Watching the hostess interact with customers, we nick named her the Mexican Food nazi (referencing the Seinfeld Soup Nazi episode) she was that rigid.   When finally seated they rushed us so badly to order, eat and get out so they could turn the table we were just weary of the whole thing by the time we left.  So, go when they aren't busy to enjoy the really delicious food.
author: Ces M.

description:
Great place! We just happened to check on yelp and stopped in to try it! We were running in from the rain and it was in between lunch and dinner in the grey
area of 4-5pm! We sat and ordered drinks and perused the menu! I have to say they make the best sangria I've ever had! The food was amazing and we didn't know if we needed reservations, but we didn't have any! The host was gracious enough to seat us and we had an awesome meal! The chips and salsa were tasty and delicious! For dessert we had chocolate flan to die for! I can't wait to go back!
author: Dolores M.

description: I have been to Tropisueno numerous times and am constantly impressed by the awesome service, delicious eats and tasty drinks! Whether sitting at the bar or at a table, lunch or dinner, this place, located conveniently close to my work, has failed to let me down. I have found myself addicted to their chips, which are the crunchiest, lightest tortilla chips I've ever had. The tacos de cachete are so tender and the camarones tropiqueno are so spicy and flavorful. The drinks are strong with a hefty 2oz+ of tequila. The bartenders are extremely attentive and make some mean mezcal cocktails, which made me fall in love with the spirit. Can't wait to get my next fix!
author: Ariel B.

description: I've been to Tropisueño a few times and have never had any issues but my experience today was all bad. First, the service was pretty slow and not very attentive. When I sat down I asked for two waters, which we never received. And then we asked for two different orders which came on one plate. I then asked a different waiter if we could get another plate and that didn't happen either. We ended up taking the two plates and utensils set up on the table next to us and using those. These two things on their own aren't that bad but then we are essentially told we have to leave because another party is coming in and they have a reservation. We were about to leave anyway but my friend and I both felt it was rude and uncalled for as there were other tables available that the other party could have sat at. I like Tropisueño but this sadly makes me not want to come back.
author: Jessica R.

description:
It was my first time ever in California, and the first time I had "west coast Latino food." It was definitely better than any Latino food I've had on the east coast, but it's still not five stars, because I went to the Mission District the following day and had an UNBELIEVABLY delicious (and underpriced) meal. 

I'm Dominican, so I'm not the best judge of Mexican food, but this did taste pretty good. They also had vegetarian options, which was good for my very vegetarian friend. The waiters were very friendly and we had no trouble getting seated. The service was a little bit slow, but still pretty good (besides, everything is slower out west).

I definitely recommend this to whomever would like to try something different. The music was from the Hispanic Caribbean (bachata, salsa, merengue), so it felt sort of like a Latin "fusion" type of restaurant.
author: Maria D.

description: In town on business from LA. Stopped in for a quick breakfast burrito. Ridiculously good and ridiculously huge. Quick, friendly service. Highly recommend this place.
author: Chase B.

description: Fun atmosphere at night! Feels like youre in Mexico, sort of. All the waiters and waitresses were very nice, helpful and accommodating! Loved that! The free chips and 3 salsas were delicious, it could make anyone happy! I ordered 2 tacos individually since I wanted something light. Delicious! My boyfriend ordered a dinner plate and everything tastes great. The pinto beans were irresistible. A little on the pricey end given the type of food but given thee experience, I didn't mind it. The restaurant was very packed, hot and uncomfortable at peak dinner hours though :(
author: M. N.

description: Their happy hour is incredible! Seating is first come first serve, but the prices for the dishes are cheap as could be with good portion sizes. We were able to get four or five dishes for $20, and were stuffed afterwards. Compared to the regular menu, this was an awesome deal and we were happy to arrive early!
author: Sarah C.

description:
If you don't feel like lugging yourself all the way to the Mission, Tropisueno is an acceptable quick-fix.

Their chips are the best in the city, entrees are decent standard fare, their Peruano beans are delicious(!) and their drinks are potent! If you go, definitely save room for dessert - their Mexican chocolate fondue is EXCELLENT! They give you strawberries and cookies to dip, and the chocolate is perfectly sweetened. Chocolate + Strawberries, what could go wrong?!

This is a grrrreat place for groups - they let my friends and I be loud and obnoxious (thankfully, it was late and we tried not to traumatize the other diners too much).
author: Shachi B.

description:
I give this a 3 due to the latex gloves. I have found that many Mexican restaurants do not use latex gloves so I was a bit surprised.. and disappointed. For all you allergy sufferers out there. This food is prepped with and prepared with latex gloves. 

If this ever changes I would love to go and eat there.. the atmosphere is very charming
author: Ashley G.

description:
A nice Mexican place to eat at downtown. It gets a bit cray-cray during lunch hours (as everyone and their business partners from the Fi-Di storm this place). Tip: during lunch, there are no reservations, it's just order, take food, scrounge for a table and sit down.

The reason why it's just A-OK is because the food is just A-OK for fancy Mexican. I had the shrimp and fish tacos and they were just average - nothing spectacular like Tacolicious or like authentic Mexican tacos. :\ The only redeeming factor for my meal was maybe the margaritas. They weren't that strong - which I guess is a good thing since I came in for lunch :o).
author: Christina C.

description: Great service and delicious food.  The complimentary chips and three salsas were all very good, especially the green salsa.  I had the Sopa de Pollo which was a dinner-portion fragrant, spicy chicken soup that really hit the spot.  The restaurant was packed and everything looked delicious.  Definitely make a reservation.
author: Becky S.

description:
This is a review for their happy hour which is m-f 4-6pm. I am not sure why others feel like the tacos are bigger than usual as they are pretty much the same size everywhere. (Cmon the tortillas are the same..) Nevertheless, the bottomless chips and dipping sauces were terrific and the chicken and fish tacos were delicious! 

Only downside is that they closed down most of the tables for happy hour so it was quite cramped at the bar.
author: Spencer H.

description: Pleasant surprise. I found this place on yelp and my coworker confirmed that it's great. I tried it and order the camarones tropisueno (not sure if I spelled it right ) at the hostess' suggestion and it was great, a bit spicy for those who are not a fam of the extra kick. But overall enjoyed my time here. It's a popular place had an hour wait but I sat at the bar. And this is a Wednesday night, I can only imagine what it's like on a weekend.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Honestly, the reason this is a 2 and not a 3 or 4 is because of the horrific service we received on Friday.

Ambiance: Pretty cool.  It's not a huge place but, very welcoming.

Food : Well I would be able to tell you more if we had received it all.  There were 5 of us for dinner.  Out of 5 drinks, one was completely wrong and the waitress made a point to tell me she would take it off our bill.  Ummm, i would hope so since she ordered the wrong thing.  Out of 5 appetizers, only 4 made it to the table and of those 4 only 3 made it prior to the entrees arriving.  Of the 5 entrees only 3 arrived.  Why only 3?  That would be because the waitress forgot to order the other 2.  Yep, crazy right?  
The food which did arrive was tasty : Nopales enchiladas, Tampiqueno (carne asada), ceviche trio and the empanadas.

The spicy mango margarita was delicious and I loved the extensive tequila menu.

Service : I think this goes without saying.

Will I go back - probably not.  On to the next spot!
author: Denise G.

description: you've raised the health score! i'm so excited i want to cry - see you soon!!
author: Kimberly B.

description:
