I love their salsa bar. They had so many different varieties, and as others have mentioned, their orange salsa is delicious! Salsa and chips-- definite winner. I also used some of their salsas to spice up my rice and beans. 

I had the combination platter with two flautas, but I was rather disappointed. The flautas were more like taquitos, rather hard and not as tasty as the 3 for $4 flautas I can find in the SoCal drive-throughs. When I'm paying $10 for a plate (which did come with the aforementioned rice and beans), I expect a bit more.

The burrito was decent. Again, nothing that amazing. Chipotle tastes just as good, if not better (and is cheaper). 

The biggest draw is the salsa bar, but that's not enough of a reason for me to come back for a meal. I would, however, consider coming back for drinks (ambiance is fun).
author: mina y.

description: Veggie burritos, fresh, friendly, cold beer, sidewalk and indoor seating. Just do it !
author: Ed H.

description: Been here a couple times now and have had pleasant experiences. I personally think that the dinner experience is much better but the lunch I had was still very good. This is right in the middle of soma which makes it an ideal spot to stop by for lunch. The one thing that threw me off was that it is a counter style ordering system for lunch rather than just a sit down with a waiter to attend to you. I can see how this is very ideal for the quick lunch especially when you only have an hour to spare, but when looking for a higher quality meal this can be a turn off. I decided to go with the chicken enchiladas for my lunch with rice and beans, the meal also comes with awesome chips that tasted homemade! The salsa bar is also incredible offering 5-6 salsas and other condiments like jalapeños. Overall this is a great spot to check out in soma with authentic tasting Mexican food.
author: Josue V.

description: Went with a party of 4 other people and loved the ambience, food and service. I can't wait to come here again and try one of their other plates. The chips and variety of salsas they serve as appetizers are very tasty and different from most mexican places.  This place tastes authentic and the service is superb.
author: Dani P.

description:
I really like this spot.

Even though San Francisco has some great Mexican food, most places are taquerias as opposed to actual restaurants and it's nice to have this one.  

Most of the items are really good.  

Platanos Fritos - fried sweet plantains with black beans and cream
Molotes - small corn masas filled with chorizo, corn and cheese 
Flautas - crispy rolled corn tortillas filled with seasoned chicken and topped with salsa verde and cream
Chicken Mole - a nice-tasting dish of chicken stewed with several spices
Combination Plates - Tacos, Enchiladas, Tamales, Flautas/Taquitos - all is great!

Make sure you arrive early or with a reservation since this place is very popular.
author: Ken G.

description:
FOOD/MARGARITA:
1.) Quesadilla
2.) Fish Taco
3.) Taco
4.) Tostado - ooh i liked this one. the beans added a nice touch
5.) Taquitos
6.) Margarita - strong, but tastes fine after licking a lil salt off the brim

Everything was good. Slightly average, maybe above. But it was cheap eats but good service, atmosphere, happy hour


SERVICE:
Bartender and busser annnnd host were all very nice and friendly ;)



ATMOSPHERE:
Casual Mexican...  Bar area, and also dining area. Has a foreign vacation feel to it.
author: Angela L.

description: I love this place. Very authentic Mexican food. I ordered their soup multiple times: it's a pretty big plate of soup.
author: Svetlanko I.

description: AMAZING!!! The food is some of the best Mexican food i have ever eaten. The atmosphere is young, fun, and delightfully homey.
author: Zeke F.

description: This is such a convenient and delicious Mexican food place! Being a vegetarian, I have many food choices that are all super delicious! The margaritas are also good!
author: Isha J.

description: Yum, Yum, and more yum!  While in San Francisco for a weekend, I was craving good, Mexican food and also trying to nurse a hangover.  We were lucky to get a reservation to this place - they get busy as the evening progresses so plan accordingly!  It's in a weird location but the food and drinks are authentic and well priced.
author: Leslie G.

description:
Huge portions, tender flavorful meat, instant refills on crisp chips, and great service.  You'll be satisfied whether you order the pollo asado (chicken), tampiqueno (carne asada/steak), or chili verde.  Leave room for beans because you'll get plenty of it as a side whether its pinto or refried. 

The ambiance is simple, cozy and dim, but it seems popular for celebrations.  Parking can be tough on the street, but there are nearby garages.
author: Jenny L.

description:
3.5 stars. Would return if I'm in the area and hankering for a sit-down Mexi-meal -- especially to try the tacos.

I must've walked by this place a million times in the past and not realized that it was here... the signage is not exactly the most prominent. It's a good thing, then, that Yerba Buena Lane isn't that long... so you're sure to notice it soon enough.

Anyhoo... I had heard great things about Tropisueño and I was really eager to try it. Thus, when friends suggested meeting up here, I was totally game. And I'll say it's definitely a worthwhile place to eat if you're staying in the area or meeting up with some friends. You will enjoy it. The food and drinks are swell and the atmosphere is lively. 

Our waiter was a peach. He knew the menu well, and steered us in the right direction. Everything came out speedily and as requested. 

The chips are light and crispy, just like I like 'em. We got three different salsas -- I tried the "red one" and liked it - a bit of kick without making you breathe fire. Our waiter took the chips away as he brought our food... which sounds like a potentially bad thing, but it was actually thoughtful. He said, "Now that you have your food, you'll want to concentrate on that." Which is true -- you get a very substantial meal here, and it's delicious, so why fill up on chips if you're here for a main event? 

Margaritas are wonderful. They taste really fresh -- the house has an almost herbaceous edge -- and they serve them on the rocks. I tried the house and the watermelon. The house was great but I think I give the edge to the watermelon. No pitchers.

To the entrees... I loved my chili verde -- gone in a flash. Lots of tangy flavors, slightly spicy, and the meat was super tender. The accompanying rice provided a nice vehicle for absorbing some of the extra sauce. Perfecto! My friend loved her salmon -- which our sharp waiter recommended. And her husband had something with beef (sorry... can't remember what! Bad Yelper!) and he thought it was good -- wasn't raving over it, but was happy. Three types of beans -- refried, pinto, and black -- showed up at our table. I thought they were all grand, and the refried beans weren't greasy. Also really enjoyed the fresh, hot tortillas... though with the rice and beans, I honestly just had one, only to try it.  

And I notice they like to keep the beverages movin' here. Even though they put a bottle of water on your table, the waiters and servers come by frequently to make sure your glass stays full. I really appreciated that. And the margaritas: Dang. We'd pretty much finish off a glass and it was like they had installed radars in the bottom of those glasses, designed to go off at the moment of Margarita Completion. Our waiter would come right by and be all "Can I get you another?" as if we were hanging out in his home and he was just being a gracious host. :) You're almost ready to say yes because they're so good... and the tequila wears your defenses down... so be ready to say no! Once you're in Margarita Town (TM) it's easy to be all, "Yeah, bring it on!" and forget that (a) there's tequila in them thar drinks and (b) you are, in fact, paying for them...

Given the proximity to all sorts of hotels and businesses, it draws a crowd. So, DO get reservations because even on a weeknight it gets busy. And if you're the first to arrive and your friends are on their way... still check in with the person at the front. They won't seat you until your entire party's there, but at least they probably won't give your table away.

Long story short: You'll enjoy your food and beverages. Convenient to BART, hotels, and lotsa offices. Have fun!
author: Tami S.

description: Not a bad place for Mexican food considering this is downtown. It's a little pricier than the taquerias in The Mission, but if I was downtown this is probably my go to place if I want Mexican food. It gets very busy for lunch so call in your order if you plan on picking it up. I recommend the shrimp burrito. It's pretty big, but it feels me up for the rest of the day. The horchata here isn't too bad either. Happy hour is great over here too, but it also feels up pretty quickly so try to get there early if you want to grab a seat inside.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
12/5/10 Update:
Dishes I would not recommend:
-Chuleta de Puerco Adobada (pork chops) - $16
(Takes way too long to cook and not worth the wait. The meat was not that juicy or tender and the marinade was too salty.)
-Pozole Vegetariano - $12
(WAY TOO SALTY...to the point where I could not even have more than a few sips of this. I ended up just consuming all the veggies in the broth but left the broth untouched after a few sips. Definitely would not order this again.)

The chips and salsa never disappoints though. The service is also always great here. I guess I should just stick to ordering the dishes I know are good here.


October, 2010
Since my last post, I've also tried the Tampiqueno (carne asada) and Pollo Asado (herb-marinated chicken).  The carne asada was amazing!  The meat was very tender and juicy.  The Pollo Asado was well marinated but a little bit on the dry side.  I loved the side of grilled mixed vegetables that came with the dish though...it was so good I almost wanted to order an additional side of vegetables.  As always, the chips and salsa were to die for and the service was excellent!  I have yet to be disappointed by this place.  Can't wait to come here again!
author: Angela F.

description:
On one of our semi-regular outing to try fancier Mexican places, we stumbled into Tropisueno. The wait was almost an hour, but we got some really good margaritas, so we soon stopped caring.

The chips and salsas here are amazing. Red, green, orange, doesn't matter. All tasty. We also got some guac, which was equally great.

I ordered the seafood soup, because it was a soup kind of night. It was FILLED with pieces of fish, shrimp, and scallop. Sort of like a cioppino, but MEXICAN AND BETTER. My friends loved the enchiladas. For the sole vegetarian in the group, the waiter recommended an off-the-menu tofu dish in...some sort of sauce. My friend regretted not ordering it in hindsight, because we saw one come out as we were leaving, and it looked amazing.

Our server was my favorite kind of server - tell-it-like-it-is, no-nonsense. When we asked about two dishes, he frankly told us that he would not recommend one of them. This is quite refreshing to hear, and made the decision process that much easier.

I hear their happy hour is great so will have to come back to try that.
author: jon y.

description:
Great atmosphere. Small and crowded (for good reason). The menu is not as extensive as some might like, but you wont be disappointed with the choices. There is something for everyone.

The food is excellent and so is the service. Prices are quite reasonable as well. 

Made it to my favorites list.
author: Mario J.

description: Damn, great Mexican food!  I mentioned this place to a friend from Houston.  She said that she knew good Mexican food, and it wasn't in SF.  Then she tried it, and admitted that this place is the bomb!  On top of that, the service was great - thanks Monique!
author: Mike L.

description: Would go back Have had the enchilda's & Chili Reiono both were enjoyable
author: Angie D.

description:
100 percent on their health inspection makes me a happy eater. 
Liked the fact that they had a salsa bar.
Chips were good as well
author: Raquel R.

description:
I have come here about 3 times so far, two times for a casual lunch with coworkers and once for drinks. I would say the price for their food is definitely worth it; really good filling food that doesn't make you feel like you ate a heart attack like farrolitos food does. 

Drinks- their margaritas are excellent and packs a punch! My advice is to go with the classic margarita for $8, the flavored ones like mango or strawberry will be $11 and done taste as good! It's a shame they don't have a happy hour menu. 

Seating is first come first serve and it can get pretty crowded during lunch and dinner times. There is also some outdoor seething if you're feeling up to facing the sf wind. It may be a little difficult to find seating for a large group during peak times! They hand you a number after you order and maybe 10, 15minutes later they bring your food to you! You also don't have to bus your own table after you're done. 

All in all, good food and a fun casual atmosphere that's good for groups! Drinks are a little pricey in my opinion and I really wish they had a happy hour menu!
author: Sandy L.

description: Excellent and fun Mexican restaurant in SF! Homemade warm chips which are excellent although oily. I ordered the camarones tropisueno which was delicious and creamy and SO filling!! Between the chips and salsa and my entree I was stuffed!! Great restaurant with large dining area!
author: Negar S.

description:
The burrito is giant - the weight of  a small baby, and seriously difficult to get through.

I love the salsa bar - there's at least 8 styles to loads up on which means you'll be doing a lot of chip eating, because they're all addictive. I'm a fan of the double dip - two salsas on the one chip. 

It's busy, especially at lunch time when the line reaches the door, so come with a little more time up your sleeve to truly enjoy yourself otherwise you'll be scarfing down that burrito baby in double time.
author: Tresna L.

description:
If you're staying at a hotel near Union Square or work in the area, this is a fantastic place to get takeout (i say takeout because this place is constantly slammed with people, especially at nights, and the wait is usually 1+ hours to get a table). 

Love the special enchiladas they have right now, veggies and nopales with a corn cream sauce. The black beans are to die for, the mexican rice has a zesty kick to it, and you get a bit of pickled cabbage with the dish as well. 

Affordable too, and the lunch menu is quick/delicious. 

Docked a star because the last time I got the enchiladas (with chicken), it was completely nasty and inedible. The chicken was fully (and i mean fully) fatty/gnarly and disgusting. After that visit, I started going solely for the veggie choice.
author: Kim C.

description:
Very disappointed with the chicken with mole. The chicken was super hard and so was the skin. The mole sauce was nice, but we wasted a big leg piece for the most part, since we simply would not chew and it was VERY low on any salt!

The empanadas were nothing to write home about $8 for 2 veggie ones iirc.

free chips and salsa were good and the margarita was solid.
author: Sumit C.

description:
Came in for a quick lunch and dinner. Dinner was ok (take a pass), but I highly recommend rolling in here for lunch. Here's the rundown on the grub: 
- chili verde was the best
- chicken and steak solid

If you find yourself at the Marriott or one of the nearby hotels and need a quick lunch option, this is it.
author: Jeff F.

description: The salsas were great. The service was wonderful. Tasted the Chicken Tacos and Enchiladas which was delish with black and pinto beans. So glad to find this place. The drinks were good too!
author: Tanvi C.

description:
I was really surprised by this place. Usually no good can come of a restaurant in a big industrial complex with other corporate places to eat but the food was more unique than the El Torito experience (and crowd) I was expecting.

Aside from more than a few complications with ordering from our waiter, the food was sent to the table within what seemed like minutes of ordering. 

Here are the things that really surprised me in a lovely way:

1) The chips at the table are light, airy, (therefore: dangerous) and different than any other tortilla chip I've had

2) The three sauces/ salsas that come with the chips are entirely different from one another and run the perfect gamut of mild, medium and spicy

3) The menu is the right size and more than reasonably priced. It's great that they have a soup and stew section with Pozole; I don't see it very often.

Here are the things that I didn't love:

1) The food was really salty. I know that can sometimes come with the Mexican food territory, but I was drinking water like a fish all night.

2) The waste. Between myself and two friends, we loved the spiciest salsa and every time we asked for more of the one in particular, they brought a tray with all three fully replenished, even though our first tray had the first two almost untouched.

It's hard to find a place in SF where you can just walk in on a weekend for dinner and not have to wait an hour+ for a table. It worked here and exceeded expectations. I'll be back.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Best part of this place:  Amazing free chips and fresh salsa's.  Really cheap lunch meals and really really good happy hour specials.

The bad:  This place is slammed damn near every single time I have gone here.  Service has kept up the pace as best as possible.

Their quick service method that they use is rough for trying to get your order quickly as well as chips and salsa.
author: Jon G.

description:
Bar seating had great service, strong drinks, and even though it was a busy Friday night our food did not take more than 20 minutes. 

Try the..
Jamaicazo
Chile with cheese tamal
Spicy chicken taco
Plantain appetizer

The spanish rice is only second to my mother's. ;)
author: Licette M.

description: I hadn't heard anything about this place when one of my friends suggested we go here for dinner after work. All she told me was it was Mexican food. Nice, I'm down for tacos and burritos. I was expecting a hole in the wall like down in the mission but when I walked through the front door I quickly noticed just how hip and trendy it was.  It had a really vibrant bar and a pretty fun vibe. I thought maybe this might get expensive but again I was in for a nice surprise. The food and drink were all very reasonably priced and legitimately delicious! I tried three different tacos (al pastor, carne asada, and camarones) , and I really thought all of them were good. Between the tortilla chips and salsas (3 kinds) and the generously portioned tacos, I was super full.  Overall, I really enjoyed my entire experience here.
author: Huy V.

description:
homemade tortilla chips + salsa + margarita = balanced diet? hell yeah!
cool atmosphere, awesome tequila cocktails and the tacos al pastor were delicious!

I definitely want to come back to try the happy hour!
author: Debbie C.

description: Had the mole and it was really good, and I also like their 3 different salsas that come with the chips. I had eaten here last year for lunch on the way to a giants game and had a mole burrito. I think I like the mole better in burrito form for some reason.
author: John G.

description:
With this visit to Tropisueno, we have dined at each and every restaurant in Yerba Buena Lane! 
The restaurant is busy before opening time. The bar is buzzing, and guests just stand around, waiting to be seated. 
Comes 5:30 pm, and the hosts promptly seat everybody. The server came to take our drinks order, and a gentleman brought chips and salsa right after. The drinks are great, we had the margarita Tropisueno and the mango jalapeño margarita, both are delicious and potent.
For appetizer we had the fried plantains, on a bed of black beans. I think next time I will order this for dessert. 
We had the shrimp entree ( cooked with tequila! ), the steak tampiqueno carne asada entree ( very tender ) and the enchiladas. All three entrees tastes fantastic, generous portions, the steak was very scrumptious and tender. Very tasty food. 
We did not have time for dessert since we had to go watch Star Trek. 
Judging by how people were lining up to wait for a table, and how tasty the food was, I think we will definitely come back here next time we go see a movie again. Everybody around us was having a great time too, this restaurant has a very good vibe. 
Service was excellent, drinks and food came fairly fast.
author: lovetoeat a.

description: This is hands down my favorite restaurant and bar in SF. Moving here from LA I was looking for a spot with great food, drinks and atmosphere. Tropisueno is everything I was looking for. Whether I come in for the taqueria style lunch, the best happy hour ever, or the dinner that I would be proud to bring any date to, I'm never disappointed. The dinner menu is filled with great options, but my personal favorite is the Enchiladas de Nopales. The food is amazing and you won't be disappointed, but what keeps me coming back are the people. Sit at the bar and you will always be served by someone who will make your day/night enjoyable. Whether it is Alejandro telling me about the best mezcal you can find, or Rachel putting her little twist on a Spicy Margarita, I always leave feeling better than I walked in. If you are looking for the perfect date spot, the best tequila bar, or the lunch that makes the rest of the day easy, do yourself a favor and come here. I am sure you will find your own reason to love it.
author: Michael K.

description: Beautiful atmosphere (dim, loud, but great for groups and Friday nights). Food was excellent. The guacamole the was what I was looking for.
author: Jo Y.

description:
After perusing Yelp for dinner ideas, I stumbled upon Tropisueno. With two dollar signs and over a thousand reviews I figured it was worth a try.  Yelp delivers another gem!

Tropisueno is delicious.  The chips are salty and crisp, the salsa trio is refreshing, and the margaritas are delightful.  My friend and I both ordered the combo plate and side of guac, which, along with the complimentary chips and salsa, gave us plenty of food.

The staff is attentive and friendly.  This is a great Mexican restaurant worth the trip to the Financial District. 

I can't wait to go back here again!
author: Annie M.

description:
Excellent food, quick service and great margaritas!

I love the three types of salsa they offer with chips!

LOVE LOVE LOVE!
author: K T.

description:
On the seventh day,
God made cucumber margaritas at Tropisueño.
He deemed them delicious, had a few too many, and slacked a little on continent creation (Hi, Antarctica!).

Thousands of years later, I couldn't be more grateful for his overindulgence.  (Sorry, Adellie penguin rookeries, but if this was the trade, I'm just glad you can huddle to keep warm.) 

As Pee-Wee Herman once said,,

'TEQUILA!!'
author: Lea N.

description: I liked my tostada. It looked small but it was packed with meat. My husband felt his carne asada was only ok. Lacked flavor he said. Kids had tacos and the mother-in-law had fajitas. Nothing exciting. The chips and guacamole were really good though. Lastly it was pricey! $100 for 2 dishes, 6 tacos, 1 tostada, chips and guacamole and 4 Mexican drinks and 2 sodas.
author: Billie B.

description: Overpriced for what you get. During the lunch crush, forget about getting a quick bite much less even getting in the door. It's packed and once you get in, order, and try to find a place to sit - you'll be hit with a ton of noise in what's essentially a packed cafeteria. The food is so-so, minus the chips and salsa. You're better off eating at the Metreon or Westfield food court.
author: Grayson E.

description:
"Who says you can't make great Mexican food outside the Mission?"

"Who says you have to sit in a crummy room to get authentic food?" 
(or, if the room's nice why does it have to be so over-priced?)

------------------------------------------------

(Took the above quotes off of the Tropisueno website) 
Those two exact thoughts are what led me to finding and visiting Tropisueno. Boyfriend and I wanted to have dinner out last Friday and realized it had been a long time since we had Mexican food. Since it was a weekend date night, I wanted to go somewhere with a decent atmosphere (don't get me wrong, I love taquerias, however, for a Friday night I wanted to go somewhere we could sit at for awhile, have drinks, etc). Also, due to the crazy storm we just had this past weekend, I didn't really want to drive too far for food. Hence, after a little Yelping, seeing great reviews, and remembering having passed by Tropisueno, a dinner destination was chosen.

We went to Tropisueno on Friday night for our 7:30pm reservation and the place was packed! The only issue I had with this was that it was really loud/noisy, tables seemed to be extra tight next to each other, and it was hot hot hot inside. Other than that, everything was wonderful.

After you sit down, the server/busser brings you chips with three different salsas - green, red, and orange (varying spicy levels) and also asks if you would like Guacamole. If they ask you, say YES! From the get go, I was blown away by their chips, salsa, and Guacamole - every single one of them was fresh and so delicious. (Keep the sauces and guac for your main dishes - yum yum yum!)

The cocktails here are also great. They have a menu of different types of Margaritas, a  menu of Tequila cocktails, wine, beer, etc. I had two of their cocktails - I don't remember the names but the first one was their Margarita with cucumber puree, second one had ginger and honey in it. Both tasted of quality ingredients, tasted great, and were strong! Definitely some great, stiff drinks = me like!

The true test of the restaurant - the food. Boyfriend got the Los Favoritos, which is the traditional combo plate. He got two items - grilled chicken Enchiladas and cheese Tamal. I ordered the Chile Verde. We also got Empanadas on the side. All of the food was absolutely delicious. I love that not only is the food here so tasty, you can tell they use quality ingredients. The sides here are great too - rice, and regardless if you order Refried or Black Beans, they're all tasty. The high note for me was definitely the tortillas/carbs (?) they use here - tortilla that came with my Chile Verde, Tamal & Enchilada tortillas, and chips are all some of the best I've tasted. 

Overall, I loved Tropisueno! Very satisfying find. Great food, drinks, atmosphere, and service, all at a very reasonable price.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Definitely a place to check out, especially if there is a particularly large stomach abyss that you need to fill. The portions are large enough to satisfy any gurgling tummy-chasm, so head over with an appetite. 

During lunchtime they transform it into a taqueria situation. Get in line, pick your lunch bomb from the giant menu (nearsighted people rejoice!!), and make your way down the assembly line to the cashier. Don't forget to appreciate the people bustling like crazy making your meal, these folks work like mad, and still manage to make your meal attractively prepared. If you avoid the lunch stampede hours between 12pm and 1pm, you can usually snag a nice table either inside the restaurant or in their outdoor seating area. Make sure to pay a visit to their well stocked salsa bar. I truly appreciate the presence of limes and hot sauce. 

For dinner I would recommend making a reservation. The taqueria shuts down to make way for a more comprehensive menu rife with delectable choices, and walking in to try and get a table can be difficult. 

Happy hour is great, there's some small plate menu options, plus their margaritas are tasty business. I will stop the gushing to insert a tiny gripe - the happy hour drink prices do not extend beyond the bar. If you find yourself at a table during happy hour, prepare to pay full price even if you are getting food. Sadly, the bar is nearly always packed during happy hour -- so shoot a few jealous glances at the lucky bar-bodies and hope for better luck next time. 

Oh! One more thing; Tropisueno has some lovely staff members. They really value customer service here, you'll be treated well!
author: Chelsea B.

description: Although my food was good, I was really unhappy with the service. I got my order to go but my order was switched with one of the employees'. As a vegetarian, it is very unsettling to notice beef on my quesadilla milliseconds before I dig my teeth in to calm the monster growling in my stomach. Since this restaurant does not have a phone that they actually answer, I had to walk back to return the food. I ended up going over my lunch time and didn't even receive an apology in return.
author: Tia S.

description:
I ate here twice over about a three week period and for the most part, I was very pleased with my choices, as were my dining companions.  As for food, I had the fried platanos and the tres huaraches both times (hey, I know what I like!) and they were excellent.  I can't remember what my dining companions had, but both were very pleased with their selections, as well.  

Minus one star for the following things: (1) The margaritas, which were very underwhelming.  (2) The service.  Agree that the servers were polite enough, but it was a bit chaotic, particularly on my first visit when we sat outside and getting the server's attention was a bit of a challenge.  It wasn't the worst, but it could have been better.  And (3) The ladies room on my second visit (didn't use it the first time) would have really benefited from some tidying.  Whenever I see a dirty restroom, I always think of what I read once in an Anthony Bourdain book.  He advises to never eat in a restaurant with a dirty bathroom.  Why?  He says the restroom is the part of the restaurant that the customers see.  If they're not willing to keep that clean, imagine what the kitchen (which you *don't* see) must look like.  Makes a lot of sense.  But, it was happy hour and pretty busy, and the food was really good, so I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt.  

All in all, I'd definitely go back to Tropisueno.
author: Anne S.

description:
Been here several times now and am pretty smitten with the food/drinks. Getting a reservation is a must as I'm mighty impatient and there is usually a decent wait after work hours.

Things that I've had:
Ceviche de Pescado - so so good. Recommended by the waiter and I really loved it. Will probably get this every time.
Guacamole de la Casa - fresh and delicious.
Empanadas de Hongos - I actually had this as my main since we had ordered several appetizers. I loved the sauce that they give to dip it into and enjoyed the empanadas as well. I'm not big on deep fried but that is the way to have these so I enjoyed them.
Platanos - So yum! Served with black beans which I ate with the chips and guac and it was such a great appetizer. Loved it.
Pollo Asado - was really tender and tasty. Enjoyed by my dining parter but I enjoyed tasting it.

The drinks here are also pretty tasty and happy hour is probably my favorite time to go here. Drinks plus all the awesome apps, it's a great combination.
author: Raina B.

description: Nice place to enjoy with friends. Lively atmosphere. Loud. The guac is really good. So chips and guac anytime. I ordered chicken fajita and it was a filling meal. Comes with fried chicken, sautéed bell peppers, pinto beans and rice. Really filling!
author: Akshay M.

description:
This place was pretty happening.  We waltz'd into this rather busy restaurant with lines out the door and sat at the bar just to grab some drinks.

The michelada featuring a Negro Modelo base and spiced sea salt, lemon juice, and chili powder at the rim of the glass as well as the tomato/clamato? juice mixed in provided just the right kick to make a rather tasty drink.

Exceptionally fast service - a cool decor - and a busy place in a happening Downtown environment make this place a definite go-to happy hour/grab a drink with your friends hangout spot.
author: Ravi M.

description: Great food and service. Very clean place and well maintained. Staff was really helpful with answering questions for us first timers here. Ordered the Chilaquiles, they were great, orange juice was on point. Great place overall.
author: Gregorio H.

description:
This place has way too many reviews so I know this is just a drop in the bucket, but I'm a fan! And it's such a good deal! I'm impressed. 

One quick note. Yelp reviews keep raving about this carne asada burrito. Luckily, I am a fan of carne asada burritos. But when I asked about it, they said they didn't serve it at dinner. sadness. So ignore all the reviews on the burritos if you're here for dinner!

Quick summary:
Pros: cheap, good portions, chile verde!, chupa chups at the end!! (yum), delicious chips and salsa
Cons: my dish, Tampiqueño, the beef was a bit dry.
author: Sarah C.

description:
What's to like?
1.  Friendly service
2.  Nice comfortable room
3.  Overall enjoyable food
4.  Fantastic fresh tortilla chips with salsa and a trio of salsas.  Yummy!!!
5.  Empanandas de Hongos (mushroom emplanada) - Very tasty
6.  Chile Verde - I will note thought that I thought it could use a little additional flavor.  It was good but the flavor was a little too single note.

What's not to like?
1.  I thought that overall the food could have used bolder flavors.
2.  Possibly the worst margarita ever.
3.  It was kind of empty.  The food is festive but it would have been nice if the atmosphere had also been festive.
author: Mark D.

description: Delicious!!! Super friendly staff, a lot of food for the cost. Definitely would recommend.
author: Ginger P.

description:
Finally got a chance to eat at Tropisueño with some rather close friends. This place gets hoppin' at lunchtime and we dove in headlong for the hustle and bustle. The menu has tons of South American, Spanish, and Caribbean delights. My favorite to see was Horchata and Agua Fresca. Two of my favorite beverages. 

We dined family-style and destroyed everything in our path. 

Guac: amazing. 
Tacos: Fantastic
Burritos: SO MANY and they were all wonderful
That pablano green "sauce": I need a bottle at my house
Chips: Thin and delightful
Ceviche: Yes

Pretty much everything was bangin' on all cylinders from the kitchen region, but I wasn't a huge fan of the margaritas. I'm not a huge fan in general, but these were just a little too potent para mi. 

Side note: The bathrooms are suuuuuper comfy. Single commode equals instant comfort. Winner.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
Been here a couple times when I used to live in SF a year ago.  My housemates loved this place!  The two of them would go quite often and I'd make the effort to join them if my schedule allowed.

I am never one to spend money on drinks (I prefer drinking at home in a relaxed fashion, plus it's cheaper) but this is a nice place with comfortable ambiance.  It's tasteful and classy Mexican and this place sure fills up super fast.  It's clear that this is a popular place for happy hour!!!  

I usually get margaritas here.  I haven't tried the other drinks.  The chips and salsa, though, are so goddamn amazing I can't stop popping them in my mouth without stopping.  In fact, I'm more into the chips and salsa than the drinks.  :D  But I've always loved food.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Tropisueño is quite good. Went with a couple friends this past Sunday and I quickly noticed the ambience. It was casual and had that enjoyable sound of light background chatter. I ordered a margarita (The House one) and it was delicious. I then ordered a cheese tamale and two vegetable enchiladas. Initially they were amazing, but the problem was they heated them to a point where they were perfect when they came out but quickly cooled. By the time I ate the tamale it was about room temperature. Wished it was heated a little bit more. That being said the food tasted great and I plan on returning next time I am in the area. I would recommend making a reservation as well because there is not a great place to wait (outside is cold at dinner time) and sometimes the wait can be a little longer (~30 minutes)
author: Roshan J.

description:
LONG overdue review.

I remember when this place had just opened and Yelp hosted an event here (as if ya'll didn't know, Yelpers + free margaritas = shenanigans). Then I worked on the other side of Yerba Buena Gardens for a year and a half and Tropisueño was shortlisted as a go-to cure for a  ridiculously long workday. Now that it's been a while, indeed I occasionally still have tropical dreams about the one too many tequila/chips'n'salsa-induced headaches I developed here. Ah, what fond, fond memories. Qué buenos recuerdos.

But what is Tropisueño, exactly (and what is it not)? The answer: a lot of things. It's a taqueria, but it's not a hole-in-the-wall. It's commercial, but it's not a chain. It's a nice restaurant, but it's not expensive. It's a bar (yay), but it's family-oriented. Basically, Tropisueño is an independently-owned version of Chevy's (which it faces some fierce competition against, down and around the block). As such it appropriately serves up more authenticity and ambiance. And the margaritas? They may not be as ginormous or colorful as you'll find at the franchise counterpart, but they are tastier and pack quite a punch. Highly recommended, especially if you can get there before 6 (when happy hour ends).

Decent prices, enjoyable atmosphere, great location (nestled between Market St. and Yerba Buena Gardens, in the same plaza as the Jewish Contemporary Museum) and did I mention that it IS a bar? IN FACT, if you bring five friends, your drinks are on the house!! (¿¿En serio?? That's what the website says: http://www.tropisueno.com). Check it out... and sweet tropical dreams to ya!
author: Kate V.

description:
I've never cared much for the food at Tropisueño, but the bar is good and it's a passable happy hour location.  And it goes off Like Whoa for Cinco de Mayo, if that's your thing.

my take on the food is that it's just not very inspired - I've just never been excited about anything I've eaten there.  Maybe I've become too accustomed to taqueria food, I dunno.  I mark a lot of places by their burritos, fair or not, and Tropisueños are just boring.
author: Oliver N.

description: The food is amazing and wonderfully authentic.  I love the food!  I found the cocktails to be a bit watered down.  Best to order them straight up!
author: Julie P.

description: This place is really just A-Ok. I was really excited to finally get to try this because it's so close to work + it has great reviews. My friend and I each got a plate of food. He got the steak + beef enchilada, while I got the Shrimp. There was a bit too much sauce and not enough shrimp :\
author: Joyce M.

description: Authentic Mexican food was great and fresh.  A little noisy but other than that we had a great time and enjoyed the atmosphere.  Great location.
author: Jason R.

description: Delicious. Veggie burrito with quac = prime. fish here is DELICIOUS! Perfectly fried. Carne asada is so so, but nachos are prime time as well. GET NACHOS!!!!
author: Roxy M.

description: We got the Tampiqueño and the Chile Verde. Both very delicious. The Chile Verde was the best pork dish I have ever had. excellent texture and tasty sauce. Tampiqueño was very good too. The complementary chips comes with 3 different salsa all very good. Nice ambiance. Great service. I left my left-over box. Went back for it, they didn't have it but they put some fresh Chile Verde in a box for me to take!! Very nice of them. We tried the Flan too. It was very dense and rich. I don't recommend it.
author: Farnaz A.

description:
SO delicious.

We got seated right at 5:30 when the dining area opens up...and I'm pretty sure the entire area filled up by 6ish, so make sure you have a reservation if you're impatient like me! The chips, three types of delicious salsa, and guacamole are amazing...I might have filled up a little too much on the guac before my entree came. 

Late disclaimer: this was the third time I've had meat in about a year and half (just jumped off the veggie train!). I ordered the chile verde and tried my friend's tampiqueno - both were extremely tender and flavorful. Add in whatever's left of the guacamole, and you have real happiness there :)

Great service, great food. Hopefully I will be back soon!
author: Caroline W.

description: Tropisueno was awesome. Wish they would blend their margaritas though!.. .I enjoyed the happy hour and the dinner we reserved for....although happy hour was very crowded.. the menu.. the service was a 5 star... The host and hostesses as well the waiter were very attentive to our needs..However,  this was the first time I went to the restaurant. I hosted  b'day party together a birthday bash for my 3 Virgo friends. The restaurant was exceptional but  I have to admit management could have at least given a couple of desserts for my b'day buddies...He did but only a tiny cupcake to split between 7 people...Come on.. we spent at least $150 for 7 of us on the table.. I organize meet ups with 1000 members and I would love to host events in this establishment...
author: Joce J.

description:
After reading so many "good" reviews and after a friend referral - I was really looking forward to trying this place out.  

Unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed to learn Tropisueno isn't your traditional dine in restaurant.  It's like Chipotle on steroids (they have seafood) and not in a good way.   

You start off by getting in line, ordering from the lady behind the glass and then you watch them make enchiladas in the microwave.  We were a party of three, so we tried a variety of items: a carne asada burrito, a tamale & carne asada taco combo plate, and the cheese enchilada plate.  I didn't stand by to watch them put together our entire order but I did notice the following: 1. Corn tortillas for tacos were not warmed up on the spot, they had been previously warmed and wrapped in foil ready for the next customer - me.  2. Four more previously warmed corn tortillas are taken out, cheese is spread, and plopped into the microwave - BOOM, now you have enchis.  3. I've had better carne asada.  

I wont return but I'll give this place two stars for a killer salsa bar and its ambience.
author: Cynthia V.

description:
Let me start by saying I am new to the area. I came to this restaurant with my friends a few weeks ago to celebrate a birthday. 

We were seated in the bar area and were laughing and having a good time with one another. We ordered a round of drinks, and a half hour later, we ordered another round. But to our dismay we were told that we were cut off. This was after ordering ONE drink.

When we asked to speak to the manager, we were told that someone in our party appeared to be drunk so it was their policy to cut us off. Mind you, this is after we had ONE drink, so we clearly were not. Furthermore, how could the actions of one person end with the decision to cut off an entire group of people?

To me, this was simply a case of people being uncomfortable with a group of education, black professionals out enjoying themselves with one another. At no point were we bothering any other patrons. At no point were we belligerent. And at no point were we even asked to keep it down. And mind you, this was IN A BAR!

After speaking with the manager, he told us that we could continue to have drinks, but that one person in the group couldn't. Really? After insulting us and making an irrational judgment you expect us to continue spending money in your establishment? No thank you. I will not be returning to this restaurant. And the owner clearly needs to look into its management.
author: Keisha C.

description: Came here for dinner with my wife. They took my info and said it would be 15-20 minutes later. Soon after they texted us saying our table was ready. We come back and check in. They said we were next. We wait and wait and no one tells us anything or checks in with us even though they see we are waiting. A few customers are seated while we are waiting. About 15 minutes later we have heard nothing and walk out. If you can't be honest with customers who cares about the food.
author: Sammy K.

description:
I highly recommend ordering a few small items off the appetizer menu in order to taste the delicious variety that this restaurant has to offer. 

First off, the start you out with some of the best chips ever, accompanied by four very different and incredible salsas. I could have made a meal out of this alone! I ordered the Tropisueno Margarita which was smooth and creative made with ginger and lemon for a fresh and unique take on a classic drink. 

The dishes that followed were all stunning. The ceviche was so fresh and chunky and had the perfect amount of citrus zing to it. I practically drink the sauce at the end! I found, however, that it was better to eat the ceviche with the light and delicious tortilla chips rather than the harder, less flavorful shell that they serve it with.  The friend plantains (one of my all-time favorite side dishes) were sooo well done: the perfect texture, not too mushy, and the most perfect balance of sweet and salty.  I almost ordered it again for dessert! The two al pastor tacos were also perfectly crafted, with rich tender meat, flavorful corn tortillas, and a burst of sweet pineapple thrown in. The empanadas were yummy and the dough was especially so - it was, withe the guacamole topper, the star component that really made the empanadas truly special.

This is definitely one of the best Mexican restaurants I've eaten at outside of LA and Austin, but again, I didn't actually order any of the entrees.  I think we did the smarter thing by trying a variety of dishes off their incredible appetizer menu.

Also, I would have liked to see a more robust dessert menu. All they had was flan and a tres leches cake, neither which I was in the mood for.
author: Ian W.

description: Yes, we love this place! The wait is worth it... I don't try a lot Mexican food places because I can have it at home but this place was so delicious! I'm also not a tequila drinker and I loved their drinks! Good vibes, amazing staff and deliciousness. So far this is my favorite San Francisco restaurant!
author: Cecilia L.

description:
I wasn't quite sure about this place when walking by outside, but very glad I stopped in for a beer and a taco.

Great happy hour specials on both drinks (beer, cocktails) and food.  I had the fish tacos - crispy fried fish with a sweet cole slaw topping.  Very nicely assembled.  I think with 2 beers and 2 tacos I spent about $11.  Good luck trying that somewhere else.

The free chips and salsas were pretty amazing as well.  Nice place to stop for a quick drink.

Just looking over their website, and it seems that they fully comply with their "bang for your buck" philosophy and "people people" staff.  Everybody was very friendly.
author: Nick G.

description: The Margaritas here are AMAZING. I love that the salt on the rim has some spice to it because it gives it a fun kick that is not found anywhere else. DO NOT get the chicken tacos if you cannot handle spicy food. My mouth was on fire. But the steak tacos were fantastic and I will definitely be going back. Fun atmosphere and if you make a reservation they always get you in on time or early. The one thing that I do not like is their menu. It is hard to read if you are not fluent in Spanish and I never actually know what I am ordering if I don't just go with the tacos. Overall this is a great place for friends to get together. They also do very well with gluten and dairy allergies.
author: Katie K.

description: Such a great Mexican  restaurant! If you prefer a sweet drink, go for the mango margarita. All the food was great but it is on the spicy side. Something we were not expecting haha. Great service, everyone was friendly, the only down side was that the bathroom was a bit unkept and didn't match how nice the rest of the place was. Overall a good experience and would go again!
author: Emilie D.

description:
This restaurant is a hidden gem in the midst of all the downtown chaos! We came here right before 5:30PM on a weekday for dinner. Dinner starts at 5:30PM so we were one of the first ones to be seated. Service was great. The waiters brought us water, chips and 3 kinds of salsa. I ordered the Tampiqueno, which is the thin cut grilled carne asada, medium rare served with a beef barbacoa enchilada. My BF ordered the Chile Verde, a pork dish. I LOVE the Tampiqueno, the carne asada is very juicy and flavorful. 

I would definitely come here again for dinner, margarita and their happy hour menu, which is surprisingly cheap!
author: Linda L.

description:
Visiting my cousin who lives in SF and I was craving good Mexican Fare.  While this place did not overwhelm, it didn't disappoint.  

Drinks: The house margarita on the rocks was FANTASTIC. Two of these are definitely enough! Cousin had a mojito which she also said was great, and would've put her to the floor if she had another. 

Food: 

I had the Tampiqueño (Niman Ranch beef, thin-cut grilled carne asada,
served with a beef barbacoa enchilada, guacamole.)  It was HUGE. Overall good flavor but the carne asada was a bit tough, and overcooked for my taste. Rice, beans, enchilada and the rest of the fare was good and I did leave stuffed so I can't complain.  

Cousin had the Huaraches "Tres Cochinitas" (Three thick tortilla "sandals" with three kinds of pork, chile verde, carnitas and al pastor w pineapple.) which she loved.  Said she would've eaten every morsel if her stomach would've allowed. 

We also tried the fried bananas with sour cream which were good as well.  

Overall if I was looking for upscale Mexican food I would probably dine again but I'm not sure it was worth what would've been a 45min wait had we not made reservations.
author: Alisha H.

description:
WOWwowWow! LOVED this restaurant! Loved every single thing about it!  This place is SO cute! The decor is fun and it's basically a great place to go to with some friends!  

The food and the drinks were simply AMAZING!  We started off with a round of Mango Jalapeño (yes, jalapeño!) Margaritas!  Seriously the best Margarita, I've ever had!  We literally were going crazy over their chips and salsa! They give you 3 different salsas and all three are ridiculously good! We ordered extra, so we could eat it with our main course.  If you go here, please get the Tostaditas de Carnitas! Holy Hell, beyond amazing.  Probably the most flavorful, tender pork I've ever had.  

I cannot wait to go here again! Amazing, amazing, AH-MAZING!
author: Suki B.

description: There was a wait when we got here but they got us seated aooner than they originally stated. The inside of the restaurant is a little cramped but you can still hear your table companions. They start you off with a big bowl of chips and 3 types of salsa. Menu items are very reasonably priced. I got the 3 choice traditional plate, just because I couldn't choose just 2 items. Got the pork tamale, al pastor taco, and carnitas taco. The tacos were excellent. They had the perfect amount of seasoned meat and the toppings were perfecly balanced. The tamale was just ok and I could not eat much of it (I had to budget stomach space). The rice and beans were ok but the real stars were the tacos.
author: Al D.

description: My boyfriend heard about this place through people in the industry. Not sure what the buzz is about. We sat at the bar and ordered a round of drinks and apps. The food was awesome, the drinks were okay but the service was horrible. The bartenders could use an attitude adjustment.
author: Carly M.

description:
Really wanted to love this place, but I only like it.  

The margaritas are only so-so, and for $11 they should be great.  I don't pay that for filler, give me real Margarita stuff!  I am probably spoiled because in Santa Rosa, I get a top-top shelf margarita for $7 at Portofino (however, I know the bartenders well!).  

Guacamole rates an A, very fresh, nice spice.  The salsas that come with chips are excellent, green salsa very flavorful, hints of lime with the green chiles, and the "cheesy" salsa surprised all in my party, and just having a 3 salsa selection included is a treat.  

What was disappointing was my combination dinner plate.  Tamal, enchilada, and taco, along with refried beans and rice, were quite disappointing.  I had a beef, chicken,a and pork selection, to get the variiety of meats, and  I am the kind of guy who will almost always finish a plate, and I left some of everything on it.  Dry, and lacking in flavor.  A good Mexican place should do better.  Come on!  Enchiladas, tacos, tamales!  

However, the chicken mole, green chile verde, and fresh fish special eaten by the others in my party rate 4 stars.  Particularly the chicken mole, although it seemed the chicken was slightly underdone, the sauce was way good.  

My advice is, go with the specials, and just drink beer or wine.
author: Jon S.

description:
Went to this place for the first time last week, and it was awesome.  It was super packed, but that didn't degrade the quality of service (note: we had reservations -- highly recommended).

Out server set up a couple servings (no pun intended) of chips and salsa, and it was DELICIOUS.  There were three salsas: a super spicy tomato-based salsa (I have a really, really high tolerance for heat  -- this salsa was HOT, but super good), a tomatillo salsa (which was equally as good, but not as hot), and some sort of spicy queso, which, again, was really good.  The little trays the salsas came in weren't very big (one of the minor reasons I didn't give 5 stars), but the server was happy to supply us with more.

I ordered the house margarita ($8, I believe), and it was absolutely delicious.  It had spicy salt on the rim, and was housed in a huge glass (not your average small margarita glass).  I was pleasantly surprised.  I also had a strawberry margarita, which was really sweet (try it, if you're into that).

For our main course I got the street-style tacos (can't remember the actual name), which were also really good, but I was kind of surprised when my plate showed up with only two tacos on it (another reason I didn't give 5 stars).  However, I thought about it after the fact, and figured you can simply order 2 orders of the tacos for around the same price as another main entree on the menu (although they wouldn't come with beans and rice, which you can order on the side).

I can't wait to come back to this place!
author: Taylor J.

description:
Food was amazing and the margaritas were good too!

We had to wait a bit to get in, but it was totally worth it.

The chips needed a little salt, but would def come back to this place.  The prices are spot on.
author: Carry B.

description:
Delicious!  Ate here with my husband after a movie on a Friday night.  I recommend making a reservation a day or 2 before to avoid a wait.

We ate/drank:
Pomegranate Margarita - yum!
Tostaditas De Carnitas
Tampiqueño

Our food was lovely. The chips & salsa are wonderful as well.

The atmosphere is clean, modern and fun.  The noise level is a bit high- but we were able to have a conversation ok.

Our service was great.
author: Christy L.

description: Decent mexican food with a wide selection on the menu, but not worth the wait.  For the time invested, id just take bart out to the mission where you can get better, cheaper mexican food.
author: Cody P.

description: Horrible service coupled with average food. Our dinners arrived before the water and cocktails. The sweet plantains were delicious but the enchiladas were bland and forgettable. You can find much better nearby.
author: Kerilyn M.

description:
One word: Joselito. Jose, our server, made our night a delight. We found this place by chance after mistakingly coming to the city for a New Year's Eve dinner without reservations (we didn't start calling restaurants until we were on BART... yeah idk what we were doing with our lives either). We thought we were doomed to a NYE dinner of Mickey D's when we found this gem tucked into an alley off the side of the Westfield Mall in Union Square. All the seating was booked so we sat ourselves down at the bar and were promptly tended to by Jose. He cared to our every need without being overbearing or hovering too much (key to a great server).

One more word: chips. They were perfectly crunchy and lightly salted (sadly I didn't read that tip to NOT fill up on chips until after we ate). They were thinner than your average chip from a bag and definitely fresh. Salsas were also spicy and fresh. I had the 2 pork tamales (~$10) and also tasted the chile verde. Admittedly, I'm not super experienced in Mexican food (authentic or not) but I found the food to be prepared with care and quite tasty. I left stuffed.

The ambiance was nice, food was great (prices were right), and service was perfect. Thank you, Tropisueno for being the perfect start to our night!
author: Catherine J.

description:
.........and I just stuffed my fat face at Tropisueno - pretty dang delicious.  Baja Fish tacos are AWESOME.  Burritos weren't very balanced, but the tortilla was thin and delicious - cheese was perfect amount and the thing was the size of a dinosaur bone.  I can eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Salsa is what's up!  Spicy is spicy -  had my nose and eyes watering, never sets in my head that water just makes this feeling worse.  MILK is a great choice.

I'll be back.

Chips weren't as mind blowing as everyone claims them to be - I think its just the salsa.
author: Jana S.

description:
Management and wait staff need retraining on customer service.  Drinks were weak and came after our appetizer and meal, and those who were seated after us received theirs first.  Wtf?!  I can't help but feel marginalized due to the fact that they were white/black and we were young Asians.  I'd overlook this but it's noted. 

During dinner, two full drinks were spilled on me by the waiter.  From my head to my bottom!  Accidents do happen but how do you handle the situation?  Offer dirty/used towels?  Stand around?  That's what they did.  Sigh.  The waiter apologized but the manager never initiated contact with me nor did he apologize to me immediately.  He only halfheartedly apologized when a concerned waiter asked if I was okay after I returned from cleaning off and changing my clothes in the only single stall restroom available.  Mind you, the line was ridiculous.  He was not empathetic or showed any compassion for what had happened.  His style of resolution was to be disingenuous and unapproachable.  "Hi I'm Andy.  I'm the manager here.  Sorry this happened but it was an accident beyond my waiter's control.  I can comp you for your drinks and just your meal.  It's out of my control."  Sounds okay, right?  Try again.  He comped drinks that we never drank bc it spilled all over me and we just started our meal.  We barely ate but dinner was ruined.  How can we enjoy our meal after this?  I'm still drenched!  It was not a solution in the right direction at all.  I can pay for my meal and drinks minus getting drinks poured on me.  He was unhelpful and had no tact.  We decided to pay and leave without making a scene.  As we were walking out, the manager approached me, without any prompting, to offer what felt like a genuine apology and to take care of my dry cleaning bill which I never used.
author: amee m.

description:
I've been trying to get a table at Tropisueno for quite some time. While it kills me to wait an hour when there are such amazing restaurants in SF, the convenient location near Powell and reasonably priced menu made it worth the wait. 

Although I love all the authentic hole-in-the-wall Mexican food in S.F., it was really nice to go to a sit down restaurant with this cuisine. Tables are served chips and three different types of salsas, each better than the last. We ordered guacamole for the table, but it wasn't anything special.

The Margaritas have way too much ice in them. For an $11 drink I expect more than 5 sips.

All the entrees were tasty, but not the best Mexican food I've had before. The Salmon filet was a standout, as well as the Chicken with Mole Poblano. 

I would still honestly come back because the ambiance is great and it is extremely convenient. The service was exceptional, right from the hostess to our waiter.
author: Ashwin S.

description: Excellent food in a prime location. Everything from the salsa to the meat was legit Mexican tasting. I recomend the Tampiqueno dish as it was substantial and very tasty.
author: Juan B.

description: Great service and ambiance but I wasn't 100% happy with my meal here. My mom and I got the guacamole and chips and four soft tacos. The guacamole was delicious and the portion was generous. They also had a great salsa bar with a variety of salsas to choose from. I thought it was nice they included a section in the salsa bar for extra cilantro and radishes. The downside of my experience here however was the tacos. The meat was well seasoned but nothing amazing. The tortilla was really hard and not steamed properly. I'm thinking this isn't a normal thing for them -- I probably caught them at a bad time. Will come back to try again.
author: Hana K.

description:
Four stars for their happy hour! I love the food choices on their happy hour menu and they're for pretty good prices. Same goes for the drinks! They make em strong, delicious, and reasonably priced.

It gets crowded quickly, so your best bet is to show up pretty close to 4 so you can grab a seat at the bar or a table. They service during happy hour isnt the best, but it makes sense because the place is just so busy!

Tropisueno remains one of my favorite happy hours downtown!
author: Erica W.

description:
Tropisueño is in a great location and serves up super tasty food. Making a reservation is recommended but not necessary. They start you out with a big helping of chips and 3 kinds of salsa. There is an orange one that I dream about for a week after eating there. It's served warm and is a bit spicy. It's so good! 

I almost always get the chile verde. It's always tender and lean and is served very quickly. I've also had the steak which was very good. 

Great place to bring a date and catch a movie across the street after.
author: Chris D.

description:
I Trop it like it's hot every chance I get. They have some of the best burritos in the downtown area, and one of my favorite happy hours.

The lunch line gets very long, so be prepared to wait, or order it from GoPago and pick it up. But be sure to get there after work to visit happy hour some time. Tostadas and margaritas are a great way to end the day.

Last but not least--the orange salsa will absolutely change your life. It's a thick, creamy and rich sauce that has a nice kick to it. It's bright enough to be seen from space, and I wish I could buy it by the gallon. It's one of the things that keeps me coming back.
author: Tyler H.

description:
Went here last night for dinner. There was an expected 30 min wait so we posted up at the crowded bar. About 25 min in, the host working reservations recommended we close out our tab at the bar because we are next. So we close out and wait...and keep waiting... No one was getting up from their table.

We waited an additional 15 minutes before we were seated. The host who had recommended we close our tabs far too early bought us drinks *on him* to make up for the wait. What a fabulous employee! Totally made up for the hassle.

The food was pretty good-we ordered the barbacoa appetizer, two veggie enchiladas, and a pork tamale. I definitely recommend the enchiladas! 

Overall this place is pretty good is you can stand the wait, and the customer service is fabulous.
author: Erin F.

description: Was excited to try this place as it was busy and had good reviews. Unfortunately the atmosphere was so noisy that we couldn't hear each other across the table. After ordering our meal, we requested takeout so we could take it to our hotel. After 40 minutes of waiting and noticing that other tables seated after us being served, we complained to waitress. She had a poor attitude as she brought us the bill without any food. After paying our bill, we asked how much longer, and she brought out food. Of course - you can guess it - food was stone cold. Too much noise, poor service, and who knows if food was good as we tossed it.
author: Suzi H.

description: This isn't bad for a Mexican in the downtown area which are usually not very good. The margarita was great. i ordered the chile relleno which was filled with picadillo and thought it was tasty but I thought my black beans and rice were bland. The salsas are very good and they bring you free chips. Any restaurant that charges for chips is one I will never return to in my book. The price wasn't over the top and I'd go back if i didn't have to option to jump on BART and head into the Mission. I hear they do a great burrito bar at lunch.
author: Sally M.

description:
Tropisueno never disappoints...assuming you can get a seat for dinner!  They are booked solid so dinner reservations are a must.  Lunch is equally packed but you can't make reservations...you simply stand in the line that almost always runs out the door and order at the counter, take your number and try to find a table. 

I just love the Prawns Tropisueno (dinner menu only).  You do have to be wary or "tourist pours" on the margs, though.  Friendly, attentive service.
author: Val B.

description: They have amazing food. It's so good! We just shared some appetizers but everything was amazing. The drinks were super strong so definitely worth a stop!
author: Dana I.

description: Let me start off by saying this place is difficult to find because their sign does not say tropisueno but Mexican kitchen so you don't know if that is the restaurant or not. 2nd their is only one bathroom in there for both men and women so the wait time is ridiculous! Service is terrible here, and being a server I know what service should be like even when it's terribly busy and the waiter only came to our table to drop of our drinks and food and that was it. To leave it took about 15 minutes and even still my friend had to flag down the manager to check us out because our waiter was no where to be found. Overall terrible experience will never come back . Food was average but not worth ever coming back.
author: Valerie B.

description:
Awesome everything. Drinks, strong. Service, speedy and humorous. 

Came for the tail end of happy hour and stayed for dinner. They were very accommodating. The only thing is the bar area could get crowded right after work hours and reserved tables can not be seated until the entire party is present. Our server was very friendly and patiently answered our questions about the food and drink menu. 

Also, have to give a shout out to the service during happy hour because he let one of our party members order his last margarita a few minutes after the happy hour officially ended and gave us a heads up.
author: Karen Z.

description:
Tropisueno is delicious, but the service is a little lackluster. The servers are extremely pushy (they will ask you if you have questions on the menu or if they can take your order so many times that you're willing to close your eyes and randomly point to an entree on the menu just to get them to leave you in peace).

Also, they push alcoholic beverages as if their lives depended on it, and if you don't order one (or worse yet, your entire table doesn't order them), they'll be pissy and jerky for the rest of the meal. What's more, they're so anxious to clear your table that they will take plates and/or their beloved alcoholic beverages literally out of your fingers, whether you're completely finished or not.

I get it, it's a popular restaurant. They want to move people out quickly. But really, at what cost, hmm?

I probably won't be back any time soon (unless it's for takeout).
author: Sarah R.

description: Best mexican food i have ever had. Friendly staff, excellent service and the perfect ambience. I ordered the chicken enchiladas and it was delicious. Quick service and great drinks. Its a must visit!
author: Kanika B.

description:
Still very good food and very competitive price in Financial District.

Service is fast and food is very authentic.  The beef fajitas has very good flavor and seasonings although the meat is low end cut ...
author: Sandy L.

description:
Pretty yummy! The mushroom miso soup is hearty and tasty! Also had the sashimi salad - lots of sashimi and pretty fresh. My friend ordered flaming roll, it comes wrapped in tinfoil and they light it on fire, great presentation :) The ambiance was pretty chill and simple. A good date place, casual but not too simple.

I'd go here again!
author: Jenny W.

description:
There are very few things to dislike about Tropisueno. Heck, I even cheated on my vegetarianism once here because of the humanely treated meat they serve (and my boyfriend and I had to try the flautas.)

Ambiance: 5 stars
It's a place you can go for a fun date night or with a group! I LOVE the feel of this place on the inside, it's just so darn fun. Perfect lighting, too.

Food and drink: 5 stars
Even as a vegetarian!

Service: 5 stars
Have always enjoyed service with a smile from our servers!

I'd give it 6 if I could! By far one of my favorite places to eat in SF.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I've been in several times and thought that the food was decent enough. However the service at this place has gone from not so great to downright awful and it started with the hostess. 

The problem began when i arrived. I was meeting my partner there for dinner who works for Westfeild. The hostess took my name and told me she would have a table for us in 5 minutes as there were several being cleared then put my name into a list on the computer. I looked over and saw several small tables being cleared...after standing less than 5 feet away from her for a while in the small reception area next to the bathrooms. When my BF came in and greeted me with hug...She began to seat parties of two ahead of us that just walked in and asked for a table for two?... WTF? I was standing right next to her...Was she high? Drunk? Forgot to take her medication ? Who knows? 

I'm a pretty patient guy, not pushy or demanding.. I'm a clean cut professional and so is my partner.  I've worked in the restaurant business for years...I know your pain.
At this point i thought it might be an oversight on her part. clearly, I was confused as to why she didn't seat us and was seating parties of two ahead of us...

After several parties of two walked in after us who asked for a table for two  and were seated by her  right away, I asked her what was going on and if there was a list we were on and why she didn't seat us at a table? She acted like she was miffed,then told me I mis understood her, then said it was a miscommunication.  Then I asked her how long it would be to be seated? Then she told me she might be able to seat us in maybe 20 to 25 minutes!  This was after she told me" 5 minutes and that tables were being cleared".  Keep in mind that I had been right in front of her the whole time, and at this point t we'd been waiting for about 15 minutes and we were the only customers waiting in the small reception besides her...

This is when it became creepy. she stared right at us  with a manic- F-you grin on her face. It was clear that she was not going to seat us.   


I wont be back and I will not recommend Tropisueno.
author: Doyle M.

description:
The digs are nice, the burritos are big, the staff is friendly, the sauce bar is saucey, and the prices are reasonable.  Even without the corporate discount I'd be paying well under $10 for a filling lunch (and probably a late afternoon snack).

The food is very good, but not amazing.  The chorizo burrito I ordered was definitely in the middle-tier among SF Mexican places, but given all the other factors, I will most certainly be back.
author: Bill H.

description:
The burritos here are MASSIVE.

We had catering from Tropisueño at work and everyone split them 50/50. I got a little crazy and split mine 75/25 and luckily there was a girl on a diet who took the 25% and made me feel less like a fat ass.

The chips are fresh and good too. Inside of the burrito was a little dry so minus a star for that. Salsa was good tho!

Will make sure to bumrush the table next time our company has catering from Tropisueño.
author: Eric C.

description: This place is incredible. My boyfriend and I came here for the first time on Saturday afternoon. The line wasn't too long, and the food was brought to our table in less than 10 minutes. We each got a combination plate with 2 items (they come with rice and beans, too) and holy guacamole the portions are HUGE. Had we known, we wouldn't have ordered so much! It was great, though. There are tons of salsa options. It was a little too chilly to sit outdoors, but the inside tables were still nice. Inexpensive. Margaritas are yummy. 5 stars!
author: Kristy C.

description: This place has great setting, ambience and variety of sauces for our food! I love the guacamole and the chips are thin and crispy. The meat here is not juicy, abit dry on the taste- if you happen to order burrito or plate or rice plate.
author: Bonnie W.

description:
What an incredible dining experience!

Tropisueño had a fun, vibrant ambience that put all of us in a great mood; a pleasant surprise because we mostly chose the place based on its proximity to where we had been sitting. The lively music and exotic aura really made it feel like a tropical dream

The food (especially the appetizers) was lovely -- flavorful and delicious -- and it was trendy, yet just authentic enough. The drinks were impeccable as well -- maybe one day we will have successfully sampled all the drinks on the menu.

Perhaps the most memorable part of our experience at Tropisueño was the service. Although our group had a minor fiasco regarding our reservation, the host and the staff were very friendly, kind, and understanding.

Everything about our experience at Tropisueño has motivated us to return in the near future for a fantastic time with good friends! hasta la próxima vez :)
author: Ashna R.

description:
I often meet friends downtown for a movie and Tropisueno is almost always our choice for a meal before or after the show. Also great pit stop when museum hopping. So easy to get to. It's a hop, skip and a jump from the Powell BART station.  

Don't know about the authenticity but the Cal Mex eats are yummy. My "go to" dish is the chicken mole. The mole sauce has a richness and depth from the chocolate with a tiny amount of heat from the chiles. I also love the Camarones Tropisueño with large succulent shrimp in a spicy sauce. 

The chips and salsa are also yummy. These are thin and lightly fried tortilla chips that don't taste greasy at all. They tend to be a little salty for me, but I still love them. Oh, well just have to order more drinks. During lunch, they have a salsa bar where you can choose from a large variety of salsas with different levels of heat. Great for the undecided. Just try them all.

I've only had lunch here so while it's busy, I've never had to wait for a table. Huge but inexpensive portions. I always have leftovers to take home.

Tip: Go to Beard Papa's or Schoggi for dessert. They're right next door.

Just be aware, a meal at Tropisueno is more expensive than at a taqueria in the Mission. Another thing to note, they take a break between lunch and dinner. They will still sell you food but there is no service in the dining room.
author: Cece E.

description:
Best Mexican

We were refer to Tropisueno Mexican Kitchen by St Regis concierge.   
We could not believe it to be So Good, Authentic Mexican, Delicious, the best we had in Southern and Northern California.   

We enjoy their most delicious mexican dishes very tasty, the atmosphere is very lively pleasant and surely clean and refreshing.  Their drink is so good, amazing unlike hotel drinks where the drink are diluted to 95% water, tasteless.    We dined there throughout our stay in SF.  
Tropisuno is only in SF, we wish they have a branch in LA.

Best Mexican outside Mexico
author: Fred E.

description:
Where to go for lunch around downtown SF? Yelp to the rescue! With over 1000 reviews and a 4 star rating, Tropisueno seemed like a solid choice. We were surprised upon entering that such a nice looking restaurant tucked in an alley of more fancy places was so decently priced! Halloween decorations of spider webs, colored paper, and lights gave the space a fun feel and the somewhat dim lighting added to the ambiance.

What I ordered (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tropisue%C3%B1o-san-francisco-3?select=Innr3Ea5qQXU_2k1k0MnYA#8rf_8mRkhn4BNfAzWOAPVw):
- Chile Rojo ($7.95): tofu and potatoes in red sauce with salad, guac, black beans, mexican rice, and mini tortillas 

First, you order at the counter and pay, then pick a table to sit at (they have outdoor seating also). Service was super fast since they have much of the food already made and when my plate came, my mouth dropped at the monstrosity of it all. I instantly knew that I wouldn't be able to finish it and ended up taking 2/3 of it home. This wasn't helped by the fact that they gave us free chips too. They have a large selection of salsas and we picked a few, but they were all pretty spicy so I didn't have too much since I wanted to eat my meal instead of get full on chugging down water to save my tongue..The tofu was the soft, silky kind which I liked and the sauce had a good flavor. I'm not sure what red sauce is supposed to taste like, but it was good! All the sides complemented the main part of the entree and I took turns taking a bite of each section. I was definitely glad that I ordered this plate instead of your normal burrito or quesadilla. I'll be back for the quality food and generous portion sizes that can even defeat guys!

TIP: Skip a meal beforehand so you have a chance at finishing what you order! Mine lasted me 3 meals...
author: Jessica C.

description:
Happy Hour from 4-6! $5 margaritas! Need I say more? 

But say more I shall, because this place deserves kind words, as not only was the food was quite delicious, the man-servant (waiter) was also attentive and nice.

My friend and I split the Chile Verde and the Camarones Tropisueño, and I was so pleased with myself for the orders, as the portions were gigantic. When it comes to good food, my fear is always that I DON'T GET ENOUGH; at Tropisueno, this was not a problem - I couldn't even finish.

All the entrees are served with rice, beans, and tortillas, which seems like a lot of food to me (and it was). The seasoning was great - the dishes were distinctly flavored so as not to resemble each other too much, which I think is the case for many Mexican restaurants. I'm not Mexican; I am not sure about the authenticity of the food here, but it was yummy.

Chips are served (and generously replenished) with a variety of salsas while you wait for your order!
author: Sijia W.
