description: Great Mexican food, awesome margs, super convenient location. It's one of those places where the food is delish and the portions are huge, so inevitably I eat until I'm in pain because it's so good I can't stop. Definitely give this place a try if you are craving Mexican and in the mid-Market area.
author: Tim G.

description:
Good inexpensive Mexican with an easy vibe. The waiter we had was so incredibly solicitous that my dining companion and I had a healthy debate about whether it was too much or just enough.

What was too much was the portions! I had leftovers for two more meals.
author: Bethany S.

description:
Decent food & cocktails. Service was okay. 

They add a health care surcharge to your bill.
author: Paul R.

description:
Their chips are addictive! I had a bunch before the appetizer, then a bunch more while eating and then I had to grab a handful before I left!

Add some great drinks and delicious food to that and you have a hit! I had the fish ceviche, served cold and limey, in a decent sized portion, making it a fantastic compliment to the cocktails.

This place gets packed, so make some reservations if you don't want to wait!
author: Vishal A.

description:
I'm baaaaaaack!

It's no secret that I'm burrito-obsessed. I like tacos too. And tortas? I've just recently started scarfing these down. 

So, imagine my delight when I saw tortas on the Tropisueno menu. Had to have! I got mine with steak, refried beans, cheese, guac, jalapenos, lettuce and mayo (no tomatoes for me!). The bread was toasted and the final product resembled a panini, 'cept it was Mexican instead of Italian. 

They have a decent 'help yourself' salsa bar, too. Tropisueno may not be the most authentic of SF Mexican joints, but it really hits the spot. And fast!
author: Jelena Z.

description:
It's always packed here for lunch and dinner!

The reason? Frickin' delicious food.

Seating can be hard to find (though outdoor seating is available when it isn't raining). There can also be a bit of a wait to get all the salsas you want. The ambiance is awesome, a little loud but casual and tight packed. 

Oh, you might smell like Mexican food when you're finished. But it's worth it. 

Another cool option is that they're on Go Pago -- super simple, just order ahead of time, receive the notification it's ready for pickup, go in and talk to the cashier. Super awesome!
author: N D.

description:
Nice little Mexican restaurant tucked in an alley next to downtown SF, this is a very fun, inviting place to eat and drink without the busy feel of the city, although this place does get crowded in a fun way.

Food was great (had the chile verde) and with portions big enough to share. Complimentary chios and 3 salsas were delicious as well. House margarita tasted good, and the staff will always come back to make sure your water cup is full. For a downtown SF restaurant, this restaurant is priced well.
author: Andy L.

description: I made reservations here and at that time they were not as crowded. We were seated and served nachos with 2 types of fresh salsa. Our food was brought out pretty quickly. I ordered the vege enchiladas and boy the plate was too pretty to eat. I've eaten a lot of Mexican but the presentation and the fresh ingredients blew me away. It was a nice size portion and was pretty full at the end. When I left, the place had a long line, so reservations are strongly recommended anytime after 7pm.
author: A K.

description: The food was pretty good!  We had the chicken tingas and shrimp tacos and the albóndigas soup.  The soup was perfect to share and the tacos were very filling.  You have to order your food at the kitchen counter and they will bring it to you when it's ready.  The service was good and the soup was made when ordered, so it took a few minutes longer than the other food.  Overall, this is a good place to stop and get a quick bite after shopping near Market Street.
author: Michelle W.

description:
My experience was tarnished at the beginning: the air conditioning was malfunctioning, resulting in restaurant being warm and a little humid. Hopefully this was just a temporary problem that has since been repaired.

The dishes themselves were good: I tried the ceviche trio and the chile verde. The ceviche was fresh, and chili verde had good flavor with nice moist pork.
author: Glen G.

description:
I LOVE the margaritas, bartenders, chips and salsa. I would come back again and again for those things. The food is not that amazing. I would expect to find a little more thought-out dishes here, and less heavy/smeared with tomato sauce that tastes like it's out of the can. That said I like their garlicky shrimp in the skillet. 

When we complained about the food we ordered (I think it was enchiladas), the server said that everyone usually likes it and asked each one of us, why we didnt like it. I felt like I was being interrogated and all he needed to do was say sorry and take it away.
author: Ariadne R.

description: We had a nice evening there, I didn't like the pork that much. My friends ordered beef and chicken and enjoyed their meals. The service is excellent and the prices are reasonable.
author: Ran H.

description:
Tropisueño has great food and margaritas in a fun (and clean!) atmosphere.  It is very affordable given the quality and quantity of food, which makes it great for college students, dates, groups (someone in a group will inevitably be broke), and this dried up queen who tends to find something to snarl at.  Luckily there was no snarling here last night!   I'm a San Francisco local who has his fair share of amazing Mexican food and is a general food snob, but I really like this place!  I live close by, and I am definitely adding it to my list of places in the neighborhood to frequent.    

For vegetarians who grumble that most Mexican restaurants don't have many vegetarian items, I have found one here!  I wasn't feeling too well, and I've also been trying to eat healthier, so I got the Pozole Vegetariano (vegetable soup with a tomato broth).  It was very flavorful and filled with vegetables.  I'd definitely get this again.  

I've had the less vegetarian-friendly Tampiqueño, which comes with an enchilada.  It is a ridiculous amount of food!  I recommend both.  If you're not into the insane about of carbs that Mexican food typically involves, the tampiqueño is good choice because it basically like a steak.  And without getting overly descriptive, all I have to say about the enchilada is that they're really good and you should probably get one.

Ah yes, last time I also had the empanadas.  I expected them to be all deep-fried and overly crispy (aka, prepared hours ago and reheated prior to being served), but they are super fresh here.  To all people who skip the first round:  don't skip it here.  They have great starters here that you shouldn't miss.  Plus, it gives you an excuse to have another margarita without looking like you have a drinking problem!  

Since my first visit months and months ago, THE SERVICE HAS IMPROVED BY 200%!    

The server was very attentive about making sure that I never had an empty margarita glass, and the entrees didn't come out until after the very yummy Molotes de Elote y Chorizo were finished.  I think it is also helpful that the margarita glasses are significantly larger now.  

I give a lot of respect to the owners of Tropisueño for reading Yelp reviews and responding to disgruntled patrons.  I was NOT happy with the service the first time that I came here.  As a result of their openness for improvement, then coming back to see dramatic improvement, it shows that they really care about their patrons, and I will definitely frequent this place more often!
author: Derek B.

description:
Went there last night with my cousins and we were expecting to have some amazing mexican food based on the 4star rating on yelp. 

First, the restaurant was a to find for non-locals and the sign that was supposed to point us toward the restaurant was incorrect. Once we finally made it to the restaurant after wandering the neighborhood we were seated quickly as there wasn't a wait.  The chips and salsa (4 kinds) were brought quickly. Chips were hot and cripsy and the salsas were great! Great flavor and kick. The salsas gave us high hopes for the entrees.  The guacamole was okay. It needed more lime and salt.The house margarita was good, but not really worth $8 based on the size and taste.

We were hoping for a great meal based on the taste of the salsa. We ordered the following:

1) 2 Chicken flauta and cheese enchilada combo plates
2) Chicken enchiladas combo plate
3) Carne Asada dish

The waiter and kitchen messed up the order and only put in 1 order of the flauta and enchilada so I was left waiting for 15 minutes while the plate was made so were didn't even get to enjoy our meal together. There was an apology but no other show for their error. 

Here's a review of the food:
The flautas were good. The enchiladas (Cheese and chicken) were not up to par because the sauce was not good. If you are looking for a flavorful sauce, this is not it. It tasted and looked like tomato sauce out of a can with a little something added as an attempt at flavor. Also, there wasn't enough sauce to cover the enchiladas so the tortillas had dried out as well.  I didn't try the carne asada but according to my cousin the spices and flavor were good but it was dried out, chewy and very hard to cut even with a steak knife.

We ended the meal with a birthday and not only did they take forever bringing out the dessert they also charged us for the dessert that wasn't even very good.

All in all,  it was an okay experience. The only reason I gave it 3 stars was because of the salsa. It was a 2 star experience otherwise. I may go back for happy hour or something but not for the entrees. I've definitely had better.
author: Roma N.

description: This place is so good. The orange-colored salsa is the bomb. The margaritas are amazing. I always get the camarones tropisueno and they are SO good - it's shrimp cooked in the orange colored salsa. I recommend asking for extra tortillas when you order or else you only end up with one or two street-sized tortillas for your entire entree.
author: Sydni S.

description:
Overall, I had a positive experience. Had lunch on the Thursday before New Year's with a friend and my daughter.  We arrived early and got to choose where to sit in the empty dining room. Ten minutes later, the dining room was packed.  Tables being moved around to seat parties of 10, and people vying for tables and chairs.

Like other reviewers have mentioned, I expected them to make our entrees in front of us as you placed your order. You know, taqueria-style.  No worries though. Our food came out relatively fast: nachos, chicken quesadilla, chicken enchilada. The portions were big. We boxed up half of my daughter's quesadilla and rice/beans from my enchilada plate.

The crowd was really easy going and fun. We sat on the banquette opposite the windows. I like the pillow (?) dividers that set up "boundaries" between you and the next table. The dining room is a bit dark but very relaxing.  I'll need to come back to see what dinner and cocktails are like. Definitely worth another visit.
author: Claudine D.

description: Best Mexican food! Very tasty too! The service was good but this place is a little pricy. But overall the service was good.
author: Annette R.

description:
Not classic Mexican food, but great service and FANTASTIC tomato salsa.

The food is "Gringo-Mexican" food, (aka over seasoned with dry spices) to make it taste "Mexican". So if you're a fan of more genuine Mexican food (like you'd get in the mission) you won't be satisfied with the food at Trpisueno.

Fun, comfortable atmosphere and great service. 
Place is full (of white people), so a lot of people definitely like it.

I'd come here again for drinks, chips & salsa, but not for meals.
author: Grilled O.

description:
Ate here once during a convention, and this place was a mob-scene. You can tell the conventioners with their name-tags strung over their necks via a laynard. I always tear mine off when I go civilian lol.

I ate their tropisueno torta, which was crammed with all sorts of meats (carne asada, carnitas, chorizo). It was quite good and seasoned well. The portions were good and the meal was satisfying. Chips are fresh and their guacamole is was fresh-tasting. Not a bad spot.
author: Derek N.

description: This spot has a great atmosphere, so naturally my friend and I had to wait quite awhile to find a spot to sit. The food was great -- I ordered pork enchiladas and was not disappointed.
author: Lauren L.

description: This is a great spot for a bite while out on the town. This place fills up quickly, so plan on waiting a while if you don't make a reservation. The food is great, as is the price-- considering it is in the financial district of one of the most expensive cities in the country. Because it is so busy, the servers are a bit inattentive. You have to work to flag them down. The alcoholic drinks are really good, but if you're drinking soda, it will be in a glass bottle. So don't expect a refill on your coke. Definitely a good place to hit on a vacation, but maybe not so much for a regular dine-in experience.
author: Jean Luc P.

description:
Its aight, since they have to cater to los gringos since its in the FiDi so others are ignored. 

Zach hopefully can learn to make better drinks as well.
author: Isis L.

description: I'm from Texas and this Mexican food is better than most restaurants I've eaten at in Texas. I've been here each of my previous 2 trips to San Francisco. The salsas are AMAZING. Great atmosphere. Vegetarian friendly and they have a bar. Great for lunch.
author: Niraj P.

description: Came in with a few friends and the service was amazing! I bit pricey but overall good experience
author: Liliana M.

description: Great happy hour. Two huge steak street tacos for $5 and two tacquitos for $4, margs for $6.50.  Place was packed!
author: Rob M.

description:
Okay, I am looking at these reviews thinking, "What the heck happened when I went there, because I had a TOTALLY different experience than most?!"

As soon as we sat down my friend ask the waiter if she could purchase a drink at the bar since it was happy hour, instead of paying full price at the table. Cue: Waiter's annoyed face at the prospect that we would be a cheap table. It went downhill from there, as we had to flag down other waiters to get our waiter to pay attention to us.

I accidently spilled my soup on the table, the waiter came over and wiped up the bare minimum leaving the table still very wet. Basically, he put forth a half ass effort on ensuring the table was dry.  We ended up using our own napkins to dry down the table to the best of our ability.

Then, came the after effects of our food which can best be summed up through the text messages my friend and I sent one another...

That night...
Friend: I think that carnitas made my stomach hurt :(
Me: Uuuuhhh, how do I put this nicely...I had to go to bathroom as soon as stepped in my apartment. That place was no bueno!
Friend: Hahaha. Basically the same thing happened to me too. No bueno indeed!

The next morning...
Me: Soooo, do I all of a sudden have an extremely sensitive stomach or is the effect of last night's AMAZING dinner still lingering? I know, I know...TMI:-)
Friend: Haha. No, no. I had stomach issues this morning too!
Me: Okay, that makes me feel better, because I was thinking "Oh great now I have a stomach bug too?"
Friend: Oh yeah. Not just you!
author: Eboniña E.

description:
The happy hour specials here are a great deal considering it is in downtown. 

House margaritas are $5.50, while chips and salsa are free!Most of the happy hour apps range between $4-5. 

The outdoor seating is also a great place to enjoy the surrounding architecture. Service was friendly and attentive.
author: Kerina J.

description: Pretty standard Mexican fair- tacos, enchiladas, etc. The chiles rellenos was bland and a bit boring, but the fish tacos were decent and the guacamole is to die for. The Jamaica (hibiscus juice) was interesting, but a little too sweet.
author: Priya S.

description: Vacationing over Labor Day weekend and since i am a margarita fan I try to find great Mexican food with a wide selection of margs. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks and food, margs were GREEAATTTT and the food was very filling, A+. The bartender knew his liquor and helped with a lot of tequila questions I had, he also introduced me to Mezcal which is now my new favorite liquor. Thank you Alejandro for an unforgettable vacation.
author: Christina M.

description: Awesome environment and food! I will miss that! I had regular chicken burrito always good! I will try beef later
author: Luis Felipe P.

description:
Loved the Ambiance, the service and the drinks!!
It a very cute place, the food was good and can't complain about the service.
Loved it!
author: Ella B.

description:
Great variety of margaritas--the watermelon margarita hit the spot and was not overly sweet or syrupy as most margaritas tend to be.  The cucumber margarita also sounded enticing, so I'll definitely be back to Tropisueño to give that a go!

The chips and three salsas that they start you off with are delicious, simple, and fresh. My favorite salsa was the orange one.

The dishes are very reasonable in price for downtown SF.  At about $12-$20 for most entrees, Tropisueño will set you back about the same as going to an Anytown, USA Chevy's, and of course the food at Tropisueño tastes much fresher than your "local" Chevy's (sorry no love for you, C!)

I ordered the Tampiqueño, and I was given a generous slab of steak and portion of rice, beans and tortillas served with a scoop of guac.  The dish was definitely a winner. 

If you're in the mood for fresh Mexican cuisine and drinks that will hit the spot an won't break the bank, definitely give Tropisueño a try.  I can attest to that bold statement on their website: good Mexican food CAN be found outside of the Mission!
author: Matt S.

description: A very l o n g wait so make a reservation. We were told an hour and it took longer than that. By the time we were seated, the restaurant was to dark to read the menu without using the light on my phone nor could we really see the food on our plates. 1 lonely candle on the table doesn't cut it. The food was very good. Tacos seemed small in size. Pollo Asado excellent but again difficult to see in order to cut properly. Waitress very pleasant
author: AG C.

description:
I used to like this place.  I don't go here that often, but last night when my partner told me we were meeting friends after work here I was pretty excited.

Well, some waitperson got screwed over by the very rude hostess.  (Didn't catch her name, but she was working on Thursday, 8/30/12 at 5:15pm.)  

She let us know that wasn't going to seat us unless we were ALL ordering dinner.  Only two of us were there at this point and we didn't know what our friends were going to order, but we told her, "Yeah!  Of course!"  BUT... she wouldn't even let us sit at one of the empty tables to drink our margaritas (We ordered drinks at the bar, but there was no place to sit to drink them.  $35.00 for TWO margaritas!  YIKES!) and wait for our friends.  So we sat down at a table outside (all of them were empty) to wait.

People who came in after us were seated, even though it wasn't 5:30.  A guy who sat down outside after us was brought a basket of chips and we were offered nothing... even though we had our very expensive drinks.

We ended up going down the way to another restaurant where they were more than happy to not only seat us, but to pull two tables together and rearrange chairs for us.  We ordered I-don't-know-how-many drinks and lots of appetizers and that server got a GREAT tip on a pretty big bill.

A tip that would have gone to a server at Tropisueno had the hostess not been such a (insert insulting word here)!  

And she ruined it for us.  We'll never go back.  And I'm sad because the food is good.
author: Michael H.

description: Good house margaritas.  Food was good, not great.  Had the tacos.  Service was friendly. Everything was good, not great.  I would definitely go back for margaritas, chips and guac.
author: Mark M.

description: I love this spot. It's a quick, go-to Mexican right by my office, great to take visiting friends or meet for lunch and the options are fresh, authentic and good quality. So far I've had the carne asada and chorizo tacos on corn tortillas. I love the carne asada. I've also had a hay day at the awesome salsa bar. The chips are pretty addicting too, light and airy. I'd love to do happy hour here and get some margs next time.
author: Madeline S.

description: Yum Shrimp Quesadilla! Long line to order at lunch so go early :) Serve pretty quick though.
author: Tina A.

description: awesome food. i always get a chicken+steak super burrito and honestly no other burrito compares. the workers here are really friendly and quick with orders. waiting usually isnt a problem anyway because im enjoying their complimentary chips and salsas
author: N A.

description:
Loved this place! After a long day of sightseeing and walking those hills, I was craving some serious Mexican food. I was not disappointed!

We took a seat and ordered up some margaritas. I went for a fancy schmancy twist by ordering the Violeta, complete with violet liquor and vanilla salt. Mmm. We were also given some fantastic chips to snack on that were paired with 4 different salsa/dips. Yum-my.

Once we were seated we snacked on some of the guac. Holy guacamole. It was so fresh and fantastic! This is a definite must order for all you guac fans.

Our entrees were both delish and we coupled them with a round of house margaritas. Honestly, these were the best of the bunch we tried and I would just go for these from the beginning. The refried beans could have been a dish on their own they were so good.

Service was great from the host to the server. The next time I'm in the area I WILL be back and I'm bringing my stretchy pants for the visit.
author: Erin C.

description: I love this place, the food is great, the margaritas are amazing and fresh, and the staff is wonderful.  This is a little hidden gem!
author: Peter U.

description:
Had a top-notch evening with friends at Tropisuena!  The Violeta is a fresh, sweet take on a margarita, the salsas are complex and flavorful, and the entrees are equally fresh and flavorful. There is a large selection of small plates if you'd like to share with friends and try several dishes. 

Request Tony as your server. He's friendly, knowledgeable, and checked in on us promptly after the delivery of each course to make sure we were happy. He won over this table of six girls!
author: Carrie B.

description:
Will not take a reservation for parties larger than FIVE people until 9:45pm.  "Good for groups", my ass.

What a joke.
author: joe b.

description: Looking for a quick snack while shopping with family, Yelp helped me locate this taco treat.  Ordered a chicken mole and pork taco, added the sauce and totally enjoyed it.  Meat flavor and sauces were some of the best I've tasted.  Clean location to sit and enjoy and people were friendly and quick!  Free chips pushes it over the top!! Totally will come back when craving a taco fix!!
author: K T.

description: Love this place, usually go for lunch but did dinner last night, menu is totally different and no salsa bar but food is still great!
author: Lydia C.

description:
I had wanted to try the food at Tropisueño for awhile, I was under the false impression that it was an expensive restaurant. Instead Tropisueño is a casual, taqueria-style ordering system with a cash register at the end of the line and numbers on sticks you bring to your table. 

The woman that were making the food were confused by their own menu and forgot what "chile rojo" was. She was arguing with another employee about how to make "chile rojo" (it was listed on the menu as a tofu dish). Eventually she said they don't have it anymore because they wanted to make it a truly vegetarian meal and she explained that potatoes were not gluten free so it wasn't vegetarian (um yea?what the..!). 

My food was good, they forgot my side of corn tortillas and no waitstaff in sight. There is a salsa bar, average to other salsa bars in SF. Not the best Mexican food in SF, it is OK if you feel like skipping the mall food around Powell Street Station/Union Square.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
Stopped for a margarita (YUM) and some snacks before heading to the game... this place was PACKED!!! Found a corner by the bar and made our move towards party time!

Bartender made some great drinks and was super fun and seemed excited to be there!  Only had the quac and chips so not sure about the food BUT, if what we had was an inclination as to the entrees I am on my way back soon!!!

Make this a definite stop on your trip around SF!!! Great place!!!
author: Mike H.

description:
ATTENTION VEGETARIANS:

Do the following:
1). Get your iPhone
2). Open Gopago (or download it, its free and awesome)
3). Look up Tropisueño
4). Go into Burrito section
5). Veggie Burrito
6). Make it a Super
7). Order
8). Go to Tropisueño and skip the huge line that's usually there
9). Pick up your order at the cash wrap
10). Pick a seat and thoroughly enjoy.
author: Carlos C.

description: Selected this restaurant based on Yelp rating. Definitely not disappointed. They were packed with a 40 minute wait for dinner. We decided to get a drink at the bar to wait...ended up staying at the bar for dinner. Chips and Salsa were fresh and  delicious. Entrees were amazing. Highly recommend this spot.
author: Julie C.

description:
Definitely in my top restaurants here in SF! The ambiance is great! Its nice but not too upscale where you fell like you can't relax. Amazing food and the drinks are out of this world, especially since El Jimador as their well tequila! The bartenders were very friendly, as well as the staff. 

Order the Jamaicazo on the rocks! They in-house steep hibiscus in El Jimador for two weeks then add cucumber, lime, and agave. Probably one of the best drinks I've ever had. They don't use any cheap margarita mixes or tap systems. All are made and shaken by the bartenders.

Appetizer: 
The chips taste like the are made in-house, and come out with three different salsas (which were all delicious!). We ordered the "Taste of 3" Mariscos Crudos with Ceviche de Camarones, Salmon Crudo, and Callos Borrachos. Again, no complaints, they were all very good!

Main Course:
I had the Callos a la Plancha. The dish was a little on the smaller side (3 large scallops) but the entire dish was great, especially the plantain-chorizo hash! My Fiancée ordered the Camarones Tropisueno. The dish was a good portion, with huge shrimp, and the chile de arbol sauce was creamy and delicious! Rice and beans were great as well (and I don't tend to like Mexican style rice).

I will hands down come back to Tropisueño!
author: Allen V.

description:
Dinner is great!  Incredible guacamole, fantastic margaritas. highly recommended for dinner.

Lunch, not so great.  Restaurant turns into a "build your own" cafeteria style lunch.  Cheap lunch, but food very basic, and actually was cold.  Not recommended for lunch.
author: Dr. Octagon O.

description: best mix of food and ambiance for a Mexican restaurant in the Financial / Soma district. can get crowded so expect to wait during lunch / dinner rush
author: Carlos H.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!!  Great lunch spot but if you are going with more than one co-worker and want to sit here, then get there before 11:30 and if you don't want a line then no later than 11:45 or the line will be out the door.  And rightfully so!  this place is delicious, decent price and just overall worth every dollar.  I love their salsa bar.  The only bad side is I have to hold myself back from going here every day for the sake of my waist line and pocket book.
author: Amanda K.

description:
One of the best Mexican joints in SF. And I know what real Mexican food is supposed to taste like - these guys are authentic through and through. Their ingredients are fresh and better yet, their margaritas are strong! Just the way I like them :) I've tried everything from their enchiladas, flautas, carne asada plate, and even chile rellenos - I hated chille rellenos my whole life until I had theirs (sorry Mom!). This place is a keeper.

Definitivamente voy a regresar porque todo esta delicioso!
author: Mariela D.

description: While the food was pretty good, the deceptive drink prices were a major turn off.  My friend ordered a well vodka soda with a splash of cranberry.  They charged her $5 for vodka, $.50 for soda and $1.50 for the splash of cranberry!!!  Same thing happened with my bourbon and soda.  When we complained, they were completely unsympathetic and told us that was the way they ran their business.  When we were seated for dinner, I ordered the $7 glass of wine and asked them to confirm the price.  The surly manager came over again and told us the price was $11, not $7, and that all of the drink prices had gone up.  He was very rude and dismissive.  I will never go back there again.
author: Tracy L.

description:
The vegetarian torta will BLOW YOUR MIND. The grilled veggies pair perfectly with the smokey mayo and creamy avocado on the soft but crunchy grilled bread. LOVE IT.
------------------------------------------------------------
Lunch is AWESOME! Practically all their lunch items are under $10 and huge portions. My coworker and I shared a veggie enchilada combo (rice + beans + 'salad') and some chips/guac for a mere $12. The platter was easily the size of their dinner portions. Unlimited salsa bar? Hells yes! Only expensive items were our margaritas, which were poured in pint glasses (bigger than dinner portion) and strong. Wish they were this affordable at dinner.
author: Cori W.

description:
This restaurant is just ok, it's nothing to write home about and the food is more of a chipotle / taco bell cross in my opinion. Very quickly made to order in front of you, the bar has a nice selection of drinks and the salsa is probably the highlight of the entire restaurant but I am not sure I would call this a favorite of mine by any means. The food was good, not so much authentic but good enough for a quick meal if you're in the area and have a craving for some mexican food. It was fresh and the staff were friendly. 

I would return but it's not on the top of my list of places to eat in the city.
author: Jason H.

description: First, I'd like to say that the location of this restaurant is great because it is just off Market Street and was not busy or surrounded by many people when we went there for lunch. The food, the food was absolutely incredible. Tastes just like a home cooked Mexican meal compared to other Mexican restaurants I've been to. I ordered a Mojado and got is super (adding sour cream and guacamole) and surprisingly, the food came by fairly quick, which was great and the portion sizes are huge! You really do get bang for your buck. Highly recommend if you are in the area.
author: Gabriel M.

description:
Amazing food-the chips and salsas they start you with could be a meal in themselves! Their old school tacos are to die for. Barbados is a fav!
Their seating system is a little unorganized, so make sure to keep checking bak with the hostess, and that others aren't walking right in ahead of you!
Tamales are great as well. 
Worth the wait, this joint is usually slammed!
author: Amanda T.

description:
Got to try the camarones al mojo de ajo, authentic Mexican food at reasonable prices. Waiters are so friendly and nice! Will be back for sure!
Forgot to mention the friendly staff!!!!
We were visiting from LA and our Hotel Concierge recomended this place. I am so glad they did.
author: Ray K.

description: Honestly, this has got to be the best food in San Francisco. Strongly deserve a 5 stars review /// The drinks are a rip off tho!
author: Allan S.

description: Best taco bar in the city.  Dinner and margaritas are top shelf too.
author: Jeff S.

description: Such a great spot for lunch, especially big groups or business lunches. Delicious homemade Mexican food. What could be better? Great menu selection of street tacos, burritos, fajitas, tamales, soaps, and more. They'll customize everything to your liking. This is like the upscale, authentic version of Chipotle! Friendly, quick service, great atmosphere.
author: Tracey K.

description:
One of my classic lunch place. Free salsa and chips, Burritos and Quesadillas below $7, lot of choices and option, easy to find a table to sit...

Unexpected in the middle of FiDi.
author: Lionel F.

description: I have only been during Lunch but I like this place. I have had better burrito's for less money but it's SF so I expect it to be expensive. Plus even though it can get pricey it's still cheaper than other options in the FiDi. When I work on Saturdays and I don't bring lunch then it's either this or Super Duper for me. The burrito's and quesadillas are all I can vouch for and they're both pretty good.
author: Renee F.

description: My go to in SOMA for Mexican. The enchiladas, rice, chips and various salsas are pure comfort. This place never disappoints. It's also got a great location in the heart of Yerba Buena. The decor is warm and inviting and the staff is on top of their game.
author: Greg J.

description:
Yeahhhhhh

You can come here for lunch or dinner or on a Saturday after shopping or after work for happy hour, basically you can come here whenever and it's a great time to be there. The ambiance is real chill and the food is so fresh and good. If you come for happy hour it does get a bit crowded so beware but other than that, there's really nothing you can bash on. The tacos are good. They have free chips and salsa and the service is awesome. The location is very convenient, right next to the Jewish Contemporary Museum and the Press Club. I'd suggest you come with a group and go to the happy hour they have because it is all very good.
author: Javier G.

description: Love the margaritas here and the bartender Remi is really friendly.  Great service and food too.
author: Justin M.

description: Absolutely love this place. One of the best burrito I've ever eaten. Love their collection of sauce. If you are vegetarians who likes Mexican food this is the place. Only bad part is they don't serve burrito after 4pm. If I'm in sfo and we crave Mexican food me n hubby come here
author: Ree R.

description:
We really wanted to try Papalote out on 24th, but didn't want to pay a $40 round trip cab date thanks to the BART strike. This was within walking distance of our hotel.

Salsas were great. Entrees were decent and the house margaritas were delicious. It was a bit loud and the service was slow.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Excellent spot. Went here before a movie on a Friday night. Glad we had a reservation as folks were waiting an hour and a quarter for tables. The salsas with the chips were extraordinary...particularly the arboleda sauce with a touch of jalapeno.

The food was fantastic from a widely varied menu. Our server was great as well giving us advice, recipe ingredients as well as great service. What a wonderful oasis in the heart of SF.

Give it a try...you'll love it too!
author: M T.

description: This place is great for workday lunches.  There's always a line, but it moves pretty fast.  The food here is always rich flavorful and delicious.  My favorite is the Tropisueno Torta, which is a sandwich with three kinds of meats on it.  They have bowls of chips and a salsa bar with several varieties.  There is plenty of seating indoors and out.
author: Steven Z.

description:
So I've passed by this place on a couple occasions and always thought ok, I'll give it a whirl... but I never do until a few days ago.

I thought it was like a sit down kinda place but it's a "get in line, order what you want, get a number, wait til the server brings it to you" kinda deal. Not bad. 

They need some AC though. Seriously. You walk into the dining room area and it's like ... warm. Sticky warm. Ick. 

Free chips and there's a salsa station to boot. There's their popular orange sauce which is good, small baby kick on the spice level. There is one salasa that had a nice kick though. The rest of the sauces, not so memorable. 

I just ordered ceviche and a super taco. Both were really good. The taco is so packed with stuff, you can't even pick it up without making an utter mess or spilling all the contents. 

My friends got the grilled shrimp plate that came with rice, beans, salad, and tortillas. A steal at like $11 bucks. It was huge! The rice was really good, it had this nice smoky, almost nutty flavor. I didn't try anything else but they said ti was good.

Cheap, relatively fast place to satisfy your craving for mexican food.

Beware, their burrito looked GINORMOUS!!! I don't know how any one can devour it in one sitting.

Oh, their house magaritas were really good. They have a chili salt to rim the glass and it was delicious.
author: Jeannie L.

description: Margharitas, chips, and fresh Mexican food that all hit the spot. I can easily see this place becoming a default to go place for a date, group dinner, or happy hour. The ambiance is fun and spacious, and the waiters were fun and friendly. Made reservations and got seated right away, along with a big bowl of chips and dips. We got the chicken mole and salmon platters, classic margaritas, and tres leches cake. Their margarita menu is extensive and it could have definitely turned into a dangerous night had it not been a workday ;)
author: Amy L.

description: At first we were skeptical since the restaurant is in a touristy area but thanks to its four star rating on Yelp we decided to give it a try.  The portions were generous and the food was delicious! We had enchiladas and fajitas and both dishes were great.  They came with lots of beans and rice.
author: Irene C.

description:
So far my favourite Mexican restaurant in San Francisco. The atmosphere is so cozy and I always feel at home here. The drinks are pricey but are very classy and made right and strong!
The food is sooooo filling and more authentic than most places in SF (outside of mission).

Salsa.... Best part. 3 types of salsa, yellow(hot), red(chunky and spices but a nice kick), and green(which is a nice refreshing salsa that balances out the other two)
Needless to say I always ask for refills on salsa. And I crave the guacamole..... Just thinking about it now....

Trop never let's me down.
author: Brittany S.

description: tuesday 9/8/2016 at 7 pm  the host a girl with a Bicthy attitude !!!!!  and   RUDE  .... and  the bartender too .....REALLY !!!!
author: Angelo S.

description: Great Mexican food and fun bartenders!! Loved everything about this spot!
author: Brenda R.

description: The wait was thirty minutes. A section of the restaurant was reserved for an event. My cheese quesadilla tasted like something that I could of made at home. What I liked about this place: ambiance, strawberry margarita and the chips and dip.
author: Nitu W.

description:
Chips and salsas were amazing. Always good when you get free stuff, especially in a restaurant in downtown SF. 

I had the veggie enchiladas. They were okay - they could have had some more veggies. The beans that came on the side went well with my dish. It was a great portion for my tummy, wallet and taste buds. 

My Mom and Dad got the tampileuno dish (skirt steak). They said it was excellent. I don't eat beef, so I didn't taste. 

Boyfriend got Chili Verde. He said the pork was delicious and took some home for leftovers. 

I would take anyone here, including locals and out-of-towners.
author: Emily G.

description:
This place gets packed for happy hour, so come early for a seat.   I was here on Halloween.  They have plenty of gluten free options.  All tasty.

I've wanted to come here twice before and didn't find it, so it can be a little hard to find.

Sat outside, very slow to bring menu and take order.   Got Guacamole and chips, never brought the drinks, by that time, dinner was finally open and we got a table inside.

Dinner was great.  Service is a little slow, though attentive for sit down dinner.  It's best when you want to chill or have some tasty food and hard hitting drinks.  The drinks here are like doubles and well balanced and tasty even with the increased alohol content.  (we made new drink orders).
The four Mexican lolipops were a nice touch, instead of mints (probably specific to Halloween?).

The atmosphere is nice and dark, rocks, candle, etc.  Even though a little cramped and packed, it didn't seem loud, you didn't get bumped and you were aloft in your own table bubble.

Honestly, my experience was 2-3 star, but I they are normally more 4 than 3 stars, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt, since I still left satisfied.

The one restroom can have quite the line.

The price is more like $20-50, than 11-30.
author: Denae W.

description:
Great place to hit, I was there late but it seems like the kind of place that has a really good happy hour. 

I love chips and salsa and they give you a huge basket and three (!) different kinds of salsa, all were very different but very good.

Food portions are generous, margaritas were well made (although not super strong).  Even though the place was slammed, service was still really good.

Great place to find yourself after work if you are in the FiDi!
author: Doug M.

description:
Listen, I sat down and some old lady struck up conversation 2 seconds into me sitting down by saying, "Hey loser!"  After all that, it's still a great place to go to.  

Here is the story: 

The salsas that came out were great. There was a tomatillo, traditional with a tomato base, and a crema-chipotle.  All of the salsas were very flavorful and fresh. The chips were freshly cooked.  The barkeep mentioned they get the chips made daily, then deep fry them to order.  Either the bartender knew I liked to drink or he was trying to flirt with me because the cocktails were awesome.  Mostly rum with a splash of coke.  One was food enough for me.  

I ordered some carne asada dish.  The carne asada was bomb.  It was nicely cooked (medium rare) and seasoned excellently.  The entree ran about $14.  Seriously, tons of steak. That Shiite could have fed two people. 

Why 4 stars, you ask?  That lady who so tried to make my acquantance when I first walked in talked my ear off.  She wouldn't leave me alone.  And normally that's not a bad thing for guys.  But, in truth, the lady next to me was some homeless broad.  The bartender apologized, but yeah... I ate enough to hurry up and get the hell out of there. : /
author: Robert B.

description:
This place is great, and I second everyone's comments about the delicious food and the deadly (in a good way) chips. 

However, I did a search on the existing reviews for "milanesa", but no one had reviewed it. How is this possible? This is the best meal in the place.

I grew up in Mexico City, and milanesa was one of my favorite dishes - it's basically a paillard of beef or chicken, breaded and deep fried. It's the Mexican weiner schnitzel, the Mexican chicken fried steak. It's heaven.

And it turns out that when you put milanesa on a soft roll with refried beans and guacamole (don't forget the chips on the side!), you are in for a treat. Perfectly fried but not greasy, and generally delicious. You have to try it.

The other stuff is good, too, but the milanesa made me write.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Maybe I had too high of expectations for this spot due to the positive reviews and looong wait for a table (for once I actually stuck it out) and review on Check Please!, but I just wasn't that impressed. Just a dressed up Chevys.

Or perhaps maybe I just didn't order the right things but I just felt lackluster from it all. I don't think I'll ever be back, I don't think it was worth the wait or the price tag. Mexican food should be cheap! 

The server was giving us a little bit of a 'i'm over this night' vibe which is understandable but don't let your customers feel it. Best thing here was definitely the unlimited amount of chips & salsa but they were so thin that trying to dip in the guacamole was near impossible. 

I wanted to love you Tropisueno but you just didn't deliver.

I do give you stars for the atmosphere, the decor and the sweet hostess, Amy, who never got frustrated or flustered with the anxious customers waiting for a table.
author: S. M.

description:
I'm just the IT guy and taste tester. My wife writes all the cool stuff

A couple weeks ago we had dinner before going to see Inception.  We were in downtown San Francisco near the Metreon on Yerba Buena Lane and noticed a Mexican restaurant, Tropisueno.  Arriving a few minutes too early for the start of dinner service at 5:30, so we enjoyed a drink at the bar.  The drink menu has a list of specialty Margaritas, which I highly recommend.  Different flavored salts are used to rim the glasses to enhance each Margarita.  I ordered the Violeta, a classic Margarita with a hint of Violet liqueur on the rocks with Vanilla salt.  My husband ordered the Margarita de la Casa, which is a traditional Margarita, but rimmed with Arbol chili salt.  Both Margaritas were well balanced and the flavored salts added a nice dimension to the beverages.  The beverages definitely stand out.

The dinner menu is fairly large offering an assortment of small seafood dishes and starter dishes, a number of entrees, and more traditional combo plates.  For a starter we ordered the Empanadas de Hongos, small Mexican turnovers filled with mushrooms and cheese.  The crust was tender and a bit flakey and the filling was well seasoned.  Chips and salsa are brought to the table at the start also.  The chips are amazing.  Thin, crispy, and salty.  They don't even need salsa.


Tropisueno Empanadas and Chips
All entrees are served with Mexican rice and a choice of beans.  The rice is lightly seasoned to produce a great flavor to accompany your main dish.  We decided on white beans for our choice.  They were creamy and sweet.  I ordered a combo plate with a vegetarian taco, and tamale, and a cheese chile relleno.  The relleno, a cheese stuffed pepper baked in a corn flour coating was the best item of the three.  Very rich, but you can't go wrong with cheese.  My husband ordered the Tampiqueno, thin cut carne asada served with a beef barbacoa enchilada.  The thin grilled beef was nice and tender and the enchilada was a delicious accompaniment to the dish.


Tropisueno Chile Relleno and Tamale

Tropisueno Tampiqueno
All in all we had a good experience and a good meal at Tropisueno.  It would be a fun place to go with a group to celebrate a birthday.  I'll have to go back for lunch, for during the day the restaurant it a taqueria, serving a different menu.
author: Chad G.

description: First timers! Not impressed! Food smells amazing! So we're sitting at the bar and it turns out there's a separate line to order food!? Say what?! It's V-day. All we wanted was an appetizers...:( better luck next time. Excited to try 5A5.
author: Jen M.

description: I met up with friends at Tropiseuno on a lazy Saturday afternoon. Their menu has a lot to offer and is decently priced, so I ordered the super baja fish burrito (guac and sour cream make it "super") and some ceviche. The ceviche was really tasty, but the fried fish in my burrito tasted really inedibly fishy. FYI, that "fishy" taste or smell is an indicator that what you're eating is far from fresh, and it made me feel slightly nauseous for the rest of the day. I'm not in the area much so would probably explore other places first, but the others in my party who ordered drinks say they were awesome, so this is probably a great place to just order margaritas and nosh on chips and guacamole.
author: Rachel A.

description: I recently had dinner here with a friend. Although small, we had no trouble enjoying our dinner and conversation. The service was prompt but not rushed. I chose two appetizers as my entree - shredded pork tostadas and shrimp ceviche. The portions were generous and the food was flavorful. The ambiance has a tropical/Mexican vibe without being kitschy.
author: Nissa P.

description: Just went to Tropisueno for lunch with my co-workers to try their burrito.  My office has continued to rave about this place and how it makes Chipotle seem like fast food (which...it sort of is...) in comparison.  In any case, I had the shrimp burrito with the spinach wrap tortilla.  When it came out, I almost died when I felt how heavy it was.  For $8.50, this was most definitely two meals.  While we waited for our food to be brought out, we were given an unlimited amount of chips, unlimited access to the salsa bar, and refills on waters.  Bear in mind that we had ordered our lunches to go, so it wasn't like we were going to be eating in for lunch.  This place gets kind of crazy and busy during lunch hour, but it's for all the right reasons.  One of my coworkers made the comment that he thought that this was some of the best Mexican food he's had in the city.  For the amount of food you get, plus the freshness of their lunch items makes this place TOTALLY worth it.  Other items that were ordered in our group was the beef quesadilla (which was deemed "OK, but a burrito would have been better), a barbacoa burrito, and a shrimp burrito with a wheat wrap.  I definitely think that this place is worth trying if you're looking to break away from the monotony of Chipotle.  Note that this place does not do burrito bowls, but has salads available.  Customizing your burrito is also easy as I asked for no beans, cheese, or sour cream in mine.
author: Lisa I.

description: First time in San Francisco and we wanted to try this place based on the reviews. Unfortunately we were very disappointed because of the poor quality of food they have here. We even called the chef over to our table to ask where he gets his recipes because of how bad the food tasted. The rice wasn't fully cooked and it was cold. The mole poblano was spicy which I thought that was odd being that it's suppose to be sweet. The margaritas are nasty! Please save yourself a trip and find a better place.
author: Mayra L.

description: Thanks again yelp! I hardly get disappointed with choice of a restaurant when I explore a new city because of yelp. Per most people's recommendations I ordered chicken enchilada and ceviche.  The enchilada was one of the best enchiladas I have had. Not too cheesy and greasy as most places. The sauce on top is flavorful and not too spicy. Ceviche was fresh. Also very affordable.
author: abby t.

description: Honestly the best Mexican restaurant in San Francisco.   Delicious Mexican food taste.  The place looks and feels traditionally Mexican.
author: Giselle P.

description: Excellent food, generous portions, wonderful condiment bar. Perfect for a late lunch after sf moma! Prepare to be too bloated to dance to the upbeat music.
author: Mac S.

description:
Buena! Soy un fan de Tropisueño!

Knowing that there's always a line out-the-door at Tropisueño, my friend and I decided to do an early lunch on Friday, 5.7.10. We arrived at 11:30 AM and luckily, there wasn't a line yet.

FOOD/DRINKS:
*Guacamole: $3.95 - YUMMY!  The guac was nice and buttery with hints from the garlic and chilis to give it a nice kick. However, there were very large chunks of avocados which would break the chip when you tried to scoop it out from the bowl. So, we ended up with pieces of chips inside the bowl.

Yes, the homemade chips were good and were served warm, however, they did NOT hold up to the guac as they were very light, thin, and crisp. They were similar to the Chevy chips but less oily and salty.

*Chicken w/ Mole Poblano (dried peppers, nuts, and chocolate): $11.95 - YUMMY! This was the first time I had mole and although I was excited, I had my reservations b/c a "savory" chocolate flavor seemed less than appetizing to me. However, I was totally blown away. The chicken (white) was extremely tender and flavorful from soaking up the sauce which was creamy, savory, spicy, nutty, with a very slight bittersweet chocolate aftertaste. 

*Chicken w/ Mole Amarillo (dried chilies, red tomatoes, onions, and garlic): $11.95 - Meh! The chicken was dry and tasted more like chicken (used for the burritos?) tossed in pico de gallo. The sauce which was more like a salsa consisted of tomatoes, garlic, onions, and cilantro. It was quite bland and didn't have much to heat to it.  

Both moles came w/ a side of seasoned rice a choice of red, black, or refried beans, and a salad. 

The rice was nicely seasoned and was cooked al-dente. The red and black beans were tender. They were unseasoned, however, it was topped with cotija cheese which gave it some seasoning. The salad consisted of crisp butter lettuce, 2 slices of red tomatoes, and 3 slices of avocados. 

*Pineapple Agua Fresca: $2.95 - It was ok; it was bit too syrupy and sweet for my taste.

*Watermelon Agua Fresca: $2.95 - It was very refreshing and slightly sweet. It was a bit grainy which shows they used real watermelon.

However, both Frescas were ROOM TEMP which was disappointing. 

*Salsa Bar: There were about 5 different types of salsas from what I recall. 
1. Salsa Verde was watery and was borderline flavorless w/ a very slight kick to it.

2. Pico De Gallo (mild and medium) was fresh and had nice chunks of red tomatoes, onions, garlic, and cilantro, however, it was flavorless. 

3. Salsa Ranchera? (orangey color salsa): OMFG, it was SOOO YUMMY! For those who are familiar with the infamous Papalote Salsa which is creamy, garlicky, and packs a kick that will leave your mouth with a fiery aftertaste...this one comes pretty damn close.

4. Salsa Roja was extremely HOT and vinegary. 

5. Condiments: Beets, jalapenos, pickled jalapenos with onions and carrots, white onions, and cilantro. 

SERVICE:
The service is so-so hence minus 1 STAR. We weren't greeted by the ladies who took our order and we waited 10 minutes at the register to pay b/c the cashier was fumbling w/ the register. She then just told us to come back and pay. 

It's Taqueria style during lunch; look at the menu, order, get a number, pay, and they bring your food to your table which takes about 5 minutes or so. However, it's a sit-down restaurant during dinner. 

I'm not fond of the Taqueria-style ordering system here b/c it's highly INEFFICIENT during lunchtime. At 11:45 AM, although the dining area was near empty, there was a line of more than 30+ people that stretched far our the doorway which is caused by bottlenecks holding up the line from staring at the menu AND b/c there's only one register. Since they bring your food to you anyways, they might as well make it a "sit-down" restaurant during lunch as well.

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
I LOVE the ambiance at Tropisueño! It reminds me of a hacienda converted into a restaurant; the open kitchen w/ Spanish tiles, the dining area w/ sloping bamboo ceilings, rustic wooden tables, chairs, flooring, and cabinets, and the cabana style booths which adds a sexy romantic touch. 

PARKING:
There's a garage 1/2 block away on Market and 4th, however Public Transportation is highly recommended as the Powell Street station is just a block away. 

If I'm in the area and craving Mexican food in a rustic environment, I'll definitely come back to Tropisueño!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I finally got a chance to have dinner here and it was really average. 

Their happy hour plates are so yummy, but their dinner is huge a disappointment. So strange that there could be such a big difference. I had the Chicken Mole. Don't get it!  Just don't the chicken was cooked ok, moist enough, but the mole sauce was awful. It tasted like a plum teriyaki sauce which was not good, even if it was supposed to be teriyaki. 

My friend had the chicken verde and that was also a huge disappointment, very plain and bland compared to their happy hour dishes. I mean their chips and sauces alone would make you think dinner would be delicious, but sadly no. Avoid the entrees here. If you want entree type food, stick with a mom and pop taqueria.
author: Jamie T.

description:
After drinking sake all day at an expo, Barting it back to the city, meeting a friend and grabbing a drink at Postrio in the Prescott... all we needed was a solid place to eat some delicious grub.  Eddie the bartender whom I call Sr. Flores (from one of my favorite movies Traffic) recommended Tropisueno.  So we gave it a whirl.  We waited for 30 minutes but with Margaritas in hand so we didn't fret.  We sat down to one of the most amazing comforting meals I've had in quite some time.  Mike ordered the puerco dish served 3 ways, my gentleman friend carnitas tacos and I ordered the sopa de abodingas.  Now the second I ordered it my gentleman friend almost flipped as he thought I was trying to create another GF shitshow.  "Why would you order a meatball soup, you know they use flour!?!"  was what I could see in his eyes.  But I asked our server twice and she checked with the kitchen and was 100% positive so I trusted her and she was so right.  No sign of wheat in the most delicious perfectly seasoned meatball soup ever!

Amazing margaritas, chips & trio of salsas (killer and gorgeous) and GF friendly!  Fun, hip, dark and sexy ambiance too!
author: Shiho F.

description:
Yum and oh my!

Delish happy hour, incredible chips and salsa (chipotle one is my fave), great margaritas. I love having lunch, dinner here, or just drinks during the HH. Roasted chicken is insane, ceviche is yummy. 

The only complaint that I would have, hence 4 stars, is that margaritas during HH can be a bit hit and miss. They get really slammed, so sometimes it's just a bit off, but given the high quality to begin with, even their "worst" margarita is still better than most places in this city.
author: Yelena K.

description: I am a born vegetarian and have been going to Tropisueno for 4 years now because mainly I like their drinks and get decent vegetarian food options. My last visit was in May 2016 and I think I am never ever going their again. I ordered a vegeretian meal (I always make sure to tell the server like 10 times what I want and how strict I am as a vegetarian). I got my food and when I was half way through I realized there was a meat piece in my rice. I almost puked and was in shock. I called the manager and he was not even apologetic about it. His exact words were - "See Miss whatever has happened has happened, we can take this out of your check" and he left. I was like really, this is how you behave with your customers? I think he was just trying to ignore me may be because this happens often there and he is used to it. I would give 0 stars if possible!! Sometimes I feel it is sin to be a vegetarian.
author: Deepali A.

description: They use queso on some dishes, without noting it on the menu, so watch out if you're pregnant...
author: Marc S.

description: If I could give them 0 stars I would. The margarita was ok but the people were so mean. We got here at 5:45 and they told us that they couldn't even take our order anymore for happy hour which ends at 6. And they weren't even nice about it. It would have been fine if they at least explained to us why we couldn't order anymore a whole 15 minutes before happy hour ended but they were rude and brushed us off. Don't come here.
author: Haley P.

description:
I liked this place.  Conveniently located near the movie theater downtown for a dinner and movie night with my boyfriend.  The three salsas were delicious.  We couldn't stop eating them!  I could have taken them hotter though!  :)

I was looking forward to the margaritas...the violeta one was decent.  The ginger one I could have done without.  Maybe I had just built up the idea of the margarita in my mind?  They were fine, but nothing I'd write home about.  My boyfriend got the sangria which he liked, but I didn't.  Had too much of a coca cola flavor to it for me.  

I had a beef dish and my boyfriend had the shrimp.  Both were great.  The ambiance was nice.  I would definitely stop by here again for their happy hour.  The bar looked nice and crowded.

The tables were close together, but not so much so that you could hear the person next to you, which was nice.  

And finally, the ultimate compliment came from my boyfriend, who's favorite fast food restaurant is Chipotle...he said this place was better than Chipotle.  Granted, it's a different take on Mexican, being a little more authentic in my mind, but for him to admit that anything is better than Chipotle is huge.  Well done, Tropisueno, well done.
author: Eliza D.

description: Awesome Mexican restaurant! Alejandro great bartender, very knowledgeable, entertaining and open to give tequila shot samples. We ordered the empanadas, trio ceviche, and pork chop entree. Everything was delish great portions and seasoning. Amazing drinks too!!
author: Kathy C.

description: Awesome food and great environment.  Lots of young people out with friends. Good salsa and good drinks. Need a reservation or plan to wait an hour which isn't a big deal if you like a few cocktails.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Great for dinners. Good meat quality for the price. The atmosphere is awesome with not much noise.
Margheritas are good but not many flavored ones are on the menu.
author: Sami A.

description:
Best Mexican in SOMA. 

Excellent Salsa, Camarones Tropisueno is a must.

Atmosphere is nice too. Lively at the bar or quant in the seating area.
author: Tammy C.

description: Mediocre dining experience. I made a reservation for 2 at 630pm on a Thursday night. Did not get waters or drink orders in until I asked someone to please come over after 15 minutes. We placed an order for guacamole to start, and I had the chicken enchiladas and he had a taco, tamale, and enchilada (to try all). The guac didn't come until the middle of our meal as our waiter forgot about it until we asked again (he never checked in to refill our waters so we didn't have a chance to ask until our entrees came). His tamale was half cooked and the enchilada fell apart. My chicken enchiladas with the cream sauce was better but nothing better than the frozen enchiladas I buy at the supermarket. Pretty disappointed with the food and service and can't think of a highlight of the meal other than the location and ambiance. No apologies for the forgotten order. Would not recommend. There are plenty other restaurants in Union square.
author: grace y.

description:
Consistent. Tasty. Incredible selection of tequilas, and they know how to make one fine marg from it. The food is consistent, the salsas fantastic (esp. like the chili de arbol ... they even have a shrimp dish with it - YUM!). The beef cheek  taco truck tacos are always tasty, as well as the scallop/chorizo and cigar dishes. We haven't gone wrong yet there. And they have a sister restaurant in Oakland serving the same fare. 

Definitely recco!
author: L S.

description:
If you're looking for a burrito, this place is not for you. The group seated ahead of us left in disdain, because they "realllllly wanted a burriiiitooo" and "like can't believe a MEXICAN place didn't have burrriiitooos".  I hope they found safety in the slightly warm, yet familiar arms of Taco Bell. 

If you're looking for  an array of spicy salsa, fresh chips, and not overly salted Mexican food then swing by. The plates are decent sized, not so big you wish you had a second stomach, but not so small you pretend to be at a French restaurant. 

Be sure order the plantanos maduros and margaritas.
author: Angie O.

description:
Tropisueno is my new fav mexican restaurant in the city. Note that it is a restaurant and not a taqueria. 

That means delicious fancy, fun, flavor margaritas with lavender salt, awesome guacamole and chile verde. 

It gets pretty busy in here, so make a reservation on Open Table and if you get there early, you can chill at the bar for a pre-drink!
author: Gladys C.

description: Greasy carnitas tacos, squeezed out about a half cup of oil from 3 tacos..shocking for such a nice place.... if you can get tacos right something is WRONG!
author: K. K.

description:
First timers- the location is down an alley and can be hard to find but just walk down and you'll be good. 

First off- 
Definitelyy the best Happy Hour in SF- 
Came here after work all the time and got the margaritas and tacos.

Margaritas $5 and they are strong and tastyyy. I also recommend the Cucumber margarita..sounds weird but it's refreshing and delicious.

Chips and Salsa here are the bomb with 3 different colors/textures/tastes 
Also- if you like Spicy, ask for the Habanero salsa it usually packs a punch. 

For the happy hour, can't go wrong with the flautas, tacos (chicken/steak and fish all good) and the quesadillas are great and simple

My favorite non happy hour dish here is the Camarones Tropisueno ..comes in a rich and creamy tomato sauce with tortillas... it is TASTYY


Call early for reservations and it's a great place to recommend to/or to bring people to visiting downtown sf.
author: Naveed B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I haven't been a huge fan of restaurants in this area, as they're usually super expensive, touristy and not very good. But, I'm a fan of this place.

I was able to get a last-minute reservation for 3 people, despite it being packed for a Monday. We arrived a few minutes early, so we grabbed a cocktail at the bar and devoured their amazing tortilla chips (warm, flaky, crunchy goodness) with multiple kinds of salsa. I tasted my friends' cocktails, and we all agreed mine (the Gloria) was the best.

I got the enchiladas, and honestly, I can't tell you what anyone else ate, because I was so hung up on my dish. Portions were huge (especially after eating a few baskets of those to-die-for chips).

This is a great spot for a group after happy hour at Press Club or Local Edition. Highly recommend.
author: Paulette B.

description:
How have I not reviewed this gem yet?

Here's the dealio: it's a taqueria/upscale dinner locale.
Lunchtime Tacqueria = ok.
Dinner = fab.

Their homemade salsas & chips are delicious.  Don't miss the Tampiqueno or Camerones Tropisueno.

Portions are huge (a little bit too huge).  Service is friendly.  Drinks are good.  And this place is within 10 minutes of my house.
author: Jaime C.

description:
Great food. Not too spicey for people who like it mild.  The food is served fast and it is delicious. 

The menu is wierd and its hard to understand what you order but the caterer is welcoming and do exlain things very well. 

Will definitely come back.
author: Barry S.

description:
I'm not an expert on authentic Mexican food, but there are few other places I've been to with better Mexican food. They start you off with chips and three different kinds of salsa. It's not like the regular chunky tomato salsa at all, but all three are unique, which makes it extra hard to stop filling yourself up on chips before your meal comes.

When our entrees came, I was speechless at how giant the portions were. The chili verde came on a huge plate, that was primarily covered with the most tender pork in a really great herb-y and spicy sauce. The ratio of rice and beans was also perfect, although I would've liked more of the cabbage salad because I loved the vinegar-y taste to balance everything out. Usually chicken is my number one choice for meat, but when the pork is this tender I can't decide which is better! My boyfriend had the chicken mole, which came with the biggest pieces of chicken I've ever seen at a restaurant. The flavor was nice and smokey, and the meat was also cooked well.

What was even better was that I ended up with enough leftovers for another meal, and it tasted just as good the next day. The prices are more than reasonable especially given the amount of food you get!
author: Ashley T.

description: Great place for happy hour! Amazing salsa and fresh, fast food! We came here from out of town based on the reviews and we weren't disappointed! The chicken is delicious, has a chargrilled BBQ taste, yum!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Food is good, drinks are very good! Highly recommend making a reservation days in advanced, or you can also wait  in line to be seated (I've seen wait to be over 60 minutes sometimes)! So definitely call ahead ;)
author: JD G.

description:
Tropisueno is not a bad option if you are feeling like a Mexican lunch that's not a burrito.  Actually, the burrito here is kinda pricey.  I would recommend a taqueria.  Instead, explore the other menu options here.  You won't regret it!

For lunch you can get the single item or upgrade it to the meal option (that just means beans + rice).  The single item is filling enough for me but I don't eat much at lunch.  When I get the meal option it's enough for two lunches.

I have to admit I haven't explored the menu that much.  I've had the chile relleno twice now, the standard and ground beef version.  I'm a sucker for chile relleno and this did not disappoint.

If you do come here, get here early.  There's a long line that moves slowly.  Once you're through the line though you can easily get a table to sit at.  A lot of people just get take away.  

BTW, you also get chips and salsa with your order.  Nice!

I would also recommend coming here for happy hour.  There's an order 5 margaritas get the sixth one free special, plus endless chips and salsa.  It's a really great happy hour actually.
author: Jean K.

description:
Great for takeout, not so great for eat -in when it comes to lunchtime. Our office is a block away, so we tend to cater this delectable food on a pretty regular basis. Once Gopago came out, we started ordering our lunches here as well. The app lets you submit your order and pay on your phone, then when you arrive, you get to skip the line and just pick up your food and go. 

Yesterday my parents wanted to try it out since they're staying in the Marriott it is attached to. We waited in the very long line, and then made our order. Once we ordered we had the trouble of finding a table. It's difficult. Lunchtime gets super busy, and for groups larger than 2 it can really be a chore. We finally got a table, and waited for our food. The weird thing about this place, is that they don't bring all of the food together. Each item came separately and between my burritto and my mother's soup there was a good 15 minutes. It makes it kind of awkward when you're eating with a group. 

That being said, the food is amazing. The burrittos are HUGE and super yummy. I always opt for the Veggie will all the fixings. The soup is also really amazing. It's a really large portion and very filling. The chips are really good too. You can tell they are made fresh, and they have the perfect crisp. Definitely recommend eating the food, I would just take it to go.
author: Lauren D.

description: I came her for lunch 2 weeks ago. The food was delicious and came out quickly. I ordered the chili relleno and it was so delicious and flavorful! The portions are pretty hefty so come hungry. Also, shout out to the fresh tortilla chips and strong margaritas.
author: Noa R.

description:
I came here over the weekend.  It is packed.  

Food: 5 stars.  Love everything that we ordered

Service: 3 stars.  Waiter was kind of pushy.  We arrived at 9:50 PM and he only left us 5 mins to order.
author: T N.

description:
So... we went here for cocktails and appetizers for happy hour and moved over to the dining area for dinner afterwards. The food was good, but a little expensive. Happy hour prices were great, so I recommend dining in the bar for some tasty appetizers. 

However, I could not rate this place higher than 3 stars because of the margaritas. Don't get me wrong, they tasted fine... but after drinking 2 of them, I was completely dizzy and nauseous, and not from the booze... it must have been from the SUGAR. It was so completely unpleasant. I thought it was just me, but I asked my boyfriend and he said he felt awful too. Never again... maybe I'll just order beer next time. :)
author: Erin B.

description: Great food, service was very friendly. Make sure you book early because the place is always full. Located in a street area that you might not expect to find a restaurant like this, it is worth seeking out...
author: Kevin G.

description:
Tropisueno, how have I never written words about you before? Not really sure... but here goes.

Your burritos. Oh, your burritos. Huge, and delicious, and flavorful, and messy. Since I began working for Yelp, I have yet to take a trip to SF without eating Tropisueno at least once. Give me a burrito anyday and I'm happy, but give me a Tropisueno burrito and I'm ecstatic.

Sure, the line can be long during the lunch rush, but they move you through quickly and the end result is totally worth it. Don't forget to stock up on salsas from the salsa bar! Lots of variety, ranging from mild to spice-tastic. Can't have a true Tropisueno experience without it.

Open one in RVA, please?
author: Jamie D.

description:
I actually loved Tropisueno, but I can not believe that they charged me more than my signed receipt allowed.  I will chalk it up to a mistake and give them due credit though!

This place has some fantastic margaritas and some great dips too!!
author: Riley R.

description: Great Mexican food, nice atmosphere. Chillies Rellenos were awesome! Flavor was on the spot.
author: Edmund S.

description:
This place is popular and was packed on a Thursday night. We were able to get reservations for 3 people earlier in the day though, which was great. I think a lot of the crowd was there for happy hour, which I'd like to try next time. Overall I enjoyed dinner here.

Things I liked:
-Really pretty decor inside, great ambiance
-Unique margaritas (I had the original that has chile salt on the rim)
-My meal - the Chile Verde

Could improve:
-The margaritas look big, but the glasses are filled 3/4 with ice
-Really hot inside for some reason
author: Paige D.

description:
A friend (who is a SF local) recommended that we have dinner here... and it was AMAZING. Everything was so delicious and fresh. Loved that the chips came with 3 dips, which were really yummy - especially the one made with peppers and sour cream. Oh, definitely order "Ceviche De Camarones"... simply delicious. 
My only complaint was that the margharitas had too much ice in them, but otherwise, really yummy.

We will definitely be returning.
author: Melissa B.

description:
The ambiance was very nice and pleasant. Coming here at nighttime, the restuarant was packed and full of energy. My friend made a reservation so we didn't have to wait long, which was good because otherwise it was so busy I'm sure we'd have had a wait.

The food is delicious and the service is great! Very pleased with it. Definitively would recommend! (Make a reservation ahead of time so you don't have I wait long!)
author: Malia P.

description:
3 stars for some mexican flair located in Yerba Buena, monthly DWD (dinner with dudes) outing 

chips are addicting 3 sauces green light heat, red type salsa mild in flavor, orange heavy and delicious!!!

chile releno stuffed with meat - ok, portion wise I would not order it again
grilled pork lion - juicy and heavy
carne asada - juicy and filling

For the atmosphere I would come back, very loud but friendly for the food I highly recommend the pork chop stay away from the chile relleno 

Food *** for the chile relleno, ***** for the pork chop and **** for the carne asada
Price $$
Service **** excellent servers always laughing and smiling
Ambiance **** dark inside pastel colors on walls, good for groups
author: Clarence A.

description: This place had really great Margaritas and a bubbly atmosphere. The bartender (don't remember his name) was really nice, asked us about our drinks and adjusted them based on our response. Can't get any better than that. The only problem was that HH gets really crowded and it was hard to get seats.
author: Patience H.

description:
The fish tacos are terrific. Sometimes they take forever to make them though. The carnitas and steak burritos are also good but warning they are guaranteed to put in you in a food coma! All orders come with chips and if you ask for extra and they usually give you a ton. the chips are extra crispy though so sometimes they cut my mouth!

Lunchtime gets super busy so it can be hard to get a table, especially if you have more than 3 or 4 people in your party. They recently added tables outside so that has definitely helped with the crowd.
author: Alice J.

description:
You know, I'm a little torn on this, because I guess this isn't a very 'authentic' Mexican food dining experience, but dammit, the food, drinks, service, and ambience were all top notch, so 5 stars it is.

We dropped in after a long day of walking around the NE corner of SF. It was still HH at the bar (great prices, need to make it back just for this) but we were able to put our name on the list for dinner, which starts service at 5:30. We ended up waiting about an hour and a half for our 3rd person; our reservation came and went, but the amazing hostess (who we had plenty of time to observe as she deftly handled the crowds coming at her from every channel) took care of us and we were seated as soon as #3 arrived.

The ambiance is warm and relaxed. Some tables are close, but not too imposing. It creates a comfortable coziness, I think. The chips and salsa was promptly delivered and drink orders were taken. The chips are light, thin, and warm and the 3 salsas range from mild to a wee bit spicy. I love them all, especially the roasted red molcajete-style in the middle.

Everyone enjoyed their drinks; my cena del oso was fruity and satisfying and quickly disappeared. Our food was also well received. Was it a mistake to bring my mom, visiting from Texas (where Mexican food is a dime a dozen), to a SF Mexican place (with SF prices)? Probably. But it was so good, I have no regrets.

For background, my boyfriend and I recently moved from Texas, where I spent 3 years as a designer for several Mexican restaurants/taquerias. I've eaten an unhealthy amount of Mexican food in that time, and while I can't claim any sort of cultural knowledge of the cooking, I know what I like...and all of this totally hit the spot.  My boyfriend and I are vegetarians; between us we had the cheese chili relleno, mushroom empanadas, elotes/nopales (so good!), and all 3 bean varieties (presumably not all vegetarian, but sometimes we can't resist...). Can't wait to go back when the craving hits again.

Also, really great service and attention to detail all around.
author: Megan S.

description:
Kind of like a mom-and-pop Chipotle. The beef burrito I got was great, but the shop's layout is extremely confusing. You can't tell whether you wait for a hostess, or just find a seat and wait for a server. 

At lunchtime, it turns out it's neither--you walk up to the line of cooks and tell them what you'd like. But only at lunch. Very disorienting.

The menu is a large blanket-looking object hanging from the wall and is hard to read. So you basically walk in, read the blanket, talk to the line cooks, make your way down to the cash register and pay, get a stanchion with your number, find a seat and they'll bring you your food. And if you want salsa, there's a salsa station over by the bar.
