Good food, good atmosphere, just hard to navigate. And I know it wasn't just me, because as I sat eating, I saw many other people also stumble into the same confusion I had.

Note: this isn't necessarily their fault, but you pay a ton of tax here. First you pay the already high 9.8% sales tax, then you're charged a 3% healthcare surcharge (SFHCSO) on top of it. I know they're not the only ones that charge this, but I'd been in SF for several days and this was the first place where I saw this on my receipt. Just be aware of it.
author: Ron S.

description: The hostess did not smile, say hello, nor greet us upon entering. We said hi and she just kind of stared and said happy hour? When we asked if there was food for happy hour she said there's a happy hour menu. We had to ask to see it, so we asked for the dinner menu as well. She never smiled. She just put the menus in our face like we were wasting her time. When we asked about sit down dinner she again just stared without any type of friendly reply. Why is she the host if she is 1) not welcoming 2) not service minded and 3) treat us like we were not professionals or somebody who she wanted in the restaurant. We were there to eat dinner and pay, not for a free meal or handout. RIP Tropisueno. You've lost my business for tonight and in the future because of this person at the door who is supposed to provide a welcoming friendly and pleasant experience. She killed that before we even entered. My friend will not be returning either.
author: Teddy T.

description:
Chips and salsa (three different types) are delightful
Margaritas (after one) leave you feeling a lil froggy
Tostadas leave your face and hands dirty ;)

Cozy little place, great food/drinks and ambiance. Staff isn't too shabby either.
author: Lydia L.

description:
So. Darn. Delicious. I take all my friends and family here who visit from out of town. Two super chicken tacos is my go to dish, but everything on their menu is seriously so good. Love their salsas at the salsa bar too. Mmmm mmm!

Just beware, on a sunny day the line for lunch during the week gets VERY long! I suggest to get there by 11:30am. Still worth the wait though.
author: Kandace H.

description: One of the best restaurants in SF. Incredible food and drinks. It is busy but without a reservation on a Thursday night, we got in in 30mins. The hostess and host were great and friendly. Our waiter was seriously the best we have had after living in SF. He was attentive and anything we asked, he did without hesitation. He earned his tip because we was so wonderful.  The food was great. We shared the chile verde and it is SOO much food for $13. Both my husband and I shared and we took some home! Really wonderful. Both margaritas we got were wonderful and had a good amount of alcohol. They do not cut you short on anything. They give you free chips and 3 kinda of salsa. I was craving Mexican food and we won't go anywhere else.
author: Erica J.

description:
One of the best happy hours I've seen.

I was in town for a conference and didn't have time to search for a good spot, so I "settled" for Tropisueno. I put "settled" in quotes because much to my surprise, the place turned out to be pretty awesome. The drinks are good and the happy specials are well worth the wait if you get there a little early. For a place where the chips and salsa are always free, they have an impressive selection of salsas. Once you're done drinking, they have decent option for vegans and my non-veg friends all enjoyed their meals.

In the end, what started out as a compromise turned into my daily happy hour spot.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Everything here is so delicious--the mole is my fave. Try your best to avoid peak meal hours because it is really tough to find a seat.
author: Kim M.

description: My daughter, cousin and I had an importune 24 hour trip to SF. We came across this palace after a long, stressful and emotional day of waiting for a Visa to India. After the disappointment of not getting the Visa we needed much needed cocktails. We sat at the bar and had a charming bartender/server by the name of Alejandro help us out. The vibe was great, the cocktails were to die and the food was very yummy.  My daughter Victoria and I can not wait to go back from Los Angeles again. We can't say there's a place in L.A. That has the same vibe, food and drinks like this. Not to mention the service too. Also, make sure you order dessert. It's to die for too.
author: O S.

description:
It's no secret that the best burritos are to be found in San Francisco (I don't mean to cause an uproar amongst people in LA, San Diego and well, Texans can just ignore that first sentence altogether lest me losing all my friends there). 

Let me amend that: *in my opinion* the best burritos are to be found in San Francisco. Typically I'd want to head to the Mission for these (ah, the best memories of my last trip to San Fran included, I kid you not, daily trips to this one place on Valencia. I was broke at the time and let's face it, one of those burritos can set you for the day as far as nutritional bang for the buck (beans & veggies, preferably spinach, extra guac, hold the cheese, hold the sour cream...Help! I'm starving just writing about this and I'm on my plane ride home where the authentic Mexican food, while remarkable, is not at all veggie friendly unless you want to go to Chipotle and I don't.) Plus all those carbs, well, they fill you up so one burrito a day is the thriftiest way to go.

I went to Tropisueno for lunch yesterday due to its proximity to Yelp HQ and oh my...it did *not* disappoint. I asked for my usual "extra EXTRA, no seriously EXTRA" hottest sauce they've got and hoped for the best. Sadly, what they gave me didn't even approach "extra" (I think they forgot, or didn't believe me, but I all but pleaded with the counter lady. I may look like a gringa, I'm a hot sauce addict). Unlike the lower brow joints in the Mission, they don't have the ubiquitous squeeze bottles of possibly the best salsa in the world, so that was a slight drawback (maybe I just didn't see them? Maybe I should have asked for a quart of hot salsa on the side? By the register, they had tiny packets of cholula or a similar hot sauce, so I grabbed a bunch of those, but in San Francisco, I want some of that salsa opium fix.)

However, *Hold the presses* because for once in my life, I did not even need to drown my burrito in hot sauce and why? Because the ingredients were *that* good. I also didn't even need--brace yourselves for this one--salt! I ordered a super veggie burrito and it came with just the right amounts of veggies, pico, beans, delectable rice (normally not a fan of a ton of rice in my burrito) and gauc. It may have had cheese, but if I didn't notice it, then it was just enough (the recent former vegan in me knows that cheese is not necessary in a kick ass delish burrito). Just a touch of sour cream and we were good to go. 

Although I had the best intentions to eat only half and save half for later (it *was* the size of my forearm), I practically inhaled that baby in minutes, while my more sensible coworkers daintily nibbled on less monstrously sized portions of food. Hello, I haven't had a burrito since I was at my fave Mexican place in Brooklyn (Taco Chulo...gotta give them props) and I just couldn't be stopped.

Don't get me started on those warm, salty chips they include in the bag. Again, normally I'm of the camp that chips always need a bit of something extra, whether that be salt and a squeeze of lime (learned that trick from my San Diego pal, Jen E), salsa and of course I'm all about the guac (by the way, anyone else agree that the avocado is the most perfect fruit? I view it as a giftfrom Mother Nature. Or, perhaps it is proof that there is in fact a god/dess). Their chips? Eaten straight out of the bag. Perhaps "scarfed down" is a better description of my style.

This place also has a fun ambiance going on, too. I'm a sucker for a festive Mexican environment and my favorite place on Valencia doesn't have that going on, so I'd look at that place as more of a meal on the go and Tropisueno as a place to sit down and drink some margaritas along with those amazing burritos and chips.

And now, I return to Kansas City where the majority of Mexican joints are not really looking out for the non carne-asada lovin' minority, so the memories of this burrito will have to last me for a while. Know something? I can deal with that. And so can my waistline.
author: Joi B.

description:
I used GoPago to skip the line, but there wasn't much of a line at noon on the Tuesday I went. There's not a clear indication of where you are supposed to go to pick up your GoPago order, but luckily I was with another co-worker who is familiar with the process, and she led me to the cashier area to wait for someone to ask us what the names on our orders were before bringing them out. Since it wasn't really busy that day, we decided to sit at one of the indoor tables even though our food was all wrapped up in foil swaddling clothes. Our burritos came with chips, and I appreciated the salsa bar selection: the three different salsas I tried were all good, and there were more that I hadn't even laid a hand on. A third co-worker who didn't use GoPago ordered her food to-go, but they treated it as an eat-in order, which was fine in our case, but it may be annoying otherwise. We had way more complimentary chips than we could possibly eat in one sitting, so we took our leftover chips and untouched salsa back to the office to share the wealth.

My chile relleno burrito was interesting, but although it sounded like a good idea at the time that I ordered it, the huge pepper inside was a little off-putting and not as easy to eat. I think I'll go with a more traditional burrito (e.g., carnitas) next time. I probably should have stopped halfway through my super burrito rather than waiting till eating 80% and realizing that I would have to take leftovers with me anyway.

The verdict: I'll be back since it's right next door to the office. GoPago makes it really quick, too.
author: Tiff T.

description: So glad we chose this restaurant during our vacation in San Fransisco. Service was fantastic. Everything we ate from the appetizers to our entrees were delicious! If you go at night try to get a reservation.
author: Stacy K.

description: Calling and asking how busy they are is like pulling teeth. They repeatedly avoid the question. Finally after rewording 4 different ways, they admit that the wait for three people is 45 to an hour.
author: Justin F.

description:
Tropisueno represents a certain point on the Margarita Graph where the price point and deliciousness meet in perfect harmony. I can't speak to the food (other than the free salsas you get with purchase of drink that are GREAT) but I've had a margarita or four here. 

Tropisuenos margaritas are super strong, not TOO sweet, and rimmed with a chili salt concoction that leaves just a little heat on your tongue.Then conveniently, you have to take another sip to squelch that. Rinse. Repeat. In short, I could drink 54 in one sitting. Sure, I'd die, but it might be worth it.
author: Kelly S.

description: Thanks to Tropisueno, I now have a love affair with burritos. And these burritos are large enough to be split between two hungry adults. My first love was the chicken asada, that was until I tried my husbands barbacoa, so good!!! The barbacoa is super tender and juicy. I go all out on my burritos - sour cream, guac, cheese, the whole nine yards. The burritos come with a side of warm and freshly made nachos, the salsa bar is loaded with options and they all taste really good. The horchata is hands down the best drink in the house, not overly sweet with just the right tones of spices. The restaurant is nice and cozy so get your meal to stay or enjoy the outdoor seating. This place gets crowded during lunch so get there early or be  patient while you wait in line- the ladies here are quick getting orders out.
author: Marlene C.

description:
Went here for a co-workers going away lunch and the food was pretty good. I got the Super Quesadilla with chicken (a super comes with sour cream and guacamole) for $7.45. It was good -- I liked that the chicken didn't have any chewy fatty pieces and the guac and sour cream blended nicely with the quesadilla to create a very powerful taste. 

My co-workers and I also got chips and guac to share and OH. MY. GOD. the guacamole is AMAZING!! It's so yummy -- it has a little bit of a kick with chopped onions, but it's oh so good. I can come back just for the guac!!!

The only thing that I disliked was that there were pigeons flying around and near us as we sat outside. I personally hate birds (especially if they are flying near my head and perching on the table)!! Needless to say, I will be sitting inside next time!
author: Janelle P.

description: Love that I can go here and get cheap food and drinks in a great atmosphere. Ive been here about five times and the waiters are always lovely even though you know they have a load of work to do. I definitley recommend it for after work drinks and dinner
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Food wasn't all that great. Decent but definitely not "authentic". The management is a JOKE! Who scolds their employees in front of tables that are still trying to enjoy the scraps they consider food. Hearing them scold 2 different employees next to 3 tables was very unsettling! Overhearing the conversation the 2 managers had with an older lady it seems like the food they serve the employees is unappealing as well. I feel sorry for all who have to work under such horrid conditions!! Management needs more training on being discreet with sensitive material. Also, could you please use kid friendly language as my daughter heard a few choice words knows as "bad". I will NEVER return to this restaurant!!
author: Ricky A.

description:
This place just gets better and better! I'm so glad I came back! I've come here for dinner 2x now and also lunch. I think it's a better value for dinner.

I'm so happy they have virgin drinks, I got the virgin strawberry daiquiri. The chips remain delicious and the sauces are yummy. This time for an entree I shared a tampiqueno and it was just right. Get the beef medium rare (the medium was a bit harder to chew).
author: Shang S.

description: I had the seafood soup, which was delicious. They gave a lot of chips and salsas. The food was very good!
author: Ben Z.

description:
I have only had drinks here and they are pretty good. The service however is appalling. They benefit from the fact that there are few Mexican restaurants close-by, especially being in the Financial District where everything closes after lunch. So they have some room to slack on customer service without it hurting them much. 

The first time I went, the hosts were not at all welcoming or accommodating, they looked at me and my friend like we were lost. The second time was alright because I sat outside and the outside seats get no service so you order inside....

The third and final time, I went with a friend, waiting for two other friends to arrive. The general seating area had not been "opened" up due to their wacky hours/availability, even though some people were sitting there. Anywho, we saved two (of the 9) bar seats for our friends who were on their way and there were no other seats left (during happy hour, shocker!). Other people wanted to sit in our reserved seats and since there were no other seats, they opted to leave. Some communication of some sort went down and the manager emerged, angrily telling us we cannot reserve seats. After my friend asked why he was being rude, he began to speak Spanish to the bar tender, telling him to stop serving us. Unbeknownst to him, my friend is a native Spanish speaker and caught the comment. They went back in forth in Spanish until finally, my friend told me that we were leaving. 

I have NEVER had such poor service at the hands of a manger. Absolutely terrible! What he should have done was offered us the general seating area but he dropped the ball and in the process lost 4 customers for 2 and damaged his and the restaurant's brand in front of many paying customers. 

I have been there before when people saved seats at a crowded time and had no problem. Overall, Tropisueno is disorganized and has poor customer service. I should have trusted myself from my first visit and never returned. Absolutely disgusted by the establishment.
author: Luwa J.

description: Love this restaurant! Dined in Sunday eve & everything was delicious!  We had a guest visiting from Sweden who had never had authentic Mexican food & is now hooked. Our waiter, Marco was an absolute delight.
author: Rosemary S.

description: Came here for dinner without a reservation, we waited approx. 30 min for a table for 5. Service was good and the food was delicious! I ordered the Tampiqueno, which came with delicious beef, rice, beans and guac. Highly recommend this place!
author: Diana F.

description: This was okay, food was good but nothing special, kinda generic. Staff was super nice and friendly.
author: Stephanie m.

description:
They have the best nacho in the world. I ordered it as an appetizer before my burrito, but nacho is hands-down the best dish in this restaurant. Not only it looks amazing with ample amounts of toppings, but the chips are crispy and delicious! 

There's some waiting time depending on what time you visit. I went around 12:15pm, and had to wait for 15minutes before I could order. 

The serving size was quite big for me.
author: Julia B.

description:
Make reservations!

This place gets super packed.  I ended up randomly nearby and decided to eat here; however, the wait is an hour long for a table of 2. On the way out, just like the few before me.

Based on my prior visit here, the food is awesome!  Service is good.  Place can get loud.
author: Ju D.

description: Came here on Memorial Day weekend... The happy hour was jam packed, but we still received prompt and polite service at the bar. They started serving dinner at 5:30 in the dining room; the menu was medium length but included elaborate dishes. I ordered the Chile Verde, which was absolutely incredible, there's no other way to put it. The only  drink I had was the house margarita, which was perfect - not too much mixer. The service was great, the food was above my expectations, and it was an overall excellent experience. 5 stars for the price-to-quality ratio.
author: Matt C.

description: Tropisueno is excellent for dinner - really amazing mexican food and margaritas.  Highly recommend.
author: Alison D.

description: Good food but service was HORRID. We were asked to be done by a certain time. Menu wasnt explained and then we were rushed out. WONT BE BACK . too bad
author: Shani B.

description: Unlimited salsa, food was awesome, some of the best tamales I've had.  Chicken Tacos excellent.
author: G S.

description: This eclectic Mexican food restaurant is absolutely delicious. Must try the beef barbacoa!
author: Angelica C.

description: I heart this place! Everything was delicious! From the margaritas, salsas, and every dish I had. Great ambiance and just a great time.
author: Tay T.

description: Went here on a weekday after a site visit of the Marriott Marquis. It's was very busy, but quick service. The food is good, but there salsas are delish, especially the orange sauce, I think I like it more than La Vics. I ordered the chile relleno and ate more chips w/ that orange sauce. I think the salsa buffet is in a tight place, that line took longer than ordering my food. I really need to go back for that sauce.
author: Lorelyn P.

description:
If I ever come back here, which is doubtful, I would only come for the drinks which were made strong & potent. You cannot beat the excellent people watching location of Yerba Buena Lane. The lane is a thoroughfare from Mission Street to Market street.

The food was bland and mediocre. The menu has very colorful and unfamiliar descriptions. The food was disappointing. The decor was nice and our server was attentive but not enough to make me return. The one bathroom stall for women is poor planning.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Tropisueño is one of the cheaper not-fast-food places to eat downtown. I recommend it because the portions are filling and the variety and price are both excellent. In addition, the interior is pleasant, and the wait staff is efficient.

A group of 4 of us came for dinner. I had a dish was called, approximately, 'tres cochinitas.' It was comprised of 3 different types of pork (one with pineapple, one with chile verde, and one in thick chunks with a drizzle of sour cream), each on a deep fried thick tortilla served with rice and beans. All 3 types of pork were distinct enough to keep me interested (but if they went a little more aggressive on the sauce, I'd be even more happy), and there was definitely enough on my plate to eat. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone with a hankering for some Mexican pork. My friends got the carnitas tacos + chicken flauta and they also found them really good. Our youngest dining companion was 10, and she found the tamales a little too spicy, but I think for grown ups, it'd probably be just right. We all enjoyed the extra dips and chips that came with the meal.
author: Robert A.

description:
After a week of long work me and four friends decided to go to Tropiseuno Friday evening. I wasn't surprised to see that it was packed, as other reviewers had mentioned. Knowingly we had made reservations ahead of time and we were promptly escorted to our table. Our waitress for the evening was incredibly nice, always smiling, and ready at a moments notice. I was very impressed by the customer service all night.

We started off with a round of the house special margaritas for the night, which were a Mango Jalapeno margarita. They were a pleasant surprise and incredibly tasty! Our second round of margaritas were the Watermelon margaritas, which were almost as good as the mango ones. Needless to say, it was hard to say no to another round of drinks, but we did it. Their margaritas are top-notch! Not to mention, they make sure your cup is NEVER empty and the moment you are close to finishing your drink, they are quick to ask if you want another one.

We started off with an appetizer of mussels which were absolutely delicious! I highly recommend them if you're a fan of seafood. I was disappointed to hear that they ran out of the Chicken Mole, so we decided to the Barbacadoa which was alright. The other girls' dishes tasted much better than mine, but still, I enjoyed the food overall.

Make sure to watch your bill though, because we quickly got up to $240 which we did not expect at all! We each ended up paying around $50, which was more than I wanted to. However, I will be back for another round of drinks and quality Mexican food with friends!
author: Vandy P.

description: Good food and friendly staff. Not the most romantic or stylish venue but lively crowd.
author: Johanna M.

description: The best margarita ever!  Our waiter is a local and so informative!  Thank you Alejandro!
author: Kathy L.

description: Great service, great food, fun vibe. This place is great. Bartender guys were fun while drank and waited for our table. My wife and I went here on Valentine's Day. They definitely made us feel special and comfortable. They did not try to scam u in buying one of their packages just to eat there like other places. I had the salmon and my wife had the spicy shrimp. Delicious!!! Mango and strawberry Margaritas were our favs. Thanks for taking care of us. See u guys again when back in SF.
author: Mike A.

description:
Made reservations for this spot on a weekend, which i recommend.  The spicy mango margaritas are great.  Food is ok, I wasn't blown away.  Cheese enchilada, the sauces were good and so were the salsas  that they gave with the chips.

Good atmosphere, easy to listen to friends conversations, not too crazy.
author: garbanzo b.

description: The food is delicious, drinks are excellent, the ambience is tasteful, service is grand. Went here for my birthday weekend and was extremely satisfied and happy.
author: Wesley S.

description: Best Mexican food. Mole is outstanding. Tortillas are home made. Chips and three kinds of salsa are great.  Chips are thin and after the three requisite bowls I am not stuffed. A gem and you need to come here but reservations are a good idea. Final tip. Try margarita with mango and jalapeño. You'll need at least two. Really.... Go here.
author: Carl B.

description:
You can count me a fan.  During lunch hours this place nicely fills the in-between space between table service and order-at-a-counter.  You order at the counter but then sit down at one of their nice tables and they bring the food to you, which makes Tropisueno perfect for lunch meetings (especially informal business meetings).  The items are a tad pricey but overall the quality is quite good and the food tasty.

Happy hour here is a good time as well - there's generally a pretty good showing of folks getting off work in the area, the margaritas are delicious, and the crowd isn't excessively douchey.
author: Peter H.

description:
Reasonably priced, tasty Mexican food. All the standards, plus more. The four of us ordered a variety of dishes and apps, and all were pleased, which is a solid hit rate. I ordered the cheese chile relleno; I was warned it would be super cheesy; it was; and it was good.  Although drinks were on the pricy side, the drink menu was fairly substantial and everyone found what they wanted. Our server was very friendly, and very good. 

Cons: this restaurant is loud -- definitely not noise level "average." It also feels a bit crowded. The salsas and guac were spicy (the salsas a bit too much so, they weren't really touched much).  Also, 7$ for guacamole? 

Cons aside, it was a good dining experience. Given the difficulties finding reasonably-priced, good food in that area of town, I'm kicking this up to 4 stars. Will go again.
author: Rob R.

description: One word - salsa bar. The tacos were good, but tasting all the salsa was better. Cool atmosphere and the happy hour seemed popular.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
The Salsas are absolutely amazing here, so tasty, so fresh. The unlimited (free) chips and salsa are awesome, yet also dangerous, as the chips are nicely warm and crunchy and the salsas are so tasty that you have a high possibility of overeating.

The staff is very friendly and the margaritas are delicious! It's a dangerous thing that I work in the neighborhood because I surely do come here too often (if such a concept exists). 

Tropisueno, you rock my working week!
author: Helen D.

description:
I have to admit that I've definitely taken a liking to this place since we started actually eating here (rather than having the vats carted into work). I still don't like the trays (vats, as I like to refer to them) but when I go in to sit down for a bit or just get food to go, it's way better.

Two of my favourites as of late are the shrimp taco and the fish taco. Super tasty and always a huge serving. The shrimp taco has quite a few shrimps in it -- the fish taco is lacking but the fish itself is so tasty that I tend to let it go.
author: Shauna S.

description: Delicious vegetarian food. I have been here three or four times. I highly recommend the veggie burrito instead of the tofu one. Classic can sometimes be more satisfying.
author: Krishan P.

description:
Cathing up with old friends while I was on my staycation.  Caught the BART from Oakland and was amazed at how this "alley" has changed.  I was a bit early so I made a reservation.  I would have that "host" station moved as they are not facing you when you walk in and have your back to you while they are on the computer.  Not very welcoming.  Of course, I made it straight to the bar.  

The place was pretty quiet for a Thursday night in the city.  The restaurant had a nice mix of traditional and modern.  The bartenders were friendly and attentive altough I did find it funny that neigther spoke a lick of spanish!  

A couple cocktails in and I realized my friends were going to be late.  My dumb ass lost my cell phone the night before.  Finally my peeps arrived and we were seated (although a half hour later).  

Not sure why but I failed to mention the bowl of chips I killed earlier. The not so nacho sauce was my favorite because I am obsessed with anything spicy and the salsa was pretty good as well.  We again were served another bowl at the table which was very difficult to resist.

We split a ceviche trio and guacamole.  Both were fresh and well proportioned as appetizers.  I ordered the Prawn Tropisueno which was saucy but a bit over salted.  There was a small curtido like mixture that was very tasty and the rice had a nice texture.

The service was great though waited a bit before they took our card for payment. Overall I enjoyed my experience which made up for the good (not spectalur) food.  I will come back and bring more friends!
author: Kim T.

description:
This was a pleasant find and no waiting on a Saturday night, we walked in around 9 and were seated almost immediately. 

I really liked the place, its not too big and its cozy, good for a quiet dinner or a dinner party. The staff is really nice and friendly, for dinner I had the Chicken with mole Poblano. The chicken was really tender which was nice, however I wasn't too fond of the sauce. It was a bit on the sweeter side with the chocolate but you can balance it with some salsa. For dessert we had the tres leches cake which was entirely too sweet so unless you like your dessert extremely sweet I wouldn't recommend it.

I would definitely come back and check out more items on their menu plus its reasonable prices, a nice dinner for under $20 in the city I say its a winner.
author: Ashleen C.

description: Bomb food and margaritas! However, how they switch it up at night trying to make it some fancy snooty tooty restaurant doesn't sit right with me. Number one you cant even get a damn burrito and are forced to go down the whole tip rout as well as pay more for less. Really?! Despite the lame dinner switch up Tropisueno is by far my favorite Mexican spot in the bay but only for lunch!
author: Mr. O.

description: Very enjoyable place.   Tasty food,  large portions at an amazing price.  Nice atmosphere.   Friendly people and even though it was a bit crowded, it was easy to find a table.   I will definitely be back.
author: Rob S.

description:
Ever have one of those days where by the time you realize you're hungry, it's that awkward time where no meal seems appropriate? Well, I suppose that's why the British have their tea, but here in the good ol' US of A it means only one thing...happy hour!!!!

I stopped by late Friday afternoon with a friend from LA after being rejected from Yank Sing and the Sentinel for my odd hunger schedule. Lucky for us, we arrived just in time for the beginning of Tropisueño's happy hour, with $2 cans of Tecate and lots of cheap food. I chose a fish taco and the ceviche, both of which were marvelous! Sadly I filled way up on the deliciously thin, crispy, oily chips and salsa so I couldn't finish the ceviche, which was chock full of fresh fish and citrus yumminess. 

The service was impeccable as well, with quick waiter service instead of the counter-style service they have going at lunch for efficiency's sake. Our waiters and bussers were very sweet, and didn't rush us out when we lingered with our beers. 

I've had two great experiences at this place now, and I'm now officially convinced that this businessman's mecca actually holds its own with its delicious, authentic-tasting Mexican fare!
author: Christina P.

description:
I typically recommend this place; however, my most recent experience, in a word, sucked. 

I work nearby and know how busy this place gets during lunch.  I was lucky enough to swing by around 3:10 on a Wednesday, (no more than ten people were in the entire place) and order a shrimp super quesadilla and soda from the counter.  The place was practically empty so I chose to eat in, grabbed my number, scooped some salsa and took a seat in the dining room.  
I started to read my book and about ten minutes later a group of Alpha Kappa Alphas that had ordered after me were served their meals.  I wasn't sure why my relatively quick order was taking so long but wasn't too concerned.  A few more minutes pass by, with either me reading or trying to flag down a server (I hadn't received my tortilla chips).  I check the time and it was 3:33.  I look at my receipt and the woman taking my order had written down 3:11.  

A server taking a dish to someone else comes up to my table and asks me if I'm waiting for something.  I tell her what I'm waiting for and without a response she walks away.

I'm confused and not feeling any guarantee that she's checking on my food so I grab my jacket, number, receipt and walk up to the counter and say that I've been waiting for over 20 minutes for my quesadilla.  She checks the order wheel facing the kitchen window and I can tell she's saying to the cook that my order isn't there.  He asks me what I ordered and I say a shrimp super quesadilla.  He tells the cashier to comp my order but panic is in her face because she doesn't seem to know how to do a cash return.  She asks a colleague and after a few minutes she hands me nine dollar bills.  
So I got a portion of my meal comped.  But not my soda.  Which was clearly on the receipt, that I showed her.  Ridiculous.  I didn't want to press the issue, I just wanted my freshly prepared lunch since time was ticking.  

I do tell her that I'm running out of time so I need my order to go.  I go back to scoop some salsa, this time in take away containers.  I return to the counter just as the cook is putting a shrimp super quesadilla in a to go box.  I stare at my food for a full two minutes before the cashier is free from ringing a customer that is his sweet time deciding on his beverage selection before my order is placed in a plastic bag and in my hand.  

I don't understand where my original order went or why there was no apology about the wait or why I got back nine dollars for my $11 meal.
author: Eugene X.

description: I love Mexican food and tequila. This place has a great cantina atmosphere, tequila bar, extravagant margaritas, and great fresh Mexican food.  The ingredients are fresh. I recommend this to any tequila enthusiasts.
author: Bud F.

description: Only reason I give this place three stars is because of the salsa and chips. This could be a meal alone as it was for my gf. I got the combination enchiladas and taco, which did not have too much taste to them. Black beans and rice were ok as well. Overall an ok Mexican restaurant.
author: Nathan G.

description:
Love this place! 

Just like everyone said their chips and salsa are fantastic... and SPICY! Loved their dish with the enchilada and steak, thanks for the recommendation!! 

Service was stellar at the bar! The bartender even whipped up a special margarita when I told him how I preferred mine. 

TIP: Come early there was an hour wait, thankfully someone was leaving at the bar when we showed up!
author: Tori E.

description:
Turns out the margaritas aren't the only good thing at Tropisueno. Their tacos are also nothing to scoff at. I tried a couple of different traditional corn tacos with rice and beans and some seriously hot salsa that had my mouth singing in a happy way.

Service at lunchtime is more cafeteria style, but don't be afraid of the line out the door. It moves quickly and efficiently. After ordering they give you a number and bring your delectable little treats to you while you go to the salsa bar and help yourself to whatever kind of heat you can handle.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Happy hour from 4-6. They have the best drinks ever, margaritas are delish and strong. The food is pretty good and the most authentic in the down town union square area.
author: America R.

description:
I know that the concept of "Fancy" Mexican food always gets mixed reviews, but this place is really great.  I like Mexican food, but sometimes feel like it would be great to go to a place where I can get good food, but not have to sit in a complete hole in the wall with blaring Mariachi music and a standard burrito bar.  Tropisueno is the place I was looking for.

Don't get me wrong - I'll still enjoy my typical hole in the wall Mexican dive, but when I'm craving Mexican without the dive-y experience, this is my new go-to!  Also, the drinks were great!  

Only minor downside, is that it felt really crowded, but we were there on a Friday night and I think we may have experienced some of the spillover from the Happy Hour, after work crowd.
author: Michelle D.

description:
I hope this was just a fluke cause the food and prices are not half bad.

Our group of 9 began our process of getting a table at 6:15p tonight.  Long wait, they'll text me.  We wait across the street in the park while the 5 kids played.  After an hour and 15 min we walk back to check in and see how much longer.
"Oh we texted you 40 min ago.  Held the table for 20 min then let it go." I never got a text. "Yes you did.  You texted right back and said you were on your way."  Um, no.  I really didn't. "Oh whoops, technical glitch, text never went out.  We can seat you in an hour. Drinks and apps outside while you wait?"  So we go outside and wait.  Drinks for kids, drinks for adults.  Chips for all. 15 min later I'm asked to come look at a table to see if it's too small for all of us.  I go, looks good, we'll take it. "Ok, give us a few minutes to prep the table."  I go back outside.  And wait.  Manager comes out 20 min later.  "We close at 10p are you going to want the table?"  Um, yes.  I said that.  I was waiting for you to get us when it was ready.  (I'm thinking I'm stuck in a communication black hole and this is a joke.)
So we sit.  We order.  We were given one quesadilla we didn't order (but were charged for).  We were not given an ordered burrito.  But it came out later. My meat was cooked the opposite of what I asked for.  The beans were the other kind we didn't ask for.  Food was fine.  Just not what we ordered.
It was truly a comical experience.  Best part is we were with out of town friends, our kids met and got along great.  LOVED all the hours we spent together trying to share a meal with one another.
Great company, good food, comical service.
author: Susan J.

description:
Thanks Yelp reviewers for the recommendation! This place was great. It had ambiance, it was quiet (for a full house) and easy to hold an intimate conversation, the service was excellent and the food was delicious and very well priced.
The meal starts with warm, thin corn tortilla chips with 3 types of salsa-yum! I had a drink special which was a watermelon Margarita ($11). The drink was strong with the flavor of fresh watermelon. 
I followed with the Chicken Mole, which came with Rice and White Beans. The entire meal was warm, fresh and perfectly cooked. The chicken almost fell off the bone and the Mole had just the right amount of heat and sweet. The rice was tasty and seasoned correctly and the white beans I mixed into the rice and again were delicious. I only ate about 1/2 my meal and was full. It's a good amount of food. This is the best Mexican I've had in several years.
Do make reservations, which can be done online through yelp. We were there on a Sunday evening and went in 45 minutes early and they could not seat us early as they said they were 1 1/2 hours out if you just walked in to wait for a table. I can see why!
author: Sonya S.

description:
Awesome place, tried to walk in twice on other occasions but the wait was over an hour. Decided to make a reservation this time through the yelp app (via open table). Easily got a table for two on a saturday night.

Waiters were quick and very nice. They bring you chips and 3 types of salsa: green, red and a yellow one that is served warm and reminds me almost of hot nacho cheese from the theater but with a strange tangy taste that I did not care for.

Everything was priced fairly cheap and they give very generous portions. My date and I ordered a small dish and a large entree and it was more than enough. A good tip is to not fill up on all the cups before your food arrives.

The only reason this is getting 4 stars is the waiters. Although super nice and quick about most things, they actually took a VERY long time to get us our bill and then return my card. Ill I'm trying to do is give them money! I dont get it. But besides that, this place is a must!
author: Kevin K.

description: It's the salsa. The pistachio green one. Its why I will be going back today. Tacos are wonderful. Get there early. Enough said.
author: Nan L.

description:
I've been here for both lunch and dinner. 

For lunch: expect the place to be relatively empty, slightly off the path of most tourists or shoppers in the area. 

Standard burrito, quesa fare; expect to spend under 10 for each - quality is great; everything is handmade. Lunch is served cafeteria style; order, take a number and seat, and food will be served. All the ingredients are great and the rice is excellent; think restaurant quality Chiptole with more options. 

The bar is also open during lunch; lime juice, lemon, and orange are pressed in front of you - the tequila comes in all flavors. I recommend stepping up from the house stock, and paying the extra 1-2 dollars for reposado or higher grade - start with Partida. The vanilla / rock salt is an added bonus and tastes great.

For dinner, expect a packed house - tourists / hotel crowd, with some locals. Portions are decent and reasonably priced for the area. 

I would go back if needed, as it is convenient, but nothing overall exciting about this place.
author: A T.

description: My favorite mexican restaurant in SF!  Recommend you to go there for lunch, not dinner.
author: Niki N.

description:
tl;dr: Go here for margaritas and salsa, go somewhere else for a lunchtime burrito.

This place is not bad, not good, just ok. I'd definitely recommend going here for margaritas after work. A good margarita is hard to find in SOMA. If they were only margaritas, I'd probably give this place a 4. I kinda want a margarita right now. They also have really good thin chips and tasty salsas which go really well with the margaritas.

I am continually disappointed however every time I go here for lunch. Their burritos are consistently not as tasty as I hope.
author: John B.

description: Chips and salsa are fantastic! Spicy, fresh, and clean flavors! Delicious! And the Carne Asada is so flavorful - same for the carnitas! All-around great meal! Would absolutely be a repeat offender here if I didn't live in SC!
author: Meredith B.

description: Yes! We got there right after 5pm just before the rush on a Tuesday! Awesome service, margaritas and happy hour food. So glad we came to this place. It's good to be back in California!
author: Kaylie S.

description: Solid 4 stars. Yummy salsa, nice maitre d', delish ceviche, great chili verde (big enough for two), good side salad.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Loved Tropisueno so much I ate there twice. First time was with a friend - after a long day at work we wanted decent drinks and food. The margaritas with the chilli salt are fab and have a real kick. 

Lovely atmosphere, buzzy vibe with Latin music on the nights I was in. Had I not been stuffed full of food, I might have dusted off my dancing shoes and grabbed one of the waiters for a salsa...

Menu was great and being GF, I had plenty of options. I had the king prawns in a lime and tequila creamy sauce which was fantastic. Beautiful flavours, with rice, red cabbage and black beans on the side. Big portions and they didn't stint on the seafood which was cooked perfectly and lovely and fresh :-)

Getting free tortilla chips and three types of salsa is great - I got this both times I ate here and water being brought to the table and topped up without being asked is great and a nice attention to detail. Staff were lovely and friendly and second time I ate here (alone), I experienced the same great service and didn't feel at all self conscious.

If I was back in SF, I would be back here in a heart beat. Mmmmmm....
author: Claire L.

description:
Tropisueno has won my heart---with their initial serving of chips and salsa!  When you sit down, their servers come to you and offer chips with their trio red, orange, and green salsas.  It is soo good that I have random cravings for it.  Their house and mango/jalepeno margaritas aren't too shabby either ;)

Their decor is simple and inviting; it gives the restaurant a warm feeling.  Their waiters are also very funny and easy to talk to, and although the service may be slow due to the huge crowds, coming here anytime is well worth it.  I would recommend making reservations because the tables fill up quick!  Also, everything that I have tasted on the menu is delicious.  I especially love the shrimp plate ($16).
author: Mary N.

description: Came here with 5 of my girlfriends for dinner. Service was ok. None of us really enjoyed what we ate or drank. Certainly not planning to return any time soon.
author: Erin P.

description: First time in San Francisco for my birthday and I wanted to eat Mexican food for dinner, when I say this spot is amazing believe me!!!! Tamarindo cocktails are amazing and the food is so tasteful! I really recommend it to anybody that's hungry for Mexican food to eat here! Had the best server ever!
author: Raymond P.

description: Just called for information to have dinner for our family of 17.  Informed that for a party of 17 or MORE ( she was rude) the starting is $12000.00 dollars.
author: Monica R.

description: Food is mediocre and customer service and the way they run late lunch service is horrible. I should have ate somewhere else.
author: Amy W.

description:
Great fresh mex! The guacamole is a must. They also have fantastic tamales.
Also, try a Cadillac Margarita if you dare. The bartender is heavy handed just the way I like it. The prices are very reasonable for the Union Square area.
author: Dan S.

description:
Great little mexican hot spot.

Happy hour, which goes from 4- 6, is extremely popular.  Happy hour specials which include $3 draft mexican beers and $5 Margaritas, as well as $ 2 tacos, is only offered in the bar area.  When I arrived at 5:30, the bar was packed.  I always wonder how people get off work so early to take advantage of happy hour specials.  I was able to order drinks at the bar and bring them to their tables outside.  They do not allow food outside though.

I had a reservation for 5:45, which I bumped back to about 6:05 while I waited for the rest of our party.  Even though the restaurant was packed, they were very accommodating.  This place is big with the after work crowd so I recommend reservations.  There were few open tables when our party of 4 was seated.

Atmosphere:  Small, crowded, and very loud.  The noise level is fun if you are looking for some place where you want to feel like you are at the "place to be" but it definitely made conversation difficult.  If you want to talk I would not recommend this place for groups more than 4.

Food:  Very good and very affordable.  They bring delicious chips and salsa (3 different varieties) to your table.  I had a $15 carne asada dish that was very good.  Others in my group got the Los favoritos which allows you to pick 3 tacos, enchiladas, and a few other options for $14.

Overall:  Food was really good (not mind blowing) and atmosphere was fun.  I love free chips and salsa!  Prices were great.  I will definitely be back.
author: John T.

description:
Went here at about 5PM on a Sunday and the FOH said they weren't seating guests at this time and we weren't really given any guidance on what to do next (ie whether there was a wait list or if it'd be first come first serve). They said we could go to the bar if we wanted. So 3 out of the 4 of us got margaritas and sat outside. It was unanimous that these were the worst margaritas we had ever had. By far. 
Call me crazy and delusional but the margaritas are far superior at Don Ramon's and that place isn't even tryna pull no fancy pants atmosphere. We left with a nasty sickening sweet lime flavor on our palates and went to go get food and drinks elsewhere. Don't think I'd go back despite the fact that it seems like the food may be good.
author: Amber R.

description:
This place is ridiculous to find. Not because I haven't been to Press Club and all of the other places in Yerba Buena Ln, but hello, why is your sign "Mexican Kitchen" with a huge T and that's it??? Took two of us, one a little drunk but that's beside the point, to find you Tropisueno!!!

Upon entry on a Wednesday at 615pm, we were surprised at the amount of people surrounding the bar. We approached the host, or who appeared to be the host, and told them we were just a party of 2. Immediately, he told us the wait would be 45 minutes. We were welcome to have a drink at the bar while we wait. Sure, but did you even put my name down? No. So I had to go back and ask him to put us on the list. I was quite annoyed at the front of the house already, which doesn't happen that often, and it definitely didn't help that there were a bunch of empty tables inside the restaurant.

Fine. Wasn't looking too good for Tropisueno at all and I was worried I'd be disappointed with the rest of dinner. We were super excited as some guy was leaving the bar and told us to quickly go to his open seat. Just as we were about to sit down and enjoy a margarita, another hostess comes up to us and says our table is ready. Wait, what??? You just told us 45 minutes which I really think he meant to say 2 minutes??? UGHHHHHH.

Whatever, we went to take our seats and immediately ordered our drinks. We also asked for the guacamole as well as we browsed the menu. We both opted for the 3 combination entree (choice of enchiladas, tacos, flautas and tamal). The food was great --- really enjoyed the guacamole, carne asada and chile verde. Oh and hello, orange sauce for chips was amazing!!

Service, 2-3 stars. Food, 5.
author: Angela S.

description: Very unorganized and below average Mexican food. It looks like a sit down style restaurant, but it is set up more like a fast good joint during the lunch hours. I had the burrito with steak and it was mostly rice. I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend.
author: J W.

description:
This little hidden gem was awesome. Cool atmosphere along with a great look made an immediate impression on us. Top that with even better service and amazingly good food and you have a winner in my book. 

I can't wait to go back!
author: Victor C.

description:
I've only been here for happy hour a few times thanks to my friend taking me here. But each time, I come out full and buzzed!

The margarita here is really good and its reasonably priced. Free chips and salsa which all the dips are pretty good. Tried the ceviche here... not the same ceviche I usually order but it's still pretty good... I just wish there was a little bit more acid inside of it. Tried the cheese quesadilla, I mean it's just cheese... but it was pretty damn good. It may have been because I was hungry. Fish tacos are pretty good too. The flauta is one of my favorites. 

Service is pretty tentative here, they come by and ask if you want a another drink when they see your glass nearing empty. Can get pretty busy though during happy hour, so come early! Definitely worth coming!
author: Johnson S.

description: Great food, robust ambience, friendly staff, strong margueritas. One of the best Mexican places in town, made better by fantastic prices. Worth a stop and then a repeat visit.
author: Chris B.

description: Came for lunch on a Saturday around 12:30.  Ordered our food right away, it arrived shortly after.  Had the chips with guacamole, one carnitas super taco and one chili verde supertaco.  The guacamole was good but the flavour was a little mild.  Both supertacos were very good.  Service was great.  Lots of different sauces of varying levels of spice.
author: David F.

description:
I'm going to settle on 4 stars for this place b/c of a few things that are annoying, otherwise it would be a solid 5 stars.

First the negatives:  The wait at lunch time is really long unless you get there before 12.  Tropisueno if you are listening, ASSEMBLY LINE! If you served your food assembly line style like many other places do you would cut down on the line, serve many more customers and prevent people from leaving or not coming at all b/c of the long wait time.  For orders that need special attention, someone could step out of the assembly line to make those orders without effecting the speed  or the assembly line.  Seriously take this into consideration for your own good as well as the customer's.

The prices are a bit steep as well, but the food and ambiance is EXCELLENT.

For the positives:

The Chips are awesome and I love that you can get a bowl of them.

The eating space is very well done.  It has a semi upscale feel, but it is not a sit down restaurant.  Excellent idea and execution.  However for dinner the place transforms into a sit down restaurant, also well executed!

The salsa bar is great, there are at least 6 salsas to choose from and I like all of them.  There are also other condiments such as onions, cilantro, limes, etc.

The agua fresca are very tasty, they rotate the flavors, but they are all good (Melon, Watermelon, Pineapple, Jamaica, Horchata, etc.)

The portions are huge and food is high quality.

Someone brings you your food to your table.  This is a nice touch and allows you to eat chips and fill up on salsa while you wait.

They also have a good drink menu and bar, but I do not partake on my frequent lunch visits, I have to go back to work afterwards.

Did I mention that the chips are hella good?  I wreck shop on the chips.

I always get the super burrito, but friends of mine have gotten tacos, the wet burrito, and quesadillas and high marks from all of them on all of those.
author: Ty C.

description: Three years after my first visit, Tropisueño remains as consistent and amazing as always.  If anything, I think the food has gotten better, and their salsa simply can't be beat.  With so much tasty food in The City, and sooo many new restaurants to try all the time, it's a testament to this place's deliciousness that it remains one of my favorite dining experiences. And did I mention that the portions are huge? And the service is awesome? (Ian took great care of us last night).  Love this place.
author: Aaron K.

description:
Would have made it to the restaurant twice if not for the weird online reservation system. 

The first time I went with out of town visitors I booked them through Open Table for a party of 4 on Friday night and everything went well and dandy. The second time I had out of town visitors again, I was redirected to a weird seatme booking site and only Fri and Sat nights are open for reservations. Unfazed, I tried calling.  No real person answers the phone, instead you get a recording telling you to check out their menus online if you're catering etc. Then they tell you to go to seatme.com to make your reservations. Thinking that maybe they are probably not going to packed on a Sunday night, I left it to chance that we might get lucky that night for a party of 6. Sunday came and my visitors and I were there at 630pm and were told that a table for 6 will not be available till 9pm. The hostess took out her iPad, made an act of taking down my name and phone number and said that she will contact us when the table becomes available. It was an act because the phone call/text never came.

Of course with our visitors hungry, it wouldn't be nice to make them wait too long for a meal. We moved on to another restaurant and had a nice night.

Nevertheless, I thought the food was good and atmosphere convivial. It's a place I would bring visitors to introduce them to Mexican food. Personally, I'd say there are better and cheaper Mexican food in the city.

Fix the online reservation system, and I'll be back with my visitors.
author: Wendy P.

description: Came here with my family and it was a fun atmosphere. House Margarita was great! Food was a little too spicy for my taste....I prefer mild...but through the spice you can still taste deliciousness
author: Jen R.

description:
The food is good however,
- There are not a lot of vegetarian options and the options they have aren't marked well
- The margaritas are $11
- The lighting is a slightly too dark
author: jack d.

description:
Ole!
- Chips and salsa are da bomb! They bring you 4 kinds of salsa - all distinct flavors, all delicious!
- Great amount of heat in the salsas and food in general.
- The Camarones Tropisueno were delicious - creamy yet bright sauce, and perfectly tender shrimp.
- Portions are generous, especially for the relatively low price point for dinner.

Tenemos una problema.
- It's friggin dark in here! You think that sitting against a wall of windows would help, but it doesn't. This gets me a little suspicious - trying to hide something, are we?
- The beef carne asada in my Tampiqueno had a mealy texture.
- The pork was cold in the Yucatan Poc Chuc. Delicious slaw though!
author: Vicente G.

description: One $5 happy hour margarita and I was definitely in a happy place..We caught the tail end of happy hour, where the bar had already started to empty out, but I could definitely see this place turning into a cluster at the height of HH. Needless to say we were pleased. The chips and salsa, as well as the $3 HH guacamole were equally as tasty. We were so impressed by the guac, that we decided to try the Salbute. All I can say is yum! The masa was perfect and chicken tinga was very tasty. I'm intrigued and want to return for more...
author: Ritu K.

description: Probably the best Mexican food I've ever had. I definitely recommend this place if you are in the city and looking for dinner. It's reasonably priced and super delicious. It does come in super large portions - so come hungry! Look into making reservations because it gets really busy in the evening.
author: Jasmine P.

description: Fun, lively and yummy restaurant!  The chips and salsas were good..great salsas! The chicken vegetable soup, and the carne asada fajitas were delicious too!
author: J. S.

description:
So Yummy! One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  Watermelon margaritas and Tropisueno Camerones are where its at!!

Love this place!
author: Gina N.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. Excellent atmosphere and surprisingly fast and effective service despite the large amount of people coming and going every minute. Food was excellent! Ii recommend anything with the sauteed veggies in it!
author: Charlie S.

description:
Yum! It took us forever to get here in traffic, but it ended up being worth it. Chips with three different salsas. I had veggie enchiladas with rice and white beans. Very good and I was stuffed afterwards. It was busy, but we were able to get a table right away. Nice, rustic decor and ambience. 

We had trouble finding it at first because we didn't know you cannot drive down Yerba Buena Lane; it's just a pedestrian area.
author: E. P.

description: The food is stellar and generous on portion. Probably the best Mexican rice I've ever had. So good. I will make this a regular stop next time I'm in the city
author: Christa H.

description:
This restaurant is one of those hidden gems. I cannot say enough good things about this place. Everything is very fresh and cooked to perfection. I usually come with my girlfriends or boyfriend during happy hour which is 4-6 PM. During this time, the food is EXTREMELY CHEAP. Before I even dive in, I have to talk about the chips and salsa. I swear that there is nothing like it. Not only are they free but they're unlimited. The chips are toasted warm and it comes with three dipping sauces: salsa, guacamole infused salsa verde & a very spicy cheese one. 

The quesadillas are considered more of an appetizer but the portion is unbelievable. They are absolutely phenomenal. I always order the carne asada quesadilla and I'm full before the third slice (there are four slices). Even my boyfriend who eats like a monster gets full from this. Mind you these are ONLY $5. A steal, especially in the financial district where most of your dining options are overly priced. The decor and service is incredible too. 

Before happy hour (during lunch), it looks like a tacqueria and there is even a salsa cart with a multitude of sauces to choose from. At dinner, they transform into an elegant restaurant with wholesome entrees. The plates are basically a full meal. Whatever you order comes with rice, beans, etc. I also LOVE the dessert. My aunt ordered all three: tres leches cake (which melted in my mouth), vanilla AND the chocolate panna cotta. I loved every single one but I have to say that the tres leches cake was my favorite. They only serve it during dinner time, however, and I'm never there around that time. Ever since, I've fallen in love with it and have been searching for a bakery that serves up a mean tres leches cake.

I find myself coming here very often and suggest it to all my friends whom love it as much as I do.
author: Joyce L.

description: Been to this place twice, both times extremely happy with the food and drinks. The second time my girlfriend and I were 30 minutes late, but they held our reservation for us. Great service!
author: Austin C.

description:
DELICIOUS.

a friend and i dined here about a week ago and filled up on chips and salsa before we even looked at the menu for dinner.  we each ordered an appetizer as our meal -- she got scallop tacos and i got real tasty number...

there was chicken on a fried tortilla and there were three of them.

no idea what it's called.

we got a few drinks, had delicious food, and great conversation!  the ambience is fun.  it did get loud which made it hard to have a deep conversation but it WAS dinner on a thursday night so i'll let it slide.
author: Lauren P.

description:
I think I ate two bowls of chips and salsa here. The warm chips were the perfect starter. This isn't your average, run-of-the-mill taqueria. This is taqueria with class. The mood lighting, convenient location and the space itself is a good place to gather friends for a birthday dinner which is exactly what we did to celebrate a friend's birthday.

I ordered Los Favoritos with a taco and an enchilada (same as the birthday girl). You can order more items with this choice if that's what you want. It comes with beans and rice. My BF ordered the mole chicken which looked pretty tasty as well. Everyone's dishes looked delicious. They also bring you fresh tortillas and three different kinds of beans. I was so full from my dinner and chips and salsa though I passed on the tortillas and had a sampling of the beans. The prices are probably on par with Chevy's but the food is much better. Service was stellar, even though people at our table were giving him a hard time, he humoured us as best he could.
author: Amy J.

description: Delicious!  Fantastic, fresh drinks. Great waitstaff and bartenders. Unique combinations - try something new and you will discover a new favorite like we did.
author: Jason D.

description:
1. Make reservations if you can, this place is hoppin! Even on a Sunday night!
2. Get the mole sauce with chicken if you get the option, it's the best mole I have ever ever had!! Not too sweet or chalky. Beef tacos are also a good bet.
3. If you can get refills on the chips and salsa...it's worth it. The best trio of salsa I've had in awhile. The red and the orange (hot queso like dip) are very strong and spicy and the tomatillo guac salsa is more mild. They are all fantastico!
4. The margaritas looked amazing. If I ever come back here to visit, I will definitely make a point to get one or five.
5. Service was attentive and the ambiance is authentic, trendy, and casual all at the same time.
author: Susan F.

description: The food here is fine.  And the ambiance is a bit fancy.  I must say that there is no real reason to come here other than convenience.  I love Mexican food, but SoMa isn't the neighborhood I would pick to subside my craving.  If you want good or great Mexican food, find a cheap place that sell coronas in the mission.  The food will be way better as will the price.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great food. Best margarita in California!  Great service a little bit spicy for my taste but yummy!
author: Monique C.

description:
For the chips alone, five stars. They lace these suckers with crack.

 Prompt service, and fresh tasty food, can't really get better for a burrito downtown.
author: Jessica S.

description: Nice cocktails and good starter but I thought the main was quite bland for both of our meals and the meat was flavoursome but quite chewy. Our waiter also wasn't particularly interested but the rest of the staff seemed nice.
author: Niall F.

description: Order the house margaritas and the beef tacos from the appetizer section. This equals a great deal and a unique flavor. Great service with this equals 5 stars for me
author: Jerrod S.

description:
Man, I love that Tropisueno is right next to my office. I would come here more often for the margarita happy hour if I didn't know from experience that having more than two of these missiles makes me throw up. (To be fair, I also sipped whiskey from a flask while at the Metreon watching the latest Twilight installment the night of that fun incident.)

They also make a mean Michelada. The food is good too, but I don't wanna talk about it.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
I avoided coming here bc it just wreaks tourist trap. And it is, with its bar-like atmosphere and schmancy outdoor seats. However, deep down, its a dive through and through with its long line to order, longer line to the bathroom, questionable service, self-serve salsa/condiments/utensils area, and surprisingly reasonable prices ($8-10/person even with drinks!)

The chips are super greasy and too thin, but the carnitas, beef, and fish tacos we had were all good. I mean, close to La Taqueria good, which is ALMOST SoCal Mexican good. Greasy, fist-full-of napkins good.
author: Snuffles B.

description: We absolutely loved this place! The service was awesome and the drinks/food were delicious. I recommend the spicy pear drink! We will definitely be back whenever we come back to San Fran!
author: Beth M.

description: Love this place. BEST COCKTAILS!! GREAT Salsa - go green!! Nothing but rave things to say here.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Steps away from the office, this is our short, quick, cheap getaway for lunch when we're too lazy to venture out for food. Portions are large and filling! And the salsa bar has a condiment for every heat- seeker. There are also some very mild salsas for those who don't like to break out in a sweat during their meal. 

My go-to standard is a green pork quesadilla. Huge chunks of green chile marinated pork in a tortilla stuffed with cheese - it's hard to go wrong there! Their burritos come standard with rice and your choice of beans and meat. If you're vegetarian, I highly recommend the chile relleno. You can also have a super for not much more (guar + sour cream).... or if you're feeling really good.... have it "wet" (aka smothered in mole sauce... YUM!)

On nice sunny days, the patio is a good place to sit and people watch, although this patio almost always is shady. Since its so close to the Metreon and Bart, there are a lot of interesting characters to fill your conversations.
author: Mar A.

description: The atmosphere was nice but a little on the dark side when eating in the evening .( not enough lighting) The food was good but for some reason it felt like the staff was rushing the customers out once they think your done they come by and try and take ur plate away without asking or once they do take your plate the come with a rag and clean your table off while your still sitting there! I wouldn't be going back.......p.s the bar tenders were rude to my husband for no reason.
author: Laura B.

description:
Two big misses: super leery waiter + insanely long wait times for our food. All of our appetizers, entrees and drinks arrived at the same time which was overwhelming. As an apology for the wait, they did comp us a chocolate torte with warm, chewy churros which were quite tasty. Still, nothing helped alleviate the antics of the creepy waiter. I'm talking winks, table lingering and uncomfortable questions about where we stayed/lived; I felt so bad for my poor coworker who was getting the brunt of this attention! 

Aside from that, we enjoyed most of the food. Some highlights:

- Awesome thin chips served with three kinds of salsa. One was spicy, the other was verde and the third tasted faintly like beans and was served warm. Due to their thinness, it's hard not to plow into the entire bowl

- Chile Verde: Giant chunks of tender pork in a lovely house sauce. All the main entrees are served with your choice of white, pinto or black beans, rice AND tortillas. If you're afraid of carbs, what are you doing at a Mexican place anyway?

I could have done without the Tacos de Cachete (braised beef cheeks). They're a bit too heavy to start off an already meat-laden meal and since it came at the same time as our main courses, it was doubly difficult to finish. The Camarones (Garlic butter shrimp) were too firm and super acidic from the lime but palatable. I did dig that they were spicy though. 

The leftovers were enough for a solid dinner the day after and the chile verde tasted even better then.
author: Faith Y.

description:
Synopsis: Highly recommended for a drinks/snack only date due to candlelit ambiance. I'd go for the Margaritas as the wine sucks and I've heard good things about the Margaritas here (reading reviews). I wouldn't come here hungry as the food is "meh". I'd order guacamole (coz the free salsa/guacamole is meh) and eat the free chips and have Margaritas. 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

How strange.. their online menu is less expensive than the actual menu at the restaurant! For example, I ordered the Chile Relleno de Picadillo and it was 11 at the restaurant and 10 on the online dinner menu http://www.tropisueno.com/tropisueno_menu_dinner.pdf

We heard about the free Valentines cake special and asked about it and the host was clueless and couldn't explain what was in it! He actually said "I don't know, some type of milk". To be fair, that cake was freaking AWESOME. Tasted light and fluffy kinda like Angel cake. 

When we exhausted our free Nachos and asked for more, they didn't come with extra salsa ( which I had to ask for twice before I finally got it)

There is definitely a language barrier as I asked them what type of rice they had and they said 3 (white, black, and refried).. umm ok I think they misunderstood my question.

Food: The chips are excellent. Their salsa is so plain! And, their guacamole (free with Nachos) tastes like bananas and is watered down :(

The main dishes were very bland, nothing special at all! Very greasy too. Their mexican rice was very typical and bland. The beans were extremely salty and again.. for lack of a better word.. bland.


-  2 stars for high price, "meh" food and drinks, "meh" service.

WINE HERE IS VERY BAD. I had an extremely sour Cab :*(
author: Kathy S.

description:
There is only so far good happy hour prices can take a place.  As I've mentioned repeatedly, I love Mexican food.  LOVE IT.  So when Amy R and I were trying to decide where to go to lay the groundwork for our night of boozing and ice skating, I remembered this place from the Elite event that I missed, and decided to come here.  Amy, being the lush that she is, had already started on her first margarita when I arrived...I knew I had to catch up quickly.

Since apparently the bar stools were not conducive to eating AND drinking, we made our way over to find a table in the bar area-ish.  Over to what, I still couldn't tell you.  There really isn't any discernible host area, although I could have been just anxious to get my tequila and didn't notice it.  Also, the "hostesses" had the personality of chimichangas.  

Anyway, although I can appreciate this due to people overstaying their welcome past happy hour and taking up a table without ordering anything expensive, we were told to go to a small table away from the roped off main area.  A table which was dirty.  Thanks, but I'd rather wait until you clean it before I go sit down at it.  Just a personal preference of mine.

As far as the food and the booze goes, it wasn't too shabby.  Nothing spectacular, although I did like the chips, but I wasn't bowled over.  Granted, this was just off the happy hour menu and we only got quesadillas and flautas, but still...

I don't know.  Our server was okay, but overall I wasn't impressed with the service.  I'm going to stick with my 3 stars until I can come back for an actual meal.
author: Pam S.

description:
Whenever I try a new Mexican restaurant, I always judge a place by their burrito. This place was good! 

Me and my friend came at lunch rush hour on a Friday, the line was out the door, yet we got through it fast, there were still a couple tables available both inside and outside, and we got our food in a timely manner!

The chips were thin and crispy, perfect for the many salsas they have to offer, the food was warm and very filling. I will most likely come here again if I am craving Mexican food and I am in the area. 

4 stars because the service was lacking, I understand it is rush hour but patience would be nice when people are ordering.
author: Lindsey V.

description:
Tropisueno was surprisingly crowded on a Tuesday night.  Service was a little spotty - my beer didn't arrive until after I was a couple bites into my entree.  But besides that the experience was positive.  Each table is set with chips and three different types of salsa - something tasty to keep you busy while waiting for your food.  I ordered three tacos al carte - carne asada, chicken, and carnitas.  Nothing particularly impressive, but they all (especially the carne asada) were satisfying and good for a quick dinner near Union Square.

Quick tip: I used Opentable reservations through yelp - simple reservation process up at the top of this page and it made getting seated on a busy Tuesday night easy!
author: Kimya P.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Tropisueno yet.

I've been working pretty consistently in the general SF downtown area since I've moved home upon graduating college in 2007. I remember when Tropisueno was just being unveiled to the eager FiDi masses with their assembly line-style lunch service, raging happy hour, and sit-down dinners - all accompanied with a solid, solid tequila bar. I've been a loyal fan since. I've immersed myself in many a delightful happy hour in their warm, dark bar area, reminiscent of a tropical tiki bar almost. I've dined in their more well-lit, rustic-woodsy-homey dining area during many a lunch break or post-shopping trip. And, every time, I've been charmed by the chupa chup lollipops that come with our checks. Every. Time. 

There's not much to be added to the 1k+ reviews affirming Tropisueno that hasn't been said already, but what bears echoing: their chips are heavenly. Crispy thin, hot, and free. Their happy hours are WELL worth the 5-10 minute scramble and seat/table stakeout - huge, cheesy-meaty quesadillas, tasty fish tacos, the aforementioned should-be award-winning chips, and other delicious Mexican fare for you to munch on after a long work day, accompanied by a cold refreshing cerveza or a strong, tasty margarita. All at discounted prices during HH. 

Solid.
author: Betty W.

description:
01.07.12

I haven't stepped foot into Tropisueno since their opening and the Yelp party a few years back.

I've forgotten how amazing their orange sauce is.

Or how fresh the guac is.

Or how potent their margaritas are.

Or how large their portions are.

You definitely won't leave here hungry.  Or sober, if that is your intention.

Total damage for six: $160
author: Jenny L.

description:
While I've been fortunate to enjoy a few too many vodkaritas at Tropisuenos, I just ate lunch here for the very first time.  Since it's in close proximity to the Yelp office, Tropisuenos is known as the Yelp Cafeteria. Fortunately, the food here tastes way better than any cafeteria I've visited in the past.

I placed my order for 2 veggie tacos at the counter and asked for some extra rice cause thought some carbs would help with the slight hangover. Minutes later they were ready! It took longer for me to find a table for 3 than for them to make my food, but not too bad of a wait.

SF Mexican food rarely disappoints and Tropisueno is no exception. The tacos were delish, the perfect amount of food and we were headed back to the office within a half hour. If only my school cafeterias were this good growing up!
author: Andrea R.

description:
Finally a good sit down Mexican restaurant in SF with some atmosphere!

Amazing ambiance, delicious food, creative margs, awesome happy hour...

I keep going back and it keeps winning my heart! The daytime service includes more of a taqueria walk-up window type menu, with tacos, burritos, super tacos, combo plates, etc, and is a great option for an early happy hour. It's fun, lively, the service is fantastic (the chips keep coming!)

The dinner menu has so much variety and isn't stuck with the standard "2-item combo" selection, but offers lots of seafood options, entrees and small plates... and it's all so tasty!

The flautas & tostaditas are not to be missed! Oh and the margaritas! Yum!!
author: Ileana S.

description:
Simple, satisfying...fresh...and yummy! Met here with a friend last week and was surprised how crowded it was for a Monday night. I recommend reservations. We started with cocktails and as with most Mexican restaurants it was heavy on the tequila drinks which don't work for me so I had one of the sparkling wine cocktails.  We didn't want to eat a full entree since they looked pretty big so we decided on three appetizers. 1. street tacos...seriously delish!. 2. Plantain..rich and satisfying. 3. ceviche - which I don't eat but it looked good. 
The service was very good and they serve chips and salsa right away - three types of salsa too. 
It's located close to Powell Street BART and near the Jewish Museum with a big courtyard in front so easy to locate and convenient. It's a hipster crowd so obviously a place for people to stop by after work.
author: Jan W.

description: True to its name, this place really is a dream. I love their margaritas and their salsas are all to die for! Happy hour is a bargain but be warned that it does get a bit crowded. They provide so many options for various dietary needs that I have been able to bring friends on all ends of the spectrum here for dinner. Great service time and time again!! Bravo!
author: Dinah C.

description:
This place is fantastic.
The food, the eclectic menu, the drinks, the service and the ambiance are all outstanding. Ive never been anything but thrilled about dining here. Its a diamond in the rough in the city. I cant wait to go back!
author: Peter D.

description:
