Not the best mexican food out there, but it was good

The have a good selection of special margaritas that are pretty good
author: Marc F.

description:
The Margaritas are little balls of poison. Don't be fooled by the pretty house salt lining the rim. There is a boatload of tequila in it.

With that being said, the food that goes with said poison is quite delicious. And no, it is not the poison talking. I wouldn't consider myself the biggest fan nor most credible authority on Mexican food, I did like the Chile Relleno, Enchilada, and the rice here. The rice in particular is very flavorful. 

The staff are very attentive but will start to rush you once it gets packed. It's a nice place with gentle dim lighting to catch up with an old friend before catching a movie close-by.
author: Jon L.

description:
Stopped in because of the great Yelp review. The vegetarian options were excellent. The Margarita's were good but more expensive than the lunch,and not really that good. 

I recommend this for a nice lunch spot. Very convenient to the conference center.
author: Joseph D.

description:
Upscale Mexican food for anyone who wants something a step up from your local taqueria. I'm a huge fan of Mexican food and love that you can get delicious, mouth watering food for less than $10 so I'm going to have to knock a start down just because Topisueno is on the pricey side.

Still, it was a nice experience and I really enjoyed the chile verde dish. The waiter was super friendly and attentive and came by multiple times to refill our water and answer my friend's (never ending) questions about their drink specials. He also brought us extra tortillas when he noticed we were out. 

I really enjoyed my dish and left feeling very stuffed which is always a good sign. The pork was super tender and flavorful. The free tortilla chips and salsas were great as well!
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
Alexandra C. nailed it with her review. This place is NOT THE SAME ANYMORE. There is NO salsa brought to you when you sit down and the wait staff has been down graded to less capable bussers since they don't have to have real waiters anymore.

They use to be a sit down and waiter serves you place, now its more like a cafeteria where you choose your food and pay first, then go sit down and food comes out within a couple minutes because its already been prepared. I had the steak fajitas and it looked like super over cooked dog food and I LOVE mexican. Lived in the mission for years and this was bar none the worse tasting meat I've ever had. My fiancee had a cheese enchilada that was reheated and rubbery to the point where she couldn't break the tortilla and just ate the cheese out of it. 

Chips, Salsa and drinks are good here, but its odd you have to pay separately for drinks and can't just buy a margarita with your food at the front counter. They haven't figured out how to hook their computer systems.

I'd go out of my way to avoid this place again unless it was a happy hour social event.
author: Michael M.

description: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, but this place is amazing! Loved their drinks and ceviche. Even their chips and salsa are spectacular! Definitely coming back.
author: Mara B.

description:
Tourist trap?

The margaritas are not good but I can see the appeal of this restaurant in this location, where there are not many options. It would not survive in the Mission or Hayes.

Gene, the manager was rude and borderline belligerent. Way to run your business like a professional.
author: Shal J.

description: We went here for dinner when some out of town guests were visiting. The food was pretty good. We have both had better Mexican food, but it was a fun atmosphere. Definitely glad we followed everyone's recommendations and made a reservation. The wait was an hour for those who didn't have them!
author: SweetBearPie H.

description: Lunch was inexpensive and food quality was excellent.  Lots of salsas to choose from made it particularly interesting
author: Stefano G.

description: Came here with co-workers for happy hour today..  Great place for drinks!  2 shots of patron and a diet coke = $21.50, plus salsa and chips, in my opinion that's not bad.  Make sure to get here before 5pm since tables and the bar get locked down quick.
author: Mike M.

description:
We were looking for a decent Mexican place near our hotel (Marriott Marquis) and found Tropisueño.  This restaruant shares a roof with the Marriott.  

We made reservations via OpenTable and our table was ready at the reserved time.  Our waiter was excellent and served us well throughout the evening.  As everybody has mentioned, the chips and salsa are really great.  Probably some of the best I've had -- just very thin chips and spicy salsa (and I have a high spice tolerance).  My wife and I both had a house margarita and it was excellent (and rather strong).

For dinner I had an old school combo plate (Los Faviritos) with 2 tacos, rice, and beans.  Everything was great.

If I was in the area, I'd return - no doubt.
author: Abhay S.

description:
I've loved Tropisueno for years and am selfishly sad it has received so many good reviews that it is now so popular! You definitely need a reservation before you go, but they can be made pretty last minute.  

I love the chile verde and now the newer sopa de pollo.  So flavorful and wonderful.  My bf always gets the camarones tropisueno.  Can't get himself to try anything different he enjoys it so much.  

Their house margs are great and LOVE the trio of salsa they bring out!
author: Annie C.

description: Marco was our server.  We arrived without reservations and they had a table ready for us with the caveat that they needed it in an hour for a reservation.  No problem!  Just so happens the ambience of the table was flipping amazing!  So the meal started off on the right foot!  It only got better from there.  The margaritas were delicious!  The guacamole was even better than my wife's and that is saying A LOT!  Our meals were memorable.  If you are reading this review trying to decide if you should eat here, the answer is YES!  Run!  Hurry up!  You won't regret it!
author: David S.

description: We went for dinner, but it was still their Happy Hour so we were limited on our menu choices. Would have liked the option of choosing from their entire menu. Food and drinks were good, service was good. Would return, but will make sure our timing is when they are serving food in their dining room.
author: Catherine S.

description: I am not really fond of Mexican food, but my husband loves it and he really liked this place. I liked it too since I had a good burrito and some chips to go with it. The ambiance is nice and spacious, and the place is buzzing with people. The only thing is, someone was kinda rushing us (by reminding us that they are switching to dinner service) hence the four stars. We might come back to try their dinner service next time.
author: Cindy S.

description: What a waste of time. Don't go here if you a large party or reasonably sized family.  Only one table in the place with enough room and the staff apparently doesn't know how to move tables together. We were turned away.  That level of intelligence and service might be expected at, I don't know, a 19th century British orphanage, but not at any place worth dining at.  Waste
author: Sean F.

description: We had the Pollo and the Carne.... both fabulous. I wish their chips were less oily, but who can complain about free chips and yummy salsa? Very affordable and gorgeous decor.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
Happy hour runs from 16h-18h, which is a bit early though they do serve $5 margaritas and some cheap(er) food. It was also pretty crowded by 17h30, so I suggest getting here early or making a reservation.

However, once you arrive and are seated, prepare yourself for an amazing dining experience. They start you off with chips and 3 different types of dipping sauces--my favorite was the green one, though the spicyness of the orange one sneaks up on you in a surprisingly pleasant and tasty way. The portions are pretty generous and the food is well prepared and delicious. A friend and I split the Chile Verde and the Camarones Tropisueño and we both walked away pleased and very, very full. Desserts look compelling, but I still haven't tried them yet. They also send you away with Chupa Chups lollipops.
author: Edie W.

description:
My friends and I wanted to enjoy a nice dinner before the 7pm Giants game at AT&T Park on Friday night. Since we arrived relatively early at 5:30p, we were one of the first to be seated in the dining room. The bar area, however, was totally packed. The waiter was attentive throughout the evening with water refill and chips. The kitchen was prompt in dishing out our entrees. We thoroughly enjoyed our feast with sufficient time to take a leisurely 15-minute walk to the Park before the first pitch.

I ordered the Tampiqueño (thin-cut grilled carne asada). My companions had Chicken with Mole Poblano, and Chile Verde. All three dishes were great and served in good portions. The beef was tender and flavorful. The chicken was moist. The pork was one of the best in the City. This place is WAY better than any Chevy's and the prices are very reasonable for a cloth-napkin establishment.

The restaurant is very lively, partly because there is no separation between the bar and dining area. Consequently, the loud noise does travel into the dining area; but it did not hinder our conversation at our table.

I titled this review as "hidden gem" because the location of the restaurant is in a pedestrian thoroughfare and not visible from the street. Unless you are attending a function at the Moscone across the street, you probably would not see or aware of this place.

Parking is relatively reasonable. Approx one block away is the Mission Street garage. The rate is $3/hour, the same as street meters.

I will definite return to try other menu items. Reservation is highly recommended. As we were leaving, we heard the hostess telling "walk-ins" that they only have tables for reservations.
author: Jean T.

description:
I heard about Tropisueno through Check Please Bay Area, but promptly forgot about it until some dinner plans came up in the city. Thank goodness I remembered it! I'll skip the boring part here where I complain about Mexican food in the Bay Area. I just got back from eating great Mexican food in San Diego a few days ago and it almost seemed like a bad idea to tempt fate by trying Mexican food in the Bay Area (based on past disappointments at a variety of restaurants), but the Yelp reviews for Tropisueno pretty much echoed what I'd heard on Check Please.

Tropisueno is on that little thoroughfare that goes between Mission and Market across from the Metreon. Beard Papa is at one end and I think Amber India is at the other. The restaurant is a moderate size, so I highly recommend making reservations or else you may have to wait a while or sit at the bar. The inside of the restaurant is warm and inviting and smells great. We were sat at a small table and immediately got chips and 3 types of salsa. I liked the orange salsa the best because it was tangy and had some heat, but the other two salsas were also good (an avocado salsa and a smoky red salsa).

We ordered some ceviche to split as an appetizer and all of us enjoyed it. It had a classic Baja peninusla flavor to it and was enough for 4 people to split. I ordered the chile verde which was really great! Sure it was a little fatty, but there was a really good portion of tender meat along with some very tasty rice, fresh tortillas, pickled onions, and three different types of beans (refried, black, and white). All of us really enjoyed all our entrees (another chile verde, chicken mole, and a sauteed fish dish).

Our waitress was super nice and attentive and the service was great! I accidentally got a cocktail which I thought was just going to be regular fresca juice (watermelon), but it had a ton of tequila in it. This surprised two of my friends as well including one who doesn't drink, but our waitress took the drink off the bill and got him a diet Coke right away. Anyway, blah, blah. This place is really good and a class act. I can't wait to come back and try some other dishes!
author: Jason W.

description:
Over the past couple months, I've been to Tropisueno four times.  Twice for dinner and twice for lunch.  The dinner entrees are huge and easily shareable.  I've gotten their combo plate and have also tried the Chile Verde.  The pork in the Chile Verde was a little too dry and tough for me but the flavors were good. Lunch is pretty standard here with taco, tortas, and mixed plate options.  Their drinks are also tasty but DON'T try their Michelada. Blech! The free chips and salsa bar are the best things there.  

The prices are pretty reasonable for the area and the food is pretty good, especially compared to the chain restaurants nearby.  Fast and easy lunch spot.
author: Helen V.

description:
** Decent "Mexican" food with nice ambiance, lacks authenticity **

Solid 3 stars for:
Food- the chips and salsa are BOMB. so that's good, b/c you know it will be delicious but that's pretty bad because its a full service restaurant and the stellar meal should not be the free appetizer. I ordered the enchiladas and tamale combo, which was edible and tasty but my bar for Mexican food is pretty high so this felt lackluster. The food is aimed for a broad palate of people, not necessarily those who enjoy authentic Mexican food. Each dish comes with rice and beans which were not memorable and do not even try that vinegary hot mess of cabbage on the side, its awful. 

Drinks- house margaritas with the spicy/salted rim: good times. 

Ambiance- nice decor and lighting with a separate, more casual bar area for drinks. 

Location- easy to find off of Market and you don't need a car to get here.
author: Rina M.

description: Great margaritas and I'm selective about my margies! Fresh, not too sweet, decent house tequila. Great light, warm chips and 3 differnt salsas. Was only there for Happy Hour but I've had dinner in the past which is also great. Can be crowded so go early before 5pm.
author: Megan M.

description:
I always give a restaurant three tries before I create any reviews.  If you grew up eating authentic Mexican dishes you won't enjoy the food here.  This place gets super crowded at lunch time, staff aren't rude, but not friendly either.  It's obvious they just want you to hurry the heck up and place your order.

Food is over overpowered with cayenne, pepper, drinks are poorly made, and it lacks flavor.
author: olga p.

description: Tropisueño is exceptional Mexican food in an area of SF that doesn't have as great of options as the Mission.  The taste and textures of their appetizers and strength of their margaritas are just what you need after a long, hard day's work, or a Tuesday.  I haven't explored their main entrees beyond the Chile Verde and Tampiqueño, but the latter, especially, is so warm and comforting on the palate.  I would use those two words about a lot of their food at least that I've tried.  The spices and flavors are not explosive or exciting, but more on the soothing side.  It's a restaurant that loves to use sauce on everything.  They gently lay and spread across your taste buds much with the viscosity of lava slowly stretching across land.  This is good for those who can't handle or just don't like to be shocked and upset by a super spicy punch.  Everything is embellished with spices, but none of it will have you running outside for the nearest fire hydrant.  All in all, it's a Spanish success!
author: Nick J.

description:
Well that was supremely satisfying. Dare I say, the best Mexican food downtown? I've walked by this place so many times, thinking that it was obviously a scam.

As a former SoCal dweller, I am skeptical of most Mexican food north of LA. That said, this place is the sh*t.

SO good.
author: Danny C.

description:
A delightful lunch option close to Union Square  when I was looking to satisfy a craving for a margarita (or 2...gotta keep the stereotypes of working at an agency alive and well) and tacos or burritos.

Not really worthy of a comparison to a Mission taqueria but a decent Mexican option in the hustle and bustle of Union Square/SOMA.
author: Amy Z.

description:
I came here for lunch during a recent conference at the Moscone center with friends and was excited to try the fish tacos.  Lunch is served taqueria style.  You order at the counter, pay, get your salsa and silverware, and they bring you your order.

The chips are fresh made and fantastic.  We had an order of guacamole for the table and it was fantastic.  Some of the salsas were a little smoky for my taste, but I could find ones I liked.  

The tacos were good, but not great.  They are Baja style, which means breaded and fried, served with shredded cabbage and crema.  To make up for the lack of originality and taste, they are huge and satisfying even the hungriest appetite.  Two is enough for a normal lunch.  

The low point of the meal, was when they forgot to bring one of our tacos.  It took a lot of haggling to get our taco and then they brought two.  Not sure why it was such a struggle to get the tacos we ordered, but they seem a little disorganized!
author: Nicole R.

description: Loved it!! Reservations might be a good idea but rest assured, well worth the wait.  I  am chef and foodie (love flavour)  and was thoroughly impressed ...So good!! Price was not crazy, ambiance was old-charm-fiesta, was relaxing and had a great vibe...the Talapia Ceviche was So Dang good***can't wait to go back...thank you for a wonderful dinner* Oh, forgot to mention the cool 'infusion margaritas' offered in addition to menu... Yummadummdumm
author: Suzanne A.

description: Happy hour ceviche and house Margaritas are the best. Can be pricey during normal hours though, given the portion ($10 for a hand bowl of ceviche plus some chips).
author: Eva D.

description: I ordered a steak quasdilla to go.  The wait was pass 10+ mins as I saw many people behind me got their food.  The food was mediocre.  Nothing special...I tasted better.  The ones on Mission taste alot more legit Mexican food.
author: Mimi L.

description: Really nice burritos and tacos. Delicious. Very fast service and helpful staff. Portions are pretty BIG!
author: Sunny G.

description:
I've passed by this place so many times wanting to give it a try. It was only recently when I had a chance to finally have dinner here. Even tho their menu is pretty small compared to other Mexican places, I was able to settle on their Chicken with Mole Poblano. The meat was very tender and the Mole sauce was delicious. I haven't had much Mole experience, but if they are all this good I should start eating more! It's definitely a dish that will get me coming back to order again. In addition, their house-made chips are so addicting! I had to force myself to stop eating them!

We called in advance and were seated quickly. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
If you think that "Chevy's" is authentic Mexican in SF you are going to LOVE Tropisueno! As for the rest of us, just make a beeline for the Mission.

Where do we start....

We were entertaining an out of town friend by visiting a museum and wanted something quick Union Square-ish. This seemed to work.

Once we got in the line to place our order we found out that they were not doing tortas. Really. That is like walking into an Italian restaurant and learning there is no spaghetti.

Then I saw two, count'em two microwaves in use right up front. Wow, what is this Subway? Eye-opener.

Once we finally all ordered and found a table we waited and waited and waited. And then one by one they served us our meals. Not all at once, but one at a time. So that was awkward. I had a chicken quesadilla and a baja fish taco. It was ok. Part of my quesadilla had almost no chicken on it. The taco looked pretty but was just average.

No one seemed enthused by our meal and we had 5 people. Our guest was the last served and by that time we were all done with our meals. Awkward.

Did I mention that she was waiting so long my sister had to ask the cashier about it. They forgot the order!

So not only did she have to wait forever for a very average meal they offered no refund, discount or even an apology.

Steer clear of this tourist magnet locals. Even Chipotle is a more authentic meal than this place.
author: Dave B.

description:
If a waiter offers you something, giving you the clear impression that it's complimentary (in this case complimentary birthday shot) just remember that it's not. Just the chips are. 

If I had known that it wasn't complimentary I wouldn't have had a shot of overpriced tequila. Really.

And then afterwards when we received the bill, I asked him about it, and he supposedly didn't understand what "complimentary" meant so I explained that to him. :/ And he replied "I said are you ready for you birthday tequila shot now? No it's not free." Honestly, I was ready to give him the benefit of the doubt but after that it just seemed really shady. I'm not sure if waiters are told to do this by management, but either way it's pretty annoying.

Besides that, the food was alright. You could get better Mexican food in other places in SF. :) It's honestly the ambiance that pulls people in, so +1 star for that.
author: Ani R.

description: So far this is my favorite Mexican restaurant in SF.  During lunch, they have an awesome burrito bar.  I tried the shrimp burrito last time I was there, which was great!  Huge portion and a reasonable price.  At the actual Tropisueno restaurant at night, I've tried everything from tacos, to quesadillas, to soups and have loved everything.  It's one of my favorite restaurants in the entire SF Bay Area.  Sometimes it's hard to get a table though, so you may want to come with a reservation.
author: Zach S.

description: Happened to stop there out of hunger while out exploring. It was quite busy and had to wait a little bit for a table for two. Once we got seated (super close quarters to the tables next to you) got some yummy chips and salsa.  It was really loud since everyone was so close together that hearing my friend across the table was difficult.  Food was pretty good...a little pricey but I think you are paying for the ambiance. The chili verde had really good flavor.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Worse service experience ever!
I had made a reservation via OpenTable (link on yelp) the night before and got there on time. The manager brushed me simply off with the words: if you make a reservation via opentable it doesn't necessarily mean that it shows up in our system. See I don't have a reservation in your name and neither a table available. I even showed him my email confirmation that I had received but he rudely suggested us to wait for 45 minutes. Poor service quality! We headed for another place and won't return for another try.
author: Katharina H.

description: Sorry but we were very surprised with the food chicken was not cook properly and they said they were going to bring me another piece .....they did bring me another one but not the same grilled chicken they decided to give me pollo con mole ....tres leches really dry and doesn't taste like tres leches at all :(
author: Teresa A.

description:
Trop gets 5 stars, I've literally eaten at this place like 300 times.  Just for lunch though.  I had dinner here once and it was all sit-down style complete with higher prices - what trickery!

Super Chicken Quesadilla is the bomb.  I think I got the fish taco once, and a burrito once.  Not as good as the quesadilla.  

Make sure you get like 3 containers of the orange salsa.  No matter what happens.  I'd buy that shit by the bottle if they sold it.  Why don't they sell bottles of it?  

They've got a good happy hour.  Trop it like it's hot.
author: Louie M.

description:
Love the Gringo Taco Salad !!!  Or, try the enchiladas, or a combinaciones, . . . or, of course, who can resist their tacos !!! 

This great Mexican restaurant is very near my office, so, like many of my fellow Yelpers, I'm here regularly for lunch.  They're tucked onto Yerba Buena Lane between the Marriott and Four Seasons hotels, just off both Market and Mission Streets.   

Tropisueño can get fairly busy during the lunch hour, but they keep the serving line moving at a really good pace.  Sometimes you may find that there are only a few remaining open tables to choose from . . . but, hey, obviously if they are filling their chairs then they must be doing something right !!!
author: Joel E.

description:
After having spent the day doing errands, and meeting up with a good friend from college, by fiance and I came by for dinner last night (3/11/14). I arrived first and because my phone had died on my walk over I looked around to see if he had beat me there, that was not the case so I decided to put our names on the list at about 8pm and was told it would be about 45-60 minute wait! The manager let my fiance know that we were open to take a seat in the bar at the communal table if we found seats and would be able to order and eat before getting seated in the actual dining room.  We got two seats, waited a few minutes and then the waiter brought us menus, waters, and chips with three types of salsa.  After looking over the menu and unsure of what to order I settled with a margarita and the three taco plate (shrimp, chicken, and carnitas) with rice and black bean, the fiance ordered the shrimp tropisueno dish and a beer. 

While the large communal table was tad cramped for the plates of food, drinks, and chips we made due and had a nice evening over some Mexican food.  I was surprised at how much meat was given in the tacos and enjoyed the flavors and seasonings given to each meat. We were very impressed with the flavorings of the fiance's shrimp dish and the sauce was great even by itself or on the chips or tortillas it had a nice hint of spice to it without overpowering your taste buds.  Seeing as the restaurant was still packed by the time we left I would highly recommend making reservations if you plan to dine here, I know we will be making them next time! If not sitting at the communal table is nice as well just less personal if that is the type of meal you are looking for.
author: Jacyn B.

description: This a is a good spot for happy hour. The margaritas are decent and the small plates are good too. I recommend for a good social happy hour.
author: Josh B.

description: Went on a Thursday and it was crowded, but we were able to snag a spot at the high top communal table. The food was great, everyone loved their dishes. Hands down, one of my favorite Mexican places and I can't wait for my next SF trip to go back.
author: C D.

description: I came here last night to celebrate my husband's birthday. It was a very good experience. I would highly recommend coming here to celebrate a birthday or just to enjoy a great dinner! The food was amazing and the waitress was attentive. We ordered the Chile Verde, chips and guacamole and margaritas - everything was perfect and the portions are very generous. Thank you for making my husband's birthday a great one :)
author: Eva K.

description:
I came here because it got good Yelp Reviews but unfortunately this was one of the WORST MEALS I have ever had.  We came during happy hour so they just had small bites but the menu looked alright.  We ordered Baja tacos which were made with tilapia.  They were slimy and tasted like catfish (and I LOVE fish tacos when made correctly).  We also ordered their version of shrimp cocktail, which was defrosted BABY shrimp with zero flavor in a sauce that tasted like ketchup.

The house margarita was totally gross as well.  The salsa's were oddly flavored and the server was busy so we got pretty lousy service.  We did order the quesadilla which was fine and the guacamole was actually good.  But seriously... don't torture yourself and go here. If you are in the area and desperate for Mexican, go to Chipotle or Chili's- at least you will have edible food.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Fantastic margaritas, great street tacos, enthusiastic staff, good happy hour deals. Enough said.
author: Brian B.

description: Recently ate here for the first time because of a recommendation from a friend. I prefer to stick with El Farolito in the Mission District but I enjoyed eating here. The food was absolutely delicious, everything was completely authentic with their own mark of flavor on each dish. The best part was the homemade chips and guacamole. Another great treat is the fresh made horchata (However this is not served at the dinner hours). The drink tastes like a yankee candle, cinnamon perhaps. The only problem was the way the lunch seating worked. You had to find your own table and claim it before anyone else could. I went here with a friend and almost ended up having to get take out, however a table opened up after five minutes.
author: Kiran K.

description:
Quick service with good food. Casual atmosphere. A nice spot to dine.

My only complaint is the guacamole is heavy on chunks of onions, which are not my favorite. Otherwise everything was great.

Would return and recommend to others.
author: Tracey P.

description:
Full dinner review here.  Finally decided to try this place after work.  Although the interior is a tad kitschy, it still evokes a sense of authenticity, all told. Rich, dark interior, with bamboo roof in areas, enclosing you in a cozy cocoon.  Good start.  We were seated by the window, and I love to people watch, so this was perfect.

Water and chips and salsa come out promptly.  Things are looking up...especially after I try the superb salsa.  So we wait...and wait...and wait.....no service.  I eventually have to get up and ask for service.  Strike one.

So we ordered the guacamole as an app.  This version was served chunky, and was quite good. Only problem? The thin chips could not stand up to the "heft" of the guacamole, and kept breaking off.   Boo!

Also ordered the seared sea scallops as a starter. Quite pleased with these for the most part.  Cooked fairly well, and presented with a wonderful accompanying avocado-tomatillo salsa.  Yum.

Their entire menu does reflect authentic Mexican coastal cuisine.  Execution is generally a positive.  So...on that note, on to the entrees.

We split the Chile Relleno de Picadillo, and were quite pleased.  Wonderful meshing of flavors.  

Interesting note. With entrees, the black beans are served as a side in a separate dish. Not so with the rice.  It would be nice if the rice were as well.  I didn't even eat much of mine.

Our server then offered what I thought was a wonderful suggestion: to try their award-winning mole.  Oooh, yes please, sounds like a plan!

Out comes a full "chicken with mole poblano" entree.  Uhh....we didn't discuss the chicken or an entree, we were talking about mole, remember?  "Oh, I'm sorry...well it's quite good."

Hrmph.  Thought about sending it back, but viewed this as an opportunity to try another dish instead.  Gotta say, the mole is a knock out.  So good!  But...the chicken served with this dish is bone-in, with the meat very inaccessible underneath the veneers of mole and skin.  I'm not one to eat the skin personally, and would have preferred a different cut of chicken (not leg or thigh) for this dish, preferably one with much more meat to actually eat! Alternately, skin the chicken for us, or serve the mole on the side.  As it stood, we were left with not-so-tidy mounds of bone and skin on our plates.  No es bueno!

On a positive note, the shared entrees were served split for 2 people, without us having to request it.

Having eaten plenty of exceptional Mexican food in both TX and NM, my standards for quality Mexican fare are pretty high, especially considering I know how incredibly bloated and stuffed I will feel afterwards!  All in all, pretty average with a couple notable exceptions (mole), but I doubt I'd return soon for a full meal, with all of the wonderful food to try in this city.  

Food: 3.5
Value: 3
Ambiance: 3.5
Service: 2.5
author: Ethan R.

description:
good happy hour spot but it gets ridiculously crowded for dinner for mediocre food. 

all decent mexican food: 
ceviche sample plate 
Huaraches
Chulet A De Puerco Adobada
Pollo Asado
mango margarita
author: Janet Y.

description:
I was bullied by an American into ordering enough food to feed four of me and what turns out to be a regular sized american. When the plate of food arrived I moaned 'What's wrong with you people?....

The weather was so wet, windy and completely out of place with the season we were supposed to be in that I felt so at home and had to do a double take when i saw the Golden Gate Bridge out the window rather than two drunk guys fighting in the street over who has the prettiest haggis (idiots, tis I who hast the fairest haggis in the land!). Anyway, instead of a trip to a sandwich joint that Mr Johnny of the T had picked out for lunch, we made the quick hop to this joint, where I was stuffed with so much Mexican grub that I' pretty sure I resembled a Piñata, albeit an extremely pale one, once the meal was over. 

Quality wise, well given that I'd spent the first couple of days in the mission, it was good but just felt a little to reserved and tame in comparison. Good grub, but lacking the sharpness in flavour (oh yeah, I'm going there with the U in flavour!).

It's good, it done the trick in filling a food shaped hole (several times over) and is pretty convenient. Mind blowing it is not. Belly busting? Well, depends if your lunch companion is a feeder or not.
author: Chris D.

description:
Lunch staff were really friendly, though didn't explain what to do. Stood around awhile. 

Two super tacos. One shredded chicken. One grilled. Guacamole was old. Needed some acid. Boring. Bland. 

Tamale vegetarian. Just cheese. Small. Boring. 

Chips. Thin. Greasy. 

Aguas frescas looked sad. 

Salsa bar was small but spicy. No labels. 

The location made me realize how unfamiliar I am with the neighborhood. Makes me feel like SF is a world class city. 

Prices were not as high as they could've been.
author: Dave B.

description:
This place was hopping on a rainy Friday night! Thankfully we made a reservation and were seated within 2 minutes. The waitstaff was incredibly friendly and service was quick. I can imagine that's hard to do in a place like this where it just gets packed. We had people coming to our table multiple times to ask us if we wanted more food, chips, drinks, or just ask us if everything was okay. All in all fantastic service.

I got the steak entree which came with a ton of sides (way too much for me to finish). It was really an enormous entree. Very good flavor but some of the steak was tough, so that's why I'm dinging them one star. If they had just gotten that part right I would have given them a solid 5 stars across the board.

This place attracts all types -- people flocking to the bar, families, retirees, you name it. You'll be comfortable here, no matter who you are.
author: Lori M.

description:
This might be the most boring review I've ever written. 

Overall this place was good. Not great but perfectly good. My only complaint is that their vegetarian options were a little thin, but then again it's Mexican food so what do you want. 

Appetizer: Crispy Flautas: really good (according to fiance)
Entree: veggie combo taco and enchilada plate
Pomegranate margarita: delish! Not too sweet

Atmosphere is warm and cozy. Probably a good first date place. The bar was packed and looked like fun.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Evidently, Tropisueno is much more of a lunch place.  My friend booked her birthday dinner here at 8pm on a Monday.  When we showed up we were told that the kitchen closes at 8:15 and that we would have to order right away...whatt???

Fear not, we immediately ordered margaritas and guacamole.  The guacamole was a ridiculous ripoff at $7.  It came in a tiny bowl about 2" high and 3" in diameter.  The main entrees seemed even more enormous by comparison.  Giant platters, and that's not counting the tortillas and beans on the side!  I was also a big fan of the three salsas - one warm one with cream, a tomatillo one, and a roasted tomato one.  Yum!
author: Cathy Y.

description: Nice atmosphere, great drinks.  Try the La Sombra!
author: Abby S.

description: I absolutely love mexican food (being from LA and all...) but have found very few places that combine ambiance and taste.  Tropisueno is a great place to meet up with a friend for drinks (bonus points for being in walking distance to Bart, and CalTrain if you're willing).  I came on a Friday night and the wait for 2 was supposed to be 45 minutes, but my gal pal & I were seated within 30.  We split a ceviche appetizer, soup, and the tampiqueno entree between the two of us and it was a lot of food even for 2 hungry girls.  The portions are very generous, especially the soup which ended up more like a stew/small pho bowl sized than a side order.  The grilled carne asada was very tender and flavorful and the ceviche refreshing...would definitely come back again!
author: Chinh T.

description:
I have never really delved into the finer parts of Mexican cuisine.  Truth be told, I never knew there was one outside of tacos, burritos, enchiladas, rice plates, etc.  For that sheer amount of ignorance, I apologize.  My mind was able to be opened when my chonie and fellow smaggit Bollywood was visiting from Hong Kong as a result the gfs coordinated a double date.  We arrived a little early, however, was whisked away promptly  to our booth, tucked away in the back.  Just as promptly, a bowl of fresh chips and three types of salsa were laid before us.  I had a light lunch so that I could chow the fuck out and immediately starting throwing down chips by the fistful.  These chips were fresh made, warm and delicious.  I knew I was in for a treat just judging from the chips and salsa.  There were three, the regular picca de gallo, some green kind, and some orange one (tastes similar to papalote sauce).  The green salsa was so fucken good...drinkable fucken good.  When our bowl was close to becoming empty, it was immediately replaced by a fresh basket and a new plate of salsas.  When everyone was situated, the menu was presented to us by a most wondrous waiter.  He went over the menu, and because I think that he had trouble memorizing it, rapped it out to us.  His right hand was bobbing up and down as he spit out item after menu.  I should have told Bollywood to lay down a beat.  I ordered the scallop appetizer, salmon tartar, and an entree of the salmon special.  The copine ordered the pollo asado.  

scallops: 5/5  The scallops were served in a plantain chorizo hash along with avocado tomatillo salsa.  Delicious!  The scallops were tender and full of flavour.  Pairing it with the salsa and meaty sauce was on point.  

salmon tartar: 5/5  The salmon tartar was also very good.  It was the day's special and was served along with a side of chips.  The salmon had a slight tangy taste from the minced mangoes.  It tastes even better when you find rolled up chips and shovel the tartar in the crevices.  

salmon special: 5/5  I usually like to order the day's special b/c you can eat the regular items anytime.  That day's special was salmon cooked in banana leaf with some type of tequila sauce served on a bed of caramelized onions.  It was joined by Mexican rice, avocado, and slaw.  When I first saw it, I cursed myself for eating so much chips.  It was a fucken heap of food.  The rice was a massive pile and I quickly asked for a side of sour cream to mix it in.  The waiter advised me that the salmon was smoky tasting and different and he was right.  The salmon was delicious and unlike any other salmon I have ever tasted.  I cannot really describe it.  The caramelized onions were a good counterpart.  The only complaint that I could possibly give was the sauce was a little too sweet.  It was like candy sauce.  The slaw was refreshing and good to clean the palette.  I love Mexican rice, however, too much and it gets dry.  The sour cream was a good antidote.  In addition, the waiter gave us some hot tortillas and a bunch of different beans.  Protein is vital for aesthetics so I dumped the re fried and black beans in.       

I tried KJeh's pollo asado and while it was good, it was nowhere on par with my dish.  The chicken was very tender and ripped easily, however, like a lot of chicken dishes, was a little bland.  Our friends ordered the al pastor tacos and chicken with mole poblano.  I was lucky and got all the money dishes.  The al pastor tacos tasted as any street taco would and the chicken with mole poblano was straight up disgusting.  The meat was braised in a sauce that contained chocolate.  It tasted like one of those Vietnamese bean desserts my mom used to make which after a spoonful, I have steadfastly refused to eat since.  It would be better if I hadn't sampled my counterparts' tidbits of food, as those little morsels single handily brought down the ranking from 5 star to 4.  If I had not had lady luck on my side, I could have ended up with one of those dishes.  However, my experience with Tropisueno was most excellent.  The waiters were very attentive and were quick to refill water or give us more chips and salsa.  I had one of the best dinners in a while.
author: Brian V.

description: The bar area is small and gets crowded on weekday evenings.  Nice strong margaritas but too much ice,  Really enjoyed the food as well.  Would have rated it higher if the bar area was a little more open and inviting
author: mihir m.

description:
Went here on a Friday and walked right in with two people. I ordered an enchilada and tomatillo for 12.95. Also, I got two house margaritas at $10. My date got a chicken mole dish for about $14. 

Enchilada & Tomatillo - 
They were good, but nothing special. A big portion of food. Not spicy.
Chicken mole -
This was not the chicken mole I've had from Texas or Los Angeles restaurants. It tasted slighty of chocolate without chili flavor. The taste was definitely off and seemed too sweet.
Margaritas - 
Not even sure there was alcohol in my drink. I had two of these and I'm a pretty small woman. I didn't feel or taste alcohol from them. It was mostly ice. Kind of ridiculous for $10.

TLDR; The service at this place was great, but I'd say the food and drinks where just okay and pretty expensive.
author: Shannon S.

description: The plantains were un-frigginbelievable. Def the best appetizer. The chick mole was superior. Sweet and tasty! The chile relleno was so-so. Their bottled tea was top notch. Nice place. They are so busy that they asked if I didn't mind offering my table at 9pm right before they sat me down. It was 7:30. I must say, it was a new and unique experience being politely asked to leave in 1 1/2 hour. They text you when your table is ready. Nice, so you can go for a walk prior to being seated.
author: Eliseo M.

description:
Would not seat our party of 8.  Very unprofessional.  Will NEVER see my business.  EVER.  PERIOD.
  Enjoyed another place down the street which was very accommodating.  Actually wanted customers!
author: Glenn F.

description: Came pretty late on a Wednesday night but it was still really crowded. I expected my friend and I would have to wait some time to get seated but to our surprise, we were seated right away! Immediately, the chips and salsa came out (they know us very well). The 3 salsas are really good, ranging from mild to spicy. The tortilla chips were good too, not too salty like some other places. The vegetarian enchiladas de nopales were so good! The creamy corn sauce was delicious (I really want the recipe). The pinto beans (which are vegetarian) were a bit too salty for my taste. Otherwise, the meal was really good. I would definitely order it again. Our waiter was super friendly and always checked on us to make sure everything was okay. All our orders came out relatively fast too, considering how busy it was. Overall, really good place that I would love to revisit again.
author: Krishna S.

description:
I have been to this place a total of four times, two times for lunch and two times for dinner.  Each experience was ok, the food was good, the servce was ok there and the set-up was good.  

This last experience was absolutely terrible.  I normally order a chicken dinner and grub on the nachos and salsa that they provide.  I went out on a limb and ordered the Ceviche Pescado, which was saturated in lemon juice and jalapenos.  I love acidity and spice in my food but for some reason, this was a tad overwhelming.  Since I ordered this appetizer as my meal (I had a big lunch), it was all I had to eat with my corona.  Unfortunately, I found out the hard way that the reason they used so much lemon juice and spice was due to the fact that they served me old/bad fish/shellfish in this dish.  I got home late after ingesting and crashed...woke up 6 hours later to an itchy and swelling feeling, only to discover that I had hives.  This is the worse allergic reaction I have ever had in my life.  I had never had hives before and this experience just kept progressing and sent me to the doctor twice.  Aside from hives, my head and neck were swelling and my glands swelled to almost the size of a golf ball.  

I had not had a bad experience other than this one time but I assure you that I will never return.  If anything, NEVER order their ceviches...I fortunately was able to recover but the hives are probably going to take a week or two to go away and that is with the hope that they do not return, as they sometimes can.  I would never want anyone to go through this trauma.  Note, I have never in my life had a food allergy until this point and boy was this bad!
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Yum,  I really do love this place!  It's close to work, owned by locals, offers great drinks and service, and most importantly, delicious food!  
My favorite dish is the Diablo Shrimp :)
Thanks for filling the belly
author: Aurora R.

description: Camarones Tropisueño were good; beans not so. Chile Verde had large chucks of meat. Main problem was noise (at dinner). Almost impossible to have a conversation over the music and everyone talking loudly trying to be heard. Won't return.
author: H. B.

description:
I never judge a book by its cover and always judge a Mexican joint by its chile rellenos.  

The thing is, if you can forge that crisp, golden brown exterior with a molten cheese soul, you can do anything. And Tropisueno nails it for about $8, which is slightly pricey for lunch, but its more than enough food.

Add to all this a bomb salsa bar and free, hot chips and you've got a winner. 

And don't even get me started on their happy hour... 5 dollar margaritas will be the end of me.
author: Mari C.

description:
Their website says it all:  authentic, traditional Mexican food and prices that speak for themselves.

A cool spot, which is walk up and order.  A great place for a quick, delicious bite.  Lots of meat and salsa choices.  And, a quick walk from Moscone or nearby hotels.

I'll be back!
author: Jodi S.

description: The margaritas are good but everything else is lacking flavor. Its not bad but I won't ever come here as a destination. Next time I end up at YBC starving I might stop in again but there is no magic.
author: Justin S.

description: Never been here before. Came in for the first time tonight with high hopes. I asked the bartenders a simple question, and they laughed, no, SCOFFED at me. Don't need to waste my time with idiots like that. Good food is immediately ruined by terrible staff. I won't be back.
author: Brooke F.

description: I hate this place Chipotle  before chipotle. Over it. Bland precooked steak in a steam pan. Any mission burrito beats it hands down. Upside you can have mexican ish food and a biz lunch. Ehh. 2 stars for being clean fast efficient .
author: Ashley A.

description:
We've been meaning to try this place for over a year. We happened to be walking by during lunch time and decided to try it out. 

First off there is no one at the hosts desk, you order at the kitchen and pay like any taqueria in the mission (lunch only) I ordered the "chile rojo" the woman at the counter had no idea what it was even though its right off the menu, I explain that it's the potato and tofu plate. She says "oh, tofu, ok" when we get to the register the woman there says one tofu and one enchilada plate we correct her an she has to go get someone else. I explain "We removed the potatoes from the dish, because there was gluten, and we wanted to make it truly vegetarian" ok...

One dish arrived at our table and the other arrived almost 15 mins later. They shorted us a side of corn tortillas. 

The salsas are good but no better than any of the good places in the mission. 

Not knowing your own menu is a bad sign, not having the things on your menu is just lame.  

It's too bad we waited so long to come here and it was so mediocre in the end.
author: Jared Z.

description:
The food (Carne Asada) was excellent and the beer on tap was pretty good too. The chips were a bit too salty to my taste, but the salsa was excellent (I especially liked the green one). It seems to be a bit busy at night, but I was lucky to be seated immediately as I was alone and there was a table available. But for bigger company some wait may be involved without prior reservation.

The lighting is a bit too dim I think - I could sometimes barely what's in my plate - but it was very tasty and the service was great. Very nice place.
author: Stanislav M.

description:
The Happy Hour is the best, but anybody who frequents this area already knows this!  Delish ceviche and tamales and the prices are super reasonable.  Actually the HH is pretty much dirt cheap and you'd be crazy to go anywhere else!  

They would have gotten 5 stars but I remember one time I went for HH and before HH was even over my friend and I were asked to move from our table by the window and we were like uh ok why, are you ending HH early?  He said it was the owners favorite table and he wanted it we were like wow, really?!  We got kicked out of our spot because of the owner?!  Jerk!  Anyways, everything else about Tropisueno is so wonderful that I am willing to look past that...

Really, it's that good.
author: Jammir G.

description:
I've been trying to figure out my aversion to hand-held foods.  It's probably a combination of a) not wanting to get my hands dirty, b) my arms getting tired from holding said food, and c) not wanting to bite my own fingers off because I eat too fast.

Having said that, my pollo asada super burrito (chicken, choice of black or refried beans, rice, sour cream, tomatoes, guacamole) was so massive that I didn't have to really hold it up with my hands; instead, I stood it up on one end on my plate, and just went from there.  When I got up to grab some salsa and napkins, Sara P. said that some guy who happened to be walking past (we were sitting next to the window) kept staring at my burrito.  Probably because it looked like my plate was having a huge boner.  Once you go.. never mind.

I also chose to have the horchata, but it was a bit too sour (?!) for my liking.  Too bad, as it's one of my favorite drinks.

Too many beans in my burrito (did that sound dirty to you?  Because it did to me..) but that's just a minor flaw.  Chicken was flavorful and I didn't have to add any salsa to mine.  Kudos for the chips and salsa bar, and also for them making our food super fast - we'd just finished paying and were in the process of carrying our numbers to our table when my burrito was brought out and handed over.

$8 for the burrito, $2.25 for the horchata, tax and tip came out to a $13 lunch.  Sort of pricey for a food coma, but I'll take it.
author: Tori S.

description:
someone stop me, I've already had 2 bowls of chips!  I'd have to say the chips and salsa were probably my favorite.  Not as impressed with the main course of corn, chicken enchilada's.  The mole was better than many places I've had, and didn't taste too charred.  Service was good and the place was packed.

I've heard the margarita's are good and strong, but haven't had them yet.
author: April N.

description: While visiting San Francisco, we had the pleasure of eating here.  We had gotten caught without making reservations on a very rainy night and thought we'd give it a try since it was near the hotel.  I was very pleased with their drinks and the portion size of their meals.  It was a tad crowded in the entry way, but then again, it was prime dinnertime during a downpour.  I will definately go again!
author: Vincent R.

description:
RSVP for 7pm.  It's now 7:11 and I'm still waiting.  ;(
 
What a night! 

We sat down and they brought chips & salsa. we got plates, but no dinner napkins.  Tried asking other servers for dinner napkins, no luck!  Finally falgged down our server and asked.

Our server was not attentive at all and he was not even listening when he was taking my order.

I order a drink with lemon and had to ask 3 times. 

Anyways, we order a Seafood dish for appetizer, Tampequeno (steak) and a pork entree.

The seafood appetizer was alright.
I liked the steaks flavoring, but it was super chewy.  Not tender at all.  If you decide to order this, be prepare to chew.  
The pork was super flavorful, but a bit dry for me.

By the end of the night, we were done.  We just wanted the check and leave. Again, try flagging down our server a few time so that we can get our check.  Lollipops to end the night?! Well that's what I saw other customers getting, but we didn't get any.

I was not happy at all! (sad face)

1 star is only because they have amazing margaritas and chips & salsa!!!
author: Jessica P.

description: Food, drinks and service all excellent.  The restaurant has a fun ambiance and it was clear the patrons were enjoying themselves.  I will return for another fine meal and good wine in due course.  Only a minor glitch that we were short one set of silverware, which was then provided without delay.
author: Steven Z.

description:
This place is AWESOME and I never would have found it without Yelp. My co-worker and I were jonesing for drinks and dinner in the notoriously dead-after-hours Financial district. We consulted the iPhone Yelp Monacle and Tropisueño definitely caught our attention. Dinner was AMAZING. 

The Violeta Margarita is soooo smooth, rimmed with vanilla salt. Way too easy to drink. The Tropisueño Margarita with a hint of ginger is even better. I'm used to describing wine as having a start, middle, and finish. I'd never had that experience with a Margarita before, but this one definitely had all three. 

I'll definitely be coming back again soon.
author: Aaron M.

description:
This was my first visit to Tropisueño. I very rarely write reviews, so the fact that I'm writing one means I actually felt strongly about this. This restaurant's food was decent (not like the Mission) and the margaritas hit the spot albeit overpriced. 
BUT, what was really unpleasant about this experience is the fact that upon showing up to be seated (after we'd waited 45 minutes already) we were told that we only had an hour and a half to enjoy our meal on account of another party coming in. This was a shock and frankly an uncalled for a rude way to treat your guests. It is unacceptable to inform your patrons that there is a time bomb on their dinner, and would be unheard of at any proper high quality restaurant where the main worry of a restaurant (especially in SoMa in downtown SF and overpriced) should always be the comfort, and leisure of the experience for the guest. I felt undervalued, like a waste of space, and would not recommend this place for an authentic, or friendly experience.
author: Ariel K.

description: Happy hour selection weak. Food delicious though and the sauces at sauce bar.
author: Hanna T.

description: Never again.  It is so loud, it is indescribable.  You cannot hear the server, let alone your companion.  I repeatedly ordered one drink, only to be told I'm getting something else.  No.  And I'm a loud person.  The meal was brought out 6 minutes after ordering dinner.  Apparently if you don't order additional appetizers (stop asking me if I want guacamole I don't want guacamole no thank you I really don't want guacamole) eat and get out.  My albondigas was supposed to be spicy.  It tasted overcooked and had a seriously tomato broth feel.  (Hint: That's not supposed to be the way it tastes.)  This was supposed to be a special dinner for me.  It just made me mad and sort of sad and left me with ringing ears.
author: Goddess B.

description:
Before I moved to SF I would almost want to visit the city just to go to Tropisueno. Great food with very fresh ingredients. 
Great vibe, very chill.
Great service.

Now on to the good stuff. The Margs. They are amazingly lethal but amazingly tasty. 
Belly up to the bar and keep the chips and salsa coming...they're a great side to their margaritas!
author: Jessica G.

description: After eating here there is no where else I want to eat!  The lines are incredible, but we were lucky to get a late reservation and go.  Incredible food.  The chips are amazing!  We bulldozed through them because we just couldn't stop eating them. My dinner was fantastic, so much good food.  Completely worth waiting for!
author: Marvin P.

description:
Hungry, worn out, and tired of the cold, my boyfriend and I found delicious shelter in Tropisueño, a hidden gem near Union Square. As you walk into the restaurant, you'll be greeted with a type of romantic-fiesta vibe-- modern, cool, and romantic on one side of the restaurant and colorfully lit with party lights near the bar. On a Sunday night, around dinner time, the wait was about 10 minutes... not too shabby!!

THE FOOD WAS AMAZING!

1. The (free) chips and salsas-- so, so good!!! Boyfriend loved it. I loved it. I bet the old couple on a date next to us loved it. But seriously, what's not to love? They have three types of salsa: a green tomatillo with a bit of a kick, red salsa that's milder, and a fantastic orange chile-pepper-made-creamy-with-olive-oil sauce (this was the best one!) 

2. The chicken mole-- the rave reviews say it all... it really is that delicious! You get two pieces of yummy tender chicken covered in mole sauce. All entrees come with Mexican rice, tortillas, and your choice of beans. This dish was definitely worth every penny. 
**TIP-- do not fill up on the delicious salsa if you order this because you will regret it!! I was so sad I couldn't eat more of the chicken because I had been too greedy w the salsa :'(

3. Chile verde with pulled pork-- again, SO, SO good!! If you ask for more tortillas, you'll be able to make little carnitas. Oh, and if you feel like channeling Emeril (aka feeling like kicking it up a notch?) you can add some of the orange salsa! Yummm!

We visited the city for 3 days and this was probably the best meal of the entire weekend. My boyfriend said it was the best Mexican "cuisine" that he's ever had :)
author: Amy Q.

description:
Came here with the sis for some happy hour margaritas. We got in right under the nose, only to find out that they only do happy hour at the bar, not at the tables. C'est la vie, we had a nice time anyway. 

As a Mission resident, it's hard to top some of the joints in my hood when it comes to Latin fare, but everything was relatively decent. 

The reason I'm rating them higher is because, although they were super swamped with the after-work crowd, and our entrées accidentally didn't get fired so we waited forever for them, is that the servers totally made up for it all. They gifted us some yummy tequila and something-juice shooters and a flan to top off our meal. Hey, crazy rushes and mix-ups happen. We were having a good time and didn't mind. But it's always appreciated when the servers care about your experience. Thanks, guys.
author: Christina S.

description:
Fantastic!
Great atmosphere, stellar service and great food. 
Not to be missed!!
and don't forget to have a cocktail, they were great as well.
author: Roxanne M.

description: I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant - after all, we're not in the Mission but I'm a fan. It's a beautiful, spacious restaurant that serves HUGE portions at affordable prices. Their salsa's and Margarita's are amazing. Friendly staff too.
author: Karlijn V.

description:
Not sure if it is just me, but the tortillas here were very bland.  

The Mango Margarita was awesome however.
author: Douglas L.

description:
3.5 stars

I wanted to love this place but instead i just liked it.  The atmosphere is lively but not too loud (like mamacita).  service was prompt.  

The guacamole was pretty tasty.  Chips were also good.  We had the empanadas de hongos.  those were pretty tasty too.  they didnt knock me over, but they were good.  the chile verde was fairly disappointing.  the carne asade was not the best texture.  it had chunks in it that was not very tender and the rest of almost tasted dry even though it was swathed in tomatillo sauce.  it just lacked dimension and looked sloppy on the plate.  it had spanish rice with it that was neither exceptional nor inventive.  it was like uncle ben's.  the refried beans were excellent.  

margaritas were kick ass strong.  tasted good too.  recommended.

i would come back.  i would like to give it another shot.  i think i will try something a little more inventive off of the menu.  i didnt get really adventurous since i was with someone who was a vegetarian, but i would like to try their mole perhaps.  the prices are pretty reasonable here too.
author: Christian C.

description: Visited here last Wednesday evening for a business meeting. The margaritas were delicious, the guacamole was amazing, and the trio of salsas they bring out were incredible as well. The service was friendly and attentive. My entree, a combination taco and enchilada, was perfect. One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. As we left, the host thanked me by name! One word: impressed.
author: Jay S.

description:
Such amazing food... Best mexican food i have eaten ever? Wow ive never had better mexican than at tropisueno
Their guac has so much flavor and everything here you can tell is fresh and made here
Whether its their warm chips or their tortillas, they make it
The only reason this place doesnt get five stars is because no matter what time of day you go its going to be packed and loud
If you want to have dinner here make sure to make reservations! The line for this place can be very long, but the people on the line find the wait worth it and i have to agree with them!
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I don't really understand why they are on open table. because you basically go in line to order your food and take a number thing and get your own table. 

I like the decor of this place, it gets a bit tooo crowded but eh, not a big deal. 

Food here is pretty good. I ordered the combo plate with beef enchilada and chicken taquito. friends had a beef torta, and a pork mole. my favorite is the chicken taquito. 

We also ordered two maragaritas. Tropisueno and the 4th down on the bar menu. Tropisueno is supposed to have ginger? in it but i didnt taste it. But their drinks were REALLY STRONG. lol chili salt was interesting, its just a hint of chili but you can see taste the spiciness.
author: Erica L.

description:
Full frontal disclosure. I like my Mexican food cheap and simple. Class it up and something is lost.

This place classes it up. And it tastes good. But that something is lost. Except for the margaritas. That's some good stuff there. Evidently they have a flavor of the month. Who KNOWS what it will be this fine August 2012?

I ordered the veggie tacos and the cheese enchiladas. Not a huge fan of yams & squashes or whatever it was in a veggie taco. Just beans and lettuce and maybe some onions and tomato. Anyhoo, the cheese enchiladas were standard and good.

The guac here was good also, but, generally, where is guac BAD? Yes, we've all had it, but most places don't F this up. The chips came with an array of dips and salsas that were superfluous and also superfluous. I'm fine with just SALSA, gracias.

Not a bad place at all, but perhaps mildly overrated? Hm?
author: Mike O.

description: Stopped in after a long day. They were quite busy but asked we could be out by 8:20 (plenty of time). Service was attentive and well informed. The food was delicious. The drinks had fresh fruit juices that really make the difference in a mixology program. Well done all around.
author: Marc Z.

description:
Tropisueno, you are so delicious! Looking for a giant and delicious burrito for lunch?  This is your place! Or, is it later in the evening and you are looking to sit down to some awesome Mexican food? Also your place! 

Tropisueno smoothly transitions from daytime taqueria to upscale Mexican dinner spot.  Their food is fresh and flavorful. They also have the best housemade salsa in town. During lunch, you can get all the salsa you want from the salsa bar. At dinner, they bring you chips and three types of salsa after you are seated. 

As much as I love this place, I have two negative(ish) notes. First, I found their serving of guacamole as an appetizer is a bit small for the price. Secondly, they take OpenTable reservations as late as 15 minutes before the kitchen closes. My friend made a reservation for 6 on her birthday and when we arrived we were told we had 15 minutes to order or we couldn't get food. Luckily everyone made it on time, but it was weird to have no warning about that when the reservation was made.

However, I consider these minor setbacks to the awesomeness that is Tropisueno! It continues to be my go-to place for both lunch and dinner downtown.
author: Liz H.

description: "Sharp piece of metal embedded in my burrito" - I used to come here almost every other week for lunch on weekends or an occasional dinner on weekdays as I live local since 2012.  It was one of my favorite restaurants until biting down on a small sharp piece of metal embedded in my burrito this past summer.  I brought it to the attention of the manager and his response was "do you want a refund?".  He didn't apologize or show any concern that I could've swallowed it and gone to the hospital.  As a result,  I have boycotted them since.  I refuse to come to a place that doesn't care about their customers.  Later I found out that one of my friends found the wrapper of a ketchup bottle in his dish prior to my incident.
author: June P.

description: Oh this place - such a good spot.  The food and drinks are fabulous, we sat at the bar for dinner, I had the scallops and chorizo plantain hash which was really good, kind of sweet.  I had the Margarita de la Casa as well, so good.  The bartenders were very helpful in making recommendations and letting us sample different tequilas for our tasting, ole!  And finally, I really enjoyed the ambiance at this place, you're smack dab in the middle of a big city and it feels like a comfortable getaway.
author: Emily M.

description:
After an awkwardly-lengthy brunch visit elsewhere earlier in the day, this lively restaurant was quite refreshing. The pork in my chili verde dish was delicious, and somehow, my margarita tasted at least as great. Chocolate flan weaseled its way onto the table, and I don't regret it one bit.  My date and I were served by a speedy, friendly staff to boot.

I hear there are free drinks when attending in groups of 5 or more. Would definitely return!
author: Garett T.

description:
This is excellent Mexican food - kind of American-ized but still very tasty. Fresh food, great flavors, vibrant atmosphere, and reasonable prices (for the area). We've been twice and will definitely be back!

Try the Chicken Mole if you like that dish - pretty damn good!
author: Karen C.

description: This is NOT a place to have a date! Giving a 3 because the food is good. There is no wait staff to take your order. The ordering process is a cluster F!  It is a zoo, they don't provide instructions on the process (more time wasted to figure it out). Once you enter the restaurant everyone gets in a cattle line to order food, get a table tent #, pay. Then move to another line/the bar to try to get a drink, pay again. Then two more spots/trips to get your own silverware and then sauces. Then you fight to try to find an open table :-o.  On top of it they brought my hot meal, then didn't bring my dates (cold) salad for another 10 mins - at least.
author: lindsey j.

description: Oh my god we completely adored this place!!! I ordered their violeta margarita and their pepino. They were both so delicious! My gf ordered strawberry margs that had fresh fruit in them! Their chips.....to die for.They are made fresh and taste completely out of this world!  They also come with a salsa tray of three different salsas. They were all delicious and spicy!.The bartender Roman was such a blast too! He was so sweet and helpful and you could tell he loves his job. We ended up ordering food so soak up our alcohol and of course were not disappointed. We just wished we had gotten a room at the Marriott next door so we could hang out there all night! We have already made plans to come back with the men just to enjoy this restaurant!
author: Anastasia B.

description:
For Vicky L. & I's weekly lunch date, I suggested Tropisueno. I don't usually like Mexican food so she was shocked I chose it. The setup is a little funky...the menu is right by the door, then you order from the line and then find a spot. You have to get your own utensils, napkins and salsas. 
I had 2 chicken tacos. They were fresh, warm and good. They are 'taco truck' style...meaning corn tortillas, onions and cilantro. Two was the perfect number for me for lunch. If I were hungrier 3 would have been better. The chips brought to our table were freshly made and perfectly salted (which is hard to do!). Vicky had a burrito which was massive. She ate most of it so it must have been good! I also had their horchata which I thought was a little too sweet.
Yerba Buena lane is great for people watching if you face a window.
author: Sara P.

description: Went here for a quick lunch while visiting the city. Two of our four orders didn't come as ordered and were fixed by the manger, thanks! Bartender was completely overwhelmed and served people all out of order which, took 25 minutes to get 2 margaritas. Weren't with the wait.  Food beat me to the table by fifteen minutes which got cold real quick. Only getting a 3 because of the managers quick help. Food ok, drinks not so much.
author: Don H.

description:
Holy Hell yeah!

Amazing margaritas, really, really good food. That's it. 

We had the house margaritas (many, many, times). The Chile Verde and the bistec were also so good. Go to this place NOW!!!
author: Lawrence A.

description:
Not so great.

Chips: Tasty, but quite greasy. You could see grease in the bottom of the bowl.

Appetizer: Molotes de Elote y Chorizo (corn masa "cigars" filled with Mexican chorizo, fresh corn and cotija cheese) was very good

Drinks: Margarita was nothing special

Main course: Tampiqueño (Niman Ranch carne asada) was quite tough and lacked flavor.

Service: Marginal.

I did not even finish my meal. My friends seemed to like their entrees, so maybe it's just me.
author: Dennis V.

description: i made sure a give a mexican restaurant a shot here in the bay area while on my vacations , their Tinga Tostada is really good its marinated pork tostada with layers of refried beans s.c lettuce and fresh cheese ,,, their orange looking hot sauce is really good too
author: Stacey P.

description:
I've been to Tropisueno several times and I've enjoyed it every time! It is a great local mexican spot that can serve as one of my lunch "go tos" as well as a great dinner option as well.

The great thing about Tropisueno is that it has found a way to be a great Dinner and Lunch spot that also features a "To Go" window for lunchers on the run.

One of my favorite dinner dishes is the grilled Salmon with a side of rice and beans. The dish is incredibly filling, yet light and not heavy. The kitchen seems to always grill it to perfection and not dry out the fish, which is easy to do. Additionally, the fresh chips, salsa and guac are a must have on every visit!

For lunch, Tropisueno is a hidden gem. The "to-go" window is a great option for those of us looking to grab a meal and take it back to the office, with the quality of a sit down meal.  Normally I go with a Chile Relleno Carnita's Burrito and load up on pico de gallo and fresh cilantro.  One thing is for sure, the staff at Tropisueno doesn't go cheap on the meat or fresh fillings for the burritos - they stack the contents high and make sure they you don't go unsatisfied.

I promise you'll love Tropisueno and you definitely will not go hungry!
author: Justin O.

description:
I don't know how I have not reviewed this excellent establishment!!! 
I have been coming here for a lunch time get away and a happy hour heaven for a little over a year now. 
During lunch time you can walk up and order at the counter, they have a roll down scroll menu, and you take a number to a table. The food is brought out to you once prepared. Everything I have tried has been amazing, personally I love chicken tacos, so per usual I get them here with a little guacamole. Yum! Oh, and they have a salsa bar with cilantro, onions, and lots of different salsas available during lunch! I have to say I have also watched company eat burritos, soup, enchiladas, and salads all of which was said to be great!

The food is AMAZING!!!! (Love there chips and salsa!!!)

In the evening they close up the front counter with a mural, and the restaurant blossoms into full service! The bar is always friendly providing excellent margaritas (guaranteed to get a strong drink). And your dollar goes a long way at happy hour!!! Not only are margaritas $5.00 but there is a food menu with varies items for $3.00 and $5.00. I love the nachos!!! 

Overall, this place offers great food, great service, great prices! And its clean! :) What more could you be seeking?!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I was never a mexican food liker but not after eating here =) Thanks to S and J lol.. This is one of the best tapas I have been to all of Bay Area..  got introduced to this tapas by my friend and instantly I knew I will be back to this place after entering inside :) Love their decor and lighting.   They brought chips with salsa and guacamole dip.  We were hungry and they tasted so good that we kept asking them for more lol.. We had Pollo Asado.. Camarones Tropisueño, and Tampiqueño.. all were delicious.. the chicken was grilled perfectly and juicy too.  The camarones tropisueno comes with wild shrimp in some arbol sauce.. my friends found it bit spicy but me being a spicy lover loved it anyway =P
I'm very picky when it comes to liking Mexican rice and glad that it tasted flavorful over here.  The beans, and the tortillas were super warm and full of flavors.

Will definitely recommend this place for groups, romantic dinners, platonic meet ups and ofcourse with best buds =)  Now have to grab my other gfs and check out this place.  I will be back here again!!
author: Hema K.

description:
Yummy!!!
I was browsing around town during my conference and ran into this place. It is located in a small walking area away from all the busy streets. You walk in, put your order in, they hand you a number and receipt of your order and then move along the line and pay for your meal. 

I ordered the chicken tamales with black beans and rice. The black beans were good but the rice had so much flavor. The chicken tamales were wonderful. They had shredded chicken breast; just what I like. 

There is a salsa bar where you can pick which salsa you like and additional toppings. I tried 3 out of the 4 options they had. There was this orange looking one which was alright but had this wonderful kick to it. then there was another one which has a blend of avocado in it and then a tomatillo one which was my favorite. 

I loved this place! I know where to get some great food the next time I come back.
author: Reena M.

description: When I worked at 4th and Market, I stopped in to Tropisueño a few times for burritos at lunch and after work for margaritas and enchiladas. Always good food and consistent service.
author: Jodie B.

description:
5 Stars for the service and food! 
Chips and salsa are never ending and absolutely delicious! 
I had the salmon braised in a banana leaf - it was mouth watering.
This place is a must for groups.
author: Shannon B.

description: Happy hour here is good. THough I am not a fan of the house margaritas, they are nothing special. Chips and salsa are great, tacos are solid, and over all enjoy coming here. If its nice out and around happy hour time, you will have a hard time getting in or sitting outside.
author: Kristan B.

description:
I love this place!

The bartenders are super friendly and the drinks are well done.

My favorite dish here is the Camarones Tropisueno - perfectly cooked shrimp in a spicy cream sauce. 

The ceviches are also really good.  

If you want soup try the Caldo de Mariscos - a super flavorful spicy tomato-based broth and tons of fresh seafood.

Service has always been top notch.
author: amy k.

description:
(This review is for the dinner menu - apparently the place morphs between taqueria and bistro on a daily basis)

First things first - the chips & salsas/sauces are absolutely first rate, and the margaritas are the best I've ever had anywhere (including my own  made with top shelf tequila, cointreau and fresh squeezed lime juice from limes straight from the tree). I don't know what their secret is but these are some truly amazing concoctions.

The chips & drinks alone are worth 4 stars, but the service and quality of the food put Tropisueno over the top for me. Everything I've ever ordered - or dining companions have ordered - has been first rate. From complex mole sauces to perfectly prepared enchiladas and tacos. Authentico? Who knows, I'm just a gringo, but very very tasty which is all that counts in my book.

Another bonus - they are keenly aware of the needs of the gluten-free diner and even maintain a special fryer for the chips (i.e. one that is *only* used for corn tortillas), and the servers know what is and isn't safe for the gluten-free diner.

HIGHLY recommended!
author: Todd H.

description:
Why such great reviews? This place was less than mediocre. The guac was laughable. My home made version is better. The food was bland, nothing special. I'd rather eat at a Mission Taqueria. Never again. Not worth it. 

Not to mention not a single person I was with was impressed. We all left very unsatisfied and quite confused over the hype.
author: Jin S.

description:
Come on now this place doesn't deserve the rating it currently has.  I went here based on the Yelp score and was so dissapointed.   
I felt so ill after eating at Tropisueno.  The Margaritas are just ok.

For awesome food and margaritas go to La Penza Azul (Alameda) or Don Pisto's (SF).
author: Mindy S.

description:
Pretty good. 

FOOD
The food was the least appealing about the place. Great chips (fresh) and salsa variety, but other than that, it's a bit pricey for what you get. I don't mind paying, but the food overall lacked much flavor. Good enough, but not great enough to get 4 stars IMO.

DRINKS
