I always go for the margaritas here. Pretty good. Not too sweet and have a good kick.

AMBIANCE
This is probably why I visit here most. Good after work vibe and crowd. Mature scene that's lively and offers great rustic aesthetics. Small outdoor seating if you'd like as well.

SERVICE
Good service. Nothing to brag about, but definitely nothing to complain about either.

Overall - good spot to grab drinks and a small bite in the Fi-Di/Soma area.
author: Good U.

description: Everyone else raves about this place, I just don't get it. The service is bad and the food isn't good either. I do love to get lots of little containers and fill each with a different color of salsa. It's so pretty, but you can do that at plenty of other places with better tacos.
author: Kelly C.

description:
A co-worker and I ventured into this spot after working a convention at the Moscone Center.  LOVED IT!  Friendly service at the bar and restaurant.  Their portions were large and the food was oozing with flavor.  

I ordered the Tampiqueno.  Wow, the carne asada was marinated and prepared perfectly.  Very tender, melt in your mouth goodness.  And the portion was enough to last a couple more dinners (at least with my appetite).

Awesome chips and salsa too.  The only downfall was that I ate so much of it that I didn't get to sample any of the appetizers like I normally would.  Oh well...next time!
author: Maryrose S.

description: My boyfriend and I made reservations here while visiting from Philly, in town for the Nike Women's Marathon. We came based on the other reviews and the closeness to our hotel. The décor and ambiance of the place was so great! I loved the lighting and the feel of the place. It didn't feel chainey or like it was trying too hard. I'm a vegan and they had a tofu dish on the menu but I asked the waiter if they could accommodate me by making the enchiladas without cream or cheese and with veggies.. It wasn't an issue and they were delicious. The salsas were tasty and the portions were hefty. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal as well. Our bill was about $30 for the two of us... It was a steal! I wish I could have taken my left overs but our hotel didn't have a fridge! Great eats in San Fran :)
author: Kate S.

description: Great mexican food.....really crispy amd fresh tortilla chips......great option for vegiterian......
author: D P.

description:
Really fantastic chips and salsa and their house margarita is fantastic, my favorite is when margaritas are made with just agave, tequila, and lime and that is how they do it!
My complaint is that a group of five of us got there around 3:40 and no one wanted to seat us or help us at all until 4:00, when happy hour started.  In my opinion, customers should always be seated and treated well, at least get us some water while we are waiting for happy hour to start!
My last comment is that their rice tastes kind if strange, kind of more indian or middle easters, not like your standard Mexican rice.
author: Jasmine F.

description: Really good food and drinks! I'm a fan of the ceviche, the chile verde, and their chips and guacamole. The drinks are good (and very strong), but are a little pricey and can vary significantly in size. Definitely get there early if you want to do happy hour - the place fills up really quickly since it has a small bar.
author: Molly P.

description: Light, salty chips, great salsa and tomatillo sauce to start.  We both ordered a 2 item entree - a taco and enchilada.  The flavors were good, but I wanted a little more meat and less rice.  You can only get margs on the rocks.  No bueno.
author: Carol S.

description:
I think this place deserves five stars for their chips alone.  I've never been to the restaurant, only gotten their catering...but we get it A LOT.  It's the offices favorite lunchtime order by FAR!
We've gotten pretty much everything on their menu and nothing is bad.  If I had to pick one thing not to get, it would be the enchiladas, but even those are yummy.
The favorite is of course the chicken mole.  Even people who don't like chicken mole go cuckoo for this stuff.  I always request the corn tortillas as well.  Their flour ones are good, but I love me some corn.
Other staples include their guac, chicken fajitas, and quesadillas.  I personally LOVE the veggie quesadillas, but the preference here is chicken which is also really tasty.  They have three types of salsas which compete for everyone's favorite, but mine is the verde.  What's great is the leftovers the next day.  Everyone happy chomping away on their thin yummy chips and salsa of choice.
Their delivery is always on time and their happy to provide serving utensils, as well as (compostable!) paper goods.
Fantastic...every time.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: I had no idea how a restaurant could accumulate that many reviews with a 4 star avg. Now I get it. We were there for lunch and the relleno burrito and fish burrito were absolutely delicious! And they are big servings that we so regretted not being able to finish. Ugh! The salsa bar was full of goodness as well. So believe the ratings. This place deserves it.
author: David S.

description:
So much food, so little room in my stomach!  ;D  I couldn't stop eating the chips with the two kinds of salsa (green, red)!  And then we ordered their house margarita, mmm-mm!!  

We ordered the ceviche (spicy fresh, good, mmm, good!), and I ordered the carne asada with rice and one chicken enchilada - but I hardly touched it between trying my bf's and friend's main entrees (shredded pork and meat ball soup) and eating all those chips/salsa, beans, tortillas, etc.  It was too much but oh so good!!  We had a very big container to take home which my bf is probably going to enjoy later for lunch - ha!  

The service was nice and attentive, and I loved the ambiance, very Latin and festive with the lights and all.  I would definitely go back, but I will try to hold back on the chips and salsa next time - uh huh, good luck!!  :)

Dinner share+tip+tax = $30

Once-a-week-dinner w/ Geraldine # 15
author: Maile N.

description:
This is a solidly good mexican place with good veggie options as well. I came here at lunch time with a friend and I got the veggie burrito. Often times veggie burritos are just beans, rice, and cheese smothered in sour cream and salsa, but this had grilled veggies in it and made me full in that burrito way without making me feel like death in the way that other mex places often do. 

The place gets crowded at lunch, but there is ample seating. You do end up sitting quite close to your fellow diners if it's a busy time, though, so this is not the place to come and have a private conversation.

Their salsa bar is absolutely amazing. i tried about five of them and all were good but I highly recommend the bright orange one as well sa the light green salsa.

Great place. I'm coming back for a quesadilla and some horchata.
author: Courtney A.

description:
I want to take a bath in their Chile de Arbol Salsa.  Wait, upon consideration of my tender bits that sounds like a terrible idea.  Okay, now I've totally ruined your appetite.  Sorry about that - let's start over.

Tropisueño is the real deal.  Casual taqueria by day and warm, inviting restaurant by night.  The food has me craving more and the margaritas could get me in trouble.  I know it's hard, but try not to load up on the chips and salsa - the meal only gets better from there.  Put the visual imagery aside, and just order anything with the Chile de Arbol.  Trust me.
author: James H.

description:
I've been here twice for dinner and I have to say this is one of my favourite Mexican restaurants in SF.  (my friend who works in the area says atmosphere during lunch is very different)

1) Atmosphere - it's got the feel of a somewhat upmarket restaurant but is still relaxed

2) Drinks - their margaritas are strong and good!

3) Food - everything I've had here have been really tasty and the price's totally reasonable (maybe it's a little pricier than a taco stand or burrito places in the Mission - but you are sitting down here at a nice restaurant!)

4) Service - nothing to fault there

Their complimentary chips & salsa is very tasty too.

They are often booked out but if you turn up earlier than your opentable reservation, they can sometimes take you in.
author: Sujan H.

description:
The skinny:

Great chips with salsa/guacamole
Nice appetizers
Great soup - pozole? very delicious
Great service 
Warm, lively but intimate atmosphere

The details:

we went on a lark (maybe I wanted Mex food not sure) and ordered too much! we made reservations, got window seats, and filled up so much on the guacamole and chips that I couldn't finish my delicious soup. The GF got the 3 item platter with stuffed bell pepper, enchilada, tamale and she couldn't finish either but especially loved the pepper.

The waiter kept refilling my water when I wasn't looking (it was hard for him to sneak the refill but he did) and the attention to us was top-notch but not overbearing. I loved the atmosphere and would recommend this place. Get a reservation on a busy night ok?
author: Chris G.

description: This place is fun! I loved the food and drinks. Chips and salsa were good, guacamole could definitely be better. Table side would be nice! The waiters are quick and helpful. I planned a post engagement dinner for my girlfriend and I at Tropisueno. The staff was very helpful in setting up seating accommodations beforehand. My only complaint is that one of the managers commented on how I was bugging them to get every single thing right for the special night. Maybe it was just his sense of humor, or maybe I'm just too sensitive. Either way, I didn't like the comment. But food was good, atmosphere intimate yet fun, it was a nice dinner. I definitely recommend Tropisueno.
author: Katelyn A.

description:
Ate here on the advise of a local. Had a group of 8 people and got there around 11:15. Beat the crowd for sure. 20 min. later, there was a line out the door at lunch time.

We had a the alot of food, but what stood out was the freshness of food, chips and the salsa bar. Really good salsa. Also had the nachos. We also had some house Margs... yeah - we were on vacation! lol! Good pours! 

Had a Fajita burrito, there was also a Veggie burrito and traditional tacos. All fresh ingredients. I have to say the portions are large and I ate all my burrito and tasted others and felt satisfied. The food is not heavy, but rich with flavor. 

Being from AZ, I had my doubts, but it was good. Would love to come back for dinner. We will be back!
author: Shon Q.

description:
in SF for business and that's the best way to try out new places. came here with a friend and was not disappointed.

salsa selection was excellent. tampiqueno was really tasty with great flavors. the beef was a little tough but didn't stop me from devouring it
author: Jon C.

description: They have a pretty good happy hour drinks and food for after work hours. They have a salsa bar with a large variety to choose from.  Really long lines at lunch time hours if you are taking food to go. The quality of their food is good and I like their fish tacos. Good margaritas also.
author: Betty S.

description: I was just "meh" about this restaurant. Nice ambiance and good service (although a little slow). Decent margaritas. Good chips and salsa. Had a tamale that was overcooked and a very good carnitas taco. Decent value for what you get. Benefit of being super close to the Marriott conference center.
author: Sara R.

description:
Holy mudslide batman, I need a drywall repair kit

That is what resonates in my head as I think back on my experiences at the Mexican kitchen. I have now tried the burrito with the steak, chicken, and with differing combinations of refried, pinto, and black beans. Though the food tasted ok, none of the flavors really popped for me and there was no texture whatsoever.  The rice seemed overcooked, the beans were not particularly seasoned well and the meat just seemed to be lacking any noticeable texture or real flavor.  

Then there is the atmosphere which is very pleasant. It is classic touristy taqueria which is very nicely done, possessing a much more authentic feeling then a chili's. 

Then  late that night my toilet is transformed into a ceramic launch pad and as my head penetrates the ceiling above me, all memories of the atmosphere leave me.
This is the fish, signing out.
author: Fish E.

description:
Tucked away on Yerba Buena Lane, Tropisueno is a little gem of a Mexican restaurant that is a cut above most of the "sit down" places in the Bay Area.  While not necessarily one those upscale Mexican places that are popping up all over the place, Tropisueno is a lively and inviting eatery focusing on the pure, clean flavors of Mexico.  They use fresh, quality ingredients to conjure up faithfully traditional dishes.  And the best part?  The food is cheap!  And, it comes to the table quickly!  The concept behind Tropisueño is to offer an inexpensive and authentic Mexican experience.  I'd say that this concept has been successfully rendered.

Starting with the most additively delicious chips I've ever eaten.  Fresh, hot, crisp and salty, the chips overshadowed the well made accompanying salsas (salsa verde and some kinda of roasted red salsa.)  We decided to get a few appetizers and opted for the tacos al pastor and the mushroom and cheese filled empanadas.  They were the perfect starters, small yet full of flavor.  The tacos were served in classic street style, garnished simply with pineapple (standard for al pastor), onion, cilantro and a little red salsa.  The earthy tasting empanadas were topped with a little fresh guacamole.  Wonderful.

Our entrees were the chile verde and chicken with mole poblano.  A sucker for slow roasted pork, I was taken by the depth of flavor the chile verde had.  Unfortunately, I was a little less impressed with the mole poblano.  While the chicken itself was good, exhibiting the taste and flavor of a naturally raised bird, the mole was a little unbalanced.  A well made mole combines chiles, chocolate, spices, nuts and herbs into something rich and complex.  This mole was too sweet, with cinnamon and clove overwhelming everything else.  The standard accompaniment of beans and rice were not mere after thoughts, as is the case in many restaurants.  Here, the perfectly cooked staple could easily be a satisfying meal.

Washing all of this good food down were the excellent $8 house margaritas.  Typically, the term "house margarita" is a shudder eliciting combination of crappy harsh tequila and syrupy sweet bottled mix.  Not true here.  This margarita in question is made with El Jimador tequila, fresh lime juice and agave nectar.  The glass is rimmed with a spicy chile salt.  Strong and delicious.  Did I mention it was $8?  Oh, and they drop that down to $5 during happy hour.  

Tropisueño is the first Mexican restaurant to challenge the hold on my heart that Frontera Grill has.  While not quite as good, I can go to Tropisueño anytime I want.  And it's amazingly inexpensive.  Neither of which I can say about Chicago-based Frontera Grill.
author: Bryce B.

description:
Easy, fresh Mexican lunch in SoMa. There's plenty of options for carnivores, veggievores and fishavores alike (I got the fish tacos, which were delicious). The service is fast and friendly (though not everything comes out at the same time if you order a few dishes, so you may have to stay on top of your own order to make sure you get it all). 

Go early if you don't want to wait in line, 'cause it's popular!
author: Ryan W.

description:
Finding a great sit down Mexican restaurant with delicious food that is not over priced is tough, especially near SOMA, however Tropisueno delivers. 

The ambiance is fun, clean, and comfortable. 
The food is incredible, better than I expected due to the location. Healthier than a mission taqueria but with all the flavor and large portions!

My favorite part is the SALSA BAR! This salsa bar is the best I have ever enjoyed. With 2 different greens, 4 different reds, and all kinds of limes, radish, and carrots, it is my dream bar. 

The bar could be better. 
We ordered the violeta and the house margaritas. Both were far from delicious. I'd love to see fresh purees rather than flavored liquors.
author: Daydra B.

description: They now have a vegan pozole! Hot damn, son... It's a must try meat eater or not!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Somehow during my stay in San Francisco, a batch of Manchester rain managed to follow me to the Golden State. Like proper, full-on Manchester rain, the kind Dylan Moran describes which is like no other in the UK - as he said, 'Like emptying a bath out of the window, where a single droplet can soak you entirely.' Not dressed for it, Rachel C and I huddled under her umbrella and followed our dinner organisers quickly to this nearby spot. Aren't we lucky that we have such awesome restaurants so close to the office? God bless SF.

Anyway, I ordered up a shrimp burrito with refried beans, and chips and salsa were provided in spades. Oh they were good. And before I knew it my tasty foil-wrapped treat came scooting over to me, handily still packaged so I could take the other half back to HQ with me and snaffle it later. Win.

The atmosphere is awesome, very Mexican cantina and the burrito itself was sublime - perfectly cooked rice, soft wrap, spicy juicy shrimps and some delicious fresh guacamole as well as a salsa to die for. I was muchos impressed. Again please! Oh wait, I don't live here. Dang, you San Franciscans are lucky!
author: Emma Louise M.

description: Excellent lunch spot near the Moscone Convention Center. Fast, lots of delicious food, good space. It's pretty expensive but so is everything in that area. I've only been for the taqueria style lunch and not for the full service dinner. There are a good amount of vegetarian options too.
author: Anna W.

description:
3.5 stars really, but I'm feeling nice.

They had some really delicious food here. I love some Mexican food, but normally, I go to the smaller hole-in-the-wall locations for good Mexican food...or SoCal. 

The chips and salsas that you get when you first sit down are pretttty awesome. I wasn't exactly sure what each was, but they were definitely some pretty good stuff. The chips were definitely fresh and the salsas went VERY well with them. They ranged from a  slight burn to a...hotter burn, but nothing TOO spicy. I got the chile verde on the suggestion and yelpers and it was definitely good. The pork was tender and the rice was decent.. I also got a Violeta margarita, I think, but it was quite pricy, but good. It was good for its price. 

It was decent, not the best Mexican food, but a pretty good place to get some pretty good Mexican food in SOMA.
author: Nina Y.

description: Go for the enchiladas, tamales, and guacamole. Pass on the tacos. Cool setup for lunch and the location is great.
author: Khalid N.

description:
When in SF, I always end up at Tropisueño since it's so close to our office. The line moves quickly, even when it's out the door, and the salsa bar is legit. So many options when it comes to sauce.

Last time I had the pork enchilada and a barbacoa taco combo. I have to admit that the taco wasn't my favorite taco I've ever eaten, but the pork was good in the enchilada. These will also be some of the biggest portions you'll ever consume, so you could probably eat for days if you order a burrito.

At lunch, this place is hopping, so I'd recommend getting there early unless you're taking your Mex to go.
author: Annie D.

description:
Happy hour is great but busy, busy, busy. 

Hint #1: Get there before 5pm. I shit you not. 

HInt #2: If you get a couple seats at the bar or community table then you lucked out. Order a couple of margs immediatley and THEN look at the menu. 

Hint #3: Ask the watiress for the Habanero Salsa for your chips. The stuff they give you won't tickle any Cali taste bud.

Hint #4: They have HOOKS under the community table!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jay H.

description:
The pork chop is amahhhzing- one of the best I've ever had!  I'm surprised it hasn't gotten the due love that it deserves.  

Service here is great as well- never had an issue, staff have always been friendly and courteous.
author: Clarissa P.

description: It's great to find a reasonably priced (by SF standards) restaurant with flavorful Mexican dishes.  The house salad is big enough to share as a light starter.  The albondigas soup has a great broth and very hearty.  Recommend this place for locals and visitors.
author: Lisamarie R.

description:
great chips and guac!
The food are also reasonably priced for the area
author: Tina C.

description:
Reservations are a must! It was super crowded even on a Monday night(could be because of Dreamforce) My sister and I really liked the chips and tried to avoid the orange salsa as much as we could. It was pretty spicy. We started off with tostada de camerones(shrimp with salsa, guacamole, lettuce on a crispy tortilla. 

I got the Tampiqueno, thin-cut beef that just melted in my mouth. It also came with a beef enchilada that didn't have cheese, but the standout part of the dish was the beef! Sister got the chicken with mole, which had an interesting taste since it was chocolate flavored as well. The chicken just fell off the bone and was pretty good. 

Definitely coming back for the beef entree :)
author: Karina C.

description: I swear to you..the carne asada I had in my burrito and nachos were leftovers from the night before in which they microwaved and presented as fresh. Smh. Very disappointing to say the least.
author: Bear Y.

description: Terrific Mexican classics like tacos, burritos and fajitas. We were famished from our drive in to the City and we were happy to find this bustling spot nearby our hotel. I loved my chicken burrito which was large, seasoned and very flavorful. They offer a wide variety of salsa from a well-stocked salsa bar. I was a little unnerved when they took my order and hurried me down the line before my food was ready. They don't let you watch as your burrito, tacos, etc are made a la Chipotle or Qdoba. They take your order and usher you along to the cashier. Having said that, the food was very tasty and the prices were hard to beat in the Financial District. Great value, I will return.
author: Jason M.

description:
The story I am about to tell you either says a lot about the food, or a lot about me. Probably both.

Basically, went there for lunch, and even though there was a crazy holiday-crowd, and a fire alarm sounding, we stayed. That should say enough.

TOFU BURRITOS! (I always like to put in a keyword search for tofu and VEGETARIAN) Great selection for meat-eaters and veggies alike!

They also have this delicious, creamy, spicy, orange, salsa-auce thing. It is awesome.

During lunchtime they have a cafeteria-style burrito/other entree bar, and for dinner it is a sit-down restaurant. I love a place that can transform to please. It is pretty busy though, so I would perhaps suggest a reservation? Or patience. The orange sauce is worth it. I also had the chile relleno once and it was quite good.
author: Kim L.

description:
Best lunch place in The Square! I come here all the time for lunch because its fast, tasty and they have the best salsa bar! Thats right, they have a salsa bar... SALSA BAR. Since im sure you know salsa has replaced ketchup as Americas favorite condiment, im sure you will rejoice, Salsa Bar! 

The fish tacos and burritos are amazing. The chips are always brought to you warm and fresh. It also has generous bar seating if you come by yourself. Yum.

I've been at night. The food is so-so and a little over priced.

Suggestion- stop by Tropisueno before you hit up a movie at the Metreon!
author: Jen E.

description:
Opted to go here rather than a place way down yonder in the Mission.  Being from out of town and with no car, we wanted to make sure we knew where the hell we were, and that we could get back to our hotel after eating without too many technical difficulties.
  
Since we knew we wanted Mexican (being that we were in California and all...), I used my handy dandy computer and Yelped away to find something within walking distance.

So glad we picked this place!  The margarita's were strong and spicy with their chili salt rimmed glasses.  The chips and salsa were delightful, and the food was great! 

The bar and wait staff showed a stellar performance.  Attentive, friendly, and quick with a laid back and chill quality.
author: Jaime W.

description:
I had the opportunity while in SFC last week on business to take my client here for dinner! 

It was recommended to me and I will say I was very happy with the end result. Great atmosphere, I felt the staff was very friendly too and not to mention the food was just as great :)

Will definitely come back when I may my way back to SFC :D
author: Sharon L.

description:
finally good mexican food i don't have to travel to the heart of the Mission for. 
Guac- suuuper delicious, 
Pico De Gallo is at the self serve salsa bar and is also super tasty on just about everything, along with the other different red and green salsa's there. 
I ordered the Shrimp Burrito, which was good, but they overloaded on the Sour Cream, so you may have to mention something when ordering, 
the rice and beans are pretty good also, oh and the chips they give you when you sit down are crispy and light! really good! 

The reason I'm giving them four instead of five stars is because how inconvenient it is to get up wait in a huge line, and ask for a lime or two. i wish they would just put them at the salsa bar.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Great food - free chips and salsa with fresh homemade chips and 4 kinds of salsa. The house margarita is very strong. Everything I tasted merits 5 stars. But that's only for the food.

They don't accept dinner reservations for groups larger than 4. Fine. But then, once we had a table - which we had to wait for despite having a reservation - they rushed us. As soon as they cleared the plates, they plunked down our check with an 18% auto-added gratuity, and not one word. Great - so we paid our checks and were finishing up our drinks when the waiter comes back and literally says "The manager says there are people waiting for this table. You can go to the bar if you like..."

We were there to celebrate a birthday - and even that meant nothing to the mysteriously absent but hard-hearted management.

SERIOUSLY? After we spent more than $100 at your restaurant, we can't even finish our drinks without being shooed out? Ridiculously unprofessional, and inappropriate.

Don't bother with this place if you would like a leisurely dining experience or even just a place where the managers don't kick you out as soon as your food is finished.
author: Diane Y.

description: Hands down the BEST Mexican restaurant i have ever been to! The chips and salsa - the environment - the service - the FOOD!!!  So ridiculously good - trust me I know Mexican food and this is DELICIOUS!!!! I have not had any better tacos al pastor than the ones I had here
author: Ana C.

description:
Where do I begin............. We had a 7:00pm reservation for four people on a Saturday night. We arrived 10 minutes late, and told the hostess we were still missing one person. They were totally fine with that and sat us anyways. The place was not very busy with tons of tables open, so we did not feel bad sitting down with only three of us.

Our waiter came over and was very short with us... took our drink order and was off. Chips & Salsa were dropped off, and the drinks were dropped off. The waiter did not come back for atleast another 10-15 minutes. When he did our drinks were almost empty.. he did not ask if we wanted another, but asked what time our reservation was at. I answered 7. He then asked what time we got here, which I answered 7:15. He was rudely walked away with out saying anything.

We then decided to order food and more drinks before he spit in our food... so we flagged him down to come over. He took our orders and left again. Seriously SOO RUDE!!!!!!!!!!!! It was sad too because the place is fun, food is good, and margaritas are delicious! 

Wished the managers/waiters would learn good customer service.
author: Brittany H.

description: Ate lunch here and it was great!   It was quick and tasty, flavors were spot-on, restaurant was clean and well decorated.  Had the house marg and was not a fan.  Pork tamale had a lot of fat in it.  The guac app, shrimp enchilada/chicken enchilada we shared were perfect for lunch.
author: Toasty R.

description: I feel like I went on a bad day. Seems the food has potential but it wasn't the freshest that day. I hate the whole self serve salsa bar and all the birds in the outdoor seating area drove me crazy. I may try again but doubt it.
author: Tali L.

description:
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in San Francisco. I am really picky when it gets to Mexican restaurants after one unfortunate surprise which I found in my burrito few years ago.

I like to come over to Tropisueño during lunch hours (cheaper).  It gets really crowded, so come early.

If you are visiting San Francisco and you are in downtown that is the place to get your lunch.

I am usually getting chicken super burrito and share half with my husband as it is HUGE.  Also I love their salsa selection.

@ Tropisueño, thank you
author: Dasha T.

description:
TLDR:
- Charming decor. City becomes tropical shack.
- Yes to chicken mole.
- Yes to the complimentary chips and dips, house-made.
- Portions are large.
- Great for entertaining people and go-to dinners out.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I know a good margarita when I see one and at the ever faithful Tropi, I've come to expect a buzzing happy hour crowd and a bottle slinging bartender relentlessly pouring glass after glass. 

The unique chili salt rims every house margarita glass and they only use the finest products to assure your beverage is 100% fresh and 100% hater free. No crum quality Rose's lime or other artificial whackness makes its way into any of their flagship libations. Head there after work on a Friday and you're likely to be met with a bustling SOMA crowd, but any other happy hour during the week and its more manageable. Even still, scoring a drink isn't all that tricky with the acrobatic bartenders pouring multiple servings per jig.

Chips and salsa are so the thing... especially since they're complimentary and what's perhaps most awesome is the varied dips you can enjoy. The salsa verde might be my favorite, but I know people who swear by the spicy creamy tomato option. Food is great for such a high volume restaurant and service is super speedy. I can't stop coming back for more.
author: Monica S.

description:
I first came here 3 years ago when they opened for lunch with one of "kids" and immediately fell for their chips! THE best lightest, crispiest perfectly salted chips and tasty salsas, I ever had! These are not your typical chips-from-a-humongous-Costco-bag kind of chips! In the following year to year & a half, I went back a few times and brought a few friends for pre-movie drinks & apps (they're $5 margaritas & 3-ceviche combo is THE best!) and dinner with out of town friends I was a little worried that their dinner crowd was quite a large as the lunch crowd!

But recently, I went back for dinner and was told by our server that they are busy ALL the time now for dinner and they are trying to secure a 2nd location! I am SOOOOO excited for Tropisueno! 

This time I tried for the 1st time their Guaraches or "Cochinitos" - 3 different types of pork from carnitas and & pineapple to a pulled pork with herbs and crema served on their individual DELICSIOUSLY crispy corn guarache-shaped tortillas with black beans, rice and a side order of their fresh guacamole!! The flavors were perfection! I maybe could have used a couple slices of lime on the side but my real only regret was that I wasn't hungrier to try other dishes as I normally would be!
author: Carmen M.

description: Visiting from out of town, we turned to yelp in search of good Mexican and made our way to Tropisueno. At the peak of Friday happy hour, it was bustling. We settled in at the bar for a drink and stayed for our meal. The space was warm and welcoming. The staff were friendly and great ambassadors! The food was delicious. We loved the chorizo cigarillos. The dried beef taco was amazing! My boyfriend loved the mole chicken. Cocktails were tastey, too. Following the lead of a regular next to us, I tried an off-menu drink that could knock your socks off (If Ramen is behind the bar, ask for his Deviled Egg)!
author: Malia S.

description: Went last minute and was pleasantly surprised.  Restaurant was busy, but wait was short.  Being from Texas, I'm pretty picky about my Mexican food.  While the beef may have been to rare for some, it was cooked perfectly for me.  Enchiladas and salsas were great!  Pricing a little on the high side.  Margaritas were mediocre.  If I lived in San Francisco I would be returning.
author: Danielle D.

description: Two and a half hour wait for delivery and the order was wrong. When we called to have them being the correct order, they said that they weren't responsible for the accuracy of the order.
author: Will S.

description:
It's ok, food wise. Atmosphere is fun and pretty authentic. The wood latilla ceiling probably set the proprietors back some funds. The decor is inspired and seems as though someone really had a vision for the place at some point. 
On a Monday night after an event nearby co hosted by the mexican consulate the restaurant was packed. But my high hopes for great food were dashed when the guacamole ($7.50) came out looking like it was purchased at trajer joes three days earlier. The green color was oxidizing into brown even though there was a good amount of lime present in the avocado. Why wasn't it fresh?
The biggest disappointment came from the chicken mole entree. The initially flavorful sauce gave way to the discovery of raw...ish chicken underneath. Now I was worried I was going to become ill. But heck two bites of raw chicken never killed anyone or??
The rest of the food was passable and better in theory (menu description) than in practice. Again the place was packed, maybe its different on other nights? Maybe people go for the drinks, I cant tell from one visit if it sucks or just an off night. But if you go... try lunch I hear it is less of an investment all around.
author: Savannah G.

description: I have been here a few times now and it is amazing every time. Margaritas are great and the food is even better. They also give you chips and a trio of salsa. This is one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Hannah D.

description:
I've got mixed feelings. Food was delicious, which is most important. But the service style was not my cup of tea. So first the good stuff:
   1) Chile Rellenos - were not overly cheesy, red sauce was perfect
   2) Horchata - flavor was just right, but got a bit too gritty at the bottom
   3) Salsa bar - will leave everyone happy. I liked everyone of their salsas actually, and enjoyed changing up my chip dip throughout my meal. 
   4) Bathroom was really well kept, decor was also well done. Love the booths near the front windows, as well as the wood on the ceilings.

Now for the bad
   1) I don't like the cafeteria style service. I guess thats what a taqueria is. Or maybe they just do this during lunch time. Anyhow, the wait was long..... 
   2) I was eating there, and yet they gave me horchata in a plastic cup?!?!?! ummmm, why? Seriously, lets keep it green folks. 
   3) They use lard in their refried beans. So if you are vegetarian be aware. Also, you should probably ask for all the veggie options, just in the event they are adding animal products into other items. 
   4) Don't forget to ask for chips, otherwise you won't get them. I think I'd prefer if the staff offered us some while we paid, instead of us having to figure that out from observing people around us.

I will probably return here next time I'm in the area. Got a good sized meal for a reasonable price when I split a platter with my SO.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Arrived on a Thurs night with party of 6.  No reservations. Was told that a table was wrapping up soon and we would be seated in 20 min. So we went to the bar but was ignored because it was understaffed and one of the bartenders was too busy flirting with 2 girls in front of him.  After 45 min the manager said in a mean way "You didn't have reservations!" as if that has anything to do with them telling us it would be 20 min and it ended up being more than 45. We didn't like the attitude at the bar or by the manager, so we went to the Indian place 2 doors down, sat immediately and had a great meal.
author: Andy J.

description:
A couple years ago I went to the Yelp elite event at Tropisueno. I remember enjoying myself thoroughly but I never went back up until last weekend. I met a few girlfriends for a pre-Bridesmaids movie dinner (have you seen it yet? If not, don't walk RUN to theaters). 

Their margaritas are top notch and we made it just in time for one on happy hour for $5. They don't use any of that margarita, sweet and sour pre-mix crap. They make everything from scratch with lime juice and agave. 

Guacamole was delicious but there wasn't a whole lot of it for what you pay. I had the two item dinner plate, an enchilada and a taco. Both were good but didn't blow me away. I wonder if this has more to do with the fact that I'm not a huge fan of this style of Mexican food. 

In the future, I'd much rather come here for a happy hour and some chips and salsa - no dinner necessary.
author: Julia N.

description:
Usually the place "right around the corner" from work sucks.  Let's face it.  You only go here for convenience, but the food is just ok.  Fortunately for me, the norm didn't hold true at Tropisueño.
The food is as authentic as the decor if not more and the tacos I ordered were just right portion-wise (the entrees on the other hand were massive)!  All of the ingredients taste as if they were just picked right before you walked in and ordered up your meal and it's great for group - a definite draw.
One thing I missed out on the first time I stopped in was the trio of salsas they bring out.  I ordered a delicious mojito this afternoon and nibbled on the tortilla chips and salsa, expecting it to be typical munchy bar food.  Instead, the spicy, cheesy, and refreshing salsas kept my tastebuds guessing.  I didn't know what favor would hit me when and how.  All this from salsa?  Good to know!
There aren't enough waiters/waitresses and I noticed that we had to wait awhile to give any service, but when we did, all the food and drinks were correct and worth the wait.
I am so happy my friend and I were lazy today. It made going back to Tropisueño an easy decision, even though I wasn't blown away the first time. Sometimes a second date seals the deal.  It did for me!
author: Elsa M.

description:
There are many delicious, authentic Mexican restaurants in San Francisco. This is not one of them. 

My steak quesadilla was edible, but didn't taste of much beyond cumin. The guacamole would have been improved by more lime, more salt, more jalapeno, more cilantro, and more avocado.

The confusing mix of self-service and table service (for instance, waiters bring the chips, but you get your own salsa) didn't improve the experience either.

If you're looking for a cheap, Mexican-ish lunch, may I recommend one of the two Chipotle locations within three blocks of this place for superior tacos and burritos?
author: Amy L.

description:
Went here with my bf because a coworker of mine recommended it. I was greeted by a very friendly hostess who sat us down. Our waiter was very nice and seem pleased to be serving us. For an appetizer, my boyfriend and I had tostaditas de carnitas which is roasted pork on crispy tortillas and it had guacamole and lettuce. The carnitas were really mouth watering good. I don't remember what my boyfriend had that night but I had Chicken with Mole Poblano. It sounded delicious and different so I wanted it. When I first got it I was so happy but when I took a bite of the chicken, it was okay. Nothing too special, at first. But the more I kept eating, the more I liked. 

Overall I had a great experience and I'll definitely go there again some time soon because of its authenticity. Also I loved hearing all the salsa and merengue songs they played that I grew up listening to.
author: Alexa P.

description: SO it was ok.  It was Friday night, crowded, loud, but we had a 7:00 pm reservation for three.  Two of us walked in and we were seated immediately.  Upon being seated we were immediately given menus and asked what we wanted to drink.  We explained it was our first visit so we needed to look at the menu and our waiter hovered.  Right as we placed our drink orders (we both got the Tropisueno and it was the right choice) the chips and 3 kinds of salsa arrive.  Chips are warm and salted just like I like them, but a little too thin for dipping IMHO.  All the salas were excellent, but the green salsa (tomatillo) was good and earthy and I really enjoyed it.  Our friend arrives, she settles in gives her drink order to the waiter and we all really start looking at the menu.  Our orders were the Chile Verde with pork cooked so tender you almost didn't have to chew it, Tampiqueno (I think my friend enjoyed it even though the server came two times trying to take it away when she was clearly not finished eating) and mine the Chile Relleno (honestly, I can be wrong but my first impression was that the sauce came from a can, and my meal was not warm, but not really cold.  Also, the rice was so hard a piece of it got caught in my throat.)  Depending on what was ordered, the food ranged from delicious to whatever.  At the end of our meal the server put on our table a little container with lollipops when he brought our bill.  In hindsight we should have grabbed them right away because after he got payment and his tip (20%, mind you) he grabbed the container with the 3 lollipops and actually dropped them on the floor as he turned away.  Yeah.  Whatever.  I would probably go again but would hope for a different server and would definitely order something different.
author: Laura K.

description:
I'm eating here wayyy too much lately. But I'm not complaining!

Finally got to try the Santo Margarita with Saint Germaine - absolutely tantalizing and heck, it has two of my favorite liquors in it! 

Our waiter upsold us on some guacamole, also doing a great job selling me on drinks I haven't tried yet. And the rice is improving a lot since my first review, this time around it was very very similar to my mom's style and I actually finished most of my plate. Erin, the owner, has reached out to me twice now on Yelp to thank me, too. Great to see the positive swing she and her staff takes towards their business.
author: Alita M.

description: So I went back and have been impressed with the service and received the correct order both times. Perhaps it was a fluke that I received the wrong food but it should never really be an issue. Their burritos are large even my San Francisco standards and they give you a lot of chips in when ordering to go.
author: Marquez G.

description: Everything awesome! Food (including some of the best chips and set of salsas anywhere), drinks, and bartenders. Would totally recommend, and can't wait to go back.
author: Lisa G.

description:
Went here for a birthday party on Saturday. There were 20 of us and as you can imagine not everyone arrived on time. Luckily here you order you food at the counter, pay and them have it delivered. They don't take reservations, so we went early to save a long row of tables right by the window. This was easy and the staff didn't mind. 

The food here is good. I got the 3 item combo: chicken tamale with mole, chicken taco and chicken enchilada with mole. The food was great, but the mole was $1 more for each item which meant that my $11.95 lunch became $13.95. The combo is one of the more expensive things on the menu, tacos are much cheaper.  Add $10 for a watery margarita and you have one expensive lunch!  Next time I will skip the drink.   

The staff was very good in clearing plates and bringing more chips. 

I will definitely go here again with a big group!
author: Heather C.

description:
A bit crowded, but understandable when you taste the epic burritos. I got the steak, and it was delicious as well as massive. I take my Mexican as seriously as any Gringo with no discernible Spanish skills whatsoever, and this one was a total winner. 

Be prepared to order when they get to you in line, as that queue moves at a pretty quick pace. The steak was plentiful, and the other ingredients were so fresh I could taste them in every bite. Also the chips and salsa were really good and plentiful. There were also multiple salsa options for you to select. Doing that rare thing where you actually get a craving for something as you type this.

Went back to meet up with some friends for Happy Hour, but got kicked out of our table at 6:30 because Happy Hour was over. Not sure if that's common in the area, but getting run out of a table always makes me uncomfortable. But the staff was up front with our party, and there were laminated cards on the table letting us know the deal before they even sat down.
author: Collin S.

description: HAIR HAIR HAIR - gross! Although I've eaten here quite a few times and enjoyed my meal, today there was a very long black hair embedded in my burrito to my surprise. There is simply no exception for hair in your food.
author: Matt D.

description: The food was alright and the place was clean; all I can really take back from the experience was how you had to shout to be heard during the dinner conversations....The acoustics mixed with the seating arrangement here was just awful.
author: Char M.

description: A popular place recommended by lots of different sources including locals.  In town for a conference, and craving good Cali Mexican food (coming from Hawaii).  Service was good and at expectation.  Ambiance was busy and loud, but it was a Saturday dinner at 7:30pm.  Food was uncomplicated, straight forward, and flavorful.  Had the carne asado taco and chicken enchilada combo, friends got the hanger steak dish (forgot the name sorry).  All around very satisfied with our Cali Mexican food fix.  Bonus: it was right out the door from the Marriott Marquis where we stayed.
author: James H.

description:
I've been on a quest for great  tequila. I was in Cancun a couple of weeks ago for spring break (I KNOW I KNOW) and spent as much time looking around for unique tequilas as I did frolicking on the beach and saying no to crafts people (no gracias please go away also please do not behead me THANK YOU). 

I like the dark aged tequilas well enough, but I am really moving towards high quality silvers, chilled, straight up with a little twist of lime. Amazing citrusy flavors and with the right tequila, very little burn. 

It all started at the bar at Tropisueno where I was taking suggestions from the bartender and this guy sitting next to me, who, it turns out, was the brand ambassador for Fortaleza (How cool is that job?). 

I drank a number of unique silver tequilas that night, but the smoothest and best was definitely the Fortaleza. It's kind of hard to find but totally worth the hunt.  As usual at these nicer Mexican places, I like to sit at the bar and graze on the appetizers, and they were particularly good at Tropisueno.  The al pastor taco truck style tacos with pineapple, onion, and cilantro were muy delicioso. 

But wait, there's more. See, the Fortaleza guy, despite having the best job in the world, turned in to a raging lunatic asshole about an hour in to my litlle saunter down tequila lane. I swear we were just sitting there chatting nicely when he starts hurling insults at me. At first I laughed, you know like when a friend starts hurling insults, but this wasn't like that. I don't know if the dude was just a twat and the tequila released it, or if he had untreated Tourettes or what. And I'm also pretty sure I didnt comment on his dwarf-like stature or ask if his mother did donkey shows in Tijuana. 

All I know is that was 6 months ago and I vividly remember the name of the brand he was pushing and have since bought 3 bottles. 

Well played sir.
author: Jay Z.

description: Excellent food excellent drinks excellent bartenders!!! Went Friday night. Wait was 45mins to a hour. Ended up being able to find seats at the bar. Immediately was serviced. Chips and salsa was great. And even though it was a busy night service was AMAZING.... So very happy with my whole experience here!!!
author: Kendra S.

description:
Mole, mole, mole!....This is the first time I tried a mole dish and based on the yelp reviews, it just made sense.  The chicken was perfectly prepared, tender, juicy, covered with this wonderful sauce of love.  Yes, it was sauce of love...people say there's like 12 different ingredients in the sauce...honestly, I really don't care what's in it as long as the end result stays consistently good.  

Being the drink of choice for a Mexican restaurant, we of course ordered a round of margaritas.  They were strong...i mean really strong, like just drinking tequila with a squeeze of lime strong.  I know I'm a light weight, but damn, these were almost hard to drink.  But, I guess it's always better to get more alcohol than less right?
author: Melanie S.

description:
Came here with a friend to check it out for an event we are hosting later in the year. Scallops appetizer (Callos a la Plancha) is super yummy! I had the Tampiqueno which was so much food for the price - ended up taking half of it home with me.  Watermelon Margarita was the margarita of the day and that was so needed on a warm City day. 

Great atmosphere, great staff, awesome food, a chill environment and outdoor seating, what more could you want?
author: Chrissy R.

description: Had the most amazing pollo asado tacos there. They were perfectly seasoned and the chicken was so tender. Some of the best chicken tacos I've ever had. Their salsa sampler that comes before the meal was also a nice treat, delicious!
author: Sara A.

description:
food was great. top notch service. they were very accommodating: 
- i carelessly messed up my reservations online (put down 2 instead of 4), they allowed me to correct over the phone
- i also asked to change the reservation time and they had no issue squeezing my friends and i in
- i wanted to surprise one of my friends with a cake for her birthday, so i left it with them earlier in the day before dinner. they kept it in the refrigerator for me and brought it out after we finished our meals (with a candle!) 
- i even changed my reservation size again for an unexpected guest. 

excellent staff, the level of service really made our night.
author: Goucho S.

description:
So my friend took me here for dinner this evening (thanks friend) and it was a very pleasant surprise.

I had a margarita to wash down the chips and tasty salsa, then ordered the tampiquena and my friend ordered the mahi mahi.  

Perfectly cooked, seasoned and thin cut of meat.  I ordered another margarita to wash that down.  For dessert, tres leches guey, what else?!?

Overall it was yummy and I would definitely go back.  They even had a Yucatecan dish on the menu which I was tempted to try.  Maybe next time.

Dios potic, cosh joicep.  Ask a Mayan what that means.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Lunch: stand in line to order & servers bring your food to you.
Dinner: be seated & order from your server

Lunch and dinner are completely different. I think I like eating lunch here much more than dinner. During lunch, the salsa bar is open so you have access to at least 5 or 6 different kinds of salsa as well as other sides like peppers and onions. During dinner, they give you large bowl of chips and 2 kinds of salsa. The 25 cent chupa chups are free at dinner. Also, I like the lunch menu more because there are more dishes and combinations.

We got the empanadas, beef chile relleno, soft taco, and enchilada. The pork was especially soft. The chile relleno was smothered in cheese. It was great. The chips and dips were great too. Our server was nice, cool, and attentive. Too bad we had to wait a while for our bill though.

Total: $30 for 2 people
author: Jennifer W.

description:
We stopped by on Saturday evening for a bite to eat.  We didn't have reservations and it was packed so we were given a choice of waiting about 20 minutes or eating at the communal table.  We chose the communal table and were glad we did because, while it was cozy and loud (I think the whole restaurant is loud - that's just the kind of place it is), the drinks and chips and salsa came quickly and that's exactly what we wanted. 

Hubby had a Diet Coke.  What is it with San Francisco and canned pops?  No fountains anywhere?  I meant to ask the waiter that but forgot.  I had a glass of sangria and really, you only need a glass or two because it was delicious but oh so strong!  The chips were heavenly:  hot and fresh and crunchy and salty.  The perfect tortilla chip.  It was served with a trio of salsas:  a spicy red, a salsa verde and a bright orange salsa that I originally thought was queso.  I loved all three and couldn't really choose which I preferred.

For our main meals, he had the Los Favoritos, choosing a chicken taco and a chicken flauta.  I sneaked a taste of the chicken taco and it was exactly how it looked:  fresh and flavorful.  I decided on two appetizers, the tacos al pastor and the crispy flautas.  The flautas were AH-MAZING.  Crunchy and so yummy.  If I go back, I will order these as a main meal and not share them with him, as I did on this trip.  The tacos al pastor were tasty, but I'm not a huge fan of soft corn tortillas.  The pork was good but I preferred the chicken tacos.  

We had a fun time.  It is a great bar environment and the communal table allowed us to spy on others' dining choices and still have a fun conversation in the midst of the bustle of the restaurant.  It is a bit off the main drag and you might miss it if you decide it's too dark and not want to walk the distance to get to it, but really it's close to everything and you'll be glad you made the detour.
author: Jean S.

description:
A friend and I went in and sat at the bar for dinner and drinks on a Wednesday night. The food was excellent including the very delicious trio of salsas and the drinks are fantastic. They have variety of salt options for your margarita which is impressive and Manuel was kind enough to walk me through the options and made sure we had everything we needed, which I loved.

Remi and Alex were the most gracious bar tenders and made our evening extremely enjoyable and we had a great time.

I rarely write reviews but I was so pleased with my experience I felt it was my duty to let them know. If I could give it more stars I would. I'll definitely be going back to this place if I'm in San Francisco again.
author: C. M.

description: I really enjoyed the food and was full at the end of the meal.  3 types of salsa is a big plus to me.  I would definitely recommend this place, but make sure you make reservations or you might have to wait a while!
author: Anil P.

description:
Had a great Friday night dinner with friends here.  We were early for our rezervation so we sat at the bar. GREAT bartenders - super friendly, talkative and made good drink suggestions.   When our table was ready we ordered platanos fritos and ceviche for apps - YUMMO.  Not the best platanos i've had, but pretty good. For dinner we had the Tampiqueno (it was standard, prob wouldn't order again), chile verde (the BF said it was really good), flautas (from the apps menu - pretty good).  

THe place is great for a social night out.  Lively and fun environment but not cheesy.  It was loud and the drinks were flowing (at least for us).  I wouldn't say its the best mexican ever, but its good enough for me to return for a fun dinner with friends.
author: Evelyn R.

description:
Best. House. Margarita. Ever!!

My friend and I came here after work, wanting a place to catch up, drink and have dinner. We were not disappointed. The minute we walked in we were in love. It has a rustic/country atmosphere and romantical lighting. We were seated immediately, despite the crowded bar and brought chips and salsa. I could have had that and been a happy camper. The three salsas are delicious! And then came the margaritas...perfect amount of agave and tequila. We both ordered the two item combo (mostly bc we didn't want to spend $20 each on an entree)   my carnitas taco was flavorful and the meat was so juicy. the sauce on the chicken enchilada was amazing. My friend had a taco and a flauta...it must have been good bc by the end, both our plates were completely empty

It is a little loud, but given its location it could have been much worse. Staff was friendly and attentive, and our two dinners and 4 margaritas came out to $55...not too shabby!
author: ashley B.

description:
Great spot for lunch. They have all the stuff you would expect plus more.

I had the Tropisueño torta - which had carne asada, pollo and carnitas and it was delicious. Horchata was tasty as well. Chips and salsa - crisp and tasty. 

Would definitely go again.
author: Hari B.

description: This place is the business! I could eat the chips and salsa for days! I've eaten burritos, quesadillas, and tacos here. They're all legit. Lines always out the door but they take care of you pretty quickly.
author: Renee S.

description: Love this place for lunch, happy hour, and/or drinks, but it can get crowded.
author: A C.

description: I hate to write reviews that are on the lower end of the 5 stars but I always give my honest opinion. I was out in SF on a short get away with friends and found this place on Yelp that was only a few blocks from my hotel. We walked in and loved the ambiance of the restaurant. It reminded me of a little local hangout in Mexico. We walked up to the counter to ask for a table and were told we were suppose to order with the ladies behind the counter (I guess we were in the middle of the happy hour and dinner switch-A-roo). We ordered our food and were given a number and the waiter would bring our food to our table. We tried to get a table in the dining room but it was closed because they were setting up for dinner, so we sat right in front of the counter where you order. We ordered a couple of drinks and waited for our food. Food showed up but still no drinks. As we began to eat the waiter asked us to get up for a second so they could close the opening were you walk up to order, no biggie it only took a second, we continued eating our meals and still no drinks. After eating about half of our meal the drinks finally showed up. The would was ok and for me to say that it's not saying too much. I guess when it comes to Mexican food I'm picky so it takes a lot to impress me.
author: Josh O.

description:
Wow..1000+ reviews?!?!?!!!

But, they are great!! I've been there mostly for dinners, and I think my favorite may actually be their free chips and dips!  The cheese one is soooo warm and gooey and absolutely delish!!!  Lunch was okay, but no warm cheese.. and it was more cafeteria style.. um.. it was okay.. Must try the carne asada and the guacamole dip.. they actually taste pretty good together..is it just me?
author: Grace C.

description: One of my favorite Mexican spots in the city. The tacos are massive. The fish taco is amazing
author: Hitesh M.

description: We love Tropisueno and always try to eat here when we are in the city.  They have the best tortilla chips I have ever tasted.  Their salsas are delicious, too:  red pepper, green salsa, and habanero, in increasing order of hotness.  Everyone, from the tender-mouthed to the Texan, can enjoy them!  I had a shrimp dish that was very spicy, but not too hot, served in a creamy sauce (I can't remember the name)--it was fantastic.  My husband had chicken enchiladas, which he pronounced delicious.  Service is fast and organized.  If you get reservations, you are generally seated right away, though you can't get online reservations too close to the start of service, so you do have to plan ahead. We will be back!
author: Sadie B.

description: First time visiting after hearing the name way too many times...was pleasantly surprised.  Higher class environment than normal Mexican food places and the food was equally as good.  Their chips were outstanding and the guacamole was amazing.  The tacos we good just right.  No complaints!
author: G. V.

description:
I'm going to say right away that I use and abuse this place during its daytime taqueria hours. I stroll right on up, get in its face, make sweet love to their chili relleno burritos, and then, with a smug sense of dominance and superiority, I drop my ten-spot at the register and walk away feeling like a man.

I might have even fist-bumped someone on my way out the door... 

Yes, I know this place is open in the evenings. I've been, and it's pretty darn good. I recall some delicious tacos with pineapple and cilantro on top, and an excellent dish that was comprised of a fried corn masa shell stuffed with chorizo and cheese. And sure, I'd go back again for an evening/dinner rendezvous, but I gotta say, I'm a guy who likes to handle my floozies on MY time, and only during daylight hours. It keeps'em from expecting too much.

So when all is said and done, I'm gonna stick to the lunch hour trysts. I like my super chili relleno burrito, all battered and fried golden, the melted cheese like a flaxen maiden of yore. And I even enjoy my moments with the darker-featured, though equally sexy super carnitas burrito. So meaty, and just all man. Mmmmm. And hell, since we're on the topic, I'm not ashamed to admit that I'm tempted by the occasional tamale from time to time. Doesn't make me less of a man. In fact, since I've started frequenting this place, there's more of me than there ever was before.
author: Brian K.

description:
The Happy Hour specials here cannot be beat! Their $5 margaritas are strong, their small plates are actually pretty big, and if you make it in on time you can have a whole meal plus drinks for not a whole lot at all. They serve standard fares like tacos, flautas, quesadilla, and ceviche, and everything we ordered was tasty.

I have also been here for dinner, and their entrees are actually quite good, and real big too. I would recommend splitting a big entree and getting one or two appetizers. We had Molotes de Elote y Chorizo, which are chorizo-filled corn mesa goodness that's deep fried and served on a bed of beans. DELICIOUS. Their Mole Poblano sauce is also amazing. Makes me want to order more rice and sop it all up!

Dinner can get busy tho. My suggestion is to come at 5:30 and get some happy hour priced drinks in you, maybe one small plate to share, and then move to a table to get your serious eating face on. No shame in scraping leftover sauce into a take-out box (we did!).
author: Melissa M.

description:
Solid Mexican restaurant with good food and good drinks.  

We came on a Friday night and the waiting area and bar was packed.  The host told us the wait would be 1.5 hours, but it seemed like we were seated in half the time (sure helped that we had a baby and stroller on hand).  Service was friendly and helpful from both the host and the wait staff the entire night.  

My mojito was made well with just the right amount of mint and lime and buzz.  The tacos al pastor were hearty with the corn tortillas going well with the flavorful pastor pork.  The flavors were good, but unfortunately for this place I've had EXCELLENT pastor so this place turned out just ok.   Accompanied with some good planatos made for a tasty meal.  My husband's ceviche appetizer was also tasty and not too raw slimy, but I personally don't care for ceviches in general so am not a good judge of them.  The waiter was nice enough to bring us a sample of their mole sauce, which we thought was alright (had better mole elsewhere too).  Overall the menu options were solid yet limited in selection.  Plenty of grilled meat entree options but I expected more from the tacos and other similar fare.  

Solid Mexican food option in a trendy, hip part of town.  Definitely a lot going on for this place.
author: Enigmajic O.

description:
I met a friend here who was visiting from out of town and had an unexpectedly great experience!  I was pretty pleased with this place all around, food, drinks, service.  Perhaps the only difficult thing was finding parking, and even that was achieved with a little patience!

Lets start with food.  The bf and I shared the tacos al pastor and the ceviche de pescado.  I was a bit upset that they did not have the tostada de camarones, which we initially requested.  The food we received was delicious though.  Especially the tacos al pastor.  That dish is surprisingly easy to screw up, but not here!  

Drinks: I had a cocktail made with tequila and cucumber. (I can't remember the name).  I had never heard of a drink like this but I love cucumber so I figured it was worth a try.  This may be one of my new favorite drinks!  And there are several others on the menu I would love to try.  

Service:  No complaints here.  We arrived late after my friends had already eaten and had no trouble getting service.  Chips and salsa were plentiful and delicious.

I'm a fan :)
author: Erin T.

description:
I've had this place on my bookmark for quite a while. With friends living just down the street, I knew that my visit was only a matter of time.
I really enjoyed the Mahi-Mahi, and luxuriously nomed on guacamole and chips. 

My cohorts were not expecting to stand in line, quickly order and seat yourself, so you won't get a better report from them. Maybe now that they know what to expect, the format won't be the only thing they remember.

Great food, great price, very tasty. I look forward to revisiting.
author: Candice T.

description: Awesome place with a fun atmosphere! Chips and Salsa were delicious. I ordered some spicy shrimp dish and my husband ordered a carne asada dish, in which he dint like as much. But mine hit the spot. Oh, and tres leches for dessert was, SUPERB!
author: BilalandRabia K.

description:
for vegetarians - the pozole is a strong 10 and enchiladas were an 8. black beans and rice are made veg. 

Margaritas were good, too.

We had great service and really enjoyed our meal.
author: aaron f.

description: This place is my ultimate guilty pleasure for Margaritas. The bartenders are so much fun and super nice. Plus the chips and salsa hit the spot perfectly.
author: Megan U.

description:
Got the pollo asado. Chicken was tender, and the sides on the plate were pretty good. Could've  used more veggies, but I usually think that for everything. 
Portions are huge! Ate half and brought half home
Chips (brought to the table) are delicious. 
Service was great.
author: Victoria K.

description:
A bit hard to find if you've never been before, but this place is a gem! Awesome staff and service, and great food. Upon seating you're immediately offered chips and a tray of 3 different salsas. The green and yellow salsas are my favorite. I love having a variety to choose from rather than just one bowl of house salsa. It's nice for a change. Like a little salsa tour.

Don't fill up too much on the chips and salsa because the food here is absolutely fantastic. I ordered the 2 item combo with a carne asada taco and chicken flauta. My dish came with rice, beans, and a little side of guacamole. That's what I'm talkin' about! What other mexican restaurant gives you a portion of guac without having to pay an extra $2? I don't know of many. My meal was $11 or so which is extremely decent.

Their margaritas are wonderful too. I ended up choosing the classic, but they have some fantastic varieties I'm willing to try in the future.

A great spot for lunch or dinner, I'll be back!
author: Ashley D.

description: Great ambiance, awesome location, delicious food, and very attentive service. I tried the pork chop and it is really good. The Taco el pastor is good too but I kinda prefer not to have pinneaple in it. Chips and salsa is great and very fulfilling. Main entree comes a bit slow, but for the food quality, I'm not dissapointed.
author: Novalina N.

description: 5 stars for the margaritas! Don't know much about the food but enjoyed the chips, salsa, and guac. Came here on a Friday night last month. Tried their regular margaritas and premium. Enjoyed both. Great spot for the area when craving margaritas.
author: Zannie S.

description: I came here for dinner one night and the food was just "ok".  I wouldn't consider the food to be truly authentic - everything seemed to have a modern twist and it just didn't work well for Mexican fare.  The chips and salsa were good, but not enough to make the meal.  The service was very good considering it was Oracle OpenWorld and every place was super busy.
author: T U.

description:
Tropisueno is an office favorite. They are very quick when it comes to taking your order, and the food is always delicious. They great selection of sauces to go with your chips.

I recommend getting the chicken enchiladas with black beans and guac. Nom nom!
author: Jason M.

description: taqueria by day, chipotle setup with many more meat choices and expanded menu with mole and tortas, taco salads and fajitas, tostadas and quesadillas, chile rellenos,  etc.  something for everyone.  portion size is grande.  bring 5 friends, get free drinks at the bar.   the tropinsueno torta was loaded with carne asada, grilled chicken, carnitas and chorizo all mashed up and spicy.  not quite the individual variety of flavors I was looking for.
author: Rob C.

description: Love Tropisueño's margaritas! Made with spicy salt and agave nectar! YUM I could gulp these down all night! As for the fish tacos...Lose one star...Their ok, but nothing special. Underdogs has WAY better fish tacos, but definitely a happy hour must!
author: Natalia H.

description: Great food, great atmosphere, great service. I highly recommend the huaraches with 3 kinds of pork (Chile Verde, al pastor, carnitas).
author: Jake U.

description:
Surprisingly there aren't a lot of Mexican food choices in SOMA for lunch.  Tropisueno fills that void and fills it well.  Actually, it's really damn yummy and I'd even rank it up there with the Mission Street Taquerias.  

The food is muy authentico, very fresh and super tasty.  The rice is hella fluffy, the meat super savory and juicy.

I can only comment on the lunch menu as I've only ever been for lunch.  My go to's at Mexican restaurants are usually cheese enchiladas.  I'm usually a fan of red enchilada sauce, but the green sauce at Tropisueno is pretty solid.  I like the slight tang to the sauce.

The guac here is also really good.  Thinking about the tomatoes and lime juice in it has got me hungry.

My favorite part is the salsa bar they have just to the right of the bar near the main seating area.  You've got about 5 or 6 salsa's to try.  Sometimes, when the place is not crowded they even bring chips to munch on.

Definitely miss having this place close by for lunch.
author: Kyle W.

description: For lunch it's outstanding. I have had their burritos, tamales, tacos and tortas all top notch and for the price it beats the hell out of Chipotle. Lunch with a drink is less than 10 bucks. I used to work in the area and would frequent the place at least once a week.
author: .James A.

description:
I can't stop thinking about their spicy orange salsa! It's part of their salsa bar which is awesome. I think it's much better than La Victoria Taqueria's orange sauce (legendary in San Jose)and contends with Papalote for best salsa in SF. I always love Mexican places that have an open (salsa) bar. Their chips were also great. Good crunch, not too greasy and more on the thin side.

The carne asada burrito I had was ENORMOUS. I was so full after it. The meat was a tender medium done-ness. Paired with some of the salsas from the salsa bar made for an excellent burrito. 

A great place for good Mexican especially if you work in FiDi. Can get pretty crowded during lunch time so try to avoid rush hour.  You order at the front and they bring your food out to you. During the wait time, load up on salsa!
author: Brian L.

description: I'm a fan! Everything from the chips to entrees, was so yummy! I'm a vegetarian and although I did not have a ton of options to choose from, I liked what the waiter picked for us. The location is also pretty nice - Yerba Buena in SF. Definitely coming back here!
author: Vinitha I.

description:
My five star rating is coming from the fact that I came to this place right after my first half marathon run in the SF Marathon and this place definitely hit the spot for me!

At this place you order your food, find a place to sit, & the food is brought to you...I ordered the super grilled chicken burrito with guacamole and sour cream on the side. The burrito was huge, even after my run I was only able to finish half and I definitely saved the other half for later. The tortilla chips are tasty & the salsa bar has a variety of choices to pick from.

Great service and food prices!
author: Nicole A.

description: Delicious food (can only speak for the vegetarian options) and great service! Was here for dinner and had a great atmosphere.Would definitely come back.
author: Lauren S.

description: Although you'll definitely find better Mexican food in the Mission (and for a third the price), Tropisueno is a great place to come for happy hour or a date night or with your amigas. The food is good, the drinks are better, and the chips are not bad either.  The wait is long, so try to make a reservation or come before the dinner rush (aka arrive before 645 if you don't want a 40min+ wait).
author: Kate P.

description:
Tropical Dream, hello
Ready to
Order?
Pollo Tacos, Tacos al Pastor, and Guacamole-
Incredibleness.
Salsas, salsas, salsas
Um YES! 
Excellent CHIPS
ma(Ñ)ana you should go and
Order a Mango Margarita with 5 friends at the bar=free drinks all night
author: Stephanie M.

description:
TROPISUENO DISCRIMINATES AGAINST THE DISABLED!!!

IF YOU ARE DISABLED OR KNOW SOMEONE THAT IS, PLEASE BOYCOTT THIS RESTAURANT. I WAS REFUSED SERVICE TODAY BECAUSE I AM DISABLED (either that, or the hostess and manager are racist).

My friend and I wanted to grab a quick bite on the way home today (Saturday 03/19/2011). As we walked by, I noticed a bunch of tables were occupied and when we entered at 5pm, there were also a number of people at the bar. The hostess asked how many and grabbed some menus. What I am assuming was the manager leaned forward and whispered something to her. While still holding the menus, she told us the kitchen closed at 5pm and sorry but they could not service us. As we were leaving, we heard her leading a couple who arrived after us into the dining room.

We we were refused service because I had a service animal, which was barely visibal (and absolutely mute), though the proper tags were visible. For those of you out there that are cheering for the way I was treated (though illegal), I really hope that you and every single person you care about, never has to be put into a situation where having a service animal is necessary. 

Though other restaurants may not have liked that I had brought in a service animal in their place of business,I have always gotten positive comments when leaving a restaurant from management for my dog being a non issue. Most times my waiter does not even know until I stand up to leave. This is the first time a restaurant has broken the law in refusing service to a disabled person.

My service animal has accompanied me into some much nicer restaurants (Momo's, Coco 500, Delancy Street, La Briciola, Alexander's Steakhouse...). Out of respect to the business and to the other patrons, though I can walk my animal into a restaurant and have it sit by the table, I always use a bag and place it under the table.

A while back, when Tropisueno opened, I had a not so steller experience. The owner actually wrote to me and asked me about my visit. She was quite nice and thanked me for my feedback and she hoped that I give Tropisueno another try. Today that proved to be a HUGE mistake.
author: Ginger K.

description:
My first, and likely LAST time at Tropisueno. We met friends who were staying at the Marriott and this place is a good tourist venue PERIOD! 
The house margaritas were forgettable, tasted like stale premixed artificially flavored lemon lime juice.
The corn chips were quite greasy and bland
My combination platter was served cold, the server was nice but returned another cold bland plate.  I've had fresher and better served food at Chipolte, and the former Chevy's.  San Francisco has much better offerings than this place.....
author: Liam S.

description: Get here early as there is always a line out the door for lunch! Get here early for happy hour too as the bar gets packed quick. Their chips and that orange sauce are amaZing. Their margaritas are always very good. I love the salted rim with the chili powder salt yum! I usually get their quesadillas or their tacos and it's good food. Then they give you lollipops with your bill which is awesome. Will be coming back here for sure but one star off because of the crowds... Not a bad thing for this place but I don't like crowds ;(
author: Christine W.

description:
Thank you Yelp! We found this place through Yelp and just loved it.
Good spicy salsa selection :)
Will return whenever go back to SF.
author: Surati S.

description:
Happy Hour Report:
Outstanding food, drinks, and service! At a great price. A great place to meet after work or before dinner. The margaritas were perfect, not too sweet. The ceviche was amazing and the tacos delicious. And the comp chips and salsa were balanced perfectly. I will be return and I suggest you do the same!
author: Clifford C.

description:
When we went there for lunch I was impressed by the restaurant and the line outside, but I was completely unimpressed with the food and the wait was pretty bad. The line moved quickly, but after paying it was about 15 minutes to get our to-go food.

I had the Barbacoa Torta and was not impressed at all. It was very bland (especially the barbacoa itself, no seasoning) and the bread was falling apart so it was difficult to eat without dropping large chunks off the sandwich. Also, the salsas are unlabeled, so you have no idea what's what.

I'm willing to give it another try, but overall I'd rather go to Taco Bell at this point.
author: Joshua O.

description:
I'm a tough critic when it comes to Mexican food. 

I've been to several of the high end places all over the bay area (Maya (SF), Dona Tomas (Berkeley), Las Camelias (Marin) and I liked Tropisueno because it delivered top quality food for a "I can eat there every day for lunch" prices. 

I've also been to some amazing hole in the wall places (and some not so amazing hole in the wall places).

I will admit that I first came here for a yelp elite event a while back, but opted against reviewing the restaurant though we were treated very well and the owner was very friendly with me when we spoke briefly. 

With that said - I went back several months later for lunch. This place seems to very popular.
