I had the burrito mojado and a lot of places do the wet burrito and cover up a mediocre burrito by drowning it in enchilada sauce. The burrito at tropisueno was legitimately awesome. Top quality burrito with great sauce for about $8.

I also like that there are no servers. You order your food and you sit down. No pressure to tip or anything like that. 

This is a rare find: GOOD high end food for an affordable price. 

I definitely recommend this place. 

Next time I have to try their horchata. I had the Thomas Kemper Ginger Ale this time around. Wow, that sounded really yuppy. Moving on...

A plus for having latinas working in the kitchen. It adds a touch of authenticity in my mind. 

I will give it a 5 star review if I go back and try a non-burrito dish and it is as awesome as today's meal.
author: Carlos A.

description:
We went here about 4pm before a 6pm Giants game. They were still serving lunch, which meant standing in line to order our custom burritos and a separate trip to the bar for margaritas. Add to that a few trips to the salsa bar and it took a while to finally get settled into our table. No worries. It was worth it.

We got a big scoop of tasty housemade guacamole to go with the light chips while we waited. Then came three footballs -- no wait, they were our super burritos. Wow, certainly all-you-can-eat size and quite good. We sampled both shrimp and carnitas. My only complaint was that they said they ran out of black beans, so we had to substitute pinto -- how can a Mexican restaurant run out of black beans at 4pm?

I love the variety at the salsa bar. I must have sampled 6 different kinds. All good. Plenty of heat.

As others have said, one reason for 4 stars is to find food this good and reasonably priced right in the heart of downtown Market Street (next to the Marriott, Westin, Yerba Buena, etc.). This is worth a repeat. Next time we'll try the tacos; they looked good too.
author: Stephen H.

description:
Tequila!! 

I remember when this place was about to open and I KNEW I had to try it! I used to be around in the evenings and one day I finally had the time to check it out. I needed my alone time so I decided to go by myself. I walked in and of course decided to sit at the bar. The bartender was super nice and we talked about tequila for a bit and after haven tried most of his recommendations I decided to try Partida. To this day I still drink it and very much enjoy it. What I liked was that he understood that I just wanted my tequila straight up so I could get all the favor and actually taste it. He was even nice enough to open a new bottle for me and even gave me the Aztec Aguilar that goes around the neck of the bottle. 

For those of you who want to explore tequila and actually taste and enjoy it (yes, it's possible despite what some people may say) 

I never tried the food but I know I will soon.  Planning to take my fellow tequila lovers here!
author: Belem R.

description: I had high hopes for this restaurant. I ordered a simple combination plate with 1 cheese tamale and 1 vegetable enchilada. What did I get?  1 vegetable taco and 1 vegetable enchilada. (problem #1) The waitress was understanding about the mixup and offered to correct the order. I was soon brought out 1 vegetable enchilada. The cheese tamale never made it (problem #2). And lastly, my vegetable enchilada had chicken in it (problem #3). As a vegetarian this was pretty bad. How is it possible to mess up a simple order? I was also surprised that the waitress did not offer to refill drinks at any point during the meal. I did however, enjoy the chips and salsas. I have had much better Mexican food (both authentic and tex mex). I will not be returning.
author: Ali E.

description: For a place you wait in line to order at a counter I must say the food is damn good.  The place is spacious and centrally located which is good and the food was tasty and reasonably priced.  Win win situation here.  We ordered the chips and guacamole, two tacos and the fajitas. The fajitas are definitely enough for two, unless you're with a big guy that eats a lot, then probably not.  They bring chips to the table so if you order chips and guac off the menu I would advise people to tell the guy no when he brings them while you wait for your food.  The guacamole was some of the best I've had in a restaurant as an app.  It was great sampling the food but next time I would probably order less.  So all in all, I would definitely have people try the fajitas, the chips and guac and the tacos maybe not all of them between two people,  HA!  Next time I will try this place for happy hour.
author: Kirsten M.

description: I loved this place!  Most of the makeup people at Nordstrom know about this place.  I was buying some eye shadow brushes at Mac one day(they have the best brushes, some are goat hair, and will last forever!), and asked my wonderful sales person if he knew about the Mexican place near by.  He did, but he gave me horrible directions!  It's a cute little place.  You order, you pay, you find a table, and they bring you some decent Mexican food.  I had enchiladas, rice, and beans.  The salsa bar was great!  I was no longer in withdrawal for Mexican food, and someone removed my strait jacket!  Hey, it's pretty hard eating without your hands!
author: Blondie R.

description: It was a little difficult to spot, but I'm glad I didn't give up on finding it. I was in love with the salsas they bring with chips; It was tough to pick a favorite. I had the pollo asado which was really good, but the marinade was something different than I was used to (full disclosure: I frequent El Pollo Loco), though I quite liked it. Even the beans and rice were really good and that's something I definitely judge a place on. Friendly service, good for groups, cute place. I would definitely recommend it.
author: A T.

description: Get a torta. Don't forget to pick up some salsa at the salsa bar on your way to eat your sandwich in the park. Perfect lunch. Done.
author: Judy L.

description:
Right next to Beard's Papa this place got pretty packed during lunch. 

The have a big menu and have a range of all types of Mexican food- burritos, fajitas, enchiladas, etc. 

You order from the counter while seeing them freshly make food and then they give you a number and you the food comes out to you. 

I got a watermelon juice and it was definitely refreshing. 

Really big portion as I got a grilled salad that came with black means and rice too. Did not finish all that. I think they forgot my order as it took awhile to come out. 

The food was definitely good but with such a nice place and setting you'd think it would have waiter service. 

You're in and out of there pretty quickly.
author: Anya R.

description:
I've tried a handful of mole entrees (4 to be exact) and this was by far the best mole I've tried at a restaurant.  The mole pablano was cooked with 3 chicken legs and one thigh and it was just the right chocolate taste, not overly sweet, and not overly bitter (like some of the moles that I have disliked).  It also had a nice roasty flavor after taste that went well with a scoop of rice or beans.  Our waitress told us that their mole was some kind of award winning mole, and I don't know if that is true and what is their definition of "award winning" but it was 5 stars in my book.  

Tropisueno was absolutely packed on a Wednesday night at 8PM, when we arrived, and we had to wait about 15 minutes.  I noticed a mixed crowd of people and it had a nice ambiance for a Mexican place and I could tell there were a number of people on dates to the tables adjacent to us.  Classy atmosphere and will have to come back again to try some more of what Tropisueno has to offer.  This restaurant is tucked away a bit discretely in Yerba Buena Lane right off of Market St. so be careful not to miss it when you swing by.
author: Albie F.

description: Lunch food was mediocre. I was quite disappointed since it had such great reviews. Lunch quality was equivalent to a cafeteria. I will not be returning.
author: Sara B.

description: It was great! Food deserves about four, maybe four and a half stars, but what really pushed me over the edge was the salsa. Amazing.
author: Sean T.

description:
After an exhausting day of Pride festivities, on my way to the Metreon, stopped in for dinner and drinks with the Fam.

Yummy cocktails.


My friends had practically one of everything om the menu, and there was unanimous praise all around. 
I had shrimp ceviche and it was excellent. 

The kitchen goofed on some tiny order detail, and proceeded to more than compensate by presenting a gorgeous creamy shrimp dish to the table. 

Delish!
author: A. H.

description:
Had dinner there on 12/18/2014.  Chips were great - thin and not greasy.  Enchiladas were okay - not greasy and a bit unique, but bland.

However, the service was atrocious.  The waiter took forever to even take our first drink order, and then forever to ever refill chips, take our food order, or take subsequent drink orders.  We finally had to track down the maitre d' in order to get service from our waiter. Will never go back.
author: Jason S.

description:
Yelpers came through once again! This restaurant was a fantastic choice that I semi-blindly picked based on reviews alone. I went with my friend who lived in Mexico and Spain so she knows what good and authentic Mexican food tastes like. She gave this place two thumbs way up.

We were seated fast on a Wednesday night and served tortilla chips with four different flavors of salsa. I was blown away at how tasty a spicy the salsas were. From my experience, when I visit a Mexican restaurant the salsa tends to be mild and watery...this place has cracked the code of delicious and flavorful salsas. We also ordered a house margarita each that gave us a great buzz to start off our meal.

For the main course, I order the chicken with mole poblano. The last time I had mole was in Mexico and once again I was pleasantly surprised at how authentic the flavor tasted. The meat was cooked just right so it fell off the bone with little effort. Our waiter asked us if we wanted a side of fresh, hot flour tortillas and beans which we excitedly said "yes" to. The combination or flavors, textures, and spices were perfect and made for a delightful dinner.

The service was great too. Our waiter was attentive and we didn't feel rushed. Overall the experience was fantastic and I'll be coming back. I knew it was a good sign when the place was packed on a Wednesday evening. Thanks Yelpers!
author: Yasasha R.

description: The food is satisfactory and affordable. It's a casual place, go to the counter to order then they bring it to you. They mean it when it comes to spicy. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but it's ok if you are nearby.
author: R J.

description: Best Mexican food in the area. Tastes as authentic as you'll get and really great homemade vibe to it. Only complaint is that I don't like how they set up the restaurant during the days on the weekends. It's like a catering/buffet style. I'd prefer I'd option to order off their regular menu. Either way great spot.
author: M M.

description:
No. I'm still at the restaurant. And my experience has been less than satisfactory. This is how bad this shit is.

My Jim G. and I came on our weekly dine out night. We figured it can't be too bad since it's in a great location, it's mexican food (you can't eff this up) and I was excited to come here since I see it when I go to Press Club. 
We go in and it's pretty packed. Good sign. We asked how long for two. We were told 10-15 minutes. Now this pissed me off already. No effing way in hell would we have been seated in 10-15 minutes with 3 couples in front of us. I asked if we could wait at the bar and they seated us. No one took our names. Bad sign. I asked the bartender for one margi. ALL I WANTED WAS MY MARGI! He looks up while making 5 drinks at once and said "yah ok hold on". 

... 2 more drinks and nothing. 4 more drinks. I politely ask "oh uh,.. how much for my margarita?". He looks up and gives me a bill. 18 bucks. WTF. 18 dollars for one drink? I was about to flip my shit. Oh btw I still hadn't gotten my drink. I asked "wait.. for just one?!" and he says "oh sorry no.. uh, here.. " and gives me a tequila sunrise. What. The HELL. I say "no. I just want one margi. No salt please". He nods. Makes 3 margis and hands them off to a waitress to give to a table. WHO WERE JUST SEATED. I've been waiting my 15 minutes. No drink. No table. I walk up to the hostess. I told her the sitch. It's been 15 mins. We aren't seated. I haven't gotten my drink. And homeboy can't even tell me how much my drink costs. She goes up to the bar and he LIES straight to her face- "oh.. No I gave you your drink". Clearly. Because it's not in my hand. I got a drink on the house. +1 star.

SOOO skip to 12 minutes later. I'm literally yelping other places in the area because this is bs. We finally get seated and the server asks what Jim wants to drink since he's not a tequila boy. He asks for some vodka drink with a specific vodka -I dont remember but the server didn't even know if they carried it behind the bar. WTF. Know your shit. He comes back and says they don't carry it. But suggested 2 other vodkas. We're almost ready to leave and he just says fine and takes it.

Needless to say... there was quite a great source of entertainment. If Seth Rogan and joaquin phoenix circa "I'm still here" had a baby.. this man sitting next to us would be him. He's clearly on a blind or first date with this girl with a banging body- and all this guy does throughout the night is make awkward ex gf and sex jokes. The party to the other side of us is drunk on someones bday and homegirl to my right is plastered and it's not even 7:30 yet. On a Tuesday. Classic.

The food. Mediocre. to say the lease. I would honestly compare it to chevys. Now.. I love chevy's .. not bagging on it. But I just expected the food to be more authentic.. and .. better. I couldnt stomach to eat my two apps (guac and chips pluse serviche and a side of rice). But then the man tells us after taking our dishes they have FLAN. OMG yes. Flan. PLEASE DONT EFF THIS UP FOR ME!!

They do. Caramel was burnt. But I dont give an eff. It's flan. +.5 stars.


I will never come here again. I will never recommend this place to anyone. I will just sit quietly at Press Club and try to forget the horrible experience that I had here last week.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Good food, great prices, nice atmosphere, delicious drinks, friendly service!

This place has it right! Their house margarita with the chili salt rim is my favorite! I've been here 3 times and the consistency is always on point. The food is good too, although this time was not as good as other dishes I've tried in the past.

- Camarones Tropisueno: spicy, good, saucy
- Flautas Appetizer: okay, too much guac, kind of plain
- Chile Ruelleno: not enough meat, good sauce
author: Linda C.

description: Probably the best Mexican restaurant in SF, with a very lively LA-type scene: large, energetic, great food, phenomenal drinks, great, happy, upbeat service.
author: Marc H.

description: Long line, but it moved quickly.  Fish tacos were delish!  Margarita was pricey but large.  I'll go back.
author: Neal W.

description:
Great happy hour. Chips and three types of salsa, modela 
 especial on tap for $3. We had guacamole, fish taco, cheese quesadilla, two beers, two margaritas, and flautas for $33 in downtown SF! Great,fun place. Will go back for dinner when in the area.
author: Greg C.

description:
Reasonably priced for the huge portions! The Pollo Asada takes an extra 20 mins, so be sure you have the time if that's what you want to order! I also recommend the Chile  Verde, incredibly tender and well seasoned pork, with generous portions of rice and beans. 

AWESOME dips for your complimentary chips ^.^

great service, great food, cute atmosphere...definitely a new SF tradition for when I visit :)
author: Andrew-London P.

description: Happy hour is crazy! It is packed, but the waiters are so quick and efficient that you are never left for wanting food or drink. Food was great!
author: Judy C.

description:
Tropisueno is a classy Mexican place near the Metreon/Union Square.  My friends and I decided on this place for our monthly get together.  In an alley with other restaurants, this restaurant was PACKED on a Friday around 7 pm.  The bar area was filled and the entire restaurant was filled up.  Good thing I had reservations through OpenTable which was very convenient.  Decor was a little tropical, carribean but very very dark and very hot.  There wasn't much ventilation and with all the people in there, it got a little uncomfortable.  

We were seated promptly, as soon as our third party member arrived which was nice, and I didn't even have to tell them that we were all there.  We started with ceviche, which was a little fishy in my opinion and all I could taste was the fish, the other flavors that I attribute with ceviche did not come through.  The onion was light, the lime and citrus was also very light, there wasn't enough variety in the flavors to make me want more of it.

The chips and salsa are just as good as everyone says.  If I come back to this restaurant, it's for the chips and salsa.  They serve three types of salsa with their complimentary chips and they are all diverse enough to be very yummy.  The light, airy chips were so addicting.  I wish I could eat those practically every day and at every Mexican restaurant I go to.

I had the carne asada which was done with skirt steak that was low quality in my opinion.  It was chewy, very sinewy and was not cooked tender enough.  Maybe I rarely eat carne asada in this fashion but was not a fan.  The enchilada it was served with was nothing special either.  Something you can get at any Mexican restaurant.  The guac, the little dollop that was provided was actually very good like others say.  Chips, salsa and guac, things that most Mexican places shouldn't mess up were AMAZING.  

Overall, overpriced Mexican in a very dark atmosphere that was nothing special beyond the chips, salsa and guac.

As my friend said, "This is the perfect place to have a date if you have acne", lol
author: Brian C.

description:
I ate here for lunch one day. 

I then came back for margaritas (and vodkaritas) the very next day. 

If that is not testament to the good nature of Tropisueno, I do not know what is...

Ok, yes it is very convenient to my office...has a bit to do with it. 

Lunch: Cafeteria style, well-priced, large portions, pretty quick. I had the nachos, and easily could've split them with someone it was so large. They were under $9. A bit messy, and I'd expect nothing less. Ain't gourmet Mexican, but it is on the nicer side. Diet Coke to boot, and I was a happy gal. 

Drinks: Order at the bar, pretty quick, hand crafted (I'm beginning to hate this word) drinks. I watched him make one of the margaritas with real agave...and they were oh so smooth. I stuck with Corona Light, and we all shared several bowls of warm toasty chips and chunky fresh salsa. 

Staff is on point, though most of it is self-serve. Well situated, nice interior...great spot for happy hour drinks, I'd venture to guess. 

Def worth a stop in. Or two. ;)
author: Colleen C.

description:
NOT A FAN. one star because we came in really late and they were nice enough to let us order  before the kitchen closed. but that's about all I can say for this place. 

If you're going to let us eat there, stop hovering and staring at us! It's just creepy. The drinks were not good, I definitely don't think my margarita should taste like industrial strength cleaning solution. The scallops were ok, but the shrimp was extremely salty. My best friend said it tasted like the ocean. The steak was not great either. It was chewy and tough, but hey, I guess that's better than eating the ocean. Honestly the best thing I had all night here were the chips & salsa. 

With food like this, I seriously don't know how this place got such great ratings?? Again, I admit we got their late, but if they didn't want to serve us, we would have been fine going somewhere else. There's no need to ruin good food!

Just thinking of the food again makes me cringe and feel yucky.
author: Kristen C.

description: Came here with my girlfriend a day after the Blueprint experience. I walked in and the ambiance looked great but it wasn't really packed around 11. My first thought was ehhhhh it may be ok. Was that a damn lie! This place was great. She had the tropisueno torta which was better then my fajitas! The tomitallo (check the spelling) sauce was freaking great too. Chips and salsa was great too. Everything is made fresh. Just our luck we were sitting and the bar and we had the best thing in the place MARGARITAS they even make the lime juice for it. Even the bartenders were cool and very friendly. When I come to San fran I will be here again!
author: Christopher C.

description: The food was underwhelming. I had the chili Verde. My date had the huaraches tres cochinitas. The service was good though. Maybe it was an off day?
author: Dean T.

description:
Tampiqueno.  Order it.  Generous, generous portion of carne asada (probably about 10-12oz?) and cooked PERFECTLY.  Seared just right on the outside, and a deep, juicy red on the inside.  Add the well-spiced rice and a barbacoa enchilada on the side; it's a feast.  And that's even if you don't have any chips and salsa.

The house margarita was ... good.  I don't know, I'm a beer guy.  But they put a red salt on there with a taste reminiscent of ... something.  I couldn't put my finger on it.  But rest assured I'll be back to figure it out - and get more carne asada.
author: Dennis C.

description: Really, really good margaritas. We had the special of the night, which was some mango margarita with jalapeño-ness and then a watermelon margarita. I think I liked the watermelon better, but then again I love anything with watermelon in its name. The meal started off with chips and 3 types of salsa, all of which were fantastic. We also shared the scallops and shrimp ceviche. Two of my friends and I decided to split the entree because we had heard that the portions were enormous. We shared the tampiqueño, which was thinly sliced carne asada. It was alright, but the meat was kind of tough and it lacked flavor. If my entree had been as good as the appetizers and drinks, this place would be five stars.
author: Anna N.

description: Really enjoyed it! I got the shrimp dish and would go back just to eat that again. It was a little pricey but the quality was so high that it was worth it.
author: Anne K.

description:
Service: Spectacular

Food: Really fresh and tasty.

Ambience: Sexy.

Value for money: Great, portions are copious.

We were offered 1 round of free drinks for the entire party of ten since we had to wait for an extra 15 minutes for the table.
author: Rajesh P.

description:
Owner is a dick. Thinks he is running a nightclub or something. 
Food was not very good at all. I've had better in Boston.. good atmosphere and staff, but that's about it. Only reason I give it a 2nd star.
author: Kevin H.

description:
This is my story of my first trip to Tropisueno.

Tropisueno: What would you like?
Me: "A regular burrito with al pastor and refried beans. And also a side of guacamole."
T: "Guacamole on the burrito?"
M: "No, a side of guacamole."

Two minutes later.

T: "Are you ordering together or separate?"
M: "Um, together, I guess."
T: "What did you order again?"
M: "A regular burrito with al pastor and refried beans. And also a side of guacamole."

They give us a number. We walk down the line to the cash register.

M: "Do I give you this number?"
T: "No. What did you order?"
M: "A regular burrito with al pastor and refried beans. And also a side of guacamole."

We pay and sit down with our number. About five minutes later, a guy comes over with our two burritos. He gives the chicken burrito to my friend and gives me my carnitas burrito. Except I didn't order carnitas...so I send it back.

I remind him that we have guacamole also; he looks at me skeptically as if I haven't actually paid for it but brings it anyway. Five minutes later, he's back with another burrito.

I bite into my burrito and find pineapple and al pastor. I didn't know my burrito came with pineapple, and as most of my friends know, I don't eat meat and fruit together.

I bring it back.

Five minutes later, I have the right burrito.

I thought my burrito was just okay. I found the al pastor to be on the dry side - one of the reasons why I like al pastor is that it tends to be juicy and tender while carnitas seem to frequently get overcooked. 

After my first experience, I have been back to Tropisueno on multiple occasions for lunch, drinks and dinner. The lunch hour still continues to be disorganized and slow. I frequently want to go get a quick burrito and get back to work but there's a decent chance that 10 minute trip will take closer to 25 minutes. As the day progresses, service tends to get better with drinks service being okay and service is much better in the evenings.

The food is solid, and I particularly like the old school combination plate dinners that they serve.

So after all of this, I have still decided to give Tropisueno three stars for:
*Proximity to the office (a short two minutes walk)
*The bar at the restaurant 
*It is one of the few reasonably-priced, sit-down spots to have lunch (or dinner) in the area
author: Wendy L.

description:
We had a great dinner.  

The margaritas aren't very strong but they are good.  Although they'll fill up the bowl of chips, we started with the Molotes de Elote y Chorizo, which are like thin egg rolls that tasted like a gordita.  They were pretty good and a nice way to start dinner.  My GF had the carne asada and I had the pork chop.  Both were good and the portions were very generous.    

Watch out for the salsas that come with the chips.  Two of them were pretty hot.
author: Larry L.

description: Gourmet Mexican beautifully spiced and moderately priced too? In this neighborhood? Wish I'd found this place earlier! My standard test for all Mexican restaurants is their chile relleno - I think I just had the Best Ever. Ordered it with picadillo, which had lovely spices and raisins. The breading was perfectly light and almost custard-like. Everything behind the kitchen looked amazingly tasty and fresh with succulent moist looking meats and happy produce. Guacamole was pretty good, as were the two salsas I tried. The small bar looked like fun, too. Can't wait to go back!
author: Tania A.

description:
It's a good thing there's a bit of a lineup here at lunch time, there's no way I'd have enough time to decide what I wanted to eat without one. With no menu posted after the gigantic wall-length one in the doorway, feast your eyes and fix your mind on one of the delicious items, repeat it three times so you'll remember and then tell one of the lovely staff behind the counter what it is you desire.

Once you've ordered, venture into the restaurant to find yourself a table, plunk your number down and munch on some complementary chips and salsa while you wait for your food to make its way over to you. You won't make it very far through that bowl of chips, mind you-even though this is a busy spot, there's not much wait time for your food. My two chicken enchiladas with refried beans and rice came out piping hot. The meal covered the entire surface area of my already rather large plate. Full of Mexican goodness, I left mucho-full!
author: Wendy P.

description:
Excellent choices of salsa and the chips were also great. Always important to get a good start.

I had chicken fajitas which came on a huge plate. The only negative was there weren't enough flour tortillas. (or chips!)

The wife had the ceviche tostada and beef taco which she devoured so it must have been good because (1) there were no leftovers for me and (2) she spoke very little!!
And then all the chips were gone too!!

We'd come back here again without hesitation to get our mexican fill!
author: Nick L.

description:
Delicious. Really enjoyed the small plates (which can be used to put together a vegetarian meal which is far more interesting than the standard tacos and burritos) -- the roasted corn was heavy and flat, but the jicama and cucumber salad was crisp and had a great bite, and best of all were the plantains with black beans, which had a really nice contrast of textures and flavors. 

Entrees are huge, and appetizers small. The house margaritas are wonderful.  Definitely recommended.
author: Julia S.

description: Tropisueno still rocks, I've had a chance to try more of their food & have NOT been disappointed AT ALL. Everything is SO fresh & delicious. Forever recommending this wonderful establishment!
author: Zhenya S.

description: Meh. You know the food was good. The service wasn't bad... I just don't know... I have had better. IF I was in the area again and dying for Mexican, i might drop in, but there are plenty of other options out there too.
author: Glenn G.

description:
I've been there a couple of times so far, and these are my impressions:
the quality/price ratio of the food is quite high, their margaritas are very good, and the tortilla chips they bring on the side with 3 kinds of salsas are fantastic;
the atmosphere is also great, and, as far as I could experience, service was very satisfying.
Just one tip: try to plan ahead if you want to dine there, as the place tend to be pretty packed all the time.

Overall I highly recommend this Mexican restaurant, which, in my opinion, is surely one of the best in town.
author: Giorgio M.

description: Great atmosphere. Food was seriously delicious. One of the best Mexican restaurants I have been too. Prices are very decent for the location as well. Made a last minute reservation and had our table waiting for us when we arrived.
author: Erin W.

description: Tropisueno your orange sauce is amazing with your awesome salsa bar. You cannot do wrong here when you are craving some Mexican food. My choice of dish is a carne asada quesadilla, and it is amazing. Don't get me wrong their tacos and burritos are awesome too but I loooove cheese. Quesadilla and drown it in that orange Chipotle sauce and you got yourself a mouth watering lunch/dinner or what ever.
author: Quyenna T.

description:
I love this restaurant. Great happy hour and food. The margaritas are unique and refreshing. I've tried a few different ones, but the duende is my favorite. It is different than any margarita I've ever tried. They provide chips and three different salsas, each different in flavor and heat. I've had the tacos on several occasions - grilled chicken and chicken tinga, as well as the flautas, However, the Mirna's Salbutes and Molotes de Elote y Barbacoa antojitos were truly unique dishes and very flavorful. I highly recommend these!
My husband and I also stopped for lunch on a Saturday and the restaurant set up is more casual with a simple taqueria menu. You order by the bar and they bring your food to the table. They have a small salsa bar with a little more variety than the three salsa they serve with chips at dinner. This is a nice option if you're in the area and want a quick Mexican fix for lunch.
author: Alya G.

description:
Like all the other reviews say, the freshness and portions were awesome here!

Ordered a chicken quesadilla, was starving before, but managed to have enough for a second meal! You can definitely taste the freshness and appreciate their authentic flavors. There are a variety of sauces to choose from, which I can never say no to, my favorite being the orange though everything else were unforgettable also.

What else is there to say? Come through! Lunch hours do get incredibly packed though! Happy hour may be my next go!
author: Winè C.

description: EXCELLENT! Authentic Mexican food with quick service.... Even during the rush of lunch hour!
author: Desiree H.

description:
It's good.

Ambiance is pleasing, food is tasty, and margaritas are strong.

This place turns into a taqueria during the day time.  Their orange sauce rivals La Vic's in SJ!
author: S. F.

description:
Tropisueno is a 2 in 1.  It's like a reversible jacket with dual looks.  It's like Clark Kent and Superman.  Mild mannered Taqueria during the day and cool restaurant by night.

I haven't been there during the day, but my friend who had did a double take as she entered.  During lunch, supposedly they have an order counter (which they roll away from the mural wall) and open seating.  

At night, it's a handsome, full-scale restaurant.  Good date and gathering place.  The service is very friendly and knowledgeable.

The food is fantastic!  Best chips (Chevy's light, but with more oomph) + 2 kinds of salsa.  I like their pork tacos.  Simple, small, flavorful, and a great accompaniment to margaritas.  They offer a creative range of specialty margaritas (i.e. lavender infused with vanilla salt, etc.).  I've only had the House one, and haven't had a reason to try another - it's soo good!  Mild, strong, with a kick of chile salt - ka pow!

Another great feature of Tropisueno are the prices.  Prices are comparable to Chevy's, which is a run-of-the-mill chain.  But Tropisueno stands out on it's own with personality, flair and a comfy, friendly vibe.

In these dreary economic times, this is a great place to brighten up without breaking the bank.  I've been here for dinner 2 nights in a row, and am looking forward to another occasion to go back.
author: Cathy K.

description:
This place is great.

We went on a Thursday night at 8pm and I was glad we made reservations because the place was busy.

That being said, the service was prompt and very good.

We split the ceviche for an appetizer and I had chicken mole for my main dish.

The ceviche was very good with large chunks of fish and not too vinegary!  The chicken mole came with rice and beans, the rice phenomenal, the beans good but not amazing.  I'm sort of a mole snob and this was the real deal!

My counter-part for the evening got a cheese enchilada and beef taco combo and said they were both excellent.

The house margaritas were also very good and came in pint glasses with pink salt :)

Overall, great value and ambiance here.
author: Joseph H.

description: I really really want to love this place.  It's close to work, clean and reasonably priced.  My one issue with it is I keep finding bay leaves in my burritos.  It may not sound that bad, but it's on par to getting a bone when biting into a piece of fish or chicken.   Other than crunchy bay leaves, Tropisueno is a great lunch spot, has a great happy hour and tasty dinner place!
author: Scott J.

description:
Not sure if I'm diggin the Taqueria part

I still LOVE this place but the Taqueria day time facade threw me off. But it was still DAMN good!
author: Rob L.

description: So I came here during lunch with a friend. This was my first time here and my friend told me it was good he's been here before. When we got here we looked at the big menu they have and then order at the counter. We ordered the steak nachos and tacos. I must say that this place was actually good. The steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked which made both the nachos and tacos really good. I would definitely come back.
author: arlene d.

description: I like and i dont like this place sometimes. The real reason why i go is because i love their salsa bar, especially the creamy kinda coral-orange salsa, it is just delicious. The price point is a lil high, even though i understand is San Francisco down town, but i will apreciate if at lease they are a lil more generous about serving the food. All the timet i order a chicken, or carnitas SUPER burrito, its only super with rice, beans, sour cream, guacamole but i never find the meat, COME ON, they charge like almost 11 dollars  for that burrito, can u make that burrito worth the money we pay for?. If i order 2 tostadas with extra cream and guacamole, its almost 7 dollars for each tostada, its crazy. Now, talking about the service, the ladies who are always encharged of the register have the worst attitude, they are so unfriendly, rude and have such an expresion on their faces that u feel they are forced to be there or either they hate to deal with people. You  guys need to change that, when we get to the register, is the moment that we are giving our money to your business and we want to make sure and feel that what we are  getting in return is worth are money and that includes quality food and great customer service. if those issues are solved you guys will be a really good place to go very often but i feel u guys got very confortable with the business you have at the moment and feel u dont need to change anything, but BE CAREUL!! thats is not an smart business thinking, you can get competition anytime and your business will just drop
author: Brenda C.

description:
I held myself back on writing a review earlier because I felt bad that I couldn't give this place five stars.  But, in good conscience, I can't.  I would give this place 2.5 stars if it would let me, but given the choices, I'll have to settle on 2, because 3 really is one too many.

Why is that?  Well, while the service was great (although a little slow getting our entrees out), everyone was polite, and the ambience was clean and well-decorated, the food lacked oomph.  The flavors were too subtle for my palate, and everything seemed...well, mushy and wet.

The menu wasn't terribly original or expansive, and seemed to really be playing it safe with very traditional fare.  The most interesting-looking dishes on the menu were the appetizers, so my partner and I started with two:  The Empanadas de Hongos (mushroom cheese filling) were tasty ONLY with the guacamole on top.  Without it, they were practically flavorless, except for a dull undertone of mushroominess.  The Crispy Flautas were just ordinary flautas, nothing special...but I've had better at any of a dozen other taquerias in this city.

We then waited...and waited.........and waited for our entrees.  Luckily, we weren't in a hurry that night.  I had ordered two enchiladas, one cheese and one meat.  They weren't terribly flavorful, kind of muddled.  They arrived with rice and white beans.  The rice was just rice, and the beans had no flavor really.  

My partner ordered the Chile Verde.  That was a better dish - the pork was very tender.  Still, the rice was just rice, and his refried beans weren't special...just refried beans.

When I first saw this restaurant mentioned in a Yelp weekly email, I thought we'd give it a try.  But, sadly, it was not a special culinary experience.  In fact, this restaurant doesn't do much over what you can get at any hole in the wall in the Mission, and many of those restaurants do it better.  This place just dresses up the same old thing with a trendier address (SoMa, right by Yerba Buena) and nicer decor.  If you are looking for good Mexican food, you'd be better served by a taqueria in the Mission, or by the comparably more upscale Maya.  There's even an inexpensive Mexican place that has better flavors in the food court of the nearby Westfield Galleria.  

The only reason I'd come back here would be if a friend was having a birthday party here, but otherwise, I'm just going to file it under restaurants where I was underwhelmed.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't special, either.
author: Amy L.

description: No specific complaints here, but I must say that I have had better Mexican food than here... When visiting San Francisco, I was staying in the Union Square area, and thanks to Brett N. and the many Yelp reviews, Tropisueño was the choice! Not only was this a good choice, but I would go here again. Even though it's not directly on the menu, for dinner, I just had a cheese quesadilla as my meal. It was good and definitely unique.  The cheese had an interesting taste (in a good way) and the flavor of the whole quesadilla was good. Even though we had to wait for a table, the wait wasn't too long and we were provided with chips, salsa, and water while we waited.  The server we had was nice and knowledgable. The food came out seemingly quickly for the restaurant being completely full. If anyone from Tropisueño is reading this, allow me to make reservations on OpenTable! I think it would make the entire system smoother and faster.
author: Michael G.

description:
Oh, Yelp Reviewers!!!  You steered me wrong again!!!  :(  and I was gonna take an out of towner friend over here too!  Good thing I tried this place before I took her here!  (And in a strange bit of irony, her coworkers were going to dinner that night.... HERE!!!  I hope they got different stuff from what I got.

With all the great Yelp Reviews and the price tag, I expected fresh refried beans or black beans, NOT canned refried beans, which this definitely taste like!   Rice was bland. The carnitas and the Carne Asada in our dishes was bland. The salsa with the chunks that was sitting with our chips were okay, but too sour for hubby.  The tostaditos de carnitas that was part of the appetizers had WAAAAY too much lettuce and the tortilla shell became very hard to chew on -- we had to use the tortilla chips from our table to make it work for us.  The dinner left me with "lead stomach" the rest of the night.  I was fearful of having maybe food poisoning but thankfully it passed towards the end if the night.  And it's always a bad sign when the server (who I think might be the dinner manager.  Big tall older guy, dark hair) steered us away from one dish we were gonna order b/c "it was gonna be taken off the menu soon."

We suspect that their specialty is seafood and tequila.  Maybe that's why I didn't have a stellar experience...

Their saving grace... The chips and the gauc that WAS on the tostaditos.  And their service wasn't that bad.  The wait was long but not THAT long (about 25 minutes when they told me about 30-40 minutes.)
author: Joanna R.

description:
By Wednesday of CM Week, I was feeling like I'd already eaten and drank my way through the city of San Francisco.  Literally, I forgot what hunger felt like because I felt like we were just constantly eating and drinking...

Nonetheless, an hour or two after lunch, my group decided to have a meeting over margaritas at Tropisueno.  Or maybe I should say that Colleen C suggested it and my group unanimously decided to go for it.  Not being a fan of tequila, I went with a vodkarita instead.  And I have to say it was pretty damn tasty!  Add that to the friendly service from the bartender and some mighty fine chips and salsa, and you've got a great meeting spot.

Half price happy hour to boot.  Hasta pronto, Tropisueno... I'll see you next visit for a vodkarita, I'm sure!
author: Gabi M.

description: Great food, good service. Tuesday evening and the place was packed, but they found a table for us within 20 minutes. Will come again.
author: Tómas J.

description: Super fun for happy hour after work!  As I was visiting town and in the office for work, my coworkers and I jaunted over here to drink away our stress for a bit.  You can't beat $5 martinis, $5 ceviche and $3 tacos, absolutely yummy and great service.  The vibe is a mix of young professionals in their late 20's and 30's and was just a positive place.  When I come back to town I would love to come here for dinner based on the other yelp raves for this place.
author: Vanitha S.

description: We saw the line so we thought the food would be terrific. What a disappointment it turned out to be. I ordered the tamale and it was mostly hardened, dry masa with a little chicken sneaked in. The refried beans had sun dried tomatoes in them that were so hard, I thought they had slipped strips of leather in there for a challenge. I ordered a margarita from the cocky bartender who, because he didn't have to pay for the liquor, poured it into the glass with his arm stretching way up high, causing a lot of the tequila to fall outside of the glass. Then he filled the glass with ice which allowed the sipper  about 1/8 cup of liquor, the rest was ice that never did melt. Cost for that lousy margarita $9.00. I learned my lesson, I'll never return here.
author: Clare H.

description:
Tropisueño is one of these places I'd walk by many times thinking that it was just another overpriced mediocre restaurants which are so prevalent in the SOMA area ... boy, was I wrong!  Must admit, I saw the place on Check Please Bay Area, and I was absolutely intrigued.  So, the next weekend, while we were shopping in SOMA, I made a point to stop by Tropisueño for lunch, and I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was ... and how reasonable the prices were!

Love their ceviches, esp. on tostadas and grilled prawn plate, but the basic items like quesadillas & enchiladas are really good too!

The service is pretty minimal during lunch ... in the evenings, it turns into a full service restaurant ... but the staff is courteous and helpful when you need an extra hand to carry the drinks to your table.
author: S. I.

description:
who knew you could find decent non tourist-trap like places for dinner downtown?! I went with a friend last night on a whim and was pleasantly surprised. the place was packed on a sunday night, and it had a cool bar like feel to it, which is always appreciated. it wasn't loud, but wasn't quiet. perfect. my favorite thing about this place was the lovely chips and dip(s). I usually stay the hell away from chips cuz they are a calorie bomb, but when the waiter brought over three types of accompanying dip, I HAD to have it. calories well splurged. 

for my main dish i got the shredded green chile pork with rice, beans and tortillas. I liked the build your own fajita aspect to it, but the dish was huge. idk if it was because i filled up on chips or what, but just looking at my entree made me full. with that said, i killed that ish lol. it was pretty good. in retrospect, was a tad salty... but that's restaurant food for you.

all in all, it was a good dining experience, and i'd go back but id...
1) have them box half my entree before bringing it out
2) ask them to not refill my chip basket lol
3) ask them to go easy on the salt
author: Jennifer O.

description: I was pleasantly surprised. I had walked past this place at least two x in the past without even giving their menu a glance. I did finally give it a glance, decided to eat and enjoyed. :) the sauces are on the creamy side, nearly French. Yummy. I will be going back for sure.
author: Out O.

description: What can I say? The Tropisueño restaurant is always good. The "Margaritas de la casa" are the best and the quantity and quality of food is great. I always come here with friends and the music and ambient is awesome!! Also they offer food for lunch with an affordable price. I put 4 stars because It's a little noisy in the dinner time...
author: Jennifer H.

description: WARNING!!! As we sat at the community table the manager Alex allowed for a women with a cat to enter the restaurant she came to the table and attempted to distract us while attempting to steal my bag. We luckily caught her before she was able to make it to the door. The manager Alex did nothing about it including not calling the police. He told us they do things differently there. If that is different I would recommend everyone finding another place to eat. Strongly believe management was in on this scam!!! Food is fine but risk of theft is to high!!!
author: Jill F.

description:
I'm not sure why some people are giving this place such high scores. I've been here a couple of times and both times I've been disappointed by the quality of the food and drinks. The waiters and bartenders are nice enough but there are many better Mexican restaurants in SOMA. If you want great margaritas, go to tres agaves (I guess it's called tres now). And the food is not something to brag about either. Their nachos are hella soggy and their tacos (I've tried all of them) are just average (hell even chipotle has better food). 

Overall it's an ok place but go in with the right expectations. It's definitely not as good as some other reviewers would have you believe.
author: Ali A.

description: Very Yummy.   Had the two tacos, carne asada and carnitas with black beans and rice.  Solid Mexican food.
author: Lyly N.

description:
Ambiance: This has officially become one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  I love the decor (especially the cute stringed lighting!), the staff, and just how simple but well thought out this place appears to be.  I would give it a 10 out of 5 if I could.

Drinks: The margaritas = so good!  Mixed to perfection.  They have a variety of salt flavors to choose from (e.g., chili, rosemary, vanilla), which I hope to experiment more with next time.

Food: I ordered the pollo asado plate and my boyfriend ordered a flauta and enchilada.  Everything tasted amazing.  Since moving away from San Diego, I haven't found a place that served comparable rice and beans (which I used to think was easy to do), but this place nailed it.

Dessert: We were too stuffed!
author: Ashley O.

description: Pollo asado. Worth the wait. Spicy mango margarita - makes the wait for the pollo asada awesome. Let's not forget the chips and triple salsa selection. I've had everything on the menu except the tacos. My fiancée gets the tacos so I always get something else. Based on her consistency, I'd assume they are awesome. Never had luck with walking in. Always need reservations. It's very close to the convention center - plan ahead. Great for lunch also, a Chipotle style ordering system. Dinner is more formal with a wait staff.
author: Omar S.

description: The food was very good and I think portions are actually bigger than they need to be. No way I could have finished my plate and not felt stuffed. The service was pretty good and quick but the tables are way too close to each other. Even on a weeknight, during dinner it's almost impossible to hear what the person across your table is saying without straining. They serve nice cold beer though!
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
Initial Visit : 4
After Visit  : 4

I initially came here with my +1 (ah, the benefits of being Elite, muhahaha) to the launch of their Bar Bites menu and was very optimistic when I left (we had tickets to catch Milk at the Castro, closing night) because I was still slightly flushed from their special of the night: The House Margarita, a strong floral blend imparted by the Hibiscus flower (Agua de Jamaica) topped off with a thin crunchy slice of cucumber.

Not only was the drink sexy to look at (pretty maroon, glinting away in the dimmed lights) but I was feeling a little sexy with that drink (or maybe it was because I was donning my new bang'ed theory and taking them out for a test drive).  In addition to the the great drinks, I was further impressed with the wide array of tasty appetizers.  My first visit left a favorable impression since I was reeling over from the numerous decadent Ceviche Bites and savory Chicken Mole Cups.

My second visit demanded more of a meal and I'm most happy to report that the Chuleta de Puerco Adobada (marinated pork chops) were amazingly tender and well seasoned.  This came accompanied by their standard beans, Mexican rice and tortillas.  I left with basically half of the meat and the rest of my plate because there was so much food.  The cost of the menu items here are not that expensive especially compared to other establishments in this area.  The appetizers start off around $6 and entrees proceed from $12 and up.  

5 stars + for the excellent customer service that I experienced at the first Elite event and still going strong when I stopped in later after Macworld.  I hope this establishment does well since it is in close proximity to the Metreon and Moscone.  The perfect casual place for a great margarita and a little more than the standard chips and salsa to spice up the evening.
author: Miika M.

description:
Tropisueno is not a real word. If it was, I think it would stand for "Transported", because that's exactly how I feel whenever I'm here. I love when a place can take you away from the stresses of life and just completely make you forget where and who you for just a little while. Dining here immediately transported me back to Puerto Vallarta and I'm hooked ever since. At lunch it's more of a taqueria so go for dinner. 

I've been here multiple times and unfortunately am always stuck with the same "couldn't care less" waiter who needs the churro pulled out of his ass. I come here for the food and ambiance. That's it. A trio of salsas grace the table upon seating and everything on the menu is delicious, especially the mole chicken. It tastes just as good the next day but don't count on taking home leftovers because you'll probably be licking you plate. 

Tropesueno knows who they are. This is not a burrito kind of place. Go to the mission for that.  You feel like you're being served honest, home-cooked, authentic Mexican soul food and at the end of your meal you'll want to jiggle your boobies to mimic the delicious flans you just ate because you loved it so much.
author: Jen Y.

description:
We had late reservations (9 pm) and i feel like the chef must have been like "yo my shift's bout to be done y'all...who cares what I serve these fools." We didn't get seated until 9:30. Ok fine. At least I got to drink a couple decent margaritas at the bar and eat some better than average chips and salsa.

After the wait, the service was still slow. Food was pretty bland, meat was chewy and rice had some hard grains going on. My shrimp were coated in some kind of creamy, spicy gravy. Boyfriend's pork chop was 50% fat. 

If it weren't for the cute ambiance, I'd say Chevys is better.
author: Mama M.

description:
This place is a regular stop for lunch among myself and my coworkers.  It's easily the best mexican food in the area, but either show up early or late... or order to-go.  You won't get a seat at noon.

The thing that really gets us coming back is their salsa bar.  That yellow-orange salsa is so good!
author: Chris A.

description:
Tropisueño is the hip new taqueria on Yerba Buena Lane. We call it the Yelp Cafeteria, because it's super close to HQ and you'll see lots of red track jackets there at lunch time. The atmo is warm and inviting and makes me feel like I'm in Mexico with its high backed carved wooden chairs, bright flowers and traditional curtains.

The place has been poppin' since its opening, with long lines out the door every day. I can't decide whether the lines are long because the food is so good, or if the folks there just haven't gotten into the fast and furious swing of burrito slingin' like their compadres in the Mission taquerias.

I've tried the ceviche, the battered fish taco and the quesadilla - all standouts! The ceviche was fresh with big chunks of tangy white fish, the fish taco was battered and tasty and the quesadilla was made with hot homemade tortillas. Mmm... I think I've discovered the cheaper and possibly better version of Maya.

Can't wait until this place gets its liquor license! It will go from being the Yelp Cafeteria to the Yelp Watering Hole. Tequila + yelpers = dangerous!
author: Nicole G.

description: Great prices, great food, and very nice atmosphere. We had an early dinner there on a Friday night. It was packed with a happy hour crowd and drinks were well worth it.
author: J M.

description:
I love a place that has a different take on Mexican Food.  (In fact, this restaurant can use the term "cuisine" rather than just "food.")  Most Mexican restaurants offer the same 25 items bloated with cheese and rice and drenched in a heavy sauce.

Tropisueno really had a unique and tasty menu.  Service was top notch and the price was reasonable.  Good lively atmosphere, but you can still talk.   Highly recommended.
author: Jim G.

description: My kids took me to this place as a birthday present and it was delicious.  Hard to find, even harder to pronounce the name (still have no idea what it means)  and of course a nightmare to park, but all in all, it was fun and festive.   Affordable prices and delicious chips
author: Elise G.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Saturday night.  There was no available table, but there was open seating at the bar so we rolled with that.

I had the Chicken with Mole Poblano - it tasted pretty good to me!  The chicken was tender and the sauce was flavorful, although I have no reference as to what a mole sauce should taste like.

My friend had the Camarones Tropisueño and seemed to really like it.  She didn't seem to like her cocktail, but I think she just can't handle alcohol very well (the drink tasted fine to me).

The service was reasonably quick, and I would definitely recommend this place to others in the future.
author: Mark R.

description:
I thought I knew the block of Mission St. that Tropisueño was on (or more accurately, adjacent to), but made the mistake of not bringing the address with me. Their sign on Mission had blown over, so I actually passed by Yerba Buena Lane several times before finding it. My fault, but a properly displayed sign would have solved the problem. Anyhoo....

The restaurant is very cute and the service was great. Unfortunately, the food was decidedly mediocre. The Chile Verde was surprisingly bland, and my girlfriend's shrimp dish tasted "off" to her. The house margarita was significantly better (the salt on the rim had a nice smoky flavor) -- although the second one I ordered wasn't as good as the first. They also don't seem to serve desert.

Not a terrible meal, and probably a good place to grab a drink, but given all the choices in S.F., Tropisueño isn't someplace we're likely to go back to.
author: Andy S.

description: Good Mexican Food, nice ambiance, affordable price.  Being a Texan, I have a high standard for Mexican & TexMex Restaurants.  Tropisueno had great chips and salsa with 3 varieties of salsa offered.  The waiter was friendly and had many great suggestions for ordering.  We had carne asada with a nice kick and chicken enchiladas with a cactus/corn sauce and filling.  Margarita was a little sweet for my preference, so minus 1 star.  Otherwise a great experience, will go back.
author: Kelly C.

description:
We decided to try this place since we were in the area shopping. We love Mexican food & came with high expectations based on Yelp reviews. It did not disappoint! 

3-4 Stars for food:
We were there around 4:30 pm on a Sunday. It was still considered lunch time, so we got a great meal for a great value.  I ordered the Chile Rellano which was good, but nothing out of the norm. Next time I'll order what my husband had, Carne Asada. Tender, juicy & well seasoned.

5 Stars for ambiance & bar:
What made this meal most enjoyable was the delicious margaritas!  I normally skip the salt, but Remy the bartender highly recommended it & he was right! Trimmed with their special chili/salt blend & using all fresh ingredients, they went down smoothly! 

We would suggest dining at the bar to experience Remy & Jose's many talents for their knowledge of Tequila & personality. We had a blast on our first experience. This will be our go to place before or after a Giants game.
author: Laroo L.

description: Stopped here on my trip to San Fran with my boyfriend because it was close to our hotel and had good yelp reviews. I'm glad we did, it ended up being one of my favourite restaurants of our trip. The atmosphere was nice, the hostess and our waiter  were very pleasant, the margaritas were delicious (but a bit pricey), but most importantly the food was delicious and an excellent value - all entrees were around 12-16 dollars and very big. My boyfriend got the special spicy mango margarita - whoa, if you like a bit of a kick, check it out! Very unique and tasty. They give you chips and 3 dips to start, and refilled both when we ran out, which was nice. I got the shrimp entree, which came in a very tasty sauce, mmm, and I got like 8 huge shrimp with it! Much bigger portion than I expected :). My boyfriend got the pork dish and enjoyed it as well. If I ever get to go back to San Fran and feel for Mexican food, I will definitely go back.
author: Erica D.

description: No question one of my new favorite happy hour spots and solid margaritas.  very popular and has a nice crowd.  I'll be back.
author: Mike V.

description: Tropisueno just catered a major event for my luxury high-rise community in the financial district (Carmel Rincon.) The staff were amazing, courteous , kind, and professional (especially Sylvia! Ask for her if you're catering an event!) The residents of our building pay a lot to be there and their expectations are high. This place delivered in a big way. They did an amazing taco spread complete with chicken and carne asada. Spectacular! Our residents were thrilled! Guacamole was fantastic. Food was fresh and delicious. Can't wait to visit their restaurant. If you're looking to cater a major event, this is the way to go!!!
author: Tiffanie C.

description:
Decently located near the Metreon, this spot has a nice fun vibe, but that's basically where the fun stops.  Margaritas not good and food pretty meh.  I'm not hard to please when it comes to mexican food, but my flautas tasted like the hard microwave version and our cocktails were from weird to just not good.

This was our last meal with our friends on our weekend in town and it was a sad ending to a fun weekend.
author: Elyse K.

description:
This place is the real deal. My wife and I dropped in for lunch and were amazed with how well organized and quick the process is considering the crowd, and how pleasant the environment is inside. 

I enjoyed the Mole Verde, a dish I never new existed. The chicken was extremely tender and flavorful, and the fresh corn tortillas topped it all off. I had a ton of food left over, so I took it home and wrapped it into two mondo tortillas which served as my lunch the next day. 

My wife tried the fish tacos and liked them as well. A nice batter with a good crunch, fresh fish with a fiesta of toppings. 

This is definitely now on our list of places to regularly visit when we make the trip to the city.
author: Jathan M.

description:
Pricey for Mexican food, but the authentic laid-back setting and service is worth it.  I've been to Tropisuenos with girlfriends after work, and usually stuff my face with their amazing chips with 3 choices of salsa!  The chips are light, fresh, and delicious (I'm a chips elitist).  I also crave their seafood ceviche at random times and need to get my fix occasionally ;)

Another great thing about Tropisuenos is its location-- a block or 2 from the Metreon, across the street from Yerba Buena bowling and ice skating, and riht off Market Street (not the shady part, either!).  I would recommend this place for a date, but not a super romantic one.  The noise level is moderate, the lights are dimmed, there is a hip and energetic vibe about the place.  For a fun date or a night out w/ friends, this is a great place to go!
author: Natassia K.

description:
Been here several times and I must say, I really love it! I recently developed Celiac's, which is basically a gluten allergy, and most restaurants I have been to don't even really know what gluten is. The most recent time I went here, the server knew exactly what gluten was, and took extra care to make sure my food was gluten free by checking with the chefs and warning me of things that may have some gluten contamination. Big bonus! 

The best thing about this place is their chips and salsa. Thin, warm, and crispy chips, 4 different types of salsa... What's not to love!? Also, the margaritas were delicious. I think they rim the glass with rosemary salt to give it an extra kick. 

The only reason I give it 4 out of 5 stars is because of the staff. They are very friendly but a bit... let's say ditzy? The first time I went, the server forgot our drinks several times, and when I went there this week, the server completely forgot about taking our order and came back about 15 mins later and said "whoa, I completely forgot about you guys!" Also, when I made a reservation, I had to repeat myself a number of times before the hostess got it right, and then when we got there, she still had the wrong amount of people for the rez. Minor details, I guess.

Overall, great place! Just make sure to make a rez--the place gets PACKED!
author: Lindsay W.

description:
Came here last night with friends and would go back in a heart beat. My only gripe was the wait, but it was Friday night in San Fran and I suppose that's the norm. It was more than an hour but you know what? When I put that food in my mouth, I almost passed out from the flavor.

Either that or I was starving. hahahah No, I wasn't. They were extremely generous with their chips and different salsas they offer. 

I will also tell you, the service was perfect! From the bar area to our waiter. They were fantastic and very attentive.

if you go-make sure to order the guacamole. You will not be disappointed. And if you are, call me and I will reimburse you. I will also call you tasteless because you are. 

I asked the waiter what HIS favorite margarita was and he brought me a "peppino" margarita, aka, cucumber. It was THEEEEEE bestest margarita. 

So, go, put your name in if it's Friday night, sit at the bar or wait for a spot to open, have some chips and try the salsas and a cucumber margarita. Don't forget the guaco.

Bien Provecha!
author: Mary C.

description: Ive been here a few times for lunch and drinks and have nothing but good things to say. Great food, reasonable prices, quick and friendly service, full bar where you can get several Mexican beers on tap,  or a mean margarita, and they don't HAVE bud light! Haha. This is a serious drinking bar, no fooling around. Great salsas and fresh fried tortilla chips too.
author: Nick C.

description:
I've been whining for over 3 years now about the lack of a decent burrito in this area... and am pleased to report that those days have come to an end.

I grabbed a take-out burrito from Tropisueno today (it's going to take me some time to remember the name) and came away happy.  

I went for the Veggie Burrito, which was very good and included freshly sauteed squash, peppers, mushrooms, etc.  This is a big step up from what a Veggie Burrito includes in most taquerias; only downside was that I had to wait 10 minutes while they sauteed the veggies (and if I'd gotten chicken it would have been instant).
author: Geoff D.

description: Yummy! I'm from Texas and have the best of Mexican and margaritas and this place is legit. Do it!
author: brittany g.

description:
i LOVED THIS PLACE!!!

The ambiance was INCREDIBLE. Very beachy latin vibe which was great and the food was absolutely fantastic! I love how they bring chupa chups with your bill, so cool! Big portions and just really great ambiance is what made it worth the while! Def would go here again!
author: Lissette L.

description: Not bad tacos but not awesome either. $12 for a margarita that is premixed is absurd. It also didn't seem to contain tequila. I am sure there are better spots in san fran.
author: Mark B.

description:
Dined here in Dec of '11 and I really enjoyed myself.  
The chips and salsa are amazing!  They had very a good variety on the drink menu.  

Loved the food!

app: 
S c a l l o p s d e  H a c h a  a  l a  P l a n c h a 1 1
Seared Sea Scallops on a plaintain-chorizo 
hash. Avocado-tomatillo salsa.

meal:
C h i l e   R e l l e n o   d e   B e e f   P i c a d i l l o   o   Q u e s o 12
cheese filled chile relleno

Only wish we weren't traveling since we had lots of leftovers.
author: Blythe Z.

description:
I come here sometimes for lunch, during there lunch hours there food is made on the line. So i usually get a super burrito (super: they add cheese, sour cream, guc, lettuce) which comes with chips &they have a salsa bar where you can fill up your own salsas.

I like this place a lot because of there chips. Always fresh and warm when i get them.
author: J W.

description: Too packed and loud! I can't see myself returning to this restaurant bc to have a covo you have to scream during the entire dinner.  The food was just ok, nothing special I could have skipped this place.
author: Vivian T.

description: Jose was an excellent bartender!!!! What the heck are those people talking about?? Plus he can make a margarita!
author: Jackie T.

description:
Had a lovely going away dinner for a friend two weeks ago here, and it was the perfect spot to celebrate great friendships over margs.

We actually had a reservation for 10 of us on Saturday night at 8:30, not sure what magic my friend had since it seems that it is hard to get a reservation, but she succeeded. 

We opted for app's and were very satisfied. The table did split ordering into two groups, so I am just speaking on behalf of 5 people.

The salsa combo with the chips was spot on. It provided something for everyone. The guacamole was also tasty.

As for what we ordered:

Platanos Fritos: I would suggest it and I am usually not a fan, but the black beans really made the dish.

Empanadas de Hongos: Tasty. I liked the crispness of the empanadas, and the guacamole was a nice, but necessary touch.

Scallops: I LOVED them, and the sauce was perfect. I will say though that I have a soft spot for scallops, so I may be biased.

Crispy Flautas: They were good, maybe a bit dry. However, that was also the last dish we were served and so I might have been too stuffed.

Service was on point, and we had two people looking over us at all times. They were also good sports, since one of my friends asked if the waiter would be her 'date' for the night!
author: Megan H.

description: Came here with a girlfriend last night and absolutely loved it. The food and service were both amazing. Also the environment felt fun and casual. They give you delicious chips and 3 kinda of salsa right when you sit down. It was an absolute plus because I was starving. And it was Sooo good! Definitely need to bring my hubby back to this place :)
author: Winnie L.

description:
You ever just want to walk out of your job, hop in the car, and drive south- way down south, to a warm tropical beach covered in sexy tan bodies smelling of coconuts sipping Margaritas and doing body shots of Patron??

Well for most of us on a Thursday afternoon, Tropisueno is as close as you're gonna get. Tropisueno even means my tropical dream.. So- If you still want to have a job on Friday, Tropisueno is where you go when you need a little Vaca in the middle of the day..

Honestly I'm fairly certain the idea for Tropisueno was stolen from 2 extremely popular hot spots in the Tri-Valley who have been around much longer.. But no matter, good food, great drinks, and consistently good service. I'll def keep coming back when I need a Margarita with lunch!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Erica B. loves her some Mexican food!  Though enchiladas are always a staple order of mine, I decided to go out on a limb here and try the shrimp burrito. The shrimps were all kinds of deliciousness.  They were big for burrito shrimp and grilled with some pretty nifty seasonings. The only problem being, there weren't that many of them.  The Tropisueno burrito is big, not small human baby big, but big in its own right.  For the size of this edible creation, there needed to be a larger shrimp to burrito accompaniment ratio.  In other words, I wasn't digging the overwhelming amount of lettuce and beans inside the flour shell. 

I have to give them applause for the salsa bar, and more importantly both the salsa verde and the bright orange colored salsa.  Both amazing, but the neon orange was pretty killer.  It resembled orange Tang and tasted like fireworks in my mouth.  Definitely had a kick and went well with their homemade tortilla chips and as a side dip for my burrito. 

I'd totally come back here again and try some other menu items.  I was a little overwhelmed by the wall menu and the amount of people lined up behind me.  It reminded me of my first trip to Subway back in 1991- I still have anxiety when I think of that process.  I don't like folks loitering about behind me pressuring me to make a quick decision.  It's just bad for the soul, and it results in order envy when you're lunching with a group.
author: Erica B.

description:
It's almost sad how often I come here. When friends come to town, it's here. When there's a lunch date to be set, it's here. When I'm just craving some mexican on my lunch hour, you'll see me here!

It's a nice restaurant with a casual ambiance. 

I usually order the quesadilla with pollo asado for lunch and munch on their unlimited perfectly thick, perfectly crunchy chips. 

I've also been here for dinner and had one of their "choose 3" dinner plates. Satisfying for sure.

Only caution: come here at 12 M-F and don't be surprised if you find yourself waiting for a table despite how large the restaurant is.
author: Tammy C.

description: Found this restaurant while walking around the Marriott Marquis.  40-minute wait to be seated, but they will text you with a 5-minute window so you can wonder around.  It was Saturday night.., and they were packed!!  This place is loud; not a place for intimate conversation.  The food was good, but nothing unexpected.  The wait staff was nice, but not very attentive.  Got one water refill before dinner was served, then nothing.  We had to flag someone down for the check.  This is the first time I've ever gone to a restaurant where the hostess advised us in advance that we'd have to be gone by a certain time so they could honor a reservation.  That's just weird, and not very welcoming.  I'd give the food 4-stars, but overall it was just a 3-star experience for me.
author: KL A.

description: Great mexican food right in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Here on a business trip, and met up with some friends. The food was quite excellent, and the atmosphere is awesome. The chips and salsa was pretty good, but I found that the salsa was quite hot (so, if you don't like spicy foods, you may not like the salsa). One word of advice: Either get here early, or make a reservation. This place tends to get packed very quickly at night.
author: Cory B.

description: good food. good ambience. salsa's were great. meats where fine. fried plantains were awesome.
author: Krishnan G.

description:
The best tortilla chips in San Francisco, and margaritas made how they should be made. I left full, slightly buzzed, and wanting more.

Atmosphere: Personable. Large seating areas, petite bar, private booths. Soundtrack: Classic mexican jukebox 

Crowd: Was pretty empty around 3:45, a few singles

Price: Margarita: Under $10, Burrito: $8.75

Try: Chips chips chips chips burrito margarita margarita margarita margarita, then walking out in a straight line
author: Taylor S.

description:
Hole mole!!!

Their mole is the best I've ever had. I've been here a few times and don't remember the other things I ordered... but the taste of their mole is ingrained in me. I wanna go back soon now!
author: Nana R.

description:
It started out great.  I see some people waiting inside, and I always have that "Did I make reservations for the right night?" panic.  But, I see my name on the computer, and I get seated right away.

The chips and salsa come out, and they were amazing.  Really light, and some really tasty salsa.  One has the heat, and there's the mild one for those that have more delicate palates.  And a couple other ones that were awesome.

But, 25 minutes goes by and I'm still waiting for my food.  At the same time, I get asked if I want a refill on my drink.  Then I get asked if I want a refill on my drink.  So, I move my glass over to the wall side.  Then I take another sip, and they ask if I want a refill on my drink.  And, when I'm finally done with it, (yeah - right, they asked me 3 times if I wanted a refill before I was even done with the first), he asks me again.  No No NO NO NO!

So, after almost half an hour, our meal finally comes.  Meh.  Absolutely nothing that would distinguish this from any other beans & rice place.  My friend's dish is too spicy for her, even though it didn't indicate that on the menu.  So, she has to scrape the sauce off.

Man.  I wish I'd gone to Amber next door.
author: masa s.

description: I normally don't write reviews, but this is literally the best food I have ever had in my entire life.  The burritos, quesadillas, and tortas are not only the best Ive ever had, but it is the best food I have every tasted in 28 years of life.  You must go here.  The lunch is the best.
author: Petey F.

description:
You know I drop in here when I'm ready to shop.  So I park across from the Metreon and bam!, I have a perfect margarita in less than a minute from my car.

I love their bar menu, tacos, ceviche, guac, more.  Top it off with a great marg, a Tecate, or glass of Clase Azul and you are good to go!

It's casual, I only like sitting at the bar, per usual, the food comes fast, it's delicious, and the drinks are perfect every time.  The dining room looks like rustic Mexico, with white linen tablecloths.  Great for a casual dinner or date night.

It's a no brainer...
author: Vincent M.

description:
Have now eaten at Tropisueno multiple times for lunch, so it's time for a YELP review...

I usually order the dark Mole with chicken, which is fantastic!  

Great fresh salsa bar along with fresh corn tortillas... 

Bottomline, this was a great surprise... it's off the beaten track but worth the visit!
author: Max J.

description: Great food! It can get expensive if you don't watch it, though. I'm happy to have finally found a mexican restaurant in SF. Tons of places in the mission for tacos, but this is a nice place to come out to with friends or a date.
author: Ami D.

description: Tropisueño has a cool vibe and some mean margaritas. Must try is the shrimp curry with rice and beans on the side. Its creamy , textured and the shrimps cooked to perfection. Mango margeritas are great too ! The guac was finger licking and we ordered a bunch for the table. Overall the price was affordable and we had a great time with our party of 8 !
author: Priyanka P.

description: Solid all around Mexican food.  I've been coming here for while (shortly after it opened) and I was amazed this place wasn't reviewed.  I love the drinks, apps, happy hour menu, and entrees.  Although one thing I've noticed recently is the increasingly busy dining area, so reservations or off peak dining is a recommended.  If possible, sit at the bar.  They've got a crazy good tequila selection.
author: Darin E.

description:
Tropisueno is a great dinner and drinks spot downtown

Great house margaritas with a chili-salt rim, yum! Really great light crispy chips with 3 different fresh salsas! The plantains with black beans are the best I've had in the city and the Shrimp dinner plate is delicious! it's spicy and creamy, oh so good! It's the perfect spot for grabbing dinner and margaritas before or after a movie.
author: Nicole D.

description:
A cute restaurant in a central location.  I loved the sauces with tortilla chips, the strong, tasty margaritas, and the Camarones Tropisueño (shrimp with cream, lime, cilantro sauce--delicious!).

My only complaint was that the servers/busers were a little too overzealous. The waiter had to come back three times to take our order and my dining companion and I aren't indecisive people by any means.
