The bus boy tried to take my plate away before I was done (I still had three shrimp and half my rice left on the plate so I was obviously not finished yet). 

Not quite as good as Colibri, but a fun place I'd definitely go back to.
author: Dani D.

description: OMG YUM... is all I have to say! Amazing food and cocktails! But, make sure to make a reservation...
author: Justine K.

description: Came here for lunch and ordered 2 chicken burritos with refried beans. Ended up getting 2 pulled pork burritos with black beans. Not a big deal - they apologized and fixed the order. Ate half of the burrito (which was mostly refried beans and a few pieces of chicken) and then bit into a piece of plastic.
author: Bryan D.

description:
DISORGANIZED.  I'll start with that, since that's the moral.  Food was satisfactory, but we had a hard time a) getting chips (free with entree, cmon!); b) getting the right food to our table -- there was a little mixup, but then we ended up with the right food; c) just in time to see the table next to us, who had ordered first not get their correct food for over 15 minutes.  Although it wasn't to me, I'm empathetic.  Not a good sign.

For those not in the know -- you order at the counter, sit with your number and wait.  Salsa bar had many choices -- some are hot, so if you have an aversion to spice, be careful. Had the tostada like salad, but the shell which was only a fried leaf wasn't crispy, and was soggy like it had been sitting out too long.  Not the best choice perhaps but I love those crispy shells when they come.  That was disappointing.  

We parked in the structure underneath for other reasons, but found it brought us almost right to the entrance (after we'd walked the full block to find it!).  So, at least there's an easy parking choice if you need it.
author: Gena U.

description: this place will be one of my favorite Mexican restaurant from now on every time that i will stop to the city and craving Mexican  food. the place is very pleasant and you don't wait to long for your food.. but gets really busy i will recommend to make a reservation before you go. anyways there chips are warm and crispy and served with 3 different salsas oh my god so good and spicy. my sister and i ordered a plate big enough to share , two tacos served with beans and rice really taste and order of ceviche de pescado just in the point so fresh and delicious. well i will totally recommended this place without doubt.
author: Gianina V.

description:
I moved here to SF City from Socal, and was a bit worried if I could find a good and honest traditional Mexican resturant. A friend of mine suggested this place for dinner and I was happy to find this hidden treasure. I have been here a few times and these are some of my suggested plates

Starters:
Scallops with Chroizo Hash-Great pairing and balance of flavor
Empanadas- Filled with mushroom and cheese. Our server informed us that they have a lady who is dedicated to make these as well as the temal and chili rellenos..That makes me feel that these are very special.

Entrees:
Albondigas- Hot and very filling. The broth is very savory and comes with rice... Perfect for cold nights. 
Chix Mole- Previous reviews say it all.. I am not a mole fan, but do order it when I come here. 
Chili Relleno- usually you find these soggy and way to heavy. Trop find a way to make the batter very light and they fill the chili with a good amount of cheese and covered in homemade sauce MmMMmmM
Chili Verde- slow roasted pork in a tangy balanced sauce a winner!
Pork Chop - forgot the name of this dish, but this one is worth the wait. It takes about 25 min to prepare, but that just tells me that this place focuses on freshness. The spices they use are very aromatic and the chop holds an insane amount of juice. They serve it with a slaw that help's balance the plate to perfection

There is nothing more I can say about the chips and salsa that has not been said before, but the margaritas I can go on and on about. You cannot really complain about them or their price due to the fact that they are made up to par of what SF locals demand. They are natural, fresh, strong and made with a higher grade of tequila. Our server informed us that it was only lime juice, agave and blanco tequila. :)
There infused salts keep me very interested. A favorite drink of mine is the Aztec Manhattan.. PLEASE TRY IT!

The decor is warm and inviting.. which is always how i have found our service. For what you get for your price if definitely gets 5 stars. 

Now if trop could only let me know how they get their flour tortillas to taste and hold together like they do??
author: Ryann C.

description:
Words cannot do justice to the actual experience at this place - you must experience it for yourself!  The service was impeccable! The food was delicious! The drinks were juicy! The ambiance was the finishing touch!  It is perfect for a date or for a nice dinner with friends.

We made reservations ahead of time.  Highly recommended since we went on a Saturday.  We were seated within one minute of arriving.

It was a group of four of us who had never been here and we unanimously agreed that this place would get a 5.  No other dining establishment we've been to even comes close.  FYI...we are all originally from LA and this, by far, is the best Mexican Food we have found in the Bay Area.

The three salsas and chips they provide are flavorful.  Here is the rest of what we ordered that left us craving for more in the future:
Oyster Appetizer
Chile Verde
Albondigas (intense taste)
Camarones Tropisueno (spicy)
Patron Margaritas
Pepino (Cucumber) Margaritas *****

Enjoy!!
author: Eddie T.

description: Great mexican restaurant and bar with reasonably priced food and drinks. My favorite items are the tropisueno torta and any of the burritos. There orange sauce at the salsa station is excellent as well. The food comes out fast and has always been good. They have a full bar which is convenient but with no wait staff during the day time you have to go up to the bar any time you want a drink. The margaritas are decent, i prefer colibri up a few blocks for there drinks.
author: Zino M.

description: That dookie sauce chicken is crazy good.  I want to bring 2 girls and put that sauce in a cup for them.  Too bad I don't know any girls.  :(
author: Richard N.

description:
If you're in San Francisco and looking for:
Nice, yet affordable
Authentic Mexican, yet authentic English speaking
Fun, yet romantic

Then Tropiseuno is your best bet.... even better if you're catching a movie at the Metreon. 

The margaritas are good, the burritos are great, the tacos are good, and the chile relenos are the best I've had. One complaint, the food is a bit more bland then I'm used to in my Americanized vision of "mexican food", but then again, if Chevy's/Chipotle is your idea of Mexican then you haven't had real Mexican food.  Either way it's the most authentic you can get without being sold parasailing and narcotics on the way in.

Another plus: they start every table off with a bowl of chips and a salsa sampler (some of the best salsa I've had).
author: Matt M.

description: Great place for mid week lunch and happy hour. They  make excellent margaritas w/ a spicy rim. Delish.
author: Marco V.

description:
My girlfriend and I ran into this place for shelter from the rain during a busy Friday happy hour. We put our name in and were told to expect a 1-hour wait. We were cool with that and planned to drink the time away at the bar. The second we got to the crowded bar and did that stand-on-your-tippy-toes look for the bartender we were greeted with a smile and the bartender suggested that we hover "over there" because some people would be leaving soon. A few minutes later we had a pair of seats at the bar. 

From the moment I ate the first bite of homemade chips and salsa I knew this place would be legit. We ordered a masa/chorizo appetizer that was pretty outstanding! My girlfriend had a pair of beef and pork tacos--I stole a bite of each and they were great! I had chicken and mole sauce which was okay--they serve it as a bone-in leg and thigh which I would agree has better flavor than a boneless cut--but deboning a bird smothered in (tasty) sauce is a little awkward.

On top of the great food, the service (in our case two bartenders) was really great. They were super friendly and talkative and even made my girlfriend an off-the-menu drink with raw egg whites and a house made pepper infused tequila. 

By the time we left the crowd had died down, the rain died down and we were both stuffed!
author: Todd E.

description: Went here for lunch on a late Saturday afternoon, and it was just fine. During lunch, is a self-seating type situation where you go up to the counter to place your order, and then find a table. There is a pretty good variety of traditional Mexican fare, and the prices are very reasonable. There is a small, full bar towards the back of the place, and there is some outdoor seating as well. Good place to grab a bite for lunch, would go back.
author: Jeff S.

description: Their food is always amazing! I love the burrito and can't stop eating the chips and half dozen types of salsas!
author: Bay M.

description:
The food was good so I'll give them another chance, but:

Service was not good:

- sat our group at a too small table (and we had a reservation!)
- we were fine and said nothing, but ~20 minutes in and all settled in they made us move (no choice in the matter) and to a demoted, non-booth. 
- took awhile to take our order
- food came piece-meal (some problem in the kitchen?). My plate came with just meat and a huge pile of rice. Beans thrown down on the table way later. Tortillas then came later even. The veggies and guac that are supposed to join the entree never existed. It was like they cooked half the meal, sent out our plates, and then as they made everything else later, sent those items as they were ready: so weird! No explanations or apologies. 
- I came home to see they marked me as an OpenTable "no show." Thanks. I wasn't late and we saw our name on their computer screen, so this was just a screw-up. I had to email OpenTable to get my credit...

Good resto so please fix yourself!
author: Catt G.

description:
I came here on Saterday night and it was awesome. I made reservations for a late dinner at 9pm and we were seated in a few minutes. Our waitress was amazing. She helped us choose from the menu and pick out some delicious cocktails. 

I had the regular Margarita and the Chile Verde. My cocktail was perfectly strong and the Chile Verde was enough for more than three meals. I literally ate it for dinner, and then breakfast and lunch. Our waitress was super nice and sent us home with extra tortillas and salasa so we could make more meals out of our (pretty much meat based) dinners.

The location is sort of hidden...it was dark but it looked like it was in the bottom of an office or apartment building. Its not right off the street...I had to call to find it after the cab dropped us off "right in front". 

The inside is super cute...authetic yet modern. The rumor is they have a fantastic happy hour from 5-7pm I think. The waitress told us to definitely try that next. 

Overall...great mexican food spot in SF.
author: Juliet S.

description:
They have the best margaritas here! I ordered the house margarita for $8 a glass and had 2 orders of it. It's good because it doesn't  taste overly sweet and I actually taste tequila! 

Another cool factor is that they give you four dipping sauces for your chips. They were all delicious. We ordered the scallops as a starter. It was $10 and came with just 3 scallops. Total tease but was ok/good. The chicken mole on the other hand is a must have!  $14, great portion size, the 2 chicken legs in there were so juicy and tender and it came with a side of beans and 2 tortilla wraps. loved it!
author: Jeanne L.

description: I've been to Tropisueño twice. Once for my birthday and once on New Years Eve. Both times have been great! The drinks are very tasty and the food is delicious! The portions are very good and you are definitely getting your moneys worth. I would recommend the enchiladas, both the veggie or the chicken. The sauce they come in is very unique and tasty. On your birthday you get a yummy dessert too! The restaurant is very nice, and the food is good, and it's not over priced for being downtown.
author: Saralee L.

description:
Disappointing.   My wife and I went on the recomendation of someone we met on the flight out.  To be fair he suggested lunch there specifically the burritos.  We found out later that you cannot get the burritos for dinner.  

We made a reservation for a Friday.  When we arrived, we were seated promptly even though walk ups had up to an hour wait.  It was a nice cool evening outside, unfortunately the restaurant was ungodly hot inside.  It probably was 80 degrees inside and there are no fans.  It was extremely uncomfortable. 

We had fried plantains and a scallop/chorizo appetizers which were good.  Unfortunately our entrees left a lot to be desired.  We both had the combination plate with enchiladas and a pork tamale.  They were all below average and my enchiladas were lukewarm.  I probably wouldn't go back again.  $70 (one beer) for mediocre Mexican food is not my idea of a good evening.
author: R F.

description: I went here for a late lunch with some out of town guests based on the reviews I read here and was not disappointed.  First, the chips they give you and very light and crispy and there are plenty of salsas and picos to choose from at their little salsa bar.  I didn't really come away with a favorite and I was trying to find the salsa that every one was saying was so hot, but I'm usually not the person to ask how spicy something is because I have a pretty high heat tolerance.  I had the Pablano Mole and it was very good.  It was kind of sweet and very flavorful, with some very tender chicken.  I'd gladly order it again, but there is a lot of other things I want to try on their menu.  I'll gladly be back sometime to try out some of their other dishes and their margaritas.
author: Scott L.

description:
OK...I'll start off by saying that I had pretty "meh!" expectations for Tropesueno.  Let's face it, it is tucked in under the Ginormous Marriott, is appointed with fakey looking beams and accessories, and always seemed to be filled with tourists/convention goers, etc.  Anyway, I needed to be down at Yerba Buena last week and decided to give it a try.

We had reservations at 7:15, and arrived a bit early only to find a big crowd around the host stand.  We gave our name and were told that our table would be ready closer to our reservation time (Reasonable, but I was fully prepared to be disappointed, as I have heard that before at other restaurants only to have to wait around for an extra half hour, depute a reservation).

Just to prove me wrong, at 7:16, they called our name and showed us to our table.  What followed was near perfect service, really great chips and salsa, and a meal that was truly delightful (had the huaraches...huge, but I ate it all!!!).  The only less than stellar part of the meal was that the flan was too much like creme brûlée for my taste (I like creme brûlée, but not when I want flan).

Having long ago decided that a decent sit down Mexican restaurant was all but extinct in San Francisco, I was extremely happy to have my preconceived notions about Tropesueno proved completely wrong.  We will definitely go back.
author: Matt M.

description: Ohhhhh man! I cannot I was always walking by this place. This is like a higher upscale chipotle. You walk in, look at a menu on the wall, and then you tell the cooks what you want to order. It's completely customizable. Once you order, you sit anywhere you want and you're brought chips to the table. You get your own water and salsa. I ordered the beef enchilada combo and Oh. My. God. It was so amazing!  Refried beans had the perfect consistency and spice. The rice was flavorful and crumbly, just how I like it. The beef was juicy and tender. The best part, it's affordable. Come during lunch and it's $13 for a combo plate. Plenty of food. I grew up in a small town so we had a lot of Mexican restaurants to choose from and they were close. In sf, you have to hunt down a good mexican restaurant, but look no further, because tropisueño is located in yerba Buena park across from target. Definitely going back and will be inviting my family when they come visit.
author: Eric M.

description: Zero stars for this place due to the management.  Went there for happy hour, was ready to order a second drink just before expiration of happy hour and manager said he would not honor happy hour because they had other, more important priorities.  Reached out to owners, but no response.  Will not eat here again until this manager is gone and will tell everyone I know.  Horrible customer service, worst I've ever seen in my 40 years. Hate to see owners who seem to have a dream to place their restaurant in the hands of a manager like this.
author: SCOTT F.

description:
I can only speak to their lunch and it seems like their dinner and drinks are pretty good.

I ordered the shrimp entree that came with salad, rice, beans and tortillas. While all the ingredients were fresh (and I also appreciate the self-serve salsa bar), it wasn't really the most impressive tasting Mexican food I've ever had. The shrimp was cooked fine and had flavor but you only get 6. I found myself slathering on hot sauce to get some extra zest.

Friends ordered the fish tacos, chile relleno, and chicken taco. They weren't super impressed either. If this place is close to your work, it could be a good choice but there are definitely better Mexican places in SF.
author: Jackie T.

description:
i always walk by this place during lunch, but there's always a line out the door, so i skip it. no line today, so i head in with some friends.  not what i thought it was at first, because how it works is you walk in, get in line, order your food and get a number.  then go find a table.  

overall, tasty food.  i think i ordered the wrong thing (shrimp burrito).  i give most of the stars here to the chips and salsa bar.  unlimited chips and UNLIMITED SALSA!!! my kind of place.  plus it's tasty salsa.  i think we had a smoky chipotle mayo one, spicy habanero, salsa verde, and maybe an avocado cilantro one.  chips were fresh and warm when they arrived at the table.  i always end u eating way too much and when my food arrives, i never finish it.

okay... so the shrimp burrito.. not so great.  i thought it was going to be a grilled shrimp, but it was more like boiled and then sauteed... missing out on that smoky flavor.  the burrito included lettuce, tomato, rice, and beans.  quacamole and sour cream an extra $1 each.  mehh.. for $13, i've had better.  i should've done what my friends did and get a combo plate, which was just meat, beans, rice, and soft tortillas on the side.  

i'll go back some day.. maybe pay day
author: Tina L.

description: My hubby and I and our son and grandson wandered in here for lunch yesterday. We were all 4 of us yumming the whole time. I had the chicken taco. Outstanding. Nice bits of shredded moist chicken rivaling the best I've ever had. My son had a platter with several offerings and was swooning from the whole thing. My hubby had a torta with 4 meats. That was spectacular. I wanted to completely hijack it. The prices are good, location is great, right by Sony Metreon. If you're in that area and like good Mexican food, look no further!
author: Barbara S.

description: This little gem is a hop and a skip from work so I frequent here often.  It's usually very busy during the week during lunch rush hour as well as after work for happy hour.  Overall a great place to catch a drink (I recommend their margaritas) and get some good tasting Mexican food.  This is a little bit of an upscale Mexican restaurant so don't expect taqueria prices.  But really it's not much more either - about $10 for a burrito. Check it out next time you're in the area.  You can also order online which is quite convenient if you happen to go during the busy times.
author: Christina F.

description:
As far as I'm concerned Tropisueno is the only decent burritto in the Financial District.

They have always  made my burrito exactly to my specifications, they use fresh ingredients and I love how the decor is like an old adobe style...very cool place.
author: G L.

description:
We really wanted this place to be better. Their best items are the chips and salsas and honestly we may be back just for that. The ceviche and empanadas de hongos were good but not amazing.

As for entree's, the chile verde has a nice kick and the chile relleno is pretty darn good; the enchiladas were okay and likely would have been better had they not been lukewarm...I like my food HOT!  Portions are HUGE...you will not leave hungry at all.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: Dearest Yelpers, I have you to thank for guiding me here with your great reviews. I certainly was not sorry for heading to this lovely gem. The pros: Good ambiance, with a low-key but happening crowd. Chips and a DELICIOUS salsa sample presented to each the table (Note: The adobo salsa kind of blew our minds. You'd swear there was cream in it, but the server assured us there was no such ingredient; this amazing stuff is vegan. We ordered more.) Very sizeable portions. Solid service. The only con? We ordered a bottle of wine and got a weird look with a "No one orders wine here." Well, we are, so ... yeah. Anyways, great place!
author: Stefanie J.

description:
Ah yes, Tropisueno! Weird fact: I actually heard about this place during a job interview and the interviewer seemed legit enough so I figured, why not give it a try? To my surprise, it has become one of my favorite places to take anyone in the city. 

What I really like about Tropisueno is that they have typical Mexican restaurant things like tacos and enchiladas, but they also have other more interesting seafood and soups and all that more interesting stuff! When I go there, however, I love getting the plantains as an appetizer, which is an interesting find, especially at a Mexican restaurant. They really grill them well and it has a great sauce on top. For entree, I typically get the three entree-ed, "Los Favoritos" with a carne asada taco, chicken enchiladas, and a pork tamale. Omg, the beef in the carne asada taco is grilled so well and the mole on that chicken enchilada - fabulosa - and the pork tamale is surprisingly tender and juicy. Oh and the free chips? Uh, is it just me, or does that seem like a slight luxury nowadays? Maybe I'm just going to the wrong places... The vibe is good, the chefs at Tropisueno seem like they know what's up - all in all, if you're looking for a great place for happy hour, or a nicer alternative to Andale's at the mall, Chevy's down the street, or Chipotle, Tropisueno is that must-go. Oh such a great find! (+1 point for that epicurean consultant from Accenture! )
author: T.T. T.

description: I thought the food and service were great. It is a busy location, however, so it was a bit noisy and packed.
author: Chris B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised, as most SF "upscale" Mexican places serve overpriced, tiny portions of unremarkable food. I'm with Louie M on the orange salsa--my husband and I polished it off immediately. Between the two of us we had five dishes (we were starving) and everything was quite good.

I really loved that the music in the dining area wasn't blasting. I hate it when restaurants turn the volume up so high you can't hear your dining companion and you have to shout your order to the waiter. It makes me short-tempered and cranky and instead of sticking around for dessert or a few more drinks I leave and never go back.
author: J H.

description:
Yummy!   Can't wait to get to SF again to go back.  It really was THAT good!  It's conveniently located by the Marriott Marquis.  The food is reasonably priced.
Suggestion:  Go to the Skybar at the Marriott Marquis to begin your evening.  Have a cocktail & enjoy the views.  Then, downstairs & out the backdoor to Tropisueno for some delicious food & killer cocktails!
author: Jen R.

description:
A coworker and I checked out this place for lunch one day. I ordered the cheese enchilada plate. It was phenomenal and a little spicier than other Mexican food I've had so far in California, which coming from Texas, I liked. 

Bonus: Lunch was under $10, which other than stopping at a food stand isn't the easiest to come by in the area!

The Verdict: I checked out their happy hour and their catering menu, and I suspect I will be back to this place!
author: Cara S.

description: Free chips with a variety of dips at the start of your meal. Sounds good to me! Great deal for its portion too. The line is super long. For dinner, make reservations or you will wait a hour!
author: Ka Yan C.

description:
I've been here twice with my boyfriend, and each time, we got really full on the chips and salsa alone (had it refilled twice while waiting for food) and had to take at least half of our actual meal to go. But it was worth it, cos they're soooo good!!

That's not to say that the 'real' food wasn't great though, because it was. I'm not too familiar with Mexican food (grew up in Singapore), so I always have trouble deciding what to order, but you can't seem to go wrong here!! I've tried the chicken mole and pollo asado, and the chicken always comes out so tender and delicious! The mole got a little too rich for me at some point (or I was just too full on chips and salsa) but I still really enjoyed it. The pollo asado was perfect! My boyfriend had the chile verde both times, and is a fan.

Got everything packed into to-go boxes when we left... even the chips and salsa. Especially the chips and salsa. Unfortunately, the little container for the salsa wasn't closed properly, and most of it spilled out into the bag before we got home... I think my boyfriend almost cried.

Pretty sure we're gonna find ourselves eating here again!
author: Ju J.

description:
I love this place soooo much.  I cannot recommend enough their Chile Relleno burrito - it's a chile relleno inside a burrito!  Also, they have the best salsas in their salsa bar.

Great vegetarian options.  I go here about once a week.
author: Jon M.

description: Love the chips & dip in this place. especially the green sauce. hella good. Love the spicy margarita, it was just right.  I am craving for another one.  Would love to come for happy hour but probably not so much for the food.  The wait is ridiculously long for a table from 45-1hr on a busy weekend.  The only flaw about this place is that they only have one restroom for each gender, come on! it's a bar and restaurant, whoever designed this place is really stupid.
author: Ann L.

description: My husband wanted "authentic" Mexican food and I wanted something good..... This place is the perfect blend. Great food, great salsa.  Easy, quick ordering and you're eating in no time. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to eat Mexican food in SF.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Fish taco, fish taco, chips, chips. Guess what I like to get here? I wish I could eat the fish tacos all the time, every time. But that would require me to go to the gym more often than I do now.

The regular burritos are enormous. I could eat half and have the other half for dinner. It's just that big. 

The chips are so light and crispy. Love that. This beats the chips at Chevy's which is saying a lot as the chips are the only reason I go to Chevy's. 

I love that there is a good selection of salsas at the salsa bar.

Yes, there's a lot of seating inside but I wish there was seating outside too.
author: cyndi L.

description: Have been here once before and it was during HH and was by myself. This time I went there with my br and is was a little impressed by the service and the lighting. It was good food but nothing to rave about. Good mart's and they kept asking if everything was ok. Very prompt service. Thanks for stuffing me and my bf full of food!!
author: Brian O.

description:
I had the chicken, steak and the fried fish taco. 
I'd definitely go back for the chicken and the steak- not so much the fish. I have to say that I am ridiculously picky when it comes to fish though.

One of my favorite parts of the meal was the chips and salsa. The chips were by far the BEST chips I have ever tasted at any Mexican Restaurant in SF. 
They are so good that I really want to go back for the Nachos. 

The Happy hour is really cheap and its a great way to unwind after a long day. 
I had a michelada which was $4. Definitely worth it. 
I tried a sip of my friend's $3 margarita and I was not a huge fan. It was a little sweet for my taste and I am a little spoiled with the fresh squeezed lemon-lime sour that I make at my job for the margaritas.  
(I bartend for a living so I think I am a bit pickier about what goes in my drinks than most people.) 

Overall, great experience. 
I am going back for the happy hour again :)
author: Zuri P.

description:
Tropisueño is a pretty decent place to get a burrito at lunchtime. It's not the  very best burrito in the area (that would be Maya) or the best value (the Los Compadres taco truck), but they make a decent-sized, tasty burrito for less than $8 including tax. I recommend the pollo tinga and the (pork) chile verde. I come here pretty often because it's in the same block as my work.

Tropisueño also deserves high marks for its salsa bar. My favorite is the salsa verde with guacamole mixed in.

I also appreciate having a good source of ceviche this close to my work. (Again, not the best ceviche in SF, but so what?) They make their ceviche with tilapia, which is supposed to be low in mercury and sustainably caught/raised.

Also, if you've only been here for lunch, I highly recommend checking them out for dinner. Their Chuleta de Puerco Adobada (pork chop Adobado) has a complex, subtle flavor, and comes perfectly cooked if you order it medium.

They seem to be a little lost as to what on their menu is gluten-free (they couldn't give a clear answer about the chorizo), but I can vouch for the Chuleta and the Platanos Fritos (fried plantains).
author: Dave M.

description: Great guacamole & Veggie burrito. Others had ceviche & fish tacos. Chips & salsa complementary.
author: Lulu d.

description: Really liked the vibe and the food was delicious. The portions were a little small for the price point but the drinks were very creative and delicious. Good for dates, but get a reservation because the places fills up pretty quick.
author: Joe W.

description:
Sat at the bar and grabbed dinner here on a Sunday night. Staff was very friendly and service was fantastic. Ordered the Duende drink (absinthe and tequila) and this weird combo works perfectly if you are like me and love the taste of fennel/licorice. Two Duende's later I was pretty damn happy. 

Food was delicious. The guac was good but not spicy enough for my liking so I asked for more jalepenos. They brought a small dish of sliced and grilled jalepeno slices. The smokey spicy flavor of these jalepenos made the guacamole taste perfect. delicious. also a big fan of warm tortilla chips...which they gave. if you dont want to spring for guac its okay...they give you 3 salsa dipping sauces complimentary when you sit down. all 3 are homemade and offer different flavors. (tip...they are a good way to get a sense of the dishes served because a few of the main dishes use a sauce based in one of the 3 salsas provided) 

Ordered the mahi mahi entree and was not dissappointed. it was a tasty light option with flavorful rice. for the first time i had WHITE beans with my rice instead of black or red. Apparently they are peruvian...a little sweet but a nice change from the normal rice and beans dishes.

id go back here anytime...highly recommended
author: Peter F.

description:
Delicious.

I went here twice during my 5 day stay.

For dinner:
- incredibly priced, right to what it should be
- tried the enchilladas with cheese and verde sauce - so so so good
- loved the rice
- wished the beans were creamier, tasted a bit like it was from a can
- loved the gaucomole and margarita, right on point - and the salsas

For happy hour:
- so freaking reasonable, and even cheaper than dinner

A MUST TRY.  DONE DONE DONE DEAL!  I wish I tried more and I wish it was in New York!!  The joint is spacious, and its located between 3rd and 4th street - I had a hard time finding it.
author: Namrata A.

description:
PREFACE: Before you all get excited abou the special listed above "Bring 5 friends to the bar and drink for free" let me break down what this special really means. Hot deal right? How can you pass this offer up.. yeah that's what we thought. But what it really means is buy 5 drinks (hence bring 5 friends), and you get 1 free (your drink free). So yeah, just had to throw that one out there first.

Now on to the food. My girlfriends and I made a trip up to SF for the weekend and decided to eat here before a night of dancing at Roe. The wait was a little long but that was anticipated as it was a Saturday night so I can't complain there.

I highly recommend sitting at the bar while you're waiting for your table. Not only do you get to work up your appetite, or in my case KILL my appetite, with their delicious chips and salsa (the orange one in the trio is money!) but you can also get a round of their house margaritas! The chips like many have stated are on the frail side so don't load up on too much guacamole or salsa or they'll break on you.

Things you must order:
+Chile Relleno -- Devine! This was literally melt in your mouth, cheese exploding everywhere kind of good. It's stuffed with beef, raisins, and olives too!

+Chile Verde - There are enough comments on this one so I won't even need to go into detail. Let's just say of the 7 girls, 4 of them ordered this.

The food was great and the service was even better. An added bonus was the close proximity to Roe. So if you're trying to find a nice, decent priced restaurant in SOMA, check this place out.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
Shoot, I didn't realize my repost (below) deleted my original post. Anyway, I've used their catering/delivery service many times and the food has always been delicious (taco bar, fajita bar, salad, rice, beans, ceviche). Customer service is always way above average as well =)

O wow,

I just got off the phone with the manager who read my yelp review (only posted about an hour ago) apologizing for the lack of fajita servings. He remembers us fr our several other orders and insisted he make this right and not lose our business - which indeed, he won't. Hooray for managers/restaurants that care!!!
author: Kimberly P.

description:
This restaurant is so good. We are so lucky to have such an amazing mexican restaurant downtown. Its worth going that extra 10 mins to avoid Colibri. My friends & family absolutely love this restaurant and would would never go any place else.

Its prices are definetly not the prices you find in the mission but for the location and taste its great. They have a great happy hour menu that includes some of the best margaritas ever. I send plenty of guests here from the hotel and never have I had any complaints.

Keep up the good work everyone!
author: Gina S.

description:
Thank you, Tropisueno, for making my birthday dinner in SF a memorable one.

All of us enjoyed our meals and my friend's eyes even bulged out when he took his first bite into the chicken. It was that good. My tampiqueno dish was delicious and the chips and salsa were on point! 

I can't say enough about how great the service was. The staff was welcoming and our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and attentive.

Delicious food, great service, amazing ambience, and highly recommended!
author: MyLinh P.

description: I like the ambience of this place.  The food is decent and the servings are big.
author: Fe R.

description: Great salsa. The beef cheeks tacos so rich and delish. Also the scallop dish was very tastie. Loved the cake soaked in coconut milk. will be coming here again soon.
author: P C.

description:
The best thing about this place is the different salsa they serve with their chips.... the salsa was absolutely amazing.  I had the tacos which were pretty good, but no better than your local taco truck and little overpriced.  
Their margaritas were pretty good and strong, and this is the only place I know which has a extensive margarita menu.  Margaritas here are expensive, over $10 a glass.  However, I did get a good buzz after having 2 margaritas.

They do have a happy hour, but good luck getting a seat.  Their bar area is very small and usually crowded.
author: Emmett B.

description:
SHORT VERSION:

PROS:
-Horchata was very good (nice and sweet)
-Guacamole was excellent (chunky and spicy)

CONS:
-Food was awful...I mean really bad
-Service wasn't terrible, but we encountered 2 staff members with bad attitudes
-Overpriced
-Parking garage was a few blocks away
 
LONG VERSION:

I decided to take my teenage daughter to SF (we live in SJ) to go out to eat and explore SF's stores and things. I yelped Mexican food in SF (my personal favorite) and Tropisueno came up with decent reviews. My daughter and I were starving by the time we got to SF and were really looking forward to a great meal. First, this place is somewhat confusing, because it's not a restaurant where you sit down and order your food, it's taqueria style, so you order your food, pay for your food, and take a seat with a number and wait for a server to bring your food to you. I didn't mind, but I just wasn't expecting that. (The woman who took our food order had a very bad attitude, but the man who rang us up was nice). Anyhow, we sat down and enjoyed our chips and guacamole, and a few minutes later our food arrived. The presentation was great..my carne asada (steak) tacos looked amazing, but they tasted awful (they also forgot the avocado I paid extra for). I mean I have never in my life tasted anything so foul. The taste was very sour and I kind of wondered if they gave me the wrong meat or if the meat was spoiled. I let my daughter take a bite and she agreed, it was terrible. The refried beans were luke warm and tasted old. The rice is a Spanish rice and it was very dry. My daughter had a burrito and the entire thing fell apart because there was so much juice from the beans that  the tortilla ripped. She was going to eat it with a fork, but there was hardly any meat inside and she said it was nothing special, so why bother. We both really enjoyed the horchata though. Anyhow, we left our plates untouched except for a few bites, and we just got up and left. It was $40 total, and a complete waste of money, because we left hungry and the taste I had in my mouth from the meat was literally making me gag. Thankfully, we went to a great place in the Mission District called Rooselvelt's Tamale Factory and let me tell you..hands down a MUCH better choice! I really don't know why anyone would eat at Tropisueno. There is nothing authentic or tasty about their food and I truly think I would have enjoyed some roach coach tacos or a hole in the wall taqueria more than I did this place. I hope the owners make some changes, because while this place has potential (a small bar, in a heavy traffic area, nice interior/ambiance) they are falling very short on food/prices/service. Never again!
author: Rowena C.

description: Love Mexican food, and these guys know what they are doing.  Went old school with the enchiladas....and was not disappointed.  Red sangria was very tasty!
author: Joseph K.

description: I had the vegetarian nachos and the poblano pepper with cheese.  Both came out really good and the dishes came out really fast.  I was very impressed overall and definitely will be back!
author: Sherwyn R.

description:
This place may be good for people who eat meat... But for people on vegetarian diet, this is place to avoid!!  There is barely anything for vegetarian. Up on request to the waiter, they brought us some small side of mixed vegetables and whole lot of bean which were flavorless.

Again, my reviews are only concerning the vegetarian options.. We ended up going to Tropisueno's since on Yelp, it says it recommended for vegetarian.. Take heed.

Also, its very loud. That may be a problem depending on the situation.
author: Avinash S.

description: Great food and atmosphere. 2nd time here and with the office guys.  They loved it as well. Order the enchilada platter and the nachos with fresh salas is the best.
author: Javed S.

description: Grabbed a reservation with OpenTable, just in case... was glad we did as there was a good line waiting when we arrived.  Food was good, reasonably priced for SF, and the salsa was outstanding!
author: Justin G.

description: THEIR ORANGE SAUCE! That's pretty much all you need to know about this place. Oh, and maybe that they have such delicious food! It's lively and great for groups. They don't take reservations so get here early before the lunch rush.
author: Jasleen K.

description:
Was having a great dinner here for the first time, right up until I came down with food poisoning from the albondigas I ordered! Sadly enough it was my birthday of all days and I was there with a group of friends. I spent the rest of the night hugging a toilet. So if you don't mind passing out on your bathroom floor after a decent mexican meal, give it a shot!

Ps - there are way better alternatives to this place. I love Chilangos for instance.
author: Chris T.

description:
Awesome Mexican restaurant. I was taken here by a friend for my graduation dinner and chose here because I'd come by for an elite event awhile ago and remember their food being pretty good. 

The service was friendly and fast. The margarita my friend got was delicious and I liked the fact that they had ice cold Bohemia on hand. They went all out with the decoration too which I thought was pretty cool.

The chips they brought out were warm and they brought out like 4 different salsas which I thought was dope because my friend likes milder stuff while I tend to prefer things on the spicier side.

I ordered the chile verde and loved it, thought maybe the sauce could've been a lil spicier but other than that it was on point. She ordered the flautas which I ate the rest of when she got full. I thought they were pretty crackin too when dipped in salsa.

All in all a great experience. Definitely plan on returning, probably for my bday dinner coming up in a couple months.
author: Tommy P.

description:
I live their food, it makes me want to jump up and dance!  The margaritas are incredible and so authentic. I also giggly recommend the chile relleno burrito. 
  This little haven it's affordable especially compared to all the way over priced fare options in the Yerba Buena area. It's also a greet, casual place to meet up for lunch or after work. 
  Keep in mind that during the day, it's a classic taqueria. At night, they transform it to a restaurant with dim lights and higher prices
author: Demitri S.

description:
After going to Tripisueno a few times again, I would have to say the wait time is quite shorter. Average wait is about 5 minutes to order and 10 minutes to receive the order. Total amount of 20 minutes is not too bad considering how big of a lunch rush this place gets.

What I usually get is a carne asada burrito. The consistency of their quality really varies based on the lunch rush. Most of the time, it's a good burrito without rips or sauce spilling out. Once in a while, it a burrito with all those problems. Well, nothing is perfect so once in a while is understandable. Their burrito is quite big and contains a good amount of meat, rice, and beans. The carne asada is not the greatest quality meat but it is nicely soft and tasty. What I found out is there's an option to make the burrito spicier by asking them to put hot sauce into it.

The burrito comes with a nice amount of freshly made chips. There is a sauce bar near the bar area of the restaurant. Their orange sauce which I have no clue what's it call is very tasty with a nice hint of spiciness. There's the regular salsa and other commonly found sauces at this sauce bar.
author: Steven B.

description:
Husband and I had dinner here last week - it was over 80 in the city - very unusual. Restaurant was crowded, made reservation from Yelp page and managed to walz right in past the walk-in waiting line.

Chips and salsa were great, and I mean that! Much more than the stock chips and salsa delivered at most restaurants- chips thin, warm, crispy - 4 different salsas including one hot (temperature wise - yum!   

If there's Mole on the menu, I need to try it - OMG it was great!!!  Rivaled some home made family recipes I've experienced way south of the border. 

Staff were very friendly and attentive. Decor nice.  Not too noisy.
5 stars.
author: Michelle K.

description: Amazing service from the bar to the tables. Incredibly knowledgeable staff. Get the Tostaditos de Carnitas. The flavor is incredible! This restaurant is truly an experience. Its so fun and beautiful inside. Its also located in a great area with plenty to do around there. I am already excited to go back.
author: Dexter H.

description: What a great Mexican restaurant! The food, drinks, decor, and waitstaff make this place a great option for singles, couples, or groups. Another perk is that the prices are very affordable, and you get a lot of value for your money. I would definitely recommend this restaurant, it was a wonderful experience.
author: Shaun L.

description:
This Mexi-Can establishment doesn't need my vote but since I'm currently devouring a delicious monster of a burrito right now it only seems appropriate that I leave my $0.02. 

The Food: solid, authentic eats. Their burritos are a special 3lb bundles of savory chicken (or other meaty goodness), saucy beans, fresh pico de gallo, perfectly formed rice pellets and a tortilla skin that sings the sweet lardy song of yumminess. 

The Drinks: margarita madness. Those things are not only lethal but delicious and on the rocks as a rule. It's hard NOT to order one of those bad boys for lunch.

The Staff: friendly and most importantly, fast. I think it's a bit odd that you have to order the food separate from your drinks but they try to make the process smooth. 

The Atmosphere: with the counter ordering and "take a number" system, they encourage a take-out audience. But for a take-out place they've got quite a bit of comfortable eating space. Definitely a nice spot to spend your lunch (or dinner) hours. 

Now if only I can figure out a way to put you in my suitcase, Tropisueño...
author: Jane K.

description:
Top menu selections by far (in my opinion):

1) Ceviche de Pescado: With a dash of fresh cilantro and avocado this ceviche will leave you craving for more!
2) Platanos Fritos: Who doesn't like fried plantains!? Warm, sweet and crispy it makes for the perfect appetizer!
3) Tampiqueño: If you're a meat lover order THIS! Good enough to share is you're not too hungry but definitely the best meat dish they have on the menu!

Can't decide? Their combo plates are also good and come with a hefty serving.

Overall a great, sit-down Mexican restaurant that will serve your Mexican Craving good!
author: Andrew S.

description: One of my absolute favorite burritos in the city. The flavor is out of this world and the value is second to none in this city. Come during lunchtime and enjoy their express burrito/taco shop on the side. I usually get their chicken burrito on a whole wheat tortilla and add guacamole. Make sure to check out their amazing salsa bar. I'm not sure the name of it, but the orange salsa is unreal. I can't seem to pour enough of it on my burrito. The orange salsa is so good I have to hold myself back from drinking it. Don't judge, it's that good. :p
author: Kristin H.

description: Nice/friendly service, Good margarita, very good Veggie pozole (soup) and okish veggie enchilada - overall would have given 4 stars but extremely low number of options for vegetarians (4 only) made me take off 1 star.
author: Rohan B.

description:
One of the cheaper places to get dinner in the area. 

The line is really long, even with a reservation we waited for quite a bit. Which was kind of disappointing.

The food was slightly fancier than your average mexican restaurant however the ingredients used werent stellar. SOme of the meat was still tough and dry.

That being said the price is right and the flavors not bad. More casual dining place than formal dinner.
author: Ryan C.

description: Well I can't really give it 5 stars unless I eat here, BUT the drinks (Margaritas) and the bartenders rock!  Roman is the coolest--extremely knowledgeable, friendly and ready to make your experience The best!  The interior is done well, outside seating as well. We always sit at the bar and chat up the bartenders (usually it's Roman). Go in, say hi and order up your favorite cocktail. Better yet, Let him create one of his own favorite libations.
author: Mark W.

description:
As much as I LOVE... I mean LOVE Tropisueno, it kills me to rate them a 4 star... I'll explain.

I have been here many many times, lunch, dinner, happy hour....The food rocks.  Bartenders are pretty good, service is pretty fast, nice atmosphere.  During the week lunch can be pretty busy with all the lunch crowd.  At night its a sit down restaurant as opposed to the taqueria at lunch.  Happy hour has great bar snacks at great prices.

I have been mostly for lunch, so my review will cover lunch in general (as well as my most recent lunch). They have a pretty extensive menu, the combo is a pretty good deal, you can choose from tacos, enchiladas, tamales, or flautas (with chicken, beef, etc).  Now my complaint here is the menu is posted on the wall, and you have to memorize what you want, and then place your order at the kitchen.  There are no paper menus or a menu at the kitchen, and many times I have forgotten my exact order by the time its time to place my order and have to revisit the menu... ugh.

The orders come with tortilla chips, that are among the finest. They have a great salsa bar with about 10 different salsas... all of which rock, and range from mild to REALLY spicy. The tomatillo salsa is among the best I have ever had. (At dinner they bring you a sample of 3, but you don't get the full bar to choose from).  Orders are then brought to your table, and usually pretty quickly.  

We both got the 3 item combo, cheese enchilada, carne asada taco, and chicken flauta.  The enchilada was great, really good sauce, and not the kind from a can.  The taco was fantastic, juicy steak, and avocado on the side which I added. My complaint comes with the flauta.  I have had better, and I have had better here.  They cover the flauta in a avocado cream and sour cream, which was pretty good, but made the crispy flauta soggy.  It also was slightly room temperature (and it was the first item I ate).  I would have preferred dippy sauce on the side.

We also go margaritas.  These are super strong... I mean 2 knocks you on the floor strong. But really tasty. They also have a chili salt they use on the rim that is prefect.  My husband however gets the plain salt since he does not care for the chili on the rim.  There are several different flavors of margaritas to choose from, all with unique salts. I have sampled many.

Adding to their down fall (and therefore unable to get 5 stars...) No fountain diet coke.   If I drank regular Coke I would be happy because they have the Mexican Coke made with real sugar...but alas... No fountain soda, and eating that much good food, I really need lots of diet coke. 

But seriously, best Mexican food. Just could use a couple small improvements..
author: David P.

description: The guacamole was probably the best I've ever had. The enchilada was delicious and the staff was very friendly. The only downside was that they were busy, but it's vacation season so that's to be expected.
author: Tina R.

description: Wow, what an awesome experience! I came to Tropisueno after work one day and loved my meal! The food was absolutely perfect and the waitstaff was incredibly kind, professional, and friendly. I ordered tamales and enchiladas and was VERY impressed with the quality and quanitity of the meal. The guacamole was on point, which is always a huge plus in my book. The meal was relatively cheap (definitely affordable) and my water cup was never empty. One thing I didn't care for about the restaurant was that the music was a bit loud, but I guess I wouldn't want my mexican restaurants any other way.
author: Tommy C.

description: We didn't have a reservation for a dinner which was a mistake as there were a couple others waiting to get seated, as well. However, we got seats by the bar instead of a table right away. The drink orders took a while due to the busy Saturday evening but the staff was always friendly. We got tortilla chips with three different sauces before the meal. The salsa was amazing not to mention the guacamole. I ate some very tasty chicken enchiladas with black beans and rice. The plate was big!
author: Siinamari T.

description: Highly recommend this restraunt. Tastey food,great customer service, romantic music and great decor!
author: Javier G.

description:
I hate tequila and I don't drink margaritas,
unless I am at Tropisueno.
Seriously, the Margaritas are so good. Even I will drink them. Many of them.
The Tropisueno and Picante are my 2 faves.
Attentive staff and awesome food keep me coming back.
The scallops I had last time were killer, and the salsas are addicting, especially the orange one.
This is easily one of my favorite spots downtown.
author: Karlee D.

description: My favorite Mexican restaurant. I have been there several times and each time I am surprised by the way these flavors burst in my mouth which makes me relish every bite.  Nachos and house sauces are something to die for . By far the best place for some sexy Mexican food with unique flavors
author: Aparna K.

description:
I really dug this place for dinner.  Reminds me of the old country (New Mexico).  This is not a taqueria dressed up as a restaurante, this is fine grub.  The green chile tomatillo pork (a personal fav dish!) is correct, and almost as good as mine (bias?).  Atmosphere was fun AND classy (nice dark lighting, good mood).  The staff brought the right things at the right times and never left us waiting for attention.  I had the margarita with absinthe: delcious and balanced.  The chips were thin and house made, guacamole was great, salsas were tasty and plentiful.  I'm getting hungry to go back!

We had no rezzie on a week night, were seated in half the time we'd been told (yay) and could hang at the bar while waiting.  These are good things.

They seemed to start checking if we were done a bit too frequently for me.  

It'd be a good 1st or 2nd date place: not too stuffy-like-I'm-trying-awkwardly-to-impress, but showing some taste and class.  Good place for friends or family too.  I'll be bringing folks here when I need a place I know will "work" with whomever.

BTW: I get the impression it's just a different deal for lunch.  This review is about dinner.
author: Timothy J.

description:
I'm not sure I get the hype. Maybe it was because of the burrito I ate the day prior that was the size of my face (Taqueria Cancun I loooove you), maybe it's that when I'm in SF I expect seriously stellar Mexican, maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but I just wasn't impressed.

I ordered the steak fajitas and they were.... alright. The tortillas were mediocre and the steak just wasn't as flavorful as the steak fajitas I've come to know and love. The guac and chips were a similar story, along with the margarita. I also wasn't a fan of their food counter being a separate world from the bar... it makes my day drinking a little more obvious. 

All in all, a solid spot for sure but if I lived in SF I don't think I'd make it a regular haunt. That being said, if someone wanted to go (and they were paying) I'd be up for a return visit.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Tacos Al Pastor - amazing
Chicken Mole Poblano - not so amazing

The first time I went I got tacos and enchiladas and it was great, but the staff said the mole poblano would be even better--it wasn't.  I'm still looking forward to going back and getting the tacos again as well as trying their fish dish.  Rice and beans and salsa are pretty good too.

Note this was all dinner.  Apparently lunch there is a different, streamlined "taqueria" menu unlike the full menu for dinner (which seems quite good/varied).
author: Mike G.

description:
Always enjoy dinner at this place - it's very conveniently located in SOMA so if you are in the area shopping you can drop by for a bite. I have rarely had to wait more than 15 minutes for a table and the staff is incredibly friendly and accomodating.

Good place for vegetarians - just make sure their main vegetarian entree is available, last time I was there they had run out of it (or the sauce they use for it). The only con is they could have better sauces with the chips, surprisingly the green one is the best - need to change the flavors for the other two)!
author: Anuya K.

description:
The male host at Tropisueño on Monday evening completely ruined my experience at this restaurant. Because of his poor attitude, I plan on never returning to this establishment, which is a shame because I do enjoy the food here.

I've been a frequent diner at Tropisueño, but when I was asked to be seated on Monday morning with my friend who was running late, the host became argumentative with me -- saying I never checked in (which I did) -- and finally ended the dialogue by rolling his eyes at me. I caught him performing this action, and I should have walked out on the spot. Unfortunately, my friend was visiting from out of town, and we needed a quick dinner spot so I couldn't leave in protest of this host's behavior and attitude.

I never write bad reviews, but I'm writing this in hope that future diners do not put up with this poor hosting that I received at Tropisueño. I love eating out in this city, but I do not tolerate rude service. As a diner, I believe that is not something I should have to experience. And due to this one guy's behavior, Tropisueño has lost this customer forever.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
5 STARS all around. 

5 stars for the food.
5 stars for the service.
5 stars for the ambiance.
5 stars for the decor.
5 stars for location.

What more can I say?

I had the chicken mole... AMAZING. 
For dessert... the tres leches. Also AMAZING. 

I don't know if I was just really really hungry (which, I was) but I thought everything was delicious. I have never scarfed down a plate of dinner so fast. I think we were in and out in less than 45 min. They serve fast and we ate fast. A perfect match. 

(Another thanks to Yelp, once again!)
author: Patty G.

description: Carne asada burrito with sour cream,guacamole,lettuce,green salsa,rice,and pinto beans,3 1/2 stars.Chips on the side.It's good.NothIng to go crazy over.They're one step above chipotle.
author: Mrs. H.

description:
Yea, overall pretty good place. Went for dinner, so it was a full-service restaurant, and everything was fine. Nothing AMAZING either. 

Would want to try again during the day when its set up as a tacqueria, as i've heard thats a better overall experience.
author: R F.

description:
Best place for plated Mexican food that isn't too far from my neighborhood. This place is popular, so be wary of lunch and after-work rushes (like you didn't already know, this is Yerba Buena, people). Reasonable prices for delicious food, even though the wound still hasn't healed over that $1 "surcharge" for the chile relleno. The beans are perfectly seasoned with flecks of cheese. Yummy rice, and the plates are  garnished with hunks of ripe avo and shredded iceberg. 

Now, LET'S TALK SALSA. This place knows what they're doing. The habanero is incredible. What am I saying?? They're ALL incredible.

Good options for us vegetarians, and there's at least ONE vegan offering on the menu. HOORAY

I prefer to dine during the afternoon, rather than evenings. Although the margaritas are worth it, they are expensive.
author: Brittany L.

description: Convenient to SOMA and Financial district. Specifically, if you're staying at the Westin off Market, it's right behind it. On the smaller side, but the interior design is pretty decent. Service wasn't great during peak dinner time, but it wasn't horrible. Food had some highlights. Her sandals were a bit greasy, but the meat was excellent. Salsa with the chips was killer. Definitely give it a shot.
author: Chad U.

description: Ok low stars for the food. Its cooked and I ate it all. For sure nothing special. But ok I woild go back for a place to meet for drinks. It could be a great place for drinks and chips and its centrally located in the city. But the food. skip it or try it and you tell me. Im picky but I know it when I taste great mex food.
author: Ray R.

description: so good!!!! great happy hour!! cheap and efficient!! Service kinda stunk but they were busy.
author: Vesna M.

description: For downtown San Francisco, this is a gem of a restaurant. The food is really good overall though the mole sauce wasn't as good as I've had in the past. I really like the chips and the three types of salsas they give. The margaritas were recommended by our tour guide friend, and I had one that was a little on the spicy side, though I was fairly warned by the server. The tamales were some of the best I've had.
author: Gene L.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Tropisueno already! I think I secretly don't want more people to know about it, I just want to enjoy it all to myself! But what the heck, might as well preach....

I've been coming here since I moved here from San Diego 3.5 years ago. Let's just say I searched long and hard to find a Mexican place with food worthy of my palate. Tropisueno was definitely love at first bite. From their food, to their salsa bar, to their margaritas; you simply can't go wrong. 

As far as the food, I've tried almost everything and love it all! I especially like the spicy chicken burrito and their empanadas. As far as margaritas, I'm a die hard fan of the Violeta, but all of them are delicious.

Now for the main reason why Tropisueno has earned 5 stars in my book; the staff. The staff at here are an awesome group of people. Everyone is personable, friendly, and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your time their. Some staff that goes above and beyond are: Carlos (bar manager), Roman (bartender) and Albert (general manager).
author: Henriette P.

description: Incredible and authentic food.   An absolute repeat visit will happen on my next trip to SF.   I highly recommend you go.
author: Felipe J.

description:
Came here recently for lunch. Man...I didn't even know that the area had a Mexican joint that's next to Press Club and Amber.  

I had the chicken enchilada plate that came with rice, salad and choice of beans.  The meat was so juicy, smooth and moist and everything on my plate was delicious!  The amount of sauce was perfect for me and didn't have to wait to long for it either.  My other friend had their Chicken Mole plate...omg, it was great!  I am picky about Moles as the ones I had before tend to be to sweet.  Tropisueno has the flavors down right.  The place is clean and their chips and salsa selection works perfectly for me.  I would come back again...very very soon!
author: J G.

description: Love this place. Food, service, ambiance. Wow. I've been there a handful of times before but this time was the best service I've ever had at ANY restaurant. I called about 45 minutes before hand and let them know I was coming with my 86 year old grandma who has a wheelchair and 4 others. Although they were completely booked, they went out of their way to reserve us a table just to accommodate my grandma. The server was incredibly attentive and sweet to my grandma. The manager even came by to say hi!  My family had the best time with awesome food. Definitively recommend!!
author: Melissa B.

description:
At first I wasn't a huge fan of their menu. No nachos, burritos, or any of the other Mexican peasant food I'm used to! Then I got some suggestions from the waiter and it was great!

I don't remember exactly what the dish was called, but it was a large portion of chicken seasoned to absolute perfection. On the side, it had grilled zucchini and squash and beans which were all excellent. I wish I had more information about it, but I'll just have to go again soon and write down the name of the dish!
author: Corry F.

description:
Great happy hour specials and I like the ambiance, plus it is so convenient to BART.  I haven't been there in quite some time, but now I want to return after reading more of the reviews, from the time that I went I believe that I had chicken tacos and some other appetizers.

If I recall correctly their prices were reasonable and the happy hour special was good.
author: Miss C.

description:
This place has such an awesome atmosphere and the food was great! I came here because of all the great reviews and definitely was not disappointed. 

I would have given them an extra star, but the hostess staff was awful. They were completely rude and condescending from the moment my bf and I walked in. No one smiled or greeted us and when we asked for a table they just looked at us and rudely replied for us to wait.
author: Audrey L.

description:
A friend and I were headed to Amber India because we had an hour to kill before meeting up with friends in a different neighborhood. They were  closed to my delight, because we moseyed on over to Tropisueño, a happy discovery. I'm still thinking about those margaritas, tacos, salsa medley, and very convenient happy hour prices. 

In daylight, they manage to have great low lighting. There was a good crowd, and the bartender was doing some cool techniques. When we walked in we immediately noticed there was only one server and were a little weary. He greeted us immediately and took our order. Another person brought us some chips and three types of salsa (the avocado one is the best, but they are all very good). He was greeting people at the door, taking orders, delivering trays full of drinks, and all with a smile on his face. Ridiculously impressive. 

We ordered one truck style beef taco and one fish taco. They were both sooo good. If I had known the truck style taco had pineapple I would have probably asked for it without it, but it was surprisingly good and I was delighted that I didn't catch that on the menu.

The minute we left we were already planning when to go back!
author: Cindy M.

description:
I'm really into this place. I work a block down the street, and I come here at least once a week for lunch and at least another once a week for the happy hour. With an extensive menu of tacos, burritos, tortas, chile rellenos, enchiladas, combinations, and amazing mole sauce, this place has got what i'm looking for every time.

Their chips and salsa are fantastic. During the lunch time there is a salsa bar with probably 6 different types of salsa, and then at happy hour they bring you a tray with three different salsas in it, each of which are fantastic. Also, happy hour has $2 tecates and $5 margaritas, and $1-$3 tacos, quesadillas, nachos, etc. 

The only downside of happy hour is that the bar area is quite small and it can be difficult to get a seat, but if you wait around for 10 minutes or so you can usually snag one. I definitely recommend this place for good mexi food if you are downtown.
author: Jamie J.

description:
its about time I rate this spot... since Ive literally had every seafood dish on the menu; all the seafood entrees are simply amazing... the ceviches are only 3.5 - 4 stars but Im hard to please w/ ceviche

service here is great too; ask, and you wish receive

going back tonight for the 8th time and I cant wait
author: Mark B.

description: Really dug this place for Happy Hour, great bartenders, especially John. Enjoyed some street tacos outside. Chips and the three sauces with the chips are excellent.
author: Ron L.

description: Excellent authentic Mexican food. Their Salsas are amazing. I tried the shrimp burrito which is massive. Lines can get long for lunch so plan in advance.
author: Abbas J.

description: Stopped in for dinner and was highly disappointed. Ordered tempiqueno (chewy), taco (not good), tamale (decent), and cheese enchilada (it's cheese...). Not a lot of flavor in any dish. Drinks read well on the menu, but lack flavor as well.
author: Briana C.

description: Great authentic Mexican restaurant in the SOMA. Menu is delicious, interesting and the service is great. The drinks are also great.
author: Will D.

description:
Chips and salsa...super delish! I loved the taste and variety of salsa/dipping sauces provided!

We ordered the vegetarian entree...super yummy tomato broth with veggies...that came with a side of the tastiest mexican rice we have ever had!! our friends ordered a combo plate ( Taco,Enchilada ,Tamale, Flauta) and a chile verde.

the house margaritas were good too!

friendly staff and great service!
author: meera h.

description: This place is da bomb. There aren't many great sit-down mexican restaurants in San Francisco, but this definitely at the top of my list. Plus, the prices are super reasonable for the quality and amount of food that you get. Highly recomendado.
author: Adam G.

description: Had the shrimp burrito with guacamole and black beans, SOO yummy. Plus horchata! A must go for delicious Mexican food in a great location!
author: Lily R.

description: It took a few years but I came back again. Service was still good, you should make reservations because if you don't you'll end up waiting a long time. Had the flautas and the spicy shrimp, good stuff. Wish I had some of the special agave tequila but I've cut down on my alcohol during the trip.
author: Edward I.

description:
I don't know why it took me so long to try this place, but I can't wait to go back.  

I went here on a Friday around 2PM after a spa day and there was still a slight line, so I took that as a good sign that the place was popular.  I looked around and the line was misleading because there were still a lot of tables available, so I knew I'd be able to get a seat.  (This is the kind of place where you order your meal and pay for it and take a number and a waiter brings your food when it's ready.)

The carnitas taco that I had was delicious and a lot larger than I would have expected.  I felt like having guacamole with my chips, but was eating alone and knew that I couldn't eat a whole order by myself.  I ended up ordering a side for something ludicrously inexpensive (maybe 95 cents?) and figured I'd get a few chips worth.  Well...I ended up getting a full ramekin full of guac that was more than enough to satisfy my craving!  (Well, not *more* than enough because I ate the whole serving!)

The waiter brought chips that were complimentary, but so crispy and fresh.  I usually don't like most chips at Mexican restaurants, but I couldn't stop eating these.  I also loved that they had such an extensive condiment bar of different types of salsas and peppers.

Alas, I didn't have any alcohol (I was already way too mellow after the spa and was afraid I'd fall asleep), but was pleased to get my Diet Coke in a can (instead of from a fountain).

The prices were definitely right.  The carnitas taco, guacamole, and Diet Coke were less than $8!

The location is great (right across from the Metreon), so it would be a good place to hit up before or after one of the museums in the area or a movie.  (Or after the spa, like I did!)
author: Kimberly B.

description:
You're paying one or two bucks more than a hole-in-the-wall Mexican place, but it's so worth it for so many reasons. The ambiance of the dining area is awesome; I recommend sitting next to the window so you can see the sculptures outside. All food orders come with free chips and free run at the salsa bar. I will say that the chips are too thin and too greasy; not only are they shiny with grease, but they oftentimes break when trying to dip them in the pico de gallo. That being said, the selection of salsas is great; pico de gallo, spicier red salsa, two kinds of green salsa, a very tasty orange sauce, and a generous portion of freshly-chopped and juicy limes.

We got the carne asada super burrito and the chicken torta. The burrito was very good; each ingredient was fresh and tasty, and you can really taste each of them. The torta was a pleasant surprise; the bread is soft and delicious, and the chicken is very tender and tasty.

You will be filled up with some of the best-quality Mexican food around for less than ten bucks, and be able to enjoy it in a very pleasant dining environment. I will definitely be back. This is a great place to go for lunch before going to MoMA, as it is just a couple blocks away.
author: Geoff L.

description:
- carne asada/al pastor burrito was huge. carne was fine and the pastor was very light colored which I thought was weird. this was not very good. 
-buddy's chile verde that i tried was pretty damn good. 
-free chips were real good. 
- orange salsa was ridiculous. loved it.
author: J A.

description: We had an amazing dinner. The waiter knew the menu well and was easily able to help navigate the offerings to help me find a gluten free dish. There was a 20min wait but it was completely worth it! Great atmosphere, great food; a winning combination
author: Jeff T.

description: Salsa bar is solid for the area.  Mission kills it of course.  But, if you want something at a decent price close to the market street aktion, this is it. They make their own chili salt for the margs.  Cheap tequila, but the food is on par.
author: Mot Y.

description: Best ceviche I've ever had, absolutely delicious! The service was excellent, very helpful, and they found us a dinner table quickly, even though it was busy.
author: Ami R.

description:
My wife LOVES coming here, but I think it's merely pretty good.

The food's good, don't get me wrong, but they use sooo much clove it isn't funny.  I can deal with it usually, but sometimes I'm just not in the mood.

The salsas are amazing though.  Especially that bright orange one...it almost tastes cheesy, even though there's no cheese in it.

The carnitas and barbacoa are pretty good.  Really, everything's pretty good.  I just wish they'd cool it with the cloves.
author: joe p.

description: This is one of my favorite places in SF now. Love the food, atmosphere and music. Really feels like you're somewhere else, not in SF. Something about this place is really relaxing.
author: Aakash P.

description:
Food is amazing, but if you go, ask for another server if you get Josefina!!

**The review below is about the service**

I would give her NO stars if I could.

My boyfriend and I have been to this place many times, especially because we used to live in SOMA.

We decided to take our visiting relatives (from Missouri) here and regret it. We honestly don't think we'll ever be back unless we get take-out.

First of all, we knew it was a friday and expected it to be busy. There was 6 of us, so we were totally cool waiting. When we sat down around 7:45 pm they were slammed and it was super easy to overlook the _first_ wait of almost 10 minutes before a server greeted us. (especially with the delicious chips and salsa)

After we ordered, Josefina basically forgot about our table.

We ordered our second round of drinks before our main dish came and then we never got them...until we were done with our food and only a minute before she handed us the check. We had to ask for water at least three times. She didn't even ask us how our food was or anything.  And all throughout this, she was standing by the server's computer by the bar the _entire_ time with her back towards us and she was literally within 5 feet of our table.

And then she messed up the check. We only split it 2 ways and she couldn't get it right. She handed us our first bill, and the first guest paid in cash (which was the only thing she picked up right away) and rang it through before we gave her the other bill. 

Thank goodness we caught the mistake on our bill (the 2nd bill): she overcharged the first bill and when we finally got her to come back to our table she barely apologized. 

After fixing the bills, she told my guest that she gave him $100 in change by mistake, which wasn't even possible because he walked in with less than $150 and his first meal was priced at around $70! 

We were so upset at that point by her rude behavior that we called the manager over (I think Charles?) who did apologize, but said well, we hope you do visit again. But didn't offer any reimbursement for the terrible service. 

Again, good food and terrible service.
author: Erica R.

description:
I like this place better for lunch than for dinner.  Came here once for dinner and was not impressed by the food at all.  For lunch it's super crowded and the food is a solid 3 stars.  The margaritas on the other hand are definitely 5 stars during lunch or dinner.  

Today we had the super veggie burrito wrapped in a wheat tortilla and had the guacamole appetizer.  The guac is legit...chunky bits of avocado, onions and cilantro.  It could do with a bit more spice, but overall it is yummy.  The super veggie burrito was filled with a variety of veggies...mushrooms, zucchini, cucumber, carrot, squash, etc.  

I would definitely come back for lunch.  The line is ridiculous, but don't be put off by it as it moves rather fast and the service is pretty fast too.  Come here if you're in the hood and wanting some reliable mexican food...if you want over the top 5 stars then you best go to the mission!
author: Mao K.

description: Nice Mexican restaurant with delicious free chips/salsa and large portions for the food. The wait on a Saturday night w/o reservations was about 20 min, and seating is first come first serve at the bar.
author: Leily P.

description:
I am renaming this restaurant  SaltySueno or SaltyPesadilla, actually.  Man, this place disappointed big time!!!

At first glance, we thought this place was going to be really good.  Decor was nice and the menu items SOUNDED appetizing.  Of course, once you bite into the actual dish, well, it all goes downhill from there.

First, the salsa was UBER-salty.  Next, the Chili Verde, WOW, salt overload.  The first and only thing I could taste was salt, salt, and more salt.  Next, the beans.  Following that, the tamale.  SALT OVERLOAD!

The margaritas weren't that good either.  I prefer Colibri just up the street in Union Square.  We tasted the absinthe one, GROSS.  The tropisueno, meh.  The oso something or other, meh.  

We were not impressed at all.  Very disappointed actually and left overly-sodiumized.  In fact, after we left we were bloated and thirsty but couldn't drink anymore water to quench the salt-lick we just ingested because we were stuffed by the food/booze we flatly indulged in.
author: Karen B.

description:
A good neighborhood taqueria by day and restaurant by night.

I like the Tampiqueño or old-school combo plates with rice and beans.

Also the The House Margarita and Guacamole are good starters.
author: Francis M.

description:
