Had a nice dinner at Tropisueno after reading the Yelp reviews and realizing that the restaurant is only steps from my hotel room at the Westin.  For $65, we enjoyed dinner for two, including a margarita or two and some guac.  Not bad.  Pretty good food, though not over the top.  The service was pleasant but not very attentive.  
The atmosphere was nice but not great.  

All in all, this didn't meet my expectations for the stars its been receiving on Yelp.  I definitely don't think this was a 4 or 5 stars, but it was a solid 2 or just a 3 in my book.  If you're in the neighborhood or at a hotel on business, you won't go home disappointed but you might not be writing to your friends insisting they rush over.  I will suck up the 10 minute bart ride next time and will hit the Mission, unless it is cold and foggy like it was tonight and I was feeling a bit slow.
author: Scott H.

description: Great Margaritas, especially the Spicy Mango. All the food had amazing flavor! Definitely will be back to try more dishes on the menu.
author: Raeven D.

description: This is like an upscale Chipotle. I had the carne asada burrito and it was gigantic. At lunch it gets really packed so order on GoPago if you can and just walk right up to the front of the line to pay.
author: David N.

description:
I was looking for a cheap place to eat off of powell st downtown and yelp'd this place. I walked in during happy hour which apparently is quite popular because the place was packed when most people are usually still at work on this weekday. I had to wait about 10 min to get a seat at the bar since they rope off 2/3 of the restaurant during happy hour. They have specials on food. I ordered two tacos carnitas and some ceviche. It was brought out very quickly. The tortillas were corn, small and high quality which was great. The tacos overall were very good. The carnitas was tender, juicy, the green salsa had a good kick to it. The ceviche was quite good as well. A lot of cilantro and great flavor to it. They serve salsa and chips for free. They include three different types all of which are delicious. 

The best part was all of it was 8 dollars. EIGHT. the restaurant itself is nice and the staff is super friendly. Awesome. I also noticed they have a pretty good collection of tequilas at the bar. And no I don't mean all five types of patron or however many they have now.
author: Shaved I.

description:
Got there on  Saturday afternoon for lunch. It is in a great location between Mission and Market, by Union Square and the Museums, so you have lots to see before or after lunch.  Once inside you order first (like you would at a taqueria) then you pay and then sit.  I do think they need to redo there seating arrangements, much to compact and tables to small and to close together.  The food was excellent I had beef enchilada's ala carte and guacamole which was good and chips. 
The prices are reasonable.  I think you should try it if your down that way. Good to go for drinks and for lunch,  I will go back and try another dish.
author: Susie S.

description: If yelp had negative stars I would give this place 5 negative stars JUST BECAUSE THEY DO NOT SELL COFFEE. Not to mention the attitude we received from emoloyees when we asked for coffee. They have an abundance of alcohol but NO COFFE + BONUS ATTITUDE!
author: Everardo M.

description: I couldn't stop gorging on their very thin and crispy chips which is served with 4 kind of sauces. There are not many veggie options on their menu, however, I was offered a special entree - tofu on a spicy tomato n cheese sauce with red rice. Huge portions, but super awesome! Would love to visit again.
author: Ruchika I.

description:
I'm not sure why I was so resistant to Tropisueño when they first opened, because the last couple times I have gone, the service was exceptional, the food was great and the drinks were well made.  

I appreciate the attention to detail, like how my water glass was never empty, despite my copious chugging, and how the server overheard my curiosity about a drink at the next table, went to the bartender to find out more and reported back to me, and how their michelada is exceptionally well balanced.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I have tried almost every Mexican restaurant near my immediate neighborhood and this was last on the list. I went on my own, for lunch on a Sunday right after opening at 11 a.m. Lunch is largely self-serve by the way, and when I saw how quickly the restaurant filled up, especially after churches let out, I could see how much more efficient that is for the owners/operators. 

REALLY good salsas! The yellowish one that is apparently some sort of chili powder base, was my favorite. Yum. Good chips. Black beans, no lard, and not so mushy. I thought the guacamole was fresh and tasted good, and the house margarita was fair. I didn't eat anything else but I really liked that the salsas and jalapenos were done in house and really well done. I would go back in a heart beat, and it was nice to see something go above and beyond the taqueria style/taco truck style, which seems to be ubiquitous here in San Francisco.
author: Deena L.

description:
Mm mm mm!

My favorite Mexican food in the City!  I love the atmosphere and never have to worry about receiving quality food and service.  Once I order and am seated, I can expect to see warm, fresh chips in front of me with a variety of sauces within moments.  I am not sure of the name, but there is this spicy red-orange sauce that I had never had before but it's my new fav!  The food always arrives with perfect timing, fresh and perfectly cooked, and best of all never bland!  The portions are great, definitely feel I'm getting bang for my buck!

Then, to top it off, they provide some kick-ass margaritas!  Their full-bar has just about everything you could want with your dish!

The staff is so friendly, watching them interact with each other, as well as the consumers, make it feel like a big family fiesta!  I look forward to my next meal here!
author: Timothy R.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Mexican but in my goal to try more food and varied cuisines, I popped out Tropisueno as a recommendation for this past weekend.  We arrived in time for our 8 pm reservation and were seated immediately.

We were served by at least two different servers who made sure our drinks were full and our food came out quickly.  Surprisingly, we were in and out of there in an hour and we dragged out the time we spent there.  Service is *insanely* quick... we had a round of drinks and chips, an appetizer, then our entrees, followed by another round of drinks.  In most restaurants, that many separate rounds would have taken us at least 1.5 hours but instead we headed out for drinks at another location before our movie.

Drinks: I'm certainly not a tequila fan, but the cocktails do not taste like it.  Surprisingly deceptive, the cocktails were like juice and I had to be very careful to not drink them as such (the menu warns they have two shots of tequila instead of the standard one you'd expect in a cocktail).  Amazingly delicious and wonderful!  

Appetizers: Free chips with three types of salsa (two were moderately spicy, one was way over my tolerance limit) and two mushroom empanadas (omg they were amazing, I loved them!)  

Entrees: My friend ordered the chicken with mole while I ordered a cheese enchilada, veggie taco and rice.  I wasn't asked what level of spice I wanted in my food so I was a bit taken aback by how hot the enchilada was, but I went for Mexican cuisine knowing I would likely have to experience the heat and flavours... which is what the experience is all about!  

Fortunately nothing was over the top for me in regards to heat (other than the one salsa) and I was extremely happy with the amount and quality of the food, the drinks were amazing and the friendliness and service from the staff impeccable.  I'd be more than happy to go back and enjoy the restaurant and its food again!
author: Cassandra J.

description: I ordered a side of chicken and a side of veggies. Everything tasted like salt. If you're a healthy eater or someone trying to lose weight, I advise eating elsewhere. The very high sodium content will cause you to be bloated and retain water. Nobody should rock the pregnant look unless they are actually pregnant. Salt to disguise inability to cook does not equal yummy.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Interesting menu, well executed, and delicious all in a great atmosphere! 

Ambiance: The ambiance is nice, clean, warm, and friendly. 

Service: Our wait staff were polite and friendly, but my water glass stood empty for a bit too long and my drinks took longer to get than I would hope. 

Food: Very good. First, your chips come with no less than four salsa varieties including a tomatillo (my favorite), a nicely flavored more mild salsa, and one salsa that was burning hot (and oh-so-good). 

We ordered the scallops for an appetizer because I husband loves them and rarely gets them. I don't like scallops. But these scallops were AMAZING! Perfectly cooked so they were slimey or rubbery and the flavor was unbelievable. 

I ordered a spicey margarita and it was tasty, but not terribly spicey. 

We ordered the pork chop and carne asada for appetizers and they had good flavor, but were a slight let down after the amazing scallops (thus the four rather than five stars).

Price: Fair prices for SF.
author: Kat S.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend after it was recommended to us by the bartender at our hotel-Sir Francis Drake. We walked to the restaurant for lunch, and I loved the surrounding area. Very pretty. 

The lunch was great-I got a pork torta and loved it. Very fresh and authentic. 

We liked it so much, we decided to come back for dinner and I'm so glad we did. My middle name being Violet, I was immediately drawn to their violet margartia. I asked our waiter what it was like and he let me know if I didn't like it, he would get me something else, which led me to believe most people sent it back but any hesitancy I had was immediately lifted when I took the first sip. This is THE BEST, I repeat, the BEST MARAGRITA I have ever had. It tasted like a fairy drink. The violet was suttle and light-not over powering. It was rimmed with vanilla salt. I would fly back to SF just to have another. The next time I come to the city, this is their bar is the first place I'm going! 

For dinner I had the Chile Verde-very good and flavorful. The pork was cooked perfectly. 

Our server was attentive and helpful. I liked that the vibe wasn't at all stuck up and it wasn't crowded. Can't wait to be back!
author: Lauren C.

description:
We have been on our way from BART to dinners in other neighborhoods, and detoured here on several occasions - I think the pumpkin-esque salsa and the rest of the salsa trio and chips call to me- the decor and service are terrific too.

Let's talk seafood- get the scallops. I'm picky about texture and they nail them! Amazing, melt in your mouth flavor. I also love the Mahi Mahi and Camarones- and the mojitos!

I usually judge Mexican restaurants by chile rellenos since it's a favorite of mine- but I've fallen so deeply for Tropisueno's seafood and chicken mole that I've never ordered it. 

The new office space I found is only a few blocks away...looking forward to trying the lunch menu!
author: Keri B.

description: Food was good but not exceptional. What really ruined our evening was that their a/c was broken and they did nothing to combat it - my ice in my margarita was melted by the time it arrived.  It was about 90 degrees in the restaurant at 8pm... How can that be enjoyable?!
author: Joseph K.

description:
I only ever come here during happy hour, but it's amazing! It gets loud and pretty crowded right around 5, but with $5 margaritas and $3 small plates who cares! 

Just as everyone else says, the margaritas are strong. I don't get two unless I've basically kissed the evening goodbye.

Flautas, fish tacos, quesadillas are all served at the bar but don't resemble bar food at all, they are delicious! Oh, did I mention the free bottomless chips and THREE kinds of salsa?

The service is pretty quick, and the bartenders always seem to try to make sure you're having a good time.
author: Alyssa G.

description: My first experience of eating out in San Francisco. The food was amazing, the service fantastic. Delicious cocktails, lovely atmosphere and very reasonably priced (I am used to London prices!)
author: Ash J.

description:
The restaurant was ok, but I liked my meal at Chevy's better. The tortillas are salty and super greasy.  We squeezed ours off on our napkins before we ate them.  However, the combination of the three salsas/dips with the tortilla chips were delicious. I ordered the taco and enchilada combination.  The Taco was small but tasty, the enchilada was bland and soggy.  
Won't be going back to Tropisueno.
author: Nicole P.

description: Went for lunch on a weekend - food was pretty good, and the service was quick. Would be interested to go there for dinner or drinks to see how it is, seems like that would be worth a try
author: Karthik K.

description:
We made reservations, very glad we did.  It was packed & very loud until happy hour died down a bit.  Drinks were good. 

The 3 salsas were interesting and chips light & airy.  Had to get a second batch they were so good.  I had the ceviche tasting which was fresh, but the one was a bit too hot for me.  I like to cry when I eat but this just burned my tongue.  My husband had the meatball soup, it was  excellent!  I'd get that next time.  Our guest had the scallops for dinner.  Since it was an appetizer, they added beans & rice for a dinner.  We were all full.  Over all, it was very good & loved the fresh ingredients.
author: Donna W.

description: Very good shrimp and fish tacos. Didn't give a 5 star only because margarita was not great. But very affordable, fast and great food.
author: Linda F.

description:
Came back here for dinner on Saturday night. The scallops/plantains /chorizo app was delicious. I had a chili rellano and enchilada combo for my main dish and it was also good. We had a bottle of Benmarco Malbec and it was so so. 

I love their extra thin/crispy chips..reminds me of Chevy's but their food is definite a few notches up from Chevy's
author: Mimi T.

description:
We stopped in for dinner last night around 7 but we didn't have reservations. There was about a 45 minute wait but it was fine since its right near Westfield mall and there's tons of other stores around to keep you occupied.

The atmosphere was lively and the place was pretty busy.  I got the Chile Verde, which I thought was delicious.  My bf got the Tampiqueno, which he liked too. He said he thought the place wasn't just your run of the mill Meixcan place, but had good flavors. The portions are pretty big so there were plenty of left overs.

In addition, before your meal comes out, they bring out a big bowl of chips with 3 different salsas. We couldn't stop eating it! All the salsas were really good and the chips were light and airy--YUM!

If I'm in the neighborhood and want some good Mexican food, I'd definitely go back!
author: christine w.

description:
Front-of-house service at Tropisueno was truly a marvel. Some time having passed, I have unfortunately forgotten the gentleman host's name, but I think I just may remember his skill for as long as I live.

What's more, the fare is surprisingly affordable, amazingly flavorful and doesn't just play second fiddle to some of the most intriguing and masterfully-shaken margaritas you'll drink in the city. Well, everything minus the pozole, the only vegetarian entrée on the menu that my long-suffering then-boyfriend was able to gulp down with minimal effort but which I found to be alarmingly bland. Chips, someawesome carne asada and those margaritas proved to be the right cure for the night.

I still kind of don't understand their pyramid scheme-esque drink promotion, wherein if you bring five friends you get to drink free for the night. I'd hope it was as straightforward as that, so I'll drag five of my closest friends who know nothing about this place and reap the benefits. They'll still thank me for the margaritas.
author: Nuri K.

description:
This is the spot for the best margaritas in downtown.Ordered the fish tacos, chicken quessadillas and margaritas for happy hour. Thats all a gal needs after a long day of work.

The dinner menu is  a la cart which is better than the taqueria style lunch menu, but it's good to have that options. I dont always want to walk to Cancun for my burrito.
author: Sofie Z.

description: We went here after RSA and I became pitifully drunk and embarrassed myself in front of my co-workers. The food was authentic and tasty, but after thinking about our experience and the other reviews, this is a trendy place for trendy people, and we certainly weren't trendy people. We had great service from the bartender, but the host refused to seat us even though there were other people sitting down, so we were forced to stand/wait for 20 minutes before sitting at the bar.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
I don't understand why this place has received such great reviews!

I had the shrimp cocktail, which came with 3 to 4 shrimp, buried in Paste Picante-like salsa with a touch of chipotle. I also had the mahi mahi, which was ok. I had bites of the following dishes: chicken mole (horribly sweet with way too much chocolate) & pozole (seasoning was just wrong!).

The best part of the meal were the chips and salsa. I would have enjoyed a meal at Chevy's more so than that meal, and I hate chain restaurants!  

I have to admit, I am Mexican and I grew up eating simple and delicious Mexican food. I know what good Mexican food should taste like. Tropisueno simply did not deliver!
author: Patricia Z.

description: Decently priced, delish, and margarita-y. The plantains and the chile relleno were standout.
author: Holly R.

description:
This place has pretty good Mexican food. It isn't AMAZING, but it will do for a good meal. I've been here quite a few times for lunch and along with the food--the service is good. There is little to no wait as you order and seat yourself.

Every meal comes with a side of chips, which is great! Can never pass on that. The fish tacos were succulent with the moist fish and the salsa. The carne asada quesadilla  is absolutely amazing. There is so much flavor with the meat which is very tender and flavorful, which is coupled with the cheese. I've also had the carne asada burrito (yes, I love carne asada) which is very filling and yummy as well.

Definitely check this place out if you're hungry and in the area, but go out of the way for this.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Ideally a 3.5 would be best. Tropisueno is one of those places we go back to because of it's potential but it could definitely improve and be a super amazing restaurant.

Their chips and salsas are a strong point, flavorful and interesting they've got that down..especially their salsa verde and the smoky chipotle one. As a lover of seafood I would say to pass on their shrimp cocktail which is definitely more American and less Mexican (i hate the first, love the latter). Ceviche is pretty fresh but the lime definitely overpowers and it's missing maybe one more fish to really make it interesting.

Their entrees are solid with their mole as my favorite. It's chocolatey and spicey in a very smooth way. The only thing that is a bummer is their lack of consistency in food - it's hard to say when it will be good or amazing so if they can work that out I would get it more often. Their meat can sometimes be a little dry but their sides always taste freshly made and the guacamole is good.

I wish they had aguas frescas available for dinner too, but their margaritas are strong and refreshing for those coming to drink. Definitely best Mexican in the Union square shopping area
author: Sam H.

description:
I considered giving 3 stars, but the awesome food made up for the initially-terrible service. We arrived a little while before they started serving dinner, so we sat at the bar and had a couple drinks. The bartender was a bit of an ass... kind of condescending and abrasive. They also sent us an alcoholic drink of some sort when asked for strawberry lemonade.

Once we were seated, everything was great. The ceviche was delectible. My tampiqueño was like the best steak fajitas I've ever had, without the tortillas.

I will be going here again.
author: Zach F.

description:
Hola panchita!  Como esta? Donde esta la biblioteca?  Mi gato es en sus pantalones.  Yes this is what 5yrs of Spanish yields.  I'm pretty sure I even got some of those words wrong.

What I do know is that I have a new fav Mexican joint next to my work...  If there is anything I know, it's Mexican food (and hookers).  A coworker recommended this place as a post work, let's get tipsy hangout spot.  Apparently if u have 5 people, one person drinks free.  HOLLA!  

I got the flautas which were awesome, and their guac is spot on.  But the best? Their margaritas.  Served in a small glass, and extra potent, they are the perfect way to end a work week....or in our case, a Tuesday.
author: Angela C.

description:
5 stars for lunch, 3 stars for dinner.

Lunch= cafeteria-style line, good service, good food, cheap prices. Free chips and unlimited salsa! Nice place to eat in, even though it gets crowded I've always managed to find a clean table. Veg food easy to get, flavorful and healthy. A $7 huge burrito plus chips is two meals for me, and I eat a lot. Couldn't ask for anything better.

Dinner= only table service, and hard to get a table; expect a wait. Prices approximately doubled from lunch. And the kicker? No burritos. I'm sure the food and service are still good, but too disappointing for me to stay.

It's a nice, upbeat atmosphere--go for lunch if at all possible--but definitely go!
author: Ashley L.

description: Not a bit disappointed!!! The margaritas were amazing.  Try the  pork chop -- really tasty. The shrimp chiviche was quite good as well.  Would love to come back here.
author: Kirti P.

description: Stopped by the restaurant for a quick lunch. The food was good, the sauces potent and spicy and the environment lively!!!
author: Puneet K.

description:
My experience with them didn't start off very well but as you can see I did end up giving them 4 stars.  I found them on Yelp and saw on their website that they deliver, score!  My office was having a big lunch get together and once again, I'm in charge of organizing.

I called, faxed, did everything possible two days before the lunch to make sure everything was going to go off without a hitch.  A whole day goes by without receiving a confirmation fax.  Um, OK, time to call, and my credit card number was on that sheet of paper!  What?!? You don't really deliver?  They don't have a car, they have a cart.  And of course there was no way there were going to "drive" the cart over to the Laurel Height neighborhood.  That would have been nice to know the day I sent in the fax, but oh well.

Long story short, almost a hour later, getting lost finding the darn place and lugging those darn trays back to the car we have our lunch.  It was delicious!  We ordered tacos for 20 people and a whole mess of chicken mole.  The mole comes with one thigh and one leg per order.  FYI: they're attached, which made it hard to share the ginormous piece of chicken.  That was pretty much the only draw back once we got the food.  

The place looked nice inside and probably fun for drinks.  I would come back if I was downtown again but I would NEVER EVER get them to deliver anything every again, or attempt to pick a large amount of food from them either.  Oh, and the people there were super nice and helped "drive" our food via cart to our car parked in a garage about 3 blocks away.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I went here with my boyfriend when we were visiting SF. I really liked it other than a few slight mix ups with our order. No biggie.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Correction to Yelp Filters: this place is NOT good for groups NOR does it take reservations... I called for reservations for my party of 8 and was advised by the host that:

1) They do not take reservations on Friday or Saturday 

2) They recommend that groups do not come on either of these days

3) When I asked about showing early to get on wait list, they strongly urged me not to bring my party of 8 on Saturday before 9PM.
author: Christine S.

description: I came here with my friend to have lunch before going to a movie.  I ordered the taco salad.  My friend ordered the fish tacos.  Well her food comes first, no big deal but almost 10 mins later and seeing other people getting their food before me when I clearly ordered my food before them was beginning to make me think if my "salad" was even made.  I asked one of the guys, he said he would go ask for me.  In the meantime, my friend went back to the front to ask as well.  The guy I asked, came back to me asking for the receipt.  He needed to know proof to show the order.  I told him that my friend has the receipt and went to the front to ask.  So my friend comes back, to say they acted like nothing was wrong, will check on my salad.  No, I'm sorry, it is obvious and CLEAR they forgot to make my order, just admit it. My friend paid for it, she said there was no apology when she checked other than the gentlman who brought my salad to me.  It wasn't his fault, but I was grateful for the apology.  This is the second time this has happened to me, except I waited longer this time.  I had to rush to eat my food so that my friend and I could make the movie.  She had finished her food already.  I'm not sure I will be coming back here again.  Service is very important at restaruants.
author: Liz D.

description: This place is great. Food is good and sizable portions (probably need a doggy bag) and reasonably priced, especially compared to alternatives in the immediate vicinity. Can be very crowded in the evenings but the wait is worth it - try open table to make reservations ahead of time!
author: Naeem I.

description: The salsa bar alone is an authentic taste of Mexican cuisine! I try to limit coming here once every two weeks because it can be addicting. The evenings get fancy with a fine dining switch up from the taqueria lunch time rush. And do yourself a favor, Margarita with Agave no matter what time of day.
author: Natalia V.

description: Disappointment!!!  Thought this would be great but although the shrimp was good and the plate presented well, beer was not cold, service was slow (food came quickly), entrees were solid 3-star but no pizzazz!!!
author: R J.

description: Great margaritas and service ... their salsas are amazing!!! if you come in for lunch you order at the counter and they bring you the food when its ready ... but if you go for dinner you need to sit in their happy hour section and you get full service  the service is the best..
author: Charlene R.

description: I've been to Tropisueno on several occasions and each time is as great as the last. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing. The food is absolutely fantastic. I'd recommend having a reservation when visiting since it avoids having to wait a long time to be seated.
author: Pablo V.

description:
Very good mexican food, a lot of interesting choices. Margarita and desserts were also really nice.

I went there with two members of my family visiting from France with their two kids (around 11 and 13) and we all loved it. It's also in a very convenient and nice location
author: aude h.

description:
I have one thing to say to you: Try the Tropisueño torta, it's amazing. 

This place is totally hidden away, I'm not sure you would find it unless you were actively looking (or, as in my case, had a friend along to show you the way), but it's well worth a little searching. 

The portions were very large, the chips and salsa were a perfect accompaniment. Next time I must try a margarita.
author: Renae H.

description: Carne Asada was pretty good.  It was dark enough that I really couldn't get a good look at my food, though.  Restaurant was quite loud and felt crowded.
author: Dean G.

description: This place is awesome! There is usually a wait but it won't be for as long as they say and the free chips and salsa will keep you going. We went twice in our visit to San Fran. Try anything...it's all good. Happy hour is a good time to go too!
author: Bri A.

description:
Dropped by here for a quick dinner with a buddy of mine last night.  Never been here before but my friend convinced me that the food here is great.  He wasn't kidding.

For dinner I ordered the pork chile verde, and holy guacamole, this has to be the BEST chile verde I have ever had.  The pork was tender, juicy, succulent and cooked to perfection.  It was covered in the chile verde sauce that was just right, and accompanied with rice that couldn't be cooked any better.  And of course we had two helpings of the chips and salsa.  The service was also attentive and outstanding.

I was not disappointed and will definitely be back again.
author: Dean N.

description:
I went for lunch with 3 other friends on June 14. All of us ordered regular burrito with chicken. We got food poisoning, stomach ache, head ache. I called the 415-243-0299 and Lady said that they had 300 customers and they ate chicken and none of them complaint and she hung up.

Server : Lorena
Time: 11:57am
Date: 06/14/2012
Receipt No. 559714

"I WOULD NEVER GO AGAIN"
author: Sardar Manjeet S.

description:
I have been going to this place for almost two years and every time I go by myself or with friends it is always amazing and I never leave saying 'Hmm, I think I am still hungry?' its more 'Oh God, get the wheel barrel!'

The girl at the front door, Ryann is awesome, and the manager during the day what was his name, Paris. Well he is just all kinds of pleasant.

I highly recommend anyone to go to this place, for their amazing food, signature drinks that are made with fresh ingredients everyday.
author: Brandon M.

description: So bummed.  Finally went back to try it out one more time.  So grossed out!!! Big black long hair in food.  Yuck! Yuck!
author: Deez C.

description: Good food and real good service. The only thing about this place is that I don't eat spicy and the food in here is pretty spicy. I would go here again though. Perfect date restaurant.
author: Willy R.

description: Don't ask for frozen margaritas , they don't have them. The regular ones are fantastic though (mango+jalapeno)! Chip and dip they put on every table is delicious. Order anything, can't go wrong in my book.
author: Varun V.

description:
This place is special to me.  I've never been for a proper dinner, but I've stopped in several times for their rad happy hour.  2 for 1 margaritas (good ones!), free chips and salsa, and a nice array of reduced price - I'm talkin $2-3 - menu items (tacos, quesadilla, flautas if I recall correctly).  Perfect spot for a drink after checkin out MOMA or Yerba Buena or a movie or whatever else you might be doing in this neighborhood.  Warm, quiet, relaxing atmosphere.

5 stars for Tropisueno.
author: Joe G.

description: Went back at lunch today.  Had the nachos which are always very yummy.  The chips and salsa are always quite tasty.  I have been there for a number of times over the course of year, and I consistently go back.  Note:  the lunch menu is different than the dinner menu
author: Sheetal P.

description:
Their welcome chips are the most amazing ones I've ever had in a restaurant, and the orange in-house sauce is to die for. Highly recommend the plantains, just a tad sweet and crispy enough, with the black beans served with light sour cream perfectly complementing the dish with a savoury tinge. The enchiladas in the cream sauce were very well-prepared too. 

Wonderful, cozy ambience. Our server was patient, pleasant and gave us some great recommendations. Location is very convenient as well. At the end, they give you some pretty awesome candy. Would definitely go back! 
 
Tip: They have some really great off-the-menu items, so be sure to ask your server if you're unsure of what to get (it's all great).
author: Jesika H.

description:
I really enjoyed Tropisueño, almost more so than I expected to.

I came here for a late dinner with my parents and it was nicer than I expected (and a little pricier).  I liked every part of the meal... The chips and dips were awesome.  They gave us three different types of dips and each was better than the one before it.  We also started with the empanadas and the molotes.  Both were delicious and between those and the chips, I was stuffed before my meal even came!

I had the camarones tropisueno and they were delicious.  Perfectly cooked and a good level of spice. 

I'd recommend this place if you're looking for higher class Mexican food... it's on the pricey side but it's quite good.
author: Samantha B.

description:
Great food, fresh, quick and great servers! My husband and I are relocating to SF and we were in town to look for apartments. Of course, being in Cali, you are guaranteed good Mexican food. 

Food:  Well, I'm a little skeptical about fancy Mexican restaurants because I love ordering my quintessential enchiladas EVERYWHERE. Well, their enchiladas do not disappoint! The enchiladas at Tropisueno are different from the ones I'm used to having, which are normally smothered in Jack cheese and melted to perfection. Everything is the same with the enchiladas except they use fresh corn tortillas and Oaxaca cheese instead of jack cheese, but great either way! My husband ordered the Tampiqueño, which was EXCELLENT! It's a must try. The nachos, salsa and all their additional salsa that come FREE are also excellent.

Service: Awesome! Our waiter was really funny and just so easy to get along with. He catered to our dietary restrictions and was quick. Food came out fresh, on time, waters were constantly filled and drinks were flowing!

Location: It's a great location; right next to Bloomingdales. We hoped over after shopping and the host accommodated us immediately. 

Go back or not: Absolutely! This is a no-fuss, quality Mexican restaurant. It's fun without the cheesy and loud mariachi music banging in the background!
author: LAIKA K.

description: I must admit, I have only been to this place for happy hour. With that being said, I highly suggest coming here. It's a great spot for a date or a place to have drinks and a bite with some friends. The tacos are really good (only $2 during happy hour 4-6...it gets super busy there so if you wanna be there for happy hour, get there at 4, or be prepared to scope out a seat). Come and give it a try!
author: Tyler L.

description: Great happy hour and surprising spot in general. I don't usually find too many awesome spots in touristy areas of the City but Tropisueno impresses every time! The food is tasty, margaritas strong, and Beard Papas next door is perfect for dessert! *slurp*
author: Calvin W.

description: What a fun spot - love the rustic decor. The food was outstanding (I had the pork cooked 3 ways) and the special margarita of the evening was innovative. The waitstaff was so friendly. We had our kids with us after a long day of sightseeing. They were very accommodating but it also seemed like a fantastic date night destination.
author: Jen B.

description:
Pricey drinks, but MAN are they good. No fancy garnish or trendy names, but it's all premium tequila and simple ingredients, like nectar and lime. SO good. and strong. very strong. 

Chips and accompanying dips were good, and we ordered a seafood soup to share. It looked like choppino to me, so I'm not too sure what its ties were to authenticity, but it was decent. I'd come back here for the drinks and appetizers, and the funny little messages on the menus. (For reference, they accept most major credit cards and fine jewelry as payment).
author: Julia C.

description:
i loved the ceviche and home made chips.
Nice ambiance and reservation made all this really easy.
author: Nicolas B.

description: Went here after a car show at the Moscone Center.  We just happened to come across it walking around and it was an amazing find!  They have delicious food and a great atmosphere.  It was extremely busy on a weekend night and we had to wait for a while but it was worth it!  The chips, tacos and margaritas were so good!
author: Gina W.

description: Food was decent. Im sure there was way better mexican in the area. The super tacos were not very super but they were good.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Not bad, not amazing authentic but quiet decent food. Love that they stay open late and are right by the BART. Location is perfect and its easy to get to. Service is attentive but also lets enjoy and relax. Decent atmosphere, very festive and pretty darn good bar.
author: Natasha M.

description: Love this place! Best Mexican food in the city. Go see Remi at the bar. He makes the best drinks from scratch.
author: Harley B.

description:
Been here twice in one week for happy hour. Doesn't that say a lot on its own? And the fact that it's just about one block away from my office isn't the only reason!

Before 6pm, M-F: $5 well-made margaritas from scratch, $3 fish tacos, and free chips and salsa!

All their margaritas are rimmed with exciting infused salts (such as chili, vanilla, and rose salt!)

The chips and salsa are the BEST I've ever had! Mostly because the chips are warm..and they give you 4 different types of delicious home-made, fresh, cool salsas. So good! nom nom nom.

And the fish tacos? More delicious nom noms :).

Only down-fall is the relatively tiny bar-area space...it's like a small hallway. But, it doesn't take tooooo long to get a seat if you're there before 6pm.
author: Gail N.

description: I did not check Yelp before eating at this place, but if I did it would be a bigger disappointment since the reviews are so good. I ordered a Solo Carne plate with beef and my husband got beef enchiladas. The orders took a long time to come out, and when they did the food was lukewarm x(. My plate was huge and looked good at first, but it was extremely bland and the whole thing was dry. Just a lot of rice and beans and a big portion of "beef" with tiny shredded lettuce and one small slice of tomato and a tiny piece of avocado with no dressing or anything made the whole plate very boring and dry.  It was in serious need of some acidity from a salad to break the dullness and dryness of the rest of the plate. The so called beef did not taste like beef at all. It had no seasoning whatsoever and the texture was more like pork. Maybe they made a mistake? But whatever it was, it tasted bad. The most decent thing was the rice, sadly. My husband's enchiladas were bland as well. Can't forget to mention the pigeon infestation they had outside, where we wrongly chose to sit. I understand this place is like pay at the counter and go but I wanted to tell one of the guys that were bringing the food to other tables that my food was inedible but every time they came I tried to get their attention and was completely ignored. Blerghh!!
author: Julia F.

description:
I go to this place quite often and it's usually a good experience. You get what you pay for. A burrito with a wide variety of meats to choose from along with some original hot thin and crispy chips. You're gonna pay like $7-8-9 for that. Very Latin America-esque atmosphere with music blasting. Chipotle style service for lunch, mexican sit-down style for dinner.

Good food but just remember that it's usually a madhouse in there.
author: Nick E.

description: The food was ok. Chips and dips good. Drinks watered down and full of ice 75% ice 25% margarita. The service was not great. The waiter tried to not so subtly rush us off the table after we finished our main course. My father who was visiting and I were talking and finishing up our drinks and practically ever 3-4 minutes the waiter would come by and tell us our check was on the table. During the meal he asked us how the food was and I said mine was fine, but when my dad replied his was dry, the waiter who didn't seem to be actually listening to our responses said good, and cleared the table and rushed off. I'm more likely to go elsewhere than coming here again.
author: Grant O.

description:
We visited last night and I thought this place was o-k.  The chips were interesting- light and thin- and we enjoyed the accompanying selection of salsa.  My husband thought the chips tasted like potato chips however and was a bit annoyed with this place after that.  

The guac was too creamy for me but my brother-in-law enjoyed it. the margaritas seemed fair for the price but the cokes came in small, chiquito glass bottles (that is, no refills, people).  Our family tried the chicken, beef, shrimp, quesadilla,... I had a chicken taco (pretty good), cheese enchilada (ok but could have been warmer) combo and it was ok.  We came with two children and were disappointed to learn that their kid meal options consist of a quesadilla or baby burrito.

I think it's fine for an average sit down mexi-restaurant with decent atmosphere.  I'd have preferred to eat tacos at a truck,or a burrito at El Farolito or Gordos, but we were a party of 6 and wanted to sit down in a quiet environment and eat.   Eh.
author: yvette l.

description:
This just may be my favorite sit-down mexican in the city. I've been many times and the food is consistently delicious. I've introduced many a friend to Tropisueno, and one is yet to be disappointed.

Lunch is just as good (maybe better!) than dinner, with a HUGE list of burrito, taco, sandwich, etc options. 

The margaritas are great. The chips & salsa are great. The food is great. The service is great. It's all great. 

Make a reservation, or else you'll be waiting a while.
author: Shikha K.

description:
Went to Tropisueño for dinner last night and I was pleased with the location, ambiance and menu selections. The prices are also very reasonable. 

One thing I didn't like (and I know I'm being really picky) was that their tortilla chips are so flimsy, they break when you dip them into the salsa or guacamole. They need to get thicker ones.

Other than that, I'm a fan.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
The best mexican restaurants I've ever been to are the ones that I feel compelled to carry mace before entering - you know, the real hole in the wall places in the really rough neighborhoods.

Tropisueno is the only Mexican restaurant I've dined at where it's both high end AND the food is fantastic.  

Kudos for fresh salsa, fish tacos that will haunt you for the rest of your life, and the best home-made chips I've ever had (greasy and paper thin).  

You want good Mexican food?  You don't speak Spanish?  This place is for you.
author: Han-Shen Y.

description: Awesome food! I have nothing bad to say about this place, great ambiance, nice staff, excellent food! One of my fav restaurants in SF hands down!
author: Amrita A.

description:
What Tropisueño really is, is an American steakhouse masquerading as a Mexican restaurant. The portions are massive, meaty, salty, and not overly spicy. The cocktails are expensive, potent, and delicious, and the service is professional and attentive. The dishes are merchandized, and the atmosphere is fine-tuned.

Like many restaurants that fit this bill, my favorite parts of the meal are always the most simple ingredients: the beans, rice, vegetables, and salsas. (The salsas are SUPER GOOD.)
author: Klevin D.

description: Sorry, but I do not 'get' the appeal of this restaurant.  Went on a recent Thurs night - packed - and the noise level is deafening!  We had a table of six and I could not hear beyond the person next to me.  There is nothing new or inventive on the menu - just the regular Mexican offerings.  Service was fine, although a bit slow.  Food taste was OK, nothing stood out.  Prices a bit high for what it is.   Would not try again.
author: Cynthia K.

description: I've walked by this place many times after work and it's always bumping! So I decided to go last night for a late dinner and I'm glad I did. I made a rez for 9:15 and the hostess said they needed a few minutes so he offered us margaritas on the house while we waited which was sweet! We waited for about 5 minutes with margaritas in hand and got seated. Our server was super friendly, attentive and knowledgable of the menu. We got the cheese enchilada and veggie taco plate with rice and white beans. Perfect amount for two people. For dessert we got the flan which was delicious. The decor and ambiance is very cute and the crowd was nice. I will definitely return!
author: R. K.

description: I've always avoided this place because it looks like such a little tourist spot but when you got time to kill before ice skating and you want a good bite to eat in SOMA on a late Sunday afternoon, there's not a lot of choices. Surprisingly the chips and guacamole were pretty decent. Margarita de casa was yummy, rimmed nicely with a taste of salty sweet and spicy. Then bar tender Carlos introduced us to some fine tequila. One was lightly infused with hibiscus for a subtle pinkish hue and sweet notes of butterscotch. The other was a fine St. Matias- good bark and no bite! It wasn't bitter and that oak barrel makes it a fabulous finish. Trust me, it makes ice skating more fun!
author: Naomi K.

description:
idk why everyone raves about this place so much. the food is definitely good but it's not THAT good. it's decent mexican food.
If this is really the best Mexican in all of SF then that's dissapointing.
author: Sonia R.

description: I think this is a great deal in terms of inexpensive mexican food.  I went for lunch and thought my torta was quite good.  They have a salsa bar which garners an additional half star in my book.  Outside seating is a plus too.  Service was a bit slow/spotty so I wouldn't go for lunch under a time crunch.  I don't think it can be beat for mexican food in this area without moving upscale.
author: Jon F.

description:
Last night, my boyfriend and I each ordered the traditional style plate with a taco (one asada, one veggie) and tamale (both cheese and chile) and we've both been HORRIBLY ILL for the past 6 hours. 

On the plus side, my dad and his girlfriend ordered other items and they're feeling fine. But, as far as I'm concerned, any restaurant that serves food that poisons me this awfully gets one star. Oof.


*Subsequent edit*

My dad is also sick. Definitely the food at Tropisueño.

Also, called the restaurant to let them know what we ate and the manager was very very kind and open to listening. Said he'd talk to the chef and GM. Guess that's the most he can do, and I appreciate that he wasn't defensive.
author: Sarah J.

description: Stick with the basics, can't go wrong.   SoCal still has the best Mexican food in my opinion.   Good spot before a movie!
author: Will F.

description:
This yummy, delicious goodness begins with chips and a trio of delightful salsas!!! We could hardly stop eating them long enough to place our dinner order.

A must have is the Caldo de Mariscos...oh sooooo GOOD!  It is a seafood soup loaded with calamari, sea scallops, mussels, large shrimp, and fresh fish in  a deliciously spicy lobster-chile broth.  I could have a bowl of this EVERY night.

The cheese chile relleno is also a great choice. It was served with Mexican rice and we sampled all of their beans...refined pinto, white and black beans.  Our favorite were the white beans, but they all were good.

The only items that don't get my vote are their "old-school" combos.  They lack flavor and character, but there are several other tasty, exceptional items to choose from; so, only bother with this section if you want a Swanson's TV dinner tasting meal.  Because of this, I cannot give it five stars, but Tropisueño is certainly a 4 1/2 star in my book .
author: Valeria V.

description:
For those of you who are confused when coming here......

When you walk in, the menu is on the wall to your left. Choose which burrito you want. Then walk a little farther and then comes the "bar" where you choose what meats and beans you want in your burrito. Then you walk a little further and pay for your food. Be careful, they will add more/ wrong ingredients to your order and charge you for it.

I asked for refried beans and I got black beans. I also asked for the regular burrito but they gave me an "upgraded" one. Which luckily I don't mind the mix up. The burrito is HUGE!!!! I only ate half and I was full.

If dining here, just grab a table and they'll bring you your food. There's a little area where you can add salsa, onions, jalapenos, etc. to your food.

Staff is friendly and the food comes out to you very quick.

The prices are pretty cheap for downtown area dining. I will definitely come here again.

The only complaints I have are that my burrito comes with cheese and I didn't get any. Ok....well not ANY. Only on one end of the burrito and it was a tiny, tiny amount. It would taste better if the cheese was spread out in the whole burrito.

Also for the nachos, I was expecting the orange nacho cheese sauce. But it was melted shredded cheese and if you don't eat it right away, the cheese hardens and sticks to the pieces of chips.

Speaking of the chips, these aren't those pre made tortilla chips. These are the ones where they fry it themselves and it is sooo yummy!

I recommend you try this place out and be the judge for yourself.

This joint will do you right.  They start you off with hot fresh chips, a delicious mild red salsa, and three salsa tasters.  The guacamole is a wonderful pre-meal decision.  Do it!

For entrees, Dinner Date & I split the four-item combination plate.  I got the cheese enchilada and cheese & jalapeno tamale.  DD got the chicken versions of the same.  The tamales were mostly masa, with very little filling, which was disappointing.  The enchiladas were interesting - sweeter than the LA versions I'm used to.  What really won me over was the black beans and rice, very flavorful and the perfect consistency.  

The house margarita was potent and a very good choice.  And I just read on another Yelper's review that they have a burrito bar during the day! I must come back.
author: Denise K.

description:
Very good food and reasonably. Weekends are a little different from weekdays. Instead of doing a sit down and someone serving you the have it so you order through the kitchen window and than they bring your food out. 

Enjoyed it very much and would go back again.
author: Steve M.

description: Fun vibe and good service. Great drinks. Always busy.
author: Vicki L.

description: Great Mexican food. 3 types of salsa. All are great.
author: Francisco M.

description:
I've been back to Tropisueno two more times - once for happy hour and once for happy hour/dinner and my high rating still stands.  The Margaritas are awesome, and if you're willing to deal with the hecticness you can't be $5 for a margarita and all the delicious chips and salsa you can eat.  And nice bartenders who don't mind that you and your friends show up breathless at 5:55 trying to beat the happy hour clock.

Dinner here was delicious and so filling - I had the empanadas and shared plantains - both appetizers - and felt like I could roll home.  My only complaint - and it is a substantial one - is that the dinner menu is not great for vegetarians.  I think they could add one or two dishes for us meat-free folks, and I'd be here quite often.
author: Gloria B.

description: Best salsas I've ever had in NorCal and great complimentary chips to go with. It can get really busy at lunch but with the cheap prices (~$9) and amazing food it's worth it. Great for sit down or take-away!
author: Connor C.

description: I love this place!  Non-pretentious, well-priced, happy, easy, happening, yummy place to meet up after work downtown.   The chips and 3 types of salsa that come straight to your table are great.  I I discovered Micheladas here and love them.  I think someone else reviewed that they are "blech" - and they are definitely unique . . . so it's just a matter of personal taste.  I always have a good time here.
author: Eve P.

description: Great mojitos. Festive atmosphere (came here for a birthday dinner). Most importantly: MATT CAIN WAS HERE WHILE WE WERE AND WE SENT HIM A CARAMEL FLAN. The food is great, I love the long tables. Dress up a little and order ceviche.
author: Sophia K.

description: Quick service for what looks like a busy lunch place. Also great food! I had the chicken and the shrimp tacos. Both were delicious and had a variety of salsa to choose from to top them off with from their salsa bar. Loved it!
author: Anj G.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by Tropisueno.  The ambiance, in my view, is  bit cheesy.  It just gives off this overpriced/inauthentic vibe.  But two things would make me come back: the margaritas and the chile verde.  The chile verde was beyond delicious ...smoky, spicy goodness I can't get out of my mind.  It almost didn't make sense how good it was.  And the prices are surprisingly reasonable.

One drawback: they had only one type of mezcal, it didn't look great, and cost $11.  What's up with the ripoff mezcal prices in SF?
author: Paul K.

description:
Oh how I miss Tex-Mex...Well the good news is that I've finally come across Tropisueño that has done a great job of filling the void!

They know how to make a great margarita and even use natural agave nectar.  The variety of salsas is a big plus.  And the food overall is pretty tasty. I've given fajitas, tacos and enchiladas a try.  I don't have to over explain Mexican food.  It is what it is, and it's either good or not good.

So one important note...they have a pretty cool concept of being a taqueria during the day, and a restaurant at night. My personal recommendation though is go during the daytime.  You still get all of the good food, but everything seems a little less expensive.  And also, the staff, bartenders in particular seemed friendlier during the day.  At night, was just a bit stuffy.  Maybe it was just that night, and a certain bartender though. Who knows.  

Anyway, I highly recommended Tropisueño. I actually want to go there now after writing this!
author: John R.

description: The margaritas were amazing. I had a cucumber margarita called "The Pepino" that was very nice. The food was above average but the price point is what gets it the 5 star rating. Service was adequate and the bartender was good. My wife had the strawberry margarita, which also was stiff with good flavors.
author: Andrew J.

description:
We paid two visits here... one to have a gargantuan burrito, and another to have the tacos. Both were excellent, in fact probably amongst the best I've had. Distinct flavors, a nice atmosphere inside and endless patience from the staff made it a joy to visit.

Someone outside the restaurant went to great lengths to assure us that there were better Mexican places in the farther reaches of the Mission district (agreed), but after spending years eating the tourist-flavored muck that's served in NYC, this was a significant step up. Well worth a visit.
author: Mark H.

description: Great spot for lunch! Use to work right around the corner at a start-up and this was one of my go to  spots. Highly recommend the Carne Asada Nachos.
author: Nitin Y.

description:
This is by far the best Mexican food you can find downtown. I hesitate to call this SoMa since it's in an alleyway off of market, but it really doesn't matter what neighborhood this place is in. It is just that damn good.

I hold business meetings here, I bring friends to lunch here, I still go here by myself when I'm in a rush to pickup a burrito. Their Carne Asada never disappoints.

I think the thing that makes Tropisueno so good is the attention to detail. The best things are the basics, like the chips and salsa. Their chips are awesome (not quite as good as Tapatia in South City, but amazing for SF), but their Salsa is absolutely incredible. Like beyond melt-in-your-mouth incredible, it is seriously good. I can't even believe how awesome place is.

The decor is transporting. It's like, one minute you're walking down an alleyway in a serious post-modern portion of SF (there's that super lopsided building immediately across from it). The next minute you're in grandma's kitchen carried away by the fragrance of deliciousness.

The only thing I have to say negatively about this place is that their Shrimp left a little to be desired. But that Carne... Whoa.

TL;DR: Order a Carne Asada plate or Burrito and weep tears of joy from the amazing food. Stop reading this review and go buy one. Now. NOW!!!
author: Joshua G.

description: Excellent ceviche and Patron margarita. Very loud and crowded, but the food makes up for getting jostled by people passing by the table.  Whenever I'm in SF, I head to Tropisueño for a ceviche fix.
author: Robin E.

description:
What a great happy hour find in FIDI! A couple girlfriends and I tried this place out last week and loved it. Here's what we ordered (all for happy hour prices): 

Drinks: 
Margarita de la Casa. ($5/glass) chili salt rim. I was pretty excited about the salt rim when I figured out there was chili powder. yum. Also, these are margaritas are strong - you're definitely getting your $5 worth. 

Food: 
- The chips and salsa (free!) are in a category of their own - totally addictive! 
- Nachos. (don't remember the price) The crack chips + beans, guac, cheese, pico de gallo, sour cream (I think...). Good, but would have preferred to just continue with the chips and salsa. 
- Chicken Quesadilla. ($6?) Delicious. Generous portion. The chicken was grilled perfectly, and there was a healthy amount of smoky cumin flavor overall. 
- Flautas. ($3 for 2) Also good, but not as memorable as the chicken quesadilla. 

My girlfriends and I rolled ourselves out of there satisfied, a little drunk, and ready to explore the city for the remainder of the evening.
author: Laura R.

description: Best Mex near Metreon easily.  Everything is tasty. Great salsa. The orange salsa is the best around. Need to attend their happy hour. Bet it's great. No doubt. no brainer..
author: Fred V.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner. Food was pretty decent. The chips and dip were amazing, and the drinks were strong. Had the house margarita. Somehow didnt come away super impressed with the dish I ordered. Some friends loved it though, so I might have erred in my decision. 

They do have a separate vegetarian menu for those who dont partake of the meat. 

I might visit again for the chips and salsa.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
In between good and great is where I put Tropisueño..

I was surprised and relieved to see the tacqueria style dining when we came here for lunch. A friend from Toronto was visiting and had a craving for guac so I thought it would be a good spot to hit before she went off to union square for shopping. 

The line was practically out the door when we got there but it moved surprisingly fast. The lunch menu is extensive- every option possible for a tacqueria is on there. The service was friendly and fast, the atmosphere is cute, and everything was really efficient.

Taste is what was lacking a little- the salsa was a bit blah. I tried every type at the salsa bar trying to find something semi spicy and couldn't. I ordered the tostada salad which was good but not enough veggies. My friend ordered the regular burrito which she thought was HUGE but it was standard SF size. 

A good place for a quick mexican food fix.. might check out happy hour sometime.
author: Seema M.

description: The service? Outstanding. Very knowledgable and friendly. The dishes needed to be simplified--too much sauce, too many ingredients, etc.
author: Jay S.

description: Damn you for being so close to my house! This place was amazing. It totally makes sense that it's always packed. The free chips and salsa was actually my favorite part of the meal, the food was great too, but oooohhhh those chips. The servers were nice and the decor is cute. This is a great date spot for casual dining.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Damn good. Reminds me of mexican restaurants back home in Bakersfield, minus the food coma. Margaritas are creative and great tasting too! Worth a visit; make a reservation.
author: Richard R.

description: Really good food, really good bang for your buck, really good chips and dip. Our server, Kayla, was pleasant and helpful, too. She very easily and proactively helped split bills for a large party.
author: Lucky B.

description: Best happy hour in SF (says me).  Great food and drinks.  This place is funny because it is a cafeteria style place for lunch and then a really nice sit down place for dinner.  For dinner, I highly recommend the porkchop.  It takes a few minutes extra to cook, and it is absolutely fantastic.  Additionally, their house margaritas are great.
author: Tasha D.

description:
yes it's pricey mexican food, but that doesn't change the fact that it tastes delicious, the portions are huge and the service is great. there's ALWAYS a big crowd waiting for a table when i come here, but the wait isn't too bad at all. my favorite appetizer is the ceviche - it's got a really great tangy, spicy kick to it that catches you a little off guard (in a good way). i also loove their warm tortilla chips and trio of house-made salsas included at every table. for entrees, i recommend the chicken with mole poblano - the meat is moist and flavorful and the sauce is amaaaazing. i love spreading it all over my rice!

i definitely need to come back here to try some of their famous margaritas...
author: Stephanie C.

description: Margaritas are awesome! Love the tapas as well. Great place for Mexican food outside of the mission district! Lines are long for dinner.
author: Ro B.

description: We came here for dinner.  The virgin margarita was yummy and refreshing.  The combo plate included an enchilada and tamale with beans and rice which were filling.   Best deal on the menu in my opinion.  Will be back to try the rest of the menu items!
author: Jennie W.

description: Delicious Mexican spot at affordable prices. Reservations fill up quickly so be sure to plan in advance. I highly recommend the chile verde - it's the house special for a reason. Tender pieces of pork with rice. Get the white beans. The waiters are friendly and attentive. They provided insight into which dishes they like better. I need to come here more often.
author: Cathy L.

description:
LEGIT JALISCO MEXICAN FOOD. 

This is what my mom cooks at home!!!!!! 

For the first time in my life i have experienced homemade Mexican food. The salsa's are amazing. The guacamole isnt like mine but its okay. But i finally found a great Mexican restaurant that serves awesome veggie food. 

Its all too bad i live in LA. FML :(
author: Aidan V.

description:
Bar and Restaurant review - I keep coming back 

I like it here: cute Mexican restaurant, good food, good drinks

I love their hibiscus flower cocktail - very refreshing.

Warm tortilla chips and a variety of dips, yummm!

The pork chop is my fav.

Great service - my water glass was never empty considering the food can get spicy - a good thing.
author: Kali F.

description:
I usually don't go for Mexican food in sit-down places (overpriced, sub-par food, would rather hit up a taco stand/truck) but this place exceeded my expectations.  First of all, for being located in downtown SF, it's reasonably priced.  They also make the best spanish rice I've had (that my mom didn't make).  And their mole is AMAZING (again, hints of cinnamon and just plain delicious!!  I'd put it on ANYTHING!)!!

Their drink list was pretty extensive and featured some interesting concoctions (rose/hibiscus infused ingredients and the like).  I had a couple of beers, but if I'd had the $10, I would have tried one of their signature drinks.  Maybe for next time.

Our server was also very good, and patient, as it took us about an hour to finally order (old friends catching up yadayada), and when there appeared to be an error on our bill, they cleared it up relatively quickly (having an engineer at the table didn't hurt either).

If I were hosting someone from out of town, this is definitely a place I'd consider taking them!
author: Matthew B.

description:
I have been here on several different occasions: happy hour with the girls, lunchtime after some power-shopping, dinner with a friend, etc. Each time I have been satisfied, as I clearly keep coming back. However, something is keeping them from breaking into the 4 or 5 star range: it's the service.

I really do like the food here, and especially during the lunch hours when the have the line open and you seat yourself, the prices are great! The house margaritas are strong and the food is pretty authentic, plus it's good quality.

I really do think the major turn off is that they don't realize that their primary market of customers are people looking to "hang out". Yes, I get that I can't linger at a table for hours on end and expect my server to be excited about it, but the last time I was there my friend and I were there for about an hour (for dinner) and we each ordered dinner and two drinks, and after our second drink was served and food was still on the table, we were given the "get the hell outta here, quick" look and treatment from our server. Bad day? Sure. But just chill out and let us finish! Same thing happened on another occasion with a table of four, all with entrees and drinks. 

I checked both times, no wait at the front and there were open tables, so it's not like we were taking up precious space for other diners. 

Anywoooo. Just save your trip to Tropisueno for the lunch hour and you will be pleased. Dinner, on the other hand, there are thousands of other places in SF that are happy to let you have a nice dinner conversation over drinks and food. Try any of those instead.

Also, albondigas. You know what I mean.
author: Erica E.

description: Sexy tacos! this reminds me of baja california! I felt like like i was home in mexico! The atmosphere was beautiful and was super romantic! My lover looked sexier than ever and we shared chips together! Date worthy!
author: Dark A.

description:
I wish we had come here when we had bigger appetites, because I really liked what we had.  Unfortunately we came for dinner after a long day of traveling from New Jersey, so it was feeling like a "fourth meal" for us.  Basically that means that we passed up appetizers and guacamole, which I had high hopes for.  

We enjoyed a large amount of their chips and salsas, which is hard to mess up.  For my entree I got their signature Camarones Tropisueno, which was jumbo shrimp in a chili-cream sauce.  I had never had anything like it, and honestly I was addicted to it.  So unexpected from a Mexican place (where my boyfriend was having the tacos and enchiladas).  

What was really weird was that they didn't ask us what type of beans we wanted until we received our food, and by the time they came we were already stuffed and not in need of more food.  Not cool.  Also, the margaritas were a little off for something that they really should have excelled at.  They were strong, but not in a good way.

Overall, I would come back, if only just to order that shrimp!
author: Jessica G.

description: Went here on Saturday night with my girl already tipsy - but I can tell the food would have tasted amazing either way. I like how they are not TOO expensive, but at the same time, they don't skimp on the portions. The chips and salsa are SO good (3 different kinds of salsa) and the drinks are prettttty strong but tasty at the same time. We ordered the Ceviche de Camarones as an appetizer (really good) and shared 2 entrees - fresh fish veracruz and camarones tropisueno. The fish was so good, so soft and the sauce was filled with flavor. The camarones tropisueno was large shrimp in sauce and also did not fail in taste. I will definitely be returning here soon! (cute place for date night, only con is the bathroom wait).
author: Fatima M.

description:
OK, so I don't recommend the burritos here, but I DO strongly recommend the happy hour!
Their margaritas are excellent here!  $5 a pop from 5-6:30 every night.  Plus free hot chips and salsa.  
The trop has become the popular after work spot for myself and my work buddies.  It's a super convenient location, just steps away from the Powell St. BART entrance.  
The staff is always super friendly and attentive and your glass isn't empty very long before one of the servers is asking if you want another.  Who can resist another, they make their margaritas with agave nectar and they serve them in these cute, what they call "rolly polly" 16 oz tumblers!  I love em!
Check it out for Happy Hour, you won't be disappointed.
author: Bethany D.

description: Great food, good drinks, nice atomosphere. Seems a little awkward going to a mexican restaurant right by the mall, but it was worth it. We had a big party for my sisters birthday. They were really accommodating, the wait staff was really attentive. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.
author: raji b.

description: Lines can be hectic for lunch but the food is really good. Prices are surprisingly low as well. Dinner is a different story all together here. So do not expect to pay the same.
author: Sammy A.

description: It was pretty crowded when we went, so it was pretty loud and there was a wait. Our waiter by the bar was really nice and friendly, but the one at our table seemed disinterested. My dad seemed to really like his meal, but mine was pretty bland and tasteless.
author: Emily F.

description: Might be the best Mexican restaurant I've ever been to.  Salsa was am-az-ing.  Drinks were very good ceviche and posole were excellent.  5 stars!
author: Danny C.

description:
It's the chips.  They're so thin, crispy, piping hot delicious, that they are the thing that tips this review from 3 to 4 stars.

I've come here for both lunch (chicken super burrito) and dinner (los favoritos, chicken and steak tacos, cheese enchilada), and enjoyed both.  The burritos are a bit pricey, but they're good.  I didn't notice the guac enough to be being noteworthy in the burrito, but as the freestanding app it was delightful - chunky, plentiful, just right.

While I didn't have one, their cocktails looked quite decadent on the menu - their schtick is different fancy salt rims - from smoked sea salt to lavender infused.  Must try someday!

Tip to lunchers - call your order in.  There's always a line out the door, but if you call it in you can just pop by the front of the line and they'll take care of you right away.
author: Allison B.

description:
While in the past I enjoyed going to this restaurant, I didn't have a pleasant experience my last visit.  I stopped by quickly during the hours of lunch.  If you have been to this place, you know that it's taqueria style.  Order and get a table.  Well, I didn't realize they do not have fajitas.  It's been a while since I've been to this restaurant.  I go to the food counter to put my order and three women were just busy chit chatting.  One who was standing by the food, continued to chat while I stood there to be  acknowledged.  She sees me standing there and didn't care to say "hello."  Finally, she turns around and says, "are you ready?"  Uh...I wasn't standing there to tell her she was stupid and lazy.  Anyway, I told her I want some veggie fajitas.  She was like, "What?" with annoyance in her voice.  So I repeated my order.  She gave me this look, eyebrows raised and said, " uh, we don't have that."

I looked at her and told her she didn't need to talk to me that way and could say it nicely.  She was a condescending bitch.  There are way better restaurants in San Francisco.  You won't last long with that attitude of your employees.
author: Tonee W.

description:
Wow, the service really couldn't have been better. My waiter was the sweetest person on the planet -- I just wanted to kiss him! Not really. Maybe after 4 of those margaritas I could have... whaaat? {blinks awkwardly}

I was in the mood for a fajita salad with ranch dressing and Chevy's wasn't going to cut it. The W concierge recommended Tropisueno and I had heard of the place and been meaning to try it for a while. What better time than by myself on a Tuesday night?

I ordered up a margarita on the rocks and took a look at the menu, but I didn't spot any salads - much less a chicken fajita salad with ranch dressing.

With one last glimmer of hope left, I asked my rico suave waiter if the kitchen could throw a salad together for me. Without *any* hesitation whatsoever, he says simply, "Of course!"

They didn't have any ranch dressing in the house, but the vinaigrette that came with my salad was tangy and light -- perfect for the marinated chicken, fresh greens and veggies on top.

My two margaritas went down so smoothly I considered just plopping down on a bar stool and staying there all night. But alas, I had to get some sleep.

Tropisueno, let's run away together. How do you feel about Cabo?
author: Nikki B.

description: This is a really great Mexican restaurant.  I've been for both dinner and lunch.  I like lunch because the service is really fast and it's easy to go with a big group because everyone pays separately when they order.  It's extremely convenient.  I also like going for dinner because I have a little more time to relax with a margharita and they have quite a selection.  Also, they give you free chips and salsa when you eat in which is definitely a must for a mexican restaurant.  If you're in the area, definitely recommend.
author: Elsa H.

description:
I didn't pay attention to the prices here as I knew ahead of time that we probably were paying for our dinner.

The chips are very thin and have the perfect crunch to them - yummy and when the basket was almost empty they were ready with a new one for us. They also had three types of complimentary salsa with the complimentary chips. I just wish they would have told ust which was which instead of dipping my chip into the too much salsa and eating the spiciest one! Ouch - my mouth was on fire!! It was good just not in that quantity so a warning would have been nice.  

The only serve Mexican beers or something like that they said and I just really wanted a plain boring beer (Bud Light) and they didn't have any.  

The menu itself wasn't very big/extensive. Was looking for more variety and didn't find it. What I had were the taco appetrizers and added rice and beans. They were okay, I have had much better though.

Their location is off the beaten path of Market Street but still close enough to walk to if you are out and about shopping or staying in the Union Square area.
author: Jenny D.

description:
This is my new favorite restaurant in SF.  It's conveniently located to my place, and the food is fantastic! 

My favorite dish is the Chicken Mole. I would highly recommend it!
author: Brian B.

description: Long story short: a super yummy place!  Good atmosphere, great drinks and even better food!  Recommendation for the pepino margarita-fresh with a cucumber flare.  Chips and trio of salsa before meal were amazing!!!  Service was stellar and prices are unbeatable!  Definitely a must for San Fran!
author: Nicole Q.

description: Went here tonight for dinner, it's my first time in San Francisco and we were staying by union square so it was a quick walk. The food was awesome, the atmosphere is cute and fun, tons of people at the bar(they had a great tequila selection). I had the build your own combo with an enchilada, carnitas taco, and hickey tamale couldn't decide which was better. My sister had the veggie enchiladas and loved them. Would definitely go back for more, decent prices too.
author: Amanda N.

description:
Simply sublime. Service was excellent. We walked in without reservations on a Saturday night about 6:00 and easily got a table. If we were eating later it may have been a bit of a wait. We were greeted by a waiter very quickly and out food came to us incredibly fast but perfectly timed. 

The appetizer pork tacos were great with the handmade chips and excellent, fresh red and green salsas. And the house margarita was damn good. 

Chicken mole was smokey, spicy and just perfectly sweet. My partner in crime had a chicken taco and cheese tamale combo that was excellent. 

Cozy and lively. Food was great. Left feeling incredibly satisfied.
author: Kevin S.

description: This place is AMAZING!!!!! Went here for their happy hour. Its a hidden GEM for sure.  The happy hour menu and drinks are AMAZING! The atmosphere is great for a friends get together or a romantic date. They also had AMAZING bartendars when we were there. Alex and Remy were badass. They were on top of everyone order, and made conversations with everyone, they were really cool. Plan to come back here FORSURE!!!! Like um... Tomorrow!!!
author: Krista R.

description: Some of the best Mexican food I've had in the Bay. I've been looking for a nice Mexican spot and happened to stumble across this one and was not disappointed. The food is fresh and would normally be charged much more at other restaurants. The prices are very fair and the food is delicious! The roasted corn napales is really good and a must try. If they have fresh watermelon ask for a watermelon mojito (if you're not a tequila fan like myself). You'll love it. Definitely check it out
author: Shabnam J.

description:
Some of the best reasonably priced food in the Metreon vicinity, this place has become my go-to spot before a movie. This really sells it short, though, as I would happily eat at Tropisueño for just about any reason. 

Their margaritas are delish, the scallop appetizer and carne asada just about heaven... even the chips are great. I was a little nervous when they opened up in the often-overlooked Yerba Buena lane but am glad to see they're running a bustling business now... it's awesome!
author: Aaron L.

description:
SOLID. 

Growing up in San Diego, I've developed the typical Mexican food snobbery that so many of us somehow acquire "What? What the fuck is all this shit in my burrito? Back in San Diego..." Hence my being slow to try Tropisueño even though it's only a block away. 

Went for the first time for lunch with friends, was confused by the lunch ordering system (I've lived in SF for too long) and proceeded to order the Chicken with Mole Pablano Burrito. While waiting in line, all the employees surprised what appeared to be a friend/fellow employee who was eating lunch with a birthday cake and sung for them. This left the elder, FiDi looking man stranded at the register as they were quickly celebrating. He gave this entirely condescending, whiny sigh of a scoff and glared at them. But no one paid attention to him. 

That made me smile. 

Then I drank some of the margarita (pretty strong), explored the fresh salsa, enjoyed the music and fantastic interior and then bit into my oversized burrito. 

I became a fan around my third bite.
author: Charles T.

description:
A great option for Mexican in SOMA.

With a combination of fresh ingredients, lots of seating and rapid service, Tropisueno quells cravings in good form.

I've had a few items here and have enjoyed them all. Their burritos are substantial, and filled with daily grilled proteins. Quesadillas also have character, with ballooning proportions and a rich side of guacamole.
