I personally love places that make their chips, and the ones here are solid. Light, crispy, and add perfect texture to the rest of your bites. 

While the line may seem long at lunch, it moves fast, so settle down, have a conversation that's not on an electronic device, and enjoy.
author: Mike K.

description:
Blegh... glorified Chipotle. 

Went for lunch and was suprised at the nice decor, and then let down by the order, get a number, and sit thing. It looks like a place that should be full service... but not the case. At least not at lunch.

Fish tacos were soggy... didn't even remotely resemble fish.

My friend waited forEVER to get his super simple burrito, I went to see what the deal was - and they brought out the wrong burrito - so essentially he had to reorder... and then it wasn't even very good.

The location, ambiance, and seemingly decent bar (I didn't order any drinks) make this place seem like it has potential... but they really need to work on their basics (how damn hard is it to throw together a delish taco or burrito?).

So lack luster I had to write a my first Yelp review of the year.
author: Alexa S.

description: Boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch (around 2:30 on a Monday) before a movie and were pleasantly surprised.  We ordered a shrimp burrito, one cheese enchilada and a steak quesadilla. We also ordered two house margaritas because, well, why not? Everything was great. Food came out very fast and service was very friendly. We've had our share of Mexican food  and consider this definitely above average. The shrimp burrito was good, the steak quesadilla was better and the cheese enchilada was AMAZING! Overall, great prices, good service and good food! I would definitely recommend.
author: Trina G.

description:
Great place. Dinner or drinks after work here is well worth it. I had the sangria blanco...a little too strong for my taste. Other items I had

-Tacos de Cachete (tender!!!)
-Molotes de Elote y Barbacoa (really great esp with the corn)
-Huaranches Tres Cochinitas (a lot of food! But really well cooked meat)
author: Lola D.

description: We came in and it was my husbands second time, my first.  It was so crowded I was worried we would not find a seat, but we nabbed one ok.  I got a tostado - chicken and hubs got a chicken burrito.  I liked it fine, but was hoping to be blown away.  We are always searching for very good Mexican.  I had almost ordered guacamole and chips extra and resisted.  I was very glad I did not as I was not impressed with the little guacamole that was on my tostado.  I think cooks over do guacamole adding too much onion, tomato, etc.  I like it simple, it takes very little additions to make good guac. I would come back here and give it another chance, but I wanted to be blown away.
author: Cindy M.

description: Great tapas and fantastic margaritas. My husband and I were famished after spending an afternoon at the SF MOMA and we hopped into this nearby place for a quick bite. Their chips are authentic and served with a bean dip that's fresh and clean. Their salsa varieties are delicious and unique, and their margaritas are a home run. I haven't tried their dinner menu, but will be sure to make a return trip.
author: Dia Z.

description:
Nothing special.

Unfortunately, my most memorable moment was asking 2 different waiters (including ours) for more salsa about 6 times total....and never received it. Combine that with the slow service and I most likely will not be back for anything other than a margarita. 

I went here on National Margarita day and needless to say the margarita did not let me down. Its hard to find a good cocktail that isn't watered down and this margarita made my day. 

Now on to the food and service. First, we were seated rather quickly but waited a considerable amount of time just to see our waiter and ask for water. Second, we ran out of the red salsa (quite tasty) before we even ordered food and asked throughout the evening. For some reason, it was determined by the staff that we didnt need it but should be told that it would be arriving shortly (over an hour of waiting). We ordered our food and I was not impressed. Not particularly let down, but not impressed either. The chicken tacos were average and the flauta (or taquito) was over fried and under stuffed. It felt like i was chewing on just a overly fried-rolled up tortilla. Then, we waited about 15 minutes just to waive the server down to close our tab. I was tired of waiting so i just handed him my card. Lastly, as far as parking goes, there is a large garage across the street on Mission (keep in mind it is packed during the day through the normal work hours).

All in all, i wouldn't recommend this place for anything other than a margarita. If you want to take a chance on the service, I would say make sure you go during a time when there are very few patrons in order to avoid a poor level of service like we had.
author: Derek F.

description:
Food poisoning.

I've been a regular for the past year - I frequented Tropisueno with multiple groups of friends probably once every other week. That's changed... It's been an excruciating three days (of throwing up, diarrhea, etc.) and my stomach remains upset to the minute of this review.

I ordered the pork chop entree, which clearly tasted weird (I've ordered this countless times to know), and the tempest (cocktail).

I doubt my friends and I will be returning in the foreseeable future. I do not tolerate food poisoning and lack of quality control, so they've seriously shattered my trust. It was especially upsetting given I had booked an expensive non-refundable travel over the weekend.

[Update/Bump from 1- to 3-stars] I reported the issue to the manager, and received a prompt but extremely detailed response. I appreciate that they took the courtesy to confront the issue and outline what appears to be a rigorous food inspection/preparation process they implement at the restaurant.
author: Jack W.

description: It's good mexican food at a really great price. Don't be put off that it's in the same building as the Marriott Marquis. It's a separate institution and has to thrive on its own merits, which it does.
author: Spencer S.

description:
This place has some great SOLID mexican food. The atmosphere here is pretty laid back and the restaurant itself is very easy to get to. It is close to parking garages, muni and bart. 
I got the chicken enchiladas when i was here. Very good. My friend got tamales and an amazing side of plantains! those rocked! 
definitely a great place to check out if you are in the area.
author: Wes P.

description: My friends and I went here for a birthday dinner. They won't seat you unless the whole party is there, so my friend and I waited at the bar for a while until everyone arrived. It was happy hour, and the margaritas were great! However, it was very crowded and we had to just find a corner to stand in and try not to be in the way. The food was pretty good. I had the Tampiqueño, which was I enjoyed, but it was too much for me to finish. The waiter forgot my friend's birthday candle, but he was friendly.
author: Raizel G.

description: I used to love this place but had not been here in a couple of years. Went there for lunch today. It was terrible. Salad was almost inedible and the tacos were small and bland. Honestly seemed like mall food court quality. I did not realize they turned lunch into a mediocre taqueria. I would maybe try dinner based on my past experience but I cannot comprehend the five star lunch reviews.
author: Andrew S.

description:
The Entrees here are superb and different from other restaurants that I've been to.

Also the chips were great because there were 3 different types of salsa

One thing that I didn't like is the waiter keep trying to up-sell their items.
author: Eric A.

description:
See Devon.

See Devon run 10 miles. Run, Devon, run!

See Devon come home, change quickly, and run over to the Yelp Elite event to booze. Drink, Devon, drink!

See Devon feel sick to her stomach for expending ~1100 calories and only restoring them with alcohol. Don't puke, Devon, don't puke!

The above could certainly be a recipe for disaster, but following the end of the event, my roommate and I crossed Yerba Buena Lane to Tropisueno for some fueling. Now, I have to be honest: the first time I went to Tropisueno was for the elite event last year and I was really not impressed. The food was lackluster, the drinks unpleasant, and I didn't really get the "upscale taqueria" vibe.

But on Saturday, my previous experience was trumped by my impatient stomach demanding something, anything, other than wine. One can only run on fumes for so long.

The super pollo asado burrito was exactly what I was looking for - filling, tasty, high-calorie, and at about $9, it wasn't about to break my wallet. And their chips were divine - crispy in a potato chip type of way, but full of the necessary salty tortilla flavor.

Nice work, Tropisueno. I've changed my mind about you. The next time I find myself making poor dietary choices while marathon training again, I'll be at your door.
author: Devon S.

description: Where do I start.....first of all, they did not take reservations, leading to a sea of humanity where everyone were being treated like cattle...get 'em in, get 'em out...rawhide!  We ordered margaritas from the bar while we waited....after a big show by the bartender...but they were very disappointing, watered down with little flavor.  Eventually we were seated, and my daughter, who has served as a waitress, noticed that our poor waiter had no chance at serving his 10 tables effectively. He provided he worst service that we have ever had, in terms of coming to our table in a painfully slow and disorganized way. The atmosphere was crowded and noisy for a Monday night. On the brighter side, the food was very tasty. This food served in a different environment by different staff would have a chance to make us a returning customer.
author: James S.

description:
Been here twice. The first time I had a good enough experience to take my friend here for her birthday, and she loved it too!

Firstly, its a cute restaurant. dim but decorated to be a bit festive enough to be a little dressy. They have a bar and tables as you go more inside. From what I remember, there are a string of lights across the windows--pretty! 

Their complimentary chips and salsa are awesome! Chips still warm and crisp, great to munch on while poring over the menu.

I got the Chile verde with pork, which all my friends agreed was the winner of the night. Its pulled pork cooked with a green chile sauce, with a side of rice. SO GOOD! 

My friends ordered some sort of steak, and another friend tacos. they were jealous of my chile verde, and ended up asking the waitress if they can have a side of the sauce! The waitress was very nice and brought some out, but it wasnt entirely the same. I think they cook the pork with the chile verde, which makes it sooo much more delicious and savory. 

We also ordered their ceviche, which was also really good. My friends got margaritas, which were about $5, and definitely worth it. :)

The prices of the food are decent, and the service friendly. I would definitely go back.
author: Eileen K.

description:
Damn Tropisueno, you know what you are doing!

We had the Callos de Hacha a la Plancha, aka, sea scallops in plaintain chorizo hash. And while I dodged the chorizo, the rest of the dish was INcredible.  And coupled with an avocado-tomatillo salsa, it made my mouth sing.  Because my dining partner wouldn't shut up about how delicious the chorizo was, there was a moment or two that I seriously considered eating pig.  Alas, no meat for me. However, what I did eat was, mmm-M, fantastic!

The Camarones Tropisueno, house favorite, was also very good (not as good as the scallops, but very good none-the-less). Our adorable waitress suggested that we get a side of tortillas to help scoop, fold and mow this dish down.  And it was a very good idea.  We scooped, folded and mowed until there was not a morsel left.

De-Lish!

And yes, all food here must be enjoyed with a house margarita.
author: Hayley W.

description: Took my mother in law here for dinner and we loved the food and had a great time. I've talked many a time about how good the food is and honestly it would be a 5 star review except for one thing. Unless you sit in the bar area it's like you're sitting in the kitchen next to the oven. It's overcast and cold outside yet it's steaming inside. Wish they had better control of the temp in the restaurant. Maybe its a good thing so I won't eat here so much otherwise I'd be here a lot more.
author: Hyung L.

description:
The only reason this place is open is because there is no other Mexican/burrito place nearby to compete.  I used to go to Tropisueno with co-workers for lunch, but I finally had to call it quits.  Their burritos are bland and I can't count how many times they've screwed up my order.  Plus the line at lunch is always out the door and it takes forever to get food.  

The two stars is really just for their chips (super oily, but SUPER tasty) and their mega hot orange salsa.
author: Lara O.

description: Went on a Sunday night... I called to make a reservation, they said they were full and just to walk in but the wait would be 45mins.  We still went and the wait was only 10 mins and there were plenty of tables available.  They don't have coffee, tea, any hot beverages or domestic beers.  Food was average, service was average.   Atmosphere is good.  I would not recommend if any one asked me where's a good Mexican restaurant in SF.
author: Marc C.

description:
Gourmet Mexican food finds a nice little home at Tropisueño.  It's a very nice/fun room.

Things got off to a bit of a rough start, though.  We did a late lunch and because neither of us had been there, we didn't know you just go up and order and *then* get a table.  It looks like a table-service kind of place.  After about 4 minutes of standing there looking stupid (and the bartender ignoring our presence), a very nice woman helped guide us through the process.  After that, it was pretty smooth sailing, except I still expected our stuff to arrive at the same time, and it didn't - I guess things just come as they're readied.

Guacamole was pretty good!  My pork burrito was really very, very good. My friend's quesadilla was HUGE.  Chips were plentiful, but a little too greasy and too thin to really get a good scoop on the guacamole. 

Prices are a little higher than one might expect from a taqueria.  But it's also not outrageous.  The ingredients are of good quality.
author: Evan G.

description: This place has some of the best Mexican food i have had on sf. The happy hour has a decent menu, and good happy hour Margaritas for $5. It also fills up really fast in the bar so get a seat fast.
author: Raul R.

description: Original well crafted margaritas!  Great salsa bar and freshly made chips. I going back and have a full meal.
author: Joe C.

description: Amazing authentic food! Best I've ever had! Lunch or dinner it's the spot to be at. The food is amazingly delicious and fresh! The drinks were strong but that's how it should be!!! ;)  Great spot! A+++++
author: Evie A.

description: Not really authentic but good food nonetheless.  Good quality meat and ingredients.  One of the best salsa bars in SF.  Each salsa is delicious.  Mainly go here for lunch and it always get packed so get there early.  Margharita is good but too pricey and nothing special.  Clean and good vibe.
author: J. W.

description:
I've been here 3 times over the past 2 months: for lunch, brunch and as of last night, dinner.  So, I feel pretty confident about my take on the place.

Best part is the drinks - I would give them 4 stars.  Unfortunately, when combined with an okay atmosphere (3 stars), and what I have found to be consistently below par food (2 stars), I decided to average out the 3 scores.

Getting to the food.  I eat vegetarian.  While they may not have many vegetarians in Mexico, I'm sure they have a few, and we definitely exist in Northern California.  As a result, I expect places to have more than one dish for me (us?) to chose.  Not here hombre.  They had one main course for me to chose from, pezole.  Good part was that I normally like pezole.  It's sometimes even considered a delicacy.  Unfortunately, Tropisueno's pezole is more a half cooked vegetables in tomato broth mix.  Not a delicacy.

In summary, come here for some margaritas but go elsewhere to eat - there are much better other options in town.
author: David A.

description:
Delicious mole!! Whenever there is a mole dish on a menu I always try it. Tropisueno's mole chicken is awesome!! The portions at Tropisueno are suprisingly large, prices are reasonable and the margaritas are very good. 

This is definitely a fun, energetic place for a birthday dinner or just a night out with friends. It gets packed quick, so definitely make a reservation.
author: Kandace K.

description: Cool bar area and good food.  The salsa selection is excellent.  Made for a very nice lunch spot.
author: Carlos G.

description:
This is a good place, but it has no competition in that part of town. It's basically a fancy taqueria.  Personally, I'll stick to the Mission.

If you get there for lunch there is a line out the door. You order at the counter, then are given a number, you sit down and wait for 10-15 minutes, and they bring you your food.  

The salsa bar has lots of different kinds of salsas, but oddly, none of them were very good.

I ordered a shrimp burrito with no tomatoes, and naturally it came with tomatoes. My buddy said they make a religion out of screwing up orders here. Why this is the only real Mexican place in a six (twelve?) block area, in which there are probably ten Thai and half a dozen Greek restaurants, is beyond me.
author: Adam Z.

description:
I'm so disappointed.  The reviews for this place are great but our experience was really poor and definitely not worth repeating.

Packed, way too hot and noisy.  Service was a little patchy from the host to the waiter.  I know AC is not always necessary in SF but the room was incredibly hot and stuffy.  In fact, it was the hottest thing about the place.

Food was poor.  The free chips and dips were the only highlight.  Flautas seriously lacked flavor, seasoning and taste and if there was chicken in them, I didn't find any.  

Tampiquena was better but the bar was now pretty low.  The slow cooked meat was tasty but sadly there was only very little of it.  The enchilada was soggy and unable to support a kitten's breath let alone any meat.  The steak was woefully under-seasoned and lacking in flavor.  The rice was dry and chewy and the refried beans (which I normally love) were dull and flat.  The other dish was equally disappointing.  Some deep-fried corn fritters that were soggy and greasy.  Now I'm not a chili masochist. I don't believe that hotter is better but this food was so lacking in spice or flavor it was incredible. 

Listening to the adjacent couple arguing with the waiter was an added bonus (just give the guy what he wants. He's paying and he's not being unreasonable asking for a drink to be made how he likes it.  I know the waiter felt that he was being unfairly criticized but seriously, I could have made the drink for the guy in less time than the discussion took about the amount of coke in his JD & coke.  And the guy was trying to be very nice about it all too).  We didn't have any margaritas, which was perhaps our second mistake, but the wine was reasonably priced and drinkable.

Due to the very long wait for food, they kindly comped the flautas.  Which was a relief as I would have hated to have paid for them.  The dog got the rest of the steak and he seemed pretty happy.  So it's a woof woof from the dog and a 'no way, never again' from me.
author: Steven R.

description: Tropisueno exceeded my expectations in every way. From the authentic trio of salsas and excellent house margarita to the delicious and perfectly cooked sea bass accompanied by delectable rice and frijoles, I was constantly surprised by the quality of their work.  Moreover, the prices were very reasonable given the downtown location. I will return whenever I find myself shopping in Union Square.
author: Ross W.

description: This place is fun, the staff are a hoot. Food and drinks always hits the spot. I'll be going back for sure.
author: Paul G.

description:
Came before a late movie for eats.  Wasn't really hungry so just had a couple tacos but they were pretty good.  Friend's dinner was to his liking as well.
The service was great!  Didn't feel like we were rushed out even though we obviously were not there to eat a full sit down dinner.
The ambience wasn't a bad touch either.  A little too much candlelight romanticism for the friend I was with but could see it being a great date spot.

I would love to come back for drinks and a full meal one day.  The bar is incredibly inviting...
author: Ninja H.

description: The food is tasty, the location is optimal for SOMA, once you get inside you forget you're IN SOMA, overall a good time. I had the seafood soup, which was pricey at $19 for a bowl but had an impressive amount of seafood inside. My friend asked for no sauce on his flautas and of course got sauce served to him. He didn't complain, but the lack of attention to details of this sort is important in a server.
author: Maya G.

description: I eat mexican food religiously and I am from Southern California.  Before coming here I was a little worried that I would be disapointed.  Turned out the mexican food was pretty good.  If you go, order one of their house margaritas!  they are perfect.  The chips and salsa were really good too.  I tried to order fish tacos and the chile relleno but they didnt have any (although it was on their menu -_-).  I wasnt super hungry so I went for their pozole vegetarano.  It was good but I know it isnt for everyone.  Besides the good food their service was really great and friendly.  I recommond this place if you feel like some mexican.
author: Cat N.

description:
Just what the stomach ordered... we needed something quick and light. So my husband and I shared the guac appetizer and each had a Baja Fish taco. I however, delighted my tastebuds with a margarita as well. :)

I wasn't expecting to order, take a number, and then sit down. Guess I should have read more Yelp reviews, ha! But it didn't really matter too much... food came out fast. My margarita took like 3 tries for the bartender to perfect. He was finding some specks in either the agave, the marg mix, or the glass... so he kept remaking until it was just right. 

(I appreciate the bartenders attention to detail... but I was thirsty for a marg, man!)

The interior was pretty cool... had some neat branches or something on the ceiling -- made you feel almost like you were outside. 

The staff was super friendly... location was just a few steps from our hotel. 

Was it the best mexican food I've ever had? -- No. Was it the best margarita I've ever had? - - No. But it was alright. Alright for a quick bite.
author: Jessica A.

description: Food was great! At least 2 or 3 options for vegetarians. Service was strictly ok. Restaurant was quite busy and servers were a bit inattentive. Possibly just streched thin.
author: Komal P.

description:
Carne Asada was tough and chewy.
Guacamole bland and too lemony.
Hostess was suppose to let my daughter know where we were seated and didn't.
Will not go back.
author: Julie R.

description: Staying at The Four Seasons or Marriott? This is a must. Very authentic Mexican food.,
author: Craig B.

description: Food and drinks were SO good. And the service was perfect. I always had what I needed and wasn't given the stink eye when my friend and I asked for more tortilla chips and tortillas. We shared the ceviche sampler - shrimp, salmon and scallops and ALL were wonderful but the salmon one was incredible. I could have had a platter of that and been satisfied. Then we shared the mole chicken (my mouth is watering as I type) and it was amazeballs. We devoured the chips and salsa too - you get three different flavors of dip/salsa and all were different and very flavorful.And the chips were fresh, crispy and warm. Oh and my house margarita - with chili salt on the rim - OMGah! Their drinks are strong, tasty, fresh and mine was served in a pint glass so I was a happy gringa! Will totally go back again.
author: Erin L.

description: Great atmosphere, good service. The sort of place I'd love to come after work with friends or maybe for a casual date.  I also love the drink selection - lots of margarita types, plus Pacifico.  Only reason it's not 5 stars is that I've never had a "wow" factor from the food.  It's solid, though.
author: Brad S.

description:
I like Mexican food, but I have to be in the mood for it. I will say I wasn't really in the mood for anything on Sat. night (3/19/11), but my friend found this place on yelp and it was close, so we decided to try it. 

It was AWESOME!!! We had drinks (the house margarita, picante, tempest, and a cucumber infused drink with violet liqueur) the platanos fritos, chicken w/ mole, chuleta de puerco adobada, and the mahi mahi en la parilla. Everything was mouthwatering. The chips and salsa were the best, and had a salsa for everybody. 

The service was so great. We could barely drink water without someone being right there to fill up our glass. They are on it. 

I would say my only complaint is the dim lighting. It wasn't dark, but very dim, and maybe it was because I was there with my friends I wasn't feeling the romantic vibe. I definitely want to bring my parents here, I know they would love it. 

5 stars Tropisueo, you have all 3 d's (dining, drinks, dinner).
author: Kristle C.

description: I make a stop by Tropisueño each time I come to the city.  It's great, especially with Happy Hour deals.  I've come here personally and with business groups.  The food is really good and as always chips is salsa is addicting.  If you like it hotter, like I do, ask the waiter for the hotter salsa.  It's a roasted habanero salsa that tastes great!
author: Alan V.

description: Very poor customer service!!!!!!! Arrived with a large party of 9 and was told we couldn't be accommodated. We then returned to see if our party could be split up and accommodated and were ignored by the 2 hostess having a personal conversation. After a few minutes we were addressed and rudely told our party also could not be accommodate if split. I guess they didn't want to make any money from a very hungry party of 9. Will never return to this place!
author: Esther D.

description: Got the Tampiqueño.  It was great.  Good beers on tap.  Great chips.   Plan to go back.
author: Michael E.

description: Very good food. Everyone in our party was very satisfied with their orders. The restaurant was very busy and it took a while to be seated (even with reservation). After that the waiter took our order right away and the food came out quickly. Would definately go there again.
author: Paul F.

description:
My new favorite Mexican restaurant. Went with coworkers yesterday and ordered the Milanesa, a torta with chicken. The server acted shocked that I asked for black beans instead of refried beans, but she reluctantly agreed to the arrangement. 

It was extremely tasty. It was large, but not i-can't-believe-i-just-ate-that-whole-thing huge that you get at some mexican restaurants (not that I have a problem with that, but my digestive tract was greatly appreciative). We had a catered lunch from Tropisueño a while ago as well. I don't know what we got, but it was surely tasty. 

My favorite part was the habanero sauce. They should probably label it for the unsuspecting patrons fooled by the creamy-looking texture, then I wouldn't have had to try all 6 sauces searching for the spiciest one. But once I found it I was quite happy.
author: Adam B.

description: This place was fantastic. The waiter was friendly, funny & efficient. The food was great! The guacamole was large enough for four people as an appetizer while drinking really good margaritas. I thought it was reasonably priced and offered both traditional & more inventive takes on dishes. I had the grilled veggies & nopales enchiladas. SO GOOD. I'd go back for sure.
author: Oh-m Y.

description:
This is one of my top five Mexican places in San Francisco (others would be Mijita, Nick's Crispy Tacos, Nopalito, and Dos Pinas).

Tropisueno is a great lunch spot - the tacos are generously sized yet moderately priced. Margaritas are delicious too!
author: claire s.

description: Pretty good Mexican food for SF. Coming from Texas, I'm picky but I generally like this place. The service was a bit spotty but I'd come back for the good food and festive atmosphere.
author: A S.

description: 4 stars for the shrimp taco. I also ordered the fish taco, but I think the shrimp was way better. I'm glad they have several different salsas, and its great that you can order 2 tacos for less than $9. The only downside to this place is the heat (from the open kitchen), and it gets packed for lunch, but I will definitely return!
author: Kari K.

description:
Just went here for the first time on a blind date and I'd have to say it's a pretty awesome place :).

It has a great atmosphere (though almost a bit too loud for a first date). And the place is just pretty awesome looking. 

The food was pretty good. Not amazing but still pretty good. The margaritas were tasty as well. 

The only reason why I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because of the hostess. The wait staff were awesome and attentive, however when we were done eating and still talking a bit the hostess kept walking by and giving us dirty looks even though  there were open tables. 

Overall I had a really good experience. Don't know if this was partially due to  the good company but I did like this place :).
author: Lauren V.

description: Great for lunch or dinner.  The atmosphere is fun, the food is tasty, and the margaritas are solid.  I especially like the the salsa bar and fold open kitchen during the day.  No need for lunch reservations, the line moves quickly.  They also cater.
author: Bud L.

description: Went here for drinks & dinner with my sister recently. Great margaritas & food. The chips and salsa are SO fresh and delicious. The waiter was great; I told him I was vegan & asked about options for me. He admitted he wasn't sure what that meant; major points for him there, I really hate when I can tell someone is unsure of the limitations but tries to fumble their way through. He took his time explaining literally every single option; and there were many. I ended up getting the plantains sans cream. So delicious, and a generous portion size. I will definitely come back. Minus one star for a snobby, rude bartender.
author: Jess H.

description:
I've been to Tropisueno three times now, and enjoyed a great meal on each occasion. Just don't come here looking for over-the-top cheese-laden TexMex; this place ain't Chili's, thank god.

Delicious margaritas are their superpower. Creatively formulated, each variety I've tried has been wonderful -- flavorful, well-balanced and not overly sweet.

My favorite dish so far is the Chicken mole: lovely, succulent and complex. It's a good dish to linger over if you're eating alone and have the time to savour every tasty morsel.

I've always enjoyed easy-going, competent and friendly service on my visits. What's not to love?
author: Todd H.

description:
Walked in here after work looking for a small bite before going off to a party for the evening. Turns out it was just starting to be happy hour, and I got one of the last seats at the bar, where I watched the bartenders churn out order after order of margaritas. 

The chips and 3 salsa dips were amazing, and I say this as someone with super annoying food allergies. I could eat it ALL, so this made me very happy. The bar food was tasty, and so were the margaritas. I really enjoyed everything. 

Why only 4 stars and not 5? I'd like to try a sit down meal before I decide if it's a 5 star place. My bar experience was good, but I didn't appreciate the tiny bathroom and how crowded it was. Maybe next time I'll come for lunch... you know, sometime between 2 an 4 pm, when it's less likely to be crowded. I hope.
author: Carol S.

description:
New favorite higher end mexican place in San Francisco.

Had the camarones tropisueno, which were delicious, spicy, served with really good rice. The tacos pastor were the best. Only thing I didn't like was the guacamole was nothing special, and very small serving for $6.

Service was okay, but it was a packed night so it was a little slow.
author: Eddy N.

description:
Chips and Salsa were indeed delicious!  The salsa is a bit spicy.  Comes with big bowl of salsa and then 3 other kinds of salsa for tasting.  The green advocado/garlic one is the best IMO. 

I got the $15 carne asada that comes with beef enchilada.  Which was a ton of food after the Chips and Salsa.  The enchilada was freeeeeaking delicious.  So sweet inside.  

The service was really good here too.  The server was really sweet and cared to ask how our plates were and if we needed anything.  

The hostess is a little ditzy though... not that that mattered.  I got my table.
author: Alias A.

description: I liked this place much more than I expected to.  I ordered the dos flautas and the huarache, both of which were excellent.  The huarache especially - the pork was very juicy, flavorful, tender, and not too salty.  Even the chips were good - crisp, thin, not too greasy.
author: Josh Q.

description: 4-6PM weekdays Happy Hour?! woohooo~~ :) We made our reservations at around 5:30, we arrived promptly at 5:20 and the waiters were all very nice and welcoming. It is a very popular place for locals and it came to no surprise for us that it will be our next favorite happy hour destination in the city! As soon as we were seated, the waiters came and serve us chips and trio salsas, and mannnnnn~ they were just so good at keeping our bowl of salsa in check and at keeping refilling them! Or was it just me and the boo that kept on munching on them!? We ordered the Combinaciones with pork flauta and beef tacos as well as the beef chile verde. After 2 more refills of salsas and chips, both dishes came out around 15 mins later, and man they are huge~! The pork flauta was very crispy with the meat still moist and tender inside. The tacos for me was very standard and a little bit dry..but my boo's beef chile verde was very good - thick and flavorful. Definitely the place worth stopping by! Make a reservation beforehand though, cuz the place gets crowded very fast. They will definitely see more of us soon when we're back with growling stomach!
author: Alisa H.

description: Although this isn't typical mexican food, it's the only place in the city I have enjoyed going back to. Making a reservation for four or more is a must especially if you're coming in after work or on a weekend. I came here once when in college and just recently when I went back to the city to visit friends. I highly suggest trying the cocktails along with your endless supply of chips and trio of salsas. Ask for their special margarita menu because they range from original to mango and strawberry, and these specials aren't always listed. For the main entree, I always go the "Los Favoritos" at the bottom of the menu and order cheese enchiladas and cheese tamales, that come with beans and rice. It's filling, not too spicey and flavorful. If you need a place to go after a long day of shopping, working, with a festive environment, great food and drinks - I highly suggest this gem that's tucked away in Yerba Buena garden.
author: Krutika D.

description:
I definitely don't hand out 5 stars like candy and Tropisueno earned these 5 stars!

I must admit that I was nervous coming in the door to be greeted by a hipster in a white shirt and skinny tie but he is quickly forgotten when you discover one of your friends is manning the bar and two shots of clase azul is on the way. Now all is well and the chips and salsa are pretty good and excellent when you are waiting for a table for 2. 

The music in the air and my dates favorite mexican tune is playing so I'm also treated to a little sweet singing. I swear I'm going to re-learn me some spanish so I can sing and also order Ceviche de Pescado it sounds like I ordered the Ceviche de Pescado. The Ceviche was delicious and mouth watering the only thing missing was a warm summer breeze. 

Not to be offensive at all but I've been to a lot of restaurants and the best cook in the kitchen was a mexican and I think dinner was made by the best mexican chef in San Francisco with a Phd in grilling streak! 

I don't know what the name of my dinner but the waiter was on point with this recommendation. I don't eat a lot of beef but this beef was tender and juicy oh my goodness it was huge and I almost engulf the whole thing.  If I could be on that silly show "The best thing I ever ate" I would talk about this steak and how I found myself swimming in Margaritas. If I could be alcoholic I would drink margaritas for six hours on a saturday...

I'm not sure if we made it to dessert but I do remember dinner being great singing at the table and a great waiter.  Tropisueno is worthy of repeat business.
author: Karim R.

description:
This place was surprisingly good.  There aren't very many Mexican restaurants in downtown, let alone GOOD ones.  My boyfriend brought me here for lunch after an early movies.  

I had the carne asada quesadilla and my bf the carne asada torta.  Both were delish and the portions were decent.  The quesadilla comes with guac, pico de gallo, and sour cream.  Not to mention the wide array of salsas and other toppings (radishes, jalapenos...etc) at the salsa bar!  The torta was pretty good.  What stood out was the chipotle mayo-type dressing on it.  Definately rounded the dish out.  You get free chips with your entree order. OH, almost forgot. The horchata was really good too.  Maybe better than some that I've had in the mission district...maybe.  

Net time I'm downtown and craving Mexican, I'll head on over to this place.  I also want to try the dinner menu, as it is different from the lunch menu.  Also some of the drinks coming out of the bar looking so good...I think one was a pomegranate margarita.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Great service! Had a long wait, but found a spot at the bar. Do call ahead for a reservation as its in a busy area. Got the tacos and a margarita and both were fantastic.
author: Vincent F.

description: This place was really good! We went here several months ago and although I can't remember exactly what we ordered, I recall having very good food, friendly and attentive service (especially with our two crazy little ones), all in a clean, comfortable, attractive environment. I will go back next time I'm in the city.
author: Bruce W.

description: Some of the best Mexican food I have found in the City.  Nice variety and excellent salsa bar.  Have been to the restaurant on weekend for lunch 3+ times and food is constantly good along with the prices.  Would guess that during the work week lunch crowd is quite heavy.
author: Steve F.

description:
This is more of a lunch place -- been here for both dinner and lunch and its like two restaurants in one.  During the lunch hour its more like a taco place and at dinner time its a sit down order off a menu place.

Lunch = paper napkins
Dinner = linen napkins

At lunch these questionable "latino" murals lift up and open up to the kitchen and at night they drop and dinner is made behind.

Its ok, if you are in that hood and dont wnat to jump on the 14 or Bart its fair.
author: G R.

description: Too bad Tropisueno is quite a ways from the office.  Everything from the service to the nice decor seem to blend well with the good food.  The chips and salsa here are great.  I appreciate warm, freshly made chips as opposed to the tough premade ones that have been sitting in a bin for who knows how long.  I've only had the burritos, and I've never been disappointed...good flavors and fresh ingredients.  I have to agree with one reviewer though, the charge for soda refills does not sit well with me.  Service is very good too.  Apparently, this place is close to the Yelp office, according to one reviewer.  Perhaps this would be a good reason to visit more often, to get a chance to schmooze with the elites.
author: Angel S.

description:
SOLID.  I mean, thats really all there is to it.  I have no idea why anyone would go to La Salsa when this place exists.  Just plain silliness in my opinion.

I got a chicken burrito with the intention of eating half of it....um, yeah - scarffed the entire thing down.  They have a pretty big menu, so I am looking forward to trying some ceviche next time I go.  They also have a great salsa bar with enough variety to quench anyones salsa needs.

I am coming back here - fo shizel.
author: Megan H.

description: We were 15 minutes late for our reservation.  They didn't give us attitude and had a GREAT table waiting for us.  The service was attentive and timely but not obtrusive, the chips and salsas were very good and unending, the margaritas and cocktails were delicious, and our food was quite good.  I liked having the option of white beans, which were perfectly prepared and tasty.  My only complaint is that it is a bit too loud, but is a happy and energetic place.  I'll go back!!
author: Brooke B.

description:
We returned to this place because we had a good meal last time around.
Well this time was a disaster. We waited over 35 minutes to get our order, they were out of the meat that we selected and on top of all this I asked the waiter to bring our check and to go containers when they finally got the food out of the kitchen, we needed to leave to make it to a concert.
He didn't do anything I requested. He thought that bringing me another margarita would make everything ok , but it was his cooperation I needed, not more alcohol.
Never again!
author: Craig H.

description:
Tropisueno is an awesome mexican kitchen to get a burrito in the downtown area. I have gone to various places while working in the downtown area on-n-off since 1995. They are a little bit pricier than compared to other places but this place is better. After eating a super burrito from this place I don't walk away with feeling of eating something greesy sick. The benefits is the chips and several different kinds of salsa and peppers at a self-serve bar. 

Now that I no longer work near the place but rather go to school farther off from my old place of employment, this place is a far walk to get lunch. I guess I can go there for lunch when I visit my old workmates. 

The burritos at this
author: Marv M.

description:
You may not have noticed this place - it is quite hidden away!

The Margueritas here are quite delicious - I could drink them all day.
(I must do that some tome!)

The food is pretty good too - a little pricey, but plenty of it!

Table-service in the evening, counter at lunch.
author: Kingpin X.

description:
Fantastic! I ate here with my wife on a Sunday night and the place was packed. Drinks are great and so is the food. I had the Huaraches tres Cochinitas and my wife had a chicken enchilada. They bring each table chips with 3 different salsas which are fantastic. 

We did not have a reservation so we ate at the bar table which was perfect. 

It is a busy place so if you are in town for business and eating alone, don't be surprised if you can't get a spot at the bar to sit.
author: Kevin L.

description: My go to sit down Mexican restaurant near work (financial district). Where else can you get a plate of enchiladas with sides for leas than $10 with unlimited chips with salsa bar near the financial district? Bonus - the place is very clean.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Um. Margarita with Canton ginger liqueur and rose salt? Yes please, x100.

p.s. That's call the Tropisueño.
author: Faffy L.

description:
Definitely will go again to try out more stuff. Was there with a colleague on Friday afternoon for lunch. The place was pretty crowded but we found a place pretty easily.  The food came pretty quickly.
Had chicken casadilla and watermelon juice. Casadialla were very good, specially the chicken was nicely marinated and grilled..
And all this for a very reasonable price.
author: Harshal K.

description:
a friend and i found this place through yelp's top SF restaurants on a monday night, and decided to try it out. we had never been here, and we ended up walking past the place two or three times because the sign only says "mexican kitchen" with a big "T" (just a heads up). 
it was surprisingly packed for a monday night around 7:30, and we had to give our names for a table for 2 on the waitlist. the host said it would be around 30 minutes for our table, and suggested we grab a drink at the bar. we decided to walk around the shops on market just as the seating app texted us a mere 10 minutes after leaving the restaurant. the host showed us to a tiny table that was tucked away in a corner, and I (being high maintenance) asked to wait for another table. the host obliged with no problems and brought us to a roomier table, and we sat down. 
they dropped off THE BEST CHIPS AND SALSA I'VE EVER HAD within minutes of sitting down, and took our drink orders as well. the salsa had 3 choices: queso, green, and red. they were all delicious, and i'm not a fan of spicy. the chips were so thin, fresh, and LIGHTLY salted - my friend and i both agreed that they were the best tortilla chips we've ever had. they had a great selection of beer on tap and by can for $5. i'm vegetarian, and it's so hard to find pozole for some reason - but this place made the best pozole i've ever had. it's my friend's favorite food and he was impressed with it, as well as his own pollo verde dish. i got a side of plantanos which were amazing as well. everything was 100% delicious and came out ten times faster than we expected. the bill came out to $40 for two people, which was extremely cheap for the quality and quantity of food that we ordered. we both got drinks as well, and ended up taking half of it home with us. the tortillas were fresh and amazing too!
the service was amazing as well, extremely attentive and happy to help. the place was packed and everyone seemed pleased, with enough servers to go around. i even overheard the next table saying that they had found this place on yelp as well, and decided to try it out for the first time that night. i'd say tropisueno is doing pretty well!
author: Emma G.

description: I think its a nice place. Definitely not quiet. The food was good. i would come back again!
author: Eshan K.

description:
I've been neglecting my social life recently , a failing I attempted to partially remedy late last week by having dinner with two of my favorite ladies.  We fetched up at Tropisueno - a restaurant that has been taunting me for months with visions of good food in a close, great location.  

Perfect pick!  Not only did we stuff ourselves full of wonderful, simple and filling food, we also had one of those great waiters who always seem to appear as if by magic just when you need him.  He worked with the dietary restrictions we threw his way and was able to recommend great options for everyone.  It's a testament to the restaurant that their menu, which looks almost wholly carnivorous on first glance, proved to be so flexible to those who choose not to eat critters of any kind.  For those without that restriction, I highly recommend the chicken, which was juicy, a bit spicy and surrounded by the most delicious sautéed veggies and rice.

Tropisueno is truly a charming place and one that - me being so close and all - I plan to return to often.  Especially considering some of the rumored happy hour offerings...
author: Suzanne B.

description:
I've walked by this place plenty of times and never noticed it somehow, so I was a little shocked when it came up on Yelp and I realized where it was.  The reviews looked good though and it was easy to get to, so we decided to give it a try tonight.

The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, but it's extremely dark and the tables are very small.  Once all the food had come, it was like playing Twister trying to get to the desired dish.

Speaking of the food - I've never had an order at a fancy restaurant come so fast.  Less than five minutes after we ordered, our dinner was served.  I thought they had the wrong table at first, but no - they just made it really speedy-like.  I had a typical combination plate - a taco and a cheese enchilada.  Both were pretty good, but not amazing.    Miss Mary got Chile Verde, which was large bits of pulled pork spiced and was strangely absent of the color green.  She wasn't too fond of it.

We also ordered the guacamole - which was fairly small and a bit too strong on the lime.  Their chips and salsa however were fantastic - they served it with a basic salsa, and then tree small salsas, a verde, a creamy red sauce, and a very hot red sauce.  The chips were light, crispy and very flavorful.

Re: The margaritas.  I tried a Picante.  It came in a small martini glass, oddly enough, but made up for it in strength.

Our server came by frequently with water and was very cordial.  Price was pretty typical, coming out to around $60 for two, after appetizers and drinks.

Final opinion?

Gary: I'm in no rush to go back, but wouldn't mind trying it again someday.

Mary: I would go back, but order something else next time.
author: Gary a.

description:
This place is excellent and the portions are huge. My husband and I ordered the Molotes de Elote y Chorizo as an appetizer and split the Chile Verde for dinner. We couldn't even finish the Chile Verde because it was so much food! The atmosphere is cozy without feeling crowded.

The only thing that was slightly confusing is that we had three different servers that kept checking on us -- but that is being picky.

While this is a first visit review Tropisueño seems to be the perfect place for a group of friends or a casual dinner date. It seems to be very popular so I would suggest arriving early or making a reservation.
author: Brooke H.

description:
A Bunny, a Pirate, and a Lizard go into a Mexican joint...

...and eat and drink themselves silly!  The End.

Well, there is a little more.

The location is great - right next to the Contemporary Jewish Museum and Craft Museum, steps away from Yerba Buena and the Metreon.  I honestly thought there was no good place to eat around there, but Tropisueno proved me wrong.  By day it's a Taqueria, by night  it's a very nice rustic restaurant with Mexican home cooking, so you get the best of both worlds.

By all means, get a Margarita - I highly recommend the Santo, which is made with St. Germain.  

Getting the basics right is key.  The chips and salsas (2 soup-bowls full of red and green salsa) are delicious.  The rice is flavorful, neither too dry nor too moist - I usually leave it on the plate, and I ate it all up.  The beans - black beans and white beans - are almost a meal in themselves.

The Camerones Tropisueno are wonderful, with a plate-licking worthy creamy chile de arbol sauce.   

They had lots of options for our vegetarian friend, which was nice.  I tasted the Chile Relleno off of her plate and it was perfect - great taste, great texture.

Best of all, our server was the BEST.  He knew everything on the menu so well, making great recommendations and always had a big smile for us.  He totally made our night!

Here's the way to do it next time:  If you bring 5 friends with you to drink at the bar, you (the host) drink for free ALL NIGHT.  Now that evening would have one hell of a punchline.
author: Liz S.

description: Mediocre, overpriced food. Watered down drinks. Avoid. +1 star for friendly service staff.
author: Nick E.

description:
Food is delicious, and so are the margaritas!  :D  It's got good ambiance for a party or date (casual one) with reasonable prices.  My hubbie and I went there on an impromptu 'date night,' and we were pleasantly surprised.

He had the chile relleno and I had the chile verde.  Both were tasty - I especially liked the chile verde sauce...drool...  Also try their scallops - perfectly cooked with a nice meaty sauce at the bottom!

Will totally be back with friends for margaritas!
author: Fontane L.

description: This place is awesome.  Amazing food and good portion size!  I go there every other week at least.
author: Ken B.

description:
Orale - what a cute spot!

I'm a stickler for authentic Mexican food and I was really pleased with the tamales here. I don't think I've had a good tamal since .. 2001? Seriously! Rancho Bravo has them but they're really dry. Too bad this place is in SF and not Seattle. We need more great Mexican food here.

So ... yes, the food was awesome. I also had tacos de bistek and loved that they made their own tortillas. That's SO important! 

Anyone else a fan of agua de jamaica? (hibiscus tea?) THEY'VE GOT IT! If you haven't tried it - you've got to. 

Their lunch service is cafeteria style. Get in line, check the menu on the wall, order up, get a #, take a seat at a table, and done! The wait isn't always short but the food is worth it! For dinner the restaurant is back to table service and ordering from menus while seated.

Overall I was very impressed!

PS - in Spanish one "tamale" is called a tamal. I'm a nerd like that ... gotta say it all autentico n' shizz. ;)
author: Katy H.

description: This is my favorite lunch place close to work. i will even go so far as to eat here if I find myself downtown on the weekends. I have never been disappointed with my food. Burritos are a great choice. Warning they will leave you in a  blissful food coma for hours. Toquitos, Tortas, and Taco Salads are also really good. If you are looking for a place to go after work they have a really good happy hour menu as well. Some things to know, it gets packed around noon. They are very efficient but you will still wait because the food does warrant a line out the door. I suggest eating there either before or after the typical lunch rush. Happy hour is a mad house, so you'll probably stand but it's fun. Make reservations for dinner.
author: John D.

description:
I went here for lunch.  The ordering process was a bit confusing for a first timer.  But one of the servers was very helpful in telling me that I ordered at the counter/kitchen area, and then take my food and drink to my table, like a cafeteria almost.  

I had a chicken burrito.  And, let me tell you, it was enough to last me the whole day!  It was huuuuuge.  Very good, but just a lot to eat at lunch time.  I saw quite a few people leave with to-go bags.  I also ordered a lunch time margarita (I had the day off!) Whew!  It was strong, but tasty.  

Overall, great experience.  Just large lunch time portions that make you feel heavy the rest of the day.
author: Abby S.

description:
I've had dinner here a couple of times and I've always left pleased.  Tonight was no exception.

I shared one of each of their four items on the "Los Favoritos" entree for $14.95.  

Los Favoritos - Old-school combo plates with rice and beans:
Taco ~ Enchilada ~ Tamal ~ Chile relleno

I didn't have any of the carne asada taco but my date seemed to enjoy it.  The chicken enchilada was really good.  It had a little too much sauce in my opinion.  The cheese tamal was good, I've had better, but for cheese it was tasty.  The chili rellenos was my favorite.  It was great, especially if you like a kick.

Our server was incredibly nice too!  

Try it!
author: Sofia H.

description:
Fantastic dinner! One caveat, my uncle got the tab, so I can't speak to the value of the meal. As for the food it was amazing. I had the spiced mango margarita, which came in a tall glass with a chili powder/salt rim. Then to eat I had the huaraches "3 sandals". The sandals are crispy fried dough-like tortillas. The 3 different kinds of pork served on top are each deliciously tender. We also got a bowl of guac that I recommend, but it was a little small for 3 people so either savor it or maybe get two bowls. We also tried the deserve, a tres leches cake topped with whipped cream and strawberries. This cake was so deliciously moist that when i bit into it i was kind of surprised it could hold its shape so well on the plate.
The service was prompt and very friendly. Of course it helps to have a reservation, but I recommend this as a place to bring family or visitors that you want to impress with a delicious meal.
author: Nik K.

description:
Disclaimer, because these reviews consistently say how awesome the drinks are, and I had a Negra Modelo (always delicious, but all it takes is opposable thumbs to serve one properly).  So I am only reviewing food here.

My tamale and enchilada were both good, nothing mind blowing, but  decent.  Big downside:  not served with vegetables of any sort, definitely something I've come to expect from sit-down places in this city.  If this place were in the $ range instead of the $$ range, they'd probably have 4-5 stars in my book.  But if a restaurant is going to charge more than $10 an entree for Mexican, I like my food to blow my mind, or at least set off some sparks with a bit of smoke, and I always expect vegetables, even if I order the chicken.  Otherwise, I might as well be at one of the awesome taquerias in the Mission where the decor is a bit cheaper, but the food is just as good, for half the price (or less).  Plus, this place is just as noisy, so it's not like you're paying for ambience--you're paying for new floors and an artistic gathering of large sticks in a pot in the center of the room.

However, it is exceptionally convenient if you are going to see a movie at Metreon, and if you're going to see a movie at Metreon, you've probably already overpaid for the ticket, so you might as well just bite bullet and pay too much for decent, veggie-less Mexican food.
author: Sydney H.

description:
Margaitas - holy shit are amazing. Staff are accomondating! 
3 stars - Because we ordered empenadas, it was so bad I spat it out and return them.
author: Chris L.

description:
Fantastic margaritas!
We came up here and were seated promptly got good service and had tasty food. Whats not to like?
You get chips and salsa and we got the guac. It was a bit small for the price but it was tasty and our table of 4 polished it off rather quickly. the salsa sampler was good, i really liked the spicy red one and asked for more. To my surprise i got a large bowl of it and got to enjoy it on my tacos as well. 

the only negative is i (and the other 3 in my party) was pretty sure we were billed for 2 margaritas we didnt order. But after 18 of them between 4 people we didnt feel we had the right, or the math skills, to argue.

All in all, im totally going back.
author: Jeff H.

description: A greeter or host is supposed to be a friendly face to help guide you through the start of your experience. This was not the case here. The servers and food were amazing but the front of the house should take a cue from the service staff. We felt unwelcome and imposing on their evening of "hanging out" at the front instead of greeted and invited into their party. Unfortunately this leaves a bad impression on the entire experience.
author: C D.

description:
Best. Chips. Ever.

My friend Jamie, who knows nothing about how chips are cooked, speaks with conviction when he says the chips are cooked in "salted oil." However they are made, they embody the holy trinity of tortilla chip characteristics:  light, salty and crisp. It's tempting to not order food at all - just buy drinks and eat free chips. Who needs protein?

There is absolutely no need to order one of the expensive margaritas on the drink menu (which is extensive). The house margaritas are usually poured strong, and the peppered salt on the rim adds the perfect kick. The wait staff has a great eye for an empty drink, pouncing you as soon as your empty glass hits the table. It doesn't take long to get people speaking loud and, often, innappropriately.
author: Trey C.

description:
It's only been my first visit and I'm already a fan of Tropisueno!!! Love that it's super super close to my work and that the food is TASTY!!! 
Didn't realize this place was an order and then you sit down with a number while you wait for your food to be brought to you type of place, but not complaining. Service was alright. Prices were very reasonable around $7.00 for a burrito and that's including tax. 

I ordered a Regular Burrito with Grilled Chicken and the red salsa sauces; it tasted amazing, a little bit spicy (but I like it SPICY)!!! Possibly THE BEST Burrito I've ever had!!! Can't wait to come back and try some of the other dishes (everyone in my party was very impressed with the food and thoroughly enjoying themselves)!! To top it all off, the complimentary tortilla chips were so light and crispy and SOOooOOO addicting!!! Be prepared to have leftover's because none of us were able to finish our orders. 

Overall this place is "MUY BUENO" and won't put too much of a dent in your wallet. Be prepared to enjoy and rave about how great Tropisueno is!! :D
author: Doris L.

description: Meh. Their burritos are suspiciously luke warm for a place that supposedly makes fresh food to order. The line is outrageous and often times there's no place to sit during the lunch rush so it's a gamble ordering in and not having a place to stay. The quality of their food is good but nothing special at all and a little pricey! The highlight though is a good margarita and the enormous well stocked salsa bar. The ambiance is cool but look or touch too much and you'll find it's a bit dusty, greasy and poorly cleaned. With the uprise in food trucks there's always trucks on 2nd and Minna, Hawthorne and Off the Grid on 5th and Minna every Wednesday and Friday. At least you know the food is hot, fresh, truly made to order and you can sit anywhere!
author: Kristen R.

description:
Restuarant at night is better than the lunch time fare.

Probably the best mexican in soma, though that's a low bar.
author: Jack K.

description: I had a friend visiting from LA, and we wanted to continue drinking and have a good meal.  This place met our expectations.  Good drinks and we did not have a reservation, however, they were very accommodating.  We were able to continue drinking while we waiting for a table of three. The tacos were all fantastic and the pollo was great.
author: Rafael H.

description:
Tropisueno is one of SF's go-to Mexican restaurants. The atmosphere is "cool", the menu is diverse, and the execution is excellent. The margaritas are well made, and the prices are definitely reasonable. The complimentary chips and salsa are a nice touch as well. 

But if you're looking to come here during primetime on the weekend, know this: It's extremely loud and crowded. Don't expect a quiet, romantic meal with your significant other. Also, even with a reservation on a Saturday night, our party was forced to wait 25 minutes before sitting down to our table. With a line out the door that evening, our service was also rushed. My next visit will be for a late lunch, where hopefully the atmosphere is a bit more peaceful and I can still get my afternoon buzz on.  

With just a few changes here and there, Tropisueno could be a five-star dining gem. Nevertheless, it's still a "must try" if you're in SOMA.
author: Adam W.

description: Big round of applause for Remi & Rafael! If they r there tip well! Such great vibes all night!!! Amazing margaritas and appetizers!
author: Nick T.

description:
Delicioso! I've been a few times now and I am yet to be disappointed in any way. The convenient location (1 block from BART) downtown is very inexpensive and has a fantastic aesthetic that I've enjoyed over work lunches and spicy dates alike. The staff are always pleasant and the salsa bar is to up there with the best.

Definitely worth checking out!
author: alex w.

description:
A great chef once said: "Happiness is not a right, it is an achievement."

Troposueno is the closest thing to a guarantee of your happiness.  This is delicious mexican food.  Whether you decide to 'OD' on the scrumptious fresh chips and salsa, or leave room for the outstanding carne asada or chicken mole...I promise you will mark this experience as the BEST mexican food in the bay area.  Furthermore, I applaud the bartenders for producing magnificent margaritas, with the right mix of freshly squeezed fruit and a lip of custom-made salts, purposed for each drink.

Trust me, you will leave this establishment yelling the blissful words, "God bless God".  I did it.  And, I don't even believe in God.  That is how good this place tasted.   For a moment, I was converted.
author: jeremy k.

description: Wonderful place to relax with friends and enjoy Mexican food. They have very relaxed outdoor seating. So much did to choose from and it's all good.
author: Norbert S.

description: Good sauces and burrito. Decent tacos
author: James V.

description:
The ambience was ideal - low lighting, very cool ceiling to look at, authentic decor, noise level was comfortable for talking, tables were well spaced, and nothing bland about the appearance. 

They give you several fresh salsas to enjoy with their ultra thin, crispy and warm tortilla chips. Their margaritas are made with natural agave nectar and taste clean and fresh. Service was pleasant and attentive and we were seated within a few minutes of walking in without a reservation on a Thursday at 9pm, despite the restaurant still being rather full. I'll be back soon!
author: Heather M.

description:
WOW. WOW. WOW!!!

It was a bit hard to find because I didn't know that it was kind of "in between" buildings. A few of my friends had trouble finding the place and it didn't seem to be clear on the GPS. Eventually, everyone found their way. 

The service was pretty great. Came in with a group of 13 people (made reservations 2 days before) and we were allowed to be seated right away. Unlimited chips and salsa on the tables = AWESOME! The chips were light (not like Chipotle's) and very delicious; not oily and salty. They had pretty good drinks from what I gathered from my friends. They brought out a bday drink, what I assumed to be a margarita, for my bf. 

Everyone had a great choice of entrees. I had the Chicken with Mole Poblano which was absolutely delectable! I received TWO HUGE pieces of chicken thigh and breast (didn't even finish) and the sauce was very good. Not too thick and it had a hint of sweetness. I tried my bf's Chile Verde, which was pretty good and also got a piece of the Tampiqueno (forgot if this is the right one). The meat for that one was really tender and delicious. 

They had a Yelp! special offer: for every entree ordered, a free tres leches dessert was given. OMG! VERY VERY GOOD! The servers and bartenders came and sang to my bf and brought out his dessert and then served everyone else. 

This place... SOO GOOD! I wish I didn't forget to order drinks though, but my friends told me their drinks were pretty good (strong and right to the point).
author: Faye F.

description: I was in town this past weekend, first time in San Fran and wanted to check out this place since it was given good reviews. First of all, a few days prior my sister and I walked in and since there was no sign of "Please wait to be seated," we walked right  to a table only to be escorted back by some worker and they pointed at the banner which is the menu and said, you order there. Alrighty  I thought to myself, kinda rude there. We left because we just missed the breakfast menu. Well a day later we went back and got in line and ordered. I really wanted authentic Mexican food and thought maybe a torta de asada would do the charm. The meat on the torta wasn't even asada, more like beef stew in some sauce, not the carne asada I expected. My sister ordered a burrito de carne asada and same thing with the meat, the rice in the burrito seems liked they scrapped the last of what on the pot because her burrito had burnt pieces of rice. The guacamole and chips were ok, the only thing I really enjoyed was my Jamaica drink. Then as we sat and picked through our "asada meat" some young lady comes and greets us and places a laminated card on our table. Turns out its a thanks for visiting us  card but get the fuck out by 5:45pm because there are dinner reservations. Um...ok..beyond annoyed at this point. How does a walk in  restaurant (if you want to call it that) where you stand in line to order your food and sit down have reservations?? I mean its like a dam taqueria only a little different because of the seating even then at a taqueria you have a server. And nevermind the owner of the place trying to hook up with the Asian chic at the bar "bring me back a bottle and I'll repay you in some way." Super annoyed to hear conversations like that, how about greet your customers?!?! To add the icing on the cake, as I walked into the "Ladies washroom," the bartender was coming out. Just weird. Food is nasty and over priced. If you like food similar to Taco Bell, then this is your place, its just over priced. If you want real authentic Mexican food, find another place. You are better off going to the Westfield Shopping Center's food court. Larger selections and probably tastes much better.
author: Nisie N.

description:
Went here for a Black Friday dinner.  Had to wait about half an hour to grab a seat (it's a smalllll place), but once we did, boy were we glad we waited.  The place is super cute and they did cram us at a table that was slightly small for three, but it was better than waiting another half hour for a table.  

The chips and salsa were great (they served four varieties of salsa) and the margaritas came quick.   The food was delicious - best I've had since leaving Mexico about seven years ago.  Really friendly wait staff, delicious chile rellenos, and wasn't that expensive, at all.  Can't wait to go back, but I think I'd recommend getting a reservation, if you plan on visiting.
author: Adam T.

description: I've been twice now.  The lunch was much better than the dinner due to the various options from which one can choose.  The dinner is a fixed menu so i ordered items which i wish i would have seen before ordering.  Surprisingly, even for dinner on a Wednesday night at 730p, reservations would have helped as we waited for 30 minutes.
author: PeteRock X.

description:
The best things about this place has to be the House Margaritas and bottomless, home made chips and salsa. I think the chips here are genuinely the best I've ever had! The Ahi salt on the  FIVE DOLLAR margaritas really bring out the flavors in the drink. I am definitely a fan of those!!

So then why only 3 stars?

---Truth be told, the Ceviche de pescado was not very fresh and had a strong day-old fishy stench going on.
---The fried plantains were slightly cold and the grease was starting to pool.
---Their only redemption came in the form of their steak and fish tacos. They were nicely flavored, not too dry and cooked just right.

-Overall, this place is great for drinks and happy hour appetizers only. 
Downside to this is their happy hour area in the restaurant, is small and always congested. 
- if you're thinking about getting a table, just remember that you waive all your rights to the pocket friendly happy hour rates on drinks and food.
author: Monlia W.

description: We stumbled across this place while wanting Mexican cuisine...wow, what a surprise! This place is awesome!  We were there during happy hour (before 6:30pm). Dishes were $2, $3 & $5!!! My husband and I tried everything from the nachos, tacos, quesadillas and tostadas!! Everything was beyond expectation and genuine Mexican cuisine! The house margarita was perfect!  After all the food and drinks, our bill was still only $23!!! Definitely will go again! (during happy hour)
author: Bendice G.

description:
The chips and salsa started things off on the right note.  There were something like four difference salsas, which was extra cool.  The chips are really greasy.  My entree was the chicken mole.  It was good, not great.  Prices are decent.  I'm a fan of the milk jug water pitchers.

Tables are a little close together, and when it's busy, it can be hard to hear.  I thought it was a little too far on the dark side as well.  That might have added to the atmosphere if it wasn't so dim.
author: M C.

description:
After really loving my meal and experience at this restaurant the first time, I went back on New Years Eve with my husband, his brother and his girlfriend. Unfortunately, my first experience didn't repeat itself. 

We started off with the flautas and the plantains, both of which were outstanding. Guacamole had pieces of onion almost as big as my fingers, which I was not a fan of. 

The meals??? Eeeh... It was OK, maybe less than OK for me. The Mahi Mahi was way too lemony, the beef too chewy, the meatball soup was too salty for my taste and the chicken was the only thing that tasted pretty good. 

As far as the service goes, even here the first experience was lot better than this second one. The waitress was aloof and didn't pay attention to what was happening at the table, taking away plates way too soon and other rookie mistakes. 

I don't think I will be going back. When I crave Mexican, I want good Mexican food. I don't want a hit or miss experience and I learned that this is a hit or miss spot. For me at least, that is.
author: Jana C.

description: Sometimes its so crowded you cant get in the door.  That's my biggest complaint.  Otherwise the enchildas and margaritas are really good and the exotic cocktails can be really tasty.  if you go during the day its more like a taco stand so be warned.
author: M C.

description: What a disappointment :(. We haven't been able to find what we consider traditional Mexican food in a sit down restaurant setting with a server and full bar since we moved to SF last year. We were SO hoping that Tropisueno would fulfill our "need." It absolutely did not. When we arrived, we sat down at the bar for a margarita while waiting for our table. There were at least two false alarms that our table was ready. Annoying. Once we were actually seated, we got our menus and that's where the confusion began. How do you not have quesadillas or burritos on your dinner menu?! Ok, maybe you want to be on the gourmet side so you have "fancier" options for dinner but when your website lists all the burritos, quesadillas, tacos, and enchilladas you desire, and then none of them are on the dinner menu, that is odd. I figured I would ask for some quesadillas any way...after all other items on the menu included tortillas, cheese, shredded chicken, rice, and beans they had the ingredients...Well we were brought some chips and salsa and they were fine. Nothing fancy nothing bad just chips and salsa. Well, after dreaming about all the burritos, and quesadillas that were on the menu I was perusing from home earlier in the day, I did not feel like ordering one of their not so traditional entree items. When the server arrived I showed him the menu items listed online and asked him if we could have some of those. His response was, "those are only for lunch." Well fine, my mistake for looking at the menu from my iPhone and not a desktop computer because the option to select lunch and dinner menus was not obvious, but seriously?! How can you tell a customer that you cannot make a quesadilla or burrito when you are already using all of those ingredients to create other dishes?! It's not like I was asking for fried chicken with a soy sauce and balsamic glaze or something crazy. Mind-boggling. Anyway, we both ended up ordering combo plates...mine with a grilled chicken taco and shredded chicken enchilada and my husband the chile relleno and a vegetarian enchilada. We agreed that our meals tasted like they came out of the freezer. Like TV dinners. That was the first time I had ever eaten an enchilada without melted cheese on top...the taco was a small soft tortilla folded in half with a few pitiful pieces of grilled chicken and a few shreds of cheese. My tacos are 10 times better. You might be thinking, "how can your husband judge the food off of vegetarian or bad choices to begin with, but I will tell you, coming from Louisiana with THE BEST vegetarian and non-vegetarian Mexican food in the country, I thought in a place like SF where vegetarian options are EVERYWHERE, that they would find a way to add flavor to a vegetarian entree...sadly they did not. We will not be returning to Tropisueno and the search for a sit-down Mexican Restaurant with a full bar and full service will continue...
author: Kelsey K.

description: HH here is solid.  Love the margaritas.  I'm also a big fan of the chips and guac.  Gotta try the dinner here sometime.
author: Brian A.

description: The food here is delicious AND their service is great.  I made a reservation (which I highly recommend) and was seated right on time even though my friend hadn't arrived.  I was starting to feel guilty when 20 minutes later I was still sitting alone (she was fighting traffic on the bridge), but when I apologized to my server, he just told me there was nothing to worry about.  Kudos to a restaurant that doesn't rush their customers!
author: Katherine S. M.

description:
Tropisueño is a great lunch spot when you're in the mood for some good mexican. 

Ordering is nice and no hassle (especially during lunchtime) - get into line, say what you want, go take a seat (like Chipotle, but nicer). The service is pretty good good - they bring your order out to you quickly and ask how everything is, but that's about it - it's really not a sit-down-and-be-served type of place, though. 

The food is good, not great, and reasonably priced. I ordered a salad, which was delicious, and thoroughly enjoyed the guacamole and chips. 

Based on reviews, sounds like I'll have to go back for drinks next time.
author: Cristina P.

description: Best mole I have ever had! Just the right balance of sweet and spicy. Excellent chips and love the 3 salsas they brought out. Service was excellent. Have to say the margaritas we had were pretty average.
author: Ernie C.

description:
Lunch and dinner are very different.   The best thing about this place, both during lunch and dinner, is the chips and salsa. I will evaluate each part of this place separately. 

Chips and salsa - 4 stars (maybe 4.5 if I could give half stars). They have a great variety of salsas with varying flavors and degrees of spice. The chips are a little greasy, but that's what makes them good! I love the lunch salsa bar with the peppers, onions, cilantro, etc. - yum! 

Food - 3 stars.  The tacos al carbon appetizer with the pineapple salsa, those get 4 stars, but the rest of the meal was just ok. Not bad, but didn't blow me away either. 

Service- 2 stars.  It took forever to get our food for dinner.  For lunch it also takes a while to get your food.  

Margarita - 1 star - way way overpriced for the size- $8 for like 4 sips, and a weird bitter taste.   

Overall -  3 stars.  Tropisueno fills a craving for good chips and salsa, but other than that, it's overpriced for what it is.
author: Lauren F.

description:
