Every time I come in here I want to eat until I explode.  A few times I have almost succeeded.  Their Chile Verde is super legit and, in all honesty, I'd ask for Tropisueno's carne asada were I ever on death row and needed to order my last meal.  

And can we talk about the Violetta for a minute?  Violet liqueur margarita on the rocks.  It's rimmed with vanilla salt!  Both your inner drunk and your inner fat kid will get on their knees and worship you for ordering one.

The service is always really nice.  Sometimes a bit slow with bringing the non-alcoholic drinks (like iced tea) and sometimes a bit slow to bring the check when you ask for it, but never ever without a smile.  In any case, I can't hate on anyone who brings me refried beans.

Great dinner spot!
author: Boots B.

description: Try not to get full off the chips because those chips are goooooooooood.  But yeah, the mexican food is legit and the service is great.  i think I went during happy hour so it was pretty crowded but the patrons were cool.
author: Don A.

description:
Yummy in my tummy goodness, definitely one of the best Mexican places I've had.

Chips and salsa. Hands down best chips and salsa I've ever had.

Guacamole and other salsas. The red one was super spicy but yums. The orange one tasted kind of like squash or pumpkin but it was also good.

Me and my friend decided to split and entree and two appetizers.

Molotes de Elote y Chorizo (Corn masa "cigars" filled with Mexican chorizo, fresh corn and cotija cheese. Black bean sauce and crema). It was pretty good I've never had anything like it before but I liked it a lot.

Platanos Fritos (Fried sweet plantains served with seasoned black beans and Mexican crema). I never had plantains before and I found out I really like them because it tastes like bananas but more tangy and since I like slightly green bananas I like it better. Although I must admit I didn't know they were so burnt since the restaurant was so dark until I saw this picture. 

Tampiqueño (Niman Ranch beef, thin-cut carne asada, and served with a beef barbacoa enchilada). Yummy deliciousness. I really liked the carne asada the beef was tender and its taste was similar to beef jerky but more moist and less tough. The enchilada was also really good. It also came with tortillas and beans. 

This restaurant was really good but I wish they had a brighter atmosphere. I mean I know it's a bar also but it was so dark in there I could barely see what I was eating.
author: Constance C.

description:
New discovery!!

During the daytime, Tropisueno is actually a little taqueria! They don't have the full dinner menu available, and it's run kind of taco truck style. They have burritos and tacos, and their tortas are incredible. Definitely a good lunch spot, too! (although dinner there is still my favorite)
author: Lauren F.

description: Fun place, really good prices for the quality of food and portion they give you! One negative was that the restaurant is extremely hot and not well ventilated. but other than that, I always pick this place for dinner parties/ gatherings !
author: Katherine C.

description: Call ahead to get on the waiting list or make a reservation! Enjoyed the food. Great service. One critique: they need to revisit their enchilada sauce. Mine is better...I'm just saying. Oh, beware of SF Healthy tax...LMBO. It's in small print in all menus throughout SF.
author: Redd K.

description: Terrific margaritas! The corn ships are fantastic too. Also a big fan of the pulled pork Chile Verde. Great buzz too.
author: Dean P.

description:
A nice place to eat before watching a movie at the Metreon.  It's cozy and dimly lit at night, making for a great date spot or a place to go with close friends.

The chips are incredibly addicting.  They're unusually thin, fried to crispy perfection and have just enough surface area for adequate scooping and dunking in the array of salsas.  Be careful though, a few of the salsas are tongue-searingly spicy.

My favorite appetizer is the scallops with chorizo-plantain hash.  Quick disclaimer: I don't like scallops.  At all.  One time when I was 8 years old, my uncle fried up a mountain of scallops, and my ridiculous self decided to shove as many as possible down my throat.  Ever since then, I've avoided scallops like an STD.  With that said, you now understand just how good Tropisueno's scallops are.

My favorite entree is the Chile Verde.  The dish consists of tender, falling-off-the-bone pork drenched in mouth-watering, tangy chile verde over perfectly seasoned Mexican rice.  It's as good as it sounds.  

The Chicken Mole was quite disappointing, especially since the majority of Yelpers recommend getting this dish.  The steak Tampiqueno was mediocre at best, with overly-tough (we ordered medium-rare) and underseasoned meat.
author: Jen Y.

description: This place is pretty amazing, being more authentic-style than your usual taqueria north of the mission, with really good prices and an awesome salsa bar.  The line moves fast
author: Mike L.

description: Not really sure how I feel about this place. The chips and salsa were good. My fiancee and I ordered the Carne Asada and it lacked any flavor. Just was very bland which was disappointing. The refried beans though were delish and not greasy like most. Will give it another shot and this time order one of these famous margs everyone is taking about. Stay tuned!!
author: Bri R.

description:
This is only a review for the lunch.

I ordered the carne asada super burrito. To my surprise, it was quite large. I also enjoyed the free chips and salsa. The dining area is quite nice and it's a comfortable place to eat a burrito during lunch break. 

My main gripe with this place is the prices. I think it was $11-12 for a burrito and a soda. A little too high for the type of food they're selling. For now, I'll give 3 stars. I want to come back for happy hour for an update to this review.
author: Jeff C.

description: I used to live in the mission so I'm giving this 2 stars for the food and 3 for the salsa.
author: Bee D.

description:
During lunch it's a bit confusing on how things work - it's cafeteria style and a lot of people get upset by it. Had a lady sitting by me bitch endlessly about how terrible the service was because she was too lazy to get up and get some silverware for herself. It was our first time there and it was easy for us realize how lunch service was without bitching about it to the staff. Just take in your surroundings and read signs.

During dinner time it is server style in a sit down low lit atmospheric setting. I have to say, it's much too crowded and loud for me; But that just means that the food must be really good and it is.

The price is right. The food is fresh and delicious. The staff is decently nice.
author: Sara M.

description: My most recent visit to Tropisueno sadly was unpleasant. I met a colleague there for lunch... it was during the RSA Conference so the city was packed. We met at Tropisueno at 11:30am to beat the rush. We sat in a booth that is tucked away a little and were over half way through our meal when the place started to fill up a bit. One of the guys who worked there walked over to our table and placed a sign on it that read "This Booth is Reserved for 4 or more people." He set it down, without saying a word, while we were eating (the two of us), and walked away. And my colleague speaks Spanish... so it was not a language issue. It was kind of rude and unprofessional. We would have moved tables if he asked, no problem!
author: Wendy R.

description: Tried to make reservations but they were booked, decided to go anyway & walkin.  We were told the wait would be 40 min. or so, got in in about 15 min. Quickly served drinks, salsa, & chips. Three different salsas.  Everyone's dinner was delicious. Drinks were fantastic. Highly recommend.
author: Theresa N.

description: So far every kind of food has been delicious, but it is not the meal that I return for.  Their salsa bar is incredible.  In particular the orange salsa is so good, I will douse anything I get with it.  Also if you ask the counter they will sell you the salsa by the half pint or pint.  Go on lunch for better prices.
author: Jake S.

description:
Best cheese quesadilla I have ever had! 

I work right around the corner from this place, and after making this little discovery I have loved going back!

Last night, we went for happy hour right after work. We grabbed seats at the table in the middle in the bar area, luckily! It's usually pretty tough to get any seats and basically, if you don't, you are shit out of luck. 

We had 4 people with us and we were excited because we found 4 seats, however the girl next to us who was with the most obnoxious group of people I have ever witnessed was "reserving" that seat. Um, sorry, but you cant reserve seats during happy hour, that just doesn't work. 

Anyway, when we sat down, the server came up right away and took our food order and drinks. We all ordered the modelo and when our server came back she told us they were all out..bummer. We got another beer instead. 

The quesadilla made up for everything, it was so good! Will definitly keep coming back but just an FYI out there...don't try and reserve seats during happy hour.
author: Jenna M.

description: Not sure what all the excitement is about. The margaritas, chips, salsa, and guacamole are all good but our entrees were nothing special. I had a chicken taco and cheese tamale. Taco was better than tamale. My husband said the chicken mole was average.  We had an 8:00 reservation and were seated right away. Our table was in the middle of the restaurant. It was very loud and the tables are extremely close together making it very hard to get in and out of your seat.
author: Mary W.

description: Food is great here. There is always a crowd. But the front service need some improvement in their customer service. They are a bit snobby and do not provide adequate information to waiting guests. All the other staffs are welcoming and great.
author: Kat K.

description: Nice restaurant in the heart of downtown SF. It's great to escape the craziness of Market Street if you're shopping at Westfield or going to the movies at the Metreon. Love the feel of the decor and the private booths in the back. Our server and his team were very attentive and pleasant. The chips and salsa never stopped flowing. It's the not the best Mexican food I've had in SF, but it's still very good. I had the enchiladas, and I loved that you could pick from the three sauces they had for the chips to put on the enchiladas. Would definitely go here again and would want to try the cocktails next time!
author: Amanda R.

description: Only had the food. Chips are hot and home made! Good salsa bar options (you help yourself), chicken burrito was nice and big. Lines for lunch can get long but move relatively fast.
author: Milena S.

description: 3.5 stars. Good ambience. Connected to the Marriott Marquis. Had the "pork in green sauce" which was average. I'm from Texas so I have a high standard for Mexican cuisine. The corn tortillas did not seem fresh. The pork was unseasoned.
author: RC D.

description: Excellent Mexican food. Strangely, super fast attentive service, even on a busy Thursday night. "Watermelon" margaritas were a bit of a letdown though. Tasted more like water than anything else.
author: Zach M.

description:
What a welcome addition to the downtown restaurant scene.
Tropisueno combines inventive mexican food without sacrificing any of your old favorites.  The service is friendly and prompt.  The atmosphere is tasteful and comfortably lit.  So often you have to give up ambiance to get a decent Mexican meal...not any more!
The only thing keeping me from giving this place 5 stars are the hard wooden chairs w/out cushions and the small margaritas.
author: Michael A.

description: Good food, great salsa and I have a cucumber margarita that was delish!
author: Rosie S.

description: Some of the best chile relleno I've ever had.  I'm not a big chips person--but I could eat a wheelbarrow of theirs.  I almost died of thirst taking midget sips of my precious only diet coke--no refills here.
author: Ralph B.

description: My coworkers swear by this place. Being Hispanic I've been there done that. Kept it real simple and ordered a Torta Chorizo.  I normally get a chorizo breakfast burrito at most places but it was already lunch so I settled with the Torta. Scale of 1-10 on the Chorizo I'd give it it a 3 or 4. So oily that the oil seeped through the bread and by the time it was given to me half of the bottom of my Torta was all grease.  Almost like they only had the bottom of the pan left and throw it in my sandwich. I could have mistaken it for a sloppy joe. The highlight of my lunch was their sauce options; they had one that reminded me of La Vic's sauce from San Jose that went really good with my Tortilla Chips. I'll make sure to update this the next time I go back with my co-workers cause I'm sure I'll be back.  Oh and they should probably have another Plasma by the tables. This is an addition to te one by the bar. It's SF and when the Giants are playing, sitting by the bar with  2 - 3 people is ok but not when your with a group of people trying to sit and eat your food.
author: JJ S.

description:
The staff is very nice, and the food is ready in a reasonably quick time, even during the later part of lunch hour.  The prices are some of the best in downtown SF.  

But you do get what you pay for.  I ordered a chicken quesadilla with the 'super' option, which is sour cream and guacamole.  I was so disappointed that the sour cream turned out to be a bunch of squiggles squirted on the surface of the top two pieces of quesadilla (there were four total) instead of a big scoop.  The guacamole was not as fresh as I'd hoped, and neither was the salsa.  

I suppose I'd go back if I'm short on cash, but I'm thinking a taco truck is a better deal.
author: Kelly B.

description: Great spot for lunch (love their line up) and also good for dinner although the menus are a little different. Their salsas are to DIE for, love that place. I enjoy getting enchiladas or the fajitas, their grilled veggies are great. Excellent choice for all tastes :)
author: Kelly T.

description:
Stopped in for lunch today and was very pleasantly surprised!  This lively little place is super cute, and it's super easy to order your food, find a table and enjoy your meal!  
The food was good, the chips and salsa are amazing.  The chips are very addicting!  The staff was very friendly and to note, I was not able to get chips when I ordered my food because they were out of the bowls to put them in at that moment, and when my food came I asked the staff member if he could bring me some and he said sure!  Brought me a bowl of chips right away!  
This place is a nice walk from where my building is, and right across the street from Yerba Buena park.  I will definately be back!  The walk, food, and ambiance are all worth it!
author: Shannon S.

description: I went here for lunch and had the chicken milanesa torta.  I give that 5 stars alone!  For the price, you get a lot and it is so fresh.  When I got my order, it was so hot, I had to wait a few minutes before I could take a bite.  The chicken was super crispy and juicy and the bread was toasted perfectly.  I tried to finish it, but that was a bad idea... should have just saved half and had the rest for dinner.  I also got a house margarita but wasn't that impressed - next time I'll get straight tequila.  I would definitely go back for lunch and would like to go for dinner.
author: Michelle H.

description: Had the pork chop, which was delicious. The margarita's are extra smooth since they use silver tequila.
author: Ted S.

description:
I wish I could say more about Tropisueno, but the margaritas were so wonderful and delicious that by the time my food arrived my judgement was a bit impaired.  I do remember that the chips were great, but the salsas were a bit bland.  We mentioned the blandness to our waitress, she brought us habinero salsa that was *not* bland.  In fact, the waitstaff were particularly helpful, friendly and attentive, but not in the annoying way.  

I thought the food was fantastic.  But I can't honestly say whether it was because the food was good, or because I had already consumed too many margaritas.  My husband and our friends seemed to also enjoy the food, and I get the impression they weren't as effected by the margaritas.  

Oh, and there is a special vegetarian menu.  It isn't huge / extensive - but if you are vegetarian you should ask for it.
author: Meghan S.

description: Inexpensive and great !!! Love it thanks yelp.
author: Danny G.

description: Pedestrian Mexican food. Oversweet mixed drinks. And to top it off, two in our party got food poisoning. Terrble experience.
author: Eva Z.

description: This place is fantastic.  Finding great food and drinks in SF is never difficult - but finding them at this price point is incredible.  The food, service, and drinks are great.  With respect to this restaurant you can trust the 4 star plus average over 2,000 reviews.  It's very good.
author: Robert F.

description:
Nom nom nom... I love heading here for bar bites and the Tropisueno margarita--St. Germain instead of orange liqueur.  Delish.

Guac is particularly good, with big chunks of red onion, and the chips are clearly homemade.  I've been for a dinner for two, for drinks for 20, and for gatherings of many sizes in between.  They always seem to manage to fit us in somewhere.

Incidentally, if you're hosting a large-ish party for drinks, your margaritas are free!  See their website for details.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
I had 2 tacos with carne asada for lunch and it was delicious.  The corn tortilla was small but the fixins were a plenty.  Packed with tender meat and fresh pico de gallo, not the kind that's all squishy and been sitting out for a while.  My friend ordered 1 super taco and since it comes with 2 tortillas, she turned it into 2 super tacos... what a steal!

Service was great and unexpected.  This is a fast-food taqueria but the waiter still came by to ask if we needed refills on our chips and water.  And then came back to take our plates and clean the table!

Would definitely recommend this for a laid-back, low-key, good Mexican eatery.
author: Anh D.

description: Hands down best Mexican food ever! The food and portions always amazing, the prices are affordable. I love the environment, it looks like a little cantina!! The happy hour is super fun as well!!
author: Rick A.

description:
Update to my previous review.  I've become a Tropisueno regular since I can't get enough.  For food, I highly recommend the Tampiqueno -- the beef is juicy, thin, and perfectly spiced.  The Chicken Mole is rich and tender.  For a classic meal, try the Los Favoritos.  Not only is everything delicious, but the three-item is a bargain (I've not yet attempted the four-item).

Also, must note that if you like drinks, you MUST come to Tropisueno.  Their bartender, Manny, is one of my top 3 bartenders in San Francisco.  He does things with tequilla that I never even dreamed of.  The house margaritas are unbelievable (with real agave nectar to sweeten), however, I highly recommend trying one of his speciality drinks.  If you're a real connoisseur of alcoholic beverages, try something that's not on the menu: he's always experimenting and loves input from his customers.

If you go to no other Mexican restaurant in SF, please go here!
author: Mark J.

description: Saw this restaurant profiled on KQED's "Check Please", so we decided to eat here for lunch.  We ordered nachos and a 3 item plate.  On the 3 item plate we had, a cheese enchilada, carne asada enchilada and carne asada taco.  Well, the carne asada had NO flavor whatsoever.  Also, the meat was a little chewy.  The whole beans were good.  The rice was so-so.  The nachos were so-so.  Finally, they do not have coffee or tea.  Yes, there are some of us who like coffee and/or tea with Mexican food.  I feel this place is basically for tourists and the convention crowd from Moscone Center.
author: Victoria M.

description:
How often do you find a place where you order guacamole and as you're walking to the table, it follows right behind you. The set up is a lot of fun and quirky, walk in to look at a wall with a huge menu, order, pay then sit down and wait around for all of 2 minutes before your food is served. 

The food is pretty tasty and the variety is large. I ordered a couple of fish tacos and could have called it a day. They were seasoned nicely and had a gorgeous tomatillo salsa to top each off. My foodie partner in crime ordered some kind of chicken sandwich concoction that was a whole lot of messy but looked yummy. Of course I munched on the guac with its big chunks of avocado and tomatoes which could have been a meal of its own. Definitely a nice spot to stop by for lunch or for happy hour drinks. Next time it is in line to try some tequila.
author: Morgan M.

description: I know Mexican food and this place is totally underrated.
author: Halfdan H.

description:
We recently celebrated my friend's birthday there and were treated very well by the wait staff. They even lit a candle on a cake we brought in and sang my friend the "Mañanitas" song. They kept the delicious house margaritas flowing, our glasses were never empty.

I've eaten there a handful of times and the food is always good. I wish they would provide a little side of lettuce and tomatoes on their platos the way some Mexican restaurants do. I've always gone for dinner so I'm not sure what it's like at lunch time. They always keep the chip bowl full and provide plenty of scrumptious salsas.

The place can get quite packed at night but the wait is short and the service is always seamless. Our party of six got seated in a cute little alcove with a booth and curtains. The place has a lot of charm and is tastefully decorated.
author: L. L.

description:
trop! oh i do love trop. 

they have the best salsa selection. must try the orange one!!!

the cucumber margarita is good, and just and overall great mexican joint.
author: Jess O.

description:
This one was borderline -- call it 3.5 stars.  In general, pretty good,  Nice drinks, good food, good service.  I saw some of the reviews saying that the Mission is better -- I would probably agree.  But, in this part of town, it is one of the better choices -- especially if you are going to catch a movie or a show and are craving some mexican food.  

Btw -- some of the appetizers are amazing.  The scallops and the plantains were both good.  Also, I personally liked the green salsa.  It had a bit of a tangy taste.
author: R M.

description: Who knew that there was a cute little Mexican restaurant across the street from the Metreon? I definitely did not! My cousin knew what was up and took us over here to get two tacos and horchata. Super yummy! Especially the Barbacoa tacos! They also have a super tasty salsa bar and all of the servers were friendly. This is a cute place to go to grab a bite, would be nice for happy hour, and seems cute for dinner! I'll definitely be return!
author: Sonya D.

description:
I think that my problem with this place is the same as what I feel for Chilango-- too clean. I think I just like my Mexican food dirty-- dirty as in El Farolito, or Taqueria Cancun. Dirty and greasy and bad for you. Tropisueno just felt a little too healthy for my taste. 

Tropisueno has catered an office event for my work, I've been there a few times for lunch, and I was there for Cinco de Mayo this year. The food for the catered event and Cinco de Mayo were actually quite excellent. I especially enjoyed the house-made chips, which were oily and delicious. I also really enjoyed the salsa and guacamole at that time, though they were not memorable. 

It's in their lunch menu where I really feel they are lacking, though I haven't quite been able to put my finger on why. Perhaps it is the prices? I feel that it is a tad expensive for Mexican food. I got the salad once, and that was served in a tostada. I didn't like it too much... I didn't hate it, but maybe it was poor choice on my part considering I do not like healthy Mexican food. I got a super burrito another time and it was huge. It was pretty good, but not memorable. I don't think I loved the salsa at the salsa bar either.

The place is always really busy for lunch, so I advise against going with a big group for lunch. 

I did really enjoy Cinco de Mayo at Tropisueno though. It was packed, as were almost all Mexican places in the city I'm sure. They cordoned off an area in the front. You had to push through the crowd to get inside to the bar to get drinks. There wasn't an outdoor bar option to my knowledge (perhaps it was temporarily down?).  The wait was long, but kudos to the bartenders who I'm sure were working under so much pressure. I'd probably been waiting about 15 minutes when this chick in a low-cut tank top squeezes next to me at the bar while we're waiting, plops her boobs on the bar and tries to get the attention of the bartender. After about another 15 minutes of waiting, the bartender ignored her and took my order.  I heard her scoff to her friends and said that she'd gotten there first. Um, no you didn't! Anyhow, I appreciate how the bartender did not fall for her slutty antics and made sure we tipped him well. They had a taco bar for the food, and that was actually very good. 

I'm not likely to return for lunch (though I may give it another shot and see if the tacos on the regular menu are up to par). I think I will return for Cinco de Mayo, unless I hear of something better. But I will highly recommend that if you need to have some event catered, look into these guys.
author: Jia min C.

description:
I will make my update review as boring as the food at Tropisueno.

Had a $9.95 shrimp burrito today, it was still just meh (over a year since I have visited) - I think the salsa was responsible for 90% of the flavor.

Apparently they are having issues distinguishing between "to go" and "for here" as both Val A. and myself ordered our orders separately, "to go", and both came out separately, "for here".   Ill add a star because I still feel bad about my 2 star slamming from last year, but yeah, still not a fan.
author: Todd F.

description:
When I used to work at Yelp, everyone called this place the Yelp Cafeteria since so many of us frequented them and for good reason! The Trop has great friendly service and a cozy atmosphere. Fresh ingredients and fast service.

LUNCH~~~ 
Their lunch menu is super yummy and has great portions. You can grab a number and eat your food there at the tables or take it to go. Get ready for a line that goes out their front door! I love their carne asada super burritos. A good friend Mari A. used to say that she just finished a burrito the size of a newborn baby. HAHA!! Their carne asada quessadillas are super NOM too!! :D 

DINNER~~~ 
Their dinner service is different from their lunch service. They're a sit down restaurant for dinner with fabulous smiling servers that come to you. Their scallops with bacon bits...*drool* Their entrees are all really good too. Their margaritas are STRONG. If you enjoy strong drinks~ you'll love them here.  Margaux N. always turns bright red after having them. So cute!!

My bf and I love this place! I can truly say I miss not being a 5 minute walk from them anymore. They take reservations through OpenTable and I do recommend getting them since they're busy every day of the week! Enjoy!!
author: Rie P.

description: I was underwhelmed by the entree - the veggie enchilada plate... as was my friend who went (ordered something with meat).  However, the drinks were delicious!  As were the chips and salsas.  I don't think I've had such thin, wonderful chips before.  And all 3 of the salsas were delicious.  I definitely intend on coming back for happy hour.  Don't think I'd come back for dinner though.
author: Rachana S.

description:
Having learned that Tropisueno won the 2009 Mission Mole competition (note: that's the delicious chocolate pepper sauce, not the small furry animal), we decided it was time to try them out.

My first impression was that they did a good job of taking a very trendy, upscale downtown location and made it feel reasonably convincingly like a mellow, homey Mexican restaurant.  Cream colored adobe-esque walls paired with subtle arches and dark wood beams make for a pleasant place to eat that doesn't feel like it's trying too hard for its atmosphere.

The tables were all full when we arrived, but the bar was empty, so we eagerly planted ourselves there.  Same food plus easier access to tequila?  Yes, have some!

The cocktail list is basically a compendium of everything you could think of to do with tequila (and unless you study the bar carefully, you might be tempted to think that's the only alcohol they offer).  After sampling a number of the various creative offerings, we uniformly decided that the house margarita (a bit pricey at $8) was still the best of them.  Made with El Jimador and agave nectar, it's a little on the sweet side, and quite tasty.  They also fancy up all their drinks with different types of salt (smoked, or chili, or sweet... this was pretty cool).

As for the food, we started with the guac and ceviche.  For only $7, the ceviche is a HUGE helping of Tilapia, which was very fresh tasting and not too acidic.  I would have loved a little more variation in what all was in it for some textural variety, but it was certainly a good value.  The guac was heavy on the tomatoes, but fine.

The much ballyhooed Mole Poblano was pretty good.  Nice flavor, on the sweeter side, though I would have appreciated more complexity, and more of a roasted pepper richness, as well as a little kick - it was quite mild.  Definitely not as good as that served up by Fiesta del Mar down in Mountain View (the High Bar for Mole in the Bay Area as far as I'm concerned), but certainly not bad either.

The Chile Verde, on the other hand, was by far the winner of the evening.  Flawlessly tender melt-in-your-mouth chunks of pork in a heavenly rich green chile sauce.  I would have liked a bit more kick to the sauce, but that's my only complaint.  Unfortunately, following the ceviche, guacamole, chips & salsa, and 2 margaritas each, we literally didn't have room to finish it (portions are plenty big), which was a travesty.

Quite a satisfying meal in all, and while it totaled up to about $100 after tax & tip, we felt it was entirely worth it.
Plus, sitting at the bar, we got to watch the absurd rate at which the bartenders pump out the margaritas.  Seriously, most of the night they were making at least 6 at at time.  Good stuff.
author: Don H.

description:
I've eaten here for dinner with parties of about 4 - 7 and sometimes in volleyball cloths (i.e. yoga pants and a t-shirt). Just so you know how awesome this place is, I don't really care that much for Mexican food but Tropisueno is one of my favorite places to eat in the entire city. Yes..uh huh...it's that damn good.

The chips are like crack. I can't stop eating them. I eat so many I've never gotten past appetizers to a full entree. Do I mind, no! Their appetizers are so amazing I don't even feel like I'm missing out on those full entrees. 

The wait staff is very personable and attentive. Really easy to have a good time there.

I love the decor. It's a rustic, wood table type of atmosphere. Cozy and sexy.

Enjoy feasting on their deliciousness!
author: Cassy R.

description:
Went here for dinner with coworkers, in town attending AdTech at the Moscone Center, so it was a convenient choice. Made a reservation ahead of time and was glad I did, the place really filled up. 
The waiters are attentive and kept our glasses full. Loved the chips and salsa, and also tried the guac which was excellent. Didn't have to wait too long for the food, given how busy they were. I had the Tampiqueño (a carne asada dish) which was fabulous but very large, so took a good portion of it home with me. I highly recommend it!
Overall very happy and will definitely go back!
author: H M.

description: BEST TACOS IN SF! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. The first time I came here I had the carne asada tacos during Happy Hour, I nearly died. Then I tried their margarita, and I nearly died again. YUMMMMMYYY!! Went here again last week and got the chicken tacos, I fell to the floor. Soooo freakin good! They actually marinate their meat. I also order the margarita and drank one and I was already feeling fuzzy. So then I had to 3 more to see what would happen...WIN!!
author: April S.

description:
Having been here a few times in the last year or so I feel Tropisueño provides a consistently good but not great experience. It seems that every time there is at least one thing that goes wrong that dashes any hope of being great. Either it is visit with poor service or a dish with a bad cut of meat, something always seems to result in a near miss.

I keep coming back though, being so close to my house it is a nice "go to" when not in the mood to cook. The food is much better than your average Mexican place (certainly much better than Chevy's down the street), but isn't a taqueria, which depending on your wants is either a good or bad thing.

All in all, solid performance that will be in my local rotation for a long time.
author: Ben K.

description:
I've been here twice in the past week, that's how good this place is!

Once for dinner:
great service, delicious food.  cheap eats.

Once for happy hour:
chips and salsa, margaritas, nachos and guacamole flowed freely.  it was also really cheap! we had a 12 person happy hour for about $150 bucks.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Started off with the house Margarita.  This was a pretty good drink.  Not too strong, but just the right mix. They also gave us chips with 2 types of salsa.  I will say that their chips and salsa are rather delicious.  I could eat these all day!

For dinner, I had the Tampiqueno.  When the plate arrived, there were 2 giant slabs of carne asada.  I was surprised how much food I got.  It also came with rice, beans and tortillas.  For the location, and the price, it was a lot of food.  Lucky for me, I eat a lot so it wasn't something that scared me!  My only complaint, which is the reason I downgraded to a 3, is that the meat wasn't tender enough to just pull apart.  It was rather tough which surprised me.  I guess that's why they're able to give me so much for the price. 

Overall, the place was decent and worth checking out.
author: Patrick L.

description: Found this little gem thanks to Yelp.  We'd heard that there was good mexican food to be had in SF (we're from CO and love Mexican food).  We were so pleasantly surprised by this place, starting with the AMAZING chips & salsa/sauces (three to choose from). All were delicious. Then had my 2nd best margarita ever -- sorry, #1 goes to The Rio in Boulder, CO. For dinner, I had the chile relleno which was fabulous (I'm not a fan of meat in my relleno's so, they offered to make it vegetarian) and it was awesome.  Hubby had the chile verde. I was expecting your standard "Green Chile", but this was a pork dish, slow cooked and was so tender and flavorful. Delicious! Highly recommend!
author: Sally G.

description: This place is always slammed and the hosts are entirely unapologetic about it (even when you have a res and end up waiting 20 minutes to sit down regardless...) but it is a fun joint with better-than-decent food. Drinks were good, but there was no happy hour (at least at the table, maybe there is at the bar). But it's a really convenient location and a good spot for after work drinks/dinner, so long as you get a reservation!
author: Rachael K.

description: Great food for this part of town! Lunch time has a burrito line during weekdays to move the crowd quickly. Good Salsa.
author: chet l.

description:
Just had dinner there with a few friends last night and was overall pleased with the restaurant.

Pros:
- Very solid Mexican food with some less-served dishes (flautas, ceviche...not just your typical enchiladas, tacos, etc).  Fresh ingredients and good sized portions
- Convenient location (close to parking at the 5th and Mission garages; close to shopping at Union Square and the convention center etc)
- Reasonable prices - all entrees were in the $12-16 range for the most part and starters were mostly less than $10
- Nice ambiance - while certainly not fancy the decor was festive and gave a good "going out" feel to the whole place
- Called to confirm our reservation

Cons:
- Service was a little patchy - the waitress put a lot of pressure on us to get alcoholic drinks (asked several times etc) and at the end they seemed to be pressuring us to leave, even though there was no one waiting for a table and there were several other parties still around (it was around 9:45-10pm)
- Gratuity (@18%) was added to our bill although we only had 5 people in our party.  At most restaurants the auto-gratuity doesn't kick in until you have 6 people
author: Dominique N.

description:
I really wanted this to be a 5-star review.  All of the good Mexican places are in the Mission, but I want one in SOMA!  Came here for dinner around 10:20pm on a Friday night and my husband and I were seatly promptly.  The decor was nice.  It was a casual eatery and not a lot of Friday night revelry, which was perfect for the mood we were in.

Chips and salsa were brought out and the chips were just the way we like them-- light and thin.  The salsa, on the other hand, didn't seem like it was made from fresh tomatoes.  Disappointing.  We also ordered the guacamole and it definitely wasn't made from fresh avocadoes.  So first impressions were quickly brought down.  

I ordered the house margarita.  After realizing that agave nectar doesn't mix well with tequila and lime juice, I ordered another without it and was pleased by the quality of the drink.  We ordered ceviche and chile verde and liked both of those.  I was pleasantly surprised (after tasting the salsa and guac) that the ceviche tasted fresh.  But the chile verde was definitely the star of the night, because the pork was cooked to perfection and the sauce was divine.  Delicious.

Overall the restaurant is okay.  If they offered a fresh salsa alternative and fresh guac (meaning guac made with avocados cut open when i order it), then I would go back.
author: Freya Z.

description:
I'd say about 3.75 stars...

During lunch hour this place becomes a taqueria who would have known! My friends and I ventured down around 1230pm to grab a bite and walking there I see this long line. And then I think "oh crap is this for Tropisueno?"..being the blind bat I am I have to get right up to the doors to figure out "oh shit its the line.."... Don't be scared of the line out the door! It actually moves pretty quickly. You line up and order your food and then you sit...

So I tried the Mojado burrito - I chose steak, black beans, everything in it minus lettuce... and red sauce! Wet please! So then you slide over and pay and the cashier dude gives you a big basket of chips...they don't skimp there! Take your number and find a seat. Lucky for us the noon crowd was dissipating so we were able to grab some seats. Put down our stuff and head to the salsa bar! Lots of salsa (and peppers, yum) to choose from. They dropped off our food and OMG the burrito was huge... we had the guacamole appetizer as well and that was yummy... 

I only ate half my burrito but I was super stuff (I am still full about 5 hours later) and I am so mad I left my burrito at work in the fridge! I'll have to go back and try some other items. My burrito was $10.. a little pricey but hey we're downtown!
author: Julie F.

description: i like this place a lot! it's the type of place that u can just walk in, casually dressed but the place is fun yet classy. It feels like u walked into baja sur or that you are in mexico. Definitely was a big fan of their chips, freshly baked and their homemade salsa and guacamole. The chicken mole was fantastic and we also got the steak. The best part was the hot tortilla skins that we used to fill with rice and their hot black beans.
author: Ellin C.

description:
Trops now delivers! If you work in the area, be sure to consider Tropisueno for your next board meeting or networking event. They have a simple order form that you fax in the day before and they follow up with a phone call to confirm everything. Delivery was on time (and free for orders over $200). You got your taco bar, fajita bar, chips, rice, beans, whatever your little heart desires. Order conservatively, though. The taco and fajita bar account for 2.5 tortillas per serving, which is a lot if you throw in the rice, beans, chips and guac. I had 28 college students in the room, ordered the fajita bar for 20, and still had food left over! 

Aside from their catering service, Trops has become one of my go-to spots for an after work drink. Their margaritas are killer! Pair that with their homemade guacamole and you have a mighty fine way to end your day.
author: Susan L.

description:
Tropisueno es el gatos pyjamas.  My spanish sucks, but my taste buds are stellar.

I've tried about half the menu so far and nothing disappoints.  The chicken mole is some of the best I've ever tried.  The chips are amazing and so is the salsa verde.  God, the ceviche is spicy and perfect.  EVERYTHING IS AHHHMAAAZING.

I love this place so don't come here and make me have to wait.
author: Christina S.

description: Son of b*tch! That was the best guacamole I've had in a long time! Really, a great meal! Would be back soon if we were locals.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I've been here twice, and there is not one dish I've tried here that I did not like. I am truly surprised, and I will not hesitate to recommend this restaurant to another human being so they could understand the humanity that this place does service to.

The scallops were tender (I love the bacon hash around it), the pollo asado was deceptively moist and tender, the chicken mole poblano was a hit, the shrimp camarones al mojo de ajo kept our mouths fresh with butter and garlic, and the beef tampiqueno was a treat.

Our waiter and busboy were on-hand at every turn. My hot girlfriend and I had awesome booth seats every time we went and thoroughly enjoyed our dinners.  

It was almost as if they knew we were coming...

hmm.... interesting...
author: Alfred Y.

description:
Oh Tropisueño, mi amore...

It's not enough that you look so good. How your margaritas hit my bloodstream with reckless abandon! Just tastes so good on my tongue. And those little outfits you wear, the anise chipotle, cardamom and smoked salts, chili aji, dios mio(!), they just tickle me silly until I can no longer hold in my moans. 

And then you bring out the mole poblano, how fragrant, hugging every inch of your delightfully salty, moist enchiladas. Black beans glinting on the platter next to them, tomato perfectly ripe and ready for the biting. Burritos so grand, bursting, trumps anything else in my hands. Chile rellenos oozing cheese out every crevice, the outside so soft. Seeing you makes me gulp, makes me salivate. But it takes a mouthful to make me quiver. 

Trust me when I say I will not stray. I'm hooked on you.
author: Ligaya T.

description:
Visited here on a Friday night after work and the place was hopping with young people, so this must be a trendy spot in the Union Square area for the end of the week.  Noise level in the bar is at just under rock concert loud - so if you are planning on an intimate evening with a lot of pre-pillow talk conversation, you may want to try another spot.  Met up with a friend and we were seated with a reservation right away - recommend you make a reservation, as it was busy and you may have to wait awhile to get a seat.
The place has a small outside seating section, but it was starting to get chilly, so recommend that area for daytime only when you can get a little sun, indoor - was nicely decorated - this is what I would call a Mexican+ restaurant.  Not quite a Chi Chi or El Torrito in cliche decor style- a little nicer than any of those.  We were set at a table for two and it was a little small, considering we were served water, cocktails, chips and salsa (three salsa's - orange, green and red - the orange was zesty hot and my particular favorite - but all were good), appetizers and main dish (in some cases all of that was there at the same time, so it got a little crowded on the table).

Drinks - I had the Prickly Pear margarita and it actually looked and tatsted a little more like a Sangria.  Not that that's a bad thing - I really like Sangria, but not what I was expecting.

Appetizers - we shared an order of Cerviche de Camarones - made with shrimp/sweet mango, marinated in citrus with onion and a little bit of habanero spice - not so much that you needed a glass of milk to douse the fire, but enough of a kick that you will want to try more.

This is when some of the service got a little spotty - we had the chips and the drinks and the appetizer and within a couple bites of the appetizer the waiter's assistant brings our main meals...really?  I know it's busy, but the difference between an El Torrito and this place should be the service and the menu - the menu beats anything you will find in a chain, but the service - you may be expecting a little more for this place.  To her credit, out waitress was very apologetic about the timing of the courses, but I took a star off for that and had them at 3, but put another star back on, as the food was really good here and want to make sure people consider it.

Entree - I had the Tampiqueno - which is thin-cut grilled carne asada, served with a beef barbacoa enchilada and guacamole.  The beef, even though thin -cut was massive and took up at least 3/4 of the plate - but it was cooked to perfection and I did manage to make my way through the entire thing - lucky I didn't fill up on chips and salsa.  Beans - you get three different kinds - Black, Pinto or Refried - I had the Black and they are served a la carte, but were what you would expect and added to the overall compliment of the meal.
 
 Because she messed up on the delivery timing of our meal, the waitress brought us a complimentary "dessert" item, which was some sort of deep-fried unknown item with more black beans drizzled with sour cream - a odd dessert in my opinion, but appreciated the effort.  It was more like an appetizer, maybe someone canceled that at another table and she had an extra item...whatever - - not enough of a distraction.  I'd gladly eat here again.
author: Steve A.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed me experience here.  It was my first Groupon purchase - $30 for $15.  We shared the ceviche (my favorite of the things we tried), a combo plate with carne asada and a cheese enchilada, and mushroom empanadas.  All of the dishes were yummy, and the bill was wallet-friendly.  The best part of them meal, though, were the chips and salsa.  The chips are extra light and fried to perfection.

Perfect example of how Groupon works...because I will definitely go back.
author: Christine O.

description: Great after work spot, met a friend here and was bummed that they told us it was a 45min wait, but we got lucky and found seats at the bar.  That's probably your best bet if you thirsty and wanna get a drink quick.  My friend had the house margarita and I had a margarita that included tequila and St. George's Spirits Absinthe...hella gooood.  For a full bar and restaurant service was great.  Super chill bartender and hostess.  Would highly consider coming back.
author: Harry F.

description: Casual yet pretty mexican rustic decor was welcoming.  One complaint: LILLIES. LILLIES have a very strong odor and can ruin a dining experience. I could've tasted my dinner better (and would have given them 4 stars) had they chosen different flower arrangements for the bar and banquettes. Regardless--the 3 salsas served with the chips were flavorful and perfectly spicy. The sangrias are very tart and memorable. I had soft tacos--pork with pineapple--sweet and savory. My dining companions all cleaned their plates. Kid-friendly and lively atmosphere and nicely located in SOMA.
author: Sara J.

description:
It's not that easy to find really great Mexican food, but this is definitely worth a try!  Great food, fantastic drinks (I'd recommend the regular Rita here), and you get three salsas for your chips. 

Don't read too many reviews, just go, and show up hungry!
author: Derek H.

description:
Excellent margaritas and wonderful food !
The burrito bar is excellent too! So nice there is a great place for Mexican food near me.
author: Sandra C.

description: My wife and I stopped by to eat since it had good reviews but were disappointed. I had the wet chicken burrito and first they forgot the mole to make it a wet burrito. Then when I did get it the mole was the same stuff you buy at the store in a can definitely not made. Then my wife had the steak fajitas and they forgot to give her the tortillas and the waiters never came back to ask if we needed anything not to mention the steak was greasy yuck! Pretty disappointed since the place is nice but the food is lacking. I only give it 2 stars because the chips were warm and their salsas were good.
author: Alex A.

description: Solid spot for some good tacos for lunch or dinner. Make reservations for groups as it is fairly popular. Chicken mole was yummy!
author: Caroline L.

description: This place was WAY too busy to wait for a table, so we decided to place our order "to-go". So this review is solely on my take-out. Staff suggested the Mole, Done! And an order of chips, salsa and guacamole. That's all I needed, that's all I have to say... Mole, Do it!
author: Windy S.

description:
Fun happy hour, drink & food specials. Tasty guac. 

Plan to return for a real meal.
author: Elsa M.

description:
Every time I go to the Metreon to catch the latest flick, I rarely can think of some place to grab a fast, tasty, and relatively cheap bite.  In comes Tropisueno...

I had forgotten that I'd wanted to come try this place out until a friend suggested it because of it's vicinity to the Metreon and because of it's drinks...but we'll get back to that in a moment. 

Tacos are good (had the chicken and fish), chips and salsa and guac were tasty and so was the tostada. As for the drinks, well they were DARN good. Drinks of choice: margaritas and mojitos. 

I'll definitely be back!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I work right around the corner from here so if it wasn't for my coworkers pointing it out, I don't think I would've ever found it...despite a sign right smack dab in the middle of the sidewalk on Market street. 

Very nicely decorated restaurant with none of the cheesy sombreros or pinatas. Order at the counter and the food is brought to your table. A word of advice: HUGE portions. Also, can't beat the free chips and unlimited salsa that comes with your meal (or for $2 if you're just craving tortilla chips!)
author: Vivian D.

description:
Very nice decor !

But Service was horrible! Waiters are very rude and take forever to serve!!

Would not come back!
author: Starfish M.

description:
Huge portions of delicious Mexican food and endless chips for a decent price. I ordered the pollo asado and was completely stuffed for $18 with tax and tip.

This is a great place for dinner before a movie over at The Metreon. I would definitely stop in again.

I did wait for 20 minutes with just one other person, so a reservation is probably a good idea if you want to get a table with a bigger group.
author: Ross A.

description:
This place has great food!  The atmosphere is great.  I've been here for happy hour and dinner.  It gets pretty crowded for happy hour, since their drinks are strong and yummy.  The food is fantastic and well worth it!  The service is top notch and I am definitely a fan!  Very refreshing to good mexican fare that's not burritos and tacos.

Woo!
author: Helen C.

description:
By recommendation from Colleen B., I hit up Tropisueno in my adventures to California. We went for a late lunch and first thing I wanted to say was that it is a cool atmosphere! Wooden seats/benches, dim lighting -- very laid back and comfortable. 

We ordered the guacamole for an appetizer because I'm OBSESSED with fresh guacamole! It wasn't the best guacamole I've had but it was pretty freakin' good. For my main meal I got the steak burrito - which was delicious but HUGE. Seriously. I barely ate half, especially with the guacamole...So buyer beware, a lot of food in the entrees. I have to say, I really didn't enjoy the margarita I got and it was too overpriced for the size of it. 

So, overall good place to go. I'd probably go back but I don't think it'd be first on my list.
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
I like this restaurant because the decor really captures the Latin feel and the prices are very reasonable.  
Like everyone said the chips, salsas and guac are very good.  The chips aren't too greasy and the salsas taste fresh.  This is a fairly new restaurant and I think it has a lot of potential.  But there were a few things I'd like to see improve.  For starters there wasn't a lot of spice or seasoning to the food.  I got the tacos and they were decent, but a little under seasoned.  And, some other people at our table said there rice was under cooked.  I really enjoyed the platanos and the empanadas, mmm
Even though there were a few issues with the food I still really enjoyed my meal here and the service was good, however there is room for improvement.  All in all I will eat there again.
author: Molly M.

description:
Came here tonight for some dinner with friends to catch up. 

I order the Carne Asada Super Burrito (yes.. I know I eat too much..thanks) and let me tell you that baby was huge! Despite its size, it lacked in quality. I had to eat nearly a quarter to get to my first taste of carne asada. So my few mere chunks of meat, was accompanied by lots of lettuce and rice and some bean. For the price, its a good portion of food but I thought it tasted just ok. 

The rest of our party all thought the food was good, not the greatest but but better than most. I believe there were enchilladas, tamales, chile relleno, taco and posoles, you know, typical of other places. So we should be back, although its not one of those places where I will have massive craving attacks for.
author: Melanie A.

description:
The bad:

Came here expecting to have an early dinner at 4:30 but they were only serving bar food which was a big disappointment.  
The service was lacking. 
Only one bathroom.

The good: 

Excellent margaritas
Good chips
The decor
author: E. Y. G.

description: Simply: Make your way here after a day at the MOMA, happy hour is not to be missed, great prices, solid food including flautas and tostado's, $5 margarita's, with just the chips and salsa enough to be worth the stop...get here early and prepare for a wait, fills up quick!
author: Mahsa K.

description:
Just came back here for my 3rd time although this is my first review.

I love their guacamole, flautas and they had decent ceviche. Each time I have come here I've only had appetizers but I want to indulge in an entree one of these days.

The atmosphere is great, very festive. 

This was my first lunch here and you actually order at a counter when you first walk in the restaurant. Normally you are seated and waited on for dinners.

Great place for either lunch or dinner.. love the appetizers!
author: Jen S.

description: Best Mexican Food in the area!!! Great food & drinks. This is a pretty popular place so be prepared for a wait... Definitely worth it though. You can hang out at the bar & order drinks and eat complimentary chips & salsa. My favorite is the green & red sauces. :)
author: Renee W.

description:
Tropisueno is single-handedly responsible for getting me into ceviche. 

Okay, so I didn't actually eat here, so this is not really a full-on review.. but what happened was, I went to the Guardian's 'best of the bay' party at Mezzanine, which just so happened to be catered by Tropisueno...and at the time, I was in total starvation mode...it was serious, i tell you...it was certainly not the time to be picky... so i made a beeline for the refreshments and stuffed my face with the first thing that I saw, literally, which happened to be a little dixie cup of ceviche from Tropisueno!!!

It was a very transformative experience...because I had previously avoided exposing myself to situations where i might have to try ceviche (don't ask me why - i love sushi more than life itself...so, no idea really what my hang-up was with ceviche). well, anyways - the point is, I have now tried ceviche two or three times at other restaurants, and while it's safe to say that I am no longer scared of ceviche itself, the Tropisueno ceviche still remains at the very top of my list. 

So thank you for that. I can't wait to actually go here and eat it again. I also went to their website and checked out the menu, and the aesthetic of the place is just so incredibly me...so i'm really looking forward to the visit.
author: Shannon R.

description: Was very excited but a bit let down. Had the Baja fish taco and the pork verde taco. The former was ok but the fish seemed dry and stale.  The latter was terrific for the toppings and meat, but their soft tacos were less than desireable... Didn't try anything else, so its only based on those 2 tacos
author: Matt H.

description:
I love their special offer for Yelpers: 5 friends pay for cocktails, the 6th one drinks free all night! What a deal! I'm not sure how they police such activity but it sounds good at least. Unfortunately we only had 4 in our party. But we were there for happy hour so it was still very affordable. 

The house margaritas were great. I loved the spicy salt rim on the glass. Definitely don't miss the humongous $3 fish taco during happy hour. It was delicious! The nachos were just OK, I'd skip those even tho the portion was decent for the price.  Just not a whole lot of flavor.

I'd come back just for those fish tacos!  Waaaaay better than Rubio's!
author: Erin S.

description: My favorite place in get Mexican food when I am in the city.  Every time I have been for dinner there has been a bit of a wait to get seated, but it is always worth it.  The hosts are friendly as they explain that there is a wait, and I usually grab a drink from the bar (can't go wrong with any of their margaritas) while I wait.  The service is always superb and the food is even better!  I love the salmon!  I recommend this to anyone looking for upscale, delicious Mexican food.
author: Sally H.

description: I would love to give this place 5 stars but on my last visit our experience was a little lacking. The owner has been there during both of my visits, he is very friendly and on top of things. If you are not happy, he will make sure you are. The hot dogs are tasty - I prefer the one with guacamole. All of the drinks we have ordered have always been delicious. Seating for two felt a little awkward, rather than intimate which is what you want with a place like this that has a lounge vibe. Seems like it would be a fun place to go with a group.
author: Mel S.

description: margaritas are delicious and strong! Try the lavender one, out of this world. The place is a little pricey, but well worth it. Happy hour is also great.
author: Patricia L.

description:
Who needs Tres Agaves?  All hail Tropisueno!

I noticed that until now my Yerba Buena list had only one 5-star food review on it, for the Chieftain (which is really a bar that happens to serve delicious food).  Everything else around here is either a really divey place suitable only for boring work lunch, or a really fancy/trendy place suitable only for blowing money.  But Tropisueno is the Goldilocks option.  It's sit-down Mexican with feisty but fairly-priced dishes (the Camarones Tropisueno is some top-notch shrimp sauce, and the molotes are the best tasting dumplings this side of dim sum), it has a cozy bar area that's perfect for happy hour, and most importantly, it's that rare restaurant whose decor job is obviously well-funded but doesn't feel sterile.  Plus, it's situated on a pedestrian plaza.  This would be a classic in any neighborhood; in the dicey Metreon-area food-scape, it exerts an almost magnetic pull.
author: Wes M.

description:
I've been in San Francisco for seven days and this is the first place that I've come back to my room to yelp about right away.  The food here is as good as it gets.  I hope they are paying the chefs well as losing them would be a crime.   I grew up eating Mexican food at least every other day and this food is really amazing.  This is my comfort food.   

I understand why people on here say the place is too loud... it can be loud if you have drunk girls celebrating a birthday as it was in my case, but the food is outstanding. 

As for the service, it was fantastic... quick and friendly.  

The chips were light, crispy, and warm.  The salsa was not spicy and had amazing flavors.  I started with flautas and they were very good... the salsa on the flautas did have a little kick but not too much that made it last for too long.   I had a chicken enchilada, chicken tamale, and a carnitas taco.  I ordered the carnitas as my waitress suggested carnitas... and I am glad I took her advice.... they were AMAZING.  The tamale, while very good was not the best I had ever had.   However, it was very good.  The masa was a bit thick for my taste, but what made it ok was that it was stuffed well.  There was plenty of chicken in the masa/chicken ratio.  The enchilada was also very good.   As for the rice and beans... again very tasty.   

The entire meal was great... there was not one thing that I ordered that I would not eat again.  Tropisueno is a must if you are looking for great Mexican food in San Francisco!
author: David C.

description:
Love it! The BF and I came here with another couple for a double date last night. What a lovely place!  We were seated at the only booth-like table that felt really private. The atmosphere of the restaurant felt like a rustic and authentic Mexican home. 

Now, for the food. It was really delicious! First, the chips were thin, perfectly crispy, and salted. The salsa was just the right blend of spice and tasted fresh. We shared the empanadas as an appetizer. They were stuffed with mushrooms and I really enjoyed them. For the main course, I had a hard time choosing. I decided to be a little adventurous and went for the chicken mole. I am so glad I did! The chicken was not dry as I had feared and was actually really tender and the mole sauce was the perfect complement. I thought the rice was a saltier than usual, but I actually enjoyed it! The waiter recommended the mestizo for a drink which tasted like a better version of a cosmo. 

Overall a great dining experience! We had a groupon which took off $30 of our meal so it ended up being around $40 per couple. Not bad for a great meal!
author: Angela L.

description:
My friend recommended this place to me and my partner but prefaced that the service was just ok while the food was fantastic. I have to say I completely disagree with him. While food was amazing, but more importantly the service was what made the evening. I was in my usual indecisive self and told the server to bring a few of his favorite dishes for us. He asked all the questions. "Are you allergic to anything? Is there anything I should stay away from bringing you?". And his choices were spot on! He brought us the meatballs and the Chili Verde. Not to mention some amazing margaritas that he also chose for us.

I have to say if you go to this place ask to sit in Camilo's section. He was fantastic. He gave us a very personalized experience that made me want to go back. I will be returning very soon!
author: Neal R.

description:
Fun little place. Yelped it and decided to try it out on a Friday night. We probably got there at 6:15 and had a 40 minute wait, which the host was pretty up front about so we didn't mind.

Service was good, attentive and fast.  Food was also delicious! The portions were HUGE! Between 3 of us we shared 2 apps and 2 entrees.  And we can eat. And we still have leftovers.  

Will definitely be back.
author: Kym P.

description: Came in here with a friend on a thursday afternoon to enjoy some fresh mexican cuisine. It was my first time coming into the restaurant and was initially confused with the ordering system. When I did figure it out I ordered my food and was siting down and eating it in less than 10 minutes. A great restaurant with a lively atmosphere. The music is great, but can be loud. We came in at 11:30am and it was beginning to get packed. As soon as 12pm came, the restaurant was full. The layout of the seats certainly causes trouble for large parties, say 6 or more, as the number of tables available is limited. The food was great. I had the super burrito and was overwhelmed by it. The chips and salsa were bomb. Salsa was spicy and fresh, and the chips were warm and crispy. The wait staff is very attentive and friendly. Overall a great experience and would visit again for happy hour.
author: Cheng Y.

description:
Tropisueno is tasty.  Came here with a friend for lunch today.  I was a little confused about the whole setup.  I thought it was a restaurant, so I had to ask a couple people if the line was only for takeout or to be seated, and I guess it was a line formation to pay for your order and grab a number and find a table.  Hehe, silly me, the restaurant looked so nice, I seriously thought it was sit down formal style with hostess and waiter service.

Anyways, the FOOD.  We ordered a regular Al Pastor burrito and a super chicken quesadilla.  The meat was so flavorful and the portion size was just right for the average price of $6-9, it was good.  Sure it's not Chipotle gigantic burrito style, but the proportionate selection of meats, beans and cheeses is just right.  The salsa bar is to die for.  There are at least 5 different kinds of salsa in addition to two kinds of peppers (the preserved jalapenos and carrots or a whole preserved pepper).  Chips are fresh and not too greasy or salty.

Tropisueno is a place I will definitely come back and recommend to friends.
author: Yun W.

description:
we came here on a wednesday night with a reservation and they still made us wait half an hour!  they tried to make up for it with free taco cards that they had laying out in the hostess kiosk.  when we sat down we got no water and no service for 20 minutes.  then they tried to make up for it with better service.  they forgot our guac too.

food here is well portioned.  if you like to feel stuffed after.
author: claudia y.

description:
i was with my friends in happy hour on thurday and the waiter that  we got  was a little one nasty we ask  him if he could pick up the curtain because we want see out side he said not for a rule of the restaurant after two rounds of drinks we pay the bill and in less that  five minutes this man came and told us we have to leave the  table to other costumer. i think that was very ignorant. 
i never go there any more. Never :)
author: Gaby B.

description:
Pretty good Mexican food, fairly priced, fast, and close to work.  All good qualities for a restaurant to have.  

When I have been here it is not too crowded and I've always found a table, but I imagine depending on which convention is in town it can get pretty crowded around lunch time.

I like the chicken quesadillas :)
author: Ben B.

description:
Just returned from dinner. The food deserves 5 stars for tastiness & originality. It is a noisy, lively place. Our waiter was great. We ended up ordering tons of food & drinks (over $125  for the two of us). Wanted to book a reservation for the following night for 4 adults & space for a stroller for our newborn twins and we're basically told by the host that he would not be able to be accommodated a stroller in this establishment. And that in a very arrogant tone! So beware, any adult diners with kids, you have to avoid this restaurant because kids are unwelcome . What the host said, is that they are just too busy for babies and he gave us the cell number for the owner (probably his dad or cousin) to back it up.  Glad, that there are so many good restaurants in SF where we can share our hard earned money.
If you, owner, read this,  suggest you consider speaking to your host scheduling He drags down your income potential (several pissed good customers/ day x 24 days per months = $$$ loss of. Income; maybe consider and sharing that loss with your employee,
Sorry to find it necessary to inform the people of SF,
author: Jochen P.

description: I came here on a Friday night at 7 and the place was jumping, 45 minutes wait for a table if no reservations but I lucked out at the bar. I chose this restaurant because it was right next to my hotel.  Bartender and fellow customers were very friendly. I had the fish special of the day, mahi mahi with white beans, and it was great - not the typically heavy mexican dish but still filling in a good way. Chips and salsa were served right away with choice of 3 different sauces/salsa. Margaritas were very good. Not sure why their website says "what is up with a basic cocktail costing $10+?" All the margaritas were $10-14. Very festive and lively atmosphere.
author: Veronica J.

description: Chips are ok, not as amazing as some claim. However, the trio of salsas are great!!! The margaritas are good, but I have had better for less than $10 (papatzul in NYC). The food is definitely NOT authentic and somewhat bland. It is much more Americanized than I was hoping for. Then the steak dish my husband had was very tough...and the sangria small and not sweet enough. Our server was nice.
author: B D.

description: Delicious food, attentive staff, great atmosphere! The go to place for a fun, romantic date night.
author: Angela S.

description:
I came here for lunch today, not expecting a whole lot, but ended up leaving impressed with the food.  It took a while for me to decide what to get, but in the end, I decided with the regular burrito made with pinto beans and al pastor.

The burrito is definitely on the large side- the woman making my burrito kept piling on the rice, beans, cheese, and al pastor to the point where it looked like she might have some trouble closing it up.  What impressed me about the al pastor at Tropisueno was the way they kept the roasted pineapple separate from the pork- that way, it retained a lot of its charred pineapple flavor.  It was lovely to get random little nuggets of sweetness from the pineapple in contrast to the salty cheese, smooth beans, and tender pork.  The pork was delicious in that there was a huge dollop of them in the burrito, plus it wasn't overly fatty.  

This huge burrito was accompanied by a handful of homemade chips, which definitely added some great crunch and texture to the meal.  They were well-seasoned, super thin and crunchy and utterly perfect with the selection of salsas they have there.  I was particularly enamored of the spicy orange salsa- I can't tell what exactly was in it, but it was good.

4 stars for a really good lunch for under $8, especially given that I only finished 1/3 of the burrito-2/3 of it are still waiting for me as a second meal.  I'd definitely be back to try out the other menu items and I can't wait to go back and eat more of their chips!
author: Angela H.

description:
Molotes de Pap y Chorizo were good, but you'd need a microscope to find the Chorizo.

I had the Tampiqueño, which turned out to be one of the best carne asada steaks I've had.  Perfectly marinated and cooked perfectly (little char on the outside, sliver of rareness in the middle).  Rice was good too--lots of flavor and a great texture and consistency.

My dad ordered Camarones Tropisueño.  Prawns were big, but came doused in way too much sauce imho.  The flavor was good, but like the salsa, there was simply NO spice to any of it.  I'm guessing because most of their clientele is white they have toned the menu down a bit, but c'mon--this isn't Indiana!  Took two tries before they brought out the "hottest" salsa they had (habenero)--it was still pretty mild, but at least you could feel some activity.  

Margaritas were small, but strong and very good.  

Overall:  Outstanding service, great little location, great food, strong drinks.  -1 star for lack of spiciness.
author: Nobody M.

description:
I got a quick response from the restaurant to my review which again reflects the quality of the people working here.  Apparently, they are going through some menu changes.  I look forward to trying this place again as I really like the people here.  We'll be back!


They have very good happy hour deals, but the food is only OK.  We tried the combo plates and it tasted more like it was made at Chevy's.  The margaritas are pretty small too.  But, the staff is very friendly.  We spent about $90 including tip for 3 people for dinner with margaritas.  2 stars for the food and 4 stars for the service.
author: Luke L.

description:
An interesting experience and a very mixed bag.   

The decor is nice and the service is friendly.  However the service was at the same time somewhat sloppy - our server forgot to bring one of our appetizers and took a very long time to show up during the meal.  Finally she charged for the wrong (more expensive) drink than we had ordered - and acted like it was the same price which it was not.

For food - the salsas are really good, empanadas are ok.  The pork chop (lomo de puerco adobado) was excellent!  However the chips were very oily and the rice so salty that it was inedible.   The house margarita was below average, but the tropisueno cocktail was super, and the michelada they made me was one of the best I've ever tasted.

My guess is that there is better to be had, just have to find it...
author: S C.

description: Excellent Guacamole and small plates that are fun to share. Definitely get the ceviche with the mango. It is mouth-watering!
author: Sonia S.

description: My wife had to talk me into going to the city from Oakland on a rainy night to see some of her visiting family. I'm glad she did.  I got the Tampiqueno / Carne Asada and it was fantastic. The meat went KA-POW in my mouth, it was so good. The enchilada, another beef, provided another entirely different taste of deliciousness. Not bad for a $15 entree. I was stuffed.  They replaced the chips so frequently we never ate a broken chip. The service is just fantastic. My only complaint is I wish the red salsa was more plentiful than the other two guac and chipotle flavors. I tried to figure out why I should hold back from a 5 star review and couldn't find a good reason. Good food. Great service. Good prices. MAKE A RESERVATION
author: Vor H.

description: Oh tropisueno .. We have had our ups and downs. Those days when it is rainy outside and all I want is a damn burrito ... I know you are there. I know you make your burritos classy but sometimes I find that just plain wrong. Your awesome placement and terrific staff keep me coming back in the hopes that someday your burritos will be as good as others. But yes I do like your chips and drinks right after work. I think I have packed away many happy hour margaritas from your bar and have then left sufficiently stumbling. I will be back for more drinks or maybe even try another entree, you are too close not to.
author: Greg G.

description: Good tacos and really good Margaritas. The peppito is totally legit
author: Joe L.

description:
My go to for Mexican food in the city. 

Love, love the crispy warm chips and salsas, tamales, beans and rice! My absolute fave on the menu. Mmm yummy. 

Have also had their specialty dishes like the chicken mole and albondigas and both were great. 

Definitely recommend tropisueno!
author: Joy A.

description: Ok, yes the chips and salsa are awesome and  the margaritas are strong and swift. But, Tropisueno failed to impress me. I think maybe I was expecting a sit down place, but since I came for lunch, its more of a taqueria. The lunch set up is awkward, you order and pay at the counter, but if you want something to drink, you have to go to the bar to order and pay seperately....it was just hard to juggle my drink, my receipts, my table number, my salsas. Then we had to ask for chips. My food came out semi-warm and the fajitas were nothing exciting. I might try it one more time, but definately for dinner. And for happy hour. Cause 8 bucks for a not so big margarita is no bueno....
author: Stephanie W.

description:
4 stars for the happy hour appetizers.  tasty and a total steal.  $2 for delicious tacos and $4 for ceviche?  Uh.... sounds awesome to me. 

2 stars for the happy hour drinks.  i ordered a couple $5 house margaritas right before the 6:00 happy hour cut-off.  I don't think I finished either (actually one got taken away before I was done).  truth be told, they just tasted really, really sweet.  like vegas sweet.  

0 stars for the euphemistically "grumpy" hostess who was not convinced that I and my party were capable of ordering entrees and thereby deserving of a seat in the dining room rather than the very crowded communal table.
author: Ash T.

description: Awesome taco bar. Really good price. Super crowded at lunch so get there early.
author: Brandon D.

description: What a GREAT spot! Atmosphere was lively and fun. The food was great...guacamole was excellent. Had the Camarones Tropisueno which was superb featuring their spicy chile de arbol sauce and the Tampiqueno carne asada which was delicious and so much meat it took two of us to finish it. The salsas they bring you to go with their chips are incredible too. Affordable and a great waiter to boot. Would highly recommend this place...but make a reservation...when we arrived (with our Yelp reservation) everyone else had to wait and hour and fifteen minutes for a table. So plan ahead and enjoy!
author: Donna T.

description:
I had a food epiphany today. I thought I'd get something different so I decided on the Tropisueno Torta.

Yes it's a sandwich. But what makes it special is the total construction. So they take this flaky buttery bread and stuff it with carnitas, chicken, carne asada and chorizo. Plus chunky guacamole, lettuce, tomato, and what seemed to be a chipotle mayo. Then they put it into a panini grill to flatten the sandwich.

If you are looking for a meat-leaning meal and not in the mood for too much rice and beans in a burrito, then this is the perfect substitute.

I think they should make a Tropisueno burrito!
author: Clodel G.

description: I give up on Tropisueno.  Reviewers have patiently detailed the same issues over and over since Tropisueno's opening, but I just don't see much progress.  I'll leave them with this final complaint, which seems to happen to me every time I go: roll the goddamn burrito the other direction so you don't have all of the guacamole in the top (or bottom) third of the burrito.  It's simple, really.
author: Laurence W.

description:
Um, the burritos here are ridiculous. Like enough to feed me for three full meals ridiculous...enough to defeat my ex--who I once watched follow a super carne asada burrito from Lil Chihuahua with two Drumstiks and a Klondike Bar--ridiculous. Things are MASSIVE. This is made even more impressive by the fact that they're like 6 bucks or something.
