I don't know if I can ever muster the strength to order one myself, but I've seen them being made and they are...ridiculous.

Moving right along...I ordered a super carne asada taco and that combined with some chips was plenty for me. Sadly, I am not wise in the ways of ordering, and down plopped my fish taco as I began to devour the previously delivered steak one. I stopped mid-bite, already aware that I was defeated. Sigh. And fish tacos don't keep well, but believe me when I tell you I damn sure tried to save it and eat it. It was even somewhat passable several hours later, and that's saying a lot for such a dish.

Chips: thin, fresh, crispy, and delicious...and the perfect amount of salt, not that that's not easy enough to adjust in most cases. 

Salsas: at least five varieties, one of which was a light green substance that I was hesitant to try as I'm not the biggest fan of green salsas in general. OMG! It's honeydew melon salsa! Or at least that's what I'd swear to. Deceptively refreshing and delicious, especially when following the mouth-searing habanero stuff.

Aguas Frescas: fuck right, they have Jamaica. I love that shit. Theirs was a little too sweet for my tastes, but that's just a minor gripe. Yeah, I'll be back for sure. And did I mention the prices? Yep, that's right: ridiculous (in a good way).
author: Jasmine F.

description: I'm a mexican who was disappointed of the food quality and poor taste of traditional cuisine although the service is great I still miss the mexican flavors.
author: Alberto X.

description:
Hands down my favorite margarita EVER!  I never order with salt but for my second round I had to try the red arbol chili salt-it complemented the flavor nicely and did not overpower it like most.

Served with warm tortilla chips with garlicky guacamole, salsa verde and roja and it's fun for hours!
author: michelle s.

description: This place was good. Really good. We came here with a group of six for my brother's  bday, and boy oh boy this place delivered. Fantastic ambience, great server who helped my dad and stepmom find more "American" Mexican dishes (I.e, quesadillas, lol). But really the food here is fantastic! Loved their guacamole, salsas, habanero mango margarita (the waiter was worried I didn't like it because I had to take breaks to enjoy the spiciness level but it was really tasty). I definitely will be back for a date night with my husband :)
author: R.A. H.

description:
Came here on a double date and was pretty excited about it, considering my other favorite yelper, Patty P, and I had missed out on one of the first 2009 elite events here.  

The atmosphere is cute, laid back, and has a Mexican feel to it. We arrived to find the guys waiting in the bar for us, which was lovely and pretty spacious.  

Service was ok.  It took me a few minutes to find someone who could find our reservation and seat us.  We finally got seated and ordered another round of drinks.  Patty and I had 2 violeta margaritas with vanilla salt. Interesting.  It didn't taste much different from a regular margarita, except that it was MUCH saltier. Ew. So then we just switched to basic ritas.  

Guac & salsa was good and the chip basket wasn't ever left empty.  I had the pollo something, which was basically half a roasted chicken atop some rice and grilled veggies. It was sooo good.  

I definitely think this would be a great place for happy hour and apps
author: Jenny W.

description: Great food here... really enjoyed there burritos, quesadillas. They have an excellent variety of Salsa's and I cannot get enough of their chips. I really want to try out other items. This is also great if you have the GoPago app. The line can get long and if you are in a rush to get in and grab your food the app works perfect. I plan on trying other food items on the menu when i come back!
author: Jessie F.

description: LOVED this place!  Made a reservation to ensure we were seated in time to see Act of Valor at the Metreon.  The margaritas were fantastic.  The chips and salsa were so unique.  Each of the three salsas were delicious.  The food was spot-on.  Delicious guacamole, tasty steak, and excellent service.  Would definitely go back.  It was quite busy, especially in the bar area so definitely make a reservation if you're on a schedule.
author: Cristina M.

description: This is one of those places where everything looks better than it tastes. The flavor of the beef fajitas was no good, and they were chewy. Skip it.
author: Olivia P.

description:
A friend had told me about this place and I actually remember walking past here before it opened. 

I finally had a chance to try this place out while in town for a Conference at Moscone this week.  So far, I've been here twice!!  

It's a cute little spot behind the Marriott Marquis next to Beard Papas.  The Chips and Salsa that they give you is really good!  

One down side is they are very slow with their service, so look at the menu ahead of time.  It was slow during dinner both times I ate here this week, but it's still really good. 

I've never had Chicken Mole before, but it was awesome!!  I don't know what it's made of and I hear that I wouldn't want to know, but I'll keep ordering it!!  

The Empenadas were good, but I wasn't a fan of the Al Pastor Tacos and I was pretty excited to order it and pretty disappointed that the meat was kinda tough. 

Didn't try the beverages cuz I like to stick with my Vodka Tonics, but it looked like they had some fun concoctions! Overall a great place for casual eating and hanging out with friends while stuck on site for a Conference at Moscone. 

Tonight might have to be x3!!
author: Suzy L.

description:
CHICKEN TACOS.  

OH wait, what was I saying ... so I found this place through yelp, and reviews really enticed me so the boyfriend and I came on a Friday.  Very long wait, but I expected as much.  If a restaurant doesn't have a wait on a Friday night, something is wrong.  

The service was embarrassingly lousy.  Everything took at least 10 minutes to happen.  First we want some chips, we wait 5 or 6 minutes, nothing happens.  We mention it to someone else, wait a few minutes, nothing happens.  Then we get our chips, but we need salsa, we try and flag down another waiter because we have no idea where ours went.  We wait another 5 minutes, he has disappeared.  We see our waiter!  Can we have some salsa?  Maybe some more diet coke?  Okay great, thanks!  Another 5 minutes passes ... where did this guy go?  The food comes!  Awesome.  Do you think we could have some salsa?  and refills?  and ... the beans and rice for the fajitas?  Great, cool, see you in a second.  Another 5 minutes, the food is getting cold, the salsa shows up!  Awesome. Could we have some refills and the rest of the fajitas?  

And so on.  Until the very end of the meal.  Even the check was a struggle to get.  

The only thing that can override how completely lack-luster the service was (and the fact that an entire damn entree was completely cold by the time we received the rest of it -- I mean, what point are fajitas without the beans, rice and tortillas?) was how fucking good the chicken tacos were.  I mean, seriously, I don't even live in San Francisco and I'm considering making a trip just for the damn tacos.  

Eat the chicken tacos.  Ignore the bad service.  Don't worry about ordering the fajitas -- they weren't that good, with or without the beans, rice and tortillas.  But for the love of all that's good and holy, eat the damn chicken tacos.  My mouth is watering just thinking of them and it's been two damn months since then.
author: Khalana O.

description:
After re-visiting Tropisueno, I can truly say that I'm a believer in this place!

I've had their Chile Relleno de Picadillo (Mild Poblano chile stuffed w/ ground beef, green olives, raisins & "savory spices") and Chile Verde (Tender pieces of pork simmered in tomatillos, pepper, chiles and herbs), which were both flavorful, filling and delicious! I've also tried out their margaritas, which were just as good as I had imagined them to be back when I wrote my 1st review for Tropisueno.

And the best part.... I recently discovered that they have some AWESOME deals!

1) Complimentary Bedtime Snacks (tacos, flautas, chips & more) w/ a 1 drink min, from 10 pm-2 am every Sun-Tues. 

2) Show up w/ 5 friends & you (the host) get free beer, wine & house Margaritas the whole evening! 

I have yet to test any of the above deal out, but g'ness gracious... I'll definitely be giving them a try soon!
author: Tiffany M.

description: I haven't written a review in 2 months and Tropisueno is so good I'm compelled to shout about it.  I am a big fan of Mexican food and this place delivers.  It's fancy Mexican, so don't go there expecting Mission taqueria or taco truck style food.  I've been for lunch and dinner and both were excellent.  I had tacos for lunch and no matter how hungry you are, you cannot finish 3.  I tried and it wasn't pretty.  For dinner we had the shrimp cocktail, plantains with black beans, and chicken mole.  The shrimp cocktail is not your typical cold shrimp in a glass with cocktail sauce, it's like a ceviche, but drowning in a tomato based sauce with tons of lime.  Yummmmmm.  The black beans with the plantains were really good too and I can live without beans. The chips and salsa are yummy and don't get me started about the margaritas.  Umph, umph, umph.
author: Diana M.

description: This is my go to joint for after work libations and eats. Their hibiscus margarita and cucumber margaritas are to die for. I recommend the C h i l e   Ve r d e which can easily be split between two.
author: Alina T.

description:
im a fan ! 
we got quite an assortment of items and loved them all. def. one of the best mexi spots ive found outside of mission
author: Sunni B.

description: We really like the food here but the service leaves a lot to be desired. Either they don't have enough servers or the servers they have aren't interested in good customer service. It would be nice to have the beans with the rest of the meal instead of when we're almost finished eating. They also clean the table off completely while customers are still sitting down. I'm not talking about clearing off the empty plates, but water glasses and wiping the table down. It would be nice to be able to sit and enjoy the entire meal, having everything we ordered, and not feel rushed.
author: Glenda W.

description:
What a fun and delicious place for dinner! Woohoo. New discovery! (new to me anyway).

Located in a fun alley between Market and Mission by the Metreon, Marriott and Westin, Tropisueno is flanked by cute eateries like Amber, Beard Papa and Press Club (just across the way). Right from the beginning the place looked good.

Inside, lots of soft lighting, warm woods, and friendly staff complete the ambience for a lively inviting experience.

We were promptly seated for our 7p reservation, a window facing seat. We were immediately greeted by some light flaky and warm tortilla chips served with red and green salsa. Yum!

With a pregnant friend and having to drive, most of us ordered a virgin margarita, which was still tasty, and looked fancy with colored salt.

Then the eating commenced. We started with the fresh guacamole ($8) and plantanos ($6). I only wished there was more of the plaintains.

For entree, I tried the Tampiqueno ($14), thin cut of carne asada that had the flavor of the grill. The plate came with rice and guac and a cheese enchilada. I really liked my carne asada, could have done without the enchilada though.

My friends ordered the Camarones Tropisueno ($16), which was shrimp in a creamy chile sauce. Very tasty as well. Served with rice.

Our entire table was also laden with 3 types of beans - refried, flava (or pinto looking ones), and black beans. We were also given warm tortillas. We were swimming in food. Everything was delicious. Service was great. Our waiter refilled our glasses regularly, came back with extra chips, extra tortillas, and even extra lollipops (Chupa Chups - comes in several flavors, those with cream and those just fruit).

We were way too full to have dessert (3 options - tres leche cake, flan caramel, or fruit chocolate fondue). Great meal. Total for 4 = about $100 before tip.

Tropisueno will be high on my go to list.
author: Cindy W.

description: The portions are absurdly large and they kept sneaking fried food into the dishes. Not in a good way.
author: Samantha M.

description: super good burrito spot and inexpensive! absolutely loved it here!
author: Tiff W.

description: We tried this place after our concierge at the Four Seasons (literally next to the restaurant) recommended it and it was great! We went there for lunch and they have a really cheap lunch menu. It's all a la carte and you just go right up to the kitchen and order and they bring it out to you. Quesadillas were around $8, tacos $3-5. Everything was made to order and really delicious. Their house margarita is really strong but the salt is chili powder like. We went there for dinner the next time and got take out and ordered the same stuff and ended up being twice the price. So I'd recommend their lunch because of the price difference. Plus take out is never as good so try to enjoy yourself and have a sit down meal. The chips and guacamole is amazing as well. Each order comes with chips so don't bother adding an order unless you really like chips).
author: Ryan S.

description: The food at Tropisueno is overpriced and mediocre at best. Outside of the just "ok" food, the staff at the restaurant are utterly rude and incompetent. I decided to dine at the restaurant on Wednesday evening and accidentally left my credit card there. When I tried to call the restaurant that evening, no one bothered to pick up the phone. I then called the restaurant on Saturday (they were closed on Thursday and Friday for the holiday) and still, no one bothered to pick up the phone. So I had to drag myself in to the establishment (I live 30 mins away), only to interact with a VERY RUDE manager, who told me that my credit card was nowhere to be found. I knew this couldn't be true, because Tropisueno was the last place I used my credit card. Feeling discouraged, I left my contact information with the manager just in case they magically found it. I quickly canceled my credit card...only to get a call from the rude manager at Tropisueno, telling me they found my credit card. It's obvious he didn't even search for my card in the lost and found bin OR someone was planning on using it, until they discovered the manager was looking for it. Either way, I will NEVER dine at this restaurant again. The food really isn't all that great and they have no idea what customer service means. I will NOT be recommending this restaurant to any of my friends or family. STAY AWAY!
author: Virginia N.

description: LOVE LOVEDDD this place!! great atmosphere, great drinks, great food and wonderful service.  Definately recommend this place!!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Delicious food and an amazing bar. 

We arrived at around 7ish on Friday night with no reservations so we chose to sit at the bar rather than wait 20 min for a table--best decision ever.

I ordered the ginger marg and my companion had the violet one. Both were tasty. 

- chips / salsa: amazing chips... warm, a little greasy but great flavor and perfect crunch. good salsas, though could be a little spicier for my taste.

- scallops w/ chorizo and plantain hash: very good combination of flavors but would have liked to have more plantains in the hash. i think there were only a few bits.

- talapia ceviche: i didn't eat much of this one, but it was pretty good. 

- chicken mole: excellent mole and really good rice. nothing i hate more than weak, overly sweet mole. this one was rich and chocolatey with lots of layers of the right spice. we had the black beans and they flavored them well. needed to ask for more tortillas b/c there was just so much food / sauce!

the bartender service was really top notch. we decided to have another cocktail after dinner and so we got to chatting with the bartender and eventually decided that he should just surprise us with 2 drinks. mine was some sort of tequila / orange / egg white concoction with a bit of pepper-infused spice and the other was a more lemony / absinthe based one. each were wonderful and delicious. honestly far better than the standard drink menu which was inventive and tasty to begin with.

we were finishing up our last drinks when mr. a+ bartender (i wish i'd caught his name) surprised us with a last "dessert" style drink for us to share that was outta this world. tequila / egg white / cinnamon and a huge chunk of orange zest dipped in cinnamon made for a satisfying "dessert" without being gross and overly sweet. it was almost like if apple cider tasted orange-y and perfectly boozy. a++

i need to make a point of getting out there for their happy hour sometime.
author: Jo W.

description:
All the good things you hear about the margaritas are true! I knew I wanted to try the ginger liquor one (fancy that, its named Tropisueño) and it was delicious. The salt on the rim is lemon/rose salt and makes it stand out that much more. 

I was surprised at 6 pm on a weeknight they didn't have any specials on the drinks or a sort of happy hour. The food prices are more resaonable than the cocktails and the chips they serve are hot, light and totally addicting. I was almost full by the time my meal came!  I enjoyed the street style tacos off the appitizer menu and found them to be fresh and not greasy or heavy. They did have a Feb. special running all month long where you get a free dessert which was nice and very tasty. I also asked if a couple items we ordered were spicy, told they weren't at all, and of course they were too spicy for me... Non-spicy Mexican food is hard to find!

The atmosphere is warm and comfortable and I like the way it is decorated inside.
author: Natalie N.

description: I made an online reservation for 4 bur noted that one of the diners was going to be a baby.  My reservation was for 8:30 on Friday night and i showed up at 8:10.  I couldn't believe it - they sat us right away.  Keep in mind there were people in the lobby, outside, in the bar waiting for a table so i'm confident they were holding this table bc they knew i was bringing a baby in a car seat - all on a Friday night.  I've never received such consideration from a restaurant in all of SF.  Many thnaks to the manager, hostesses, and staff.  Oh i almost forgot, the Bistec Tampiquena, Huaraches, and Chili Verde were all great.
author: Michael C.

description: Walked in with no reservation on Tuesday night and were seated right away. Chips and salsa were delicious, probably the best part of the meal. We got the Old School dishes which let you pick out of tacos, enchiladas etc. BF says the taco was good, I got the flauta and enchilada which were both good but nothing to write home about. We both got margaritas which were pretty good (Tropisueno was our favorite). Overall a good place to try out if you're in the area.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Went there for happy hour, and surprise, surprise... that's amazing too.

They have great tapas... I love the flautas and the chicken tacos... and who can turn down one of their delicious signature margaritas? 

Seriously... I love this place.
author: Shawna M.

description: Food was great! My friend and I ordered the chicken soup and a beef enchilada plate and we were definitely full. Both dishes hit the spot. The soup is hearty and has a kick to it and the enchilada was tasty. Restaurant atmosphere is awesome - great for a catch up session with a friend(s). Service was good too - nothing exemplary, but positive. Four things that made me enjoy eating there more- clean bathroom, short time for food to come out, fresh tasting chips, and the  salsa bar.
author: Jess Y.

description:
Medical studies say that up to 75% of our total body weight is made of water.   

Thanks to the bar at Tropisueno, I housed close to 75% of it with the House Margarita through my system during Happy Hours.

Please excuse me now, I think I am gonna have to water the lawn!

--

Translated to English, this place means Tropical Dream.  The salsas and moles here are just that.

I hope all my readers and fans had a great St. Patrick's!
author: CT L.

description: The chips were fresh and tasty, with decent salsa, and the plantains were pretty good (nicely fried and sweet) but everything went a bit downhill from there. The pozole was quite underwhelming (except in the salt department - there, overwhelming). It was too brothy for me - there really wasn't much there. I liked the idea of having shared dishes of beans and tortillas for the table, but the beans were really bland! The service was enthusiastic but spotty. I was surprised at how crowded it was on a Monday night, but I'm still trying to up my opentable points, so no worries there. I don't think I'll be back.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Tacqueria by day, full service sit down at night, and margaritas available in both modes of operation. Damn, that's smart...and works for me. Works for me at least twice a week in fact.

Stand-out items:

-fish tacos
-al-pastor tacos with smoky sweet grilled pineapple on top (dinner menu)
-camarones tropisueno (dinner menu)
-the margaritas rimmed with chile salt

Stick around long enough and you'll leave loving "Tropishhhhueno".
author: Jennifer O.

description: Food was fantastic but don't go an hour before closing! They basically push you out the door. If you don't order another margarita, they will take your glass away (with at least a few sips left in it)!!!!
author: Sangeeta N.

description:
Went there with a friend who found it on her iPhone while we were wandering the city and craving mexican food.
The ambiance was nice, very romantic with candle lit tables and all that.  The waiter was friendly, and we had good service.

The food was ok.  It was sort of 'up scale' taqueria, I suppose, but my problem with it was the cheese.  The cheese in my enchalada and chile relleno was in a word, gummy.  It seemed to have melted with the consistency of a slab of glue, and though the spices in the beans and salsas and sauce were all good, the cheese didn't seemed to be mixed with anything that gave it flavor.

The bottom of the chile relleno was very soggy and the bottom of the enchalada was hard, both of them seeming to have been sitting for a long time.

Overall, go there if you are close by and want some grub, but don't order what I did.
author: Elli J.

description:
I got a response from the restaurant manager/owner? I thought I would share it with everyone. 

Erin, my first trip to Tropisueno was for lunch. Service was okay. Not great, but not bad either considering you only get your food and then sit down to eat it. The second time, my boyfriend and I went for dinner on a Saturday night. It was CRAZY busy,but service was great. We were asked by differernt memebers of your staff how our food was and if we needed anything else. This is why I do not understand why we sat at a table for 30 minutes on a Thursday night without being served. I thank you for your explanation but I hope it does happen to someone else

 Hi Thu,

Erin B. has sent you a message on Yelp:

Your Review

"Hi Thu, 
Michael and I were really disappointed to see this review and know that you had such a crummy experience. I want to thank you for taking the time to yelp because it always gives us such great feedback and helps us make changes. We have looked into the circumstances on that evening. Your server has only been with us for two weeks and he did not know you were in his section. The busser brought the chips and salsa and the waiter just never saw you as "his". Certainly this should not be your problem and I am so sorry that you had your night ruined by it but I just wanted to let you know how it happened. 

I am curious. You have been 3 times (THANK YOU!) and I am wondering how the other experiences were from a service standpoint. While our food is not always perfect, we are confident that it is really tasty most of the time. Service remains our bigger struggle. Any feedback at all would be great to hear. Again, I appreciate the time you spent to review us and look forward to hearing more if you feel like responding. Happy Yelping! Sincerely, Erin Brooks"

To reply, click the link below:
http://www.yelp.com/mail?action_view_message=1&messageid=mR6x219D4vEaR5NXXJh3jQ

See you on Yelp,

The Yelp Team
author: Thu L.

description:
awesome margaritas, free chips and salsa and a great vibe. what could be better? have gone on two occasions and each time the drinks were great and the service was speedy.

we had dinner one evening in addition to drinks and it was fantastic. fiance had one of the steak dishes - it was MASSIVE. flautas and tacos were awesome too.
author: laura f.

description:
They have a good happy hour; it's a great value. Unfortunately it ends at 6pm. They make seriously good margaritas. The chips are lighter then in most Mexican restaurants. Very tasty but a little greasy. 

The dinner menu is solid. I've eaten here several times and never had a bad meal. Not amazing food, but very good and very consistent.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The front desk receptionist was not friendly. The food was good and the waiter for my table was excellent.
author: Athena C.

description:
I had a damn good Camarones (Shrimp) here. Even the rice was extremely good. My dish seemed pretty basic; shrimp, rice, sauce, but wow was it good. 

Free chips w/ red and green salsa. 

I got a Duende Margarita, which was an Absinthe Margarita. I couldn't resist. I'm pretty sure that's the way it's supposed to taste, but I will remember to stick to a normal margarita next time. 

If you drive, park at the Mission & 5th garage.

The free Tres Leches was pretty good (available all through February).
author: Ken L.

description:
Just had a delicious solo dinner at Tropisueno. The wait was kind of long - 30+ minutes for a Tuesday night - but that's probably because of the conference in town. The hostesses were both very nice and accommodating. In fact, all the service was great. Polite and fast, just how I like it. (When it comes to restaurant service, at least...)

For some reason, few of the entrees really screamed EAT ME but ALL of the appetizers did. So I ordered two apps instead of one entree and it was the perfect amount of food. The appetizers really complimented each other too! 

I got:
-Seared scallops over chorizo and plantain hash with avocado tomatillo sauce. Simply divine. The hash was crunchy, it was soft, it was spicy, it was sweet. Everything you could possibly want! Offset by the tangy yet smooth tomatillo avocado salsa (which comes with the chips btw and is to die for). The scallops were seared to perfection and deliciously seasoned.
-Tacos al pastor. These were also very good. Grilled bits of pork with pineapple and more of that delicious green salsa. Like the hash it was meaty and crunchy in parts, soft and sweet in other parts - but this one with a citrus note and delicious corn tortillas. My only complaint was that they were a little too juicy. The brownish juice ran down my sleeve into my new cardigan - sadness!

Total bill: under $20. Now that's what I call a good time.
author: Shelley S.

description:
Great for Happy Hour! You really get more bang for your buck when it comes to food. Plus the chips and salsa, that and a house margarita and you're good to go. May I warn you the drinks are strong. 

A friend and I just missed Happy Hour and wasn't pleased. We had the SCALLOPS and CRISPY FLAUTAS, so delicious! But the service was h-o-r-r-i-b-l-e. The Happy Hour menu was still out so of course, we ordered from it, not caring if the prices were higher. Innocently ordered a quesadilla and the bartender looks at us with a straight face and says, "ABSOLUTELY NOT!" Whoaaaa. Plus we waited 15 mins for our bill, mind you we were sitting at the bar and it was slow. Apparently our tab got lost while they changed shifts. I wasn't too surprised, while sitting there they charged a guy the wrong tab, luckily both parties were still present to pay the right bill.

I'll go back (hopefully write a better review) but only during Happy Hour.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
i love mexican food, that much is apparent. if you've been keeping track, this is the third mexican place i've yelped in a month; the 13th overall. for me, the best mexican restaurants not only have super scrumptious chile rellenos, they're also places that you'd want to kick back and have a few margaritas with friends. tropisueño is definitely a place like that. 

happy hour is only from 4-6pm on weekdays, but if you can get to SOMA by then, it's well worth it. originally $8 margaritas are only $5, and you can get cans of tecate for $3! plus food is at a happy hour price - $2 tacos, $3 for guac and chips or flautas, and ceviche for $4. 

tropisueño's fresh and fun atmosphere is what keeps me coming back. it's perfect for friends from out of town, a ladies night out, after-work happy hours, and even that picky eater you know (cheese enchiladas).
author: Kris G.

description: There aren't many places you can get a non "foofy" margarita in the city. I did, however, thoroughly enjoy the margaritas here.
author: Rachel R.

description:
My first visit to Tropisueño was for the Elite event back in January. The food was really good and I bookmarked Tropisueño in my mental rolodex to try again at a later date. That later date was this past Sunday. The verdict? Still pretty damn good.

We decided to order a few things to split (because sharing is caring!)
Here's what we tried:

-Guacamole: nice size portion with just the right amount of spice.
-Tacos Al Pastor: mmmm, porky goodness! The bits of pineapple added the perfect amount of sweetness.
-Flautas: not bad (how can anything deep fried and covered with sour cream be?) but definitely my least favorite dish we tried.
-Chile Relleno de Picadillo: I love me a good Chile Relleno and Tropisueño's version did not disappoint!

I decided to wash down all this goodness with one of their special margaritas - the Santo featuring St. Germaine elderflower. It was ok, pretty much the lowlight of the meal for me. Next time I will definitely keep it simple and stick to the house margarita.

Did someone say next time? Oh yes, I'll definitely be back soon. Anyone want to share some plates?
author: phil h.

description:
They have my absolute favorite happy hour in the city. $5 for their delicious house margaritas and cheap bar bites.

I stayed for dinner once and it was pretty good. They don't have too many vegetarian options, but the chile rellenos were awesome. Comes with LOTS of rice, beans and tortillas too.
author: Tamara M.

description:
The Camarones Tropisueno (large shrimp in a chili, lime, tomato sauce, maybe some garlic in there too.) was really, really good.  
A house margarita, yes.  Not sure of the tequila used, but it was tasty and a good idea.
Get the ceviche.  Love that stuff.  Tilapia chunks in lime juice and cucumbers and avocado and cilantro.  I'd eat that for lunch everyday if I could.
My wife had the combo plate which was good (a chili relleno, a tamale and an enchilada), but I think I got the better dish.
It's pricier than your typical Mission taquerias, but I truly enjoyed eating there.  And will go back.  Nice work.  
Service was fine.  No issues on the ordering.  Checked on us a few times for refills.  Great time.  Go eat there.
author: Kev M.

description: This restaurant was amazing. We came here on a whim - and there was an hour and a half wait. We got a spot at the bar and sat with an awesome bartender named Roman. He was amazing and the rest of the staff was just as accommodating. I will definitely come back, and well worth the wait!
author: Lori F.

description:
Spectacular !!!!!  Do not pass up the camarone Tropisueno  !!! 
We loved it so much, I  wish I could figure out what's in the sauce.
author: Jay R.

description:
Let me start by saying "DAMN THOSE WERE SOME GOOD ASS CHIPS AND SALASA!" Chips so light with texture and good crunch. For those that would like to try this place, think of Chevys but alot better food and service wise!
The min i walked it it felt like walking to too a Mexican grandmothers house. Very homey. The staff was great our waiter Jorge was prompt and was always around our table if we need anything.

Erin the hostess= Awesome!, she informed me well about how the restaurant is hiring a full time host so reservations can be taken all around.
 
I over ordered a bit not knowing how big their portions were and let me just say, they were filling.

House margarita-8
 Nice bite but smooth.

Toadasa de camarones-8
 (could use alittle more lime but very tasty)

Tampiqueño 14 
Thin, marinated carne asada, topped with grilled green onions with an enchilada. 

The rice was good could use alittle more flavor but the guac with the carne asada. BOMB!

Just remember to get here early or make reservations. Oh and if your not familiar with the city it might take you a while to find the place. Its in a alley tucked away near the Jewish Art museum.  Dont be surprise when this place gets packed. BIG UPS!
author: Brent W.

description: This place has amazing food and prices! We went 2 nights in a row while staying at The Westin on Market St. Superb service too.!
author: Annie P.

description: Food is Great, everything is Fresh, salsa n Chips r yummy. Good ambiance n very affordable prices.
author: Pedro C.

description: I have been dying to go here for a long time! I finally did that and I loved it! We did have a wait and it was ok since my friend and I had a lot of catching up to do. Then when we were seated we were given the chips and salsa quickly. The salsas were AMAZING!! I loved especially the creamy roasted tomato salsa. The we had the los favoritos plate I loved to death the plate but the star was the flauta! I really liked the tamale and its probably the best I have in ages. I liked the enchilada but next time instead of beef I will do chicken and we asked for refried beans but got black but it was all good for me. I will be going back as much as I can and just remember you will have a wait its popular!
author: Nadia N.

description:
Very nice. I enjoyed everything about my meal here. From the food to the décor to the atmosphere. I loved that it's a place to grab a quick lunch, but still felt like a regular restaurant. 

Walking in, you're filtered into the line to order right away. Menu is typical Mexican joint food. Nothing SPECTACULAR, but all satisfactory. Prices are decent. 

I came during the lunch rush hour and it was full, but I didn't have to wait for a seat. The complimentary chips were great. Warm, thin and crispy. My favorite. My burrito was brought to me a lot faster than I thought it would be. Especially with the number of customers, I thought I'd be waiting much longer. 

Very good, until I find a better place near the office, this is my current Mexican-food-fix spot.
author: Jon C.

description: Was excited to try.  Chips and guac was good not great.  Had the fish burrito.  It was bland quite horrible really. Disappointing would not go back.
author: Scott A.

description: This is a great option for lunch if you are visiting the museums. The food is good, service fast and the location fabulous.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
The decor inside is comfortable and appealing.  Whoever designed the interior wanted to make you feel transported to another place, and they've done well.  I especially appreciated the wooden skeleton behind my head while I ate my burrito.

They haven't quite figured out how to service people, though.  They should probably get those card stand things so servers can see your number.  My friend got #12, but the server walked around for 5 minutes looking for #72 even though we insisted that it was definitely her carne asada quesadilla.  I'll forgive them for this, since they're new, and I think they're going to figure this out eventually.

The food for the most part was just okay.  My burrito wasn't anything special, and neither was my friend's 'dilla.  The chips, however, are AMAZING, and to make it even better Tropisueno has an awesome salsa bar complete with all-you-can-eat jalepeno peppers, both grilled and raw.  We screwed around eating a bunch of peppers, crying, panting, and then discovered that the jalepenos had auto-magically transformed our food into yummy.  How?  I don't know.  Maybe it's because we didn't have any water.
author: Jin D.

description:
This restaurant is conveniently set next to the Contemporary Jewish Museum of San Francisco. It beats Chevy's and aspires to be Tommy's. 

I've been to the restaurant three times now and have had the same experience-- very good food but not very good service. At the end of the day, I just can't justify spending money at a restaurant in SF that 2 out of 3 times forgot to bring my side order.
author: Danny E.

description:
Not your typical Mexican Slop house!  Great House Margarita!!
Extremely nice staff!!  I had the Tampiqueño which is Niman Ranch beef, thin-cut carne asada, and served with a beef barbacoa enchilada...wonderful!!!  Tried the Camarones Tropisueño which is a house favorite ...shrimp in an  chile de arbol sauce finished with 
crema, lime juice and cilantro...but you have to like Spicy!!
author: karen d.

description: Wow I can not believe food this good was priced this fair.  So much flavor in each dish.  We tried the enchiladas, tacos and tamales.  For appetizer we had the 3 types of ceviche.  All fresh and delicious.  The place was packed on a Friday night so we did have to wait for 1 hour.  No problem since we got a seat at the bar and that gave us an opportunity to try a unique tequila infused hibiscus drink.  The chips and salsa were very good and we almost filled our tummies with it waiting to be seated.  Only draw back was that it did get pretty loud but after a few drinks I didn't mind.
author: nima s.

description: Great food, good service, delicious chips, guacamole and salsa.  Yum.
author: Brian J.

description: Upgrading because they have an excellent happy hour!  It's only from 4-6pm on weekdays but if you can get there, the food and drink specials are worth coming early.
author: Julie L.

description:
Overpriced for Mexican food. The food had large portions and was certainly tasty, but it was kind of fancy feeling and the prices didn't really match what we were eating. The whole time I was just thinking that we could be spending less than twenty dollars with a magnificent super burrito each, if we were in the Mission. I got the sandals which were deep fried bread/tortilla-like things and a generous portion of meat. They give you a lot of rice with everything which is completely unnecessary in my opinion.The chips and dip in the beginning were pretty great though.

I would warn against the appetizer with mango and shrimp, because the shrimp was way too shrimpy and we both felt a bit woozy afterwards.
author: Shizuka L.

description: Love the atmosphere, the food and the service. I was a little disappointed they didn't have Pina Coladas, Coffee or old skool Mexican grub. I'll definitely be back though.
author: Yoni D.

description: Came here for lunch and it was good. I love the decor and ambiance of Tropisueno and when I went here it was already packed. So what you do is you order and pay upfront, then chose a place to sit, and they bring out your food for you. The prices are sooo reasonable considering the location. I ordered the enchiladas which came with a small salad and some rice and beans. The next time I came here it was for a late lunch and drinks and I don't know if it was the margaritas I drank or what....but when I came home I took a nap and upon waking up I threw up....So I had both a good and bad experience here....The food you can't go wrong with though. I honestly think it had to be something in my margarita.....
author: Diane L.

description: Nice start to the San Francisco leg of our vacation. Knowing we'd be hungry after our flight I had researched good cheap eats near our hotel in the Financial District and Tropisueno seemed to be the consensus; it did not disappoint. Great casual, inexpensive Mexican fare. As you enter a blackboard lists the menu which features massive burritos for just $6.95 (a venue back home touts burritos bigger than your head and these were even larger), tortas (Mexican sandwiches), tacos and other typical fare. You place your order at a counter, customize your extras (some included such as choice of beans, some extra such as guacamole, sour cream and mole sauce and grab a seat (inside or al fresco) where your food is delivered. While you wait you receive complimentary tortilla chips and access to a salsa bar with a myriad of options. Caution if sitting al fresco; do not leave any food unattended or the local pigeons will help themselves. The interior is set up like Mexican cantina and has a full bar if you want a margarita or what not with your grub, there is even Mexican coke. Arriving in between lunch and dinner on a werkday there was no line and ample seating. We both great enjoyed our burritos and would likely gain a few pounds if this place opened up in our neighborhood in Chicago!
author: Erick N.

description: It gets a little loud in this restaurant but it has the best Mexican food I have ever had! I highly recommend it!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Lunch Review:

Went on a Monday at about 12:15pm and the line wasn't too bad. I was expecting a huge line from reading some of the reviews but the time spent in line was probably a total of 7 minutes including ordering and paying. After paying, you get a number if you're eating in and they'll bring the food to you. Sometimes they have it already at the cash register if it's a simple burrito or chips. 

The menu has all the typical fare including guacamole chips, nachos oversized burritos, taco truck style tacos, cheesy enchiladas, chile rellenos, and combination plates. 

I got a combination plate with enchilada and chile rellenos, very solid fare. My girlfriend got the burrito. Guacamole chips appetizer were good as well with the semi-salty chips, mmm. My gf and I are light eaters so neither of us finished our food. In hindsight, we probably could have shared an entree so recommendation for those couples who eat light, simply share an entree and get an appetizer. I also got the cantaloupe agua fresca, which was good stuff, not too sweet like some places would have it. 

I liked the atmosphere and design of the place. Once you sit down, you really don't feel like you're in the middle of downtown. Rather, you get the sense that you're in Mexico having a lunch, away from all the hustle and bustle of the working city.

Overall, it's definitely a good place to have a sit-down lunch (as well as takeout) if you're in the mood for Mexican food at reasonable prices.
author: David N.

description: Simply fantastic Mexican food. Great place with super friendly staff and priced.right
author: Eric T.

description: Always a long line at lunch, but the handle it well.  If you're afraid of dirty taquerias, this is a nice, clean alternative.  Good happy hour prices too.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: well woth the wait. Thank you to all the people who wrote reviews for this place. SF is known for their great food, this place is why. I live in So Cal and we have great mexican food but id fly back up just for this place. its a little spicy but it its so good. the chips and the salsa was great the green salsa was my favorite. I got the chicken mole because of all the yelp reviews and I wasnt disappointed. go early or make a reservation. We waited about 30 mins for a table for 2.
author: Devon A.

description:
i got an email from the owner about my yelp review. Very kind and polite and invited me back to try the dinner where they turn in to a full restaurant with waiters etc.
I ordered the plantains and mahi mahi and chips with salsa (2 diff. kind) came as well.
i LOVED it! 
Dinner was a totally different experience than my lunch and now i think i will go there for either occasion. 
Thank you for the email- i wouldn't have came back for dinner but  i am so glad i did give it a try!
I will be back.
author: C A.

description: Excellent food, attentive service! No disappointments. Ask for the prickly pear margaritas to get things rolling.
author: Ken A.

description: Trio salsas are the bomb, especially because they are free. House margaritas hit the spot, and I appreciate the spin with chili salt rimmed glasses. Get the scallop, shrimp and salmon ceviches. We also had the carne asada with black beans and a barbacoa enchilada - liked it very much. Overall, a good value. Highly suggest a reservation, but even with our 9:30 seating the place was still buzzing when we left an hour later.
author: Sam P.

description:
Imagine my review below. Can you taste the salsa and black beans? Bueno. 

Now imagine you've decided to make that lunch a bit more festive with a margarita. And not just any margarita, but one where the well tequila is El Jimador, the lime juice is so fresh you can taste the tree, and the glass is rimmed with arbol chili salt.

The cool thing is you don't have to imagine this anymore. You can live the dream, right here. Ask for Rodrigo and tell him Nish sent you. Adios, and see you at the bar for happy hour sometime.
author: Nish N.

description: I like their veggie stew/soup which has corn dumpling-like bites in it. Packs just the right punch. Can't wait to go back. Tried their tacos too which were above average but nothing spectacular. Margaritas are decent.
author: Natasha I.

description: It was an OK place to grab some Mexican food.  The entire staff was friendly, our food arrived quick, and the prices were good.  The seasoning is OK but different than you normally find.  Fountain drinks, lemonade and such can be expensive as you purchase those from the bar.  Would be OK for smaller groups of no more than 6 for they don't have a lot of space.  I wouldn't go out of the way to eat here again as so many other places near by but as stated it was an okay place.
author: John F.

description: I'm generally wary of Mexican restaurants outside the Mission but this one impresses me more and more every time. You can't go wrong with any of the menu items (the rice is fresh as are the tamales and enchiladas), the portions are generous, and the ambiance is really nice. I have yet to be disappointed! Will for sure be back to try everything else.
author: Z L.

description:
Two words: CHICKEN MOLE.

I love this restaurant. First time here, I went with a girlfriend. I ordered the chicken mole and she ordered the Camarones Tropisueño (shrimp in some kind of tasty lime sauce). The mole sauce was the tastiest I've had, easily better than any other Mexican restaurant I've been to. The chips were fresh and plentiful. The salsa was delicious (both red and green varieties) and service was fast and attentive.

Second time here was only three days after my first visit. Some friends came to visit from Vancouver and they were dying to eat Mexican food. I guess good Mexican food is in short supply up in Canada, eh? This time I ordered the chili rellenos. My guests loved the chips and salsa so much, they asked for a second filling long after the bill was paid and the waiter had packed our leftover food away.

Entrees come with delicious Mexican rice and a choice of beans: pinto, black, or white. Normally, I prefer black beans over white beans, but the white beans they serve are a delicious buttery texture.

In sum, eat here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Kel S.

description:
The moment I took a bite of the chips, I knew I would give the place 5 stars. They are fresh out of the kitchen, warm, light, and perfectly salty.

The house margarita has chili pepper flakes mixed in with the salt. The guacamole is out of this world.

My date ordered the free range chicken and couldn't stop talking about it afterward.

My meal was the steak + enchilada and I would order it again.

I live in the Mission, but this place has the best Mexican I've had in SF.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food, but I really like this place. 
It's miles better than the nasty Chevys of the world and you don't have to venture into the Mission for quality Mexican food in the city

The Chips + Salsa was good, my shrimp plate with rice was great and it came up to only $20! 
The ambience is rather dark but fun. 
I'll definitely be back when i'm craving Mexican!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Serious props to the bartender who didn't even blink when six black and camouflaged twenty-somethings complete with face paint came barreling into this establishment in desperate search of one margarita. 

Nope, not six, or five, or even three. Just one. With six straws.

Oh, and an extra glass which was then to be used to make a 'salsa suicide', complete with onion and cilantro garnish at the salsa bar. So one other person could drink it straight. 

Not only did this bartender not even flinch, he straight up offered a basket of chips to go with it. 

These six potential nutcases (including myself) proceeded to take down the one margarita split six ways, the entire basket of chips, and the salsa suicide in two minutes flat, all while filming the action as if we were videotaping an improv sketch for the insane asylum's upcoming Talent Show. Again, no surprise from the bartender, despite at least a dozen crosseyed looks from other dining patrons. 

Once we were finished with our improv sketch, we proceeded to dart from the table at the speed of light, say our thanks, and race out the door. Oh, and we left Mr Bartender a phatty tip. It's service like that, along with 1/6 of a killer margarita, and a handful of hot, fresh AMAZING chips and salsa, that get this place five stars. And of course putting up with five crazed yelpers on a race for time loony scavenger hunt. Then again, considering the 'Yelp Cafeteria' nickname, I'm sure Tropisueno didn't think twice..As they say, know your audience.

Thanks Tropisueno! Te amo mucho!
author: Veronica R.

description:
Mmmm .... burritos ...

Good, solid Mexican food in a slightly upscale and trendy dining environment.  While I appreciate the authenticity of the more typical, grungy taqueria, sometimes it's nice to have a pretty place to eat your chips and salsa.

I've only visited during the lunch hour, always wishing a siesta could ensue.  Delicious vegetarian burrito.  Good quesadillas.  Decent enchiladas, but a little disappointing.  Yummy, fresh chips and a salsa bar come included with an entree.

Conveniently located near the Metreon and downtown shopping.
author: Jamie T.

description:
This is my go-to lunch spot during stressful work days. Mexican food is the ultimate comfort food and having this walking distance to my work is a blessing lol. 

Walking in I immediately feel transported somewhere else, i definitely do not feel as though I am standing inside somewhere in downtown San Francisco the decor is nice but even nicer is the food!

I love the burritos here especially the grilled shrimp burrito but I can only ever finish half if i expect to actually get any work done after lunch...the tortas are great as well, a bit messy but the toasted outside with the soft delicious filling is fantastic although some days I skip both of these and just get the nachos loaded with everything and my meat of choice would have to be the carnitas...yummmmm. 

They also have a good salsa bar and i usually opt for the orange sauce/salsa and the salsa verde (i like the creamy green one maybe it has avo in it) it has a nice acidity to balance out the meat. 

Food comes out quick and they have great homemade chips that are complimentary..all in all a great lunch spot for a decent mexican feast.
author: Cristina F.

description:
Call em Mexican Martinis (as we occasionally reference them in Austin), vodka margaritas or what have you: there's a whole subset of the margarita imbibing public that likes his or her margarita with vodka instead of tequila, thanks very much.  That was certainly the case when a handful of us Yelp folk stopped in for a get-together here, in what has apparently become familiar as a regular Yelp hangout.

They seem to take great pride in mixology, and each our cocktails (margaritas and Mexican martinis alike) were handmade and tasty looking. I, being more of an eccentric brew fan, sipped on a couple of Negro Modelos, which treated me just fine.  And no matter how busy they got here, these guys never seemed overmatched.  That's what I call skillz, ya'll.
author: Kevin N.

description: This place was crazy busy when my wife and I went there, luckily we had a reservation so we didn't have to wait in line.  Even if you did have to wait, the food would have been worth it.  We shared several of the smaller appetizer portion entrees.  Next time we're in San Fran we will definitely have to head back.  Don't get the barbacoa tacos, I didn't think they were all that great.  Next time I'm there, I'm going to have to get one of the entree dishes, they looked fantastic.  FYI.  They charge this rediculous surcharge for the San Fran healthcare law as if there aren't enough taxes in CA.
author: Tom H.

description:
I love happy hours.  So much so that I went to two happy hours today (perhaps disclosing this fact might not be such a good idea in my first Yelp review, but hey, let's be honest here-- I love my happy hours!).  A little bit ridiculous to go to two in one day, perhaps, but nonetheless worth it.  

I was planning to spend one hour at Tropisueno and the second hour at the other bar, but I definitely enjoyed Tropisueno so much that I stayed later than planned.

I've been to Tropisueno once before-- and I loved it that time!  So since then, we've been itching to return.  The $5 margaritas, which come with a disclaimer warning of high alcohol content (which is the best kind of disclaimer, in my opinion), are tasty.  They were strong enough to make two of my friends tipsy to the edge of drunkenness after two margaritas by the time we left.  

This time, I just had the chicken quesadilla ($5).  They got my order wrong at first, bringing out a cheese quesadilla instead of quesadilla con pollo (chicken quesadilla), and although I told our waiter it was okay and to forget about it, a minute later he brought a chicken quesadilla for me anyway.  How could I turn that down? I couldn't.  So I got to try the chicken quesadilla, which was juicy and cheesey and good.  

My friends ordered tacos (beef) and ceviche.  I absolutely adore ceviche.  Tropisueno's ceviche is pretty good, but I wish the fish had been a little fresher this time around.  I thought the "fishy" flavor was a little strong compared to the first time I had ceviche at Tropisueno.  But for the price, I cannot complain at all.  And with the bottomless tortilla chips and salsa, I would definitely recommend this place.  

Note:  I would only come here for happy hour.  My cousin and I walked by Tropisueno in the fall while looking for a place to eat, and on a whim we walked into Tropisueno . . . then walked right back out.   It's not a "cheap eats" restraurant, and although it's priced at about average for a dinner in San Francisco, I would tell the intrepid explorer to go specifically for the happy hour in order to eat, drink, and be merry!
author: Jeanne Y.

description: We arrived at around 4pm on a Saturday and it was kind of chaotic. It was not clear where to go and who was in charge. Once we figured out that you order at the window we took a seat in the bar (not at the bar). It took sometime to realize that no one was going to take a drink order, so we walked up to the bar to order. The restaurant opens at 5:30pm, and it was then that our table in the bar started to get regular service. Once we figured out how it all worked, we really enjoyed ourselves. The food was very tasty. I would definitely go back.
author: Meg M.

description:
I started with a mistake - thinking I made a 6:30 reservation when I actually made a 6. They were very accommodating and we were seated at about 6:50. The only reason I took a star off was because it was so unbelievably hot in there. To the point where its uncomfortable enough where you just want to leave. But, the three of us stayed.
It started with 3 red sangrias, which were good, but made to order. I prefer the sangria that's been soaking in the fruit all day - isn't that the point?
The chips for the table and the 3 sauces were very good. The orange one is very hot, so be careful.
I had the Tampiquano. I'm not usually a carne asada fan because the meat is usually very tough and not to flavorful. This changed my tune on carne asada after one bite. The meat was cooked and seasoned very well. It also came with a beef enchilada. I am an enchilada fan and I deal ok with some heat, but thing was hot. Took a couple of bites, it burned, but I liked the taste enough to go in for a couple more at the end.
My wife had the chicken with mole poblano and she said it is the best chicken at a Mexican place she has ever had. She got all the way through it before I thought to ask for a taste! She said it was just the right amount of heat and the chicken was super moist.
No dessert. I love the location, just a quick step over to the Press Club for a night cap.
author: Jon P.

description:
Finally, finally, finally!!  Today, I finally was able to find out what all the fuss was about.

I had the opportunity to go for lunch and believe me when I say, I'll be here at least 1x / week!  WOW!

The Ceviche Tostada was killer!  It was light, the tilapia was fresh and it was served on a small tostada shell.  Perfection realized.

I also ordered the guac and as usual, devoured all the chips before my food came so I 'had' to share my tostada & I didn't roll out of there.  Big chunks of avocado really made this guacamole great.

Baja fish taco... yum!!!  The batter was light and crispy and since I ate all the chips, I piled loads of guac on top and made it even better.  I mean, what is not better with guacamole?! 

My friend ordered the horchata and I insisted he give me a taste (or 5) and it was really good.  I opted for my fav, Fizzy Lizzy.  They have this at my favorite Puerto Rican restaurant (Sol Food) and I'm starting to think this is a good sign.

The 2 item combo looked delicious and was a huge portion.  I didn't try it, but this non-Yelper says, "it was good.. the food overall was ok... out of 5 stars it gets 3.3...  the guac though was good... the ceviche was delicious"  Sounds like you may want to skip the carnitas taco / flautas combo and go my way ;)

I was extremely happy and full leaving Tropisueno.  Not only was the food great, but the atmosphere was comfortable & casual yet polished.

If I hadn't left so full, I may have actually stepped into Beard Papa next door instead of fantasized about it.  Phew!
author: Lauren C.

description: It gets super crowded, so I usually take my orders to-go. I've only had their quesadilla a few times, but it's been wonderful. There was one order in which they forgot to include the sour cream/guacamole, but it wasn't a big deal.
author: T M.

description:
Slow/indifferent service complimented by mediocre food. I have eaten here several times before (my wife likes the place) and have been underwhelmed every time; yet somehow it is packed. We waited a solid ten minutes for someone to take our drink order and then waited over an hour for our entrees. I received a smallish dried out pork chop.....pretty average. In fairness, I had ordered the pork chop before and it was bigger and juicer, but this was pretty small. Given that I munched away on chips during the hour I waited I was not really hungry by the time the food arrived anyway (maybe that is their strategy?)

My wife's shrimp entree was pretty average too, it was advertised as spicy, and maybe it is for the folks in Kansas, but to my taste pretty mild. The only good thing was the price point, one hundred bucks for four adults with drinks, not bad, but I didn't really enjoy the food, which is really the whole point of eating out. Also did I mention how crazy loud it was.  Yet the masses still  come  to genuflect at this shrine to mediocrity..................................
author: Eric R.

description: Cool environment, yummy food and margaritas!
author: Ashley P.

description: authentic Mexican food here!!! I usually consider eating here when I'm at downtown SF and would like to have some Mexican food.
author: Lily W.

description:
-Excellent service. There was nothing I could have wanted that I didn't have before I wanted it. Very impressive!

-Great ambiance. Comfortable, warm and inviting. Loved the lighting.

-Good food, although a bit on the heavy-side. A little light on the vegetarian options though. Flavorful dishes.
author: Charles B.

description:
I like this place....plain and simple.

In a sea of expensive restaurants in the FiDi, this place offers affordable food at lunch that tastes freshly made.  I ordered the Mole cheese enchiladas and they were very tasty.  My friend ordered the chicken enchiladas with mole sauce and was equally pleased.  At the end of the meal both of our plates looked as if they had been licked clean.  We didn't, we didn't.

This place is billed as a Mexican kitchen and it holds true to its marketing niche.  There are no waiters.  Instead you order your food from a serving line and a runner brings it to your table when it is ready.  Think of this restaurant as an upgrade from all of the places you would normally find in the Mission.  

I enjoyed it and I am looking forward to my return.
author: Richard R.

description: Food was good, but the cafeteria style service was ridiculous.  Why this place is not using waiters to sell more food, drinks and improve customer satisfaction is beyond me.  Very strange set-up and was uncomfortable enough for me that I wouldn't go back.
author: Evan L.

description: I love this place!!!  It's close to work and they have some really good tacos.  The margarita's are the best!  I usually come here for lunch or happy hour and I'm always pleased.  This place gets really busy so get there early and make sure to order yourself a margarita.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
What?

I walk by this place every day and I never noticed there was a Mexican joint here? Man, I am losing my touch. Oh well, luckily for me, I had another Steph in tow and she suggested we nosh on some tacos at this here lunch spot. Rumored the Yelp cafeteria, I figured it was a good bet for some solid food and I am happy to report that it was, indeed, a nice lunch.

I went with the chicken taco and a fish taco and while I generally prefer a more charbroiled approach to chicken in my tacos, this was good and marinated in something tasty that made it super tender. One goof on their part is I asked for no onions ( I loathe raw onions as much as I loathe a long line for the ladies restroom) and I sadly, got a mountain full of them on said taco, so minus a point for not listening, but otherwise, this was a solid place and I will return another day for some noontime grubage.
author: Stephy S.

description: tomatillo avocado salsa!!! yum!  The pepper brined pork chop was amazing!  Great prices, great service!
author: Rebecca W.

description: The food here was really good but I wish the service and set up was a little different.  I'm all about ordering and and then paying afterwards but Tropisueno took it to another level where you ordered then had to turn a little corner and tell the cashier what you just ordered.  It seemed a little clunky to me especially when there were a couple of us and there was only one person paying.  Then some food was given to us right away and other was delivered.  I must say that the ambiance and food was really good though so that made up for it...a little bit.
author: Blake B.

description: I am such a fan of this place! Their margaritas and tequila are awesome, and the food is absolutely amazing. My favorite dish is the chile relleno, so tasty!  I also love the classy vibe of this place, and consider it a favorite of mine when downtown and craving some Mexican food!
author: Bridget B.

description:
When we arrived during Happy Hour--around 5pm--and were told we were too early to be seated for dinner. Instead, we camped out at the bar and enjoyed a few good drinks and took in the great decor.. After an hour, we asked our bartender if we could switch to a table for dinner. He said he'd get someone to help us, but that help never arrived. Instead, we waited awkwardly for about 10 minutes while Happy Hour drunks angrily eyed us and coveted our spot. Minus 1/2 star.

We go up and walked near the entrance and were given a table. Maybe they didn't have enough servers working, but ours came by very infrequently--minus 1/2 star.

The food was four-stars worthy. I got the chili verde, which was VERY good. And so where the white beans. But the mediocre service bumps this place down to three stars.
author: Gina D.

description: We were looking for a good Mexican restaurant with warm ambiance and we found it! Every dish we tasted was delicious and our server Eliseo was great!  Definitely will return!
author: Jennie C.

description: Food is good, but the restaurant just wants to turn tables. Server tried to rush us through dinner / dessert / drinks, and gave us dirty looks when we didn't leave shortly after the hour. After spending $120+ I expected better service.
author: J. M.

description: Yowza. This place is wacky good. Massive potions, fresh food, friendly staff. Can't go wrong.
author: Mark B.

description: Super busy at lunchtime on a workday (duh!) but my group of four ordered & got a table, our food, & drinks from the bar with minimal (less than 5 mins) wait. BIG plates of food, and very tasty all around.
author: Julie M.

description:
House margaritas have a lot of kick, yes they do. Accompany that with the tons of good salsa and fresh melt-in-your mouth chips...oh man!

Came here last weekend since I was chaperoning my brother's prom and me and the hub needed a place to relax and enjoy each other's company. It was a Saturday night and the wait was pretty long: 45 minutes. That gave me enough time to go buy some sexy heels at the nearby Ross since the pair I had on were giving mama some pain. Got my shoes within a half an hour and when we came back our table was ready. Lovely.

Sat down in a lively room with dim lights and were immediately served the best chips and salsa ever. My sweetie was all over the smoked red pepper salsa and we ordered our house margaritas. At first glance upon receiving them, you're like, "Right, this is gonna be good? Look how small this glass is?" Do not be fooled. This margarita packs a punch and is delicious to boot! Pair that with your salsa and chips and I'm good until dinner comes. We decided to order tapas style and ordered the empanadas, pork tacos, and grilled shrimp. We were still hungry and later decided to order the fish ceviche. Everything was so amazing. The flavors settles nicely and stayed with me all night. The portions are perfect and you won't feel overstuffed. The environment was a mix of couples an d families without screaming kid fest. The rooms are packed but not uncomfortably so. Very comfy ambiance and great location in the heart of Embarcadero. Chaperoning Prom night was so much more that that after heading here for dinner.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I suggested meeting at Tropisueno since it was near where I needed to be later that night.  Plus, I could walk there.

We didn't have a reservation but it was early so the place was pretty empty.  My friend had had a long night the night before so wanted something hearty.  I felt like I had been eating all day so I wanted the opposite.

We started with the guacamole which was great and the chips and salsa they provided were as good as I remembered from the Elite event a while back.    We had the pollo asada and the mahi mahi as entrees. While my friend seemed to enjoy the chicken, my fish didn't taste so fresh.  It smelled stronger than I prefer.  

The portions were a good size and prices were typical for the area.  Service was off that night but not too bad. I'd be willing to go back and try other stuff, I guess.
author: Seong P.

description:
It took awhile, but we finally found a Mexican restaurant in the city not named Chevy's that we like. 

This location, while looking small from the exterior, is actually fairly large inside. The food is top notch, especially the rice, while the portions are satisfying. The complimentary range of salsa is also great.

On the downside, the water is room temperature, which is no bueno. It's a small complaint in the grand scheme of things though.

Overall, good place, which we would recommend and will probably be back to at some point in time.
author: Sami R.

description: Good happy hour.  Lots of cheap yummy items on the HH menu and good cheap margaritas.  The bar fills fast so the earlier you can get there the better.
author: Heather S.

description:
WOW!! What a great hidden treasure in San Francisco!

Tropisueno is a great place to get your weekend started!

My best friend suggested we try something new and she picked this place based on all the great yelp reviews!  And all you yelpers, you sure know how to pick a great place for Mexican food!

When we got there on Friday night, the place was packed! The bar was in full swing and all the tables were full! It was going to be a 40 minute wait on a Friday night! But we decided to wait! After about 30 minutes, a bar area freed up and we were seated there and our adventure began! 

The chips & salsa were absolutely amazing! (Mind you, I'm a  picky salsa eater but these made my taste buds dance!) We ordered organic Margaritas that were made just right! Left a big smile on my face! Since we were a group of 4, we decided to order a bunch of appetizers! We ordered the platanos, the shrimp, the flautas, and tacos al pastor! It was all so good, we even repeated on a few plates!! And the prices are great, the appetizers range from $6 to $10!  And the Margaritas at $8! 

The only drawback was that the drunk people were getting just too loud and we couldn't hear each other anymore! 

Overall, this is an excellent place for a delicious Mexican Meal! Next Time, I will be there for HAPPY HOUR so I don't have to wait 35 minutes to sit at the bar!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
My first meal after arriving in SF after 20+ years.

I was VERY satisfied. 

Came in for a quick lunch right after getting into town, just stumbled upon this place. 
The chips and salsa (free with meal order) were fabulous. I had a cheese  chili relleno with rice and beans and it KICKED ASS! Wicked cheap too! Like $6.95 or something. 
Gotta be the best deal in town. Also not greasy, so I felt great after leaving.
I'd go here for lunch every day if I lived in this neighborhood.
author: Ken C.

description:
The chips are so good here I could eat 4 bowls of the stuff. They are light warm and crispy, paired with the salsa and guac, I was almost completely full from this along with a margarita. 

Let me start by saying, my perpetual lateness was trying to arrive somewhat on time for my college group of friends. I am notoriously known for being late with them, and not my coworkers. Go figure? But then at work we had this regular happy hour and we ended up chatting so then crap, and wait I need gas for my car. 

Rushing we get up to the city and park and we're 15 mins late. When we arrive basically the people cheered and said I must not have planned the timing of arrival because 15 mins was the best lateness I've had in the past year. *sigh* Epic sadness.

Sitting down I order a strong margarita and start the noshing on the delicious chips. For dinner I ordered the pork chop, which was so awesomely good. It was tender, moist and that perfect light pink inside. I wish I had ordered more of the salad instead of the rice for the plate because I had been so full from the chips. Nevertheless I wolfed down the meat.

And for dessert they had Chupa Chups! I love those things. I got the cherry flavor. 

Service was fantastic as well, the wait staff kept refilling our glasses of water even though we had a pitcher on our table. Not to mention that the Ambassador to Columbia was dining there that same night. 

I think the only problem I had was, it was so hard to find the restaurant since the symbol on the door is just a T.
author: Jessica C.

description: Great stop for lunch and after work cocktails.  They offer a great special(*bring 5 friends to the bar and host drinks FREE).  Food cooked to order, fresh, casual, and large portions.
author: Carmen T.

description:
My girlfriend and I decided to spend our after-Thanksgiving-weekend in the city (we live in Oakland), and have a great time. For dinner on Sunday we decided to hit Tropisueno, since some days earlier we had seen a review of this place on Check, Please (public TV).

From the moment you enter the place, it feels warm and cozy. The service is very friendly. Immediately, we were served with chips and salsas (four different kinds). All of them were wonderful!

We started ordering a couple of margaritas: they were very good.

For dinner, she had the chile verde, which she loved. I was undecided, since everything on the menu sounded so good, so asked the waiter and he suggested the mole poblano (the best in SF, he said), so I went for it. I have to say it was kind of flavorless. I am a Mexican, and haven't had mole poblano for years, so my expectations were higher. Still I think maybe it can be the best in SF, but being used to the mole poblano from Mexico, this one was a little disappointing. The tortillas were not very good either, just ok.

Still, we will come back to give a try to the carne tampiquena and, specially, the caldo de mariscos.
author: alejandro z.

description: Our first time here was a Friday night, we made reservations and were seated right away. Started our night off with the house margaritas which were great (very strong) and then had the flautas. It came with only 2 on the plate so we all sorta wished that the starters were more for sharing rather than an individual serving. Our server was very attentive and we all enjoyed the food. I had the vegetarian pozole which was very spicy but good. I'm not a flan fan so we skipped out on desert, but all in all I would go back, it was a good experience.
author: Tori M.

description: OMG for the record: best mole poblano EVER, nice portions, great salsas, yummy margaritas, friendly service they have it all!! quiero mole poblano mas pronto que de inmediato!!
author: Ana G.

description:
Stopped here for a couple of Margaritas, chips, and an appetizer before taking in a movie.  I couldn't have been happier with the experience, and I look forward to doing it again in the future.

Looking forward to having dinner nest time.
author: Travis S.

description:
Haven't tried it yet because while the ACTUAL website (not even the one that is linked from Yelp) says that they offer home delivery, I heard from a very snooty hostess that they don't actually do any delivery except for corporate. 

After I called and was perturbed, another friend suggested that I wasn't nice enough and called back regarding pick up. Previously mentioned hostess (or whoever picks up the phone) was entirely UNhelpful regarding entree options and was also snooty about the pick up time and availability.

Seriously, check out my reviews. I don't give 1 star lightly.

Maybe I'll try them in person, but it's unlikely. In SOMA, there are just too many restaurants to try for me to bother with someone I've had a bad experience with.
author: Jenni C.

description:
My friend and I commenced our birthday celebration with dinner at Tropisueno.  Despite an initial mix up with the reservations, the staff was friendly and helpful and able to seat our party of 15 quickly (once we were all present).  

The food was good, but what I ordered was not quite on par with what I've had at other upscale Mexican restaurants in the city such as Colibri and Mamacita's (it's much better than Tres Agaves, though).  I ordered the Pozole Vegetariano, which I did not realize was soup until it arrived at the table.  I thought it was flavorful, but another friend who had the same dish claimed it was too salty.  For what it's worth, I heard a lot of positive comments on the food from the table.  The complimentary guacamole was delicious (I think it was on the house because we were a large group).  I like that Tropisueno has numerous vegetarian options on the menu (there is a separate vegetarian dinner menu that is not posted online).  Beware, though, the margaritas are strong!  

In sum, I think that Tropisueno is a great place for a large group if you are looking for a moderately-priced option downtown.
author: Grace W.

description:
Since i am extremely busy today, and mired in deep fathoms of fuckery....

Ill do a play by play of me eating my order....which consisted of a baja fish taco, and a chicken taco.

1. Opened box of chicken taco. Phone rings...blah blah blah.....fuckery.
2. Took bite...a little dry, salsa nice and spicy, yes im working on it...no you cant.
3. One more bite, still a little dry, fuck i got salsa on my new jeans, fuck everything and all that is holy, im so pissed. Fuck you stop staring at me, throws Sharpie.
4. Finishes taco, follows up with water. Holy shit...this water tastes like a 4 year old dish sponge. Cilantro is awesome right now.

Fish taco....
1. Take a bite....crispy outside, fish (tilapia?) is fresh, Its a fish taco, no you cannot....bullshit, tell him ill get back to him, im eating, you fucking PorkWallace...
2. Goddamn....lime flavor galore, sour cream is a little thick, fuck these emails, punches desk, oops there's HR...hi, yes...im fine.
3. Sip of water....fuck oh yeah....sponges....fish taco alleviates flavor, steals soda off neighbor's desk....fuck, how old is this? Its flat and...oh shit HR...no, really, im fine....the vein is always there.
4. Last bite, extra crunchy, i love it....perfect amount of sour cream, i swear, i will put my hand through this wall if i get another email about....GAH...sponge water? Why do i keep forgetting.
5. Licks taco box to get sponge flavor out of mouth....Oh, theres HR...mandatory meeting? Now? Im ok, i just....ok....give me 5 minutes.

Gotta go.
author: Mick F.

description:
I was there with a friend from out of town for happy hour and we had a great time
The margaritas were really good and only$5, appetizers cheap and good too
Jimmy the server was great, terrific customer service
We were so pleased that my friend wanted to go back the next day
author: Rolando S.

description:
Tropisueno has bueno food, service and better than decent prices for the Yerba Buena area. I had pork tamales with bean and rice. I've had better tamales at Mi Pueblo, but really WTF do I know about how a tamale should taste? I mean, I gave Lee Chen's Taqueria (http://www.yelp.com/biz/fresh-tortillas-south-boston) 4 stars for Jesus' sake.

As any Dios fearin' gringo worth his la sal will tell you, we *know* Mexican food. And by *know*  I mean we have no GD idea.  
Overall, Tropisuenos is mas o menos. But cheap. I have failed my family so badly.
author: Francis S.

description:
The food was absolutely amazing.

Things we ordered:
- Guacamole
- Salmon, scallops, and shrimp ceviche trio
