Wondered what all the hype was abt this restaurant. Long wait times intrigued me, but now I know it was for the drinks. Based on what I had, there's no reason for me to go back. Chile verde came out in minutes--close to seconds, indicating a nice plate of microwaved food. The verde was over salted and the meat was quickly disintegrating, which could mean it had been sitting in the refridge for awhile. the rice was bland and did not taste fresh. 

Service was really great, and the restaurant space is Inviting. This alone, earns it 2 stars.
author: louise f.

description:
came here on a lark to meet a colleague. 
Did the Mole Poblano w/chicken. Truly amazing.
I didn't really expect it to be quasi-taqueria style, but it has a full bar and a really nice dining room, so it totally works. It was working lunch, so didn't get a chance to test the cocktails, but jamaica was good.
author: pedro w.

description: Our standard pit stop for all out-of-towners: go grab a couple of drinks at The View, and then head down to Tropisueno for a lovely Mexican meal. The food is great (special mention to the mole, is perfection!), the Margharitas fantastic (and strong), the chips and dips never ending, all in a cute, intimate setting. Oh and it is Bart-able. I am sold!
author: Ishita G.

description: one tequila two tequila three tequila FLOOR. hahahahahahahaha. anyhoo, here at Tropisueno, unlike many other local Mexi restaurants, they ACTUALLY PUT TEQUILA IN THE MARGARITAS. oh yes they do. the food is pretty darn good and creative for nouvelle mex. from what i remember. looking forward to a sober return. hahahahahahahahaha.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: My favorite happy hour spot! i have yet to have a dish that wasnt amazing!! The bartenders are super friendly and fun to be around while you eat..
author: Chris B.

description: Amazing chips and salsa.  Awesome atmosphere, great Margaritas, and tasty food.
author: Matt A.

description: Chips and salsa ... excellent . Specialty margaritas ... excellent . Hostess and Bartenders ....  excellent . You don't need to go down to the Mission  to get  great authentic mexican dishes ... GO HERE ! Guacamole was great as well as the enchiladas and salmon . I had the Chile Verde which was as tender and tasty as my grandmother's when she made it years ago  . We will definitely be back !
author: Shawn F.

description:
I want to give this place 5 stars for the chips alone.  They are the freaking best chips I've ever had at any Mexican restaurant, and this is coming from someone who isn't even a fan of tortilla chips (unless they're Doritos).

But sadly, I won't give Tropisueño 5 stars because for some weird reason, they took a lifetime and a half to get me my order of 2 fish tacos.  I doubt the fish is so fresh that they went out of their way to catch it, so puh-lease don't make me wait that long.

At least I had the most amazing chips ever to tie me over until then.
author: L Y.

description: Loved the variety of Salsa.  The margaritas were really good and the service was top notch.
author: Greg G.

description: Food was strictly average, especially given the abundance of Mexican food in the area. Salsas were nice, but chips very greasy.  Ditto for the scallop appetizer, which was on a bed of very oily chorizo. Retried beans wereremarkably, pretty lousy.  Plus the place is so noisy, forget about any meaningful conversation.
author: Clemencia C.

description: Absolutely delicious!  We were in San Fran on vacation for about a week... and even with all of the good food around the Union Square area, we had to eat there twice!  Go there if you're in the area... you won't be disappointed!
author: Dan W.

description:
I am VERY torn between 3 and 4 stars for this place, and I'm willing to give it a second shot because of the great reviews and what I think is 4 star potential. 

The story of the missing guac
Reservations and seating were a breeze. Unfortunately, other things weren't so easy. We were sitting eating our chips and salsa (which were delicious) for literally 15 minutes before a server came over to ask what we wanted. We ordered guac to start, two margaritas, and two entrees. The margaritas came a while (about 8 minutes) later, but no guac. Then came our dinner plates, but still no guac. Then came the bill, with guac on it (no, not a smudge of green goodness, but a charge for something we didn't get). Waa waa. However, when we brought it to the attention of the server, he took off the guac AND COMPED OUR DRINKS. Above and beyond for sure. 

The Chile Verde was AMAZING, but my fellow diner's plate, the Tampiqueño, was a little dry. Three stars for one plate being amazing and the willingness of the server to make up for other shortcomings with discounts (the only other way to my heart besides food). I just can't give it more stars based on the service and so-so dish. I definitely want to go back and give this place more stars, so stay tuned...
author: Matthew S.

description: The food and service were excellent. Very authentic. Busy place. Servings are large enough to share. I would certainly recommend it and plan to comeback when in town.
author: Fernando O.

description: Popped in with friends on a Saturday afternoon for some pre-dinner drinks and appetizers.  We just ordered nachos and guacamole and they were all very tasty, especially the nachos.  I ordered a wine spritzer (what was I thinking? hello tequila chaser), which they weren't sure how to measure so I got a massive pour of wine with a spritz of soda. Hehe! Maybe it was our hunger or the twinkly Christmas lights, but it was so cozy and the main dishes looked mouthwatering.  Now I need to come back and try dinner...
author: Sophie E.

description:
If this place weren't so close to Yelp headquarters, would it be getting these ratings ?  I'm not so sure...

I was just there today.  Saturday 1:30-ish.

The food is respectable.  They take the Chipotle chain and go much much further with the decor, a much more expanded wall menu and transport you to the mexican coast.

The downside for me.  It was my first visit.  I walked by and saw an exterior that looked like a hip latin restaurant.  You walk in and you're kind of let down that it's a burrito joint with a cafeteria line.

If there's no signage explaining how it works or no one is there to greet you (and there should be, it''s a brand new place after all) to acclimate down from the feel that drew you in the first place, then you're not real sure what you're supposed to do and you're let down that muuuuch different from the outside.

I was starving so I stayed.  I ate solo at the bar.  A young woman who appeared to be the owner was with what appeared to be her mother at the bar as well.

She had her back to the door.  I was the only other person at the bar and she was two seats away and never acknowledged me whatsoever. Not even when I got up to leave did she say thanks..how was everything?  I'm not attention-starved.  There was hardly anyone in there...

I watched as a few folks came in and had the identical reaction I did when I walked in.  They came in...paused to figure out that it's not a hip latin restaurant after all but a cafeteria-style burrito place...and the owner had her back to the door yacking with her mother behaving somewhat oblivious.

The food for what it is, I can not deny is decent.  Given the high-brow location however (Four Seasons, Jewish Museum, The Press Club across the walkway, this woman has no concept of service or of managing the problem of customers coming in and discovering that it's not the HIP LATIN RESTAURANT THAT IT LOOKS LIKE FROM THE OUTSIDE.

You have an authentic mexican taqueria lady, but you need to learn customer service.  Do something about before you become a bad episode of Gordon Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares...
author: Luis O.

description: Delicious margaritas - Especially spicy. Salsa to devour. Main was ok
author: Geo N.

description: I had heard amazing things about this place.  It almost lived up to them but not quite 5 stars.  Everything was tasty and the service was great.  I will give it another try.
author: Meg K.

description:
I tried to call to make reservations for a birthday dinner, and although the woman on the phone was friendly and did ask me to hold. I said sure. She got back to me relatively quickly and once I explained the desire to make reservations and gave details on the date, number of people and time she asked me to hold again. I said sure.

I waited on hold for well over 10 minutes. Nothing but silence. At that point, I'm pretty sure I was forgotten about.

I can understand if they are busy and can't work on making reservations for me. But does it hurt to check back on the line and at least ask for my contact information so they can get back to me when they are a little less busy? 

Thing is, I'm not even certain that they were busy, I am just hoping they WERE busy, considering how long my phone call was ignored and evidently forgotten about.

Even if they asked to call back I'd be fine with it, albeit a little unprofessional, but at least it would be SOMETHING! 

Way to lose a huge party that would have spent a lot of money, Tropisueño.

I am not going all the way down to 1-star because really, those chips ARE delicious, but they need to work on being more professional on the phone.
author: Crystal C.

description: We're giving it 5 stars. We we're looking for a restaurant with a sign that said tropisueno but the sign says Mexican kitchen it smelled great but I was a little confused so we continued to look for tropisueno. Once I looked at the yelp map again we decided it had to be the correct place. It was on a wait and the bar was packed. The bartenders were quick and although we decided if a bar spot opened up we would eat there. They had quoted us a 45 min wait - we were sat before we finished our drinks. Our guacamole came within 2 mins if ordering and I ordered the shrimp and made tacos out of them ... It had great flavor the server warned me it was spicy it was great. My bf had carne Asada and barbacoca the barbacoca was the bomb the carne was cook just how we liked it and was very good - I was so stuffed after the chips and salsa and guacamole I only ate 1/4 of my dinner but my bf couldn't  let anything go to waste it was all too delicious.
author: Leslie S.

description: 2 ounces of tequila in every margarita. Need I say more? Ok, I will. Best taqueria/Mexican spot in the city by far. Ambiance, quality, service, and the variety of menu options make Tropisueno A+ in my book. Absolutely loved my fish tacos, guacamole, light as air chips, and did I mention the margaritas? Hell yes.
author: Kylie S.

description:
Not Satisfied with yesterday's experience AT ALL!  Went here second time (first time for drinks *they were yummy margaritas*) , we asked to be seated at a table that would accommodate 3 adults and a stroller (our stroller is an orbit g2 it rotates 360 making it into a hichchair if you wanted to). They gave us a table fairly quickly but would not let us take our stroller and gave us a high chair which our baby is too small for still. When the waiter came he took our orders in a timely manner, when our food was SERVED it was mayhem, our friend is vegetarian she got all meat, my order was half veggie half meat and i ordered all carneasada. So they redid her order and tried to redo mine. In the end they had to REDO MY ORDER TWICE! how hard is it to get a chicken tamale and steak enchilada with no beans only rice?? I had to wait a while. I understand they gave us desert on the house BUT this IS ABSURD ! and the waiter felt bad or whatever he felt he kept coming up to check on us , every time i tried to put food into my mouth **back off buddy**.


Customer service so so 

The place is very well decorated, rustic old style Mexican which is a plus 


Never coming back there for sure!
author: Inna R.

description:
Finally, what I've been looking for in San Francisco -- a Mexican restaurant with great food but doesn't look like a total dive. Food is great, portions are generous and cheap for the ambiance/neighborhood. 

Food quality is way better than Maya or Velvet Cantina.

The food reminds me a lot of Loteria Grill in in L.A.
author: Rocky A.

description: Bad service and half of the seating closed off at dinner on a Saturday night with most diners forced to eat outside.
author: Joshuah C.

description:
Tropisueño is two different restaurants. At lunch time, it's a quick taqueria, and at dinner time it's a sit-down fiesta. I love both. The chips and salsa are where it's at. I don't know what's in that orange salsa. Essence of cheese? Gold bullion? Don't know, but it's delicious. The chips are thin, like chips should be. None of this freddy-krueger-fingers-chip, so thick it cuts my mouth to pieces" nonesense. 
The shrimp was great, the sauce was similar to the orange delight mentioned above, and the rice was seasoned just right. I wish there had been a few more shrimp, but shrimp is usually a skimpy plate. I made two fat little burritos with my tortillas, and it was the perfect meal. 
The margarita was strong. It may have been a little too strong, or it might just have been my first drink that night, and I might be a wimp. 
We were sitting against the window, and there were pillows on the bench side. One of them looked like a cat scratcher. This is not a critique as much as it's an observation. 
I came really close to giving this place five stars, and had the beans been better, I would have. But beans are important, you know?
author: Chanti B.

description: No more weird things in my carnitas burrito = 5 stars from me. And trust me, I've tested them out multiple times.
author: Chantelle D.

description: It's not hype.  The chips and salsa are really that good!
author: Emily S.

description:
OK, so here is the deal. I went there on Monday June 8 with six people to celebrate a friends birthday. We had reservations for 6 at 6pm. The place was empty with the exception of the bar. We were seated immediately, which I thought was great. 

We were quickly given chips, salsa and water. Chips were amazing, thin and crispy but  the green salsa was not spicy at all, I was a little disappointed at this. Our friendly server shows up and takes our drink order. Margaritas are amazingly good, but really small and a little pricy.  

For appetizers we order ceviche, guacamole and fried plantains. All of them disappeared from the table quickly (especially the ceviche, it was that good). 

All of a sudden the place gets completely packed. All tables are taken. People are loud and there is a lady whose phone keeps on ringing every five minutes with the loudest and most annoying ringtone I've ever heard.  

We order our food, chile verde, mole poblano and tampiquena. All of this dishes came with rice and beans. Rice comes on the  plate, beans come separate in a "family style" as our server told us after only one small bowl of refried beans appeared for all of us. Beans were good, but obviously not enough for all of us. The rice was not good at all. it was hard and dry. The chile verde was not flavorful at all. The mole I can't even describe. I decided not to try the other dish anymore. 

We all looked at ourselves with disappointment. We have heard many good things about this place and the experience was just falling through. We asked for our check, not once, not twice, but three times! and still it took about 30 minutes to arrive!

I really think that the place is under-staffed. Our server (it really seemed like she was everyone's server) was running around everywhere trying to help all the people but obviously she couldn't be in all places at once. 

Overall I think they need to improve the food. It was just bland, not outstanding at all. Get more staff, seriously! One server for 20 tables is not enough! I felt bad for the lady that was our server at the end. I could see we were not the only table with WTF faces by the time we left.

Next time I'll only get drinks and appetizers.
author: Ezekiel G.

description: My friend invited me here for lunch one rainy day and it was a pleasant surprise! Even though the weather was wet and I'd really prefer something soupy, this was a great lunch indeed. I got the carne asada super burrito and and watermelon agua fresca. The chips were delicious and I had some fun experimenting at the salsa bar. I'd like the drop by at night and see the difference.
author: L M.

description: Great lunch spot, and delicious unmatched salsa bar.
author: Chas J.

description: This restaurant apparently does not like single diners.  I have gone on two occasions when the host was dismissive upon the announcement that I was dining alone.  In addition, the host would not put my name on the electronic wait list upon curtly announcing that the wait would be at least 45 minutes.  Upon being questioned as to why he was not placing my name on the wait list, the host stated that he would remember me.  It was obvious (based on his body language and facial expression) that he had no intent of seating me at a table.  I noticed that larger parties were treated more attentively.
author: Deno B.

description:
This place is HIGHLY over-rated. You'll be happier if you lower your expectations before coming. 

While there are several issues, the main one is that the food just isn't very good quality - the chicken in particular. The dishes are generally overflavored, yet the flavor is not very interesting. The whole time we were there, we kept wishing we were at another Mexican place, such as LuLu's. It's not bad, but there is definitely better elsewhere.

Alert: this is one of those places where you order at the counter, then (hopefully) find a table, and they bring you the food later. How much later varies widely; with only four people and only normal dishes, some dishes came out so late that others at our table were already finished eating. They bring chips (eventually) which is nice, but they are too oily. And there is frantic music playing - as if someone needed more hypertension - it makes the place more stressful.

Some positives: The combination plates are very large - good if you're very hungry but we had to leave quite a bit behind - and the beans are pretty tasty. You can get your own salsas, and there is quite a variety.
author: Alexander M.

description: Great food, great taste. The servings of beans and rice are large - - - so come hungry or bring along someone to share it with. A nice quick place for lunch right in the middle of the downtown shopping district.
author: Jim H.

description: GREAT place!!  I screwed up and made reservations for the wrong day and they still helped me.  Food was amazing and the staff was very knowledgeable about everything.  Highly recommended!
author: Sarah F.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Their food is great, and its a great atmosphere for a date, or a small group outing. I can't remember the exact entrees we got, but I have had a few different ones now and I have enjoyed them all. I also highly recommend their margaritas.
author: John H.

description:
Tropisueno is an adorable little oasis of loveliness.  Some friends and I went here for grub the other day, and while it was a little tough to find, it made it feel that much more special and intimate.  The decor is awesome, the staff is super friendly, and the food is good (not great).

-1 star for only selling individual margaritas (c'mon people, some of us want pitchers!!) and for having no spicy salsa option.  Both the tomato and tomatillo salsas were super yummy, but neither had much of a kick.

The mole was great, the white beans were incredible, and they know how to make a great (but somewhat pricy) margarita.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Ashley S.

description:
This was a great Mexican place and only steps from my workplace. The chips were thin and crisp, just the way I like them. They have some kick ass salsa that left my lips tingling for quite some time after the meal. I had the carnitas which was amazingly tasty and tender.

To top it off, the service was great. Although one person in our party did wait a while for her meal, one of our guests was late and the line was out the door. The cashier was incredibly helpful and let her sneak up and order so we could all eat together. 

A definite recommendation!
author: Joe R.

description:
Love at first bite!

I am very pleased with this burrito I am halfway through from Tropisueno. Yum, yum, yum. How it took me this long to try this yummy place a block from my office is beyond me. The prices are reasonable, the quality outstanding, service friendly and it didn't really take that long even though there was a long line. 

My only regret, in my excitement getting my take-out I forgot to grab some salsa for my chips! However I did snag some extra hot sauce. Will have to dine in next time when I have some time for a longer break. I have to give 5 stars because there is nothing nearly as good and reasonably priced as this around this area for lunch.
author: Abby W.

description:
Drinks were very good...
The chips and salsa and guacamole are among the best I've ever consumed.
Main course was Chile Verde...so tender, so tasty, so gone in a few seconds...

The staff are at your table just the right amount of times...filling your glasses and bringing more chips...

Good Food, Good Fun,
author: James R.

description:
I would gve four stars if the servce wasn't so slow....

This place is awesome. For someone who lives near Maya, this is a welcome alternative - at much more attractive prices. The drinks are infinitely better (you must try the specialty margaritas with flavored salt - I was in love with the Violeta with vanilla salt) and the food was pretty good. Tried the guac, scallops and carne asada beef (tamiqueno). Guac was fine, scallops were ok (overpriced - but the plantain-chorizo hash saved the dish) and beef was good. 

Gripes: I wish they had HH past 6 p.m. (bc seriously, who gets off that early?), and the service was super slow. Granted, it was a Friday night, but we were sitting at the bar and the place was only 1/2 full.

Definitely will try again.
author: Adrienne C.

description: Awesome happy hour, great service, and legit tacos. Their orange salsa is fantastically hard to hold back on.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
5 stars for their Happy Hour!

I had dinner here a year ago. I liked the chips, the dinner was ok, and the margaritas were very tasty. But I wasn't "wowed."
BUT came here with classmates this past week for HH. Whoa! Why did I not know of their HH the first two years I was in school?!

Holy crap- their HH menu is f'n amazing. It's cheaper than Chevy's and the food and drinks are GOOD.  And unlike Chevy's- you don't have to see the fat and calories listed for your platter of cheese-covered fried food. 

What a great deal!  I had a platter of nachos, a fish taco, tons of chips and salsa and a Tecate for....$10! With tax and tip we're talking max $14 for a crapload of food.  Tecate was $2. Their house margarita (VERY tasty) is $5 during HH!
Only downer was the taco. Not worth bothering. 

Dayam. I will be back. Hopefully not too often, as even I would become rather rotund eating like this several times a week.  

BTW- the nachos were supposed to be shared, but I ate almost all of the platter by myself. It was a big-ass platter, too. Not some sad little salad plate size thing.
I wanted more the next day....
author: Allucaneat G.

description:
There was a time in my life where I was addicted to this place.
The food is amazingly authentic Mexican. 
Everything is good.
The best time to go is during happy hour, you get free chips and salsa and $5 margaritas. sooooo goood.
Manuel the bartender does an OUTSTANDING JOB making his own original infused cocktails that will totally please your tastebuds.
Invite him to prepare something for you and im sure he will please.
This place rocks!!!
author: Flor D.

description: I go here often. Food is great and portions are big. Service is pretty good, and I've had no complaints.
author: Pratik T.

description: Should be 3.5. Nice place. We went there with a large party late in the evening. Unfortunately they were out of several items but the waiter was very nice and had great service recovery capabilities.   He was also very flexible in dealing with someone with food allergies and who was finicky.  I had the Pork Adobado, which was mildly flavorful.  They chips came with four different salsas, of which 2 were pretty spicy.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Martin K.

description: Very good mexican food, with unique spices. I had multiple tacos which were cooked to perfection, than had their shrimp Tropisueno special, an amazing sauce with a decent kick if you like spicy food.  Very good ambiance as well, 4.5/5 in my book.
author: Spencer W.

description: My wife and I took a week long trip to San Francisco and found Tropisueno while walking around the first day. We ended up going there 3 times during our trip! Enough said.
author: Adam W.

description:
Last night was the first time I went to this place, you can bet your money I'd be back.   Heck, I started a darn Yelp account just to review this place!

If you want good Mexican food but in a setting a little fancier than your fav joint in the Mission, come to this place.  RESIST THE TEMPTATION TO GO TO NOPALITO, which in my opinion is so overrated. Tropisueno knows how to do Mexican food right (with great prices too!)

The chips are fantastic.  The margaritas menu has good variety.  The menu has so much to offer I have to go back to try the other stuff! There are the basics (tamales, enchiladas, chile rellenos), the slightly more fancy (chicken mole, great carne asada), and the even-more fancy for you Yuppies out there (scallops served on chorizo plantain hash which I unfortunately didn't get to try, I'm going to get that next time). I very much enjoyed the chile relleno stuffed with beef.  My husband got the chicken mole which he let me try =) I can honestly say it's the best chicken mole I have ever had.  Super juicy, very tender.  I also liked that they offer not only refried and black beans but also white beans.  The white beans were really good.  Only downside is dessert, they only offered one choice, chocolate fondue.  Maybe they should add more to the dessert menu...

As for the non-food related aspects: Hostess/wait staff/bartenders were all very nice.  Decor is cute.  And the prices are very reasonable and you definitely get your money's worth.
author: Helen C.

description: Recommended by a friend we tried this spot for dinner one night and it did not disappoint. The food was fresh and authentic. The atmosphere was alive and full of energy. Make sure you have made reservations ahead of time because this place is popular and remains packed.
author: Jay N.

description: The place was full with a lot of young people on a Wednesday night. The service was good, I like the chips and salsa, and I had the tampiqueno which was delicious. Will need to come back one day for dinner and a margarita.
author: Rami R.

description:
Great food. Great flavors. Great chips. Great burritos.

Try the Tropisueno Torta... you will fall in love.
author: Brian P.

description: If i am back in town, I would like to visit here again.  Great ambiance, and food was good.  We had a lot of fun!
author: Eriko T.

description:
Tropisueno is truly a great place. The food was so fresh including the 2 delicious types of salsa served. You could taste the freshness. The chips are home-made and come to the table in a big bowl still warm. You never have to ask for more water because they will be at your table to fill it as soon as it is empty. They are not overbearing either, it is almost like they appear out of nowhere.

I had the Mahi Mahi served with on a bed of red cabbage cooked to a perfect consistency. Also accompanied by black beans and rice. Everything was just delicious! 

This is my new favorite Mexican place. If you are in San Francisco visiting or if you live here, you MUST go here! We were pleasantly surprised when got the bill. It is very reasonably priced food of an excellent quality in downtown San Francisco.

Finally, excellent margaritas, too!II
author: James A.

description:
We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. The ambiance was nice-festive, but also nice and chill at the same time. I loved that they were playing awesome cumbia music the entire night, really made our dinner fun. 

We enjoyed all the dishes we split, but the chicken mole was especially a standout-it was loved by all. The prices are very reasonable, the food fresh and the portions are pretty sizable. 

The only glitch was with service. We had a very awkward waiter who we guessed just had a very, very, very dry sense of humor. Nobody knew this until he cracked a joke halfway through the night. Awkwardly. 

Be warned that this place charges you if you are celebrating a birthday and decide to bring in a cake. It's not a small fee either-it was like 25-35 bucks. Not only is the fee ridiculous (we could have bought a cake for that price!), but we also weren't told that a fee would be assessed. When we brought it up with the manager, he wasn't getting it, so my friend Cristy started speaking to him in Spanish. At one point, he just blurted out and said well this is how we do it in Mexico along with other nonsense. After a while, he conceded and it was taken off our tab. Other than that fiasco, no major complaints.
author: Jenny W.

description: Love it. Great food, even better service- and ive been five times and service is consistently good. Ambience is AMAZING for a date or for fun night w friends.  Pretty good prices too.
author: Daniel R.

description: Nice Environment, good food, great place for a semi casual dinner with friends. The staff is super nice and our server was really great. I  really enjoyed the chicken mole. the ceviche and camerones  that our table ordered. The chips are a bit greasy, but other then that it was great.
author: Molly A.

description: This place is so great! The chips come out piping hot and fresh with a selection of four delicious salsas to try. They gladly replenished our chips four times! I also got a yummy house margarita with a chili pepper coated rim. Delicious! For an entree I had the chile relleno which was awesome. Even the decor is perfection. I love this place. Great attention to detail.
author: Turi F.

description:
Place has a super cool atmosphere. Only ate here once with a couple of friends, but the food is reasonably priced, for the portion! Food was great, and so was the service!

The margaritas were excellent! The dips that came with the chips were really good, too! I highly recommend this place the next time you're in the city. Yum!
author: Joselyn B.

description:
Make sure to ask for the different salsas for the chips! They're GOOD!
Food here pretty tasty. Price is a bit expensive but this is very good Mexican food. Nice to eat at with friends.
Only downside here is that the service here isn't that good though. But the food makes up for it! Carne Asada really good and so is the rice!
author: Ann T.

description: This place has reaaly good mexican food. I got the tropisueno (sp?) and it was delicious. The spicy mango margarita has so yummy with just the right amount of kick from jalapeno. And omg their chips just melts in ur mouth. My fav mex place so far is pancho villa and this comes a close second. but of course this is more upscale.
author: Ritu S.

description:
Pleasantly surprised w/ my first happy hour experience here.

Really tasty fish taco. Great chips and guac (thankfully not overloaded w/ onions). Not very impressed by the shrimp cocktail--way too watery.
author: C G.

description: I love this place! It's a very casual traditional Mexican restaurant atmosphere. Their food is pretty good and the margaritas are excellent. It's a fun place, great service, and very inexpensive! It's also one of the very few Mexican restaurants near SOMA/Fidi.
author: Jenna Q.

description: From start to finish I had a memorable an amazing time. Love the atmosphere that Tropisueno has created.  The chips and salsa have to be some off the best I've ever tasted.  I also had the house margarita which was fresh and no nasty sweet and sour.  I ordered the tampiqueno  which was delicious and would definitely recommend. My friend ordered the pollo asado which was so tender and juicy.  I have to say I was impressed with the food. Service was also great and prompt. One can see why this place is packed on a Monday night.
author: Zach W.

description:
The first time I had dinner there was fantastic. The service was great and the food was yummy.

I've been back more for their happy hour specials. Their $5 nachos are so good with their $4 margaritas and $4 shots. The atmosphere is nice, but the service for happy hour could be better.
author: Leslie Ann V.

description: I've been here 3 times. Service is great every time I've been there. Food is delish overall. I can never eat much here because I always fill myself up with their guacamole and margarita.
author: Tria V.

description:
There are only two places in the FIDI with perfect burritos, Tropisueno is one and the other is a truck on Sansome and Pacific. 

Plus, Tropisueno's ambiance is great, love the old time wooden furniture.
author: John V.

description: There orange salsa is to die for. All the rest of the food is just help to get that salsa into your mouth. Note that their lunch menu is much different from their dinner menu. I enjoyed both, but I am often there for lunch.
author: Garrison N.

description:
I'm on a business trip in SF for a week, and I came here for lunch yesterday with my boss and a co-worker. At around noon, the restaurant was pretty crowded. At first I thought there it was a cafeteria-style type of ordering where you get your food and pay for it, but turns out you just order and they bring it to you. For my lunch dish, I ordered the carne asada torta, and it honestly was not the best torta I've had. The bread was a little soggy and the meat was a bit oversalted without the savory sensation that I expect from my asada. One thing I did enjoy was the jicama fresca, with just the right amount of flowery sweetness that was refreshing even in foggy drizzly San Fran. 

The best part about the restaurant is probably the free chips and salsa bar. The service there was splendid as well, and fast! Because the ordering line was too crowded, I approached the bartender and asked how I can get some free chips. She actually sprinted over to the kitchen and brought me some freshly baked chips! Chica was on TOP of it! Kudos to her! And there were probably 12 different things at the salsa bar, and I'm a sucker for options and dipped my chips in practically everything (the chipotle sauce was some spicy goodness) 

Nice vibe, overall - loved the stringed lights - I guess I liked everything about the restaurant except for the actual main course that I got. Then again, I might just be a Mexican food snob, being from LA and all...
author: Andy L.

description:
OMG!
Can I just say yummy!  I am so excited to go back!
We had a huge party and our server was able to handle that with stride!  Jose did a wonderful job and was very personable.  He knew the menu and was able to make very delicious suggestions that pleased my friends and I!

I like my food super spicy, and every other place I've tried has fallen super short on the salsa picante...not Tropisueno!  They brought me out 2 different salsas and explained how they were made and what was in them.  These salsas kicked my bootie, and they were super flavor filled!

The bartenders were amazing and they also were able to speak about ALL their TEQUILAS and make this wonderful cucumber drink!  I highly recommend it...they'll know what you're talking about!

And finally my hat is off to Chef Faria!  He is able to cook the most amazing and authentic food I've had.  And on top of that, he is sooooo nice and comes out and talks to everyone!

Is it Monday yet, cause I can't wait for happy hour!
author: Nicole F.

description: I totally love this place.  Super awesome burritos, like no other place in town; great margaritas; super fantastic dinners.  I've found that it's hard to find another Mexican place like Tropisueno in town, despite having a ton of Mexican places to choose from.  This place is just different.
author: Liat W.

description: Well, I've definitely experienced better (that's what she said). I'd actually give it a 2.5 stars, but because the service was pretty atrocious, I dropped it down to 2.  It wasn't busy when we walked in, but the three of us each got a burrito.  It took forever to get our lunch, and we sat and watched while the people in line behind us got their food.   Once we got it, the rice in the burritos weren't cooked completely.  One of the burritos was wrong too.  It could have been good, but for a $10 meal, I'd probably go somewhere else.
author: Taylor L.

description: Easy quick lunch! I had 2 chicken enchiladas with red sauce that was out of this world. I wanted to dunk everything into this red sauce. My husband had a shrimp cheese quesadilla which I don't personally think is a good combination or very Mexican for that matter. It was kind of boring but not with my red sauce! I would go there again! Great for lunch if you're in the neighborhood or going to the movies at the Metreon, since their food court is closed for renovation right now!
author: Carol M.

description: At Tropisieno, it's the small things that really count. I love the way they offer you four different salsas with your chips and the flavored salt that adorns the house margarita. Or. Maybe it's a choice of three differemt kimds of beans with your entree. They are what make up for the things I don't like, slow service being the big thing. Even with a super friendly server, it's hard to ignore a slow kitchen. And, I might be a bit spoiled thinking this, but I shouldn't have to wait fifteen minutes for my two top, not when I have a reservation. And yet, both things are true. I think Tropisueno occasionally falls into that special San Francisco category of places (Frances and Flour+Water come to mind) where no matter what day it is, it's always packed and you just have to wait, wait, wait. I find that annoying, but I can't penalize them too mucj for it. Besides, the food is good. Really good. My camarones Tropisueno really rocked. The spicy chile de arbol sauce had just enough cream amd lime to give it a nice zing and the potion slze was perfect. My friend's tampiqueno (beef, beef, and a little more beef) was equally delicious. So, good eats and some prime people watching saved the meal. Oh, and the excellent margarita. Can't forget that.
author: Nicole M.

description: We ate here for lunch with our parents and our two young children. The staff was very friendly and helped us find a table so the little ones could sit. There was a serving line where you could look at the food before ordering. I had a tamale and an enchilada, both of which I heartily recommend. The chips were warm and crisp, the salsas very flavorful.
author: Robert M.

description:
Great Food, Great Drinks and Great Place.  They don't have a lot of the standard Burritos on the dinner menu I was looking at, but the chips / carne asada / drinks were awesome.

Good mexican food is a must for me, and I'm ecstatic to find the place.
author: jeremy S.

description: Delicious!! Althought portions are enormous!!! Easily can share an entree.
author: Lauren M.

description: Love Taco Tuesday.  Definitely the best one out there.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Mmmm...yum! The chipotle sauce is just perfect! The chips? Well, every review on here has already said it, they're great. The flan riminded me of when my mom used to make it. It's really well decorated and artistic. Very clean and classy.  
P.s. Check out the mural! Oooh!
author: Jaime S.

description: Tasty Mexican food served in a lively well done atmosphere. Excellent chips and salsa. Always a good preliminary sign of the food to come. Large selection of margaritas to choose from to assist with washing down your entree. If your in the area I would recommend trying this restaurant. Parking is accessible on the fifth and mission garage which is awesome considering SF parking can make your break your decision to try a new place.
author: mary s.

description:
I'm giving the food four stars, and the service (including the hostess and their special events planner) only 3 stars. 

Let me start with the most important part of this review: FOOD. The trio of salsas each had their own characteristics. The orange salsa had a different texture than most salsas and it was a little peppery hot. It's best to try them all for yourself to experience what everyone is talking about. Next, we had the tacos al pastor and the empanadas de hongos. The tacos were so good with the pineapple and grilled pork. It was like a classy taco from a taco truck. The empanada was meh. If it was served just out of the oven or deep fryer, I'm sure this savory hot pocket would have been crispier and melt in your mouth good. The guac served with it didn't do any justice, but it was a great addition to the salsas and chips. For our main dishes, we ordered the pork chile verde, chicken with mole poblano, tampiqueno and the camarones tropisueno. All were served with Mexican rice, warm tortillas, and black and refried beans. The chile verde was flavorful and the pork was so soft it was easy to pull apart with you fork. The chicken mole was unique and had a nutty flavor. The tampiqueno was the most favored dish among our party. The carne asada was medium well, and when stuffed in a tortilla with rice, beans and salsa, it resulted to a perfect mini burrito. The second favored dish was the camarones tampiqueno. It was a hearty dish of scrumptious shrimp! Lastly, for dessert was tres leches cake. We were so full from our dinner, that we couldn't really enjoy dessert, also Tropisueno does not serve coffee or tea. The tres leches cake was good, but could have done without the bitter sauce that came with it. 

If you are still reading this, cool! Now about the service...the service we experienced at Tropisueno was a bit off. Their hostesses were a bit sketchy and clueless when it came to making reservations for a party of 8. I finally had to make my reservations through their special events planner, Erin. Erin was really helpful and accommodating when making plans for our dinner party. A week before we dined at Tropisueno, she worked with me on creating a set menu to make our dinner party special for the birthday girl. Our server was serious and stiff, just like a strict teacher that wouldn't allow us to have any fun. Also, something happened to Erin's computer that evening and she was unable to print out our customized menu, and as an alternate solution, she came up with simple and characterless menus for us. Oh well. My friends and I want to come back, and next time we'll just expect good food with a so-so service. 

To summarize this long review, great place for dinner and margaritas with an almost below average service. 

**diner tip: bring an appetite because the food is really filling!
author: Jocelyn P.

description:
My husband and I JUST ate some fantastic food at Tropisueño! FINALLY a nice, modern, clean, friendly, TASTY *SIT-DOWN* Mexican food in San Francisco!

We had Cheese Enchiladass, Chili Relleno, Shredded Beef Enchiladas, Chicken Tacos, Refried Beans, Black Beans, Garlic Shrimp Appetizer, and the Empanada Appetizer... ALL were excellent, fresh, hot and well-presented.

The service was great and prompt.

Minus 1 star for noise...

We WILL be back!
author: Jay R.

description: This review is based on the one dish I order whenever I visit Tropisueno: The carne platter, with a big portion of barbacoa, carnitas or carne asada -- and nothing else (except some guacamole and salsa). To me, beans and rice and chips and tortillas are just uselessly carby delivery mechanisms for the meat. And the meat here is four-star-tasty, so why not skip right to the good stuff?
author: Henry F.

description:
Went  for lunch and it was ok. If you are in town for a conference or training class in the Moscone Center area, it is a good place to grab some Mexican food, but if are able to travel a bit, I would recommend checking out places in the Mission district.

I got the carnitas plate with salad. They customize to your tastes, which is great. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I found the carnitas to be too salty. The guacamole was adequate, not great. 

If I am at the Marriott taking another class, I would probably go there for a quick lunch again, but don't expect to experience the Mexican food San Francisco has to offer.
author: Sean G.

description:
Amazing mexican food!

I'm vegetarian and mexican food sometimes is hit or miss. This fairly small establishment is one of my favorites - hands down. I went for lunch on a Saturday and the wait was minimal. As any place in the area - street parking is a little tricky but can be found

Four of us ate (very well I might add) for less than 30 bucks. Price was great and the food was tasty. One of the few places that I have found that serves a vegetarian tamale.

The salsa bar is well hyped and was great. There were at least 6-7 salsas that I remember. The habanero salsa is particularly good for those with a spicy liking.

Definitely recommend! A+
author: Sachin T.

description:
Came here with the girlfriend for lunch.  Both of us were a little thrown off by the big menu on the wall at the front, and then moving on to order from the line of cooks.

The Food which we ended up getting was really good.  The chips were really tasty, but thin (and we prefer the thick).  Obviously homemade, and tasted great with the various sauces they offered.

My quesadilla was very tasty and large, and the chicken tacos were decent.  The girlfriend really enjoyed her enchilada, and loved that there were tons of vegetarian options including a few different types of vegetarian Tamales.  We will probably come back just because of that.
author: David B.

description: When dining at Tropisueno, the only word I can use to describe the food and beverages is "Ole!" The Margaritas have never let me down, and the food is an excellent pairing. The stand up bar is a great place for a happy hour with friends and or coworkers. Run don't walk to Tropisueno. You won't regret it.
author: Andy D.

description: Definitely one of my favorite places. Especially love the orange salsa.
author: Radhika S.

description: Delicious! Everything thing here is amazing from the tacos to the burritos and the margaritas. You can't go wrong with tropesuenos! Everytime I'm in the city I make a point to come here. Try the tropesueno margarita and carnitas tacos.
author: Katie S.

description: Damn this place was good. I went here for lunch one weekday afternoon with a group of people and easily found seating for 10+ people without a reservation. I got the chile relleno and liked it a lot. I guess what I liked most were the chips. I know, I know: "They're just chips". But these chips were GOOD. And their little "salsa" bar was great! Prices are ok, slightly higher than I would have wanted but my burrito was so big, I had to split it into 3 portions and eat it over the course of 3 meal times. I would definitely go back here again. :)
author: Jasmine S.

description:
We walked in because they were fully booked at 6pm. The receptionist said the wait was 45 mins just to shoo us away. I went out they had plenty of tables empty outside so I went back in to ask her about those tables and if we could sit there. I went back and stood in line . There was a couple before us in line, without a reservation just like us. Just less than a minute ago she told us 45 mins wait and now she gave a table to the other couple who had no reservations and came in after us!! I was standing right there ! I confronted her about it and she said that they just had a cancellation. Giving her the benefit of doubt I asked her if they had any more tables due to cancellation and she said she had a table. She didn't even offer us the other table on her own, we had to ask for it! 
Once we were seated they serves us chips and 3 salsas. Their chips are easily the best chips I've ever had. The green and red salsa were amazing. Their guac was yummy too
We ordered house margharita which again was amazing 
I ordered cheese Tamales and my husband ordered the ceviche
Both were exceptionally delicious and perfectly cooked.
Finally for the desert we ordered their tres lyches cake, it was amazing!!!!!!
Overall, very bad receptionist but amazing food and service by the waiter and other servers. 
I will go back but only with a reservation just to avoid having to talk to the receptionist
author: Kshama T.

description:
Tropisueño is tropi-bueno!

The food is top-notch.  Twice I've had the tampiqueño, and I was twice satisfied (it's grilled beef, and they do make it well-done, so be forewarned if you like your meat bloody as hell and not burnt to a crisp).  The chile relleno -- mmm.  Tastes like a big, extra-tasty tamale.  The chips and salsa they show up with when you sit down are always fresh, hot and good.  And the margaritas are awesome -- strong but not acidic.

Best of all, it's cheap!  Cheaper than the Chevy's down the street!  I can never go to Chevy's again knowing that Tropisueño is just a few feet away.

And by the way: pay attention to the menu, where it says "Watch Out!" next to the Yucatecan Poc Chuc.  Seriously: watch out.  That habanero salsa that comes with it is _really_ hot.  Your lips will be burning for half an hour afterward.  But it sure is good!
author: Marco C.

description: (-) Got the chile verde, would rather go to Chevy's for mexican food
author: Eric H.

description:
I am not from San Fransisco, so thank you Yelpers for turning me onto this amazing restaurant
I enjoyed the Chili Verde and my boyfriend had the something unpronounceable for my whiteness, but it was shrimp and it was delicious!  The place was a little smaller than the beautiful pictures let on, but there was such a great environment.
The servers, bussers and runners were very attentive and polite, but not very friendly.  The service was great, just not as friendly as I would have liked.
We were on our way to the Orpheum theatre and our server made sure we got out of there in plenty of time, even with the delicious mexican chocolate fondue!!
author: Christina H.

description: For a Sunday lunch I can recommend the place. A lot of people but not packed. Tasty food for a good price at a central location. Would definitely visit again.
author: Marvin T.

description: I always find it difficult to find a restaurant open late in SOMA, but I am glad I stumbled (or used my boyfriends Yelp app) upon Tropisueno. First, the chips and salsa are perfect. Warm chips and a choice of 4 salsas with all different heat levels. I had the Taco al Pastor and they were delicious! The perfectly cooked pork paired well with the sweetness of the pineapple. I was not a fan of the green sauce that came on the enchiladas though. My boyfriend seemed to enjoy it though. I will be back to try some more.
author: Ryann M.

description: i ordered the Tampiqueño ($16) and i loved it. however, my friend's 3 dish combo ($14) came out to be quite dry and its taste was extremely average. i was surprised by how big of a difference 2 dollars could make...in addition, our server was quite slow at bringing us water and chips, so we ended up calling someone else for that...lastly, the restaurant was very stuffy and warm...perhaps next time they don't have to turn the heater so high. it's in the middle of summer after all.
author: Louis O.

description: Quite possibility the best tacos i have had in SF. Of course, I mostly eat burritos so my frame of reference is narrow. But they are still decent and overstuffed.
author: Scott M.

description: Very good mexican food! Thanks yelp for the recommendation!
author: Chace D.

description: My wife and I really like this place. It's our favorite Mexican restaurant in SF. The prices are very reasonable, the food is consistently good and the portions are more than enough, even for someone like myself who eats a lot. I always order and recommend the Los Favoritos. You can choose two or three items; taco, enchilada, tamal, flauta. I always end up ordering the same thing, two beef enchiladas and a pork taco. All entrees come with beans (choice of refried pinto, white or black) and Mexican rice. Their warm tortilla chips are the best! Better yet, they come with your meal, you can get free refills, and they are served with three different types of salsa, all of which are good. Margaritas are also tasty and strong.
author: Serghio P.

description: Great food, fast service. Would get five stars, but Trop loses a star due to the salsa bar being accessible by one person at a time.
author: Joe S.

description: Surprisingly tasty and cozy for the chrome-and-plastic neighborhood.  Tastiest margarita I've had in a long time or since.  Food very reasonably priced, margaritas not so reasonable, but worth it.
author: Lauren J.

description: Very crowded and loud. We sat at the bar wait was 45 minutes. Food quality was very good, quantity was also sufficeint. I would eat here again.
author: m w.

description: Went here on a Friday night and business was pumping.  This is upscale Mexican food or what Mexicans might call "Mex for yuppies."  Service was a bit slow but a good time had by all.  Flavors are good and the food authentic.  This is a good alternative to Tres Agave.
author: Laurence H.

description: I had to Yelp about this place. My co workers took me here as we were trying to figure what to eat.  This place is real cool! Great location, real nice decor and flavor of decor. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you.  I am a ceviche freak! When I saw that they had this I had to try it and I was not disappointed. It is a different way of ceviche that I am use to but I really liked it. I also had a simple quesidilla and it was huge! The atmosphere is noisy which I did not mind it's a very busy restaurant and great food and the staff was real nice. They prepare the food pretty fast as well, so it's perfect for lunch time.
author: X X.

description:
Work lunch for two on a rainy day. We were lucky...when we arrived shortly after noon, there was barely a line. As we were placing our orders, the lunch crowd rushed in. 

When you first enter the restaurant, the menu is to your immediate left. Get in line, place your order, grab your order number, and find a table. Don't forget to grab your utensils and salsa along the way. 

The chips were lightly salted and perfectly crunchy. I ordered a carne asada super quesadilla, which turned out to be 4 quite large pieces. I surprised myself by finishing the entire thing. Not good for my diet at all!! The guacamole had chunks of avocado in it, just the way I like it! The quesadilla was delicious without being greasy. This is not a taqueria with authentically greasy Mexican fare, but it is a good lunch option for those working in the downtown area.
author: Aileen P.

description:
FANTASTIC new Mexican restaurant in SOMA.  Leaving the Contemporary Jewish Museum with a hankering for Mexican food, we stumbled upon Tropisueno right next door.   It was packed on a Thursday eve., and the wait would have been over 20 minutes.  But they seated as at the beautiful bar, and we were happy to eat there.  The place is so comfortably and authentically arranged, it's hard to believe it's only been there 3 months!  They've got plenty of super friendly and gracious staff, so they're not overworked.  They were attentive and the food came fairly quickly, even though it was crowded.

Incredibly flavorful food at reasonable prices.  Great margaritas.  Lots of fine touches: toasted corners of the empanadas, the salsa had a very rich roasted flavor, the pozole had a real kick to it, the huge bowlful of warm, light, tasty chips did not last long.  We got three different types of beans that all had excellent flavor and texture.  I was with two vegetarians who were plenty satisfied, though there is room on the menu for more dishes.

One of the owners was running the bar, and he clearly set the tone for this place, with a very clear vision of great Mexican food, ambiance, and service, and with a calm, low-key approach that made the whole experience relaxing and entirely satisfying.
author: Fred W.

description: love this spot and the people!! really good food. kind of on the pricy side but definitely worth it! happy hour is great too!!
author: Grace C.

description: Big meal, great chips and salsa, fair price.
author: Graham U.

description:
Best  Mexican food in the Financal Dist. I love the ladies in the open kitchen and staff here. Why not 5 stars? The room and lunchtime ordering are awful. Too bad! At lunch it is always crowded with a line from about 11:30. I go just before. The menu is on the wall away from the lady taking the orders so when she asks about sauces or fillings you have to go back and refer to the wall. If there is a line you really have to swim upstream through the people behind you. Except for seats next to the windows the place is very DARK inside. The bar is on the back wall. There is lots of seating outside, but it is always shaded and cool or cold and windy. I suggest that you go early or for dinner when there is menue/table service.
The sauces here are excellent, both the ones on the food and at the salsa  station. The problem is that there is often a line at the salsa station. The food here is authentic  Mexican homestyle food from an open kitchen. It reminds me of La Chata in Guadalajara where you can see the ladies preparing your meal. Tacos (street kind)  Tortas, Tostados, and the useual items. Last time I ordered the Chile Relleno and enjoyed it. They use very good ingredients. The food here is just to good to be wasted on this dark space with very poor flow. I hope that they move to a better space. Oue lastima!
author: David I.

description: My boyfriend and I came here and love, loved the food. I actually really want to go back next time we're in the area. But besides the food being delicious and the service being fantastic, their margaritas were what sealed the deal! Such quality. I had the Mestizo margarita and it was, and still is, the best margarita I've ever had. Love it!
author: G L.

description: Fresh ingredients. Distinct taste. Decent ambience and good service. Not your typical Mexican restaurant.
author: Pankti S.

description:
We usually try to stay away from sit-down Mexican food, but Tropisueno is a good deviation from the rule.  I've had the burrito for lunch and it was huge and pretty good.  The carnitas was crispy but not dry and the women behind the counter were extra friendly.  For dinner, we've been impressed with the empenadas and tacos on the Starters menu and the chile verde pork and the pork chop.  The servings have always been generous and the service has never been a problem.  Try the ceviche and guacamole, too!

All in all, a great sit-down Mexican place with reasonable prices and a fun location near everything!
author: Fernando C.

description:
I sat at the bar waiting and was served the most delicious crispy, fresh chips and 4 different dips. My favorite dip was a warm, creamy, spicy tomato salsa.  The house margaritas are made with agave nectar and very strong, but good! 

For entree, I highly recommend trying the chicken with mole. A leg and thigh piece is smothered in a rich mole sauce made of nuts and chocolate! 

Tropisueno has a fun, casual atmosphere. The food was reasonably priced and the staff was very nice and attentive. This mexican restaurant is a great place to stop for a margarita or for dinner after work. Just a warning, it's gets crowded, so don't hesitate to make a reservation!
author: Laura L.

description:
Ancient mexican legend has it that you can tell a restaurant by its salsa.  What, then, would they say of Picante, Taco Bell, and Tropisueno? They'd probably say nothing, look down in disgust, and spit on the ground.

Seriously, how can so many people looove the chips and salsa? The salsa is, at best, a step up from the stuff from 'New York City'. And the chicken I had with my taco;  the beef i had with my enchilada were both much too salty. The $10 habenaro pork skewers are three bitesized pieces of flabby meat. Overall, not worth the price, dont plan on going back.

The second star is there only for the Margaritas.
author: Enoch D.

description: I thought good Mexican food only lived in the mission until I came here--great Mexcian food spot in soma.  The margaritas are tasty along with the chips and salsa.  I am definitely adding this spot to my list when I'm in soma and in the mood for Mexican.
author: Karen N.

description: The restaurant was definitely nice, I had carne asada (good but the beef enchilada wasn't great) and a very nice spicy mango margarita (which is not on the menu). Gets pretty busy, so book it in advance!
author: Roberto G.

description:
Great and affordable and yummy mexican lunch spot downtown, right opposite the cube of the modern Jewish museum. The interior is a lot nicer than your average burrito place and the prices are not much higher. 
Plus you can sit down nicely. I had the super veggie taco and the fish taco, both of which were great everyday quality.
I will test it for dinner tonight!!
author: Alexandra D.

description:
Fantastic restaurant, great owners.  I really enjoyed dinner on Saturday night with friends.  The staff and bartenders are extremely friendly.  They just received their license and they make a great margarita.

The pork chop was excellent.  Great place for mexican food in a lively environment.  I need to come back during lunch hours to try the taqueria.
author: E L.

description:
I'm thankful that I read the directions posted on their website because I had no problem getting there, but almost everyone got lost! 

We were there as a group of 7.  My friend and I shared the guacamole (which turned out to be completely unnecessary because everything we ordered ended up coming with guac), shrimp tostada, and the Tampiqueño, which was an entree of carne asada with an enchilada with sides of beans and rice.  The meat was absolutely delicious - cooked medium-ish with that great grilled/charred (not burnt) flavor, yet soft.  Our waiter brought us all 3 types of beans to try.  I would normally order black beans, but the refried and white beans were delicious too! The rice was kinda salty but still edible. The tostada was really good too, but our flautas were definitely kinda burnt (which was hard to see w/ their mood lighting, but there was definitely some blackness going on).  Another bad thing was that our waiter was hard selling their crap like no joke.  I mean, I get it - sell more, get more tips, etc...but he was definitely pressuring every person to order at least one alcoholic drink.  He did generally have good recommendations for us, however.

Key points: Free chips and salsa, good house margarita (says the friend that had one), and pretty poppin even at 9pm on a Saturday night. We had a big group, so reservation was KEY.  For the carne asada entree alone I would come back!
author: Alice C.

description: Happy hour here is great! A small vacation from wintry, cold San Francisco, this place transports you to warm sandy beaches with PH-resh margaritas. $5 for Margis, $2 for tacos = happy gals at happy hour. Dinner menu is small with not a ton of options so I opt for happy hour. $40 for four gals.
author: Sarah M.

description: Great ambiance, yummy food, not enough veggie options though.
author: Cherry M.

description:
Chips & Salsa + Guac and Margaritas are the best there! 

Went last night with a good friend for a late supper. I was early so I went to the bar and got the Classic Margarita for $8. It's 2oz of pure Agave shaken not blended dipped in a salty spicy mix. At first I didn't feel the affect until 15 minutes later. Boy was I slurring my words! That's after only ONE margarita. Imagine two.... 

The host and hostess were very gracious. They went ahead and seated me even though my friend was late. Immediately I got the super-duper delicious airy crispy tasty chips with green and red salsa bowls. I asked for the spicier haberno salsa. The guy looked at me and kept asking if I was sure I am ready for it. Bring it on! It was smoky and spicy. My type of salsa. I ate half of the batch of chips by the time my friend finally arrived. I could have finished all of them but I figured I should save a bit for her since she was coming directly from the gym. 

I ordered from the Los Favorites (2 for $10) - Chile relleno and Enchilada. Tasty. Nothing special. Covered in a lot of cheese so you gotta eat as it arrives. My sweet-little friend ordered the Chile Verde which was so salty that she HAD to return it. The server was gracious enough to take her word. I took a taste and it was S-A-L-T-Y. So what did my friend get? Something sweet - Chicken with Mole Poblano. She enjoyed it but it wasn't anything special. It was just an A-ok meal. 

The place was packed and the atmosphere was joyous. 

I would come back for the Happy Hour specials and for the Chips and Margaritas.
author: Veritas V.

description:
I just got back from this place, and I think I found my new favorite spot in the city! The atmosphere is right, the food is tasty, and the drinks are well-made.

Antonio or Tony (not quiet sure which one he goes by formally) made us some great margarita's. He was very polite, efficient, and helpful while informing me on all of the choices from the agave drinks. That can seem overwhelming as an amateur, but he made it easy.

Thanks, Tropisueño, and thanks Antonio for a great experience!!
author: David K.

description: So TASTY! I just started a new gig and needed a place to grab lunch that wasn't the 3 S's...soup, salad or sandwich. A longtime friend suggested this place. So flavorful! I order a very plain burrito-just beans, cheese, rice and salsa. So satisfying! I cannot wait to go back and try more. Thanks Miriam for the suggestion!
author: Rachel W.

description:
Went with the wifey on Valentines day.  We each had a margarita (which was nothing more or less than average).  I had the Tampiqueno (quite good).  She had an order of the Ceviche (very good) and an order of the Crispy Flautas (standard fare, but worthwhile).  We shared an order of the guac (not the best I've ever had)

Food - 4.5 Stars (chips are fantastic)
Ambiance - 4 stars (cramped and noisy, but charming)
Service - 4 stars (cool & competent, but very...very slow)
Price - 5 stars (you can't beat what you're getting for the price)

Overall an excellent experience.  We'll be back.
author: Thomas K.

description:
My boyfriend works hard, so the other day when he got home he wasn't in the mood for taqueria Mexican food, but something more like this where you can sit down in a cute atmosphere and linger. 

The two stars are for that - the atmosphere. The three missing stars are for the bad food (or lack of decent food, however you want to put it).

Sure, the free chips are good like everyone says. But I mean, come on, how far can that carry bad food that you are actually paying for??

We had a couple margaritas (decent at best), and sampled a couple entrees that were not so good. The one really good thing was the Chile Relleno, full of flavor.

The atmosphere was really cute, our server was so nice, but when you want good Mexican food in SF, it seems you are better off at a taqueria and then moving on to a bar to linger over a drink or two.

I can't speak for what it is like at lunch, when it claims to be rearranged into more of a taqueria.
author: Abby Z.

description: Solid! I'll eat here again soon. GREAT salsas.
author: Jason G.

description: Great spot! Fast bar service, great salsa tray with three different salas...kinda spicy but awesome! We had the plantains and black beans also, nice compliment to the salty salsa...would definitely go back if in town longer...
author: Brooke E.

description: This place is excellent! I went on Saturday at 8p, and there was a 30 minute wait  - very reasonable. The bar area is lively, the chips and salsa are delicious! The staff are friendly and efficient. The food is delicious and prices are reasonable. I had the Chili Verde - it was so tasty with a little spicy bite. The guacamole is tasty. My friend had the Chicken with Mole Poblano - he said it was very tasty, but warning - they do leave the skin on.
author: Dusty S.

description:
I went here and I wasn't even hungry... the atmosphere is top notch. It just feels like a getaway. the dining experience here was phenomenal. It just felt right.

The food when it got here was delicious as well. I pretty much ate until I was absolutely stuffed. 

Prices are $$ as to be expected. But I'd definitely return here again.
author: Nelson C.

description: My coworkers and I had a fabulous lunch there. I have gone two times in two days. I made a joke about drinking Sangria during work hours only to find out it was sans alcohol lol!  At any rate the food is fresh and delicious! A wonderful addition to the downtown area indeed. The veggie taco and fish taco are yummy, and their quacamole is out of this world! While I know it is not quite "authentic" Mexican, and that the system of delivering the food to the table could be improved, I still think it is one of the better lunch options in the area given you have the Westfield foodcourt, or a few fancy overpriced men-in-suits type places to choose from. Not as fabulous for dinner as the prices go up and the menu changes.
author: Mark S.

description: just another disappointing mexican restaurants where you pay $$$ but end up getting low quality food. i seriously don't know how that one collected all the good reviews and yelp stars..
author: Beril Y.

description:
Atmosphere? Check
Proximity to YBCA and MOMA? Check 
Good Service? Check
Affordable? Check
Reservations online? Check
Great Salsa and Chips? Check
Delicious taco and enchilada plate? Check

Tropisueno met all my requirements!  Deserving of four stars.
author: Mark O.

description: Thin, crunchy chips and delicious salsa comes for free with happy hour (and eating).  I've only been there for happy hour ($5 margaritas, $2 Tecates, $4 wells) but that I highly recommend.  The service is attentive and I like that they have both the bar and a long tall table with stools for more casual drinking seating.  Even though it's downtown, there's something about being a little off of Market that keeps out the tourists so it can be busy in a fun way, not an annoying way.  Oh!  And if you ask they will give you sour cream with the chips and salsa and it's the wonderful creamy stuff you can only get in Mexican grocery stores= such a treat.
author: Luthien N.

description: Best margaritas! Everytime we're here from Los Angeles we stop by!
author: Di G.

description: The food here was good, not amazing, but good.  I had a sandwich, which was probably a mistake.  My husband had the chili relleno burrito, and that was very good.  I was really looking forward to the chips and salsa from reading the yelp reviews, but I wasn't that impressed.  They were very light, but they tasted a little off to me.  Maybe I'd got my hopes up too high.  Yummy salsas though, and quite a selection of them which was nice.
author: Alexis S.

description: Delicious! I loved this place! Unique food, stylish presentation, fast and friendly service. I would definitely go back.
author: Abby T.

description: Went with some co-workers after we had already been to happy hour.  We shared a bunch of appetizers and the Ta m p i q u e ñ o.  The guacamole was AMAZING.  All the food was awesome and the service was great.  If I ever come back to San Fran, would love to come here again.
author: Jessie H.

description:
I'm only rating this on one night, and it was a very unusual night for this place. It was the Yelp party and therefore no moola came out of my pockets. Keep that in mind ;)

I need to address the important issues first. THEIR CHIPS ARE FRIED MORSELS OF HEAVEN AND YOU MUST GO TRY THEM NOW. Seriously. I have been to 50+ Mexican joints and I've had chips at all of them. These are, hands down, without a doubt, the best chips I've ever EVER had. They literally melt in your mouth like a dream. If I could go there and just order three baskets of chips, I would. (And yes, the different salsas are good...but these chips...they are the STAR.)

The mixed drinks are hella good. I wish I could remember everything the waiter told me about them, but I can tell you there's this pinkish drink that is a variation on a traditional Mayan drink. (Basically, they just made it alcoholic by adding tequila.) It was good. It was potent. 

I had some shots of tequila. Smooth. Tequila-y.

They also passed out samples of microbrews they had on tap. I really wish I could remember the name of them, but the darker amber one is phenomenal. 

As for the food, it's all pretty good. There were these mini nacho chip bowls filled with various things. The guacamole one was great. My guest for the night tried the pork and said it was perfect, that it was prepared exactly as it should be - not too dry, not too rare...absolutely perfect.

I'd go here for dinner. The atmosphere is awesome. The ceiling is just rows of logs. There seems to be a private booth (divided from the room by curtains) off to the side, but it was blocked off for the party by the dj.

I hear they used to sell tasty margharita Chupa Chups for $0.25 but had to stop because people just assumed they were free and they were taking them.

All-in-all, solid addition to the fancy Yerba Buena Lane.
author: Danyell K.

description:
i was hoping to get a lil bit more from tropisueño.  the ambiance is great.  the drinks are nice.  i just was hoping for the food to be a tad bit better.

while waiting for our friends, we got some drinks and we liked them but things got a bit mediocre w/ the food.  the non-veg folk got the moletes de papa y chorizo which were basically empanada stuffed w/ chorizo and potatoes.  these tasted OK but nothing special.  for my main dish i got the pork chop marinated in chiles and spices.  the chop was cooked nicely but lacked flavor.  my wife got the chesse enchiladas and she liked them but thought them to be a tad bit cheesy.

it's a good spot for groups as my wife and her friends had a girls night shortly after this.  the food is good for a big group but there are better mexican joints in the city,
author: Swarup B.

description: Cute environment, however the food was very lackluster and we were surprised given the high rating on Yelp (we were visiting SF over the weekend). Looks like a great place for happy hour though without food.
author: Melanie F.

description: You know that a bar is going to be good when it is packed at 6 pm on a Monday night!  We knew nothing about the place when we meandered inside for a drink. I inquired about Happy Hour and was told that it was over in 7 minutes so I rushed over to the server station and caught the bartender's eye. He was super busy but made 2 amazing 5 dollar margaritas! Only problem was there was no where at all to sit and it was kind of funny when a busser offered us chips because we couldn't hold the bowl and the drinks and the salsa! But it was a nice gesture and we soon snagged a couple of seats at the community bar table. Those margs were so good that we had to order two more and the guacamole to eat with the chips and salsa. Our waiter was Ernie. He was not only easy to look at but he was super attentive and friendly. We wanted a snack by the time we were on our thirdsies and he suggested a couple of tacos...Delish!!
author: Sage K.

description: Friday's Happy Hour is fantastic! The service can be flustered at times because they get so busy, but worth it! Great eats and great Margaritas that can make navigating my way to Bart a bit difficult.
author: Jihad L.

description: Unbelievable margarita's (try the house margarita with chile salt) and it's right downtown for more adventures afterwards or before.
author: Paul M.

description:
The price is right and Bob Barker retired a long time ago.  

I seldom appreciate having to pay $14 for three carnitas.  Tropisueno to the rescue!  This is one place that actually makes sense to go a la carte on the ordering.  I had a shrimp taco less the sour cream and a chili rellano stuffed with cheese.  I wasn't a super fan of the breading on the pepper (was a little moist for my liking) but the taco is worth coming back to have again and I'd love to try their enchiladas in the not-so-distant future.

Of the things I love most about Mexican food restaurants?  The salsa bar.  Tropisueno did not disappoint.  While the chips might be fried in trans fats (someone correct me if I'm wrong about that) at least you can smear them with a delicious dollop of salsa.

Strawberry margs weren't overly sweet!  Friday lunch?  I'll have two.  Gladly!

Biggest plus of all?  Once you make it through the line, your food comes out FAST.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Layout was confusing at first and was still confusing the second visit.  I've only been there during lunch.  The burrito I had here was really good and was huge.  So far the times I went were hours after the lunch time rush and had plenty of seating to choose from.  There are a variety of salsas available in the middle of the restaurant but it still finds a way to be in an odd place.  After we were done eating we picked up our plates looking to put them somewhere but then decided to leave them.  I think they bus the dishes for you.
author: Jesse C.

description:
So crazy good!! The best tacos in downtown for the best prices. There is a line out the door everyday for a reason. 

The cute lunch guy's name is Mike. I always blush when I see him. 

Four stars only because they need to expedite their take out line. I order, I watch the person make my food and wrap it to go, I stand in line to pay. I pay. Then for some reason I continue to wait for my order, even though I know my food is, literally, chilling on the counter.? 

I predict that "Si Senor" and it's dumpy cousin in the alley will be out of business shortly. Why would anyone pay more for their salty mediocre overpriced food?
author: sparkle f.

description: I love love love this place. Everything on the menu is beyond good but man those chips and salsa blow me away and pretty much the best gaucamole I have ever had in my life. Oh and they make one heck of a margarita, this place rules!
author: tabitha n.

description: Fun atmosphere, delicious margaritas and great food! I've been twice for drinks and dinner and service was very fast and friendly. Both times they allowed me to order something that wasn't on the menu and they were very accommodating! The first time I went I was talking to the bartender about tequila and they didn't have what I wanted so they gave me a free margarita with a similar tequila and then brought a free round of margaritas for our whole table (six girls)! I will definitely go back.
author: Gina C.

description:
We had dinner here for my birthday.  When we arrived, our table was not ready (we had reservations) - so they bought us a round of drinks!  Can I say the margaritas are the BEST?  There's chili in the salt on the rim - yum!
