Chips tasted fresh made and the three salsas were delicious!  You get a traditional red salsa, a green tomatillo salsa (mild), and a spicier chipotle salsa.  All yummy.  We also got guacamole which was tasty (but honestly, how do you screw up fresh guac?)

I had two appetizers for dinner - pork taco truck tacos and fried plantains.  The pork tacos were delicious - the addition of a bit a pineapple was wonderful.  Next time, I will try a pork entree.  Fried plantains were delish as well.

As for ambiance, it's nicely decorated but LOUD.  Don't try to have an intimate conversation during the weekend dinner rush.  Service was wonderful (and I'm picky).  Prices are quite affordable.  

I will definitely be back.
author: Marti S.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants I have ever been to!!!!! The steak torta sandwich and the chicken quesadilla are to die for!!!!! Cool experience all together with a large menu by the door to pick out ur food, then order and take a seat to have ur meal served!!!! AMAZING!!!
author: Steve V.

description: My boss and I stopped into Tropisueno last night after a very long and demanding day at work, but found the kitchen was already closed. After seeing us briefly debate whether we should stay or find another place, our waitress Monique offered to bring out whatever she could for us from the kitchen. She brought out more food than either of us were hoping!! Her extra care and attention to us has definitely made us want to come back in the future. Can't speak highly enough about her service or her sweet demeanor. Tropisueno has Monique to thank for making us repeat customers!!
author: T S.

description:
Went here tonight with some friends for dinner and it was pretty good. Their chips were really fresh, and the salsa is fantastic. I had a Corona that was pretty cold, though it didn't come with a lime; which I thought was a little odd. My girlfriend and her friends had the house margarita, which they said was really good.

For the entrees, I had their "Pollo Asado", which was really good though I wasn't expecting an actual half of a chicken to be on my plate. Good nonetheless.

Friends had their "Los Favoritos" meals, with some tacos, enchiladas and tamales that looked pretty good.  One of the plates in our party was messed up with chili relleno instead of a tamale. The waiter apologized, said they'd being out a tamale free of charge. Four minutes later, the tamale arrived though as some other reviews have said, when they mess up, the cooks seem to be _very_ rushed back there. The tamale arrived with the corn husk still on, and melted cheese on top of the husk. Pointless, much?

Screw ups aside, the prices are decent for the quality of food you get.
author: Jon U.

description: A friend had seen Tropisueño featured on Check Please so we decided to go celebrate a friend's birthday there. What a wonderful choice!!! We made reservations and were seated within 5 min of arriving. The ambiance was fantastic ( a lot of people, dimly lit, casual) and the food...uhhhhhhh delicious!!!!  To begin with, the variety of salsas they serve you right from the beginning are indicators of how great the meal will be!  As an appetizer, I ordered the Molotes de Elote y Chorizo, I didn't like the combination to be honest but friends at the table enjoyed them.  My entree selection was the Chile Verde, ay, ay, ay...SO GOOD!  It was absolutely amazing!!! I wish I could have finished it all!
author: Monica B.

description: I love this place for its ambiance and its chips served with three salsas. I prefer their appetizers to the mains. Very friendly wait staff. The wait for a table on Thursday and Friday evenings can be long! But the bar is inviting and convivial.
author: Parminder B.

description: I officially love this place!  Especially after I ditched a date, who was three-sheets to the wind when I met up with him.  Tropisueno was my only hope, while I waited an hour for a friend to meet me so a night in the city and the pretty wouldn't be wasted.  I found myself rolling solo at the bar with chips and salsa, and chicken tacos (as usual).  Delicious food and great service.  Plus the burrito bar they have open during day is amazing!! I'll be back again and again, but next time I'll be bringing my crew.
author: Michele O.

description: My friend and I stopped by this place during the Yerba Buena Night event this past week. The atmosphere was so nice and the food was beautifully presented! The drinks were heavy on the alcohol (for me, since I'm a light weight, maybe not for others) but still super delicious! The platanos and black beans were so delicious and the complementary chips tasted fresh and home made. They even came with three different salsas in a beautiful dish - like I already mentioned, presentation was superb. But the best was our server, Eliseo, who made us feel very comfortable and was super personable. Great time!
author: Sam K.

description: Free chips and salsa (there's an awesome mix and match salsa bar) AND please order the tortas...sooooo good.
author: Hilary L.

description: I was craving Mexican food. I'm usually not into Mexican food, but I loved the Chicken with Mole Poblano--it was a pretty large portion. Loved the chips and salsas that come for free!
author: Vera W.

description: So I'm a native East Coaster whose idea of good Mexican is Chipotle. I can't say I even love Mexican food. I like tacos, and I love chips & salsa. I've tried Vicky's in San Jose and thought they were quite good, but not good enough to make me love Mexican. Tropisueno made me want to come back the next day. Their fish tacos, crispy tacos and meats were delicious. And a big plus - eating in the bar area is just fun. It's nice inside for a Tacqueria type restaurant, yet it still retains some of that Tacqueria with the doors open to the street feel.
author: Bern H.

description:
My friends and I were about to go clubbing in the area and were in the mood for Mexican food for dinner. Tropisueño was our pick and I really enjoyed it.

The four of us ordered plenty of food to share. We started off with lots of chips with salsas and guacamole, as well as their Crispy Flautas. The regular salsa and the salsa verde are very good for my taste, in other words, they are quite mild. LOL. I wished their guacamole were bigger because I can never have enough of them. The flautas were crispy and tasty as how they should be.

Then we had two orders of their "Los Favoritos," which included a taco, an enchilada, a tamale and a Chile relleno. They also came with rice. The beef taco and beef enchilada were exactly what I expected them to be. But I especially loved the chicken tamales and the Chile relleno. They are so full of flavors and delicious. The portion was generous and for $14.95, it was a steal. At Zazil in SF center, a chile relleno alone is $14. We also had the Tampiqueño - a thin, marinated carne asada, topped with grilled green onions, and Fresh Mahi-Mahi en la Parilla - seasoned mahi-mahi with ground chive and cabbage slaw. Both dishes were delicious and memorable,

Overall, I think it was a nice restaurant with great food in one of the best locations in the city at a very affordable price. The ambiance was very comfortable. I would love to visit again when I am craving for Mexican food in the area again.
author: Jose K.

description: The food was pretty good and had very large portions. I've been for both lunch and dinner, and the atmosphere was great, the food was pretty good, and the service was decent. They did take forever to get water, but they promptly brought more chips and salsa and our food was served soon after ordering.
author: Haley K.

description: Delicious.  Great chips with a choice of savory salsas!  Big portions!  Lively atmosphere. We had reservations on a pretty busy evening at 6:30pm and got shown to our table almost immediately. What more can you ask for? I've been here twice, and any time I'm doing something in in this vicinity and need dinner or a happy hour meeting spot, this will be a top contender.
author: Liz S.

description: Restaurant was busy so would seat us only when full party arrived. Food was great - just had the enchilada. The margarita was bigger than my water glass!  Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice dinner experience in this area.
author: Heather R.

description:
Came here for lunch with a co-worker, and I am definitely a fan as a lunch option in FiDi.

The ambiance is an interesting mix of Chipotle and a more upscale restaurant; you order at the front and then take a seat, while someone else brings you your food.  Strangely enough, it works.

I had a shrimp taco and split a Torta Tropisueno; both were delicious! The shrimp taco was spiced well and had lots of flavor.  The tart vinegar slaw, spicy and garlic-heavy shrimp, and great salsa hit the spot.

The torta.. oh, the torta. The Tropisueno torta has carne asada, grilled chicken, carnitas and chorizo. Yes, you read that correctly, there are FOUR types of meat in it... how can you go wrong?  The beans, guac, lettuce and salsa complement the huge amount of meat, and create an overall delicious sandwich.

Total bill was $10 per person, I will definitely be back here for lunch.
author: VL K.

description: My Mom and I travel to San Francisco very often and this is our go-to restaurant. Ive never heard of a tofu burrito and this place had it on their menu. I was not disappointed. It was the most tastiest meatless burrito I have ever tried. The salsa bar has 8 different salsas for you to choose from and grilled peppers and a few other toppings for your tastebuds.  If you're looking for delicious Mexican food, be sure to check this place out.
author: Yaritza B.

description: perfect.  sit in the bar and order off the full menu. have the best margarita in the area. top notch.
author: Jessica B.

description:
A friend and I decided to try this place out because it was new and looked decent from the outside.  We just sat at around the bar area and ordered off the regular menu because apparently once you're passed happy hour you can't get anything off the bar menu even at regular price.

The drinks were decent. 

Dishes we ordered:
Ceviche de Pescado - fish tasted fresh, but very bland in flavor
Empanadas de Hongo - (we ordered this once we found out we couldn't order the quesadilla from the bar menu) decent tasting, but one of those once you eat it you'll forget about it dishes, definitely not going to order again
Yucatan Poc Chuc - The pork skewers itself not that flavorful, but the salsa definitely packs a punch

Out of the dishes we tried I liked the free chip and salsa the best.  Overall the restaurant's dishes were bland and forgettable.  It wasn't bad tasting I was just expecting something better seasoned considering them bill themselves as an "Authentic Mexican Restaurant".
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I always said that Mexican was at the bottom of my list of culinary preferences, but this place has really flipped the script for me. 

The small plates are amazing! The platanos and the fluatas are so delicious. Ask for the habenero salsa if you want some extra heat. 

We also had the camarones tropisueno (shrimp) and while delicious we think next time we'll just get small plates, because those were the highlights of our meal.

Also their cocktails rule :)
author: Jonathan H.

description: The tostada is great for refried bean lovers like myself.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Went here just now for a little X-mas office party fiesta. Granted it was a party of 3, but hey, a party nonetheless. Ole! We stood in line at 1:30 and it was pretty crowded. I guess a good sign? You order in a line, and then get a number and sit down. You would think that it would be crappy, but think again..

I ordered a chicken enchilada combo meal, with came with black beans, yummy crumbles of queso fresco dancing atop the bean pile, yummy Mexican rice (I wish I liked rice, I really do, its sad) a little baby scoop of guacamole and my enchilada. The star of the plate was cheesy and red-saucy, but not overkill. I would suggest getting two of those bad boys if you're really hungry because they're not huge. Overall, the place was nice because it was clean, predictable (no experimental  flavors or anything) Mexican food. No surprises but no disappointments either. 

The sweet lady who took our orders and brought it to our table was more than nice, and at 8 months pregnant, no less. Bless her heart (and big tummy.) 

While you eat, you feel like you're in Mexico because the restaurant is festively decorated with giant plants everywhere. It's just one of those happy places you can't help but to go back to once in a while to escape the boring crap. We all need a little tree jungle fiesta sometimes.

12/23/09
I would just like to add that I coincidentally got the worst tummy ache of my life and possibly in the history of mankind about 2 hours after lunch, which stayed with me the whole night and still kind of lingering today. Not saying its them, but its suspicious....
author: Russaqueen r.

description:
It's my first time at Tropisueno last Saturday.  Their chips, A+!!   Thin, crisp and delicious!  My margarita was good!  Unique cocktail menu.  

Both the scallop starter (Callosde Hacha ala Plancha) and the Chicken with Mole Poblano were salty for my palette.  My seafood soup (Caldo de Mariscos) was not salty.  The flavor was good but not great either.  The seafood was tender/not overcooked.  

We had the fondu for dessert.  The presentation was great but nothing you can't make at home, melting chocolate with diced fruits.  The elephant ears were good.

I would go back for happy hour, but not for dinner.
author: Gina W.

description:
Very tasty food and the sauces are incredible. If you like spice- they have a couple of sauces that will totally satisfy you. 

I ordered a Cheese Enchilada with Rice and Beans and a Carne Asada taco. Delicious! 

I had a friend who is vegetarian and she was VERY happy with her burrito as well! 

I didn't have any drinks but it will be a definite must next time!
author: R B.

description: So I ordered a tostada salad, plus grilled chicken, plus sour cream; and I got a ... tostada salad. Boo. The line had been so long (around 1pm) and we were in a hurry to get back to a conference, so I didn't correct or complain. Portion was huge but the dressing was tame. Yup. It sure would have benefited from some of that sour cream. We had a party of about eight and I'll admit I :was: pretty impressed with the speed of food turn-around, especially given the crowd. And my taco shell was awesome (I fully believe in eating the whole tortilla and/or bread bowl when the opportunity arises.) All in all, a nice, easy spot for lunch with a pretty big menu...but I'm sticking with a carnivore-friendly taco next time.
author: Christina G.

description: This spot has all the mexican staple foods: tacos, burritos, tortilla soup, enchiladas, and margaritas! They also have some great unique dishes with a mexican spin as well. The margaritas come in many different flavors, and the beers on tap are good as well. This is a good spot to hit up before or after a movie at the Metreon which is very close by.
author: Casi C.

description: Had a chance to try this place out the other day with a group of friends after a long day. I must've strolled through Yueba Buena Lane on my way to the Metreon from BART and passed up this restaurant a hundred times. I thought it had some of the freshest seafood served in any Mexican restaurant I've ever been in. Everything I ate was so fresh from the salsa and the chips, to the guacamole, the ceviche, and the main course which was a skirt steak served with rice, black beans, a chicken enchilada and tortillas. Look I get it, Mexican in this town is tough. Mexican in the SOMA with a new fancy restaurant opening up every other day by some former sous chef of a Michelin rated chef is tough. But you know what's tough? Settling for bad Mexican in a place like Kings Beach after a long day of snowboarding. People in SF have no idea how good they got it. I thought the service was amazing and the wait staff extremely helpful and friendly. Definitely will be returning to this place in the future.
author: Eric L.

description: My friend, Stacey and I stumbled upon this sweet little treat by accident. We were hungry and I loves me some Mexican. OMFG! It's amazing. Stacey lives in Melbourne, AU and is a world traveller and according to her, "This is the best burrito I've ever had." You'll leave your wife or husband for one of their margaritas. The waitress recommended "The Tropisueno"- and oh my. They used rose-infused sweet salt around the rim of the glass. I licked it off and didn't care who was looking. I'm new in town and I can't wait to go back.
author: Lianne S.

description: I sat at the bar and had great service.  Negra Modela on tap is always good in my book.  The veggie soup (entree) was enormous and delicious.  Great flavors, descent prices, and a nice atmosphere.
author: JK K.

description:
This place is amazing!
The food is savory and simple, leaves you wanting more. Their margaritas are smooth and delicious, easily one of the best ones I've ever had. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kristi S.

description: Mexican Kitchen!  One of the friendliest restaurants I've ever been in.  The food is fantastic.  We stopped in for lunch and returned for dinner the next night - surprise! - the restaurant was transformed...we felt like we were in a movie.  Multiple sauces.  Excellent, excellent food and service.  Highly recommend.
author: Dodo H.

description:
I checked this place out on Monday for lunch, and from the looks of it, it was the first day they'd had customers. Everything was just a little disjointed and slow, but I'll cut them slack since they're new. All inefficiency aside, the torta with al pastor I ordered was actually pretty darn good, fresh bread, well marinated meat, and pretty tasty chips on the side. From the decor I couldn't tell if they were going for a more formal sit down place or casual taqueria-style digs, but it's a pretty nice atmosphere either way, with a good view of Daniel Liebeskind's off kiltered blue cube across the way. 

Finally a good Mexican spot in the hood!
author: Keyvan R.

description: For your own good, don't show up at this place close to their transition from "cantina" to restaurant - it greatly confuses the manager, hostess, and waitstaff. I doubt my situation is common, but it was shockingly lame enough to get me to post. We had a large party and had spent about $300 from 4:30pm to 5:30pm on Saturday. When two more from our party arrived, they were unable to be fed due to the absurd logic used by the management... "uh, we are now into dinner service, so we'd have to serve you a full dinner and your table (which sat 10) is in 3 service areas... We don't know how to get you food". Well, your a restaurant, right. How bout you bring us a menu, we'll order, you bring the food, and when we're done and have paid you, we'll leave. "Yeah, well, uh, you can put your name in for a table, then we'll seat you"... But, as you can plainly see, we are already at a table, why don't you just bring two menus?" Hmmm, uh, we could move you to another table. "... Ok, so we move, you clean this table, we'll go to another table so you can clean that one later, thus taxing your obviously easily confused wait staff... If you've read this far, you can probably imagine that we left without ordering any more food and went on our way with two of the ten of us starving. What a bunch of mindless nitwits! I have more insightful and logical discussions with my two year old. F*#@ this place and their asinine group of managers... Food was pretty good.
author: Tate C.

description: Margaritas!!!  Love 'em.  The first time I came here was at lunch time and I was caught off guard by the order your food and find a table routine.  I think they change it to table service at night.  The food was good.
author: Michael R.

description: Upscale Mexican with a fun ambiance for dinner and drinks with friends/family.  Get reservations because this place gets busy with the nearby mall traffic.  Their chips and dip is addictive, but their guacamole definitely needed more salt and lime; it was otherwise just an avocado paste.  Their namesake shrimp dish (camarones tropisueno, $16) had ~5-7 humongous shrimps in a delicious sauce and not too spicy.  Worth a try if you're looking for a festive Mexican dinner.
author: Grace M.

description:
went here for a birthday dinner for a spanish friend. the vibe is nice, good layout, but the service, while somewhat attentive, was absent-minded. strangely the crowd dispersed quickly by 10pm despite it being a saturday night, but this may be a pan-SF phenomenon.. the food was decent and tasty, if uninspired. 

all in all, a nice experience but nothing to write home about.
author: Venktesh R.

description:
good: fluatas, salsas, tacos de pastor, whole beans, cute decor, strong margaritas
bad: refried bean were burnt, my bf didn't care for his food...he said it was flavorless.
author: mel m.

description: Amazing. The ceviches were delicious and I could have eaten them all night. The entrees were very generous (as with most Mexican restaurants) and the mole was top notch. Service was kinda super adorable too. It was great to find such a solid restaurant after a long afternoon at SF MOMA.
author: Jack B.

description: Great spot....really good chips and salsa and the food is gourmet.  Only downfall is they have a good happy hour but the bar area is tiny.  I brought a group of 15 people in and the manager was not very helpful in finding a place for our group to hang out and when we did get a place to sit, she kicked us out saying they needed the tables for dinner.  Still giving it 4 stars because of the great salsas, lunch and margaritas...
author: Sean B.

description: Extra star for the chips, salsa and quick service; no stars for the food, which tasted like a microwave dinner or for the margarita, which tasted like a store-bought pre-mix. If you've never been to a taco stand you might might perhaps find this food court version palatable.
author: Tom S.

description: Food's just as yummy at lunchtime, but it's all taqueria-style.  Wait in line, order at the counter, and they'll bring it to your table.  Drinks are available at the bar.  The green "mole" was tasty!
author: Andi T.

description:
Enjoyed a delicious birthday lunch here with friends on a Sunday afternoon.
We arrived at noon and the place was already starting to fill up, so we grabbed a booth and then placed our order at the counter.  Within minutes our dishes arrived.  I ordered the solo carne plate with chicken, black beans and extra lettuce instead of rice.  The portions were extremely generous and the food was soooo good.  The chicken was well seasoned and flavorful and the beans were just the right texture--smooth and creamy and not at all gritty. For those with food sensitivities like me (gluten and dairy), it was nice to eat somewhere with so many options. Also, the management team was very helpful and responded quickly when I had emailed them in advance about safe menu options for me to enjoy.
My friends enjoyed the chips and salsa (there were at least half a dozen varieties to choose from), 2 rounds of margaritas, burritos and beef tacos.  We enjoyed the laid back atmosphere of the place and did not feel at all rushed to leave, so we ended up staying for about 2 hours just chatting and catching up.  All in all, a great place to have a casual, delicious Mexican lunch.  Though I live in San Mateo and am not in SF that often, I am already thinking of an excuse to head back for lunch again.
author: Liz C.

description: Poor service, mediocre food, messed up order; that sums it up.  Seems like this restaurant must have been better at some point.  On our visit, even after repeating our orders 3x, two of the five dishes were not made as ordered.  In addition, the meat tasted as if someone had poured a jar of cloves into the dish.  Otherwise, the food was surprisingly bland.
author: TXSebas T.

description: This is for lunch review only, dinner is a different set-up and has no salsa bar. I came here for lunch today with my coworker and I have to say this is place yummy. All I had was a regular burrito, but it was huge I couldn't even finish it.  I tried my coworker ceviche taco and it was delicious, its definitely something I will be ordering the next time I'm there.  There salsa bar is amazing too, they have a salsa that taste like tomato basil, which in my opinion is really good.
author: Angela T.

description: Delicious. A friend and I came for dinner last night and unlike lunch, at dinner there isn't a counter and self seating.  We sat down and both ordered two soft tacos with mango and pineapple salsa.  They gave us a huge basket of flaky chips and two types of salsa, red and green. Mixing them both is even more delicious. The tacos were also tasty and filling. I like this place and is a good choice for a Mexican food option while around the mall.
author: Natalie S.

description: I was in the mood for some great Mexican food but I didn't want a taqueria. Luckily I checked yelp and I found Tropisueno which is just steps from Market street. The ambiance of the place is classy but casual and the prices are extremely reasonable for what you're getting. The wait for a table here can be pretty long on busy nights so I decided to skip the line and eat at the bar. I got the chicken enchiladas and a house margarita (in addition to the complementary chips and salsa). I think you can tell a lot about a place by the chips and salsa and Tropisueno's chips were still glistening from the oil where they hand made them. The chips weren't greasy nor were they too thin or too thick. The salsa was probably the best I've ever had and they even gave a small selection of three other types of salsas which was a great touch. As I watched the bartender make drinks for others at the bar discussing origins of the different types of tequila and working with fresh orange zest and other garnishes I knew I was in good hands. Their house margarita turned out to be fantastic, a shining example of what a margarita should taste like. When the enchiladas in red sauce came they looked and tasted phenomenal. They give you a few choices for beans and it's served in a bowl on the side just so they could have enough room for your enchiladas and rice on the plate. The everything was seasoned perfectly and never before have I had melt in your mouth chicken like the chicken in these enchiladas. I really have no criticisms or anything but praise for Tropisueno, really my only issue is that I don't live down the street from them so I can go back every week.
author: Matt E.

description: YUM!! who would have thought the best Mexican would be in the middle of the Convention center's food court. came here for lunch and had the shrimp taco. It was fresh and delicious. They gave me a free bowl of chips, and they have a salsa bar with at least fifteen salsa. I was in heaven! And left for lunch for about $6. Next time I am in SF, I will be back. I am headed to Mexico City in February and now I am soooo excited.
author: Nicole E.

description:
I came here after a long day of travel, and really just wanted some comfort food. From when I entered Tropisueño I knew it was a good pick: low lighting, rich wood decor, a small bar... it seemed to be a perfect fit.

I ordered the pollo asada for my dinner and was really impressed. The chicken had a delicious, spicy crust and was super juicy; it's served as a full half chicken. Surprisingly, though, the rice was my favorite part of the dish! I'm not sure what spices and seasonings go into it, but man, it was tasty. The pollo asada also comes with a side of veggies which were fine, but nothing amazing.

There were also great chips and salsa served beforehand.

I will say that the service was not amazing. On the plus side I was warned of a 25-minute wait for the pollo asada, and when it turned out to be just about 10, I was pleased. On the downside, my waitress was mostly indifferent and not terribly friendly.

If you can deal with the service, then definitely go.
author: Paul M.

description: Got a reservation for seven and was seated a little bit early.  Service at  the bar was slow and at the table even slower.  Food was good but a couple of the dishes were overcooked.  Salsa and guac was tasty but the chips were so thin they constantly broke.  Very frustrating.  Margaritas were extremely tasty and lethal.  Recommendation: Go to Maya or Tres Agave instead.
author: Jeff M.

description: Amazing chips and salsa. Great entrees. Tasty margaritas and friendly prompt service. I would pass on the guac.
author: Matthew B.

description: Hands down the best sandwich in town. Get the Tropisueno (Rick Bayless aint got nothing on this). The best chips and salsa in San Francisco. If you are from southern California and are always left wanting to be back home when you go out for Mexican food, want no more. The only thing missing from the menu is a California burrito but there is always Olivo's for that.
author: Fancy P.

description:
I just got out of an hour and a half long meeting and the whole time I was dreaming of their chips.  They really are that good.

Oh yeah - it would be AWESOME if they added a soup to the menu.
author: Jessica B.

description: This place is Great, very authentic Mexican food, chips and Salsa are delicious too.
author: Pedro C.

description:
Food was good. The service was excellent. The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive. 

The prices, unbelievable. 

The chips and salsa to start off were aaaaaamzing. 

**Good place to go on a budget.**
author: Art A.

description: Wow - I am in love! Tie me up and force feed me those perfectly crispy thin chips dipped in creamy guacamole and I'll be anyone's slave! Yes...you read that correctly...this is not an exaggeration. Talk about "having me at hello" -  from the moment those perfect chips and assortment of delicious sauces dropped in front of me I was hooked. This place knows how to do it right. Service is stellar, atmosphere is perfect and food/drinks are spectacular. Perfect for date night or a big group of friends. A must visit!
author: Linda b.

description:
I went here a few months ago and I still can't stop thinking about it. The food is nice and clean (i.e. not too heavy or greasy. ). I loved the salsa and guacamole. I could have a meal on that alone. I also appreciated the fact that the portions weren't too big. and there cocktails are great! I had some drink that had honey in it.  It went down so smooth I felt that it would be a great thing to drink while sick. That is a good thing. They also have a drink with absinthe. Which may sound scary until you drink it. Then you realize that it is scary good.  

The only real reason that I am not giving this five stars is for its location. Unfortunately they are located in the small complex sits between Market and Mission. If my friend hadn't known that there was a restaurant that existed somewhere in the general vicinity I would have never gone. I guess for some people it is a good thing that it's tucked away like some sort of San Francisco secret..."to each his own" I guess. Over all this is an awesome place and I can't wait to return.
author: Nicole T.

description: If you want Mexican food in a friendly atmosphere, this is not the place to go.  The servers are horrible and seem to not understand the concept of what service means. Everytime I asked for anything (ie water, more chips, etc)  while here for dinner the other day, it seemed as though it was a chore, or I got a loud *sigh* in response.  There are too many other great Mexican places to go in this city and unfortunately, I will not be back to Tropisueno.
author: C R.

description: I work across the street and I'm always intrigued by their sign that has a hand pointing down the alley and advertises margaritas.  I was looking for a new place for lunch and thought this would be another Rubios, Baja Fresh or taco truck.  Needless to say, my expectations were surpassed there.  The ambiance is nice, the food is solid, chips and salsa  were the best I've had in the city (and I'm from So Cal, I know my Mexican food) and the men that came into this place around lunch were HOT!  I'm just saying.  Well done Tropisueno, well done.
author: Katie H.

description: Food was ok, not very authentic, but then again maybe it wasn't supposed to be. Ambiance was OK - a bit busy for my taste. Good Mexican beer selection though and great salsa. Will opt for one of the great tacqueria's next time
author: Mike V.

description: Okay, I will give you another star, Tropisueño, because your empanadas are pretty tasty and the tortilla chips are consistently fresh and crispy and delightful. But still, I wish there were better Mexican food options in the downtown/SOMA area :(
author: Richa A.

description:
I want to update my review because the management here at Tropisueno made a huge effort to reach out to me to try to resolve this issue.  Although I couldn't do much to help them figure out why I was getting over charged they took a lot of time to research it and get in touch with me to resolve.  I love a restaurant where management/ownership cares and doesn't pass me off as just a complaining customer.  I'd still review your receipts and your settled charges to make sure everything is properly charged and if not, let them know right away.
=================

I WOULD have given these guys more stars BUT every time I use my charge/check card to buy food here, they charge MORE than what I charge.  Given it's only $0.10-$0.15 more but they've done it EVERY SINGLE TIME.  They are cheating customers so all of you that use your card at Tropisueno beware.  I'd look at all your charges made there and see if they've added extra on top of what you've signed for.  I'm reporting all of the past 5 charges I've made there to my card companies.

As far as food goes...YUM
author: Nor I.

description: Great original Mexican food!  It's refreshing to go to a Mexican restaurant that has more than just quesadillas, fajitas, tacos and enchiladas.  I had the chile rellano and I had no complaints.  I just wish they had more variety at the bar!
author: Alex R.

description: Cool place and great food, I was able to get a reservation on short notice for a great table. The food was wonderful as well as the ambience, but the staff was rather inattentive and overworked. Maybe he got sat too many tables at once or they were flat out understaffed, but either way he didn't explain any extenuating circumstances. Try the ceviche.
author: Benjamin K.

description: Delicioso! A little confusing walking in because they do take reservations and have a hostess stand. However, is a walk up and order, seat yourself with a number establishment. Menu is quite diverse from ceviche (recommended) to al pastor with pineapple. Not a fan of fruit in food usually but quite good. Full bar with nice selection of unique salsas. All very fresh and have their own unique twist. Not your standard Mission Mexican food. Definitely worth a try!
author: Howard C.

description: DELICIOUS FOOD! From the moment you sit down, you are served delicious chips with great salsas. Amazing drinks! Mouthwatering entrees! Highly, highly recommend this place for mexican food!
author: Joy B.

description: Was I whilst away to the Yucatan peninsula?  By the sounds of the tunes on the PA and the coctel on the menu, I'd say so.  Would recommend the shrimp taco over the veg taco to pescatarian types.  One idea to help out the less adventurous salsa samplers than myself: labels, (I didn't see em if you had em.) Will be back.
author: Mandy S.

description:
Part of the May 2010 vaca food mongering- closed out a all-day traipse around SF in the rain with a stop at this place on Yelp's say-so.

Chile Verde was melt-in-mouth good. Chips were nice and light and crispy, with a nice selection of salsas. Guacamole was great. Reports (and a little taste) of the tampiqueño were just as good. Drinks were well-made and did have a bit of a kick. 

Service was very attentive without being overbearing, and very polite. All in all, an excellent experience.
author: Mike R.

description:
It's a friendly, lively authentic feelign Mexican restuarnt.  Be warned, that it is cafetaria style service, where you choose off a menu at the front, join a queue, order and pay for your food.  The upshot is that they bring the food to you wherever you choose to sit.  Corn chips are complimentary and there is a fully stocked bar.  

If you order the maragarita, you'll love the chili style salt on the rim!  

There is a good selection of food choices and prices are reasonable. Its defnitely a great place to chill after a day of shopping in town. Sit at the bar if you dont want to eat.

The place and loo's are clean and it has a great vibe.  Perfect for large groups!

Finally, yeah the waitstaff English is a little challenged but hey use it as an excuse to brush up on your Espanol!
author: J M.

description: I had the chicken mole  which was not at all spicy or flavorful.  The portion was good.  The service was excellent.  I informed the waitress that we had to leave within an hour, and we were able to pay and leave within 50 minutes.  If the mole had more taste, I would give this place another star.
author: Zila M.

description:
This review is mostly about the service that I experienced last week. 
Our waiter did not seem to know much about the menu. When I asked him how to describe one of their sparkling cocktails he literally leaned over my shoulder to read the menu description to me, instead of answering my question about the tequila to cava ratio. When I asked for a recommendation for dinner, giving him 3 things that I wanted, he chose something completely different than what I said I was interested in. (I mentioned the mahi-mahi, the chicken, or the carne asada. He suggested the shrimpl- seemed like he was trying to upsell me or would win a prize if people ordered the shrimp). Finally he suggested the chicken, so I ordered the Pollo Asado. I was never told it was a 1/2 of a chicken (like a rotisserie chicken, on the bones) and it does not say that it comes served this way on the menu. I never would have ordered this dish if I knew it came served like this (although my husband would have loved it, I do not). When I asked the waiter if the menu said it came served like this he said and gave an uncomfortable yes, and then just simply walked away. He did not bother to see if I liked it, he did not ask if we wanted more drinks, and he obviously did not read the menu, because it does NOT state that you will get a 1/2 of a chicken.  
"Pollo Asado plump, free range chicken marinated with citrus and achiote. grilled and served with sauteed zucchini, mushrooms, yellow squash, peppers and onion"

I believe this was misleading and not really acceptable to not inform the customer of what they are ordering. The pros are that the margaritas are great, as are the ceviche, scallops, and salsas.
author: Amy J.

description: This place had some great tacos.  I had 2 super tacos with chicken and the works of guac and sour cream along with black beans, lettuce and cheese.  It was very flavorful and the service was pretty quick.  The chips and salsa were awesome, fresh and very tasty.  My friends both had burritos and they were happy with their food as well.  I only came here for lunch and would love to come back for dinner to see their service as it seems many peoples reviews weren't that great.  But as I was here in the city for only business, Tropisueno hit the spot for my lunch needs.
author: Leilani R.

description: Had a super burrito. Really good. Service was very fast ta get my food. Chips were really fresh.
author: Jesse S.

description:
We decided to make the BART trip to Tropisueño after they won Mission's Kitchen yearly mole competition, which was pretty much the limit of our knowledge about the place.  My first impression upon walking in the door was, "Wow.  I clearly don't get out of the Mission enough for Mexican."  Far from a no-frills hole-in-the-wall, Tropisueño is all big and nice.  Everything is painted in Mexican / Southwest motifs, and all the tables and chairs are nicely crafted and well-treated dark wood.

We probably arrived at around 8:30 on Friday evening, and sure enough, were quoted a 30-35 minute wait time for a table.  The bar, however, was nearly empty, so we opted for that.  (I mean, really; no waiting, equal access to food, and speedy access to booze and bartenders?  Why not sit at the bar, if there's only two of you?)  The friendly and attentive bartenders handed us a reasonably extensive menu of tequila cocktails right away, which was a pleasant surprise; we'd expected a reasonable selection of margaritas, but were extra intrigued by the variety and creativity of the list.  One side of the menu was devoted to variations on a classic margarita (ie, elderflower or ginger liquor in place of orange, or chili or vanilla flavored salt), and the other to other tequila-based cocktails.

My boyfriend started off with a classic margarita, which was pretty darn good, though not the best I've ever had.  I opted for a Santo, basically a margarita with St. Germaine elderflower liquor instead or orange liquor, and chili-flavored salt, also very tasty, though a little on the sweet side (he didn't like it as much as the classic).  Later, he ordered the ginger-flavored margarita, and when I couldn't decide what to try next, the bartender suggested a drink from the "tequila cocktails" list made with hibiscus-infused tequila and cucumber puree, which reminded me in some ways of things I've had at The Orbit Room.  I am not typically a huge fan of cucumber, but this absolutely worked; we both agreed that it was pretty fantastic and yummy.  Pretty much everything was in the $9-11 range (and I think there was one $12 drink), and worth it.

As with any Mesican establishment worth its salt (hah), chips and salsa were complimentary and quite tasty.  Don't know for sure, but I could believe the chips were homemade (still slightly hot with oil & with a fresh-tortilla-sort-of taste).  They brought a red tomato based salsa that was pretty good, and a green avocado-based one that was FABULOUS, though it could've done with just a bit more kick.  It was all I could do not to gorge myself on chips.  We also ordered the guacamole, which was also really delicious and fresh, if just a touch on the salty side.  It didn't look like much at first, but kicked our asses in the end; we were sad that we only managed to eat about half of it.

But understandable, all things considered.  I was drooling over half the things on the appetizer menu, but given my self-appointed status as benevolent empress-dictator in charge of SF ceviche quality control, I had to go with the ceviche, which was quite a generous portion for $6.  (Bonus points for the fact that it was tilapia & thus environmentally sound.)  REALLY good.  For entrees, I had the Chili Verde pork; the sauce had a fantastic, fresh green chili & black pepper flavor, with just the right amount of spice.  The pork itself was also of excellent quality: meaty chunks with not a lot of fat, but still tender enough to eat with a fork.  This was definitely one of the best parts of the meal.  My boyfriend had the Mole Poblano, which was sort of why we were there; he's definitely more of a mole eater than me, but I enjoyed the taste I had.  The chicken was good, and the mole sauce itself was thick and chocolaty, with a hint of smoke and a really nice cinnamon flavor.  Both entrees came with rice and beans, which were not amazing, but pretty good mixed in with the chili verde sauce.  About $100 even after tax and tip for two entrees, two appetizers, and four cocktails.

The atmosphere was laid back and fun; the bartenders were friendly and super-attentive, and the servers were absolutely on it the whole time we were there.  Not sure how often we'll get out here in the future given that it's a bart trip and a bit of walking, but it was definitely a fun and tasty evening.  Definitely recommend, even on a weekend evening. :-)
author: Angela B.

description: As always I love finding new Mexican restaurants. This one was okay not on the top of my list or a place I would die to visit again. I got the veggie enchiladas with Spanish rice and beans which were decent but definitely missing some spices. I went for lunch so it was super busy and what I really enjoyed was the ambient of this place. Very quaint and cute.
author: Colleen W.

description: very friendly staff!  treat yourself and try the salmon!  make sure to make reservations.
author: Leia R.

description: Chips and salsas were great.  Guac was really oniony and limey, but it was gone in 10 minutes.  Margaritas are strong as hell - I was buzzed after one - good bang for your buck I suppose.  Had the combo plate - small chicken taco and cheese enchilada - the enchilada was as good as to be expected, the taco was meh...  The rice and beans were nothing to rave about.  Fantastic atmosphere - good lighting; could be romantic or good for a group.  Curious about the booth in the corner with drawn back curtains- looks super cozy and private.  Service was friendly and timed well.  I'd go back if I was in the area and try the mole - a bit hard to find the location the first time.
author: Erin C.

description: Stopped here on a Sunday evening at the end of a writing retreat, and had the best time ever.  I ate a light meal of empanadas at the bar and enjoyed a wonderful margarita with chili salt, their signature cocktail the Tropisueno (a hibiscus/cucumber/apple/tequila concoction), and an egg white cocktail.  Made some great new friends and the empanadas were perfection and the perfect portion for my hunger level.  Everyone was so friendly and funny...definitely going to be a regular here.
author: Jo S.

description: For a Tuesday I can't quite understand why they were rushing us like we were in a taco bell at 10:55 five minutes before closing.  We were on a date and I thought that obvious  by the way we looked at each other in the eyes as they came by several times to get our order when we hadn't even glanced at the menu. It felt un nerving. We just wanted to take our time, there didn't seem to be anyone waiting for our table, it was 8:30pm and by 9:15 our check was slung on our table. Again, we just wanted to sit and enjoy one another and the atmosphere. It would have been nice to feel like we had time to enjoy one another. Next time maybe.
author: Michelle K.

description: This is a guilty pleasure. I love the food, but it is a little heavy, lots of cheese
author: matthew s.

description: Ordered the Chili Verde and Carne Asada.  The food was great and chips/salsa terrific.  Our service wasn't very good, but I would give this place another chance based on the food alone.
author: Steve P.

description: Very nice the Sunday we tried it.  Great choice of salsas and yummy chips.  On the weekend (it seems), you order at the cooking station, pay, then they bring out the food.  Weekdays they may have waiter service.  Only down tick was the fish in the fish taco. Chunk of fried fish, but soggy without much texture.  Regular taco was yummy.
author: Eclectic E.

description:
I'm looking forward to the full opening of this place.  We went for the pre-opening celebration last night and they had a great selection of incredibly tasty tacos, ceviche and tamales.

Starting next week, they will offer a "taco bar" service (tacos, burritos, quesadillas, etc) for lunch.  In December when they open for dinner, they will have full table service and an upscale sounding menu.  The chef (who was incredibly friendly) said they've set up the place to "transform" between the casual lunch scene and the dinner vibe.  Different windows will open, lighting will change, etc.

We will be back.
author: Todd S.

description: This is a very biased review because Tropisueño is the absolute closest restaurant to where I work. They certainly see me a lot more on rainy days! A little overprices, but they usually have enough seating for a group of about 8 people (good for welcome-the-new-guy lunches) and their chips are great. Above par salsa bar too, if I do say so.
author: Adam D.

description: Recently had lunch here.  It was good, but I hear its the dinner menu one should take advantage of.  The lunch menu was different, smaller, and not as creative.  I had a burrito that was very good and huge.  I think I ate about a quarter of it and took the rest home.  The other food people ate was also good.  Not outstanding, but good.  I'd eat here again if I were walking by around lunch time.  I'd definately come back to try dinner.
author: Brad F.

description: This is really good mexican food.  Some of the drinks were a little too complex for our group, but I had the Tropisueno (with ginger) and it was fabulous.  The food was all around great!  I even tried something I'd never had before and tried the meat filled chile relleno on the waitress' recommendation.  Wonderful, aromatic, delicious!  Everyone at our table had a great meal!  Too full for dessert.
author: Robin B.

description: Awww yeah! I love me some Tropisueno!!! The margaritas are made with real agave, NO sweet and sour and are absolutely delish! The bartenders are all super cool and the food is pretty good too. Can get very crowded, but I think it's worth it if you need a Mexi-fix in the Union Square area.
author: Julia M.

description: Joined my girlfriends for some drinks. Margaritas were good and chips and salsa were served but we were kicked out of the table after an hour due to a reservation. Will be back in the future and hopefully we can stay longer.
author: Melissa P.

description: So amazing. Had the chicken with mole poblana (only $15.00, what a great price.). Nothing on the menu was too expensive. Very well priced. Great atmosphere. Lively music and amazing chips and salsa. This place was packed, sign of a great tasting experience. I suggest you make a reservation for dinner due to a 30-50 min wait time (host said that was average.) I will be back again.
author: April M.

description: We've had mexican all over the country and I have to say for Carnitas this place is now second on my list, The Little Onion in Santa Ana still ranks #1 for me.  I had a business meeting down in the financial district and afterwards hubby and I were hungry so we decided to let google advise us and this was close.  Although, it took us over an hour to go the 2.5 miles to get here and finding parking is a nightmare. Best to park in the mall parking garage and walk as it's really not that far.   Still worth all that though. Walked in at 5:45 PM and waitress told us we had to be out of our table at 7:15 for someone who had a reservation but we were okay with that as we just wanted food.  They bring you 3 different salsas and two of them were good. Chips are nice and thin and were very warm. Ordered guacamole too and it was okay.  I had the Carnitas and they were very good! Not too fat and lots of flavor. Hubby had the Chicken with Mole and he said it was very good, flavorful and tender.  Two complaints - Diet Coke in a can - Seriously?  You have a bar why is it not on tap and it was pricey for the can!! Also, It is VERY loud in there and very hard to hear each other. In fact we ended up barely talking as it was so hard to hear each other.  But, other than we'll be back!
author: Diana S.

description: Great food! Love the salsas they serve with chips at the bar and at the table, too! The wait staff is very attentive and nice. Made a reservation ahead, which was good, because it was packed- from what we heard, it usually is. Noisy, but  worth it for the food!
author: Nancy P.

description:
I discovered this restaurant when it was featured in 7x7 Magazine! One picture had me on the phone calling for a reservation. We went on a Friday @ 6pm and the bar was packed but there were plenty of open tables. I do suggest if you plan on going anytime after 6, making a reservation because once we sat down it filled up really quickly.

The busboy brought us water, chips and salsa within 2 minutes of us sitting down! The chips and salsa were very good! They could have been a TAD less salty but the water is plentiful and quickly refilled throughout the meal. We ordered margaritas (The House Margarita & the Violeta). The Violeta was 50 cents more but had much more tequila than the house margarita. The margaritas were great! The portions were slightly smaller than other restaurants but it was hardly an issue.

For our main courses we order the chicken with mole and 2 chicken enchiladas! The enchiladas were good! There could have been a bit more flavor but they included a nice cheese on the top! As for the chicken mole, WOW! This is the BEST MOLE I have ever had. I am somewhat of a Mole Aficionado and I was thrilled with the mole @ Tropisueno. The portions are generous. We ordered black beans with our meal which were a little watery but good none-the-less.

The service was great! We were greeted immediately. The busboy was attentive to our water as well as chips and salsa. The waitress came back several times to check on us.

The decor is warm, cozy and wonderful! It makes you feel comfortable. 

Overall I highly recommend a visit to Tropisueno for DINNER! I have never been let down by the recommendations of 7x7 and Tropisueno is another great mexican restaurant to add to my list!
author: Casey Jane D.

description: Best happy hour in this city, BY FAR! The service is amazing!! They have more chips out before you can even ask! Tasty and strong margaritas! The food is cheap during happy hour and it is to die for!! Best chicken quesadilla EVER! It does get crowded, but the service is still great!!! I will always come here for happy hour!
author: Kayla O.

description: Chips were awesome. Service was slow... maybe because it was busy. The bartender tried to deny the 5 people deal when there was 7 of us. Carne Asda was extremely fatty.  Chicken enchiladas were good.
author: David M.

description: Bland. Really bland. Good vibe but the food needs a swift kick in the pants I might say.
author: Caedmon P.

description: Great place! The seafood is amazing! Only minus for the guacamole, I expected it to be more and mixed at the table.
author: Emma S.

description:
the chicken mole was really just average... lacked the complexity of the flavors from the ingredients
the restaurant itself has a good design... traditional mexican style with a contemporary twist
service was pretty good... attentive and friendly
author: charlotte s.

description: The food is really bad.. For that kind of price there are soo many much much better restaurants.  Forget it if u try to have a conversation, the noice decibel is so high.
author: Fiam H.

description: mmmh SO GOOD! This food is fantastic!!! I can imagine it now: yom yom yom yom. I ordered a chicken torta. The meat was well seasoned, tender, delectable, finger lickin good. The condiments were unlimited, spicy, fresh, and healthy. The salsa selection was gloriousness fabulousness mmmmh. Fresh juices too! OMG. Best restaurant I've been to in a long long time. I never even liked Mexican food before this. I've been living in a cave all this time and have finally seen the light!
author: Wanjiru K.

description: Server took a long time to get us silverware and our order. The food was mediocre but the chip and guacamole was great.
author: Jared L.

description:
I generally am not a fan of Mexican cuisine.  At all.  Four of us were attending the Gertrude Stein exhibit and gallery talk at the Contemporary Jewish Museum, and one of the party had the good sense to make dinner reservations beforehand at this eatery.

Well.  I tell you.  I am now a convert.

The food was absolutely tremendous.  I cleaned every plate put before me.  I chose two appetizers: the platanos fritos and the Camarones al Mojo de Ajo.  Ssssccrrruummmppptious!  The chips that arrived before dinner, with a selection of three dipping sauces, were horribly addictive.  Be careful about ordering spicy dishes.  Some of them are ultra sultry ;-)

I can't say enough about the Tres Leches cake.  Four of us shared two of them, and know what?  Next time I am getting a whole one to myself.  I don't usually eat cake of any kind--I'm more of a pie-and-cookie person--but this dessert rocked my world.  Incredible flavor.

We went on a Thursday at 6 PM; the place was jam packed to the gills; you felt an energetic, lively, slightly chaotic vibe the moment you stepped through the doors.  I strongly recommend reservations if you are coming for dinner.
author: Lizette W.

description: This place is a great, inexpensive place to get Mexican food.  They have a salsa bar where you can sample as many different types as you'd like.  I ordered the mole Poblano, which was very good; it came with Mexican rice, beans, tortillas, and guacamole for $12.  The portions are very generous, and you get free chips with your meal (but you have to ask for it).  Generally a very comfortable restaurant with good service and great prices!
author: T T.

description: I like it because it is conveniently located next to my work but the way they conduct their taqueria section always drives me crazy. Why can't they just get their system in order? I'm used to taquerias where you tell them what you want and they make it for you right there in front of you. Instead at Tropisueno they have you wait in line, order,pay for your food, then wait 10-15 minutes for your burrito to be ready. All the food and ingredients are in front a la Pancho Villa and even Chipotle. Their system is much faster and efficient. All in all it is a little pricey and their food is ok and their system sucks. Be prepared.
author: Nick H.

description: Good food, average margaritas. Overall, I was pleased with dinner last night, but as a huge margarita fan, I was really disappointed with both of the different margaritas I ordered. Order the food and stick with beer!
author: Megan N.

description:
We have a charity event coming up and I was looking for something fun to eat for lunch.  Read about Tropisueno and their fajita bar.  SOunded fab and their Yelps were good.  I called on Monday, assured someone would call me back but was asked to fax in my request "so she'll be prepared."  Tuesday afternoon, no one has called back.  I call again.  Someone different answers and tells me "we don't deliver."  Um, your website says you do and I've already spoken with someone about having it delivered.  She puts me on hold and I'm disconnected.    I call again the following day--third time now--and say that I'm getting nervous, the event is quite soon...no one's called me back.  I give them my personal cell since "the manager can only call you back after 430" when I'm off work.  No one calls me back.  I call them AGAIN, in the evening, when I'm assured a manager can talk with me.  And I am put on hold.  Forever.
So, to recap: four calls,  a fax listing our desires & willingness to pay with a credit card,  uninformed & uncaring staff.  Guess what?  We went with someone else.  The food may be great but I'll never know because the service was ridiuclously bad.  They are getting one star because Yelp won't let me give them NO stars.
author: julie a.

description:
I'll start this review by stating that I've been to this restaurant three times in the past two weeks. I'm sold. This place is great for lunch, happy hour and dinner. The overall atmosphere is nice -- not too campy or cheesy, but just enough decor to keep it interesting. The vibe is generally pretty energetic, with most tables usually full. 

The selection of salsas they bring you when you arrive are great. I hate going to places and eating the same boring salsa over and over until the meal arrives. Not only do they give you four, they give you four GOOD salsas. Just be careful, it's very easy to fill up on chips before the dinners make it. The dinner food is actually pretty unique. It takes Mexican food to the next level, with a little more intricate flavors and presentation. I normally opt for the traditional plate, which lets you choose a combination of 2 or three unique items (I'm pretty predictable and stick the the chicken taco and cheese enchilada.) I've tried other items on the menu and have been equally as satisfied. 

 As other reviewers have noted, the service here sucks. Plain and simple. I've yet to have any sort of amazing experience with a wait staff -- tonight, for example, I ordered a second round of their "Margaritas de la Casa" (delicious, BTW...), and had to flag the waiter down after 20 minutes of waiting. It was busy, but it wasn't THAT busy....They can be pushy and start to clear drinks/glasses when they are still half full. They checked in three times on me asking if I was done when I still had a taco in my hand. Not the end of the world, but annoying no less. 

But in looking at the quality of the food and drinks, it's hard to stay away from this place. It's conveniently located near Muni (and my work!), so I definitely see myself going back for more!
author: William d.

description: Went here on a Tuesday evening after a few drinks at the Press Club- what a fabulous mexican restaurant! The food was great and the margaritas were even better! This place was packed on a Tuesday! I love places like this! Highly recommend and super convenient to the convention crowd if visitors are ever in SF and staying in the area.
author: Kimberly M.

description:
-The mahi was awesome.  
-Tasted the chicken and it was definitely a cut above the colonels' 
-Rice was okay....throw back to the mexican rice you would find at any chain restaurant.
-Service was quick but a tad over barring.

Overall, the food, service and ambiance was bueno!!!

Give it a try.
author: Solbiato S.

description: Even with reservations, had to wait.  Overpriced drinks, overpriced food.  SLOW service, dry barbacoa, fatty carne asada.  A real pain to get to.  Single restrooms for the entire restaurant.  There's got to be better than this.
author: Amanda H.

description: This place is over all a super solid "fancy" mexican + margaritas joint.  Neither are the best in town, but a pretty good combination.   That said, if the margaritas were great, I wouldn't have decided to experiment with the cocktails.
author: Amjad S.

description: I'll still loving this place and have converted quite a few of my friends into addicts. in addition to the great tortilla chips, they have a good mole and the nachos are a solid pick as well. My new obsession are the refried beans. Tropisueno's is so creamy and flavorful and I can't get enough.
author: Y C.

description: Well-prepared upscale Mexican food. Food was good, but the margarita's are very good. Close to the conference center and the hotels between conference center and market.
author: Jason H.

description: Beyond amazing food... Beyond amazing service. Erin is an exceptional manager that really values customer service. You cannot go wrong with this restaurant- everything is beyond wonderful! The entire staff goes above and beyond- always.
author: Darryl S.

description: good food and nice service - especially loved their tequila drinks and margaritas!
author: Amelia B.

description: Great place, great food, margaritas were a little expensive but only a couple do the trick.
author: Ed M.

description: I totally love this place! For some reason, I have only gotten the torta for lunch (it's too good for me to get something else). I finally went there for diner and it was just as great. I forgot my glasses, so I have mo idea what I had (basically just pointed to the menu). Anyway, great food and great prices for lunch. Diner is a little more, but so worth it.
author: Khim Y.

description: Food is very good, however, this place sucks for happy hour. You go in, order food at the window and they DO NOT tell you that there is no place to sit, as the restaurant area is closed after 5:00PM, basically the beginning of happy hour. They make you stand in this really small bar area unless you are lucky enough to get a table stand, eat your food and have your drinks. All the while the sit down restaurant area is empty- most folks don't go for sit down order till after 7:00 so it's a stupid policy. You see folks sitting outside freezing sipping their margaritas while the main cantina area is EMPTY. Food good but would not recommend, restaurant poorly managed.
author: Kit K.

description:
Before we were all to go to this hotel event, my homegirl said that she wanted to go have dinner at a place where she could have a margarita.  Of course what do we do when we need to find a place?  Go on yelp.

For one, the staff was very accommodating to us (We joked that it was mostly due to the fact that my friend is a very attractive woman).  Getting there at 8:15 on a Friday night, with no reservation, they were telling us that it was going to be a 45 to 60 minute wait for a table.  Not wanting to wait that long, we asked if we could just sit at the bar.  While they said that was an option, they instead set up seats for us at a bar like center table which ended up working out for us.  On top of that, after we ordered, the host came by to tell us a table had become available and offered for us to move if we wished.  A nice consideration.

The food here was very good and pretty sizable portions.  I had the Chicken with Mole Poblano.  I found the rice and the chicken to be pretty tasty and there was so much that I still had half left to eat for drunken leftovers today.  I also had the chance to sample some of my friends' dishes and every one of them was delicious.  The margaritas were pretty good too, although I would've liked them to be a bit stronger, but then again I could just be greedy.

I really liked the atmosphere this restaurant had too.  Really nice ambiance.  I am definitely looking forward to coming back to this place to try out their other dishes.
author: Joel J.

description: Awesome Mexican food to be found in San Fran (compared to back in the east coast). This one's near Moscone and a great find for conventions. I liked the cafeteria style, take-out/dine-in option and the fun dining area. Good chips, check. Humongous (and great tasting) burritos, check.
author: Mark L.

description: Been here twice now, and I'm a big fan of this place. The food is tasty, and the price is not bad. The service is a little slow, but not unacceptable by any means. Tropisueño is good at exceeding expectations.
author: David K.

description: surprsingly amazing mexicxan food.
author: Ryan B.

description: This is probably the best Mexican restaurant I've tried so far.  It's such a cute place with nice earthy decor.  Margaritas are super strong, just the way I like it :)  They make fresh chips and salsa. The wait can be a bit long but it's worth it!  I'm going back there soon and try their tres leche.  I'm sure I won't be disappointed.
author: Ms B.

description: Loved this place on our visit to SF. We arrived around 5:15 on a saturday and were told that dinner service began at 5:30. No biggie, got a couple margs plus chips and salsa at the bar. We were seated about 20 min later. We(2people) shared the tacos de cachete-pretty yummy. And the chile verde-delish! And huge portion! We did not leave hungry. PS- the wait was over an hour when we left around 7.
author: Sara J.

description:
what a pleasant surprise! i was in town visiting with fellow londoners who had no idea what good mexican food was having been raised in london, as opposed to me - a california native. i needed to take them somewhere close to union square as that's where we were staying.

i am rating this place 5 stars with the understanding that for the location and the price, it really doesn't get any better. 

the food was great as far as i was concerned - they had combo plates which i love at mexican restaurants. the chips were light, warm and free flowing. the guacomole and both salsas were solid.

i really didn't expect much being that this place is right off of market and could easily be one of the random junky restaurants that area is filled with, but this was delicious and i would highly recommend it after a day of shopping.

i know there is better (read: more authentic) mexican food in the city, but again for the location this was unbeatable.
author: Ana H.

description: A good place to eat.  Convenient location, warm, inviting atmosphere, nice prices, and tasty food.
author: SF R.

description: A notch above Chevys, maybe? Felt like fast food but with some thought put into the presentation. They have free chips and 3 sauces, I give them that. BF had the chicken mole, not even close! I had empanadas but I've had better. Nothing special about this place.
author: MiSa S.

description: Great atmosphere and decor.  The service staff was very eager to please, especially when a fly was discovered in my margarita.  The margarita was pretty good but on the pricey side for the amount given.  I ordered the flautas (thumps up), empanadas (a bit heavy) and guacamole (small portion).  The food definitely tasted more authentic than the chain Mexican restaurants, providing  good menu alternatives.
author: Marichelle M.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Thank you ELISEO (my new favorite sever) for a perfect dining experience. As a bartender and server I tend to be a little judgmental about service (because I know that its really not that hard to do it well) and you far exceeded my expectations. As a cook and a recent transplant from New Mexico, I am happy to find delicious authentic food in a place that makes me feel at home. The house margaritas are large well balanced, the chips and salsa plentiful and the right amount of spicy, the tamales were delicious, and the chicken inside my enchilada had a marinade on it that would make my Grandma jealous. I ate until I almost couldn't move because the food was that good. Seriously. Again, thank you to Eliseo for the great service that I have been missing in this city, and thank you to Tropisueno for giving me a place that feels and tastes like home. I will be seeing you soon!
author: Allie P.

description: Food is pretty good, but the service is terrible.  The hostess can use some lessons on customer service.  Too bad...  Otherwise a pretty decent restaurant.
author: Alvin T.

description: Based on one meal I'd have to say this place has a lot of potential for being a regular place for me to eat at. The food is pretty authentic and tasty, the service is efficient and friendly, and the margaritas are strong. What else do you want from a Mexican restaurant? It's a great locale and nice to have a decent "slightly" upscale Mexican place to eat at when in the Union Square area.
author: David H.

description:
I love this place! The food is delicious. They are fast at lunch and fancy at dinner. I love the margaritas, but unfortunately can never make it to happy hour. If they were only cheaper so I could actually afford the number I would like to drink, this place would get 5 stars.

It's so hard to find a place like this in the financial district. Not overpriced and very good. I meet friends here for lunch as often as I can.
author: Lynne J.

description:
Food here is actually good but the service is terrible.  If you come here for lunch, it will take you 30-40 minutes to get your food to go.  Also, they screw up your order all the time.  Even with simplest orders like chicken tamales vs. cheese tamales.  Or chicken tacos vs. beef tacos.  They just never get it quite right.   
This place is fine to go to when it's empty or at an off-hour like 3pm.  The food is good.  They just lack service.
author: susie k.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to. The food is delicious, fresh and a great value for the price.
author: Shlomit N.

description:
Wow - it's not very often that I am impressed with Mexican food. But, I heart the scallops!!! Or the Callos de Hacha a la Plancha (seared sea scallops on a plantain-chorizo hash with avacao tomatillo salsa). This was sooooo good! I admit, I wasn't sure what to think of a plantain and chorizo has, but it worked really well with the scallops. The plantains weren't sugary sweet (but plantains aren't) and the chorizo isn't too salty, so the two work well together, an in combination with the scallops - even better. Tony and I liked it so much, we used the awesome tortilla chips (perfectly light and not oily) to scoop up the rest of the hash. That was one clean plate. I was sad when the server took our plate away (even though there really wasn't anymore left). When I heard the server at the next table tell the folks he highly recommended the scallops, I kept saying "they're damned good" to Tony. Of course, this might be due to the house margarita (El Jimador Blanco, fresh lime juice and organic agave nector). That was a very good margarita, but very strong.  I couldn't finish it before I started to get sleepy and the busy Friday night crowd noise seemed to be amplified. Of course, I could have been getting a food coma from the Chicken with Mole Poblano (leg and thigh in a traditional sauce of dry chiles, spices, nuts, herbs and chocolate). The dish was huge! The tortillas they provided were super hot and fresh. There was a wonderful aroma of warm chocolate and spices. It was a very good mole sauce. Tony got the Tampiqueno (marinated carne asada topped with grilled green onions with an enchilada) - 1 huge piece of carne asada  (it was bigger than his two hands put together). I like my mole better. I wished the pork had a little bit more fat in it, because I think grilling it made the existing meat a little bit on the drier side.  We ended the nite with a coffee (to try to wake me up from the food coma and pleasant buzz) and this huge flan. The flan was an interesting texture, smooth and creamy at the top, drier at the bottom (you can tell where the water bath started and ended) - and it was a thicker and creamier texture than flan usually is. I felt like I was eating an egg flavored almost-cheese cake. It was delicious, just different. Tony's drink? A Michelala? (sp? - mix of Mexican beer and wine) - I didn't enjoy it that much. It tasted like flat beer. 

The portions are big, the servers were friendly, they refilled the water quite frequently. A great find. PS - I agree with other yelpers., the red salsa definitely taste better. The green salsa is made with tomatillos, and a lot of lime juice. It was sort of an odd tangy flavor- not bad, not great-just odd.
author: Annie Y.

description: fun place, good drinks, yumm chips and decent food!
author: Shal S.

description: Love the food here. Always have a good experience every time I go. Great staff, very friendly, quick and high energy. I would recommend Tropisueño to anyone looking to have an amazing night out in San Francisco. So far this is the only restaurant I've been to in the city that I loved and I know I'm not walking out into iffy area of the city, for anyone that likes to have a few drinks.
author: Garrett B.

description: love it! this was such a great discovery! one lazy work afternoon, we decided to take a little trip to tropisueno. i'm not sure if it's like this for lunch, but instead of tableside service, we ordered from the counter and it was delivered to us at first come-first serve tables. when i went to order, i asked for 3 tacos...the woman exclaimed, "wait, for how many people?" me - "oh, just me." lady - "oh no, you should only get 2." so, i said okay, thanks for saving me money and the suggestion. when my tacos arrived, i was even more grateful when i found that they were monstrous...and delicious! i also had a delicious glass of margarita, which was rimmed with chili-lime powder, making it that much more superb! i can't wait to come back!
author: Marjie T.

description:
Went here on a Wednesday evening--around 6:30--and the place was packed! Pulled up three random chairs and we made a mini table until a real one was open. Only took about 20 mins to get seated.

The margaritas were really good--we got the chili salt-rimmed ones. They have several different kinds of salt, which is great. And they were awesome. About $9 each, which is fair considering it isn't Dave's. 

They served their chips & THREE kinds of salsa immediately. Absolutely delicious: the chips were clearly house-made, and the salsas...verde, a pico/red salsa mix & the most incredible orange-colored sauce. One negative is that they brought out guacamole which was amazing too--but apparently costs an additional $7 and we never requested it (thought it was free til we got the bill)...so minus a star for that--you should not serve ppl food that they didn't order if it's not free...seriously. 

I got an amazing chicken dish--perfectly seasoned & roasted, and still on the bone which I thought was interesting since it came with tortillas... My friends got the meatball soup, which she said was fabulous every time she got it--and really filling. We also got this appetizer that was named after cigars for their shape (name escapes me now)...they were vegetarian, fried and amazing (although, I do always commend a place for having non-fried vegetarian food--it IS possible, I swear). 

It was pretty loud but was at capacity, so I can't be surprised. Servers were friendly, though it does drive me nuts when there are so many people serving you that one person can't refill water glasses & bring a new fork, or another basket of chips. 

Will be back soon.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I walked by this place many times on the way to work but never tried it until recently. It looks very fancy from the outside so i thought it would be too pricey for quick lunch. However, my friends told me it is not so i gave it a shot. We went there for lunch. I was surprised by a long line! It took a while for the line to move because only couple people can order at a time. It is like a subway style which people take your order and make it fresh for you on the spot. If you order it for dining, you take a number and they will bring food to your table.

Personally I think the food is not Mexican authentic but it tastes so good! The burrito is to die for. Chip is light, crispy, and homemade. However, all the food is so oily!! One time my friend ordered Quesadilla and it came out super oily. She could not even eat the bottom piece as it was soak in oil! 

Lunch menu is different from dinner menu. Lunch price is reasonable but dinner price is expensive. However the atmosphere of the place in the evening is better than lunch time. it is good for a dinner date =)

Few tips before going to this place
1. Only eat here once a week because it is very oily and fat
2. Chip is supposed to come with your order but you NEED TO ask for it!!
3. The line is very long especially during lunch time. I would suggest to get here before noon like 11:30ish AM or later like 1 PM to avoid lunch crowd.
 
All in all, i would recommend this place for lunch. Variety of menu and many choices of meat to choose from. The price is right for Market St lunch spot.
author: MEi R.

description: Hot day - Just what el Doctoro ordered - some fish tacos and fresh watermelon punch in the little cantina. Don't let the outside fool you this place hits all three F's for us (friendly, fresh & fast)...
author: Todd M.
