description: Great for lunch(casual, order up front) and great for dinner(converted to a restaurant with table service). AMAZING mole burritos(only at lunch). That one is not on the menu but you can order it. Every order comes with a bowl of chips and you can get whatever salsas or dips you want at a salsa bar nearby. Strong drinks and cute atmosphere. Service is very attentive and you get lollipops! Chicken mole and chile verde are our fave entrees.
author: SunnyandNolan E.

description: Customer service on the ordering side is HORRIBLE!!! The lady at the register has the worst attitude I have ever seen. I decide to not tip her because of her customer service and what does she do? She tries snatching the pen from me! When I proceed to tell her that I still needed to use her pen she decides to roll her eyes. P.s.  food is not that great! Never coming here again!
author: Michelle M.

description:
I have to say that after living in San Francisco for 10 years, I have finally found the absolute best Margarita money can buy. Their house Margarita is my favorite standby, and I have recently ventured out into some of his other creations without the least bit of disappointment so far. I find now that I have to look at the drink menu again before I make a final decision.

I have only had an opportunity to have dinner there on one occasion, and am extremely pleased with the service, food  quality, and proportions. I look forward to trying their lunch which is taqueria style with an open kitchen and roll-down menu that gets closed up and put away when the convert into sit-down dinner service. At night time is my favorite when the lighting is full on cozy and intimate
author: Sam W.

description: So it's been awhile since I yelped. I'm sorry to come back from my yelp break to such a disappointing review. I can't believe there are people that would give this place four stars. I was going to give this place 2 stars but the House Margarita's are to die for. The disappointments: the mole was too sweet, the rice was dry and had a weird sour taste. We asked for corn tortillas with our meal and were given two tortillas. One for each person. I don't know about you but 1 tortilla is not enough with Mexican or Latin American food. The positive: House Margarita's with agave, the beans, plantains and the salsa that comes with the chips. Side effect: My husband and I were extremely gassy after eating at this place. I know, TMI but someone has to let you all know.
author: Karla B.

description: AWESOME margaritas...a little pricey though. The chips and salsa are to die for...I'll have to revisit when I try the food. I'm sure it's awesome as well *thumbs up*
author: Marisa R.

description:
We had just had some drinks at the Press Club, and stumbled on this wonderful new restaurant. The restaurant was busy, which was kind of surprising given its location near the financial district and the fact it was a Tuesday night in January. Our server was very friendly, and served us enormous bowls of light, non-oily chips and salsas while we waited. I ate the Pollo Asada - and it was very tasty indeed. Our bill, for 3 people (we didn't drink any more booze) came to $45 pre tip. 
A great find - we'll definitely be coming back.
author: Nicholas H.

description: Real good Mexican food. My favorite here is their burritos. They also give a big bowl of chips with your order and have about 10 different sides/salsas to go with the chips available there. Furthermore, the atmosphere is great, the staff is very friendly and you get all this for a reasonable price! 5 stars!!
author: Govind R.

description: There wasn't a host at the front of the restaurant for about 10 minutes when we arrived at 5pm - so much for creating a welcoming place. Any other restaurant would have a host welcoming you, especially if their door is open and obviously open for business. This place is only a sit down, actual restaurant style place starting at 5:30pm. Also you must have a reservation to eat here. Otherwise, be prepared to stand and eat as it is custom to do here apparently.... (really?!) Before 5:30pm, you can sit down at the bar, or small tables (but the rest of the restaurant is closed until it's open for dinner). There is very limited seating.  It is in prime location next to Jewish Museum & MOMA, across from the Metreon. There are tons of other restaurants near by with excellent service compared to this place.
author: R And J.

description: Delicious Mexican food. Good portions. I recommend the camerones tropisueno.  Next time, I'm getting the chile rellano.  Friendly service. Solid 4 stars.
author: Eddie L.

description: Although there was a 30 minute wait, it was absolutely worth it. We each ordered a different entree: chile verde, camarones tropisueno, chicken enchiladas, and chicken tacos. Everyone LOVED their food! They start you with some chips and 3 salsas that were all really yummy. My camarones (shrimp) were in this creamy... spicy... limey... amazing sauce. I started sopping up the sauce with leftover tortillas and I would've licked the place if nobody was watching! The margaritas were delicious, but could've been a bit stronger. Dinner and a drink came to $25 per person. I will definitely be back!
author: Ashley K.

description: MMMM Burritos... Light Crispy chips, and an awesome salsa bar, plus they make the burrito right in front of you, all at a decent price.  Hands down best burrito place on Market
author: Greg S.

description: Today was the 2nd time I've been to Tropisueno and I think it's even more amazing than the first time! The food is so good and closer to authentic than most Mex places. When you walk in immediately see the menu which isn't one that has been pasted on the wall, it's a huge menu and big enough for many people to read together. The staff is very nice and you can see what they're putting in your plate while you're ordering. I had a veggie Torta and words can't describe how good it was. While my plate was being made I munched on chips and 3 different salsas from the salsa bar. The sangria I ordered from the bar was delicious but it was $8, although still worth the money. Decor is very cute, nice wooden tables and cool lighting. Also near the register they have cute little packets of Tapatio! Love this place, will keep coming back!
author: Mitch C.

description:
We went to Tropisueno on the recommendation of a friend and was very pleased with meal and service.  

We were seated promptly and chips and salsa were brought over to the table.  Chips were light and the salsas had plenty of flavor and the right amount of heat.  

For starters we had the Empanadas and Yucatan Poc Chuc.  Empanadas were delicious and not too heavy.  The Yucatan Poc Chuc was very flavorful and seasoned well.  

For the meal we had Tampiqueno, (the carne asada with beef enchilada) and the Camarones Tropisueno (Shrimp in a chile creme sauce).  Both dishes were great.  The carne asada was a very healthy portion, perfectly cooked, with lots of  flavor.  The Shrimp was also very tasty, had some good spice but not overwhelming.  I had never had a sauce like this before and was pleasantly surprised.  

Service was very friendly and attentive.  Atmosphere is the restaurant was very energetic, looking around everyone seemed to be having a good time.

It was great to eat at a Mexican restaurant that offered more than just a deep fried tortilla covered with cheese and a flavorless red sauce.  We had a good experience here and I'd definitely suggest checking this place out.
author: Michael S.

description: I've been to this restaurant a few times and had a good experience. Unfortunately, last night was unacceptable. The restaurant was really busy when we arrived for our reservation at 7:15. We were not seated until 7:40, which was understandable. Our meal was completely rushed through and they took the food away before we were even done. At 8:30 our waiter told us that we would need to leave in 15 minutes because the next reservation had arrived. This made my friends and I extremely upset. When we spoke to the manager, he told us they typically allot 2 and a half hours for a dinner party. We told him we had barely made an hour. All he did was apologize and say that we should feel comfortable staying longer. The waiter didn't come back to our table at all. I will not go back to this restaurant. Food is definitely not worth the horrible service.
author: Zaina K.

description:
Great authentic latin place in the middle of downtown. There menu list is amazing great. I have tried basically everything and have not been disappointed. I am so pleased that I have shared this hidden gem with all my co-workers.

Atmosphere very authentic cozy, latin sytle. Prices not bad at all. Great place to stop by and have a great fullfilled lunch.
author: josue p.

description:
So I walk by this place occasionally and there is always a line. So today my friend and I decided to see what this place was really about. Honestly this was like the worst food I tasted in a long time.

The place is really nice so that is why I am giving it one star. The service was horrible at the cashier desk. I ordered three tacos and a drink ($1.75 for canned drink, like come on, I have ate at restaurants where the drink is $2.00, but they have refills). The Fish Tacos were 3.95 I think, but somehow the bill ran to 19.80, so does that mean the tax is almost $6 dollars?? And there was a sketchy receipt incident where I couldn't really get the total.

Well the cashier in there (I will not identify the gender of this person because everyone has a bad day at work) with a low voice said the total was something but I couldn't hear them but it sounded like they said $9.80 (I should have been smart and thought 3.95 for three tacos is not 9.80 but I said maybe they said something else but definitely not 19.80, Man was I wrong). I checked to look at the cashier register total; it said 1.75 so I assumed that was for the canned drink. It never said the total. So they gave me .20 cents I think, I put it in my wallet carefully. Then I started to turn around and realized she hadn't given me back my whole change. So I turn around and say u didn't give me back my change. So they say "Yea" and point at the receipt that is right by their sided of the register. Then I realized maybe they gave it to and it is in my wallet. THE RECIEPT( my Stupidity) I thought it was there for some odd reason. So I walked off to my table. I have worked Retail before and they always teach u to hand the receipt to the customer rite, I am thinking it's the same for Food locations too. Or at least place the receipts right by customer side of the counter so they know it's theirs to keep. While at my table, I say I never got my receipt (late thought I know), actually my friend reminded. So I go back to ask for the receipt (I will say the place did get busy), the cashier takes a receipt out of the garbage and hands it to me (I am not hygienic freak so its whatever). BUT I look at the receipt walking back and it's not my receipt.(bad luck).

Anyways I get my Three $20 worth of tacos, wow so good..NOT. The tacos didn't even come with any chips and it had way too much cabbage in it. Honestly I prefer to eat Mexican food ( not taco bell type) but this wasn't even good. I mean it was so plain, no taste at all. Honestly I have eaten at Chili's and Cheesecake Factory (American restaurants) and even their tacos are not that plain compared to these. I am not saying I am a Mexican food expert, but if any food is plain, I don't care how Mexican it is or it isn't, it sucks. Let's be honest, you can taste bad burritos and tacos but u can hope their salsa is good but not here, the salsa sucked. The fish tasted horrible and plain also. I also noticed that there were people that had chips and salsa and we didn't, and my friend said I think you have to ask for it. If that is the case, I am going to leave that assumption alone cause I hope not. Even taquerias in Hayward give chips and salsa. 

In conclusion, the place was pretty crowded to my surprise. Maybe people know what to order I think. Fish Tacos is a no go. I would not come to this place just because there are way too many Mexican places that are better, I think I would really have walked numerous blocks to go to Gordos (which is ok food) then pay $20 for this meal.  If you like this place don't feel offended or think this is personal attack ok, it is just my experience and my opinion of it, so don't freak out Tropisueno lovers. But the service I experienced was horrible although the person that brought my food was really nice.
author: Syed J.

description: Been to this place tons of times now. Love it!! Happy hour margaritas are delicious and $5!! Friendly staff, amazing salsa, and good tacos. Decent selection of tequila as well and for a fair price. I've never been there early enough but apparently during the day they have a taco bar open inside. Also, at night they expand it into a restaurant.
author: Michael R.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here because I was too hungry to go too far away from our hotel to search for food, and the indian restaurant located next to it had really bad service (the hostess was bitchy for no reason) and we decided to just leave and we tried this place instead.  Boy, were we glad that we came here! The food was good, the service was great, and the whole place was just cozy.  
We came for an early dinner, so even without a reservation we were still able to be seated right away.  We ordered the Empanandas de Hongos as a starter -- if you like mushrooms like we do, this is very yummy and they were loaded with mushrooms.  My boyfriend ordered the Albondigas Guisadas -- a lighter dish but still filling.  I got the Tampiqueño -- i like how my carne asada was juicy and tender, not dry at all unlike some places might cook their meat.  Both of our dishes were very flavorful and delicious, and they came with big sides -- rice, beans, the whole nine yard.  I also highly recommend the guac to go with your chips in the beginning.
author: Kailin H.

description: Dinner Review:  Very cute place- dark & swanky..great for a date night.  It is pretty small and noisy, especially if you're near the bar area.  Husband & I ordered the house margarita (although small, it was potent and tasty) I had the 2 item combo which had black beans, rice, chicken taco, & chili rellano.  Husband had the asada (steak) We ate up everything and were stuffed!  I loved the avocado salsa that came with the chips- reminded me of the el pollo loco one...I could pour that on anything and be satisfied.  I understand lunch is very different, so no idea about that.  Service was very attentive as well.
author: Autumn C.

description: My purse was stolen here during dinner last month.  The waiter thought the couple next to us was suspicious when they ordered their meal and then asked for the check without eating any of it.  That is when they stole my bag.  They probably used a stolen card to pay for their "meals".  Yes, bad things happen, but the manager didn't even comp our $50 bill.  The customer service here is awful.  I had no wallet, house keys, cell phone, etc, but they graciously took my friends credit card and ran our whole bill.  Who does that??  We called the police and filed a report and the waiter was the witness.  There are lots of other Mexican joints in the city -- so need no to ever return to this establishment.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Love the quesadillas and the nachos- really good meat selection and the salsa bar is always fresh- service is a little slow and not orderly but the food is worth the slight chaos. Lunch time crowd is usually out the door so come early.
author: Julie Z.

description: this is a great place for fast quality mexican. the ingreidents are fresh and the plates are not too heavy. its a great lunch place! then you can head down the street and grab a famous cream puff from Beard Papa's Cream Puffs
author: Romina T.

description:
Nice decor! Nice owners!  

Food was generally excellent, though my Pollo Asada was a little bland compared with the other fantastic food. 

Dessert was great.  Service was more than excellent.
author: Chon Q.

description:
What a cozy, awesome gem this place is! The ambiance is chic, authentic, and casual -- it's hard to pass up the invitation as you walk by.

The food is excellent: even the rice is bursting with flavor. The Mahi Mahi melts in your mouth and the mole's got the delicate balance between chili and chocolate right. The salsas are very good but not the best I had. The cocktails sound more interesting than they taste -- I had the Tropisueno -- again, quite good but not the best.

Add the attentive, friendly service (Juan Carlos!) and a dinner tab under $30, this place can't be beat! I'm definitely going back and telling others about it.
author: S K.

description: Had the Albondigas Guisadas - excellent! Not what I was expecting when my friend said let's go out for Mexican. I'm not an expert on Mexican food, but the menu seemed more authentic and unusual than your typical burritos and tostadas fare. The atmosphere was good - dim lighting and a little loud, but spot on for a classier evening out. Service was pleasant and quick. Prices were quite reasonable. I will be back.
author: Caitlin H.

description: Best margaritas in town! Great food, great service and not too expensive. Though if you want to eat there BOOK AHEAD they book out very quickly so can't really take walk-ins.
author: Anna T.

description:
okay, i'm going to expose myself as not being very sophisticated right now, but i judge my Mexican restaurants based on the free tortilla chips you get, and let me tell you...freaking delicious.  just as good as Chevy's!  that's right, i said it...so there.

platanos fritos was amazing.  kinda more on the dessert side for me, but whatever.  

guacamole was a bit dissappointing.  

the "molotes de papa y chorizo"...basically a tamale-like dish, was really tasty.  

the rice was excellent.  i'm all about the sides and carbs, so suck it.

the carne asada was okay.  chile rellenos and enchilada were also decent.

for dessert, we got the flan and the tres leches cake...the flan was really, really good.  the tres leches cake was good as well, but was definitely upstaged by the flan.

the service was very friendly and efficient...the atmosphere was pretty cool.  this is definitely a good spot to hit up when you're in the area and in the mood for some Mexican food.
author: Miss P.

description: Try the Chile Verde, it was what the bartender recommended and we didn't regret ordering it.  Large cubes of tender pork dressed in a bright, zesty tomatillo sauce, with a generous helping of spanish rice, black beans with peppers and corn tortillas.  We shared the entree, and it was more than enough for two girls, particularly as we filled up on the homemade tortilla chips and salsa.  It was incredibly reasonable and definitely worth a repeat visit!
author: Janet L.

description: Fun place and food was great.  Really enjoyed the ceviche and the Camerones Tropisueno was incredible!
author: David J.

description: Good service but the food wasn't that great. My enchilada and tamale were both seriously dry. The enchilada was just meat wrapped in a tortilla topped with tomato sauce. No cheese?? No yummy sauce drenching it? No cheese on top? No bueno. My rice was dry too. The chips were so flimsy they kept breaking every time I dipped them in guacamole. My watermelon margarita was fine. Really loud atmosphere, which doesn't bother me. I can see coming here for drinks but it really was overall a "meh" experience.
author: Molly P.

description:
While planning the eating portion of my weekend trip to San Francisco I did what I always do in these situations...I turned to my friends at Yelp for recommendations. Once again, my awesome fellow Yelpers did not disappoint! We were in town for Wondercon and staying near Moscone. We were looking for a good Happy Hour and Tropisueno, aka Yelp Cafeteria to those in the know, was calling my name!!! 

What an awesome place. The vibe is mellow, the staff is friendly, the food is delicious, and the margaritas are strong. The menu states that each margarita contains 2 ounces of quality tequila...and oh they are not kidding. I watched the generous pour of El Jimador go into our many margaritas and experienced the warm, happy, and eventually fuzzy feeling that followed. The happy hour is the best deal going...get here early because the bar fills up fast! House margaritas are $5 as are well drinks. Tequila shots are $4 and cans of Tecate are $2. There is a large assortment of happy hour food at reasonable prices.

My partner in crime had the house margarita which comes rimmed with a deliciously spicy chili salt. It was crisp, smooth, and strong. The other signature margaritas on the menu were not included in the happy hour (regular price $9,) but they sounded so interesting I had to try a couple. I ordered a Violeta, which was a violet perfume explosion in my mouth. It comes in a glass rimmed with vanilla salt. I am not sure this is for everyone but I enjoyed it. For my second drink I ordered the Tropisueno, a margarita with ginger liquer, lemon juice, and a rim of rose infused salt and sugar. This was a delicious variation of a lemon drop and my favorite drink of the evening. Our fabulous bartender also made us a Bloody Maria which was awesome. His special touch was the juice of half and orange which brought out the bright sweetness of the tomato in the mixer. 

The happy hour food menu had so many amazing and inexpensive choices but we had a couple more stops to make on our happy hour food crawl, so we just ordered the nachos. The chips were light and crispy and the beans were deliciously creamy. There was an abundance of gooey cheese and fresh guacamole. The portion was huge and only $5.

We enjoyed our happy hour experience so much we returned the next day for lunch. Lunch is taqueria style where you walk up, order your food, and find your own seat. I ordered a rajas tamale with mole poblano and a bean and cheese tostada. My partner in crime ordered a shredded beef burrito. The tamale was light and fluffy with nice strips of chile and just enough gooey cheese. The mole was nicely spiced and a really good match with the tamale. The tostada had a generous portion of the creamy and delicious refried beans. The gigantic foil-wrapped burrito weighed about 3 pounds and was generously filled with tender and flavorful beef. There is a salsa bar with an assortment of fresh and tasty salsas. I fell in love with the tomatillo salsa and couldn't stop eating it. By the end I was drinking it...no really, I was. I washed my meal down with a house margarita which was just as delicious as the one from night before. Lunch for two including my drink was $21 and we were full up to our eyeballs!

Great food, great service, great drinks, at great prices!!! If I lived in SF this would be one of my regular haunts!!!
author: Carrie D.

description: Never, in any way, shape or form order the taco salad!  It was one of the most awful things I have ever seen from a Mexican restaurant.
author: Danielle S.

description: Good Mexican food, fresh and never greasy. Takes reservations on open table easily before you show up to cut the line and food is made fast. Great location for the movies and shopping. We get the same waitress every time and she is very attentive and friendly. Good place for friends, not recommended for a date because it is a little noisy. Combination plate of traditional classics is a great deal.
author: lindsay p.

description:
i love this place! the decor and ambiance is very nice and comforting. the staff here are friendly, and tropisueno can always hit the spot. i have only come for lunch a couple of times, and hopefully one night i'll be able to come down for the whole dinner scene. they have a nice variety of salsas and their nachos are so good! i wish they put a little more guacamole and sour cream on them, but its still delicious! tacos are great too!

not only that but they always change up their aguas frescas. they have always been refreshing and tasty!
author: Lisa B.

description: The food here is generally solid and the people friendly, but I swear if they don't heat up my next burrito I'm going to make a scene.  The shrimp super burrito was my first experience and it was not hot so I switched to ordering the carnitas super burrito, which is sometimes still cooler than it should be.  The a la carte enchiladas are pretty good but to get more than two or to get the enchiladas meal is overpriced.  A tiny margarita also ran me $10, so no mas on that front.
author: Matt C.

description: Great food and service. Some unique menu items. My water glass was always full. Wish i would have gone all day without food. I couldn't finish my dinner...but i really wanted to.
author: Kitch W.

description: If there is one thing I have learned in 6+ years here in SF, it is never to put any value whatsoever in a 'line out the door' - there is a herd mentality here that is fairly comical - especially for a place that prides itself on so much independent thinking. This place is ok, but just ok. A nice setting in an agreeable part of the city, it is one level above Chipolte.
author: George S.

description: In town for business and came across this place with help of Google Places.  The place was packed, and because I was by myself they would only offer me a seat at the bar.  It was a little crammed, but comfortable enough to enjoy a margarita and a comfy meal.  To start, they served chips with three different sauces - all three were pretty good, all homemade and varying in spiciness.  I had the Chile Relleno de Beef Picadillo and it was pretty good.  It was flavorful and light, not heavy in greasy cheese like a fast food joint.   The bartenders were great, funny and conversational. Overall, good meal.
author: Cristina B.

description: Homemade chips are addictive. Decor and ambiance are tops. Decent prices considering the other district options are pricey (Ducca, Press Club, etc). Lots to fill you. Nothing too experimental if you're looking for discovery, all stuff you can recognize. Margeritas are solid. Would go back.
author: Aki S.

description: Not just a pretty face on a place.  Of course, it's beautiful, in a beautiful new area downtown across from the new Jewish Museum (and down a few doors from Beard Papas, and around the corner from my night class).  The food was WONDERFUL.  Happy Hour was "happy" for my friend and THE FOOD, delicioso and cheap during Happy Hour.  Go forth and be happy.
author: Christina V.

description:
"I think there's a difference between just getting by and being content..."

she says.

"For me, it's how close it is to Friday ;-)"

I reply.

It's a subtle difference, and I don't think I thought about it until she said it... You can just get by with the bare minimum but contentment implies a feeling of gratefulness. It helps you get out of bed. It makes the sun brighter and the air taste sweet.

("Me la cavo," one might say in Italian - I'm taking Italian right now - "I get by...")

Tropisueño, with its intimate and cozy ambiance, elicits more of the latter feeling. You get a wonderful assortment of delicious dishes for a reasonable price. The service is great, combining hints of upscale restaurant formalities with the humility of the small. The Chicken Mole Poblano was savory and satisfying. The Tres Leches cake was a flavor explosion of both fruits and colors.

("Te la cavi bene," one might reply back - I know Tropisueño isn't an Italian restaurant but I don't know any Spanish - "You get by just fine...")

An impulse pick, but a good (and affordable) pick nonetheless. Sometimes it's better to just choose with your feelings... and, I don't know, I felt pretty content right then and there...
author: Keane L.

description:
is it wrong to judge my mexican restaurants by the quality of their complimentary chips and salsa? well, too bad, i'll do it anyway and based simply on the fresh chips and salsas that tropisueno offers, i'm a fan!

i've been here twice so far and thoroughly enjoyed the chips and salsa... oh, and the food too! on my first visit i tried the sea scallops for starters, albondigas (meatballs), and camarones (shrimp) tropisueno. was a tad disappointed with only getting three scallops between me and my bf, but whatever. the entrees were also a bit saltier than i expected, but decent.

my second time here we stuck  to the basics: the 4-item los favoritos with chicken taco, beef enchilada, chicken tamale, and chile relleno... a-ha! this is where they excel at! everything was delicious and went great with the house margarita and jamaica (hibiscus) cocktail! my only qualm was that the cocktails are a tad small for the price and the guacamole is also a bit pricey... but otherwise, pretty good!
author: Andrey C.

description: Meh. Not all that impressed. Service was slow, my quesadilla was greasy and on the soggy side and they forgot my side of guacamole. At least the prices were reasonablish.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Perfect Mole carnitas. Unexpected. Will be back. And in fact went back the other night. In the day times they have their caffeteria counter open and at night there's table service. It was packed even on a Tuesday night and the food was still great. Dinner was about $2-3 more than lunch, but still great value for money.
author: Steven W.

description: Really good food and service, even though they were extremely busy.
author: Nick H.

description: The place was amazing. We decided on the restaurant based on the reviews. It was a Friday night, so it was busy. We called ahead and found out the wait was 45mins to an hour. Rather than go there and wait, we went on their website and made reservations for 8:45pm (it was 7pm at the time). When we got there, we were promptly seated. The place was crowded with people waiting even at 8:45pm. The drinks were delicious. We got a margarita and one of their tequila / bubbly wine drinks. Me and my girlfriend would definitely recommend the guacamole. Its a bit pricy but the portion was huge! Definitely enough for at least three to share. The chips were very crispy and delicious. By the time our entrees came out we were pretty much already full. The entree portions are big as well. I got their pork chop, which was think and juicy, and served on a bed of slaw and rice. My girlfriend got the tilapia. She said it was good. We both left very happy and full. While relatively pricier for a Mexican restaurant, the portion sizes and drinks more than made up for it!!
author: Edward N.

description: This is my absolute FAVORITE Mexican restaurant in San Francisco. The food tastes great, and the portions are perfect. I love that the chips and salsa are *free*!  The margaritas are good. I just wish they would offer pitchers of it too.
author: Julie P.

description: Had dinner there on Monday night...the food was delicious, thre service was great, but the margarita salt tasted like seasoned salt....would have preferred the regular margarita salt
author: JD R.

description: Five stars for two of the BEST restaurant workers in the city of San Francisco, Manuel and Antonio!  These guys efficiently served food and drinks to the lounge last Friday night (at full capacity) and maintained a friendly and courteous attitude.  If I owned a restaurant I would want these gentlemen serving my customers.  Excellent job guys!
author: R.J. S.

description:
I was disappointed in this place. The food was mediocre and bland, and the waiter screwed up on multiple accounts. The most amusing of these was when he didn't bring out the beans that were supposed to accompany my entree. When he brought the check, I asked if my meal came with beans. He responded "if you'd like," as if I was supposed to ask for them a second time. He acted as if it were a major inconvenience for him to bring me the rest of my meal.

Also, they tried charging us for something that we didn't order.

Find somewhere else to eat.
author: David W.

description: This is my favorite "fancy" Mexican restaurant in the city.  "Fancy" meaning not a hole in the wall burrito place. The food and the drinks are way better than Tres Agaves.  They have really good happy hour deals and their margaritas are super strong.  The food portions are huge and it is super yummy.  You can't beat it.  The location is a little weird and hidden.  Forget about finding a parking spot but there are plenty of garages nearby.  Also hit up beard papas next door for a cream puff after dinner.
author: Brian O.

description: Here's what you do, you're on your way to MOMA or going bowling at Yerba Buena or maybe you just got out of a matinee at Metreon. Go to Tropisueño and get a bag of chips. They're only two dollars, you will thank me for this advice. They are so unbelievably good. You don't even need salsa or guacamole although you can get it. Oh my god they are good.
author: Klik W.

description: Visited this place while on business at a conference.  Chips and salsa were excellent:  The chips were freshly made, fried but light and crispy, and they served two fresh salsas (tomato and tomatillo).  I had the Chile Verde, which was some fork-tender marinated pork in a green chile sauce with some light, fluffy rice.  My only dig is the lack of free refills on soda (the food's a little spicy so you'll want to drink up the water first!), but the service was great when it was supposed to be an invisible when you wanted to eat and talk.  Definitely recommend going here when at a conference @ Moscone...and make sure to get a reservation first!
author: Jason L.

description:
so my (Latino) SF friends tell me, the visiting Angeleno, how lucky i am that i could "throw a stone in L.A. and hit good mexican food, but not so much here."  (i agree that i could probably chuck a rock & hit some kind of mexican food down in the Southland, but it would not be necessarily good...)
anyway, they raved about this place...and they were absolutely right in their excitement.  the service was wonderful and friendly, the margaritas delicious, and the chips and salsa addictive -- and no bank-breaking prices.  very reasonable for what you get.
the ceviche has a nice kick to it, and goes well with the aforementioned yummy chips.  three kinds of beans: refried, black, and white -- but they are all one kind of delicious.  enchiladas had great texture and flavour balance -- not drowning in some awful red sauce, but actually holding their own.
if i lived here, i'd get a place close enough so i could throw a rock and hit Tropisueño...or at least eat here often. (i won't take good mexican food down in L.A. for granted again!)
author: Erika G.

description: really central location, and offers great deals in a phenomenally cozy atmosphere. Late nite munchies sunday, monday, tuesday! bring 5 people and get drinks on the house all night. Also fun to watch people passing by either from work during happy hour or Yerba Buena.
author: Chris B.

description: True to the reviews listed here.  Burritto and chicken mole both amazing.  Salsa bar great as well.  I am not an expert on Mexican food but I have nothing to complain about.  We went midday when there was no table service, which worked out fine for us.
author: David C.

description: I love it for lunch. I love it for dinner. I love it for Happy Hour. Only reason it is 4 not 5 stars, it is in such a random area. I work in Union Square so it is perfect for me during the week, but if they could open a 2nd location in say, Russian Hill, I would be really jazzed!
author: Amy M.

description: Great bartender! Offers fun new tequila tastes. Yummy food. Fun atmosphere. Go! Absolutely a 5 star review!
author: D R.

description: Tropisueño's food is delicious and at great prices, especially during happy hour which unfortunately only went until 6pm.  We went here on the suggestion of our friend Jeff and it was the perfect choice.  Happy hour offers some amazing deals and our waitress let us put in a big order to slide in right before the 6pm deadline.  The carnitas tacos were especially noteworthy.  Finally, all of the food and drinks for 3 came out to only $19.  Hard to beat that anywhere, impossible in downtown SF!
author: Matt B.

description: It's a nice fun restaurant. The waiters are nice, as they gave us the dish they served wrongly for free. One thing I don't like is that the seafood dishes all contain meat, which is a bit surprising, and a bit hard to take order for pesco-tarians.
author: Shirley W.

description: What a gema ocultada! Me and my TWO hot dates -- stifle yourself; it could happen -- popped in here for an impromptu dinner and just couldn't believe it. From the awesome service and cozy ambiance to the lethal margaritas, perfecto chips with salsa so fresh it oughtter be slapped ... which collectively should be enough, but no ~ it got better. The entrees were extraordinarily yummy (I'd never had mole BEEF before), plus a final bill so reasonable that we were all flabbergasted. Now don't all run here at once and make them drive up the prices, but don't deny yourself the experience of this adorable alleyway cocina, either.
author: Gregor G.

description: This place is fantastic for Mexican food.  Whether you want a taco-truck style taco, an enormous burrito, or a fun margarita, this place gets it right.  The line moves pretty fast at lunch time, so it's also great for a quick takeout.  Looks like a fun place for happy hour too, though I've only ever eaten lunch here.  Highly recommended.
author: Richard L.

description: I went here for lunch yesterday on a Sunday.  I was very disappointed.  First of all it was a "order here" first then you sit down and they deliver the food to you.  I got my 2 tacos first before I received my shrimp with the red sauce.  The tacos were mostly flavorless and cold.  The meat was pretty tasteless compared to the taquerias in the Mission and the avocado and toppings were piled so high it was hard to eat.  Then the shrimp with the red sauce came out.  The shrimp were small and tough, tasted like they were frozen first, and it needed the sauce just so you wouldn't taste the shrimp.  I tasted the tamarindo drink and it was also watery and flavorless so I settled with the watermelon one which was just ok.  I wouldn't go back.  This is definitely a place for out of town gringos who know nothing about good Mexican food.  I'm disappointed though because I remember coming here around 1-2 years ago and it was really good.
author: Mitch A.

description: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING! Nestled right across from the Press Club and down the alley from Bearded Papa what an amazing find. Can we start a Mexican Food Club so when place like this opens I am not left out? I mean...a 4 meat torta, what? Amazing! Barbacoa...stellar! ~Out
author: Bryan M.

description:
reallly was looking forward to going here. mexican food is my favorite cuisine but its hard to find upscale places doing more than just burritos. 

really great night. the location is cool....yerba buena gardens kind of tucked away in a side alley. 

inside is really nice blend of casual and upscale...you feel like your on vacation when you walk in. the service was really good too. 

we had the seared scallops with tomatillo and chorizo which was awesome. 
the friend plantains with blackbeans was really good too. but very very filling. 
the chicken mole was super good as was the flanksteak. the food isnt fancy but it is conceptual and sophisticated.
the only gripe is dessert....two options tres leches or a flan. we got the flan which was fine but it be great to see a awesome dessert list at somepoint.

cocktails were excellent too margharitas done with a variety of tequilas and spirits and rimmed with variations of salt like vanilla salt and a smoked sea salt. 

AND for the quality of the experience its a really good value too.
author: Mohammad G.

description: This place is great...if you can find it. GPS won't steer you there and it is on a hidden street/bourtyard off od Mission, but it is worth the wandering...the food is well priced and was delicious and the house margherita  really gets a good buzz going. The chips are homemade and the salsas are fresh and tasty. I had a combo platter with the tamal and chile relleno - I was more than statisfied with a full belly and a tequila buzz.
author: Jess W.

description: Prior to my latest visit I had only been to Tropisueño for drinks.  However, came here for lunch last week for a going away lunch and enjoyed my meal.  Have to say the meats were marinated just right.  The ceviche that we ordered was also excellent.  I did not think I'd find this place authentic, but it was reasonably priced and tasty.  They also make good horchata.  They were also very efficient in bringing over your dishes.  I like how you order just as you enter, pay and then you get your food a couple minutes later.
author: Christopher W.

description: My 2 friends and I had a thoroughly enjoyable dinner there on Saturday night.  We were greeted by the biggest smile on the house manager's face only to be followed by excellent service by our waiter, Caesar and the rest of the very busy but very friendly staff.  The food was wonderful, I hate going to places where you take a bite and your tongue is on fire for the rest of the meal.  The seasonings were perfect with just the right amount of heat which complemented the meal not over powered it.  The margaritas are very strong so beware but the smiles they illicit are real.  Even the lollipop you get at the end was a perfect ending to a delightful evening.  The art too was most enjoyable as well.  All in all, a superb place for an authentic and delicious meal.
author: Irv S.

description: We went last weekend with friends. Things we liked - friendly service (were very cool with our friends having their baby there, helped us pick drinks and food items, etc), chill setting, good cocktails, and some great food items. Loved the empanadas, and the pork chop was really fantastic. Wasn't a huge fan of the pulled pork as it was very fatty. Fun spot - would likely go back for cocktails and apps before I went back for dinner, as there are other Mexican spots we love like Mamacita. Easy to get a reso on Opentable and convenient to Metreon / Bloomingdales mall though so a good choice for last minute dinner in the area.
author: Sarah R.

description: Great food, great margarita's, and good vibe!  Just wish it was closer to my house!
author: Georgia G.

description:
I'm so glad this restaurant was on check please, or I would never have known it was here.

At last, a restaurant that really knows how to make margaritas that aren't super sweet, and you can actually taste the tequilla!  OMG, the chips and salsa are amazing!  They give you four different salsas, and each one is yummy.  My only complaint, is that you can't stop eating them.  I had the prawns for my entree, which were really tasty.

We can't wait to go back, and try some other dishes.  Just the margaritas and the chips and salsa alone are worth another trip.
author: Meghan L.

description: Um - ok went back to what I thought my favorite place was in San Francisco.....service was subpar than it was the first time I went.  Sat at the bar in the most accessible corner - but was still ignored - even when I knew the bar tender saw me sitting trying to get his attention.  Ok so i ordered a girlie drink - I like them...but why did the bartender reconfirm 8 times with a look like "are you serious" while my date was there.....luckily she's my wife so she is comfortable with my man hood.  So we sat down and ordered.  Waitress sucked....not nice, not welcoming, I felt like she didnt want to be there....we ate food and she was trying to clear out the plates before I was even done with my food....relax lady with the pink shirt..... The guys there are pretty cool, the female staff - not so nice.  Plantains and my girlie drink still rocked so that is why I gave the three stars....
author: Shel D.

description: Tasty, affordable - extremely so given the neighborhood. The basic classic dish I had was fresh-tasting and delicious. The staff was glad to see me. I'll be back.
author: John M.

description:
3.5 stars.  drinks here are pretty strong!!  i had the tropisueno margarita, and i could only drink half of it.  the chips and green salsa were delish.  

we got the fried plantains to share, which you can't really go wrong w/.  for my entree, i got the veggie posole, which was good.  the spice level was good, and it was just the right amount of food after eating so many chips.  the fiance got 2 veggie tacos which came w/ rice and beans.  when the entrees came out, the black beans apparently weren't done yet, so they gave us veggie white beans, which were pretty good.  

this is a pretty nice for mexican in the area, which clearly does not have much variety in the way of mexican.
author: Helen T.

description: What a great restaurant!  Four of us had drinks, appetizers and dinner recently and it couldn't have been better.  All of the classic Mexican restaurant flavors were there, but many of the recipes were prepared differently than I expected.  Everything was delicious but my favorite was the plantains appetizer - I have never tasted better plantains anywhere, including in the Caribbean.  The service was perfect -- friendly, helpful, but the servers were never in the way.  Absolutely loved this place.
author: Julie R.

description: Love this place.  It's very infrequent that I find a restaurant that makes Spanish rice like my grandmother and all my aunt's used to make it.  Tropisueno brings back those memories.  It's a great place, but I usually just order the beans and rice every time I go there.
author: Rene H.

description: Terrible service ! We had reserved for 8:15 and reached Tropiseuna on time. But we still had to wait for half an hour before they seated us ! And worst, they were only able to find  table for 2 for our group of 3. When we complained to the waiter, and asked to see the manager, he just gave us some hog-wash stroy that it is "normal" for things like that to happen. I agree that a 5-10 minute wait is acceptable, but half and hour wait and still not able to provide a table for 3 is totally unacceptable. And imagine the arrogance of the waiters to be able to claim that it is ok to make patrons wait this long ! He prawns were good. Other than that I didn't like the food very much either.
author: Mohammed P.

description: Authentic, rustic and homey, this SOMA mexican restaurant is a great place to head for some unique "home style" Mexican cooking.  The atmosphere is relaxed and energetic and the food is inspired and made with care and affection.  The drinks are just as creative, strong and tasty.  I'm looking forward to our next visit!  My friend had a tamale and enchilada combo which looked amazing (I tasted the tamale--plump and flavorful with an updated modern touch).  I got the pork chop marinated in a chile brine and grilled--amazing flavors, super tender bone-in medium thick chop served atop some of the best Mexican rice along side some red-cabbage slaw.  The chips are home made and thin and the salsa is also home made and tasty.  This is a great spot for friends, socializing and fun after a long week at the office.
author: Erik J.

description:
tasty mexican food, and a nice ambiance.  if you need a change from your mundane taqueria, come to tropisueno for the nice dining experience.  but of course, the ambiance and downtown location will tack on a couple more bucks on your dishes.  they have a full bar, and their get-it-yourself salsa bar is always stocked - and clean.

call in your order if you need a bite during the lunch rush, or simply come after 2pm and you're grand.
author: Sheri N.

description:
A few friends and I needed a place to eat and I'd found this place while yelping.Honestly I'm surprised I'd never noticed it before.I'm glad I found it though because affordable good food that I haven't already grown tired of in the downtown area is getting a little harder for me.
The place is not that large,but it has a nice atmosphere.Our group was pretty large but they were able to seat us pretty rapidly.At any other place we would've needed to make a reservation.Shortly after being seated they take orders for drinks and bring out the chips.Yumm yum those chips were good,I loved the green salsa.Once our entire group had decided what we'd wanted we ordered,me and my friend went for los favoritos with cheese enchiladas and we also ordered the mushroom empanadas.
The mushroom empanadas were OKAY.they were dry,i expected them to be creamy and more mushroomy.And the enchiladas were exceptional.The food was good, but idk; I've had real and delicious mexican food before and this place is good but not great. I'd come again, but if I'm craving original real Mexican food I won't come here.
Service was excellent though!
author: Peeta B.

description:
Picture it...Sicily...it's a dark and stormy night...

No wait...sorry...wrong show. But seriously, it was a dark and stormy night, and it was late. I had just gotten done meeting Mark J. for a drink at Amber next door. I was mad fiendish for some food (and you know I love me some food!) Unfortunately, Amber was no longer serving food - boo! (Though, it was like super late on a Tuesday, so that's understandable).

As we trudge out through the rain, my stomach rumbling and Mark worrying if the thunder was quickly approaching, I console him and inform him that the noise is just my stomach.

But wait...what do we have here? ¡Tropisueño! (Do you like how I got all fancy and Spanish there?) What luck! But wait...they are closing. We run to the door just as the owner, Erin, is turning the sign. But Erin (in case you did not know) is a sweetheart. She's the kind of sweet that would take in a box of stray kittens from a homeless woman at Wal-Mart. Just overflowing with sweet. So she takes pity on our pathetic and slightly wet souls and lets us in. (Though she had to rush to the kitchen to tell them that, even though she said that they could clean up, there was just one more customer...)

So from the very start I love this place. From there...it just keeps getting better (sorry for stealing the Christina Aguilera lyric...)

So back to Miss Erin. Aside from being utterly sweet, she's utterly devoted to this place. As an owner, she loves what she does and she loves her customers. How do I know? Because she told us. We were able to spend about 15 minutes talking with her and getting to know the "lay of the land" in regards to Tropisueño. I've never had such a great time getting to know the owner of a restaurant before. Usually it's them talking about where they've worked, how fabulous they think they are...yada yada yada. Instead, she told us how excited and nervous she was for the restaurant to be starting. Mark and I both gave some suggestions, and even mentioned the Yelp part of ourselves, which she said she loved...because (to paraphrase) "I want this restaurant to be for the locals. And Yelp is great for giving me feedback from the locals." Well Erin, this local loves what you're doing - keep it up my dear!

Manny (Manuel) the bartender makes the most delicious michelada - and seriously, I've had some good ones before. But his rocked. There's something about the secret recipe salt that he uses, with just a hint of lime and pepper...my lips weren't burning, my stomach wasn't hurting...it was D-double-LICIOUS! 


In regards to food...I ordered Tropisueño with the white beans. So f-ing good. Like not even playing. It all blended so perfectly together in my mouth that I thought I was having a food orgasm. Hell, I might have...who knows? And the white beans...yes, they are definitely one of their specialties. As Mark said, it does have a slight sweet taste to them. Though it's a natural sweet taste. But to me it taste like barley or oats.

Overall, Tropisueño definitely deserves it 5 star rating and if I could give it more then I would. Even if they are in the thick of "downtown tourist" central, they are made and cater to us local folks. With an exceptionally delicious menu of amazing and authentic quality food, backed up with the outstanding service from the employees and the owner...you have to try this place out. And while I might be a bit sad if I come back here and this place is swamped busy from such great reviews, I know that waiting around will be totally worth it.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Great food. Beautiful presentation. Fresh. Atmosphere is elegant, but low key. I wish we had someting this good for Mexican cuisine in Boston.
author: Mark D.

description: Great food, fun ambience, even better service.  Salsas are crazy good!!
author: John S.

description: How anyone can rate this place lower than 5 stars is beyond me. This places location makes you think stuffy, fake food and extremely high prices.......well you would be WRONG! The food is amazing and really authentic and original. The speed and quality that you get your order is great and the selection of sauces and salsas is to die for....especially if you like it "hot"....a perfect place for lunch on the go or relax outside and people watch...
author: David Q.

description: Mike S. suggested we hit this place for lunch, it's close to the office and he said he liked it. Oliver N., however, expressed mild disdain, but since I had not been there, I decided to give it a try.  While there, ran into two other groups of co-workers, so this place is either loved by my officemates or is still being feeled out by everyone.  Acceptable, but not super-fantastic, as far as the food goes.  Kind of an upscale Chipotle; they appear to have a full service bar, which would be great if you want a margarita with your lunch.  I may visit here again, but if I need a burrito fix, I'll most likely be hitting someplace else.
author: Andy B.

description: I was contacted by management in appreciation of my review and feedback. She informed me that the feedback was well received and they are working on better efficiencies. She invited me back and hoped that during my next visit those improvements will be evident. I have been back several times and Tropisueno is now way ahead of Maya's. Thx Tropisueno you rock! :)
author: Rich W.

description: Eating solo tonight I sat at the bar and had a kickass tropisueño margarita, which was very tasty but a little light on the ginger & rose flavor....almost tasted standard except for the lemon-salt.  The bartender seemed extremely competent and everyone was friendly.  For a light dinner I had the appetizer tacos al pastor (grilled pork with pineapple, cilantro, onion & salsa) - it was quite tasty although needed a pinch of salt and maybe a pinch more pineapple. Tried their tres-leches cake too it was probably the second-best I've ever had (first best being my husband's cinco-leche cake with toasted coconut on top).  The guys next to me at the bar ordered regular meals that looked alright but, like other reviews say, sans vegetation.  However, with a margarita, light meal and desert from Tropisueño, la vida es muy buena.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Lunch is still good, but for dinner they lose the taqueria style and transform into nighttime dining, complete with a reduced menu (where did my vegetables go?) and higher prices. Bleah.
author: Jade P.

description: Great things have been popping up in this little alley - Beard Papa, Amber, Press Club and now Tropisueño! For the financial district, this is a great addition. Our whole crew hopped over to our new taqueria neighbor today (hoping the tequila bar was open for the 75th anniversary of the repeal of prohibition, but to no avail) and had quite the lunch. The burrito was definitely tasty, and the bites of fish taco and ceviche I had. And they have some tasty horchata, a pretty rare commodity. I'll bump them up a star when I can have a margaritta and my real tropical dreams will come true...
author: Michael E.

description: We went here for dinner, the food was awesome, the margaritas were delicious and the service was great. The trio of salsa and trio of beans they serve are a nice way to try a bunch of different great flavors. Every thing we ordered was great, I hope to go back again soon!
author: Maureen B.

description: YUM!  Seriously yum!  Great drinks, delicious food and AMAZING service!  Try the "little cigars".  Fried dough with corn, black beans and chorizo... ridiculously good.
author: Chloe B.

description:
great happy hour!

total was $32.
2 margaritas and a dos quis.
ceviche had chunky tilapia in a limey sauce, mmm; served with 2 tortillas.
guacamole for $3, worth it.
fat bowl of chips, with salsa, but too liquidy.
2 fish tacos, yes!
beef taco, not bad either.

after all that, we were so sick of tortillas.  8D
author: Ethan L.

description:
one day i had the BIGGEST HANKERING FOR A MARGARITA.

so of course i went on yelp to search for places that served GREAT MARGARITAS!

i was looking for a place that was near the BART and in a safe area.  this place is right across the street from the Metreon and it is super safe!
since none of my friends could come with me and i couldnt get rid of this craving, i went by myself on thursday at 6pm.  there werent that many people, so i got to know the bar managers manuel and antonio, and THEYRE THE BEST! they were so nice and courteous, and they really really really took care of me.  

the margaritas were SO GOOD.  the chili salt rim is THE BEST. M!M!M!M!M the margaritas were crisp, clean, and FRESH.  went down smoothly, and after i was done i wanted MORE. 
so i had three.  along with some other drinks.  

all in all, the drinks are DELICIOUS, the workers are so NICE AND FRIENDLY, and the location is convenient and safe!!
author: Rosa K.

description:
i liked this place. it's a fun spot, great mexican decor, really nice servers, good vibe. sometimes places too close to union square can feel a little cheesy, but i didn't feel that here. i thought it was fairly priced and a good option for a bite before a movie or casual dinner after work. 

had a small birthday dinner here with some girlfriends. we missed our reservation but were able to snag seats in the bar area which was just fine. since it was late and we'd already had a bit of wine across the way at press club, we decided to share some small plates. everything we had was pretty yummy. from the plantains and black beans to the scallops and chorizo, to the mushroom empanadas. it's not literal mexican cuisine, but more a merge of several latin american influences.  it worked for me. their chips and salsa were very good too and they are super generous with refilling you when you get low. 

i'd really like to go back and try more. they also have crios rose from argentina on their wine list, a favorite of mine, and not easy to find, so i was a happy happy girl.
author: rachel p.

description:
The food here was delicious, but the server we had was lousy.  A little gruff and only stopped by to see if we wanted anything else once in the 90 minutes we were there.  I would give 4 stars for the food and 2 stars for service.

The chips were DELICIOUS!  Thin and crispy, really light and not greasy at all.  The mole was fantastic (almost as good as some we had in Merida, Mexico) and we liked the rice that came with the plates.  The margaritas were small, but really strong, so well worth the $8.

All in all a great meal because of the food and company. 

FYI, cake cutting fee is $17.50, but they will not tell you this in advance.  So be forewarned!
author: Ling L.

description: Just ate here last night for the first time. I loved it! Great food, great music, GREAT (strong) margaritas! Good prices and good service. I really enjoyed it! Would definitely go back. Also, I like the atmosphere... highly reccomend
author: Nicole L.

description: severely average food and drink. nothing to write home about. portions were way too large: service average as well.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Well, I had lunch here- thought it was great and talked my husband into the ride downtown for dinner.  Made a reservation thru Open Table, got a confirmation, showed up- they never heard of us and were not willing to accommodate us.  Won't be going back.
author: nina l.

description:
Good Atmosphere. Nice surroundings. Good location.
Signature margarita (with ginger) was OK, but the standard house margarita was excellent. Fantastic chips with very good salsas - red & green.

My wife had a sampler platter of three of the basics. Said it was good.
I first ordered the Mariscos soup, but it was so salty I had to send it back. The waitress (who was wonderful) said even the chef agreed that it was too salty.

I switched to the Chicken Mole and it was quite tasty (but a bit salty also).

The final bill was reasonable for the drinks and food we ate.
Not a big Mexican food fan anyway, so I probably will not go back.
author: Harris M.

description: The best Mexican Restaurant for the price.  Great service, awesome tequila selection!  Live band.  Awesome atmosphere.  Margaritas are strongly recommended!  I was reading the other reviews and some people come on here and yelp without knowing the facts.  TROPISUENO IS A TAQUERIA BY DAY, SIT DOWN RESTARAUNT BY NIGHT!!!!!  I hope this clears up all these Chipotle comments I keep reading.  Also recommend the Chicken Mole.....and Carnitas Tacos....ok now Im done.
author: Brandon H.

description: Great food, but iffy hours at night.  Would be good if they were open when they say they are. Twice now I've shown up around 930 on a Thursday to be told 'sorry, our kitchen closed early tonight ...'  For travelers like me, it's very frustrating to want to come back to a place I enjoyed, only to be turned away.  Either be open when you say you're open, or change your hours, please.
author: Mark C.

description: Love the location, setup and food-- so good. Staff is very friendly as well.  My one big complaint: I ordered their entree salad with chicken, and while it was good, it was most definitely overpriced at $11.35.  Given that there isn't anything super special about the salad aside from the jicama, they need to lower the price by $3-$4.  I'll definitely be coming here once a week, but will get my salads elsewhere.
author: Sonia S.

description: Great for dinner and everything was delicious.  A little overpriced, but you pay for the location and the scenery also.  Margaritas were yummy and I loved the chips and salsa.
author: H. A.

description: Not super impressed so far. I've eaten here about three times now, quesedilla, tacos and torta respectively, and so far only the torta has been decent. even the al pastor, which is usually the one thing guaranteed to be good at a mexican joint, was sort of dry and bland. organization behind the counter seems to be an issue, too, as two out of three times they have made me my meal for dine-in, when I asked for it to-go. they do have a nice looking tequila selection, though, and as long as they don't mess with the torta at all, I guess I'll come back. would come back more if they gave you chips with your to-go order, too.
author: Tom H.

description:
For all those who love Tropisueno for its lunch - DON'T EAT HERE FOR DINNER.

The Appetizer: Yucatan Poc Chuc - dry, chewy, thin pieces of unseasoned pork with very hot salsa - 1/2 star

The Entrees: Tampiqueño - Chewy, chewy, chewy - I almost spit it out after chewing it for a couple of minutes without success but decided to swallow it like a pill instead.  The meat in the enchillada was overdone and burnt. (1/2 star)

The only reason I didn't send it back was b/c I was trying to make it to a movie on time.

Save yourself the trip - go to any of the thousands of taquerias in this city and skip this one - at least for dinner.
author: Howard G.

description:
My first experience at Tropisueño involved an afternoon playing Yatzee on my i phone with friends and drinking several margaritas. That pretty much sums up how awesome it is. They also have tarot card imagery on all their stuff, which to me has some odd associations with my crazy Latino mother, but I didn't seem to mind. Overall, the décor manages to capture a certain Mexican flair without being cheesy like many places going for that look. 

The food is quite fresh and tasty. They have two different types of vegan burritos. One involves some sort of marinated tofu and the other is grilled veggie. I believe you can get these in other forms like tacos and tostadas, but don't hold me to it. The tofu burrito was pretty good. The tofu didn't have much flavor. I kind of feel like Latinos don't know what to do with tofu sometimes and kind of freak out and just throw it in a burrito tasting all bland and sad, and then everyone is sad. The grilled veggie, though less exciting, is much better. The veggies are all grilldy and zesty and make it nice and flavorful. 

They also have a salsa bar! I cannot understate the importance of a salsa bar. I hate it when you have to ask for extra salsa, so that you can pour it on your burrito! For a bite composer like me (I'm a nut case that likes to create the perfect balanced bite every time), side salsa is a must (I'm talking to you Chipotle!). Anyway, the guac is pretty good, though nothing to write home about. What I would post a serious letter to someone about are the Margaritas. They make them fresh with agave nectar! They are really quite delicious and not cloyingly sweet like many, and that's just their basic margarita. You don't even have to order top shelf for that. [By the way, I love how all the foodies have discovered that agave rocks everyone socks, and they're including it in all sorts of foodie drinks and stuff and acting like they just discovered it! Foodies, the vegans knew about that shiz a long, long time ago! What's next, nutritional yeast on toast!?!]
author: Jeani H.

description: Updating my review.  They're consistently wonderful all around, and beer and wine are now much more accessible.  Friendly, knowledgable service, great food and cocktails--they're a treasure.
author: Earline A.

description: This place was very hyped up to me by my coworkers so I came in with pretty high expectations. Let's just say that it wasn't the best Mexican food, I've had, but it's also not the worst. For the price you do get a very large plate of food, but the seasoning could be a little more authentic and a little less "American". Also, the decor is pretty amazing albeit a bit cheesy. All in all, this is a great lunch spot if you happen to be in soma and don't feel like trekking all the way to the Mission.
author: Kirk R.

description: Fantastic! This place is close to my work so I go a lot - and it never disappoints. Favs include tacos al pastor, plantains, the best margaritas (hooray for real margaritas with agave nectar, not some giant pint glass full of sweet and sour). Service is consistently good - friendly when slammed. Lunch is great and quick, but don't miss going for dinner. The meatball stew - unbelievable!!
author: Jonnie R.

description: I would say 3.5 stars and would go again if craving mexican in the area but would not seek out.  The salsa great and the drinks great - although strong.  Plantains awesome and then...the entree.  I think we ordered bad but I picked the 1 and only vegetarian option (which is a bit odd for a mexican restaurant) and it was very uneventful.  However the food being delivered to others looked very good.  If you are a veggie eater and usually can find good options or just skip the meat at mexican restaurants (which I usually can) this is not the place for you.  Great place to sit at the bar to rest from shopping - eat the chips, salsa, gauc and plantains - go shop and look around some more and eat dinner else where.
author: Jessica M.

description: Nice vibe and decorations. We liked the different salsas they offered. I think the food was just average though. Seems like a good happy hour place.
author: Lin H.

description: Manuel makes the best cocktails! I can't wait to have dinner at tropisueno.  Great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Kattya B.

description: This place is great. The shrimp starter was one of the best dishes I have ever had, anywhere. Plus, the prices are reasonable and they make a mean margarita. Wow.
author: Mike C.

description: Not bad, not bad!  I really dislike eating in this area of SF.  No matter where you go it seems as if you pay too much, get too little, and it takes too long.  This place is different.  It is a sit down restaurant with a pleasant environment, and nice seating.  They serve chips, and they have a salsa bar.  Their hot salsa is amazing.  I couldn't stop eating it.  The quality of the food is good for the price.  It of course wasn't the best Mexican food I have had, but it definitely beats the crap out of Chevy's, and the Mexican restaurant across the street in the Yurba Buena Center.  They are also pretty fast for a sit down restaurant at lunch time.  You don't have to mess with the bill, because you pay when you order at the front.  You also can pick your own seats.  This place is ideal if you work in the area, or if you are visiting the museums for the day.
author: Michele F.

description: Tropisueno has become my favorite SF restaurant since I love the ambiance, the food, the chips and the service.  Their chili relleno combo is awesome, but now that I'm on a health kick I order the pollo asado which is off the hook!  It's located right behind Amber Restaurant off of Market, the only thing I'd change is perhaps selling margaritas by the pitcher since most Mexican restaurants do that and it would drive more business.  PS I love the Chup Chup lollipops and wish they sold those by the bag!
author: Nazli P.

description: FABULOUS!!!  We loved it so much, we went here twice during our short stay in San Francisco.  Food was delicious, homemade and super fresh, drinks were amazing with service to match!  We had Paco the first night and he was awesome - great service and loved all his recommendations.  I usually don't even like margaritas on the rocks, but they don't have blenders but he assured me I would like it.  He was right!  Another one of his recommendations was the Pepino - a cucumber margarita that was out of this world!  We had our kids with us so he explained that they didn't have a kids menu, but could pretty much make them anything.  So, while this isn't a kids place, it was definitely very family friendly.  He basically made them plain chicken tacos and a chicken quesadilla, which, was probably the BEST quesadilla I have ever tasted.  So, our kids were happy and we were happy too, because we didn't have to settle for substandard food/drinks/environment that usually come with a family friendly establishment.  To top it all off, it was AFFORDABLE!  This place is an absolute FIND in the middle of a high tourist area where you would expect prices to be inflated.  My husband came in the second night we were there and I knew he would love it, so we had to go again.  Our experience was equally fantastic!  We loved the Pepino margaritas so much our waiter (different the second night) even gave us the recipe, after we asked.  He even told us if we wanted to buy another, we could go up to the bar and watch the bartender make it for us, so we could see exactly how to make it.  We really appreciated this - the bartender, a very sweet and friendly gal, explained the steps to us.  Everyone really went out of their way to provide service at a level you normally just don't see, but you could tell this is just the way they do things.  I will definitely visit again when in San Francisco and until then, will do my best to recreate the Pepino margarita at home!
author: MaryAnn W.

description: While visiting San Fran we were looking for Mexican food close to where we were staying when we stumbled upon Tropisueno, and vwe were not disappointed!  The service was good and attentive.  The complimentary chips and salsa were delicious and so fresh!    The margaritas and cocktails we tried were good.  The food is not authentic but all very yummy!   I had the salmon,obviously not a traditional Mexican dish, but it was done very well!!  Our entire party left happy and I would definitely return.
author: Kaitlin H.

description: I really like Tropisueno-- have only enjoyed Margaritas and Antojitos here.  I love the Margaritas as they have good and healthy pours of Tequila (El Jimador Blanco), fresh lime juice and organic Agave nectar.  The Margarita has a wonderful rim of salt and chile and it is a very appealing part of the drinking experience.  You keep lifting the glass to enjoy the salt and spice.  A most satisfying Margarita.  The Antojitos are well made and presented; I enjoyed the Mole Poblano which is a second plate item.  I really enjoyed the Ceviche de Pescado-- a perfect thing to enjoy with the Margaritas.  The service at Tropisueño is exceptional; no request to big and I am impressed that they are able to handle a larger crowd and no beat is skipped; very friendly and willing to accommodate.  I will go back for dinner.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
I had the Tampiqueño (carne asada and an enchilada) and a Siete Legunas to drink.  Both were quite tasty.  Also, the chips and salsa were very fresh.  The price seemed quite acceptable for the area and definitely was worth what I got.

I'd definitely go back and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
author: Andrew O.

description: I used to work by this fabulous establishment.  I ate here at least 3 times a week.  All the sauce and meat options are amazing.  I love how i can customize my burrito any way i want.  I hate rice!!!!!  The torta is the most amazing mexican dish I have had!!!!!  cheat on your burrito with a torta!!!
author: Lyndsey H.

description: My coworker just hosted her birthday dinner here and it was wonderful. I enjoy the amber lighting and the friendly staff. I mostly came for drinks so I only tried a little of the ceviche which was very good. I have come here for lunch during the work week and I think its a good deal for the money. Way better than a $5 foot long.
author: Dana H.

description: I've walked by this place the past couple months while it was readying for opening and I finally ate there this past weekend.  I was hoping it would be good since it's near home and work, but it really exceeded my expectations.  The chips were delicious and all the salsas in the salsa bar were yummy.  The three different tacos I tried were all great - highlight was the al pastor, which was delicious with pineapple.  I also really enjoyed the carne asada - very flavorful and moist.  Tropisueno's prices were great, especially considering the quality of the food, and I'm really looking forward to making this restaurant one of my regular spots.
author: Rebecca S.

description: The service has definitely improved here and the food still rocks.  I also love that they have whole wheat tortillas now!
author: Rachel T.

description:
Yummy! 

My sister suggested we go here so we did.

My boyfriend and I ordered the Chicken quesadilla and nachos. Yum!

Make sure you get the chips and salsa...at lunch they have a little self serve cart full of sauces you can pick and choose from. 

I'm no expert on Mexcian food but we sure enjoyed eating here. Their green sauce (sorry I don't know the name) was sooo good, hint of lime and very tasty on the quesadillas.

Although delicious, we wouldn't get the nachos again but would try a different dish...the chips and salsa were so good that the nachos weren't necessary! 

If you lose your way, go the Palomar hotel (beside Old Navy) and ask for the really good Mexican restaurant...they'll know you're talking about this one and point you in the right direction!
author: Ali H.

description: First time at Tropisueño. Saw all the great reviews and gave it a try. Well worth the walk over. The chips are amazing. Very thin, light and not over greased. Ordered the Torta and it was great. Bread was soft and carne asada was good quality. I am here 3 more days and will def be back
author: L K.

description: Margarita drinks too small. I had the pollo asado. Delicious. Shrimp cocktail. Pretty good. Overall the food was yummy. I recommend if it's in the area.
author: Francisco R.

description: Obviously, it was better than Chevy's, but that should be a given.  I went in with relatively high expectations given the enthusiasm from yelp staffers, but I think that the high praise was a bit unwarranted -- maybe lunch versus dinner standards are the difference?  We went for dinner, and my party of 3 split on whether we liked the food.  We had a variety of items, and nothing was extraordinary, although most of it was fine.  We ate a lot of chips and salsa, but it was kind of that mindless type of eating like when you're watching football/award show on the boober.  Their house drinks sounded exciting, but truthfully, they were kind of rough.  Staff was accomodating about dietary needs, and they were friendly though not especially together (a minor quibble for a fairly informal restaurant).
author: Leo C.

description: I love Tropisueno as a perfect quick get away for lunch downtown. Their chips and salsa are amazing! The regular food is okay, but my favorite part about this place is the cocktails. Happy Hour here rules, and you can get red in the cheeks on great margueritas before heading back to work. My favorite is actually the house marguerita which has a spicy salted rim and is not overly sour or sweet.
author: Christina B.

description: I wanted to try all the restaurant within walking distant from my home.  I usually do not eat Mexican food on a regular basis as it is too heavy.  I decide to try this as my monthly slurge on heavy food.  The chips was good, but wish the guacamole is a bit chunkier.  My margarita was tasty.    I ordered the pork chop.  The serving portions are big.  I had enough to take back for a second meal. The price is very decent, taking into consideration the portion size, and the location of the restaurant.   Will definitely be back more often to try other dishes.
author: Ayn K.

description: Excellent, fast service.  Substitutions are welcomed. Food is delicious and portions are generous.  A+.
author: S N.

description: I still adore Tropisueno for its happy hour but am sad to report that it has been "discovered." I've probably been at least 5 times in the past few months, and usually there is no problem getting service or a seat by the bar area. When we went last week it was a totally different story. People poured in and practically fought for seats, and the waitstaff was fairly overwhelmed. They said it'd been getting progressively busier and busier (props to them in this economy that says a lot). So still a great spot, but be warned it's no longer chill and easy. If you're looking for a livelier scene though, you've got it!
author: Shoshana D.

description: This was a suggestion on a recent trip and didn't disappoint.  Very quaint atmosphere with an incredibly gracious staff.  The food wasn't "out of this world" but it was good.  Margaritas are a must!  The bar area is small and located right next to the kitchen so not the most relaxing place to be, but if dining in the main dining room, you are good to go!
author: Jason P.

description: I would give Tropisueno a 3.5 stars. I really enjoyed the ambiance, the polite smiling servers, the spotlessness of the place and the salsa bar.
