The chips were PERFECT: crispy, thin, salty, crunchy. The salsas were also tasty. The Agua de Jamaica was also delicious. My meal was good, too. I loved the fluffy Spanish rice and the refried beans sprinkled with queso Cotija. My two chicken taquitos came with a nice side salad of lettuce, tomatoes and a generous dollop of sour cream. The taquitos, however, were just okay. The chicken tasted a little dry. I would like to go back to try other things on the menu. It's a fun, upper scale Mexican place and its long overdue in that corridor of the SoMA/Financial.
author: Dee I.

description: Great service. I got the favorite plate with two chicken mole enchiladas and a pork tamale. My boyfriend got two steak tacos and a chicken enchilada with red sauce. Everything was great! Also had 2 house margaritas. Friendly staff and good food. Highly recommend.
author: Heather T.

description:
Super pleased with my Tropisueno experience. I took my boyfriend there on Thursday night for his birthday. I'm not a big mexican food fan which is why I have a hard time giving this place 5 stars - though it should be noted that if they can please a non-mexican food lover then they're doing pretty good!. I called ahead and told them it was the bf's birthday and they said they could bring out a dessert and sing.
Instead, since we ended up ordering dessert, they brought out a nice shot of tequila in a champagne glass with a salted/seasoned lime. very classy! and the song they sang was nice and not corny. My bf is not one for making a scene but he enjoyed it.
A+ to them for making it a special birthday.
The food was pretty good too. We had the scallops with chorizo for starters which were very nice. I ordered the stuffed chilli, quite nice, and the bf ordered a shrimp dish which was too spicy for me but he really enjoyed it.
We each had a margarita. I love that they sweeten them with agave syrup! Nice touch.
We will definitely come back next time my boyfriend insists on mexican food. If the experience is just as good the next time around I might consider upping this to a 5 star rating.
Go check it out!
author: Sandra E.

description:
Executive Summary:  Overpriced margarita's, poor service at night has me opting out of Tropisueno after lunch.

While I wasn't beating down the door the day this place opened, I was there before you needed a reservation to dine on a Saturday night.  The first time I went to Trop it was for lunch, and I was blown away at the quality to price ratio for two street tacos.  Since then, I feel like the tacos keep getting smaller, the servers a little sloppier and the prices a little less bearable.  

The deathblow for me came right before Christmas when I was at happy hour with a friend of mine, we were having a good enough time drinking margaritas and eating chips and salsa, that is until the bill came--12 margaritas for $72 dollars.  Wow! Now that is an expensive happy hour for two people, not to mention the fact that I DIDN'T drink 6 margaritas.  As most people comment, the drinks are stiff, and personally I don't have a tolerance of a professional binge drinker.  One could therefore reason that with 6 margaritas I would be in a pool of my own vomit when the bill came. I informed the waiter of this discrepancy, that in fact I could have not consumed more than 4 margaritas, but as I am a reasonable person I will pay for 5 since I believe it was a misunderstanding.  Long story short, he told his manager/owner(?), who then informed me that if he SAID we had 12 margaritas then I would be paying for 12 margaritas.  So we did, and despite the fact that the service was outstanding (on that occasion), I left no tip and will not return for another drink.  

Nothing like this has ever happened to me when dining out, so it never occurred to me that I should be responsible for keeping a running tally of drinks in case they try to slip a few extra in there. Consider yourself warned happy hour isn't a very good deal if you have to pay for 4 drinks you never consumed.
author: Brian F.

description: Above-average Mexican food. I had delicious mole, which is always nice. The service was fantastic and the decor is definitely above par. It gets a little crowded and noisy at peak times. Definitely a solid option for pre-movie dinner if you're seeing a show at the Metreon.
author: Alex L.

description:
Been once before to Tropisueno for a quick dinner. I remember the food being very good, but we were frankly in a mad rush to catch a movie so my friend and I couldn't really get the feel for the place. 

Round 2 on Saturday night with another friend. This time we came for drinks before seeing a rock show downtown. I like the fact that they take pride in the quality of their cocktail ingredients. All the tequila are top notch. No Cuervo or Patron in sight. Only the finest Jalisco has to offer. And they use agave nectar rather than simple syrup which makes the drinks even better. But the bar service, this is where they really earned the 5th star! Manuel and his bar staff, Luca and Gonzalo rounded out the experience for us. I even got an adhoc Tequila education from Manuel who was very busy that night. They are just terribly nice folks who want to make sure their patrons are happy and taken care of. I will come back here again and again. It's unpretentious and warm and the atmosphere makes me feel like I'm in Mexico all over again. The owners who are not of Mexican descent really captured the spirit, warmth, and hospitality of Mexico. Muy bien!
author: C P.

description: I have been here at least ten times, and it is delicious every single time.  Their margaritas are excellent, the three salsas they serve with the chips are also amazing.  My only complaint is that the mahi-mahi never seems to be available when I try to order it.
author: Josh B.

description:
I'm a really picky Mexican food eater but I think this place is great.  The drinks are amazing to say the least.  Pricey alcohol but really good though.

I had the tostada camarones, bad spanish (shrimp taco salad), and the tampiqueno? ( steak, enchilada, rice place). Everything was awesome.  Their portions also pretty sizable.

Oooo...did i mention homemade chips...love those too.
author: Tell-it-like-it-is M.

description: Always have a very good meal here- enchiladas plate is my favorite- the burrito's are huge- almost too big. Chips are warm and salsa bar is generous. Goo strong margarita. Clean location with good quick staff. All the mission flavors without all the mission madness.
author: Scott W.

description: It feels kind of wrong to go here when there is a preponderance of fantastic/authentic experiences just a few blocks away. Ok, so it's more than a few blocks, but if you are craving Mexican, you are better off trekking to the Mission for the real deal. I'd rather hit the food court at the Westfield and save my burrito fix for later. I had the fish tacos and they weren't anything to write home about -- tortillas were a bit starchy, the fish a little too fried. In all, a forgettable meal.
author: Chris O.

description:
Great little Mexican restaurant off Yerba Buena.  The prices were affordable (near downtown SF) and the food was outstanding.  I had the mole with pork, with the guacamole starter.  The guacamole was a touch salty, but everything else was excellent.  

Tropisueno is a casual dining restaurant - you order at the counter and pick your table.   Waiters will serve your order.
author: Adrian K.

description: This is one of the worst Mexican restaurants in town. To start the food is priced too high for the amount of food you get. The food here is disgusting. I had taco de carne asada and the meat tasted old like it wasn't clean or has been sitting there for a while. Of course I never give up on a place after one try, so I ordered the tamales. The  tamales here were mediocre and not very impressive. They used cumin in this dish which is not a  traditional Mexican spice and actually shadowed the other flavors in the the tamal. The rice was disgusting it did not taste authentic and again had that over powering taste of cumin. My friend had the mole and according to her it was not good at all and also said it did not taste authentic. The only authentic Mexican thing at this restaurant is the servers and other wait staff. The only thing that is worth going here for is the margaritas and chip during happy hour other then that I will never return or recommend any one going here. Now for the actual venue.The lighting in this restaurant is so dark that it is almost impossible to read the menu or use the bathroom. I also think the bathroom in the front are  the only bathrooms in the restaurant because you constantly see servers and chefs using this bathroom, and to top it I dont think I sen the sign stating it's law for restaurant workers to wash Tere hands before going back to work.  So if your looking for an over priced un-authentic Mexican restaurant where there is hardly any room to sit then Tropisueno is your place.
author: Rafael M.

description: Good service and good food overall. Fun environment. I ordered the seafood soup (caldo de mariscos) which was delicious.
author: Renee C.

description:
Here's My overall summary: 
Margaritas: Very good (read: boozey enough to make you feel good)
FOOD: Good, but not enough variety on veggie side and limitations on when certain food can and cannot be ordered (read: not enough flexibility for my Sally from When Harry Met Sally ordering style). The PLAINTAINS are what make it for me. YEAH Plaintains! Also good fresh light salty homemade tortilla chips, a must for good Mexican in my book.
DECOR: Cute Mexican style, pleasant atmosphere, but often very crowded.
SERVICE: OK but too slow during busy times. They don't go out of their way to accommodate special menu requests. 

Here's my story:
The first time we went here I'll admit I was in a PISSY mood. Don't ask me to explain myself; I just was. When we got there on Friday evening, it was packed as all hell and we were told we could camp out at the bar area or wait 90 minutes. I needed a bevvie, stat. It took about 25 minutes to get one, only after I very nearly pulled out MEGGA BIATCH to get one from the bartender. I was hot, thirsty, and why was this place so goddamned bright? I was also getting crap from the waiter for wanting a quesadilla when we were there after lunch & happy hour, and though they made them then, suddenly, miraculously, these ingredients seem to just disappear from the kitchen after 7pm. I settled on plantains, guac, and booze. Luckily, the ritas came eventually and that makes everything better. The night got progressively better after that. The plaintains were AWESOME. I love that they even have them on the menu- why doesn't everywhere?! 

To top it off, they give you CHUBBA CHUBS instead of mints. Hellloooooo these are the best lollipops ever. I highly recommend the icecream-flavored one. I nearly peed myself when they came out. Um, I think that was after 2 or 3 margaritas. But I was ready to award many a star after that, let me tell you. 

And, even better, on our way home we stopped in a little convenience store on 4th street across from Yerba Beuna Gardens. After some drunken conversation with the guy behind the counter (involving tequila, and why the jelly bean container I was holding should only cost 1.99 instead of 5.99), just as my friends and I were about to leave, I was awarded a FREE thing of jelly beans. And I am not a give away free-things-to cute kind of girl, so let me tell you, after the whole Chubba-chubs excitement, I was ready to dance in the streets with my free jelly beans. Sweeeeeet. It's the simple things, really. 

The second time we went it actually was happy hour, so quesadillas were allowed. Pretty good but nothing amazing. We were instructed we could stay at a table only until 7pm; as the hour neared we kept getting looks from the waitstaff to get up and go. We didn't even get our lollipops. I snuck an extra Chubba-chups on the way out, just 'cause. Been back a number of times for drinks- the ritas always keep me happy.
author: Kristen L.

description: We had reservations for 4 and another friend decided to join us at the last minute. When I spoke to the host about it, he wasn't rude at all, despite the fact that they were absolutely packed. We only had to wait a few minutes and they were kind enough to accommodate all 5 of us. The margaritas were decent; I think my friends liked theirs more than I liked mine. The guacamole is awful here, but everything else was very good. The Tampiqueno, which my friend got, is like an entire cow on a plate. Seriously, two or more people can share that dish. I had the scallop and chorizo appetizer and it was delicious, especially considering how easy it is to ruin scallops. They provide free salsas, chips, beans and tortillas for the table, which is very generous. Our waiter was friendly and helpful, but had some Nazi-like person (manager??) shadowing his every move. She barely smiled, and didn't seem too friendly, and I just thought that seemed kind of strange. We had no problems with our service at all. The interior is very nice, with a nice view of the Jewish Museum. I'll definitely return here and would love to try it out at happy hour.
author: Maria V.

description:
Overpriced.  The chips, salsa, and guac are good, but the appetizers were not very filling.  Our Carne Asada entre was tough and dry.  You can find much better Mexican food for the price in the Bay Area.

Drinks were great, however.
author: John S.

description: yummy margaritas! full bar. fresh chips and salsa - you get 3 different salsas. my favorite entree is the chile verde. meat is soooo tender and juicy. sauce is really tasty. the portions are huge. it does tend to get really loud in there so you have to scream a bit while making conversation. location is convenient and close to bart.
author: Judy k.

description: Tropisueno has the best chips of any restaurant I've eaten at. The basket is honestly addicting, and the "just one more chip" mentality has never gotten me far. I also love the chicken tacos. The happy hour deal can't be beat. We had a full meal (without beers, sadly) for under $20! Love it.
author: Samantha S.

description: Upon further reflection and a very nice note from the owner, I'm upgrading my review to 2 stars.
author: Erik K.

description:
After a conference at the Moscone Center a group of us were looking for a place for dinner.  I suggested Tropisueno based on the location, and the good reviews on Yelp. 

The 5 of us had a fantastic time there.  The service was perfect.  The margaritas are outstanding...and the entrees were outstanding also.  The menu looked so good that I had a hard time choosing, but went with the Chile Verde, based on the waiters recommendation.

I was completely stuffed after eating chips and salsa and the Chili Verde, and it was completely delicious.

The other entrees that were ordered by our group were the chicken mole', the mahi mahi, the shimp and the another person ordered the chili verde.  Every one was in "the clean plate club", including the dainty gal who threw down that mahi mahi like you wouldn't believe.

The chips we fresh and warm (can't beat that) and the two salsas were very interesting, I do like things a little spicier and upon request they brought out some of the hot stuff, that had a wonderful kick of habenero.

And to top off all of that, the prices are quite reasonable.

This is definitely a place that I want to come back to.

The one thing to note is that the street address, isn't a 'real' street.
author: Drew J.

description: I love the food here I  have to say I have eaten alot of mexican food in my life and by far this is some of the best I have ever had. I read the last review and to my knowledge the owners names are Erin and Mike and they are both really great people who care alot about this restaurant and its patrons. I would recomend this place to everyone who loves true mexican food. I recomend the tamales or burritos they are so gooood.
author: Jeni Z.

description:
This place is great during lunch as a taqueria but I would not go back for happy hour with a big group of people.

The bar area is very small. I came with a big group and had to talk my way into getting a table.  The hostess was very stressed out about giving us a table for drinks and apps even though the restaurant was completly empty at the time! 

She gave in and sat us a table but then failed to tell us that the happy hour prices would no longer apply to us because we were seated! --Mind you, we were sitting three feet from the bar! --So there we were... ordering margarita after margarita thinking its happy hour!  We got the bill and were shocked! I tried to talk to the waiter and ask him to adjust. He said he gave us one of 7 rounds of drinks at happy hour price and thought that was fair enough! 

I feel like if they would have let us know we probably would have been Ok with it ... but we felt totally duped! Ugh! and Annoyed at the whole situation! 

I would not recommend this place for happy hour for groups of four or more.
author: Tish L.

description:
We had a little time to kill before Josh Kornbluth's show at the Contemporary Jewish Museum Thursday evening, we were thinking about where to go for supper after. Wondering around Yerba Buena Lane, we stumbled onto Tropisuena. Never heard of the place... looked Mexican... I'm not a fan of Mexican food, but the place smelled good, looked great, and the menu was very interesting.
After the show - good show: Andy Warhol: Good for the Jews? - we went back and were seated at a table for two in the window. The place was about half full and the waiter came right over for our drink order. Drinks in hand, we were given time to peruse the menu, and a fine menu it was, fairly traditional, straightforward and simply prepared Mexican food. We ordered Guacamole to start. My wife had the Combo Special - black beans, rice, a beef enchilada and a chicken enchilada. I ordered Albondiags - meatballs in a chili broth with chunks of carrots and potato, yellow rice and white beans on the side. The table was hardly big enough to hold all the plates. It all went well with a XX Lager draft.
Everything was perfect. The enchiladas were tasty and moist and NOT smothered in cheese, as they so often are. The Guacamole was chunky and spicy. My Albondiags were served in a bowl, swimming in a very spicy, but not disagreeable chili broth. The warm, white beans were creamy in the mouth, and the perfect coolant after the spicy broth.
All in all, great! The servers were attentive, friendly and not pushy. I'll be back. You should try Tropisueno; you don't have to like Mexican food, but you have to like good food, perfectly prepared.
author: Marcus R.

description: Hmmmmmm did I get the wrong thing? Chicken tamale did not rock my world as I expected it to.  Will try again next week
author: Sophia C.

description: Upscale Mexican food with a festive environment. prices were reasonable and food was tasty. I walked out stuffed. Make a reservation!
author: Susannah S.

description: This is a great place for cheap, festive Chevy's like food...,,but better...Their Free CHIPS comes in a big wooden bowl and it comes with both salsa and green sauce.  Their portions are huge and you can get your grub on....all for under $13 per person....THis place is great to have in Union Square or Yerba Buena area! everything around is usually expensive but if you are on the dime....hey why not...GO TROPISUeNO!!!
author: Q A.

description: If you ever find yourself in SOMA at lunchtime, do yourself a favor and listen to my advice: Go to Tropisueno, and order the Tropisueno Torta. Oh dear god in heaven is that an awesome sandwich! Once you take that first bite you will feel like theres a flavor block party in your mouth and EVERYBODY is invited! The food is great, the service wonderful, the maragritas? Oh man I want one right now just thinking about it. So heed my advice go to Tropisueno, you will not be disapointed (You can thank me later).
author: Garrett H.

description: The setting is lovely - warm colors, homey seating, but still unexpectedly sophisticated. I enjoyed my vegetables with mole poblano, and the spanish rice on the side was addictive! Add a killer horchata and you've got a girl hooked with minimal effort.
author: Purnima M.

description: Chips and salsa were amazing!  Service was good. I ordered a combo plate  beef enchilada & chicken tamale.  It was disgusting!  The sauce was a can of plain tomato sauce on top of what might have been good food. If you have any idea what real Mexican  food is supposed to taste like this isn't it.  You will be disappointed.
author: Lisa D.

description: Excellent chips n salsa, yucatan pork chuc and pozole!  Great atmosphere and superb service.
author: manas K.

description: Love the food.  Great Margs.  Only thing to critique would be the service time...As long as you've got at least an hour for dinner, you should go here.  I've never had a bad meal here and the prices are completely reasonable.
author: Niki G.

description:
It's decent but it could easily be a lot better.  

It's near the Metreon and Yerba Buena so it's conveniently located if you're in the area.  The inside is nice, and once seated they give you a basket of hot chips with a trio of salsas.  So it starts off really well, but then... we ordered drinks and dinner and it just started to go down hill.  They have different margaritas which is good except it took an awfully long time to get them and once they arrived one of them was the wrong kind.  Mistakes happen at all restaurants and it was kind of loud so it's not really an issue, but an apology wouldn't have hurt either.  When we ordered dinner one person was having a tough time ordering so they asked the waiter for their recommendation after handing in their menu.  This was a mistake.  The waiter recommended the mole, the person ordering said, ' it's chicken breast, right?'  The waiter replied, 'yes and it's very good.'  The meals came and the mole was chicken legs not chicken breast.  The issue was mentioned to the waiter and he said, 'no, its chicken leg and thigh.'  Again, it was loud, and the mole looked good so we overlooked it.  Next came the chile verde and this one was definitely a strike out.  Rather than coming as the described succulent pieces of meat, we received a blob of meat that fell apart easily and was at least 50% fat.  The bits of meat were fine, but what restaurant serves a chunk of fat?  Yuck.  We pulled off the meat and left a giant pile of fat.  We would have mentioned this to our waiter during dinner but he never came by to ask if everything was alright.  When he finally came we told him everything was good but the chile verde was a disappointment and pointed out the giant pile of fat left over.  He thanked us for letting him know and said he was going to take it to the chef.  Later he brought us our bill and never mentioned the chile verde again.  Really?  That's the best they could do?  It's not terribly surprising but it is disappointing.  Once again an apology wouldn't have hurt and an offer for a free drink or a dessert would have made us happy.  Oh well.
author: Cantik E.

description: I went to Tropisueno on a whim and was happy to find the decor both festive and modern and not at all tacky. The service was great and the food tasty and affordable. It's a great downtown find. The ceviche and tacos al pastor were awesome and the entrees were pretty good too.
author: Sara W.

description: My wife and our two kids had dinner here on sat night and we loved it. The freshly  made chips and salsas are hard to resist.  They don't have a kids menu but the waitor offered to modify some of the dishes to make them kid friendly.  My wife had the carne asada and I had the mole. We both loved our food.  The service is warm and the restaurant has the feel of an outdoor patio.  We will be returning and gladly recommend this place to our friends.
author: S. Z.

description: This is the perfect spot for dinner and drinks. They have a great happy hour, tasty food (the guacamole is delicious!), and the staff is really nice.
author: Amy N.

description: I'd give this 3 and 1/2 stars...it is for lunch only.  Went here with co workers for a going away lunch for one of our colleagues.  Had the large mojado burrito with red sauce.  Well made, excellent ingredients, very flavorful and for such a massive burrto, i didn't feel like i had just consumed piece of lead.  I credit that to good ingredients and good technique and preparation of the food.  Staff were friendly although at lunch it's essentially cafeteria style.  Recommended!!
author: Ron T.

description: My boyfriend and i went there a week ago. it was our first time going there. The atmosphere was good. Service was good. We Loved their salsas especially the really spicy one! We ordered Micheladas to drink which where really good. To start we ordered Tacos, tamales de chorizo, and empanadas de hongos. The Tamales where OK. The Empanadas where OK but the Tacos where GREAT!! Then for dinner i got a chicken plate which was delicious but the portion was big so i got half of it to go. My boyfriend ordered the chuleta plate and he really liked it to. For dessert we got a tres leches cake. It was delicious! Overall we had a good experience. The only bad part of our visit was when we over heard two of the employees say that the whole place was full of coca roaches and rats and that nobody noticed. The where laughing so i guess they thought it was funny but we didn't think it was.  We where grossed out and disappointed because the food was good but we will NOT be going back to Tropisueno. yuck.
author: J O.

description: I stumbled upon this place for the first time today. I haven't had a chance to try their margaritas, but I did have the chicken burrito. The burrito was really good and the service was quick. Considering the low price point for a meal here (prices are on par with Andale or Chipotle but with better food), the space looks really nice and welcoming. It's a new restaurant, so there are still some execution issues (I have no idea how they'll handle lines when they get busy given how close the counter is to the door). Overall, this place was great and is a very nice addition to the SoMa lunch scene.
author: Charles H.

description:
Walking into Tropisueno is like walking into Mexico City itself.  With the traditional decor, neutral colors, and the warm scent of Mexican food from the taqueria.
The food is fresh and phenomenal.  And my favorite part, they are so vegetarian friendly.  Thanks Antelmo!  They actually have tofu, steamed and delicious!  It makes an excellent veggie burrito.  Any salsa lover will have fun with the salsa bar.  I went back twice.  The grilled jalapenos are creative and delious...who thinks of that?  
Their maragaritas are smokin' with bar manager, Manuel's, spicy salt around the rim.  Can't wait to check out the tequila tasting menu.  
Parking is nearby in the Mission and 5th St garage.  I recommend everyone checking this place out.  It's a perfect compliment to shopping downtown.  You can thank me afterwards.
The best part of the experience at Tropisueno is meeting the owners and the staff.  Meet them and you will not only adore them, but adore their restaurant as well.
author: Vang L.

description: Tropisueno is an excellent addition to the financial district.  A taqueria during the daytime, and full service at night.  Check out the happy hour with cheap priced margarittas, guacomole, and ceviche.
author: David S.

description:
it's clean mexican food, at actually a pretty ridiculously good price. they brought quality mexican food and a trendy atmosphere together.

i used to work around the area, and visited this place when it just opened for dinner. They gave us complimentary virgin margaritas on the house since they didn't have their alcohol license yet. 

if you want the nice ambience at a discounted price, this place is legit.

(Restaurant.com had a $10 gift certificate for only 40 cents. Now that is legit)
author: Garrett W.

description: Went for dinner and drinks last night and had been looking forward to it, as this place was recommended by a friend and I also saw it on Check, Please.  Meh.  Pros:  chips and salsas (3 types) were good, first margarita was spot on (second was not good), plantanos fritos (yummy).  Cons:  service was so rushed it was unbelievable (like a SNL skit), most of the food was chevy's quality (ie. not good), and the drinks were inconsistent (see above).  I wouldn't go back for dinner.  Maybe lunch is better?
author: Michael W.

description:
MMMM MMMM! I am so stoked that there is a decent Mexican food restaurant Downtown. The prices are really reasonable, portions are more than generous, and the food is damn good. I love the mini salsa bar they give you at the beginning with a mountain of chips. If you're a Gringa in disguise like me, cuidado! The salsa is on the spicier side. My husband really likes spicy food and his nose ran, but he loved it. Fortunately the avocado salsa is more mild and they give you some white-girl salsa on the side so everyone gets to snack. Some horchata would have been a godsend, unfortunately it's not on the menu. I opted for a Mexican coke instead.  I highly recommend the plantains with black beans to start, and the Chile Verde. It has a hint of all spice, so expect more of a green mole flavor. I really enjoyed it and the pork was cooked perfectly--big cubes of moist, cut with a fork meat. 
The service was very friendly and prompt, but not rushed at all. The decor is really cozy and warm. Noise level is a bit loud, but not distracting. Maybe not the best place to take your hard of hearing grandparents or a soft spoken date. Perfect place to go after a movie with a group of friends or for happy hour.
author: Nitalia P.

description: This is a popular little place for a weeknight dinner.  We didn't have a reservation, but got seated almost right away for 8pm dinner for two.  Started with House Margaritas ($8).  Really good flavor, cute glasses, salt, on the rocks.  I should have had two, but instead tried the Pale Ale, which was ok.  For dinner, my Husband had chicken mole, which he loved.  I had a vegetarian soup with spicy tomato broth, vegetables and hominy!  Extremely filling, and goes well with beer.  The wait staff was really polite and friendly.  They didn't rush us out.  Several people had birthday dinners that night, and the staff came out and sang for them.
author: Erin C.

description: Love the "horchata" rice drink! Order w/o ice- bcuz it's cold already...
author: Liz D.

description:
I ordered the house margarita. It was strong. I thought i read somewhere in fine print that they use 2 ounces of tequila. It was good but too strong for me. I drank a third of it and passed it on to chris.
They chips were warm, thin and crispy. It was served with what looked like a roasted red tomato salsa. It reminded me of the chevy's salsa but better. The other salsa was creamy, it tasted like there was avocado in it. I ordered the shrimp cocktail. It was different but good. I ordered the camarones tropisueno. It was delicious and spicy. It was served with mexican rice, a trio of beans served family style and warm corn tortillas.
Chris had the grilled pork chops. It was tender, juicy and very tasty. I had a few bites of that. I ordered the Tres Leche cake which was good but not as moist I had hoped. The Tres leche cake from Safeway still wins. The service was good and the bathroom was clean.
author: Joie G.

description: This place is awesome. Food was fast, delicious, affordable, and pretty authentic. The decor is so cute that  you would think that this restaurant would be expensive at first glance.  The free chips that you get are light and crispy, really good. (I am picky about my tortilla chips)They also have an impressive salsa bar that has not just salsa but really good roasted peppers. I will be going back!
author: Amanda C.

description: After my co-worker reccommended tropisuenos's chile relleno for lunch today, I decided to stop by and give it a try. After all, its located directly next to my work. Instead, I arrive and see the "chile relleno burritto" and I cannot lie--I am thoroughly satisfied. The prices are reasonable, especially considering the portion size. (huge!) You can order to go or sit down. The restaraunt itself is pretty classy and super clean.  I have yet to try the margharitas, but ive heard they are SUPERB, well priced, and strong!  The chips and salsa were tantalizing. Fresh, light and crispy tortialla chips and home made salsa with a variety to choose from. Enjoy!
author: TJ p.

description: Very good food and a sweet tequila selection, but the place has its quirks.  Staying in the huge hotel in the same building, they offer a nice alternative to the hotel.  I walk in at night, sit at the bar and can order drinks and food.  I walk in for lunch, not realizing it's a stand in line place . . .so I stand waiting at the hostess stand (a few employees saw me and did not inform me of what to do) and it took me a few minutes to figure out that I have to stand in line like I'm in a cafeteria.  There are enough chicas working in the cafeteria line to be servers . . .start offering table service!
author: Whitney P.

description: Came here for happy hour...which ends at 6?! Too bad I got there at 6:01. Anyway, had some chips, salsa, and guac. Chips were good, the rest was just so-so. Wasn't compelling enough to get me to stay for dinner. We sat at the bar and the bartender was nice, service overall seemed great.
author: Humaira M.

description: Not up to par for San Francisco cuisine.  I think they survive on a steady diet of fresh tourist blood form union square.  Overly salty carne asada and house margie had red pepper flakes which I didn't care for.
author: Matthew T.

description: Huge burritos and guacamole appetizer. Very reasonable and affordable as well. The chips were delicious and the different salsas and sauces were great. We also found this place after visiting the Contemporary Jewish Museum by looking on Yelp. From the outside, it looks like a sit down restaurant, but it's the elegance of a sit down with more of an order at the counter and watch as everything is assembled in front of you. The place was packed but no problem finding a place to sit. I wish there were fountain sodas instead of cans and watch for wobbly tables.
author: Jon G.

description:
I've only been here for takeout burritos. Something in the beans or rice has a nice spicy flavor that is not typical of typical taquerias. On my first visit I made the mistake of ordering the grilled veggie burrito; it was tasty enough, but took forever to make. Now I only order things that I know they can make on the spot, but for whatever reason, even that takes an extraordinarily long time. It seems like the assembly is very disorganized.

So my review is 4 stars for food; 5+ for the chips and salsa, and barely a 3 for slow service.
author: Jeff H.

description: I'm usually not a fan of mexican food but this restaurant definitely was excellent.  The food was very authentic and fresh, the service was fast and friendly, and the location is perfect close to everything in Union Square and the AMC Metreon.  It is also across from the Yerba Buena Gardens so perfect date place and after meal walk.  They also have a nice bar scene so if you are shopping or mingling around Union Square/downtown, it's also a cool place just to stop by and grab a cocktail.
author: Ben L.

description: Omg pretty darn good! The service was perfect and even included tequila tasting. Also got a free desert! Food was great and prices were better than chevy's with much less salt haha.
author: Robert A.

description: Went Saturday nite, sat at the Community Table, my wife has a great pazzole (sp?) and I had one of the best Pork Chops in quite a while, Margarita was tasty and Negro Modelo on tap, definetly will be back, great location, nice vibe
author: Scott S.

description: Great place with very good service. Loved the food and the house margaritas
author: Raghu N.

description: I judge Mexican restaurants mostly by their salsa and I am very hard to please.  This place has incredible salsa, and everything else is as good as the salsa! Thats all I really have to say.
author: Bryan G.

description: I had a carne asada burrito with guacamole. The meat was fantastic, although everything (including the salsa) was a bit too salty for my taste. I would definitely go back, this is a solid restaurant. Yeah, the chips are pretty epic. Nice decor as well.
author: Tea H.

description: Tuesday evening around 7:45pm, J and I went to dinner at Tropisueno. I had a coupon from one of the coupon places. We came in just as it was filling up, but only had to wait a few minutes.  The place looked cute, with little pyramids on the benches separating the tables, and weird containers of stones on the tables themselves. Starting out, for drinks, the only drinks they offer are alcoholic - no agua frescas or juice or anything like that, yes we asked and they even told us that. We stuck with water, and got a nice pitcher of water left on the table (yay). They also give you nachos with four different salsas. We were both hungry, and filled up on those, which were the best part of the meal. J didn't see anything he really liked on the menu, which almost never happens, as he really loves food. He ended up getting the enchiladas, which were not featured, but squished at the top corner. Most of the items sounded fancy, but then when you saw what they were, you realized they were fairly boring. Meat with veggies and side.  And, it's not like we have not been to non-tacos/enchiladas type mexican places before..we usually like them.  I tried a seafood soup.  We started out with plantains, which were the second best part of the meal. Not the best ones ive had, but good. They came atop some beans. By the time the entrees came, we were both pretty full. J's meal tasted basic. My soup was GIGANTIC and I ate the seafood pieces out of it, but the broth was bland. It seemed like a dish I've had at italian places, but without the flavor. They bring you a thing full of tortillas and beans, and mine came with rice, so I filled up mostly on the rice and beans, which were good. I was not impressed with my soup at all. As I said, we had a coupon off, but it still cost more than I would have paid for the tastiness of the food. So, it wasn't bad, but the "meh, I've experienced better" two stars probably aptly describes this place, after a discussion between J and I. The décor was nice though, and the location convenient, and the bathroom was ok, but I had to use the men's room, as there was a girl holed up in there who wouldn't (couldn't?) come out lol. I'd say, check it out and see what you think, you might like it. I don't think I'd go back.
author: Merredith L.

description: went back. salmon dish was great again. drinks were awesome. service superb. bartenders personable and even put me on to a new drink. i love this place.
author: Food C.

description:
you have GOT to have a margarita! this place rocks, YUM!!!

will write more later
author: Spooky E.

description: HUGE portions! Food was good but none of us could of finished our entrees. In fact each entree could of fed three people.
author: Tom T.

description: I gave it 5 stars, not because it's best best Mexican I've ever had- rather the best Mexican fast serve food ever.  It kind of feels like chipotle, or a fast serve burrito place... But don't let it fool you, because they serve excellent and very flavor intensive food.  The décor is nice and comfortable.  The drinks taste fresh and real.
author: Justsun B.

description: Great spot!  The fact that it's not too loud and can continue conversations easily is a shoe-in.  Food was yummy and service excellent-- all for very reasonable prices.  I would totally go back again!
author: Megan M.

description: Very good. Excellent service. Great marguerita selection.
author: Wendy W.

description: Came in with 3 of my girlfriends and we had a great time. Food was very tasty and a great atmosphere. Staff was attentive as well. Will definitely come back!
author: Aly K.

description: If you're attending a conference at Moscone and used to having to take a taxi to anywhere decent, try this place. The menu isn't huge, but everything I've had on it has been awesome - beautifully cooked, delicious and generous portions. I can't get enough of the ceviche, and the house margarita is the best I've had in an eternity. Instantly added to my best-of-SF list.
author: Simon P.

description:
No need to go to Mission when you have Tropisueno -a mere block from Powell St. bart/muni station!  I love dinner but my fave is the daytime taqueria - you can choose what goes in your burrito, taco, torta (sandwich) AND they have the best home-made salsas (from non-spicy pico de gallo to VERY spicy orange-colored salsa).  

Also, much better walking the block by the 4 Seasons/Westin/Marriott than near the Mission bart stations.
author: kristy l.

description:
great happy hour for cheap prices.  the chips / salsa / guac are definitely worth getting.

$5 margaritas and $3 draft.
author: Jason J.

description: My girlfriend and I decided to try this place since it was near the Metreon and had good reviews. We were very impressed! The food was great and the atmosphere was perfect - casual but still intimate. Our server, Rafael, was helpful with suggestions and we ended up ordering what he recommended (Tampiqueño and the Molé). His service was perfect, really the best I can remember; he didn't hover but he was never far away and showed up exactly on queue. In short, we will definitely be heading back here!
author: Ryan B.

description: The chips are perfect here! I went for lunch this afternoon and had the beef enchiladas and tamale combination plate that came with rice and beans - it was awesome. The service was exceptional, and I thought the decor was perfectly themed for this place, it definitely gives off the feeling of being in another country. They also have a great bar which I'm sure is pretty popular during the week for happy hour, but I didn't have a drink while I was visiting so can't comment on the drinks.
author: Anthony R.

description: A group of us went for dinner.  The food was all fantastic.  To start the chips and salsa are really good.   The chips are light and perfectly salty.  We had the trip of cerviches and a couple of other apps.  All were really full of flavor.    I had the carne asada main that comes with and enchalada - I think it was $15.  It was well seasoned and a large portion.  I would definitely get it again.  Everyone liked their food.  Fantastic margaritas that pack a punch for $6.50 with very good quality tequila.  I got  one that has ginger in it and it was great.  The service was great.  Will definitely go back.  One thing is they have to work on their web site- it's terrible and doesn't have the menu.
author: Gina T.

description: Tropisueno is tucked away next to a beautiful church and when you finally find this restaurant, you will be lured in by isn't warm and cozy atmosphere.  The food was good, but not authentic.  You will certainly have a great meal here and it is a fun place to come with a few friends and chat the night away.
author: Shane M.

description: I am definitely a fan of this place.  My husband and I decided to stop in after seeing Coraline 3d at the Metreon.  The prices were fantastic.  We were thinking for the area it was in the prices would be high, but my husband and I spent a total of around $55 for both dinners and two alcoholic drinks each, which is good for the city.  Both of our meals were excellent - I had the Chicken Mole and my husband the pick two with an Enchilada and Chili Rellano.  The place was lively, the servers were very friendly and attentive, and we did not have to wait to be seated.  We will be back some time very soon.
author: Rise G.

description: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food but my hubby is...so we decided to come and try this place out for lunch.  I just recently found out that during lunch time they have a "lunch bar" where you go to the food bar and order what you want and they make it for you.  Then you find your own seats.  But for dinner its actually a sit down dinner service.  Anyways, my hubby and I both ordered regular burritos for lunch and let me tell you these burritos were HUGE! I thought the burritos at Villa Corona were big..but these guys might have been be bigger!  The people there were super friendly and the restaurant looked clean.  I think aside from Villa Corona...this is probably the other Mexican restaurant I would go :) (also try their watermeleon juice...it was nummy and refreshing!)
author: JenJen W.

description: This place is great!!  Staying at Marriott Hotel - this place is very convenient.  Service was great, food was outstanding.  I had the Mahi Mahi...fresh, inexpensive, all-around winner!
author: Lisa N.

description: Truly the best Margarita,chips and ceviche in the city ! I love this place and I love their happy hour .Great atmosphere as well. It's right by my work too,so it's pretty convenient as well .
author: Geri M.

description: My go to place for mexican food.  I love their pork chop dish.  So good!!!   I have been back many times and have always been impressed with my entrees: Chile Verd (Pork),  Tampiqueno (Beef), Chuleta de Puerco Adobada (Pork chop), Camarones Tropisueno (Shrimp) .  Definitely check this place out.  Bonus...their margaritas are yummy too!
author: Tammy S.

description: This place is what Chevy's wants to be... classy and tasty.  The menu is simple, lots of great seafood options.  I had the "camorones tropisuenos" and I was delivered a huge plate of giant shrimps in an amazing sauce.  Oh and their drinks were first class.  I had a hibiscus ("jamaica") based cocktail... AHHHmazing!  Also worth mentioning is the service- the wait staff was warm and attentive.  I will be going there a lot in the future.
author: Mar C.

description: Generous helping of "Smaller" nachos, good quality carne asada, fresh tasting salsas. Though the interior looks a bit unfinished (well, they did just open), it's looking really nice. Full bar soon, I hear... :-)
author: Maximillian M.

description: One of the tree best Mexican meals I have had!  The chips and variety of sauces where the best I have ever had.  Our entrees where great and the service exceptional.  Best meal we have had on this trip to SF!  We will be back!
author: Derek N.

description: The Chile Verde is so good I've never even bothered to try anything else. Eliseo is so great, he's fast, patient and never pushy. Ask for him. Carlos the bartender knows his tequila and is proud to share that knowledge. Honestly one of the best Mexican restaurants I've eaten in, and I love Mexican food.
author: Tom H.

description: We live in walnut creek and randomly found this place one time.  It was amazing so we've come back once or twice since.  The staff was really friendly, the food excellent and a full bar to top it off!  Great location near the metreon/yerba buena gardens/moma.
author: J E.

description: Stopped in for lunch and LOVED it.  The place looks like it's going to be much more expensive than it is.  The food was just fantastic!  The freshest chips, great tacos and some of the best salsa I've had in the City.
author: Suzanne G.

description: We stopped here for a quick snack and a beer.  They've got a nice, small bar with the upscale Mexican thing going on.  They serve good chips and great salsas and our chile cheese tamale was tasty.  The shrimp cocktail came in a nice broth but the shrimp itself was too limey for us and we couldn't finish it.  Still, a good place to throw down a Negro Modelo or a Margarita and sample some more upscale Mexican fare.
author: Matt L.

description:
I love this place for several reasons - 
Happy Hour - two tacos, one margarita, one beer = $10 UNBEATABLE!!!
Taqueria - super fresh daytime food, yum
Restaurant - Can I mention again how much I love the shrimp tropisueno? And they are on restaurant.com, so you can get a discount off the already reasonable price for white tablecloth downtown dining.
author: Margaret S.

description: I'm gonna get crazy and say this place makes the best chips which leads me to declare the nachos the best I've had in I dunno' San Francisco? California? Anywhere? They are fresh, light, hot and so flaky! Had lunch with friends here on a workday. All ala carte tacos come double tortilla-ed up perfect for making one taco into two! I had the chicken taco and the fish taco, both excellent but varied in their preparation. The fish taco had a great cabbage slaw on it and was quite salty, yet pleasing. It's walk up and order lunch style and sit down for dinner. As I slid through the cafeteria style lunch line I couldn't help notice that the burritos looked gigantic! Compliments on the creamy avocado salsa, fresh pico de gallo and accessible salsa bar. Compliments on the good looking men at this place for lunch too!
author: Jenny T.

description: It was great, I just ordered the wrong thing. I ordered a combo plate - clearly there are much better things on the menu, I just felt like this at the time. My taco was great, but it seemed like they must have re-heated (maybe even microwaved) my tamal too much because the end of it was rock solid. My fiance got the ceviche and tacos al pastor and they were delicious! The ceviche had a ton of delicious fish and was only $7 - definitely a deal. I was there for dinner, but based on how great the 4 - 6 happy hour menu looked, I definitely plan on going back for happy hour.
author: Niki N.

description: Great burritos!  Went there for lunch today and had a delicious regular steak burrito, which came with - beans, rice, cheese, salsa AND lettuce! I love lettuce in burritos and not every place provides this.  My to-go meal also came with a large amount of chips.  Make sure you don't forget to swoop by the salsa bar on your way out - the bright orange salsa is pretty good and spicy along with the other typical salsa of pico de gallo.  Great location (down the alley from Beard Papa) and not a long wait!  My lunch was about $7.50 which is not bad when you get a delicious meal from it!
author: Leslie U.

description: The burritos are amazing. Full of flavor, many ingredients, textures. The beef is also high quality, somewhat surprising for a caftetia style place
author: Ben G.

description: The food and margaritas are excellent.  The atmosphere is nice as well.  One of the few good places to eat downtown.
author: Nora G.

description: This place is a bit hidden off the busy Market street area, but worth it when you arrive. It's more casual taqueria/burrito shop by day, and a bit more service oriented in the evenings.  The vibe was very inviting, lively yet comfortable, and a bit of authentic Mexican meets city vibe. Chips and salsas are excellent, shrimp taco was huge, tasty and filling, and the cheese enchilada was oozing with tasty melted cheese and a spicy flavorful red sauce.  Would order the same thing over and over. Only drawback was their lunch ordering system is flawed.  Items are brought out separately to a tableside number stand, and they can't really keep track of whether or not your order is complete.  I don't like a waiter asking me if I have received everything or if I have something else in the kitchen....that's your job, not mine.
author: Todd C.

description: The bartender was great and the drinks were ok but the food (tacos) gave me food poisoning.
author: Carlos G.

description:
I came here on a weekday night with a friend for dinner. The decor is simple but nice. Upon entering we saw some people at the bar and the dining area was mostly empty with just a few patrons. The table where we were seated was small. It was hard fitting everything on the table when our orders came. 

The service was very good. Upon seating we were going to order ice tea but they didn't offer that. So the waiter offered us a Jamaica (hibiscus flower) juice drink. He brought a sample for us to taste. It was good and he said that it was good for clearing out the toxins from the liver. After we place our orders, the server brought us some delicious fresh chips with a guacamole dip and salsa. I had salmon, rice and vegetables. My companion got the mole with chicken which was appealing at first because the sauce contains chocolate. The sauce was good but the chicken was very dry. It was like eating chicken jerky. I was happy with my salmon but wished there was a more flavor. Along with our entrees they brought a side of refried beans and tortilla wraps. I made myself a wrap and was filled to the brim with food. We decided to go for the dessert. They only have one - a chocolate fondue with slices of mango, strawberries, and banana. The dessert was disappointing. They brought the fondue out and the chocolate started burning after awhile but the actual temperature of the chocolate was lukewarm. I think they used dark chocolate which is a plus. 

Overall, the server was very nice. He kept coming over to check on us. He tried to explain what things were on the menu. I will return just to try the drinks at the bar with small bites on the side.
author: Candace F.

description:
I went to this place on a Sunday night, and I was glad I made a reservation. It seemed relatively busy. This place is really easy to get to and right off of bart. The ambiance is cool and comfortable, and upon sitting down you get chips and three types of salsa, which were very good. The only odd thing, is that through out the night, we were served by three people. They were all servers, not bussers or anything, so it was kind of weird because at the beginning we gave our drink order, and then someone else came to take it again. But regardless, it was a great meal. Relatively well priced, especially in downtown San Francisco. However, guacamole was almost the price of an entree.
The food was very tasty - kind of soul Mexican food. This isn't a burrito/quesadilla place - it's a more authentic, comfort food. The portions were great for the price as well. 
We also had a tres leche desert cake - wow, one of the best deserts I've ever had, worth every penny and more.
Check it out, it's worth the stop.
author: Austin S.

description: I really wanted to write a positive review this time but I can't   The best thing I had was  the Margarita.  The food was over salted with that chalky iodized salt.  I had the combo carne asada and chicken enchilada. The meat was a very small portion, dry and salty.  The enchilada lacked cheese and also heavy with the salt.  Even the beans on the side were salty.  It was if the cook had an accidental spill of salt. I had to drink so much water.  I tried a piece of my friend's salmon and that was fine.  I hate to say it but its on the par to Chevy's.  It is  aesthetically pleasing and the service was descent.  I think at the very least its okay for an afterwork margarita.
author: Food F.

description: I was really hoping this place would fill the burrito-shaped void that exists in SOMA. There are simply no good burrito places within walking distance of my place. We ate here and thought the food was decent, but there were some problems. For one, it seems like they still have to figure out a logical flow for the place. The ordering, getting utensils, and getting salsa was a little confusing. Also, the food was overpriced. The burritos are especially expensive at a whopping $9 for something you could get for $4 elsewhere. Yes, the place has some atmosphere, but for these prices the food should have something special going on too.
author: Michelle A.

description: Had dinner here Thur 7/18/13, made a reservation here for 2 people at 7pm, arrived a bit late but we were seated immediately, the couple in front of us had no reservation and were told it would be a 1 hour wait!  The first thing I would like to compliment them on is the service, we had 2 people waiting on us the entire meal, never had to ask for drink re-fills, kept bringing us chips and salsa, the salsa was so yummy when i mentioned this to the waiter he brought us a larger bowl of salsa, they even gave me the recipe.  My hubby and I ordered the cucumber margarita recommended by the waitress and it was a great choice.  The food was also delicious, I ordered the mushroom empanadas and told the waitress I would love a salad but did not see one on the menu, she brought me a very generous side salad with avacados, my hubby also loved his meal.  The service, food, drinks and vibe did not disappoint!
author: L T.

description:
Tropisueño is my new favorite Mexican restaurant! It's too bad I don't live in San Francisco, because otherwise I would go here all the time. I live in Southern California, so you would think I'd be able to find a better Mexican restaurant here, but Tropisueño is the best!

Starting off with the chips and salsa, the chips are fresh and there are two types of salsa: one green one and one red one. The green salsa was good, but the red salsa was awesome! You could tell it was homemade, and it tasted better than any salsa I've ever had. For drinks, my boyfriend and I got horchata and this too was no store-bought horchata. It's not like the sugar-filled drinks you'll buy from a store or get at other restaurants. This was sweet, but not too sweet. It was also kind of thick. It may not be everyone's cup of tea, but it is good and should be tried.

As for dinner, my boyfriend ordered the mole and I ordered two tamales and an echilada. The enchilada was very good as were the tamales. My boyfriend really enjoyed his mole as well. For dessert, they only had one option. It's melted chocolate served with cinnamon tortilla chips and assorted fruit. Unfortunately, this wasn't on the menu, so I will just tell you now that it's $10, which might be a little too much, but it was good. However, if the owners are reading this, pineapple dipped in chocolate is odd. Bananas would work better.

Overall, I'd give the food 4 stars. Yes, it is very good, and definitely on par with the best Mexican food I've had, but I have recently tried 5-star food and Tropisueño just isn't quite there. Why do I give it 5 stars then? Because of the 6-star service. One of the ways I rate a restaurant is how often they refill my water (I drink a lot), and they not only leave you with a small bottle with extra water, but the bus boy comes over to refill your glasses for you! The waitress was also very nice. For those who don't like too much service, you may feel a bit smothered, but I was very happy with the service.

Good food, excellent service. Tropisueño, me haces falta...
author: Michael S.

description: This place was pretty good, although they didn't meet my expectations with all the hype from the yelp event. The food was delicious, but you have to come hungry cause you get a lot of heavy food. Their chips and salsa are the best things I've ever had. The only downside is that my vegetarian friends had a hard time picking things. It's a tad bit expensive, but worth it.
author: Casey Z.

description: first time we went, great service! second time, it took 3 requests and 15 minutes to get my diabetic friend a sprite for his low blood sugar. it was understaffed and service was incredibly slow. then they automatically added 18% tip on a 5-person check.....never coming back
author: ben c.

description: We loved it. Four of us managed to share several plates and got the best variety possible.  The margaritas are made with Agave instead of Triple Sec and as a margarita snob I found the agave had too much flavor but the waiter was very anxious to find me just the right mix and this is just personal.  Very fun experience, good service and great food.
author: Margaret S.

description: I'm a little bit of a Mexican food snob and I was super happy with my meal. I tried the empanadas, ceviche, and the mole. All very tasty. The place was PACKED on a Thursday evening. I was really glad I made a reservation. I'll definitely go back. Tropisueno had a fun atmosphere, good food, and it was moderately priced... my kind of place!
author: Alejandra S.

description: Great place! I'd def choose this spot over Chevy's or Chipotle which are in 2 block vicinity. Great chips n' salsa.. prices are decent.. and love the atmosphere!
author: Ava K.

description:
She Said (M), He Said (S):  We live right around this neighborhood so we saw it being built and thought it would be just another pricey spot.  Coming from San Diego we were in search of a good, reasonably priced Mexican joint that wasn't a chain.  Thank goodness for Tropisueno!  

First Impression:  We went there when it first opened up [before they had their liquor license] and were kindly greeted with a smile.  That hasn't faded the whole time they've been open. 

Décor:   This place is nicely decorated.  It feels authentically chic and the mood lighting helps you unwind after work or when you're just strolling around the 'hood.

Ambiance:  Chill - great for socializing and hanging out!

Food:  The complimentary chips and salsa - can't go wrong.  Guacamole - delish.  Carnitas?!  - YUM!  The flavor of everything is great but could use some toning down of salt.

Happy Hour:  The margaritas are strong and the spiced salt on the rims give it an extra kick.  Yummy!    The only complaint is their hH is too short.  Only until 6 PM?!  We'd give it another star if they bumped it an extra hour.  

Price:  Lunch, happy hour, or dinner their prices are well priced for the tasty food, especially compared to other places in the city. 

Service:  Depending on how busy it is the service can be a bit slow, but they are super attentive to what you want.  We've always had them asking if there was anything else we needed.

Conclusion:  The food and prices are comparable to that of San Diego.   The authentic flare is there and so is the kindness of the people working there.  No need to look for another place to get street tacos.  Bon Appetite!
author: M and S.

description:
Terrific new addition to the alley between Market and Mission.
Staff was very friendly and helpful; decor is warm and inviting--not too dark, and with soft music.

Everything was delicious, starting with the crisp, warm chips and the virgin margaritas (complimentary, since their liquor license is still pending).

The Oaxacan Mole Poblano was nicely sweet and tangy. The range of menu offerings is impressive so I look forward to trying more.

Prices are very reasonable, especially for this up-and-coming area.
author: John L.

description: Incredibly attentive service, outrageously delicious food, and a nice casual vibe makes Tropisueno my new favorite Mexican restaurant in SF. I have to agree with Mark J. that Tropisueno's food is at the same level as Maya -- well, I actually think it's much better. I had the house margarita which packed a punch!
author: Lilia A.

description: Great food, excellent margaritas! Perfect for bringing our little ones too!
author: PHill Resident G.

description: The Salsa and Chips are pretty great. Reminds me of La Vics Orange Sauce! Lunchtime is a quick tacqueria as a great sit down for lunch hour. The place is setup very nicely and the price is extremely reasonable. I havent had a margarita but it does look like they do have a very decent selection. All they need now is a big screen TV!
author: Marcus H.

description: So tasty! We go there for lunch sometimes and also do catering at the office. I recommend doing a taco bar at your next event. It's always a big hit!
author: Mel C.

description:
nice place,   not pricey!  
i am not a  of mexican food lover,  but this e place it's different. it's not he typical taqueria ( at least at night) , and i had a good experience.  
the chile relleno was very good , 
violet margarita- ok
the service was excellent 

i  will come back definitely
author: Lorena Raquel B.

description: I was pleased when this place moved in.  I love the taqueria at lunch and the dinners are great too.  The food, really can not be beat by any other Mexican place in the area.  I just can't give it more stars because every time I've been something was messed up with our order or the timing of the dishes/service was off.  I'm hoping it's just a new restaurant still trying to find it's footing and that things will improve.
author: Lee S.

description: Good Mexican food and fantastic Margaritas!!
author: Gustavo L.

description: This is a great spot for happy hours. The margaritas are de-lish with a spicy salt rimming what seem to be hand blown glasses. The fish tacos are light and crispy, and the chips are always warm and fresh - ask for the salsa verde. Great happy hour prices and comfortable atmosphere, will definitely be back!
author: Ellie C.

description:
For the last three years, we've been looking for good authentic Mexican food with good ambience as well as good vegetarian options. Our search ended when we stumbled into Tropisueno a few months back. During lunch the place is very reasonable and somewhat like a taqueria and during dinner time, it turns into a fine dine Mexican restaurant.
The chips are thin and crispy and all the different kinds of salsa they have are very yummy. I could just have an entire meal of just Chips, Salsa and Guacamole.
author: Ruchi M.

description: This is the second time me and my wife came to eat here.  The experience was ok for the first time.  We came again last week, the server recommended a few dishes to us, we tried all of them, and they were excellent.  I'm not very familiar with Mexican food, so I won't comment much, but we enjoyed the food and service a lot.
author: Dee L.

description: After seeing Tropisueno on Check Please Bay Area I was very exciting to take two good friends there last night. Unfortunately I could not recall the do's and don'ts from the TV show and ordered the seafood soup.  It was a huge bowl of spicy but watery broth with 2 shrimps, 2 scallops, 2 mussels hiding way at the bottom.  Virtually no seafood given the water content.  I had the Siete Leguas margarita which was served in a thimble for $9.  Not a good value.  I will never go back...too bad...I had such high hopes ...but $140 for 4 people was way overpriced.  The tables are really jammed in together for a nice claustrophobic feeling.  But hey....the chips are good.
author: don k.

description: Margaritas were good and the food was okay. Reason for 2 stars? They told us to leave right after we paid our bill...even though my friends I were still talking.  We weren't there for hours after we paid the bill.  We had been sitting there and chatting for about 10 minutes when they basically kicked us out.  Way to keep it classy, Tropisueno.
author: Claire C.

description: For lunch, its a good downtown option. Its inexpensive, with quick service, and a warm, sunny, atmosphere. I got chicken and carnitas tacos, served simple with onions, pico de gallo, and cilantro. Both meats were tender and free of fat, and I could easily dress up the flavor (though flavorful enough on their own) with one of the many delicious salsas they offer for FREE at their salsa bar. Broiled serrano peppers are also offered at their salsa bar, making for a nice free little appetizer if you aren't feeling the chips your meal comes with (as others have said, they aren't anything special). Deciding it best to not go back to the office tipsy (not today anyway!) I didn't try one of the margaritas Yelped so highly about, but I would go back to try it for dinner and will definitely be indulging when I do. Three stars, because though the tacos are GOOD, I've had better at La Oxaquena in the Mission (whose fare is even cheaper).
author: Raquel C.

description: You wouldn't think service would be an issue at a cafeteria-style restaurant...think again.   We came here for lunch lured by a nice looking space and the promise of decent tacos near my office.  The women behind the counter were, to the one, completely clueless, and by the time we'd communicated our (uncomplicated) order, we'd almost lost our appetite.  The food was okay, but the tacos were so over-stuffed that they were impossible to eat by hand.  The one shining point was the fish tacos, which were admittedly fairly tasty.
author: David B.

description: This is by far the noisiest restaurant I have ever been to - the Maitre'd was less than friendly and bordered on being rude. The food was quite ordinary. They seemed to have jammed as many tables as they could fit into the place so we were almost rubbing elbows with the people next to us. Seems to be a place for getting margaritas so lots of people are drinking. Would not go back to this place unless no other place was available - even then would think twice about it.  Could not talk to each other at the same table because it was so noisy we could not hear each other.  Had to leave to go elsewhere for desert and coffee.
author: Zachary A.

description: A solid 4-star place.  Good portions and everything is nicely seasoned.  The service is very good and the drink selection is awesome.  This place isn't the best Mexican food I've ever had but the wait isn't terrible.  Opt to sit at the bar area if the dining room wait is too insane and get guacamole for sure!
author: Tabitha S.

description: My best friend said it was the "best mexican restaurant I've ever been to. Better than Puerto Allegro." Better than Puerto Allegro? That sets the bar pretty damn high. So I finally go to the restaurant and I ask the hostess for a table. Says the hostess, "I'm sorry, but we're booked...the ENTIRE night." Wow. This place must be phenomenal. Days went by and the build up kept building. The next time I make a reservation. This time I'm guaranteed a table. I sit, order, drink and eat. End result: it was good, but not mind blowing. Probably because it was clearly overhyped. But let me say this: the portions are good, and so were the enchiladas. The margarita with the absinthe was delicious. Prices are moderate, not cheap. And make a reservation so you don't have to wait the ENTIRE night. If you live in the area or want to eat at a sit-down, nice restaurant, come here. Otherwise the Mission is just a bus ride away.
author: Alex H.

description: Just went to Tropisueno for the first time for lunch last Friday and ordered a burrito. It was so delicious but super huge, I could only get through 1/2 of it.  I just had the leftovers today (Sunday) and it saves really well.  Also I loved the chips it came with and was really surprised to see that they had Tapatio in packet form! I will definitely come back for lunch and I want to try them for dinner!
author: Melissa P.

description:
I was soured the minute we walked in the door.  The host was on the phone.  FIne, I waited.  Another host came up, didn't even look at me, then another, same thing.  Then the head host?  got off the phone, looked right past me to seat a man that had just walked in the door.  Hello?  I wasn't invisible,  I my whole family beside me!  
Anyway, once seated, we had a fantastic server, and it was smooth sailing from there.  Delicious chips with a great selection of salsas and guacamole.  
I had the pollo con mole (or something to that effect) which was great but spicy!  We ordered everything our server recommended, and it was all delicious.  Most everything had a bit of kick to it, so be prepared for some spice.  They do not have a kid's menu but when I asked our server for a cheese quesadilla, he said sure!  When my son lost Mr. Potato Head's nose, our server climber under the table looking for it!  He was wonderful, and went above and beyond.
4 stars!  Improve that initial greeting, and it'd be 5.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: My favorite place for lunch. If you go early or a little late, you can usually avoid the out-the-door line. I've never been here for dinner but the taqueria-style ordering is quick and yummy. Also reasonably priced. Try the barbacoa, it's delicious!
author: Lyndsey R.

description:
The place look really nice. The server was really hard to understand poor English and the food is OK. If you know something about Mexican food this is more American wannabe Mexican, Price is good, Quality OK better Colibri are any taqueria in Mission.
For Lunch is poor, I order a burrito and taste was like  a bite of paper. I never feel any flavor of the meat. Really after I taste I star to laughing and put that in the garage.
Dinner better I like the drink but the food not really. The server was funny and really poor in detail. He never know what wine was good or drinks, just say margaritas lol was a really funny experience. If you want a funny time go there . If you want a great service and great quality in food go to the worse taqueria in mission:)
author: Jonathan R.

description: This place is far from a dream(sueno), more like tropi-nightmare. Horrible Mexican food, bland flavors and nothing special.
author: B P.

description: i had to go here for a work lunch once.  it looked like a cute place and i was excited to try it-the ingredients seemed really fresh and i liked the ambiance of the place.  i'm not sure if it's because i got veggie stuff, but this was some of the blandest mexican food i've ever had.  the meat eaters at my table seemed to like it though.  it's not hard to find good veggie items at a mexican restaurant, so i was rather puzzled.
author: Kate W.

description: margaritas are awesome and food is solid. a great choice for happy hour!
author: Helen T.

description: great food but the last 2 times we have gone it has been too crowded.  it took 15 minutes to get a drink at the bar tonight, and the bartender was MAJOR RUDE!
author: Alisa M.

description: very good dinner spot for mexican. usually sit at the bar to eat, and service can sometimes be hit or miss. great salsas; chicken mole and pork verde.
author: Jason N.

description: 5 stars for the margaritas and the chicken mole.  I can't wait to go back for happy hour!
author: John D.

description: Great margaritas and chips and salsa.  This review is for their evening restaurant menu.  The restaurant lights up at night and has incredible ambiance for a mexican restaurant.  The food is good, but the best part is that they offer fried plantains with black bean sauce...yummy.  Great  spot for casual dinner.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Great Find thanks to yelp! my boyfriend and I found this cute yummy place while in search for lunch in the city. The staff is super friendly and the food was Delicious!.. great value. Try the chicken mole. I will def. be back to try the margaritas everyone was talking about. My new fav place!!
author: CIN H.

description: We love this place. We go twice a month or so for their happy hour. By far the best margaritas in San Francisco.
author: Haley S.

description: We showed up for a late dinner on a Thursday night. The restaurant was busy but service was attentive and fast. The atmosphere here is just right, not too bright, nicely decorated. The food, the most important thing, was really delicious. Portions were great and the prices were fine. We'll definitely return.
author: Steve H.

description: Because 900+ reviews surely won't get the message across, I'm going to add my two cents and reiterate that this is a perfect happy hour spot. $2 Tecate is pretty much unbeatable... and some side ceviche (among the best I've tried!) won't hurt either. It was fairly crowded even for a Monday, so I can't imagine -- and might not even really want to experience -- what it's like any other evening, but it's a small price to pay for a fun atmosphere and enticing prices. Fairly eclectic crowd, decent service (the bartenders seemed a tad overwhelmed, but they came through for us and were always polite), and delicious salsa('s). (The yellow one was very addictive. I don't know what was in there, apart from the obvious cheese, but it was doing the trick.) To be absolutely honest, I don't think I'd come here for lunch or dinner considering all of the other options in the area... but, in the happy hour league, it certainly ranks high.
author: G. J.

description: I agree with all the raves!  We were surprised when we stumbled upon this restaurant and found a real gem.  Great food.  Lovely setting, friendly staff and great drinks.  Eat here!
author: Lorie L.

description: Closest to homemade Mexican I've tasted in SF. Mole polano is lovely. The flank steak is so so. Try their cocktails featuring tequilas too...Excellent.
author: M P.

description: oh man, this place is delicious. i came here last week with a co-worker and just loved the ambiance of the restaurant. it can get pretty busy at lunch, so you might want to try and beat the 12pm rush. i ended up ordering the fish taco and some chips with guacamole. ugh it was sooo good.
author: Heather S.

description: Came here with some coworkers for tequila, margaritas, and dinner, and was satisfied with all three. I recommend the Chile Verde.
author: B S.

description: Very GOOD mexican located at a very convenient location if you are in this part of the city.   My partner said they served some of the BEST Chicken Mole she has ever had (and she's tried a lot) and it was surperb!   The chips and salsa were freshly made and warm.  The Black Beans were served in a separate bowl - which I like.  Overall, the food was well prepared and generous, so go hungry! You will also not be dissapointed with the wait staff -  all were attentative and very helpful when asked questions about menu selections.   Definately on the go back to list.
author: G M.

description: I had an enormous shrimp burrito for lunch. Pushing it pricewise (c'mon, it's just a burrito), but it *was* seafood and it *did* come with an equally massive bowl of chips. These aren't your momma's big thick crunchy chips - they're thin, crisp, rather oily. Perfect. There's no threat of mangling your mouth off sharp corners, and the salsa was delicious as well. Next time I'll just order the tacos (under $5!) and fill myself the rest of the way with these chips.
author: Victor L.

description: Excellent service (Oliver - a veteran pro server). Accommodated our group near 10:30pm closing time. First time visitors, great decor, very high end and traditional in the new building near the Jewish center. We were introduced a milk jug of water and a basket of fresh tortilla chips with both a tomatillo and pico de gallo salsa. We ordered an entree of Tamales (cheese and pepper) and a pepper stuffed, egg battered, chile rellano (OMG!) A shrimp prawn camarones tostada on a bed of guacamole. Lastly, the stuffed empanada cheese and mushrooms, delicious. All in all, punctual service and fresh food. Refined Mexican was totally unexpected in the area, even though its surrounded by wine bars and high end boutique stores. They take VISA credit card, excellent. Speaking of money, their prices are reasonable and fair. And to think we left Del Taco on Market St. because they took ATM and cash only! Great find, we will be back.
author: Wilson T.

description:
i eat here at least once a week and today i noticed that i had been charged 50 cents on my check. i went back to the cashier, an young lady, and asked why the charge. she answered me "the extra pico de galo that they put in yr burrito." well, i was surprised: why charge for it if they offer it free at the salsa bar? it makes no sense.
