but the reason i am complaining is  not the 0.50 charge but the way the cashier (young lady) talked to me!! she was very rude, by the way, as usual; she never smiles and seems to be always upset, never makes eye contact and i just did not like the way she talked to me. i hate to complain like that but i am just tired of being treated like that by her.
well, i would always tell my co-workers: no matter how good you are but a bad attitude can spoil everything! too bad :((

on the other hand, i do love the other cashier during the week! i do not know his name but he is dark-haired (long and curly). he is always a gentleman to me, two thumbs up for you, young man!!!
author: liv a.

description: My finance and I frequent Tropisueno as it's walking distance from our place and the food is always pretty good. We like to sit at the bar when we go out to a casual meal but the head bar tender seems ruins my experience at this restaurant each and every time. He's unfriendly (even though he knows our faces), he's lazy, he's forgetful (last time we dined he forgot to place our order), he's unapologetic and he's always one step behind what we need -- a fork, a glass of water, another drink, more chips, etc. This place would get 5 stars if he got canned.
author: Alexis L.

description: loved it.  nice staff, great food, good prices.  what's not to like?  the chips were fresh, thin and delicious (so what if they break when dipping into the delicious, thick guacamole?).  The ceviche was tasty but not amazing, the chile verde was awesome and tender, the margaritas were made with El Jimador and left us thoroughly anesthitized!
author: Madelena M.

description: I have gone back a few times and I am still in love. It is just so convenient when you are shopping downtown or are going to the Metreon! They have made lifetime fan out of me. The food is consistently excellent, and the drinks are strong and refreshing.
author: Suzanne H.

description: Good place for lunch and a casual spot for some lunchtime drinks. For fellow out-of-towners: they are EXTREMELY hard to find, solely based on their address. They're actually located INSIDE the yerba Buena center...Yerba Buena isn't actually a street. It was a bitch trying to find it using my tom tom! So I'm taking a star off. They're set up like a fancy chipotle, as you stand in a line and watch them add the beans, rice, meat etc on your plate. If you get something that requires a little more handling, they'll give you a number and bring it to you. At first it was a little confusing, so we had to stand back and watch a few folks go thru the line to get it lol. The food was more than enough...they had BIG servings, the chips and guac were good and they made a strawberry margarita with real strawberries. All around good experience.
author: vanessa m.

description: "The Joy" and I were in the Yerba Buena Area last night for a museum showing and stopped by Tropisueno for the first time. We were greeted by one of the owners who was gracious and professional. The place was full so I recommend reservations unless you enjoy having a drink at a busy bar area while you wait to be seated. The atmosphere was fun and welcoming by the entire staff. The scallop app was terrific. I recommend for two. Since this was our first visit we ordered standards for a  Mexican/Latin American restaurant. We both had the version of combination plate which included taco, enchilada, tamale. Each dish included rice, choice of beans, and hot tortillas. We were impressed with the quality and quantity. If we ordered this dish again, we would just pick two items for the combo. Service was stellar and the owner stopped by to confirm we were happy with the meal. She appeared to be very experienced in the restaurant business. We will be back to test the "Happy Hour" special menu, beers, margaritas, and other dishes for dinner. We encourage everyone to stop by and have some fun!
author: Gerry C.

description: If you're looking for an upscale Mexican restaurant, this place is definitely decent.  The food is good and the prices are pretty reasonable.  The service is a bit on the slow side, though not that big a deal.  But it gets 3 stars instead of 4 because it's not as good as Mexico DF.
author: Tom S.

description: more like 3.75 stars--a touch pricey and a tad salty.  i usually go for cheaper mexican, but had company in town and wanted to try something a step up.  the experience was pretty good.  quick walk from powell st BART.   we had reservations for 7:30 and got seated at ~7:40/5 when the rest of our party arrived.  i had the vegetarian posole (other options may have been cheese chile relleno or enchiladas) and it was really tasty, but a bit salty.  the house margaritas were strong (good) and the chips and salsa were delish (though i would have liked a salsa refill...)  ambiance was really nice, not too noisy, servers were friendly.
author: Jenni D.

description:
We have been here for margaritas for happy hour.
Small drinks compare to the larger ones you get everywhere else...
And then we try dinner.
The food was great! But the Appetizers are really a waste of money.
We got two little tacos like with no flavor and tons of sour cream. And that was 8 dlls!! Considering you can get a decent burrito full of flavor anywhere else in the city i thougt this was a total rip off.
Also when we got our plates all above the 15dlls range, they only got us 3 little cups of beans and one basket of tortillas for a group of 8???
Of course they promptly added the 18%  for a large party and charged 2 extra margaritas! They corrected that mistake but i remember they did the same thing when we were there for happy hour.
Overcharging guys who drink a little bit is not a good thing.
I will be drinking my margaritas somewhere else!
I dare to say Chevy's... i rather go drink there!
Small drinks, is not a trade of for a view!
author: Jose A. P.

description: This place has a rockin' happy hour and delicious bites. Make sure to get there early because happy hour an get pretty crowded. I mostly eat at lunch because it's quick on the cheap and very tasty.  They allow me to sub chorizo on my taco so they can do no wrong in my book.  Salsa bar selection is top notch and the chips are homemade and best in town!
author: elizabeth s.

description: love the happy hour menu and house margaritas.
author: Amity L.

description: It gets all it's two stars because the food was yummy and reasonably priced. It lost the three other stars due to truly atrocious service -- had to beg to have our orders taken, the food took forever to come out.
author: Dan G.

description: I am updating my review and changing the rating to four stars not because anything I said initially was incorrect but simply to reflect the diligent efforts of the owner to understand what caused my poor experience and to make changes for the better.
author: Richard P.

description: We had lunch there today and they were not too busy which I now understand why.  My wife's chicken mole was tasty but everything else was pretty average. All items from entrées to rice and salsa were just way too salty!  My al pastor burrito was nearly inedible because of the salt. I guess they are hoping everyone will order more drinks?  The chips.... according to other yelpers - the chips are made there?  Doubt it, and if they were making them then that would be another knock - I've had way better chips elsewhere - lots of places actually.  Can you write about service in a place where you order at the counter as you come in and they bring the food out the match the number?  The food did come out fast but the man didn't bring water or utensils.   So its mostly self serve. I don't get the other yelpers that write about such great service - have you really eaten here?  Lastly whats up with the picture of bullfighters in the bathroom - I thought this was a mexican place not a spanish place?   Anyhow, with so many great places to eat in SF  I don't think I'll be going back for seconds.
author: Eric H.
